analyzed: yasya saṃjāta kopasya bhayam eti carācaram
translated: Whose anger, when aroused, the moving and unmoving world fears,

original: taṃ tvaṃ mām atigarveṇa devarājāvamanyase // / / //
analyzed: tam tvam mām ati garveṇa devarāja avamanyase
translated: you insult that me, O king of gods, with excessive pride.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: mahendro vāraṇaskandhād avatīrya tvarānvitaḥ /
analyzed: mahendraḥ vāraṇa skandhāt avatīrya tvarā anvitaḥ
translated: Mahendra quickly descended from the elephant's back

original: prasādayām āsa muniṃ durvāsasam akalmaṣam // / / //
analyzed: prasādayām āsa munim durvāsasam akalmaṣam
translated: and sought the favor of the sage Durvasa, who was free from sin.

original: prasādyamānaḥ sa tadā praṇipātapuraḥsaram /
analyzed: prasādyamānaḥ sa tadā praṇipāta puraḥsaram
translated: When he was being appeased, preceded by prostration,

original: pratyuvāca sahasrākṣaṃ durvāsā munisattamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pratyuvāca sahasrākṣam durvāsāḥ muni sattamaḥ
translated: the best of sages Durvasa replied to the thousand-eyed one.

original: durvāsā uvāca /
analyzed: durvāsāḥ uvāca
translated: Durvasa said:

original: nāhaṃ kṛpāluhṛdayo na ca māṃ bhajate kṣamā /
analyzed: na aham kṛpālu hṛdayaḥ na ca mām bhajate kṣamā
translated: I do not have a compassionate heart, nor does forgiveness dwell in me,

original: anye te munayaḥ śakra durvāsasam avehi mām // / / //
analyzed: anye te munayaḥ śakra durvāsasam avehi mām
translated: Know me, O Shakra, to be the very Durvasa.

original: gautamādibhir anyais tvaṃ garvam āpādito mudhā /
analyzed: gautama ādibhiḥ anyaiḥ tvam garvam āpāditaḥ mudhā
translated: You have been falsely made proud by others like Gautama.

original: akṣāntisārasarvasvaṃ durvāsasam avehi mām // / / //
analyzed: akṣānti sāra sarvasvam durvāsasam avehi mām
translated: Know me to be the very Durvasa, the essence of intolerance.

original: vasiṣṭhādyair dayāsāraiḥ stotraṃ kurvadbhir uccakaiḥ /
analyzed: vasiṣṭha ādyaiḥ dayā sāraiḥ stotram kurvadbhiḥ uccakais
translated: By Vashishtha and others, whose essence is compassion, who were loudly praising you,

original: garvaṃ gato 'si yenaivaṃ mām apy adyāvamanyase // / / //🔽jvalajjaṭākalāpasya bhṛkuṭīkuṭilaṃ mukham /
analyzed: garvam gataḥ si yena evam mām api adya avamanyase  jvalat jaṭā kalāpasya bhṛkuṭī kuṭilam mukham
translated: You have become so proud that you now insult even me.

original: nirīkṣya kas tribhuvane mama yo na gato bhayam // / / //
analyzed: nirīkṣya kaḥ tribhuvane mama yaḥ na gataḥ bhayam
translated: Who in the three worlds would not be afraid on seeing the face distorted with knitted brows of one with blazing matted locks?

original: nāhaṃ kṣamiṣye bahunā kim uktena śatakrato /
analyzed: na aham kṣamiṣye bahunā kim uktena śatakrato
translated: I will not forgive, what is the use of speaking much, O Shatakratu?

original: viḍambanām imāṃ bhūyaḥ karoṣy anunayātmikām // / / //
analyzed: viḍambanām imām bhūyas karoṣi anunaya ātmikām
translated: You are again making this mockery full of flattery.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽ity uktvā prayayau vipro devarājo 'pi taṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  iti uktvā prayayau vipraḥ devarājaḥ tam punar
translated: Parashara said:🔽Having said this, the brahmin left. The king of the gods, O brahmin, again

original: āruhyairāvataṃ brahman prayayāv amarāvatīm // / / //
analyzed: āruhya airāvatam brahman prayayau amarāvatīm
translated: mounted Airavata and went to Amaravati.

original: tataḥprabhṛti niḥśrīkaṃ saśakraṃ bhuvanatrayam /
analyzed: tatas prabhṛti niḥśrīkam sa śakram bhuvanatrayam
translated: From that time onwards, the three worlds along with Indra became devoid of glory,

original: maitreyāsīd apadhvastaṃ saṃkṣīṇauṣadhivīrudham // / / //
analyzed: maitreya āsīt apadhvastam saṃkṣīṇa oṣadhi vīrudham
translated: degraded, and the herbs and creepers withered away, O Maitreya.

original: na yajñāḥ saṃpravartante na tapasyanti tāpasāḥ /
analyzed: na yajñāḥ saṃpravartante na tapasyanti tāpasāḥ
translated: Sacrifices were not performed, ascetics did not practice austerities,

original: na ca dānādidharmeṣu manaś cakre tadā janaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na ca dāna ādi dharmeṣu manaḥ cakre tadā janaḥ
translated: and people did not turn their minds to virtues like charity.

original: niḥsattvāḥ sakalā lokā lobhādyupahatendriyāḥ /
analyzed: niḥsattvāḥ sakalāḥ lokāḥ lobha ādi upahata indriyāḥ
translated: All the people in the world became devoid of courage, their senses afflicted by greed and other vices.

original: svalpe 'pi hi babhūvus te sābhilāṣā dvijottama // / / //
analyzed: su alpe pi hi babhūvuḥ te sa abhilāṣāḥ dvijottama
translated: O best of Brahmins, they became greedy even for very little things.

original: yataḥ sattvaṃ tato lakṣmīḥ sattvaṃ bhūtyanusāri ca /
analyzed: yatas sattvam tatas lakṣmīḥ sattvam bhūti anusāri ca
translated: Where there is courage, there is prosperity, and courage follows prosperity.

original: niḥśrīkāṇāṃ kutaḥ sattvaṃ vinā tena guṇāḥ kutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: niḥśrīkāṇām kutas sattvam vinā tena guṇāḥ kutas
translated: How can there be courage in those who are devoid of prosperity? And how can there be virtues without it?

original: balaśauryādyabhāvaś ca puruṣāṇāṃ guṇair vinā /
analyzed: bala śaurya ādi abhāvaḥ ca puruṣāṇām guṇaiḥ vinā
translated: And men are devoid of strength, valor, and other qualities without virtues.

original: laṅghanīyaḥ samastasya balaśauryavivarjitaḥ /
analyzed: laṅghanīyaḥ samastasya bala śaurya vivarjitaḥ
translated: He who is devoid of strength and valor can be easily defeated by everyone.

original: bhavaty apadhvastamatir laṅghitaḥ prathitaḥ pumān // / / //
analyzed: bhavati apadhvasta matiḥ laṅghitaḥ prathitaḥ pumān
translated: A man who is despised and defeated becomes famous.

original: evam atyantaniḥśrīke trailokye sattvavarjite /
analyzed: evam atyanta niḥśrīke trailokye sattva varjite
translated: Thus, when the three worlds became extremely devoid of prosperity and courage,

original: devān prati balodyogaṃ cakrur daiteyadānavāḥ // / / //
analyzed: devān prati bala udyogam cakruḥ daiteya dānavāḥ
translated: the Daityas and Danavas made preparations to attack the gods.

original: lobhābhibhūtā niḥśrīkā daityāḥ sattvavivarjitāḥ /
analyzed: lobha abhibhūtāḥ niḥśrīkāḥ daityāḥ sattva vivarjitāḥ
translated: The Daityas, overcome by greed and devoid of prosperity and courage,

original: śriyā vihīnair niḥsattvair devaiś cakrus tato raṇam // / / //
analyzed: śriyā vihīnaiḥ niḥsattvaiḥ devaiḥ cakruḥ tatas raṇam
translated: fought with the gods who were also devoid of prosperity and courage.

original: vijitās tridaśā daityair indrādyāḥ śaraṇaṃ yayuḥ /
analyzed: vijitāḥ tridaśāḥ daityaiḥ indra ādyāḥ śaraṇam yayuḥ
translated: The gods were conquered by the demons, and Indra and the others went for refuge.

original: pitāmahaṃ mahābhāgaṃ hutāśanapurogamāḥ // / / //
analyzed: pitāmaham mahābhāgam hutāśana purogamāḥ
translated: The gods, headed by Indra, sought refuge with the Grandfather, the illustrious one, who was at the head of the sacrificial fire.

original: nārāyaṇam aṇīyāṃsam aśeṣāṇām aṇīyasām /🔽samastānāṃ gariṣṭhaṃ ca bhūrādīnāṃ garīyasām // / / //

original: paraḥ parasmāt puruṣāt paramātmasvarūpadhṛk /
analyzed: paraḥ parasmāt puruṣāt paramātma sva rūpa dhṛk
translated: Greater than the supreme person, the embodiment of the supreme self,

original: yogibhiś cintyate yo 'sau muktihetor mumukṣubhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: yogibhiḥ cintyate yaḥ sau mukti hetoḥ mumukṣubhiḥ
translated: Who is contemplated by yogis, by those who seek liberation for the sake of liberation...

original: sattvādayo na santīśe yatra ca prākṛtā guṇāḥ /
analyzed: sattva ādayaḥ na santi īśe yatra ca prākṛtāḥ guṇāḥ
translated: In whom the natural qualities such as sattva do not exist, the Lord,

original: sa śuddhaḥ sarvaśuddhebhyaḥ pumān ādyaḥ prasīdatu // / / //
analyzed: sa śuddhaḥ sarva śuddhebhyaḥ pumān ādyaḥ prasīdatu
translated: May that pure, primordial being, the purest of all, be gracious to us...

original: kalākāṣṭhānimeṣādi kālasūtrasya gocare /
analyzed: kalā kāṣṭhā nimeṣa ādi kālasūtrasya gocare
translated: In the domain of the thread of time, with its kalas, kashthas, nimeshas, etc.,

original: yasya śaktir na śuddhasya prasīdatu sa no hariḥ // / / //
analyzed: yasya śaktiḥ na śuddhasya prasīdatu sa naḥ hariḥ
translated: May that Hari, whose power is not pure, be gracious to us...

original: procyate parameśo hi yaḥ śuddho 'py upacārataḥ /
analyzed: procyate parameśaḥ hi yaḥ upacārataḥ
translated: The supreme Lord is indeed said to be pure, even figuratively,

original: prasīdatu sa no viṣṇur ātmā yaḥ sarvadehinām // / / //
analyzed: prasīdatu sa naḥ viṣṇuḥ ātmā yaḥ sarva dehinām
translated: May that Vishnu, the Self of all embodied beings, be gracious to us...

original: yaḥ kāraṇaṃ ca kāryaṃ ca kāraṇasyāpi kāraṇam /
analyzed: yaḥ kāraṇam ca kāryam ca kāraṇasya api kāraṇam
translated: Who is the cause, the effect, and the cause of the cause,

original: kāryasyāpi ca yaḥ kāryaṃ prasīdatu sa no hariḥ // / / //🔽kāryakāryasya yat kāryaṃ tatkāryasyāpi yaḥ svayam /🔽tatkāryakāryabhūto yas tataś ca praṇato 'smi tam // / / //
analyzed: kāryasya api ca yaḥ kāryam prasīdatu sa naḥ hariḥ  kārya kāryasya yat kāryam tad kāryasya api yaḥ svayam  tad kārya kārya bhūtaḥ yaḥ tatas ca praṇataḥ smi tam
translated: May that Hari be pleased with me, who is the effect of the effect, and the cause of the cause.🔽I bow to Him who is the effect of the effect of the effect, and the cause of the cause of the cause.

original: kāraṇaṃ kāraṇasyāpi tasya kāraṇakāraṇam /
analyzed: kāraṇam kāraṇasya api tasya kāraṇa kāraṇam
translated: I bow to Him who is the cause of the cause of the effect of the effect.

original: tatkāraṇānāṃ hetuṃ taṃ praṇato 'smi sureśvaram // / / //🔽bhoktāraṃ bhojyabhūtaṃ ca sraṣṭāraṃ sṛjyam eva ca /
analyzed: tad kāraṇānām hetum tam praṇataḥ smi sureśvaram  bhoktāram bhojya bhūtam ca sraṣṭāram sṛjyam eva ca
translated: I bow to that Lord of the gods, who is the cause of the cause, and the cause of the cause of that cause.

original: kāryakartṛsvarūpaṃ taṃ praṇato 'smi paraṃ padam // / / //🔽viśuddhabodhavan nityam ajam akṣayam avyayam /
analyzed: kārya kartṛ svarūpam tam praṇataḥ smi param padam  viśuddha bodha vat nityam ajam akṣayam avyayam
translated: I bow to that Supreme Being, who is the enjoyer, the object of enjoyment, the creator, and the created, and who assumes the form of the agent of action.🔽I bow to that Supreme State of Vishnu, which is pure consciousness, eternal, unborn, imperishable, undecaying,

original: avyaktam avikāraṃ yat tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam // / / //🔽na sthūlaṃ na ca sūkṣmaṃ yan na viśeṣaṇagocaram /
analyzed: avyaktam a vikāram yat tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam  na sthūlam na ca sūkṣmam yat na viśeṣaṇa gocaram
translated: unmanifest, and unchanging.

original: tat padaṃ paramaṃ viṣṇoḥ praṇamāmi sadāmalam // / / //
analyzed: tat padam paramam viṣṇoḥ praṇamāmi sadā amalam
translated: I constantly bow to that pure Supreme State of Vishnu, which is neither gross nor subtle, and is not the object of any distinguishing attribute.

original: yasyāyutāyutāṃśāṃśe viśvaśaktir iyaṃ sthitā /
analyzed: yasya ayuta ayuta aṃśa aṃśe viśva śaktiḥ iyam sthitā
translated: I bow to that imperishable One, whose one hundredth part of a part contains this power of the universe,

original: parabrahmasvarūpasya praṇamāmi tam avyayam // / / //
analyzed: para brahma sva rūpasya praṇamāmi tam avyayam
translated: and who is of the nature of the Supreme Brahman.

original: yan na devā na munayo na cāhaṃ na ca śaṃkaraḥ /
analyzed: yat na devāḥ na munayaḥ na ca aham na ca śaṃkaraḥ
translated: That supreme abode of Vishnu, which neither the gods, nor the sages, nor I, nor Shankara,

original: jānanti parameśasya tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam // / / //🔽yad yoginaḥ sadodyuktāḥ puṇyapāpakṣaye 'kṣayam /
analyzed: jānanti parameśasya tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam  yat yoginaḥ sadā udyuktāḥ puṇya pāpa kṣaye kṣayam
translated: know, of the Supreme Lord.

original: paśyanti praṇave cintyaṃ tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam // / / //🔽śaktayo yasya devasya brahmaviṣṇuśivātmikāḥ /
analyzed: paśyanti praṇave cintyam tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam  śaktayaḥ yasya devasya brahma viṣṇu śiva ātmikāḥ
translated: That imperishable supreme abode of Vishnu, which the yogis, always striving, see when their sins and merits are exhausted,🔽and which is to be contemplated in the syllable Om.🔽That supreme abode of Vishnu, of whom the powers, consisting of Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva,

original: bhavanty abhūtapūrvasya tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam // / / //
analyzed: bhavanti a bhūta pūrvasya tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam
translated: belong to the unborn.

original: sarveśa sarvabhūtātman sarva sarvāśrayācyuta /
analyzed: sarva īśa sarva bhūta ātman sarva sarva āśraya acyuta
translated: O Lord of all, soul of all beings, all, support of all, Achyuta,

original: prasīda viṣṇo bhaktānāṃ vraja no dṛṣṭigocaram // / / //
analyzed: prasīda viṣṇo bhaktānām vraja naḥ dṛṣṭi gocaram
translated: be pleased, O Vishnu, and go within the range of our vision.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity udīritam ākarṇya brahmaṇas tridaśās tataḥ /
analyzed: iti udīritam ākarṇya brahmaṇaḥ tridaśāḥ tatas
translated: Having heard this uttered by Brahma, the gods

original: praṇamyocuḥ prasīdeti vraja no dṛṣṭigocaram // / / //🔽yan nāyaṃ bhagavān brahmā jānāti paramaṃ padam /
analyzed: praṇamya ūcuḥ prasīda iti vraja naḥ dṛṣṭi gocaram  yat na ayam bhagavān brahmā jānāti paramam padam
translated: bowed down and said, Be pleased and go within the range of our vision.

original: taṃ natāḥ smo jagaddhāma tava sarvagatācyuta // / / //
analyzed: tam natāḥ smaḥ jagat dhāma tava sarvagata acyuta
translated: We bow to you, O Achyuta, the abode of the world, whose supreme abode even this Lord Brahma does not know.

original: ity ante vacasas teṣāṃ devānāṃ brahmaṇas tathā /
analyzed: iti ante vacasaḥ teṣām devānām brahmaṇaḥ tathā
translated: At the end of these words of the gods and Brahma,

original: ūcur devarṣayaḥ sarve bṛhaspatipurogamāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ūcuḥ devarṣayaḥ sarve bṛhaspati purogamāḥ
translated: The celestial sages, all headed by Brihaspati, said:

original: ādyo yajñaḥ pumān īḍyo yaḥ pūrveṣāṃ ca pūrvajaḥ /
analyzed: ādyaḥ yajñaḥ pumān īḍyaḥ yaḥ pūrveṣām ca pūrvajaḥ
translated: The first sacrifice, the adorable Being, who is the foremost of all that are ancient,

original: taṃ natāḥ smo jagatsraṣṭuḥ sraṣṭāram aviśeṣaṇam // / / //
analyzed: tam natāḥ smaḥ jagat sraṣṭuḥ sraṣṭāram a viśeṣaṇam
translated: We bow to Him, the Creator of the Creator of the universe, the One without distinction.

original: bhagavan bhūtabhavyeśa yajñamūrtidharāvyaya /
analyzed: bhagavan bhūta bhavya īśa yajñamūrti dhara avyaya
translated: O Lord, the Master of the past and the future, the Immutable One who assumes the form of sacrifice,

original: prasīda praṇatānāṃ tvaṃ sarveṣāṃ dehi darśanam // / / //
analyzed: prasīda praṇatānām tvam sarveṣām dehi darśanam
translated: Be gracious, show Yourself to us all who bow to You.

original: eṣa brahmā tathaivāyaṃ saha rudrais trilocanaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa brahmā tathā eva ayam saha rudraiḥ trilocanaḥ
translated: Here is Brahma, and this is Shiva with the three eyes,

original: sarvādityaiḥ samaṃ pūṣā pāvako 'yaṃ sahāgnibhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarva ādityaiḥ samam pūṣā pāvakaḥ yam saha agnibhiḥ
translated: Pushan with all the Adityas, and Agni with the other fires,

original: aśvinau vasavaś ceme sarve caite marudgaṇāḥ /
analyzed: aśvinau vasavaḥ ca ime sarve ca ete marut gaṇāḥ
translated: Here are the Ashvins, the Vasus, and all the Maruts,

original: sādhyā viśve tathā devā devendraś cāyam īśvaraḥ // / / //🔽praṇāmapravaṇā nātha daityasainyaparājitāḥ /
analyzed: sādhyāḥ viśve tathā devāḥ deva indraḥ ca ayam īśvaraḥ  praṇāma pravaṇāḥ nātha daitya sainya parājitāḥ
translated: The Sadhyas, the Vishvadevas, and Indra the Lord of the gods,🔽O Lord, we are inclined to bow down, defeated by the demon army,

original: śaraṇaṃ tvām anuprāptāḥ samastā devatāgaṇāḥ // / / //
analyzed: śaraṇam tvām anuprāptāḥ samastāḥ devatā gaṇāḥ
translated: All the assembled hosts of gods have come to You for refuge.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: evaṃ saṃstūyamānas tu bhagavāñ chaṅkhacakradhṛk /
analyzed: evam saṃstūyamānaḥ tu bhagavān śaṅkha cakra dhṛk
translated: Thus praised, the Lord, the wielder of the conch and discus,

original: jagāma darśanaṃ teṣāṃ maitreya parameśvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: jagāma darśanam teṣām maitreya parameśvaraḥ
translated: Appeared before them, O Maitreya, the Supreme Lord.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā te tadā devāḥ śaṅkhacakragadādharam /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā te tadā devāḥ śaṅkha cakra gadā dharam
translated: Seeing him, the gods, holding a conch, discus and mace,

original: apūrvarūpasaṃsthānaṃ tejasāṃ rāśim ūrjitam // / / //
analyzed: a pūrva rūpa saṃsthānam tejasām rāśim ūrjitam
translated: with an unprecedented form and appearance, a mass of radiant energy,

original: praṇamya praṇatāḥ pūrvaṃ saṃkṣobhastimitekṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: praṇamya praṇatāḥ pūrvam saṃkṣobha stimita īkṣaṇāḥ
translated: bowing down, having bowed down earlier, with eyes still from agitation,

original: tuṣṭuvuḥ puṇḍarīkākṣaṃ pitāmahapurogamāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tuṣṭuvuḥ puṇḍarīkākṣam pitāmaha purogamāḥ
translated: praised the lotus-eyed one, with the Grandfather at the forefront.

original: devā ūcuḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The gods said:

original: namo namas te viśveśa tvaṃ brahmā tvaṃ pinākadhṛk /
analyzed: namaḥ namaḥ te viśveśa tvam brahmā tvam pinākadhṛk
translated: Salutations, salutations to you, O Lord of the universe, you are Brahma, you are the wielder of the Pinaka bow,

original: indras tvam agniḥ pavano varuṇaḥ savitā yamaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ tvam agniḥ pavanaḥ varuṇaḥ savitā yamaḥ
translated: You are Indra, Agni, Pavana (Wind), Varuna, Savita (Sun), Yama,

original: vasavo marutaḥ sādhyā viśvedevagaṇā bhavān // / / //
analyzed: vasavaḥ marutaḥ sādhyāḥ viśvedeva gaṇāḥ bhavān
translated: You are the Vasus, Maruts, Sadhyas, and the groups of Vishvadevas.

original: yo 'yaṃ tavāgato deva samīpaṃ devatāgaṇaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ yam tava āgataḥ deva samīpam devatā gaṇaḥ
translated: This group of gods who have come near you, O God,

original: sa tvam eva jagatsraṣṭā yataḥ sarvagato bhavān // / / //
analyzed: sa tvam eva jagatsraṣṭā yatas sarva gataḥ bhavān
translated: You alone are the creator of the universe, since you are omnipresent.

original: tvaṃ yajñas tvaṃ vaṣaṭkāras tvam oṅkāraḥ prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: tvam yajñaḥ tvam vaṣaṭkāraḥ tvam oṅkāraḥ prajāpatiḥ
translated: You are the sacrifice, you are the Vashatkara (the exclamation made at a sacrifice), you are the Om (the syllable uttered at the beginning of a Vedic rite), you are Prajapati,

original: vettā vedyaṃ ca sarvātmaṃs tvanmayaṃ cākhilaṃ jagat // / / //
analyzed: vettā vedyam ca sarvātman tvad mayam ca akhilam jagat
translated: You are the knower and the object of knowledge, you are the all-pervading soul, and the entire universe is full of you.

original: tvām ārtāḥ śaraṇaṃ viṣṇo prayātā daityanirjitāḥ /
analyzed: tvām ārtāḥ śaraṇam viṣṇo prayātāḥ daitya nirjitāḥ
translated: We, who are afflicted and defeated by the demons, have come to you for refuge, O Vishnu.

original: vayaṃ prasīda sarvātmaṃs tejasāpyāyayasva naḥ // / / //
analyzed: vayam prasīda sarvātman tejasā āpyāyayasva naḥ
translated: Be pleased, O soul of all, and invigorate us with your radiance.

original: tāvad ārtis tathā vāñchā tāvan mohas tathāsukham /
analyzed: tāvat ārtiḥ tathā vāñchā tāvat mohaḥ tathā asukham
translated: So long is there sorrow, so long is there desire, so long is there delusion, so long is there misery,

original: yāvan nāyāti śaraṇaṃ tvām aśeṣāghanāśanam // / / //
analyzed: yāvat nā āyāti śaraṇam tvām aśeṣa agha nāśanam
translated: Until one does not take refuge in you, the destroyer of all sins.

original: tvaṃ prasādaṃ prasannātman prapannānāṃ kuruṣva naḥ /
analyzed: tvam prasādam prasanna ātman prapannānām kuruṣva naḥ
translated: You, O Lord of the mind, be gracious to us who have sought refuge in you.

original: tejasāṃ nātha sarveṣāṃ svaśaktyāpyāyanaṃ kuru // / / //
analyzed: tejasām nātha sarveṣām sva śakti āpyāyanam kuru
translated: O Lord of all energies, nourish them according to your power.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: evaṃ saṃstūyamānas tu praṇatair amarair hariḥ /
analyzed: evam saṃstūyamānaḥ tu praṇataiḥ amaraiḥ hariḥ
translated: Thus praised by the bowing gods, Hari,

original: prasannadṛṣṭir bhagavān idam āha sa viśvakṛt // / / //
analyzed: prasanna dṛṣṭiḥ bhagavān idam āha sa viśvakṛt
translated: the blissful-eyed Lord, the creator of the universe, said this:

original: bhagavān uvāca /
analyzed: bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Lord said:

original: tejaso bhavatāṃ devāḥ kariṣyāmy upabṛṃhaṇam /
analyzed: tejasaḥ bhavatām devāḥ kariṣyāmi upabṛṃhaṇam
translated: O gods, I will increase your energy.

original: vadāmy ahaṃ yat kriyatāṃ bhavadbhis tad idaṃ surāḥ // / / //
analyzed: vadāmi aham yat kriyatām bhavadbhiḥ tat idam surāḥ
translated: I tell you what should be done by you, O gods.

original: ānīya sahitā daityaiḥ kṣīrābdhau sakalauṣadhīḥ /
analyzed: ānīya sahitāḥ daityaiḥ kṣīrābdhau sakala oṣadhīḥ
translated: Having brought all the herbs to the milk ocean along with the demons,

original: manthānaṃ mandaraṃ kṛtvā netraṃ kṛtvā tu vāsukim /
