analyzed: vinaṣṭa prāyam abhavat tvayā idānīm samedhitam
translated: became almost destroyed, and now it has been revived by you.

original: dārāḥ putrās tathāgāraṃ suhṛddhānyadhanādikam /
analyzed: dārāḥ putrāḥ tathā āgāram suhṛd dhānya dhana ādikam
translated: Wife, children, house, friends, grain, wealth, and so on -

original: bhavaty etan mahābhāge nityaṃ tvadvīkṣaṇān nṛṇām // / / //
analyzed: bhavati etat mahābhāge nityam tvad vīkṣaṇāt nṛṇām
translated: this belongs to men always by your grace, O blessed one.

original: śarīrārogyam aiśvaryam aripakṣakṣayaḥ sukham /
analyzed: śarīra ārogyam aiśvaryam ari pakṣa kṣayaḥ sukham
translated: Good health of the body, prosperity, destruction of enemies, and happiness,

original: devi tvaddṛṣṭidṛṣṭānāṃ puruṣāṇāṃ na durlabham // / / //
analyzed: devi tvad dṛṣṭi dṛṣṭānām puruṣāṇām na durlabham
translated: are not difficult to obtain for those men who are seen by your glance, O Goddess.

original: tvaṃ mātā sarvabhūtānāṃ devadevo hariḥ pitā /
analyzed: tvam mātā sarva bhūtānām devadevaḥ hariḥ pitā
translated: You are the mother of all beings, and Hari, the god of gods, is the father.

original: tvayaitad viṣṇunā cāmba jagad vyāptaṃ carācaram // / / //🔽mā naḥ kośaṃ tathā goṣṭhaṃ mā gṛhaṃ mā paricchadam /
analyzed: tvayā etat viṣṇunā ca amba jagat vyāptam carācaram  mā naḥ kośam tathā goṣṭham mā gṛham mā paricchadam
translated: O Mother, this world of moving and unmoving beings is pervaded by you and Vishnu.🔽O you who purify all, do not abandon our treasury, our cowpen, our house, our belongings,

original: mā śarīraṃ kalatraṃ ca tyajethāḥ sarvapāvani // / / //
analyzed: mā śarīram kalatram ca tyajethāḥ sarva pāvani
translated: our bodies, our wives,

original: mā putrān mā suhṛdvargān mā paśūn mā vibhūṣaṇam /
analyzed: mā putrān mā suhṛd vargāt mā paśūn mā vibhūṣaṇam
translated: our sons, our circle of friends, our animals, our ornaments,

original: tyajethā mama devasya viṣṇor vakṣaḥsthalālaye // / / //🔽sattvena satyaśaucābhyāṃ tathā śīlādibhir guṇaiḥ /
analyzed: tyajethāḥ mama devasya viṣṇoḥ vakṣaḥsthala ālaye  sattvena satya śaucābhyām tathā śīla ādibhiḥ guṇaiḥ
translated: while residing in the chest of my god Vishnu.

original: tyajyante te narāḥ sadyaḥ saṃtyaktā ye tvayāmale // / / //🔽tvayāvalokitāḥ sadyaḥ śīlādyair akhilair guṇaiḥ /
analyzed: tyajyante te narāḥ sadyas saṃtyaktāḥ ye tvayā amale  tvayā avalokitāḥ sadyas śīla ādyaiḥ akhilaiḥ guṇaiḥ
translated: Those men who are abandoned by you, O Immaculate One, are immediately abandoned by their virtues such as truthfulness, purity, and good conduct.🔽Men who are devoid of all good qualities are immediately endowed with all good qualities such as good conduct by being looked upon by you.

original: kulaiśvaryaiś ca yujyante puruṣā nirguṇā api // / / //
analyzed: kula aiśvaryaiḥ ca yujyante puruṣāḥ nirguṇāḥ api
translated: They are endowed with nobility and prosperity.

original: sa ślāghyaḥ sa guṇī dhanyaḥ sa kulīnaḥ sa buddhimān /
analyzed: sa ślāghyaḥ sa guṇī dhanyaḥ sa kulīnaḥ sa buddhimān
translated: He is praiseworthy, virtuous, fortunate, of noble birth, and intelligent,

original: sa śūraḥ sa ca vikrānto yas tvayā devi vīkṣitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa śūraḥ sa ca vikrāntaḥ yaḥ tvayā devi vīkṣitaḥ
translated: He is a hero and valiant, who has been looked at by you, O Goddess.

original: sadyo vaiguṇyam āyānti śīlādyāḥ sakalā guṇāḥ /
analyzed: sadyas vaiguṇyam āyānti śīla ādyāḥ sakalāḥ guṇāḥ
translated: All virtues, including morality, etc., immediately become defective,

original: parāṅmukhī jagaddhātrī yasya tvaṃ viṣṇuvallabhe // / / //
analyzed: parāṅmukhī jagaddhātrī yasya tvam viṣṇu vallabhe
translated: If you, O Goddess, the mother of the world, turn away from him, O beloved of Vishnu.

original: na te varṇayituṃ śaktā guṇāñ jihvāpi vedhasaḥ /
analyzed: na te varṇayitum śaktā jihvā api vedhasaḥ
translated: The tongue of Brahma himself is not able to describe your qualities.

original: prasīda devi padmākṣi māsmāṃs tyākṣīḥ kadācana // / / //
analyzed: prasīda devi padma akṣi mā asmān tyākṣīḥ kadācana
translated: Be gracious, O Goddess, O lotus-eyed one, never forsake us.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: evaṃ śrīḥ saṃstutā samyak prāha hṛṣṭā śatakratum /
analyzed: evam śrīḥ saṃstutā samyak prāha hṛṣṭā śatakratum
translated: Thus praised well, Shri, delighted, spoke to Shatakratu,

original: śṛṇvatāṃ sarvadevānāṃ sarvabhūtasthitā dvija // / / //
analyzed: śṛṇvatām sarva devānām sarva bhūta sthitā dvija
translated: while all the gods and all beings were listening, O Brahmana.

original: śrīr uvāca /🔽parituṣṭāsmi deveśa stotreṇānena te hare /
analyzed: śrīḥ uvāca  parituṣṭā asmi deveśa stotreṇa anena te hare
translated: Shri said:🔽O Lord of gods, I am pleased with this hymn of yours, O Hari.

original: varaṃ vṛṇīṣva yas tv iṣṭo varadāhaṃ tavāgatā // / / //
analyzed: varam vṛṇīṣva yaḥ tu iṣṭaḥ vara dā aham tava āgatā
translated: Choose a boon, for I have come as a granter of boons to you.

original: indra uvāca /
analyzed: indraḥ uvāca
translated: Indra said:

original: varadā yadi me devi varārho yadi cāpy aham /
analyzed: vara dā yadi me devi vara arhaḥ yadi ca api aham
translated: If you are the giver of boons, O Goddess, and if I am worthy of a boon,

original: trailokyaṃ na tvayā tyājyam eṣa me 'stu varaḥ paraḥ // / / //
analyzed: trailokyam na tvayā tyājyam eṣa me stu varaḥ paraḥ
translated: let not the three worlds be forsaken by you - let this be my supreme boon.

original: stotreṇa yas tathaitena tvāṃ stoṣyaty abdhisaṃbhave /
analyzed: stotreṇa yaḥ tathā etena tvām stoṣyati abdhi saṃbhave
translated: And he who will praise you with this hymn, O you who arose from the ocean,

original: sa tvayā na parityājyo dvitīyo 'stu varo mama // / / //
analyzed: sa tvayā na parityājyaḥ dvitīyaḥ stu varaḥ mama
translated: You should not abandon him. Let this be my second boon.

original: śrīr uvāca /
analyzed: śrīḥ uvāca
translated: Shri said:

original: trailokyaṃ tridaśaśreṣṭha na saṃtyakṣyāmi vāsava /
analyzed: trailokyam tridaśa śreṣṭha na saṃtyakṣyāmi vāsava
translated: O best of the gods, O Vasava, I will not abandon the three worlds.

original: datto varo mayāyaṃ te stotrārādhanatuṣṭayā // / / //
analyzed: dattaḥ varaḥ mayā ayam te stotra ārādhana tuṣṭayā
translated: This boon has been granted to you by me, pleased with your praise and worship.

original: yaś ca sāyaṃ tathā prātaḥ stotreṇānena mānavaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca sāyam tathā prātar stotreṇa anena mānavaḥ
translated: And the man who will praise me with this hymn in the evening and in the morning,

original: māṃ stoṣyati na tasyāhaṃ bhaviṣyāmi parāṅmukhī // / / //
analyzed: mām stoṣyati na tasya aham bhaviṣyāmi parāṅmukhī
translated: I will not turn away from him.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: evaṃ dadau varau devī devarājāya vai purā /
analyzed: evam dadau varau devī devarājāya vai purā
translated: Thus the goddess formerly granted two boons to the king of the gods,

original: maitreya śrīr mahābhāgā stotrārādhanatoṣitā // / / //
analyzed: maitreya śrīḥ mahābhāgā stotra ārādhana toṣitā
translated: O Maitreya, the greatly fortunate Shri, pleased by praise and worship.

original: bhṛgoḥ khyātyāṃ samutpannā śrīḥ pūrvam udadheḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: bhṛgoḥ khyātyām samutpannā śrīḥ pūrvam udadheḥ punar
translated: Shri was born from Khyati of Bhrigu, and again from the ocean,

original: devadānavayatnena prasūtāmṛtamanthane // / / //
analyzed: deva dānava yatnena prasūta amṛta manthane
translated: when she was born through the efforts of gods and demons in the churning of the nectar ocean.

original: evaṃ yadā jagatsvāmī devadevo janārdanaḥ /
analyzed: evam yadā jagatsvāmī devadevaḥ janārdanaḥ
translated: Thus when Janardana, the lord of the world, the god of gods,

original: avatāraṃ karoty eṣā tadā śrīs tatsahāyinī // / / //
analyzed: avatāram karoti eṣā tadā śrīḥ tad sahāyinī
translated: descends, Shri then becomes his companion.

original: punaś ca padmā saṃbhūtā ādityo 'bhūd yadā hariḥ /
analyzed: punar ca padmā saṃbhūtā ādityaḥ bhūt yadā hariḥ
translated: And again, when Hari became the sun, Padma was born,

original: yadā tu bhārgavo rāmas tadābhūd dharaṇī tv iyam // / / //
analyzed: yadā tu bhārgavaḥ rāmaḥ tadā abhūt dharaṇī tu iyam
translated: but when he was Rama, the son of Bhrigu, then she became this earth.

original: rāghavatve 'bhavat sītā rukmiṇī kṛṣṇajanmani /
analyzed: rāghava tve bhavat sītā rukmiṇī kṛṣṇa janmani
translated: In the incarnation as Rama, she was Sita, and in the birth of Krishna, she was Rukmini.

original: anyeṣu cāvatāreṣu viṣṇor eṣā sahāyinī // / / //
analyzed: anyeṣu ca avatāreṣu viṣṇoḥ eṣā sahāyinī
translated: In the other incarnations of Vishnu, she is his companion.

original: devatve devadeheyaṃ manuṣyatve ca mānuṣī /
analyzed: deva tve deva dehā iyam manuṣya tve ca mānuṣī
translated: In the state of divinity, she has a divine body, and in the human state, she is human.

original: viṣṇor dehānurūpāṃ vai karoty eṣātmanas tanum // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ deha anurūpām vai karoti eṣā ātmanaḥ tanum
translated: She assumes a form befitting Vishnu's body.

original: yaś caitac chṛṇuyāj janma lakṣmyā yaś ca paṭhen naraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca etat śṛṇuyāt janma lakṣmyāḥ yaḥ ca paṭhet naraḥ
translated: One who listens to this birth of Lakshmi and one who recites this,

original: śriyo na vicyutis tasya gṛhe yāvat kulatrayam // / / //
analyzed: śriyaḥ na vicyutiḥ tasya gṛhe yāvat kula trayam
translated: Lakshmi never departs from his house as long as three generations of his family continue.

original: paṭhyate yeṣu caiveyaṃ gṛheṣu śrīstutir mune /
analyzed: paṭhyate yeṣu ca evā iyam gṛheṣu śrī stutiḥ mune
translated: O sage! In those houses where this praise of Lakshmi is recited,

original: alakṣmīḥ kalahādhārā na teṣv āste kadācana // / / //
analyzed: alakṣmīḥ kalaha ādhārā na teṣu āste kadācana
translated: Ill-fortune, the source of quarrels, never stays there.

original: etat te kathitaṃ brahman yan māṃ tvaṃ paripṛcchasi /
analyzed: etat te kathitam brahman yat mām tvam paripṛcchasi
translated: O Brahmin! I have told you what you asked me.

original: kṣīrābdhau śrīr yathā jātā pūrvaṃ bhṛgusutā satī // / / //
analyzed: kṣīrābdhau śrīḥ yathā jātā pūrvam bhṛgu sutā satī
translated: How Lakshmi, the daughter of Bhrigu, was born in the milk ocean in the past.

original: iti sakalavibhūtyavāptihetuḥ stutir iyam indramukhodgatā hi lakṣmyāḥ /
analyzed: iti sakala vibhūti avāpti hetuḥ stutiḥ iyam indra mukha udgatā hi lakṣmyāḥ
translated: This praise of Lakshmi, which originated from Indra's mouth, is the cause of attaining all prosperity.

original: anudinam iha paṭhyate nṛbhir yair vasati na teṣu kadācid apy alakṣmīḥ // / / //🔽iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe prathame 'ṃśe navamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: anudinam iha paṭhyate nṛbhiḥ yaiḥ vasati na teṣu kadācid api alakṣmīḥ 🔽iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe prathame ṃśe navamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: If this is recited daily by men, ill-fortune never resides with them.

original: maitreya uvāca /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca
translated: Maitreya said:

original: kathitaṃ me tvayā sarvaṃ yat pṛṣṭo 'si mahāmune /
analyzed: kathitam me tvayā sarvam yat pṛṣṭaḥ si mahā mune
translated: O great sage, you have told me everything that I asked about.

original: bhṛgusargāt prabhṛty eṣa sargo me kathyatāṃ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhṛgu sargāt prabhṛti eṣa sargaḥ me kathyatām punar
translated: Now please tell me again about the creation that began with Bhrigu's creation.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: bhṛgoḥ khyātyāṃ samutpannā lakṣmīr viṣṇuparigrahaḥ /
analyzed: bhṛgoḥ khyātyām samutpannā lakṣmīḥ viṣṇu parigrahaḥ
translated: Lakshmi, the wife of Vishnu, was born to Bhrigu from Khyati.

original: tathā dhātṛvidhātārau khyātyāṃ jātau sutau bhṛgoḥ // / / //
analyzed: tathā dhātṛ vidhātārau khyātyām jātau sutau bhṛgoḥ
translated: Similarly, Dhatri and Vidhatri were born as sons to Bhrigu from Khyati.

original: āyatir niyatiś caiva meroḥ kanye mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: āyatiḥ niyatiḥ ca eva meroḥ kanye mahātmanaḥ
translated: Aayati and Niyati were the daughters of the great Meru.

original: dhātṛvidhātros te bhārye tayor jātau sutāv ubhau // / / //
analyzed: dhātṛ vidhātroḥ te bhārye tayoḥ jātau sutau ubhau
translated: They were the wives of Dhatri and Vidhatri and gave birth to two sons.

original: prāṇaś caiva mṛkaṇḍuś ca mārkaṇḍeyo mṛkaṇḍutaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ ca eva mṛkaṇḍuḥ ca mārkaṇḍeyaḥ mṛkaṇḍutaḥ
translated: Pranas and Mrikandu were born to them. Markandeya was born from Mrikandu.

original: tato vedaśirā jajñe prāṇasyāpi sutaṃ śṛṇu // / / //
analyzed: tatas vedaśirāḥ jajñe prāṇasya api sutam śṛṇu
translated: Then Veda-shira was born. Now listen about the son of Prana.

original: prāṇasya dyutimān putro rājavāṃś ca tato 'bhavat /
analyzed: prāṇasya dyutimān putraḥ rājavān ca tatas bhavat
translated: Prana had a son named Dyutiman, from whom Rajava was born.

original: tato vaṃśo mahābhāga vistāraṃ bhārgavo gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas vaṃśaḥ mahābhāga vistāram bhārgavaḥ gataḥ
translated: O greatly fortunate one, from him the Bhargava lineage spread.

original: patnī marīceḥ saṃbhūtiḥ paurṇamāsam asūyata /🔽virajāḥ parvataś caiva tasya putrau mahātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: patnī marīceḥ saṃbhūtiḥ paurṇamāsam asūyata  virajāḥ parvataḥ ca eva tasya putrau mahātmanaḥ
translated: Marichi's wife Sambhuti gave birth to Paurnamasa.🔽The great-souled one had two sons named Viraja and Parvata.

original: vaṃśasaṃkīrtane putrān vadiṣye 'haṃ tato dvija /
analyzed: vaṃśa saṃkīrtane putrān vadiṣye haṃ tatas dvija
translated: O Brahmin, I will now tell you about the sons mentioned in the lineage.

original: smṛtiś cāṅgirasaḥ patnī prasūtā kanyakās tathā /
analyzed: smṛtiḥ ca aṅgirasaḥ patnī prasūtā kanyakāḥ tathā
translated: And Smriti, the wife of Angiras, gave birth to daughters,

original: sinīvālī kuhūś caiva rākā cānumatī tathā // / / //
analyzed: sinīvālī kuhūḥ ca eva rākā ca anumatiḥ tathā
translated: Sinivali, Kuhu, Raka, and Anumati.

original: anasūyā tathaivātrer jajñe putrān akalmaṣān /
analyzed: anasūyā tathā eva atreḥ jajñe putrān akalmaṣān
translated: And Anasuiya, the wife of Atri, gave birth to sons free from sin,

original: somaṃ durvāsasaṃ caiva dattātreyaṃ ca yoginam // / / //
analyzed: somam durvāsasam ca eva dattātreyam ca yoginam
translated: Soma, Durvasa, and Dattatreya the yogi.

original: prītyāṃ pulastyabhāryāyāṃ dattolis tatsuto 'bhavat /
analyzed: prītyām pulastya bhāryāyām dattoliḥ tad sutaḥ bhavat
translated: In Priti, the wife of Pulastya, Dattoli was born as his son.

original: pūrvajanmani so 'gastyaḥ smṛtaḥ svāyaṃbhuve 'ntare // / / //
analyzed: pūrva janmani saḥ gastyaḥ smṛtaḥ svāyaṃbhuve ntare
translated: In his previous birth, he is known as Agastya in the Svayambhuva period.

original: kardamaś cārvarīvāṃś ca sahiṣṇuś ca sutatrayam /
analyzed: kardamaḥ cārvarīvān ca sahiṣṇuḥ ca suta trayam
translated: Kardama, Arvarivana, and Sahimshu are the three sons.

original: kṣamā tu suṣuve bhāryā pulahasya prajāpateḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṣamā tu suṣuve bhāryā pulahasya prajāpateḥ
translated: Kshama, the wife of Prajapati Pulaha, gave birth to them.

original: kratoś ca sannatir bhāryā vālakhilyān asūyata /
analyzed: kratoḥ ca sannatiḥ bhāryā vālakhilyān asūyata
translated: And Sannati, the wife of Kratu, gave birth to the Valakhilyas.

original: ṣaṣṭis tāni sahasrāṇi ṛṣīṇām ūrdhvaretasām /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭiḥ tāni sahasrāṇi ṛṣīṇām ūrdhvaretasām
translated: There were sixty thousand sages of celibate conduct,

original: aṅguṣṭhaparvamātrāṇāṃ jvaladbhāskaratejasām // / / //
analyzed: aṅguṣṭha parva mātrāṇām jvalat bhāskara tejasām
translated: the size of a thumb joint, blazing with the brilliance of the sun.

original: ūrjāyāṃ ca vasiṣṭhasya saptājāyanta vai sutāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ūrjāyām ca vasiṣṭhasya sapta ajāyanta vai sutāḥ
translated: And in Urja, the wife of Vasishtha, seven sons were born.

original: rajo gotrordhvabāhuś ca savanaś cānaghas tathā /
analyzed: rajaḥ gotra ūrdhvabāhuḥ ca savanaḥ ca anaghaḥ tathā
translated: Rajas, Gotra, Urdhvabahu, Savana, Ananga,

original: sutapāḥ śukra ity ete sarve saptarṣayo 'malāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sutapāḥ śukraḥ iti ete sarve sapta ṛṣayaḥ malāḥ
translated: Sutapa, and Shukra - all these seven sages are pure.

original: yo 'sāv agnir abhimānī brahmaṇas tanayo 'grajaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ agniḥ abhimānī brahmaṇaḥ tanayaḥ grajaḥ
translated: That Agni who was the eldest son of Brahma, born of his mind,

original: tasmāt svāhā sutāṃl lebhe trīn udāraujaso dvija // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt svāhā sutān lebhe trīn udāra ojasaḥ dvija
translated: From him, O twice-born one, Svaha obtained three sons of great vigor.

original: pāvakaṃ pavamānaṃ ca śuciṃ cāpi jalāśinam // / / //
analyzed: pāvakam pavamānam ca śucim ca api jala āśinam
translated: Pavaka, Pavamana, and also Shuchi, the eater of water.

original: teṣāṃ tu saṃtatāv anye catvāriṃśac ca pañca ca /
analyzed: teṣām tu saṃtatau anye catvāriṃśat ca pañca ca
translated: And from their continuation, there are another forty-five,

original: kathyante vahnayaś caite pitā putratrayaṃ ca yat // / / //
analyzed: kathyante vahnayaḥ ca ete pitā putra trayam ca yat
translated: These are said to be the fires, and the father and three sons.

original: evam ekonapañcāśad vahnayaḥ parikīrtitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: evam ekonapañcāśat vahnayaḥ parikīrtitāḥ
translated: Thus, the fires are declared to be forty-nine.

original: pitaro brahmaṇā sṛṣṭā vyākhyātā ye mayā tava /
analyzed: pitaraḥ brahmaṇā sṛṣṭāḥ vyākhyātāḥ ye mayā tava
translated: The ancestors who were created by Brahma and described by me to you,

original: agniṣvāttā barhiṣado 'nagnayaḥ sāgnayaś ca ye // / / //
analyzed: agniṣvāttāḥ barhiṣadaḥ nagnayaḥ sa agnayaḥ ca ye
translated: The Agniṣvāttas, Barhiṣads, Anāgāmins, and Sāgāmins,

original: tebhyaḥ svadhā sute jajñe menāṃ vai dhāriṇīṃ tathā /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ svadhā sute jajñe menām vai dhāriṇīm tathā
translated: From them, Svadhā gave birth to Sutā and also Menā, the supporter.

original: te ubhe brahmavādinyau yoginyau cāpy ubhe dvija // / / //
analyzed: te ubhe brahma vādinyau yoginyau ca api ubhe dvija
translated: Both of them are expounders of the Vedas, and both are yoginīs, O twice-born.

original: uttamajñānasaṃpanne sarvaiḥ samuditair guṇaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: uttama jñāna saṃpanne sarvaiḥ samuditaiḥ guṇaiḥ
translated: Endowed with the highest knowledge, and with all the virtues combined.

original: ity eṣā dakṣakanyānāṃ kathitāpatyasaṃtatiḥ /
analyzed: iti eṣā dakṣa kanyānām kathita apatya saṃtatiḥ
translated: Thus is told the continuation of the offspring of Daksha's daughters.

original: śraddhāvān saṃsmarann etām anapatyo na jāyate // / / //
analyzed: śraddhāvān saṃsmaran etām anapatyaḥ na jāyate
translated: One who is faithful and remembers this, does not become childless.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe prathame 'ṃśe daśamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe prathame ṃśe daśamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the tenth chapter in the first section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: priyavratottānapādau manoḥ svāyambhuvasya tu /
analyzed: priyavrata uttānapādau manoḥ svāyambhuvasya tu
translated: Priyavrata and Uttamapada, the two sons of Manu, the son of the self-existent one,

original: dvau putrau sumahāvīryau dharmajñau kathitau tava // / / //🔽tayor uttānapādasya surucyām uttamaḥ sutaḥ /
analyzed: dvau putrau su mahā vīryau dharma jñau kathitau tava  tayoḥ uttānapādasya surucyām uttamaḥ sutaḥ
translated: who are known to be very powerful and virtuous, have been mentioned to you.🔽Of them, the best son of Uttamapada,

original: abhīṣṭāyām abhūd brahman pitur atyantavallabhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: abhīṣṭāyām abhūt brahman pituḥ atyanta vallabhaḥ
translated: was born to his beloved wife Suruchi, O Brahmana, and was dearly loved by his father.

original: sunītir nāma yā rājñas tasyābhūn mahiṣī dvija /
analyzed: sunītiḥ nāma yā rājñaḥ tasya abhūt mahiṣī dvija
translated: O Brahmana, the king had a queen named Suniti,

original: sa nātiprītimāṃs tasyāṃ tasyāś cābhūd dhruvaḥ sutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa na ati prītimān tasyām tasyāḥ ca abhūt dhruvaḥ sutaḥ
translated: and he was not very fond of her, and she had a son named Dhruva.

original: rājāsanasthitasyāṅkaṃ pitur bhrātaram āśritam /
analyzed: rāja āsana sthitasya aṅkam pituḥ bhrātaram āśritam
translated: Seeing his brother Uttama seated on his father's lap,

original: dṛṣṭvottamaṃ dhruvaś cakre tam āroḍhuṃ manoratham // / / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā uttamam dhruvaḥ cakre tam āroḍhum manoratham
translated: Dhruva desired to ascend there.

original: pratyakṣaṃ bhūpatis tasyāḥ surucyā nābhyanandata /
analyzed: pratyakṣam bhūpatiḥ tasyāḥ surucyāḥ na abhyanandata
translated: The king, in the presence of Suniti, did not welcome

original: praṇayenāgataṃ putram utsaṅgārohaṇotsukam // / / //
analyzed: praṇayena āgatam putram utsaṅga ārohaṇa utsukam
translated: his son who had come with affection, eager to ascend his lap.

original: sapatnī tanayaṃ dṛṣṭvā tam aṅkārohaṇotsukam /
analyzed: sapatnī tanayam dṛṣṭvā tam aṅka ārohaṇa utsukam
translated: Seeing her son eager to ascend her lap,

original: svaputraṃ ca tathārūḍhaṃ surucir vākyam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: sva putram ca tathā ārūḍham suruciḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: and her own son already seated there, Suruchi spoke these words:

original: kriyate kiṃ vṛthā vatsa mahān eṣa manorathaḥ /
analyzed: kriyate kim vṛthā vatsa mahān eṣa manorathaḥ
translated: O child, why do you make this great effort in vain?

original: anyastrīgarbhajātena asaṃbhūya mamodare /
analyzed: anya strī garbha jātena a saṃbhūya mama udare
translated: You desire to be born in the womb of another woman, without being conceived in my womb.

original: uttamottamam aprāpyam aviveko 'bhivāñchasi // / / //
analyzed: uttama uttamam a prāpyam a vivekaḥ bhivāñchasi
translated: You desire what is unattainable, what is supreme, without discrimination.

original: satyaṃ sutas tvam apy asya kintu na tvaṃ mayā dhṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: satyam sutaḥ tvam api asya kintu na tvam mayā dhṛtaḥ
translated: It is true that you are his son, but you were not held by me.

original: etad rājāsanaṃ sarvabhūbhṛtsaṃśrayaketanam /🔽yogyaṃ mamaiva putrasya kim ātmā kliśyate tvayā // / / //
analyzed: etat rāja āsanam sarva bhūbhṛt saṃśraya ketanam  yogyam mama eva putrasya kim ātmā kliśyate tvayā
translated: This royal throne is the emblem of the support of all kings.🔽It is worthy only of my son. Why do you torment yourself?

original: uccair manorathas te 'yaṃ matputrasyeva kiṃ vṛthā /
analyzed: uccais manorathaḥ te yam mad putrasya iva kim vṛthā
translated: Is this lofty desire of yours in vain, like that of my son?

original: sunītyām ātmano janma kiṃ tvayā nāvagamyate // / / //
analyzed: sunītyām ātmanaḥ janma kim tvayā na avagamyate
translated: Do you not understand that you were born from Sunīti, yourself?

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parāśara said:

original: utsṛjya pitaraṃ bālas tac chrutvā mātṛbhāṣitam /
analyzed: utsṛjya pitaram bālaḥ tat śrutvā mātṛ bhāṣitam
translated: Hearing those words of his mother, the child, abandoning his father,

original: jagāma kupito mātur nijāyā dvija mandiram // / / //
analyzed: jagāma kupitaḥ mātuḥ nijāyāḥ dvija mandiram
translated: went in anger, O twice-born one, to the house of his own mother.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā kupitaṃ putram īṣatprasphuritādharam /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā kupitam putram īṣat prasphurita adharam
translated: Seeing that angry son, with his lips slightly quivering,

original: sunītir aṅkam āropya maitreyaitad abhāṣata // / / //
analyzed: sunītiḥ aṅkam āropya maitreya etat abhāṣata
translated: Sunīti, O Maitreya, having placed him on her lap, said this:

original: sunītir uvāca /
analyzed: sunītiḥ uvāca
translated: Sunīti said:

original: vatsa kaḥ kopahetus te kaś ca tvāṃ nābhinandati /
analyzed: vatsa kaḥ kopa hetuḥ te kaḥ ca tvām na abhinandati
translated: O child, what is the cause of your anger? Who does not welcome you?

original: ko 'vajānāti pitaraṃ tava yas te 'parādhyati // / / //
analyzed: kaḥ vajānāti pitaram tava yaḥ te parādhyati
translated: Who disrespects your father, who offends you?

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity uktaḥ sakalaṃ mātre kathayām āsa tad yathā /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ sakalam mātre kathayām āsa tat yathā
translated: Thus addressed, he told his mother everything as it had happened.

original: suruciḥ prāha bhūpālapratyakṣam atigarvitā // / / //
analyzed: suruciḥ prāha bhūpāla pratyakṣam ati garvitā
translated: Suruchi said in the presence of the king, extremely proud...

original: niḥśvasya seti kathite tasmin putreṇa durmanāḥ /
analyzed: niḥśvasya sā iti kathite tasmin putreṇa durmanāḥ
translated: When her son told her this, she sighed and became distressed.

original: śvāsakṣāmekṣaṇā dīnā sunītir vākyam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: śvāsa kṣāma īkṣaṇā dīnā sunītiḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: With eyes dimmed by breath, the miserable Suniti spoke these words...

original: sunītir uvāca /
analyzed: sunītiḥ uvāca
translated: Suniti said:

original: suruciḥ satyam āhedaṃ svalpabhāgyo 'si putraka /
analyzed: suruciḥ satyam āha idam su alpabhāgyaḥ si putraka
translated: Suruchi has spoken the truth, my son, you have little merit.

original: na hi puṇyavatāṃ vatsa sapatnair evam ucyate // / / //
analyzed: na hi puṇyavatām vatsa sapatnaiḥ evam ucyate
translated: O child, one who has merit is not spoken to like this by rivals.

original: nodvegas tāta kartavyaḥ kṛtaṃ yad bhavatā purā /
analyzed: na udvegaḥ tāta kartavyaḥ kṛtam yat bhavatā purā
translated: O son, you should not be distressed. What has been done by you before,

original: tat ko 'pahartuṃ śaknoti dātuṃ kaś cākṛtaṃ tvayā // / / //
analyzed: tat kaḥ upahartum śaknoti dātum kaḥ ca a kṛtam tvayā
translated: who can take that away? And who can give you what has not been done by you?

original: ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: veṅk ins
translated: Here is the corrected and aligned text:

original: tat tvayā nātra kartavyaṃ duḥkhaṃ tadvākyasaṃbhavam // / / //
analyzed: tat tvayā nā atra kartavyam duḥkham tad vākya saṃbhavam
translated: Therefore, you should not feel sorrow on account of his words.

original: rājāsanaṃ tathā chatraṃ varāśvā varavāraṇāḥ /
analyzed: rāja āsanam tathā chatram vara aśvāḥ vara vāraṇāḥ
translated: The royal throne, the umbrella, the excellent horses and elephants,

original: yasya puṇyāni tasyaiva matvaitac chāmya putraka // / / //
analyzed: yasya puṇyāni tasya eva matvā etat śāmya putraka
translated: thinking that these belong to one who has merit, be pacified, O son.

original: anyajanmakṛtaiḥ puṇyaiḥ surucyāṃ surucir nṛpaḥ /
analyzed: anya janma kṛtaiḥ puṇyaiḥ surucyām suruciḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: By the merits of his deeds in a previous life, Suruci became the king's beloved wife.

original: bhāryeti procyate cānyā madvidhā puṇyavarjitā // / / //
analyzed: bhāryā iti procyate ca anyā madvidhā puṇya varjitā
translated: But others like me, devoid of merit, are called wives.

original: puṇyopacayasaṃpannas tasyāḥ putras tathottamaḥ /
analyzed: puṇya upacaya saṃpannaḥ tasyāḥ putraḥ tathā uttamaḥ
translated: His son was also excellent, endowed with the accumulation of meritorious deeds.

original: mama putras tathā jātaḥ svalpapuṇyo dhruvo bhavān // / / //
analyzed: mama putraḥ tathā jātaḥ su alpa puṇyaḥ dhruvaḥ bhavān
translated: And my son was born thus, you, Dhruva, are of little merit.

original: tathāpi duḥkhaṃ na bhavān kartum arhati putraka /
analyzed: tathā api duḥkham na bhavān kartum arhati putraka
translated: Still, O son, you should not grieve.

original: yasya yāvat sa tenaiva svena tuṣyati buddhimān // / / //
analyzed: yasya yāvat sa tena eva svena tuṣyati buddhimān
translated: The wise one is satisfied with his own, as much as he has.

original: yadi ced duḥkham atyarthaṃ surucyā vacanāt tava /
analyzed: yadi ced duḥkham atyartham surucyāḥ vacanāt tava
translated: If, indeed, you are greatly afflicted by the words of Suruci,

original: tat puṇyopacaye yatnaṃ kuru sarvaphalaprade // / / //
analyzed: tat puṇya upacaye yatnam kuru sarva phala prade
translated: then strive for the accumulation of merit, which bestows all fruits.

original: suśīlo bhava dharmātmā maitraḥ prāṇihite rataḥ /
analyzed: su śīlaḥ bhava dharma ātmā maitraḥ prāṇi hite rataḥ
translated: Be virtuous, righteous, friendly, and devoted to the welfare of beings.

original: nimnaṃ yathāpaḥ pravaṇāḥ pātram āyānti saṃpadaḥ // / / //
analyzed: nimnam yathā āpaḥ pravaṇāḥ pātram āyānti saṃpadaḥ
translated: As the waters flow downwards, so do riches come to the deserving.

original: dhruva uvāca /
analyzed: dhruvaḥ uvāca
translated: Dhruva said:

original: amba yat tvam idaṃ prāha praśamāya vaco mama /
analyzed: amba yat tvam idam prāha praśamāya vacaḥ mama
translated: Mother, the words you have spoken to pacify me,

original: naitad durvacasā bhinne hṛdaye mama tiṣṭhati // / / //
analyzed: na etat durvacasā bhinne hṛdaye mama tiṣṭhati
translated: do not remain in my heart, which is not shattered by harsh words.

original: so 'haṃ tathā yatiṣyāmi yathā sarvottamottamam /
analyzed: saḥ ham tathā yatiṣyāmi yathā sarva uttama uttamam
translated: I shall strive in such a way that I will attain the highest of all.

original: sthānaṃ prāpsyāmy aśeṣāṇāṃ jagatām abhipūjitam // / / //
analyzed: sthānam prāpsyāmi aśeṣāṇām jagatām abhipūjitam
translated: I shall attain that position which is worshipped by all the worlds.

original: surucir dayitā rājñas tasyā jāto 'smi nodarāt /
analyzed: suruciḥ dayitā rājñaḥ tasyāḥ jātaḥ smi na udarāt
translated: I, Suruchi, the beloved of the king, was born from her womb.

original: prabhāvaṃ paśya me 'mba tvaṃ dhṛtasyāpi tavodare // / / //
analyzed: prabhāvam paśya me mba tvam dhṛtasya api tava udare
translated: O mother, behold my power, though held in your womb.

original: uttamaḥ sa mama bhrātā yo garbheṇa dhṛtas tayā /
analyzed: uttamaḥ sa mama bhrātā yaḥ garbheṇa dhṛtaḥ tayā
translated: He is my elder brother who was held by her in her womb.

original: sa rājāsanam āpnotu pitrā dattaṃ tathāstu tat // / / //
analyzed: sa rāja āsanam āpnotu pitrā dattam tathā astu tat
translated: Let him attain the royal throne given by our father. Let it be so.

original: nānyadattam abhīpsyāmi sthānam amba svakarmaṇā /
analyzed: na anya dattam abhīpsyāmi sthānam amba sva karmaṇā
translated: O mother, I do not desire any other position given by others, but by my own deeds.

original: icchāmi tad ahaṃ sthānaṃ yan na prāpa pitā mama // / / //
analyzed: icchāmi tat aham sthānam yat na prāpa pitā mama
translated: I desire that position which my father did not attain.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: nirjagāma gṛhān mātur ity uktvā mātaraṃ dhruvaḥ /
analyzed: nirjagāma gṛhāt mātuḥ iti uktvā mātaram dhruvaḥ
translated: Having said this to his mother, Dhruva left his mother's house.

original: purāc ca nirgamya tatas tadbāhyopavanaṃ yayau // / / //
analyzed: purāt ca nirgamya tatas tad bāhya upavanam yayau
translated: And having gone out of the city, he went to the garden outside.

original: sa dadarśa munīṃs tatra sapta pūrvāgatān dhruvaḥ /
analyzed: sa dadarśa munīn tatra sapta pūrva āgatān dhruvaḥ
translated: Dhruva saw there seven sages who had come earlier,

original: kṛṣṇājinottarīyeṣu viṣṭareṣu samāsthitān // / / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇājina uttarīyeṣu viṣṭareṣu samāsthitān
translated: seated on mats covered with black antelope skin.

original: sa rājaputras tān sarvān praṇipatyābhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: sa rāja putraḥ tān sarvān praṇipatya abhyabhāṣata
translated: The prince bowed down to all of them and spoke to them,

original: praśrayāvanataḥ samyag abhivādanapūrvakam // / / //
analyzed: praśraya avanataḥ samyak abhivādana pūrvakam
translated: with humility and respect, preceded by salutations.

original: dhruva uvāca /
analyzed: dhruvaḥ uvāca
translated: Dhruva said:

original: uttānapādatanayaṃ māṃ nibodhata sattamāḥ /
analyzed: uttānapāda tanayam mām nibodhata sattamāḥ
translated: I am the son of Utantapada. Know me, O best of men, to be such.

original: jātaṃ sunītyāṃ nirvedād yuṣmākaṃ prāptam antikam // / / //
analyzed: jātam sunītyām nirvedāt yuṣmākam prāptam antikam
translated: I have been born of Suniti, and have come to you from a feeling of disgust.

original: ṛṣaya ūcuḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The Rishis said:

original: catuḥpañcābdasaṃbhūto bālas tvaṃ nṛpanandana /
analyzed: catur pañca abda saṃbhūtaḥ bālaḥ tvam nṛpa nandana
translated: You are a child of four or five years, O prince.

original: nirvedakāraṇaṃ kiṃcit tava nādyāpi vidyate // / / //🔽na cintyaṃ bhavataḥ kiṃcid dhriyate bhūpatiḥ pitā /
analyzed: nirveda kāraṇam kiṃcid tava na adyā api vidyate  na cintyam bhavataḥ kiṃcid dhriyate bhūpatiḥ pitā
translated: You have not as yet any cause for disgust.🔽You have nothing to grieve for. Your father is alive.

original: na caiveṣṭaviyogādi tava paśyāma bālaka // / / //
analyzed: na ca evā iṣṭa viyoga ādi tava paśyāma bālaka
translated: We do not see any cause of grief in you, O child.

original: śarīre na ca te vyādhir asmābhir upalakṣyate /
analyzed: śarīre na ca te vyādhiḥ asmābhiḥ upalakṣyate
translated: We do not see any disease in your body.

original: nirvedaḥ kiṃnimittas te kathyatāṃ yadi vidyate // / / //
analyzed: nirvedaḥ kiṃnimittaḥ te kathyatām yadi vidyate
translated: If you have any cause for disgust, do you tell us.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tataḥ sa kathayām āsa surucyā yad udāhṛtam /
analyzed: tatas sa kathayām āsa surucyā yat udāhṛtam
translated: He then told them what Suruchi had said.

original: tan niśamya tataḥ procur munayas te parasparam // / / //🔽aho kṣātraṃ paraṃ tejo bālasyāpi yad akṣamā /
analyzed: tat niśamya tatas procuḥ munayaḥ te parasparam  aho kṣātram param tejaḥ bālasya api yat akṣamā
translated: Hearing it, the Rishis said to one another:

original: sapatnyā mātur uktasya hṛdayān nāpasarpati // / / //
analyzed: sapatnyāḥ mātuḥ uktasya hṛdayāt na apasarpati
translated: Oh! the Kshatriya spirit is so great that even a child cannot bear the words of his step-mother.🔽The words spoken by her do not leave his heart.

original: bho bhoḥ kṣatriyadāyāda nirvedād yat tvayādhunā /
analyzed: bho bhoḥ kṣatriya dāyāda nirvedāt yat tvayā adhunā
translated: O prince, the disgust which you have shown today,

original: kartuṃ vyavasitaṃ tan naḥ kathyatāṃ yadi rocate // / / //🔽yac ca kāryaṃ tavāsmābhiḥ sāhāyyam amitadyute /
analyzed: kartum vyavasitam tat naḥ kathyatām yadi rocate  yat ca kāryam tava asmābhiḥ sāhāyyam amita dyute
translated: If it pleases you, tell us what we should do.🔽O you of immeasurable splendour, tell us what service we can render to you.

original: tad ucyatāṃ vivakṣus tvam asmābhir upalakṣyase // / / //
analyzed: tat ucyatām vivakṣuḥ tvam asmābhiḥ upalakṣyase
translated: We perceive that you wish to speak to us.

original: dhruva uvāca /
analyzed: dhruvaḥ uvāca
translated: Dhruva said:

original: nāham artham abhīpsāmi na rājyaṃ dvijasattamāḥ /
analyzed: na aham artham abhīpsāmi na rājyam dvijasattamāḥ
translated: O best of the twice-born, I do not desire wealth or kingdom.

original: tat sthānam ekam icchāmi bhuktaṃ nānyena yat purā // / / //
analyzed: tat sthānam ekam icchāmi bhuktam na anyena yat purā
translated: I only wish for that one place which has not been enjoyed by anyone else before.

original: etan me kriyatāṃ samyak kathyatāṃ prāpyate yathā /
analyzed: etat me kriyatām samyak kathyatām prāpyate yathā
translated: Do this for me properly. Tell me how it can be attained.

original: sthānam agryaṃ samastebhyaḥ sthānebhyo munisattamāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sthānam agryam samastebhyaḥ sthānebhyaḥ muni sattamāḥ
translated: O best of sages, that foremost place among all places.

original: marīcir uvāca /🔽anārādhitagovindair naraiḥ sthānaṃ nṛpātmaja /
analyzed: marīciḥ uvāca  an ārādhita govindaiḥ naraiḥ sthānam nṛpa ātmaja
translated: Marichi said:

original: na hi saṃprāpyate śreṣṭhaṃ tasmād ārādhayācyutam // / / //
analyzed: na hi saṃprāpyate śreṣṭham tasmāt ārādhaya acyutam
translated: O prince, that excellent place cannot be attained by men who have not worshipped Govinda. Therefore, worship Achyuta.

original: atrir uvāca /🔽paraḥ parāṇāṃ puruṣo yasya tuṣṭo janārdanaḥ /
analyzed: atriḥ uvāca  paraḥ parāṇām puruṣaḥ yasya tuṣṭaḥ janārdanaḥ
translated: Atri said:

original: sa prāpnoty akṣayaṃ sthānam etat satyaṃ mayoditam // / / //
analyzed: sa prāpnoti akṣayam sthānam etat satyam mayā uditam
translated: That person whose Janardana, the Supreme Being of all, is pleased, attains the imperishable place. This is the truth I have spoken.

original: aṅgirā uvāca /
analyzed: aṅgirāḥ uvāca
translated: Angiras said:

original: yasyāntaḥ sarvam evedam acyutasyāvyayātmanaḥ /
analyzed: yasya antar sarvam eva idam acyutasya avyaya ātmanaḥ
translated: Within whom is all this, of Achyuta of imperishable soul,

original: tam ārādhaya govindaṃ sthānam agryaṃ yadīcchasi // / / //
analyzed: tam ārādhaya govindam sthānam agryam yadi icchasi
translated: Propitiate that Govinda, if you desire the highest position.

original: pulastya uvāca /
analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca
translated: Pulastya said:

original: paraṃ brahma paraṃ dhāma yo 'sau brahma tathā param /
analyzed: param brahma param dhāma yaḥ sau brahma tathā param
translated: He who is the supreme Brahman, the supreme abode, and the supreme Brahman itself,

original: tam ārādhya hariṃ yāti muktim apy atidurlabhām // / / //
analyzed: tam ārādhya harim yāti muktim api ati durlabhām
translated: By propitiating that Hari, one attains liberation, which is very difficult to obtain.

original: kratur uvāca /
analyzed: kratuḥ uvāca
translated: Kratu said:

original: yo yajñapuruṣo yajñe yoge yaḥ paramaḥ pumān /
analyzed: yaḥ yajñapuruṣaḥ yajñe yoge yaḥ paramaḥ pumān
translated: He who is the sacrificial being in the sacrifice, the supreme male in yoga,

original: tasmiṃs tuṣṭe yad aprāpyaṃ kiṃ tad asti janārdane // / / //
analyzed: tasmin tuṣṭe yat a prāpyam kim tat asti janārdane
translated: When he is pleased, what is there that cannot be attained in Janardana?

original: pulaha uvāca /🔽aindram indraḥ paraṃ sthānaṃ yam ārādhya jagatpatim /
analyzed: pulahaḥ uvāca  aindram indraḥ param sthānam yam ārādhya jagatpatim
translated: Pulaha said:🔽Indra, having propitiated that lord of the universe, Vishnu, the lord of sacrifice,

original: prāpa yajñapatiṃ viṣṇuṃ tam ārādhaya suvrata // / / //
analyzed: prāpa yajñapatim viṣṇum tam ārādhaya suvrata
translated: Attained the supreme position of Indra. O one of good vows, propitiate him.

original: vasiṣṭha uvāca /
analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ uvāca
translated: Vasishtha said:

original: prāpnoṣy ārādhite viṣṇau manasā yad yad icchasi /
analyzed: prāpnoṣi ārādhite viṣṇau manasā yat yat icchasi
translated: By propitiating Vishnu, you will obtain whatever you desire in your mind.

original: trailokyāntargataṃ sthānaṃ kim u vatsottamottamam // / / //
analyzed: trailokya antargatam sthānam kim vatsa uttamottamam
translated: What to speak of the best of the best positions within the three worlds?

original: ins /
analyzed: ins
translated: Inserts:

original: kṛṣṇārādhanam evaikaṃ puṃsaḥ sarvaphalapradam // / / / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇa ārādhanam eva ekam puṃsaḥ sarva phala pradam
translated: The propitiation of Krishna alone grants all fruits to a man.

original: sarvair apy evam evoktaṃ tad upāyam abṛhat sate // / / / //
analyzed: sarvaiḥ api evam evā uktam tat upāyam sate
translated: All of them have said the same, that is the means for one of great vows.

original: dhruva uvāca /
analyzed: dhruvaḥ uvāca
translated: Dhruva said:

original: ārādhyaḥ kathito devo bhavadbhiḥ praṇatasya me /
analyzed: ārādhyaḥ kathitaḥ devaḥ bhavadbhiḥ praṇatasya me
translated: The god who is to be propitiated has been mentioned by you to me who am bowing down.

original: mayā tatparitoṣāya yaj japtavyaṃ tad ucyatām // / / //
analyzed: mayā tad paritoṣāya yat japtavyam tat ucyatām
translated: Tell me what is to be repeated by me for his satisfaction.

original: yathā cārādhanaṃ tasya mayā kāryaṃ mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: yathā ca ārādhanam tasya mayā kāryam mahātmanaḥ
translated: How the propitiation of that great soul is to be done by me,

original: prasādasumukhās tan me kathayantu maharṣayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prasāda su mukhāḥ tat me kathayantu mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: the great sages, being pleased, should tell me that.

original: ṛṣaya ūcuḥ /🔽rājaputra yathā viṣṇor ārādhanaparair naraiḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ ūcuḥ  rāja putra yathā viṣṇoḥ ārādhana paraiḥ naraiḥ
translated: The sages said:🔽O prince, as the propitiation is to be done by men devoted to the propitiation of Vishnu,

original: kāryam ārādhanaṃ tan no yathāvac chrotum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: kāryam ārādhanam tat naḥ yathāvat śrotum arhasi
translated: you should listen to that as it is.

original: bāhyārthād akhilāc cittaṃ tyājayet prathamaṃ naraḥ /
analyzed: bāhya arthāt akhilāt cittam tyājayet prathamam naraḥ
translated: A man should first abandon his mind from all external objects,

original: tasminn eva jagaddhāmni tataḥ kurvīta niścalam // / / //
analyzed: tasmin eva jagat dhāmni tatas kurvīta niścalam
translated: and then fix it unwaveringly on that abode of the universe.

original: evam ekāgracittena tanmayena dhṛtātmanā /
analyzed: evam ekāgra cittena tad mayena dhṛta ātmanā
translated: Thus, with a mind concentrated, absorbed in that, and the self controlled,

original: japtavyaṃ yan nibodhaitat tan naḥ pārthivanandana // / / //
analyzed: japtavyam yat nibodha etat tat naḥ pārthiva nandana
translated: what is to be repeated should be known by you, O delight of the king.

original: hiraṇyagarbhapuruṣapradhānavyaktarūpiṇe /
analyzed: hiraṇyagarbha puruṣa pradhāna vyakta rūpiṇe
translated: To the one who has the form of the manifest, the principle Purusha, and Hiranyagarbha,

original: oṃ namo vāsudevāya śuddhajñānasvabhāvine // / / //🔽etaj jajāpa bhagavān japyaṃ svāyambhuvo manuḥ /
analyzed: om namaḥ vāsudevāya śuddha jñāna sva bhāvine  etat jajāpa bhagavān japyam svāyambhuvaḥ manuḥ
translated: Om, salutations to Vāsudeva, whose nature is pure knowledge.

original: pitāmahas tava purā tasya tuṣṭo janārdanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pitāmahaḥ tava purā tasya tuṣṭaḥ janārdanaḥ
translated: This was the Japa performed by the self-born Manu, the grandfather, in ancient times, and Janārdana was pleased with him.

original: dadau yathābhilaṣitām ṛddhiṃ trailokyadurlabhām /
analyzed: dadau yathā abhilaṣitām ṛddhim trailokya durlabhām
translated: And bestowed on him prosperity, difficult to be obtained in the three worlds, as desired by him.

original: tathā tvam api govindaṃ toṣayaitat sadā japan // / / //
analyzed: tathā tvam api govindam toṣaya etat sadā japan
translated: In the same way, you too, always reciting this, please Govinda.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe prathame 'ṃśe ekādaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe prathame ṃśe ekādaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eleventh chapter in the first section of the Visnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: niśamyaitad aśeṣeṇa maitreya nṛpateḥ sutaḥ /
analyzed: niśamya etat aśeṣeṇa maitreya nṛpateḥ sutaḥ
translated: Having heard all this, O Maitreya, the son of the king,

original: nirjagāma vanāt tasmāt praṇipatya sa tān ṛṣīn // / / //🔽kṛtakṛtyam ivātmānaṃ manyamānas tato dvija /
analyzed: nirjagāma vanāt tasmāt praṇipatya sa tān ṛṣīn  kṛtakṛtyam iva ātmānam manyamānaḥ tatas dvija
translated: departed from that forest, having bowed to those sages.

original: madhusaṃjñaṃ mahāpuṇyaṃ jagāma yamunātaṭam // / / //
analyzed: madhu saṃjñam mahā puṇyam jagāma yamunā taṭam
translated: Considering himself as having accomplished his purpose, O twice-born, he then went to the great holy place called Madhu, on the banks of the Yamuna.

original: punaś ca madhusaṃjñena daityenādhiṣṭhitaṃ yataḥ /
analyzed: punar ca madhu saṃjñena daityena adhiṣṭhitam yatas
translated: And because it was again occupied by a demon named Madhu,

original: tato madhuvanaṃ nāmnā khyātam atra mahītale // / / //
analyzed: tatas madhuvanam nāmnā khyātam atra mahī tale
translated: therefore it became known by the name of Madhuvana on this earth.

original: hatvā ca lavaṇaṃ rakṣo madhuputraṃ mahābalam /
analyzed: hatvā ca lavaṇam rakṣaḥ madhu putram mahā balam
translated: And having killed the Rakshasa Lavana, the very powerful son of Madhu,

original: śatrughno madhurāṃ nāma purīṃ yatra cakāra vai // / / //
analyzed: śatrughnaḥ madhurām nāma purīm yatra cakāra vai
translated: Shatrughna founded a city there named Madhura.

original: yatra vai devadevasya sāṃnidhyaṃ harimedhasaḥ /
analyzed: yatra vai devadevasya sāṃnidhyam harimedhasaḥ
translated: Where there is the presence of the god of gods, the tawny-haired Hari,

original: sarvapāpahare tasmiṃs tapas tīrthe cakāra saḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarva pāpa hare tasmin tapaḥ tīrthe cakāra saḥ
translated: in that holy place which removes all sins, he performed austerities.

original: marīcimiśrair munibhir yathoddiṣṭam abhūt tathā /
analyzed: marīci miśraiḥ munibhiḥ yathā uddiṣṭam abhūt tathā
translated: As directed by the sages including Marīci, it happened accordingly.

original: ātmany aśeṣadeveśaṃ sthitaṃ viṣṇum amanyata // / / //
analyzed: ātmani aśeṣa deva īśam sthitam viṣṇum amanyata
translated: He considered Viṣṇu, the Lord of all gods, to be present within himself.

original: ananyacetasas tasya dhyāyato bhagavān hariḥ /
analyzed: an anya cetasaḥ tasya dhyāyataḥ bhagavān hariḥ
translated: For him, whose mind was fixed on nothing else and who meditated, Lord Hari

original: sarvabhūtagato vipra sarvabhāvagato 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: sarva bhūta gataḥ vipra sarva bhāva gataḥ bhavat
translated: became present in all beings and in all states, O Brāhmaṇa.

original: manasy avasthite tasya viṣṇau maitreya yoginaḥ /
analyzed: manasi avasthite tasya viṣṇau maitreya yoginaḥ
translated: When the yogī remained in Viṣṇu in his mind, O Maitreya,

original: na śaśāka dharā bhāram udvoḍhuṃ bhūtadhāriṇī // / / //🔽vāmapādasthite tasmin nanāmārdhena medinī /🔽dvitīyaṃ ca nanāmārdhaṃ kṣiter dakṣiṇataḥ sthite // / / //
analyzed: na śaśāka dharā bhāram udvoḍhum bhūta dhāriṇī  vāma pāda sthite tasmin nanāma ardhena medinī  dvitīyam ca nanāma ardham kṣiteḥ dakṣiṇatas sthite
translated: the earth, the supporter of beings, was unable to bear the burden.🔽When he stood with half his foot on the left side, the earth bowed down.🔽When he stood with half his foot on the right side, the earth bowed down again.

original: pādāṅguṣṭhena saṃpīḍya yadā sa vasudhāṃ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: pādāṅguṣṭhena saṃpīḍya yadā sa vasudhām sthitaḥ
translated: When he stood on the earth, pressing it with his big toe, O Brāhmaṇa,

original: tadā sā vasudhā vipra cacāla saha parvataiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tadā sā vasudhā vipra cacāla saha parvataiḥ
translated: then the earth trembled with the mountains.

original: nadyo nadāḥ samudrāś ca saṃkṣobhaṃ paramaṃ yayuḥ /🔽tatkṣobhād amarāḥ kṣobhaṃ paraṃ jagmur mahāmune // / / //
analyzed: nadyaḥ nadāḥ samudrāḥ ca saṃkṣobham paramam yayuḥ  tad kṣobhāt amarāḥ kṣobham param jagmuḥ mahā mune
translated: The rivers, streams and oceans became extremely agitated.🔽O great sage, the gods became extremely agitated due to that agitation.

original: yāmā nāma tadā devā maitreya paramākulāḥ /
analyzed: yāmāḥ nāma tadā devāḥ maitreya parama ākulāḥ
translated: Then, O Maitreya, the gods named Yāmas became extremely anxious.

original: indreṇa saha saṃmantrya dhyānabhaṅgaṃ pracakramuḥ // / / //
analyzed: indreṇa saha saṃmantrya dhyāna bhaṅgam pracakramuḥ
translated: Consulting with Indra, they attempted to disturb his meditation.

original: kūṣmāṇḍā vividhai rūpair mahendreṇa mahāmune /
analyzed: kūṣmāṇḍāḥ vividhaiḥ rūpaiḥ mahā indreṇa mahā mune
translated: O great sage, the Kūṣmāṇḍas, in various forms, by the Great Indra,

original: samādhibhaṅgam atyantam ārabdhāḥ kartum āturāḥ // / / //
analyzed: samādhi bhaṅgam atyantam ārabdhāḥ kartum āturāḥ
translated: O great sage, the Kūṣmāṇḍas, in various forms, were extremely eager to cause a complete disruption of his meditation.

original: sunītir nāma tanmātā sāsrā tatpurataḥ sthitā /
analyzed: sunītiḥ nāma tad mātā sa asrā tad puratas sthitā
translated: His mother Sunīti, full of tears, stood before him.

original: putreti karuṇāṃ vācam āha māyāmayī tadā // / / //
analyzed: putra iti karuṇām vācam āha māyā mayī tadā
translated: The illusory one, with a voice of compassion, said to him, Son!

original: putrakāsmān nivartasva śarīravyayadāruṇāt /
analyzed: putraka asmāt nivartasva śarīra vyaya dāruṇāt
translated: Son, why do you persist in this terrible self-mortification?

original: nirbandhato mayā labdho bahubhis tvaṃ manorathaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: nirbandhataḥ mayā labdhaḥ bahubhiḥ tvam manorathaiḥ
translated: I obtained you after many desires, with great effort.

original: dīnām ekāṃ parityaktum anāthāṃ na tvam arhasi /
analyzed: dīnām ekām parityaktum anāthām na tvam arhasi
translated: You should not abandon me, a helpless and miserable woman,

original: sapatnīvacanād vatsa agates tvaṃ gatir mama // / / //
analyzed: sapatnī vacanāt vatsa agateḥ tvam gatiḥ mama
translated: because of the words of a co-wife, O child. You are my refuge.

original: kva ca tvaṃ pañcavarṣīyaḥ kva caitad dāruṇaṃ tapaḥ /
analyzed: kva ca tvam pañca varṣīyaḥ kva ca etat dāruṇam tapaḥ
translated: Where are you, only five years old, and where is this terrible austerity?

original: nivartyatāṃ manaḥ kaṣṭān nirbandhāt phalavarjitāt // / / //
analyzed: nivartyatām manaḥ kaṣṭāt nirbandhāt phala varjitāt
translated: Turn away your mind from this painful and fruitless persistence.

original: kālaḥ krīḍanakānāṃ te tadante 'dhyayanasya ca /
analyzed: kālaḥ krīḍanakānām te tad ante dhyayanasya ca
translated: The time for your play is now, O child, and after that for study.

original: tataḥ samastabhogānāṃ tadante ceṣyate tapaḥ // / / //🔽kālaḥ krīḍanakānāṃ yas tava bālasya putraka /
analyzed: tatas samasta bhogānām tad ante ca iṣyate tapaḥ  kālaḥ krīḍanakānām yaḥ tava bālasya putraka
translated: And after that, austerity is desired for the enjoyment of all pleasures.🔽That time for your play, O child, is now,

original: tasmiṃs tvam itthaṃ tapasi kiṃ nāśāyātmano rataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmin tvam ittham tapasi kim nāśāya ātmanaḥ rataḥ
translated: why are you engaged in this kind of austerity for your own destruction?

original: matprītiḥ paramo dharmo vayovasthākriyākramam /
analyzed: mad prītiḥ paramaḥ dharmaḥ vayaḥ vasthā kriyā kramam
translated: The highest duty is to please me. Follow the order of age and condition.

original: anuvartasva mā mohaṃ nivartāsmād adharmataḥ // / / //
analyzed: anuvartasva mā moham nivarta asmāt adharmataḥ
translated: Do not be deluded. Turn away from this unrighteousness.

original: parityajati vatsādya yady etan na bhavāṃs tapaḥ /
analyzed: parityajati vatsa adya yadi etat na bhavān tapaḥ
translated: If you do not abandon this austerity today, O child,

original: tyakṣyāmy aham api prāṇāṃs tato vai paśyatas tava // / / //
analyzed: tyakṣyāmi aham api prāṇān tatas vai paśyataḥ tava
translated: then I will also give up my life, while you look on.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: sa tāṃ vilapatīm evaṃ bāṣpavyākulalocanām /
analyzed: sa tām vilapatīm evam bāṣpa vyākula locanām
translated: He, seeing her thus lamenting, her eyes filled with tears,

original: samāhitamanā viṣṇau paśyann api na dṛṣṭavān // / / //
analyzed: samāhita manāḥ viṣṇau paśyan api na dṛṣṭavān
translated: with a concentrated mind on Vishnu, though seeing, did not see.

original: vatsa vatsa sughorāṇi rakṣāṃsy etāni bhīṣaṇe /
analyzed: vatsa vatsa su ghorāṇi rakṣāṃsi etāni bhīṣaṇe
translated: O child, O child, these extremely terrible and frightening demons,

original: vane 'bhyudyataśastrāṇi samāyānty apagamyatām // / / //
analyzed: vane bhyudyata śastrāṇi samāyānti apagamyatām
translated: with uplifted weapons, are coming in the forest. Go away!

original: ity uktvā prayayau sātha rakṣāṃsy āvirbabhus tataḥ /
analyzed: iti uktvā prayayau sā atha rakṣāṃsi āvis babhuḥ tatas
translated: Having said this, she departed. Then the demons appeared,

original: abhyudyatograśastrāṇi jvālāmālākulair mukhaiḥ // / / //🔽tato nādān atīvogrān rājaputrasya te puraḥ /
analyzed: abhyudyata ugra śastrāṇi jvālā mālā ākulaiḥ mukhaiḥ  tatas nādān atīva ugrān rāja putrasya te puras
translated: with uplifted fierce weapons, their faces ablaze with garlands of flames.🔽Then the night-walkers, whirling their blazing weapons,

original: mumucur dīptaśastrāṇi bhrāmayanto niśācarāḥ // / / //
analyzed: mumucuḥ dīpta śastrāṇi bhrāmayantaḥ niśācarāḥ
translated: emitted extremely terrible roars in front of the prince.

original: śivāś ca śataśo neduḥ sajvālakavalair mukhaiḥ /
analyzed: śivāḥ ca śataśas neduḥ sa jvāla kavalaiḥ mukhaiḥ
translated: And hundreds of jackals howled with mouths agape and flaming.

original: trāsāya tasya bālasya yogayuktasya sarvataḥ // / / //🔽hanyatāṃ hanyatām eṣa chidyatāṃ chidyatām ayam /
analyzed: trāsāya tasya bālasya yoga yuktasya sarvatas  hanyatām hanyatām eṣa chidyatām chidyatām ayam
translated: For the terror of that child, engaged in yoga, on all sides.🔽Let him be killed, let him be killed! Let him be cut, let him be cut!

original: bhakṣyatāṃ bhakṣyatāṃ cāyam ity ūcus te niśācarāḥ // / / //🔽tato nānāvidhān nādān siṃhoṣṭramakarānanāḥ /
analyzed: bhakṣyatām bhakṣyatām ca ayam iti ūcuḥ te niśācarāḥ  tatas nānāvidhān nādān siṃha uṣṭra makara ānanāḥ
translated: Let him be eaten, let him be eaten! said those wanderers of the night.🔽Then those night-wanderers, with faces like lions, camels, and alligators,

original: trāsāya rājaputrasya nedus te rajanīcarāḥ // / / //
analyzed: trāsāya rāja putrasya neduḥ te rajanīcarāḥ
translated: roared various kinds of roars to frighten the prince.

original: rakṣāṃsi tāni te nādāḥ śivās tāny āyudhāni ca /
analyzed: rakṣāṃsi tāni te nādāḥ śivāḥ tāni āyudhāni ca
translated: Those sounds of the Rakshasas and those auspicious weapons,

original: govindāsaktacittasya yayur nendriyagocaram // / / //🔽ekāgracetāḥ satataṃ viṣṇum evātmasaṃśrayam /
analyzed: govinda āsakta cittasya yayuḥ nā indriya gocaram  ekāgra cetāḥ satatam viṣṇum eva ātma saṃśrayam
translated: did not come within the range of the senses of the son of the lord of the earth, whose mind was fixed on Govinda.

original: dṛṣṭavān pṛthivīnāthaputro nānyat kathaṃcana // / / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭavān pṛthivī nātha putraḥ na anyat kathaṃcana
translated: With a concentrated mind, the son of the lord of the earth always saw only Vishnu, his own refuge, and nothing else at all.

original: tataḥ sarvāsu māyāsu vilīnāsu punaḥ surāḥ /
analyzed: tatas sarvāsu māyāsu vilīnāsu punar surāḥ
translated: Then, when all the illusions had disappeared again, the gods,

original: saṃkṣobhaṃ paramaṃ jagmus tatparābhavaśaṅkitāḥ // / / //🔽te sametya jagadyonim anādinidhanaṃ harim /
analyzed: saṃkṣobham paramam jagmuḥ tad parābhava śaṅkitāḥ  te sametya jagadyonim an ādi nidhanam harim
translated: fearing his defeat, were greatly agitated.

original: śaraṇyaṃ śaraṇaṃ yātās tapasā tasya tāpitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: śaraṇyam śaraṇam yātāḥ tapasā tasya tāpitāḥ
translated: Having assembled, they went for refuge to Hari, the origin of the world, who is without beginning or end, the protector, afflicted by his austerity.

original: devā ūcuḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The gods said:

original: devadeva jagannātha pareśa puruṣottama /
analyzed: devadeva jagannātha pareśa puruṣottama
translated: God of gods, lord of the world, supreme lord, best of beings,

original: dhruvasya tapasā taptās tvāṃ vayaṃ śaraṇaṃ gatāḥ // / / //
analyzed: dhruvasya tapasā taptāḥ tvām vayam śaraṇam gatāḥ
translated: We are tormented by the austerities of Dhruva and have come to you for refuge.

original: dine dine kalāśeṣaiḥ śaśāṅkaḥ pūryate yathā /
analyzed: dine dine kalā śeṣaiḥ śaśāṅkaḥ pūryate yathā
translated: Just as the moon is filled day by day by the remaining digits,

original: tathāyaṃ tapasā deva prayāty ṛddhim aharniśam // / / //🔽auttānapāditapasā vayam itthaṃ janārdana /
analyzed: tathā ayam tapasā deva prayāti ṛddhim aharniśam  auttānapādi tapasā vayam ittham janārdana
translated: in the same way, O Lord, this one attains prosperity day and night through austerities.🔽O Janardana, we are thus frightened by the austerities of Utanka's son.

original: bhītās tvāṃ śaraṇaṃ yātās tapasas taṃ nivartaya // / / //🔽na vidmaḥ kiṃ sa śakratvaṃ kiṃ sūryatvam abhīpsati /
analyzed: bhītāḥ tvām śaraṇam yātāḥ tapasaḥ tam nivartaya  na vidmaḥ kim sa śakra tvam kim sūrya tvam abhīpsati
translated: We have come to you for refuge, turn him away from austerities.🔽We do not know what state he desires, whether Shakra's, Surya's, or the lord of waters,

original: vittapāmbupasomānāṃ sābhilāṣaḥ padeṣu kim // / / //
analyzed: vittapa ambupa somānām sa abhilāṣaḥ padeṣu kim
translated: or whether he is desirous of the positions of Kubera, Varuna, and Soma.

original: tad asmākaṃ prasīdeśa hṛdayāc chalyam uddhara /
analyzed: tat asmākam prasīda īśa hṛdayāt śalyam uddhara
translated: Therefore, be gracious to us and remove this dart from our hearts.

original: uttānapādatanayaṃ tapasaḥ saṃnivartaya // / / //
analyzed: uttānapāda tanayam tapasaḥ saṃnivartaya
translated: Turn away Utanka's son from austerities.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca /🔽nendratvaṃ na ca sūryatvaṃ naivāmbupadhaneśatām /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca  na indra tvam na ca sūrya tvam na eva ambupa dhaneśa tām
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: prārthayaty eṣa yaṃ kāmaṃ taṃ karomy akhilaṃ surāḥ // / / //
analyzed: prārthayati eṣa yam kāmam tam karomi akhilam surāḥ
translated: I will fulfill all the desires for which he is performing austerities, whether it be the state of Indra, Surya, or the lord of waters.

original: yāta devā yathākāmaṃ svasthānaṃ vigatajvarāḥ /
analyzed: yāta devāḥ yathākāmam sva sthānam vigata jvarāḥ
translated: Go, O gods, to your respective abodes, free from anxiety.

original: nivartayāmy ahaṃ bālaṃ tapasy āsaktamānasam // / / //
analyzed: nivartayāmi aham bālam tapasi āsakta mānasam
translated: I shall turn away the child whose mind is attached to austerities.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity uktā devadevena praṇamya tridaśās tataḥ /
analyzed: iti uktāḥ devadevena praṇamya tridaśāḥ tatas
translated: Thus addressed by the Lord of the gods, the thirty gods,

original: prayayuḥ svāni dhiṣṇyāni śatakratupurogamāḥ // / / //
analyzed: prayayuḥ svāni dhiṣṇyāni śatakratu purogamāḥ
translated: having bowed to him, went to their respective abodes, with Indra at their head.

original: bhagavān api sarvātmā tanmayatvena toṣitaḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān api sarva ātmā tad maya tvena toṣitaḥ
translated: The Lord, the soul of all, being satisfied by Dhruva's devotion to him,

original: gatvā dhruvam uvācedaṃ caturbhujavapur hariḥ // / / //
analyzed: gatvā dhruvam uvāca idam catur bhuja vapuḥ hariḥ
translated: Hari, assuming the form of four arms, went to Dhruva and said to him:

original: śrībhagavān uvāca /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: auttānapāde bhadraṃ te tapasā paritoṣitaḥ /
analyzed: auttānapāde bhadram te tapasā paritoṣitaḥ
translated: O son of Uttānapāda, welfare to you. I am pleased with your austerities.

original: varado 'ham anuprāpto varaṃ varaya suvrata // / / //
analyzed: vara daḥ ham anuprāptaḥ varam varaya suvrata
translated: I am the giver of boons. I have come. Choose a boon, O you of good vows.

original: bāhyārthanirapekṣaṃ te mayi cittaṃ yad āhitam /
analyzed: bāhya artha nirapekṣam te mayi cittam yat āhitam
translated: Your mind, independent of external objects, has been fixed on me.

original: tuṣṭo 'haṃ bhavatas tena tad vṛṇīṣva varaṃ param // / / //
analyzed: tuṣṭaḥ ham bhavataḥ tena tat vṛṇīṣva varam param
translated: I am satisfied with that. Choose from me the highest boon.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: śrutvetthaṃ gaditaṃ tasya devadevasya bālakaḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā ittham gaditam tasya devadevasya bālakaḥ
translated: Having heard this said by the god of gods, the boy,

original: unmīlitākṣo dadṛśe dhyānadṛṣṭaṃ hariṃ puraḥ // / / //
analyzed: unmīlita akṣaḥ dadṛśe dhyāna dṛṣṭam harim puras
translated: opening his eyes, saw Hari, seen in meditation, in front of him.

original: śaṅkhacakragadāśārṅgavarāsidharam acyutam /🔽kirīṭinaṃ samālokya jagāma śirasā mahīm // / / //
analyzed: śaṅkha cakra gadā śārṅga vara asi dharam acyutam  kirīṭinam samālokya jagāma śirasā mahīm
translated: Seeing Achyuta, the holder of the conch, discus, mace, bow, and excellent sword,🔽wearing a crown, he fell on the ground with his head.

original: romāñcitāṅgaḥ sahasā sādhvasaṃ paramaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: romāñcita aṅgaḥ sahasā sādhvasam paramam gataḥ
translated: Suddenly his body bristling with hair, he attained the highest sanctity.

original: stavāya devadevasya sa cakre mānasaṃ dhruvaḥ // / / //
analyzed: stavāya devadevasya sa cakre mānasam dhruvaḥ
translated: Dhruva made up his mind to praise the God of gods.

original: kiṃ vadāmi stutāv asya kenoktenāsya saṃstutiḥ /
analyzed: kim vadāmi stutau asya kena uktena asya saṃstutiḥ
translated: What shall I say in praising Him? By what words can His praise be uttered?

original: ity ākulamatir devaṃ tam eva śaraṇaṃ yayau // / / //
analyzed: iti ākula matiḥ devam tam eva śaraṇam yayau
translated: With his mind thus agitated, he sought refuge in Him alone.

original: dhruva uvāca /
analyzed: dhruvaḥ uvāca
translated: Dhruva said:

original: bhagavan yadi me toṣaṃ tapasā paramaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: bhagavan yadi me toṣam tapasā paramam gataḥ
translated: O Lord, if I have attained the highest satisfaction through austerities,

original: stotuṃ tad aham icchāmi varam enaṃ prayaccha me // / / //
analyzed: stotum tat aham icchāmi varam enam prayaccha me
translated: I wish to praise You. Grant me this boon.

original: brahmādyair vedavedajñair jñāyate yasya no gatiḥ /
analyzed: brahma ādyaiḥ veda veda jñaiḥ jñāyate yasya no gatiḥ
translated: He whose end is not known even by Brahma and others who know the Vedas and the Vedanta,

original: taṃ tvāṃ katham ahaṃ deva stotuṃ śakṣyāmi bālakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tam tvām katham aham deva stotum śakṣyāmi bālakaḥ
translated: O God, how can I, a child, praise You?

original: tvadbhaktipravaṇaṃ hy etat parameśvara me manaḥ /
analyzed: tvad bhakti pravaṇam hi etat parameśvara me manaḥ
translated: O Supreme Lord, this mind of mine is inclined towards devotion to You.

original: stotuṃ pravṛttaṃ tvatpādau tatra prajñāṃ prayaccha me // / / //
analyzed: stotum pravṛttam tvad pādau tatra prajñām prayaccha me
translated: It is engaged in praising Your feet. Grant me wisdom in that.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: śaṅkhaprāntena govindas taṃ pasparśa kṛtāñjalim /
analyzed: śaṅkha prāntena govindaḥ tam pasparśa kṛtāñjalim
translated: Govinda, with the tip of His conch, touched the folded hands of Utanka,

original: uttānapādatanayaṃ dvijavarya jagatpatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: uttānapāda tanayam dvija varya jagatpatiḥ
translated: the son of Utanapada, O best of Brahmanas, the Lord of the world.

original: atha prasannavadanaḥ tatkṣaṇān nṛpanandanaḥ /
analyzed: atha prasanna vadanaḥ tad kṣaṇāt nṛpa nandanaḥ
translated: Then, in a moment, the prince, with a cheerful face,

original: tuṣṭāva praṇato bhūtvā bhūtadhātāram acyutam // / / //
analyzed: tuṣṭāva praṇataḥ bhūtvā bhūta dhātāram acyutam
translated: bowed down and praised the immutable supporter of beings.

original: dhruva uvāca /
analyzed: dhruvaḥ uvāca
translated: Dhruva said:

original: bhūmir āpo 'nalo vāyuḥ khaṃ mano buddhir eva ca /
analyzed: bhūmiḥ āpaḥ nalaḥ vāyuḥ kham manaḥ buddhiḥ eva ca
translated: Earth, water, fire, air, space, mind, and intellect,

original: bhūtādir ādiprakṛtir yasya rūpaṃ nato 'smi tam // / / //
analyzed: bhūtādiḥ ādi prakṛtiḥ yasya rūpam nataḥ smi tam
translated: The primordial nature, I bow to Him whose form is that.

original: śuddhaḥ sūkṣmo 'khilavyāpī pradhānāt parataḥ pumān /
analyzed: śuddhaḥ sūkṣmaḥ khila vyāpī pradhānāt paratas pumān
translated: Pure, subtle, all-pervading, the Purusha is beyond the primordial nature.

original: yasya rūpaṃ namas tasmai puruṣāya guṇātmane // / / //
analyzed: yasya rūpam namaḥ tasmai puruṣāya guṇa ātmane
translated: I bow to Him, whose form is that, the Purusha, the soul of the qualities.

original: bhūrādīnāṃ samastānāṃ gandhādīnāṃ ca śāśvataḥ /
analyzed: bhūḥ ādīnām samastānām gandha ādīnām ca śāśvataḥ
translated: The eternal one of the earth and other elements, and of smell and other sense objects,

original: buddhyādīnāṃ pradhānasya puruṣasya ca yaḥ paraḥ // / / //🔽taṃ brahmabhūtam ātmānam aśeṣajagataḥ patim /
analyzed: buddhi ādīnām pradhānasya puruṣasya ca yaḥ paraḥ  tam brahma bhūtam ātmānam aśeṣa jagataḥ patim
translated: The one beyond the intellect and other faculties, the primordial nature, and the Purusha.

original: prapadye śaraṇaṃ śuddhaṃ tvadrūpaṃ parameśvara // / / //
analyzed: prapadye śaraṇam śuddham tvad rūpam parameśvara
translated: I take refuge in that pure form of yours, the Supreme Lord, who is Brahman, the soul, the lord of the entire world.

original: bṛhattvād bṛṃhaṇatvāc ca yad rūpaṃ brahmasaṃjñitam /
analyzed: bṛhat tvāt bṛṃhaṇa tvāt ca yat rūpam brahma saṃjñitam
translated: I bow to that form which is called Brahman, because of its greatness and nourishing nature,

original: tasmai namas te sarvātman yogicintyāvikāravat // / / //
analyzed: tasmai namaḥ te sarva ātman yogi cintya avikāravat
translated: To you, the soul of all, who are inconceivable like an unchanging entity, O immutable one.

original: sahasraśīrṣā puruṣaḥ sahasrākṣaḥ sahasrapāt /
analyzed: sahasra śīrṣā puruṣaḥ sahasra akṣaḥ sahasra pād
translated: The Purusha has a thousand heads, a thousand eyes, and a thousand feet,

original: sarvavyāpī bhuvaḥ sparśād atyatiṣṭhad daśāṅgulam // / / //
analyzed: sarvavyāpī bhuvaḥ sparśāt atyatiṣṭhat daśa aṅgulam
translated: It pervades everything and stands ten finger-breadths above the touch of the earth.

original: yad bhūtaṃ yac ca vai bhavyaṃ puruṣottama tad bhavān /
analyzed: yat bhūtam yat ca vai bhavyam puruṣottama tat bhavān
translated: O Supreme Being, you are all that exists and all that will exist,

original: tvatto virāṭ svarāṭ samrāṭ tvattaś cāpy adhipūruṣaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tvattaḥ virāj svarāj samrāj tvattaḥ ca api adhipūruṣaḥ
translated: From you, the Virāṭ, the Svarāṭ, the Samrāṭ, and also the Supreme Being.

original: atyaricyata so 'dhaś ca tiryag ūrdhvaṃ ca vai bhuvaḥ /🔽tvatto viśvam idaṃ jātaṃ tvatto bhūtabhaviṣyatī // / / //
analyzed: atyaricyata saḥ dhas ca tiryak ūrdhvam ca vai bhuvaḥ  tvattaḥ viśvam idam jātam tvattaḥ bhūta bhaviṣyatī
translated: He surpassed the earth below, diagonally, and above.🔽This entire universe was born from you, and from you will come what has not yet been.

original: tvadrūpadhāriṇaś cāntaḥ sarvabhūtam idaṃ jagat /
analyzed: tvad rūpa dhāriṇaḥ ca antar sarva bhūtam idam jagat
translated: And this universe, which is within all beings, bears your form.

original: tvatto yajñaḥ sarvahutaḥ pṛṣadājyaṃ paśur dvidhā // / / //
analyzed: tvattaḥ yajñaḥ sarva hutaḥ pṛṣadājyam paśuḥ dvidhā
translated: From you, the sacrifice, the all-consuming oblation, the speckled ghee, the animal, the two-fold...

original: tvatta ṛco 'tha sāmāni tvattaś chandāṃsi jajñire /
analyzed: tvattaḥ ṛcaḥ tha sāmāni tvattaḥ chandāṃsi jajñire
translated: From you, the Ṛc verses, the Sāman chants, from you the meters were born.

original: tvatto yajūṃṣy ajāyanta tvatto 'śvāś caikatodataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tvattaḥ yajūṃṣi ajāyanta tvattaḥ śvāḥ ca ekatodataḥ
translated: From you, the Yajus formulas were born, from you the horses with single hooves...

original: gāvas tvattaḥ samudbhūtās tvatto 'jā avayo mṛgāḥ /
analyzed: gāvaḥ tvattaḥ samudbhūtāḥ tvattaḥ jāḥ avayaḥ mṛgāḥ
translated: The cows arose from you, from you the goats, sheep, and deer.

original: tvanmukhād brāhmaṇā bāhvos tvattaḥ kṣatram ajāyata // / / //
analyzed: tvad mukhāt brāhmaṇāḥ bāhvoḥ tvattaḥ kṣatram ajāyata
translated: From your mouth, the Brahmins, from your arms, the Kṣatriyas were born.

original: vaiśyās tavorujāḥ śūdrās tava padbhyāṃ samudgatāḥ /
analyzed: vaiśyāḥ tava ūru jāḥ śūdrāḥ tava padbhyām samudgatāḥ
translated: The Vaiśyas are born from your thighs, the Śūdras arose from your feet.

original: akṣṇoḥ sūryo 'nilaḥ prāṇāc candramā manasas tava // / / //
analyzed: akṣṇoḥ sūryaḥ nilaḥ prāṇāt candramāḥ manasaḥ tava
translated: From your eyes, the sun, from your breath, the wind, from your mind, the moon...

original: prāṇo 'ntaḥsuṣirāj jāto mukhād agnir ajāyata /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ ntar suṣirāt jātaḥ mukhāt agniḥ ajāyata
translated: The breath was born from the inner cavity, from your mouth, the fire was born.

original: nābhito gaganaṃ dyauś ca śirasaḥ samavartata /
analyzed: nābhitaḥ gaganam dyauḥ ca śirasaḥ samavartata
translated: From your navel, the sky and heaven came forth from your head.

original: diśaḥ śrotrāt kṣitiḥ padbhyāṃ tvattaḥ sarvam abhūd idam // / / //
analyzed: diśaḥ śrotrāt kṣitiḥ padbhyām tvattaḥ sarvam abhūt idam
translated: The quarters from the ears, the earth from the feet, from you has all this been produced.

original: nyagrodhaḥ sumahān alpe yathā bīje vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: nyagrodhaḥ su mahān alpe yathā bīje vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Just as a very large banyan tree is contained in a small seed,

original: saṃyame viśvam akhilaṃ bījabhūte tathā tvayi // / / //
analyzed: saṃyame viśvam akhilam bīja bhūte tathā tvayi
translated: in the same way, O Lord, the entire universe is contained in you, who are the seed.

original: bījād aṅkurasaṃbhūto nyagrodhaḥ sa samucchritaḥ /
analyzed: bījāt aṅkura saṃbhūtaḥ nyagrodhaḥ sa samucchritaḥ
translated: The banyan tree grows from the seed, rising up,

original: vistāraṃ ca yathā yāti tvattaḥ sṛṣṭau tathā jagat // / / //
analyzed: vistāram ca yathā yāti tvattaḥ sṛṣṭau tathā jagat
translated: and just as it spreads out, so does the world in creation from you.

original: yathā hi kadalī nānyā tvakpatrān nātha dṛśyate /
analyzed: yathā hi kadalī na anyā tvac patrāt na atha dṛśyate
translated: Just as a plantain tree is not seen to be different from its bark and leaves, O Lord,

original: evaṃ viśvasya nānyas tvaṃ tvatsthāyīśvara dṛśyate // / / //
analyzed: evam viśvasya nā anyaḥ tvam tvad sthāyī īśvara dṛśyate
translated: in the same way, the universe is not seen to be different from you, O eternal one.

original: hlādinī saṃdhinī saṃvit tvayy ekā sarvasaṃsthitau /
analyzed: hlādinī saṃdhinī saṃvid tvayi ekā sarva saṃsthitau
translated: The one consciousness, which delights and sustains, is established in you, O Lord, in whom all things abide.

original: hlādatāpakarī miśrā tvayi no guṇavarjite // / / //🔽pṛthagbhūtaikabhūtāya bhūtabhūtāya te namaḥ /
analyzed: hlāda tāpa karī miśrā tvayi no guṇa varjite  pṛthak bhūta eka bhūtāya bhūta bhūtāya te namaḥ
translated: That which causes delight and pain is mixed, but not in you, who are free from qualities.🔽Salutations to you who are separate and yet the one reality, to you who are the reality of all beings,

original: prabhūtabhūtabhūtāya tubhyaṃ bhūtātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prabhūta bhūta bhūtāya tubhyam bhūta ātmane namaḥ
translated: salutations to you who are the reality of the abundant beings, to you who are the soul of beings.

original: vyaktapradhānapuruṣavirāṭ saṃrāṭ svarāṭ tathā /
analyzed: vyakta pradhāna puruṣa virāj saṃrāj svarāj tathā
translated: The manifest, Pradhana, Purusha, Virat, Samrat, Svarat,

original: vibhāvyate 'ntaḥkaraṇe puruṣeṣv akṣayo bhavān // / / //
analyzed: vibhāvyate ntaḥkaraṇe puruṣeṣu akṣayaḥ bhavān
translated: you, the imperishable one, are perceived in the hearts of men.

original: sarvasmin sarvabhūtas tvaṃ sarvaḥ sarvasvarūpadhṛk /
analyzed: sarvasmin sarva bhūtaḥ tvam sarvaḥ sarva sva rūpa dhṛk
translated: You are all in all beings, all, the holder of all forms.

original: sarvaṃ tvattas tataś ca tvaṃ namaḥ sarvātmane 'stu te // / / //
analyzed: sarvam tvattaḥ tatas ca tvam namaḥ sarvātmane stu te
translated: All comes from you and you are from that. Salutations to you, the soul of all.

original: sarvātmako 'si sarveśa sarvabhūtasthito yataḥ /
analyzed: sarva ātmakaḥ si sarva īśa sarva bhūta sthitaḥ yatas
translated: You are the soul of all, the lord of all, present in all beings.

original: kathayāmi tataḥ kiṃ te sarvaṃ vetsi hṛdi sthitam // / / //🔽sarvātman sarvabhūteśa sarvasattvasamudbhava /
analyzed: kathayāmi tatas kim te sarvam vetsi hṛdi sthitam  sarva ātman sarva bhūta īśa sarva sattva samudbhava
translated: Therefore, what can I tell you? You know everything in the heart.🔽O soul of all, lord of all beings, origin of all beings,

original: sarvabhūto bhavān vetti sarvasattvamanoratham // / / //
analyzed: sarva bhūtaḥ bhavān vetti sarva sattva manoratham
translated: You are all beings. You know the desires of all beings.

original: yo me manoratho nātha saphalaḥ sa tvayā kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ me manorathaḥ nātha saphalaḥ sa tvayā kṛtaḥ
translated: O lord, the desire I had has been fulfilled by you.

original: tapaś ca taptaṃ saphalaṃ yad dṛṣṭo 'si jagatpate // / / //
analyzed: tapaḥ ca taptam saphalam yat dṛṣṭaḥ si jagatpate
translated: The penance I performed has borne fruit, for I have seen you, the lord of the world.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: tapasas tat phalaṃ prāptaṃ yad dṛṣṭo 'haṃ tvayā dhruva /
analyzed: tapasaḥ tat phalam prāptam yat dṛṣṭaḥ ham tvayā dhruva
translated: The fruit of your penance has been obtained, in that you have seen me, O Dhruva.

original: maddarśanaṃ hi viphalaṃ rājaputra na jāyate // / / //
analyzed: mad darśanam hi viphalam rāja putra na jāyate
translated: For seeing me, O prince, does not go in vain.

original: varaṃ varaya tasmāt tvaṃ yathābhimatam ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: varam varaya tasmāt tvam yathā abhimatam ātmanaḥ
translated: Therefore, choose a boon as you desire for yourself.

original: sarvaṃ saṃpadyate puṃsāṃ mayi dṛṣṭipathaṃ gate // / / //
analyzed: sarvam saṃpadyate puṃsām mayi dṛṣṭi patham gate
translated: For men, everything is accomplished when they come within the range of my vision.
