analyzed: na yaṣṭavyam na hotavyam na dātavyam kathaṃcana
translated: One should not perform sacrifices, one should not offer oblations, one should not give anything at all,

original: bhoktā yajñasya kas tv anyo hy ahaṃ yajñapatiḥ prabhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhoktā yajñasya kaḥ tu anyaḥ hi aham yajñapatiḥ prabhuḥ
translated: Who else is the enjoyer of the sacrifice? I am the lord of the sacrifice and the master.

original: tatas tam ṛṣayaḥ pūrvaṃ saṃpūjya pṛthivīpatim /
analyzed: tatas tam ṛṣayaḥ pūrvam saṃpūjya pṛthivīpatim
translated: Then the sages, having first worshipped the lord of the earth,

original: ūcuḥ sāmakalaṃ samyaṅ maitreya samupasthitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ūcuḥ sāma kalam samyak maitreya samupasthitāḥ
translated: Spoke to him in full, O Maitreya, having approached him.

original: ṛṣaya ūcuḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The sages said:

original: bho bho rājañ chṛṇuṣva tvaṃ yad vadāmas tava prabho /
analyzed: bho bho rājam śṛṇuṣva tvam yat vadāmaḥ tava prabho
translated: O king, listen to what we say, O lord,

original: rājyadehopakārāya prajānāṃ ca hitaṃ param // / / //🔽dīrghasatreṇa deveśaṃ sarvayajñeśvaraṃ harim /
analyzed: rājya deha upakārāya prajānām ca hitam param  dīrgha satreṇa deveśam sarva yajña īśvaram harim
translated: For the benefit of the body of the kingdom and for the supreme welfare of the subjects.

original: pūjayiṣyāma bhadraṃ te tatrāṃśas te bhaviṣyati // / / //🔽yajñena yajñapuruṣo viṣṇuḥ saṃprīṇito nṛpa /
analyzed: pūjayiṣyāma bhadram te tatra aṃśaḥ te bhaviṣyati  yajñena yajñapuruṣaḥ viṣṇuḥ saṃprīṇitaḥ nṛpa
translated: In a long sacrifice, we shall worship Hari, the lord of gods and the lord of all sacrifices, for your good. In that, you will have a share.

original: asmābhir bhavataḥ kāmān sarvān eva pradāsyati // / / //
analyzed: asmābhiḥ bhavataḥ kāmān sarvān eva pradāsyati
translated: By the sacrifice, Vishnu, the lord of sacrifice, will be gratified by us, O king, and will grant you all your desires.

original: yajñair yajñeśvaro yeṣāṃ rāṣṭre saṃpūjyate hariḥ /
analyzed: yajñaiḥ yajñeśvaraḥ yeṣām rāṣṭre saṃpūjyate hariḥ
translated: O king, to those kings in whose kingdom Hari, the lord of sacrifice, is worshipped by sacrifices,

original: teṣāṃ sarvepsitāvāptiṃ dadāti nṛpa bhūbhṛtām // / / //
analyzed: teṣām sarva īpsita avāptim dadāti nṛpa bhūbhṛtām
translated: He grants the attainment of all desires, O king.

original: vena uvāca /🔽mattaḥ ko 'bhyadhiko 'nyo 'sti kaś cārādhyo mamāparaḥ /
analyzed: venaḥ uvāca  mattaḥ kaḥ bhyadhikaḥ sti kaḥ ca ārādhyaḥ mama aparaḥ
translated: Vena said:🔽Who is superior to me? Who else is to be worshipped by me?

original: ko 'yaṃ harir iti khyāto yo vai yajñeśvaro mataḥ // / / //
analyzed: kaḥ yam hariḥ iti khyātaḥ yaḥ vai yajñeśvaraḥ mataḥ
translated: Who is this one known as Hari, who is considered the lord of sacrifice?

original: brahmā janārdanaḥ śaṃbhur indro vāyur yamo raviḥ /
analyzed: brahmā janārdanaḥ śaṃbhuḥ indraḥ vāyuḥ yamaḥ raviḥ
translated: Brahma, Janardana, Shambhu, Indra, Vayu, Yama, Ravi,

original: hutabhug varuṇo dhātā pūṣā bhūmir niśākaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: hutabhuj varuṇaḥ dhātā pūṣā bhūmiḥ niśākaraḥ
translated: The fire god, Varuna, Dhata, Pushan, the earth, the moon,

original: ete cānye ca ye devāḥ śāpānugrahakāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: ete ca anye ca ye devāḥ śāpa anugraha kāriṇaḥ
translated: And all the other gods who bestow blessings and curses,

original: nṛpasyaite śarīrasthāḥ sarvadevamayo nṛpaḥ // / / //
analyzed: nṛpasya ete śarīra sthāḥ sarva deva mayaḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: All these reside in the king's body. The king is the embodiment of all gods.

original: etaj jñātvā mayājñaptaṃ yad yathā kriyatāṃ tathā /
analyzed: etat jñātvā mayā ājñaptam yat yathā kriyatām tathā
translated: Knowing this, I command you. Do as I say.

original: na dātavyaṃ na hotavyaṃ na yaṣṭavyaṃ ca bho dvijāḥ // / / //
analyzed: na dātavyam na hotavyam na yaṣṭavyam ca bho dvijāḥ
translated: O Brahmins, nothing should be given, nothing should be offered into the fire, and no sacrifices should be performed.

original: bhartṛśuśrūṣaṇaṃ dharmo yathā strīṇāṃ paro mataḥ /
analyzed: bhartṛ śuśrūṣaṇam dharmaḥ yathā strīṇām paraḥ mataḥ
translated: Just as serving one's husband is considered the highest duty for women,

original: mamājñāpālanaṃ dharmo bhavatāṃ ca tathā dvijāḥ // / / //
analyzed: mama ājñā pālanam dharmaḥ bhavatām ca tathā dvijāḥ
translated: O Brahmins, obeying my command is your duty in the same way.

original: ṛṣaya ūcuḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The sages said:

original: dehy anujñāṃ mahārāja mā dharmo yātu saṃkṣayam /
analyzed: dehi anujñām mahā rāja mā dharmaḥ yātu saṃkṣayam
translated: Grant permission, great king, lest dharma be destroyed.

original: haviṣāṃ pariṇāmo 'yaṃ yad etad akhilaṃ jagat // / / //
analyzed: haviṣām pariṇāmaḥ yam yat etat akhilam jagat
translated: This entire world is the transformation of the oblations.

original: ins /
analyzed: ins
translated: (Insertion:)

original: dharme ca saṃkṣayaṃ yāte kṣīyate cākhilaṃ jagat // / / //
analyzed: dharme ca saṃkṣayam yāte kṣīyate ca akhilam jagat
translated: When dharma is destroyed, the entire world is destroyed.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: iti vijñāpyamāno 'pi sa venaḥ paramarṣibhiḥ /
analyzed: iti vijñāpyamānaḥ pi sa venaḥ parama ṛṣibhiḥ
translated: Though thus entreated by the great sages,🔽The sinful Vena did not give permission. He was repeatedly told:

original: pāpo dadāti nānujñāṃ tadā proktaḥ punaḥ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pāpaḥ dadāti na anujñām tadā proktaḥ punar punar
translated: (Vena said:)🔽I am the king, the lord of the people. I am the creator, the destroyer, and the protector.

original: tatas te munayaḥ sarve kopāmarṣasamanvitāḥ /
analyzed: tatas te munayaḥ sarve kopa amarṣa samanvitāḥ
translated: Then all those sages, filled with anger and indignation,

original: hanyatāṃ hanyatāṃ pāpa ity ūcus te parasparam // / / //
analyzed: hanyatām hanyatām pāpaḥ iti ūcuḥ te parasparam
translated: said to each other, Let the sinner be killed, let him be killed.

original: yo yajñapuruṣaṃ viṣṇum anādinidhanaṃ prabhum /
analyzed: yaḥ yajñapuruṣam viṣṇum an ādi nidhanam prabhum
translated: He who censures Vishnu, the personified sacrifice, the beginningless and endless Lord,

original: vinindaty adhamācāro na sa yogyo bhuvaḥ patiḥ // / / //
analyzed: vinindati adhama ācāraḥ na sa yogyaḥ bhuvaḥ patiḥ
translated: that one of low conduct is not fit to be the king of the earth.

original: ity uktvā mantrapūtais taiḥ kuśair munigaṇā nṛpam /
analyzed: iti uktvā mantra pūtaiḥ taiḥ kuśaiḥ muni gaṇāḥ nṛpam
translated: Having said this, the sages, with sacred kusha grass, killed the king,

original: nijaghnur nihataṃ pūrvaṃ bhagavannindanādinā // / / //
analyzed: nijaghnuḥ nihatam pūrvam bhagavat nindana ādinā
translated: who had already been killed by his own censure of the Lord.

original: tataś ca munayo reṇuṃ dadṛśuḥ sarvato dvija /
analyzed: tatas ca munayaḥ reṇum dadṛśuḥ sarvatas dvija
translated: Then, O twice-born one, the sages saw dust everywhere.

original: kim etad iti cāsannaṃ papracchus te janaṃ tadā // / / //🔽ākhyātaṃ ca janais teṣāṃ caurībhūtair arājake /
analyzed: kim etat iti ca āsannam papracchuḥ te janam tadā  ākhyātam ca janaiḥ teṣām caurībhūtaiḥ arājake
translated: They asked the people nearby, What is this?🔽The people, who had become thieves, told them that in the kingless country,

original: rāṣṭre tu lokair ārabdhaṃ parasvādānam āturaiḥ // / / //🔽teṣām udīrṇavegānāṃ caurāṇāṃ munisattamāḥ /
analyzed: rāṣṭre tu lokaiḥ ārabdham para sva ādānam āturaiḥ  teṣām udīrṇa vegānām caurāṇām muni sattamāḥ
translated: the afflicted people had started to take away the wealth of others.🔽O best of sages, a great dust was seen of those thieves,

original: sumahān dṛśyate reṇuḥ paravittāpahāriṇām // / / //
analyzed: su mahān dṛśyate reṇuḥ para vitta apahāriṇām
translated: who were carrying away the wealth of others with great speed.

original: tataḥ saṃmantrya te sarve munayas tasya bhūbhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tatas saṃmantrya te sarve munayaḥ tasya bhūbhṛtaḥ
translated: Then all those sages, having consulted together,

original: mamanthur ūruṃ putrārtham anapatyasya yatnataḥ // / / //
analyzed: mamanthuḥ ūrum putra artham anapatyasya yatnataḥ
translated: vigorously churned the thigh of that childless king for the sake of a son.

original: mathyataś ca samuttasthau tasyoroḥ puruṣaḥ kila /
analyzed: mathyataḥ ca samuttasthau tasya ūroḥ puruṣaḥ kila
translated: While he was being churned, a man arose from his chest.

original: dagdhasthūṇāpratīkāśaḥ kharvaṭāsyo 'tihrasvakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dagdha sthūṇā pratīkāśaḥ kharvaṭa āsyaḥ ti hrasvakaḥ
translated: He resembled a burnt skeleton, was short, and extremely small.

original: kiṃ karomīti tān sarvān viprān āha tvarānvitaḥ /
analyzed: kim karomi iti tān sarvān viprān āha tvarā anvitaḥ
translated: He quickly said to all those Brahmins, What should I do?

original: niṣīdeti tam ūcus te niṣādas tena so 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: niṣīda iti tam ūcuḥ te niṣādaḥ tena saḥ bhavat
translated: They told him, Sit down. Because of that, he became a Nisada.

original: tatas tatsaṃbhavā jātā vindhyaśailanivāsinaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tad saṃbhavāḥ jātāḥ vindhya śaila nivāsinaḥ
translated: Then, born from him, the Nisadas lived in the Vindhya mountains.

original: niṣādā muniśārdūla pāpakarmopalakṣaṇāḥ // / / //
analyzed: niṣādāḥ muni śārdūla pāpa karma upalakṣaṇāḥ
translated: O tiger among sages, they were characterized by sinful deeds.

original: tena dvāreṇa tat pāpaṃ niṣkrāntaṃ tasya bhūpateḥ /
analyzed: tena dvāreṇa tat pāpam niṣkrāntam tasya bhūpateḥ
translated: Through that door, the sin of that king came out.

original: niṣādās te tato jātā venakalmaṣanāśanāḥ // / / //🔽tato 'sya dakṣiṇaṃ hastaṃ mamanthus te dvijottamāḥ // / / //
analyzed: niṣādāḥ te tatas jātāḥ vena kalmaṣa nāśanāḥ  tatas sya dakṣiṇam hastam mamanthuḥ te dvijottamāḥ
translated: They became Nisadas, the destroyers of Vena's sin.🔽Then those best of Brahmins churned his right hand.

original: mathyamāne ca tatrābhūt pṛthur vainyaḥ pratāpavān /🔽dīpyamānaḥ svavapuṣā sākṣād agnir iva jvalan // / / //
analyzed: mathyamāne ca tatra abhūt pṛthuḥ vainyaḥ pratāpavān  dīpyamānaḥ sva vapuṣā sākṣāt agniḥ iva jvalan
translated: While it was being churned, the powerful Prithu Vainya arose.🔽Shining with his own body, he blazed like fire itself.

original: ādyam ājagavaṃ nāma khāt papāta tato dhanuḥ /
analyzed: ādyam ājagavam nāma khāt papāta tatas dhanuḥ
translated: Then a bow named Ajagava fell from the sky.

original: śarāś ca divyā nabhasaḥ kavacaṃ ca papāta ha // / / //
analyzed: śarāḥ ca divyāḥ nabhasaḥ kavacam ca papāta ha
translated: Divine arrows and armor also fell from the sky.

original: tasmiñ jāte tu bhūtāni saṃprahṛṣṭāni sarvaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmin jāte tu bhūtāni saṃprahṛṣṭāni sarvaśas
translated: And when he was born, all beings were greatly delighted.

original: satputreṇa ca jātena veno 'pi tridivaṃ yayau /
analyzed: sat putreṇa ca jātena tridivam yayau
translated: And when the virtuous son was born, Vena also went to heaven.

original: punnāmno narakāt trātaḥ sa tena sumahātmanā // / / //🔽taṃ samudrāś ca nadyaś ca ratnāny ādāya sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: put nāmnaḥ narakāt trātaḥ sa tena su mahātmanā  tam samudrāḥ ca nadyaḥ ca ratnāni ādāya sarvaśas
translated: And by that greatly illustrious one, he was saved from the hell named Put.🔽And the oceans and rivers, taking all kinds of jewels,

original: toyāni cābhiṣekārthaṃ sarvāṇy evopatasthire // / / //
analyzed: toyāni ca abhiṣeka artham sarvāṇi eva upatasthire
translated: And all the waters for the purpose of consecration, attended upon him.

original: pitāmahaś ca bhagavān devair āṅgirasaiḥ saha /
analyzed: pitāmahaḥ ca bhagavān devaiḥ āṅgirasaiḥ saha
translated: And the blessed grandfather, together with the gods and the descendants of Angiras,

original: sthāvarāṇi ca bhūtāni jaṅgamāni ca sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: sthāvarāṇi ca bhūtāni jaṅgamāni ca sarvaśas
translated: And all the immobile and mobile beings,

original: samāgamya tadā vainyam abhyaṣiñcan narādhipam // / / //
analyzed: samāgamya tadā vainyam abhyaṣiñcat narādhipam
translated: Having assembled, consecrated Vena's son as the king of men.

original: haste tu dakṣiṇe cakraṃ dṛṣṭvā tasya pitāmahaḥ /
analyzed: haste tu dakṣiṇe cakram dṛṣṭvā tasya pitāmahaḥ
translated: And seeing the discus on his right hand, the grandfather,

original: viṣṇor aṃśaṃ pṛthuṃ matvā paritoṣaṃ paraṃ yayau // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ aṃśam pṛthum matvā paritoṣam param yayau
translated: Considering Prithu to be a part of Vishnu, was greatly pleased.

original: viṣṇucihnaṃ kare cakraṃ sarveṣāṃ cakravartinām /
analyzed: viṣṇu cihnam kare cakram sarveṣām cakravartinām
translated: The discus is the mark of Vishnu on the hand of all emperors,

original: bhavaty avyāhato yasya prabhāvas tridaśair api // / / //🔽mahatā rājarājyena pṛthur vainyaḥ pratāpavān /
analyzed: bhavati avyāhataḥ yasya prabhāvaḥ tridaśaiḥ api  mahatā rāja rājyena pṛthuḥ vainyaḥ pratāpavān
translated: Whose power is unobstructed even by the gods.🔽The powerful Prithu, the son of Vena, was consecrated with great royal sovereignty,

original: so 'bhiṣikto mahātejā vidhivad dharmakovidaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: saḥ bhiṣiktaḥ mahā tejāḥ vidhivat dharma kovidaiḥ
translated: By those who knew the law, in the proper manner, the greatly radiant one.

original: pitrāparañjitās tasya prajās tenānurañjitāḥ /
analyzed: pitrā aparañjitāḥ tasya prajāḥ tena anurañjitāḥ
translated: His subjects, not pleased by his father, were pleased by him.

original: anurāgāt tatas tasya nāma rājety ajāyata // / / //
analyzed: anurāgāt tatas tasya nāma rājā iti ajāyata
translated: And from that affection, his name became Rāja.

original: āpas tastambhire cāsya samudram abhiyāsyataḥ /
analyzed: āpaḥ tastambhire ca asya samudram abhiyāsyataḥ
translated: And the waters froze for him as he advanced towards the ocean.

original: parvatāś ca dadur mārgaṃ dhvajabhaṅgaś ca nābhavat // / / //
analyzed: parvatāḥ ca daduḥ mārgam dhvaja bhaṅgaḥ ca na abhavat
translated: And the mountains gave way, and his flag did not break.

original: akṛṣṭapacyā pṛthivī siddhyanty annāni cintayā /
analyzed: a kṛṣṭa pacyā pṛthivī siddhyanti annāni cintayā
translated: The earth yielded crops without ploughing, and food was accomplished by thought.

original: sarvakāmadughā gāvaḥ puṭake puṭake madhu // / / //
analyzed: sarva kāmadughāḥ gāvaḥ puṭake puṭake madhu
translated: Cows yielded all desires, and honey in every pot.

original: tasya vai jātamātrasya yajñe paitāmahe śubhe /
analyzed: tasya vai jāta mātrasya yajñe paitāmahe śubhe
translated: In that very auspicious ancestral sacrifice of his,

original: sūtaḥ sūtyāṃ samutpannaḥ sautye 'hani mahāmatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: sūtaḥ sūtyām samutpannaḥ sautye hani mahāmatiḥ
translated: the greatly wise Sūta, born from a Sūti, was born on the Sūtya day.

original: ins /
analyzed: d ins
translated: (Sūta said:)

original: pṛthur evābhavat tasmāt tataḥ pṛthur ajāyata // / / //
analyzed: pṛthuḥ eva abhavat tasmāt tatas pṛthuḥ ajāyata
translated: Therefore, Pṛthu became known as Pṛthu, and from him Pṛthu was born.

original: tasminn eva mahāyajño jajñe prājño 'tha māgadhaḥ /
analyzed: tasmin eva mahāyajñaḥ jajñe prājñaḥ tha māgadhaḥ
translated: In that very great sacrifice, the wise Māgadha was born.

original: proktau tadā munivarais tāv ubhau sūtamāgadhau // / / //
analyzed: proktau tadā muni varaiḥ tau ubhau sūta māgadhau
translated: Then the excellent sages said to both Sūta and Māgadha:

original: stūyatām eṣa nṛpatiḥ pṛthur vainyaḥ pratāpavān /
analyzed: stūyatām eṣa nṛpatiḥ pṛthuḥ vainyaḥ pratāpavān
translated: Let this powerful king Pṛthu, the son of Vena, be praised.

original: karmaitad anurūpaṃ ca pātraṃ stotrasya cāpy ayam // / / //
analyzed: karma etat anurūpam ca pātram stotrasya ca api ayam
translated: This deed is befitting, and he is worthy of praise.

original: tatas tāv ūcatur viprān sarvān eva kṛtāñjalī /
analyzed: tatas tau ūcatuḥ viprān sarvān eva kṛtāñjalī
translated: Then they spoke to all the brahmins with folded hands:

original: adyajātasya no karma jñāyate 'sya mahīpateḥ // / / //
analyzed: adya jātasya no karma jñāyate sya mahīpateḥ
translated: The deeds of this king born today are not known.

original: guṇā na cāsya jñāyante na cāsya prathitaṃ yaśaḥ /
analyzed: guṇāḥ na ca asya jñāyante na ca asya prathitam yaśaḥ
translated: His qualities are not known, nor is his fame widespread.

original: stotraṃ kimāśrayaṃ tv asya kāryam asmābhir ucyatām // / / //
analyzed: stotram kimāśrayam tu asya kāryam asmābhiḥ ucyatām
translated: On what basis should we compose his praise? Tell us.

original: ṛṣaya ūcuḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The sages said:

original: kariṣyaty eṣa yat karma cakravartī mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: kariṣyati eṣa yat karma cakravartī mahā balaḥ
translated: This powerful emperor will perform great deeds.

original: guṇā bhaviṣyā ye cāsya tair ayaṃ stūyatāṃ nṛpaḥ // / / //
analyzed: guṇāḥ bhaviṣyāḥ ye ca asya taiḥ ayam stūyatām nṛpaḥ
translated: Let this king be praised by those qualities that will be his.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tataḥ sa nṛpatis toṣaṃ tac chrutvā paramaṃ yayau /
analyzed: tatas sa nṛpatiḥ toṣam tat śrutvā paramam yayau
translated: Then that king, having heard that, was greatly pleased.

original: sadguṇaiḥ ślāghyatām eti stavyāś cābhyāṃ guṇā mama // / / //
analyzed: sat guṇaiḥ ślāghya tām eti stavyāḥ ca ābhyām guṇāḥ mama
translated: He is worthy of praise by good qualities, and my qualities are worthy of praise.

original: tasmād yad atra stotre me guṇanirvarṇanaṃ tv imau /
analyzed: tasmāt yat atra stotre me guṇa nirvarṇanam tu imau
translated: Therefore, whatever praise of my qualities these two will do in this hymn,

original: kariṣyete kariṣyāmi tad evāhaṃ samāhitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kariṣyete kariṣyāmi tat eva aham samāhitaḥ
translated: I will do with full attention.

original: yad imau varjanīyaṃ ca kiṃcid atra vadiṣyataḥ /
analyzed: yat imau varjanīyam ca kiṃcid atra vadiṣyataḥ
translated: Whatever they will say here that should be avoided,

original: tad ahaṃ varjayiṣyāmīty evaṃ cakre matiṃ nṛpaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat aham varjayiṣyāmi iti evam cakre matim nṛpaḥ
translated: I will avoid it. Thus the king made up his mind.

original: atha tau cakratuḥ stotraṃ pṛthor vainyasya dhīmataḥ /
analyzed: atha tau cakratuḥ stotram pṛthoḥ vainyasya dhīmataḥ
translated: Then they composed a hymn of praise to Prithu, the wise son of Vena,

original: bhaviṣyaiḥ karmabhiḥ samyak susvarau sūtamāgadhau // / / //
analyzed: bhaviṣyaiḥ karmabhiḥ samyak su svarau sūta māgadhau
translated: The Suta and the Magadha were well-versed in the future deeds.

original: satyavāg dānaśīlo 'yaṃ satyasandho nareśvaraḥ /
analyzed: satya vāc dāna śīlaḥ yam satya sandhaḥ nareśvaraḥ
translated: This lord of men is truthful, generous, and true to his promises.

original: hrīmān maitraḥ kṣamāśīlo vikrānto duṣṭaśāsanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: hrīmān maitraḥ kṣamā śīlaḥ vikrāntaḥ duṣṭa śāsanaḥ
translated: He is modest, friendly, forgiving, valorous, and punishes the wicked.

original: dharmajñāś ca kṛtajñāś ca dayāvān priyabhāṣakaḥ /
analyzed: dharma jñāḥ ca kṛtajñāḥ ca dayāvān priya bhāṣakaḥ
translated: He knows dharma, is grateful, compassionate, and speaks pleasantly.

original: mānyān mānayitā yajvā brahmaṇyaḥ sādhuvatsalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mānyān mānayitā yajvā brahmaṇyaḥ sādhu vatsalaḥ
translated: He respects the respectable, performs sacrifices, is devoted to Brahmins, and loves the virtuous.

original: samaḥ śatrau ca mitre ca vyavahārasthitau nṛpaḥ // / / //
analyzed: samaḥ śatrau ca mitre ca vyavahāra sthitau nṛpaḥ
translated: The king is impartial towards enemies and friends in his conduct.

original: sūtenoktān guṇān itthaṃ sa tadā māgadhena ca /
analyzed: sūtena uktān guṇān ittham sa tadā māgadhena ca
translated: Thus, when the Suta and the Magadha spoke of his qualities,

original: cakāra hṛdi tādṛk ca karmaṇā kṛtavān asau // / / //
analyzed: cakāra hṛdi tādṛś ca karmaṇā kṛtavān asau
translated: He kept them in his heart and performed such deeds.

original: tataḥ sa pṛthivīpālaḥ pālayan vasudhām imām /
analyzed: tatas sa pṛthivīpālaḥ pālayan vasudhām imām
translated: Then that lord of the earth, ruling this earth,

original: iyāja vividhair yajñair mahadbhir bhūridakṣiṇaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: iyāja vividhaiḥ yajñaiḥ mahadbhiḥ bhūri dakṣiṇaiḥ
translated: Sacrificed with various great sacrifices with abundant gifts.

original: taṃ prajāḥ pṛthivīnātham upatasthuḥ kṣudhārditāḥ /
analyzed: tam prajāḥ pṛthivī nātham upatasthuḥ kṣudhā arditāḥ
translated: The people, afflicted by hunger, approached that lord of the earth,

original: oṣadhīṣu praṇaṣṭāsu tasmin kāle hy arājake /
analyzed: oṣadhīṣu praṇaṣṭāsu tasmin kāle hi arājake
translated: When the herbs were destroyed, at that time when there was no king.

original: tam ūcus tena tāḥ pṛṣṭās tatrāgamanakāraṇam // / / //🔽ins /
analyzed: tam ūcuḥ tena tāḥ pṛṣṭāḥ tatra āgamana kāraṇam 🔽d ins
translated: When asked by him, they told him the reason for their coming.

original: prajāpatiguṇaṃ śūraṃ pṛthuṃ satyaparākramam // / / //
analyzed: prajāpati guṇam śūram pṛthum satya parākramam
translated: The heroic Prithu, who was endued with the attributes of Prajapati, and whose prowess was truth itself,

original: prajā ūcuḥ /🔽arājake nṛpaśreṣṭha dharitryā sakalauṣadhīḥ /
analyzed: prajāḥ ūcuḥ  arājake nṛpa śreṣṭha dharitryā sakala oṣadhīḥ
translated: The subjects said:🔽O best of kings, in the absence of a king, the entire herbs of the earth

original: grastās tataḥ kṣayaṃ yānti prajāḥ sarvāḥ prajeśvara // / / //
analyzed: grastāḥ tatas kṣayam yānti prajāḥ sarvāḥ prajeśvara
translated: are devoured and all the subjects perish, O lord of subjects.

original: tvaṃ no vṛttiprado dhātrā prajāpālo nirūpitaḥ /
analyzed: tvam naḥ vṛtti pradaḥ dhātrā prajāpālaḥ nirūpitaḥ
translated: You are appointed by the Creator as the protector of our livelihood.

original: dehi naḥ kṣutparītānāṃ prajānāṃ jīvanauṣadhīḥ // / / //
analyzed: dehi naḥ kṣudh parītānām prajānām jīvana oṣadhīḥ
translated: Give us the life-giving herbs to the subjects afflicted with hunger.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tato 'tha nṛpatir divyam ādāyājagavaṃ dhanuḥ /
analyzed: nṛpatiḥ divyam ādāya ājagavam dhanuḥ
translated: Then the king, angrily taking up the divine Ajagava bow

original: śarāṃś ca divyān kupitaḥ so 'nvadhāvad vasuṃdharām // / / //
analyzed: śarān ca divyān kupitaḥ saḥ nvadhāvat vasuṃdharām
translated: and divine arrows, pursued the earth.

original: tato nanāśa tvaritā gaur bhūtvā tu vasuṃdharā /
analyzed: tatas nanāśa tvaritā gauḥ bhūtvā tu vasuṃdharā
translated: Then the earth, becoming a cow, quickly disappeared.

original: sā lokān brahmalokādīn saṃtrāsād agaman mahī // / / //
analyzed: sā lokān brahma loka ādīn saṃtrāsāt agamat mahī
translated: Out of fear, the earth went to the worlds of Brahma and others.

original: yatra yatra yayau devī sā tadā bhūtadhāriṇī /🔽tatra tatra tu sā vainyaṃ dadṛśe 'bhyudyatāyudham // / / //🔽tatas taṃ prāha vasudhā pṛthuṃ pṛthuparākramam /
analyzed: yatra yatra yayau devī sā tadā bhūta dhāriṇī  tatra tatra tu sā vainyam dadṛśe bhyudyata āyudham  tatas tam prāha vasudhā pṛthum pṛthu parākramam
translated: Wherever the goddess, the bearer of beings, went,🔽there she saw Vainya with his weapons raised.🔽Then the earth, trembling and intent on saving herself from his arrows,

original: pravepamānā tadbāṇaparitrāṇaparāyaṇā // / / //
analyzed: pravepamānā tad bāṇa paritrāṇa parāyaṇā
translated: spoke to Prithu, of vast prowess,

original: pṛthivy uvāca /
analyzed: pṛthivī uvāca
translated: The Earth said:

original: strīvadhe tvaṃ mahāpāpaṃ kiṃ narendra na paśyasi /
analyzed: strī vadhe tvam mahā pāpam kim narendra na paśyasi
translated: O king, do you not see the great sin in the killing of a woman?

original: yena māṃ hantum atyarthaṃ prakaroṣi nṛpodyamam // / / //
analyzed: yena mām hantum atyartham prakaroṣi nṛpa udyamam
translated: For which you are making such great efforts to kill me?

original: pṛthur uvāca /
analyzed: pṛthuḥ uvāca
translated: Pṛthu said:

original: ekasmin yatra nidhanaṃ prāpite duṣṭacāriṇi /
analyzed: ekasmin yatra nidhanam prāpite duṣṭa cāriṇi
translated: When a single one of evil conduct is killed,

original: bahūnāṃ bhavati kṣemaṃ tasya puṇyaprado vadhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bahūnām bhavati kṣemam tasya puṇya pradaḥ vadhaḥ
translated: if it brings peace to many, then killing him is meritorious.

original: pṛthivy uvāca /
analyzed: pṛthivī uvāca
translated: The Earth said:

original: prajānām upakārāya yadi māṃ tvaṃ haniṣyasi /
analyzed: prajānām upakārāya yadi mām tvam haniṣyasi
translated: If you will kill me for the welfare of the people,

original: ādhāraḥ kaḥ prajānāṃ te nṛpaśreṣṭha bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: ādhāraḥ kaḥ prajānām te nṛpa śreṣṭha bhaviṣyati
translated: O best of kings, what will be the support of your people?

original: pṛthur uvāca /
analyzed: pṛthuḥ uvāca
translated: Pṛthu said:

original: tvāṃ hatvā vasudhe bāṇair macchāsanaparāṅmukhīm /
analyzed: tvām hatvā vasudhe bāṇaiḥ mad śāsana parāṅmukhīm
translated: Having killed you, O Earth, with my arrows, for disobeying my command,

original: ātmayogabalenemā dhārayiṣyāmy ahaṃ prajāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ātma yoga balena imāḥ dhārayiṣyāmi aham prajāḥ
translated: I shall sustain these people by the power of my own yoga.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽tataḥ praṇamya vasudhā taṃ bhūyaḥ prāha pārthivam /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  tatas praṇamya vasudhā tam bhūyas prāha pārthivam
translated: Parashara said:

original: pravepitāṅgī paramaṃ sādhvasaṃ samupāgatā // / / //
analyzed: pravepita aṅgī paramam sādhvasam samupāgatā
translated: Then the Earth, trembling all over, bowed to him and spoke to the king again, having attained the highest state of fear.

original: pṛthivy uvāca /
analyzed: pṛthivī uvāca
translated: The Earth said:

original: upāyataḥ samārabdhāḥ sarve siddhyanty upakramāḥ /
analyzed: upāyatas samārabdhāḥ sarve siddhyanti upakramāḥ
translated: All undertakings begun by proper means are successful.

original: tasmād vadāmy upāyaṃ te taṃ kuruṣva yadīcchasi // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt vadāmi upāyam te tam kuruṣva yadi icchasi
translated: Therefore, I tell you the means. Do it if you wish.

original: samastā yā mayā jīrṇā naranātha mahauṣadhīḥ /
analyzed: samastāḥ yāḥ mayā jīrṇāḥ naranātha mahā auṣadhīḥ
translated: O lord of men, I have digested all the great herbs.

original: yadīcchasi pradāsyāmi tāḥ kṣīrapariṇāminīḥ // / / //
analyzed: yadi icchasi pradāsyāmi tāḥ kṣīra pariṇāminīḥ
translated: If you desire, I will give them to you, transformed into milk.

original: tasmāt prajāhitārthāya mama dharmabhṛtāṃ vara /
analyzed: tasmāt prajā hita arthāya mama dharma bhṛtām vara
translated: Therefore, O best among the upholders of dharma, for the welfare of the subjects,

original: taṃ tu vatsaṃ prayaccha tvaṃ kṣareyaṃ yena vatsalā // / / //🔽samāṃ ca kuru sarvatra yena kṣīraṃ samantataḥ /
analyzed: tam tu vatsam prayaccha tvam kṣareyam yena vatsalā  samām ca kuru sarvatra yena kṣīram samantataḥ
translated: give me that calf by whom I, being affectionate towards the calf, may yield milk.🔽And make it equal everywhere, so that milk may be available everywhere.

original: varauṣadhībījabhūtaṃ vīra sarvatra bhāvaye // / / //
analyzed: vara oṣadhī bīja bhūtam vīra sarvatra bhāvaye
translated: O hero, cultivate that seed of excellent herbs everywhere.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽tata utsārayām āsa śailāñ chatasahasraśaḥ /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  tatas utsārayām āsa śailām śata sahasraśas
translated: Parashara said:🔽Then Vainya cleared away hundreds and thousands of mountains

original: dhanuṣkoṭyā tadā vainyas tena śailā vivardhitāḥ // / / //🔽na hi pūrvavisarge vai viṣame pṛthivītale /
analyzed: dhanuṣkoṭyā tadā vainyaḥ tena śailāḥ vivardhitāḥ  na hi pūrva visarge vai viṣame pṛthivī tale
translated: with the tip of his bow, and thereby the mountains were increased.🔽In the previous creation, on the uneven surface of the earth,

original: pravibhāgaḥ purāṇāṃ vā grāmāṇāṃ vā tadābhavat // / / //
analyzed: pravibhāgaḥ purāṇām vā grāmāṇām vā tadā bhavat
translated: there was no division of cities or villages at that time.

original: na sasyāni na gorakṣyaṃ na kṛṣir na vaṇikpathaḥ /
analyzed: na sasyāni na gorakṣyam na kṛṣiḥ na vaṇikpathaḥ
translated: There were no crops, no cattle-rearing, no agriculture, no trade routes.

original: vainyāt prabhṛti maitreya sarvasyaitasya saṃbhavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vainyāt prabhṛti maitreya sarvasya etasya saṃbhavaḥ
translated: O Maitreya, from Vainya onwards, all this came into existence.

original: yatra yatra samaṃ tv asyā bhūmer āsīn narādhipaḥ /
analyzed: yatra yatra samam tu asyāḥ bhūmeḥ āsīt narādhipaḥ
translated: Wherever the earth was even, there the king established himself.

original: tatra tatra prajānāṃ hi nivāsaṃ samarocayat // / / //🔽āhāraḥ phalamūlāni prajānām abhavat tadā /
analyzed: tatra tatra prajānām hi nivāsam samarocayat  āhāraḥ phala mūlāni prajānām abhavat tadā
translated: He selected various places for the habitation of the people.🔽The food of the people then consisted of fruits and roots.

original: kṛcchreṇa mahatā so 'pi praṇaṣṭāsv oṣadhīṣu vai // / / //
analyzed: kṛcchreṇa mahatā saḥ pi praṇaṣṭāsu oṣadhīṣu vai
translated: When the herbs disappeared, it became very difficult to get them.

original: sa kalpayitvā vatsaṃ tu manuṃ svāyambhuvaṃ prabhum /
analyzed: sa kalpayitvā vatsam tu manum svāyambhuvam prabhum
translated: Having created Manu, the self-existent lord, as the calf,

original: sve pāṇau pṛthivīnātho dudoha pṛthivīṃ pṛthuḥ /
analyzed: sve pāṇau pṛthivī nāthaḥ dudoha pṛthivīm pṛthuḥ
translated: the lord of the earth, Prithu, milked the earth with his own hand.

original: sasyajātāni sarvāṇi prajānāṃ hitakāmyayā // / / //
analyzed: sasya jātāni sarvāṇi prajānām hita kāmyayā
translated: With a desire for the welfare of the people, he milked all the crops.

original: tenānnena prajās tāta vartante 'dyāpi nityaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tena annena prajāḥ tāta vartante dyā api nityaśas
translated: O son! Even today, the people subsist on that food.

original: prāṇapradānāt sa pṛthur yasmād bhūmer abhūt pitā /
analyzed: prāṇa pradānāt sa pṛthuḥ yasmāt bhūmeḥ abhūt pitā
translated: Because Prithu became the father of the earth by giving it life,

original: tatas tu pṛthivīsaṃjñām avāpākhiladhāriṇī // / / //
analyzed: tatas tu pṛthivī saṃjñām avāpa akhila dhāriṇī
translated: the earth, the supporter of all, then obtained the name Prithivi.

original: tataś ca devair munibhir daityai rakṣobhir adribhiḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca devaiḥ munibhiḥ daityaiḥ rakṣobhiḥ adribhiḥ
translated: Then by the gods, sages, demons, Rakshasas, mountains,

original: gandharvair uragair yakṣaiḥ pitṛbhis tarubhis tathā // / / //🔽tat tat pātram upādāya tat tad dugdhaṃ mune payaḥ /
analyzed: gandharvaiḥ uragaiḥ yakṣaiḥ pitṛbhiḥ tarubhiḥ tathā  tat tat pātram upādāya tat tat dugdham mune payaḥ
translated: Gandharvas, serpents, Yakshas, ancestors, and trees,🔽O sage! that milk was milked into those respective vessels.

original: vatsadogdhṛviśeṣāś ca teṣāṃ tadyonayo 'bhavan // / / //
analyzed: vatsa dogdhṛ viśeṣāḥ ca teṣām tad yonayaḥ bhavan
translated: The calves, milkmen, and their respective wombs were created.

original: saiṣā dhātrī vidhātrī ca dhāriṇī poṣaṇī tathā /
analyzed: sā eṣā dhātrī vidhātrī ca dhāriṇī poṣaṇī tathā
translated: She is the nurse, the creator, the supporter, and the nourisher of all.

original: sarvasya jagataḥ pṛthvī viṣṇupādatalodbhavā // / / //
analyzed: sarvasya jagataḥ pṛthvī viṣṇu pāda tala udbhavā
translated: The earth, the source of Vishnu's feet, is the mother of the entire universe.

original: evaṃprabhāvaḥ sa pṛthuḥ putro venasya vīryavān /
analyzed: evaṃprabhāvaḥ sa pṛthuḥ putraḥ venasya vīryavān
translated: Such was the power of Prithu, the valiant son of Vena.

original: jajñe mahīpatiḥ pūrvaṃ rājābhūj janarañjanāt // / / //
analyzed: jajñe mahīpatiḥ pūrvam rājā abhūt jana rañjanāt
translated: He was the first king, delighting the people.

original: ya idaṃ janma vainyasya pṛthoḥ saṃkīrtayen naraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ idam janma vainyasya pṛthoḥ saṃkīrtayet naraḥ
translated: One who recites this birth of Prithu, the son of Vena,

original: na tasya duṣkṛtaṃ kiṃcit phaladāyi prajāyate // / / //
analyzed: na tasya duṣkṛtam kiṃcid phala dāyi prajāyate
translated: for him no evil deed bears fruit.

original: duḥsvapnopaśamaṃ nṝṇāṃ śṛṇvatāṃ caitad uttamam /
analyzed: duḥsvapna upaśamam nṝṇām śṛṇvatām ca etat uttamam
translated: For those who hear this excellent account, which removes bad dreams,

original: pṛthor janma prabhāvaś ca karoti satataṃ nṛṇām // / / //
analyzed: pṛthoḥ janma prabhāvaḥ ca karoti satatam nṛṇām
translated: the birth and power of Prithu always brings good to men.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe prathame 'ṃśe trayodaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe prathame ṃśe trayodaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirteenth chapter in the first section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: pṛthoḥ putrau mahāvīryau jajñāte 'ntardhivādinau /
analyzed: pṛthoḥ putrau mahā vīryau jajñāte ntardhi vādinau
translated: Prithu had two very powerful sons, Antardhi and Vadin.

original: śikhaṇḍinī havirdhānam antardhānād vyajāyata // / / //
analyzed: śikhaṇḍinī havirdhānam antardhānāt vyajāyata
translated: Shikhandi gave birth to Havirdhana through Antardhi.

original: havirdhānāt ṣaḍ āgneyī dhiṣaṇājanayat sutān /
analyzed: havirdhānāt ṣaṭ āgneyī dhiṣaṇā janayat sutān
translated: Havirdhana's six sons were born from Agni's daughter Dhi-shana.

original: prācīnabarhiṣaṃ śukraṃ gayaṃ kṛṣṇaṃ vṛjājinau // / / //
analyzed: prācīna barhiṣam śukram gayam kṛṣṇam vṛja ajinau
translated: They were Prachinavarhisha, Shukra, Gaya, Krishna, Vrija and Ajina.

original: prācīnabarhir bhagavān mahān āsīt prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: prācīnabarhiḥ bhagavān mahān āsīt prajāpatiḥ
translated: The illustrious and great Prachinavarhi was a Prajapati.

original: havirdhānir mahārājo yena saṃvardhitāḥ prajāḥ // / / //
analyzed: havirdhāniḥ mahā rājaḥ yena saṃvardhitāḥ prajāḥ
translated: The great king Havirdhana, by whom the subjects were increased.

original: prācīnāgrāḥ kuśās tasya pṛthivyāṃ viśrutā mune /
analyzed: prācīna agrāḥ kuśāḥ tasya pṛthivyām viśrutāḥ mune
translated: O sage, the Kusha grass with their tips pointing to the east, became famous on the earth.

original: prācīnabarhir abhavat khyāto bhuvi mahābalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prācīnabarhiḥ abhavat khyātaḥ bhuvi mahā balaḥ
translated: The greatly powerful Prachinavarhi became famous on earth.

original: samudratanayāyāṃ tu kṛtadāro mahīpatiḥ /
analyzed: samudra tanayāyām tu kṛta dāraḥ mahīpatiḥ
translated: The lord of the earth, having taken a wife from the daughter of the ocean,

original: mahatas tapasaḥ pāre savarṇāyāṃ mahīpateḥ // / / //
analyzed: mahataḥ tapasaḥ pāre savarṇāyām mahīpateḥ
translated: on the other side of the great penance, of the lord of the earth Savarna.

original: savarṇādhatta sāmudrī daśa prācīnabarhiṣaḥ /
analyzed: savarṇā adhatta sāmudrī daśa prācīnabarhiṣaḥ
translated: The daughter of the ocean Savarna gave birth to ten Prachinavarhis.

original: sarve pracetaso nāma dhanurvedasya pāragāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarve pracetasaḥ nāma dhanurvedasya pāragāḥ
translated: All of them were named Prachetas, masters of the science of archery.

original: apṛthagdharmacaraṇās te 'tapyanta mahat tapaḥ /
analyzed: a pṛthak dharma caraṇāḥ te tapyanta mahat tapaḥ
translated: They practiced religion without distinction, and performed great austerities.

original: daśa varṣasahasrāṇi samudrasalileśayāḥ // / / //
analyzed: daśa varṣa sahasrāṇi samudrasalileśayāḥ
translated: For ten thousand years, they dwelt in the waters of the ocean.

original: maitreya uvāca /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca
translated: Maitreya said:

original: yadarthaṃ te mahātmānas tapas tepur mahāmune /
analyzed: yad artham te mahātmānaḥ tapaḥ tepuḥ mahā mune
translated: O great sage, for what purpose did those great souls perform austerities?

original: pracetasaḥ samudrāmbhasy etad ākhyātum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: pracetasaḥ samudra ambhasi etat ākhyātum arhasi
translated: The Prachetas in the waters of the ocean, it is proper for you to relate this.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽pitrā pracetasaḥ proktāḥ prajārtham amitātmanā /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  pitrā pracetasaḥ proktāḥ prajā artham amita ātmanā
translated: Parashara said:🔽The Prachetas were told by their father, of immeasurable soul,

original: prajāpatiniyuktena bahumānapuraḥsaram // / / //
analyzed: prajāpati niyuktena bahu māna puraḥsaram
translated: engaged by Prajapati, with great respect, for the sake of offspring.

original: prācīnabarhir uvāca /🔽brahmaṇā devadevena samādiṣṭo 'smy ahaṃ sutāḥ /
analyzed: prācīnabarhiḥ uvāca  brahmaṇā devadevena samādiṣṭaḥ smi aham sutāḥ
translated: Prachinavarhi said:

original: prajāḥ saṃvardhanīyās te mayā coktaṃ tatheti tat // / / //
analyzed: prajāḥ saṃvardhanīyāḥ te mayā ca uktam tathā iti tat
translated: O sons, I have been commanded by Brahma, the Lord of gods, to increase the population. I have agreed to do so.

original: tan mama prītaye putrāḥ prajāvṛddhim atandritāḥ /
analyzed: tat mama prītaye putrāḥ prajā vṛddhim atandritāḥ
translated: Therefore, O sons, for my satisfaction, diligently increase the population.

original: kurudhvaṃ mānanīyā ca samyag ājñā prajāpateḥ // / / //
analyzed: kurudhvam mānanīyā ca samyak ājñā prajāpateḥ
translated: And properly carry out the command of the Lord of creatures.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tatas te tat pituḥ śrutvā vacanaṃ nṛpanandanāḥ /
analyzed: tatas te tat pituḥ śrutvā vacanam nṛpa nandanāḥ
translated: Then those princes, having heard those words of their father,

original: tathety uktvā ca taṃ bhūyaḥ papracchuḥ pitaraṃ mune // / / //
analyzed: tathā iti uktvā ca tam bhūyas papracchuḥ pitaram mune
translated: said So be it and again asked their father, O sage.

original: pracetasa ūcuḥ /🔽yena tāta prajāvṛddhau samarthāḥ karmaṇā vayam /
analyzed: pracetasaḥ ūcuḥ  yena tāta prajā vṛddhau samarthāḥ karmaṇā vayam
translated: The Pracetasas said:

original: bhavema tat samastaṃ naḥ karma vyākhyātum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: bhavema tat samastam naḥ karma vyākhyātum arhasi
translated: O father, you should tell us in full that act by which we may be able to increase the population.

original: pitovāca /
analyzed: pitā uvāca
translated: The father said:

original: ārādhya varadaṃ viṣṇum iṣṭaprāptim asaṃśayam /
analyzed: ārādhya vara dam viṣṇum iṣṭa prāptim asaṃśayam
translated: By propitiating Vishnu, the giver of boons, a mortal undoubtedly attains the desired object.

original: sameti nānyathā martyaḥ kim anyat kathayāmi vaḥ // / / //🔽tasmāt prajāvivṛddhyarthaṃ sarvabhūtaprabhuṃ harim /
analyzed: sameti na anyathā martyaḥ kim anyat kathayāmi vaḥ  tasmāt prajā vivṛddhi artham sarva bhūta prabhum harim
translated: There is no other way. What else shall I tell you?

original: ārādhayata govindaṃ yadi siddhim abhīpsatha // / / //
analyzed: ārādhayata govindam yadi siddhim
translated: Therefore, if you desire success, worship Hari, the Lord of all beings, Govinda, for the increase of population.

original: dharmam arthaṃ ca kāmaṃ ca mokṣaṃ cānvicchatā sadā /
analyzed: dharmam artham ca kāmam ca mokṣam ca anvicchatā sadā
translated: By him who desires to attain virtue, wealth, pleasure and liberation,

original: ārādhanīyo bhagavān anādiḥ puruṣottamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ārādhanīyaḥ bhagavān anādiḥ puruṣottamaḥ
translated: The Supreme Lord, the beginningless Supreme Person, should always be worshipped.

original: yasminn ārādhite sargaṃ cakārādau prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: yasmin ārādhite sargam cakāra ādau prajāpatiḥ
translated: By whom, when worshipped, the Lord of creatures created the world in the beginning,

original: tam ārādhyācyutaṃ vṛddhiḥ prajānāṃ vo bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: tam ārādhya acyutam vṛddhiḥ prajānām vaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: By worshipping that Acyuta, may you have increase in your progeny.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity evam uktās te pitrā putrāḥ pracetaso daśa /
analyzed: iti evam uktāḥ te pitrā putrāḥ pracetasaḥ daśa
translated: Thus addressed by their father, the ten Prachetasas,

original: magnāḥ payodhisalile tapas tepuḥ samāhitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: magnāḥ payodhi salile tapaḥ tepuḥ samāhitāḥ
translated: Immersed in the waters of the ocean, performed austerities with concentrated minds.

original: daśa varṣasahasrāṇi nyastacittā jagatpatau /
analyzed: daśa varṣa sahasrāṇi nyasta cittāḥ jagatpatau
translated: For ten thousand years, with their minds fixed on Narayana, the Lord of the world,

original: nārāyaṇe muniśreṣṭha sarvalokaparāyaṇe // / / //
analyzed: nārāyaṇe muni śreṣṭha sarva loka parāyaṇe
translated: The best of sages, the ultimate refuge of all the worlds,

original: tatraiva te sthitā devam ekāgramanaso harim /
analyzed: tatra eva te sthitāḥ devam ekāgra manasaḥ harim
translated: There itself, they remained, with their minds concentrated on Lord Hari.

original: tuṣṭuvur yaḥ stutaḥ kāmān stotur iṣṭān prayacchati // / / //
analyzed: tuṣṭuvuḥ yaḥ stutaḥ kāmān stotuḥ iṣṭān prayacchati
translated: They praised him, whom when praised, he grants the desires wished for by the worshipper.

original: maitreya uvāca /🔽stavaṃ pracetaso viṣṇoḥ samudrāmbhasi saṃsthitāḥ /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca  stavam pracetasaḥ viṣṇoḥ samudra ambhasi saṃsthitāḥ
translated: Maitreya said:🔽The Prachetasas, dwelling in the waters of the ocean,

original: cakrus taṃ me muniśreṣṭha supuṇyaṃ vaktum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: cakruḥ tam me muni śreṣṭha su puṇyam vaktum arhasi
translated: Performed Vishnu's praise. O best of sages, that is very holy. You should tell it to me.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: śṛṇu maitreya govindaṃ yathāpūrvaṃ pracetasaḥ /
analyzed: śṛṇu maitreya govindam yathāpūrvam pracetasaḥ
translated: Listen, Maitreya, how the Prachetasas formerly praised Govinda.

original: tuṣṭuvus tanmayībhūtāḥ samudrasalileśayāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tuṣṭuvuḥ tanmayībhūtāḥ samudrasalileśayāḥ
translated: They praised him, becoming absorbed in him, dwelling in the waters of the ocean.

original: pracetasa ūcuḥ /
analyzed: pracetasaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The Pracetās said:

original: natāḥ sma sarvavacasāṃ pratiṣṭhā yatra śāśvatī /
analyzed: natāḥ sma sarva vacasām pratiṣṭhā yatra śāśvatī
translated: We bow to him who is the eternal foundation of all speech,

original: tam ādyantam aśeṣasya jagataḥ paramaṃ prabhum // / / //
analyzed: tam ādi antam aśeṣasya jagataḥ paramam prabhum
translated: The first and last, the supreme lord of the entire universe.

original: ins /
analyzed: d ins
translated: (Here is the corrected and aligned Sanskrit-English translation pairs:)

original: jagadbījatayā natvā carurūpavibhāgataḥ // / / / //
analyzed: jagat bīja tayā natvā caru rūpa vibhāgataḥ
translated: Bowing to him as the seed of the universe, in the form of the sacrificial cake,

original: śuddharūpapraṇāmeta tuṣṭo viṣṇuḥ pracetasām // / / / //
analyzed: śuddha rūpa praṇāmeta tuṣṭaḥ viṣṇuḥ pracetasām
translated: Vishnu, pleased by the Pracetas' salutations to his pure form,

original: jyotir ādyam anaupamyam aṇv anantam apāravat /
analyzed: jyotiḥ ādyam anaupamyam aṇu anantam apāra vat
translated: The primordial light, incomparable, atomic, infinite, boundless,

original: yonibhūtam aśeṣasya sthāvarasya carasya ca // / / //
analyzed: yoni bhūtam aśeṣasya sthāvarasya carasya ca
translated: The source of all that is immobile and mobile,

original: yasyāhaḥ prathamaṃ rūpam arūpasya tato niśā /
analyzed: yasya ahar prathamam rūpam arūpasya tatas niśā
translated: Whose first form is day, and then night, of the formless one,

original: saṃdhyā ca parameśasya tasmai kālātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃdhyā ca parameśasya tasmai kāla ātmane namaḥ
translated: And the twilight of the supreme lord, salutations to him, the embodiment of time.

original: bhujyate 'nudinaṃ devaiḥ pitṛbhiś ca sudhātmakaḥ /
analyzed: bhujyate devaiḥ pitṛbhiḥ ca sudhā ātmakaḥ
translated: Consumed daily by the gods and ancestors, consisting of nectar,

original: jīvabhūtaḥ samastasya tasmai somātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: jīva bhūtaḥ samastasya tasmai soma ātmane namaḥ
translated: The life-force of the entire universe, salutations to him, the embodiment of Soma.

original: yas tamo hanti tīvrātmā svabhābhir bhāsayan nabhaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tamaḥ hanti tīvra ātmā sva bhābhiḥ bhāsayan nabhaḥ
translated: He who destroys darkness with his intense self, illuminating the sky with his rays,

original: gharmaśītāmbhasāṃ yonis tasmai sūryātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: gharma śīta ambhasām yoniḥ tasmai sūrya ātmane namaḥ
translated: The source of heat, cold, and water, salutations to him, the embodiment of the sun.

original: kāṭhinyavān yo bibharti jagad etad aśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: kāṭhinyavān yaḥ bibharti jagat etat aśeṣatas
translated: Who is full of hardness and supports this entire world,

original: śabdādisaṃśrayo vyāpī tasmai bhūmyātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śabda ādi saṃśrayaḥ vyāpī tasmai bhūmi ātmane namaḥ
translated: The abode of sound and other qualities, and is all-pervading, salutations to that form of Earth.

original: yad yonibhūtaṃ jagato bījaṃ yat sarvadehinām /
analyzed: yat yoni bhūtam jagataḥ bījam yat sarva dehinām
translated: The source from which the universe has originated and is the seed of all embodied beings,

original: tat toyarūpam īśasya namāmo harimedhasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat toya rūpam īśasya namāmaḥ harimedhasaḥ
translated: We bow to that water form of the Lord, O Viṣṇu, of the mind of Hari.

original: yo mukhaṃ sarvadevānāṃ havyabhuk kavyabhuk tathā /
analyzed: yaḥ mukham sarva devānām havya bhuj kavya bhuj tathā
translated: Who is the mouth of all gods, the consumer of oblations offered to gods and ancestors,

original: pitṝṇāṃ ca namas tasmai viṣṇave pāvakātmane // / / //
analyzed: pitṝṇām ca namaḥ tasmai viṣṇave pāvaka ātmane
translated: Salutations to that form of fire, Viṣṇu.

original: pañcadhāvasthito dehe yaś ceṣṭāṃ kurute 'niśam /
analyzed: pañcadhā avasthitaḥ dehe yaḥ ceṣṭām kurute niśam
translated: Who is present in the body in five forms and constantly performs the functions of movement,

original: ākāśayonir bhagavāṃs tasmai vāyvātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ākāśa yoniḥ bhagavān tasmai vāyu ātmane namaḥ
translated: The unborn Lord, the source of space, salutations to that form of air.

original: avakāśam aśeṣāṇāṃ bhūtānāṃ yaḥ prayacchati /
analyzed: avakāśam aśeṣāṇām bhūtānām yaḥ prayacchati
translated: Who grants space to all beings,

original: anantamūrtimāñ chuddhas tasmai vyomātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ananta mūrtimān tasmai vyoma ātmane namaḥ
translated: The infinite-formed, pure one, salutations to that form of space.

original: samastendriyavargasya yaḥ sadā sthānam uttamam /
analyzed: samasta indriya vargasya yaḥ sadā sthānam uttamam
translated: Who is always the supreme abode of the entire group of senses,

original: tasmai śabdādirūpāya namaḥ kṛṣṇāya vedhase // / / //
analyzed: tasmai śabda ādi rūpāya namaḥ kṛṣṇāya vedhase
translated: Salutations to that form of sound and other sense objects, to the creator Kṛṣṇa.

original: gṛhṇāti viṣayān nityam indriyātmā kṣarākṣaraḥ /
analyzed: gṛhṇāti viṣayān nityam indriya ātmā kṣara akṣaraḥ
translated: Who constantly grasps the sense objects, the imperishable and perishable soul of the senses,

original: yas tasmai jñānamūlāya natāḥ sma harimedhase // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ tasmai jñāna mūlāya natāḥ sma harimedhase
translated: We bow to that form of knowledge, O Viṣṇu, of the mind of Hari.

original: gṛhītān indriyair arthān ātmane yaḥ prayacchati /
analyzed: gṛhītān indriyaiḥ arthān ātmane yaḥ prayacchati
translated: Salutations to Him who, through the senses, offers to the inner self, the objects of the senses,

original: antaḥkaraṇabhūtāya tasmai viśvātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: antaḥkaraṇa bhūtāya tasmai viśvātmane namaḥ
translated: to Him who is the inner controller, to the soul of the universe.

original: yasminn anante sakalaṃ viśvaṃ yasmāt tathodgatam /🔽layasthānaṃ ca yas tasmai namaḥ prakṛtidharmiṇe // / / //
analyzed: yasmin anante sakalam viśvam yasmāt tathā udgatam  laya sthānam ca yaḥ tasmai namaḥ prakṛti dharmiṇe
translated: Salutations to Him in whom the entire universe rests, from whom it has originated,🔽and to whom it returns, to Him who possesses the qualities of Prakriti.

original: śuddhaḥ saṃllakṣyate bhrāntyā guṇavān iva yo 'guṇaḥ /
analyzed: śuddhaḥ san lakṣyate bhrāntyā guṇavān iva yaḥ guṇaḥ
translated: We bow to that Supreme Being, who though pure, is seen through illusion as if possessing qualities, though qualityless.

original: tam ātmarūpiṇaṃ devaṃ natāḥ sma puruṣottamam // / / //🔽avikāram ajaṃ śuddhaṃ nirguṇaṃ yan nirañjanam /
analyzed: tam ātma rūpiṇam devam natāḥ sma puruṣottamam  avikāram ajam śuddham nirguṇam yat nirañjanam
translated: We bow to that Supreme Person, who is of the form of the Self.🔽We bow to that Supreme Brahman, which is changeless, unborn, pure, qualityless, and free from passion,

original: natāḥ sma tat paraṃ brahma viṣṇor yat paramaṃ padam // / / //🔽adīrghahrasvam asthūlam anaṇv agryam alohitam /
analyzed: natāḥ sma tat param brahma viṣṇoḥ yat paramam padam  a dīrgha hrasvam a sthūlam an aṇu agryam a lohitam
translated: which is Vishnu's highest abode.🔽We bow to that which is neither long nor short, neither gross nor atomic, neither bloody nor oily,

original: asnehacchāyam atanum asaktam asamīraṇam // / / //🔽anākāśam asaṃsparśam agandham arasaṃ ca yat /
analyzed: a sneha chāyam a tanum a saktam a samīraṇam  an ākāśam a saṃsparśam a gandham a rasam ca yat
translated: neither smooth nor rough, neither attached nor moving.🔽We bow to that which is neither space nor touch, neither smell nor taste,

original: acakṣuḥśrotram acalam avākpāṇim amānasam // / / //🔽anāmagotram asukham atejaskam ahetukam /
analyzed: a cakṣuḥ śrotram acalam a vāc pāṇim a mānasam  a nāma gotram a sukham a tejaskam a hetukam
translated: which is neither eye nor ear, neither foot nor hand, neither mind nor speech.🔽We bow to that which is beyond name and lineage, neither happiness nor splendor, nor cause,

original: abhayaṃ bhrāntirahitam anidram ajarāmaram // / / //
analyzed: a bhayam bhrānti rahitam anidram ajara amaram
translated: which is fearless, free from error, neither sleeping nor subject to old age and death.

original: arajo 'śabdam amṛtam aplutaṃ yad asaṃvṛtam /
analyzed: arajaḥ śabdam amṛtam a plutam yat a saṃvṛtam
translated: That which is free from dust, sound, death, and is not submerged, and is not covered,

original: pūrvāpare na vai yasmiṃs tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam // / / //
analyzed: pūrva apare na vai yasmin tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam
translated: In which there is no east or west, that is the supreme abode of Vishnu.

original: param īśitvaguṇavat sarvabhūtam asaṃśrayam /
analyzed: param īśitva guṇavat sarva bhūtam a saṃśrayam
translated: The supreme, possessing the quality of lordship, all-pervading, without support,

original: natāḥ sma tat padaṃ viṣṇor jihvādṛggocaraṃ na yat // / / //
analyzed: natāḥ sma tat padam viṣṇoḥ jihvā dṛś gocaram na yat
translated: We bow to that state of Vishnu, which is not within the range of tongue or sight.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: evaṃ pracetaso viṣṇuṃ stuvantas tatsamādhayaḥ /
analyzed: evam pracetasaḥ viṣṇum stuvantaḥ tad samādhayaḥ
translated: Thus the Pracetas, absorbed in meditation on Vishnu, praising him,

original: daśa varṣasahasrāṇi tapaś cerur mahārṇave // / / //
analyzed: daśa varṣa sahasrāṇi tapaḥ ceruḥ mahā arṇave
translated: Practiced austerities for ten thousand years in the great ocean.

original: tataḥ prasanno bhagavāṃs teṣām antarjale hariḥ /🔽dadau darśanam unnidranīlotpaladalacchaviḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas prasannaḥ bhagavān teṣām antar jale hariḥ  dadau darśanam unnidra nīlotpala dala chaviḥ
translated: Then the Blessed Lord Hari, pleased with them, while they were in the water,🔽Gave them a vision of himself, his complexion like the petals of a full-blown blue lotus.

original: patatrirājam ārūḍham avalokya pracetasaḥ /
analyzed: patatri rājam ārūḍham avalokya pracetasaḥ
translated: Seeing him mounted on the king of birds, the Pracetas,

original: praṇipetuḥ śirobhis taṃ bhaktibhārāvanāmitaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: praṇipetuḥ śirobhiḥ tam bhakti bhāra avanāmitaiḥ
translated: Bowed their heads to him, their heads bent down with the weight of devotion.

original: tatas tān āha bhagavān vriyatām īpsito varaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tān āha bhagavān vriyatām īpsitaḥ varaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed Lord said to them, Choose the desired boon.

original: prasādasumukho 'haṃ vo varadaḥ samupasthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prasāda su mukhaḥ ham vaḥ vara daḥ samupasthitaḥ
translated: I am pleased with you, I am ready to grant boons with a favorable face.

original: tatas tam ūcur varadaṃ praṇipatya pracetasaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tam ūcuḥ vara dam praṇipatya pracetasaḥ
translated: Then the Pracetas, having bowed to him, the giver of boons, said to him:

original: yathā pitrā samādiṣṭaṃ prajānāṃ vṛddhikāraṇam // / / //
analyzed: yathā pitrā samādiṣṭam prajānām vṛddhi kāraṇam
translated: As directed by their father, for the increase of the subjects.

original: sa cāpi devas taṃ dattvā yathābhilaṣitaṃ varam /
analyzed: sa ca api devaḥ tam dattvā yathā abhilaṣitam varam
translated: And that god, having granted him the desired boon,

original: antardhānaṃ jagāmāśu te ca niścakramur jalāt // / / //
analyzed: antardhānam jagāma āśu te ca niścakramuḥ jalāt
translated: quickly disappeared, and they came out of the water.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe prathame 'ṃśe caturdaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe prathame ṃśe caturdaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourteenth chapter in the first section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽tapaś caratsu pṛthivīṃ pracetaḥsu mahīruhāḥ /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  tapaḥ caratsu pṛthivīm pracetaḥsu mahīruhāḥ
translated: Parashara said:

original: arakṣyamāṇām āvavrur babhūvātha prajākṣayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: a rakṣyamāṇām āvavruḥ babhūva atha prajā kṣayaḥ
translated: While the Prachetas were performing austerities, the trees covered the unguarded earth. Then the destruction of the subjects occurred.

original: nāśakan māruto vātuṃ vṛtaṃ kham abhavad drumaiḥ /
analyzed: na aśakat mārutaḥ vātum vṛtam kham abhavat drumaiḥ
translated: The wind was unable to blow, the sky became filled with trees.

original: daśavarṣasahasrāṇi na śekuś ceṣṭituṃ prajāḥ // / / //
analyzed: daśa varṣa sahasrāṇi na śekuḥ ceṣṭitum prajāḥ
translated: For ten thousand years, the subjects were unable to move.

original: tān dṛṣṭvā jalaniṣkrāntāḥ sarve kruddhāḥ pracetasaḥ /
analyzed: tān dṛṣṭvā jala niṣkrāntāḥ sarve kruddhāḥ pracetasaḥ
translated: Seeing them come out of the water, all the angry Prachetas,

original: mukhebhyo vāyum agniṃ ca te 'sṛjañ jātamanyavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mukhebhyaḥ vāyum agnim ca te sṛjam jāta manyavaḥ
translated: with their anger aroused, created wind and fire from their mouths.

original: unmūlān atha tān vṛkṣān kṛtvā vāyur aśoṣayat /
analyzed: unmūlān atha tān vṛkṣān kṛtvā vāyuḥ aśoṣayat
translated: Then the wind uprooted those trees and dried them up.

original: tān agnir adahad ghoras tatrābhūd drumasaṃkṣayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tān agniḥ adahat ghoraḥ tatra abhūt druma saṃkṣayaḥ
translated: The terrible fire burned them, and there was the destruction of the trees.

original: drumakṣayam atho dṛṣṭvā kiṃcic chiṣṭeṣu śākhiṣu /
analyzed: druma kṣayam atho dṛṣṭvā kiṃcid śiṣṭeṣu śākhiṣu
translated: Seeing the destruction of the trees, with only a few remaining,

original: upagamyābravīd etān rājā somaḥ prajāpatīn // / / //
analyzed: upagamya abravīt etān rājā somaḥ prajāpatīn
translated: Approaching, King Soma spoke to those Prajapatis:

original: kopaṃ yacchata rājānaḥ śṛṇudhvaṃ ca vaco mama /
analyzed: kopam yacchata rājānaḥ śṛṇudhvam ca vacaḥ mama

analyzed: saṃdhānam vaḥ kariṣyāmi saha kṣitiruhaiḥ aham

original: ratnabhūtā ca kanyeyaṃ vārkṣeyī varavarṇinī /
analyzed: ratna bhūtā ca kanyā iyam vārkṣeyī varavarṇinī

original: bhaviṣyaṃ jānatā pūrvaṃ mayā gobhir vivardhitā // / / //
analyzed: bhaviṣyam jānatā pūrvam mayā gobhiḥ vivardhitā

analyzed: māriṣā nāma nāmnā eṣā vṛkṣāṇām iti nirmitā

analyzed: bhāryā vaḥ stu mahābhāgā dhruvam vaṃśa vivardhinī

analyzed: asyām utpatsyate vidvān dakṣaḥ nāma prajāpatiḥ

original: pramlocovāca /
analyzed: pramlocā uvāca

analyzed: pratyūṣasi āgatāḥ brahman satyam etat na tat mṛṣā
translated: O Brahman, I came in the morning, this is true, not false.

analyzed: kintu adya tasya kālasya gatāni abda śatāni te

original: soma uvāca /
analyzed: somaḥ uvāca

analyzed: tatas sa sādhvasaḥ vipraḥ tām papraccha āyata īkṣaṇām

analyzed: kathyatām bhīru kaḥ kālaḥ tvayā me ramataḥ saha

original: pramlocovāca /
analyzed: pramlocā uvāca

analyzed: māsāḥ ca ṣaṭ tathā eva anyat samatītam dina trayam

original: ṛṣir uvāca /
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ uvāca
translated: The Rishi said,

original: satyaṃ bhīru vadasy etat parihāso 'tha vā śubhe /
analyzed: satyam bhīru vadasi etat vā śubhe
translated: O timid one, is it true that you say? Or is it a joke, O auspicious one?

original: dinam ekam ahaṃ manye tvayā sārdham ihāsitam // / / //
analyzed: dinam ekam aham manye tvayā sārdham iha āsitam
translated: I think that I have sported with you for only one day.

original: pramlocovāca /
analyzed: pramlocā uvāca
translated: Pramlocha said,

original: vadiṣyāmy anṛtaṃ brahman katham atra tavāntike /
analyzed: vadiṣyāmi anṛtam brahman katham atra tava antike
translated: O Brahmana, how can I speak an untruth before you?

analyzed: viśeṣeṇa adya bhavatā pṛṣṭā mārga anuvartinā
translated: Especially when I have been asked by you who are following the path of virtue.

original: soma uvāca /
analyzed: somaḥ uvāca
translated: Soma said,

original: niśamya tad vacaḥ tasyāḥ sa munir nṛpanandanāḥ /
analyzed: niśamya tat vacaḥ tasyāḥ sa muniḥ nṛpa nandanāḥ
translated: Hearing these words of hers, the Rishi, O princes,

analyzed: dhik mām dhik mām atīva ittham nininda ātmānam ātmanā
translated: Cursed himself, saying, 'Fie on me! Fie on me!'

original: munir uvāca /🔽tapāṃsi mama naṣṭāni hataṃ brahmavidāṃ dhanam /
analyzed: muniḥ uvāca  tapāṃsi mama naṣṭāni hatam brahma vidām dhanam
translated: The Rishi said,🔽My penances are destroyed. The wealth of the knowers of Brahman is lost.

original: hṛto vivekaḥ kenāpi yoṣin mohāya nirmitā // / / //
analyzed: hṛtaḥ vivekaḥ kena api yoṣit mohāya nirmitā
translated: My discrimination has been taken away by someone. A woman has been created for deluding me.

original: ūrmiṣaṭkātigaṃ brahma jñeyam ātmajayena me /
analyzed: ūrmi ṣaṭka atigam brahma jñeyam ātma jayena me
translated: The Brahman which is beyond the six waves, which is to be known by the conquest of the self,

original: matir eṣā hṛtā yena dhik taṃ kāmaṃ mahāgraham // / / //🔽ins /
analyzed: matiḥ eṣā hṛtā yena dhik tam kāmam mahā graham  d ins

analyzed: kṣuḍtṛc śoka mohau ca jarā mṛtyū ṣaṭ ūrmayaḥ
translated: The six waves are hunger, thirst, sorrow, delusion, old age, and death.

original: vratāni vedavedyāptikāraṇāny akhilāni ca /
analyzed: vratāni veda vedya āpti kāraṇāni akhilāni ca
translated: All the vows and causes of attaining the knowledge of the Vedas,

analyzed: naraka grāma mārgeṇa saṅgena apahṛtāni me

analyzed: vinindya ittham sa dharma jñaḥ svayam ātmānam ātmanā

analyzed: tām apsarasam āsīnām idam vacanam abravīt
translated: He spoke these words to the seated apsara.

analyzed: gaccha pāpe yathākāmam yat kāryam tat kṛtam tvayā

analyzed: satām sapta padam maitram uṣitaḥ ham tvayā saha

analyzed: tvayā dhik tvām mahā moha mañjūṣām su jugupsitām

analyzed: somaḥ uvāca  yāvat ittham sa viprarṣiḥ tām bravīti sumadhyamām
translated: Soma said:🔽While that brahmin sage was thus speaking to that slender-waisted one,

translated: The chaste one, constantly trembling, with her creeper-like body exhausted,

translated: the best of sages angrily said, Go, go!🔽She, thus reproached by him, then left the hermitage,

analyzed: nirmārjamānāḥ gātrāṇi galat sveda jalāni vai

analyzed: ṛṣiṇā yaḥ tadā garbhaḥ tasyāḥ dehe samāhitaḥ

analyzed: aryamā ca eva dhātā ca tvaṣṭā pūṣā tathā eva ca
translated: and also Aryaman, Dhātṛ, Tvaṣṭṛ, and Pūṣan.

original: vivasvān savitā caiva mitro varuṇa eva ca /
analyzed: vivasvān savitā ca eva mitraḥ varuṇaḥ eva ca
translated: Vivasvān, Savitṛ, Mitra, and Varuṇa,

original: aṃśo bhagaś cātitejā ādityā dvādaśa smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: aṃśaḥ bhagaḥ ca ati tejāḥ ādityāḥ dvādaśa smṛtāḥ
translated: Aṃśa, Bhaga of great splendor - these are known as the twelve Ādityas.

original: cākṣuṣasyāntare pūrvam āsan ye tuṣitāḥ surāḥ /
analyzed: cākṣuṣasya antare pūrvam āsan ye tuṣitāḥ surāḥ
translated: Those who were the Tushita gods in the previous Manvantara of Chakshusha,

original: vaivasvate 'ntare te vai ādityā dvādaśa smṛtāḥ // / / //🔽saptaviṃśati yāḥ proktāḥ somapatnyo 'tha suvratāḥ // / / //
analyzed: vaivasvate ntare te vai ādityāḥ dvādaśa smṛtāḥ  saptaviṃśati yāḥ proktāḥ suvratāḥ
translated: are known as the twelve Adityas in the Vaivasvata Manvantara.

original: After Ś / / / / / /
analyzed: after
translated: The twenty-seven wives of Soma, of excellent vows, who are said to be the lunar mansions,

original: ed / Veṅk / ins / / while ins / after /🔽sarvā nakṣatrayoginyas tannāmnaś caiva tāḥ smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: e t veṅk ins while d ins after  sarvāḥ nakṣatra yoginyaḥ tad nāmnaḥ ca eva tāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: are the daughters of Daksha, born from Pradha.

original: ins / after /
analyzed: t ins after
translated: All of them are the Yoginis of the lunar mansions and are known by their respective names.🔽By the curse of Daksha, they became wives of Soma.

original: dakṣaśāpād yā sapatyāḥ tāsu yakṣagṛhārthite // / / //
analyzed: dakṣa śāpāt yā sapatyāḥ tāsu yakṣa gṛha arthite
translated: From them, the Yakshas and Rakshasas were born.

original: tāsām apatyāny abhavan dīptāny amitatejasām // / / //
analyzed: tāsām apatyāni abhavan dīptāni amita tejasām
translated: They had brilliant and immeasurable offspring.

original: ariṣṭanemipatnīnām apatyānīha ṣoḍaśa // / / //
analyzed: ariṣṭanemi patnīnām apatyāni iha ṣoḍaśa
translated: The sixteen sons of the wives of Arishtanemi,

original: bahuputrasya viduṣaś catasro vidyutaḥ smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: bahuputrasya viduṣaḥ catasraḥ vidyutaḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The four daughters of the learned Bahuputra are known as the Vidyut.

original: pratyaṅgirasajāḥ śreṣṭhā ṛco brahmarṣisatkṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: pratyaṅgirasa jāḥ śreṣṭhāḥ ṛcaḥ brahmarṣi satkṛtāḥ
translated: The excellent Rig-Veda hymns, revered by the Brahmana sages, are born from Pratyangira.

original: kṛśāśvasya tu devarṣer devapraharaṇāḥ sutāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṛśāśvasya tu devarṣeḥ deva praharaṇāḥ sutāḥ
translated: The sons of the celestial Rishi Krsaswa, who wield celestial weapons,

original: ete yugasahasrānte jāyante punar eva hi /
analyzed: ete yuga sahasra ante jāyante punar eva hi
translated: These are born again at the end of a thousand yugas.

original: sarve devagaṇās tāta trayas triṃśat tu chandajāḥ /
analyzed: sarve deva gaṇāḥ tāta trayaḥ triṃśat tu chanda jāḥ
translated: O son, all the thirty-three groups of gods are born from the Vedas.

original: teṣām apīha satataṃ nirodhotpattir ucyate // / / //
analyzed: teṣām api iha satatam nirodha utpattiḥ ucyate
translated: Their cessation and origination are also said to occur constantly here.

original: yathā sūryasya maitreya udayāstamanāv iha /
analyzed: yathā sūryasya maitreyaḥ udaya astamanau iha
translated: Just as the rising and setting of the sun are spoken of here, Maitreya,

original: evaṃ devanikāyās te saṃbhavanti yuge yuge // / / //
analyzed: evam deva nikāyāḥ te saṃbhavanti yuge yuge
translated: in the same way, those groups of gods come into existence in each yuga.

original: dityā putradvayaṃ jajñe kaśyapād iti naḥ śrutam /
analyzed: dityā putra dvayam jajñe kaśyapāt iti naḥ śrutam
translated: We have heard that Diti gave birth to a pair of sons from Kashyapa.

original: hiraṇyakaśipuś caiva hiraṇyākṣaś ca durjayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ ca eva hiraṇyākṣaḥ ca durjayaḥ
translated: They were Hiranyakashipu and the invincible Hiranyaksha.

original: siṃhikā cābhavat kanyā vipracitteḥ parigrahaḥ // / / //
analyzed: siṃhikā ca abhavat kanyā vipracitteḥ parigrahaḥ
translated: And Simhika became the wife of Viprachitti.

original: hiraṇyakaśipoḥ putrāś catvāraḥ prathitaujasaḥ /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipoḥ putrāḥ catvāraḥ prathita ojasaḥ
translated: Hiranyakashipu had four sons of great prowess.

original: anuhlādaś ca hlādaś ca prahlādaś caiva dharmavān /
analyzed: anuhlādaḥ ca hlādaḥ ca prahlādaḥ ca eva dharmavān
translated: Anuhlada, Hlada, and the righteous Prahlada,

original: saṃhlādaś ca mahāvīryā daityavaṃśavivardhanāḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃhlādaḥ ca mahā vīryāḥ daitya vaṃśa vivardhanāḥ
translated: and Samhlada, of great valor, who extended the lineage of the daityas.

original: teṣāṃ madhye mahābhāgaḥ sarvatra samadṛg vaśī /
analyzed: teṣām madhye mahābhāgaḥ sarvatra samadṛś vaśī
translated: Among them, the greatly fortunate one, impartial towards all, self-controlled,

original: prahlādaḥ paramāṃ bhaktiṃ ya uvāha janārdane // / / //
analyzed: prahlādaḥ paramām bhaktim yaḥ uvāha janārdane
translated: Prahlada, who bore supreme devotion to Janardana.

original: ins /🔽prahlādavan nṛsiṃhaikabhaktibhāvāya dehinām // / / / //
analyzed: d ins  prahlāda vat nṛsiṃha eka bhakti bhāvāya dehinām
translated: Inserts:🔽For the attainment of single-minded devotion to Narasimha like Prahlada by embodied beings.

original: āvahac chravaṇautsukyaṃ tatprabhāvam asūcayat // / / / //
analyzed: āvahat śravaṇa autsukyam tad prabhāvam asūcayat
translated: It indicated his power, arousing eagerness to hear.

original: daityendradīpito vahniḥ sarvāṅgopacito dvija /
analyzed: daitya indra dīpitaḥ vahniḥ sarva aṅga upacitaḥ dvija
translated: O Brahmin, the fire kindled by the lord of the daityas, spreading over his entire body,

original: na dadāha ca yaṃ pūrvaṃ vāsudeve hṛdi sthite // / / //🔽mahārṇavāntaḥsalile sthitasya calato mahī /
analyzed: na dadāha ca yam pūrvam vāsudeve hṛdi sthite  mahā arṇava antar salile sthitasya calataḥ mahī
translated: whom the fire did not burn before, when Vāsudeva was in his heart.🔽The entire earth, along with the water in the great ocean, shook

original: cacāla sakalā yasya pāśabaddhasya dhīmataḥ // / / //🔽na bhinnaṃ vividhaiḥ śastrair yasya daityendrapātitaiḥ /
analyzed: cacāla sakalā yasya pāśa baddhasya dhīmataḥ  na bhinnam vividhaiḥ śastraiḥ yasya daitya indra pātitaiḥ
translated: when the wise one, bound by fetters, moved.🔽The body of him whose mind was always fixed on Acyuta, was not pierced anywhere

original: śarīram adrikaṭhinaṃ sarvatrācyutacetasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śarīram adri kaṭhinam sarvatra acyuta cetasaḥ
translated: by various weapons thrown by the lords of demons, though hard as a mountain.

original: viṣānalojjvalamukhā yasya daityapracoditāḥ /
analyzed: viṣa anala ujjvala mukhāḥ yasya daitya pracoditāḥ
translated: The lords of serpents, urged by the demons, whose mouths were blazing with poison and fire,

original: nāntāya sarpapatayo babhūvur urutejasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na antāya sarpa patayaḥ babhūvuḥ uru tejasaḥ
translated: did not cause death to the greatly powerful one.

original: śailair ākrāntadeho 'pi yaḥ smaran puruṣottamam /
analyzed: śailaiḥ ākrānta dehaḥ yaḥ smaran puruṣottamam
translated: Even when his body was crushed by mountains, he, remembering Puruṣottama,

original: tatyāja nātmanaḥ prāṇān viṣṇusmaraṇadaṃśitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatyāja na ātmanaḥ prāṇān viṣṇu smaraṇa daṃśitaḥ
translated: did not give up his life, protected by the recollection of Viṣṇu.

original: patantam uccād avanir yam upetya mahāmatim /
analyzed: patantam uccāt avaniḥ yam upetya mahāmatim
translated: The earth, approaching that greatly wise one falling from a great height,

original: dadhāra daityapatinā kṣiptaṃ svarganivāsinā // / / //
analyzed: dadhāra daitya patinā kṣiptam svarga nivāsinā
translated: supported him, thrown by the lord of demons, the resident of heaven.

original: yasya saṃśoṣako vāyur dehe daityendrayojitaḥ /
analyzed: yasya saṃśoṣakaḥ vāyuḥ dehe daitya indra yojitaḥ
translated: The drying wind, employed in his body by the lord of demons,

original: avāpa saṃkṣayaṃ sadyaś cittasthe madhusūdane // / / //
analyzed: avāpa saṃkṣayam sadyas citta sthe madhusūdane
translated: was immediately destroyed, when Madhusūdana was in his mind.

original: viṣāṇabhaṅgam unmattā madahāniṃ ca diggajāḥ /
analyzed: viṣāṇa bhaṅgam unmattāḥ mada hānim ca diggajāḥ
translated: The elephants of the directions, intoxicated, obtained the breaking of their tusks and the loss of their pride,

original: yasya vakṣaḥsthale prāptā daityendrapariṇāmitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yasya vakṣaḥ sthale prāptāḥ daitya indra pariṇāmitāḥ
translated: Whose chest was struck by the transformed Daityendra,

original: yasya cotpāditā kṛtyā daityarājapurohitaiḥ /
analyzed: yasya ca utpāditā kṛtyā daitya rāja purohitaiḥ
translated: And by the priests of the king of demons,

original: babhūva nāntāya purā govindāsaktacetasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: babhūva na antāya purā govinda āsakta cetasaḥ
translated: Did not lead to his destruction, as his mind was always fixed on Govinda.

original: śambarasya ca māyānāṃ sahasram atimāyinaḥ /
analyzed: śambarasya ca māyānām sahasram ati māyinaḥ
translated: The thousand illusions of Shambara, which were very deceptive,

original: yasmin prayuktaṃ cakreṇa kṛṣṇasya vitathīkṛtam // / / //
analyzed: yasmin prayuktam cakreṇa kṛṣṇasya vitathīkṛtam
translated: Were rendered futile by the discus of Krishna, when used against him.

original: daityendrasūdopahṛtaṃ yaś ca hālāhalaṃ viṣam /
analyzed: daitya indra sūda upahṛtam yaḥ ca hālāhalam viṣam
translated: The poison halahala, offered by the cook of the king of demons,

original: jarayām āsa matimān avikāram amatsarī // / / //
analyzed: jarayām āsa matimān a vikāram a matsarī
translated: Was digested by the wise one without any change, without any malice.

original: samacetā jagaty asmin yaḥ sarveṣv eva jantuṣu /
analyzed: sama cetāḥ jagati asmin yaḥ sarveṣu eva jantuṣu
translated: He who had an equal mind towards all beings in this world,

original: yathātmani tathānyatra paraṃ maitraguṇānvitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yathā ātmani tathā anyatra param maitra guṇa anvitaḥ
translated: Who was endowed with the highest quality of friendliness towards others as towards himself,

original: dharmātmā satyaśaucādiguṇānām ākaraḥ paraḥ /
analyzed: dharma ātmā satya śauca ādi guṇānām ākaraḥ paraḥ
translated: The one with a righteous soul, the supreme abode of virtues like truthfulness and purity,

original: upamānam aśeṣāṇāṃ sādhūnāṃ yaḥ sadābhavat // / / //
analyzed: upamānam aśeṣāṇām sādhūnām yaḥ sadā bhavat
translated: Who was always the standard of comparison for all the virtuous ones.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe prathame 'ṃśe pañcadaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe prathame ṃśe pañcadaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fifteenth chapter in the first section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: maitreya uvāca /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca
translated: Maitreya said:

original: kathito bhavatā vaṃśo mānavānāṃ mahāmune /
analyzed: kathitaḥ bhavatā vaṃśaḥ mānavānām mahā mune
translated: The lineage of Manu has been narrated by you, O great sage.

original: kāraṇaṃ cāsya jagato viṣṇur eva sanātanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāraṇam ca asya jagataḥ viṣṇuḥ eva sanātanaḥ
translated: And Vishnu alone is the eternal cause of this world.

original: yat tv etad bhagavān āha prahlādaṃ daityasattamam /
analyzed: yat tu etat bhagavān āha prahlādam daitya sattamam
translated: As regards what the Lord said to Prahlada, the best of the Daityas,

original: dadāha nāgnir nāstraiś ca kṣuṇṇas tatyāja jīvitam // / / //
analyzed: dadāha nā agniḥ nā astraiḥ ca kṣuṇṇaḥ tatyāja jīvitam
translated: that fire did not burn him, and he did not give up his life though cut off by weapons.

original: jagāma vasudhā kṣobhaṃ yatrābdhisalile sthite /
analyzed: jagāma vasudhā kṣobham yatra abdhi salile sthite
translated: When he remained in the water of the ocean, the earth trembled,

original: bandhabaddho 'pi calati vikṣiptāṅgaiḥ samāhatā // / / //
analyzed: bandha baddhaḥ calati vikṣipta aṅgaiḥ samāhatā
translated: and though bound, he moved, struck with his limbs extended.

original: śailair ākrāntadeho 'pi na mamāra ca yaḥ purā /
analyzed: śailaiḥ na mamāra ca yaḥ purā
translated: And though his body was crushed by mountains in the past, he did not die.

original: tvayaivātīva māhātmyaṃ kathitaṃ yasya dhīmataḥ // / / //🔽tasya prabhāvam atulaṃ viṣṇor bhaktimato mune /
analyzed: tvayā eva atīva māhātmyam kathitam yasya dhīmataḥ  tasya prabhāvam atulam viṣṇoḥ bhaktimataḥ mune
translated: You yourself have spoken of the greatness of that wise one to an excessive degree.🔽O sage, I wish to hear about the incomparable power of Vishnu, who has devotion,

original: śrotum icchāmi yasyaitac caritaṃ tv amitaujasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śrotum icchāmi yasya etat caritam tu amita ojasaḥ
translated: of him whose character is immeasurable, O sage.

original: kiṃnimittam asau śastrair vikṣato ditijair mune /
analyzed: kiṃnimittam asau śastraiḥ vikṣataḥ ditijaiḥ mune
translated: For what reason was he wounded by weapons of the sons of Diti?

original: kimarthaṃ cābdhisalile nikṣipto dharmatatparaḥ // / / //🔽ākrāntaḥ parvataiḥ kasmāt kasmād daṣṭo mahoragaiḥ /🔽kṣiptaḥ kim adriśikharāt kiṃ vā pāvakasaṃcaye // / / //
analyzed: kimartham ca abdhi salile nikṣiptaḥ dharma tatparaḥ  ākrāntaḥ parvataiḥ kasmāt kasmāt daṣṭaḥ mahā uragaiḥ  kṣiptaḥ kim adri śikharāt kim vā pāvaka saṃcaye
translated: And for what reason was he, who was devoted to dharma, thrown into the water of the ocean?🔽Why was he crushed by mountains? Why was he bitten by great serpents?🔽Why was he thrown from the peak of a mountain? Why was he thrown into a mass of fire?

original: digdantināṃ dantabhūmiḥ sa ca kasmān nirūpitaḥ /
analyzed: digdantinām danta bhūmiḥ sa ca kasmāt nirūpitaḥ
translated: Why was he made the ground for the tusks of the elephants of the directions?

original: saṃśoṣako 'nilaś cāsya prayuktaḥ kiṃ mahāsuraiḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃśoṣakaḥ nilaḥ ca asya prayuktaḥ kim mahā asuraiḥ
translated: Was the drying wind employed by the great Asuras?

original: kṛtyāṃ ca daityaguravo yuyujus te tu kiṃ mune /
analyzed: kṛtyām ca daitya guravaḥ yuyujuḥ te tu kim mune
translated: And did the preceptors of the Daityas, O sage, employ the Kṛtyā against him?

original: śambaraś cāpi māyānāṃ sahasraṃ kiṃ prayuktavān // / / //🔽hālāhalaṃ viṣaṃ ghoraṃ daityasūdair mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: śambaraḥ ca api māyānām sahasram kim prayuktavān  hālāhalam viṣam ghoram daitya sūdaiḥ mahātmanaḥ
translated: And did Śambara employ a thousand illusions against him?

original: kasmād dattaṃ vināśāya yaj jīrṇaṃ tena dhīmatā // / / //
analyzed: kasmāt dattam vināśāya yat jīrṇam tena dhīmatā
translated: And why was the terrible poison Hālāhala given by the great Asura mothers to the magnanimous one for his destruction, which was digested by him?

original: etat sarvaṃ mahābhāga prahlādasya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: etat sarvam mahābhāga prahlādasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: All this, O illustrious one, of the great soul Prahlāda,

original: caritaṃ śrotum icchāmi mahāmāhātmyasūcakam // / / //
analyzed: caritam śrotum icchāmi mahā māhātmya sūcakam
translated: I desire to hear, indicating great greatness.

original: na hi kautūhalaṃ tatra yad daityair na hato hi saḥ /
analyzed: na hi kautūhalam tatra yat daityaiḥ na hataḥ hi saḥ
translated: For there is no curiosity there that he was not killed by the Daityas.

original: ananyamanaso viṣṇau kaḥ samartho nipātane // / / //
analyzed: an anya manasaḥ viṣṇau kaḥ samarthaḥ nipātane
translated: Who is able to bring down one whose mind is fixed on Viṣṇu?

original: tasmin dharmapare nityaṃ keśavārādhanodyate /
analyzed: tasmin dharma pare nityam keśava ārādhana udyate
translated: In him who was always devoted to righteousness, who was engaged in worshipping Keśava,

original: svavaṃśaprabhavair daityaiḥ kartuṃ dveṣo 'tiduṣkaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: sva vaṃśa prabhavaiḥ daityaiḥ kartum dveṣo ti duṣkaraḥ
translated: it was very difficult for the Daityas born in his own family to arouse hatred.

original: dharmātmani mahābhāge viṣṇubhakte vimatsare /
analyzed: dharma ātmani mahābhāge viṣṇu bhakte vimatsare
translated: In that righteous-souled, illustrious, devotee of Viṣṇu, free from malice,

original: daiteyaiḥ prahṛtaṃ kasmāt tan mamākhyātum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: daiteyaiḥ prahṛtam kasmāt tat mama ākhyātum arhasi
translated: why was he struck by the Daityas? It behoves you to relate that to me.

original: praharanti mahātmāno vipakṣe cāpi nedṛśe /
analyzed: praharanti mahātmānaḥ vipakṣe ca api na īdṛśe
translated: The great ones strike even at such a foe,

original: guṇaiḥ samanvite sādhau kiṃ punar yaḥ svapakṣajaḥ // / / //
analyzed: guṇaiḥ samanvite sādhau kim punar yaḥ sva pakṣa jaḥ
translated: much more at one born in their own party, who is virtuous and endowed with good qualities.

original: tad etat kathyatāṃ sarvaṃ vistarān munisattama /
analyzed: tat etat kathyatām sarvam vistarāt muni sattama
translated: Therefore, O best of sages, tell me all this in detail.

original: daityeśvarasya caritaṃ śrotum icchāmy aśeṣataḥ // / / //
analyzed: daitya īśvarasya caritam śrotum icchāmi aśeṣatas
translated: I desire to hear the entire conduct of the lord of the demons.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe prathame 'ṃśe ṣoḍaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe prathame ṃśe ṣoḍaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixteenth chapter in the first section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽maitreya śrūyatāṃ samyak caritaṃ tasya dhīmataḥ /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  maitreya śrūyatām samyak caritam tasya dhīmataḥ
translated: Parashara said:

original: prahlādasya sadodāracaritasya mahātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prahlādasya sadā udāra caritasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: O Maitreya, listen properly to the conduct of that wise, always magnanimous, and great soul Prahlada.

original: diteḥ putro mahāvīryo hiraṇyakaśipuḥ purā /
analyzed: diteḥ putraḥ mahā vīryaḥ hiraṇyakaśipuḥ purā
translated: In ancient times, the son of Diti, the greatly powerful Hiranyakashipu,

original: trailokyaṃ vaśam āninye brahmaṇo varadarpitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: trailokyam vaśam āninye brahmaṇaḥ vara darpitaḥ
translated: brought the three worlds under his control, arrogant with the boon granted by Brahma.

original: indratvam akarod daityaḥ sa cāsīt savitā svayam /
analyzed: indra tvam akarot daityaḥ sa ca āsīt savitā svayam
translated: The demon himself became Indra, the sun,

original: vāyur agnir apāṃ nāthaḥ somaś cāsīn mahāsuraḥ // / / //🔽dhanānām adhipaḥ so 'bhūt sa evāsīt svayaṃ yamaḥ /
analyzed: vāyuḥ agniḥ apām nāthaḥ somaḥ ca āsīt mahā asuraḥ  dhanānām adhipaḥ saḥ bhūt saḥ eva āsīt svayam yamaḥ
