translated: the great demon became the wind, fire, lord of the waters, and the moon.🔽He became the lord of wealth, and he himself became Yama.

original: yajñabhāgān aśeṣāṃs tu sa svayaṃ bubhuje 'suraḥ // / / //
analyzed: yajña bhāgān aśeṣān tu sa svayam bubhuje suraḥ
translated: The demon himself enjoyed all the shares in the sacrifices.

original: devāḥ svargaṃ parityajya tattrāsān munisattama /
analyzed: devāḥ svargam parityajya tad trāsāt muni sattama
translated: O best of sages, the gods, out of fear, left heaven

original: vicerur avanau sarve bibhrāṇā mānuṣīṃ tanum // / / //
analyzed: viceruḥ avanau sarve bibhrāṇāḥ mānuṣīm tanum
translated: and roamed on earth, all assuming human forms.

original: jitvā tribhuvanaṃ sarvaṃ trailokyaiśvaryadarpitaḥ /
analyzed: jitvā tribhuvanam sarvam trailokya aiśvarya darpitaḥ
translated: Having conquered the three worlds, intoxicated with the sovereignty of the three worlds,

original: udgīyamāno gandharvair bubhuje viṣayān priyān // / / //
analyzed: udgīyamānaḥ gandharvaiḥ bubhuje viṣayān priyān
translated: he enjoyed his beloved pleasures, being sung by gandharvas.

original: pānāsaktaṃ mahātmānaṃ hiraṇyakaśipuṃ tadā /
analyzed: pāna āsaktam mahātmānam hiraṇyakaśipum tadā
translated: When the great Hiranyakashipu was engrossed in drinking,

original: upāsāṃ cakrire sarve siddhagandharvapannagāḥ // / / //
analyzed: upāsām cakrire sarve siddha gandharva pannagāḥ
translated: all the siddhas, gandharvas and serpents attended upon him.

original: avādayañ jaguś cānye jayaśabdān athāpare /
analyzed: avādayam jaguḥ ca anye jaya śabdān atha apare
translated: Some played musical instruments, others sang, and still others shouted Victory!

original: daityeśvarasya purataś cakruḥ siddhā mudānvitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: daitya īśvarasya puratas cakruḥ siddhāḥ mudā anvitāḥ
translated: The delighted siddhas performed in front of the lord of the daityas.

original: tatra pranṛttāpsarasi sphāṭikābhramaye 'suraḥ /
analyzed: tatra pranṛtta apsarasi sphāṭika abhra maye suraḥ
translated: There, in the crystal and cloud-like palace, the demon,

original: papau pānaṃ mudā yuktaḥ prāsāde sumanohare // / / //
analyzed: papau pānam mudā yuktaḥ prāsāde su manohare
translated: joyfully drank with the dancing apsaras.

original: tasya putro mahābhāgaḥ prahlādo nāma nāmataḥ /
analyzed: tasya putraḥ mahābhāgaḥ prahlādaḥ nāma nāmataḥ
translated: His son, the greatly fortunate one named Prahlada,

original: papāṭha bālapāṭhyāni gurugehaṃ gato 'rbhakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: papāṭha bāla pāṭhyāni guru geham gataḥ ṛbhakaḥ
translated: as a child went to his teacher's house and recited the lessons for children.

original: ekadā tu sa dharmātmā jagāma guruṇā saha /
analyzed: ekadā tu sa dharma ātmā jagāma guruṇā saha
translated: But once, that righteous one went with his teacher

original: pānāsaktasya purataḥ pitur daityapates tadā // / / //
analyzed: pāna āsaktasya puratas pituḥ daitya pateḥ tadā
translated: in front of his father, the lord of the daityas, who was engrossed in drinking.

original: pādapraṇāmāvanataṃ tam utthāpya pitā sutam /
analyzed: pāda praṇāma avanatam tam utthāpya pitā sutam
translated: The father, Hiraṇyakaśipu, raised up his son, who was bowing down at his feet,

original: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ prāha prahlādam amitaujasam // / / //
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ prāha prahlādam amita ojasam
translated: and said to Prahlāda, of immeasurable prowess.

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /🔽paṭhyatāṃ bhavatā vatsa sārabhūtaṃ subhāṣitam /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca  paṭhyatām bhavatā vatsa sāra bhūtam subhāṣitam
translated: Hiraṇyakaśipu said:🔽O son, recite for me the essence of the well-spoken teachings,

original: kālenaitāvatā yat te sadodyuktena śikṣitam // / / //
analyzed: kālena etāvatā yat te sadā udyuktena śikṣitam
translated: which you have diligently studied in this period of time.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlāda said:

original: śrūyatāṃ tāta vakṣyāmi sārabhūtaṃ tavājñayā /
analyzed: śrūyatām tāta vakṣyāmi sāra bhūtam tava ājñayā
translated: Listen, father, I will tell you the essence, by your command,

original: samāhitamanā bhūtvā yan me cetasy avasthitam // / / //🔽anādimadhyāntam ajam avṛddhikṣayam acyutam /
analyzed: samāhita manāḥ bhūtvā yat me cetasi avasthitam  an ādi madhya antam ajam a vṛddhi kṣayam acyutam
translated: with a concentrated mind, of what is established in my heart.🔽I bow to the one without beginning, middle, or end, the unborn, the one without increase or decrease, the imperishable,

original: praṇato 'smy antasaṃtānaṃ sarvakāraṇakāraṇam // / / //
analyzed: praṇataḥ smi anta saṃtānam sarva kāraṇa kāraṇam
translated: the inner continuum, the cause of all causes.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parāśara said:

original: etan niśamya daityendraḥ kopasaṃraktalocanaḥ /
analyzed: etat niśamya daitya indraḥ kopa saṃrakta locanaḥ
translated: Hearing this, the lord of the demons, his eyes red with anger,

original: vilokya tadguruṃ prāha sphuritādharapallavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vilokya tad gurum prāha sphurita adhara pallavaḥ
translated: looking at his guru, his lips trembling, said:

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca
translated: Hiraṇyakaśipu said:

original: brahmabandho kim etat te vipakṣastutisaṃhitam /
analyzed: brahmabandho kim etat te vipakṣa stuti saṃhitam
translated: O Brahmanical wretch, what is this, full of praise for your adversary,

original: asāraṃ grāhito bālo mām avajñāya durmate // / / //
analyzed: asāram grāhitaḥ bālaḥ mām avajñāya durmate
translated: that you have made the boy grasp, disregarding me, O evil-minded one?

original: gurur uvāca /
analyzed: guruḥ uvāca
translated: The guru said:

original: daityeśvara na kopasya vaśam āgantum arhasi /
analyzed: daitya īśvara na kopasya vaśam āgantum arhasi
translated: O lord of demons, you should not come under the sway of anger.

original: mamopadeśajanitaṃ nāyaṃ vadati te sutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mama upadeśa janitam na ayam vadati te sutaḥ
translated: This son of yours does not speak out of my advice.

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /🔽anuśiṣṭo 'si kenedṛg vatsa prahlāda kathyatām /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca  anuśiṣṭaḥ si kena īdṛś vatsa prahlāda kathyatām
translated: Hiraṇyakaśipu said:🔽By whom has this been taught to you, O child Prahlāda, tell me.

original: mayopadiṣṭaṃ nety eṣa prabravīti gurus tava // / / //
analyzed: mayā upadiṣṭam na iti eṣa prabravīti guruḥ tava
translated: He says that this is not taught by me, your teacher.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlāda said:

original: śāstā viṣṇur aśeṣasya jagato yo hṛdi sthitaḥ /
analyzed: śāstā viṣṇuḥ aśeṣasya jagataḥ yaḥ hṛdi sthitaḥ
translated: He who is the chastiser and is present in the heart of the entire world,

original: tam ṛte paramātmānaṃ tāta kaḥ kena śāsyate // / / //
analyzed: tam ṛte paramātmānam tāta kaḥ kena śāsyate
translated: excepting that Supreme Soul, O father, who is being taught by whom?

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca
translated: Hiraṇyakaśipu said:

original: ko 'yaṃ viṣṇuḥ sudurbuddhe yaṃ bravīṣi punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ yam viṣṇuḥ su durbuddhe yam bravīṣi punar punar
translated: O extremely wicked one, who is this Viṣṇu, whom you are repeatedly mentioning,

original: jagatām īśvarasyeha purataḥ prasabhaṃ mama // / / //
analyzed: jagatām īśvarasya iha puratas prasabham mama
translated: in the presence of the lord of the worlds, in my very presence?

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlāda said:

original: na śabdagocaraṃ yasya yogidhyeyaṃ paraṃ padam /
analyzed: na śabda gocaram yasya yogi dhyeyam param padam
translated: He who is not within the range of words, who is the highest object of meditation by the yogis,

original: yato yaś ca svayaṃ viśvaṃ sa viṣṇuḥ parameśvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: yatas yaḥ ca svayam viśvam sa viṣṇuḥ parameśvaraḥ
translated: from whom and who is the universe, He is Viṣṇu, the Supreme Lord.

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca
translated: Hiraṇyakaśipu said:

original: parameśvarasaṃjño 'jña kim anyo mayy avasthite /
analyzed: parameśvara saṃjñaḥ jña kim anyaḥ mayi avasthite
translated: O ignorant one, is there any other than the Supreme Lord, while I am present here?

original: tavāsti martukāmas tvaṃ prabravīṣi punaḥ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tava asti martu kāmaḥ tvam prabravīṣi punar punar
translated: You who are desirous of death, are repeatedly speaking.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlada said:

original: na kevalaṃ tāta mama prajānāṃ sa brahmabhūto bhavataś ca viṣṇuḥ /
analyzed: na kevalam tāta mama prajānām sa brahma bhūtaḥ bhavataḥ ca viṣṇuḥ
translated: O father, not only am I, but all the people, and you, are Vishnu, who has become Brahman.

original: dhātā vidhātā parameśvaraś ca prasīda kopaṃ kuruṣe kimartham // / / //
analyzed: dhātā vidhātā parameśvaraḥ ca prasīda kopam kuruṣe kimartham
translated: He is the creator, the ordainer, and the supreme lord. Be pleased, why do you get angry?

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /🔽praviṣṭaḥ ko 'sya hṛdayaṃ durbuddher atipāpakṛt /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca  praviṣṭaḥ kaḥ sya hṛdayam durbuddheḥ ati pāpa kṛt
translated: Hiranyakashipu said:🔽Who has entered the heart of this wicked one, the extremely sinful one,

original: yenedṛśāny asādhūni vadaty āviṣṭamānasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yena īdṛśāni asādhūni vadati āviṣṭa mānasaḥ
translated: by whom his mind is possessed and he speaks such wicked words?

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlada said:

original: na kevalaṃ maddhṛdayaṃ sa viṣṇur ākramya lokān akhilān avasthitaḥ /
analyzed: na kevalam mad hṛdayam sa viṣṇuḥ ākramya lokān akhilān avasthitaḥ
translated: Not only my heart, but Vishnu has pervaded and remains in all the worlds.

original: sa māṃ tvadādīṃś ca pitaḥ samastān samastaceṣṭāsu yunakti sarvagaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa mām tvad ādīn ca pitar samastān samasta ceṣṭāsu yunakti sarva gaḥ
translated: O father, that all-pervading one engages me, you and all others in all activities.

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca
translated: Hiranyakashipu said:

original: niṣkrāmyatām ayaṃ duṣṭaḥ śāsyatāṃ ca guror gṛhe /
analyzed: niṣkrāmyatām ayam duṣṭaḥ śāsyatām ca guroḥ gṛhe
translated: Let this wicked one be expelled and punished in the teacher's house.

original: yojito durmatiḥ kena vipakṣavitathastutau // / / //
analyzed: yojitaḥ durmatiḥ kena vipakṣa vitatha stutau
translated: By whom has this evil-minded one been engaged in praising the false of the enemies?

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity ukte sa tadā daityair nīto gurugṛhaṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: iti ukte sa tadā daityaiḥ nītaḥ guru gṛham punar
translated: When this was said by the demons, he was again taken to the teacher's house.

original: jagrāha vidyām aniśaṃ guruśuśrūṣaṇodyataḥ // / / //
analyzed: jagrāha vidyām aniśam guru śuśrūṣaṇa udyataḥ
translated: He diligently served the teacher and continuously studied the scriptures.

original: kāle 'tīte 'timahati prahlādam asureśvaraḥ /
analyzed: kāle tīte timahati prahlādam asura īśvaraḥ
translated: After a very long time had passed, the lord of the asuras

original: samāhūyābravīd gāthā kācit putraka gīyatām // / / //
analyzed: samāhūya abravīt gāthā kācid putraka gīyatām
translated: and said, Sing a song, my son.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlāda said:

original: yataḥ pradhānapuruṣau yataś caitac carācaram /
analyzed: yatas pradhāna puruṣau yatas ca etat carācaram
translated: From whom the Primordial Nature and the Puruṣa, and this moving and unmoving (universe) have originated,

original: kāraṇaṃ sakalasyāsya sa no viṣṇuḥ prasīdatu // / / //
analyzed: kāraṇam sakalasya asya sa naḥ viṣṇuḥ prasīdatu
translated: may that Viṣṇu be pleased with us, who is the cause of all this.

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca
translated: Hiraṇyakaśipu said:

original: durātmā vadhyatām eṣa nānenārtho 'sti jīvatā /
analyzed: durātmā vadhyatām eṣa na anena arthaḥ sti jīvatā
translated: Kill this wicked one. We have no use for him alive.

original: svapakṣahānikartṛtvād yaḥ kulāṅgāratāṃ gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: sva pakṣa hāni kartṛ tvāt yaḥ kulāṅgāra tām gataḥ
translated: He has become a disgrace to the family, because he causes harm to our own side.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parāśara said:

original: ity ājñaptās tatas tena pragṛhītamahāyudhāḥ /
analyzed: iti ājñaptāḥ tatas tena pragṛhīta mahā āyudhāḥ
translated: Thus commanded by him, the demons, taking up great weapons,

original: udyatās tasya nāśāya daityāḥ śatasahasraśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: udyatāḥ tasya nāśāya daityāḥ śata sahasraśas
translated: rose up to destroy him in hundreds and thousands.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlāda said:

original: viṣṇuḥ śastreṣu yuṣmāsu mayi cāsau yathā sthitaḥ /
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ śastreṣu yuṣmāsu mayi ca asau yathā sthitaḥ
translated: As Viṣṇu is present in the weapons and in me,

original: daiteyās tena satyena mā krāmantv āyudhāni vaḥ // / / //
analyzed: daiteyāḥ tena satyena mā krāmantu āyudhāni vaḥ
translated: by that truth, O sons of Diti, may your weapons not touch him.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parāśara said:

original: tatas taiḥ śataśo daityaiḥ śastraughair āhato 'pi san /
analyzed: tatas taiḥ śataśas daityaiḥ śastra oghaiḥ san
translated: Then, although struck by hundreds of demons with showers of weapons,

original: nāvāpa vedanām alpām abhūc caiva punar navaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na avāpa vedanām alpām abhūt ca eva punar navaḥ
translated: he felt not the slightest pain and became fresh again.

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca
translated: Hiraṇyakaśipu said:

original: durbuddhe vinivartasva vairipakṣastavād ataḥ /
analyzed: durbuddhe vinivartasva vairi pakṣa stavāt atas
translated: O foolish one, desist from this, for you are now on the side of your enemies.

original: abhayaṃ te prayacchāmi mātimūḍhamatir bhava // / / //
analyzed: abhayam te prayacchāmi mā ati mūḍha matiḥ bhava
translated: I grant you immunity. Do not be excessively deluded.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlāda said:

original: bhayaṃ bhayānām apahāriṇi sthite manasy anante mama kutra tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: bhayam bhayānām apahāriṇi sthite manasi anante mama kutra tiṣṭhati
translated: When the infinite one, the remover of all fears, resides in my mind, where can my fear remain?

original: yasmin smṛte janmajarāntakādi bhayāni sarvāṇy apayānti tāta // / / //
analyzed: yasmin smṛte janma jarā antaka ādi bhayāni sarvāṇi apayānti tāta
translated: O father, when he is remembered, all fears like birth, old age, death, etc. disappear.

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca
translated: Hiraṇyakaśipu said:

original: bho bhoḥ sarpāḥ durācāram enam atyantadurmatim /
analyzed: bho bhoḥ sarpāḥ durācāram enam atyanta durmatim
translated: O serpents, this extremely wicked and evil-minded one,

original: viṣajvālāvilair vaktraiḥ sadyo nayata saṃkṣayam // / / //
analyzed: viṣa jvālā āvilaiḥ vaktraiḥ sadyas nayata saṃkṣayam
translated: quickly destroy him with your mouths filled with the flames of poison.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parāśara said:

original: ity uktās tena te sarpāḥ kuhakās takṣakādayaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktāḥ tena te sarpāḥ kuhakāḥ takṣaka ādayaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by him, those serpents Kuhaka, Takṣaka and others,

original: adaṃśanta samasteṣu gātreṣv ativiṣolbaṇāḥ // / / //
analyzed: adaṃśanta samasteṣu gātreṣu ati viṣa ulbaṇāḥ
translated: bit him all over his body with their extremely poisonous fangs.

original: sa tv āsaktamatiḥ kṛṣṇe daṃśyamāno mahoragaiḥ /
analyzed: sa tu āsakta matiḥ kṛṣṇe daṃśyamānaḥ mahā uragaiḥ
translated: But he, with his mind attached to Kṛṣṇa, being bitten by the great serpents,

original: na vivedātmano gātraṃ tatsmṛtyāhlādasaṃsthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na viveda ātmanaḥ gātram tad smṛtyā āhlāda saṃsthitaḥ
translated: did not feel his body, remaining delighted by the recollection of him.

original: sarpā ūcuḥ /
analyzed: sarpāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The serpents said:

original: daṃṣṭrā viśīrṇā maṇayaḥ sphuṭanti phaṇeṣu tāpo hṛdayeṣu kampaḥ /
analyzed: daṃṣṭrāḥ viśīrṇāḥ maṇayaḥ sphuṭanti phaṇeṣu tāpaḥ hṛdayeṣu kampaḥ
translated: Our fangs are broken, the gems are shattered, there is heat in the hoods and trembling in the hearts,

original: nāsya tvacaḥ svalpam apīha bhinnaṃ praśādhi daityeśvara karma cānyat // / / //
analyzed: na asya tvacaḥ su alpam api iha bhinnam praśādhi daitya īśvara karma ca anyat
translated: Not even a small part of his skin is broken. O lord of demons, direct him to do some other work.

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /🔽he diggajāḥ saṃkaṭadantamiśrā ghnatainam asmadripupakṣabhinnam /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca  he diggajāḥ saṃkaṭa danta miśrāḥ ghnata enam asmad ripu pakṣa bhinnam
translated: Hiraṇyakaśipu said:🔽O elephants of the directions, you who are mixed with sharp tusks, kill him who is on the side of our enemies.

original: tajjā vināśāya bhavanti tasya yathāraṇeḥ prajvalito hutāśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tad jāḥ vināśāya bhavanti tasya yathā araṇeḥ prajvalitaḥ hutāśaḥ
translated: They are born for his destruction, like a blazing fire for a forest.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽tataḥ sa diggajair bālo bhūbhṛcchikharasaṃnibhaiḥ /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  tatas sa diggajaiḥ bālaḥ bhūbhṛt śikhara saṃnibhaiḥ
translated: Parashara said:

original: pātito dharaṇīpṛṣṭhe viṣāṇair apy apīḍyata // / / //🔽smaratas tasya govindam ibhadantāḥ sahasraśaḥ /
analyzed: pātitaḥ dharaṇī pṛṣṭhe viṣāṇaiḥ api apīḍyata  smarataḥ tasya govindam ibha dantāḥ sahasraśas
translated: Then the child was thrown down on the ground by the elephants of the directions, which were like the peaks of mountains, and was also afflicted by their tusks.

original: śīrṇā vakṣaḥsthalaṃ prāpya sa prāha pitaraṃ tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: śīrṇā vakṣaḥ sthalam prāpya sa prāha pitaram tatas
translated: While he was remembering Govinda, thousands of the tusks of the elephants were shattered, reaching his chest. Then he said to his father.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlada said:

original: dantā gajānāṃ kuliśāgraniṣṭhurāḥ śīrṇā yad ete na balaṃ mamaitat /
analyzed: dantāḥ gajānām kuliśa agra niṣṭhurāḥ śīrṇāḥ yat ete na balam mama etat
translated: The tusks of the elephants, which are as sharp as the tips of thunderbolts, are shattered. This is not my strength.

original: mahāvipatpāpavināśano 'yaṃ janārdanānusmaraṇānubhāvaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mahā vipad pāpa vināśanaḥ yam janārdana anusmaraṇa anubhāvaḥ
translated: This is the power of remembering Janardana, which destroys great calamities and sins.

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca
translated: Hiraṇyakaśipu said:

original: jvālyatām asurā vahnir apasarpata diggajāḥ /
analyzed: jvālyatām asurāḥ vahniḥ apasarpata diggajāḥ
translated: Let the fire be kindled, O demons, let the elephants of the directions move away.

original: vāyo samedhayāgniṃ tvaṃ dahyatām eṣa pāpakṛt // / / //
analyzed: vāyo samedhaya agnim tvam dahyatām eṣa pāpa kṛt
translated: O Vayu, kindle the fire and let this sinner be burnt.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: mahākāṣṭhacayacchannam asurendrasutaṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: mahā kāṣṭha caya channam asura indra sutam tatas
translated: Then, the sons of the lord of demons, covered with a heap of large logs,

original: prajvālya dānavā vahniṃ dadahuḥ svāmicoditāḥ // / / //
analyzed: prajvālya dānavāḥ vahnim dadahuḥ svāmi coditāḥ
translated: the demons, commanded by their lord, set fire to the fire and burned him.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlada said:

original: tātaiṣa vahniḥ pavanerito 'pi na māṃ dahaty atra samantato 'ham /
analyzed: tāta eṣa vahniḥ pavana īritaḥ na mām dahati atra samantataḥ ham
translated: Father, this fire, even when blown by the wind, does not burn me here on all sides.

original: paśyāmi padmāstaraṇāstṛtāni śītāni sarvāṇi diśāṃ mukhāni // / / //🔽ins /🔽trailokyam etat sacarācaraṃ yad viṣṇuṃ vijiṣṇuṃ prabhaviṣṇum īḍyaṃ /
analyzed: paśyāmi padma āstaraṇa āstṛtāni śītāni sarvāṇi diśām mukhāni  ins  trailokyam etat sa carācaram yat viṣṇum vijiṣṇum prabhaviṣṇum īḍyam
translated: I see all the faces of the directions covered with cool lotus cushions.🔽(Here is the Sanskrit text with the alignment and English translations updated to match the Sanskrit:)🔽I always praise Vishnu, the all-pervading, the victorious, the powerful, the worthy of worship,

original: alaṃ kariṣṇuṃ tv asahiṣṇum itthaṃ sthāṇuṃ sadā staumi sadā sadaiva // / / //
analyzed: alam kariṣṇum tu a sahiṣṇum ittham sthāṇum sadā staumi sadā sadā eva
translated: the one who can do anything, the intolerant, the immovable, always and forever.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: atha daityeśvaraṃ procur bhārgavasyātmajā dvijāḥ /
analyzed: atha daitya īśvaram procuḥ bhārgavasya ātmajāḥ dvijāḥ
translated: Then the twice-born sons of Bhrigu, the high-souled priests,

original: purohitā mahātmānaḥ sāmnā saṃstūya vāgminaḥ // / / //
analyzed: purohitāḥ mahātmānaḥ sāmnā saṃstūya vāgminaḥ
translated: the eloquent ones, having praised with soothing words, spoke to the lord of demons.

original: purohitā ūcuḥ /
analyzed: purohitāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The priests said:

original: rājan niyamyatāṃ kopo bāle 'tra tanaye nije /
analyzed: rājan niyamyatām kopaḥ bāle tanaye nije
translated: O king, restrain your anger towards this young son of yours,

original: kopo devanikāyeṣu tatra te saphalo yataḥ // / / //
analyzed: kopaḥ devanikāyeṣu tatra te saphalaḥ yatas
translated: for your anger towards the hosts of gods will be fruitful there.

original: ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: e t veṅk ins
translated: (Here is the Sanskrit text with the alignment and English translations updated to match the Sanskrit:)

original: tataḥ purohitair ukto hiraṇyakaśipuḥ svakaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas purohitaiḥ uktaḥ hiraṇyakaśipuḥ svakaiḥ
translated: Then the priests of his own said to Hiraṇyakaśipu:

original: tathā tathainaṃ bālaṃ te śāsitāro vayaṃ nṛpa /
analyzed: tathā tathā enam bālam te śāsitāraḥ vayam nṛpa
translated: O king, we shall so instruct this child

original: yathā vipakṣanāśāya vinītas te bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: yathā vipakṣa nāśāya vinītaḥ te bhaviṣyati
translated: that he will be well-disciplined for the destruction of his adversaries.

original: bālatvaṃ sarvadoṣāṇāṃ daityarājāspadaṃ yataḥ /
analyzed: bāla tvam sarva doṣāṇām daitya rāja āspadam yatas
translated: Since childhood is the abode of all faults, O king of the demons,

original: tato 'tra kopam atyarthaṃ yoktum arhasi nārbhake // / / //
analyzed: tatas tra kopam atyartham yoktum arhasi na arbhake
translated: therefore you should not be excessively angry with the child.

original: na tyakṣyati hareḥ pakṣam asmākaṃ vacanād yadi /
analyzed: na tyakṣyati hareḥ pakṣam asmākam vacanāt yadi
translated: If he does not abandon devotion to Hari even at our words,

original: tataḥ kṛtyāṃ vadhāyāsya kariṣyāmo 'nivartinīm // / / //
analyzed: tatas kṛtyām vadhāya asya kariṣyāmaḥ nivartinīm
translated: then we shall perform an unfailing rite for his destruction.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: evam abhyarthitas tais tu daityarājaḥ purohitaiḥ /
analyzed: evam abhyarthitaḥ taiḥ tu daitya rājaḥ purohitaiḥ
translated: Thus requested by the priests, the demon king

original: daityair niṣkrāmayām āsa putraṃ pāvakasaṃcayāt // / / //
analyzed: daityaiḥ niṣkrāmayām āsa putram pāvaka saṃcayāt
translated: had his son taken out of the heap of fire by the demons.

original: tato gurugṛhe bālaḥ sa vasan bāladānavān /
analyzed: tatas guru gṛhe bālaḥ sa vasan bāla dānavān
translated: Then the child, dwelling in the house of his preceptor,

original: adhyāpayām āsa muhur upadeśāntare guroḥ // / / //
analyzed: adhyāpayām āsa muhur upadeśa antare guroḥ
translated: often taught the young demons, while the preceptor was engaged elsewhere.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlada said:

original: śrūyatāṃ paramārtho me daiteyā ditijātmajāḥ /
analyzed: śrūyatām parama arthaḥ me daiteyāḥ ditija ātmajāḥ
translated: Listen to my ultimate truth, O demons, sons of Diti.

original: na cānyathaitan mantavyaṃ nātra lobhādikāraṇam // / / //
analyzed: na ca anyathā etat mantavyam na atra lobha ādi kāraṇam
translated: This should not be thought otherwise, nor is greed the cause here.

original: janma bālyaṃ tataḥ sarvo jantuḥ prāpnoti yauvanam /
analyzed: janma bālyam tatas sarvaḥ jantuḥ prāpnoti yauvanam
translated: Birth, childhood, then all beings attain youth,

original: avyāhataiva bhavati tato 'nudivasaṃ jarā // / / //
analyzed: avyāhatā eva bhavati tatas nu divasam jarā
translated: and then old age comes upon them day by day, without fail.

original: tataś ca mṛtyum abhyeti jantur daityeśvarātmajāḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca mṛtyum abhyeti jantuḥ daitya īśvara ātmajāḥ
translated: And then the being goes to death, O daughters of the lord of demons.

original: pratyakṣaṃ dṛśyate caitad asmākaṃ bhavatāṃ tathā // / / //
analyzed: pratyakṣam dṛśyate ca etat asmākam bhavatām tathā
translated: This is seen directly by us and by you,

original: mṛtasya ca punar janma bhavaty etac ca nānyathā /
analyzed: mṛtasya ca punar janma bhavati etat ca na anyathā
translated: and the rebirth of the dead takes place, and this is not otherwise.

original: āgamo 'yaṃ tathā tac ca nopādānaṃ vinodbhavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: āgamaḥ yam tathā tat ca na upādānam vinā udbhavaḥ
translated: This is the scripture, and that does not arise without a cause,

original: garbhavāsādi yāvat tu punarjanmopapādanam /
analyzed: garbha vāsa ādi yāvat tu punarjanma upapādanam
translated: as long as the production of rebirth from the womb and so on,

original: samastāvasthakaṃ tāvad duḥkham evāvagamyatām // / / //
analyzed: samasta avasthakam tāvat duḥkham evā avagamyatām
translated: as long as the entire state is understood to be nothing but suffering.

original: kṣuttṛṣṇopaśamaṃ tadvac śītādyupaśamaṃ sukham /
analyzed: kṣudh tṛṣṇā upaśamam tadvat śīta ādi upaśamam sukham
translated: Similarly, the alleviation of hunger and thirst, and the alleviation of cold and so on, is considered happiness,

original: manyate bālabuddhitvād duḥkham eva hi tat punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: manyate bāla buddhi tvāt duḥkham eva hi tat punar
translated: but that is suffering again, due to the childishness of the mind.

original: atyantastimitāṅgānāṃ vyāyāmena sukhaiṣiṇām /
analyzed: atyanta stimita aṅgānām vyāyāmena sukha eṣiṇām
translated: For those whose limbs are completely numb, who seek happiness through exertion,

original: bhrāntijñānavatāṃ puṃsāṃ prahāro 'pi sukhāyate // / / //🔽kva śarīram aśeṣāṇāṃ śleṣmādīnāṃ mahācayaḥ /
analyzed: bhrānti jñānavatām puṃsām prahāraḥ sukhāyate  kva śarīram aśeṣāṇām śleṣma ādīnām mahā cayaḥ
translated: and who have erroneous knowledge, even a blow becomes a source of happiness.🔽Where is the body, the great collection of phlegm and other humors,

original: kva cāṅgaśobhāsaurabhyakamanīyādayo guṇāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kva ca aṅga śobhā saurabhya kamanīya ādayaḥ guṇāḥ
translated: and where are the qualities such as beauty, fragrance, and charm of the limbs?

original: māṃsāsṛkpūyaviṇmūtrasnāyumajjāsthisaṃhatau /
analyzed: māṃsa asṛj pūya viṣ mūtra snāyu majja asthi saṃhatau
translated: If a fool is pleased with the body, which is a collection of flesh, blood, pus, feces, urine, sinews, marrow and bones,

original: dehe cet prītimān mūḍho bhavitā narake 'pi saḥ // / / //🔽agneḥ śītena toyasya tṛṣā bhaktasya ca kṣudhā /
analyzed: dehe ced prītimān mūḍhaḥ bhavitā narake saḥ  agneḥ śītena toyasya tṛṣā bhaktasya ca kṣudhā
translated: he will be pleased even in hell.🔽Cold is made to do the work of pleasure by fire, thirst by water, and hunger by food,

original: kriyate sukhakartṛtvaṃ tadvilomasya cetaraiḥ // / / //
analyzed: kriyate sukha kartṛ tvam tad vilomasya ca itaraiḥ
translated: and the opposite of these by the others.

original: karoti he daityaputrā yāvanmātraṃ parigraham /
analyzed: karoti he daitya putrāḥ yāvat mātram parigraham
translated: O son of a demon, he who makes as many possessions,

original: tāvanmātraṃ sa evāsya duḥkhaṃ cetasi yacchati // / / //
analyzed: tāvat mātram saḥ eva asya duḥkham cetasi yacchati
translated: he alone puts that much sorrow in his mind.

original: yāvataḥ kurute jantuḥ saṃbandhān manasaḥ priyān /
analyzed: yāvataḥ kurute jantuḥ saṃbandhān manasaḥ priyān
translated: As many connections as a creature makes with things dear to the mind,

original: tāvanto 'sya nikhanyante hṛdaye śokaśaṅkavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tāvantaḥ sya nikhanyante hṛdaye śoka śaṅkavaḥ
translated: so many darts of sorrow are planted in his heart.

original: yad yad gṛhe tan manasi yatra tatrāvatiṣṭhataḥ /
analyzed: yat yat gṛhe tat manasi yatra tatra avatiṣṭhataḥ
translated: Whatever is in the house, that is in the mind of one who abides anywhere.

original: nāśadāhāpaharaṇaṃ kutas tatraiva tiṣṭhati // / / //
analyzed: nāśa dāha apaharaṇam kutas tatra eva tiṣṭhati
translated: How can it remain there itself, when there is destruction, burning and carrying away?

original: janmany atra mahad duḥkhaṃ mriyamāṇasya cāpi tat /
analyzed: janmani atra mahat duḥkham mriyamāṇasya ca api tat
translated: There is great sorrow in this birth, and also in dying,

original: yātanāsu yamasyograṃ garbhasaṃkramaṇeṣu ca // / / //
analyzed: yātanāsu yamasya ugram garbha saṃkramaṇeṣu ca
translated: and in the terrible torments of Yama, and in passing through the womb.

original: garbhe ca sukhaleśo 'pi bhavadbhir anumīyate /
analyzed: garbhe ca sukha leśaḥ bhavadbhiḥ anumīyate
translated: Even a little pleasure in the womb is inferred by you all.

original: yadi tat kathyatām evaṃ sarvaṃ duḥkhamayaṃ jagat // / / //
analyzed: yadi tat kathyatām evam sarvam duḥkha mayam jagat
translated: If so, then tell me how this entire world is full of suffering.

original: tad etad atiduḥkhānām āspade 'tra bhavārṇave /
analyzed: tat etat ati duḥkhānām āspade bhava arṇave
translated: In this ocean of worldly existence, which is a abode of great miseries,

original: bhavatāṃ kathyate satyaṃ viṣṇur ekaḥ parāyaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhavatām kathyate satyam viṣṇuḥ ekaḥ parāyaṇaḥ
translated: it is truthfully said that Viṣṇu alone is the ultimate refuge for you all.

original: mā jānīta vayaṃ bālā dehī deheṣu śāśvataḥ /
analyzed: mā jānīta vayam bālāḥ dehī deheṣu śāśvataḥ
translated: Do not consider us as children. The soul is eternal in the bodies of embodied beings.

original: jarāyauvanajanmādyā dharmā dehasya nātmanaḥ // / / //🔽bālo 'haṃ tāvad icchāto yatiṣye śreyase yuvā /
analyzed: jarā yauvana janma ādyāḥ dharmāḥ dehasya na ātmanaḥ  bālaḥ ham tāvat icchātaḥ yatiṣye śreyase yuvā
translated: Old age, youth, birth, etc. are qualities of the body, not of the soul.🔽As long as I am a child, I will strive for the highest good out of desire. When I am young,

original: yuvāhaṃ vārddhake prāpte kariṣyāmy ātmano hitam // / / //
analyzed: yuvā aham vārddhake prāpte kariṣyāmi ātmanaḥ hitam
translated: I will do what is beneficial for myself when I reach old age.

original: vṛddho 'haṃ mama kāryāṇi samastāni na gocare /
analyzed: vṛddhaḥ ham mama kāryāṇi samastāni na gocare
translated: I am old, and all my duties are beyond my reach.

original: kiṃ kariṣyāmi mandātmā samarthena na yat kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: kim kariṣyāmi manda ātmā samarthena na yat kṛtam
translated: What will I do, O evil-minded one, that was not done by one who was capable?

original: evaṃ durāśayākṣiptamānasaḥ puruṣaḥ sadā /
analyzed: evam durāśayā ākṣipta mānasaḥ puruṣaḥ sadā
translated: Thus, a person whose mind is always captivated by such bad desires,

original: śreyaso 'bhimukhaṃ yāti na kadācit pipāsitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śreyasaḥ abhimukham yāti na kadācid pipāsitaḥ
translated: never goes towards the highest good, as if he were thirsty.

original: bālye krīḍanakāsaktā yauvane viṣayonmukhāḥ /
analyzed: bālye krīḍanaka āsaktāḥ yauvane viṣaya unmukhāḥ
translated: In childhood, they are engrossed in play; in youth, they are inclined towards sensual objects.

original: ajñānayanty aśaktyā ca vārddhakaṃ samupasthitam // / / //
analyzed: ajñānayanti aśaktyā ca vārddhakam samupasthitam
translated: They spend their old age in ignorance and incapacity.

original: tasmād bālye vivekātmā yateta śreyase sadā /
analyzed: tasmāt bālye viveka ātmā yateta śreyase sadā
translated: Therefore, in childhood, one should always strive for the highest good with a discriminating soul,

original: bālyayauvanavṛddhādyair dehabhāvair asaṃyutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bālya yauvana vṛddha ādyaiḥ deha bhāvaiḥ a saṃyutaḥ
translated: unconnected with the bodily states of childhood, youth, old age, etc.

original: tad etad vo mayākhyātaṃ yadi jānīta nānṛtam /
analyzed: tat etat vaḥ mayā ākhyātam yadi jānīta na anṛtam
translated: I have told you this, if you know it to be not false.

original: tad asmatprītaye viṣṇuḥ smaryatāṃ bandhamuktidaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat asmad prītaye viṣṇuḥ smaryatām bandha mukti daḥ
translated: Therefore, for our pleasure, may Vishnu, the giver of liberation from bondage, be remembered.

original: āyāsaḥ smaraṇe ko 'sya smṛto yacchati śobhanam /
analyzed: āyāsaḥ smaraṇe kaḥ sya smṛtaḥ yacchati śobhanam
translated: What effort is there in remembering him? He who is remembered grants what is good.

original: pāpakṣayaś ca bhavati smaratāṃ tam aharniśam // / / //
analyzed: pāpa kṣayaḥ ca bhavati smaratām tam aharniśam
translated: And for those who remember him day and night, there is destruction of sins.

original: sarvabhūtasthite tasmin matir maitrī divāniśam /
analyzed: sarva bhūta sthite tasmin matiḥ maitrī divāniśam
translated: May you have a friendly attitude day and night towards him who abides in all beings.

original: bhavatāṃ jāyatām evaṃ sarvakleśān prahāsyatha // / / //
analyzed: bhavatām jāyatām evam sarva kleśān prahāsyatha
translated: In this way, you will abandon all afflictions.

original: tāpatrayeṇābhihataṃ yad etad akhilaṃ jagat /
analyzed: tāpa trayeṇa abhihatam yat etat akhilam jagat
translated: This entire world is afflicted by the three kinds of distress.

original: tadā śocyeṣu bhūteṣu dveṣaṃ prājñaḥ karoti kaḥ // / / //🔽atha bhadrāṇi bhūtāni hīnaśaktir ahaṃ param /
analyzed: tadā śocyeṣu bhūteṣu dveṣam prājñaḥ karoti kaḥ  atha bhadrāṇi bhūtāni hīna śaktiḥ aham param
translated: Then, what wise person would feel hatred towards beings who are to be pitied?

original: mudaṃ tathāpi kurvīta hānir dveṣaphalaṃ yataḥ // / / //🔽baddhavairāṇi bhūtāni dveṣaṃ kurvanti cet tataḥ /
analyzed: mudam tathā api kurvīta hāniḥ dveṣa phalam yatas  baddhavairāṇi bhūtāni dveṣam kurvanti ced tatas
translated: If noble beings are superior to me in power, then even so, one should feel joy, because hatred is the fruit of loss.

original: śocyāny aho 'timohena vyāptānīti manīṣiṇām // / / //
analyzed: śocyāni aho ti mohena vyāptāni iti manīṣiṇām
translated: If beings who have formed enmity feel hatred, then they are to be pitied, as they are overwhelmed by extreme delusion, according to the wise.

original: ete bhinnadṛśāṃ daityā vikalpāḥ kathitā mayā /
analyzed: ete bhinnadṛśām daityāḥ vikalpāḥ kathitāḥ mayā
translated: These are the alternatives of the demons who have a different view, as explained by me.

original: kṛtvābhyupagamaṃ tatra saṃkṣepaḥ śrūyatāṃ mama // / / //
analyzed: kṛtvā abhyupagamam tatra saṃkṣepaḥ śrūyatām mama
translated: Having accepted that, may my summary be heard.

original: vistāraḥ sarvabhūtasya viṣṇor viśvam idaṃ jagat /
analyzed: vistāraḥ sarva bhūtasya viṣṇoḥ viśvam idam jagat
translated: The entire universe is the expansion of Vishnu, the soul of all beings.

original: draṣṭavyam ātmavat tasmād abhedena vicakṣaṇaiḥ // / / //🔽samutsṛjyāsuraṃ bhāvaṃ tasmād yūyaṃ yathā vayam /
analyzed: draṣṭavyam ātma vat tasmāt abhedena vicakṣaṇaiḥ  samutsṛjya āsuram bhāvam tasmāt yūyam yathā vayam
translated: Therefore, the wise should see it as non-different from the Self.

original: tathā yatnaṃ kariṣyāmo yathā prāpsyāma nirvṛtim // / / //
analyzed: tathā yatnam kariṣyāmaḥ yathā prāpsyāma nirvṛtim
translated: Therefore, you should give up your demoniacal nature and strive in such a way that we may attain liberation.

original: naivāgninā na cārkeṇa nendunā na ca vāyunā /
analyzed: na eva agninā na ca arkeṇa na indunā na ca vāyunā
translated: Neither by fire, nor by the sun, nor by the moon, nor by the wind,

original: parjanyavaruṇābhyāṃ vā na siddhair na ca rākṣasaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: parjanya varuṇābhyām vā na siddhaiḥ na ca rākṣasaiḥ
translated: nor by Parjanya (rain) and Varuna, nor by the Siddhas, nor by the Rakshasas,

original: na yakṣair na ca daityendrair noragair na ca kiṃnaraiḥ /
analyzed: na yakṣaiḥ na ca daitya indraiḥ na uragaiḥ na ca kiṃnaraiḥ
translated: nor by the Yakshas, nor by the kings of the Daityas, nor by the Uragas (serpents), nor by the Kinnaras,

original: na manuṣyair na paśubhir doṣair naivātmasaṃbhavaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: na manuṣyaiḥ na paśubhiḥ doṣaiḥ na eva ātma saṃbhavaiḥ
translated: nor by men, nor by animals, nor by faults arising from one's own self,

original: jvarākṣirogātīsāraplīhagulmādikais tathā /
analyzed: jvara akṣi roga atīsāra plīha gulma ādikaiḥ tathā
translated: nor by fever, eye diseases, dysentery, spleen, abdominal tumors, and so on,

original: dveṣerṣyāmatsarādyair vā rāgalobhādibhiḥ kṣayam // / / //
analyzed: dveṣa īrṣyā matsara ādyaiḥ vā rāga lobha ādibhiḥ kṣayam
translated: nor by hatred, envy, greed, and so on, nor by attachment, greed, and so on, does it perish.

original: na cānyair nīyate kaiścin nityā yātyantanirmalā /
analyzed: na ca anyaiḥ nīyate kaiścid nityā yā atyanta nirmalā
translated: It is not taken away by anyone else, it is eternal and extremely pure.

original: tām āpnoty amale nyasya keśave hṛdayaṃ naraḥ // / / //
analyzed: tām āpnoti amale nyasya keśave hṛdayam naraḥ
translated: A man attains it by placing his heart in the pure Keshava.

original: asārasaṃsāravivartaneṣu mā yāta toṣaṃ prasabhaṃ bravīmi /
analyzed: asāra saṃsāra vivartaneṣu mā yāta toṣam prasabham bravīmi
translated: Do not take delight in the worthless wanderings of worldly life, I say forcefully.

original: sarvatra daityāḥ samatām upeta samatvam ārādhanam acyutasya // / / //
analyzed: sarvatra daityāḥ samatām upeta samatvam ārādhanam acyutasya
translated: The worship of Achyuta is the same everywhere.

original: tasmin prasanne kim ihāsty alabhyaṃ dharmārthakāmair alam alpakās te /
analyzed: tasmin prasanne kim iha asti alabhyam dharma artha kāmaiḥ alam alpakāḥ te
translated: When he is pleased, what is there that cannot be obtained? Dharma, Artha, and Kama are insignificant.

original: samāśritād brahmataror anantān niḥsaṃśayaṃ prāpsyatha vai mahat phalam // / / //
analyzed: samāśritāt brahma taroḥ anantāt niḥsaṃśayam prāpsyatha vai mahat phalam
translated: By resorting to the infinite tree of Brahman, you will undoubtedly attain great fruits.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe prathame 'ṃśe saptadaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe prathame ṃśe saptadaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the seventeenth chapter in the first section of the Visnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tasyaitāṃ dānavāś ceṣṭāṃ dṛṣṭvā daityapater bhayāt /
analyzed: tasya etām dānavāḥ ceṣṭām dṛṣṭvā daitya pateḥ bhayāt
translated: Seeing this behavior of their lord, the demons, out of fear of the king of demons,

original: ācacakṣuḥ sa covāca sūdān āhūya satvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: ācacakṣuḥ sa ca uvāca sūdān āhūya sa tvaraḥ
translated: quickly summoned the cooks and said:

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca
translated: Hiranyakashipu said:

original: he sūdā mama putro 'sāv anyeṣām api durmatiḥ /
analyzed: he sūdāḥ mama saḥ anyeṣām api durmatiḥ
translated: O cooks, this son of mine, wicked towards others,

original: kumārgadeśiko duṣṭo hanyatām avilambitam // / / //
analyzed: ku mārga deśikaḥ duṣṭaḥ hanyatām avilambitam
translated: is a teacher of wrong paths. Let him be killed without delay.

original: hālāhalaṃ viṣaṃ tasya sarvabhakṣyeṣu dīyatām /
analyzed: hālāhalam viṣam tasya sarva bhakṣyeṣu dīyatām
translated: Put deadly poison in all his food.

original: avijñātam asau pāpo vadhyatāṃ mā vicāryatām // / / //
analyzed: a vijñātam asau pāpaḥ vadhyatām mā vicāryatām
translated: Let that sinful one be killed without being recognized. Do not hesitate.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: te tathaiva tataś cakruḥ prahlādāya mahātmane /
analyzed: te tathā eva tatas cakruḥ prahlādāya mahātmane
translated: They did just that to the great soul Prahlada.

original: viṣadānaṃ yathājñaptaṃ pitrā tasya mahātmanaḥ // / / //🔽hālāhalaṃ viṣaṃ ghoram anantoccāraṇena saḥ /
analyzed: viṣa dānam yathā ājñaptam pitrā tasya mahātmanaḥ  hālāhalam viṣam ghoram ananta uccāraṇena saḥ
translated: as instructed by his father, the great soul.

original: abhimantrya sahānnena maitreya bubhuje tadā // / / //
analyzed: abhimantrya saha annena maitreya bubhuje tadā
translated: The endless recitation of the mantra, O Maitreya, he enchanted the terrible poison halahala and then ate it with food.

original: avikāraṃ sa tad bhuktvā prahlādaḥ svasthamānasaḥ /
analyzed: avikāram sa tat bhuktvā prahlādaḥ svastha mānasaḥ
translated: Having eaten it without any change, Prahlada, with a composed mind,

original: anantakhyātinirvīryaṃ jarayām āsa durviṣam // / / //
analyzed: ananta khyāti nirvīryam āsa durviṣam
translated: digested the difficult-to-digest poison, which was ineffective due to the fame of the endless one.

original: tataḥ sūdā bhayatrastā jīrṇaṃ dṛṣṭvā mahāviṣam /
analyzed: tatas sūdāḥ bhaya trastāḥ jīrṇam dṛṣṭvā mahā viṣam
translated: Then the cooks, frightened, seeing the great poison digested,

original: daityeśvaram upāgamya praṇipatyedam abruvan // / / //
analyzed: daitya īśvaram upāgamya praṇipatya idam abruvan
translated: approached the lord of the demons, bowed down and said this:

original: sūdā ūcuḥ /
analyzed: sūdāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The cooks said:

original: daityarāja viṣaṃ dattam asmābhir atibhīṣaṇam /
analyzed: daitya rāja viṣam dattam asmābhiḥ ati bhīṣaṇam
translated: O king of demons, we gave him extremely terrible poison.

original: jīrṇaṃ tac ca sahānnena prahlādena sutena te // / / //
analyzed: jīrṇam tat ca saha annena prahlādena sutena te
translated: But your son Prahlada digested it with food.

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca
translated: Hiranyakashipu said:

original: tvaryatāṃ tvaryatāṃ sadyo he he daityapurohitāḥ /
analyzed: tvaryatām tvaryatām sadyas he he daitya purohitāḥ
translated: Hurry, hurry, immediately, O priests of the demons,

original: kṛtyāṃ tasya vināśāya utpādayata mā ciram // / / //
analyzed: kṛtyām tasya vināśāya utpādayata mā ciram
translated: create a spell for his destruction, do not delay.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽sakāśam āgamya tataḥ prahlādasya purohitāḥ /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  sakāśam āgamya tatas prahlādasya purohitāḥ
translated: Parashara said:🔽Then the priests, having approached Prahlada,

original: sāmapūrvam athocus te prahlādaṃ vinayānvitam // / / //
analyzed: sāma pūrvam athā ūcuḥ te prahlādam vinaya anvitam
translated: spoke to Prahlada, who was endowed with humility, first with conciliation:

original: purohitā ūcuḥ /
analyzed: purohitāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The priests said:

original: jātas trailokyavikhyāta āyuṣman brahmaṇaḥ kule /
analyzed: jātaḥ trailokya vikhyātaḥ āyuṣman brahmaṇaḥ kule
translated: O long-lived one, you were born in the family of Brahma, renowned in the three worlds.

original: daityarājasya tanayo hiraṇyakaśipor bhavān // / / //
analyzed: daitya rājasya tanayaḥ hiraṇyakaśipoḥ bhavān
translated: You are the son of Hiranyakashipu, the king of the demons.

original: kiṃ daivaiḥ kim anantena kim anyena tavāśrayaḥ /
analyzed: kim daivaiḥ kim anantena kim anyena tava āśrayaḥ
translated: What need have you of the gods, of Vishnu, or of anyone else? You are self-sufficient.

original: pitā samastalokānāṃ tvaṃ tathaiva bhaviṣyasi // / / //
analyzed: pitā samasta lokānām tvam tathā eva bhaviṣyasi
translated: You will become the father of all the worlds, just as he is.

original: tasmāt parityajaināṃ tvaṃ vipakṣastavasaṃhitām /
analyzed: tasmāt parityaja enām tvam vipakṣaḥ tava saṃhitām
translated: Therefore, abandon this attitude of hostility towards him.

original: vācyaḥ pitā samastānāṃ gurūṇāṃ paramo guruḥ // / / //
analyzed: vācyaḥ pitā samastānām gurūṇām paramaḥ guruḥ
translated: The father is the supreme guru of all gurus.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlada said:

original: evam etan mahābhāgāḥ ślāghyam etan mahākulam /
analyzed: evam etat mahābhāgāḥ ślāghyam etat mahā kulam
translated: This is true, O illustrious ones, this great family is indeed praiseworthy.

original: marīceḥ sakale 'py asmin trailokye nānyathā vadet // / / //
analyzed: marīceḥ sakale pi asmin trailokye na anyathā vadet
translated: In the entire three worlds, one should not speak otherwise of Marichi.

original: pitā ca mama sarvasmiñ jagaty utkṛṣṭaceṣṭitaḥ /
analyzed: pitā ca mama sarvasmin jagati utkṛṣṭa ceṣṭitaḥ
translated: And my father is the most exalted of all beings in the universe.

original: etad apy avagacchāmi satyam atrāpi nānṛtam // / / //
analyzed: etat api avagacchāmi satyam atra api na anṛtam
translated: I understand this too, it is true, there is no falsehood here.

original: gurūṇām api sarveṣāṃ pitā paramako guruḥ /
analyzed: gurūṇām api sarveṣām pitā paramakaḥ guruḥ
translated: The father is indeed the supreme guru of all gurus.

original: yad uktaṃ bhrāntis tatrāpi svalpāpi hi na vidyate // / / //
analyzed: yat uktam bhrāntiḥ tatra api su alpā api hi na vidyate
translated: What has been said there, even a little error is not found.

original: pitā gurur na saṃdehaḥ pūjanīyaḥ prayatnataḥ /
analyzed: pitā guruḥ na saṃdehaḥ pūjanīyaḥ prayatnataḥ
translated: The father is indeed the guru, he should be worshipped with effort.

original: tatrāpi nāparādhyāmīty evaṃ manasi me sthitam // / / //🔽yat tv etat kim anantenety uktaṃ yuṣmābhir īdṛśam /
analyzed: tatra api na aparādhyāmi iti evam manasi me sthitam  yat tu etat kim anantena iti uktam yuṣmābhiḥ īdṛśam
translated: Even there, the thought in my mind was, 'I should not offend.'🔽As for what you said, 'What is the use of Ananta,'

original: ko bravīti yathāyuktaṃ kiṃ tu naitad vaco 'rthavat // / / //
analyzed: kaḥ bravīti yathā yuktam kim tu na etat vacaḥ rthavat
translated: Who speaks appropriately? But this statement is not meaningful.

original: ity uktvā so 'bhavan maunī teṣāṃ gauravayantritaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktvā saḥ bhavat maunī teṣām gaurava yantritaḥ
translated: Having said this, he became silent, restrained by their respect.

original: prahasya ca punaḥ prāha kim anantena sādhv iti // / / //
analyzed: prahasya ca punar prāha kim anantena sādhu iti
translated: And laughing again, he said, What is the use of Ananta? It is good.

original: sādhu bhoḥ kim anantena sādhu bho guravo mama /
analyzed: sādhu bhoḥ kim anantena sādhu bho guravaḥ mama
translated: Good, good! What is the use of Ananta, good sirs, my teachers?

original: śrūyatāṃ yad anantena yadi khedaṃ na yāsyatha // / / //
analyzed: śrūyatām yat anantena yadi khedam na yāsyatha
translated: Listen to what is of no use if you will not be distressed.

original: dharmārthakāmamokṣākhyaḥ puruṣārtha udāhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: dharma artha kāma mokṣa ākhyaḥ puruṣa arthaḥ udāhṛtaḥ
translated: The human goal is said to be called Dharma, Artha, Kama, and Moksha.

original: catuṣṭayam idaṃ yasmāt tasmāt kiṃ kim idaṃ vṛthā // / / //🔽marīcimiśrair dakṣeṇa tathaivānyair anantataḥ /
analyzed: catuṣṭayam idam yasmāt tasmāt kim kim idam vṛthā  marīci miśraiḥ dakṣeṇa tathā eva anyaiḥ anantataḥ
translated: Since this is a set of four, therefore what is of no use?

original: dharmaḥ prāptas tathaivānyair arthaḥ kāmas tathāparaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: dharmaḥ prāptaḥ tathā eva anyaiḥ arthaḥ kāmaḥ tathā aparaiḥ
translated: By Ananta, Dharma was obtained by Marichi and his sons, by Daksha, and by others. Similarly, by others, Artha, and by others, Kama.

original: tattattvavedino bhūtvā jñānadhyānasamādhibhiḥ /
analyzed: tad tattva vedinaḥ bhūtvā jñāna dhyāna samādhibhiḥ
translated: Having become knowers of that truth, by knowledge, meditation, and samadhi,

original: avāpur muktim apare puruṣā dhvastabandhanāḥ // / / //
analyzed: avāpuḥ muktim apare puruṣāḥ dhvasta bandhanāḥ
translated: Other men, with their bonds destroyed, attained liberation.

original: saṃpadaiśvaryamāhātmyajñānasaṃtatikarmaṇām /
analyzed: saṃpad aiśvarya māhātmya jñāna saṃtati karmaṇām
translated: The root of wealth, lordship, greatness, knowledge, progeny, and action,

original: vimukteś caikato labhyaṃ mūlam ārādhanaṃ hareḥ // / / //
analyzed: vimukteḥ ca ekatas labhyam mūlam ārādhanam hareḥ
translated: And of liberation, is the worship of Hari, which is obtained from one source.

original: yato dharmārthakāmākhyaṃ vimuktiś ca phalaṃ dvijāḥ /
analyzed: yatas dharma artha kāma ākhyam vimuktiḥ ca phalam dvijāḥ
translated: From which, O Brahmins, the fruits called Dharma, Artha, Kama, and Liberation,

original: tenāpi hi kim ity evam anantena kim ucyate // / / //
analyzed: tena api hi kim iti evam anantena kim ucyate
translated: Even by that, what is to be said of the infinite?

original: kiṃ vātra bahunoktena bhavanto guravo mama /
analyzed: kim vā atra bahunā uktena bhavantaḥ guravaḥ mama
translated: Or what is the use of speaking much in this matter? You are my teachers.

original: vadantu sādhu vāsādhu viveko 'smākam alpakaḥ // / / //🔽ed / Veṅk / ins / while / cont / after /
analyzed: vadantu sādhu vā asādhu vivekaḥ smākam alpakaḥ  e t veṅk ins while
translated: Let them speak what is good or bad, our discrimination is small.

original: bahunātra kim uktena sa eva jagataḥ patiḥ // / / / //
analyzed: bahunā atra kim uktena saḥ eva jagataḥ patiḥ
translated: What is the use of speaking much in this? He alone is the lord of the world.

original: sa kartā ca vikartā ca saṃhartā ca hṛdi sthitaḥ // / / / //
analyzed: sa kartā ca vikartā ca saṃhartā ca hṛdi sthitaḥ
translated: He is the creator, the transformer, the destroyer, and resides in the heart.

original: sa bhoktā bhojyam apy evaṃ sa eva jagadīśvaraḥ // / / / //
analyzed: sa bhoktā bhojyam api evam saḥ eva jagat īśvaraḥ
translated: He is the enjoyer, and the object of enjoyment, he alone is the lord of the world.

original: bhavadbhir etat kṣantavyaṃ bālyād uktaṃ tu yan mayā // / / / //
analyzed: bhavadbhiḥ etat kṣantavyam bālyāt uktam tu yat mayā
translated: This should be forgiven by you, what has been said by me out of childishness.

original: purohitā ūcuḥ /🔽dahyamānas tvam asmābhir agninā bāla rakṣitaḥ /
analyzed: purohitāḥ ūcuḥ  dahyamānaḥ tvam asmābhiḥ agninā bāla rakṣitaḥ
translated: The priests said:

original: bhūyo na vakṣyasīty evaṃ naivaṃ jñāto 'sy abuddhimān // / / //
analyzed: bhūyas na vakṣyasi iti evam na evam jñātaḥ si abuddhimān
translated: You were saved by us from the fire, O child, lest you should speak again. Thus it was not known that you are unwise.

original: yady asmadvacanān mohagrāhaṃ na tyakṣyate bhavān /
analyzed: yadi asmad vacanāt moha grāham na tyakṣyate bhavān
translated: If you do not abandon this delusion out of our words,

original: tataḥ kṛtyāṃ vināśāya tava sṛkṣyāma durmate // / / //
analyzed: tatas kṛtyām vināśāya tava sṛkṣyāma durmate
translated: then, O evil-minded one, we will create a kriya (ritual) for your destruction.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlada said:

original: kaḥ kena rakṣyate jantur jantuḥ kaḥ kena hanyate /
analyzed: kaḥ kena rakṣyate jantuḥ jantuḥ kaḥ kena hanyate
translated: By whom is a creature protected? By whom is a creature killed?

original: hanti rakṣati caivātmā jagat sarvaṃ carācaram // / / //
analyzed: hanti rakṣati ca eva ātmā jagat sarvam carācaram
translated: The self protects and kills the entire world, the moving and unmoving.

original: ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: veṅk ins
translated: (Here is the corrected and aligned output:)

original: karmaṇā jāyate sarvaṃ karmaiva gatisādhanam // / / / //
analyzed: karmaṇā jāyate sarvam karma eva gati sādhanam
translated: By action everything is born, action alone is the means of attaining the goal.

original: tasmāt sarvaprayatnena sādhu karma samācaret // / / / //
analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena sādhu karma samācaret
translated: Therefore, with all effort, one should perform good deeds.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity uktās tena te kruddhā daityarājapurohitāḥ /
analyzed: iti uktāḥ tena te kruddhāḥ daitya rāja purohitāḥ
translated: Thus addressed by him, those angry priests of the king of demons

original: kṛtyām utpādayām āsur jvālāmālojjvalānanām // / / //🔽atibhīmā samāgamya pādanyāsakṣatakṣitiḥ /
analyzed: kṛtyām utpādayām āsuḥ jvālā mālā ujjvala ānanām  ati bhīmā samāgamya pāda nyāsa kṣata kṣitiḥ
translated: Created a kriya (ritual) with a face blazing with flames.🔽That extremely terrible one, having come, with the earth wounded by the placement of her feet,

original: śūlena sā susaṃkruddhā taṃ jaghānātha vakṣasi // / / //
analyzed: śūlena sā su saṃkruddhā tam jaghāna atha vakṣasi
translated: With a spear, she became very angry and struck him on the chest.

original: tat tasya hṛdayaṃ prāpya śūlaṃ bālasya dīptimat /
analyzed: tat tasya hṛdayam prāpya śūlam bālasya dīptimat
translated: That spear, having reached the heart of that child, radiant,

original: jagāma khaṇḍitaṃ bhūmau tatrāpi śatadhābhavat // / / //
analyzed: jagāma khaṇḍitam bhūmau tatra api śatadhā bhavat
translated: Went broken to the ground, and there also broke into a hundred pieces.

original: yatrānapāyī bhagavān hṛdy āste harir īśvaraḥ /
analyzed: yatra anapāyī bhagavān hṛdi āste hariḥ īśvaraḥ
translated: Where the imperishable Lord Hari, the Supreme Being, resides in the heart,

original: bhaṅgo bhavati vajrasya tatra śūlasya kā kathā // / / //🔽apāpe tatra pāpaiś ca pātitā daityayājakaiḥ /
analyzed: bhaṅgaḥ bhavati vajrasya tatra śūlasya kā kathā  apāpe tatra pāpaiḥ ca pātitā daitya yājakaiḥ
translated: The thunderbolt itself is shattered, what to speak of the trident.🔽There, the wicked demons, the sacrificers of demons, threw her, the sinless one, with sins.

original: tān eva sā jaghānāśu kṛtyā nāśaṃ jagāma ca // / / //
analyzed: tān eva sā jaghāna āśu kṛtyā nāśam jagāma ca
translated: She herself quickly killed them and then disappeared.

original: kṛtyayā dahyamānāṃs tān vilokya sa mahāmatiḥ /
analyzed: kṛtyayā dahyamānān tān vilokya sa mahāmatiḥ
translated: Seeing them being burned by the Kṛtyā, the greatly wise one,

original: trāhi kṛṣṇety ananteti vadann abhyavapadyata // / / //
analyzed: trāhi kṛṣṇa iti ananta iti vadan abhyavapadyata
translated: crying Save, Kṛṣṇa! Ananta! fell down.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlāda said:

original: sarvavyāpiñ jagadrūpa jagatsraṣṭar janārdana /
analyzed: sarvavyāpim jagat rūpa jagatsraṣṭar janārdana
translated: O all-pervading one, O form of the universe, O creator of the world, O Janārdana,

original: trāhi viprān imān asmād duḥsahān mantrapāvakāt // / / //🔽yathā sarveṣu bhūteṣu sarvavyāpī jagadguruḥ /
analyzed: trāhi viprān imān asmāt duḥsahāt mantra pāvakāt  yathā sarveṣu bhūteṣu sarvavyāpī jagadguruḥ
translated: save these brahmins from this unbearable fire of mantras.🔽Just as Viṣṇu, the all-pervading one, the teacher of the world, is present in all beings,

original: viṣṇur eva tathā sarve jīvantv ete purohitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ eva tathā sarve jīvantu ete purohitāḥ
translated: in the same way, let all these priests live.

original: yathā sarvagataṃ viṣṇuṃ manyamāno 'napāyinam /
analyzed: yathā sarva gatam viṣṇum manyamānaḥ napāyinam
translated: Just as I consider Viṣṇu, who is present everywhere and is free from misfortune,

original: cintayāmy aripakṣe 'pi jīvantv ete tathā dvijāḥ // / / //
analyzed: cintayāmi ari pakṣe jīvantu ete tathā dvijāḥ
translated: even in the enemy's party, in the same way, let these brahmins live.

original: ye hantum āgatā dattaṃ yair viṣaṃ yair hutāśanaḥ /
analyzed: ye hantum āgatāḥ dattam yaiḥ viṣam yaiḥ hutāśanaḥ
translated: Those who came to kill, those who gave poison, those who offered fire,

original: yair diggajair ahaṃ kṣuṇṇo daṣṭaḥ sarpaiś ca yair aham // / / //
analyzed: yaiḥ diggajaiḥ aham kṣuṇṇaḥ daṣṭaḥ sarpaiḥ ca yaiḥ aham
translated: those who crushed me with the elephants of the directions, and those who bit me with snakes,

original: teṣv ahaṃ mitrapakṣe ca samaḥ pāpo 'smi na kvacit /
analyzed: teṣu aham mitra pakṣe ca samaḥ pāpaḥ smi na kvacid
translated: I am impartial towards them and towards my friends, and I am not sinful towards anyone.

original: yathā tenādya satyena jīvantv asurayājakāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yathā tena adya satyena jīvantu asura yājakāḥ
translated: By that truth, let the Asura priests live today.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity uktās tena te sarve saṃspṛṣṭāś ca nirāmayāḥ /
analyzed: iti uktāḥ tena te sarve saṃspṛṣṭāḥ ca nirāmayāḥ
translated: Thus addressed by him, all of them, touched by him, became free from disease.

original: samuttasthur dvijā bhūyas taṃ cocuḥ praśrayānvitam // / / //
analyzed: samuttasthuḥ dvijāḥ bhūyas tam ca ūcuḥ praśraya anvitam
translated: The Brahmins again stood up and spoke to him with humility.

original: purohitā ūcuḥ /
analyzed: purohitāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The priests said:

original: dīrghāyur apratihato balavīryasamanvitaḥ /
analyzed: dīrgha āyuḥ a pratihataḥ bala vīrya samanvitaḥ
translated: O child, be long-lived, invincible, endowed with strength and vigor,

original: putrapautradhanaiśvaryair yukto vatsa bhavottamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: putra pautra dhana aiśvaryaiḥ yuktaḥ vatsa bhava uttamaḥ
translated: united with sons, grandsons, wealth and prosperity, O best of the good.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽ity uktvā taṃ tato gatvā yathāvṛttaṃ purohitāḥ /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  iti uktvā tam tatas gatvā yathāvṛttam purohitāḥ
translated: Parashara said:

original: daityarājāya sakalam ācacakṣur mahāmune // / / //
analyzed: daitya rājāya sakalam ācacakṣuḥ mahā mune
translated: Having said this, the priests then went to the king of the demons and told him everything that had happened, O great sage.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe prathame 'ṃśe 'ṣṭādaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe prathame ṃśe ṣṭādaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eighteenth chapter in the first section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽hiraṇyakaśipuḥ śrutvā tāṃ kṛtyāṃ vitathīkṛtām /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  hiraṇyakaśipuḥ śrutvā tām kṛtyām vitathīkṛtām
translated: Parashara said:🔽Hearing that the Krittika star had been rendered fruitless,

original: āhūya putraṃ papraccha prabhāvasyāsya kāraṇam // / / //
analyzed: āhūya putram papraccha prabhāvasya asya kāraṇam
translated: Hiranyakashipu summoned his son and asked him the reason for this power.

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca
translated: Hiranyakashipu said:

original: prahlāda suprabhāvo 'si kim etat te viceṣṭitam /
analyzed: prahlāda suprabhāvo si kim etat te viceṣṭitam
translated: Prahlada, you are very powerful. What is this behavior of yours?

original: etan mantrādijanitam utāho sahajaṃ tava // / / //
analyzed: etat mantra ādi janitam uta aho sahajam tava
translated: Is this due to mantras and other means, or is it innate in you?

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: evaṃ pṛṣṭas tadā pitrā prahlādo 'surabālakaḥ /
analyzed: evam pṛṣṭaḥ tadā pitrā prahlādo sura bālakaḥ
translated: Thus asked by his father, the demon boy Prahlada,

original: praṇipatya pituḥ pādāv idaṃ vacanam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: praṇipatya pituḥ pādau idam vacanam abravīt
translated: bowing at his father's feet, spoke these words:

original: na mantrādikṛtas tāta na ca naisargiko mama /
analyzed: na mantra ādi kṛtaḥ tāta na ca naisargikaḥ mama
translated: O father, this power of mine is not due to mantras and other means, nor is it natural.

original: prabhāva eṣa sāmānyo yasya yasyācyuto hṛdi // / / //
analyzed: prabhāvaḥ eṣa sāmānyaḥ yasya yasya acyutaḥ hṛdi
translated: This is the common power of anyone in whose heart Achyuta (Vishnu) resides.

original: anyeṣāṃ yo na pāpāni cintayaty ātmano yathā /
analyzed: anyeṣām yaḥ na pāpāni cintayati ātmanaḥ yathā
translated: One who does not think of others' sins as he would of his own,

original: tasya pāpāgamas tāta hetvabhāvān na vidyate // / / //
analyzed: tasya pāpa āgamaḥ tāta hetu abhāvāt na vidyate
translated: for him, O father, there is no coming of sin due to the absence of a cause.

original: karmaṇā manasā vācā parapīḍāṃ karoti yaḥ /
analyzed: karmaṇā manasā vācā para pīḍām karoti yaḥ
translated: One who inflicts harm on others by action, thought, or speech,

original: tad bījaṃ janma phalati prabhūtaṃ tasya cāśubham // / / //
analyzed: tat bījam janma phalati prabhūtam tasya ca aśubham
translated: for him, the seed of that (action) bears abundant inauspicious fruits.

original: so 'haṃ na pāpam icchāmi na karomi vadāmi vā /
analyzed: saḥ ham na pāpam icchāmi na karomi vadāmi vā
translated: I do not desire, do, or speak any sin,

original: cintayan sarvabhūtastham ātmany api ca keśavam // / / //
analyzed: cintayan sarva bhūta stham ātmani api ca keśavam
translated: thinking of Keshava (Vishnu) residing in all beings, including myself.

original: śārīraṃ mānasaṃ duḥkhaṃ daivaṃ bhūtabhavaṃ tathā /
analyzed: śārīram mānasam duḥkham daivam bhūta bhavam tathā
translated: How can physical, mental, divine, or elemental suffering arise for me,

original: sarvatra śubhacittasya tasya me jāyate kutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarvatra śubha cittasya tasya me jāyate kutas
translated: who am of auspicious mind in all things?

original: evaṃ sarveṣu bhūteṣu bhaktir avyabhicāriṇī /
analyzed: evam sarveṣu bhūteṣu bhaktiḥ avyabhicāriṇī
translated: Thus, unwavering devotion to all beings is in me,

original: kartavyā paṇḍitair jñātvā sarvabhūtamayaṃ harim // / / //
analyzed: kartavyā paṇḍitaiḥ jñātvā sarva bhūta mayam harim
translated: should be known by the wise, knowing Hari to be all beings.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: iti śrutvā sa daityendraḥ prāsādaśikhare sthitaḥ /
analyzed: iti śrutvā sa daitya indraḥ prāsāda śikhare sthitaḥ
translated: Having heard this, the lord of the demons, standing on the top of the palace,

original: krodhāndhakāritamukhaḥ prāha daiteyakiṃkarān // / / //🔽durātmā kṣipyatām asmāt prāsādāc chatayojanāt /
analyzed: krodha andhakārita mukhaḥ prāha daiteya kiṃkarān  durātmā kṣipyatām asmāt prāsādāt śata yojanāt
translated: with his face darkened by anger, spoke to the servants of the demons:🔽Throw this evil-souled one from this palace a hundred yojanas (800 miles).

original: giripṛṣṭhe patatv asmiñ śilābhinnāṅgasaṃhatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: giri pṛṣṭhe patatu asmin śilā bhinna aṅga saṃhatiḥ
translated: Let him fall on the mountain peak, his body shattered by the rocks.

original: tatas taṃ cikṣipuḥ sarve bālaṃ daiteyakiṃkarāḥ /
analyzed: tatas tam cikṣipuḥ sarve bālam daiteya kiṃkarāḥ
translated: Then all the servants of the demons threw that child.

original: papāta so 'py adhaḥ kṣipto hṛdayenodvahan harim // / / //🔽patamānaṃ jagaddhātrī jagaddhātari keśave /
analyzed: papāta saḥ pi adhas kṣiptaḥ hṛdayena udvahan harim  patamānam jagaddhātrī jagaddhātari keśave
translated: And he, thrown down, fell with his heart upholding Hari.

original: bhaktiyuktaṃ dadhārainam upagamya ca medinī // / / //
analyzed: bhakti yuktam dadhāra enam upagamya ca medinī
translated: As he was falling, the mother of the world, the earth, full of devotion to Keshava, the supporter of the world,🔽approached him and held him.

original: tato vilokya taṃ svastham aviśīrṇāsthibandhanam /
analyzed: tatas vilokya tam svastham a viśīrṇa asthi bandhanam
translated: Then, seeing him safe, with his bones and joints unbroken,

original: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ prāha śambaraṃ māyināṃ varam // / / //
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ prāha śambaram māyinām varam
translated: Hiranyakashipu said to Shambara, the best of magicians:

original: nāsmābhiḥ śakyate hantum ayaṃ durvṛttabālakaḥ /
analyzed: na asmābhiḥ śakyate hantum ayam durvṛtta bālakaḥ
translated: This wicked boy cannot be killed by us.

original: māyāṃ vetti bhavāṃs tasmān māyayainaṃ niṣūdaya // / / //
analyzed: māyām vetti bhavān tasmāt māyayā enam niṣūdaya
translated: You know magic, therefore destroy him by magic.

original: śambara uvāca /
analyzed: śambaraḥ uvāca
translated: Shambara said:

original: sūdayāmy eṣa daityendra paśya māyābalaṃ mama /
analyzed: sūdayāmi eṣa daitya indra paśya māyā balam mama
translated: I shall destroy him, O king of the Daityas. Behold the power of my illusion.

original: sahasram atra māyānāṃ paśya koṭiśataṃ tathā // / / //
analyzed: sahasram atra māyānām paśya koṭi śatam tathā
translated: Here I see a thousand illusions, and also a hundred koṭis of illusions.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parāśara said:

original: tataḥ samasṛjan māyāḥ prahlāde śambaro 'suraḥ /
analyzed: tatas samasṛjat māyāḥ prahlāde suraḥ
translated: Then Śambara, the demon, created illusions in Prahlāda,

original: vināśam icchan durbuddhiḥ sarvatra samadarśini // / / //
analyzed: vināśam icchan durbuddhiḥ sarvatra samadarśini
translated: the one who sees equally everywhere, the one with a wicked mind who desired destruction.

original: samāhitamanā bhūtvā śambare 'pi vimatsaraḥ /
analyzed: samāhita manāḥ bhūtvā śambare vimatsaraḥ
translated: With a concentrated mind, free from jealousy even towards Śambara,

original: maitreya so 'pi prahlādaḥ sasmāra madhusūdanam // / / //
analyzed: maitreya saḥ u pi prahlādaḥ sasmāra madhusūdanam
translated: that Prahlāda, O Maitreya, remembered Madhusūdana.

original: tato bhagavatā tasya rakṣārthaṃ cakram uttamam /
analyzed: tatas bhagavatā tasya rakṣā artham cakram uttamam
translated: Then, for the sake of protecting him, the excellent discus of the Lord,

original: ājagāma samājñaptaṃ jvālāmāli sudarśanam // / / //🔽tena māyāsahasraṃ tac śambarasyāśugāminā /
analyzed: ājagāma samājñaptam jvālā māli sudarśanam  tena māyā sahasram tat śambarasya āśu gāminā
translated: the blazing Sudarśana, commanded to come, arrived.🔽By that one moving swiftly, the body of the child being protected, the thousand illusions of Śambara

original: bālasya rakṣatā deham ekaikaśyena sūditam // / / //
analyzed: bālasya rakṣatā deham ekaikaśyena sūditam
translated: were destroyed one by one.

original: saṃśoṣakaṃ tato vāyuṃ daityendra idam abravīt /
analyzed: saṃśoṣakam tatas vāyum daitya indraḥ idam abravīt
translated: Then the lord of the Daityas said to the drying wind:

original: śīghram eṣa mamādeśād durātmā nīyatāṃ kṣayam // / / //
analyzed: śīghram eṣa mama ādeśāt durātmā nīyatām kṣayam
translated: By my order, quickly take this wicked one to destruction.

original: tathety uktvātha so 'py enaṃ viveśa pavano laghuḥ /
analyzed: tathā iti uktvā atha saḥ pi enam viveśa pavanaḥ laghuḥ
translated: Saying So be it, that light wind entered him,

original: śīto 'tirūkṣaḥ śoṣāya taddehasyātiduḥsahaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śītaḥ ti rūkṣaḥ śoṣāya tad dehasya ati duḥsahaḥ
translated: very cold and rough, extremely unbearable for the drying of his body.

original: tenāviṣṭaṃ tathātmānaṃ sa buddhvā daityabālakaḥ /
analyzed: tena āviṣṭam tathā ātmānam sa buddhvā daitya bālakaḥ
translated: The demon boy, realizing that his own self was thus possessed,

original: hṛdayena mahātmānaṃ dadhāra dharaṇīdharam // / / //🔽hṛdayasthas tatas tasya taṃ vāyum atiśoṣaṇam /
analyzed: hṛdayena mahātmānam dadhāra dharaṇīdharam  hṛdaya sthaḥ tatas tasya tam vāyum atiśoṣaṇam
translated: held in his heart the great-souled supporter of the earth.🔽Then Janardana, angry, drank up that extremely drying wind that was in his heart.

original: papau janārdanaḥ kruddhaḥ sa yayau pavanaḥ kṣayam // / / //
analyzed: papau janārdanaḥ kruddhaḥ sa yayau pavanaḥ kṣayam
translated: Thus the wind was destroyed.

original: kṣīṇāsu sarvamāyāsu pavane saṃkṣayaṃ gate /
analyzed: kṣīṇāsu sarva māyāsu pavane saṃkṣayam gate
translated: When all the illusions were exhausted and the wind was destroyed,

original: jagāma so 'pi bhavanaṃ guror eva mahāmatiḥ // / / //🔽ahany ahany athācāryo nītiṃ rājyaphalapradām /
analyzed: jagāma saḥ u pi bhavanam guroḥ eva mahāmatiḥ  ahani ahani atha ācāryaḥ nītim rājya phala pradām
translated: that greatly wise one also went to the abode of his teacher.🔽Day after day, the teacher made the boy understand the policy that grants the fruit of the kingdom,

original: grāhayām āsa taṃ bālaṃ rājñām uśanasā kṛtām // / / //
analyzed: grāhayām āsa tam bālam rājñām uśanasā kṛtām
translated: that was composed by Ushanasa for the kings.

original: gṛhītanītiśāstraṃ taṃ vinītaṃ sa yadā guruḥ /
analyzed: gṛhīta nīti śāstram tam vinītam sa yadā guruḥ
translated: When the teacher saw that he had mastered the policy scriptures and was humble,

original: mene tadainaṃ tatpitre kathayām āsa śikṣitam // / / //
analyzed: mene tadā enam tad pitre kathayām āsa śikṣitam
translated: he then told his father that he had been taught.

original: ācārya uvāca /
analyzed: ācāryaḥ uvāca
translated: The teacher said:

original: gṛhītanītiśāstras te putro daityapate kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: gṛhīta nīti śāstraḥ te putraḥ daitya pate kṛtaḥ
translated: O lord of the demons, your son has been made to master the policy scriptures.

original: prahlādas tattvato vetti bhārgaveṇa yad īritam // / / //
analyzed: prahlādaḥ tattvataḥ vetti bhārgaveṇa yat īritam
translated: Prahlada truly knows what was said by Bhargava.

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca
translated: Hiranyakashipu said:

original: mitreṣu varteta katham arivargeṣu bhūpatiḥ /
analyzed: mitreṣu varteta katham arivargeṣu bhūpatiḥ
translated: How should a king behave towards friends and enemies?

original: prahlāda triṣu kāleṣu madhyastheṣu kathaṃ caret // / / //🔽kathaṃ mantriṣv amātyeṣu bāhyeṣv ābhyantareṣu ca /
analyzed: prahlāda triṣu kāleṣu madhyastheṣu katham caret  katham mantriṣu amātyeṣu bāhyeṣu ābhyantareṣu ca
translated: O Prahlada, how should one conduct oneself in the three middle periods?🔽How in the ministers, the counselors, the outsiders, and the insiders,

original: cāreṣu pauravargeṣu śaṅkiteṣv itareṣu ca // / / //
analyzed: cāreṣu paura vargeṣu śaṅkiteṣu itareṣu ca
translated: In the spies, in the group of citizens, in the suspicious and in the others?

original: kṛtyākṛtyavidhānaṃ ca durgāṭavikasādhanam /
analyzed: kṛtyā akṛtya vidhānam ca durga āṭavika sādhanam
translated: And the injunction of what should be done and what should not be done, and the means of overcoming difficulties and wildernesses,

original: prahlāda kathyatāṃ samyak tathā kaṇṭakaśodhanam // / / //
analyzed: prahlāda kathyatām samyak tathā kaṇṭaka śodhanam
translated: O Prahlada, let the complete removal of thorns be told.

original: etac cānyac ca sakalam adhītaṃ bhavatā yathā /
analyzed: etat ca anyat ca sakalam adhītam bhavatā yathā
translated: And all this and more has been studied by you as it is,

original: tathā me kathyatāṃ jñātuṃ tavecchāmi manogatam // / / //
analyzed: tathā me kathyatām jñātum tava icchāmi manogatam
translated: So let it be told to me. I wish to know what is in your mind.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: praṇipatya pituḥ pādau tataḥ praśrayabhūṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: praṇipatya pituḥ pādau tatas praśraya bhūṣaṇaḥ
translated: Then, adorned with humility, Prahlada bowed at his father's feet,

original: prahlādaḥ prāha daityendraṃ kṛtāñjalipuṭaḥ sthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prahlādaḥ prāha daitya indram kṛta añjali puṭaḥ sthitaḥ
translated: and standing with folded hands, said to the lord of the demons.

original: prahlāda uvāca /🔽mamopadiṣṭaṃ sakalaṃ guruṇā nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca  mama upadiṣṭam sakalam guruṇā na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: Prahlada said:🔽All this has been taught to me by my teacher, there is no doubt about it.

original: gṛhītaṃ ca mayā kintu na sad etan mataṃ mama // / / //🔽sāma copapradānaṃ ca bhedadaṇḍau tathaiva ca /
analyzed: gṛhītam ca mayā kintu na sat etat matam mama  sāma ca upapradānam ca bheda daṇḍau tathā eva ca
translated: But it has been accepted by me, but this is not considered good by me.🔽Soothing, conciliation, dissension, and punishment,

original: upāyāḥ kathitā hy ete mitrādīnāṃ ca sādhane // / / //
analyzed: upāyāḥ kathitāḥ hi ete mitra ādīnām ca sādhane
translated: these are said to be the means for accomplishing friends and others.

original: tān evāhaṃ na paśyāmi mitrādīṃs tāta mā krudhaḥ /
analyzed: tān eva aham na paśyāmi mitra ādīn tāta mā krudhaḥ
translated: I do not see those friends and others, O child, do not be angry.

original: sādhyābhāve mahābāho sādhanaiḥ kiṃ prayojanam // / / //
analyzed: sādhya abhāve mahā bāho sādhanaiḥ kim prayojanam
translated: In the absence of the objects to be accomplished, O mighty-armed one, what is the use of the means of accomplishment?

original: sarvabhūtātmake tāta jagannāthe jaganmaye /
analyzed: sarva bhūta ātmake tāta jagannāthe jagat maye
translated: In the Lord of the universe, who is the soul of all beings, who is the essence of the universe,

original: paramātmani govinde mitrāmitrakathā kutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: parama ātmani govinde mitra amitra kathā kutas
translated: in Govinda, the Supreme Self, how can there be talk of friends and enemies?

original: tvayy asti bhagavān viṣṇur mayi cānyatra cāsti saḥ /
analyzed: tvayi asti bhagavān viṣṇuḥ mayi ca anyatra ca asti saḥ
translated: In you, O Lord, Vishnu exists, and He exists in me and elsewhere.

original: yatas tato 'yaṃ mitraṃ me śatruś ceti pṛthak kutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yatas tatas yam mitram me śatruḥ ca iti pṛthak kutas
translated: From that, how can there be a separate notion of this as my friend and that as my enemy?

original: tad ebhir alam atyarthaṃ duṣṭārambhoktivistaraiḥ /
analyzed: tat ebhiḥ alam atyartham duṣṭa ārambha ukti vistaraiḥ
translated: Therefore, enough of these extensive statements of evil undertakings.

original: avidyāntargatair yatnaḥ kartavyas tāta śobhane // / / //
analyzed: avidyā antargataiḥ yatnaḥ kartavyaḥ tāta śobhane
translated: O beautiful one, O child, effort should be made to overcome ignorance.

original: vidyābuddhir avidyāyām ajñānāt tāta jāyate /
analyzed: vidyā buddhiḥ avidyāyām ajñānāt tāta jāyate
translated: O child, knowledge arises from ignorance due to lack of knowledge in ignorance.

original: bālo 'gniṃ kiṃ na khadyotam asureśvara manyate // / / //
analyzed: bālaḥ gnim kim na khadyotam asura īśvara manyate
translated: Does a child not consider a firefly to be fire, O lord of demons?

original: tat karma yan na bandhāya sā vidyā yā vimuktaye /
analyzed: tat karma yat na bandhāya sā vidyā yā vimuktaye
translated: That action which does not lead to bondage is knowledge that leads to liberation.

original: āyāsāyāparaṃ karma vidyānyā śilpanaipuṇam // / / //🔽tad etad avagamyāham asāraṃ sādhyam uttamam /
analyzed: āyāsāya aparam karma vidyā anyā śilpa naipuṇam  tat etat avagamya aham asāram sādhyam uttamam
translated: Other action leads to toil, and other knowledge is skill in craftsmanship.🔽Having understood this, I consider the highest goal to be insubstantial.

original: niśāmaya mahābhāga praṇipatya bravīmi yat // / / //
analyzed: niśāmaya mahābhāga praṇipatya bravīmi yat
translated: Listen, O illustrious one, I speak after bowing down.

original: na cintayati ko rājyaṃ ko dhanaṃ nābhivāñchati /
analyzed: na cintayati kaḥ rājyam kaḥ dhanam na abhivāñchati
translated: No one thinks of sovereignty, no one desires wealth.

original: tathāpi bhāvyam evaitad ubhayaṃ prāpyate naraiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tathā api bhāvyam eva etat ubhayam prāpyate naraiḥ
translated: Nevertheless, this pair is indeed obtained by men.

original: sarva eva mahābhāga mahattvaṃ prati sodyamāḥ /
analyzed: sarve eva mahābhāga mahat tvam prati sa udyamāḥ
translated: All of you are indeed greatly fortunate and striving for greatness.

original: tathāpi puṃsāṃ bhāgyāni nodyamā bhūtihetavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tathā api puṃsām bhāgyāni na udyamāḥ bhūti hetavaḥ
translated: Nevertheless, the fortunes of men, not their efforts, are the cause of prosperity.

original: jaḍānām avivekānām aśūrāṇām api prabho /
analyzed: jaḍānām a vivekānām a śūrāṇām api prabho
translated: Even for the dull, the unreflective, and the cowardly, O lord,

original: bhāgyabhojyāni rājyāni santy anītimatām api // / / //
analyzed: bhāgya bhojyāni rājyāni santi anītimatām api
translated: there are kingdoms to be enjoyed by fate, even for those lacking in policy.

original: tasmād yateta puṇyeṣu ya icchen mahatīṃ śriyam /
analyzed: tasmāt yateta puṇyeṣu yaḥ icchet mahatīm śriyam
translated: Therefore, one who desires great prosperity should strive in meritorious deeds.

original: yatitavyaṃ samatve ca nirvāṇam api cecchatā // / / //
analyzed: yatitavyam samatve ca nirvāṇam api ca icchatā
translated: One who desires even liberation should strive for equanimity.

original: devā manuṣyāḥ paśavaḥ pakṣivṛkṣasarīsṛpāḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ manuṣyāḥ paśavaḥ pakṣi vṛkṣa sarīsṛpāḥ
translated: Gods, humans, animals, birds, trees, and reptiles -

original: rūpam etad anantasya viṣṇor bhinnam iva sthitam // / / //
analyzed: rūpam etat anantasya viṣṇoḥ bhinnam iva sthitam
translated: this form of the infinite Vishnu appears as if divided.

original: etad vijānatā sarvaṃ jagat sthāvarajaṅgamam /
analyzed: etat vijānatā sarvam jagat sthāvara jaṅgamam
translated: Knowing this, the entire world of moving and unmoving beings

original: draṣṭavyam ātmavad viṣṇur yato 'yaṃ viśvarūpadhṛk // / / //
analyzed: draṣṭavyam ātma vat viṣṇuḥ yatas yam viśva rūpa dhṛk
translated: should be seen as the self, for Vishnu assumes the form of the universe.

original: evaṃ jñāte sa bhagavān anādiḥ parameśvaraḥ /
analyzed: evam jñāte sa bhagavān anādiḥ parameśvaraḥ
translated: When this is known, that unborn Supreme Lord

original: prasīdaty acyutas tasmin prasanne kleśasaṃkṣayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prasīdati acyutaḥ tasmin prasanne kleśa saṃkṣayaḥ
translated: becomes pleased. When he is pleased, the afflictions are destroyed.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽etac chrutvā tu kopena samutthāya varāsanāt /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  etat śrutvā tu kopena samutthāya varāsanāt
translated: Parashara said:🔽Hearing this, Hiranyakashipu angrily rose from his excellent seat,

original: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ putraṃ padā vakṣasy atāḍayat // / / //
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ putram padā vakṣasi atāḍayat
translated: and kicked his son on the chest with his foot.

original: uvāca ca sa kopena sāmarṣaḥ prajvalann iva /
analyzed: uvāca ca sa kopena sa amarṣaḥ prajvalan iva
translated: And he spoke with anger, his eyes red with rage,
