original: niṣpiṣya pāṇinā pāṇiṃ hantukāmo jagad yathā // / / //
analyzed: niṣpiṣya pāṇinā pāṇim hantu kāmaḥ jagat yathā
translated: rubbing his hands together, as if wishing to destroy the world.

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca
translated: Hiranyakashipu said:

original: he vipracitte he rāho he balaiṣa mahārṇave /
analyzed: he vipracitte he rāho he bala eṣa mahā arṇave
translated: O Viprachitti, O Rahu, O Bala, in this great ocean,

original: nāgapāśair dṛḍhaṃ baddhvā kṣipyatāṃ mā vilambatha // / / //
analyzed: nāgapāśaiḥ dṛḍham baddhvā kṣipyatām mā vilambatha
translated: Bind him tightly with the ropes of the serpents and throw him in, do not delay.

original: anyathā sakalā lokās tathā daiteyadānavāḥ /
analyzed: anyathā sakalāḥ lokāḥ tathā daiteya dānavāḥ
translated: Otherwise, all the worlds, as well as the Daityas and Danavas,

original: anuyāsyanti mūḍhasya matam asya durātmanaḥ // / / //🔽bahuśo vārito 'smābhir ayaṃ pāpas tathāpy areḥ /
analyzed: anuyāsyanti mūḍhasya matam asya durātmanaḥ  bahuśas vāritaḥ smābhiḥ ayam pāpaḥ tathā api areḥ
translated: Will follow the opinion of this deluded and evil-minded one.

original: stutiṃ karoti duṣṭānāṃ vadha evopakārakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: stutim karoti duṣṭānām vadhaḥ eva upakārakaḥ
translated: Though this sinner has been repeatedly warned by us, he still praises the enemy. The only favor to be done to the wicked is to kill them.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tatas te satvarā daityā baddhvā taṃ nāgabandhanaiḥ /🔽bhartur ājñāṃ puraskṛtya cikṣipuḥ salilārṇave // / / //
analyzed: tatas te sa tvarāḥ daityāḥ baddhvā tam nāga bandhanaiḥ  bhartuḥ ājñām puraskṛtya cikṣipuḥ salila arṇave
translated: Then those Daityas, binding him tightly with serpent ropes,🔽Out of respect for their master's command, threw him into the great ocean.

original: tataś cacāla calatā prahlādena mahārṇavaḥ /
analyzed: tatas cacāla calatā prahlādena mahā arṇavaḥ
translated: And then the great ocean trembled with the throwing in of Prahlada.

original: udvelo 'bhūt paraṃ kṣobham upetya ca samantataḥ // / / //
analyzed: udvelaḥ bhūt param kṣobham upetya ca samantataḥ
translated: and the ocean became agitated and overflowed on all sides.

original: bhūrlokam akhilaṃ dṛṣṭvā plāvyamānaṃ mahāmbhasā /
analyzed: bhūrlokam akhilam dṛṣṭvā plāvyamānam mahā ambhasā
translated: Seeing the entire world of mortals being flooded by the great waters,

original: hiraṇyakaśipur daityān idam āha mahāmune // / / //
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ daityān idam āha mahā mune
translated: Hiraṇyakaśipu, O great sage, said to the demons:

original: hiraṇyakaśipur uvāca /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipuḥ uvāca
translated: Hiraṇyakaśipu said:

original: daiteyāḥ sakalaiḥ śailair atraiva varuṇālaye /
analyzed: daiteyāḥ sakalaiḥ śailaiḥ atrā eva varuṇālaye
translated: O Daityas, in this very abode of Varuṇa, with all the mountains,

original: niśchidraiḥ sarvataḥ sarvaiś cīyatām eṣa durmatiḥ // / / //🔽nāgnir dahati naivāyaṃ śastraiś chinno na coragaiḥ /🔽kṣayaṃ nīto na vātena na viṣeṇa na kṛtyayā // / / //
analyzed: niśchidraiḥ sarvatas sarvaiḥ cīyatām eṣa durmatiḥ  na agniḥ dahati na eva ayam śastraiḥ chinnaḥ na ca uragaiḥ  kṣayam nītaḥ na vātena na viṣeṇa na kṛtyayā
translated: let this wicked one be completely covered on all sides by all of you.🔽Fire does not burn him, nor is he cut by weapons or snakes,🔽nor is he destroyed by wind, poison, or sorcery.

original: na māyābhir na caivoccāt pātito na ca diggajaiḥ /
analyzed: na māyābhiḥ na ca eva uccāt pātitaḥ na ca diggajaiḥ
translated: He is not affected by illusions, nor is he thrown down from high places or by the elephants of the directions.

original: bālo 'tiduṣṭacitto 'yaṃ nānenārtho 'sti jīvatā // / / //
analyzed: yam na anena arthaḥ sti jīvatā
translated: This child with an extremely wicked mind, there is no purpose in his remaining alive.

original: tad eṣa toyadhāv atra samākrānto mahīdharaiḥ /
analyzed: tat eṣa toyadhau atra samākrāntaḥ mahīdharaiḥ
translated: Therefore, let him be seized by the mountains in this ocean

original: tiṣṭhatv abdasahasrāntaṃ prāṇān hāsyati durmatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tiṣṭhatu abda sahasra antam prāṇān hāsyati durmatiḥ
translated: and remain there for a thousand years, and this wicked one will lose his life.

original: tato daityā dānavāś ca parvatais taṃ mahodadhau /
analyzed: tatas daityāḥ dānavāḥ ca parvataiḥ tam mahā udadhau
translated: Then the Daityas and Dānavas, with the mountains,

original: ākramya cayanaṃ cakrur yojanāni sahasraśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ākramya cayanam cakruḥ yojanāni sahasraśas
translated: in the great ocean, covered him for thousands of yojanas.

original: sa citaḥ parvatair antaḥ samudrasya mahāmatiḥ /
analyzed: sa citaḥ parvataiḥ antar samudrasya mahāmatiḥ
translated: That greatly wise one, within the ocean, with mountains in his mind,

original: tuṣṭāvāhnikavelāyām ekāgramatir acyutam // / / //
analyzed: tuṣṭāva āhnika velāyām ekāgra matiḥ acyutam
translated: with a concentrated mind, at the time of the daily worship, to the imperishable one.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlāda said:

original: namas te puṇḍarīkākṣa namas te puruṣottama /
analyzed: namaḥ te puṇḍarīkākṣa namaḥ te puruṣottama
translated: Salutations to you, O lotus-eyed one, salutations to you, O supreme being.

original: namas te sarvalokātman namas te tigmacakriṇe // / / //
analyzed: namaḥ te sarva loka ātman namaḥ te tigma cakriṇe
translated: Salutations to you, the soul of all worlds, salutations to you, O wielder of the sharp discus.

original: namo brahmaṇyadevāya gobrāhmaṇahitāya ca /
analyzed: namaḥ brahmaṇyadevāya go brāhmaṇa hitāya ca
translated: Salutations to the god devoted to Brahman, to the welfare of cows and Brahmins,

original: jagaddhitāya kṛṣṇāya govindāya namo namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: jagat hitāya kṛṣṇāya govindāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: to Kṛṣṇa, for the welfare of the world, salutations again and again to Govinda.

original: brahmatve sṛjate viśvaṃ sthitau pālayate punaḥ /
analyzed: brahmatve sṛjate viśvam sthitau pālayate punar
translated: In the state of Brahman, he creates the universe, in the state of preservation, he protects it again,

original: rudrarūpāya kalpānte namas tubhyaṃ trimūrtaye // / / //
analyzed: rudra rūpāya kalpa ante namaḥ tubhyam trimūrtaye
translated: to the one in the form of Rudra at the end of the kalpa, salutations to you, the three-formed one.

original: devā yakṣāsurāḥ siddhā nāgā gandharvakiṃnarāḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ yakṣa asurāḥ siddhāḥ nāgāḥ gandharva kiṃnarāḥ
translated: Gods, Yakṣas, Asuras, Siddhas, Nāgas, Gandharvas, Kinnaras,🔽Piśācas, Rākṣasas, humans, animals,

original: piśācā rākṣasāś caiva manuṣyāḥ paśavas tathā // / / //🔽pakṣiṇaḥ sthāvarāś caiva pipīlikasarīsṛpāḥ /
analyzed: piśācāḥ rākṣasāḥ ca eva manuṣyāḥ paśavaḥ tathā  pakṣiṇaḥ sthāvarāḥ ca eva pipīlika sarīsṛpāḥ
translated: birds, immobile beings, ants, reptiles,

original: bhūmyāpo 'gnir nabho vāyuḥ śabdaḥ sparśas tathā rasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhūmi apaḥ gniḥ nabhaḥ vāyuḥ śabdaḥ sparśaḥ tathā rasaḥ
translated: earth, water, fire, space, air, sound, touch, taste,

original: rūpaṃ gandho mano buddhir ātmā kālas tathā guṇāḥ /
analyzed: rūpam gandhaḥ manaḥ buddhiḥ ātmā kālaḥ tathā guṇāḥ
translated: form, smell, mind, intellect, soul, time, and the qualities,

original: eteṣāṃ paramārthaś ca sarvam etat tvam acyuta // / / //🔽vidyāvidye bhavān satyam asatyaṃ tvaṃ viṣāmṛte /
analyzed: eteṣām parama arthaḥ ca sarvam etat tvam acyuta  vidyā avidye bhavān satyam asatyam tvam viṣa amṛte
translated: And the ultimate reality of these is all this, O Acyuta.🔽You are knowledge and ignorance, truth and falsehood, and the poison and nectar.

original: pravṛttaṃ ca nivṛttaṃ ca karma vedoditaṃ bhavān // / / //🔽samastakarmabhoktā ca karmopakaraṇāni ca /
analyzed: pravṛttam ca nivṛttam ca karma veda uditam bhavān  samasta karma bhoktā ca karma upakaraṇāni ca
translated: You are the engaged and disengaged actions enjoined by the Vedas.🔽You are the enjoyer of all actions and the instruments of action.

original: tvam eva viṣṇo sarvāṇi sarvakarmaphalaṃ ca yat // / / //
analyzed: tvam eva viṣṇo sarvāṇi sarva karma phalam ca yat
translated: O Vishnu, you alone are all these and the fruits of all actions.

original: mayy anyatra tathāśeṣabhūteṣu bhuvaneṣu ca /
analyzed: mayi anyatra tathā aśeṣa bhūteṣu bhuvaneṣu ca
translated: In me, in others, and in all beings and worlds,

original: tavaiva vyāptir aiśvaryaguṇasaṃsūcikī prabho // / / //
analyzed: tava eva vyāptiḥ aiśvarya guṇa saṃsūcikī prabho
translated: Your pervasion, O Lord, indicates your qualities of lordship.

original: tvāṃ yoginaś cintayanti tvāṃ yajanti ca yajvinaḥ /
analyzed: tvām yoginaḥ cintayanti tvām yajanti ca yajvinaḥ
translated: The yogis contemplate you, and the sacrificers worship you.

original: havyakavyabhug ekas tvaṃ pitṛdevasvarūpadhṛk // / / //🔽rūpaṃ mahat te 'cyuta yatra viśvaṃ yataś ca sūkṣmaṃ jagad etad īśa /
analyzed: havya kavya bhuj ekaḥ tvam pitṛ deva sva rūpa dhṛk  rūpam mahat te cyuta yatra viśvam yatas ca sūkṣmam jagat etat īśa
translated: You alone are the enjoyer of oblations, and you assume the forms of ancestors and gods.🔽O Acyuta, your great form is where the universe is, and from which this subtle world originates, O Lord.

original: rūpāṇi sūkṣmāṇi ca bhūtabhedās teṣv antar ātmākhyam atīva sūkṣmam // / / //
analyzed: rūpāṇi sūkṣmāṇi ca bhūta bhedāḥ teṣu antar ātma ākhyam atīva sūkṣmam
translated: The subtle forms and the different elements are within that, and the inner self is extremely subtle.

original: tasmāc ca sūkṣmādiviśeṣaṇānām agocare yat paramārtharūpam /
analyzed: tasmāt ca sūkṣma ādi viśeṣaṇānām agocare yat paramārtha rūpam
translated: And from that, the supreme reality which is beyond the range of qualifications such as subtlety,

original: kim apy acintyaṃ tava rūpam asti tasmai namas te puruṣottamāya // / / //
analyzed: kim api acintyam tava rūpam asti tasmai namaḥ te puruṣottamāya
translated: You have some inconceivable form. Salutations to you, to that Supreme Person.

original: sarvabhūteṣu sarvātman yā śaktir aparā tava /
analyzed: sarva bhūteṣu sarva ātman yā śaktiḥ aparā tava
translated: In all beings, O all-souled one, is your other power,

original: guṇāśrayā namas tasyai śāśvatāyai sureśvara // / / //
analyzed: guṇa āśrayā namaḥ tasyai śāśvatāyai sureśvara
translated: which is the basis of the qualities. Salutations to that eternal one, O Lord of the gods.

original: yātītagocarā vācāṃ manasāṃ cāviśeṣaṇā /
analyzed: yā atīta gocarā vācām manasām ca a viśeṣaṇā
translated: Which is beyond the range of speech and mind, and is not distinguished by them,

original: jñānijñānaparicchedyā tāṃ vande ceśvarīṃ parām // / / //🔽oṃ namo vāsudevāya tasmai bhagavate sadā /
analyzed: jñāni jñāna paricchedyā tām vande ca īśvarīm parām  om namaḥ vāsudevāya tasmai bhagavate sadā
translated: which is to be defined by the knowledge of the knowers of the Absolute, I bow to that supreme Goddess.

original: vyatiriktaṃ na yasyāsti vyatirikto 'khilasya yaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vyatiriktam na yasya asti khilasya yaḥ
translated: Om, salutations to that Lord Vāsudeva, who is always without anything different from Him, and who is different from everything else.

original: namas tasmai namas tasmai namas tasmai mahātmane /
analyzed: namaḥ tasmai namaḥ tasmai namaḥ tasmai mahātmane
translated: Salutations to Him, salutations to Him, salutations to that magnanimous one,

original: nāmarūpaṃ na yasyaiko yo 'stitvenopalabhyate // / / //
analyzed: nāma rūpam na yasya ekaḥ yaḥ stitvena upalabhyate
translated: who has no name or form, and who is perceived as existing alone.

original: yasyāvatārarūpāṇi samarcanti divaukasaḥ /
analyzed: yasya avatāra rūpāṇi samarcanti divaukasaḥ
translated: To whom the dwellers of heaven worship the forms of incarnations,

original: apaśyantaḥ paraṃ rūpaṃ namas tasmai mahātmane // / / //
analyzed: a paśyantaḥ param rūpam namaḥ tasmai mahātmane
translated: not seeing the supreme form, salutations to that magnanimous one.

original: yo 'ntas tiṣṭhann aśeṣasya paśyatīśaḥ śubhāśubham /
analyzed: yaḥ ntar tiṣṭhan aśeṣasya paśyati īśaḥ śubha aśubham
translated: Who, dwelling within, the Lord sees the good and evil of all,

original: taṃ sarvasākṣiṇaṃ viṣṇuṃ namasye parameśvaram // / / //
analyzed: tam sarva sākṣiṇam viṣṇum namasye parameśvaram
translated: I bow to that Viṣṇu, the supreme Lord, the witness of all.

original: namo 'stu viṣṇave tasmai yasyābhinnam idaṃ jagat /
analyzed: namaḥ stu viṣṇave tasmai yasya abhinnam idam jagat
translated: Salutations to that Vishnu, in whom this universe is non-different.

original: dhyeyaḥ sa jagatām ādyaḥ sa prasīdatu me 'vyayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dhyeyaḥ sa jagatām ādyaḥ sa prasīdatu me vyayaḥ
translated: He is the first of all worlds, may that imperishable one be pleased with me.

original: yatrotam etat protaṃ ca viśvam akṣarasaṃjñake /
analyzed: yatra utam etat protam ca viśvam akṣara saṃjñake
translated: In whom this universe is woven and spread, in the one known as the imperishable.

original: ādhārabhūtaḥ sarvasya sa prasīdatu me hariḥ // / / //
analyzed: ādhāra bhūtaḥ sarvasya sa prasīdatu me hariḥ
translated: May that Hari, the support of all, be pleased with me.

original: oṃ namo viṣṇave tasmai namas tasmai punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: om namaḥ viṣṇave tasmai namaḥ tasmai punar punar
translated: Om, salutations to that Vishnu, salutations again and again to him,

original: yatra sarvaṃ yataḥ sarvaṃ yaḥ sarvaṃ sarvataś ca yaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yatra sarvam yatas sarvam yaḥ sarvam sarvatas ca yaḥ
translated: In whom all, from whom all, who is all and all-pervading.

original: sarvagatvād anantasya sa evāham avasthitaḥ /
analyzed: sarva ga tvāt anantasya saḥ eva aham avasthitaḥ
translated: By being all-pervading, I am established as the infinite one.

original: mattaḥ sarvam ahaṃ sarvaṃ mayi sarvaṃ sanātane // / / //
analyzed: mattaḥ sarvam aham sarvam mayi sarvam sanātane
translated: All is from me, all is me, all is in me, the eternal one.

original: aham evākṣayo nityaḥ paramātmātmasaṃśrayaḥ /
analyzed: aham eva akṣayaḥ nityaḥ paramātmā ātma saṃśrayaḥ
translated: I alone am the imperishable, the eternal, the supreme self, the refuge of the soul.

original: brahmasaṃjño 'ham evāgre tathānte ca paraḥ pumān // / / //
analyzed: brahma saṃjñaḥ ham eva agre tathā ante ca paraḥ pumān
translated: I alone am the Brahman in the beginning, and at the end I am the supreme being.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe prathame 'ṃśa ekonaviṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe prathame ṃśe ekonaviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the nineteenth chapter in the first section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽evaṃ saṃcintayan viṣṇum abhedenātmano dvija /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  evam saṃcintayan viṣṇum abhedena ātmanaḥ dvija
translated: Parashara said:🔽Thus contemplating on Vishnu as non-different from his own self, O Brahmin,

original: tanmayatvam avāpāgryaṃ mene cātmānam acyutam // / / //
analyzed: tad maya tvam avāpa agryam mene ca ātmānam acyutam
translated: He attained the highest state of being absorbed in him and considered himself to be Achyuta (the unchanging one).

original: visasmāra tathātmānaṃ nānyat kiṃcid ajānata /
analyzed: visasmāra tathā ātmānam na anyat kiṃcid ajānata
translated: He forgot his own self and knew nothing else.

original: aham evāvyayo 'nantaḥ paramātmety acintayat // / / //
analyzed: aham eva avyayaḥ nantaḥ paramātmā iti acintayat
translated: He thought, I alone am the imperishable, infinite, supreme Self.

original: tasya tadbhāvanāyogāt kṣīṇapāpasya vai kramāt /
analyzed: tasya tad bhāvanā yogāt kṣīṇa pāpasya vai kramāt
translated: By the yoga of meditation on Him, his sins gradually diminished,

original: śuddhe 'ntaḥkaraṇe viṣṇus tasthau jñānamayo 'cyutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śuddhe ntaḥkaraṇe viṣṇuḥ tasthau cyutaḥ
translated: and in his purified heart, Vishnu, the undecaying one consisting of knowledge, remained.

original: yogaprabhāvāt prahlāde jāte viṣṇumaye 'sure /
analyzed: yoga prabhāvāt prahlāde jāte viṣṇu maye sure
translated: By the power of yoga, when Prahlada became full of Vishnu,

original: calaty uragabandhais tair maitreya truṭitaṃ kṣaṇāt // / / //🔽bhrāntagrāhagaṇaḥ sormir yayau kṣobhaṃ mahārṇavaḥ /
analyzed: calati uraga bandhaiḥ taiḥ maitreya truṭitam kṣaṇāt  bhrānta grāha gaṇaḥ sa ūrmiḥ yayau kṣobham mahā arṇavaḥ
translated: the mountain, with its serpent-bands, trembled and was shattered in a moment.🔽The great ocean, with its moving waves and shoals, was agitated.

original: cacāla ca mahī sarvā saśailavanakānanā // / / //🔽sa ca taṃ śailasaṃghātaṃ daityair nyastam athopari /
analyzed: cacāla ca mahī sarvā sa śaila vana kānanā  sa ca tam śaila saṃghātam daityaiḥ nyastam atha upari
translated: The whole earth, with its mountains, forests and groves, trembled.🔽And he, the greatly wise one, having placed that mass of mountains on top, as placed by the demons,

original: prakṣipya tasmāt salilān niścakrāma mahāmatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: prakṣipya tasmāt salilāt niścakrāma mahāmatiḥ
translated: emerged from the water.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca sa jagad bhūyo gaganādyupalakṣaṇam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca sa jagat bhūyaḥ gagana ādi upalakṣaṇam
translated: And seeing the world again, characterized by the sky and so on,

original: prahlādo 'smīti sasmāra punar ātmānam ātmanā // / / //
analyzed: prahlādaḥ smi iti sasmāra punar ātmānam ātmanā
translated: Prahlada remembered himself by himself, thinking I am Prahlada.

original: tuṣṭāva ca punar dhīmān anādiṃ puruṣottamam /
analyzed: tuṣṭāva ca punar dhīmān anādim puruṣottamam
translated: And the wise one again praised the beginningless Supreme Being,

original: ekāgramatir avyagro yatavākkāyamānasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ekāgra matiḥ avyagraḥ yata vāc kāya mānasaḥ
translated: with a one-pointed mind, undisturbed, with controlled speech, body and mind.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlada said:

original: oṃ namaḥ paramārthārtha sthūlasūkṣma kṣarākṣara /
analyzed: om namaḥ paramārtha artha sthūla sūkṣma kṣara akṣara
translated: Om, salutations to the Supreme Reality, the gross, the subtle, the perishable and the imperishable,

original: vyaktāvyakta kalātīta sakaleśa nirañjana // / / //
analyzed: vyakta avyakta kalā atīta sakala īśa nirañjana
translated: The manifest, the unmanifest, beyond the constituents, the possessor of all parts, the unstained,

original: guṇāñjana guṇādhāra nirguṇātman guṇasthita /
analyzed: guṇa añjana guṇa ādhāra nirguṇa ātman guṇa sthita
translated: The bestower of qualities, the support of qualities, of the nature of the attributeless, abiding in the attributes,

original: mūrtāmūrta mahāmūrte sūkṣmamūrte sphuṭāsphuṭa // / / //
analyzed: mūrta amūrta mahā mūrte sūkṣma mūrte sphuṭa asphuṭa
translated: The embodied, the unembodied, the great embodied, the subtle embodied, the manifest and the unmanifest,

original: karālasaumyarūpātman vidyāvidyāmayācyuta /
analyzed: karāla saumya rūpa ātman vidyā avidyā maya acyuta
translated: The fearful and the gentle-formed, the imperishable one consisting of knowledge and ignorance,

original: sadasadrūpasadbhāva sadasadbhāvabhāvana // / / //
analyzed: sat asat rūpa sadbhāva sat asat bhāva bhāvana
translated: The existent and the non-existent, the reality of the existent and the non-existent, the conceiver of the existent and the non-existent,

original: nityānitya prapañcātman niṣprapañcāmalāśraya /
analyzed: nitya anitya prapañca ātman niṣprapañca amala āśraya
translated: The eternal and the non-eternal, the universe, the support of the non-eternal, the pure one,

original: ekāneka namas tubhyaṃ vāsudevādikāraṇa // / / //
analyzed: eka aneka namaḥ tubhyam vāsudeva ādikāraṇa
translated: Salutations to you, the one and the many, the cause of Vāsudeva and others.

original: yaḥ sthūlasūkṣmaḥ prakaṭaprakāśo yaḥ sarvabhūto na ca sarvabhūtaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ sthūla sūkṣmaḥ prakaṭa prakāśaḥ yaḥ sarva bhūtaḥ na ca sarva bhūtaḥ
translated: He who is gross and subtle, the manifest light, who is all beings and yet not all beings,

original: viśvaṃ yataś caitad aviśvahetor namo 'stu tasmai puruṣottamāya // / / //
analyzed: viśvam yatas ca etat a viśva hetoḥ namaḥ stu tasmai puruṣottamāya
translated: From whom this universe originates, the cause of the universe, salutations to that Supreme Being.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tasya taccetaso devaḥ stutim itthaṃ prakurvataḥ /
analyzed: tasya tad cetasaḥ devaḥ stutim ittham prakurvataḥ
translated: To his mind engaged in such praise,

original: āvirbabhūva bhagavān pītāmbaradharo hariḥ // / / //
analyzed: āvirbabhūva bhagavān pīta ambara dharaḥ hariḥ
translated: the Blessed Lord Hari, clad in yellow garments, appeared.

original: sasaṃbhramas tam ālokya samutthāyākulākṣaram /
analyzed: sa saṃbhramaḥ tam ālokya samutthāya ākula akṣaram
translated: Seeing him, he was agitated and rose up, his words faltering,

original: namo 'stu viṣṇavaity etad vyājahārāsakṛd dvija // / / //
analyzed: namaḥ stu viṣṇavā eti etat vyājahāra asakṛt dvija
translated: Salutation to Vishnu - this the Brahmana uttered repeatedly.

original: prahlāda uvāca /🔽deva prapannārtihara prasādaṃ kuru keśava /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca  deva prapanna ārti hara prasādam kuru keśava
translated: Prahlada said:🔽O God, remover of the distress of those who have surrendered, be gracious.

original: avalokanadānena bhūyo māṃ pāvayāvyaya // / / //
analyzed: avalokana dānena bhūyas mām pāvaya avyaya
translated: O Keshava, purify me again by the gift of your glance, O imperishable one.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: kurvatas te prasanno 'haṃ bhaktim avyabhicāriṇīm /
analyzed: kurvataḥ te prasannaḥ ham bhaktim avyabhicāriṇīm
translated: I am pleased with your unwavering devotion.

original: yathābhilaṣito mattaḥ prahlāda vriyatāṃ varaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yathā abhilaṣitaḥ mattaḥ prahlāda vriyatām varaḥ
translated: O Prahlada, choose a boon from me, as desired by you.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlada said:

original: nātha yonisahasreṣu yeṣu yeṣu vrajāmy aham /
analyzed: na atha yoni sahasreṣu yeṣu yeṣu vrajāmi aham
translated: O Lord, in whatever thousands of wombs I go,

original: teṣu teṣv acyutā bhaktir acyutāstu sadā tvayi // / / //🔽yā prītir avivekānāṃ viṣayeṣv anapāyinī /
analyzed: teṣu teṣu acyutā bhaktiḥ acyuta astu sadā tvayi  yā prītiḥ a vivekānām viṣayeṣu anapāyinī
translated: may my devotion to you, O Imperishable One, always be unshakable.

original: tvām anusmarataḥ sā me hṛdayān māpasarpatu // / / //
analyzed: tvām anusmarataḥ sā me hṛdayāt mā apasarpatu
translated: May that affection which the undiscerning have for objects of sense, never leave my heart as I think of you.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: mayi bhaktis tavāsty eva bhūyo 'py evaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: mayi bhaktiḥ tava asti eva bhūyas u pi evam bhaviṣyati
translated: You have devotion to me, and it will be so again.

original: varaś ca mattaḥ prahlāda vriyatāṃ yas tavepsitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: varaḥ ca mattaḥ prahlāda vriyatām yaḥ tava īpsitaḥ
translated: And choose a boon from me, O Prahlada, which you desire.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlada said:

original: mayi dveṣānubandho 'bhūt saṃstutāv udyate tava /
analyzed: mayi dveṣa anubandhaḥ bhūt saṃstutau udyate tava
translated: When praise was offered to you, there was a feeling of enmity in me.

original: matpitus tatkṛtaṃ pāpaṃ deva tasya praṇaśyatu // / / //
analyzed: mad pituḥ tat kṛtam pāpam deva tasya praṇaśyatu
translated: May the sin committed by my father, O Lord, be destroyed for him.

original: śastrāṇi pātitāny aṅge kṣipto yac cāgnisaṃhatau /
analyzed: śastrāṇi pātitāni aṅge kṣiptaḥ yat ca agni saṃhatau
translated: The weapons that were hurled on his body, and the fact that he was thrown into a mass of fire,

original: daṃśitaś coragair dattaṃ yad viṣaṃ mama bhojane // / / //
analyzed: daṃśitaḥ ca uragaiḥ dattam yat viṣam mama bhojane
translated: And the poison that was given in my food by the serpents who were bound,

original: baddhvā samudre yat kṣipto yac cito 'smi śiloccayaiḥ /
analyzed: baddhvā samudre yat kṣiptaḥ yat citaḥ smi śiloccayaiḥ
translated: The fact that he was bound and thrown into the ocean, and that he was crushed by mountains,

original: anyāni cāpy asādhūni yāni pitrā kṛtāni me // / / //
analyzed: anyāni ca api asādhūni yāni pitrā kṛtāni me
translated: And the other evil deeds that were done by my father,

original: tvayi bhaktimato dveṣād aghaṃ tatsaṃbhavaṃ ca yat /
analyzed: tvayi bhaktimataḥ dveṣāt agham tad saṃbhavam ca yat
translated: The sin arising from that, O Lord, due to enmity towards one who has devotion to you,

original: tvatprasādāt prabho sadyas tena mucyeta me pitā // / / //
analyzed: tvad prasādāt prabho sadyas tena mucyeta me pitā
translated: May my father be immediately freed from that, by your grace, O Lord.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: prahlāda sarvam etat te matprasādād bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: prahlāda sarvam etat te mad prasādāt bhaviṣyati
translated: Prahlāda, all this will happen to you by my grace.

original: anyaṃ ca te varaṃ dadmi vriyatām asurātmaja // / / //
analyzed: anyam ca te varam dadmi vriyatām asura ātmaja
translated: And I will give you another boon, O son of the asura. Choose it.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlāda said:

original: kṛtakṛtyo 'smi bhagavan vareṇānena yat tvayi /
analyzed: kṛtakṛtyaḥ smi bhagavan vareṇa anena yat tvayi
translated: O Blessed One, I am satisfied with this boon that I have from you.

original: bhavitrī tvatprasādena bhaktir avyabhicāriṇī // / / //
analyzed: bhavitrī tvad prasādena bhaktiḥ avyabhicāriṇī
translated: By your grace, may there be unwavering devotion to you.

original: dharmārthakāmaiḥ kiṃ tasya muktis tasya kare sthitā /
analyzed: dharma artha kāmaiḥ kim tasya muktiḥ tasya kare sthitā
translated: What is the use of dharma, artha and kāma for him? Liberation is in his hand.

original: samastajagatāṃ mūle yasya bhaktiḥ sthirā tvayi // / / //
analyzed: samasta jagatām mūle yasya bhaktiḥ sthirā tvayi
translated: And whose devotion to you is firm at the root of all beings,

original: śrībhagavān uvāca /🔽yathā te niścalaṃ ceto mayi bhaktisamanvitam /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca  yathā te niścalam cetaḥ mayi bhakti samanvitam
translated: The Blessed Lord said:🔽As your mind is unwavering and full of devotion in Me,

original: tathā tvaṃ matprasādena nirvāṇaṃ param āpsyasi // / / //
analyzed: tathā tvam mad prasādena nirvāṇam param āpsyasi
translated: in the same way, by My grace, you will attain the highest liberation.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity uktvāntardadhe viṣṇus tasya maitreya paśyataḥ /
analyzed: iti uktvā antardadhe viṣṇuḥ tasya maitreya paśyataḥ
translated: Having said this, Vishnu disappeared, O Maitreya, while he was watching.

original: sa cāpi punar āgamya vavande caraṇau pituḥ // / / //🔽taṃ pitā mūrdhny upāghrāya pariṣvajya ca pīḍitam /
analyzed: sa ca api punar āgamya vavande caraṇau pituḥ  tam pitā mūrdhni upāghrāya pariṣvajya ca pīḍitam
translated: And he too, having returned, bowed at his father's feet.

original: jīvasīty āha vatseti bāṣpārdranayano dvija // / / //
analyzed: jīvasi iti āha vatsa iti bāṣpa ārdra nayanaḥ dvija
translated: The father, smelling the head of the afflicted one and embracing him, said, You are alive, O child, with eyes wet with tears, O Brahmin.

original: prītimāṃś cābhavat tasminn anutāpī mahāsuraḥ /
analyzed: prītimān ca abhavat tasmin anutāpī mahā asuraḥ
translated: And the great demon, full of joy and remorse,

original: gurupitroś cakāraivaṃ śuśrūṣāṃ so 'pi dharmavit // / / //🔽pitary uparatiṃ nīte narasiṃhasvarūpiṇā /
analyzed: guru pitroḥ cakāra evam śuśrūṣām saḥ pi dharma vid  pitari uparatim nīte narasiṃha svarūpiṇā
translated: and he, knowing dharma, thus served his guru and father.🔽When his father was led to rest by Vishnu in the form of Narasimha,

original: viṣṇunā so 'pi daityānāṃ maitreyābhūt patis tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇunā saḥ pi daityānām maitreya abhūt patiḥ tatas
translated: he too became the lord of the demons, O Maitreya.

original: tadrājyabhūtiṃ saṃprāpya karmaśuddhikarīṃ dvija /
analyzed: tad rājya bhūtim saṃprāpya karma śuddhi karīm dvija
translated: Having attained the prosperity of that kingdom, which purifies one's actions, O Brahmin,

original: putrapautrāṃś ca subahūn avāpyaiśvaryam eva ca // / / //
analyzed: putra pautrān ca su bahūn avāpya aiśvaryam eva ca
translated: and having obtained many sons, grandsons, and wealth,

original: kṣīṇādhikāraḥ sa yadā puṇyapāpavivarjitaḥ /
analyzed: kṣīṇa adhikāraḥ sa yadā puṇya pāpa vivarjitaḥ
translated: When he had exhausted his merit and demerit, and was freed from the consequences of his good and evil deeds,

original: tadāsau bhagavaddhyānāt paraṃ nirvāṇam āptavān // / / //
analyzed: tadā asau bhagavat dhyānāt param nirvāṇam āptavān
translated: then he attained the highest state of Nirvana by the meditation of the Lord.

original: evaṃprabhāvo daityo 'sau maitreyāsīn mahāmatiḥ /
analyzed: evaṃprabhāvaḥ sau maitreya āsīt mahāmatiḥ
translated: Such was the power of that Daitya, O Maitreya, the greatly wise Prahlada,

original: prahlādo bhagavadbhakto yaṃ tvaṃ mām anupṛcchasi // / / //
analyzed: prahlādaḥ bhagavat bhaktaḥ yam tvam mām anupṛcchasi
translated: the devotee of the Lord, of whom you have asked me.

original: yas tv etac caritaṃ tasya prahlādasya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tu etat caritam tasya prahlādasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: He who listens to this story of the great soul Prahlada,

original: śṛṇoti tasya pāpāni sadyo gacchanti saṃkṣayam // / / //🔽ahorātrakṛtaṃ pāpaṃ prahlādacaritaṃ naraḥ /
analyzed: śṛṇoti tasya pāpāni sadyas gacchanti saṃkṣayam  ahorātra kṛtam pāpam prahlāda caritam naraḥ
translated: his sins immediately perish.🔽The sin committed during a day and night, a man who listens to and recites the story of Prahlada,

original: śṛṇvan paṭhaṃś ca maitreya vyapohati na saṃśayaḥ // / / //🔽paurṇamāsyām amāvāsyām aṣṭamyām atha vā paṭhan /
analyzed: śṛṇvan paṭhan ca maitreya vyapohati na saṃśayaḥ  paurṇamāsyām amāvāsyām aṣṭamyām atha vā paṭhan
translated: removes it, O Maitreya, there is no doubt.🔽One who recites it on the full moon day, the new moon day, the eighth day, or the twelfth day,

original: dvādaśyāṃ vā tad āpnoti gopradānaphalaṃ dvija // / / //
analyzed: dvādaśyām vā tat āpnoti go pradāna phalam dvija
translated: obtains, O Brahmin, the fruit of the gift of a cow.

original: prahlādaṃ sakalāpatsu yathā rakṣitavān hariḥ /
analyzed: prahlādam sakala āpatsu yathā rakṣitavān hariḥ
translated: As Hari protected Prahlada in all calamities,

original: tathā rakṣati yas tasya śṛṇoti caritaṃ sadā // / / //
analyzed: tathā rakṣati yaḥ tasya śṛṇoti caritam sadā
translated: so he always protects him who listens to his story.

original: ins /
analyzed: d ins
translated: Inserts:

original: karuṇaṃ caraṇānamre cāruṇaṃ praṇatadruhi // / / / //
analyzed: karuṇam caraṇa ānamre ca aruṇam praṇata druhi
translated: And the tender feet of the compassionate one, which are red to the enemies who bow down.

original: prahlādavaradaṃ vande nṛsiṃhaghṛṇibhīṣaṇaṃ // / / / //
translated: I praise the boon-granting Narasimha, terrifying with wrath.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe prathame 'ṃśe viṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe prathame ṃśe viṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twentieth chapter in the first section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: saṃhlādaputra āyuṣmāñ śibir bāṣkala eva ca /
analyzed: saṃhlāda putraḥ āyuṣmān śibiḥ bāṣkalaḥ eva ca
translated: The long-lived Shibi and Bashkala were the sons of Samhlāda.

original: virocanas tu prāhlādir balir jajñe virocanāt // / / //
analyzed: virocanaḥ tu prāhlādiḥ baliḥ jajñe virocanāt
translated: But Virochana, the son of Prahlāda, had a son named Bali.

original: baleḥ putraśataṃ tv āsīd bāṇajyeṣṭhaṃ mahāmune /
analyzed: baleḥ putra śatam tu āsīt bāṇa jyeṣṭham mahā mune
translated: O great sage, Bali had a hundred sons, with Bāṇa as the eldest.

original: hiraṇyākṣasutāś cāsan sarva eva mahābalāḥ // / / //
analyzed: hiraṇyākṣa sutāḥ ca āsan sarve eva mahā balāḥ
translated: All the sons of Hiraṇyākṣa were extremely powerful.

original: jharjharaḥ śakuniś caiva bhūtasaṃtāpanas tathā /
analyzed: jharjharaḥ śakuniḥ ca eva bhūtasaṃtāpanaḥ tathā
translated: Jharjhara, Śakuni, Bhūta-santāpana,

original: mahānābho mahābāhuḥ kālanābhas tathāparaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mahānābhaḥ mahābāhuḥ kālanābhaḥ tathā aparaḥ
translated: Mahānābha, Mahābāhu, and another Kālanābha,

original: abhavan danuputrāś ca dvimūrdhā śaṃkaras tathā /
analyzed: abhavan danu putrāḥ ca dvimūrdhā śaṃkaraḥ tathā
translated: and the sons of Danu were Dvimūrdhā, Śaṅkara,

original: ayomukhaḥ śaṅkuśirāḥ kapilaḥ śambaras tathā // / / //
analyzed: ayomukhaḥ śaṅkuśirāḥ kapilaḥ śambaraḥ tathā
translated: Ayamaukha, Śaṅkuśiras, Kapila, Śambara,

original: ekacakro mahābāhus tārakaś ca mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: ekacakraḥ mahā bāhuḥ tārakaḥ ca mahā balaḥ
translated: Ekacakra, Mahābāhu, and the greatly powerful Tāraka.

original: svarbhānur vṛṣaparvā ca pulomā ca mahābalaḥ // / / //

analyzed: m ins l only after ap
translated: Inserts only after.

original: subst / only for /🔽mṛgāṇām api sarveṣāṃ rājye siṃhaṃ dadau vibhuḥ // / / / //
analyzed: subst l only for ab  mṛgāṇām api sarveṣām rājye siṃham dadau vibhuḥ
translated: Substitutes only for.🔽The lord made the lion the king of all the beasts.

original: kravyādānāṃ daṃṣṭriṇāṃ ca mṛgāṇāṃ vyāghram īśvaram // / / / //
analyzed: kravyādānām daṃṣṭriṇām ca mṛgāṇām vyāghram īśvaram
translated: And the tiger the lord of the carnivorous, fanged beasts.

original: vanaspatīnāṃ rājānaṃ plakṣam evābhyaṣecayat // / / //🔽ed / Veṅk / ins / after /
analyzed: vanaspatīnām rājānam plakṣam eva abhyaṣecayat  veṅk ins after
translated: And consecrated the king of the trees, the fig tree, as the king of trees.

original: evaṃ vibhajya jātīnāṃ prādhānyenākarot prabhūn // / / //
analyzed: evam vibhajya jātīnām prādhānyena akarot prabhūn
translated: Thus dividing the species, he made the principal ones...

original: evaṃ vibhajya rājyāni diśāṃ pālān anantaram /
analyzed: evam vibhajya rājyāni diśām pālān anantaram
translated: Thus dividing the kingdoms, he then established the guardians of the directions.

original: prajāpatipatir brahmā sthāpayām āsa sarvataḥ // / / //🔽pūrvasyāṃ diśi rājānaṃ vairājasya prajāpateḥ /
analyzed: prajāpati patiḥ brahmā sthāpayām āsa sarvatas  pūrvasyām diśi rājānam vairājasya prajāpateḥ
translated: Brahma, the lord of Prajapati, established them everywhere...🔽In the eastern direction, he consecrated the king Sudhanva, the son of the Prajapati Vairaja,

original: diśāpālaṃ sudhanvānaṃ rājānaṃ so 'bhyaṣecayat // / / //🔽dakṣiṇasyāṃ diśi tathā kardamasya prajāpateḥ /
analyzed: diśāpālam sudhanvānam rājānam saḥ bhyaṣecayat  dakṣiṇasyām diśi tathā kardamasya prajāpateḥ
translated: as the guardian of the direction.

original: putraṃ śaṅkhapadaṃ nāma rājānaṃ so 'bhyaṣecayat // / / //
analyzed: putram śaṅkhapadam nāma rājānam saḥ bhyaṣecayat
translated: In the southern direction, he consecrated the son of the Prajapati Kardama, named Shankhapada, as the king.

original: paścimasyāṃ diśi tathā rajasaḥ putram acyutam /
analyzed: paścimasyām diśi tathā rajasaḥ putram acyutam
translated: In the western direction, he consecrated the son of Rajas, the imperishable one,

original: ketumantaṃ mahātmānaṃ rājānam abhiṣiktavān // / / //🔽tathā hiraṇyaromāṇaṃ parjanyasya prajāpateḥ /
analyzed: ketumantam mahātmānam rājānam abhiṣiktavān  tathā hiraṇya romāṇam parjanyasya prajāpateḥ
translated: the great-souled king Ketumata.🔽In the northern direction, he consecrated the invincible son of the Prajapati Hiranyaroma,

original: udīcyāṃ diśi durdharṣaṃ rājānaṃ so 'bhyaṣecayat // / / //
analyzed: udīcyām diśi durdharṣam rājānam saḥ bhyaṣecayat
translated: as the king.

original: tair iyaṃ pṛthivī sarvā saptadvīpā sakānanā /
analyzed: taiḥ iyam pṛthivī sarvā saptadvīpā sa kānanā
translated: By them, this entire earth with its seven islands and forests,

original: yathāpradeśam adyāpi dharmataḥ paripālyate // / / //🔽ete sarve pravṛttasya sthitau viṣṇor mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: yathāpradeśam adya api dharmataḥ paripālyate  ete sarve pravṛttasya sthitau viṣṇoḥ mahātmanaḥ
translated: even to this day, they are being protected according to the law in their respective regions.🔽All these kings and other great kings who have come, O best of sages,

original: vibhūtibhūtā rājāno ye cānye munisattama // / / //
analyzed: vibhūti bhūtāḥ rājānaḥ ye ca anye muni sattama
translated: are the manifestations of the great Vishnu, who is engaged in the maintenance of the world.

original: ye bhaviṣyanti ye bhūtāḥ sarvabhūteśvarā dvija /
analyzed: ye bhaviṣyanti ye bhūtāḥ sarva bhūta īśvarāḥ dvija
translated: O best of Brahmins, all those who have been, who are, or who will be the lords of all beings,

original: te sarve sarvabhūtasya viṣṇor aṃśā dvijottama // / / //🔽ye tu devādhipatayo ye ca daityādhipās tathā /
analyzed: te sarve sarva bhūtasya viṣṇoḥ aṃśāḥ dvijottama  ye tu deva adhipatayaḥ ye ca daitya adhipāḥ tathā
translated: are all parts of Vishnu, the Lord of all beings, O best of Brahmins.🔽Those who are the lords of the gods, those who are the lords of the demons,

original: dānavānāṃ ca ye nāthā ye nāthāḥ piśitāśinām // / / //
analyzed: dānavānām ca ye nāthāḥ ye nāthāḥ piśitāśinām
translated: those who are the lords of the Danavas, those who are the lords of the flesh-eaters,

original: paśūnāṃ ye ca patayaḥ patayo ye ca pakṣiṇām /
analyzed: paśūnām ye ca patayaḥ patayaḥ ye ca pakṣiṇām
translated: those who are the lords of the animals, those who are the lords of the birds,

original: manuṣyāṇāṃ ca sarpāṇāṃ nāgānāṃ cādhipās tu ye // / / //
analyzed: manuṣyāṇām ca sarpāṇām nāgānām ca adhipāḥ tu ye
translated: those who are the lords of men, serpents, and Nagas,

original: vṛkṣāṇāṃ parvatānāṃ ca grahāṇāṃ cāpi ye 'dhipāḥ /
analyzed: vṛkṣāṇām parvatānām ca grahāṇām ca api ye dhipāḥ
translated: those who are the lords of trees, mountains, and planets,

original: atītā vartamānāś ca ye bhaviṣyanti cāpare /
analyzed: atītāḥ vartamānāḥ ca ye bhaviṣyanti ca apare
translated: whether past, present, or future,

original: te sarve sarvabhūtasya viṣṇor aṃśasamudbhavāḥ // / / //🔽na hi pālanasāmarthyam ṛte sarveśvaraṃ harim /
analyzed: te sarve sarva bhūtasya viṣṇoḥ aṃśa samudbhavāḥ  na hi pālana sāmarthyam ṛte sarva īśvaram harim
translated: all of them have originated from a part of Vishnu, the Lord of all beings.🔽For without Hari, the Lord of all,🔽no one else can have the power to maintain the world, O greatly wise one,

original: sthitau sthitaṃ mahāprājña bhavaty anyasya kasyacit // / / //
analyzed: sthitau sthitam mahā prājña bhavati anyasya kasyacid
translated: whether in the past, present, or future.

original: sṛjaty eṣa jagat sṛṣṭau sthitau pāti sanātanaḥ /
analyzed: sṛjati eṣa jagat sṛṣṭau sthitau pāti sanātanaḥ
translated: He creates the world at the time of creation, and as the eternal one, he protects it during sustenance.

original: hanti caivāntakatve ca rajaḥsattvādisaṃśrayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: hanti ca eva antaka tve ca rajaḥ sattva ādi saṃśrayaḥ
translated: And at the time of destruction, he destroys it, resorting to rajas and sattva qualities.

original: caturvibhāgaḥ saṃsṛṣṭau caturdhā saṃsthitaḥ sthitau /
analyzed: catur vibhāgaḥ saṃsṛṣṭau caturdhā saṃsthitaḥ sthitau
translated: In creation, he is divided into four parts, and in sustenance, he remains in four ways.

original: pralayaṃ ca karoty ante caturbhedo janārdanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pralayam ca karoti ante catur bhedaḥ janārdanaḥ
translated: At the end, Janardana, in four forms, brings about dissolution.

original: ekenāṃśena brahmāsau bhavaty avyaktamūrtimān /
analyzed: ekena aṃśena brahmā asau bhavati avyakta mūrtimān
translated: With one part, he becomes Brahma, having an unmanifest form.

original: marīcimiśrāḥ patayaḥ prajānām anyabhāgataḥ // / / //
analyzed: marīci miśrāḥ patayaḥ prajānām anya bhāgataḥ
translated: The lords of beings, along with Marichi, are from another part.

original: kālas tṛtīyas tasyāṃśaḥ sarvabhūtāni cāparaḥ /
analyzed: kālaḥ tṛtīyaḥ tasya aṃśaḥ sarva bhūtāni ca aparaḥ
translated: Time is his third part, and another is all beings.

original: itthaṃ caturdhā saṃsṛṣṭau vartate 'sau rajoguṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ittham caturdhā saṃsṛṣṭau vartate rajaḥ guṇaḥ
translated: Thus, resorting to the rajas quality, he exists in four ways during creation.

original: ekāṃśenāsthito viṣṇuḥ karoti paripālanam /
analyzed: eka aṃśena āsthitaḥ viṣṇuḥ karoti paripālanam
translated: With one part, Vishnu remains and performs protection.

original: manvādirūpī cānyena kālarūpo 'pareṇa ca // / / //
analyzed: manu ādi rūpī ca anyena kāla rūpaḥ pareṇa ca
translated: And in another form, as Manu and others, and in another as time,

original: sarvabhūteṣu cānyena saṃsthitaḥ kurute sthitim /
analyzed: sarva bhūteṣu ca anyena saṃsthitaḥ kurute sthitim
translated: and in another in all beings, he remains and brings about sustenance.

original: sattvaṃ guṇaṃ samāśritya jagataḥ puruṣottamaḥ // / / //🔽āśritya tamaso vṛttim antakāle tathā prabhuḥ /
analyzed: sattvam guṇam samāśritya jagataḥ puruṣottamaḥ  āśritya tamasaḥ vṛttim anta kāle tathā prabhuḥ
translated: The best of beings, resorting to the sattva quality,

original: rudrasvarūpī bhagavān ekāṃśena bhavaty ajaḥ // / / //
translated: and at the time of destruction, the lord, the unborn one, becomes Rudra, resorting to the mode of tamas, with one part.

original: agnyantakādirūpeṇa bhāgenānyena vartate /
analyzed: agni antaka ādi rūpeṇa bhāgena anyena vartate
translated: He exists in another part in the form of Agni, Antaka (destroyer), etc.

original: kālasvarūpo bhāgo 'nyaḥ sarvabhūtāni cāparaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāla svarūpaḥ bhāgaḥ nyaḥ sarva bhūtāni ca aparaḥ
translated: Another part is in the form of time, and another in all beings.

original: vināśaṃ kurvatas tasya caturdhaivaṃ mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: vināśam kurvataḥ tasya caturdhā evam mahātmanaḥ
translated: Thus, of that great soul who brings about destruction in four ways,

original: vibhāgakalpanā brahman kathyate sārvakālikī // / / //
analyzed: vibhāga kalpanā brahman kathyate sārvakālikī
translated: The imagination of division is described, O Brahmin, as being for all time.

original: brahmā dakṣādayaḥ kālas tathaivākhilajantavaḥ /
analyzed: brahmā dakṣa ādayaḥ kālaḥ tathā eva akhila jantavaḥ
translated: Brahma, Daksha and others, time, and all living beings,

original: vibhūtayo harer etā jagataḥ sṛṣṭihetavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vibhūtayaḥ hareḥ etāḥ jagataḥ sṛṣṭi hetavaḥ
translated: These are the manifestations of Hari, the causes of the creation of the world.

original: viṣṇur manvādayaḥ kālaḥ sarvabhūtāni ca dvija /
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ manu ādayaḥ kālaḥ sarva bhūtāni ca dvija
translated: Vishnu, Manu and others, time, and all beings, O Brahmin,

original: sthiter nimittabhūtasya viṣṇor etā vibhūtayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sthiteḥ nimitta bhūtasya viṣṇoḥ etāḥ vibhūtayaḥ
translated: These are the manifestations of Vishnu, the cause of sustenance.

original: rudraḥ kālo 'ntakādyāś ca samastāś caiva jantavaḥ /
analyzed: rudraḥ kālaḥ antaka ādyāḥ ca samastāḥ ca eva jantavaḥ
translated: Rudra, time, the destroyers and all living beings,

original: caturdhā pralayāyaitā janārdanavibhūtayaḥ // / / //🔽jagadādau tathā madhye sṛṣṭir āpralayād dvija /
analyzed: caturdhā pralayāya etāḥ janārdana vibhūtayaḥ  jagat ādau tathā madhye sṛṣṭiḥ ā pralayāt dvija
translated: These are the four manifestations of Janardana for dissolution.🔽O Brahmin, in the beginning and middle of the world, creation is done until dissolution,

original: dhātrā marīcimiśraiś ca kriyate jantubhis tathā // / / //
analyzed: dhātrā marīci miśraiḥ ca kriyate jantubhiḥ tathā
translated: By the creator, by Marichi and others, and by living beings.

original: brahmā sṛjaty ādikāle marīcipramukhās tataḥ /
analyzed: brahmā sṛjati ādi kāle marīci pramukhāḥ tatas
translated: Brahma creates in the beginning, then Marichi and others,

original: utpādayanty apatyāni jantavaś ca pratikṣaṇam // / / //
analyzed: utpādayanti apatyāni jantavaḥ ca pratikṣaṇam
translated: And living beings produce offspring every moment.

original: kālena na vinā brahmā sṛṣṭiniṣpādako dvija /
analyzed: kālena na vinā brahmā sṛṣṭi niṣpādakaḥ dvija
translated: Without Time, O twice-born one, neither Brahman, the creator of the universe,🔽nor all the Prajāpatis, nor all living beings,

original: na prajāpatayaḥ sarve na caivākhilajantavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na prajāpatayaḥ sarve na ca eva akhila jantavaḥ
translated: can exist.

original: evam eva vibhāgo 'yaṃ sthitāv apy upadiśyate /
analyzed: evam eva vibhāgaḥ yam sthitau api upadiśyate
translated: Even so, this division is taught to exist in the case of dissolution also.

original: caturdhā devadevasya maitreya pralaye tathā // / / //
analyzed: caturdhā devadevasya maitreya pralaye tathā
translated: O Maitreya, in the dissolution of the Lord of gods, it is of four kinds.

original: yat kiṃcit sṛjyate yena sattvajātena vai dvija /
analyzed: yat kiṃcid sṛjyate yena sattva jātena vai dvija
translated: Whatever is created by any being, O twice-born,

original: tasya sṛjyasya saṃbhūtau tat sarvaṃ vai hares tanuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasya sṛjyasya saṃbhūtau tat sarvam vai hareḥ tanuḥ
translated: all that is the body of Hari in the creation of that which is to be created.

original: hanti yāvat kvacit kiṃcit bhūtaṃ sthāvarajaṅgamam /
analyzed: hanti yāvat kvacid kiṃcid bhūtam sthāvara jaṅgamam
translated: Whatever is destroyed somewhere, whether moving or unmoving,

original: janārdanasya tad raudraṃ maitreyāntakaraṃ vapuḥ // / / //🔽evam eva jagatsraṣṭā jagatpātā tathā jagat /
analyzed: janārdanasya tat raudram maitreya anta karam vapuḥ  evam eva jagatsraṣṭā jagat pātā tathā jagat
translated: that is the destructive form of Janardana, O Maitreya.

original: jagadbhakṣayitā devaḥ samastasya janārdanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: jagat bhakṣayitā devaḥ samastasya janārdanaḥ
translated: Thus, the Lord Janardana is the creator, the protector, and the destroyer of the world.

original: sargasthityantakāleṣu tridhaivaṃ saṃpravartate /
analyzed: sarga sthiti anta kāleṣu tridhā evam saṃpravartate
translated: In the beginning, middle, and end of the world, he acts in three ways.

original: guṇapravṛttyā paramaṃ padaṃ tasyāguṇaṃ mahat // / / //
analyzed: guṇa pravṛttyā paramam padam tasya aguṇam mahat
translated: By the activity of the qualities, he attains the highest state, which is free from qualities and great.

original: tac ca jñānamayaṃ vyāpi svasaṃvedyam anaupamam /
analyzed: tat ca jñāna mayam vyāpi sva saṃvedyam anaupamam
translated: That is knowledge-based, all-pervading, self-realizable, and incomparable.

original: catuṣprakāraṃ tad api svarūpaṃ paramātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: catuṣprakāram tat api svarūpam paramātmanaḥ
translated: That is also of four kinds, the form of the Supreme Self.

original: maitreya uvāca /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca
translated: Maitreya said:

original: catuṣprakāratāṃ tasya brahmabhūtasya vai mune /
analyzed: catuṣprakāra tām tasya brahma bhūtasya vai mune
translated: O sage, please explain to me the four aspects of that Brahman-hood,

original: tvām ācakṣva yathānyāyaṃ yad uktaṃ paramaṃ padam // / / //
analyzed: tvām ācakṣva yathānyāyam yat uktam paramam padam
translated: as they are properly stated, of the supreme state that has been spoken of.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: maitreya kāraṇaṃ proktaṃ sādhanaṃ sarvavastuṣu /
analyzed: maitreya kāraṇam proktam sādhanam sarva vastuṣu
translated: Maitreya, the means is said to be the cause in all matters.

original: sādhyaṃ ca vastv abhimataṃ yat sādhayitum ātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sādhyam ca vastu abhimatam yat sādhayitum ātmanaḥ
translated: And the desired object to be accomplished is that which one wishes to accomplish for oneself.

original: yogino muktikāmasya prāṇāyāmādi sādhanam /
analyzed: yoginaḥ mukti kāmasya prāṇāyāma ādi sādhanam
translated: For the yogi who desires liberation, the means are breath control and so on.

original: sādhyaṃ ca paramaṃ brahma punar nāvartate yataḥ // / / //
analyzed: sādhyam ca paramam brahma punar na āvartate yatas
translated: And the supreme Brahman is to be accomplished, from which one does not return.

original: sādhanālambanaṃ jñānaṃ muktaye yogināṃ hi yat /
analyzed: sādhana ālambanam jñānam muktaye yoginām hi yat
translated: For the liberation of yogis, the knowledge that has the means as its object,

original: sa bhedaḥ prathamas tasya jñānabhūtasya vai mune // / / //
analyzed: sa bhedaḥ prathamaḥ tasya jñāna bhūtasya vai mune
translated: that, O sage, is the first aspect of that which is in the form of knowledge.

original: yuñjataḥ kleśamuktyarthaṃ sādhyaṃ yad brahmayoginaḥ /
analyzed: yuñjataḥ kleśa mukti artham sādhyam yat brahma yoginaḥ
translated: For the yogi who practices to attain Brahman for the sake of liberation from afflictions,

original: tadālambanavijñānaṃ dvitīyo 'ṃśo mahāmune // / / //
analyzed: tad ālambana vijñānam dvitīyaḥ ṃśaḥ mahā mune
translated: the knowledge that has that as its object is the second part, O great sage.

original: ubhayos tv avibhāgena sādhyasādhanayor hi yat /
analyzed: ubhayoḥ tu avibhāgena sādhya sādhanayoḥ hi yat
translated: But that which is the non-differentiation of both the means and the object to be accomplished,

original: vijñānam advaitamayaṃ tadbhāgo 'nyo mayoditaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vijñānam advaita mayam tad bhāgaḥ nyaḥ mayā uditaḥ
translated: the knowledge that is of the nature of non-duality, that is another part declared by me.

original: jñānatrayasya caitasya viśeṣo yo mahāmune /
analyzed: jñāna trayasya ca etasya viśeṣaḥ yaḥ mahā mune
translated: And, O great sage, the distinction of this triad of knowledge,

original: tan nirākaraṇadvāradarśitātmasvarūpavat // / / //
translated: Like the nature of the self shown through the door of refuting that.

original: nirvyāpāram anākhyeyaṃ vyāptimātram anaupamam /
analyzed: nirvyāpāram anākhyeyam vyāpti mātram anaupamam
translated: It is without activity, indescribable, merely pervasive, incomparable,

original: ātmasaṃbodhaviṣayaṃ sattāmātram alakṣaṇam // / / //
analyzed: ātma saṃbodha viṣayam sattā mātram alakṣaṇam
translated: The object of self-realization, mere existence, without characteristics.

original: praśāntam abhayaṃ śuddhaṃ durvibhāvyam asaṃśrayam /
analyzed: praśāntam abhayam śuddham durvibhāvyam a saṃśrayam
translated: Tranquil, fearless, pure, difficult to comprehend, without support,

original: viṣṇor jñānamayasyoktaṃ taj jñānaṃ paramaṃ padam // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ jñāna mayasya uktam tat jñānam paramam padam
translated: The knowledge of Viṣṇu, consisting of knowledge, is said to be the highest state.

original: tatrājñānanirodhena yogino yānti ye layam /
analyzed: tatra ajñāna nirodhena yoginaḥ yānti ye layam
translated: There, by the cessation of ignorance, the yogis who attain dissolution,

original: saṃsārakarṣaṇoptau te yānti nirbījatāṃ dvija // / / //
analyzed: saṃsāra karṣaṇa uptau te yānti nirbīja tām dvija
translated: They, O Brahmin, go to seedlessness in the churning of worldly existence.

original: evaṃprakāram amalaṃ nityaṃ vyāpakam akṣayam /
analyzed: evaṃprakāram amalam nityam vyāpakam akṣayam
translated: Such is the pure, eternal, all-pervading, imperishable,

original: samastaheyarahitaṃ viṣṇvākhyaṃ paramaṃ padam // / / //
analyzed: samasta heya rahitam viṣṇu ākhyam paramam padam
translated: Free from all impurities, the highest state called Viṣṇu.

original: tad brahma paramaṃ yogī yato nāvartate punaḥ /
analyzed: tat brahma paramam yogī yatas na āvartate punar
translated: That is Brahman, the highest, from which the yogi does not return again.

original: apuṇyapuṇyoparame kṣīṇakleśo 'tinirmalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: apuṇya puṇya uparame kṣīṇa kleśaḥ ti nirmalaḥ
translated: At the cessation of merit and demerit, with afflictions destroyed, extremely pure,

original: dve rūpe brahmaṇas tasya mūrtaṃ cāmūrtam eva ca /
analyzed: dve rūpe brahmaṇaḥ tasya mūrtam ca amūrtam eva ca
translated: Brahman has two forms, the manifest and the unmanifest,

original: kṣarākṣarasvarūpe te sarvabhūteṣu ca sthite // / / //
analyzed: kṣara akṣara svarūpe te sarva bhūteṣu ca sthite
translated: They are in the form of the perishable and the imperishable, and are present in all beings.

original: akṣaraṃ tat paraṃ brahma kṣaraṃ sarvam idaṃ jagat /
analyzed: akṣaram tat param brahma kṣaram sarvam idam jagat
translated: The imperishable is that supreme Brahman, the perishable is this entire world.

original: ekadeśasthitasyendor jyotsnā vistāriṇī yathā /
analyzed: eka deśa sthitasya indoḥ jyotsnā vistāriṇī yathā
translated: As the moonlight of the moon situated in one place spreads everywhere,

original: parasya brahmaṇaḥ śaktis tathaitad akhilaṃ jagat // / / //🔽tatrāpy āsannadūratvād bahutvasvalpatāmayaḥ /
analyzed: parasya brahmaṇaḥ śaktiḥ tathā etat akhilam jagat  tatra api āsanna dūra tvāt bahu tva su alpa tā mayaḥ
translated: in the same way this entire world is the power of the Supreme Brahman.

original: jyotsnābhedo 'sti tacchaktes tadvan maitreya vidyate // / / //
analyzed: jyotsnā bhedaḥ u sti tad śakteḥ tadvat maitreya vidyate
translated: Even there, due to nearness and distance, there is a difference in the moonlight, consisting of multiplicity and smallness. In the same way, O Maitreya, there is a difference in the power of the Supreme.

original: brahmaviṣṇuśivā brahman pradhānā brahmaśaktayaḥ /
analyzed: brahma viṣṇu śivāḥ brahman pradhānāḥ brahma śaktayaḥ
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva, O Brahmin, are the principal powers of Brahman.

original: tataś ca devā maitreya nyūnā dakṣādayas tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca devāḥ maitreya nyūnāḥ dakṣa ādayaḥ tatas
translated: Then come the gods, O Maitreya, then the less powerful Daksha and others.

original: tato manuṣyāḥ paśavo mṛgapakṣisarīsṛpāḥ /
analyzed: tatas manuṣyāḥ paśavaḥ mṛga pakṣi sarīsṛpāḥ
translated: Then come men, animals, birds, reptiles,

original: nyūnā nyūnatarāś caiva vṛkṣagulmādayas tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: nyūnāḥ nyūnatarāḥ ca eva vṛkṣa gulma ādayaḥ tatas
translated: and even less and still less, trees, shrubs, and so on.

original: tad etad akṣayaṃ nityaṃ jagan munivarākhilam /
analyzed: tat etat akṣayam nityam jagat muni vara akhilam
translated: This entire world, O best of sages, is imperishable and eternal,

original: āvirbhāvatirobhāvajanmanāśavikalpavat // / / //
analyzed: āvirbhāva tirobhāva janma nāśa vikalpavat
translated: subject to manifestation, disappearance, birth, and destruction.

original: sarvaśaktimayo viṣṇuḥ svarūpaṃ brahmaṇo 'param /
analyzed: sarva śakti mayaḥ viṣṇuḥ svarūpam param
translated: Vishnu, who is full of all power, is another form of Brahman,

original: mūrtaṃ yad yogibhiḥ pūrvaṃ yogārambheṣu cintyate // / / //
analyzed: mūrtam yat yogibhiḥ pūrvam yoga ārambheṣu cintyate
translated: which is first contemplated by yogis in the beginning of yoga.

original: sālambano mahāyogaḥ sabījo yatra saṃsthitaḥ /
analyzed: sa ālambanaḥ mahā yogaḥ sa bījaḥ yatra saṃsthitaḥ
translated: The great yoga with an object, with seeds, in which is situated,

original: manasy avyāhate samyag yuñjatāṃ jāyate mune // / / //
analyzed: manasi avyāhate samyak yuñjatām jāyate mune
translated: is produced, O sage, in the unobstructed mind of those who practice well.

original: sa paraḥ sarvaśaktīnāṃ brahmaṇaḥ samanantaraḥ /
analyzed: sa paraḥ sarva śaktīnām brahmaṇaḥ samanantaraḥ
translated: He is the Supreme, the immediate cause of all potencies of Brahman.

original: mūrtaṃ brahma mahābhāga sarvabrahmamayo hariḥ // / / //
analyzed: mūrtam brahma mahābhāga sarva brahma mayaḥ hariḥ
translated: O greatly fortunate one, Hari, the embodied Brahman, is full of all Brahman.

original: tatra sarvam idaṃ protam otaṃ caivākhilaṃ jagat /
analyzed: tatra sarvam idam protam otam ca eva akhilam jagat
translated: In Him this entire universe is woven and also created.

original: tato jagaj jagat tasmin sa jagac cākhilaṃ mune // / / //
analyzed: tatas jagat jagat tasmin sa jagat ca akhilam mune
translated: Then, O sage, the universe is in Him and He is in the entire universe.

original: kṣarākṣaramayo viṣṇur bibharty akhilam īśvaraḥ /
analyzed: kṣara akṣara mayaḥ viṣṇuḥ bibharti akhilam īśvaraḥ
translated: Vishnu, the Lord, who is full of the perishable and the imperishable, supports everything.

original: puruṣāvyākṛtamayaṃ bhūṣaṇāstrasvarūpavat // / / //
analyzed: puruṣa avyākṛta mayam bhūṣaṇa astra svarūpavat
translated: In the form of ornaments and weapons, He is full of Purusha and the Unmanifest.

original: maitreya uvāca /🔽bhūṣaṇāstrasvarūpasthaṃ yad etad akhilaṃ jagat /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca  bhūṣaṇa astra svarūpa stham yat etat akhilam jagat
translated: Maitreya said:

original: bibharti bhagavān viṣṇus tan mamākhyātum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: bibharti bhagavān viṣṇuḥ tat mama ākhyātum arhasi
translated: You should tell me how the Blessed Lord Vishnu supports this entire universe, which is in the form of ornaments and weapons.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: namas kṛtvāprameyāya viṣṇave prabhaviṣṇave /
analyzed: namaḥ kṛtvā aprameyāya viṣṇave prabhaviṣṇave
translated: Having bowed to the immeasurable Vishnu, the powerful one,

original: kathayāmi yathākhyātaṃ vasiṣṭhena mamābhavat // / / //🔽ātmānam asya jagato nirlepam aguṇāmalam /
analyzed: kathayāmi yathā ākhyātam vasiṣṭhena mama abhavat  ātmānam asya jagataḥ nirlepam aguṇa amalam
translated: I shall narrate as it was told to me by Vasishtha.

original: bibharti kaustubhamaṇisvarūpaṃ bhagavān hariḥ // / / //
analyzed: bibharti kaustubha maṇi sva rūpam bhagavān hariḥ
translated: The Blessed Lord Hari bears the form of the Kaustubha gem, which is the unsullied, attributeless, pure Self of this universe.

original: ins /
analyzed: d ins
translated: Inserts:

original: asya jagata ātmānaṃ puruṣaṃ śuddhaṃ kṣatrajñam // / / //
analyzed: asya jagataḥ ātmānam puruṣam śuddham kṣatra jñam
translated: The pure, conscious Purusha, the Self of this universe, in the form of ornaments and weapons.

original: śrīvatsasaṃsthānadharam anante ca samāśritam /
analyzed: śrīvatsa saṃsthāna dharam anante ca samāśritam
translated: The form of Srivatsa is supported by Ananta.

original: pradhānaṃ buddhir apy āste gadārūpeṇa mādhave // / / //
analyzed: pradhānam buddhiḥ api āste gadā rūpeṇa mādhave
translated: The Pradhana (primordial matter) and the intellect also reside in Madhava in the form of the club.

original: bhūtādim indriyādiṃ ca dvidhāhaṃkāram īśvaraḥ /
analyzed: bhūtādim indriya ādim ca dvidhā ahaṃkāram īśvaraḥ
translated: The Lord bears the two forms of egoism, the great elements and the senses,

original: bibharti śaṅkharūpeṇa śārṅgarūpeṇa ca sthitam // / / //🔽calatsvarūpam atyantaṃ javenāntaritānilam /
analyzed: bibharti śaṅkha rūpeṇa śārṅga rūpeṇa ca sthitam  calat svarūpam atyantam javena antarita anilam
translated: existing in the form of the conch and the Sharnga (bow).🔽The mind, which is of a moving form, and which is obstructed by the swift wind,

original: cakrasvarūpaṃ ca mano dhatte viṣṇukare sthitam // / / //
analyzed: cakra svarūpam ca manaḥ dhatte viṣṇu kare sthitam
translated: bears the form of the discus, situated in the hand of Vishnu.

original: pañcarūpā tu yā mālā vaijayantī gadābhṛtaḥ /🔽sā bhūtahetusaṃghātā bhūtamālā ca vai dvija // / / //🔽yānīndriyāṇy aśeṣāṇi buddhikarmātmakāni vai /
analyzed: pañca rūpā tu yā mālā vaijayantī gadābhṛtaḥ  sā bhūta hetu saṃghātā bhūta mālā ca vai dvija  yāni indriyāṇi aśeṣāṇi buddhi karma ātmakāni vai
translated: The garland of five forms that the wielder of the club wears,🔽is the garland of elements, O Brahmin, consisting of the aggregate of the causes of the elements.🔽Janardana bears all the senses, which are of the nature of knowledge and action,

original: śararūpāṇy aśeṣāṇi tāni dhatte janārdanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śara rūpāṇi aśeṣāṇi tāni dhatte janārdanaḥ
translated: in the form of arrows.

original: bibharti yac cāsiratnam acyuto 'tyantanirmalam /
analyzed: bibharti yat ca asi ratnam
translated: The spotless crest-jewel that Achyuta wears,

original: vidyāmayaṃ tu taj jñānam avidyācarmasaṃsthitam // / / //
analyzed: vidyā mayam tu tat jñānam avidyā carma saṃsthitam
translated: is knowledge consisting of learning, covered by the skin of ignorance.

original: itthaṃ pumān pradhānaṃ ca buddhyahaṃkāram eva ca /
analyzed: ittham pumān pradhānam ca buddhi ahaṃkāram eva ca
translated: Thus, the Purusha, the Pradhana, the intellect, the ego,

original: bhūtāni ca hṛṣīkeśe manaḥ sarvendriyāṇi ca /
analyzed: bhūtāni ca hṛṣīkeśe manaḥ sarva indriyāṇi ca
translated: the elements, the mind, and all the senses are in Hrishikesha.

original: vidyāvidye ca maitreya sarvam etat samāśritam // / / //
analyzed: vidyā avidye ca maitreya sarvam etat samāśritam
translated: Knowledge and ignorance, O Maitreya, all this rests upon Him.

original: astrabhūṣaṇasaṃsthānasvarūpaṃ rūpavarjitaḥ /
analyzed: astra bhūṣaṇa saṃsthāna svarūpam rūpa varjitaḥ
translated: He, who is devoid of form, bears the form of weapons and ornaments,

original: bibharti māyārūpo 'sau śreyase prāṇināṃ hariḥ // / / //
analyzed: bibharti māyā rūpaḥ sau śreyase prāṇinām hariḥ
translated: Hari, in the form of Maya, for the welfare of living beings.

original: savikāraṃ pradhānaṃ ca pumāṃsaṃ cākhilaṃ jagat /
analyzed: sa vikāram pradhānam ca pumāṃsam ca akhilam jagat
translated: The Pradhana with modifications, the Purusha, and the entire world,

original: bibharti puṇḍarīkākṣas tad evaṃ parameśvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: bibharti puṇḍarīkākṣaḥ tat evam parameśvaraḥ
translated: The lotus-eyed one bears it all, thus is the Supreme Lord.

original: yā vidyā yā tathāvidyā yat sad yac cāsad avyaye /
analyzed: yā vidyā yā tathā avidyā yat sat yat ca asat avyaye
translated: That knowledge, that ignorance, that which is real and that which is unreal, O imperishable one,

original: tat sarvaṃ sarvabhūteśe maitreya madhusūdane // / / //
analyzed: tat sarvam sarva bhūta īśe maitreya madhusūdane
translated: All that is in the Lord of all beings, in Madhusudana, O Maitreya.

original: kalākāṣṭhānimeṣādidinartvayanahāyanaiḥ /
analyzed: kalā kāṣṭhā nimeṣa ādi dina ṛtu ayana hāyanaiḥ
translated: With kalas, kashthas, nimeshas, days, seasons, solstices, and years,

original: kālasvarūpo bhagavān apāro harir avyayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāla svarūpaḥ bhagavān apāraḥ hariḥ avyayaḥ
translated: The Lord, the infinite, undecaying Hari, is the form of time.

original: bhūrloko 'tha bhuvarlokaḥ svarloko munisattama /
analyzed: bhūrlokaḥ tha bhuvarlokaḥ svarlokaḥ muni sattama
translated: The earth world, the Bhuvar world, the Svar world, O best of sages,

original: mahar janas tapaḥ satyaṃ saptalokān imān vibhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: mahar janaḥ tapaḥ satyam sapta lokān imān vibhuḥ
translated: The Mahar, Janas, Tapas, and Satya worlds - the all-pervading one bears these seven worlds.

original: lokātmamūrtiḥ sarveṣāṃ pūrveṣām api pūrvajaḥ /
analyzed: loka ātma mūrtiḥ sarveṣām pūrveṣām api pūrvajaḥ
translated: The embodiment of the worlds, the elder of all the elders,

original: ādhāraḥ sarvavidyānāṃ svayam eva hariḥ sthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ādhāraḥ sarva vidyānām svayam eva hariḥ sthitaḥ
translated: Hari himself is the support of all knowledge.

original: devamānuṣapaśvādisvarūpair bahubhir vibhuḥ /
analyzed: deva mānuṣa paśu ādi svarūpaiḥ bahubhiḥ vibhuḥ
translated: The all-pervading one, in many forms such as gods, humans, animals, etc.,

original: sthitaḥ sarveśvaro 'nanto bhūtamūrtir amūrtimān // / / //
analyzed: sthitaḥ sarva īśvaraḥ nantaḥ bhūta mūrtiḥ a mūrtimān
translated: The infinite Lord of all, embodied in all beings, though himself formless, is present in all things.

original: ṛco yajūṃṣi sāmāni tathaivātharvaṇāni ca /
analyzed: ṛcaḥ yajūṃṣi sāmāni tathā eva ātharvaṇāni ca
translated: The Ṛg, Yajur, Sāma, and Atharva Vedas,

original: itihāsopavedāś ca vedānteṣu tathoktayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: itihāsa upavedāḥ ca vedānteṣu tathā uktayaḥ
translated: The Itihāsas, the Upavedas, the Vedānta texts,

original: vedāṅgāni samastāni manvādigaditāni ca /🔽śāstrāṇy aśeṣāṇy ākhyānāny anuvākāś ca ye kvacit // / / //
analyzed: vedāṅgāni samastāni manu ādi gaditāni ca  śāstrāṇi aśeṣāṇi ākhyānāni anuvākāḥ ca ye kvacid
translated: All the Vedāṅgas, the works of Manu and others,🔽All the scriptures, the legends, the Anuvākas,

original: kāvyālāpāś ca ye kecid gītakāny akhilāni ca /
analyzed: kāvya ālāpāḥ ca ye kecid gītakāni akhilāni ca
translated: All the poetic compositions, and all the songs,

original: śabdamūrtidharasyaitad vapur viṣṇor mahātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śabda mūrti dharasya etat vapuḥ viṣṇoḥ mahātmanaḥ
translated: Are the body of the great Viṣṇu, who is embodied in sound.

original: yāni mūrtāny amūrtāni yāny atrānyatra vā kvacit /
analyzed: yāni mūrtāni amūrtāni yāni atra anyatra vā kvacid
translated: Whatever has form or is formless, whatever exists here or elsewhere,

original: santi vai vastujātāni tāni sarvāṇi tadvapuḥ // / / //
analyzed: santi vai vastu jātāni tāni sarvāṇi tad vapuḥ
translated: All those classes of things are his body.

original: ahaṃ hariḥ sarvam idaṃ janārdano nānyat tataḥ kāraṇakāryajātam /
analyzed: aham hariḥ sarvam idam janārdanaḥ na anyat tatas kāraṇa kārya jātam
translated: I am Hari, all this is Janārdana; there is nothing else, neither cause nor effect, than him.

original: īdṛṅ mano yasya na tasya bhūyo bhavodbhavā dvandvagadā bhavanti // / / //
analyzed: īdṛś manaḥ yasya na tasya bhūyas bhava udbhavāḥ dvandva gadāḥ bhavanti
translated: For him whose mind is thus, the sorrows of birth, rebirth, and duality do not exist.

original: ity eṣa te 'ṃśaḥ prathamaḥ purāṇasyāsya vai dvija /
analyzed: iti eṣa te ṃśaḥ prathamaḥ purāṇasya asya vai dvija
translated: Thus, O twice-born, this is the first section of this Purāṇa,

original: yathāvat kathito yasmiñ śrute pāpair vimucyate // / / //
analyzed: yathāvat kathitaḥ yasmin śrute pāpaiḥ vimucyate
translated: Which, when heard, one is freed from sins.

original: kārttikyāṃ puṣkarasnāne dvādaśābde tu yat phalam /
analyzed: kārttikyām puṣkara snāne dvādaśa abde tu yat phalam
translated: The fruit that one obtains by bathing at Pushkara on the full moon day of Kartika, after twelve years,

original: tad asya śravaṇe sarvaṃ maitreyāpnoti mānavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat asya śravaṇe sarvam maitreya āpnoti mānavaḥ
translated: that fruit, O Maitreya, a man obtains by listening to this (Purana).

original: devarṣipitṛgandharvayakṣādīnāṃ ca saṃbhavam /
analyzed: deva ṛṣi pitṛ gandharva yakṣa ādīnām ca saṃbhavam
translated: The origin of gods, sages, ancestors, Gandharvas, Yakshas, and others,

original: bhavanti śṛṇvataḥ puṃso devādyā varadā mune // / / //
analyzed: bhavanti śṛṇvataḥ puṃsaḥ deva ādyāḥ vara dāḥ mune
translated: if a person listens to it, O sage, gods and others become bestowers of boons.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe prathame 'ṃśe dvāvimśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe prathame ṃśe dvāvimśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-second chapter in the first section of the great Vishnu Purana.

original: samāptaḥ prathamo 'ṃśaḥ
analyzed: samāptaḥ prathamaḥ ṃśaḥ
translated: The first section is completed.

original: maitreya uvāca /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca
translated: Maitreya said:

original: bhagavan sarvam ākhyātaṃ mamaitad akhilaṃ tvayā /
analyzed: bhagavan sarvam ākhyātam mama etat akhilam tvayā
translated: O Lord, all this has been fully described to me by you,

original: jagataḥ sargasaṃbandhi yat pṛṣṭo 'si guro mayā // / / //
analyzed: jagataḥ sarga saṃbandhi yat pṛṣṭaḥ si guro mayā
translated: O Guru, about the creation of the world, which I asked you.

original: yo 'yam aṃśo jagatsṛṣṭisaṃbandho gaditas tvayā /
analyzed: yaḥ yam aṃśaḥ jagat sṛṣṭi saṃbandhaḥ gaditaḥ tvayā
translated: This part concerning the creation of the world that has been narrated by you,

original: tatrāhaṃ śrotum icchāmi bhūyo 'pi munisattama // / / //
analyzed: tatra aham śrotum icchāmi bhūyas muni sattama
translated: there, O best of sages, I wish to hear further.

original: priyavratottānapādau sutau svāyambhuvasya yau /
analyzed: priyavrata uttānapādau sutau svāyambhuvasya yau
translated: Priyavrata and Utantapada, the two sons of Svayambhu,

original: tayor uttānapādasya dhruvaḥ putras tvayoditaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tayoḥ uttānapādasya dhruvaḥ putraḥ tvayā uditaḥ
translated: of them, the son of Utantapada is Dhruva, as told by you.

original: priyavratasya naivoktā bhavatā dvija saṃtatiḥ /
analyzed: priyavratasya nā evā uktā bhavatā dvija saṃtatiḥ
translated: O Brahmin, the progeny of Priyavrata has not been mentioned by you.

original: tām ahaṃ śrotum icchāmi prasanno vaktum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: tām aham śrotum icchāmi prasannaḥ vaktum arhasi
translated: I wish to hear that, you should tell it with pleasure.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: kardamasyātmajāṃ kanyām upayeme priyavrataḥ /
analyzed: kardamasya ātmajām kanyām upayeme priyavrataḥ
translated: Priyavrata married the daughter of Kardama,

original: samrāṭ kukṣiś ca tatkanye daśaputrās tathāpare // / / //
analyzed: samrāj kukṣiḥ ca tad kanye daśa putrāḥ tathā apare
translated: and Samrat, Kushi, and their other ten sons married her sisters.

original: mahāprajñā mahāvīryā vinītā dayitāḥ pituḥ /
analyzed: mahā prajñāḥ mahā vīryāḥ vinītāḥ dayitāḥ pituḥ
translated: They were all of great wisdom, great prowess, humble, and dear to their father.

original: priyavratasutāḥ khyātās teṣāṃ nāmāni me śṛṇu // / / //
analyzed: priyavrata sutāḥ khyātāḥ teṣām nāmāni me śṛṇu
translated: The sons of Priyavrata were famous; hear their names from me.

original: āgnīdhraś cāgnibāhuś ca vapuṣmān dyutimāṃs tathā /
analyzed: āgnīdhraḥ ca agnibāhuḥ ca vapuṣmān dyutimān tathā
translated: Agnidhra, Agnivahu, Vabhru, Dyutiman,

original: medhā medhātithir bhavyaḥ savanaḥ putra eva ca // / / //
analyzed: medhāḥ medhātithiḥ bhavyaḥ savanaḥ putraḥ eva ca
translated: Medha, Medhatithi, Bhavya, Savana, and Putra,

original: jyotiṣmān daśamas teṣāṃ satyanāmā suto 'bhavat /
analyzed: jyotiṣmān daśamaḥ teṣām satyanāmā sutaḥ bhavat
translated: and Jyotishmat was the tenth; his son was named Satya.

original: priyavratasya putrāṇāṃ prakhyātā balavīryataḥ // / / //
analyzed: priyavratasya putrāṇām prakhyātāḥ bala vīryataḥ
translated: The sons of Priyavrata were famous for their strength and valor.

original: medhāgnibāhuputrās tu trayo yogaparāyaṇāḥ /
analyzed: medha agnibāhu putrāḥ tu trayaḥ yoga parāyaṇāḥ
translated: The three sons of Medha and Agnivahu were devoted to yoga,

original: jātismarā mahābhāgā na rājyāya mano dadhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: jātismarāḥ mahābhāgāḥ na rājyāya manaḥ
translated: were greatly fortunate and remembered their past births, and did not set their minds on the kingdom.

original: nirmamāḥ sarvakālaṃ tu samastārtheṣu vai mune /
analyzed: nirmamāḥ sarvakālam tu samasta artheṣu vai mune
translated: They were always free from possessiveness, O sage, in regard to all objects,

original: cakruḥ kriyā yathānyāyam aphalākāṅkṣiṇo hi te // / / //
analyzed: cakruḥ kriyāḥ yathānyāyam a phala ākāṅkṣiṇaḥ hi te
translated: and performed their duties properly, without desire for results.

original: priyavrato dadau teṣāṃ saptānāṃ munisattama /
analyzed: priyavrataḥ dadau teṣām saptānām muni sattama
translated: O best of sages, Priyavrata gave them seven

original: vibhajya sapta dvīpāni maitreya sumahātmanām // / / //
analyzed: vibhajya sapta dvīpāni maitreya su mahātmanām
translated: And divided the seven islands among seven very illustrious sons.

original: jambūdvīpaṃ mahābhāga so 'gnīdhrāya dadau pitā /
analyzed: jambūdvīpam mahābhāga saḥ gnīdhrāya dadau pitā
translated: O greatly fortunate one, the father gave Jambudvipa to Agni.

original: medhātithes tathā prādāt plakṣadvīpam athāparam // / / //
analyzed: medhātitheḥ tathā prādāt plakṣadvīpam atha aparam
translated: And he gave the other island of Plakṣa to Medhātithi.

original: śālmale ca vapuṣmantaṃ narendram abhiṣiktavān /
analyzed: śālmale ca vapuṣmantam narendram abhiṣiktavān
translated: And he consecrated the king Vapuṣmān in Śālmala.

original: jyotiṣmantaṃ kuśadvīpe rājānaṃ kṛtavān prabhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: jyotiṣmantam kuśadvīpe rājānam kṛtavān prabhuḥ
translated: The lord made Jyotiṣmān the king in Kuśa island.

original: dyutimantaṃ ca rājānaṃ krauñcadvīpe samādiśat /🔽śākadvīpeśvaraṃ cāpi bhavyaṃ cakre priyavrataḥ // / / //
analyzed: dyutimantam ca rājānam krauñcadvīpe samādiśat  śākadvīpa īśvaram ca api bhavyam cakre priyavrataḥ
translated: And he appointed Dyutimat as the king in Krauncha island.🔽Priyavrata made Bhavyā the lord of Śāka island.

original: puṣkarādhipatiṃ cakre savanaṃ cāpi sa prabhuḥ /
analyzed: puṣkara adhipatim cakre savanam ca api sa prabhuḥ
translated: And the lord made Savana the lord of Puṣkara.

original: jambūdvīpeśvaro yas tu āgnīdhro munisattama /
analyzed: jambūdvīpa īśvaraḥ yaḥ tu āgnīdhraḥ muni sattama
translated: O best of sages, Agni was the lord of Jambudvipa.

original: tasya putrā babhūvus te prajāpatisamā nava // / / //
analyzed: tasya putrāḥ babhūvuḥ te prajāpati samāḥ nava
translated: He had nine sons equal to Prajāpati.

original: nābhiḥ kiṃpuruṣaś caiva harivarṣa ilāvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: nābhiḥ kiṃpuruṣaḥ ca eva harivarṣaḥ ilāvṛtaḥ
translated: They were Nābhi, Kiṃpuruṣa, Harivarṣa, Ilāvṛta,

original: ramyo hiraṇvān ṣaṣṭhas tu kurur bhadrāśva eva ca /
analyzed: ramyaḥ hiraṇvān ṣaṣṭhaḥ tu kuruḥ bhadrāśvaḥ eva ca
translated: Ramya, Hiraṇvā, the sixth, Kuru, Bhadrāśva,

original: ketumālas tathaivānyaḥ sādhuceṣṭo nṛpo 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: ketumālaḥ tathā evā anyaḥ sādhu ceṣṭaḥ nṛpaḥ bhavat
translated: And Ketumāla. Another was the king Sādhuceṣṭa.

original: jambūdvīpavibhāgāṃs tu teṣāṃ vipra niśāmaya /
analyzed: jambūdvīpa vibhāgān tu teṣām vipra niśāmaya
translated: O Brahmin, listen to the divisions of Jambudvipa by them.

original: pitrā dattaṃ himāhvaṃ tu varṣaṃ nābhes tu dakṣiṇam // / / //
analyzed: pitrā dattam himāhvam tu varṣam nābheḥ tu dakṣiṇam
translated: To Nabhi's son, he gave the northern Himavat country.

original: hemakūṭaṃ tathā varṣaṃ dadau kiṃpuruṣāya saḥ /
analyzed: hemakūṭam tathā varṣam dadau kiṃpuruṣāya saḥ
translated: He gave the Himakūṭa country to Kiṃpuruṣa.

original: tṛtīyaṃ naiṣadhaṃ varṣaṃ harivarṣāya dattavān // / / //
analyzed: tṛtīyam naiṣadham varṣam harivarṣāya dattavān
translated: He gave the third country Niṣadha to Harivarṣa.

original: ilāvṛtāya pradadau merur yatra tu madhyame /
analyzed: ilāvṛtāya pradadau meruḥ yatra tu madhyame
translated: He gave to Ilāvṛta the country in the middle, where Meru is.

original: nīlācalāśritaṃ varṣaṃ ramyāya pradadau pitā // / / //
analyzed: nīla acala āśritam varṣam ramyāya pradadau pitā
translated: The father gave the country situated on the Nīla mountain to Ramya.

original: śvetaṃ yad uttaraṃ tasmāt pitrā dattaṃ hiraṇvate // / / //
analyzed: śvetam yat uttaram tasmāt pitrā dattam hiraṇvate
translated: What is the northern Śveta country, he gave to Hiraṇyanābha.

original: yad uttaraṃ śṛṅgavato varṣaṃ tat kurave dadau /
analyzed: yat uttaram śṛṅgavataḥ varṣam tat kurave dadau
translated: What is the northern country of Śṛṅgavān, he gave to Kuru.

original: meroḥ pūrveṇa yad varṣaṃ bhadrāśvāya pradattavān // / / //
analyzed: meroḥ pūrveṇa yat varṣam bhadrāśvāya pradattavān
translated: What is the country to the east of Meru, he gave to Bhadrāśva.

original: gandhamādanavarṣaṃ tu ketumālāya dattavān /🔽ity etāni dadau tebhyaḥ putrebhyaḥ sa nareśvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: gandhamādana varṣam tu ketumālāya dattavān  iti etāni dadau tebhyaḥ putrebhyaḥ sa nareśvaraḥ
translated: He gave the country of Gandhamādana to Ketumāla.🔽Thus that lord of men gave these countries to his sons.

original: varṣeṣv eteṣu tān putrān abhiṣicya sa bhūpatiḥ /
analyzed: varṣeṣu eteṣu tān putrān abhiṣicya sa bhūpatiḥ
translated: Having consecrated those sons in these countries, that lord of the earth,

original: sālagrāmaṃ mahāpuṇyaṃ maitreya tapase yayau // / / //
analyzed: sālagrāmam mahā puṇyam maitreya tapase yayau
translated: the greatly meritorious Sālagrāma, O Maitreya, went to asceticism.

original: yāni kiṃpuruṣādīni varṣāṇy aṣṭau mahāmune /
analyzed: yāni kiṃpuruṣa ādīni varṣāṇi aṣṭau mahā mune
translated: O great sage, those eight countries beginning with Kiṃpuruṣa,

original: teṣāṃ svābhāvikī siddhiḥ sukhaprāyā hy ayatnataḥ // / / //
analyzed: teṣām svābhāvikī siddhiḥ sukha prāyā hi ayatnataḥ
translated: Their natural attainment is mostly blissful and effortless.

original: viparyayo na teṣv asti jarāmṛtyubhayaṃ na ca /
analyzed: viparyayaḥ na teṣu asti jarā mṛtyu bhayam na ca
translated: There is no reversal for them, nor is there the fear of old age and death.

original: dharmādharmau na teṣv āstāṃ nottamādhamamadhyamāḥ // / / //
analyzed: dharma adharmau na teṣu āstām na uttama adhama madhyamāḥ
translated: Dharma and adharma do not exist for them, nor are there the best, worst, and middling.

original: na teṣv asti yugāvasthā kṣetreṣv aṣṭasu sarvadā /
analyzed: na teṣu asti yuga avasthā kṣetreṣu aṣṭasu sarvadā
translated: In the eight pure realms, there is always no yuga-period.

original: himāhvayaṃ tu vai varṣaṃ nābher āsīn mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: himāhvayam tu vai varṣam nābheḥ āsīt mahātmanaḥ
translated: But the Himavat region was the land of the great-souled Nabhi.

original: tasyarṣabho 'bhavat putro merudevyāṃ mahādyutiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasya ṛṣabhaḥ bhavat putraḥ merudevyām mahā dyutiḥ
translated: His son was Rishabha, of great splendor, born to the wife Meru.

original: ṛṣabhād bharato jajñe jyeṣṭhaḥ putraśatasya saḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣabhāt bharataḥ jajñe jyeṣṭhaḥ putra śatasya saḥ
translated: Bharata was born from Rishabha, the eldest of his hundred sons.

original: kṛtvā rājyaṃ svadharmeṇa tatheṣṭvā vividhān makhān // / / //
analyzed: kṛtvā rājyam svadharmeṇa tathā iṣṭvā vividhān makhān
translated: Having ruled righteously and performed various sacrifices,

original: abhiṣicya sutaṃ vīraṃ bharataṃ pṛthivīpatiḥ /
analyzed: abhiṣicya sutam vīram bharatam pṛthivīpatiḥ
translated: the heroic king Bharata consecrated his son.

original: tapase sa mahābhāgaḥ pulahasyāśramaṃ yayau // / / //
analyzed: tapase sa mahābhāgaḥ pulahasya āśramam yayau
translated: The greatly fortunate one went to the hermitage of Pulaha for austerities.

original: vānaprasthavidhānena tatrāpi kṛtaniścayaḥ /
analyzed: vānaprastha vidhānena tatra api kṛta niścayaḥ
translated: Having resolved to follow the rules of forest dwellers,

original: tapas tepe yathānyāyam iyāja sa mahīpatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tapaḥ tepe yathānyāyam iyāja sa mahīpatiḥ
translated: the king performed austerities and sacrifices as prescribed.

original: tapasā karṣito 'tyarthaṃ kṛśo dhamanisaṃtataḥ /
analyzed: tapasā karṣitaḥ tyartham kṛśaḥ dhamani saṃtataḥ
translated: Emaciated by austerities, thin and full of veins,
