analyzed: apūpa vikrayāt ca eva tathā pustaka vikrayāḥ
translated: And from selling cakes, and likewise from selling books,

original: raṅgopajīvī kaivartaḥ kuṇḍāśī garadas tathā /
analyzed: raṅga upajīvī kaivartaḥ kuṇḍāśī garadaḥ tathā
translated: the stage performer, the fisherman, the one who lives on leavings, the poisoner,

original: sūcī māhiṣikaś caiva parvagāmī ca yo dvijaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sūcī māhiṣikaḥ ca eva parva gāmī ca yaḥ dvijaḥ
translated: the one who uses a needle, the buffalo keeper, and the brahmin who travels on holidays,

original: agāradāhī mitraghnaḥ śākunir grāmayājakaḥ /
analyzed: agāra dāhī mitra ghnaḥ śākuniḥ grāmayājakaḥ
translated: the one who burns houses, the betrayer of friends, the fowler, the village priest,

original: rudhirāndhe patanty ete somaṃ vikrīṇate ca ye // / / //
analyzed: rudhirāndhe patanti ete somam vikrīṇate ca ye
translated: fall into the bloodless hell, as do those who sell Soma.

original: madhuhā grāmahantā ca yāti vaitaraṇīṃ naraḥ // / / //
analyzed: madhu hā grāma hantā ca yāti vaitaraṇīm naraḥ
translated: The slayer of honey and the destroyer of villages goes to Vaitaraṇī.

original: dhanayauvanamattās tu maryādābhedino hi ye /
analyzed: dhana yauvana mattāḥ tu maryādā bhedinaḥ hi ye
translated: Those who are intoxicated with wealth and youth and violate boundaries,

original: te kṛṣṇe yānty aśaucāś ca kuhakājīvinaś ca ye // / / //🔽asipatravanaṃ yāti vanacchedī vṛthaiva yaḥ /
analyzed: te kṛṣṇe yānti aśaucāḥ ca kuhaka ājīvinaḥ ca ye  asipatravanam yāti vana chedī vṛthā eva yaḥ
translated: and those who are impure and live by deceit, go to Kṛṣṇa.🔽One who cuts down a forest without reason goes to Asipatravana.

original: aurabhriko mṛgavyādho vahnijvāle patanti vai // / / //
analyzed: aurabhrikaḥ mṛgavyādhaḥ vahnijvāle patanti vai
translated: The keeper of sheep and the hunter fall into Vahnijvāla.

original: yānty ete dvija tatraiva yaś cāpākeṣu vahnidaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yānti ete dvija tatra eva yaḥ ca apākeṣu vahni daḥ
translated: O Brahmin, those who give fire to unripe crops go there.

original: vrateṣu lopako yaś ca svāśramād vicyutaś ca yaḥ /
analyzed: vrateṣu lopakaḥ yaḥ ca sva āśramāt vicyutaḥ ca yaḥ
translated: One who violates vows and one who deviates from his own stage of life,

original: saṃdaṃśayātanāmadhye patatas tāv ubhāv api // / / //
analyzed: saṃdaṃśa yātanā madhye patataḥ tau ubhau api
translated: both of them fall into Sandansa and Yataka.

original: divā svapneṣu skandante ye narā brahmacāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: divā svapneṣu skandante ye narāḥ brahmacāriṇaḥ
translated: Those men who emit semen during daytime and dreams while celibate,

original: putrair adhyāpitā ye ca te patanti śvabhojane // / / //
analyzed: putraiḥ adhyāpitāḥ ye ca te patanti śvabhojane
translated: and those who are taught by their sons, they fall into Śvabhojana.

original: ete cānye ca narakāḥ śataśo 'tha sahasraśaḥ /
analyzed: ete ca anye ca narakāḥ sahasraśas
translated: These and other hells are hundreds and thousands,

original: yeṣu duṣkṛtakarmāṇaḥ pacyante yātanāgatāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yeṣu duṣkṛta karmāṇaḥ pacyante yātanā gatāḥ
translated: in which those who have committed evil deeds are cooked, having come under punishment.

original: tathaiva pāpāny etāni tathānyāni sahasraśaḥ /
analyzed: tathā eva pāpāni etāni tathā anyāni sahasraśas
translated: Similarly, there are these and other sins in thousands,

original: bhujyante yāni puruṣair narakāntaragocaraiḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhujyante yāni puruṣaiḥ naraka antara gocaraiḥ
translated: which are experienced by men who go to other hells.

original: varṇāśramaviruddhaṃ ca karma kurvanti ye narāḥ /
analyzed: varṇa āśrama viruddham ca karma kurvanti ye narāḥ
translated: Those men who perform acts contrary to the duties of the castes and the orders,

original: karmaṇā manasā vācā nirayeṣu patanti te // / / //🔽adhaḥśirobhir dṛśyante nārakair divi devatāḥ /
analyzed: karmaṇā manasā vācā nirayeṣu patanti te  adhaḥśirobhiḥ dṛśyante nārakaiḥ divi devatāḥ
translated: Fall into hell by their acts, thoughts, and words.🔽The denizens of hell are seen with their heads downwards by the gods in heaven.

original: devāś cādhomukhān sarvān adhaḥ paśyanti nārakān // / / //
analyzed: devāḥ ca adhomukhān sarvān adhas paśyanti nārakān
translated: And the gods see all the denizens of hell with their faces downwards.

original: sthāvarāḥ kṛmayo 'bjāś ca pakṣiṇaḥ paśavo narāḥ /
analyzed: sthāvarāḥ kṛmayaḥ bjāḥ ca pakṣiṇaḥ paśavaḥ narāḥ
translated: The immobile, insects, aquatic animals, birds, cattle, and men,

original: dhārmikās tridaśās tadvan mokṣiṇaś ca yathākramam // / / //
analyzed: dhārmikāḥ tridaśāḥ tadvat mokṣiṇaḥ ca yathākramam
translated: The righteous, the gods, and the liberated, are respectively higher.

original: sahasrabhāgaprathamā dvitīyānukramās tathā /
analyzed: sahasra bhāga prathamāḥ dvitīya anukramāḥ tathā
translated: The first is a thousand times greater, and the second is in the same order.

original: sarve hy ete mahābhāga yāvan muktisamāśrayāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarve hi ete mahābhāga yāvat mukti samāśrayāḥ
translated: For all these are greatly fortunate, up to those who are devoted to liberation.

original: yāvanto jantavaḥ svarge tāvanto narakaukasaḥ /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ jantavaḥ svarge tāvantaḥ naraka okasaḥ
translated: As many beings there are in heaven, so many are the denizens of hell.

original: pāpakṛd yāti narakaṃ prāyaścittaparāṅmukhaḥ // / / //🔽pāpānām anurūpāṇi prāyaścittāni yad yathā /
analyzed: pāpa kṛt yāti narakam prāyaścitta parāṅmukhaḥ  pāpānām anurūpāṇi prāyaścittāni yat yathā
translated: A sinner goes to hell, averse to expiation.🔽The great sages have declared the expiations for sins, in proportion to the sins,

original: tathā tathaiva saṃsmṛtya proktāni paramarṣibhiḥ // / / //🔽pāpe gurūṇi guruṇi svalpāny alpe ca tadvidaḥ /
analyzed: tathā tathā eva saṃsmṛtya proktāni parama ṛṣibhiḥ  pāpe gurūṇi guruṇi su alpāni alpe ca tad vidaḥ
translated: Remembering them as they are.🔽The expiations for grave sins are heavy, and for light ones they are light, O Maitreya,

original: prāyaścittāni maitreya jaguḥ svāyaṃbhuvādayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prāyaścittāni maitreya jaguḥ svāyaṃbhuva ādayaḥ
translated: The self-born and others have declared.

original: prāyaścittāny aśeṣāṇi tapaḥkarmātmakāni vai /
analyzed: prāyaścittāni aśeṣāṇi tapaḥ karma ātmakāni vai
translated: All the expiations are of the nature of austerities and acts.

original: yāni teṣām aśeṣāṇāṃ kṛṣṇānusmaraṇaṃ param // / / //
analyzed: yāni teṣām aśeṣāṇām kṛṣṇa anusmaraṇam param
translated: Of all of them, the highest is the recollection of Kṛṣṇa.

original: kṛte pāpe 'nutāpo vai yasya puṃsaḥ prajāyate /
analyzed: kṛte pāpe nu tāpaḥ vai yasya puṃsaḥ prajāyate
translated: For a person who repents after committing a sin,

original: prāyaścittaṃ tu tasyaikaṃ harisaṃsmaraṇaṃ param // / / //
analyzed: prāyaścittam tu tasya ekam hari saṃsmaraṇam param
translated: the only expiation is the supreme recollection of Hari.

original: prātar niśi tathā saṃdhyāmadhyāhnādiṣu saṃsmaran /
analyzed: prātar niśi tathā saṃdhyā madhyāhna ādiṣu saṃsmaran
translated: Remembering Nārāyaṇa in the morning, evening, twilight, midday, and other times,

original: nārāyaṇam avāpnoti sadyaḥ pāpakṣayaṃ naraḥ // / / //
analyzed: nārāyaṇam avāpnoti sadyas pāpa kṣayam naraḥ
translated: a man immediately attains sinlessness and obtains heaven.

original: viṣṇusaṃsmaraṇāt kṣīṇasamastakleśasaṃcayaḥ /
analyzed: viṣṇu saṃsmaraṇāt kṣīṇa samasta kleśa saṃcayaḥ
translated: By recollecting Viṣṇu, the entire heap of afflictions is destroyed,

original: muktiṃ prayāti svargāptis tasya vighno 'numīyate // / / //
analyzed: muktim prayāti svarga āptiḥ tasya vighnaḥ numīyate
translated: and he attains liberation. The attainment of heaven is inferred to be an obstacle for him.

original: vāsudeve mano yasya japahomārcanādiṣu /
analyzed: vāsudeve manaḥ yasya japa homa arcana ādiṣu
translated: For one whose mind is on Vāsudeva in japa, homa, worship, etc.,

original: tasyāntarāyo maitreya devendratvādikaṃ phalam // / / //🔽kva nākapṛṣṭhagamanaṃ punarāvṛttilakṣaṇam /
analyzed: tasya antarāyaḥ maitreya deva indra tva ādikam phalam  kva nāka pṛṣṭha gamanam punarāvṛtti lakṣaṇam
translated: the obstacle is the fruit of becoming Indra of the gods, O Maitreya.🔽Where is going to the heavenly world, characterized by return,

original: kva japo vāsudeveti muktibījam anuttamam // / / //
analyzed: kva japaḥ vāsudeva iti mukti bījam anuttamam
translated: and where is the japa of Vāsudeva, the unsurpassed seed of liberation?

original: tasmād aharniśaṃ viṣṇuṃ saṃsmaran puruṣo mune /
analyzed: tasmāt aharniśam viṣṇum saṃsmaran puruṣaḥ mune
translated: Therefore, O sage, a man who remembers Viṣṇu day and night,

original: na yāti narakaṃ śuddhaḥ saṃkṣīṇākhilapātakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na yāti narakam śuddhaḥ saṃkṣīṇa akhila pātakaḥ
translated: does not go to hell, being pure and having destroyed all sins.

original: manaḥprītikaraḥ svargo narakas tadviparyayaḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ prīti karaḥ svargaḥ narakaḥ tad viparyayaḥ
translated: Heaven is that which delights the mind, and hell is the reverse of that.

original: narakasvargasaṃjñe vai pāpapuṇye dvijottama // / / //🔽vastv ekam eva duḥkhāya sukhāyerṣyodbhavāya ca /
analyzed: naraka svarga saṃjñe vai pāpa puṇye dvijottama  vastu ekam eva duḥkhāya sukhāya īrṣyā udbhavāya ca
translated: O best of Brahmins, sin and merit are known as hell and heaven respectively.

original: kopāya ca yatas tasmād vastu vastvātmakaṃ kutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kopāya ca yatas tasmāt vastu vastu ātmakam kutas
translated: The same object causes sorrow, joy, jealousy, and anger. Therefore, how can an object have the nature of an object?

original: tad eva prītaye bhūtvā punar duḥkhāya jāyate /
analyzed: tat eva prītaye bhūtvā punar duḥkhāya jāyate
translated: That very thing, having become the cause of joy, is born again as the cause of sorrow.

original: tad eva kopāya yataḥ prasādāya ca jāyate // / / //
analyzed: tat eva kopāya yatas prasādāya ca jāyate
translated: That very thing is the cause of anger and is born as the cause of favor.

original: tasmād duḥkhātmakaṃ nāsti na ca kiṃcit sukhātmakam /
analyzed: tasmāt duḥkha ātmakam nā asti na ca kiṃcid sukha ātmakam
translated: Therefore, there is nothing that has the nature of sorrow, nor anything that has the nature of joy.

original: manasaḥ pariṇāmo 'yaṃ sukhaduḥkhādilakṣaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: manasaḥ pariṇāmaḥ yam sukha duḥkha ādi lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: This transformation of the mind is characterized by joy, sorrow, etc.

original: jñānam eva paraṃ brahma jñānaṃ bandhāya ceṣyate /
analyzed: jñānam eva param brahma jñānam bandhāya ca iṣyate
translated: Knowledge itself is the supreme Brahman, and knowledge is also considered to be the cause of bondage.

original: jñānātmakam idaṃ viśvaṃ na jñānād vidyate param // / / //
analyzed: jñāna ātmakam idam viśvam na jñānāt vidyate param
translated: This universe has knowledge as its essence; there is nothing higher than knowledge.

original: vidyāvidyeti maitreya jñānam evopadhāraya // / / //
analyzed: vidyā avidyā iti maitreya jñānam eva upadhāraya
translated: Knowledge and ignorance, Maitreya, should be considered as knowledge alone.

original: evam etan mayākhyātaṃ bhavato maṇḍalaṃ bhuvaḥ /
analyzed: evam etat mayā ākhyātam bhavataḥ maṇḍalam bhuvaḥ
translated: Thus, I have described to you the circle of the earth,

original: pātālāni ca sarvāṇi tathaiva narakā dvija // / / //
analyzed: pātālāni ca sarvāṇi tathā eva narakāḥ dvija
translated: all the nether worlds, and the hells, O Brahmin.

original: samudrāḥ parvatāś caiva dvīpā varṣāṇi nimnagāḥ /
analyzed: samudrāḥ parvatāḥ ca eva dvīpāḥ varṣāṇi nimnagāḥ
translated: The oceans, mountains, islands, countries, and rivers,

original: saṃkṣepāt sarvam ākhyātaṃ kiṃ bhūyaḥ śrotum icchasi // / / //
analyzed: saṃkṣepāt sarvam ākhyātam kim bhūyas śrotum icchasi
translated: I have briefly told you everything. What more do you wish to hear?

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe dvitīye 'ṃśe ṣaṣṭho 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe dvitīye ṃśe ṣaṣṭhaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixth chapter in the second section of the Visnu Purana.

original: maitreya uvāca /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca
translated: Maitreya said:

original: kathitaṃ bhavatā brahman mamaitad akhilaṃ tvayā /
analyzed: kathitam bhavatā brahman mama etat akhilam tvayā
translated: O Brahman, you have told me all this.

original: bhuvarlokādikāṃl lokāñ śrotum icchāmy ahaṃ mune // / / //
analyzed: bhuvarloka ādikān śrotum icchāmi aham mune
translated: O sage, I wish to hear about the worlds beginning with Bhuvarloka.

original: tathaiva grahasaṃsthānaṃ pramāṇāni yathātatham /
analyzed: tathā eva graha saṃsthānam pramāṇāni yathātatham
translated: And likewise the arrangement of the planets, their sizes and so on,

original: samācakṣva mahābhāga mahyaṃ tvaṃ paripṛcchate // / / //
analyzed: samācakṣva mahābhāga mahyam tvam paripṛcchate
translated: please tell me, O greatly fortunate one, as I ask you.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ravicandramasor yāvan mayūkhair avabhāsyate /
analyzed: ravi candramasoḥ yāvat mayūkhaiḥ avabhāsyate
translated: As far as the earth is illuminated by the rays of the sun and moon,

original: sasamudrasaricchailā tāvatī pṛthivī smṛtā // / / //
analyzed: sa samudra sarit śailā tāvatī pṛthivī smṛtā
translated: that much is said to be the extent of the earth with its oceans, rivers and mountains.

original: yāvatpramāṇā pṛthivī vistāraparimaṇḍalāt /
analyzed: yāvat pramāṇā pṛthivī vistāra parimaṇḍalāt
translated: As much as is the extent of the earth in terms of its breadth and circumference,

original: nabhas tāvatpramāṇaṃ vai vyāsamaṇḍalato dvija // / / //🔽bhūmer yojanalakṣe tu sauraṃ maitreya maṇḍalam /🔽lakṣe divākarasyāpi maṇḍalaṃ śaśinaḥ sthitam // / / //
analyzed: nabhaḥ tāvat pramāṇam vai vyāsa maṇḍalataḥ dvija  bhūmeḥ yojana lakṣe tu sauram maitreya maṇḍalam  lakṣe divākarasya api maṇḍalam śaśinaḥ sthitam
translated: O Brahmin, the sky is of the same extent in terms of its breadth and circumference.🔽O Maitreya, the solar sphere is one lakh yojanas above the earth,🔽and the sphere of the moon is situated one lakh yojanas above the sun.

original: pūrṇe śatasahasre tu yojanānāṃ niśākarāt /
analyzed: pūrṇe śata sahasre tu yojanānām niśākarāt
translated: And at a full one hundred thousand yojanas from the moon,

original: nakṣatramaṇḍalaṃ kṛtsnam upariṣṭāt prakāśate // / / //
analyzed: nakṣatra maṇḍalam kṛtsnam upariṣṭāt prakāśate
translated: The entire lunar mansion shines above.

original: dve lakṣe cottare brahman budho nakṣatramaṇḍalāt /
analyzed: dve lakṣe ca uttare brahman budhaḥ nakṣatra maṇḍalāt
translated: O Brahmin, Budha is two hundred thousand yojanas above the lunar mansion.

original: tāvatpramāṇabhāge tu budhasyāpy uśanā sthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tāvat pramāṇa bhāge tu budhasya api uśanā sthitaḥ
translated: Shukra is situated at a distance of the same measure from Budha.

original: aṅgārako 'pi śukrasya tatpramāṇe vyavasthitaḥ /🔽lakṣadvaye tu bhaumasya sthito devapurohitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: aṅgārakaḥ pi śukrasya tad pramāṇe vyavasthitaḥ  lakṣa dvaye tu bhaumasya sthitaḥ devapurohitaḥ
translated: Angaraka is also situated at the same measure from Shukra.🔽The priest of the gods is situated two hundred thousand yojanas from Bhouma.

original: saurir bṛhaspateś cordhvaṃ dvilakṣe samavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: sauriḥ bṛhaspateḥ ca ūrdhvam dvi lakṣe samavasthitaḥ
translated: Surya is situated two hundred thousand yojanas above Brihaspati.

original: saptarṣimaṇḍalaṃ tasmāl lakṣam ekaṃ dvijottama // / / //
analyzed: saptarṣi maṇḍalam tasmāt lakṣam ekam dvijottama
translated: O best of Brahmins, the circle of the seven sages is one hundred thousand yojanas above that.

original: ṛṣibhyas tu sahasrāṇāṃ śatād ūrdhvaṃ vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣibhyaḥ tu sahasrāṇām śatāt ūrdhvam vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Above the sages, it is situated at a distance of more than a hundred thousand yojanas.

original: meḍhībhūtaḥ samastasya jyotiścakrasya vai dhruvaḥ // / / //
analyzed: meḍhī bhūtaḥ samastasya jyotiścakrasya vai dhruvaḥ
translated: The pole star is fixed, being the axis of the entire circle of stars.

original: trailokyam etat kathitam utsedhena mahāmune /
analyzed: trailokyam etat kathitam utsedhena mahā mune
translated: O great sage, this is said to be the height of the three worlds.

original: ijyāphalasya bhūr eṣā ijyā cātra pratiṣṭhitā // / / //
analyzed: ijyā phalasya bhūḥ eṣā ijyā ca atra pratiṣṭhitā
translated: This is the land of the fruits of worship, and worship is established here.

original: dhruvād ūrdhvaṃ maharloko yatra te kalpavāsinaḥ /
analyzed: dhruvāt ūrdhvam mahar lokaḥ yatra te kalpa vāsinaḥ
translated: Above the pole star is the world of Maharloka, where the residents of the kalpa live.

original: ekayojanakoṭī tu maharloko 'bhidhīyate // / / //
analyzed: eka yojana koṭī tu mahar lokaḥ bhidhīyate
translated: Maharloka is said to be one crore yojanas.

original: dve koṭī tu jano loko yatra te brahmaṇaḥ sutāḥ /🔽sanandanādyāḥ kathitā maitreyāmalacetasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dve koṭī tu janaḥ lokaḥ yatra te brahmaṇaḥ sutāḥ  sanandana ādyāḥ kathitāḥ maitreya amala cetasaḥ
translated: The world of Brahmapurohita gods is twice that of Brahmakâya gods.🔽The world of Mahâbrahmâ gods is four times that of Brahmapurohita gods.🔽The world of Mahâbrahmâ gods is four times that of Brahmapurohita gods.🔽The world of Janaloka is four times that of Mahâbrahmâ gods.🔽The world of Janaloka is four times that of Mahâbrahmâ gods.🔽The world of Tapoloka is four times that of Janaloka.

original: caturguṇottare cordhvaṃ janalokāt tapaḥ smṛtaḥ /🔽vairājā yatra te devāḥ sthitā dāhavivarjitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: caturguṇa uttare ca ūrdhvam janalokāt tapaḥ smṛtaḥ  vairājāḥ yatra te devāḥ sthitāḥ dāha vivarjitāḥ
translated: The world of Tapoloka is four times that of Janaloka.🔽The world of Satyaloka is six times that of Tapoloka.

original: ṣaḍguṇena tapolokāt satyaloko virājate /
analyzed: ṣaḍguṇena tapolokāt satyalokaḥ virājate
translated: The world of Satyaloka is six times that of Tapoloka.

original: apunarmārakā yatra brahmaloko hi sa smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: a punar mārakāḥ yatra brahma lokaḥ hi sa smṛtaḥ
translated: The world of Brahmaloka is said to be where the gods of Brahmaloka reside, free from burning.🔽The world of Brahmaloka is said to be where the gods of Brahmaloka reside, free from burning.

original: pādagamyaṃ tu yat kiṃcid vastv asti pṛthivīmayam /
analyzed: pāda gamyam tu yat kiṃcid vastu asti pṛthivī mayam
translated: Whatever substance there is on earth that can be reached by foot,

original: sa bhūrlokaḥ samākhyāto vistaro 'sya mayoditaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa bhūrlokaḥ samākhyātaḥ vistaraḥ sya mayā uditaḥ
translated: That is called the world of earth. Its extent has been described by me.

original: bhūmisūryāntaraṃ yat tu siddhādimunisevitam /
analyzed: bhūmi sūrya antaram yat tu siddha ādi muni sevitam
translated: Whatever is between the earth and the sun, frequented by the Siddhas and other sages,

original: bhuvarlokas tu so 'py ukto dvitīyo munisattama // / / //
analyzed: bhuvarlokaḥ tu saḥ pi uktaḥ dvitīyaḥ muni sattama
translated: That is said to be the world of Bhuvarloka, the second best world, O best of sages.

original: dhruvasūryāntaraṃ yat tu niyutāni caturdaśa /
analyzed: dhruva sūrya antaram yat tu niyutāni caturdaśa
translated: Whatever is between Dhruva and the sun, fourteen million yojanas,

original: svarlokaḥ so 'pi gadito lokasaṃsthānacintakaiḥ // / / //🔽trailokyam etat kṛtakaṃ maitreya paripaṭhyate /
analyzed: svarlokaḥ saḥ pi gaditaḥ loka saṃsthāna cintakaiḥ  trailokyam etat kṛtakam maitreya paripaṭhyate
translated: That is said to be the world of Svarloka by those who contemplate the structure of the worlds.🔽O Maitreya, this triad of worlds is said to be created,

original: janas tapas tathā satyam iti cākṛtakaṃ trayam // / / //
analyzed: janaḥ tapaḥ tathā satyam iti ca akṛtakam trayam
translated: While the three worlds of Jana, Tapas, and Satya are uncreated.

original: kṛtakākṛtayor madhye maharloka iti smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: kṛtaka akṛtayoḥ madhye mahar lokaḥ iti smṛtaḥ
translated: Between the created and the uncreated, the world of Maharloka is known.

original: śūnyo bhavati kalpānte yo 'tyantaṃ na vinaśyati // / / //
analyzed: śūnyaḥ bhavati kalpa ante tyantam na vinaśyati
translated: It remains empty at the end of a kalpa, and it is never destroyed.

original: ete sapta mayā lokā maitreya kathitās tava /
analyzed: ete sapta mayā lokāḥ maitreya kathitāḥ tava
translated: O Maitreya, I have thus described to you these seven worlds.

original: pātālāni ca saptaiva brahmāṇḍasyaiṣa vistaraḥ // / / //🔽etad aṇḍakaṭāhena tiryak cordhvam adhas tathā /
analyzed: pātālāni ca sapta eva brahmāṇḍasya eṣa vistaraḥ  etat aṇḍa kaṭāhena tiryak ca ūrdhvam adhas tathā
translated: And there are seven nether worlds. This is the extent of the universe.🔽This universe is surrounded on all sides by the shell of the egg, above, below and across,

original: kapitthasya yathā bījaṃ sarvato vai samāvṛtam // / / //
analyzed: kapitthasya yathā bījam sarvatas vai samāvṛtam
translated: just as the seed of a wood-apple is completely surrounded on all sides.

original: daśottareṇa payasā maitreyāṇḍaṃ ca tad vṛtam /
analyzed: daśa uttareṇa payasā maitreya aṇḍam ca tat vṛtam
translated: O Maitreya, that egg is surrounded by water, ten times greater.

original: sarvo 'mbuparidhāno 'sau vahninā veṣṭito bahiḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarvaḥ mbu paridhānaḥ sau vahninā veṣṭitaḥ bahis
translated: It is all surrounded by water, and that is surrounded by fire on the outside.

original: vahniś ca vāyunā vāyur maitreya nabhasā vṛtaḥ /
analyzed: vahniḥ ca vāyunā vāyuḥ maitreya nabhasā vṛtaḥ
translated: And fire is surrounded by air, O Maitreya, and air is surrounded by space.

original: bhūtādinā nabhaḥ so 'pi mahatā pariveṣṭitaḥ /
analyzed: bhūtādinā nabhaḥ saḥ pi mahatā pariveṣṭitaḥ
translated: And that space is enveloped by mahat, the primordial material nature.

original: daśottarāṇy aśeṣāṇi maitreyaitāni sapta vai // / / //🔽mahāntaṃ ca samāvṛtya pradhānaṃ samavasthitam /🔽anantasya na tasyāntaḥ saṃkhyānaṃ vāpi vidyate // / / //
analyzed: daśa uttarāṇi aśeṣāṇi maitreya etāni sapta vai  mahāntam ca samāvṛtya pradhānam samavasthitam  anantasya na tasya antar saṃkhyānam vā api vidyate
translated: O Maitreya, all these seven are ten times greater than the preceding one.🔽And the primordial material nature, which is the cause of the mahat-tattva, is situated surrounding the mahat-tattva.🔽There is no end or enumeration of that infinite one.

original: tad anantam asaṃkhyātapramāṇaṃ cāpi vai yataḥ /
analyzed: tat anantam asaṃkhyāta pramāṇam ca api vai yatas
translated: Because it is infinite, immeasurable and innumerable,

original: hetubhūtam aśeṣasya prakṛtiḥ sā parā mune // / / //🔽aṇḍānāṃ tu sahasrāṇāṃ sahasrāṇy ayutāni ca /
analyzed: hetu bhūtam aśeṣasya prakṛtiḥ sā parā mune  aṇḍānām tu sahasrāṇām sahasrāṇi ayutāni ca
translated: O sage, that is the supreme Prakṛti, the cause of everything.🔽There are thousands, ten thousands, and hundreds of thousands of such eggs.

original: īdṛśānāṃ tathā tatra koṭikoṭiśatāni ca // / / //
analyzed: īdṛśānām tathā tatra koṭi koṭi śatāni ca
translated: And there are hundreds of thousands of crores of such eggs there.

original: dāruṇy agnir yathā tailaṃ tile tadvat pumān api /
analyzed: dāruṇi agniḥ yathā tailam tile tadvat pumān api
translated: Just as fire is in wood, and oil is in sesamum, in the same way the Puruṣa is in Prakṛti.

original: pradhāne 'vasthito vyāpī cetanātmātmavedanaḥ // / / //🔽pradhānaṃ ca pumāṃś caiva sarvabhūtātmabhūtayā /
analyzed: pradhāne vasthitaḥ vyāpī cetanā ātmā ātma vedanaḥ  pradhānam ca pumān ca eva sarva bhūta ātma bhūtayā
translated: The Puruṣa, who is all-pervading, conscious, and knows the Self, abides in Prakṛti.

original: viṣṇuśaktyā mahābuddhe vṛtau saṃśrayadharmiṇau // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇu śaktyā mahābuddhe vṛtau saṃśraya dharmiṇau
translated: O greatly wise one, the Prakṛti and the Puruṣa, who are the Self of all beings, are surrounded by Viṣṇu's Śakti, and are united with the quality of dependence.

original: tayoḥ saiva pṛthagbhāvakāraṇaṃ saṃśrayasya ca /
analyzed: tayoḥ sā eva pṛthak bhāva kāraṇam saṃśrayasya ca
translated: That Śakti alone is the cause of their separate existence and dependence.

original: kṣobhakāraṇabhūtā ca sargakāle mahāmate // / / //
analyzed: kṣobha kāraṇa bhūtā ca sarga kāle mahāmate
translated: And, O greatly wise one, it is the cause of agitation at the time of creation.

original: yathā saktaṃ jale vāto bibharti kaṇikāśatam /
analyzed: yathā saktam jale vātaḥ bibharti kaṇikā śatam
translated: Just as the wind holds a hundred drops of water,

original: śaktiḥ sāpi tathā viṣṇoḥ pradhānapuruṣātmakam // / / //
analyzed: śaktiḥ sā api tathā viṣṇoḥ pradhāna puruṣa ātmakam
translated: in the same way, that Śakti of Viṣṇu holds the Prakṛti and Puruṣa.

original: yathā ca pādapo mūlaskandhaśākhādisaṃyutaḥ /🔽ādibījāt prabhavati bījāny anyāni vai tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: yathā ca pādapaḥ mūla skandha śākhā ādi saṃyutaḥ  ādi bījāt prabhavati bījāni anyāni vai tatas
translated: And just as a tree, with its roots, trunk, branches, etc.,🔽arises from the original seed, and from it other seeds arise,

original: prabhavanti tatas tebhyaḥ saṃbhavanty apare drumāḥ /
analyzed: prabhavanti tatas tebhyaḥ saṃbhavanti apare drumāḥ
translated: from those other seeds, other trees arise.

original: te 'pi tallakṣaṇadravyakāraṇānugatā mune // / / //
analyzed: te pi tad lakṣaṇa dravya kāraṇa anugatāḥ mune
translated: O sage, they also follow the characteristics and material causes of that.

original: evam avyākṛtāt pūrvaṃ jāyante mahadādayaḥ /
analyzed: evam avyākṛtāt pūrvam jāyante mahat ādayaḥ
translated: Thus, the great elements and others are born from the indeterminate before.

original: viśeṣāntās tatas tebhyaḥ saṃbhavanti surādayaḥ /
analyzed: viśeṣa antāḥ tatas tebhyaḥ saṃbhavanti sura ādayaḥ
translated: From them, the gods and others originate, ending with the specific.

original: tebhyaś ca putrās teṣāṃ ca putrāṇām apare sutāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca putrāḥ teṣām ca putrāṇām apare sutāḥ
translated: And from them, their sons, and from their sons, other sons...

original: bījād vṛkṣapraroheṇa yathā nāpacayas taroḥ /
analyzed: bījāt vṛkṣa praroheṇa yathā na apacayaḥ taroḥ
translated: Just as a tree does not diminish by the growth of a tree from a seed,

original: bhūtānāṃ bhūtasargeṇa naivāsty apacayas tathā // / / //
analyzed: bhūtānām bhūta sargeṇa na eva asti apacayaḥ tathā
translated: so there is no diminution of the elements by the creation of the elements...

original: saṃnidhānād yathākāśakālādyāḥ kāraṇaṃ taroḥ /
analyzed: saṃnidhānāt yathā ākāśa kāla ādyāḥ kāraṇam taroḥ
translated: Just as space, time, etc. are the causes of a tree due to their proximity,

original: tathaivāpariṇāmena viśvasya bhagavān hariḥ // / / //
analyzed: tathā eva apariṇāmena viśvasya bhagavān hariḥ
translated: in the same way, the Lord Hari of the universe is without change...

original: vrīhibīje yathā mūlaṃ nālaṃ patrāṅkurau tathā /
analyzed: vrīhi bīje yathā mūlam nālam patra aṅkurau tathā
translated: Just as the root, sprout, leaf, and sprout are in a rice seed,

original: kāṇḍakoṣas tathā puṣpaṃ kṣīraṃ tadvac ca taṇḍulāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāṇḍa koṣaḥ tathā puṣpam kṣīram tadvat ca taṇḍulāḥ
translated: so also the stem, sheath, flower, milk, and rice grains...

original: tuṣāḥ kaṇāś ca santo vai yānty āvirbhāvam ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: tuṣāḥ kaṇāḥ ca santaḥ vai yānti āvirbhāvam ātmanaḥ
translated: The husks and grains, being real, attain manifestation, O best of sages,

original: prarohahetusāmagrīm āsādya munisattama // / / //
analyzed: praroha hetu sāmagrīm āsādya muni sattama
translated: obtaining the assemblage of causes for growth...

original: tathā karmasv anekeṣu devādyāḥ samavasthitāḥ /
analyzed: tathā karmasu anekeṣu deva ādyāḥ samavasthitāḥ
translated: Similarly, the gods and others are present in many actions,

original: viṣṇuśaktiṃ samāsādya praroham upayānti vai // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇu śaktim samāsādya praroham upayānti vai
translated: attaining the power of Vishnu, they attain growth...

original: sa ca viṣṇuḥ paraṃ brahma yataḥ sarvam idaṃ jagat /
analyzed: sa ca viṣṇuḥ param brahma yatas sarvam idam jagat
translated: And that Vishnu is the Supreme Brahman from which this entire universe has originated.

original: jagac ca yo yatra cedaṃ yasmiṃś ca layam eṣyati // / / //
analyzed: jagat ca yaḥ yatra ca idam yasmin ca layam eṣyati
translated: And in which this universe exists and into which it will merge.

original: tad brahma tat paraṃ dhāma sadasatparamaṃ padam /🔽yasya sarvam abhedena jagad etac carācaram // / / //
analyzed: tat brahma tat param dhāma sat asat paramam padam  yasya sarvam abhedena jagat etat carācaram
translated: That is Brahman, that is the Supreme Abode, that is the Supreme State, both existent and non-existent.🔽In whom this entire moving and unmoving world is non-differentiated.

original: sa eva mūlaprakṛtir vyaktarūpī jagac ca saḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva mūlaprakṛtiḥ vyakta rūpī jagat ca saḥ
translated: He alone is the Original Nature, assuming the form of the Manifest, and He is the universe.

original: tasminn eva layaṃ sarvaṃ yāti tatra ca tiṣṭhati // / / //
analyzed: tasmin eva layam sarvam yāti tatra ca tiṣṭhati
translated: In Him alone does everything merge, and in Him it abides.

original: kartā kriyāṇāṃ sa ca ijyate kratuḥ sa eva tatkarmaphalaṃ ca tasya yat /
analyzed: kartā kriyāṇām sa ca ijyate kratuḥ saḥ eva tat karma phalam ca tasya yat
translated: He is the agent of actions, He is the sacrifice, He is the fruit of those actions,

original: srugādi yat sādhanam apy aśeṣato harer na kiṃcid vyatiriktam asti vai // / / //
analyzed: sruc ādi yat sādhanam api aśeṣatas hareḥ na kiṃcid vyatiriktam asti vai
translated: And all the implements such as the sacrificial ladle are nothing but Hari, there is nothing separate from Him.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe dvitīye 'ṃśe saptamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe dvitīye ṃśe saptamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the seventh chapter in the second section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: vyākhyātam etad brahmāṇḍasaṃsthānaṃ tava suvrata /
analyzed: vyākhyātam etat brahmāṇḍa saṃsthānam tava suvrata
translated: O one of good vows, this arrangement of the universe has been explained to you.

original: tataḥ pramāṇasaṃsthāne sūryādīnāṃ śṛṇuṣva me // / / //
analyzed: tatas pramāṇa saṃsthāne sūrya ādīnām śṛṇuṣva me
translated: Now listen from me about the measurements and arrangement of the sun and others.

original: yojanānāṃ sahasrāṇi bhāskarasya ratho nava /
analyzed: yojanānām sahasrāṇi bhāskarasya rathaḥ nava
translated: The chariot of the sun is nine thousand yojanas (a yojana is a unit of distance equal to approximately 8 miles) in size.

original: īṣādaṇḍas tathaivāsya dviguṇo munisattama // / / //
analyzed: īṣā daṇḍaḥ tathā eva asya dviguṇaḥ muni sattama
translated: O best of sages, its axle is twice that,

original: sārdhakoṭis tathā sapta niyutāny adhikāni vai /
analyzed: sārdha koṭiḥ tathā sapta niyutāni adhikāni vai
translated: along with seven and a half million and more.

original: yojanānāṃ tu tasyākṣas tatra cakraṃ pratiṣṭhitam // / / //
analyzed: yojanānām tu tasya akṣaḥ tatra cakram pratiṣṭhitam
translated: The wheel is established there, at a distance of one and a half million yojanas.

original: trinābhimati pañcāre ṣaṇṇeminy akṣayātmake /
analyzed: tri nābhimati pañca are akṣaya ātmake
translated: It has three naves, five spokes, six rims, and an imperishable nature.

original: saṃvatsaramaye kṛtsnaṃ kālacakraṃ pratiṣṭhitam // / / //
analyzed: saṃvatsara maye kṛtsnam kālacakram pratiṣṭhitam
translated: The entire wheel of time is established in it, consisting of one year.

original: catvāriṃśat sahasrāṇi dvitīyo 'kṣo vivasvataḥ /
analyzed: catvāriṃśat sahasrāṇi dvitīyaḥ kṣaḥ vivasvataḥ
translated: The second axle of Vivasvat's chariot is forty thousand (yojanas),

original: pañcānyāni tu sārdhāni syandanasya mahāmate // / / //
analyzed: pañca anyāni tu sārdhāni syandanasya mahāmate
translated: and five more, O great-minded one, along with half.

original: akṣapramāṇam ubhayoḥ pramāṇaṃ tadyugārdhayoḥ /
analyzed: akṣa pramāṇam ubhayoḥ pramāṇam tat yuga ardhayoḥ
translated: The measure of both axles is the same as the measure of half a yuga.

original: hrasvo 'kṣas tadyugārdhaṃ ca dhruvādhāro rathasya vai /
analyzed: hrasvaḥ kṣaḥ tad yuga ardham ca dhruva ādhāraḥ rathasya vai
translated: The short axle, half a yuga, is the support of the chariot's axle.

original: dvitīye 'kṣe tu tac cakraṃ saṃsthitaṃ mānasācale // / / //
analyzed: dvitīye kṣe tu tat cakram saṃsthitam mānasa acale
translated: But that wheel is established on the second axle, on the immovable Manasa mountain.

original: hayāś ca sapta chandāṃsi teṣāṃ nāmāni me śṛṇu /
analyzed: hayāḥ ca sapta chandāṃsi teṣām nāmāni me śṛṇu
translated: And the seven horses are the meters. Listen to their names from me.

original: gāyatrī ca bṛhaty uṣṇig jagatī triṣṭub eva ca /
analyzed: gāyatrī ca bṛhatī uṣṇih jagatī triṣṭubh eva ca
translated: Gāyatrī, Bṛhatī, Uṣṇih, Jagatī, Triṣṭubh,

original: anuṣṭup paṅktir ity uktāś chandāṃsi harayo raveḥ // / / //
analyzed: anuṣṭubh paṅktiḥ iti uktāḥ chandāṃsi harayaḥ raveḥ
translated: Anuṣṭubh, and Paṅkti are said to be the meters, the horses of the sun.

original: mānasottaraśaile tu pūrvato vāsavī purī /
analyzed: mānasottara śaile tu pūrvatas vāsavī purī
translated: To the east of the Manosottara mountain is the city of Vāsava.

original: dakṣiṇena yamasyānyā pratīcyāṃ varuṇasya ca /
analyzed: dakṣiṇena yamasya anyā pratīcyām varuṇasya ca
translated: To the south of Yama is another, and to the west of Varuna,

original: uttareṇa ca somasya tāsāṃ nāmāni me śṛṇu // / / //
analyzed: uttareṇa ca somasya tāsām nāmāni me śṛṇu
translated: and to the north of Soma. Hear from me their names.

original: vasvokasārā śakrasya yāmyā saṃyamanī tathā /
analyzed: vasvokasārā śakrasya yāmyā saṃyamanī tathā
translated: The city of Vasvokasara belongs to Shakra, that of Yama is Samyamani,

original: purī sukhā jaleśasya somasya ca vibhāvarī // / / //
analyzed: purī sukhā jaleśasya somasya ca vibhāvarī
translated: the city of Sukha belongs to the Lord of waters, and of Soma is Vibhavri.

original: kāṣṭhāṃ gato dakṣiṇataḥ kṣipteṣur iva sarpati /
analyzed: kāṣṭhām gataḥ dakṣiṇatas kṣipta iṣuḥ iva sarpati
translated: Going to the south, it moves like an arrow shot.

original: maitreya bhagavān bhānur jyotiṣāṃ cakrasaṃyutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: maitreya bhagavān bhānuḥ jyotiṣām cakra saṃyutaḥ
translated: O Maitreya, the illustrious sun, along with the circle of luminaries,

original: ahorātravyavasthānakāraṇaṃ bhagavān raviḥ /
analyzed: ahar rātra vyavasthāna kāraṇam bhagavān raviḥ
translated: The illustrious sun is the cause of the arrangement of day and night.

original: devayānaḥ paraḥ panthā yogināṃ kleśasaṃkṣaye // / / //🔽divasasya ravir madhye sarvakālaṃ vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: deva yānaḥ paraḥ panthāḥ yoginām kleśa saṃkṣaye  divasasya raviḥ madhye sarvakālam vyavasthitaḥ
translated: The path of the gods is the supreme path for the yogis in the destruction of afflictions.🔽The sun is in the middle of the day, always established.

original: sarvadvīpeṣu maitreya niśārdhasya ca saṃmukhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarva dvīpeṣu maitreya niśārdhasya ca saṃmukhaḥ
translated: In all the continents, O Maitreya, it is in front at midnight.

original: udayāstamane caiva sarvakālaṃ tu saṃmukhe /
analyzed: udaya astamane ca eva sarvakālam tu saṃmukhe
translated: At sunrise and sunset, it is always in front.

original: diśāsv aśeṣāsu tathā maitreya vidiśāsu ca // / / //
analyzed: diśāsu aśeṣāsu tathā maitreya vidiśāsu ca
translated: In all the directions and intermediate directions, O Maitreya,

original: yair yatra dṛśyate bhāsvān sa teṣām udayaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yaiḥ yatra dṛśyate bhāsvān sa teṣām udayaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: wherever the sun is seen, that is considered its rising.

original: tirobhāvaṃ ca yatraiti tatraivāstamanaṃ raveḥ // / / //
analyzed: tirobhāvam ca yatra eti tatra eva astamanam raveḥ
translated: And where it disappears, there is the setting of the sun.

original: naivāstamanam arkasya nodayaḥ sarvadā sataḥ /
analyzed: na eva astamanam arkasya na udayaḥ sarvadā sataḥ
translated: The sun never sets or rises, being always existent.

original: udayāstamanākhyaṃ hi darśanādarśanaṃ raveḥ // / / //
analyzed: udaya astamana ākhyam hi darśana adarśanam raveḥ
translated: The rising and setting of the sun is only the appearance and disappearance of its light.

original: śakrādīnāṃ pure tiṣṭhan spṛśaty eṣa puratrayam /
analyzed: śakra ādīnām pure tiṣṭhan spṛśati eṣa puratrayam
translated: Dwelling in the city of Indra and others, it touches three cities.

original: vikarṇau dvau vikarṇasthas trīn koṇān dve pure tathā // / / //
analyzed: vikarṇau dvau vikarṇa sthaḥ trīn koṇān dve pure tathā
translated: With two horns, it touches three corners and two cities.

original: udito vardhamānābhir āmadhyāhnāt tapan raviḥ /
analyzed: uditaḥ vardhamānābhiḥ ā madhyāhnāt tapan raviḥ
translated: Rising with the increasing rays, the sun heats till midday.

original: tataḥ paraṃ hrasantībhir gobhir astaṃ niyacchati // / / //🔽udayāstamanābhyāṃ ca smṛte pūrvāpare diśau /
analyzed: tatas param hrasantībhiḥ gobhiḥ astam niyacchati  udaya astamanābhyām ca smṛte pūrva apare diśau
translated: Then, after that, it is restrained by the setting with the decreasing rays.🔽And by the rising and setting, the eastern and western directions are remembered.

original: yāvat purastāt tapati tāvat pṛṣṭhe ca pārśvayoḥ // / / //
analyzed: yāvat purastāt tapati tāvat pṛṣṭhe ca pārśvayoḥ
translated: As far as it heats in front, so far on the back and on the sides.

original: ṛte 'maragirer meror upari brahmaṇaḥ sabhām /
analyzed: ṛte mara gireḥ meroḥ upari brahmaṇaḥ sabhām
translated: Except for the abode of Brahma on the top of the divine mountain Meru.

original: ye ye marīcayo 'rkasya prayānti brahmaṇaḥ sabhām /
analyzed: ye ye marīcayaḥ rkasya prayānti brahmaṇaḥ sabhām
translated: Those rays of the sun that go to the abode of Brahma,

original: te te nirastās tadbhāsā pratīpam upayānti vai // / / //
analyzed: te te nirastāḥ tad bhāsā pratīpam upayānti vai
translated: they are all repelled by its light and return in the opposite direction.

original: tasmād diśy uttarasyāṃ vai divārātriḥ sadaiva hi /
analyzed: tasmāt diśi uttarasyām vai divārātriḥ sadā eva hi
translated: Therefore, in the northern direction, there is always day and night,

original: sarveṣāṃ dvīpavarṣāṇāṃ merur uttarato yataḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarveṣām dvīpa varṣāṇām meruḥ uttaratas yatas
translated: because Meru is to the north of all the islands and countries.

original: prabhā vivasvato rātrāv astaṃ gacchati bhāskare /
analyzed: prabhā vivasvataḥ rātrau astam gacchati bhāskare
translated: The radiance of the sun, when the sun goes to set,

original: viśaty agnim ato rātrau vahnir dūrāt prakāśate // / / //
analyzed: viśati agnim atas rātrau vahniḥ dūrāt prakāśate
translated: Therefore, at night, fire enters into the sun, and the fire shines from a distance.

original: vahnipādas tathā bhānuṃ dineṣv āviśati dvija /
analyzed: vahni pādaḥ tathā bhānum dineṣu āviśati dvija
translated: O Brahmin, in the same way, the foot of fire enters the sun during the days.

original: atīva vahnisaṃyogād ataḥ sūryaḥ prakāśate // / / //
analyzed: atīva vahni saṃyogāt atas sūryaḥ prakāśate
translated: Therefore, the sun shines due to its excessive contact with fire.

original: tejasī bhāskarāgneye prakāśoṣṇasvarūpiṇī /
analyzed: tejasī bhāskara āgneye prakāśa uṣṇa svarūpiṇī
translated: The two energies of the sun and fire, having the nature of light and heat,

original: parasparānupraveśād āpyāyete divāniśam // / / //
analyzed: paraspara anupraveśāt āpyāyete divāniśam
translated: increase day and night due to their mutual penetration.

original: dakṣiṇottarabhūmyardhe samuttiṣṭhati bhāskare /
analyzed: dakṣiṇa uttara bhūmi ardhe samuttiṣṭhati bhāskare
translated: When the sun rises in the southern and northern hemispheres,

original: ahorātraṃ viśaty ambhas tamaḥprākāśyaśīlavat // / / //
analyzed: ahorātram viśati ambhaḥ tamaḥ prākāśya śīlavat
translated: day and night enter the water, having the nature of darkness and light.

original: ātāmrā hi bhavanty āpo divā naktapraveśanāt /
analyzed: ātāmrāḥ hi bhavanti āpaḥ divā nakta praveśanāt
translated: For, the water becomes reddish due to entering the night during the day.

original: dinaṃ viśati caivāmbho bhāskare 'stam upāgate /
analyzed: dinam viśati ca eva ambhaḥ bhāskare upāgate
translated: And when the sun has set, the day enters the water.

original: tasmāc chuklībhavanty āpo naktam ahnaḥ praveśanāt // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt śuklībhavanti āpaḥ naktam ahnaḥ praveśanāt
translated: Therefore, the water becomes white due to entering the day during the night.

original: evaṃ puṣkaramadhye tu yadā yāti divākaraḥ /
analyzed: evam puṣkara madhye tu yadā yāti divākaraḥ
translated: Thus, when the sun moves in the middle of the lotus,

original: triṃśadbhāgaṃ tu medinyās tadā mauhūrtikī gatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: triṃśat bhāgam tu medinyāḥ tadā mauhūrtikī gatiḥ
translated: then it is the motion of a muhurta, one-thirtieth of the earth.

original: kulālacakraparyanto bhramann eṣa divākaraḥ /
analyzed: kulāla cakra paryantaḥ bhraman eṣa divākaraḥ
translated: The sun, moving like the edge of a potter's wheel,

original: karoty ahas tathā rātriṃ vimuñcan medinīṃ dvija // / / //
analyzed: karoti ahar tathā rātrim vimuñcan medinīm dvija
translated: creates day and night, O Brahmin, leaving the earth.

original: ayanasyottarasyādau makaraṃ yāti bhāskaraḥ /
analyzed: ayanasya uttarasya ādau makaram yāti bhāskaraḥ
translated: At the beginning of the northern solstice, the sun enters Capricorn.

original: tataḥ kumbhaṃ ca mīnaṃ ca rāśe rāśyantaraṃ dvija // / / //
analyzed: tatas kumbham ca mīnam ca rāśeḥ rāśi antaram dvija
translated: Then, O Brahmin, it enters Aquarius and Pisces, one sign after another.

original: triṣv eteṣv atha bhukteṣu tato vaiṣuvatīṃ gatim /
analyzed: triṣu eteṣu atha bhukteṣu tatas vaiṣuvatīm gatim
translated: When these three signs have been traversed, then the sun proceeds to the equinoctial passage,

original: prayāti savitā kurvann ahorātraṃ tataḥ samam // / / //
analyzed: prayāti savitā kurvan ahorātram tatas samam
translated: making day and night equal.

original: tato rātriḥ kṣayaṃ yāti vardhate 'nudinaṃ dinam // / / //
analyzed: tatas rātriḥ kṣayam yāti vardhate nu dinam dinam
translated: Then night diminishes and day increases.

original: tataś ca mithunasyānte parāṃ kāṣṭhām upāgataḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca mithunasya ante parām kāṣṭhām upāgataḥ
translated: Then, at the end of Gemini, having reached its farthest limit,

original: rāśiṃ karkaṭakaṃ prāpya kurute dakṣiṇāyanam // / / //
analyzed: rāśim karkaṭakam prāpya kurute dakṣiṇāyanam
translated: the sun enters the sign of Cancer and begins its southern course.

original: kulālacakraparyanto yathā śīghraṃ pravartate /
analyzed: kulāla cakra paryantaḥ yathā śīghram pravartate
translated: Just as the circumference of a potter's wheel moves swiftly,

original: dakṣiṇe prakrame sūryas tathā śīghraṃ pravartate // / / //
analyzed: dakṣiṇe prakrame sūryaḥ tathā śīghram pravartate
translated: so the sun moves swiftly in its southern course.

original: ativegitayā kālaṃ vāyuvegagatiś caran /
analyzed: ati vegi tayā kālam vāyu vega gatiḥ caran
translated: Moving swiftly, with the speed of the wind, it traverses the time,

original: tasmāt prakṛṣṭāṃ bhūmiṃ tu kālenālpena gacchati // / / //🔽sūryo dvādaśabhiḥ śaighryān muhūrtair dakṣiṇāyane /
analyzed: tasmāt prakṛṣṭām bhūmim tu kālena alpena gacchati  sūryaḥ dvādaśabhiḥ śaighryāt muhūrtaiḥ dakṣiṇāyane
translated: and therefore covers a great distance in a short time.🔽In the southern solstice, the sun, due to its swiftness, covers twelve signs in twelve muhurtas.

original: trayodaśārdham ṛkṣāṇām ahnā tu carate dvija /
analyzed: trayodaśa ardham ṛkṣāṇām ahnā tu carate dvija
translated: O Brahmin, it traverses thirteen and a half signs in a day.

original: muhūrtais tāvadṛkṣāṇi naktam aṣṭādaśaiś caran // / / //
analyzed: muhūrtaiḥ tāvat ṛkṣāṇi naktam aṣṭādaśaiḥ caran
translated: In the night, it traverses the same number of signs in eighteen muhurtas.

original: kulālacakramadhyastho yathā mandaṃ prasarpati /
analyzed: kulāla cakra madhya sthaḥ yathā mandam prasarpati
translated: As a potter's wheel, when its momentum is exhausted, slows down and stops,

original: tathodagayane sūryaḥ sarpate mandavikramaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tathā udagayane sūryaḥ sarpate manda vikramaḥ
translated: so the sun moves slowly in the northern solstice.

original: tasmād dīrgheṇa kālena bhūmim alpāṃ tu gacchati /
analyzed: tasmāt dīrgheṇa kālena bhūmim alpām tu gacchati
translated: Therefore, in a long time, it covers a small distance on the earth.

original: aṣṭādaśamuhūrtaṃ yad uttarāyaṇapaścimam // / / //
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa muhūrtam yat uttarāyaṇa paścimam
translated: The last eighteen muhurtas of the northern solstice

original: ahar bhavati tatrāpi carate mandavikramaḥ // / / //🔽trayodaśārdham ahnaiva ṛkṣāṇāṃ carate raviḥ /
analyzed: ahar bhavati tatra api carate manda vikramaḥ  trayodaśa ardham ahnā eva ṛkṣāṇām carate raviḥ
translated: are the day, and even there, the sun moves slowly.🔽The sun moves through thirteen and a half signs in a day,

original: muhūrtais tāvadṛkṣāṇi rātrau dvādaśabhiś caran // / / //
analyzed: muhūrtaiḥ tāvat ṛkṣāṇi rātrau dvādaśabhiḥ caran
translated: and through twelve muhurtas in the night, moving through the same number of signs.

original: adho mandataraṃ nābhyāṃ cakraṃ bhramati vai yathā /
analyzed: adhas mandataram nābhyām cakram bhramati vai yathā
translated: Just as a wheel moves more slowly below the axle,

original: mṛtpiṇḍa iva madhyastho dhruvo bhramati vai tathā // / / //
analyzed: mṛd piṇḍaḥ iva madhya sthaḥ dhruvaḥ bhramati vai tathā
translated: so does Dhruva move more slowly, like a lump of clay in the middle.

original: kulālacakranābhis tu yathā tatraiva vartate /
analyzed: kulāla cakra nābhiḥ tu yathā tatra eva vartate
translated: Just as the nave of a potter's wheel remains in the same place,

original: dhruvas tathā hi maitreya tatraiva parivartate // / / //
analyzed: dhruvaḥ tathā hi maitreya tatra eva parivartate
translated: so does Dhruva, O Maitreya, revolve in the same place.

original: ubhayoḥ kāṣṭhayor madhye bhramato maṇḍalāni ca /🔽divā naktaṃ ca sūryasya mandā śīghrā ca vai gatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: ubhayoḥ kāṣṭhayoḥ madhye bhramataḥ maṇḍalāni ca  divā naktam ca sūryasya mandā śīghrā ca vai gatiḥ
translated: Between the two extremities, while moving in circles,🔽the sun's motion is slow by day and fast by night.

original: mandāhni yasminn ayane śīghrā naktaṃ tadā gatiḥ /
analyzed: manda ahni yasmin ayane śīghrā naktam tadā gatiḥ
translated: In the northern solstice, when the day is slow, the night is fast,

original: śīghrā niśi yadā cāsya tadā mandā divā gatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: śīghrā niśi yadā ca asya tadā mandā divā gatiḥ
translated: When his motion is rapid at night, then it is slow by day.

original: ekapramāṇam evaiṣa mārgaṃ yāti divākaraḥ /
analyzed: eka pramāṇam eva eṣa mārgam yāti divākaraḥ
translated: The sun moves in a path of one measure only.

original: ahorātreṇa yo bhuṅkte samastā rāśayo dvija // / / //
analyzed: ahorātreṇa yaḥ bhuṅkte samastāḥ rāśayaḥ dvija
translated: O Brahmin, he who eats all the signs in a day and night,

original: ṣaḍ eva rāśayo bhuṅkte rātrāv anyāṃś ca ṣaḍ divā // / / //
analyzed: ṣaṭ eva rāśayaḥ bhuṅkte rātrau anyān ca ṣaṭ divā
translated: eats only six signs at night and six others during the day.

original: rāśipramāṇajanitā dīrghahrasvātmatā dine /
analyzed: rāśi pramāṇa janitā dīrgha hrasva ātma tā dine
translated: The length and shortness of the day is produced by the measure of the signs,

original: tathā niśāyāṃ rāśīnāṃ pramāṇair laghudīrghatā // / / //
analyzed: tathā niśāyām rāśīnām pramāṇaiḥ laghu dīrgha tā
translated: and likewise the lightness and heaviness of the signs at night by their measures.

original: dināder dīrghahrasvatvaṃ tadbhogenaiva jāyate /
analyzed: dina ādeḥ dīrgha hrasva tvam tad bhogena eva jāyate
translated: The length and shortness of the day and so on is produced by the enjoyment of those [signs].

original: uttare prakrame śīghrā niśi mandā gatir divā // / / //
analyzed: uttare prakrame śīghrā niśi mandā gatiḥ divā
translated: When proceeding north, the motion is rapid at night and slow by day,

original: dakṣiṇe tv ayane caiva viparītā vivasvataḥ // / / //🔽uṣā rātriḥ samākhyātā vyuṣṭiś cāpy ucyate dinam /
analyzed: dakṣiṇe tu ayane ca eva viparītā vivasvataḥ  uṣāḥ rātriḥ samākhyātā vyuṣṭiḥ ca api ucyate dinam
translated: but in the southern solstice, the motion of the sun is the reverse.🔽Dawn is called night, and the appearance [of the sun] is said to be day.

original: procyate ca tathā saṃdhyā uṣāvyuṣṭyor yad antaram // / / //
analyzed: procyate ca tathā saṃdhyā uṣā vyuṣṭyoḥ yat antaram
translated: And the interval between dawn and appearance is said to be twilight.

original: saṃdhyākāle tu saṃprāpte raudre paramadāruṇe /
analyzed: saṃdhyā kāle tu saṃprāpte raudre parama dāruṇe
translated: When twilight has arrived, terrible and extremely dreadful,

original: mandehā rākṣasā ghorāḥ sūryam icchanti khāditum // / / //
analyzed: mandehāḥ rākṣasāḥ ghorāḥ sūryam icchanti khāditum
translated: the terrible and fearful demons called Mandehas desire to eat the sun.

original: prajāpatikṛtaḥ śāpas teṣāṃ maitreya rakṣasām /
analyzed: prajāpati kṛtaḥ śāpaḥ teṣām maitreya rakṣasām
translated: O Maitreya, there is a curse on those demons by Prajapati,

original: akṣayatvaṃ śarīrāṇāṃ maraṇaṃ ca dine dine // / / //
analyzed: akṣaya tvam śarīrāṇām maraṇam ca dine dine
translated: The imperishability of bodies and death every day.

original: tataḥ sūryasya tair yuddhaṃ bhavaty atyantadāruṇam /
analyzed: tatas sūryasya taiḥ yuddham bhavati atyanta dāruṇam
translated: Then there is a battle between the sun and them, extremely terrible.

original: tato dvijottamās toyaṃ yat kṣipanti mahāmune // / / //
analyzed: tatas dvijottamāḥ toyam yat kṣipanti mahā mune
translated: Then, O best of Brahmins, the water that is sprinkled, O great sage,

original: oṃkārabrahmasaṃyuktaṃ gāyatryā cābhimantritam /
analyzed: oṃkāra brahma saṃyuktam gāyatryā ca abhimantritam
translated: Conjoined with the syllable Om and consecrated with the Gayatri mantra,

original: tena dahyanti te pāpā vajrībhūtena vāriṇā // / / //
analyzed: tena dahyanti te pāpāḥ vajrībhūtena vāriṇā
translated: By that, those sinners are burned by the water that has become like lightning.

original: agnihotre hūyate yā samantrā prathamāhutiḥ /
analyzed: agnihotre hūyate yā sa mantrā prathama āhutiḥ
translated: The first oblation that is offered in the Agnihotra with the proper mantra,

original: sūryo jyotiḥ sahasrāṃśus tayā dīpyati bhāskaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: sūryaḥ jyotiḥ sahasrāṃśuḥ tayā dīpyati bhāskaraḥ
translated: The sun, the thousand-rayed light, shines with that radiance.

original: oṃkāro bhagavān viṣṇus tridhāmā vacasāṃ patiḥ /
analyzed: oṃkāraḥ bhagavān viṣṇuḥ tridhāmā vacasām patiḥ
translated: The syllable Om is the revered Vishnu, the three worlds, the lord of speech,

original: taduccāraṇatas te tu vināśaṃ yānti rākṣasāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tad uccāraṇataḥ te tu vināśam yānti rākṣasāḥ
translated: By uttering that, those Rakshasas meet with destruction.

original: vaiṣṇavo 'ṃśaḥ paraḥ sūryo yo 'ntarjyotir asaṃplavam /🔽abhidhāyaka oṃkāras tasya sa prerakaḥ paraḥ // / / //
analyzed: vaiṣṇavaḥ ṃśaḥ paraḥ sūryaḥ yaḥ ntar jyotiḥ a saṃplavam  abhidhāyakaḥ oṃkāraḥ tasya sa prerakaḥ paraḥ
translated: The supreme portion of Vishnu is the sun, the inner light that does not perish,🔽The syllable Om is its supreme impeller.

original: tena tat preritaṃ jyotir oṃkāreṇātha dīptimat /
analyzed: tena tat preritam jyotiḥ oṃkāreṇa atha dīptimat
translated: Impelled by that, the radiant light, along with the syllable Om,

original: dahaty aśeṣarakṣāṃsi mandehākhyāny aghāni vai // / / //
analyzed: dahati aśeṣa rakṣāṃsi mandeha ākhyāni aghāni vai
translated: Burns all the Rakshasas, the evil ones known as Mandehas.

original: tasmān nollaṅghanaṃ kāryaṃ saṃdhyopāsanakarmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt na ullaṅghanam kāryam saṃdhyā upāsana karmaṇaḥ
translated: Therefore, the rite of worship at dawn and dusk should not be transgressed.

original: sa hanti sūryaṃ saṃdhyāyā nopāstiṃ kurute hi yaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa hanti sūryam saṃdhyāyāḥ na upāstim kurute hi yaḥ
translated: He who does not perform the evening worship kills the sun.

original: tataḥ prayāti bhagavān brāhmaṇair abhirakṣitaḥ /
analyzed: tatas prayāti bhagavān brāhmaṇaiḥ abhirakṣitaḥ
translated: Then the Lord departs, protected by the Brahmins,

original: vālakhilyādibhiś caiva jagataḥ pālanodyataḥ // / / //
analyzed: vālakhilya ādibhiḥ ca eva jagataḥ pālana udyataḥ
translated: And by the Valakhilya and others, ready to protect the world.

original: After / / / / ins /
analyzed: after ins
translated: After this, the following is inserted:

original: prabhur vaikhānasair api // / / / //
analyzed: prabhuḥ vaikhānasaiḥ api
translated: The Lord is also with the Vaikhanasas.

original: mahātmabhir mahātmā vai / / / / / / / / // / / / //
analyzed: mahātmabhiḥ mahātmā vai
translated: The Great Soul is with the great souls.

original: kāṣṭhā nimeṣā daśa pañca caiva triṃśac ca kāṣṭhā gaṇayet kalāṃ tām /
analyzed: kāṣṭhāḥ nimeṣāḥ daśa pañca ca eva triṃśat ca kāṣṭhāḥ gaṇayet kalām tām
translated: Fifteen and ten are the kashthas, and thirty kashthas should be counted as one kala.

original: triṃśatkalāś caiva bhaven muhūrtas tais triṃśatā rātryahanī samete // / / //
analyzed: triṃśat kalāḥ ca eva bhavet muhūrtaḥ taiḥ triṃśatā rātri ahanī samete
translated: Thirty kalas make one muhurta, and thirty of those make one day and night, equal in length.

original: hrāsavṛddhī tv aharbhāgair divasānāṃ yathākramam /
analyzed: hrāsa vṛddhī tu ahar bhāgaiḥ divasānām yathākramam
translated: The decrease and increase of the day parts are in order.

original: saṃdhyā muhūrtamātrā vai hrāsavṛddhau samā smṛtā // / / //
analyzed: saṃdhyā muhūrta mātrā vai hrāsa vṛddhau samā smṛtā
translated: The sandhya muhurta is considered equal in the decrease and increase.

original: rekhāprabhṛty athāditye trimuhūrtagate tu vai /
analyzed: rekhā prabhṛti atha āditye tri muhūrta gate tu vai
translated: When the sun has reached the line and three muhurtas have passed,

original: prātaḥ smṛtas tataḥ kālo bhāgaś cāhnaḥ sa pañcamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prātar smṛtaḥ tatas kālaḥ bhāgaḥ ca ahnaḥ sa pañcamaḥ
translated: That time is considered morning, the fifth part of the day.

original: tasmāt prātastanāt kālāt trimuhūrtas tu saṃgavaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt prātastanāt kālāt tri muhūrtaḥ tu saṃgavaḥ
translated: From that morning time, three muhurtas is sangava.

original: madhyāhnas trimuhūrtas tu tasmāt kālāt tu saṃgavāt // / / //
analyzed: madhyāhnaḥ tri muhūrtaḥ tu tasmāt kālāt tu saṃgavāt
translated: The midday is three muhūrtas, from that time until sunset.

original: tasmān mādhyāhnikāt kālād aparāhṇa iti smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt mādhyāhnikāt kālāt aparāhṇaḥ iti smṛtaḥ
translated: From that midday time, it is known as the afternoon.

original: traya eva muhūrtās tu kālabhāgaḥ smṛto budhaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: trayaḥ eva muhūrtāḥ tu kāla bhāgaḥ smṛtaḥ budhaiḥ
translated: The wise consider three muhūrtas to be the part of the day.

original: aparāhṇe vyatīte tu kālaḥ sāyāhna ucyate /
analyzed: aparāhṇe vyatīte tu kālaḥ sāyāhnaḥ ucyate
translated: When the afternoon has passed, the time is said to be evening.

original: daśapañcamuhūrtāho muhūrtās traya eva ca // / / //
analyzed: daśa pañca muhūrta ahaḥ muhūrtāḥ trayaḥ eva ca
translated: Fifteen muhūrtas, ten muhūrtas, and three muhūrtas -

original: daśapañcamuhūrtaṃ vai ahar vaiṣuvataṃ smṛtam // / / //
analyzed: daśa pañca muhūrtam vai ahar vaiṣuvatam smṛtam
translated: The day of the equinox is said to be fifteen muhūrtas.

original: vardhate 'ho hrasati ca ayane dakṣiṇottare /
analyzed: vardhate ho hrasati ca ayane dakṣiṇa uttare
translated: The day increases and decreases in the southern and northern solstices.

original: ahas tu grasate rātriṃ rātrir grasati vāsaram // / / //🔽śaradvasantayor madhye viṣuvaṃ tu vibhāvyate /
analyzed: ahar tu grasate rātrim rātriḥ grasati vāsaram  śarad vasantayoḥ madhye viṣuvam tu vibhāvyate
translated: But the day swallows the night, and the night swallows the day.🔽In the middle of autumn and spring, the equinox is observed.

original: tulāmeṣagate bhānau samarātridinaṃ tu tat // / / //
analyzed: tulā meṣa gate bhānau sama rātri dinam tu tat
translated: When the sun is in Libra or Aries, the day and night are equal.

original: karkaṭāvasthite bhānau dakṣiṇāyanam ucyate /
analyzed: karkaṭa avasthite bhānau dakṣiṇāyanam ucyate
translated: When the sun is in Cancer, it is said to be the southern solstice.

original: uttarāyaṇam apy uktaṃ makarasthe divākare // / / //
analyzed: uttarāyaṇam api uktam makara sthe divākare
translated: The northern solstice is also said to be when the sun is in Capricorn.

original: triṃśanmuhūrtaṃ kathitam ahorātraṃ tu yan mayā /
analyzed: triṃśat muhūrtam kathitam ahorātram tu yat mayā
translated: The day and night that I have described as thirty muhūrtas,

original: tāni pañcadaśa brahman pakṣa ity abhidhīyate // / / //
analyzed: tāni pañcadaśa brahman pakṣaḥ iti abhidhīyate
translated: fifteen of those, O Brahmin, are called a fortnight.

original: māsaḥ pakṣadvayenokto dvau māsau cārkajāv ṛtuḥ /
translated: Two months caused by the sun make a season.

original: ṛtutrayaṃ cāpy ayanaṃ dve 'yane varṣasaṃjñite // / / //
analyzed: ṛtu trayam ca api ayanam dve yane varṣa saṃjñite
translated: Three seasons make an ayana, and two ayanas make what is called a year.

original: saṃvatsarādayaḥ pañca caturmāsavikalpitāḥ /
analyzed: saṃvatsara ādayaḥ pañca catur māsa vikalpitāḥ
translated: The five, Samvatsara and the rest, are determined by four months each.

original: niścayaḥ sarvakālasya yugam ity abhidhīyate // / / //
analyzed: niścayaḥ sarva kālasya yugam iti abhidhīyate
translated: The determination of all time is called a yuga.

original: saṃvatsaras tu prathamo dvitīyaḥ parivatsaraḥ /
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ tu prathamaḥ dvitīyaḥ parivatsaraḥ
translated: The first is Samvatsara, the second is Parivatsara,

original: idvatsaras tṛtīyas tu caturthaś cānuvatsaraḥ /
analyzed: idvatsaraḥ tṛtīyaḥ tu caturthaḥ ca anuvatsaraḥ
translated: the third is Idvatsara, the fourth is Anuvatsara,

original: vatsaraḥ pañcamaś cātra kālo 'yaṃ yugasaṃjñitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vatsaraḥ pañcamaḥ ca atra kālaḥ yam yuga saṃjñitaḥ
translated: and the fifth is Vatsara - this time is called a yuga.

original: yaḥ śvetasyottare śailaḥ śṛṅgavān iti viśrutaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ śvetasya uttare śailaḥ śṛṅgavān iti viśrutaḥ
translated: The mountain to the north of the white one, known as Sringavan,

original: trīṇi tasya tu śṛṅgāṇi yair asau śṛṅgavān smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: trīṇi tasya tu śṛṅgāṇi yaiḥ asau śṛṅgavān smṛtaḥ
translated: has three peaks, by which it is remembered as Sringavan.

original: dakṣiṇaṃ cottaraṃ caiva madhyaṃ vaiṣuvataṃ tathā /
analyzed: dakṣiṇam ca uttaram ca eva madhyam vaiṣuvatam tathā
translated: The southern, the northern, and the central one, which is the equinoctial point,

original: śaradvasantayor madhye tad bhānuḥ pratipadyate /
analyzed: śarad vasantayoḥ madhye tat bhānuḥ pratipadyate
translated: the sun enters in the middle of autumn and spring,

original: meṣādau ca tulādau ca maitreya viṣuvatsthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: meṣa ādau ca tulā ādau ca maitreya viṣuvat sthitaḥ
translated: O Maitreya, when it is in Aries or Libra, it is in the equinoctial position.

original: tadā tulyam ahorātraṃ karoti timirāpahaḥ /
analyzed: tadā tulyam ahorātram karoti timirāpahaḥ
translated: Then the remover of darkness makes day and night equal,

original: daśapañcamuhūrtaṃ vai tad etad ubhayaṃ smṛtam // / / //
analyzed: daśa pañca muhūrtam vai tat etat ubhayam smṛtam
translated: each of them is said to be fifteen muhurtas.

original: prathame kṛttikābhāge yadā bhāsvāṃs tadā śaśī /🔽viśākhānāṃ caturthe 'ṃśe mune tiṣṭhaty asaṃśayam // / / //🔽viśākhānāṃ yadā sūryaś caraty aṃśaṃ tṛtīyakam /
analyzed: prathame kṛttikā bhāge yadā bhāsvān tadā śaśī  viśākhānām caturthe ṃśe mune tiṣṭhati asaṃśayam  viśākhānām yadā sūryaḥ carati aṃśam tṛtīyakam
translated: When the sun is in the first part of Krittika, the moon is undoubtedly in the fourth part of Vishakha, O sage.

original: tadā candraṃ vijānīyāt kṛttikāśirasi sthitam // / / //
analyzed: tadā candram vijānīyāt kṛttikā śirasi sthitam
translated: When the sun moves in the third part of Vishakha, one should know that the moon is then situated at the head of Krittika.

original: tadaiva viṣuvākhyo vai kālaḥ puṇyo 'bhidhīyate /
analyzed: tadā eva viṣuva ākhyaḥ vai kālaḥ puṇyaḥ bhidhīyate
translated: At that very time, the period called Visuva is said to be auspicious.

original: tadā dānāni deyāni devebhyaḥ prayatātmabhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tadā dānāni deyāni devebhyaḥ prayata ātmabhiḥ
translated: At that time, gifts should be given to gods by those who are self-controlled.

original: brāhmaṇebhyaḥ pitṛbhyaś ca mukham etat tu dānajam /
analyzed: brāhmaṇebhyaḥ pitṛbhyaḥ ca mukham etat tu dāna jam
translated: This is the foremost among the gifts given to Brahmins and ancestors.

original: dattadānas tu viṣuve kṛtakṛtyo 'bhijāyate // / / //
analyzed: datta dānaḥ tu viṣuve kṛtakṛtyaḥ bhijāyate
translated: One who has given gifts at the time of Visuva becomes successful and contented.

original: ahorātrārdhamāsau tu kalāḥ kāṣṭhāḥ kṣaṇās tathā /
analyzed: ahorātra ardha māsau tu kalāḥ kāṣṭhāḥ kṣaṇāḥ tathā
translated: Day, night, half-month, parts, instants,

original: paurṇamāsī tathā jñeyā amāvāsyā tathaiva ca /
analyzed: paurṇamāsī tathā jñeyā amāvāsyā tathā eva ca
translated: the full moon, and the new moon should be known,

original: sinīvālī kuhūś caiva rākā cānumatis tathā // / / //
analyzed: sinīvālī kuhūḥ ca eva rākā ca anumatiḥ tathā
translated: Sinivali, Kuhu, Raka, and Anumati,

original: tapastapasyau madhumādhavau ca śukraḥ śuciś cāyanam uttaraṃ syāt /
analyzed: tapaḥ tapasyau madhu mādhavau ca śukraḥ śuciḥ ca ayanam uttaram syāt
translated: Tapas and Tapasya are Madhu and Madhava, Shukra and Shuchi are the northern solstice,

original: nabho nabhasyo 'tha iṣaś ca sorjaḥ sahaḥsahasyāv iti dakṣiṇaṃ syāt // / / //
analyzed: nabhaḥ nabhasyaḥ thaḥ iṣaḥ ca sa ūrjaḥ sahaḥ sahasyau iti dakṣiṇam syāt
translated: Nabhas and Nabhasya, Ishan and Urja, Saha and Sahasya are the southern solstice.

original: lokālokas tu yaḥ śailaḥ prāgukto bhavato mayā /
analyzed: lokālokaḥ tu yaḥ śailaḥ prāc uktaḥ bhavataḥ mayā
translated: I have already told you about the mountain Lokāloka.

original: lokapālās tu catvāras tatra tiṣṭhanti suvratāḥ // / / //
analyzed: lokapālāḥ tu catvāraḥ tatra tiṣṭhanti suvratāḥ
translated: The four guardians of the world, of excellent vows, stand there.

original: sudhāmā śaṅkhapāc caiva kardamasyātmajau dvija /
analyzed: sudhāmā śaṅkhapād ca eva kardamasya ātmajau dvija
translated: O twice-born one, Sudhāmā and Śaṅkhapā, the two sons of Kardama,

original: hiraṇyaromā caivānyaś caturthaḥ ketumān api // / / //
analyzed: hiraṇyaromā ca eva anyaḥ caturthaḥ ketumān api
translated: and another, Hiraṇyaromā, and the fourth Ketumān,

original: nirdvaṃdvā nirabhīmānā nistandrā niṣparigrahāḥ /
analyzed: nirdvaṃdvāḥ nirabhīmānāḥ nistandrāḥ niṣparigrahāḥ
translated: free from the pairs of opposites, free from pride, free from drowsiness, free from attachments,

original: lokapālāḥ sthitā hy ete lokāloke caturdiśam // / / //
analyzed: lokapālāḥ sthitāḥ hi ete lokāloke caturdiśam
translated: these guardians of the world stand in the four directions of Lokāloka.

original: uttaraṃ yad agastyasya ajavīthyāś ca dakṣiṇam /
analyzed: uttaram yat agastyasya ajavīthyāḥ ca dakṣiṇam
translated: To the north of Agastya and to the south of Ajavīthī,

original: pitṛyānaḥ sa vai panthā vaiśvānarapathād bahiḥ // / / //
analyzed: pitṛyānaḥ sa vai panthāḥ vaiśvānara pathāt bahis
translated: that path is the path of the manes, outside the path of Agni.

original: tatrāsate mahātmāna ṛṣayo ye 'gnihotriṇaḥ /
analyzed: tatra āsate mahātmānaḥ ṛṣayaḥ ye gnihotriṇaḥ
translated: There dwell the great-souled sages who offer the Agnihotra,

original: bhūtārambhakṛtaṃ brahma śaṃsanta ṛtvigudyatāḥ /
analyzed: bhūta ārambha kṛtam brahma śaṃsantaḥ ṛtvij udyatāḥ
translated: reciting the Brahman that is the origin of beings, led by the priests.

original: lokārambhaṃ prārabhante teṣāṃ panthāḥ sa dakṣiṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: loka ārambham prārabhante teṣām panthāḥ sa dakṣiṇaḥ
translated: They begin the creation of the world; their path is the southern one.

original: calitaṃ te punar brahma sthāpayanti yuge yuge /
analyzed: calitam te punar brahma sthāpayanti yuge yuge
translated: They again establish the moving Brahman in each yuga.

original: saṃtatyā tapasā caiva maryādābhiḥ śrutena ca // / / //
analyzed: saṃtatyā tapasā ca eva maryādābhiḥ śrutena ca
translated: By continuity, austerity, boundaries, and learning.

original: jāyamānās tu pūrve tu paścimānāṃ gṛheṣu vai /
analyzed: jāyamānāḥ tu pūrve tu paścimānām gṛheṣu vai
translated: But the earlier ones are born in the houses of the later ones,

original: paścimāś caiva pūrveṣāṃ jāyante nidhaneṣv iha // / / //
analyzed: paścimāḥ ca eva pūrveṣām jāyante nidhaneṣu iha
translated: and the western ones are born from the eastern ones in the destructions here.

original: evam āvartamānās te tiṣṭhanty ābhūtasaṃplavāt /
analyzed: evam āvartamānāḥ te tiṣṭhanti ā bhūtasaṃplavāt
translated: Thus revolving, they remain until the dissolution of all things.

original: savitur dakṣiṇaṃ mārgaṃ śritā hy ācandratārakam // / / //
analyzed: savituḥ dakṣiṇam mārgam śritāḥ hi ācandratārakam
translated: They follow the southern path of the sun as far as the moon and stars.

original: nāgavīthyuttaraṃ yac ca saptarṣibhyaś ca dakṣiṇam /
analyzed: nāgavīthī uttaram yat ca saptarṣibhyaḥ ca dakṣiṇam
translated: And that which is to the north of the Nāga path and to the south of the seven sages,

original: uttaraḥ savituḥ panthā devayānas tu sa smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: uttaraḥ savituḥ panthāḥ deva yānaḥ tu sa smṛtaḥ
translated: that is the northern path of the sun, known as the path of the gods.

original: tatra te vaśinaḥ siddhā vimalā brahmacāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: tatra te vaśinaḥ siddhāḥ vimalāḥ brahmacāriṇaḥ
translated: There, they are self-controlled, perfected, pure, celibate,

original: saṃtatiṃ te jugupsanti tasmān mṛtyur jitaś ca taiḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃtatim te jugupsanti tasmāt mṛtyuḥ jitaḥ ca taiḥ
translated: and despise continuity, therefore they have conquered death.

original: aṣṭāśītisahasrāṇi yatīnām ūrdhvaretasām /
analyzed: aṣṭāśīti sahasrāṇi yatīnām ūrdhvaretasām
translated: There are eighty-eight thousand ascetics with sublimated sexuality,

original: udakpanthānam aryamṇaḥ śritā hy ābhūtasaṃplavāt // / / //
analyzed: udak panthānam aryamṇaḥ śritāḥ hi ā bhūtasaṃplavāt
translated: who follow the northern path of Aryaman until the dissolution of all things.

original: te 'saṃprayogāl lobhasya maithunasya ca varjanāt /
analyzed: te saṃprayogāt lobhasya maithunasya ca varjanāt
translated: By not engaging in greed, by avoiding sexual intercourse,

original: icchādveṣāpravṛttyā ca bhūtārambhavivarjanāt // / / //
analyzed: icchā dveṣa apravṛttyā ca bhūta ārambha vivarjanāt
translated: by not engaging in desire and aversion, and by avoiding the creation of beings,

original: punaś cākāmasaṃyogāc śabdāder doṣadarśanāt /
analyzed: punar ca a kāma saṃyogāt śabda ādeḥ doṣa darśanāt
translated: and again by not engaging in desire, by seeing faults in sound and so on,

original: ity ebhiḥ kāraṇaiḥ śuddhās te 'mṛtatvaṃ hi bhejire // / / //
analyzed: iti ebhiḥ kāraṇaiḥ śuddhāḥ te mṛta tvam hi bhejire
translated: by these causes they are pure and attain immortality.

original: ābhūtasaṃplavaṃ sthānam amṛtatvaṃ vibhāvyate /
analyzed: ābhūtasaṃplavam sthānam amṛta tvam vibhāvyate
translated: The state of being till the dissolution of all elements is considered immortality.

original: trailokyasthitikālo 'yam apunarmāra ucyate // / / //
analyzed: trailokya sthiti kālaḥ yam a punarmāraḥ ucyate
translated: This is the period of the existence of the three worlds, and is called the Apunarmar (non-returner).

original: brahmahatyāśvamedhābhyāṃ pāpapuṇyakṛto vidhiḥ /
analyzed: brahmahatyā aśvamedhābhyām pāpa puṇya kṛtaḥ vidhiḥ
translated: The rites for the doer of sin and merit, from Brahman-slaughter and horse-sacrifice,

original: ābhūtasaṃplavāntāntaṃ phalam uktaṃ tayor dvija // / / //
analyzed: ā bhūta saṃplava anta antam phalam uktam tayoḥ dvija
translated: The fruit of those two is said to be till the end of the dissolution of all elements, O Brahmin.

original: yāvanmātrapradeśe tu maitreyāvasthito dhruvaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat mātra pradeśe tu maitreya avasthitaḥ dhruvaḥ
translated: In whatever region, Maitreya, Dhruva is situated,

original: kṣayam āyāti tāvat tu bhūmer ābhūtasaṃplave // / / //
analyzed: kṣayam āyāti tāvat tu bhūmeḥ ā bhūta saṃplave
translated: Till that much of the earth is destroyed at the dissolution of all elements.

original: ūrdhvottaram ṛṣibhyas tu dhruvo yatra vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: ūrdhva uttaram ṛṣibhyaḥ tu dhruvaḥ yatra vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Above and north of the sages, where Dhruva is situated,

original: etad viṣṇupadaṃ divyaṃ tṛtīyaṃ vyomni bhāsvaram // / / //🔽nirdhūtadoṣapaṅkānāṃ yatīnāṃ saṃyatātmanām /🔽sthānaṃ tat paramaṃ vipra puṇyapāpaparikṣaye // / / //
analyzed: etat viṣṇu padam divyam tṛtīyam vyomni bhāsvaram  nirdhūta doṣa paṅkānām yatīnām saṃyata ātmanām  sthānam tat paramam vipra puṇya pāpa parikṣaye
translated: That is the divine abode of Vishnu, the third luminous one in the sky.🔽O Brahmin, that is the highest abode of ascetics who have shaken off the mud of faults, who have controlled their minds,

original: apuṇyapuṇyoparame kṣīṇāśeṣāptihetavaḥ /
analyzed: apuṇya puṇya uparame kṣīṇa aśeṣa āpti hetavaḥ
translated: At the destruction of both merit and demerit, when all the causes of attainment are exhausted,

original: yatra gatvā na śocanti tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam // / / //
analyzed: yatra gatvā na śocanti tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam
translated: Where having gone one does not grieve, that is the highest abode of Vishnu.

original: dharmadhruvādyās tiṣṭhanti yatra te lokasākṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: dharma dhruva ādyāḥ tiṣṭhanti yatra te lokasākṣiṇaḥ
translated: Where Dharma, Dhruva and others, the witnesses of the worlds, are situated,

original: tatsārṣṭyotpannayogeddhās tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam // / / //
analyzed: tad sārṣṭya utpanna yoga iddhāḥ tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam
translated: Generated by association with that, burnt by yoga, that is the highest abode of Vishnu.

original: yatrotam etat protaṃ ca yad bhūtaṃ sacarācaram /
analyzed: yatra utam etat protam ca yat bhūtam sacarācaram
translated: Wherein is woven this universe, moving and unmoving, which is past, present and to come,

original: bhāvyaṃ ca viśvaṃ maitreya tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam // / / //
analyzed: bhāvyam ca viśvam maitreya tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam
translated: and the whole world, Maitreya, that is to be, that is the supreme abode of Vishnu.

original: divīva cakṣur ātataṃ vitataṃ yan mahātmanām /
analyzed: divi iva cakṣuḥ ātatam vitatam yat mahātmanām
translated: Which is spread out like the eye in the sky of the great souls,

original: vivekajñānadṛṣṭaṃ ca tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam // / / //
analyzed: viveka jñāna dṛṣṭam ca tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam
translated: and is seen by the knowledge of discrimination, that is the supreme abode of Vishnu.

original: yasmin pratiṣṭhito bhāsvān meḍhībhūtaḥ svayaṃ dhruvaḥ /
analyzed: yasmin pratiṣṭhitaḥ bhāsvān meḍhī bhūtaḥ svayam dhruvaḥ
translated: In which is established the shining Dhruva, the pivot himself,

original: dhruve ca sarvajyotīṃṣi jyotiṣv ambhomuco dvija // / / //
analyzed: dhruve ca sarva jyotīṃṣi jyotiṣu ambhomucaḥ dvija
translated: and in Dhruva all the stars, O twice-born, and in the stars the rain-clouds,

original: megheṣu saṃtatā vṛṣṭir vṛṣṭeḥ sṛṣṭeś ca poṣaṇam /
analyzed: megheṣu saṃtatā vṛṣṭiḥ vṛṣṭeḥ sṛṣṭeḥ ca poṣaṇam
translated: and in the clouds the continuous rain, and from rain the nourishment of creation,

original: āpyāyanaṃ ca sarveṣāṃ devādīnāṃ mahāmune // / / //
analyzed: āpyāyanam ca sarveṣām deva ādīnām mahā mune
translated: and the satisfaction of all the gods and others, O great sage.

original: tataś cājyāhutidvārā poṣitās te havirbhujaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca ājya āhuti dvārā poṣitāḥ te havirbhujaḥ
translated: And then, the fire-offerings, nourished through the oblations,

original: vṛṣṭeḥ kāraṇatāṃ yānti bhūtānāṃ sthitaye punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vṛṣṭeḥ kāraṇa tām yānti bhūtānām sthitaye punar
translated: become the cause of rain again for the sustenance of beings.

original: evam etat padaṃ viṣṇos tṛtīyam amalātmakam /
analyzed: evam etat padam viṣṇoḥ tṛtīyam amala ātmakam
translated: Thus this third abode of Vishnu, of pure nature,

original: ādhārabhūtaṃ lokānāṃ trayāṇāṃ vṛṣṭikāraṇam // / / //
analyzed: ādhāra bhūtam lokānām trayāṇām vṛṣṭi kāraṇam
translated: is the support of the worlds, the cause of rain for the three.

original: tataḥ prabhavati brahman sarvapāpaharā sarit /
analyzed: tatas prabhavati brahman sarva pāpa harā sarit
translated: Then, O Brahman, flows the river that removes all sins,

original: gaṅgā devāṅganāṅgānām anulepanapiñjarā // / / //
analyzed: gaṅgā deva aṅganā aṅgānām anulepana piñjarā
translated: the Ganges, yellow with the unguents of the limbs of the celestial women.

original: vāmapādāmbujāṅguṣṭhanakhasrotovinirgatām /
analyzed: vāma pāda ambuja aṅguṣṭha nakha srotaḥ vinirgatām
translated: Which flows from the nail of the toe of the lotus-like left foot,

original: viṣṇor bibharti yāṃ bhaktyā śirasāharniśaṃ dhruvaḥ // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ bibharti yām bhaktyā śirasā aharniśam dhruvaḥ
translated: Which Dhruva, with devotion, bears on his head day and night.

original: tataḥ saptarṣayo yasyāḥ prāṇāyāmaparāyaṇāḥ /🔽tiṣṭhanti vīcimālābhir uhyamānajaṭājale // / / //
analyzed: tatas saptarṣayaḥ yasyāḥ prāṇāyāma parāyaṇāḥ  tiṣṭhanti vīci mālābhiḥ uhyamāna jaṭā jale
translated: Then the seven sages, intent on breath control,🔽Stand in the water of the matted locks, being carried by the garlands of waves.

original: vāryoghaiḥ saṃtatair yasyāḥ plāvitaṃ śaśimaṇḍalam /
analyzed: vāri oghaiḥ saṃtataiḥ yasyāḥ plāvitam śaśi maṇḍalam
translated: By the continuous streams of water, the lunar disc

original: bhūyo 'dhikatarāṃ kāntiṃ vahaty etad upakṣayam // / / //
analyzed: bhūyas dhikatarām kāntim vahati etat upakṣayam
translated: Bears this decrease, with increased beauty.

original: merupṛṣṭhe pataty uccair niṣkrāntā śaśimaṇḍalāt /
analyzed: meru pṛṣṭhe patati uccais niṣkrāntā śaśi maṇḍalāt
translated: Rising high from the lunar disc, it falls on the back of Meru,

original: jagataḥ pāvanārthāya yā prayāti caturdiśam // / / //
analyzed: jagataḥ pāvana arthāya yā prayāti caturdiśam
translated: Which flows in the four directions for the purification of the world.

original: sītā cālakanandā ca cakṣur bhadrā ca saṃsthitā /
analyzed: sītā ca alakanandā ca cakṣuḥ bhadrā ca saṃsthitā
translated: Sita, Alakananda, Caksu, and Bhadra are situated,

original: ekaiva yā caturbhedā digbhedagatilakṣaṇā // / / //
analyzed: ekā eva yā catur bhedā diś bheda gati lakṣaṇā
translated: Which is one, but divided into four by the directions.

original: bhedaṃ cālakanandākhyaṃ yasyāḥ śarvo 'pi dakṣiṇam /
analyzed: bhedam ca alakanandā ākhyam yasyāḥ dakṣiṇam
translated: And whose division called Alakananda,

original: dadhāra śirasā prītyā varṣāṇām adhikaṃ śatam // / / //🔽śambhor jaṭākalāpāc ca viniṣkrāntāsthiśarkarān /
analyzed: dadhāra śirasā prītyā varṣāṇām adhikam śatam  śambhoḥ jaṭā kalāpāt ca viniṣkrānta asthi śarkarān
translated: Shiva held on his head with love for more than a hundred years.🔽And which, flowing from the matted locks of Shiva,

original: plāvayitvā divaṃ ninye yā pāpān sagarātmajān // / / //
analyzed: plāvayitvā divam ninye yā pāpān sagara ātmajān
translated: Carried the bones of Sagara's sons to heaven after drowning them.

original: snātasya salile yasyāḥ sadyaḥ pāpaṃ praṇaśyati /
analyzed: snātasya salile yasyāḥ sadyas pāpam praṇaśyati
translated: In whose waters, when bathed, the sin of one is immediately destroyed,

original: apūrvapuṇyaprāptiś ca sadyo maitreya jāyate // / / //
analyzed: apūrva puṇya prāptiḥ ca sadyas maitreya jāyate
translated: And the attainment of unprecedented merit arises immediately, O Maitreya.

original: dattāḥ pitṛbhyo yatrāpas tanayaiḥ śraddhayānvitaiḥ /
analyzed: dattāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ yatra āpaḥ tanayaiḥ śraddhayā anvitaiḥ
translated: Where the waters are offered by the sons endowed with faith to the ancestors,

original: samātrayaṃ prayacchanti tṛptiṃ maitreya durlabhām // / / //
analyzed: samā trayam prayacchanti tṛptim maitreya durlabhām
translated: They give satisfaction for three months, which is difficult to obtain, O Maitreya.

original: yasyām iṣṭvā mahāyajñair yajñeśaṃ puruṣottamam /
analyzed: yasyām iṣṭvā mahā yajñaiḥ yajñeśam puruṣottamam
translated: Having worshipped the Lord of sacrifice, the Supreme Being, in great sacrifices,

original: dvijabhūpāḥ parām ṛddhim avāpur divi ceha ca // / / //
analyzed: dvija bhūpāḥ parām ṛddhim avāpuḥ divi ca iha ca
translated: The Brahmins and kings attained the highest prosperity in heaven and on earth.

original: snānād vidhūtapāpāś ca yajjale yatayas tathā /
analyzed: snānāt vidhūta pāpāḥ ca yad jale yatayaḥ tathā
translated: The ascetics, having bathed in whose waters, are freed from sins,

original: keśavāsaktamanasaḥ prāptā nirvāṇam uttamam // / / //
analyzed: keśava āsakta manasaḥ prāptāḥ nirvāṇam uttamam
translated: And those with minds attached to the hair, have attained the highest liberation.

original: śrutābhilaṣitā dṛṣṭā spṛṣṭā pītāvagāhitā /
analyzed: śrutā abhilaṣitā dṛṣṭā spṛṣṭā pītā avagāhitā
translated: Heard, desired, seen, touched, drunk, and plunged into,

original: yā pāvayati bhūtāni kīrtitā ca dine dine // / / //
analyzed: yā pāvayati bhūtāni kīrtitā ca dine dine
translated: Which purifies beings when praised day after day.

original: gaṅgā gaṅgeti yan nāma yojanānāṃ śateṣv api /
analyzed: gaṅgā gaṅgā iti yat nāma yojanānām śateṣu api
translated: The name Ganga, Ganga is uttered even from hundreds of yojanas away,

original: sthitair uccāritaṃ hanti pāpaṃ janmatrayārjitam // / / //
analyzed: sthitaiḥ uccāritam hanti pāpam janma traya arjitam
translated: And destroys the sin accumulated in three births.

original: yataḥ sā pāvanāyālaṃ trayāṇāṃ jagatām api /
analyzed: yatas sā pāvanāya alam trayāṇām jagatām api
translated: From which it is sufficient for the purification of the three worlds,

original: samudbhūtā paraṃ tat tu tṛtīyaṃ bhagavatpadam // / / //
analyzed: samudbhūtā param tat tu tṛtīyam bhagavat padam
translated: But that is the highest third abode of the Lord.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe dvitīye 'ṃśe 'ṣṭamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe dvitīye ṃśe ṣṭamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
