translated: or after that, as he wishes, for the sake of receiving a guest.🔽There, he should worship the guest who has arrived with a welcome and so on,

original: tathāsanapradānena pādaprakṣālanena ca // / / //🔽śraddhayā cānnadānena priyapraśnottareṇa ca /
analyzed: tathā āsana pradānena pāda prakṣālanena ca  śraddhayā ca anna dānena priya praśna uttareṇa ca
translated: and also by offering him a seat and washing his feet.🔽And by giving food with faith, and by answering his questions pleasantly,

original: gacchataś cānuyānena prītim utpādayed gṛhī // / / //🔽ajñātakulanāmānam anyataḥ samupāgatam /
analyzed: gacchataḥ ca anuyānena prītim utpādayet gṛhī  ajñāta kula nāmānam anyatas samupāgatam
translated: and by following him when he leaves, a householder should generate affection.🔽One should properly worship a guest who has come from elsewhere, whose family and name are unknown,

original: pūjayed atithiṃ samyaṅ naikagrāmanivāsinam // / / //🔽akiṃcanam asaṃbandham anyadeśād upāgatam /
analyzed: pūjayet atithim samyak na eka grāma nivāsinam  akiṃcanam asaṃbandham anya deśāt upāgatam
translated: and who resides in another village, not in one's own village.🔽One who does not worship a guest who has come from another country, who has no possessions, and who is unrelated,

original: asaṃpūjyātithiṃ bhuñjan bhoktukāmaṃ vrajaty adhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: a saṃpūjya atithim bhuñjan bhoktu kāmam vrajati adhas
translated: while desiring to eat, goes down to hell.

original: svādhyāyagotracaraṇam apṛṣṭvā ca tathā kulam /
analyzed: svādhyāya gotra caraṇam a pṛṣṭvā ca tathā kulam
translated: Without asking about his Vedic branch, his gotra, his conduct, and his family,

original: hiraṇyagarbhabuddhyā taṃ manyetābhyāgataṃ gṛhī // / / //
analyzed: hiraṇyagarbha buddhyā tam manyeta abhyāgatam gṛhī
translated: the householder should consider him as Hiraṇyagarbha, if he has come to his house.

original: pitrarthaṃ cāparaṃ vipram ekam apy āśayen nṛpa /
analyzed: pitṛ artham ca aparam vipram ekam api āśayet nṛpa
translated: And for the sake of his father, the king should entertain another brāhmaṇa also.

original: taddeśyaṃ viditācārasaṃbhūtiṃ pāñcayajñikam // / / //
analyzed: tad deśyam vidita ācāra saṃbhūtim pāñcayajñikam
translated: One who belongs to that country, whose conduct and origin are known, who performs the five sacrifices,

original: annāgraṃ ca samuddhṛtya hantakāropakalpitam /
analyzed: anna agram ca samuddhṛtya hantakāra upakalpitam
translated: and having taken out the first portion of food intended for the oblation,

original: nirvāpabhūtaṃ bhūpāla śrotriyāyopapādayet // / / //
analyzed: nirvāpa bhūtam bhūpāla śrotriyāya upapādayet
translated: the king should offer it to the brāhmaṇa who is well-versed in the Vedas, O king, as a substitute for the oblation.

original: dadyāc ca bhikṣātritayaṃ parivrāḍbrahmacāriṇām /
analyzed: dadyāt ca bhikṣā tritayam parivrāj brahmacāriṇām
translated: And he should give three alms to the wandering ascetics and celibate students,

original: icchayā ca budho dadyād vibhave saty avāritam // / / //
analyzed: icchayā ca budhaḥ dadyāt vibhave sati a vāritam
translated: and the wise one should give more, if he wishes, when he has the means, without hesitation.

original: ity ete 'tithayaḥ proktāḥ prāguktā bhikṣavaś ca ye /
analyzed: iti ete tithayaḥ proktāḥ prāc uktāḥ bhikṣavaḥ ca ye
translated: Thus these are declared to be the guests, and also the mendicants mentioned before.

original: caturaḥ pūjayed etān nṛyajñarṇāt pramucyate // / / //
analyzed: caturaḥ pūjayet etān nṛ yajña ṛṇāt pramucyate
translated: One should honor these four, and is freed from the debt to men.

original: atithir yasya bhagnāśo gṛhād yāty anyatomukhaḥ /
analyzed: atithiḥ yasya bhagna āśaḥ gṛhāt yāti anyatas mukhaḥ
translated: If a guest goes away from one's house with his hopes disappointed, with his face turned away,

original: sa dattvā duṣkṛtaṃ tasmai puṇyam ādāya gacchati // / / //
analyzed: sa dattvā duṣkṛtam tasmai puṇyam ādāya gacchati
translated: then he gives his evil to him and takes his merit and goes away.

original: dhātā prajāpatiḥ śakro vahnir vasugaṇo 'ryamā /
analyzed: dhātā prajāpatiḥ śakraḥ vahniḥ vasu gaṇaḥ ryamā
translated: Dhātṛ, Prajāpati, Śakra, Agni, the group of Vasus, Aryaman,

original: praviśyātithim ete vai bhuñjante 'nnaṃ nareśvara // / / //
analyzed: praviśya atithim ete vai bhuñjante nnam nareśvara
translated: O lord of men, having entered, they enjoy the food.

original: ins /
analyzed: ins
translated: (The text is corrupt here)

original: ye ca viṣṇuparā nityaṃ ye ca vikhānasāśramāḥ // / / / //
analyzed: ye ca viṣṇu parāḥ nityam ye ca vikhānasa āśramāḥ
translated: Those who are always devoted to Vishnu, those who are in the hermitages of the sages,

original: pañcarātraṃ vidhānajñā ye ca viṣṇuparāyaṇāḥ // / / / //🔽viṣṇurūpadharā ye te viṣṇum eva samāśritāḥ // / / / //
analyzed: pañca rātram vidhāna jñāḥ ye ca viṣṇu parāyaṇāḥ  viṣṇu rūpa dharāḥ ye te viṣṇum eva samāśritāḥ
translated: Those who know the rules of the Pancharatra and are devoted to Vishnu,🔽Those who have the form of Vishnu are indeed devoted to Vishnu himself.

original: sarvo viṣṇumayo loka iti matvā sthitāś ca ye // / / / //
analyzed: sarvaḥ viṣṇu mayaḥ lokaḥ iti matvā sthitāḥ ca ye
translated: Those who consider the entire world to be full of Vishnu and abide by that,

original: sarva ete hy atithayo mṛṣyā vai sārvakālikam // / / / //
analyzed: sarve ete hi atithayaḥ mṛṣyāḥ vai sārvakālikam
translated: All these are guests and should be honored at all times.

original: eteṣām ekam atithiṃ pūjayet puṇyalokabhāk // / / / //
analyzed: eteṣām ekam atithim pūjayet puṇya loka bhāj
translated: One should honor one of these guests and attain the world of the virtuous.

original: tasmād atithipūjāyāṃ yateta satataṃ naraḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt atithi pūjāyām yateta satatam naraḥ
translated: Therefore, a man should always strive in the worship of guests.

original: sa kevalam aghaṃ bhuṅkte yo bhuṅkte tv atithiṃ vinā // / / //🔽tataḥ suvāsinīduḥkhigarbhiṇīvṛddhabālakān /🔽bhojayet saṃskṛtānnena prathamaṃ caramaṃ gṛhī // / / //
analyzed: sa kevalam agham bhuṅkte yaḥ bhuṅkte tu atithim vinā  tatas suvāsinī duḥkhi garbhiṇī vṛddha bālakān  bhojayet saṃskṛta annena prathamam caramam gṛhī
translated: He who eats without honoring a guest, eats only sin.🔽Then the householder should first and last feed the newly married, the afflicted, the pregnant, the elderly, and the children,

original: abhuktavatsu caiteṣu bhuñjan bhuṅkte 'tiduṣkṛtam /
analyzed: a bhuktavatsu ca eteṣu bhuñjan bhuṅkte ti duṣkṛtam
translated: With well-cooked food. If they eat while these have not eaten, they eat great sin.

original: mṛtaś ca narakaṃ gatvā śleṣmabhug jāyate naraḥ // / / //
analyzed: mṛtaḥ ca narakam gatvā śleṣma bhuj jāyate naraḥ
translated: And after death, going to hell, that man is born as a snot-eater.

original: asnātāśī malaṃ bhuṅkte hy ajapī pūyaśoṇitam /
analyzed: asnāta āśī malam bhuṅkte hi ajapī pūya śoṇitam
translated: One who eats without bathing eats impurity; one who does not chant the sacred syllable eats pus and blood.

original: asaṃskṛtānnabhuṅ mūtraṃ bālādiprathamaṃ śakṛt // / / //🔽ed / Veṅk / ins / after /
analyzed: a saṃskṛta anna bhuj mūtram bāla ādi prathamam śakṛt  e t veṅk ins after
translated: One who eats uncooked food eats urine; the first feces of a child and so on.🔽After.

original: after / before /
analyzed: g after d before
translated: Before.

original: abhūtāśī kṛmiṃ bhuṅkte adātā viṣam aśnute // / / //
analyzed: a bhūta āśī kṛmim bhuṅkte a dātā viṣam aśnute
translated: One who eats falsehoods eats worms; one who does not give experiences poison.

original: tasmāc chṛṇuṣva rājendra yathā bhuñjīta vai gṛhī /
analyzed: tasmāt śṛṇuṣva rāja indra yathā bhuñjīta vai gṛhī
translated: Therefore, O lord of kings, listen to how a householder should eat.

original: bhuñjataś ca yathā puṃsaḥ pāpabandho na jāyate // / / //
analyzed: bhuñjataḥ ca yathā puṃsaḥ pāpa bandhaḥ na jāyate
translated: And how, when a man eats, the bondage of sin does not arise.

original: iha cārogyam atulaṃ balavṛddhis tathā nṛpa /
analyzed: iha ca ārogyam atulam bala vṛddhiḥ tathā nṛpa
translated: Here, O king, there is incomparable health and increase of strength.

original: bhavaty ariṣṭaśāntiś ca vairipakṣābhicārikā // / / //
analyzed: bhavati ariṣṭa śāntiḥ ca vairi pakṣa ābhicārikā
translated: And there is peace from misfortune, and from the sorcery of enemies.

original: snāto yathāvat kṛtvā ca devarṣipitṛtarpaṇam /🔽praśastaratnapāṇiś ca bhuñjīta prayato gṛhī // / / //
analyzed: snātaḥ yathāvat kṛtvā ca deva ṛṣi pitṛ tarpaṇam  praśasta ratna pāṇiḥ ca bhuñjīta prayataḥ gṛhī
translated: Having bathed and offered libations to the gods, sages and ancestors as prescribed,🔽The householder, purified, should eat, holding auspicious gems in his hands.

original: kṛte jape hute vahnau śuddhavastradharo nṛpa /
analyzed: kṛte jape hute vahnau śuddha vastra dharaḥ nṛpa
translated: O king, having chanted the sacred syllables, offered oblations to the fire, and wearing clean clothes,

original: dattvātithibhyo viprebhyo gurubhyaḥ saṃśritāya ca /🔽puṇyagandhadharaḥ śastamālyadhārī nareśvara // / / //
analyzed: dattvā atithibhyaḥ viprebhyaḥ gurubhyaḥ saṃśritāya ca  puṇya gandha dharaḥ śasta mālya dhārī nareśvara
translated: Having given to guests, Brahmins, teachers and dependents,🔽Wearing auspicious scents and garlands, O lord of men.

original: naikavastradharo 'thārdrapāṇipādo nareśvara /
analyzed: na eka vastra dharaḥ thā ārdra pāṇi pādaḥ nareśvara
translated: Not wearing a single garment, with wet hands and feet, O lord of men,

original: viśuddhavadanaḥ prīto bhuñjīta na vidiṅmukhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: viśuddha vadanaḥ prītaḥ bhuñjīta na vidiś mukhaḥ
translated: With a pure face, being pleased, he should eat, not facing any direction.

original: prāṅmukhodaṅmukho vāpi na caivānyamanā naraḥ /
analyzed: prāc mukha udak mukhaḥ vā api na ca eva anya manāḥ naraḥ
translated: Facing east or north, not with a distracted mind,

original: annaṃ praśastaṃ pathyaṃ ca prokṣitaṃ prokṣaṇodakaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: annam praśastam pathyam ca prokṣitam prokṣaṇa udakaiḥ
translated: Food that is praised, wholesome, sprinkled with water consecrated with mantras,

original: na kutsitāhṛtaṃ naiva jugupsāvad asaṃskṛtam /
analyzed: na kutsita āhṛtam na eva jugupsāvat a saṃskṛtam
translated: Not despised, not improperly prepared,

original: dattvā tu bhuktaṃ śiṣyebhyaḥ kṣudhitebhyas tathā gṛhī // / / //
analyzed: dattvā tu bhuktam śiṣyebhyaḥ kṣudhitebhyaḥ tathā gṛhī
translated: Having offered to disciples and hungry people, a householder,

original: praśastaśuddhapātreṣu bhuñjītākupito nṛpa // / / //
analyzed: praśasta śuddha pātreṣu bhuñjīta akupitaḥ nṛpa
translated: Should eat in well-praised and pure vessels, not angry, O king.

original: nāsandīsaṃsthite pātre nādeśe ca nareśvara /
analyzed: na āsandī saṃsthite pātre na adeśe ca nareśvara
translated: Not in a vessel placed on a bench, not in an improper place, O lord of men,

original: nākāle nātisaṃkīrṇe dattvāgraṃ ca naro 'gnaye // / / //
analyzed: na akāle na ati saṃkīrṇe dattvā agram ca naraḥ gnaye
translated: Not at the wrong time, not too crowded, having offered the first portion to Agni,

original: mantrābhimantritaṃ śastaṃ na ca paryuṣitaṃ nṛpa /🔽anyatra phalamāṃsebhyaḥ śuṣkaśākādikāṃs tathā // / / //
analyzed: mantra abhimantritam śastam na ca paryuṣitam nṛpa  anyatra phala māṃsebhyaḥ śuṣka śāka ādikān tathā
translated: Consecrated with mantras, praised, not stale, O king.🔽Except for fruits and meat, and similarly dry vegetables etc.,

original: tadvad bādarikebhyaś ca guḍapakvebhya eva ca /🔽bhuñjītoddhṛtasārāṇi na kadācin nareśvara // / / //
analyzed: tadvat bādarikebhyaḥ ca guḍa pakvebhyaḥ eva ca  bhuñjīta uddhṛta sārāṇi na kadācid nareśvara
translated: Similarly, for pomegranates and for jaggery-cooked dishes,🔽One should eat, O lord of men, never, those from which the essence has been extracted.

original: nāśeṣaṃ puruṣo 'śnīyād anyatra jagatīpate /
analyzed: na aśeṣam śnīyāt anyatra jagatīpate
translated: A man should not eat everything, except on other occasions, O lord of the earth.

original: madhvambudadhisarpibhyaḥ saktubhyaś ca vivekavān // / / //
analyzed: madhu ambu dadhi sarpibhyaḥ saktubhyaḥ ca vivekavān
translated: discriminating between honey, water, curd, ghee and flour.

original: aśnīyāt tanmanā bhūtvā pūrvaṃ tu madhuraṃ rasam /
analyzed: aśnīyāt tad manāḥ bhūtvā pūrvam tu madhuram rasam
translated: One should eat, with a focused mind, first the sweet taste.

original: lavaṇāmlau tathā madhye kaṭutiktādikaṃ tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: lavaṇa amlau tathā madhye kaṭu tikta ādikam tatas
translated: Then salt and sour in the middle, and then bitter and pungent etc.

original: prāg dravaṃ puruṣo 'śnan vai madhye ca kaṭhināśanam /
analyzed: prāk dravam puruṣaḥ śnan vai madhye ca kaṭhina aśanam
translated: A man who eats first liquid food, then solid food in the middle,

original: punar ante dravāśī tu balārogye na muñcati // / / //
analyzed: punar ante drava āśī tu bala ārogye na muñcati
translated: and again liquid food at the end, does not lose strength and health.

original: anindyaṃ bhakṣayed itthaṃ vāgyato 'nnam akutsayan /
analyzed: anindyam bhakṣayet ittham vāgyataḥ nnam a kutsayan
translated: One should eat food in this way, without criticizing, with a controlled mind.

original: pañcagrāsaṃ mahāmaunaṃ prāṇādyāpyāyanāya tat // / / //
analyzed: pañca grāsam mahā maunam prāṇa ādi āpyāyanāya tat
translated: The great silence of five morsels is for the nourishment of the life force and so on.

original: bhuktvā samyag athācamya prāṅmukhodaṅmukho 'pi vā /
analyzed: bhuktvā samyak atha ācamya vā
translated: Having eaten properly, then having sipped water, facing east or north,

original: yathāvat punar ācāmet pāṇī prakṣālya mūlataḥ // / / //
analyzed: yathāvat punar ācāmet pāṇī prakṣālya mūlataḥ
translated: one should sip water again as appropriate, having washed the hands from the roots.

original: svasthaḥ praśāntacittas tu kṛtāsanaparigrahaḥ /
analyzed: svasthaḥ praśānta cittaḥ tu kṛta āsana parigrahaḥ
translated: Being healthy and with a calm mind, having taken up a seat,

original: abhīṣṭadevatānāṃ tu kurvīta smaraṇaṃ naraḥ // / / //
analyzed: abhīṣṭa devatānām tu kurvīta smaraṇam naraḥ
translated: a man should recollect the desired deities.

original: agnir āpyāyayatv annaṃ pārthivaṃ pavaneritaḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ āpyāyayatu annam pārthivam pavana īritaḥ
translated: May fire, impelled by wind, nourish the earthly food,

original: dattāvakāśaṃ nabhasā jarayatv astu me sukham // / / //
analyzed: datta avakāśam nabhasā jarayatu astu me sukham
translated: having been given space by the sky. May it bring me happiness.

original: annaṃ balāya me bhūmer apām agnyanilasya ca /
analyzed: annam balāya me bhūmeḥ apām agni anilasya ca
translated: May food be for the strength of the earth, water, fire and wind.

original: bhavatv etat pariṇatau mamāstv avyāhataṃ sukham // / / //
analyzed: bhavatu etat pariṇatau mama astu avyāhatam sukham
translated: May this be transformed, and may I have uninterrupted happiness.

original: prāṇāpānasamānānām udānavyānayos tathā /
analyzed: prāṇa apāna samānānām udāna vyānayoḥ tathā
translated: Of the vital airs prana, apana, samana, udana and vyana,

original: annaṃ puṣṭikaraṃ cāstu mamāstv avyāhataṃ sukham // / / //
analyzed: annam puṣṭi karam ca astu mama astu avyāhatam sukham
translated: May food be nourishing, and may I have uninterrupted happiness.

original: agastir agnir vaḍavānalaś ca bhuktaṃ mayānnaṃ jarayatv aśeṣam /
analyzed: agastiḥ agniḥ vaḍavānalaḥ ca bhuktam mayā annam jarayatu aśeṣam
translated: May Agastya, the fire, and the submarine fire completely digest the food I have eaten.

original: sukhaṃ ca me tatpariṇāmasaṃbhavaṃ yacchantv arogo mama cāstu dehe // / / //
analyzed: sukham ca me tad pariṇāma saṃbhavam yacchantu arogaḥ mama ca astu dehe
translated: And may they grant me happiness arising from its transformation, and may I have good health in my body.

original: ins /
analyzed: d ins
translated: Inserts:

original: deheṣu sarveṣu yathā ca dehī / / / / // / / //
analyzed: deheṣu sarveṣu yathā ca dehī
translated: And as the embodied soul is in all bodies...

original: viṣṇuḥ samastendriyadehadehī pradhānabhūto bhagavān yathaikaḥ /
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ samasta indriya deha dehī pradhāna bhūtaḥ bhagavān yathā ekaḥ
translated: As Vishnu, the supreme lord of all the senses and the body, is the one primary principle,

original: satyena tenānnam aśeṣam etad ārogyadaṃ me pariṇāmam etu // / / //
analyzed: satyena tena annam aśeṣam etat ārogya dam me pariṇāmam etu
translated: By that truth, may this entire food be digested in me, and may it bring good health.

original: viṣṇur attā tathaivānnaṃ pariṇāmaś ca vai yathā /
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ attā tathā eva annam pariṇāmaḥ ca vai yathā
translated: As Vishnu is the eater, and food is so called, and as digestion is so called,

original: satyena tena vai bhuktaṃ jīryatv annam idaṃ tathā // / / //
analyzed: satyena tena vai bhuktam jīryatu annam idam tathā
translated: By that truth, may the food eaten be digested in the same way.

original: ity uccārya svahastena parimṛjya tathodaram /
analyzed: iti uccārya sva hastena parimṛjya tathā udaram
translated: Having uttered this, and having rubbed one's belly with one's own hand,

original: anāyāsapradāyīni kuryāt karmāṇy atandritaḥ // / / //
analyzed: anāyāsa pradāyīni kuryāt karmāṇi atandritaḥ
translated: One should perform one's duties diligently without laziness, which are conducive to the attainment of the highest goal.

original: sacchāstrādivinodena sanmārgād avirodhinā /
analyzed: sat śāstra ādi vinodena sat mārgāt avirodhinā
translated: One should spend the day with the enjoyment of good scriptures etc., which is not contrary to the right path.

original: dinaṃ nayet tataḥ saṃdhyām upatiṣṭhet samāhitaḥ // / / //🔽dināntasaṃdhyāṃ sūryeṇa pūrvām ṛkṣair yutāṃ budhaḥ /
analyzed: dinam nayet tatas saṃdhyām upatiṣṭhet samāhitaḥ  dina anta saṃdhyām sūryeṇa pūrvām ṛkṣaiḥ yutām budhaḥ
translated: Then, one should worship the evening twilight with a concentrated mind.

original: upatiṣṭhed yathānyāyaṃ samyag ācamya pārthiva // / / //
analyzed: upatiṣṭhet yathānyāyam samyak ācamya pārthiva
translated: The wise one should worship the evening twilight along with the sun, and the morning twilight along with the stars, O king, after properly sipping water.

original: sarvakālam upasthānaṃ saṃdhyayoḥ pārthiveṣyate /
analyzed: sarvakālam upasthānam saṃdhyayoḥ pārthiva iṣyate
translated: The worship of the two twilights is prescribed for kings at all times,

original: anyatrasūtakāśaucavibhramāturabhītitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: anyatra sūtaka āśauca vibhrama ātura bhītitaḥ
translated: except during the impurity caused by childbirth, or when one is confused or frightened by illness.

original: sūryeṇābhyudito yaś ca tyaktaḥ sūryeṇa ca svapan /
analyzed: sūryeṇa abhyuditaḥ yaḥ ca tyaktaḥ sūryeṇa ca svapan
translated: One who is not seen by the sun when rising, or who is abandoned by the sun while sleeping,

original: anyatrāturabhāvāt tu prāyaścittīyate naraḥ // / / //🔽tasmād anudite sūrye samutthāya mahīpate /
analyzed: anyatra ātura bhāvāt tu prāyaścittīyate naraḥ  tasmāt an udite sūrye samutthāya mahīpate
translated: except when one is sick, is considered to require expiation, O king.🔽Therefore, O lord of the earth, a man should rise before sunrise

original: upatiṣṭhen naraḥ saṃdhyām asvapaṃś ca dināntajām // / / //
analyzed: upatiṣṭhet naraḥ saṃdhyām a svapan ca dina anta jām
translated: and worship the morning twilight, and also the evening twilight if he has not slept.

original: upatiṣṭhanti ye saṃdhyāṃ na pūrvāṃ na ca paścimām /
analyzed: upatiṣṭhanti ye saṃdhyām na pūrvām na ca paścimām
translated: Those evil-minded ones who do not worship the morning or evening twilight,

original: vrajanti te durātmānas tāmisraṃ narakaṃ nṛpa // / / //
analyzed: vrajanti te durātmānaḥ tāmisram narakam nṛpa
translated: they go to the hell of Tamisra, O king.

original: punaḥ pākam upādāya sāyam apy avanīpate /
analyzed: punar pākam upādāya sāyam api avanīpate
translated: Again, O lord of the earth, in the evening also, after cooking,

original: vaiśvadevanimittaṃ vai patny amantraṃ baliṃ haret // / / //
analyzed: vaiśvadeva nimittam vai patnī amantram balim haret
translated: For the sake of the Vaisvadeva rite, the wife should offer the Bali offering without mantras.

original: tatrāpi śvapacādibhyas tathaivānnāpavarjanam // / / //
analyzed: tatra api śvapaca ādibhyaḥ tathā eva anna apavarjanam
translated: Even there, food should be given to outcasts and others in the same way.

original: atithiṃ cāgataṃ tatra svaśaktyā pūjayed budhaḥ /
analyzed: atithim ca āgatam tatra sva śaktyā pūjayet budhaḥ
translated: And a wise man should honor a guest who has come there to his ability.

original: pādaśaucāsanaprahvasvāgatoktyā ca pūjanam /
analyzed: pāda śauca āsana prahva svāgata uktyā ca pūjanam
translated: Worship with washing of feet, offering a seat, bowing, and saying Welcome.

original: tataś cānnapradānena śayanena ca pārthiva // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca anna pradānena śayanena ca pārthiva
translated: And then, O king, with the gift of food and a bed.

original: dinātithau tu vimukhe gate yat pātakaṃ nṛpa /
analyzed: dina atithau tu vimukhe gate yat pātakam nṛpa
translated: O king, the sin that one incurs when a guest leaves displeased after staying for a day,

original: tad evāṣṭaguṇaṃ puṃsāṃ sūryoḍhe vimukhe gate // / / //
analyzed: tat eva aṣṭaguṇam puṃsām sūrya ūḍhe vimukhe gate
translated: is the same eight times when a guest who has arrived at sunrise leaves displeased.

original: tasmāt svaśaktyā rājendra sūryoḍham atithiṃ naraḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt sva śaktyā rāja indra sūrya ūḍham atithim naraḥ
translated: Therefore, O lord of kings, a man should honor a guest who has arrived at sunrise to his ability.

original: pūjayet pūjite tasmin pūjitāḥ sarvadevatāḥ // / / //🔽annaśākāmbudānena svaśaktyā prīṇayet pumān /
analyzed: pūjayet pūjite tasmin pūjitāḥ sarva devatāḥ  anna śāka ambu dānena sva śaktyā prīṇayet pumān
translated: When he is honored, all the gods are honored.🔽A man should satisfy him with the gift of food, vegetables, and water to his ability,

original: śayanaprastaramahīpradānair athavāpi tam // / / //🔽kṛtapādādiśaucaś ca bhuktvā sāyaṃ tato gṛhī /
analyzed: śayana prastara mahī pradānaiḥ athavā api tam  kṛta pāda ādi śaucaḥ ca bhuktvā sāyam tatas gṛhī
translated: or with the gift of a bed, a mat, or land.🔽And having performed the purification of feet, etc., the householder should eat in the evening, O king,

original: gacched asphuṭitāṃ śayyām api dārumayīṃ nṛpa // / / //
analyzed: gacchet a sphuṭitām śayyām api dāru mayīm nṛpa
translated: and then go to bed, even if it is made of wood, that is not torn.

original: nāviśālāṃ na vā bhagnāṃ nāsamāṃ malināṃ na ca /
analyzed: na aviśālām na vā bhagnām na asamām malinām na ca
translated: Not too wide, not broken, not uneven, not dirty,

original: na ca jantumayīṃ śayyām adhitiṣṭhed anāstṛtām // / / //
analyzed: na ca jantu mayīm śayyām adhitiṣṭhet an āstṛtām
translated: Nor should he lie down on a bed of living creatures, or on one that is not covered.

original: prācyāṃ diśi śiraḥ śastaṃ yāmyāyām athavā nṛpa /
analyzed: prācyām diśi śiraḥ śastam yāmyāyām athavā nṛpa
translated: It is recommended that the head should be placed towards the east or south, O king.

original: sadaiva svapataḥ puṃso viparītaṃ tu rogadam // / / //
analyzed: sadā eva svapataḥ puṃsaḥ viparītam tu roga dam
translated: For a person always sleeping in the opposite direction is prone to diseases.

original: ṛtāv upagamaḥ śastaḥ svapatnyām avanīpate /
analyzed: ṛtau upagamaḥ śastaḥ sva patnyām avanīpate
translated: O Lord of the Earth, it is recommended to approach one's own wife during her season,

original: punnāmarkṣe śubhe kāle jyeṣṭhayugmāsu rātriṣu // / / //🔽nāsnātāṃ tu striyaṃ gacchen nāturāṃ na rajasvalām /🔽nāniṣṭāṃ na prakupitāṃ nāpraśastāṃ na garbhiṇīm // / / //
analyzed: put nāma ṛkṣe śubhe kāle jyeṣṭha yugmāsu rātriṣu  na asnātām tu striyam gacchet na āturām na rajasvalām  na aniṣṭām na prakupitām na apraśastām na garbhiṇīm
translated: On an auspicious day with a male constellation, in the first half of the night, in the even months.🔽One should not have intercourse with an unbathed woman, a sick woman, a woman in her menses,🔽A woman who is not desired, a woman who is angry, a woman who is not praised, a pregnant woman.

original: nādakṣiṇāṃ nānyakāmāṃ nākāmāṃ nānyayoṣitam /
analyzed: na a dakṣiṇām na anya kāmām na a kāmām na anya yoṣitam
translated: Not without giving a gift, not with a woman who desires another, not with a woman who is not desirous, not with another's woman.

original: kṣutkṣāmām atibhuktāṃ vā svayaṃ caibhir guṇair yutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṣudh kṣāmām ati bhuktām vā svayam ca ebhiḥ guṇaiḥ yutaḥ
translated: And oneself endowed with these qualities, not emaciated with hunger, not over-fed,

original: snātaḥ sraggandhadhṛk prītaḥ nādhmātaḥ kṣudhito 'pi vā /
analyzed: snātaḥ sraj gandha dhṛk prītaḥ na ādhmātaḥ kṣudhitaḥ vā
translated: Bathed, wearing garlands and fragrances, cheerful, not suffering from asthma or hunger,

original: sakāmaḥ sānurāgaś ca vyavāyaṃ puruṣo vrajet // / / //
analyzed: sa kāmaḥ sa anurāgaḥ ca vyavāyam puruṣaḥ vrajet
translated: A man should engage in sexual intercourse with desire and affection.

original: caturdaśy aṣṭamī caiva amāvāsyātha pūrṇimā /
analyzed: caturdaśī aṣṭamī ca eva amāvāsyā atha pūrṇimā
translated: The fourteenth, the eighth, the new moon, and the full moon,

original: parvāṇy etāni rājendra ravisaṃkrāntir eva ca // / / //
analyzed: parvāṇi etāni rāja indra ravi saṃkrāntiḥ eva ca
translated: These are the festivals, O Lord of kings, and also the transit of the sun.

original: tailastrīmāṃsasaṃbhogī parvasv eteṣu vai pumān /
analyzed: taila strī māṃsa saṃbhogī parvasu eteṣu vai pumān
translated: A man who indulges in oil, women and meat on these parvas,

original: viṇmūtrabhojanaṃ nāma prayāti narakaṃ mṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: viṣ mūtra bhojanam nāma prayāti narakam mṛtaḥ
translated: after death goes to hell called Vinnmutribhojana.

original: aśeṣaparvasv eteṣu tasmāt saṃyamibhir budhaiḥ /
analyzed: aśeṣa parvasu eteṣu tasmāt saṃyamibhiḥ budhaiḥ
translated: Therefore, on all these parvas, wise ones who are self-controlled,

original: bhāvyaṃ sacchāstradevejyādhyānajapyaparair naraiḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhāvyam sat śāstra deva ijyā dhyāna japya paraiḥ naraiḥ
translated: men who are devoted to good scriptures, worship of gods, meditation and japa, should conduct themselves thus.

original: nānyayonāv ayonau vā nopayuktauṣadhas tathā /
analyzed: na anya yonau ayonau vā na upayukta auṣadhaḥ tathā
translated: One should not have sexual intercourse in any other birth canal or in an improper place, or while taking medicine,

original: devadvijagurūṇāṃ ca vyavāyī nāśraye bhavet // / / //
analyzed: deva dvija gurūṇām ca vyavāyī na āśraye bhavet
translated: or while defiling gods, Brahmins and preceptors.

original: caityacatvaratīreṣu naiva goṣṭhe catuṣpathe /🔽naiva śmaśānopavane salileṣu mahīpate // / / //
analyzed: caitya catvara tīreṣu nā eva goṣṭhe catuṣpathe  na eva śmaśāna upavane salileṣu mahīpate
translated: One should not have sexual intercourse on the outskirts of a caitya, a crossroads, a cowpen, a junction of four roads,🔽or near a cremation ground, a garden, or in water, O king.🔽O king, a wise man should not have sexual intercourse on all the mentioned parvas, or during the two twilights,

original: proktaparvasv aśeṣeṣu naiva bhūpāla saṃdhyayoḥ /🔽gacched vyavāyaṃ matimān na mūtroccārapīḍitaḥ // / / //🔽parvasv abhigamo 'dhanyo divā pāpaprado nṛpa /
analyzed: prokta parvasu aśeṣeṣu nā eva bhūpāla saṃdhyayoḥ  gacchet vyavāyam matimān na mūtra uccāra pīḍitaḥ  parvasu abhigamaḥ dhanyaḥ divā pāpa pradaḥ nṛpa
translated: or when afflicted by urine or feces.🔽Sexual intercourse on parvas is inauspicious, and during the day it causes sin, O king.

original: bhuvi rogaprado nṝṇām apraśasto jalāśaye // / / //🔽paradārān na gaccheta manasāpi kadācana /
analyzed: bhuvi roga pradaḥ nṝṇām apraśastaḥ jalāśaye  para dārān na gaccheta manasā api kadācana
translated: It causes disease for men on the ground, and is not praiseworthy in water reservoirs.🔽One should not go to another's wife even mentally, let alone verbally.

original: kim u vācāsthibandho 'pi nāsti teṣu vyavāyinām // / / //
analyzed: kim u vācā asthi bandhaḥ na asti teṣu vyavāyinām
translated: Even the binding of bones does not exist for those who have sexual intercourse with them.

original: mṛto narakam abhyeti hīyate 'trāpi cāyuṣaḥ /
analyzed: mṛtaḥ narakam abhyeti hīyate ca āyuṣaḥ
translated: A man who dies after committing adultery, goes to hell and his life span is reduced.

original: paradāraratiḥ puṃsām ubhayatrāpi bhītidā // / / //
analyzed: para dāra ratiḥ puṃsām ubhayatra api bhīti dā
translated: Sexual pleasure with another's wife is fearful in both worlds for men.

original: iti matvā svadāreṣu ṛtumatsu budho vrajet /
analyzed: iti matvā sva dāreṣu ṛtumatsu budhaḥ vrajet
translated: Knowing this, a wise man should approach his own menstruating wife,

original: yathoktadoṣahīneṣu sakāmeṣv anṛtāv api // / / //
analyzed: yathā ukta doṣa hīneṣu sa kāmeṣu anṛtau api
translated: In one who is free from the faults mentioned, and who is desirous, even during the forbidden period.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe tṛtīyāṃśe ekādaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe tṛtīya aṃśe ekādaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eleventh chapter in the third section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: aurva uvāca /
analyzed: aurvaḥ uvāca
translated: Aurva said:

original: devagobrāhmaṇān siddhavṛddhācāryāṃs tathārcayet /
analyzed: deva go brāhmaṇān siddha vṛddha ācāryān tathā arcayet
translated: One should worship gods, cows, Brahmins, accomplished ones, elders and teachers.

original: dvikālaṃ ca namet saṃdhyām agnīn upacaret tathā // / / //
analyzed: dvikālam ca namet saṃdhyām agnīn upacaret tathā
translated: One should bow twice a day at dusk and dawn, and serve the sacred fires.

original: sadānupahate vastre praśastāś ca tathauṣadhīḥ /
analyzed: sadā anupahate vastre praśastāḥ ca tathā oṣadhīḥ
translated: One should always wear unsoiled clothes and auspicious herbs,

original: gāruḍāni ca ratnāni bibhṛyāt prayato naraḥ // / / //
analyzed: gāruḍāni ca ratnāni bibhṛyāt prayataḥ naraḥ
translated: And a pure man should carry Garuda's gems.

original: prasnigdhāmalakeśaś ca sugandhaś cāruveṣadhṛk /
analyzed: prasnigdha amala keśaḥ ca sugandhaḥ cāru veṣa dhṛk
translated: One should have slightly oily and clean hair, be fragrant and wear beautiful clothes,

original: sitāḥ sumanaso hṛdyā bibhṛyāc ca naraḥ sadā // / / //🔽kiṃcit parasvaṃ na haren nālpam apy apriyaṃ vadet /
analyzed: sitāḥ sumanasaḥ hṛdyāḥ bibhṛyāt ca naraḥ sadā  kiṃcid para svam na haret na alpam api apriyam vadet
translated: And a man should always carry white, pleasant flowers.🔽One should not steal even a little of others' property, nor speak even slightly unpleasant words.

original: priyaṃ ca nānṛtaṃ brūyān nānyadoṣān udīrayet // / / //
analyzed: priyam ca na anṛtam brūyāt na anya doṣān udīrayet
translated: One should not speak pleasant lies, nor mention the faults of others.

original: nānyastriyaṃ tathā vairaṃ rocayet puruṣeśvara /
analyzed: na anya striyam tathā vairam rocayet puruṣa īśvara
translated: O Lord of men, one should not desire another's wife or enmity.

original: na duṣṭayānam ārohet kūlacchāyāṃ na saṃśrayet // / / //🔽vidviṣṭapatitonmattabahuvairādikīṭakaiḥ /
analyzed: na duṣṭa yānam ārohet kūla chāyām na saṃśrayet  vidviṣṭa patita unmatta bahu vaira ādi kīṭakaiḥ
translated: One should not ride a defective vehicle, nor should one resort to the shade of a riverbank.🔽With those who are hostile, fallen, insane, full of enmity, and so on, with insects,

original: bandhakībandhakībhartṛkṣudrānṛtakathaiḥ saha // / / //
analyzed: bandhakī bandhakī bhartṛ kṣudra anṛta kathaiḥ saha
translated: with prostitutes, the husbands of prostitutes, the mean, and those who tell lies,

original: tathātivyayaśīlaiś ca parivādarataiḥ śaṭhaiḥ /
analyzed: tathā ati vyaya śīlaiḥ ca parivāda rataiḥ śaṭhaiḥ
translated: and likewise with those who are excessively extravagant, those who delight in slander, and the deceitful,

original: budho maitrīṃ na kurvīta naikaḥ panthānam āśrayet // / / //
analyzed: budhaḥ maitrīm na kurvīta na ekaḥ panthānam āśrayet
translated: the wise one should not make friendship. One should not travel alone on a path.

original: nāvagāhej jalaughasya vegam agre nareśvara /🔽pradīptaṃ veśma na viśen nārohec chikharaṃ taroḥ // / / //🔽na kuryād dantasaṃgharṣaṃ na kuṣṇīyāc ca nāsikām /
analyzed: na avagāhet jala oghasya vegam agre nareśvara  pradīptam veśma na viśet na ārohet śikharam taroḥ  na kuryāt danta saṃgharṣam na kuṣṇīyāt ca nāsikām
translated: One should not go against the current of a river, O lord of men.🔽One should not enter a burning house, nor climb a tree.🔽One should not grind one's teeth, nor should one make a hissing sound through the nose.

original: nāsaṃvṛtamukho jṛmbhec śvāsakāsau ca varjayet // / / //
analyzed: na asaṃvṛta mukhaḥ jṛmbhet śvāsa kāsau ca varjayet
translated: One should not yawn with an uncovered mouth, and should avoid sneezing and coughing.

original: noccair haset saśabdaṃ ca na muñcet pavanaṃ budhaḥ /🔽nakhān na khādayec chindyān na tṛṇaṃ na mahīṃ likhet // / / //
analyzed: na uccais haset sa śabdam ca na muñcet pavanam budhaḥ  nakhān na khādayet chindyāt na tṛṇam na mahīm likhet
translated: One should not laugh loudly with sound, nor should the wise one release flatus.🔽One should not bite one's nails, nor should one cut grass or scratch the ground.

original: na śmaśru bhakṣayel loṣṭaṃ na mṛd nīyād vicakṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: na śmaśru bhakṣayet loṣṭam na mṛd nīyāt vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: A wise person should not eat hair, nor should one take clay.

original: jyotīṃṣy amedhyaḥ śastāni nābhivīkṣeta ca prabho // / / //
analyzed: jyotīṃṣi amedhyaḥ śastāni na abhivīkṣeta ca prabho
translated: One should not look at the luminaries while impure, O lord.

original: nagnāṃ parastriyaṃ caiva sūryaṃ cāstamanodaye /
analyzed: nagnām para striyam ca eva sūryam ca astamana udaye
translated: One should not look at a naked woman, nor at the sun at the time of rising or setting.

original: na huṃkuryāc chavaṃ caiva śavagandho hi somajaḥ // / / //🔽catuṣpathaṃ caityataruṃ śmaśānopavanāni ca /
analyzed: na huṃkuryāt śavam ca eva śava gandhaḥ hi soma jaḥ  catuṣpatham caitya tarum śmaśāna upavanāni ca
translated: One should not sneeze at a corpse, for the smell of a corpse is inauspicious, O Somaja.🔽One should always avoid at night the crossroads, trees near temples, cremation grounds, gardens,

original: duṣṭastrīsaṃnikarṣaṃ ca varjayen niśi sarvadā // / / //
analyzed: duṣṭa strī saṃnikarṣam ca varjayet niśi sarvadā
translated: and the company of wicked women.

original: pūjyadevadvijajyotiśchāyāṃ nātikramed budhaḥ /
analyzed: pūjya deva dvija jyotiḥ chāyām na atikramet budhaḥ
translated: A wise man should not cross the shadow of a deity, a Brahmin, or a sacred fire.

original: naikaḥ śūnyāṭavīṃ gacchen na ca śūnyagṛhe vaset // / / //🔽keśāsthikaṇṭakāmedhyabalibhasmatuṣāṃs tathā /
analyzed: na ekaḥ śūnya aṭavīm gacchet na ca śūnya gṛhe vaset  keśa asthi kaṇṭaka amedhya bali bhasma tuṣān tathā
translated: One should not travel alone through a deserted forest or stay in an empty house.🔽One should avoid from a distance hair, bones, thorns, impure substances, sacrificial offerings, ashes, chaff,

original: snānārdradharaṇīṃ caiva dūrataḥ parivarjayet // / / //
analyzed: snāna ārdra dharaṇīm ca eva dūratas parivarjayet
translated: and wet earth after bathing.

original: nānāryān āśrayet kāṃścin na jihmaṃ rocayed budhaḥ /
analyzed: na anāryān āśrayet kāṃścid na jihmam rocayet budhaḥ
translated: One should not rely on the ignoble, nor should a wise person approve of crookedness.

original: upasarpeta na vyālāṃś ciraṃ tiṣṭhen na cotthitaḥ // / / //🔽atīva jāgarasvapne tadvat sthānāsane budhaḥ /
analyzed: upasarpeta na vyālān ciram tiṣṭhet na ca utthitaḥ  atīva jāgara svapne tadvat sthāna āsane budhaḥ
translated: One should not approach wild animals, nor stand for a long time after rising.

original: na seveta tathā śayyāṃ vyāyāmaṃ ca nareśvara // / / //
analyzed: na seveta tathā śayyām vyāyāmam ca nareśvara
translated: A wise person should not indulge excessively in keeping awake or sleeping, nor in standing or sitting, O lord of men.🔽One should not use a bed, nor should one exercise.

original: daṃṣṭriṇaḥ śṛṅgiṇaś caiva prājño dūreṇa varjayet /
analyzed: daṃṣṭriṇaḥ śṛṅgiṇaḥ ca eva prājñaḥ dūreṇa varjayet
translated: A wise person should avoid from a distance those with fangs or horns,

original: avaśyāyaṃ ca rājendra puro vātātapau tathā // / / //
analyzed: avaśyāyam ca rāja indra puras vāta ātapau tathā
translated: as well as excessive wind, rain, and sun, O lord of kings.

original: na snāyān na svapen nagno na caivopaspṛśed budhaḥ /
analyzed: na snāyāt na svapet nagnaḥ na ca eva upaspṛśet budhaḥ
translated: A wise man should not bathe, sleep, or touch water with his private parts exposed.

original: muktakacchaś ca nācāmed devādyarcāṃ ca varjayet // / / //
analyzed: mukta kacchaḥ ca na ācāmet deva ādi arcām ca varjayet
translated: One should not sip water with the lower garment loosened, and should avoid worshipping gods and others.

original: homadevārcanādyāsu kriyāsv ācamane tathā /
analyzed: homa deva arcana ādyāsu kriyāsu ācamane tathā
translated: In rituals such as homa and worship of gods, and during sipping water,

original: naikavastraḥ pravarteta dvijavācanake jape // / / //
analyzed: na eka vastraḥ pravarteta dvija vācanake jape
translated: one should not perform with only one garment, or during the recitation of the Veda by Brahmins.

original: nāsamañjasaśīlais tu sahāsīta kadācana /
analyzed: na asamañjasa śīlaiḥ tu saha āsīta kadācana
translated: One should never sit with those who are of irregular conduct.

original: sadvṛttasaṃnikarṣo hi kṣaṇārdham api śasyate // / / //
analyzed: sat vṛtta saṃnikarṣaḥ hi kṣaṇa ardham api śasyate
translated: Association with the virtuous is praised even for half a moment.

original: virodhaṃ nottamair gacchen nādhamaiś ca sadā budhaḥ /
analyzed: virodham na uttamaiḥ gacchet na adhamaiḥ ca sadā budhaḥ
translated: A wise man should never quarrel with superiors or inferiors.

original: vivāhaś ca vivādaś ca tulyaśīlair nṛpeṣyate // / / //
analyzed: vivāhaḥ ca vivādaḥ ca tulya śīlaiḥ nṛpa iṣyate
translated: Marriage and disputes are considered proper only with those of equal conduct by kings.

original: nārabheta kaliṃ prājñaḥ śuṣkavairaṃ ca varjayet /
analyzed: na ārabheta kalim prājñaḥ śuṣka vairam ca varjayet
translated: A wise man should not start a quarrel, and should avoid fruitless enmity.

original: apy alpahāniḥ soḍhavyā vaireṇārthāgamaṃ tyajet // / / //🔽snāto nāṅgāni nirmārjet snānaśāṭyā na pāṇinā /🔽na ca nirdhūnayet keśān nācāmec caiva cotthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: api alpa hāniḥ soḍhavyā vaireṇa artha āgamam tyajet  snātaḥ na aṅgāni nirmārjet snāna śāṭyā na pāṇinā  na ca nirdhūnayet keśān na ācāmet ca eva ca utthitaḥ
translated: Even a small loss should be tolerated; one should give up the acquisition of wealth through enmity.🔽One who has bathed should not wipe the limbs with the bathing cloth or with the hand.🔽One should not shake the hair, and should not sip water while standing.

original: pādena nākramet pādaṃ na pūjyābhimukhaṃ nayet /
analyzed: pādena na ākramet pādam na pūjya abhimukham nayet
translated: One should not step over one's feet, or lead one who is being worshipped in front.

original: vīrāsanaṃ guror agre bhajeta vinayānvitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vīrāsanam guroḥ agre bhajeta vinaya anvitaḥ
translated: One should sit in the heroic posture in front of the teacher, endowed with humility.

original: apasavyaṃ na gacchec ca devāgāracatuṣpathān /🔽māṅgalyapūjyāṃś ca tato viparītān na dakṣiṇam // / / //
analyzed: apasavyam na gacchet ca devāgāra catuṣpathān  māṅgalya pūjyān ca tatas viparītān na dakṣiṇam
translated: One should not go against the current of a river, nor against the direction of the wind, nor against the direction of the sun, nor against the direction of the stars.🔽One should not go against the direction of the gods, temples, crossroads, auspicious objects of worship, or to the left.

original: somāgnyarkāmbuvāyūnāṃ pūjyānāṃ ca na saṃmukham /🔽kuryāt ṣṭhīvanaviṇmūtrasamutsargaṃ ca paṇḍitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: soma agni arka ambu vāyūnām pūjyānām ca na saṃmukham  kuryāt ṣṭhīvana viṣ mūtra samutsargam ca paṇḍitaḥ
translated: One should not spit, urinate or defecate in the direction of the moon, fire, sun, water, wind, or other objects of worship.🔽A wise person should not do these things in front of such objects.

original: tiṣṭhan na mūtrayet tadvat panthānaṃ nāvamūtrayet /
analyzed: tiṣṭhat na mūtrayet tadvat panthānam na avamūtrayet
translated: One should not urinate while standing, nor should one urinate on a path or in water.

original: śleṣmaviṇmūtraraktāni sarvadaiva na laṅghayet // / / //🔽śleṣmasiṃhānakotsargo nānnakāle praśasyate /
analyzed: śleṣma viṣ mūtra raktāni sarvadā eva na laṅghayet  śleṣma siṃhānaka utsargaḥ na anna kāle praśasyate
translated: One should never cross over phlegm, feces, urine or blood.🔽The discharge of phlegm and flatus is not recommended at the time of eating.

original: balimaṅgalajapyādau na home na mahājane // / / //🔽yoṣito nāvamanyeta na cāsāṃ viśvased budhaḥ /
analyzed: bali maṅgala japya ādau na home na mahājane  yoṣitaḥ na avamanyeta na ca āsām viśvaset budhaḥ
translated: During offerings, auspicious prayers and recitations, during a sacrifice, or in a large gathering.🔽A wise person should not disrespect women, nor should he trust them.

original: na caiverṣyur bhavet tāsu nādhikuryāt kadācana // / / //
analyzed: na ca eva īrṣyuḥ bhavet tāsu na adhikuryāt kadācana
translated: He should not be jealous of them, nor should he ever dominate them.

original: maṅgalyapuṣparatnājyapūjyān anabhivādya ca /
analyzed: maṅgalya puṣpa ratna ājya pūjyān an abhivādya ca
translated: Without first paying homage to auspicious flowers, jewels, clarified butter and objects of worship,

original: na niṣkramed gṛhāt prājñaḥ sadācāraparo nṛpa // / / //🔽catuṣpathān namas kuryāt kāle homaparo bhavet /
analyzed: na niṣkramet gṛhāt prājñaḥ sat ācāra paraḥ nṛpa  catuṣpathān namaḥ kuryāt kāle homa paraḥ bhavet
translated: A wise person should not leave his house, O king, always devoted to good conduct.🔽One should bow to crossroads, and be devoted to fire offerings at the proper time.

original: dīnān abhyuddharet sādhūn upāsīta bahuśrutān // / / //
analyzed: dīnān abhyuddharet sādhūn upāsīta bahuśrutān
translated: One should uplift the poor, serve the virtuous and the learned.

original: devarṣipūjakaḥ samyak pitṛpiṇḍodakapradaḥ /
translated: He who properly worships gods and sages, offers oblations and water to the manes,

original: satkartā cātithīnāṃ yaḥ sa lokān uttamān vrajet // / / //🔽ins /
analyzed: satkartā ca atithīnām yaḥ sa lokān uttamān vrajet  d ins
translated: and treats guests well, goes to the highest worlds.

original: ekāgracittasya dṛḍhavratasya sarvendriyaprītinivartakasya /
analyzed: ekāgra cittasya dṛḍha vratasya sarva indriya prīti nivartakasya
translated: For one with a concentrated mind, firm vows, who turns away the delights of all the senses,

original: adhyātmayoge yatamānasasya mokṣo dhruvaṃ nityam ahiṃsakasya // / / //
analyzed: adhyātma yoge yata mānasasya mokṣaḥ dhruvam nityam ahiṃsakasya
translated: who strives in the yoga of the self, whose mind is focused, and who is certainly non-violent, liberation is certain and eternal.

original: hitaṃ mitaṃ priyaṃ kāle vaśyātmā yo 'bhibhāṣate /
analyzed: hitam mitam priyam kāle vaśya ātmā yaḥ abhibhāṣate
translated: He who speaks beneficial, measured, and timely words, with a controlled self,

original: sa yāti lokān āhlādahetubhūtān nṛpākṣayān // / / //
analyzed: sa yāti lokān āhlāda hetu bhūtān nṛpa akṣayān
translated: he goes to the imperishable worlds that are the cause of delight.

original: dhīmān hrīmān kṣamāyukta āstiko vinayānvitaḥ /
analyzed: dhīmān hrīmān kṣamā yuktaḥ āstikaḥ vinaya anvitaḥ
translated: The wise, the humble, the patient, the faithful, the modest,

original: vidyābhijanavṛddhānāṃ yāti lokān anuttamān // / / //
analyzed: vidyā abhijana vṛddhānām yāti lokān anuttamān
translated: he goes to the unsurpassed worlds of those who are advanced in learning and noble birth.

original: akālagarjitādau tu parvasv āśaucakādiṣu /
analyzed: akāla garjita ādau tu parvasu āśaucaka ādiṣu
translated: But when there is untimely thunder or other such things, on parvan days, during impurity, etc.,

original: anadhyāyaṃ budhaḥ kuryād uparāgādike tathā // / / //
analyzed: anadhyāyam budhaḥ kuryāt uparāga ādike tathā
translated: the wise one should suspend study, as well as during eclipses and other such events.

original: śamaṃ nayati yaḥ kruddhān sarvabandhur amatsarī /
analyzed: śamam nayati yaḥ kruddhān sarva bandhuḥ amatsarī
translated: He who pacifies the angry, who is the friend of all, who is free from envy,

original: bhītāśvāsanakṛt sādhuḥ svargas tasyālpakaṃ phalam // / / //
analyzed: bhīta āśvāsana kṛt sādhuḥ svargaḥ tasya alpakam phalam
translated: who reassures the frightened, the virtuous one, heaven is a small reward for him.

original: varṣātapādike chatrī daṇḍī rātryaṭavīṣu ca /
analyzed: varṣa ātapa ādike chatrī daṇḍī rātri aṭavīṣu ca
translated: One should carry an umbrella and a staff in rain, heat, etc., and at night in the forest,

original: śarīratrāṇakāmo vai sopānatkaḥ sadā vrajet // / / //
analyzed: śarīra trāṇa kāmaḥ vai sa upānatkaḥ sadā vrajet
translated: One who desires to protect one's body should always walk with shoes on.

original: nordhvaṃ na tiryag dūraṃ vā nirīkṣan paryaṭed budhaḥ /
analyzed: na ūrdhvam na tiryak dūram vā nirīkṣan paryaṭet budhaḥ
translated: A wise person should not walk looking upwards, sideways, or far away.

original: yugamātraṃ mahīpṛṣṭhaṃ naro gacched vilokayan // / / //
analyzed: yuga mātram mahī pṛṣṭham naraḥ gacchet vilokayan
translated: A man should walk looking at a distance of two cubits on the ground.

original: doṣahetūn aśeṣāṃś ca vaśyātmā yo nirasyati /
analyzed: doṣa hetūn aśeṣān ca vaśya ātmā yaḥ nirasyati
translated: He who, with a controlled self, sets aside all the causes of faults,

original: tasya dharmārthakāmānāṃ hānir nālpāpi jāyate // / / //🔽ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: tasya dharma artha kāmānām hāniḥ na alpā api jāyate  veṅk ins
translated: For him, there is no loss at all of Dharma, Artha, and Kama.

original: sadācārarataḥ prājño vidyāvinayaśikṣitaḥ // / / //
translated: Always engaged in good conduct, wise, learned in knowledge and humility,

original: pāpe 'py apāpaḥ puruṣe 'py abhidhatte priyāṇi yaḥ /
analyzed: pāpe pi apāpaḥ puruṣe pi abhidhatte priyāṇi yaḥ
translated: He who speaks pleasant words to a sinful person, to a man, without sin,

original: maitrīdravāntaḥkaraṇas tasya muktiḥ kare sthitā // / / //
analyzed: maitrī drava antaḥkaraṇaḥ tasya muktiḥ kare sthitā
translated: With a heart full of friendliness, his liberation is in his hand.

original: ye kāmakrodhalobhānāṃ vītarāgā na gocare /
analyzed: ye kāma krodha lobhānām vīta rāgāḥ na gocare
translated: For those who are free from attachment to desire, anger, and greed,

original: sadācārasthitās teṣām anubhāvair dhṛtā mahī // / / //
analyzed: sat ācāra sthitāḥ teṣām anubhāvaiḥ dhṛtā mahī
translated: The earth is sustained by the power of those who abide in good conduct.

original: tasmāt satyaṃ vadet prājño yat paraprītikāraṇam /
analyzed: tasmāt satyam vadet prājñaḥ yat para prīti kāraṇam
translated: Therefore, a wise person should speak the truth that causes delight in others.

original: satyaṃ yat paraduḥkhāya tatra maunaparo bhavet // / / //
analyzed: satyam yat para duḥkhāya tatra mauna paraḥ bhavet
translated: If the truth causes pain to others, one should remain silent about it.

original: priyam uktaṃ hitaṃ naitad iti matvā na tad vadet /
analyzed: priyam uktam hitam na etat iti matvā na tat vadet
translated: One should not speak what is said to be pleasant but not beneficial,

original: śreyas tatra hitaṃ vākyaṃ yady apy atyantam apriyam // / / //🔽prāṇinām upakārāya yad eveha paratra ca /
analyzed: śreyaḥ tatra hitam vākyam yadi api atyantam apriyam  prāṇinām upakārāya yat eva iha paratra ca
translated: That beneficial advice, even if extremely unpleasant, is better.

original: karmaṇā manasā vācā tad eva matimān bhajet // / / //
analyzed: karmaṇā manasā vācā tat eva matimān bhajet
translated: One should always resort to that action, thought, and speech which is beneficial to living beings both in this world and the next.🔽A wise person should always resort to that.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe tṛtīyāṃśe dvādaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe tṛtīya aṃśe dvādaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twelfth chapter in the third section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: aurva uvāca /
analyzed: aurvaḥ uvāca
translated: Aurva said:

original: sacailasya pituḥ snānaṃ jāte putre vidhīyate /🔽jātakarma tathā kuryāc śrāddham abhyudaye ca yat // / / //
analyzed: sa cailasya pituḥ snānam jāte putre vidhīyate  jātakarma tathā kuryāt śrāddham abhyudaye ca yat
translated: For the father, the bath with clothes on is prescribed when a son is born.🔽One should perform the birth rites and the ancestral rites at the time of prosperity.

original: yugmān devāṃś ca pitryāṃś ca samyak savyakramād dvijān /
analyzed: yugmān devān ca pitryān ca samyak savya kramāt dvijān
translated: One should worship the even-numbered gods and ancestors, and the Brahmins in the proper order,

original: pūjayed bhojayec caiva tanmanā nānyamānasaḥ // / / //🔽dadhyakṣataiḥ sabadaraiḥ prāṅmukhodaṅmukho 'pi vā /
analyzed: pūjayet bhojayet ca eva tad manāḥ na anya mānasaḥ  dadhi akṣataiḥ sa badaraiḥ vā
translated: and feed them, with a focused mind, not thinking of anything else.🔽With curd, unbroken rice, and jujube fruits, facing east or north,

original: devatīrthena vai piṇḍān dadyāt kāyena vā nṛpa // / / //
analyzed: deva tīrthena vai piṇḍān dadyāt kāyena vā nṛpa
translated: one should offer the funeral cakes with the water from the foot of the image of Vishnu, O king.

original: nāndīmukhaḥ pitṛgaṇas tena śrāddhena pārthiva /
analyzed: nāndīmukhaḥ pitṛ gaṇaḥ tena śrāddhena pārthiva
translated: The group of ancestors with Nandi at the head, O king, is pleased with that ancestral rite.

original: prīyate tat tu kartavyaṃ puruṣaiḥ sarvavṛddhiṣu // / / //
analyzed: prīyate tat tu kartavyam puruṣaiḥ sarva vṛddhiṣu
translated: That should be done by men at all times of prosperity.

original: kanyāputravivāheṣu praveśe navaveśmanaḥ /
analyzed: kanyā putra vivāheṣu praveśe nava veśmanaḥ
translated: At the time of the marriage of a daughter or son, at the time of entering a new house,

original: nāmakarmaṇi bālānāṃ cūḍākarmādike tathā // / / //
analyzed: nāmakarmaṇi bālānām cūḍākarma ādike tathā
translated: In the naming ceremony of children, and in the rites such as the tonsure ceremony,

original: sīmantonnayane caiva putrādimukhadarśane /
analyzed: sīmantonnayane ca eva putra ādi mukha darśane
translated: In the ceremony of parting the hair, and in the seeing of the face of a son and others,

original: nāndīmukhaṃ pitṛgaṇaṃ pūjayet prayato gṛhī // / / //
analyzed: nāndīmukham pitṛ gaṇam pūjayet prayataḥ gṛhī
translated: The householder, being pure, should worship the group of ancestors with the Nandīmukha rite.

original: pitṛpūjākramaḥ prokto vṛddhāv eṣa samāsataḥ /
analyzed: pitṛ pūjā kramaḥ proktaḥ vṛddhau eṣa samāsatas
translated: The order of worship of the ancestors has been stated in brief in the Vṛddhi (rite).

original: śrūyatām avanīpāla pretakarmakriyāvidhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: śrūyatām avanīpāla preta karma kriyā vidhiḥ
translated: O king, let the procedure of the rite of the departed ancestors be heard.

original: pretadehaṃ śubhaiḥ snānaiḥ snāpitaṃ sragvibhūṣitam /
analyzed: preta deham śubhaiḥ snānaiḥ snāpitam sraj vibhūṣitam
translated: The body of the departed one, having been bathed with auspicious baths and adorned with garlands,

original: dagdhvā grāmād bahiḥ snātvā sacailāḥ salilāśaye // / / //
analyzed: dagdhvā grāmāt bahis snātvā sa cailāḥ salilāśaye
translated: Having cremated it outside the village, having bathed, with the clothes on, in a pond,

original: yatra tatra sthitāyaitad amukāyeti vādinaḥ /
analyzed: yatra tatra sthitāya etat amukāya iti vādinaḥ
translated: Standing anywhere, saying To such and such a one,

original: dakṣiṇābhimukhā dadyur bāndhavāḥ salilāñjalim // / / //
analyzed: dakṣiṇa abhimukhāḥ dadyuḥ bāndhavāḥ salila añjalim
translated: The relatives, facing south, should offer a handful of water.

original: praviṣṭāś ca samaṃ gobhir grāmaṃ nakṣatradarśane /
analyzed: praviṣṭāḥ ca samam gobhiḥ grāmam nakṣatra darśane
translated: And having entered the village with the cows, at the sight of the constellation,

original: kaṭadharmāṃs tataḥ kuryur bhūmau prastaraśāyinaḥ // / / //🔽dātavyo 'nudinaṃ piṇḍaḥ pretāya bhuvi pārthiva /
analyzed: kaṭa dharmān tatas kuryuḥ bhūmau prastara śāyinaḥ  dātavyaḥ nu dinam piṇḍaḥ pretāya bhuvi pārthiva
translated: They should perform the rites of the dead, lying on the ground on a mat.🔽The ball of rice should be offered daily to the departed one on the ground, O king.

original: divā ca bhaktaṃ bhoktavyam amāṃsaṃ manujarṣabha // / / //
analyzed: divā ca bhaktam bhoktavyam a māṃsam manuja ṛṣabha
translated: And the food, without meat, should be eaten during the day, O best of men.

original: dināni tāni cecchātaḥ kartavyaṃ viprabhojanam /
analyzed: dināni tāni ca icchātaḥ kartavyam vipra bhojanam
translated: And for those days, if desired, the feeding of Brahmins should be done.

original: pretas tṛptiṃ tathā yāti bandhuvargeṇa bhuñjatā // / / //
analyzed: pretaḥ tṛptim tathā yāti bandhu vargeṇa bhuñjatā
translated: And the preta becomes satisfied, along with the group of relatives who eat.

original: prathame 'hni tṛtīye ca saptame navame tathā /
analyzed: prathame hni tṛtīye ca saptame navame tathā
translated: On the first day, the third, the seventh, and the ninth,

original: vastratyāgaṃ bahiḥsnānaṃ kṛtvā dadyāt tilodakam // / / //
analyzed: vastra tyāgam bahis snānam kṛtvā dadyāt tila udakam
translated: Having given up clothes and bathed outside, one should offer water with sesamum seeds.

original: ins /
analyzed: ins
translated: Here is the corrected and aligned text:

original: tato 'nubandhuvargas tu bhuvi dadyāt tilodakam // / / //
analyzed: tatas nu bandhu vargaḥ tu bhuvi dadyāt tila udakam
translated: Then the group of relatives should offer water with sesamum seeds on the ground.

original: caturthe 'hni ca kartavyaṃ bhasmāsthicayanaṃ nṛpa /
analyzed: caturthe hni ca kartavyam bhasma asthi cayanam nṛpa
translated: On the fourth day, O king, the collection of ashes and bones should be done.

original: tadūrdhvam aṅgasparśaś ca sapiṇḍānām apīṣyate // / / //
analyzed: tad ūrdhvam aṅga sparśaḥ ca sapiṇḍānām api iṣyate
translated: After that, the touching of the limbs is considered even for the sapiṇḍas.

original: yogyāḥ sarvakriyāṇāṃ tu samānasalilās tathā /
analyzed: yogyāḥ sarva kriyāṇām tu samāna salilāḥ tathā
translated: The eligible ones are for all the rites, and also those with the same water, O king,

original: anulepanapuṣpādibhogād anyatra pārthiva // / / //
analyzed: anulepana puṣpa ādi bhogāt anyatra pārthiva
translated: Except for the enjoyment of anointing, flowers, etc., O king.

original: śayyāsanopabhogaś ca sapiṇḍānām apīṣyate /
analyzed: śayyā āsana upabhogaḥ ca sapiṇḍānām api iṣyate
translated: The enjoyment of bed and seat is also considered for the sapiṇḍas.

original: bhasmāsthicayanād ūrdhvaṃ saṃyogo na tu yoṣitām // / / //
analyzed: bhasma asthi cayanāt ūrdhvam saṃyogaḥ na tu yoṣitām
translated: After the collection of ashes and bones, there is no union with women.

original: bāle deśāntarasthe ca patite ca munau mṛte /
analyzed: bāle deśa antara sthe ca patite ca munau mṛte
translated: For a child, one who is in a foreign country, and for a fallen sage who dies,

original: sadyaḥ śaucaṃ tathecchāto jalāgnyudbandhanādiṣu // / / //
analyzed: sadyas śaucam tathā icchātaḥ jala agni udbandhana ādiṣu
translated: There is immediate purification, and also by one's own will, in the case of drowning, fire, hanging, etc.

original: mṛtabandhor daśāhāni kulasyānnaṃ na bhujyate /
analyzed: mṛta bandhoḥ daśa ahāni kulasya annam na bhujyate
translated: For ten days after the death of a relative, the food of the family is not eaten.

original: dānaṃ pratigraho yajñaḥ svādhyāyaś ca nivartate // / / //
analyzed: dānam pratigrahaḥ yajñaḥ svādhyāyaḥ ca nivartate
translated: Giving gifts, accepting gifts, performing sacrifices, and studying the Vedas cease.

original: viprasyaitad dvādaśāhaṃ rājanyasyāpy aśaucakam /
analyzed: viprasya etat dvādaśa aham rājanyasya api aśaucakam
translated: For a Brahmin, this period of impurity lasts for twelve days, and for a Kshatriya also.

original: ardhamāsaṃ tu vaiśyasya māsaṃ śūdrasya śuddhaye // / / //
analyzed: ardha māsam tu vaiśyasya māsam śūdrasya śuddhaye
translated: For a Vaishya, it is for half a month, and for a Shudra, for one month, for the sake of purification.

original: ayujo bhojayet kāmaṃ dvijān ādye tato dine /
analyzed: ayujaḥ bhojayet kāmam dvijān ādye tatas dine
translated: One may feed odd-numbered Brahmins as one wishes on the first day after the death.

original: dadyād darbheṣu piṇḍaṃ ca pretāyocchiṣṭasaṃnidhau // / / //🔽vāryāyudhapratodās tu daṇḍaś ca dvijabhojanāt /
analyzed: dadyāt darbheṣu piṇḍam ca pretāya ucchiṣṭa saṃnidhau  vāri āyudha pratodāḥ tu daṇḍaḥ ca dvija bhojanāt
translated: And one should offer a ball of rice on darbha grass in the presence of the leftovers for the deceased.

original: spraṣṭavyo 'nantaraṃ varṇaiḥ śudhyeraṃs te tataḥ kramāt // / / //
analyzed: spraṣṭavyaḥ nantaram varṇaiḥ śudhyeran te tatas kramāt
translated: But a water vessel, weapon, whip, and staff should be touched by the lower castes after the Brahmins have eaten. They would become pure in that order.

original: tataḥ svavarṇadharmā ye viprādīnām udāhṛtāḥ /🔽tān kurvīta pumāñ jīven nijadharmārjanais tathā // / / //
analyzed: tatas sva varṇa dharmāḥ ye vipra ādīnām udāhṛtāḥ  tān kurvīta pumān jīvet nija dharma arjanaiḥ tathā
translated: Then, the duties specific to each varna, such as those of Brahmins and others, have been stated.🔽A man should perform them and earn his livelihood through his own duties.

original: mṛte 'hani ca kartavyam ekoddiṣṭam ataḥ param /
analyzed: mṛte hani ca kartavyam ekoddiṣṭam atas param
translated: And after that, the Ekoddista (offering to the deceased) should be performed on the death anniversary.

original: āhvānādikriyādaivaniyogarahitaṃ hi tat // / / //
analyzed: āhvāna ādi kriyā daiva niyoga rahitam hi tat
translated: For that is devoid of the rites beginning with invitation and the appointment of a priest.

original: eko 'rghyas tatra dātavyas tathaivaikaṃ pavitrakam /
analyzed: ekaḥ rghyaḥ tatra dātavyaḥ tathā eva ekam pavitrakam
translated: There, one Arghya and one Pavitraka should be offered.

original: pretāya piṇḍo dātavyo bhuktavatsu dvijātiṣu // / / //
analyzed: pretāya piṇḍaḥ dātavyaḥ bhuktavatsu dvijātiṣu
translated: The ball of rice should be offered to the deceased after the twice-born have eaten.

original: praśnaś ca tatrābhiratir yajamānadvijanmanām /
analyzed: praśnaḥ ca tatra abhiratiḥ yajamāna dvijanmanām
translated: And there is a question and delight of the sacrificing Brahmins.

original: akṣayyam amukasyeti vaktavyaṃ viratau tathā // / / //
analyzed: akṣayyam amukasya iti vaktavyam viratau tathā
translated: It should be said Imperishable for such and such at the conclusion of the rite.

original: ekoddiṣṭamayo dharma ittham āvatsarāt smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: ekoddiṣṭa mayaḥ dharmaḥ ittham ā vatsarāt smṛtaḥ
translated: Thus, the Dharma consisting of Ekoddista is remembered from the Avatsara.

original: sapiṇḍīkaraṇaṃ tasmin kāle rājendra tac chṛṇu // / / //
analyzed: sapiṇḍīkaraṇam tasmin kāle rāja indra tat śṛṇu
translated: On that occasion, O lord of kings, listen to the Sapindikarana.

original: ekoddiṣṭavidhānena kāryaṃ tad api pārthiva // / / //
analyzed: ekoddiṣṭa vidhānena kāryam tat api pārthiva
translated: That also should be performed according to the rules of Ekoddista, O king.

original: After / / /ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: after veṅk ins
translated: After the insertion by the editor Venkatesh.

original: saṃvatsare 'tha ṣaṣṭhe vā māsi vā dvādaśe 'hni vā // / / //
analyzed: saṃvatsare tha ṣaṣṭhe vā māsi vā dvādaśe hni vā
translated: In the year, or in the sixth month, or on the twelfth day,

original: tilagandhodakair yuktaṃ tatra pātracatuṣṭayam // / / //
analyzed: tila gandha udakaiḥ yuktam tatra pātra catuṣṭayam
translated: There, four vessels should be filled with sesamum seeds, fragrances, and water.

original: pātraṃ pretasya tatraikaṃ paitraṃ pātratrayaṃ tathā /
analyzed: pātram pretasya tatra ekam paitram pātra trayam tathā
translated: There, one vessel is for the departed, and three vessels are for the ancestors.

original: secayet pitṛpātreṣu pretapātraṃ nṛpa triṣu // / / //
analyzed: secayet pitṛpātreṣu pretapātram nṛpa triṣu
translated: O king, the vessel of the departed should be sprinkled in the three vessels of the ancestors.

original: tataḥ pitṛtvam āpanne tasmin prete mahīpate /
analyzed: tatas pitṛ tvam āpanne tasmin prete mahīpate
translated: Then, O lord of the earth, when the departed one has attained the state of an ancestor,

original: śrāddhadharmair aśeṣais tu tatpūrvān arcayet pitṝn // / / //
analyzed: śrāddha dharmaiḥ aśeṣaiḥ tu tad pūrvān arcayet pitṝn
translated: One should worship the ancestors with all the rites of the Sraddha.

original: putraḥ pautraḥ prapautro vā bandhur vā bhrātṛsaṃtatiḥ /
analyzed: putraḥ pautraḥ prapautraḥ vā bandhuḥ vā bhrātṛ saṃtatiḥ
translated: The son, grandson, great-grandson, or a relative or the line of brothers,

original: sapiṇḍasaṃtatir vāpi kriyārho nṛpa jāyate // / / //
analyzed: sapiṇḍa saṃtatiḥ vā api kriyā arhaḥ nṛpa jāyate
translated: Or even the line of Sapindas becomes worthy of performing the rites, O king.

original: teṣām abhāve sarveṣāṃ samānodakasaṃtatiḥ /
analyzed: teṣām abhāve sarveṣām samāna udaka saṃtatiḥ
translated: In the absence of all of them, the continuity of those related by the same water offering,

original: mātṛpakṣasya piṇḍena saṃbaddhā ye jalena vā // / / //
analyzed: mātṛ pakṣasya piṇḍena saṃbaddhāḥ ye jalena vā
translated: those related by the ball of rice of the mother's side or by water,

original: kuladvaye 'pi cocchinne strībhiḥ kāryāḥ kriyā nṛpa /
analyzed: kula dvaye ca ucchinne strībhiḥ kāryāḥ kriyāḥ nṛpa
translated: and also in the case of the extinction of both families, the rites should be performed by women, O king.

original: saṃghātāntargatair vāpi kāryāḥ pretasya yāḥ kriyāḥ /
analyzed: saṃghāta antargataiḥ vā api kāryāḥ pretasya yāḥ kriyāḥ
translated: Or the rites for the deceased should be performed by those who are included in the assembly,

original: utsannabandhurikthānāṃ kārayed avanīpatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: utsanna bandhu rikthānām kārayet avanīpatiḥ
translated: and the rites for those whose relatives and wealth have perished should be performed by the lord of the earth.

original: pūrvāḥ kriyā madhyamāś ca tathā caivottarāḥ kriyāḥ /
analyzed: pūrvāḥ kriyāḥ madhyamāḥ ca tathā ca eva uttarāḥ kriyāḥ
translated: The rites are threefold: the preliminary rites, the middle rites, and the final rites.

original: triḥprakārāḥ kriyā hy etās tāsāṃ bhedaṃ śṛṇuṣva me // / / //
analyzed: tris prakārāḥ kriyāḥ hi etāḥ tāsām bhedam śṛṇuṣva me
translated: Listen to me, O king, I shall describe the difference between them.

original: ādāhavāryāyudhādisparśādyantās tu yāḥ kriyāḥ /
analyzed: ādāha vāri āyudha ādi sparśa ādi antāḥ tu yāḥ kriyāḥ
translated: Those rites which end with the touch of fire, water, weapons, etc.,

original: tāḥ pūrvā madhyamā māsi māsy ekoddiṣṭasaṃjñitāḥ // / / //🔽prete pitṛtvam āpanne sapiṇḍīkaraṇād anu /
analyzed: tāḥ pūrvāḥ madhyamāḥ māsi māsi ekoddiṣṭa saṃjñitāḥ  prete pitṛ tvam āpanne sapiṇḍīkaraṇāt anu
translated: are the preliminary rites, the middle rites are performed monthly, and are known as Ekoddista.🔽After the deceased has attained the state of a manes, the rites for the manes are performed after the Sapindikarana,

original: kriyante yāḥ kriyāḥ pitryāḥ procyante tā nṛpottarāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kriyante yāḥ kriyāḥ pitryāḥ procyante tāḥ nṛpa uttarāḥ
translated: and those rites, O king, are called the final rites.

original: pitṛmātṛsapiṇḍais tu samānasalilais tathā /
analyzed: pitṛ mātṛ sapiṇḍaiḥ tu samāna salilaiḥ tathā
translated: By the Sapindas of the father and mother, by those related by the same water offering,

original: tatsaṃghātagataiś caiva rājñā vā dhanahāriṇā // / / //
analyzed: tad saṃghāta gataiḥ ca eva rājñā vā dhana hāriṇā
translated: by those who are included in their assembly, and by the king who takes the wealth,🔽the rites for the deceased should be performed.

original: pūrvāḥ kriyās tu kartavyāḥ putrādyair eva cottarāḥ /🔽dauhitrair vā naraśreṣṭha kāryās tattanayais tathā // / / //
analyzed: pūrvāḥ kriyāḥ tu kartavyāḥ putra ādyaiḥ eva ca uttarāḥ  dauhitraiḥ vā nara śreṣṭha kāryāḥ tad tanayaiḥ tathā
translated: The former rites should be performed by the sons and others, and the latter rites by the grandsons and their sons, O best of men.

original: mṛtāhani ca kartavyāḥ strīṇām apy uttarāḥ kriyāḥ /
analyzed: mṛta ahani ca kartavyāḥ strīṇām api uttarāḥ kriyāḥ
translated: On the day of death, the latter rites should be performed even by women.

original: pratisaṃvatsaraṃ rājann ekoddiṣṭavidhānataḥ // / / //
analyzed: pratisaṃvatsaram rājan ekoddiṣṭa vidhānataḥ
translated: And every year, O king, according to the Ekoddista rites.

original: tasmād uttarasaṃjñā yāḥ kriyās tāḥ śṛṇu pārthiva /
analyzed: tasmāt uttara saṃjñāḥ yāḥ kriyāḥ tāḥ śṛṇu pārthiva
translated: Therefore, listen, O king, to those rites which are called latter.

original: yadā yadā ca kartavyā vidhinā yena cānagha // / / //
analyzed: yadā yadā ca kartavyāḥ vidhinā yena ca anagha
translated: And when and when they should be performed and by what method, O sinless one.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe tṛtīyāṃśe trayodaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe tṛtīya aṃśe trayodaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirteenth chapter in the third section of the Vishnu Purana, dealing with the funeral rites.

original: aurva uvāca /
analyzed: aurvaḥ uvāca
translated: Aurva said:

original: brahmendrarudranāsatyasūryāgnivasumārutān /
analyzed: brahma indra rudra nāsatya sūrya agni vasu mārutān
translated: Brahma, Indra, Rudra, the Ashvins, the Sun, the Fire, the Vasus, the Maruts,

original: viśvedevān ṛṣigaṇān vayāṃsi manujān paśūn // / / //
analyzed: viśvedevān ṛṣi gaṇān vayāṃsi manujān paśūn
translated: The Vishvadevas, the groups of sages, the birds, men, animals,

original: sarīsṛpān pitṛgaṇān yac cānyad bhūtasaṃjñitam /
analyzed: sarīsṛpān pitṛ gaṇān yat ca anyat bhūta saṃjñitam
translated: The reptiles, the groups of ancestors, and whatever else is known as a being,

original: śrāddhaṃ śraddhānvitaḥ kurvan tarpayaty akhilaṃ jagat // / / //
analyzed: śrāddham śraddhā anvitaḥ kurvan tarpayati akhilam jagat
translated: The one who performs the Shraddha with faith satisfies the entire world.

original: māsi māsy asite pakṣe pañcadaśyāṃ nareśvara /
analyzed: māsi māsi asite pakṣe pañcadaśyām nareśvara
translated: On the fifteenth day of the dark fortnight every month, O lord of men,

original: tathāṣṭakāsu kurvīta kāmyān kālāñ chṛṇuṣva me // / / //
analyzed: tathā aṣṭakāsu kurvīta kāmyān me
translated: And on the Ashtakas, one should perform the desired rites. Listen to me about the times.

original: śrāddhārham āgataṃ dravyaṃ viśiṣṭam athavā dvijam /🔽śrāddhaṃ kurvīta vijñāya vyatīpāte 'yane tathā // / / //
analyzed: śrāddha arham āgatam dravyam viśiṣṭam athavā dvijam  śrāddham kurvīta vijñāya vyatīpāte yane tathā
translated: When the materials fit for a Śrāddha have arrived, or when a distinguished Brāhmaṇa has come,

original: viṣuve cāpi saṃprāpte grahaṇe śaśisūryayoḥ /
analyzed: viṣuve ca api saṃprāpte grahaṇe śaśi sūryayoḥ
translated: one should perform a Śrāddha, knowing that it is the time of a Vyatīpāta, an eclipse of the sun or moon,

original: samasteṣv eva bhūpāla rāśiṣv arke ca gacchati // / / //
analyzed: samasteṣu eva bhūpāla rāśiṣu arke ca gacchati
translated: or when the sun enters a new sign of the zodiac, O king,🔽or when the sun enters any of the signs of the zodiac,

original: nakṣatragrahapīḍāsu duṣṭasvapnāvalokane /
analyzed: nakṣatra graha pīḍāsu duṣṭa svapna avalokane
translated: or when there is an affliction of the stars and planets, or when one sees evil dreams,

original: icchāśrāddhāni kurvīta navasasyāgame tathā // / / //
analyzed: icchāśrāddhāni kurvīta nava sasya āgame tathā
translated: or when new grain has arrived, one should perform Śrāddhas according to one's desire.

original: amāvāsyā yadā maitraviśākhāsvātiyoginī /
analyzed: amāvāsyā yadā maitra viśākhā svāti yoginī
translated: When the new moon is in conjunction with Maitra, Viśākhā, or Svātī,

original: śrāddhaiḥ pitṛgaṇas tṛptiṃ tathāpnoty aṣṭavārṣikīm // / / //
analyzed: śrāddhaiḥ pitṛ gaṇaḥ tṛptim tathā āpnoti aṣṭa vārṣikīm
translated: the group of ancestors obtain satisfaction for eight years through Śrāddhas.

original: amāvāsyā yadā puṣye raudre carkṣe punarvasau /
analyzed: amāvāsyā yadā puṣye raudre ca ṛkṣe punarvasau
translated: When the new moon is in conjunction with Puṣya, Rohiṇī, or Punarvasu,

original: dvādaśābdaṃ tadā tṛptiṃ prayānti pitaro 'rcitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: dvādaśa abdam tadā tṛptim prayānti pitaraḥ rcitāḥ
translated: the ancestors, when worshipped, attain satisfaction for twelve years.

original: vāsavājaikapādarkṣe pitṝṇāṃ tṛptim icchatām /
analyzed: vāsava aja ekapāda ṛkṣe pitṝṇām tṛptim icchatām
translated: On the asterisms of Vāsudeva, Aśvinī, and Ekāṣṭaka,

original: vāruṇe cāpy amāvāsyā devānām api durlabhā // / / //
analyzed: vāruṇe ca api amāvāsyā devānām api durlabhā
translated: when the new moon is in conjunction with Varuṇa, it is difficult to obtain even for the gods.

original: navasv ṛkṣeṣv amāvāsyā yadaiteṣv avanīpate /
analyzed: navasu ṛkṣeṣu amāvāsyā yadā eteṣu avanīpate
translated: When the new moon is in any of these nine asterisms, O lord of the earth,

original: tadā tṛptipradaṃ śrāddhaṃ pitṝṇāṃ śṛṇu cāparam // / / //
analyzed: tadā tṛpti pradam śrāddham pitṝṇām śṛṇu ca aparam
translated: then Śrāddha gives satisfaction to the ancestors. Listen to another thing.

original: gītaṃ sanatkumāreṇa yad'ilāya mahātmane /
analyzed: gītam sanatkumāreṇa yat ilāya mahātmane
translated: The song sung by Sanatkumara to the great-souled Ila,

original: pṛcchate pitṛbhaktāya śraddhayāvanatāya ca // / / //
analyzed: pṛcchate pitṛ bhaktāya śraddhayā avanatāya ca
translated: When he asked with devotion and humility, being devoted to his father.

original: sanatkumāra uvāca /🔽vaiśākhamāsasya ca yā tṛtīyā navamy asau kārttikaśuklapakṣe /
analyzed: sanatkumāraḥ uvāca  vaiśākha māsasya ca yā tṛtīyā navamī asau kārttika śukla pakṣe
translated: Sanatkumara said:🔽The third day of the month of Vaishakha, the ninth day of the bright fortnight of Kartika,

original: nabhasyamāsasya tu kṛṣṇapakṣe trayodaśī pañcadaśī ca māghe // / / //
analyzed: nabhasya māsasya tu kṛṣṇa pakṣe trayodaśī pañcadaśī ca māghe
translated: The thirteenth day of the dark fortnight of Nabhasya, and the fifteenth day of Magha -

original: etā yugādyās tithayaś catasro 'py anantapuṇyā nṛpa saṃpradiṣṭāḥ // / / //🔽ins / after /
analyzed: etāḥ yuga ādyāḥ tithayaḥ catasraḥ pi ananta puṇyāḥ nṛpa saṃpradiṣṭāḥ  ins after
translated: These four dates are declared to be of infinite merit, O king, at the beginning of the yugas.

original: dve śukle dve tathā kṛṣṇe yugādye munayo viduḥ // / / / //
analyzed: dve śukle dve tathā kṛṣṇe yuga ādye munayaḥ viduḥ
translated: Two bright and two dark fortnights, the sages know, are the beginnings of the yugas.

original: śukle pūrvāhnike grāhye kṛṣṇe caivāparāhnike // / / / //
analyzed: śukle pūrvāhnike grāhye kṛṣṇe ca eva aparāhnike
translated: In the bright fortnight, the morning should be accepted, and in the dark fortnight, the afternoon.

original: yugādyeṣu yugānteṣu dattam akṣayam iṣyate // / / / //
analyzed: yuga ādyeṣu yuga anteṣu dattam akṣayam iṣyate
translated: On the beginnings and ends of the yugas, what is given is considered to be inexhaustible.

original: upaplave candramaso raveś ca triṣv aṣṭakāsv apy ayanadvaye ca // / / //🔽Ś / / / ins / / ins / l / after and l / after /
analyzed: upaplave candramasaḥ raveḥ ca triṣu aṣṭakāsu api ayana dvaye ca  ins d ins l after and l after
translated: At the eclipses of the moon and the sun, on the three Ashtakas, and in the two solstices,

original: candrakṣaye māghavamāsi yatra dinakṣaye vai viṣuvaddvayaṃ ca /
analyzed: candra kṣaye māghava māsi yatra dinakṣaye vai viṣuvat dvayam ca
translated: On the new moon day, when the moon wanes in the month of Magha, and at the two equinoxes at the end of the day,

original: manvantarādyās tithayas tathaiva chāyāgajasya vyatipātakālaḥ // / / //
analyzed: manvantara ādyāḥ tithayaḥ tathā eva chāyāgajasya vyatipāta kālaḥ
translated: The Manvantaras and other days, as well as the time of the eclipse of the shadow-elephant,

original: pānīyam apy atra tilair vimiśraṃ dadyāt pitṛbhyaḥ prayato manuṣyaḥ /
analyzed: pānīyam api atra tilaiḥ vimiśram dadyāt pitṛbhyaḥ prayataḥ manuṣyaḥ
translated: A man should offer here water mixed with sesamum to the ancestors, being restrained.

original: śrāddhaṃ kṛtaṃ tena samāḥ sahasraṃ rahasyam etat pitaro vadanti // / / //
analyzed: śrāddham kṛtam tena samāḥ sahasram rahasyam etat pitaraḥ vadanti
translated: By that, a thousand years of Śrāddha are performed. This is a secret that the ancestors speak.

original: māghāsite pañcadaśī kadācid upaiti yogaṃ yadi vāruṇena /
analyzed: māgha asite pañcadaśī kadācid upaiti yogam yadi vāruṇena
translated: Sometimes the new moon of Māgha comes with a conjunction with Varuṇa,

original: ṛkṣeṇa kālaḥ sa paraḥ pitṝṇāṃ na hy alpapuṇyair nṛpa labhyate 'sau // / / //
analyzed: ṛkṣeṇa kālaḥ sa paraḥ pitṝṇām na hi alpa puṇyaiḥ nṛpa labhyate sau
translated: If it is with the lunar mansion, that is the supreme time for the ancestors. O king, that is not obtained by those with little merit.

original: kāle dhaniṣṭhā yadi nāma tasmin bhavanti bhūpāla tadā pitṛbhyaḥ /
analyzed: kāle dhaniṣṭhā yadi nāma tasmin bhavanti bhūpāla tadā pitṛbhyaḥ
translated: If on that day, the lunar mansion of Dhaniṣṭhā occurs, then, O king, whatever water and food is offered to the ancestors,

original: dattaṃ jalānnaṃ pradadāti tṛptiṃ varṣāyutaṃ tatkulajair manuṣyaiḥ // / / //🔽tatraiva ced bhādrapadās tu pūrvāḥ kāle tadā yat kriyate pitṛbhyaḥ /
analyzed: dattam jala annam pradadāti tṛptim varṣa ayutam tad kula jaiḥ manuṣyaiḥ  tatra eva ced bhādrapadāḥ tu pūrvāḥ kāle tadā yat kriyate pitṛbhyaḥ
translated: That gives satisfaction to the men born in that family for ten thousand years.🔽If on that day, the lunar mansion of Bhadrapadā occurs, then whatever Śrāddha is performed for the ancestors,

original: śrāddhaṃ parāṃ tṛptim upetya tena yugaṃ samagraṃ pitaraḥ svapanti // / / //
analyzed: śrāddham parām tṛptim upetya tena yugam samagram pitaraḥ svapanti
translated: By that, the ancestors, having attained supreme satisfaction, sleep for a complete yuga.

original: gaṅgāṃ śatadrūm atha vā vipāśāṃ sarasvatīṃ naimiṣagomatīṃ vā /
analyzed: gaṅgām śatadrūm atha vā vipāśām sarasvatīm naimiṣa gomatīm vā
translated: The Ganges, the Shatadru, the Vipasha, the Sarasvati, the Naimisha, the Gomati,

original: tato 'vagāhyārcanam ādareṇa kṛtvā pitṝṇāṃ duritāni hanti // / / //
analyzed: tatas vagāhya arcanam ādareṇa kṛtvā pitṝṇām duritāni hanti
translated: Then having bathed and worshipped with reverence, he destroys the sins of the ancestors.

original: gāyanti caitat pitaraḥ sadaiva varṣāmaghātṛptim avāpya bhūyaḥ /
analyzed: gāyanti ca etat pitaraḥ sadā eva varṣā maghā tṛptim avāpya bhūyas
translated: And the ancestors always sing this: Having obtained rain and the satisfaction of libations, we will again

original: māghāsitānte śubhatīrthatoyair yāsyāma tṛptiṃ tanayādidattaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: māgha asita ante śubha tīrtha toyaiḥ yāsyāma tṛptim tanaya ādi dattaiḥ
translated: at the end of Māgha, obtain satisfaction from the auspicious waters of holy places given by our descendants.

original: cittaṃ ca vittaṃ ca nṛṇāṃ viśuddhaṃ śastaś ca kālaḥ kathito vidhiś ca /
analyzed: cittam ca vittam ca nṛṇām viśuddham śastaḥ ca kālaḥ kathitaḥ vidhiḥ ca
translated: The mind and wealth of men are pure, and the proper time and method have been declared.

original: pātraṃ yathoktaṃ paramā ca bhaktir nṛṇāṃ prayacchaty abhivāñchitāni // / / //
analyzed: pātram yathā uktam paramā ca bhaktiḥ nṛṇām prayacchati abhivāñchitāni
translated: And the proper recipient, as described, and supreme devotion, grant men their desired objects.

original: pitṛgītāṃs tathaivātra ślokāṃs tāṃś ca śṛṇuṣva me /
analyzed: pitṛ gītān tathā eva atra ślokān tān ca śṛṇuṣva me
translated: And listen to these verses sung by the ancestors here, and by me.

original: śrutvā tathaiva bhavatā bhāvyaṃ tatrādṛtātmanā // / / //🔽api dhanyaḥ kule jāyād asmākaṃ matimān naraḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā tathā eva bhavatā bhāvyam tatra ādṛta ātmanā  api dhanyaḥ kule jāyāt asmākam matimān naraḥ
translated: Having heard them, you should act accordingly, with a disciplined mind.🔽Even a blessed and intelligent man will be born in our family,

original: akurvan vittaśāṭhyaṃ yaḥ piṇḍānno nirvapiṣyati // / / //
analyzed: akurvan vitta śāṭhyam yaḥ piṇḍān naḥ nirvapiṣyati
translated: who, without being stingy with wealth, will offer us funeral cakes.

original: ratnavastramahīyānamahābhogādikaṃ vasu /
analyzed: ratna vastra mahīyāna mahā bhoga ādikam vasu
translated: Wealth such as jewels, clothes, land, great enjoyments, and so on,

original: vibhave sati viprebhyo yo 'smān uddiśya dāsyati // / / //
analyzed: vibhave sati viprebhyaḥ yaḥ smān uddiśya dāsyati
translated: if one has the means, will give to the Brahmins, dedicating it to us.

original: annena vā yathāśaktyā kāle 'smin bhaktinamradhīḥ /
analyzed: annena vā yathāśaktyā kāle smin bhakti namra dhīḥ
translated: Or with food, according to one's ability, in this time, with a mind humble with devotion,

original: bhojayiṣyati viprāgryāṃs tanmātravibhavo naraḥ // / / //🔽asamartho 'nnadānasya dhānyam āmaṃ svaśaktitaḥ /
analyzed: bhojayiṣyati vipra agryān tad mātra vibhavaḥ naraḥ  asamarthaḥ nna dānasya dhānyam āmam sva śaktitaḥ
translated: A man who has only that much wealth will feed the best of Brahmins.🔽If unable to give food, he will give raw grain according to his capacity,

original: pradāsyati dvijāgrebhyaḥ svalpālpāṃ vāpi dakṣiṇām // / / //🔽tatrāpy asāmarthyayutaḥ karāgrāgrasthitāṃs tilān /
analyzed: pradāsyati dvija agrebhyaḥ su alpa alpām vā api dakṣiṇām  tatra api a sāmarthya yutaḥ kara agra agra sthitān tilān
translated: To the foremost of Brahmins, or even a small fee.🔽If still unable, O king, he will give a few sesame seeds held in the tip of his hand,

original: praṇamya dvijamukhyāya kasmaicid bhūpa dāsyati // / / //
analyzed: praṇamya dvijamukhyāya kasmaicid bhūpa dāsyati
