translated: To some chief Brahmin, after bowing down.

original: tilaiḥ saptāṣṭabhir vāpi samavetāñ jalāñjalīn /
analyzed: tilaiḥ sapta aṣṭabhiḥ vā api samavetām jala añjalīn
translated: With seven or eight sesame seeds collected, he will offer water libations,

original: bhaktinamraḥ samuddiśya bhuvy asmākaṃ pradāsyati // / / //
analyzed: bhakti namraḥ samuddiśya bhuvi asmākam pradāsyati
translated: With devotion and humility, dedicating them to us on the ground.

original: yataḥ kutaścit saṃprāpya gobhyo vāpi gavāhnikam /
analyzed: yatas kutaścid saṃprāpya gobhyaḥ vā api gavāhnikam
translated: Having obtained it from somewhere, or even the daily food for cows,

original: abhāve prīṇayann asmāñ śraddhāyuktaḥ pradāsyati // / / //
analyzed: abhāve prīṇayan asmām śraddhā yuktaḥ pradāsyati
translated: In the absence of other offerings, he will give it with faith, pleasing us.

original: sarvābhāve vanaṃ gatvā kakṣamūlapradarśakaḥ /
analyzed: sarva abhāve vanam gatvā kakṣa mūla pradarśakaḥ
translated: In the complete absence of offerings, he will go to a forest, show the roots of the bushes,

original: sūryādilokapālānām idam uccair paṭhiṣyati // / / //
analyzed: sūrya ādi lokapālānām idam uccais paṭhiṣyati
translated: And recite this loudly to the guardians of the world beginning with Surya:

original: na me 'sti vittaṃ na dhanaṃ ca nānyac chrāddhopayogyaṃ svapitṝn nato 'smi /
analyzed: na me sti vittam na dhanam ca na anyat śrāddha upayogyam sva pitṝn nataḥ smi
translated: I have no wealth, no money, and nothing else useful for the ancestral rites. I bow down to my ancestors.

original: tṛpyantu bhaktyā pitaro mayaitau kṛtau bhujau vartmani mārutasya // / / //
analyzed: tṛpyantu bhaktyā pitaraḥ mayā etau kṛtau bhujau vartmani mārutasya
translated: May the ancestors be satisfied with devotion. I have made these two arms on the path of the wind.

original: aurva uvāca /
analyzed: aurvaḥ uvāca
translated: Aurva said:

original: ity etat pitṛbhir gītaṃ bhāvābhāvaprayojanam /
analyzed: iti etat pitṛbhiḥ gītam bhāva abhāva prayojanam
translated: Thus have the ancestors sung this purpose of existence and non-existence.

original: yaḥ karoti kṛtaṃ tena śrāddhaṃ bhavati pārthiva // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ karoti kṛtam tena śrāddham bhavati pārthiva
translated: One who performs this, for him the ancestral rite is done, O king.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe tṛtīyāṃśe caturdaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe tṛtīya aṃśe caturdaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourteenth chapter in the third section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: aurva uvāca /
analyzed: aurvaḥ uvāca
translated: Aurva said:

original: brāhmaṇān bhojayec chrāddhe yadguṇāṃs tān nibodha me // / / //
analyzed: brāhmaṇān bhojayet śrāddhe yad guṇān tān nibodha me
translated: One should feed Brahmins in the ancestral rite. Know from me those who possess those qualities.

original: triṇāciketas trimadhus trisuparṇaḥ ṣaḍaṅgavit /🔽vedavic chrotriyo yogī tathā vai jyeṣṭhasāmagaḥ // / / //
analyzed: triṇāciketaḥ tri madhuḥ tri suparṇaḥ ṣaḍaṅga vid  veda vid śrotriyaḥ yogī tathā vai jyeṣṭhasāma gaḥ
translated: One who knows the three Naciketas, the three Madhus, the three Suparnas, and the six limbs,🔽One who knows the Vedas, is a Srotriya, is a yogi, and is also a singer of the Jyestha Sama Veda,

original: ṛtviksvasrīyadauhitrajāmātṛśvaśurās tathā /
analyzed: ṛtvij svasrīya dauhitra jāmātṛ śvaśurāḥ tathā
translated: The officiating priest, sister's son, daughter's son, son-in-law, and father-in-law,

original: mātulo 'tha taponiṣṭhaḥ pañcāgnyabhiratas tathā /
analyzed: tapaḥ niṣṭhaḥ pañcāgni abhirataḥ tathā
translated: The maternal uncle, one devoted to austerities, one engaged in the five fires,

original: śiṣyāḥ saṃbandhinaś caiva mātāpitṛrataś ca yaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śiṣyāḥ saṃbandhinaḥ ca eva mātā pitṛ rataḥ ca yaḥ
translated: The disciples, relatives, and one devoted to mother and father,

original: etān niyojayec chrāddhe pūrvoktān prathamaṃ nṛpa /
analyzed: etān niyojayet śrāddhe pūrva uktān prathamam nṛpa
translated: One should engage these mentioned earlier in the ancestral rite, O king,

original: brāhmaṇān pitṛpuṣṭyartham anukalpeṣv anantarān // / / //
analyzed: brāhmaṇān pitṛ puṣṭi artham anukalpeṣu anantarān
translated: The Brahmins for nourishing the ancestors, and the next ones in the alternative cases.

original: mitradhruk kunakhī klībaḥ śyāvadantas tathā dvijaḥ /
analyzed: mitra druh kunakhī klībaḥ śyāva dantaḥ tathā dvijaḥ
translated: One who injures a friend, one with defective nails, a eunuch, a twice-born with black teeth,

original: kanyādūṣayitā vahnivedojjhaḥ somavikrayī // / / //
translated: One who defiles a virgin, one who abandons the sacred fire and the Vedas, one who sells Soma,

original: abhiśastas tathā stenaḥ piśuno grāmayājakaḥ /
analyzed: abhiśastaḥ tathā stenaḥ piśunaḥ grāmayājakaḥ
translated: One who is accused, a thief, a slanderer, one who sacrifices for a village,

original: bhṛtakādhyāpakas tadvad bhṛtakādhyāpitaś ca yaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhṛtaka adhyāpakaḥ tadvat bhṛtaka adhyāpitaḥ ca yaḥ
translated: One who teaches for wages, one who is taught by one who teaches for wages,

original: parapūrvāpatiś caiva mātāpitros tathojjhakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: parapūrvā patiḥ ca eva mātā pitroḥ tathā ujjhakaḥ
translated: One who has a wife who was previously married to another, one who abandons his mother and father,

original: ins /
analyzed: ins
translated: Inserts:

original: tathā bhrātṛparityāgī dūṣakaḥ sarvanindakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tathā bhrātṛ parityāgī dūṣakaḥ sarva nindakaḥ
translated: One who abandons his brother, one who defiles, one who censures all,

original: vṛṣalīsūtipoṣṭā ca vṛṣalīpatir eva ca // / / //
analyzed: vṛṣalī sūti poṣṭā ca vṛṣalī patiḥ eva ca
translated: One who nourishes the child of a Śūdra woman, one who is the husband of a Śūdra woman,

original: tathā devalakaś caiva śrāddhe nārhati ketanam // / / //
analyzed: tathā devalakaḥ ca eva śrāddhe na arhati ketanam
translated: One who is a temple priest, is not fit to be invited to a Śrāddha.

original: prathame 'hni budhaḥ śastāñ śrotriyādīn nimantrayet /
analyzed: prathame hni budhaḥ śastām śrotriya ādīn nimantrayet
translated: On the first day, a wise man should invite the Śrotriyas and others who are praiseworthy.

original: kathayec ca tadaivaiṣāṃ niyogān pitṛdaivikān // / / //🔽tataḥ krodhavyavāyādīn āyāsaṃ ca dvijaiḥ saha /
analyzed: kathayet ca tadā eva eṣām niyogān pitṛ daivikān  tatas krodha vyavāya ādīn āyāsam ca dvijaiḥ saha
translated: And at that time itself, he should inform them of the duties related to the ancestors and the gods.

original: yajamāno na kurvīta doṣas tatra mahān ayam // / / //
analyzed: yajamānaḥ na kurvīta doṣaḥ tatra mahān ayam
translated: Then, the patron of the sacrifice should not show anger, engage in sexual intercourse, or feel tired along with the Brahmins. This is a great fault there.

original: śrāddhe niyukto bhuktvā vā bhojayitvā niyujya ca /
analyzed: śrāddhe niyuktaḥ bhuktvā vā bhojayitvā niyujya ca
translated: Having eaten or having fed, while engaged in a Śrāddha, one should not engage in sexual intercourse.

original: vyavāyī retaso garte majjayaty ātmanaḥ pitṝn // / / //
analyzed: vyavāyī retasaḥ garte majjayati ātmanaḥ pitṝn
translated: He causes his ancestors to sink into the pit of semen.

original: tasmāt prathamam atroktaṃ dvijāgryāṇāṃ nimantraṇam /🔽animantrya dvijān geham āgatān bhojayed yatīn // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt prathamam atra uktam dvijāgryāṇām nimantraṇam  a nimantrya dvijān geham āgatān bhojayet yatīn
translated: Therefore, the first thing mentioned here is the invitation of the foremost twice-borns.🔽Without inviting the twice-borns, one should feed the ascetics who come to the house.

original: pādaśaucādinā geham āgatān pūjayed dvijān // / / //
analyzed: pāda śauca ādinā geham āgatān pūjayet dvijān
translated: One should worship the twice-borns who come to the house with foot-washing etc.

original: pavitrapāṇir ācāntān āsaneṣūpaveśayet /
analyzed: pavitra pāṇiḥ ācāntān āsaneṣu upaveśayet
translated: With pure hands, one should make them sit on seats.

original: pitṝṇām ayujo yugmān devānām icchayā dvijān // / / //
analyzed: pitṝṇām ayujaḥ yugmān devānām icchayā dvijān
translated: The odd number of twice-borns for the ancestors and the even number for the gods, as one wishes.

original: devānām ekam ekaṃ vā pitṝṇāṃ ca niyojayet // / / //
analyzed: devānām ekam ekam vā pitṝṇām ca niyojayet
translated: One should engage one or two for the gods and one for the ancestors.

original: tathā mātāmahaśrāddhaṃ vaiśvadevasamanvitam /
analyzed: tathā mātāmaha śrāddham vaiśvadeva samanvitam
translated: Similarly, one should perform the Śrāddha for the maternal grandfather along with the Vaiśvadeva.

original: kurvīta bhaktisaṃpannas tantraṃ vā vaiśvadevikam // / / //🔽prāṅmukhān bhojayed viprān devānām ubhayātmakān /
analyzed: kurvīta bhakti saṃpannaḥ tantram vā vaiśvadevikam  prāc mukhān bhojayet viprān devānām ubhaya ātmakān
translated: Or one endowed with devotion should perform the ritual connected with the Vaiśvadeva.🔽One should feed the twice-borns facing east, who are of the nature of both the gods and ancestors.

original: pitṛpaitāmahānāṃ ca bhojayec cāpy udaṅmukhān // / / //
analyzed: pitṛpaitāmahānām ca bhojayet ca api udak mukhān
translated: And one should also feed those facing north for the ancestors and grandfathers.

original: pṛthak tayoḥ kecid āhuḥ śrāddhasya karaṇaṃ nṛpa /
analyzed: pṛthak tayoḥ kecid āhuḥ śrāddhasya karaṇam nṛpa
translated: Some say that the performance of Śrāddha should be separate for the two, O king.

original: ekatraikena pākena vadanty anye maharṣayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ekatra ekena pākena vadanti anye mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: Other great sages say that it should be done in one place with a single cooking.

original: viṣṭarārthaṃ kuśān dattvā saṃpūjyārghyaṃ vidhānataḥ /
analyzed: viṣṭara artham kuśān dattvā saṃpūjya arghyam vidhānataḥ
translated: Having offered Kuśa grass for the seat and worshipped with the prescribed procedure for Arghya,

original: kuryād āvāhanaṃ prājño devānāṃ tadanujñayā // / / //🔽yavāmbunā ca devānāṃ dadyād arghyaṃ vidhānataḥ /
analyzed: kuryāt āvāhanam prājñaḥ devānām tad anujñayā  yava ambunā ca devānām dadyāt arghyam vidhānataḥ
translated: The wise one should perform the invocation of the gods with their permission.🔽And with barley water, one should offer the arghya to the gods according to the rules.

original: sraggandhadhūpadīpāṃś ca dattvā tebhyo yathāvidhi // / / //
analyzed: sraj gandha dhūpa dīpān ca dattvā tebhyaḥ yathāvidhi
translated: Having offered garlands, fragrances, incense, and lamps to them according to the prescribed rituals,

original: pitṝṇām apasavyaṃ tat sarvam evopakalpayet /
analyzed: pitṝṇām apasavyam tat sarvam eva upakalpayet
translated: one should arrange everything in the reverse direction for the ancestors.

original: anujñāṃ ca tataḥ prāpya dattvā darbhān dvidhākṛtān // / / //
analyzed: anujñām ca tatas prāpya dattvā darbhān dvidhākṛtān
translated: And having obtained their permission, having offered the kuśa grass cut into two pieces,

original: mantrapūrvaṃ pitṝṇāṃ tu kuryād āvāhanaṃ budhaḥ /
analyzed: mantra pūrvam pitṝṇām tu kuryāt āvāhanam budhaḥ
translated: the wise one should perform the invocation of the ancestors with the mantras.

original: tilāmbunā cāpasavyaṃ dadyād arghyādikaṃ nṛpa // / / //
analyzed: tila ambunā ca apasavyam dadyāt arghya ādikam nṛpa
translated: And with sesamum water in the reverse direction, one should offer the arghya etc., O king.

original: kāle tatrātithiṃ prāptam annakāmaṃ nṛpādhvagam /
analyzed: kāle tatra atithim prāptam anna kāmam nṛpa adhvagam
translated: At that time, if a guest arrives who desires food, a traveler,

original: brāhmaṇair abhyanujñātaḥ kāmaṃ tam api bhojayet // / / //
analyzed: brāhmaṇaiḥ abhyanujñātaḥ kāmam tam api bhojayet
translated: one should, with the permission of the brahmins, feed him also as one wishes.

original: yogino vividhai rūpair narāṇām upakāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: yoginaḥ vividhaiḥ rūpaiḥ narāṇām upakāriṇaḥ
translated: The yogis, who help people in various forms,

original: bhramanti pṛthivīm etām avijñātasvarūpiṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhramanti pṛthivīm etām avijñāta svarūpiṇaḥ
translated: wander this earth, their true nature unknown.

original: tasmād abhyarcayet prāptaṃ śrāddhakāle 'tithiṃ budhaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt abhyarcayet prāptam śrāddha kāle tithim budhaḥ
translated: Therefore, a wise one should honor a guest who arrives at the time of the śrāddha.

original: śrāddhakriyāphalaṃ hanti narendrāpūjito 'tithiḥ // / / //
analyzed: śrāddha kriyā phalam hanti tithiḥ
translated: O king, an unhonored guest destroys the fruits of the śrāddha rites.

original: juhuyād vyañjanakṣāravarjam annaṃ tato 'nale /
analyzed: juhuyāt vyañjana kṣāra varjam annam tatas nale
translated: Then one should offer into the fire the food without condiments and salt,

original: anujñāto dvijais tais tu trikṛtvaḥ puruṣarṣabha // / / //
analyzed: anujñātaḥ dvijaiḥ taiḥ tu tri kṛtvas puruṣa ṛṣabha
translated: Then, with the permission of those Brahmins, he should offer into the fire the food excluding condiments and salt, O best of men.

original: agnaye kavyavāhāya svāhety ādau nṛpāhutiḥ /
analyzed: agnaye kavya vāhāya svāhā iti ādau nṛpa āhutiḥ
translated: The first oblation to the fire should be made with the mantra Svâhâ to Agni Kavyavâhana,

original: somāya vai pitṛmate dātavyā tadanantaram // / / //
analyzed: somāya vai pitṛmate dātavyā tad anantaram
translated: and then the second oblation should be made to Soma, the lord of the manes.

original: vaivasvatāya caivānyā tṛtīyā dīyate tataḥ /
analyzed: vaivasvatāya ca eva anyā tṛtīyā dīyate tatas
translated: The third oblation should then be made to Vaivasvata.

original: hutāvaśiṣṭam alpālpaṃ viprapātreṣu nirvapet // / / //🔽tato 'nnaṃ mṛṣṭam atyartham abhīṣṭam atisaṃskṛtam /
analyzed: huta avaśiṣṭam alpa alpam vipra pātreṣu nirvapet  tatas nnam mṛṣṭam atyartham abhīṣṭam atisaṃskṛtam
translated: The remaining small portion of the oblation should be poured into the vessels of the Brahmins.🔽Then, having offered the well-cooked, very delicious, and highly refined food,

original: dattvā juṣadhvam icchāto vācyam etad aniṣṭhuram // / / //
analyzed: dattvā juṣadhvam icchātaḥ vācyam etat aniṣṭhuram
translated: he should say Jushdhum (may you enjoy) according to his desire, in a non-harsh manner.

original: bhoktavyaṃ taiś ca taccittair maunibhiḥ sumukhaiḥ sukham /
analyzed: bhoktavyam taiḥ ca tad cittaiḥ maunibhiḥ su mukhaiḥ sukham
translated: They should eat it with a pure heart, silently, with a good face, and happily.

original: akrudhyatā cātvaratā deyaṃ tenāpi bhaktitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: a krudhyatā ca a tvaratā deyam tena api bhaktitaḥ
translated: And he should offer it with devotion, without anger and haste.

original: rakṣoghnamantrapaṭhanaṃ bhūmer āstaraṇaṃ tilaiḥ /
analyzed: rakṣaḥ ghna mantra paṭhanam bhūmeḥ āstaraṇam tilaiḥ
translated: Having recited the Rakshas-killing mantras and having covered the ground with sesamum seeds,

original: kṛtvā dhyeyāḥ svapitaras ta eva dvijasattamāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṛtvā dhyeyāḥ sva pitaraḥ te eva dvijasattamāḥ
translated: those best of Brahmins should be meditated upon as the very manes.

original: pitā pitāmahaś caiva tathaiva prapitāmahaḥ /
analyzed: pitā pitāmahaḥ ca eva tathā eva prapitāmahaḥ
translated: The father, the grandfather, and the great-grandfather,

original: mama tṛptiṃ prayāntv adya vipradeheṣu saṃsthitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: mama tṛptim prayāntu adya vipra deheṣu saṃsthitāḥ
translated: May they, residing in the bodies of Brahmins, be satisfied today.

original: pitā pitāmahaś caiva tathaiva prapitāmahaḥ /
analyzed: pitā pitāmahaḥ ca eva tathā eva prapitāmahaḥ
translated: The father, grandfather, and great-grandfather,

original: mama tṛptiṃ prayāntv agnihomāpyāyitamūrtayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mama tṛptim prayāntu agni homa āpyāyita mūrtayaḥ
translated: May their forms nourished by the Agnihotra offerings go to heaven.

original: pitā pitāmahaś caiva tathaiva prapitāmahaḥ /
analyzed: pitā pitāmahaḥ ca eva tathā eva prapitāmahaḥ
translated: The father, grandfather, and great-grandfather,

original: tṛptiṃ prayāntu piṇḍena mayā dattena bhūtale // / / //
analyzed: tṛptim prayāntu piṇḍena mayā dattena bhū tale
translated: May they be satisfied by the ball of rice offered by me on the ground.

original: pitā pitāmahaś caiva tathaiva prapitāmahaḥ /
analyzed: pitā pitāmahaḥ ca eva tathā eva prapitāmahaḥ
translated: The father, grandfather, and great-grandfather,

original: tṛptiṃ prayāntu me bhaktyā yan mayaitad ihāhṛtam // / / //
analyzed: tṛptim prayāntu me bhaktyā yat mayā etat iha āhṛtam
translated: May they be satisfied by my devotion to what has been brought here.

original: mātāmahas tṛptim upaitu tasya tathā pitā tasya pitā tathānyaḥ /
analyzed: mātāmahaḥ tṛptim upaitu tasya tathā pitā tasya pitā tathā anyaḥ
translated: May the maternal grandfather, his father, and another,

original: viśve ca devāḥ paramāṃ prayāntu tṛptiṃ praṇaśyantu ca yātudhānāḥ // / / //
analyzed: viśve ca devāḥ paramām prayāntu tṛptim praṇaśyantu ca yātudhānāḥ
translated: And may all the gods attain the highest satisfaction, and may the demons perish.

original: yajñeśvaro havyasamastakavya bhoktāvyayātmā harir īśvaro 'tra /
analyzed: bhoktā avyaya ātmā hariḥ
translated: The lord of sacrifice, the enjoyer of all oblations and havya offerings, the imperishable soul, Hari, the lord, is here.

original: tatsaṃnidhānād apayāntu sadyo rakṣāṃsy aśeṣāṇy asurāś ca sarve // / / //
analyzed: tad saṃnidhānāt apayāntu sadyas rakṣāṃsi aśeṣāṇi asurāḥ ca sarve
translated: By his presence, may all the remaining demons and Rakshasas depart immediately.

original: tṛpteṣu teṣu vikired annaṃ vipreṣu bhūtale /
analyzed: tṛpteṣu teṣu vikiret annam vipreṣu bhū tale
translated: When they are satisfied, one should scatter food on the ground among the Brahmins.

original: dadyāc cācamanārthāya tebhyo vāri sakṛt sakṛt // / / //🔽sutṛptais tair anujñātaḥ sarveṇānnena bhūtale /
analyzed: dadyāt ca ācamana arthāya tebhyaḥ vāri sakṛt sakṛt  su tṛptaiḥ taiḥ anujñātaḥ sarveṇa annena bhū tale
translated: And should offer water once to each of them for sipping.🔽When they have been satisfied, with their permission, he should place all the food on the ground.

original: satilena tataḥ piṇḍān samyag dadyāt samāhitaḥ // / / //🔽pitṛtīrthena salilaṃ dadyād atha jalāñjalim /
analyzed: sa tilena tatas piṇḍān samyak dadyāt samāhitaḥ  pitṛtīrthena salilam dadyāt atha jala añjalim
translated: Then, with concentrated mind, he should properly offer the piṇḍas along with sesamum seeds.🔽He should then offer water in the form of an añjali with the piṇḍapitṛ tithi,

original: mātāmahebhyas tenaiva piṇḍāṃs tīrthena nirvapet // / / //🔽ins /
analyzed: mātāmahebhyaḥ tena eva piṇḍān tīrthena nirvapet  ins
translated: and with the same tithi, he should offer the piṇḍas to the maternal grandfathers.

original: dakṣiṇāpravaṇaṃ caiva prayatnenopapādayet // / / / //
analyzed: dakṣiṇā pravaṇam ca eva prayatnena upapādayet
translated: He should carefully arrange the ground sloping towards the south.

original: avakāśeṣu cokṣeṣu jalatīreṣu caiva hi // / / / //
analyzed: avakāśeṣu cokṣeṣu jala tīreṣu ca eva hi
translated: In open and clean places, and on the banks of water,

original: dakṣiṇāgreṣu darbheṣu puṣpadhūpādipūjitam /
analyzed: dakṣiṇa agreṣu darbheṣu puṣpa dhūpa ādi pūjitam
translated: on kuśa grass with the tips pointing south, worshipped with flowers, incense, and so on,

original: svapitre prathamaṃ piṇḍaṃ dadyād ucchiṣṭasaṃnidhau // / / //
analyzed: sva pitre prathamam piṇḍam dadyāt ucchiṣṭa saṃnidhau
translated: he should first offer the piṇḍa to his father in the vicinity of the remnants of the food.

original: pitāmahāya caivānyaṃ tatpitre ca tathā param /
analyzed: pitāmahāya ca eva anyam tad pitre ca tathā param
translated: And another to his grandfather, and likewise another to his great-grandfather.

original: darbhamūle lepabhujaḥ prīṇayel lepagharṣaṇaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: darbha mūle   prīṇayet lepa gharṣaṇaiḥ
translated: At the root of the kuśa grass, he should gratify the manes who subsist on smearings with smearings and rubbings.

original: piṇḍair mātāmahāṃs tadvad gandhamālyādisaṃyutaiḥ /
analyzed: piṇḍaiḥ mātāmahān tadvat gandha mālya ādi saṃyutaiḥ
translated: In the same way, with scents, garlands, and so on, he should worship the maternal grandfathers with piṇḍas,

original: pūjayitvā dvijāgryāṇāṃ dadyād ācamanaṃ tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: pūjayitvā dvijāgryāṇām dadyāt ācamanam tatas
translated: and then offer ācamana to the best of the twice-born.

original: pitṛbhyaḥ prathamaṃ bhaktyā tanmanasko nareśvara /🔽susvadhety āśiṣā yuktāṃ dadyāc chaktyā ca dakṣiṇām // / / //
analyzed: pitṛbhyaḥ prathamam bhaktyā tad manaskaḥ nareśvara  su svadhā iti āśiṣā yuktām dadyāt śaktyā ca dakṣiṇām
translated: O lord of men, with a concentrated mind, he should first offer oblations to the ancestors with devotion.🔽And he should give Dakshina according to his ability, along with the benediction Svastha.

original: dattvā ca dakṣiṇāṃ tebhyo vācayed vaiśvadevikān /
analyzed: dattvā ca dakṣiṇām tebhyaḥ vācayet vaiśvadevikān
translated: Having given Dakshina to them, he should recite the mantras for the Vishvadeva offerings.

original: prīyantām iti ye viśvedevās tena itīrayet // / / //
analyzed: prīyantām iti ye viśvedevāḥ tena iti īrayet
translated: He should say May the Vishvedevas be pleased with that.

original: tatheti cokte tair vipraiḥ prārthanīyās tathāśiṣaḥ /
analyzed: tathā iti ca ukte taiḥ vipraiḥ prārthanīyāḥ tathā āśiṣaḥ
translated: When the Brahmins say So be it, he should ask for blessings from them.

original: paścād visarjayed devān pūrvaṃ paitrān mahāmate // / / //
analyzed: paścāt visarjayet devān pūrvam paitrān mahāmate
translated: O greatly wise one, he should first dismiss the ancestors and then the gods.

original: mātāmahānām apy evaṃ saha devaiḥ kramaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: mātāmahānām api evam saha devaiḥ kramaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The same procedure is remembered for the maternal grandfathers along with the gods.

original: bhojane ca svaśaktyā ca dāne tadvad visarjane // / / //
analyzed: bhojane ca sva śaktyā ca dāne tadvat visarjane
translated: In feeding, in giving according to one's ability, and in dismissal, it is the same.

original: āpādaśaucanāt pūrvaṃ kuryād devadvijanmasu /
analyzed: ā pāda śaucanāt pūrvam kuryāt deva dvijanmasu
translated: Before washing the feet, he should perform the dismissal of the gods and Brahmins.

original: visarjanaṃ tu prathamaṃ paitraṃ mātāmaheṣu vai // / / //🔽visarjayet prītivacaḥ sanmānābhyarcitāṃs tataḥ /
analyzed: visarjanam tu prathamam paitram mātāmaheṣu vai  visarjayet prīti vacaḥ sat māna abhyarcitān tatas
translated: But the dismissal of the ancestors should be done first among the maternal grandfathers.🔽Then he should dismiss them with pleasing words, after honoring them with respect and esteem.

original: nivartetābhyanujñāta ādvārāt tān anuvrajet // / / //
analyzed: nivarteta abhyanujñātaḥ ā dvārāt tān anuvrajet
translated: Then, with their permission, he should return and follow them up to the door.

original: tatas tu vaiśvadevākhyāṃ kuryān nityakriyāṃ budhaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tu vaiśvadeva ākhyām kuryāt nityakriyām budhaḥ
translated: Then the wise one should perform the daily ritual called Vishvadeva.

original: bhuñjīyāc ca samaṃ pūjyabhṛtyabandhubhir ātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhuñjīyāt ca samam pūjya bhṛtya bandhubhiḥ ātmanaḥ
translated: And should eat together with his honoured servants and relatives.

original: evaṃ śrāddhaṃ budhaḥ kuryāt paitraṃ mātāmahaṃ tathā /
analyzed: evam śrāddham budhaḥ kuryāt paitram mātāmaham tathā
translated: Thus a wise man should perform the ancestral offering and also the offering to the maternal grandfather.

original: śrāddhair āpyāyitā dadyuḥ sarvakāmān pitāmahāḥ // / / //
analyzed: śrāddhaiḥ āpyāyitāḥ dadyuḥ sarva kāmān pitāmahāḥ
translated: The grandfathers, being gratified by the offerings, would grant all desires.

original: trīṇi śrāddhe pavitrāṇi dauhitraḥ kutapas tilāḥ /
analyzed: trīṇi śrāddhe pavitrāṇi dauhitraḥ kutapaḥ tilāḥ
translated: Three things are pure in a śrāddha: the daughter's son, a worn-out piece of cloth, and sesamum seeds.

original: rajatasya tathā dānaṃ kathāsaṃdarśanādikam // / / //
analyzed: rajatasya tathā dānam kathā saṃdarśana ādikam
translated: So also the gift of silver, and conversation, showing, etc.

original: varjyāni kurvatā śrāddhaṃ kopo 'dhvagamanaṃ tvarā /
analyzed: varjyāni kurvatā śrāddham kopaḥ dhva gamanam tvarā
translated: These three should be avoided by one performing a śrāddha: anger, going on a journey, and haste.

original: bhoktur apy atra rājendra trayam etan na śasyate // / / //
analyzed: bhoktuḥ api atra rāja indra trayam etat na śasyate
translated: Even for the eater, O lord of kings, these three are not recommended.

original: viśvedevāḥ sapitaras tathā mātāmahā nṛpa /
analyzed: viśvedevāḥ sa pitaraḥ tathā mātāmahāḥ nṛpa
translated: The Viśvedevas, the manes, and also the maternal grandfathers,

original: kulaṃ cāpyāyyate puṃsāṃ sarvaṃ śrāddhaṃ prakurvatām // / / //
analyzed: kulam ca āpyāyyate puṃsām sarvam śrāddham prakurvatām
translated: and the family of those men who perform the śrāddha are gratified.

original: somādhāraḥ pitṛgaṇo yogādhāraś ca candramāḥ /
analyzed: soma ādhāraḥ pitṛ gaṇaḥ yoga ādhāraḥ ca candramāḥ
translated: The group of manes is based on the moon, and the moon is based on yoga.

original: śrāddhe yoginiyogas tu tasmād bhūpāla śasyate // / / //
analyzed: śrāddhe yogi niyogaḥ tu tasmāt bhūpāla śasyate
translated: Therefore, O king, the engagement of a yogī is recommended in a śrāddha.

original: sahasrasyāpi viprāṇāṃ yogī cet purataḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: sahasrasya api viprāṇām yogī ced puratas sthitaḥ
translated: Even if a thousand brāhmaṇas are present, if a yogī is in front,

original: sarvān bhoktṝṃs tārayati yajamānaṃ tathā nṛpa // / / //
analyzed: sarvān bhoktṝn tārayati yajamānam tathā nṛpa
translated: he liberates all the eaters, as well as the sacrificer, O king.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe tṛtīyāṃśe pañcadaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe tṛtīya aṃśe pañcadaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Fifteenth Chapter in the Third Section of the Vishnu Purana, dealing with the Creation.

original: aurva uvāca /
analyzed: aurvaḥ uvāca
translated: Aurva said:

original: haviṣyamatsyamāṃsais tu śaśasya śakunasya ca /
analyzed: haviṣya matsya māṃsaiḥ tu śaśasya śakunasya ca
translated: With havis, fish, meat, rabbit, chicken,

original: saukaracchāgalaiṇeyarauravair gavayena ca // / / //🔽aurabhragavyaiś ca tathā māsavṛddhyā pitāmahāḥ /
analyzed: saukara chāgala aiṇeya rauravaiḥ gavayena ca  aurabhra gavyaiḥ ca tathā māsa vṛddhyā pitāmahāḥ
translated: pork, goat, deer, buffalo,

original: prayānti tṛptiṃ māṃsais tu nityaṃ vārdhrīṇasām iṣaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: prayānti tṛptim māṃsaiḥ tu nityam vārdhrīṇasām iṣaiḥ
translated: and sheep meat, the grandfathers are always satisfied with the meat of old goats and other animals, increasing month by month.

original: khaḍgamāṃsam atīvātra kālaśākaṃ tathā madhu /
analyzed: khaḍga māṃsam atīva atra kālaśākam tathā madhu
translated: The meat of rhinoceros, black antelope, and boar, as well as honey,

original: śastāni karmaṇy atyantatṛptidāni nareśvara // / / //
analyzed: śastāni karmaṇi atyanta tṛpti dāni nareśvara
translated: are recommended for rituals, O lord of men, as they give complete satisfaction.

original: gayām upetya yaḥ śrāddhaṃ karoti pṛthivīpate /
analyzed: gayām upetya yaḥ śrāddham karoti pṛthivīpate
translated: O lord of the earth, one who performs a Shraddha ceremony after going to Gaya,

original: saphalaṃ tasya taj janma jāyate pitṛtuṣṭidam // / / //
analyzed: saphalam tasya tat janma jāyate pitṛ tuṣṭi dam
translated: his birth becomes fruitful, giving satisfaction to the ancestors.

original: prasātikāḥ sanīvārāḥ śyāmākā dvividhās tathā /
analyzed: prasātikāḥ sa nīvārāḥ śyāmākāḥ dvividhāḥ tathā
translated: The Prasatikas, Nivaras, Shyamakas, and the two types of wild herbs,

original: vanyauṣadhīpradhānās tu śrāddhārhāḥ puruṣarṣabha // / / //🔽yavāḥ priyaṃgavo mudgā godhūmā vrīhayas tilāḥ /
analyzed: vanya oṣadhī pradhānāḥ tu śrāddha arhāḥ puruṣa ṛṣabha  yavāḥ priyaṃgavaḥ mudgāḥ godhūmāḥ vrīhayaḥ tilāḥ
translated: are considered suitable for Shraddha ceremonies, O best of men.🔽Barley, Priyangu, green gram, wheat, rice, sesame,

original: niṣpāvāḥ kovidārāś ca sarṣapāś cātra śobhanāḥ // / / //
analyzed: niṣpāvāḥ kovidārāḥ ca sarṣapāḥ ca atra śobhanāḥ
translated: Nipava, Kovidara, and mustard are auspicious here.

original: akṛtāgrayaṇaṃ yac ca dhānyajātaṃ nareśvara /
analyzed: a kṛta āgrayaṇam yat ca dhānya jātam nareśvara
translated: O lord of men, whatever grains are not used for the first offering,

original: rājamāṣān aṇūṃś caiva masūrāṃś ca vivarjayet // / / //🔽alābuṃ gṛñjanaṃ caiva palāṇḍuṃ piṇḍamūlakam /
analyzed: rājamāṣān aṇūn ca eva masūrān ca vivarjayet  alābum gṛñjanam ca eva palāṇḍum piṇḍamūlakam
translated: He should avoid rajma beans, small beans, and masura lentils.🔽Gourds, leeks, onions, radish,🔽Gandharaka, eggplants, and saline substances,

original: gandhārakaṃ karambhāṇi lavaṇāny auṣarāṇi ca // / / //🔽āraktāś caiva niryāsāḥ pratyakṣalavaṇāni ca /
analyzed: gandhārakam karambhāṇi lavaṇāni auṣarāṇi ca  āraktāḥ ca eva niryāsāḥ pratyakṣa lavaṇāni ca
translated: Red exudations, and salt obtained by evaporation,

original: varjyāny etāni vai śrāddhe yac ca vācā na śasyate // / / //
analyzed: varjyāni etāni vai śrāddhe yat ca vācā na śasyate
translated: These are to be avoided in a Shraddha ceremony, as well as what is not praised by speech.

original: naktāhṛtam anutsṛṣṭaṃ tṛpyate na ca yatra gauḥ /
analyzed: nakta āhṛtam an utsṛṣṭam tṛpyate na ca yatra gauḥ
translated: Water brought at night, not discarded, where a cow is not satisfied,

original: durgandhi phenilaṃ cāmbu śrāddhayogyaṃ na pārthiva // / / //
analyzed: durgandhi phenilam ca ambu śrāddha yogyam na pārthiva
translated: Smelly, frothy water is not suitable for a Shraddha ceremony, O king.

original: kṣīram ekaśaphānāṃ yad auṣṭram āvikam eva ca /
analyzed: kṣīram ekaśaphānām yat auṣṭram āvikam eva ca
translated: Milk of one-hoofed animals, camel's milk, and sheep's milk,

original: mārgaṃ ca māhiṣaṃ caiva varjayec chrāddhakarmaṇi // / / //
analyzed: mārgam ca māhiṣam ca eva varjayet śrāddha karmaṇi
translated: And goat's milk should be avoided in a Shraddha ceremony.

original: ṣaṇḍāpaviddhacaṇḍālapāṣaṇḍyunmattarogibhiḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṇḍa apaviddha caṇḍāla pāṣaṇḍi unmatta rogibhiḥ
translated: By eunuchs, outcasts, Chandalas, heretics, madmen, and the sick,

original: kṛkavākuśvanagnaiś ca vānaragrāmasūkaraiḥ // / / //
analyzed: ca vānara grāma sūkaraiḥ
translated: By crows, dogs, naked ascetics, monkeys, village pigs,

original: udakyāsūtikāśaucimṛtahāraiś ca vīkṣite /
analyzed: udakyā sūtikā āśauci mṛtahāraiḥ ca vīkṣite
translated: By menstruating women, women in childbirth, impure persons, and those carrying corpses,

original: śrāddhe surā na pitaro bhuñjate puruṣarṣabha // / / //
analyzed: śrāddhe surāḥ na pitaraḥ bhuñjate puruṣa ṛṣabha
translated: The ancestors do not partake of the offerings in a Shraddha ceremony, O best of men.

original: tasmāt pariśrite kuryāc śrāddhaṃ śraddhāsamanvitaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt pariśrite kuryāt śrāddham śraddhā samanvitaḥ
translated: Therefore, with faith, one should perform a Shraddha ceremony in a secluded place,

original: urvyāṃ ca tilavikṣepād yātudhānān nivārayet // / / //🔽na pūti naivopapannaṃ keśakīṭādibhir nṛpa /
analyzed: urvyām ca tila vikṣepāt yātudhānān nivārayet  na pūti na eva upapannam keśa kīṭa ādibhiḥ nṛpa
translated: And by scattering sesame seeds on the ground, one should ward off the demons.🔽Nor should one offer food that is spoiled, O king, by hair, insects, etc.,

original: na caivābhiṣavair miśram annaṃ paryuṣitaṃ tathā // / / //
analyzed: na ca eva abhiṣavaiḥ miśram annam paryuṣitam tathā
translated: Nor food mixed with remnants of a meal, nor stale food.

original: śraddhāsamanvitair dattaṃ pitṛbhyo nāmagotrataḥ /
analyzed: śraddhā samanvitaiḥ dattam pitṛbhyaḥ nāma gotrataḥ
translated: When given with faith to the ancestors, mentioning their names and gotras,

original: yadāhārās tu te jātās tadāhāratvam eti tat // / / //
analyzed: yad āhārāḥ tu te jātāḥ tad āhāra tvam eti tat
translated: It becomes food for them, whatever food they were accustomed to.

original: śrūyante cāpi pitṛbhir gītā gāthā mahīpate /
analyzed: śrūyante ca api pitṛbhiḥ gītāḥ gāthāḥ mahīpate
translated: And, O king, these verses are heard sung by the ancestors,

original: ikṣvākor manuputrasya kalāpopavane purā // / / //
analyzed: ikṣvākoḥ manu putrasya kalāpa upavane purā
translated: In the past, in the pleasure grove of Kalāpa belonging to Ikṣvāku, the son of Manu.

original: api nas te bhaviṣyanti kule sanmārgaśīlinaḥ /
analyzed: api naḥ te bhaviṣyanti kule sat mārga śīlinaḥ
translated: Will there be in our family those who follow the right path,

original: gayām upetya ye piṇḍān dāsyanty asmākam ādarāt // / / //
analyzed: gayām upetya ye piṇḍān dāsyanti asmākam ādarāt
translated: Who, having gone to Gayā, will respectfully offer us balls of rice?

original: api naḥ sa kule jāyād yo no dadyāt trayodaśīm /
analyzed: api naḥ sa kule jāyāt yaḥ naḥ dadyāt trayodaśīm
translated: Will there be born to us one who will offer us on the thirteenth day,

original: pāyasaṃ madhusarpibhyāṃ varṣāsu ca maghāsu ca // / / //
analyzed: pāyasam madhu sarpibhyām varṣāsu ca maghāsu ca
translated: Rice boiled in milk and ghee, during the rainy season and under the constellation Magha?

original: gaurīṃ vāpy udvahet kanyāṃ nīlaṃ vā vṛṣam utsṛjet /
analyzed: gaurīm vā api udvahet kanyām nīlam vā vṛṣam utsṛjet
translated: Or who will marry a fair maiden, or set free a blue bull,

original: yajeta vāśvamedhena vidhivad dakṣiṇāvatā // / / //
analyzed: yajeta vā aśvamedhena vidhivat dakṣiṇāvatā
translated: Or perform a horse sacrifice according to the rules, with gifts?

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe tṛtīyāṃśe ṣoḍaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe tṛtīya aṃśe ṣoḍaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixteenth chapter in the third section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity āha bhagavān aurvaḥ sagarāya mahātmane /
analyzed: iti āha bhagavān aurvaḥ sagarāya mahātmane
translated: Thus spoke the revered Aurva to the great Sagara,

original: sadācārān purā samyaṅ maitreya paripṛcchate // / / //🔽ins /
analyzed: sat ācārān purā samyak maitreya paripṛcchate  ins
translated: when he was properly asked by him about the conduct of the virtuous in the past.

original: evaṃ navabhir adhyāyais trayīdharmaḥ prapañcitaḥ // / / / //
analyzed: evam navabhiḥ adhyāyaiḥ trayī dharmaḥ prapañcitaḥ
translated: Thus the duties of the three Vedas have been expounded in nine chapters.

original: tatparityāganindārtham adhyāyadvayam uttaram // / / / //
analyzed: tad parityāga nindā artham adhyāya dvayam uttaram
translated: The next two chapters are for the purpose of censuring the abandonment of that.

original: mayāpy etad aśeṣeṇa kathitaṃ bhavato dvija /
analyzed: mayā api etat aśeṣeṇa kathitam bhavataḥ dvija
translated: All this has been told by me to you, O twice-born.

original: samullaṅghya sadācāraṃ kaścin nāpnoti śobhanam // / / //
analyzed: samullaṅghya sat ācāram kaścid nā āpnoti śobhanam
translated: Without following good conduct, no one attains anything good.

original: maitreya uvāca /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca
translated: Maitreya said:

original: ṣaṇḍāpaviddhapramukhā viditā bhagavan mayā /
analyzed: ṣaṇḍa apaviddha pramukhāḥ viditāḥ bhagavat mayā
translated: O Lord, I know those beginning with eunuchs and outcasts,

original: udakyādyāś ca ye sarve nagnam icchāmi veditum // / / //
analyzed: udakyā ādyāḥ ca ye sarve nagnam icchāmi veditum
translated: and all those beginning with menstruating women. I wish to know about the naked.

original: ko nagnaḥ kiṃsamācāro nagnasaṃjñāṃ naro labhet /
analyzed: kaḥ nagnaḥ kiṃsamācāraḥ nagna saṃjñām naraḥ labhet
translated: Who is naked? What is his conduct? By what does a man get the designation of naked?

original: nagnasvarūpam icchāmi yathāvat gaditaṃ tvayā // / / //
analyzed: nagna sva rūpam icchāmi yathāvat gaditam tvayā
translated: I wish to know the true nature of the naked, as you have said.

original: ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: veṅk ins
translated: Ed. Veṅkaṭaśāstrī inserts:

original: śrotuṃ dharmabhṛtāṃ śreṣṭha na hy asty aviditaṃ tava // / / //
analyzed: śrotum dharma bhṛtām śreṣṭha na hi asti aviditam tava
translated: O best among the upholders of dharma, I wish to hear, for there is nothing unknown to you.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parāśara said:

original: ṛgyajuḥsāmasaṃjñeyaṃ trayī varṇāvṛtir dvija /
analyzed: ṛk yajuḥ sāma saṃjñā iyam trayī varṇa āvṛtiḥ dvija
translated: O twice-born, this Triad known as Ṛg, Yajus and Sāman is the refuge of the Varnas,

original: etām ujjhati yo mohāt sa nagnaḥ pātakī smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: etām ujjhati yaḥ mohāt sa nagnaḥ pātakī smṛtaḥ
translated: He who, through folly, abandons it, is considered naked and sinful.

original: trayī samastavarṇānāṃ dvija saṃvaraṇaṃ yataḥ /
analyzed: trayī samasta varṇānām dvija saṃvaraṇam yatas
translated: Since the three Vedas are the covering for all the varnas, O twice-born,

original: nagno bhavaty ujjhitāyām atas tasyām asaṃśayam // / / //🔽idaṃ ca śrūyatām anyad bhīṣmāya sumahātmane /
analyzed: nagnaḥ bhavati ujjhitāyām atas tasyām asaṃśayam  idam ca śrūyatām anyat bhīṣmāya su mahātmane
translated: one becomes naked upon abandoning them, there is no doubt about it.

original: kathayām āsa dharmajño vasiṣṭho 'smatpitāmahaḥ // / / //🔽mayāpi tasya gadataḥ śrutam etan mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: kathayām āsa dharma jñaḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ smat pitāmahaḥ  mayā api tasya gadataḥ śrutam etat mahātmanaḥ
translated: And listen to this other thing, which was told by our grandfather, the righteous Vasishtha, to the very great-souled Bhishma.

original: nagnasaṃbandhi maitreya yat pṛṣṭo 'ham iha tvayā // / / //
analyzed: nagna saṃbandhi maitreya yat pṛṣṭaḥ ham iha tvayā
translated: And this was heard by me also, when that great soul was speaking, O Maitreya, about which you have asked me here, regarding the naked.

original: devāsuram abhūd yuddhaṃ divyam abdaṃ purā dvija /
analyzed: devāsuram abhūt yuddham divyam abdam purā dvija
translated: O twice-born, in ancient times there was a war between the gods and demons for a divine year.

original: tasmin parājitā devā daityair hrādapurogamaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmin parājitāḥ devāḥ daityaiḥ hrāda purogamaiḥ
translated: In that (war), the gods were defeated by the demons led by Hrada.

original: kṣīrodasyottaraṃ kūlaṃ gatvātapyanta vai tapaḥ /
analyzed: kṣīrodasya uttaram kūlam gatvā atapyanta vai tapaḥ
translated: Having gone to the northern shore of the Milky Ocean, they tormented themselves with austerities.

original: viṣṇor ārādhanārthāya jaguś cemaṃ stavaṃ tadā // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ ārādhana arthāya jaguḥ ca imam stavam tadā
translated: And they sang this hymn for the propitiation of Vishnu.

original: devā ūcuḥ /🔽ārādhanāya lokānāṃ viṣṇor īśasya yāṃ giram /
analyzed: devāḥ ūcuḥ  ārādhanāya lokānām viṣṇoḥ īśasya yām giram
translated: The gods said:🔽For the propitiation of Vishnu, the Lord of the worlds, we shall recite this hymn.

original: vakṣyāmo bhagavān ādyas tayā viṣṇuḥ prasīdatu // / / //
analyzed: vakṣyāmaḥ bhagavān ādyaḥ tayā viṣṇuḥ prasīdatu
translated: May the primordial Lord Vishnu be pleased with it.

original: yato bhūtāny aśeṣāṇi prasūtāni mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: yatas bhūtāni aśeṣāṇi prasūtāni mahātmanaḥ
translated: From whom have originated all beings in their entirety,

original: yasmiṃś ca layam eṣyanti kas taṃ saṃstotum īśvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: yasmin ca layam eṣyanti kaḥ tam saṃstotum īśvaraḥ
translated: and in whom they will merge - who can praise that Lord?

original: tathāpy arātividhvaṃsadhvastavīryā bhavārthinaḥ /
analyzed: tathā api arāti vidhvaṃsa dhvasta vīryāḥ bhava arthinaḥ
translated: Nevertheless, we, whose energy has been destroyed by the annihilation of our enemies, seeking existence,

original: tvāṃ stoṣyāmas tavoktīnāṃ yāthārthyaṃ naiva gocare // / / //
analyzed: tvām stoṣyāmaḥ tava uktīnām yāthārthyam nā eva gocare
translated: will praise you, for we are not capable of understanding the truth of your statements.

original: tvam urvī salilaṃ vahnir vāyur ākāśam eva ca /🔽samastam antaḥkaraṇaṃ pradhānaṃ tatparaḥ pumān // / / //
analyzed: tvam urvī salilam vahniḥ vāyuḥ ākāśam eva ca  samastam antaḥkaraṇam pradhānam tad paraḥ pumān
translated: You are the earth, water, fire, air, and space,🔽the totality of the internal organs, the primordial matter, and the supreme being.

original: ekaṃ tavaitad bhūtātman mūrtāmūrtamayaṃ vapuḥ /
analyzed: ekam tava etat bhūta ātman mūrta amūrta mayam vapuḥ
translated: This one body of yours, O soul of beings, consists of both the manifest and the unmanifest,

original: ābrahmastambaparyantaṃ sthānakālavibhedavat // / / //
analyzed: ā brahmastamba paryantam sthāna kāla vibhedavat
translated: extending from Brahman down to a blade of grass, with distinctions of place and time.

original: tatreśa tava yat pūrvaṃ tvannābhikamalodbhavam /
analyzed: tatra īśa tava yat pūrvam tvad nābhi kamala udbhavam
translated: There, O Lord, your form that arose from the lotus of your navel

original: rūpaṃ sargopakārāya tasmai brahmātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: rūpam sarga upakārāya tasmai brahma ātmane namaḥ
translated: for the purpose of creation, to that Brahman-form of yours, I offer salutations.

original: śakrārkarudravasvaśvimarutsomādibhedavat /
analyzed: śakra arka rudra vasu aśvi marut soma ādi bhedavat
translated: We, who are distinguished as Indra, Arka (Sun), Rudra, Vāsudeva, Aśvins, Maruts, Soma, and others,

original: vayam evaṃ svarūpaṃ te tasmai devātmane namaḥ // / / //🔽dambhaprāyam asaṃbodhi titikṣādamavarjitam /
analyzed: vayam evam sva rūpam te tasmai deva ātmane namaḥ  dambha prāyam a saṃbodhi titikṣā dama varjitam
translated: to that form of yours, to that divine self of yours, I offer salutations.🔽That form of yours, O Govinda, which is full of arrogance, devoid of enlightenment, and bereft of forbearance and self-control,

original: yad rūpaṃ tava govinda tasmai daityātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yat rūpam tava govinda tasmai daitya ātmane namaḥ
translated: to that form of yours, which is the self of the demons, I offer salutations.

original: nātijñānavahā yasmin nāḍyaḥ stimitatejasi /
analyzed: na ati jñāna vahāḥ yasmin nāḍyaḥ stimita tejasi
translated: To you, O Yaksha-soul, who are devoid of the channels that carry knowledge, and whose lustre is motionless,

original: śabdādilobhi yat tasmai tubhyaṃ yakṣātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śabda ādi lobhi yat tasmai tubhyam yakṣa ātmane namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, who are the cause of the attachment to sound and other objects.

original: krauryamāyāmayaṃ ghoraṃ yac ca rūpaṃ tavāsitam /
analyzed: kraurya māyā mayam ghoram yat ca rūpam tava asitam
translated: And to that dark form of yours, which is terrible and full of cruelty and illusion,

original: niśācarātmane tasmai namas te puruṣottama // / / //
analyzed: niśācara ātmane tasmai namaḥ te puruṣottama
translated: Salutations to you, O best of beings, who are the soul of the wanderers of the night.

original: svargasthadharmisaddharmaphalopakaraṇaṃ tava /
analyzed: svarga stha dharmi sat dharma phala upakaraṇam tava
translated: To you, who are the means of enjoying the fruits of the true dharma of the virtuous in heaven,

original: dharmākhyaṃ ca tathā rūpaṃ namas tasmai janārdana // / / //
analyzed: dharma ākhyam ca tathā rūpam namaḥ tasmai janārdana
translated: And to that form of yours called Dharma, salutations to you, O Janardana.

original: harṣaprāyam asaṃsargi gatimad gamanādiṣu /
analyzed: harṣa prāyam a saṃsargi gatimat gamana ādiṣu
translated: To that form of yours which is full of joy, which is unconnected, which is endowed with motion in moving,

original: siddhātmaṃs tava yad rūpaṃ tasmai siddhātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: siddha ātman tava yat rūpam tasmai siddha ātmane namaḥ
translated: Salutations to that form of yours which is the soul of the Siddhas.

original: atitikṣādhanaṃ krūram upabhogasahaṃ hare /
analyzed: a titikṣā dhanam krūram upabhoga saham hare
translated: To you, O Hari, who are the cruel one, who are the means of great patience, who can endure enjoyment,

original: dvijihvaṃ tava yad rūpaṃ tasmai sarpātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dvi jihvam tava yat rūpam tasmai sarpa ātmane namaḥ
translated: Salutations to that form of yours which is the soul of the serpents.

original: avabodhi ca yac chāntam adoṣam apakalmaṣam /
analyzed: avabodhi ca yat śāntam adoṣam apakalmaṣam
translated: And to that which is understood to be tranquil, faultless, and free from sin,

original: ṛṣirūpātmane tasmai viṣṇo rūpāya te namaḥ // / / //🔽bhakṣayaty atha kalpānte bhūtāni yad avāritam /
analyzed: ṛṣi rūpa ātmane tasmai viṣṇoḥ rūpāya te namaḥ  bhakṣayati atha kalpa ante bhūtāni yat a vāritam
translated: Salutations to that form of yours, O Vishnu, which is the soul of the Rishis.🔽And to that form of yours, O lotus-eyed one, which, at the end of the Kalpa, devours the beings without obstruction,

original: tvadrūpaṃ puṇḍarīkākṣa tasmai kālātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tvad rūpam puṇḍarīkākṣa tasmai kāla ātmane namaḥ
translated: Salutations to that form of yours which is the soul of Time.

original: saṃbhakṣya sarvabhūtāni devādīny aviśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: saṃbhakṣya sarva bhūtāni deva ādīni aviśeṣatas
translated: To that form of Rudra which, at the end, having devoured all beings, including the gods, without distinction,

original: nṛtyaty ante ca yad rūpaṃ tasmai rudrātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: nṛtyati ante ca yat rūpam tasmai rudra ātmane namaḥ
translated: dances, salutations to that form of Rudra.

original: pravṛttyā rajaso yac ca karmaṇāṃ kāraṇātmakam /
analyzed: pravṛttyā rajasaḥ yat ca karmaṇām kāraṇa ātmakam
translated: And to that form of yours which is the cause of actions through the activity of rajas,

original: janārdana namas tasmai tvadrūpāya narātmane // / / //
analyzed: janārdana namaḥ tasmai tvad rūpāya nara ātmane
translated: Salutations to that form of yours which is Janardana, the soul of men.

original: aṣṭāviṃśadvadhopetaṃ yad rūpaṃ tāmasaṃ tava /
analyzed: aṣṭāviṃśat vadha upetam yat rūpam tāmasam tava
translated: To that form of yours which is tamas, endowed with twenty-eight kinds of bondage,

original: unmārgagāmi sarvātmaṃs tasmai paśvātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: unmārga gāmi sarva ātman tasmai paśu ātmane namaḥ
translated: which goes on wrong paths, the soul of all, salutations to that form of yours which is the soul of animals.

original: yajñāṅgabhūtaṃ yad rūpaṃ jagataḥ siddhisādhanam /
analyzed: yajña aṅga bhūtam yat rūpam jagataḥ siddhi sādhanam
translated: To that form of yours which is an accessory of sacrifice, the means of accomplishing the world,

original: vṛkṣādibhedair yad bhedi tasmai mukhyātmane namaḥ // / / //🔽tiryaṅmanuṣyadevādivyomaśabdādikaṃ ca yat /
analyzed: vṛkṣa ādi bhedaiḥ yat bhedi tasmai mukhya ātmane namaḥ  tiryak manuṣya deva ādi vyoma śabda ādikam ca yat
translated: which is divided into trees and other categories, salutations to that form of yours which is the principal soul.

original: rūpaṃ tavādeḥ sarvasya tasmai sarvātmane namaḥ // / / //🔽pradhānabuddhyādimayād aśeṣād yad anyad asmāt paramaṃ parātman /
analyzed: rūpam tava ādeḥ sarvasya tasmai sarvātmane namaḥ  pradhāna buddhi ādi mayāt aśeṣāt yat anyat asmāt paramam parātman
translated: And to that form of yours which is the soul of all, beginning with the sky, sound, etc., of animals, men, gods, etc.,🔽salutations to that form of yours which is not equal to anything else, the first form of yours, which is different from the totality of prakriti, intellect, etc., the supreme self.

original: rūpaṃ tavādyaṃ na yad anyatulyaṃ tasmai namaḥ kāraṇakāraṇāya // / / //🔽śuklādidīrghādighanādihīnam agocare yac ca viśeṣaṇānām /
analyzed: rūpam tava ādyam na yat anya tulyam tasmai namaḥ kāraṇa kāraṇāya 🔽śukla ādi dīrgha ādi ghana ādi hīnam agocare yat ca viśeṣaṇānām
translated: Salutations to that cause of causes.🔽To that form of yours which is beyond the range of adjectives such as white, long, and gross,

original: śuddhātiśuddhaṃ paramarṣidṛśyaṃ rūpāya tasmai bhagavan natāḥ smaḥ // / / //🔽yan naḥ śarīreṣu yad anyadeheṣv aśeṣavastuṣv ajam avyayaṃ yat /
analyzed: śuddha ati śuddham parama ṛṣi dṛśyam rūpāya tasmai bhagavat natāḥ smaḥ  yat naḥ śarīreṣu yat anya deheṣu aśeṣa vastuṣu ajam avyayam yat
translated: We bow to that Supreme Brahman, the cause of the universe, the pure, the extremely pure, visible to the great sages.🔽We bow to that Supreme Brahman, who is unborn and imperishable in our bodies, in the bodies of others, and in all things,

original: yasmāc ca nānyad vyatiriktam asti brahmasvarūpāya natāḥ sma tasmai // / / //
analyzed: yasmāt ca nā anyat vyatiriktam asti brahma svarūpāya natāḥ sma tasmai
translated: and from whom nothing else is separate.

original: sakalam idam ajasya yasya rūpaṃ paramapadātmavataḥ sanātanasya /
analyzed: sakalam idam ajasya yasya rūpam parama pada ātmavataḥ sanātanasya
translated: We bow to that Supreme Brahman, whose form is this entire universe, who is the eternal Self of the highest state,

original: tam anidhanam aśeṣabījabhūtaṃ prabhum amalaṃ praṇatāḥ sma vāsudevam // / / //
analyzed: tam a nidhanam aśeṣa bīja bhūtam prabhum amalam praṇatāḥ sma vāsudevam
translated: We bow to that imperishable Lord, the source of all, the pure Vāsudeva.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parāśara said:

original: stotrasyāsyāvasāne tu dadṛśuḥ parameśvaram /
analyzed: stotrasya asya avasāne tu dadṛśuḥ parameśvaram
translated: At the end of this hymn, the gods saw the Supreme Lord,

original: śaṅkhacakragadāpāṇiṃ garuḍasthaṃ surā harim // / / //
analyzed: śaṅkha cakra gadā pāṇim garuḍa stham surāḥ harim
translated: Hari, seated on Garuḍa, with a conch, discus, and mace in his hands.

original: tam ūcuḥ sakalā devāḥ praṇipātapuraḥsaram /🔽prasīda deva daityebhyas trāhīti śaraṇārthinaḥ // / / //🔽trailokyaṃ yajñabhāgāś ca daityair hrādapurogamaiḥ /
analyzed: tam ūcuḥ sakalāḥ devāḥ praṇipāta puraḥsaram  prasīda deva daityebhyaḥ trāhi iti śaraṇa arthinaḥ  trailokyam yajña bhāgāḥ ca daityaiḥ hrāda purogamaiḥ
translated: They all said, bowing down:🔽Be gracious, O Lord, save us from the demons, we who seek refuge in you.

original: hṛtaṃ no brahmaṇo 'py ājñām ullaṅghya parameśvara // / / //
analyzed: hṛtam naḥ ājñām ullaṅghya parameśvara
translated: The three worlds and our shares in the sacrifices have been taken away by the demons led by Hrāda, O Supreme Lord, disregarding even Brahmā's command.

original: yady apy aśeṣabhūtasya vayaṃ te ca tavāṃśakāḥ /
analyzed: yadi api aśeṣa bhūtasya vayam te ca tava aṃśakāḥ
translated: Although we and you are all parts of you,

original: tathāpy avidyābhedena bhinnaṃ paśyāmahe jagat // / / //
analyzed: tathā api avidyā bhedena bhinnam paśyāmahe jagat
translated: yet we see the world as different due to the difference of ignorance.

original: svavarṇadharmābhiratā vedamārgānusāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: sva varṇa dharma abhiratāḥ veda mārga anusāriṇaḥ
translated: Devoted to the duties of their own class, following the path of the Vedas,

original: na śakyās te 'rayo hantum asmābhis tapasānvitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: na śakyāḥ te rayaḥ hantum asmābhiḥ tapasā anvitāḥ
translated: those ascetics cannot be killed by us.

original: tam upāyam aśeṣātmann asmākaṃ dātum arhasi /
analyzed: tam upāyam aśeṣa ātman asmākam dātum arhasi
translated: O all-souled one, it is proper for you to give us that means,

original: yena tān asurān hantuṃ bhavema bhagavan kṣamāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yena tān asurān hantum bhavema bhagavan kṣamāḥ
translated: by which, O Lord, we may be able to kill those demons.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity ukto bhagavāṃs tebhyo māyāmohaṃ śarīrataḥ /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ bhagavān tebhyaḥ māyā moham śarīrataḥ
translated: Thus addressed, the Lord, having created Maya-moha from his body,

original: samutpādya dadau viṣṇuḥ prāha cedaṃ surottamān // / / //
analyzed: samutpādya dadau viṣṇuḥ prāha ca idam sura uttamān
translated: gave it to Vishnu and spoke to the best of the gods:

original: māyāmoho 'yam akhilān daityāṃs tān mohayiṣyati /
analyzed: māyā mohaḥ yam akhilān daityān tān mohayiṣyati
translated: This Maya-moha will stupefy all those demons.

original: tato vadhyā bhaviṣyanti vedamārgabahiṣkṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas vadhyāḥ bhaviṣyanti veda mārga bahiṣkṛtāḥ
translated: Then they will be killed, excluded from the path of the Vedas.

original: sthitau sthitasya me vadhyā yāvantaḥ paripanthinaḥ /
analyzed: sthitau sthitasya me vadhyāḥ yāvantaḥ paripanthinaḥ
translated: As long as there are obstacles to the establishment of my existence,

original: brahmaṇo hy adhikārasya devā daityādikāḥ surāḥ // / / //
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ hi adhikārasya devāḥ daitya ādikāḥ surāḥ
translated: the gods such as the demons are obstacles to the authority of Brahma.

original: tad gacchata na bhīḥ kāryā māyāmoho 'yam agrataḥ /
analyzed: tat gacchata na bhīḥ kāryā māyā mohaḥ yam agratas
translated: Therefore, go. Do not be afraid. This Maya-moha is in front.

original: gacchatv adyopakārāya bhavatāṃ bhavitā surāḥ // / / //
analyzed: gacchatu adya upakārāya bhavatām bhavitā surāḥ
translated: Go now for the benefit of the gods.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity uktāḥ praṇipatyainaṃ yayur devā yathāgatam /
analyzed: iti uktāḥ praṇipatya enam yayuḥ devāḥ yathāgatam
translated: Thus addressed, the gods bowed to him and went away as they had come.

original: māyāmoho 'pi taiḥ sārdhaṃ yayau yatra mahāsurāḥ // / / //
analyzed: māyā mohaḥ pi taiḥ sārdham yayau yatra mahā asurāḥ
translated: Maya-moha also went with them to where the great asuras were.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe tṛtīyāṃśe saptadaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe tṛtīya aṃśe saptadaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the seventeenth chapter in the third section of the Vishnu Purana, dealing with the birth of Maya-moha and his going to the asuras.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽tapasy abhiratān so 'tha māyāmoho mahāsurān /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  tapasi abhiratān saḥ tha māyā mohaḥ mahā asurān
translated: Parashara said:

original: maitreya dadṛśe gatvā narmadātīrasaṃśrayān // / / //
analyzed: maitreya dadṛśe gatvā narmadā tīra saṃśrayān
translated: Then, O Maitreya, Maya-moha saw the great asuras engaged in austerities, dwelling on the banks of the Narmada river.

original: tato digambaro muṇḍo barhipatradharo dvija /
analyzed: tatas digambaraḥ muṇḍaḥ barhi patra dharaḥ dvija
translated: The naked, shaven-headed Maya-moha, holding a peacock feather,

original: māyāmoho 'surān ślakṣṇam idaṃ vacanam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: māyā mohaḥ surān ślakṣṇam idam vacanam abravīt
translated: spoke these gentle words to the asuras:

original: māyāmoha uvāca /
analyzed: māyā mohaḥ uvāca
translated: Maya-moha said:

original: bho daityapatayo brūta yadarthaṃ tapyate tapaḥ /
analyzed: bho daitya patayaḥ brūta yad artham tapyate tapaḥ
translated: O lords of the demons, tell me for what purpose you are performing austerities.

original: aihikaṃ vātha pāratryaṃ tapasaḥ phalam icchatha // / / //
analyzed: aihikam vā atha pāratryam tapasaḥ phalam icchatha
translated: Do you desire the fruits of austerities in this world or the next?

original: asurā ūcuḥ /🔽pāratryaphalalābhāya tapaścaryā mahāmate /
analyzed: asurāḥ ūcuḥ  pāratrya phala lābhāya tapaḥ caryā mahāmate
translated: The asuras said:🔽O greatly wise one, we are engaged in this austerity to obtain fruits in the next world.

original: asmābhir iyam ārabdhā kiṃ vā te 'tra vivakṣitam // / / //
analyzed: asmābhiḥ iyam ārabdhā kim vā te tra vivakṣitam
translated: What is your intention in this matter?

original: māyāmoha uvāca /
analyzed: māyā mohaḥ uvāca
translated: Maya-moha said:

original: kurudhvaṃ mama vākyāni yadi muktim abhīpsatha /🔽arhadhvaṃ dharmam etaṃ ca muktidvāram asaṃvṛtam // / / //
analyzed: kurudhvam mama vākyāni yadi muktim  arhadhvam dharmam etam ca mukti dvāram asaṃvṛtam
translated: Do my words, if you desire liberation.🔽Honor this Dharma, the unobstructed door to liberation.

original: dharmo vimukter arho 'yaṃ naitasmād aparaḥ paraḥ /
analyzed: dharmaḥ vimukteḥ arhaḥ yam na etasmāt aparaḥ paraḥ
translated: This Dharma is worthy of liberation, there is no higher Dharma than this.

original: atraivāvasthitāḥ svargaṃ vimuktiṃ vā gamiṣyatha // / / //
analyzed: atrā eva avasthitāḥ svargam vimuktim vā gamiṣyatha
translated: Abiding in this alone, you will attain heaven or liberation.

original: arhadhvaṃ dharmam etaṃ ca sarve yūyaṃ mahābalāḥ // / / //
analyzed: arhadhvam dharmam etam ca sarve yūyam mahā balāḥ
translated: All of you greatly powerful ones, honor this Dharma.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: evaṃprakārair bahubhir yuktidarśanavardhitaiḥ /
analyzed: evaṃprakāraiḥ bahubhiḥ yukti darśana vardhitaiḥ
translated: In this way, by many such arguments and reasonings,

original: māyāmohena daityās te vedamārgād apākṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: māyā mohena daityāḥ te veda mārgāt apākṛtāḥ
translated: Maya Moha led the demons away from the path of the Vedas.

original: dharmāyaitad adharmāya sad etan na sad ity api /
analyzed: dharmāya etat adharmāya sat etat na sat iti api
translated: This is Dharma, that is Adharma; this is truth, that is not truth.

original: vimuktaye tv idaṃ naitad vimuktiṃ saṃprayacchati // / / //
analyzed: vimuktaye tu idam na etat vimuktim saṃprayacchati
translated: This leads to liberation, that does not grant liberation.

original: paramārtho 'yam atyarthaṃ paramārtho na cāpy ayam // / / //
analyzed: parama arthaḥ yam atyartham parama arthaḥ na ca api ayam
translated: This is ultimate truth, that is not ultimate truth.

original: kāryam etad akāryaṃ ca naitad evaṃ sphuṭaṃ tv idam /
analyzed: kāryam etat akāryam ca na etat evam sphuṭam tu idam
translated: This is to be done, that is not to be done; this is clear, that is not clear.

original: digvāsasām ayaṃ dharmo dharmo 'yaṃ bahuvāsasām // / / //
analyzed: digvāsasām ayam dharmaḥ dharmaḥ yam bahu vāsasām
translated: This is the Dharma of the naked, that is the Dharma of the well-clothed.

original: ity anekāntavādaṃ ca māyāmohena naikadhā /
analyzed: iti anekāntavādam ca māyā mohena nā ekadhā
translated: In this way, by Maya Moha, the doctrine of non-absoluteness was proclaimed in many ways.

original: tena darśayatā daityāḥ svadharmāṃs tyājitā dvija // / / //
analyzed: tena darśayatā daityāḥ svadharmān tyājitāḥ dvija
translated: By him, O twice-born one, the demons were made to abandon their own duties.

original: arhathemaṃ mahādharmaṃ māyāmohena te yataḥ /
analyzed: arhatha imam mahā dharmam māyā mohena te yatas
translated: You are worthy of this great Dharma, since it was taught by Māyāmoha.

original: proktās tam āśritā dharmam arhatās tena te 'bhavan // / / //
analyzed: proktāḥ tam āśritāḥ dharmam arhatāḥ tena te bhavan
translated: They who resorted to that Dharma became Arhats by him.

original: trayīdharmasamutsargaṃ māyāmohena te 'surāḥ /
analyzed: trayī dharma samutsargam māyā mohena te surāḥ
translated: By Māyāmoha, the Asuras were made to abandon the Dharma of the three Vedas.

original: kāritās tanmayā hy āsaṃs tathānye tatprabodhitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāritāḥ tad mayāḥ hi āsan tathā anye tad prabodhitāḥ
translated: They became devoted to him, and others were awakened by him.

original: tair apy anye pare taiś ca tair apy anye pare ca taiḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ api anye pare taiḥ ca taiḥ api anye pare ca taiḥ
translated: By them, others, and by those others, and by those others still,

original: alpair ahobhiḥ saṃtyaktā tair daityaiḥ prāyaśas trayī // / / //
analyzed: alpaiḥ ahobhiḥ saṃtyaktā taiḥ daityaiḥ prāyaśas trayī
translated: in a few days, the three Vedas were almost entirely abandoned by those demons.

original: punaś ca raktāmbaradhṛṅ māyāmoho 'jitekṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: punar ca rakta ambara dhṛk māyā mohaḥ jita īkṣaṇaḥ
translated: And again, Māyāmoha, with eyes unconquered, wearing red garments,

original: anyān āhāsurān gatvā mṛdvalpamadhurākṣaram // / / //
analyzed: anyān āha asurān gatvā mṛdu alpa madhura akṣaram
translated: having gone to other Asuras, spoke in a soft, small, sweet voice.

original: māyāmoha uvāca /
analyzed: māyā mohaḥ uvāca
translated: Māyāmoha said:

original: svargārthaṃ yadi vo vāñchā nirvāṇārtham athāsurāḥ /
analyzed: svarga artham yadi vaḥ vāñchā nirvāṇa artham atha asurāḥ
translated: If you have a desire for heaven, or for liberation, O Asuras,

original: tad alaṃ paśughātādiduṣṭadharmaṃ nibodhata // / / //
analyzed: tat alam paśu ghāta ādi duṣṭa dharmam nibodhata
translated: then understand that the evil Dharma of killing animals and so on is enough.

original: vijñānamayam evaitad aśeṣam avagacchata /
analyzed: vijñāna mayam eva etat aśeṣam avagacchata
translated: Know that all this is made of consciousness.

original: budhyadhvaṃ me vacaḥ samyag budhair evam udīritam // / / //
analyzed: budhyadhvam me vacaḥ samyak budhaiḥ evam udīritam
translated: Understand my words well, spoken thus by the wise.

original: jagad etad anādhāraṃ bhrāntijñānārthatatparam /
translated: This world, having no support, is intent on the objects of erroneous knowledge,

original: rāgādiduṣṭam atyarthaṃ bhrāmyate bhavasaṃkaṭe // / / //
analyzed: rāga ādi duṣṭam atyartham bhrāmyate bhava saṃkaṭe
translated: and is greatly deluded in the calamity of worldly existence, being corrupted by passion and other [defilements].

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: evaṃ budhyata budhyadhvaṃ budhyataivam itīrayan /
analyzed: evam budhyata budhyadhvam budhyata evam iti īrayan
translated: Thus speaking, Understand! Understand! Understand in this way!

original: māyāmohaḥ sa daityeyān dharmam atyājayan nijam // / / //
analyzed: māyā mohaḥ sa dharmam atyājayat nijam
translated: That Maya-moha, abandoning his own dharma,

original: nānāprakāravacanaṃ sa teṣāṃ yuktiyojitam /
analyzed: nānā prakāra vacanam sa teṣām yukti yojitam
translated: Spoke in various ways, connected with reason, to those demons,

original: tathā tathāvadad dharmaṃ tatyajus te yathā yathā // / / //
analyzed: tathā tathā avadat dharmam tatyajuḥ te yathā yathā
translated: And they abandoned dharma in various ways, as he spoke.

original: te 'py anyeṣāṃ tathaivocur anyair anye tathoditāḥ /
analyzed: te pi anyeṣām tathā eva ūcuḥ anyaiḥ anye tathā uditāḥ
translated: They also spoke similarly to others, and others thus instructed,

original: maitreya tatyajur dharmaṃ vedasmṛtyuditaṃ param // / / //🔽anyān apy anyapāṣaṇḍaprakārair bahubhir dvija /
analyzed: maitreya tatyajuḥ dharmam veda smṛti uditam param  anyān api anya pāṣaṇḍa prakāraiḥ bahubhiḥ dvija
translated: Abandoned the supreme dharma taught in the Vedas and Smritis, O Maitreya.🔽O Brahmin, in many ways, Maya-moha, the creator of great delusion,

original: daiteyān mohayām āsa māyāmoho 'timohakṛt // / / //
analyzed: daiteyān mohayām āsa
translated: Deluded other demons with various kinds of false doctrines.

original: svalpenaiva hi kālena māyāmohena te 'surāḥ /
analyzed: su alpena eva hi kālena māyā mohena te surāḥ
translated: In a short time, those demons, deluded by Maya-moha,

original: mohitās tatyajuḥ sarvāṃ trayīmārgāśritāṃ kathām // / / //
analyzed: mohitāḥ tatyajuḥ sarvām trayī mārga āśritām kathām
translated: Abandoned all the stories based on the path of the three Vedas.

original: kecid vinindāṃ vedānāṃ devānām apare dvija /
analyzed: kecid vinindām vedānām devānām apare dvija
translated: Some criticized the Vedas, O Brahmin, and others the gods,

original: yajñakarmakalāpasya tathānye ca dvijanmanām // / / //
analyzed: yajña karma kalāpasya tathā anye ca dvijanmanām
translated: and other rites of the twice-born,

original: naitad yuktisahaṃ vākyaṃ hiṃsā dharmāya neṣyate /
analyzed: na etat yukti saham vākyam hiṃsā dharmāya na iṣyate
translated: This statement is not reasonable, as violence is not accepted for the sake of dharma.

original: havīṃṣy analadagdhāni phalāyety arbhakoditam // / / //
analyzed: havīṃṣi anala dagdhāni phalāya iti arbhaka uditam
translated: The statement by a child that oblations burnt in the fire lead to results,

original: yajñair anekair devatvam avāpyendreṇa bhujyate /
analyzed: yajñaiḥ anekaiḥ deva tvam avāpya indreṇa bhujyate
translated: Having attained godhood through many sacrifices, Indra enjoys it.

original: śamyādi yadi cet kāṣṭhaṃ tadvaraṃ patrabhuk paśuḥ // / / //
analyzed: śamī ādi yadi ced kāṣṭham tat varam patra bhuj paśuḥ
translated: If a piece of wood is used as a sacrificial post, it is better for an animal to eat leaves.

original: After ins /
analyzed: after m ins
translated: After the insertion,

original: bhaved yajñasya sādhanam // / / / //
analyzed: bhavet yajñasya sādhanam
translated: would be a means of sacrifice.

original: tadāhāras tadā nityaṃ / / / / / / / / // / / / //
analyzed: tad āhāraḥ tadā nityam
translated: If one who subsists on that is always...

original: nihatasya paśor yajñe svargaprāptir yadīṣyate /
analyzed: nihatasya paśoḥ yajñe svarga prāptiḥ yadi iṣyate
translated: If the attainment of heaven for a slain animal in a sacrifice is accepted,

original: svapitā yajamānena kiṃ nu tasmān na hanyate // / / //
analyzed: svapitā yajamānena kim nu tasmāt na hanyate
translated: why is one's own father not killed by the sacrificer?

original: tṛptaye jāyate puṃso bhuktam anyena cet tataḥ /
analyzed: tṛptaye jāyate puṃsaḥ bhuktam anyena ced tatas
translated: If food eaten by another is for the satisfaction of a person,

original: dadyāc chrāddhaṃ śraddhayānnaṃ na vaheyuḥ pravāsinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dadyāt śrāddham śraddhayā annam na vaheyuḥ pravāsinaḥ
translated: one should offer a śrāddha with faith, food should not be carried by travelers.

original: janaśraddheyam ity etad avagamya tato 'tra vaḥ /
analyzed: jana śraddheyam iti etat avagamya tra vaḥ
translated: Having understood this to be believable by the people, then here for you,

original: upekṣā śreyasī vākyaṃ rocatāṃ yan mayeritam // / / //
analyzed: upekṣā śreyasī vākyam rocatām yat mayā īritam
translated: let the statement uttered by me be accepted as the best, either indifference or...

original: na hy āptavādā nabhaso nipatanti mahāsurāḥ /
analyzed: na hi āpta vādāḥ nabhasaḥ nipatanti mahā asurāḥ
translated: O great demons, the words of the trustworthy do not fall from the sky,

original: yuktimad vacanaṃ grāhyaṃ mayānyaiś ca bhavadvidhaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: yuktimat vacanam grāhyam mayā anyaiḥ ca bhavadvidhaiḥ
translated: and by others like you, words that are reasonable.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: māyāmohena te daityāḥ prakārair bahubhis tathā /
analyzed: māyā mohena te daityāḥ prakāraiḥ bahubhiḥ tathā
translated: Those demons were deluded by Maya in many ways,

original: vyutthāpitā yathā naiṣāṃ trayīṃ kaścid arocayat // / / //
analyzed: vyutthāpitāḥ yathā na eṣām trayīm kaścid arocayat
translated: so that none of them took any interest in the three Vedas.

original: ittham unmārgayāteṣu teṣu daityeṣu te 'marāḥ /
analyzed: ittham unmārga yāteṣu teṣu daityeṣu te marāḥ
translated: When those demons thus went astray, those immortals,

original: udyogaṃ paramaṃ kṛtvā yuddhāya samupasthitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: udyogam paramam kṛtvā yuddhāya samupasthitāḥ
translated: making supreme effort, approached for battle.

original: tato devāsuraṃ yuddhaṃ punar evābhavad dvija /
analyzed: tatas devāsuram yuddham punar evā bhavat dvija
translated: Then again there was the battle between the gods and demons, O Brahmin.

original: hatāś ca te 'surā devaiḥ sanmārgaparipanthinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: hatāḥ ca te surāḥ devaiḥ sat mārga paripanthinaḥ
translated: And those demons, obstructing the right path, were killed by the gods.

original: saddharmakavacas teṣām abhūd yaḥ prathamaṃ dvija /
analyzed: sat dharma kavacaḥ teṣām abhūt yaḥ prathamam dvija
translated: O Brahmin, that which was their armor of true Dharma in the beginning,

original: tena rakṣābhavat pūrvaṃ neśur naṣṭe ca tatra te // / / //
analyzed: tena rakṣā bhavat pūrvam neśuḥ naṣṭe ca tatra te
translated: by that there was protection before, and when that was destroyed, they perished.

original: tato maitreya tanmārgavartino ye 'bhavañ janāḥ /
analyzed: tatas maitreya tad mārga vartinaḥ ye bhavam janāḥ
translated: Then, O Maitreya, those people who followed that path,

original: nagnās te tair yatas tyaktaṃ trayīsaṃvaraṇaṃ vṛthā // / / //🔽ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: nagnāḥ te taiḥ yatas tyaktam trayī saṃvaraṇam vṛthā  e t veṅk ins
translated: since they were naked, having abandoned the covering of the three Vedas in vain.

original: kṛtāś ca te 'surā devair nānāvedavinindakāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṛtāḥ ca te surāḥ devaiḥ nānā veda vinindakāḥ
translated: O Brahmin, those demons were made by the gods to be the slanderers of the various Vedas.

original: brahmacārī gṛhasthaś ca vānaprasthas tathāśramāḥ /🔽parivrāḍ vā caturtho 'tra pañcamo nopapadyate // / / //
analyzed: brahmacārī gṛhasthaḥ ca vānaprasthaḥ tathā āśramāḥ  parivrāj vā caturthaḥ tra pañcamaḥ na upapadyate
translated: Brahmacharya, Garhasthya, Vanaprastha and Sannyasa are the four Ashramas.🔽The fifth Ashrama is not recognized.

original: yas tu saṃtyajya gārhasthyaṃ vānaprastho na jāyate /
analyzed: yaḥ tu saṃtyajya gārhasthyam vānaprasthaḥ na jāyate
translated: He who, having renounced the duties of a householder, does not become a Vanaprastha or a Sannyasin,

original: parivrāḍ vāpi maitreya sa nagnaḥ pāpakṛn naraḥ // / / //🔽nityānāṃ karmaṇāṃ vipra tasya hānir aharniśam /
analyzed: parivrāj vā api maitreya sa nagnaḥ pāpa kṛt naraḥ  nityānām karmaṇām vipra tasya hāniḥ aharniśam
translated: that man, O Maitreya, is a sinner, a naked one.🔽The daily duties of a Brahmana are lost to him day and night.

original: akurvan vihitaṃ karma śaktaḥ patati taddine // / / //
analyzed: akurvan vihitam karma śaktaḥ patati tad dine
translated: He who, being able, does not perform the enjoined duties, falls on that very day.

original: prāyaścittena mahatā śuddhiṃ prāpnoty anāpadi /
analyzed: prāyaścittena mahatā śuddhim prāpnoti anāpadi
translated: In the case of a Brahmana, a great expiation is necessary for purification, except in an emergency.

original: pakṣaṃ nityakriyāhāneḥ kartā maitreya mānavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pakṣam nitya kriyā hāneḥ kartā maitreya mānavaḥ
translated: The man who omits the daily duties for a fortnight, O Maitreya,

original: saṃvatsaraṃ kriyāhānir yasya puṃso 'bhijāyate /
analyzed: saṃvatsaram kriyā hāniḥ yasya puṃsaḥ abhijāyate
translated: and the man who omits the daily duties for a year,

original: tasyāvalokanāt sūryo nirīkṣyaḥ sādhubhiḥ sadā // / / //🔽spṛṣṭe snānaṃ sacailasya śuddhihetur mahāmune /
analyzed: tasya avalokanāt sūryaḥ nirīkṣyaḥ sādhubhiḥ sadā  spṛṣṭe snānam sa cailasya śuddhi hetuḥ mahā mune
translated: his sight should always be avoided by the good.🔽O great sage, if a man is touched by him, he becomes pure by bathing with his clothes on.

original: puṃso bhavati tasyoktā na śuddhiḥ pāpakarmaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: puṃsaḥ bhavati tasya uktā na śuddhiḥ pāpa karmaṇaḥ
translated: But the purification of that sinful man is not mentioned.

original: devarṣipitṛbhūtāni yasya niḥśvasya veśmani /
analyzed: deva ṛṣi pitṛ bhūtāni yasya niḥśvasya veśmani
translated: He whose house is touched by the breath of the gods, sages, manes and spirits,

original: prayānty anarcitāny atra na tasmāt pāpakṛn naraḥ // / / //
analyzed: prayānti anarcitāni atra na tasmāt pāpa kṛt naraḥ
translated: One should not associate with them, for a sinful man does not go there by worshipping them.

original: devādiniḥśvāsahataṃ śarīraṃ yasya veśma ca /
analyzed: deva ādi niḥśvāsa hatam śarīram yasya veśma ca
translated: Whose body and house are struck by the breath of gods etc.,

original: na tena saṃkaraṃ kuryād gṛhāsanaparicchadaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: na tena saṃkaram kuryāt gṛha āsana paricchadaiḥ
translated: One should not have a mixture with him in the house, seat and belongings.

original: saṃbhāṣaṇānupraśnādi sahāsyaṃ caiva kurvataḥ /
analyzed: saṃbhāṣaṇa anupraśna ādi saha āsyam ca eva kurvataḥ
translated: For one who talks, inquires, laughs etc. with him,

original: jāyate tulyatā puṃsas tenaiva dvija vatsaram // / / //
analyzed: jāyate tulya tā puṃsaḥ tena eva dvija vatsaram
translated: O Brahmin, he becomes equal to him for one year.

original: atha bhuṅkte gṛhe tasya karoty āsyāṃ tathāsane /
analyzed: atha bhuṅkte gṛhe tasya karoti āsyām tathā āsane
translated: If he eats in his house, uses his seat and bed,

original: śete cāpy ekaśayane sa sadyas tatsamo bhavet // / / //
analyzed: śete ca api eka śayane sa sadyas tad samaḥ bhavet
translated: and sleeps on the same bed, he immediately becomes like him.

original: devatāpitṛbhūtāni tathānabhyarcya yo 'tithīn /
analyzed: devatā pitṛ bhūtāni tathā an abhyarcya tithīn
translated: If one eats without worshipping gods, ancestors, spirits and guests,

original: bhuṅkte sa pātakaṃ bhuṅkte niṣkṛtis tasya kīdṛśī // / / //
analyzed: bhuṅkte sa pātakam bhuṅkte niṣkṛtiḥ tasya kīdṛśī
translated: he eats sin. What is his expiation?

original: brāhmaṇādyāś ca ye varṇāḥ svadharmād anyatomukham /
analyzed: brāhmaṇa ādyāḥ ca ye varṇāḥ svadharmāt anyatas mukham
translated: Those who are Brahmins and other varnas, if they turn away from their own dharma

original: yānti te nagnasaṃjñāṃ tu hīnakarmasv avasthitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yānti te nagna saṃjñām tu hīna karmasu avasthitāḥ
translated: and engage in inferior actions, they become known as naked.

original: caturṇāṃ yatra varṇānāṃ maitreyātyantasaṃkaraḥ /
analyzed: caturṇām yatra varṇānām maitreya atyanta saṃkaraḥ
translated: Where there is complete mixture of the four varnas,

original: tatrāsyā sādhuvṛttīnām upaghātāya jāyate // / / //
analyzed: tatra āsyā sādhu vṛttīnām upaghātāya jāyate
translated: there it arises for the destruction of the good conduct of this (world).

original: anabhyarcya ṛṣīn devān pitṛbhūtātithīṃs tathā /
analyzed: an abhyarcya ṛṣīn devān pitṛ bhūta atithīn tathā
translated: Without worshipping the sages, gods, ancestors, spirits and guests,

original: yo bhuṅkte tasya saṃbhāṣāt patanti narake narāḥ // / / //🔽tasmād etān naro nagnāṃs trayīsaṃtyāgadūṣitān /
analyzed: yaḥ bhuṅkte tasya saṃbhāṣāt patanti narake narāḥ  tasmāt etān naraḥ nagnān trayī saṃtyāga dūṣitān
translated: By conversing with him who eats, men fall into hell.🔽Therefore, a wise man should always avoid these naked ones, defiled by abandoning the three Vedas,

original: sarvadā varjayet prājña ālāpasparśanādiṣu // / / //
analyzed: sarvadā varjayet prājñaḥ ālāpa sparśana ādiṣu
translated: in conversation, touch, and so on.

original: śraddhāvadbhiḥ kṛtaṃ yatnād devān pitṛpitāmahān /
analyzed: śraddhāvadbhiḥ kṛtam yatnāt devān pitṛ pitāmahān
translated: The offerings made with faith by those who have made an effort to please the gods, ancestors, and grandfathers,

original: na prīṇayati tac chrāddhaṃ yady ebhir avalokitam // / / //
analyzed: na prīṇayati tat śrāddham yadi ebhiḥ avalokitam
translated: that śrāddha does not satisfy them if it is seen by these (sinners).

original: śrūyate ca purā khyāto rājā śatadhanur bhuvi /
analyzed: śrūyate ca purā khyātaḥ rājā śatadhanuḥ bhuvi
translated: And it is heard that in ancient times there was a famous king on earth named Śatadhanu.

original: patnī ca śaibyā tasyābhūd atidharmaparāyaṇā // / / //
analyzed: patnī ca śaibyā tasya abhūt ati dharma parāyaṇā
translated: And his wife was Śaibyā, who was extremely devoted to dharma.

original: pativratā mahābhāgā satyaśaucadayānvitā /
analyzed: pativratā mahābhāgā satya śauca dayā anvitā
translated: She was a chaste wife, greatly fortunate, endowed with truthfulness, purity, and compassion,

original: sarvalakṣaṇasaṃpannā saṃpannā vinayena ca // / / //
analyzed: sarva lakṣaṇa saṃpannā saṃpannā vinayena ca
translated: and she was endowed with all the auspicious marks and was accomplished in humility.

original: sa tu rājā tayā sārdhaṃ devadevaṃ janārdanam /
analyzed: sa tu rājā tayā sārdham devadevam janārdanam
translated: That king, together with her, worshipped Janārdana, the god of gods,

original: ārādhayām āsa vibhuṃ parameṇa samādhinā // / / //
analyzed: ārādhayām āsa vibhum parameṇa samādhinā
translated: the powerful one, with supreme concentration.

original: homair japais tathā dānair upavāsaiś ca bhaktitaḥ /
analyzed: homaiḥ japaiḥ tathā dānaiḥ upavāsaiḥ ca bhaktitaḥ
translated: With oblations, japa, gifts, fasts, and with devotion,

original: pūjābhiś cānudivasaṃ tanmanā nānyamānasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pūjābhiḥ ca anudivasam tad manāḥ na anya mānasaḥ
translated: with daily worship, with his mind on that (god) and not on anything else.

original: ekadā tu samaṃ snātau tau tu bhāryāpatī jale /
analyzed: ekadā tu samam snātau tau tu bhāryā patī jale
translated: But one day, the couple bathed together in the water,

original: bhāgīrathyāḥ samuttīrṇau kārttikyāṃ samupoṣitau /
analyzed: bhāgīrathyāḥ samuttīrṇau kārttikyām samupoṣitau
translated: Having fasted on the full moon day of Kartika and crossed the Bhagirathi,

original: pāṣaṇḍinam apaśyetām āyāntaṃ saṃmukhaṃ dvija // / / //
analyzed: pāṣaṇḍinam apaśyetām āyāntam saṃmukham dvija
translated: they saw a heretic coming towards them, O Brahmin.

original: cāpācāryasya tasyāsau sakhā rājño mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: cāpa ācāryasya tasya asau sakhā rājñaḥ mahātmanaḥ
translated: He was a friend of the great king, the archery teacher.

original: atas tadgauravāt tena sahālāpam athākarot // / / //
analyzed: atas tad gauravāt tena saha ālāpam atha akarot
translated: Therefore, out of respect for him, he engaged in conversation with him.

original: na tu sā vāgyatā devī tasya patnī yatavratā /
analyzed: na tu sā vāgyatā devī tasya patnī yata vratā
translated: But the goddess, his wife, was not restrained in speech, being of firm vows.

original: upoṣitāsmīti raviṃ tasmin dṛṣṭe dadarśa ca // / / //
analyzed: upoṣitā asmi iti ravim tasmin dṛṣṭe dadarśa ca
translated: Having fasted, she saw the sun when he was seen.

original: samāgamya yathānyāyaṃ dampatī tau yathāvidhi /
analyzed: samāgamya yathānyāyam dampatī tau yathāvidhi
translated: Having met in the proper way, the couple, as is proper,

original: viṣṇoḥ pūjādikaṃ sarvaṃ kṛtavantau dvijottama // / / //🔽kālena gacchatā rājā mamārāsau sapatnajit /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ pūjā ādikam sarvam kṛtavantau dvijottama  kālena gacchatā rājā mamāra asau sapatna jit
translated: performed all the worship of Vishnu, O best of Brahmins.🔽In due course, the king, the conqueror of enemies, died.

original: anvāruroha taṃ devī citāsthaṃ bhūpatiṃ patim // / / //
analyzed: anvāruroha tam devī citā stham bhūpatim patim
translated: The queen ascended the funeral pyre with her husband, the king.

original: sa tu tenāpacāreṇa śvā jajñe vasudhādhipaḥ /
analyzed: sa tu tena apacāreṇa śvā jajñe vasudhādhipaḥ
translated: Due to that misconduct, the king was born as a dog.

original: upoṣitena pāṣaṇḍasaṃbhāṣo yaḥ kṛto 'bhavat // / / //
