analyzed: upoṣitena pāṣaṇḍa saṃbhāṣaḥ yaḥ kṛtaḥ bhavat
translated: The conversation with the heretic that was had while fasting.

original: sāpi jātismarā jajñe kāśirājasutā śubhā /
analyzed: sā api jātismarā jajñe kāśi rāja sutā śubhā
translated: She too was born as the beautiful daughter of the king of Kashi, remembering her past birth.

original: sarvavijñānasaṃpannā sarvalakṣaṇabhūṣitā // / / //
analyzed: sarva vijñāna saṃpannā sarva lakṣaṇa bhūṣitā
translated: Endowed with all knowledge and adorned with all auspicious marks.

original: tāṃ pitā dātukāmo 'bhūd varāya vinivāritaḥ /
analyzed: tām pitā dātu kāmaḥ bhūt varāya vinivāritaḥ
translated: The father was desirous of giving her to a bridegroom, but was prevented.

original: tayaiva tanvyā virato vivāhārambhato nṛpaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tayā eva tanvyā virataḥ vivāha ārambhataḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: The king desisted from beginning the marriage rites by the very same slender-bodied one.

original: tataḥ sā divyayā dṛṣṭyā dṛṣṭvā śvānaṃ nijaṃ patim /
analyzed: tatas sā divyayā dṛṣṭyā dṛṣṭvā śvānam nijam patim
translated: Then she, with her divine vision, seeing her own husband in the form of a dog,

original: vaidiśākhyaṃ puraṃ gatvā tadavasthaṃ dadarśa tam // / / //
analyzed: vaidiśa ākhyam puram gatvā tad avastham dadarśa tam
translated: went to the city called Vaidiśa and saw him in that very state.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvaiva mahābhāgā śvānabhūtaṃ patiṃ tathā /🔽dadau tasmai varāhāraṃ satkārapravaṇaṃ śubham // / / //
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā eva mahābhāgā śvāna bhūtam patim tathā  dadau tasmai vara āhāram satkāra pravaṇam śubham
translated: Seeing her husband in that condition as a dog, the greatly fortunate one,🔽gave him the best food, which was good and conducive to respect.

original: bhuñjan dattaṃ tayā so 'nnam atimiṣṭam abhīpsitam /
analyzed: bhuñjan dattam tayā saḥ nnam ati miṣṭam abhīpsitam
translated: Eating the food given by her, which was very much desired and liked,

original: śvajātilalitaṃ kurvan bahu cāṭu cakāra vai // / / //
analyzed: śva jāti lalitam kurvan bahu cāṭu cakāra vai
translated: he, acting like a dog, made many flattering remarks.

original: atīva vrīḍitā bālā kurvatā cāṭu tena sā /
analyzed: atīva vrīḍitā bālā kurvatā cāṭu tena sā
translated: The young woman, very much ashamed by his flattering,

original: praṇāmapūrvam āhedaṃ dayitaṃ taṃ kuyonijam // / / //
analyzed: praṇāma pūrvam āha idam dayitam tam ku yoni jam
translated: spoke to her beloved who was born in an animal womb, after bowing down to him.

original: patny uvāca /
analyzed: patnī uvāca
translated: The wife said:

original: smaryatāṃ tan mahārāja dākṣiṇyalalitaṃ tvayā /
analyzed: smaryatām tat mahā rāja dākṣiṇya lalitam tvayā
translated: O great king, may that gracefulness of yours be remembered,

original: yena śvayonim āpanno mama cāṭukaro bhavān // / / //
analyzed: yena śva yonim āpannaḥ mama cāṭu karaḥ bhavān
translated: by which you, engaged in flattering me, have attained a dog's womb.

original: pāṣaṇḍinaṃ samābhāṣya tīrthasnānād anantaram /
analyzed: pāṣaṇḍinam samābhāṣya tīrtha snānāt anantaram
translated: Having spoken to the heretic after bathing at a holy place,

original: prāpto 'si kutsitāṃ yoniṃ kiṃ na smarasi tat prabho // / / //
analyzed: prāptaḥ u si kutsitām yonim kim na smarasi tat prabho
translated: You have attained a despicable birth. Do you not remember that, O Lord?

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tayaivaṃ smārite tatra pūrvajātikṛte tadā /
analyzed: tayā evam smārite tatra pūrva jāti kṛte tadā
translated: Thus reminded there of his past birth,

original: dadhyau ciram athāvāpa nirvedam atidurlabham // / / //🔽nirviṇṇacittaḥ sa tato nirgamya nagarād bahiḥ /
analyzed: dadhyau ciram atha avāpa nirvedam ati durlabham  nirviṇṇa cittaḥ sa tatas nirgamya nagarāt bahis
translated: he meditated for a long time and attained the extremely rare state of detachment.🔽With a detached mind, he then left the city and went outside,

original: maruprapatanaṃ kṛtvā śārgālīṃ yonim āgataḥ // / / //
analyzed: maruprapatanam kṛtvā śārgālīm yonim āgataḥ
translated: and by throwing himself from a cliff, he took birth as a jackal.

original: sāpi dvitīye saṃprāpte varṣe divyena cakṣuṣā /
analyzed: sā api dvitīye saṃprāpte varṣe divyena cakṣuṣā
translated: In the second year, she too, with her divine eye,

original: jñātvā sṛgālaṃ taṃ draṣṭuṃ yayau kolāhalaṃ girim // / / //
analyzed: jñātvā sṛgālam tam draṣṭum yayau kolāhalam girim
translated: knew that he was a jackal and went to the Koilahala mountain to see him.

original: tatrāpi dṛṣṭvā taṃ prāha śārgālīṃ yonim āgatam /
analyzed: tatra api dṛṣṭvā tam prāha śārgālīm yonim āgatam
translated: There too, seeing him who had taken birth as a jackal,

original: bhartāram api cārvaṅgī tanayā pṛthivīkṣitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhartāram api cāru aṅgī tanayā pṛthivīkṣitaḥ
translated: the beautiful daughter of the king spoke to her husband.

original: patny uvāca /
analyzed: patnī uvāca
translated: The wife said:

original: api smarasi rājendra śvayonisthasya yan mayā /
analyzed: api smarasi rāja indra śva yoni sthasya yat mayā
translated: O lord of kings, do you remember what I told you when you were in the womb of a dog,

original: proktaṃ te pūrvacaritaṃ pāṣaṇḍālāpasaṃśrayam // / / //
analyzed: proktam te pūrva caritam pāṣaṇḍa ālāpa saṃśrayam
translated: about your past conduct based on the talk of heretics?

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: punas tayoktaṃ taj jñātvā satyaṃ satyavatāṃ varaḥ /
analyzed: punar tayā uktam tat jñātvā satyam satyavatām varaḥ
translated: Knowing that to be true, the best of the truthful ones,

original: kānane sa nirāhāras tatyāja svaṃ kalevaram // / / //
analyzed: kānane sa nirāhāraḥ tatyāja svam kalevaram
translated: in the forest, without food, gave up his body.

original: bhūyas tato vṛkaṃ jātaṃ gatvā taṃ nirjane vane /
analyzed: bhūyas tatas vṛkam jātam gatvā tam nirjane vane
translated: Again, assuming the form of a wolf, she went to the solitary forest and reminded her husband of their past life.

original: smārayām āsa bhartāraṃ pūrvavṛttam aninditā // / / //
analyzed: smārayām āsa bhartāram pūrva vṛttam aninditā
translated: The unblemished one said to him:

original: na tvaṃ vṛko mahābhāga rājā śatadhanur bhavān /
analyzed: na tvam vṛkaḥ mahābhāga rājā śatadhanuḥ bhavān
translated: You are not a wolf, O blessed one. You are King Shatadhanu.

original: śvā bhūtvā tvaṃ śṛgālo 'bhūr vṛkatvaṃ sāmprataṃ gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: śvā bhūtvā tvam śṛgālaḥ bhūḥ vṛka tvam sāmpratam gataḥ
translated: Having been a dog, you became a jackal, and now you have attained the state of a wolf.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: smāritena yathā vyaktas tenātmā gṛdhratāṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: smāritena yathā vyaktaḥ tena ātmā gṛdhra tām gataḥ
translated: Thus reminded, his soul became manifest in the form of a vulture.

original: apāpā sā punaś cainaṃ bodhayām āsa bhāminī // / / //
analyzed: apāpā sā punar ca enam bodhayām āsa bhāminī
translated: The beautiful one, free from sin, again enlightened him:

original: narendra smaryatām ātmā hy alaṃ te gṛdhraceṣṭayā /
analyzed: narendra smaryatām ātmā hi alam te gṛdhra ceṣṭayā
translated: O lord of men, remember your true self. Enough of this vulture-like behavior.

original: pāṣaṇḍālāpajāto 'yaṃ doṣo yad gṛdhratāṃ gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: pāṣaṇḍa ālāpa jātaḥ yam doṣaḥ yat gṛdhra tām gataḥ
translated: This fault of becoming a vulture arose from the talk of heretics.

original: tataḥ kākatvam āpannaṃ samanantarajanmani /
analyzed: tatas kāka tvam āpannam samanantara janmani
translated: Then, in his next birth, he attained the state of a crow.

original: uvāca tanvī bhartāram upalabhyātmayogataḥ // / / //
analyzed: uvāca tanvī bhartāram upalabhya ātma yogataḥ
translated: The slender one, recognizing her husband through her spiritual power, said to him:

original: aśeṣā bhūbhṛtaḥ pūrvaṃ vaśyā yasmai baliṃ daduḥ /
analyzed: aśeṣāḥ bhūbhṛtaḥ pūrvam vaśyāḥ yasmai balim daduḥ
translated: Those who formerly paid tribute to you, all the kings,

original: sa tvaṃ kākatvam āpanno jāto 'dya balibhuk prabho // / / //
analyzed: sa tvam kāka tvam āpannaḥ jātaḥ dya balibhuj prabho
translated: you have now become a crow, O lord, and are eating offerings.

original: evam eva ca kākatve smāritaḥ sa purātanam /
analyzed: evam eva ca kāka tve smāritaḥ sa purātanam
translated: Thus reminded of his past in the form of a crow,

original: tatyāja bhūpatiḥ prāṇān mayūratvam avāpa ca // / / //
analyzed: tatyāja bhūpatiḥ prāṇān mayūra tvam avāpa ca
translated: The king gave up his life and attained the state of a peacock.

original: mayūratve tataḥ sā vai cakārānugataṃ śubhā /
analyzed: mayūra tve tatas sā vai cakāra anugatam śubhā
translated: Then that auspicious one followed him in the form of a peacock.

original: dattaiḥ pratikṣaṇaṃ bhojyair bālā tajjātibhojanaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: dattaiḥ pratikṣaṇam bhojyaiḥ bālā tad jāti bhojanaiḥ
translated: The young girl, with food given to her every moment, fed him with food of that species.

original: tatas tu janako rājā vājimedhaṃ mahākratum /🔽cakāra tasyāvabhṛthe snāpayām āsa taṃ tadā // / / //
analyzed: tatas tu janakaḥ rājā vājimedham mahā kratum  cakāra tasya avabhṛthe snāpayām āsa tam tadā
translated: Then King Janaka performed the great sacrifice of a horse sacrifice.🔽In its concluding bath, he had him bathed.

original: sasnau svayaṃ ca tanvaṅgī smārayām āsa cāpi tam /
analyzed: sasnau svayam ca tanvaṅgī smārayām āsa ca api tam
translated: The slender-bodied one herself bathed and reminded him.

original: yathāsau śvaśṛgālādyā yonīr jagrāha pārthivaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yathā asau śva śṛgāla ādyāḥ yonīḥ jagrāha pārthivaḥ
translated: How the king took birth as a dog, jackal, and other species.

original: smṛtajanmakramaḥ so 'tha tatyāja svaṃ kalevaram /
analyzed: smṛta janma kramaḥ saḥ tha tatyāja svam kalevaram
translated: Then, remembering the sequence of his births, he gave up his body.

original: jajñe ca janakasyaiva putro 'sau sumahātmanaḥ // / / //🔽tataḥ sā pitaraṃ tanvī vivāhārtham acodayat /
analyzed: jajñe ca janakasya eva su mahātmanaḥ  tatas sā pitaram tanvī vivāha artham acodayat
translated: And he was born as the son of that very great-souled Janaka.🔽Then the slender girl urged her father to arrange a marriage.

original: sa cāpi kārayām āsa pitā tasyāḥ svayaṃvaram // / / //🔽svayaṃvare kṛte sā taṃ saṃprāptaṃ patim ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca api kārayām āsa pitā tasyāḥ svayaṃvaram  svayaṃvare kṛte sā tam saṃprāptam patim ātmanaḥ
translated: And her father also arranged a svayamvara for her.🔽When the svayamvara was held, she chose as her husband the one who had come to her.

original: varayām āsa bhūyo 'pi bhartṛbhāvena bhāminī // / / //
analyzed: varayām āsa bhūyas pi bhartṛ bhāvena bhāminī
translated: The beautiful woman again chose him as her husband.

original: bubhuje ca tayā sārdhaṃ saṃbhogān nṛpanandanaḥ /
analyzed: bubhuje ca tayā sārdham saṃbhogān nṛpa nandanaḥ
translated: And the prince enjoyed pleasures with her.

original: pitary uparate rājyaṃ videheṣu cakāra saḥ // / / //
analyzed: pitari uparate rājyam videheṣu cakāra saḥ
translated: After the death of his father, he ruled the kingdom of Videha.

original: iyāja yajñān subahūn dadau dānāni cārthinām /
analyzed: iyāja yajñān su bahūn dadau dānāni ca arthinām
translated: He performed many sacrifices, gave gifts to the needy,

original: putrān utpādayām āsa yuyudhe ca sahāribhiḥ // / / //🔽rājyaṃ kṛtvā yathānyāyaṃ pālayitvā vasuṃdharām /
analyzed: putrān utpādayām āsa yuyudhe ca saha aribhiḥ  rājyam kṛtvā yathānyāyam pālayitvā vasuṃdharām
translated: begot sons, and fought with enemies.🔽Having ruled the kingdom righteously and protected the earth,

original: tatyāja sa priyān prāṇān saṃgrāme dharmato nṛpaḥ // / / //🔽tataś citāsthaṃ taṃ bhūyo bhartāraṃ sā śubhekṣaṇā /
analyzed: tatyāja sa priyān prāṇān saṃgrāme dharmataḥ nṛpaḥ  tatas citā stham tam bhūyas bhartāram sā śubha īkṣaṇā
translated: that king gave up his dear life in battle according to dharma.🔽Then that beautiful-eyed one, as before, joyfully

original: anvāruroha vidhivad yathāpūrvaṃ mudāvatī // / / //
analyzed: anvāruroha vidhivat yathāpūrvam mudāvatī
translated: again ascended the funeral pyre of her husband according to the prescribed manner.

original: tato 'vāpa tayā sārdhaṃ rājaputryā sa pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: tatas vāpa tayā sārdham rāja putryā sa pārthivaḥ
translated: Then that king, along with that princess,

original: aindrān atītya vai lokāṃl lokān kāmaduho 'kṣayān // / / //
analyzed: aindrān atītya vai lokān lokān kāmaduhaḥ kṣayān
translated: attained the inexhaustible worlds that fulfill desires, surpassing even the worlds of Indra.

original: svargākṣayatvam atulaṃ dāmpatyam atidurlabham /
analyzed: svarga akṣaya tvam atulam dāmpatyam ati durlabham
translated: The incomparable and extremely rare attainment of heaven and immortality by a couple,

original: prāptaṃ puṇyaphalaṃ prāpya saṃśuddhiṃ tāṃ dvijottama // / / //
analyzed: prāptam puṇya phalam prāpya saṃśuddhim tām dvijottama
translated: having attained that, O best of Brahmins, the fruit of merit and purity

original: eṣa pāṣaṇḍasaṃbhāṣadoṣaḥ prokto mayā dvija /
analyzed: eṣa pāṣaṇḍa saṃbhāṣa doṣaḥ proktaḥ mayā dvija
translated: Thus, O Brahmin, I have told you about the sin of conversing with heretics,

original: tathāśvamedhāvabhṛthasnānamāhātmyam eva ca // / / //
analyzed: tathā aśvamedha avabhṛtha snāna māhātmyam eva ca
translated: as well as the greatness of the concluding bath of the horse sacrifice.

original: tasmāt pāṣaṇḍibhiḥ pāpair ālāpasparśanaṃ tyajet /
analyzed: tasmāt pāṣaṇḍibhiḥ pāpaiḥ ālāpa sparśanam tyajet
translated: Therefore, one should avoid conversation and touch with sinful heretics,

original: viśeṣataḥ kriyākāle yajñādau cāpi dīkṣitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: viśeṣataḥ kriyā kāle yajña ādau ca api dīkṣitaḥ
translated: Especially at the time of rituals and sacrifices, one who is initiated,

original: kriyāhānir gṛhe yasya māsam ekaṃ prajāyate /
analyzed: kriyā hāniḥ gṛhe yasya māsam ekam prajāyate
translated: If there is a loss of ritual in one's house for one month,

original: tasyāvalokanāt sūryaṃ paśyeta matimān naraḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasya avalokanāt sūryam paśyeta matimān naraḥ
translated: A wise man should not look at the sun after seeing him.

original: kiṃ punar yais tu saṃtyaktā trayī sarvātmanā dvija /
analyzed: kim punar yaiḥ tu saṃtyaktā trayī sarva ātmanā dvija
translated: What to speak of those who have abandoned the three Vedas completely, O Brahmin,

original: parānnabhojibhiḥ pāpair vedavādavirodhibhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: para anna bhojibhiḥ pāpaiḥ veda vāda virodhibhiḥ
translated: By sinful ones who eat others' food and contradict the Vedic teachings.

original: After / ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: after e t veṅk ins
translated: After.

original: sahālāpas tu saṃsargaḥ sahāsyā cātipāpinī // / / / //
analyzed: saha ālāpaḥ tu saṃsargaḥ saha āsyā ca ati pāpinī
translated: Conversation is association, and laughing together is extremely sinful.

original: pāṣaṇḍibhir durācārais tasmāt tān parivarjayet // / / / //
analyzed: pāṣaṇḍibhiḥ durācāraiḥ tasmāt tān parivarjayet
translated: Therefore, one should avoid them.

original: pāṣaṇḍino vikarmasthān baiḍālavratikāñ chaṭhān /
analyzed: pāṣaṇḍinaḥ vikarma sthān baiḍālavratikām chaṭhān
translated: Heretics, those who perform forbidden acts, those who follow the cat's vow, cheats,

original: haitukān bakavṛttīṃś ca vāṅmātreṇāpi nārcayet // / / //
analyzed: haitukān bakavṛttīn ca vāc mātreṇa api na arcayet
translated: Logicians, and those who behave like cranes, one should not worship even verbally.

original: ins /
analyzed: ins
translated: Inserts.

original: bhraṣṭaḥ svadharmāt pāṣaṇḍo vikarmastho niṣiddhakṛt // / / / //
analyzed: bhraṣṭaḥ svadharmāt pāṣaṇḍaḥ vikarma sthaḥ niṣiddha kṛt
translated: One who has fallen from one's own duty is a heretic, one who performs forbidden acts, one who does prohibited acts.

original: yasya dharmasya yo nityaṃ suradhvaja ivocchritaḥ // / / / //
analyzed: yasya dharmasya yaḥ nityam sura dhvajaḥ iva ucchritaḥ
translated: Of whatever duty, he who is always raised like the banner of the gods,

original: pracchannāni ca pāpāni baiḍālaṃ nāma tadvratam // / / / //
analyzed: pracchannāni ca pāpāni baiḍālam nāma tat vratam
translated: And hidden sins, that vow is called the cat's vow.

original: priyaṃ vakti puro 'nyatra vipriyaṃ kurute bhṛśam // / / / //
analyzed: priyam vakti puras nyatra vipriyam kurute bhṛśam
translated: speaks pleasantly in front, but does great harm elsewhere.

original: tyaktāparādhaceṣṭaś ca śaṭho 'yaṃ kathito budhaiḥ // / / / //
analyzed: tyakta aparādha ceṣṭaḥ ca śaṭhaḥ yam kathitaḥ budhaiḥ
translated: This one who has abandoned the practice of offending is said to be a deceiver by the wise.

original: saṃdehakṛd dhetubhir yaḥ satkarmasu sa haitukaḥ // / / / //
analyzed: saṃdeha kṛt hetubhiḥ yaḥ sat karmasu sa haitukaḥ
translated: He who creates doubt with reasons in good deeds is a sophist.

original: arvāgdṛṣṭir nikṛtikāḥ svārthasādhanatatparāḥ // / / / //
analyzed: arvāk dṛṣṭiḥ nikṛtikāḥ sva artha sādhana tatparāḥ
translated: Those who have a limited perspective, are deceitful, and are devoted to accomplishing their own ends.

original: cont /
analyzed: b cont
translated: Here is the corrected and aligned text:

original: śaṭho mithyāvinītaś ca bakavṛttir udāhṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śaṭhaḥ mithyā vinītaḥ ca baka vṛttiḥ udāhṛtaḥ
translated: The deceiver and the falsely humble are said to have the behavior of a crane.

original: dūrād apāstaḥ saṃparkas sahāsyāpi ca pāpibhiḥ /
analyzed: dūrāt apāstaḥ saṃparkaḥ sahāsyā api ca pāpibhiḥ
translated: Association should be avoided from afar, even with an associate who is sinful.

original: pāṣaṇḍibhir durācārais tasmāt tān parivarjayet // / / //
analyzed: pāṣaṇḍibhiḥ durācāraiḥ tasmāt tān parivarjayet
translated: One should therefore avoid those who are heretics, of bad conduct,

original: ete nagnās tavākhyātā dṛṣṭyā śrāddhopaghātakāḥ /
analyzed: ete nagnāḥ tava ākhyātāḥ dṛṣṭyā śrāddha upaghātakāḥ
translated: These naked ones have been described to you, who harm the Śrāddha by their sight.

original: yeṣāṃ saṃbhāṣaṇāt puṃsāṃ dinapuṇyaṃ praṇaśyati // / / //
analyzed: yeṣām saṃbhāṣaṇāt puṃsām dina puṇyam praṇaśyati
translated: By conversing with whom, the merit of men for the day perishes.

original: ete pāṣaṇḍinaḥ pāpā na hy etān ālaped budhaḥ /
analyzed: ete pāṣaṇḍinaḥ pāpāḥ na hi etān ālapet budhaḥ
translated: These are sinful heretics, a wise man should not converse with them.

original: puṇyaṃ naśyati saṃbhāṣād eteṣāṃ taddinodbhavam // / / //
analyzed: puṇyam naśyati saṃbhāṣāt eteṣām tad dina udbhavam
translated: By conversing with them, the merit arising from that day perishes.

original: puṃsāṃ jaṭādharaṇamauṇḍyavatāṃ vṛthaiva moghāśinām akhilaśaucanirākṛtānām /
analyzed: puṃsām jaṭā dharaṇa mauṇḍyavatām vṛthā eva mogha āśinām akhila śauca nirākṛtānām
translated: Of men who have matted hair, shave their heads in vain, eat in vain, are devoid of all purity,

original: toyapradānapitṛpiṇḍabahiṣkṛtānāṃ saṃbhāṣaṇād api narā narakaṃ prayānti // / / //
analyzed: toya pradāna pitṛ piṇḍa bahiṣkṛtānām saṃbhāṣaṇāt api narāḥ narakam prayānti
translated: Men, by conversing with those who have omitted to offer water libations or the funeral cakes to their ancestors, go to hell.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe tṛtīyāṃśe 'ṣṭādaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe tṛtīya aṃśe ṣṭādaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eighteenth chapter in the third section of the Visnu Purana, dealing with the creation of the world.

original: maitreya uvāca /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca
translated: Maitreya said:

original: bhagavan yan naraiḥ kāryaṃ sādhukarmaṇy avasthitaiḥ /
analyzed: bhagavan yat naraiḥ kāryam sādhu karmaṇi avasthitaiḥ
translated: O Lord, what should be done by men who are established in good deeds,

original: tan mahyaṃ guruṇākhyātaṃ nityanaimittikātmakam // / / //
analyzed: tat mahyam guruṇā ākhyātam nitya naimittika ātmakam
translated: that has been explained to me by the teacher in the form of daily and occasional duties.

original: varṇadharmās tathākhyātā dharmā ye cāśrameṣu vai /
analyzed: varṇa dharmāḥ tathā ākhyātāḥ dharmāḥ ye ca āśrameṣu vai
translated: The duties of the castes and stages of life have also been explained.

original: śrotum icchāmy ahaṃ vaṃśāṃs tāṃs tvaṃ prabrūhi me guro // / / //
analyzed: śrotum icchāmi aham vaṃśān tān tvam prabrūhi me guro
translated: I wish to hear about the dynasties. O teacher, please tell me that.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: maitreya śrūyatām ayam anekayajvivīraśūrabhūpālālaṃkṛto brahmādir mānavo vaṃśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: maitreya śrūyatām ayam aneka yajvi vīra śūra bhūpāla alaṃkṛtaḥ brahma ādiḥ mānavaḥ vaṃśaḥ
translated: O Maitreya, let this dynasty of Manu, adorned with many great kings, beginning with Brahma, be heard.

original: tathā coktam /
analyzed: tathā ca uktam
translated: And it is said:

original: brahmādyaṃ yo manor vaṃśam ahany ahani saṃsmaret /
analyzed: brahma ādyam yaḥ manoḥ vaṃśam ahani ahani saṃsmaret
translated: One who remembers the dynasty of Manu beginning with Brahma day by day,

original: tasya vaṃśasamucchedo na kadācid bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: tasya vaṃśa samucchedaḥ na kadācid bhaviṣyati
translated: for him the destruction of his dynasty will never happen.

original: tad asya vaṃśasyānupūrvīm aśeṣapāpaprakṣālanāya maitreya tāṃ śṛṇu // / / //
analyzed: tat asya vaṃśasya ānupūrvīm aśeṣa pāpa prakṣālanāya maitreya tām śṛṇu
translated: Therefore, O Maitreya, listen to that lineage of Manu, which is in order, for the complete washing away of all sins.

original: tad yathā sakalajagatām anādir ādibhūtaṛgyajuḥsāmādimayo bhagavadviṣṇumayasya brahmaṇo mūrtaṃ rūpaṃ hiraṇyagarbho brahmāṇḍato bhagavān brahmā
analyzed: tat yathā sakala jagatām anādiḥ ādi bhūta ṛk yajuḥ sāma ādi mayaḥ bhagavat viṣṇu mayasya brahmaṇaḥ mūrtam rūpam hiraṇyagarbhaḥ brahmāṇḍataḥ bhagavān brahmā  /
translated: As for instance, the eternal, primordial form of the Supreme Brahman, consisting of the Rig, Yajur, Sama, and other Vedas, and identified with the divine Vishnu, was the golden-hued Garbhodaka ocean, the abode of the universe.

original: prāg babhūva // / / //
analyzed: prāk babhūva
translated: In the beginning, the illustrious Brahma, the lord of the universe, was born from that ocean.

original: brahmaṇaś ca dakṣiṇāṅguṣṭhajanmā dakṣaḥ prajāpatir dakṣasyāditir aditer vivasvān vivasvato manuḥ // / / //
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ ca dakṣiṇa aṅguṣṭha janmā dakṣaḥ prajāpatiḥ dakṣasya aditiḥ aditeḥ vivasvān vivasvataḥ manuḥ
translated: Brahma was born from the right thumb of Brahma. Daksha Prajapati was born from Daksha. Aditi was born from Aditi. Vivasvan was born from Vivasvan. Manu was born from Manu.

original: manor ikṣvākunṛgadhṛṣṭaśaryātinariṣyantaprāṃśunābhāganediṣṭakarūṣapṛṣadhrākhyā daśa putrā babhūvuḥ // / / //
analyzed: manoḥ ikṣvāku nṛga dhṛṣṭa śaryāti nariṣyanta prāṃśu nābhāga nediṣṭa karūṣa pṛṣadhra ākhyāḥ daśa putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Manu had ten sons named Ikshvaku, Nriga, Dhristashva, Sharyati, Narishyanta, Prashvi, Nabhaga, Nediṣṭha, Karusha, and Prishadhra.

original: iṣṭiṃ ca mitrāvaruṇayor manuḥ putrakāmaś cakāra // / / //
analyzed: iṣṭim ca mitrāvaruṇayoḥ manuḥ putra kāmaḥ cakāra
translated: Manu, desiring a son, performed a sacrifice to Mitra and Varuna.

original: tatrāpahute hotur apacārād ilā nāma kanyā babhūva // / / //
analyzed: tatra apahute hotuḥ apacārāt ilā nāma kanyā babhūva
translated: In that sacrifice, due to the fault of the Hotri priest, a daughter named Ila was born.

original: saiva ca mitrāvaruṇayoḥ prasādāt sudyumno nāma manoḥ putro maitreyāsīt // / / //
analyzed: sā eva ca mitrāvaruṇayoḥ prasādāt sudyumnaḥ nāma manoḥ putraḥ maitreya āsīt
translated: By the grace of Mitra and Varuna, that Ila became the son of Manu, named Sudyumna.

original: punaś ceśvarakopāt strī satī somasūnor budhasyāśramasamīpe babhrāma // / / //
analyzed: punar ca īśvara kopāt strī satī soma sūnoḥ budhasya āśrama samīpe babhrāma
translated: Again, due to the anger of the gods, she became a woman and wandered near the hermitage of Soma's son Budha.

original: sānurāgaś ca tasyāṃ budhaḥ purūravasam ātmajam utpādayām āsa // / / //
analyzed: sa anurāgaḥ ca tasyām budhaḥ purūravasam ātmajam utpādayām āsa
translated: And Budha, with affection for her, begot Purūravas as his son.

original: jāte ca tasminn amitatejobhiḥ paramarṣibhir ṛṅmayo yajurmayaḥ sāmamayo 'tharvamayaḥ
analyzed: jāte ca tasmin amita tejobhiḥ parama ṛṣibhiḥ ṛk mayaḥ yajuḥ mayaḥ sāma mayaḥ tharva mayaḥ
translated: And when he was born, the Supreme Rishis, who were of immeasurable splendour, who consisted of the Rig Veda, the Yajur Veda, the Sama Veda, the Atharva Veda,

original: sarvamayo manomayo jñānamayo na kiṃcinmayo bhagavān yajñapuruṣasvarūpī sudyumnasya
analyzed: sarva mayaḥ manaḥ mayaḥ jñāna mayaḥ na kiṃcid mayaḥ bhagavān yajñapuruṣa svarūpī sudyumnasya
translated: who consisted of everything, who consisted of the mind, who consisted of knowledge, who consisted of nothing, the Blessed Lord, in the form of the sacrificial being, to Sudyumna,

original: puṃstvam abhilaṣadbhir yathāvad iṣṭas tatprasādāc cāsāv ilā punar api sudyumno 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: puṃstvam abhilaṣadbhiḥ yathāvat iṣṭaḥ tad prasādāt ca asau ilā punar api sudyumnaḥ bhavat
translated: who desired manhood, was duly worshipped. And by his grace, Ila again became Sudyumna.

original: tasyāpy utkalagayavinatasaṃjñās trayaḥ putrā babhūvuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasya api utkala gaya vinata saṃjñāḥ trayaḥ putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: And he had three sons named Utkalā, Gaya, and Vinata.

original: sudyumnas tu strīpūrvakatvād rājyabhāgaṃ na lebhe // / / //
analyzed: sudyumnaḥ tu strī pūrvaka tvāt rājya bhāgam na lebhe
translated: But Sudyumna, because he was formerly a woman, did not obtain a share in the kingdom.

original: tatpitrā tu vasiṣṭhavacanāt pratiṣṭhānaṃ nāma nagaraṃ sudyumnāya dattaṃ tac cāsau purūravase prādāt // / / //
analyzed: tad pitrā tu vasiṣṭha vacanāt pratiṣṭhānam nāma nagaram sudyumnāya dattam tat ca asau purūravase prādāt
translated: But his father, at the advice of Vasishtha, gave the city named Pratiṣṭhāna to Sudyumna, and he gave it to Purūravas.

original: pṛṣadhras tu manoḥ putro gurugovadhāc chūdratvam agamat // / / //
analyzed: pṛṣadhraḥ tu manoḥ putraḥ guru go vadhāt śūdra tvam agamat
translated: But Prishadhra, the son of Manu, became a Shudra because of killing a Guru and a cow.

original: karūṣāt kārūṣāḥ kṣatriyā mahābalaparākramā babhūvuḥ // / / //
analyzed: karūṣāt kārūṣāḥ kṣatriyāḥ mahā bala parākramāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: From Karusha, the Karushas sprang, Kshatriyas of great strength and prowess.

original: nābhāgo nediṣṭaputras tu vaiśyatām agamat /
analyzed: nābhāgaḥ nediṣṭa putraḥ tu vaiśya tām agamat
translated: Nabhaga, the son of Neḍiṣṭha, became a Vaiśya.

original: tasmād bhalandanaḥ putro 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt bhalandanaḥ putraḥ bhavat
translated: From him was born a son named Bhalandana.

original: bhalandanād vatsaprir udārakīrtiḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhalandanāt vatsapriḥ udāra kīrtiḥ
translated: From Bhalandana was born Vatsapri, of great fame.

original: vatsapreḥ prāṃśur abhavat // / / //
analyzed: vatsapreḥ prāṃśuḥ abhavat
translated: From Vatsapri was born Prāṃśu.

original: prajāniś ca prāṃśor eko 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: prajāniḥ ca prāṃśoḥ ekaḥ bhavat
translated: And from Prāṃśu was born one named Prajāni.

original: tataś ca khanitras tasmāc cakṣupaḥ cakṣupāc cātibalaparākramo viṃśo 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca khanitraḥ tasmāt cakṣupaḥ cakṣupāt ca ati bala parākramaḥ viṃśaḥ bhavat
translated: From him was born Khanitra, from him Chakshus, and from Chakshus was born Vīṃśa, of great strength and valor.

original: tato viviṃśas tasmāc ca khaninetras tataś cātivibhūtiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas viviṃśaḥ tasmāt ca khaninetraḥ tatas ca ativibhūtiḥ
translated: From him was born Vivīṃśa, from him Khaninetra, and from him Ativibhūti.

original: ativibhūter bhūribalaparākramaḥ karaṃdhamaḥ putro 'bhavat tasmād apy avikṣir avikṣer apy atibalaḥ putro marutto 'bhavad yasyemāv adyāpi ślokau 🔽gīyete // / / //
analyzed: ativibhūteḥ bhūri bala parākramaḥ karaṃdhamaḥ putraḥ bhavat tasmāt api avikṣiḥ avikṣeḥ api atibalaḥ putraḥ maruttaḥ bhavat yasya imau adya api ślokau  gīyete
translated: From Ativibhūti was born a son named Karandhama, of great strength and valor. From him was born a son named Avikshit, and from Avikshit a son named Marutta, of great strength. Even today these two verses are sung about him:

original: maruttasya yathā yajñas tathā kasyābhavad bhuvi /
analyzed: maruttasya yathā yajñaḥ tathā kasya bhavat bhuvi
translated: As was Marutta's sacrifice, so was no one's on earth.

original: sarvaṃ hiraṇmayaṃ yasya yajñavastv atiśobhanam // / / //🔽amādyad indraḥ somena dakṣiṇābhir dvijātayaḥ /
analyzed: sarvam hiraṇmayam yasya yajña vastu ati śobhanam  amādyat indraḥ somena dakṣiṇābhiḥ dvijātayaḥ
translated: All the sacrificial articles of which were made of gold, and were extremely beautiful.

original: marutaḥ pariveṣṭāraḥ sadasyāś ca divaukasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: marutaḥ pariveṣṭāraḥ sadasyāḥ ca divaukasaḥ
translated: Indra was satisfied with Soma, the twice-born with gifts, the Maruts were the attendants, and the denizens of heaven were the members of the assembly.

original: maruttaś cakravartī nariṣyantanāmānaṃ putram avāpa // / / //
analyzed: maruttaḥ cakravartī nariṣyanta nāmānam putram avāpa
translated: Marutta obtained a son named Narishyanta.

original: tasmāc ca damo damasya putro rājyavardhano jajñe // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt ca damaḥ damasya putraḥ rājyavardhanaḥ jajñe
translated: And from him was born Dama, Dama's son was Rajyavardhana.

original: rājyavardhanāt sudhṛtir abhūt tataś ca naras tasmāc ca kevalaḥ kevalād bandhumān bandhumato vegavān vegavato budhaś tataś ca tṛṇabinduḥ //
analyzed: rājyavardhanāt sudhṛtiḥ abhūt tatas ca naraḥ tasmāt ca kevalaḥ kevalāt bandhumān bandhumataḥ vegavān vegavataḥ budhaḥ tatas ca tṛṇabinduḥ
translated: From Rajyavardhana was born Sudhriti, from him Nara, from him Kevala, from Kevala Bandhumat, from Bandhumat Vegavat, from Vegavat Budha, and from him Trinabindu.

original: tasyāpy ekā kanyā ilavilā nāma // / / //
analyzed: tasya api ekā kanyā ilavilā nāma
translated: He also had a daughter named Ilvila.

original: taṃ cālambuṣā nāma varāpsarās tṛṇabinduṃ bheje // / / //
analyzed: tam ca alambuṣā nāma vara apsarāḥ tṛṇabindum bheje
translated: And the celestial nymph named Alambusha chose Trinabindu.

original: tasyām asya viśālo jajñe yaḥ purīṃ vaiśālīṃ nāma nirmame // / / //
analyzed: tasyām asya viśālaḥ jajñe yaḥ purīm vaiśālīm nāma nirmame
translated: In her he begot Vishala, who founded the city named Vaishali.

original: hemacandro viśālasya putro 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: hemacandraḥ viśālasya putraḥ bhavat
translated: Vishala's son was Hemachandra.

original: tasmāc ca sucandras tattanayo dhūmrāśvas tasyāpi sṛñjayo 'bhūt // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt ca sucandraḥ tad tanayaḥ dhūmrāśvaḥ tasya api sṛñjayaḥ bhūt
translated: And from him was born Suchandra, his son was Dhumrashva, and from him was born Srinjaya.

original: sṛñjayāt sahadevaḥ /
analyzed: sṛñjayāt sahadevaḥ
translated: From Srinjaya was born Sahadeva.

original: tataḥ kṛśāśvo nāma putro 'bhavat // / / //🔽somadattaḥ kṛśāśvāj jajñe yo daśāśvamedhān ājahāra // / / //🔽tatputraś ca janamejayaḥ /🔽janamejayāt sumatiḥ /
analyzed: tatas kṛśāśvaḥ nāma putraḥ bhavat 🔽somadattaḥ kṛśāśvāt jajñe yaḥ daśa aśvamedhān ājahāra 🔽tad putraḥ ca janamejayaḥ 🔽janamejayāt sumatiḥ
translated: From him was born a son named Kshashtravriddha.🔽From Kshashtravriddha was born Kshashtrasena, from Kshashtrasena was born Kshashtradeva, from Kshashtradeva was born Kshashtrasama, from Kshashtrasama was born Kshashtrasaha, from Kshashtrasaha was born Kshashtrasainika, from Kshashtrasainika was born Kshashtrasaha, from Kshashtrasaha was born Kshashtrasama, from Kshashtrasama was born Kshashtradeva, from Kshashtradeva was born Kshashtrasena, from Kshashtrasena was born Kshashtravriddha, from Kshashtravriddha was born Kshashtrasaha, from Kshashtrasaha was born Kshashtrasama, from Kshashtrasama was born Kshashtradeva, from Kshashtradeva was born Kshashtrasena, from Kshashtrasena was born Kshashtravriddha, from Kshashtravriddha was born Kshashtrasaha, from Kshashtrasaha was born Kshashtrasama, from Kshashtrasama was born Kshashtradeva, from Kshashtradeva was born Kshashtrasena, from Kshashtrasena was born Kshashtravriddha,

original: ete vaiśālikā bhūbhṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ete vaiśālikāḥ bhūbhṛtaḥ
translated: These were the kings of Vaisali.

original: śloko 'py atra gīyate /
analyzed: ślokaḥ pi atra gīyate
translated: A verse is also sung here:

original: tṛṇabindoḥ prasādena sarve vaiśālikā nṛpāḥ /
analyzed: tṛṇabindoḥ prasādena sarve vaiśālikāḥ nṛpāḥ
translated: By the grace of Trinabindu, all the kings of Vaisali,

original: dīrghāyuṣo mahātmāno vīryavanto 'tidhārmikāḥ // / / //
analyzed: dīrgha āyuṣaḥ mahātmānaḥ vīryavantaḥ ti dhārmikāḥ
translated: long-lived, magnanimous, valorous, and greatly devoted to dharma,

original: śaryāteḥ kanyā sukanyā nāmābhavad yām upayeme cyavanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śaryāteḥ kanyā sukanyā nāma abhavat yām upayeme cyavanaḥ
translated: Sharyati had a daughter named Sukanya, whom Chyavana married.

original: ānartaś ca nāma dhārmikaḥ śaryātiputro 'bhūt // / / //
analyzed: ānartaḥ ca nāma dhārmikaḥ śaryāti putraḥ bhūt
translated: And Sharyati had a righteous son named Anarta.

original: ānartasyāpi revato nāma putro jajñe yo 'sāv ānartaviṣayaṃ bubhuje purīṃ ca kuśasthalīm adhyuvāsa // / / //
analyzed: ānartasya api revataḥ nāma putraḥ jajñe saḥ ānarta viṣayam bubhuje purīm ca kuśasthalīm adhyuvāsa
translated: Anarta had a son named Revata, who ruled the land of Anarta and lived in the city of Kushasthali.

original: revatasyāpi raivataḥ putraḥ kakudmī nāma dharmātmā bhrātṛśatasya jyeṣṭho 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: revatasya api raivataḥ putraḥ kakudmī nāma dharma ātmā bhrātṛ śatasya jyeṣṭhaḥ bhavat
translated: Revata had a son named Raivata, who was righteous and the eldest of a hundred brothers.

original: tasya ca revatī nāma kanyā /
analyzed: tasya ca revatī nāma kanyā
translated: And he had a daughter named Revati.

original: tām ādāya kasyeyam arhatīti bhagavantam abjayoniṃ praṣṭuṃ brahmalokaṃ jagāma // / / //
analyzed: tām ādāya kasya iyam arhati iti bhagavantam abjayonim praṣṭum brahma lokam jagāma
translated: Taking her, he went to Brahma's world to ask the lotus-born lord to whom she was worthy of being given.

original: tāvac ca brahmaṇo 'ntike hāhāhūhūsaṃjñābhyāṃ gandharvābhyām atitānaṃ nāma divyaṃ gāndharvam agīyata // / / //
analyzed: tāvat ca brahmaṇaḥ ntike hāhā hūhū saṃjñābhyām gandharvābhyām atitānam nāma divyam gāndharvam agīyata
translated: And in the meantime, near Brahma, the gandharvas named Haha and Huhu were singing a divine gandharva song named Atitana.

original: tāvac ca trimārgaparivartair anekayugaparivṛttitiṣṭhann api raivataḥ śṛṇvan muhūrtam iva mene // / / //
analyzed: tāvat ca tri mārga parivartaiḥ aneka yuga parivṛtti tiṣṭhan api raivataḥ śṛṇvan muhūrtam iva mene
translated: And in the meantime, while Raivata, who had been living for many ages, turning the three paths, heard it, he thought it was only a moment.

original: gītāvasāne ca bhagavantam abjayoniṃ praṇamya raivataḥ kanyāyogyaṃ varam apṛcchat // / / //
analyzed: gīta avasāne ca bhagavantam abjayonim praṇamya raivataḥ kanyā yogyam varam apṛcchat
translated: And at the end of the singing, Raivata, bowing to the Lord of the Lotus, asked for a groom worthy of his daughter.

original: taṃ cāha bhagavān kathaya yo 'bhimatas te vara iti // / / //
analyzed: tam ca āha bhagavān kathaya yaḥ bhimataḥ te varaḥ iti
translated: And the Lord said, Tell me which groom you desire.

original: punaś ca praṇamya bhagavate tasmai yathābhimatān ātmanaḥ sa varān kathayām āsa /
analyzed: punar ca praṇamya bhagavate tasmai yathā abhimatān ātmanaḥ sa varān kathayām āsa
translated: And again bowing to the Lord, he told him the grooms he desired.

original: ka eṣāṃ bhagavato 'bhimato yasmai kanyām imāṃ prayacchāmīti // / / //
analyzed: kaḥ eṣām bhagavataḥ bhimataḥ yasmai kanyām imām prayacchāmi iti
translated: Who among them is desired by the Lord, to whom I shall give my daughter?

original: tataḥ kiṃcidavanataśirāḥ sasmitaṃ bhagavān abjayonir āha // / / //
analyzed: tatas kiṃcid avanata śirāḥ sa smitam bhagavān abjayoniḥ āha
translated: Then the Lord of the Lotus, with his head slightly bent and smiling, said:

original: ya ete bhavato 'bhimatā naiteṣāṃ sāmpratam apatyāpatyasaṃtatir apy avanītale 'sti // / / //
analyzed: ye ete bhavataḥ bhimatāḥ na eteṣām sāmpratam apatya apatya saṃtatiḥ api avanī tale sti
translated: These are not desired by me. They have no offspring or descendants on earth.

original: bahūni hi tavātraiva gāndharvaṃ śṛṇvataś caturyugāny atītāni // / / //
analyzed: bahūni hi tava atra eva gāndharvam śṛṇvataḥ caturyugāni atītāni
translated: For many ages have passed while you were listening to the Gandharva music here.

original: sāmprataṃ hi bhūtale 'ṣṭāviṃśatitamasya manoś caturyugam atītaprāyam āsanno hi tatra kaliḥ // / / //
analyzed: sāmpratam hi bhū tale ṣṭāviṃśatitamasya manoḥ caturyugam atīta prāyam āsannaḥ hi tatra kaliḥ
translated: Now, on this earth, the twenty-eighth four-yuga of Manu is almost over, and Kali is near there.

original: anyasmai kanyāratnam idaṃ bhavataikākinā deyam // / / //
analyzed: anyasmai kanyā ratnam idam bhavatā ekākinā deyam
translated: This jewel of a daughter should be given by you alone to someone else.

original: bhavato 'pi mitramantribhṛtyakalatrabandhubalakośādayaḥ samastāḥ kālenaitenātyantam atītāḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhavataḥ pi mitra mantri bhṛtya kalatra bandhu bala kośa ādayaḥ samastāḥ kālena etena atyantam atītāḥ
translated: All your friends, ministers, servants, wife, relatives, army, treasury, etc. have also passed away completely by this time.

original: tataḥ punar utpannasādhvasaḥ sa rājā bhagavantaṃ praṇamya papraccha // / / //
analyzed: tatas punar utpanna sādhvasaḥ sa rājā bhagavantam praṇamya papraccha
translated: Then, the king, who had again become fearful, bowed to the Blessed One and asked:

original: bhagavann evam avasthite mayeyaṃ kasmai deyeti // / / //
analyzed: bhagavan evam avasthite mayā iyam kasmai deyā iti
translated: Blessed One, in this situation, to whom should I give her?

original: tataḥ sa bhagavān kiṃcidavanamrakandharaṃ kṛtāñjalibhūtaṃ sarvalokagurur abjayonir āha // / / //
analyzed: tatas sa bhagavān kiṃcid avanamra kandharam kṛtāñjali bhūtam sarva loka guruḥ abjayoniḥ āha
translated: Then, the Blessed One, the Lotus-born, the Guru of all worlds, said to him, who had bent his neck slightly and joined his palms in reverence:

original: brahmovāca /
analyzed: brahmā uvāca
translated: Brahma said:

original: na hy ādimadhyāntam ajasya yasya vidmo vayaṃ sarvamayasya dhātuḥ /
analyzed: na hi ādi madhya antam ajasya yasya vidmaḥ vayam sarva mayasya dhātuḥ
translated: We do not know the beginning, middle, or end of the unborn one, the creator of all.

original: na ca svarūpaṃ na paraṃ svabhāvaṃ na caiva sāraṃ parameśvarasya // / / //
analyzed: na ca svarūpam na param svabhāvam na ca eva sāram parameśvarasya
translated: We do not know his true nature, his supreme essence, or his ultimate reality.

original: kalāmuhūrtādimayaś ca kālo na yadvibhūteḥ pariṇāmahetuḥ /
analyzed: kalā muhūrta ādi mayaḥ ca kālaḥ na yad vibhūteḥ pariṇāma hetuḥ
translated: Time, consisting of kalas, muhurtas, etc., is not the cause of transformation of his glory.

original: ajanmanāśasya samastamūrter anāmarūpasya sanātanasya // / / //
analyzed: a janma nāśasya samasta mūrteḥ a nāma rūpasya sanātanasya
translated: To the unborn and undying one, the embodiment of all, the one without name or form, the eternal one.

original: yasya prasādād aham acyutasya bhūtaḥ prajāsṛṣṭikaro 'ntakārī /
analyzed: yasya prasādāt aham acyutasya bhūtaḥ prajā sṛṣṭi karaḥ nta kārī
translated: By whose grace, I am Achyuta, the creator and destroyer of beings.

original: krodhāc ca rudraḥ sthitihetubhūto yasmāc ca madhye puruṣaḥ parasmāt // / / //
analyzed: krodhāt ca rudraḥ sthiti hetu bhūtaḥ yasmāt ca madhye puruṣaḥ parasmāt
translated: And Rudra, the cause of sustenance, is born from his anger, and the Purusha in the middle is from the Supreme One.

original: madrūpam āsthāya sṛjaty ajo yaḥ sthitau ca yo 'sau puruṣasvarūpī /
analyzed: mad rūpam āsthāya sṛjati ajaḥ yaḥ sthitau ca puruṣa svarūpī
translated: The unborn one creates by assuming my form, and in sustenance, he assumes the form of Purusha.

original: rudrasvarūpeṇa ca yo 'tti viśvaṃ dhatte tathānantavapuḥ samastam // / / //
analyzed: rudra sva rūpeṇa ca yaḥ viśvam dhatte tathā ananta vapuḥ samastam
translated: And in the form of Rudra, he consumes the universe, and in the form of Ananta, he supports the entire universe.

original: śakrādirūpī paripāti viśvam arkendurūpaś ca tamo hinasti /
analyzed: śakra ādi rūpī paripāti viśvam arka indu rūpaḥ ca tamaḥ hinasti
translated: Assuming the form of Shakra and others, he protects the universe, and in the form of the sun and moon, he destroys darkness.

original: pākāya yo 'gnitvam upetya lokān bibharti pṛthvīvapur avyayātmā // / / //🔽ceṣṭāṃ karoti śvasanasvarūpī lokasya tṛptiṃ ca jalānnarūpī /
analyzed: pākāya yaḥ gni tvam upetya lokān bibharti pṛthvī vapuḥ avyaya ātmā  ceṣṭām karoti śvasana svarūpī lokasya tṛptim ca jala anna rūpī
translated: Assuming the form of fire, he sustains the worlds for their digestion, and in the form of the earth, he supports the imperishable self.🔽Assuming the form of breath, he causes the movement of the world, and in the form of water and food, he grants satisfaction to the world.

original: dadāti viśvasthitisaṃsthitas tu sarvāvakāśaṃ ca nabhaḥsvarūpī // / / //
analyzed: dadāti viśva sthiti saṃsthitaḥ tu sarva avakāśam ca nabhaḥ svarūpī
translated: Abiding in the establishment of the universe, he assumes the form of space, which is the abode of all.

original: yaḥ sṛjyate sargakṛd ātmanaiva yaḥ pālyate pālayitā ca devaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ sṛjyate sarga kṛt ātmanā eva yaḥ pālyate pālayitā ca devaḥ
translated: The creator himself is created, and the protector god is protected.

original: viśvātmanā saṃhriyate 'ntakārī pṛthak trayasyāsya ca yo 'vyayātmā // / / //
analyzed: viśva ātmanā saṃhriyate ntakārī pṛthak trayasya asya ca yaḥ vyaya ātmā
translated: The destroyer of the universe, the imperishable soul of the three, is withdrawn in his universal form.

original: yasmiñ jagad yo jagad etad ādyo yaś cāśrito 'smiñ jagati svayaṃbhūḥ /
analyzed: yasmin jagat yaḥ jagat etat ādyaḥ yaḥ ca āśritaḥ smin jagati svayaṃbhūḥ
translated: In whom the world exists, who is the first of this world, and who is the self-existent one dependent on this world,

original: sa sarvabhūtaprabhavo dharitryāṃ svāṃśena viṣṇur nṛpate 'vatīrṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa sarva bhūta prabhavaḥ dharitryām sva aṃśena viṣṇuḥ nṛpate vatīrṇaḥ
translated: That origin of all beings, Vishnu, has descended on earth with a part of himself, O king.

original: kuśasthalī yā tava bhūpa ramyā purī purābhūd amarāvatīva /
analyzed: kuśasthalī yā tava bhūpa ramyā purī purā abhūt amarāvatī iva
translated: O king, that beautiful city of yours, Kusasthali, which was formerly like Amaravati,

original: sā dvārakā saṃprati tatra cāste sa keśavāṃśo baladevanāmā // / / //
analyzed: sā dvārakā saṃprati tatra ca āste sa keśava aṃśaḥ baladeva nāmā
translated: That Dvaraka now exists there, and that part of Keshava is named Baladeva.

original: tasmai tvam enāṃ tanayāṃ narendra prayaccha māyāmanujāya jāyām /
analyzed: tasmai tvam enām tanayām narendra prayaccha māyā manu jāya jāyām
translated: O king, give this daughter of yours to that son of Maya as a wife.

original: ślāghyo varo 'sau tanayā taveyaṃ strīratnabhūtā sadṛśo hi yogaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ślāghyaḥ sau tanayā tava iyam strī ratna bhūtā sadṛśaḥ hi yogaḥ
translated: That bridegroom is praiseworthy, and this daughter of yours is a jewel of a woman; the union is indeed proper.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: itīrito 'sau kamalodbhavena bhuvaṃ samāsādya patiḥ prajānām /🔽dadarśa hrasvān puruṣān aśeṣān alpaujasaḥ svalpavivekavīryān // / / //
analyzed: iti īritaḥ sau kamalodbhavena bhuvam samāsādya patiḥ prajānām  dadarśa hrasvān puruṣān aśeṣān alpa ojasaḥ su alpa viveka vīryān
translated: Thus addressed by the lotus-born one, the lord of beings came down to earth,🔽and saw all the short men, of little strength and little discrimination and energy.

original: kuśasthalīṃ tāṃ ca purīm upetya dṛṣṭvānyarūpāṃ pradadau svakanyām /
analyzed: kuśasthalīm tām ca purīm upetya dṛṣṭvā anya rūpām pradadau sva kanyām
translated: And having reached that city of Kusasthali, he saw it in a different form and gave his daughter to him.

original: sīradhvajāya sphaṭikācalābha vakṣaḥsthalāyātuladhīr narendraḥ // / / //🔽uccapramāṇām iti tām avekṣya svalāṅgalāgreṇa sa tālaketuḥ /🔽vināmayām āsa tataś ca sāpi babhūva sadyo vanitā yathānyā // / / //
analyzed: sīra dhvajāya sphaṭika acala ābha vakṣaḥsthalāya atula dhīḥ narendraḥ  ucca pramāṇām iti tām avekṣya sva lāṅgala agreṇa sa tālaketuḥ  vināmayām āsa tatas ca sā api babhūva sadyas vanitā yathā anyā
translated: The king of incomparable wisdom, the son of Vivasvat, gave her to the king of Sivi, whose chest was as bright as crystal or a mountain.🔽Seeing her of such great height, the king of Sivi, with the end of his plough, bent her down, and she immediately became an ordinary woman.

original: tāṃ revatīṃ raivatabhūpakanyāṃ sīrāyudho 'sau vidhinopayeme /
analyzed: tām revatīm raivata bhūpa kanyām sīrāyudhaḥ sau vidhinā upayeme
translated: Then that plough-wielding king married Revati, the daughter of the king of Raivata, according to the prescribed rites.

original: dattvā ca kanyāṃ sa nṛpo jagāma himālayaṃ vai tapase dhṛtātmā // / / //
analyzed: dattvā ca kanyām sa nṛpaḥ jagāma himālayam vai tapase dhṛta ātmā
translated: And the king, having given his daughter, went to the Himalayas to perform austerities, with his mind fixed on (Vishnu).

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe prathamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe prathamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the first chapter in the fourth section of the Visnu Purana, dealing with the creation.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: yāvac ca brahmalokāt kakudmī raivato nābhyeti tāvat puṇyajanasaṃjñā rākṣasās tām asya purīṃ kuśasthalīṃ jaghnuḥ // / / //
analyzed: yāvat ca brahma lokāt kakudmī raivataḥ na abhyeti tāvat puṇyajana saṃjñāḥ rākṣasāḥ tām asya purīm kuśasthalīm jaghnuḥ
translated: While Raivata Kakudmi was away from the world of Brahma, the Rakshasas called Punyajanas attacked and destroyed his city Kusha-sthali.

original: tac cāsya bhrātṛśataṃ puṇyajanatrāsād diśo bheje // / / //
analyzed: tat ca asya bhrātṛ śatam puṇyajana trāsāt diśaḥ bheje
translated: And his hundred brothers, frightened of the Punyajanas, fled in different directions.

original: tadanvayāś ca kṣatriyāḥ sarvadikṣv abhavan // / / //
analyzed: tad anvayāḥ ca kṣatriyāḥ sarva dikṣu abhavan
translated: And their descendants became Kshatriyas in all directions.

original: dhṛṣṭasyāpi dhārṣṭakaṃ kṣatram abhavat // / / //
analyzed: dhṛṣṭasya api dhārṣṭakam kṣatram abhavat
translated: And Dhrisht's Kshatriya race was called Dharshtuka.

original: nabhagasyātmajo nābhāgasaṃjño 'bhavat /
analyzed: nabhagasya ātmajaḥ nābhāga saṃjñaḥ bhavat
translated: Nabhaga's son was called Nabha.

original: tasya ambarīṣaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ambarīṣaḥ
translated: His son was Ambarīṣa.

original: ambarīṣasyāpi virūpo 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: ambarīṣasya api virūpaḥ bhavat
translated: Ambarīṣa's son was Virūpa.

original: virūpāt pṛṣadaśvo jajñe tataś ca rathītaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: virūpāt pṛṣadaśvaḥ jajñe tatas ca rathītaraḥ
translated: From Virūpa was born Pṛṣadaśva, and from him Rathītarā.

original: tatrāyaṃ ślokaḥ /
analyzed: tatra ayam ślokaḥ
translated: Regarding him, there is this verse:

original: ete kṣatraprasūtā vai punaś cāṅgirasāḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: ete kṣatra prasūtāḥ vai punar ca āṅgirasāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: These were born in the Kṣatriya race and are again remembered as descendants of Aṅgiras.

original: rathītarāṇāṃ pravarāḥ kṣatropetā dvijātayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: rathītarāṇām pravarāḥ kṣatra upetāḥ dvijātayaḥ
translated: The Rathītaras are the best among the Kṣatriyas, the twice-born who are associated with the Kṣatriyas.

original: kṣuvataś ca manor ikṣvākur ghrāṇataḥ putro jajñe // / / //
analyzed: kṣuvataḥ ca manoḥ ikṣvākuḥ ghrāṇataḥ putraḥ jajñe
translated: And from Manu's mouth, Ikṣvāku was born as his son.

original: tasya putraśatapravarā vikukṣinimidaṇḍākhyās trayaḥ putrā /
analyzed: tasya putra śata pravarāḥ vikukṣi nimi daṇḍa ākhyāḥ trayaḥ
translated: He had three sons, the eldest of whom was Vikukṣi, the middle one was Nimi, and the youngest was Daṇḍa.

original: śakunipramukhāḥ pañcāśat putrāḥ uttarāpatharakṣitāro babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: śakuni pramukhāḥ pañcāśat putrāḥ uttarāpatha rakṣitāraḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: The fifty sons headed by Śakuni became the rulers of the northern region.

original: catvāriṃśad aṣṭau ca dakṣiṇāpathabhūpālāḥ // / / //
analyzed: catvāriṃśat aṣṭau ca dakṣiṇāpatha bhūpālāḥ
translated: Forty-eight became the rulers of the southern region.

original: sa cekṣvākur aṣṭakāyām utpādya śrāddhārhaṃ māṃsam ānayeti vikukṣim ājñāpayām āsa /
analyzed: sa ca ikṣvākuḥ aṣṭakāyām utpādya śrāddha arham māṃsam ānaya iti vikukṣim ājñāpayām āsa
translated: That Ikṣvāku ordered Vikukṣi, Bring me meat fit for a śrāddha on the eighth lunar day.

original: sa tatheti gṛhītājño vanam abhyetyānekān mṛgān hatvātiśrānto 'tikṣutparīto vikukṣir ekaṃ śaśam abhakṣayat /
analyzed: sa tathā iti gṛhīta ājñaḥ vanam abhyetya anekān mṛgān hatvā ati śrāntaḥ ti kṣudh parītaḥ vikukṣiḥ ekam śaśam abhakṣayat
translated: He agreed and went to the forest, killed many deer, and being very tired and extremely hungry, Vikukṣi ate one rabbit.

original: śeṣaṃ ca māṃsam ānīya pitre nivedayām āsa // / / //
analyzed: śeṣam ca māṃsam ānīya pitre nivedayām āsa
translated: He brought the remaining meat and informed his father.

original: ikṣvākukulācāryas tatprokṣaṇāya vasiṣṭhaś coditaḥ prāha /
analyzed: ikṣvāku kula ācāryaḥ tad prokṣaṇāya vasiṣṭhaḥ coditaḥ prāha
translated: The family priest of the Ikshvaku dynasty, Vasishtha, was called to sprinkle the food. He said:

original: alam anenāmedhyenāmiṣeṇa durātmanānena te putreṇaitan māṃsam upahataṃ yato 'nena śaśo bhakṣitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: alam anena amedhyena āmiṣeṇa durātmanā anena te putreṇa etat māṃsam upahatam yatas nena śaśaḥ bhakṣitaḥ
translated: Enough of this impure meat. This son of yours is wicked. This meat has been defiled by him because he has eaten a hare.

original: tataś cāsau vikukṣir guruṇaivam uktaḥ śaśādasaṃjñām avāpa pitrā ca parityaktaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca asau vikukṣiḥ guruṇā evam uktaḥ śaśāda saṃjñām avāpa pitrā ca parityaktaḥ
translated: Then Vikuksi, thus addressed by his Guru, received the name of Shashada and was abandoned by his father.

original: pitary uparate cākhilām etāṃ pṛthvīṃ dharmataḥ śaśāsa // / / //
analyzed: pitari uparate ca akhilām etām pṛthvīm dharmataḥ śaśāsa
translated: And when his father passed away, he righteously ruled this entire earth.

original: śaśādasya puraṃjayo nāma putro 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: śaśādasya puraṃjayaḥ nāma putraḥ bhavat
translated: Shashada had a son named Puranjaya.

original: idaṃ cānyat purā hi tretāyāṃ devāsuram atīva bhīṣaṇaṃ yuddham āsīt /
analyzed: idam ca anyat purā hi tretāyām devāsuram atīva bhīṣaṇam yuddham āsīt
translated: And this other thing happened in ancient times, in the Treta age, there was a very terrible war between the gods and the demons.

original: tatra cātibalibhir asurair amarāḥ parājitā bhagavantaṃ viṣṇum ārādhayāṃ cakruḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatra ca ati balibhiḥ asuraiḥ amarāḥ parājitāḥ bhagavantam viṣṇum ārādhayām cakruḥ
translated: And in that war, the immortals were defeated by the extremely powerful demons and they propitiated Lord Vishnu.

original: prasannaś ca devānām anādinidhanaḥ sakalajagatparāyaṇo nārāyaṇaḥ prāha /
analyzed: prasannaḥ ca devānām an ādi nidhanaḥ sakala jagat parāyaṇaḥ nārāyaṇaḥ prāha
translated: And the god Narayana, who has no beginning or end and is the ultimate refuge of the entire world, being pleased, said:

original: jñātam eva mayā yuṣmābhir yad abhilaṣitaṃ tadartham idaṃ śrūyatām /
analyzed: jñātam eva mayā yuṣmābhiḥ yat abhilaṣitam tad artham idam śrūyatām
translated: I know very well what you desire. Listen to this for that purpose.

original: puraṃjayo nāma śaśādasya ca rājarṣes tanayaḥ kṣatriyavaryas taccharīre 'ham aṃśena
analyzed: puraṃjayaḥ nāma śaśādasya ca rājarṣeḥ tanayaḥ kṣatriya varyaḥ tad śarīre ham aṃśena
translated: And the best of Kshatriyas, the son of the royal sage Shashada, named Puranjaya, I myself, having descended with a portion of myself into his body,

original: svayam evāvatīrya tān aśeṣān asurān nihaniṣyāmi tad bhavadbhiḥ puraṃjayo 'suravadhārthāya
analyzed: svayam eva avatīrya tān aśeṣān asurān nihaniṣyāmi tat bhavadbhiḥ puraṃjayaḥ sura vadha arthāya
translated: will slay all those Asuras. Therefore, you should strive to kill the Asuras for the sake of Puranjaya.

original: kāryodyogaḥ kārya iti etac ca śrutvā praṇamya bhagavantaṃ viṣṇum amarāḥ puraṃjayasakāśam
analyzed: kārya udyogaḥ kāryaḥ iti etat ca śrutvā praṇamya bhagavantam viṣṇum amarāḥ puraṃjaya sakāśam
translated: This should be done. Having heard this and bowed to Lord Vishnu, the immortals

original: ājagmuḥ // / / //
analyzed: ājagmuḥ
translated: went to Puranjaya.

original: ūcuś cainaṃ /
analyzed: ūcuḥ ca enam
translated: And they said to him:

original: bho bhoḥ kṣatriyavaryāsmābhir abhyarthitena bhavatāsmākam arātivadhodyatānāṃ sāhāyyaṃ kṛtam icchāmaḥ /🔽tad bhavatāsmākam abhyāgatānāṃ praṇayabhaṅgo na kāryaḥ /
analyzed: bho bhoḥ kṣatriya varya asmābhiḥ abhyarthitena bhavatā asmākam arāti vadha udyatānām sāhāyyam kṛtam icchāmaḥ  tat bhavatā asmākam abhyāgatānām praṇaya bhaṅgaḥ na kāryaḥ
translated: O best of Kshatriyas, we request you to help us who are ready to kill our enemies.

original: ity uktaḥ puraṃjayaḥ prāha /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ puraṃjayaḥ prāha
translated: Therefore, you should not disappoint us who have come to you. Thus addressed, Puranjaya said:

original: sakalatrailokyanātho yo 'yaṃ yuṣmākam indraḥ śatakratur asya yady ahaṃ skandhārūḍho yuṣmadarātibhiḥ saha yotsye tadāhaṃ bhavatāṃ sahāyaḥ /
analyzed: sakala trailokya nāthaḥ yaḥ yam yuṣmākam indraḥ śatakratuḥ asya yadi aham skandha ārūḍhaḥ yuṣmad arātibhiḥ saha yotsye tadā aham bhavatām sahāyaḥ
translated: If I can fight with your enemies, riding on the shoulders of this Indra Shatakratu, the lord of the three worlds, then I will be your ally.

original: ity ākarṇya samastadevair indreṇa ca bāḍham ity evaṃ samanvicchitam // / / //
analyzed: iti ākarṇya samasta devaiḥ indreṇa ca bāḍham iti evam samanvicchitam
translated: Having heard this, it was agreed by all the gods and Indra that it should be so.

original: tataś ca śatakrator vṛṣabharūpadhāriṇaḥ kakutstho 'tiharṣasamanvito bhagavataś carācaraguror acyutasya tejasāpyāyito devāsurasaṃgrāme samastān 🔽evāsurān nijaghāna // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca śatakratoḥ vṛṣabha rūpa dhāriṇaḥ kakutsthaḥ u ti harṣa samanvitaḥ bhagavataḥ carācara guroḥ acyutasya tejasā āpyāyitaḥ deva asura saṃgrāme samastān  eva asurān nijaghāna
translated: And being strengthened by the power of the Lord, the Guru of the moving and unmoving world, the undeceiving one, he killed all the demons in the battle between the gods and demons.

original: yataś ca vṛṣabhakakutsthena rājñā niṣūditam asurabalam ataś cāsau kakutsthasaṃjñām avāpa // / / //
analyzed: yatas ca vṛṣabha kakud sthena rājñā niṣūditam asura balam atas ca asau kakutstha saṃjñām avāpa
translated: And because the demon army was destroyed by King Kakutstha, he came to be known as Kakutstha.

original: kakutsthasyāpy anenāḥ putro 'bhūt pṛthur anenasaḥ pṛthor viśvagaśvas tasyāpi cāndro
analyzed: kakutsthasya api anenāḥ putraḥ bhūt pṛthuḥ anenasaḥ pṛthoḥ viśvagaśvaḥ tasya api cāndraḥ
translated: Kakutstha's son was Anenas, Anenas' son was Prithu, Prithu's son was Vishvagashva, Vishvagashva's son was Chandra.

original: yuvanāśvaś cāndrasya tasya yuvanāśvasya śrāvasto yaḥ purīṃ śrāvastīṃ niveśayām āsa // / / //🔽śrāvastasya bṛhadaśvas tasyāpi kuvalayāśvo yo 'sāv uttaṅkasya maharṣer apakāriṇaṃ
analyzed: yuvanāśvaḥ cāndrasya tasya yuvanāśvasya śrāvastaḥ yaḥ purīm śrāvastīm niveśayām āsa  śrāvastasya bṛhadaśvaḥ tasya api kuvalayāśvaḥ yaḥ sau uttaṅkasya mahā ṛṣeḥ apakāriṇam
translated: Chandra's son was Yuvanashva, Yuvanashva's son was Shravashtashva, who founded the city of Shravasti.🔽Shravashtashva's son was Brihadashva, Brihadashva's son was Kuvalayashva, who, being strengthened by the power of Vishnu, killed the demon named Dhundhu, who had wronged the great sage Utanka,

original: dhundhunāmānam asuraṃ vaiṣṇavena tejasāpyāyitaḥ putrasahasrair ekaviṃśatibhiḥ parivṛto
analyzed: dhundhu nāmānam asuram vaiṣṇavena tejasā āpyāyitaḥ putra sahasraiḥ ekaviṃśatibhiḥ parivṛtaḥ
translated: and who was surrounded by twenty-one thousand sons.

original: jaghāna dhundhumārasaṃjñāṃ cāvāpa // / / //
analyzed: jaghāna dhundhumāra saṃjñām ca avāpa
translated: And he came to be known as Dhundhumara.

original: tasya ca samastā eva putrā dhundhumukhaniḥśvāsāgninā vipluṣṭā vineśuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasya ca samastāḥ eva putrāḥ dhundhu mukha niḥśvāsa agninā vipluṣṭāḥ vineśuḥ
translated: And all his sons, except three, were consumed by the fire from Dhundhu's mouth and perished.

original: dṛḍhāśvacandrāśvakapilāśvās trayaḥ kevalaṃ avaśeṣitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: dṛḍhāśva candrāśva kapilāśvāḥ trayaḥ kevalam avaśeṣitāḥ
translated: The three who survived were Dṛḍhāśva, Candrāśva, and Kapilāśva.

original: dṛḍhāśvād dharyaśvas tasmān nikumbho nikumbhāt saṃhitāśvaḥ /
analyzed: dṛḍhāśvāt haryaśvaḥ tasmāt nikumbhaḥ nikumbhāt saṃhitāśvaḥ
translated: From Dṛḍhāśva came Haryakṣa, from him Nikumbha, from Nikumbha Saṃhitāśva.

original: tataś ca kṛśāśvas /
analyzed: tatas ca kṛśāśvaḥ
translated: From him Kṛśāśva,

original: tasmāc ca prasenajit tato yuvanāśvo 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt ca prasenajit tatas yuvanāśvaḥ bhavat
translated: from him Prasenajit, from him Yuvanāśva.

original: tasya cāputrasyātinirvedān munīnām āśramamaṇḍale nivasataḥ kṛpālubhis tair munibhir apatyotpādanāya iṣṭiḥ kṛtā /
analyzed: tasya ca aputrasya ati nirvedāt munīnām āśrama maṇḍale nivasataḥ kṛpālubhiḥ taiḥ munibhiḥ apatya utpādanāya iṣṭiḥ kṛtā
translated: And when he had no son, while dwelling in a circle of sages' hermitages out of great sorrow, those compassionate sages performed a sacrifice to bring forth offspring.

original: tasyāṃ ca madhyarātrinivṛttāyāṃ mantrapūtajalapūrṇaṃ kalaśaṃ vedimadhye niveśya te munayaḥ suṣupuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasyām ca madhya rātri nivṛttāyām mantra pūta jala pūrṇam kalaśam vedi madhye niveśya te munayaḥ suṣupuḥ
translated: And when the sacrifice was completed at midnight, they placed a pot filled with water purified by mantras in the middle of the altar and fell asleep.

original: teṣu ca supteṣv atitṛṭparītaḥ sa bhūpālas tam āśramaṃ viveśa // / / //
analyzed: teṣu ca supteṣu ati tṛṣ parītaḥ sa bhūpālaḥ tam āśramam viveśa
translated: And while they were sleeping, the king, tormented by extreme thirst, entered the hermitage.

original: suptāṃś ca tān ṛṣīn naivotthāpayām āsa /
analyzed: suptān ca tān ṛṣīn na eva utthāpayām āsa
translated: And he did not wake up the sleeping sages.

original: tac ca kalaśajalam aparimeyamāhātmyaṃ mantrapūtaṃ papau // / / //
analyzed: tat ca kalaśa jalam aparimeya māhātmyam mantra pūtam papau
translated: And he drank the water from the pot, which had immeasurable greatness and was purified by mantras.

original: prabuddhāś ca ṛṣayaḥ papracchuḥ kenaitan mantrapūtaṃ vāri pītam // / / //
analyzed: prabuddhāḥ ca ṛṣayaḥ papracchuḥ kena etat mantra pūtam vāri pītam
translated: And the awakened sages asked, By whom was this water purified with mantras drunk?

original: atra hi pīte rājño yuvanāśvasya patnī mahābalaparākramaṃ putraṃ janayiṣyatīty ākarṇya sa rājā ajānatā mayā pītam ity āha // / / //
analyzed: atra hi pīte rājñaḥ yuvanāśvasya patnī mahā bala parākramam putram janayiṣyati iti ākarṇya sa rājā a jānatā mayā pītam iti āha
translated: For it was heard that if this water was drunk by King Yuvanashva's wife, she would give birth to a son of great strength and valor. The king said, It was drunk by me unknowingly.

original: garbhaś ca yuvanāśvasyodare 'bhavat krameṇa ca vavṛdhe // / / //
analyzed: garbhaḥ ca yuvanāśvasya udare bhavat krameṇa ca vavṛdhe
translated: And the embryo became in the womb of Yuvanashva, and gradually grew.

original: prāptasamayaś ca dakṣiṇakukṣim avanīpater nirbhidya niścakrāma na cāsau rājā mamāra // / / //
analyzed: prāpta samayaḥ ca dakṣiṇa kukṣim avanīpateḥ nirbhidya niścakrāma na ca asau rājā mamāra
translated: And when the time came, it pierced the right side of the king and came out. And the king did not die.

original: jāto nāmaiṣa kaṃ dhāsyatīti munayaḥ procuḥ // / / //
analyzed: jātaḥ nāma eṣa kam dhāsyati iti munayaḥ procuḥ
translated: The sages said, Who will nourish this one who is born?

original: athāgamya devarāḍ abravīt mām ayaṃ dhāsyatīti // / / //
analyzed: atha āgamya devarāj abravīt mām ayam dhāsyati iti
translated: Then the king of gods came and said, This one will nourish me.

original: tato māṃdhātā nāmato 'bhavat /🔽vaktre cāsya pradeśinī devarājena nyastā tāṃ papau /
analyzed: tatas māṃdhātā nāmataḥ bhavat  vaktre ca asya pradeśinī devarājena nyastā tām papau
translated: Therefore, he became known as Mandhatri.🔽And the forefinger was placed in his mouth by the king of gods. He sucked it.

original: tāṃ cāmṛtasrāviṇīm āsvādyāhnaiva sa vyavardhata // / / //
analyzed: tām ca amṛta srāviṇīm āsvādya ahnā eva sa vyavardhata
translated: And having tasted that which exuded nectar, he grew up in a day.

original: sa tu māṃdhātā cakravartī saptadvīpāṃ mahīṃ bubhuje // / / //
analyzed: sa tu māṃdhātā cakravartī sapta dvīpām mahīm bubhuje
translated: And that Mandhatri became a universal monarch and ruled the earth with its seven islands.

original: bhavati cātra ślokaḥ /
analyzed: bhavati ca atra ślokaḥ
translated: And there is a verse here:

original: yāvat sūrya udeti sma yāvac ca pratitiṣṭhati /
analyzed: yāvat sūryaḥ udeti sma yāvat ca pratitiṣṭhati
translated: As long as the sun rises and sets,

original: sarvaṃ tad yauvanāśvasya māṃdhātuḥ kṣetram ucyate // / / //
analyzed: sarvam tat yauvanāśvasya māṃdhātuḥ kṣetram ucyate
translated: all that is said to be the field of Mandhatri, the son of Yuvanashva.

original: māṃdhātā śaśabindor duhitaraṃ bindumatīm upayeme /
analyzed: māṃdhātā śaśabindoḥ duhitaram bindumatīm upayeme
translated: Mandhatri married Bindumadhi, the daughter of Shashabindu.

original: purukutsam ambarīṣaṃ ca mucakundaṃ ca tasyāṃ putratrayam utpādayām āsa // / / //
analyzed: purukutsam ambarīṣam ca mucakundam ca tasyām putra trayam utpādayām āsa
translated: He begot three sons on her: Purukutsa, Ambarisha, and Muchukunda.

original: pañcāśac ca duhitaras tasya nṛpater babhūvuḥ // / / //
analyzed: pañcāśat ca duhitaraḥ tasya nṛpateḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: And that king had fifty daughters.

original: bahvṛcaś ca saubharir nāma ṛṣir antarjale dvādaśābdaṃ kālam uvāsa // / / //
analyzed: bahvṛcaḥ ca saubhariḥ nāma ṛṣiḥ antar jale dvādaśa abdam kālam uvāsa
translated: And a sage named Saubhari, a reciter of the Rig Veda, lived in the water for twelve years.

original: tatra cāntarjale saṃmado nāmātibahuprajo 'tipramāṇo mīnādhipatir āsīt /
analyzed: tatra ca antar jale saṃmadaḥ nāma ati bahu prajaḥ tipramāṇaḥ mīna adhipatiḥ āsīt
translated: And in that water there was a very populous and huge fish king named Sammada.

original: tasya ca putrapautradauhitrāḥ pārśvataḥ pṛṣṭhato 'grato vakṣaḥpucchaśirasāṃ copari bhramantas tenaiva sahāharniśam atinirvṛtā remire // / /
analyzed: tasya ca putra pautra dauhitrāḥ pārśvatas pṛṣṭhatas gratas vakṣaḥ puccha śirasām ca upari bhramantaḥ tena eva saha aharniśam ati nirvṛtāḥ remire  /
translated: And his sons, grandsons, and great-grandsons, moving around on his sides, back, front, chest, tail, and head, sported with him day and night, extremely happy.

original: sa cāpi tatsparśopacīyamānaharṣaprakarṣo bahuprakāraṃ tasya ṛṣeḥ paśyatas tair ātmajapautradauhitrādibhiḥ sahānudinaṃ bahuprakāraṃ reme //
analyzed: sa ca api tad sparśa upacīyamāna harṣa prakarṣaḥ bahu prakāram tasya ṛṣeḥ paśyataḥ taiḥ ātmaja pautra dauhitra ādibhiḥ saha anudinam bahu prakāram reme
translated: And he, his joy increasing by the touch of them, sported with his own children, grandchildren, great-grandchildren, and so on, in many ways, every day, in the presence of that sage.

original: athāntarjalāvasthitaḥ sa saubharir ekāgratāsamādhānam apahāyānudinaṃ tat tasya matsyasyātmajapautradauhitrādibhiḥ sahātiramaṇīyaṃ lalitam avekṣyācintayat
analyzed: atha antar jala avasthitaḥ sa saubhariḥ ekāgra tā samādhānam apahāya anudinam tat tasya matsyasya ātmaja pautra dauhitra ādibhiḥ saha ati ramaṇīyam lalitam avekṣya acintayat
translated: Then, as Subari was staying in the water, he gave up his one-pointed concentration and saw every day the great sport of that fish with his sons, grandsons, great-grandsons, and so on, and thought:

original: aho dhanyo 'yam īdṛśam apy anabhimataṃ yonyantaram avāpyaibhir ātmajapautrādibhiḥ saha ramamāṇo 'tīvāsmākaṃ spṛhām utpādayati /
analyzed: aho dhanyaḥ yam īdṛśam api anabhimatam yoni antaram avāpya ebhiḥ ātmaja pautra ādibhiḥ saha ramamāṇaḥ tīva asmākam spṛhām utpādayati
translated: Oh, how fortunate this one is! Even having obtained such an undesirable other birth, he is enjoying himself with his sons, grandsons, and so on, and is producing great longing in us.

original: vayam apy evaṃ putrādibhiḥ saha ramiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam api evam putra ādibhiḥ saha ramiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We too will enjoy ourselves like this with our sons and so on.

original: ity evam abhisamīkṣya sa tasmād antarjalān niṣkramya nirveṣṭukāmaḥ kanyārthaṃ māṃdhātāraṃ rājānam agacchat // / / //
analyzed: iti evam abhisamīkṣya sa tasmāt antar jalāt niṣkramya nirveṣṭu kāmaḥ kanyā artham māṃdhātāram rājānam agacchat
translated: Having considered this, he came out of the water and, desiring to get married, went to King Mandhatri for a daughter.

original: āgamanaśravaṇasamanantaraṃ cotthāya tena rājñā samyag arghādinā pūjitaḥ kṛtāsanaparigrahaḥ saubharir uvāca // / / //
analyzed: āgamana śravaṇa samanantaram ca utthāya tena rājñā samyak argha ādinā pūjitaḥ kṛta āsana parigrahaḥ saubhariḥ uvāca
translated: And as soon as he heard of his arrival, the king rose up and honored him properly with the argha offering and so on. Accepting the seat offered to him, Subari said:

original: saubharir uvāca /
analyzed: saubhariḥ uvāca
translated: Subari said:

original: nirveṣṭukāmo 'smi narendra kanyāṃ prayaccha me mā praṇayaṃ vibhāṅkṣīḥ /
analyzed: nirveṣṭu kāmaḥ smi narendra kanyām prayaccha me mā praṇayam vibhāṅkṣīḥ
translated: O king, I desire to get married. Give me a daughter. Do not destroy my love.

original: na hy arthinaḥ kāryavaśābhyupetāḥ kakutsthagotre vimukhāḥ prayānti // / / //
analyzed: na hi arthinaḥ kārya vaśa abhyupetāḥ kakutstha gotre vimukhāḥ prayānti
translated: For those who come with a request, being obliged to do what is necessary, do not go away disappointed from the family of Kakutstha.

original: anye 'pi santy eva nṛpāḥ pṛthivyāṃ kṣmāpāla yeṣāṃtanayāḥ prasūtāḥ /
analyzed: anye pi santi eva nṛpāḥ pṛthivyām kṣmāpāla yeṣām tanayāḥ prasūtāḥ
translated: There are other kings on earth, lords of the land, from whom sons have been born.

original: kiṃtv arthinām arthitadānadīkṣā kṛtavrataṃ ślāghyam idaṃ kulaṃ te // / / //
analyzed: kiṃtu arthinām arthita dāna dīkṣā kṛta vratam ślāghyam idam kulam te
translated: But your family is worthy of praise for its vow of giving to supplicants who ask for it.

original: śatārdhasaṃkhyās tava santi kanyās tāsāṃ mamaikāṃ nṛpate prayaccha /
analyzed: śatārdha saṃkhyāḥ tava santi kanyāḥ tāsām mama ekām nṛpate prayaccha
translated: You have fifty daughters. Give me one of them, O king.

original: yat prārthanābhaṅgabhayād bibhemi tasmād ahaṃ rājavarātiduḥkhāt // / / //
analyzed: yat prārthanā bhaṅga bhayāt bibhemi tasmāt aham rāja vara ati duḥkhāt
translated: Because I fear that my request will be refused, I am afraid of the great sorrow of the best of kings.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: iti ṛṣivacanam ākarṇya sa rājā jarājarjaritadehaṃ tam ṛṣim ālokya pratyākhyānakātaras tasmāc ca bhagavataḥ śāpato bibhyatkiṃcidadhomukhaś ciraṃ
analyzed: iti ṛṣi vacanam ākarṇya sa rājā jarā jarjarita deham tam ṛṣim ālokya pratyākhyāna kātaraḥ tasmāt ca bhagavataḥ śāpataḥ bibhyat kiṃcid adhomukhaḥ ciram
translated: Having heard these words of the sage, the king, seeing that the sage's body was worn out by old age, was afraid of refusing and feared the curse of the illustrious one. He remained silent for a long time, his face slightly lowered.

original: dadhyau // / / //
analyzed: dadhyau
translated: He pondered.

original: saubharir uvāca /
analyzed: saubhariḥ uvāca
translated: Saubhari said:

original: narendra kasmāt samupaiṣi cintām aśakyam uktaṃ na mayātra kiṃcit /
analyzed: narendra kasmāt samupaiṣi cintām aśakyam uktam na mayā atra kiṃcid
translated: O king, why do you fall into thought? I have not said anything impossible here.

original: yāvaśyadeyā tanayā tayaiva kṛtārthatā no yadi kiṃ na labdham // / / //
analyzed: yā avaśya deyā tanayā tayā eva kṛtārtha tā naḥ yadi kim na labdham
translated: If you have to give your daughter, and if she herself has attained her goal, what is not gained?

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: atha tasya śāpabhītaḥ sapraśrayam uvācāsau rājā // / / //
analyzed: atha tasya śāpa bhītaḥ sa praśrayam uvāca asau rājā
translated: Then, fearing his curse, the king spoke to him with respect:

original: rājovāca /
analyzed: rājā uvāca
translated: The king said:

original: bhagavann asmatkulasthitir iyaṃ ya eva kanyāyā abhirucito 'bhijanavān varas tasmai kanyā pradīyate /
analyzed: bhagavan asmad kula sthitiḥ iyam yaḥ eva kanyāyāḥ abhirucitaḥ varaḥ tasmai kanyā pradīyate
translated: Blessed one, it is our family custom that a maiden is given to the suitor whom she herself chooses, who is of noble birth.

original: bhagavadājñāsmanmanorathānām apy agocaravartinī /
analyzed: bhagavat ājñā asmad manorathānām api agocara vartinī
translated: The Blessed One's command is beyond the reach of our desires.

original: katham apy eṣā saṃjātā tad evam upasthite na vidmaḥ kiṃ kurma ity etan mayā cintyate /
analyzed: katham api eṣā saṃjātā tat evam upasthite na vidmaḥ kim kurmaḥ iti etat mayā cintyate
translated: How this has come to pass, now that it has, we know not what to do. This is what I am thinking.

original: ity abhihite ca tena bhūbhujā munir acintayat /
analyzed: iti abhihite ca tena bhūbhujā muniḥ acintayat
translated: When this was said by the king, the sage thought:

original: aho 'yam anyo 'smatpratyākhyānopāyo vṛddho 'yam anabhimataḥ strīṇāṃ kim uta kanyānām ity amunā saṃcintyaivam abhihitam /
analyzed: aho yam smad pratyākhyāna upāyaḥ vṛddhaḥ yam an abhimataḥ strīṇām kim uta kanyānām iti amunā saṃcintya evam abhihitam
translated: Ah, this is another way of refusing me. He thinks that I am old and not desired by women, much less by maidens, and so he has said this deliberately.

original: evam astu tathā kariṣyāmīti saṃcintya māṃdhātāram uvāca // / / //
analyzed: evam astu tathā kariṣyāmi iti saṃcintya māṃdhātāram uvāca
translated: Let it be so. I will do just that. Thinking this, he said to Māndhātṛ:

original: yady evaṃ tadādiśyatām asmākaṃ praveśāya kanyāntaḥpuravarṣavaraḥ /
analyzed: yadi evam tadā ādiśyatām asmākam praveśāya kanyā antaḥpura varṣavaraḥ
translated: If it is so, then let the best of the maidens' attendants be ordered for our entry.

original: yadi kanyaiva kācin mām abhilaṣati tadāhaṃ dārasaṃgrahaṃ kariṣyāmīty anyathā cet tad alam asmākam etenātītakālārambhenety uktvā virarāma //
analyzed: yadi kanyā eva kācid mām abhilaṣati tadā aham dāra saṃgraham kariṣyāmi iti anyathā ced tat alam asmākam etena atīta kāla ārambhena iti uktvā virarāma
translated: If any maiden at all desires me, then I will take a wife; otherwise, enough of this beginning of the past time,' and so saying, he ceased.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tataś ca māṃdhātrā muniśāpaśaṅkitena kanyāntaḥpuravarṣavaraḥ samājñaptaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca māṃdhātrā muni śāpa śaṅkitena kanyā antaḥpura varṣavaraḥ samājñaptaḥ
translated: Then Mandhatri, fearing the curse of the sage, commanded the best of the maidens in his harem.

original: kanyāntaḥpuraṃ praviśann eva bhagavān akhilasiddhagandharvamanuṣyebhyo 'tiśayena kamanīyaṃ rūpam akarot // / / //
analyzed: kanyā antaḥpuram praviśan eva bhagavān akhila siddha gandharva manuṣyebhyaḥ tiśayena kamanīyam rūpam akarot
translated: As he entered the inner apartments, the Blessed One made his form more lovely than that of all the Siddhas, Gandharvas, and men.

original: praveśya ca tam ṛṣim antaḥpuravarṣavaras tāḥ kanyakāḥ prāha // / / //
analyzed: praveśya ca tam ṛṣim antaḥpura varṣavaraḥ tāḥ kanyakāḥ prāha
translated: And having introduced the Rishi into the inner apartments, the best of the maidens said to them.

original: bhavatīnāṃ janayitā mahārājaḥ samājñāpayati /
analyzed: bhavatīnām janayitā mahā rājaḥ samājñāpayati
translated: Your father, the great king, commands you.

original: ayam asmān brahmarṣiḥ kanyārthī samabhyāgato mayā cāsya pratijñātaṃ yady asmatkanyakā
analyzed: ayam asmān brahmarṣiḥ kanyā arthī samabhyāgataḥ mayā ca asya pratijñātam yadī asmad kanyakā
translated: This Brahmana Rishi has come to us, desiring a maiden, and I have promised him that if any of your maidens

original: kācid bhagavantaṃ varayati tat kanyāyāś chande nāhaṃ paripanthānaṃ kariṣyāmīty ākarṇya
analyzed: kācid bhagavantam varayati tat kanyāyāḥ chande na aham paripanthānam kariṣyāmi iti ākarṇya
translated: chooses the Blessed One, I will not stand in the way of the maiden's desire. Having heard this,

original: sarvā eva tāḥ kanyāḥ sānurāgāḥ samanmathāḥ kareṇava ivebhayūthapatiṃ tam ṛṣim ahamahamikayā
analyzed: sarvāḥ eva tāḥ kanyāḥ sa anurāgāḥ sa manmathāḥ kareṇavaḥ iva ibha yūtha patim tam ṛṣim ahamahamikayā
translated: All those maidens, full of love and passion, like she-elephants to that sage, the lord of the herd of elephants, with a sense of mine and thine,🔽

original: varayāṃ babhūvuḥ // / / //
analyzed: babhūvuḥ
translated: All those maidens, filled with love and passion, like she-elephants for the leader of a herd of elephants, vied with each other to choose that sage.

original: ūcuś ca /🔽alaṃ bhaginyo 'ham imaṃ vṛṇomi vṛto mayā naiṣa tavānurūpaḥ /
analyzed: ūcuḥ ca  alam bhaginyaḥ ham imam vṛṇomi vṛtaḥ mayā na eṣa tava anurūpaḥ
translated: They said:🔽Enough, sisters! I choose him. He is not suitable for you, who have been chosen by me.

original: mamaiva bhartā vidhinaiṣa sṛṣṭaḥ sṛṣṭāham asyopaśamaṃ prayāhi // / / //
analyzed: mama eva bhartā vidhinā eṣa sṛṣṭaḥ sṛṣṭā aham asya upaśamam prayāhi
translated: He has been created by fate as my husband alone. Give up your attachment to him.

original: vṛto mayāyaṃ prathamaṃ mayāyaṃ gṛhaṃ viśann eva vihanyase kim /
analyzed: vṛtaḥ mayā ayam prathamam mayā ayam gṛham viśan eva vihanyase kim
translated: He has been chosen by me first. Why do you obstruct him even as he enters the house?

original: mayā mayeti kṣitipātmajānāṃ tadartham atyarthakalir babhūva // / / //
analyzed: mayā mayā iti kṣitipa ātmajānām tad artham atyartha kaliḥ babhūva
translated: Saying 'mine, mine,' there was an extremely fierce quarrel among the daughters of the king.

original: yadā tu sarvābhir atīva hārdād vṛtaḥ sa kanyābhir anindyakīrtiḥ /
analyzed: yadā tu sarvābhiḥ atīva hārdāt vṛtaḥ sa kanyābhiḥ anindya kīrtiḥ
translated: When he, of unblemished fame, was chosen by all the maidens with the utmost affection,

original: tadā sa kanyādhikṛto nṛpāya yathāvad ācaṣṭa vinamramūrtiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tadā sa kanyā adhikṛtaḥ nṛpāya yathāvat ācaṣṭa vinamra mūrtiḥ
translated: then the one in charge of the maidens, with a humble form, reported to the king as it was.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tadavagamāt kiṃ kim etat kathaya kiṃ karomīti kiṃ mayābhihitam ity ākulamatir anicchann api kathamapi rājānumene // / / //
analyzed: tad avagamāt kim kim etat kathaya kim karomi iti kim mayā abhihitam iti ākula matiḥ an icchan api katham api rājā anumene
translated: Understanding that, he said, What is this? Tell me. What should I do? What have I said? With a troubled mind, though unwilling, he somehow agreed to the king's request.

original: kṛtānurūpavivāhaś ca maharṣiḥ sakalā eva tāḥ kanyāḥ svam āśramam anayat // / / //
analyzed: kṛta anurūpa vivāhaḥ ca mahā ṛṣiḥ sakalāḥ eva tāḥ kanyāḥ svam āśramam anayat
translated: And the great Rishi, having celebrated the nuptials in due form, took all the maidens to his hermitage.🔽There he summoned Vishvakarma, the inventor of all the arts and crafts, who was like another Creator,

original: tatra cāśeṣaśilpiśilpapraṇetāraṃ dhātāram ivānyaṃ viśvakarmāṇam āhūya sakalakanyānām
analyzed: tatra ca aśeṣa śilpi śilpa praṇetāram dhātāram iva anyam viśvakarmāṇam āhūya sakala kanyānām
translated: and ordered him to build for each of the maidens a palace with gardens and spacious courts, furnished with excellent beds,

original: ekaikasyāḥ protphullapaṅkajāḥ kūjatkalahaṃsakāraṇḍavādi vihaṃgamābhirāmajalāśayāḥ🔽sopavanāḥ sāvakāśāḥ sādhuśayyāparicchadāḥ prāsādāḥ kriyantām ity ādideśa // / / //
analyzed: ekaikasyāḥ protphulla paṅkajāḥ kūjat kalahaṃsa kāraṇḍava ādi vihaṃgama abhirāma jalāśayāḥ  sa upavanāḥ sa avakāśāḥ sādhu śayyā paricchadāḥ prāsādāḥ kriyantām iti ādideśa
translated: with artificial lakes charming with blooming lotuses and with the sweet notes of wild geese and ruddy geese,

original: tac ca tathaivānuṣṭhitam aśeṣaśilpaviśeṣācāryas tvaṣṭā darśitavān // / / //🔽tataś ca paramarṣiṇā saubhariṇājñaptas teṣu gṛheṣv anapāyī nandanāmā mahānidhir āsāṃ cakre // / / //
analyzed: tat ca tathā eva anuṣṭhitam aśeṣa śilpa viśeṣa ācāryaḥ tvaṣṭā darśitavān  tatas ca parama ṛṣiṇā saubhariṇā ājñaptaḥ teṣu gṛheṣu anapāyī nanda nāmā mahā nidhiḥ āsām cakre
translated: and all this was carried out accordingly. The master of all the special arts, Vishvakarma, showed his skill.🔽Then, at the command of the great Rishi Saubhari, a great treasure named Nanda, which never failed, was placed in those houses.

original: tato 'navaratabhakṣyabhojyalehyādyupabhogair āgatānugatabhṛtyādīn aharniśam aśeṣagṛheṣu tāḥ kṣitīśaduhitaro bhojayām āsuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas nava rata bhakṣya bhojya lehya ādi upabhogaiḥ āgata anugata bhṛtya ādīn aharniśam aśeṣa gṛheṣu tāḥ kṣitīśa duhitaraḥ bhojayām āsuḥ
