translated: Then those daughters of the king daily fed, in all the houses, day and night, the servants and others who came and stayed with them, with food, both hard and soft, and other enjoyments.

original: ekadā tu duhitṛsnehākṛṣṭahṛdayaḥ sa mahīpatir atiduḥkhitās tāḥ sukhitā veti vicintya
analyzed: ekadā tu duhitṛ sneha ākṛṣṭa hṛdayaḥ sa mahīpatiḥ ati duḥkhitāḥ tāḥ sukhitāḥ vā iti vicintya
translated: But once, his heart drawn by the affection for his daughter, the king, thinking, Are they very unhappy or happy?

original: tasya maharṣer āśramam upetya sphuradaṃśumālāṃ sphaṭikamayīṃ prāsādamālām atiramyopavanajalāśayāṃ
analyzed: tasya mahā ṛṣeḥ āśramam upetya sphurat aṃśumālām sphaṭika mayīm prāsāda mālām ati ramya upavana jalāśayām
translated: approached the hermitage of that great sage, and saw a row of crystal palaces shining with bright rays, with very delightful gardens and ponds,

original: dadarśa // / / //
analyzed: dadarśa
translated: and he saw (his daughter).

original: praviśya caikaṃ prāsādam ātmajāṃ pariṣvajya kṛtāsanaparigrahaḥ pravṛddhasnehanayanāmbugarbhanayano 'bravīt // / / //
analyzed: praviśya ca ekam prāsādam ātmajām pariṣvajya kṛta āsana parigrahaḥ pravṛddha sneha nayana ambu garbha nayanaḥ bravīt
translated: And having entered one palace, embracing his daughter, and taking a seat, with eyes filled with tears of overflowing affection, he said (to her):

original: apy atra vatse bhavatyāḥ sukham uta kiṃcid asukham api te maharṣiḥ snehavān uta saṃsmaryate 'smadgṛhavāsasyety uktā tattanayā pitaram āha //🔽tātātiramaṇīyaḥ prāsādo 'trātimanojñam upavanam atikalavākyavihaṃgābhirutāḥ protphullapadmākarā jalāśayāḥ /
analyzed: api atra vatse bhavatyāḥ sukham uta kiṃcid asukham api te mahā ṛṣiḥ snehavān uta saṃsmaryate smad gṛha vāsasya iti uktā tad tanayā pitaram āha  tāta ati ramaṇīyaḥ prāsādaḥ upavanam ati kala vākya vihaṃga abhirutāḥ protphulla padma ākarāḥ jalāśayāḥ
translated: Dear child, are you happy here? Is there anything unpleasant for you? Does the affectionate great sage remember our household life? Thus addressed, his daughter said to her father:🔽Father, this palace is very delightful, the garden here is very charming, the ponds with blooming lotuses are resounding with the sweet songs of birds.

original: manonukūlabhakṣyabhojyānulepanavastra bhūṣaṇādibhogopabhogā mṛdūni śayanāni sarvasaṃpatsamavetam etad gārhasthyam tathāpi kena vā janmabhūmir
analyzed: manonukūla bhakṣya bhojya anulepana vastra bhūṣaṇa ādi bhoga upabhogāḥ mṛdūni śayanāni sarva saṃpad samavetam etat gārhasthyam tathā api kena vā janma bhūmiḥ
translated: The enjoyments of food and drink that are pleasing to the mind, the unguents, clothes, ornaments, and so on, the soft beds, this household life endowed with all prosperity - nevertheless, by whom is the birthplace of one who has gone forth

original: na smaryate // / / //
analyzed: na smaryate
translated: is not remembered.

original: tvatprasādād idam aśeṣam atiśobhanam // / / //
analyzed: tvad prasādāt idam aśeṣam ati śobhanam
translated: By your grace, all this is extremely splendid.

original: kiṃtv ekaṃ mamaitad duḥkhakāraṇaṃ yad asmadgṛhān maharṣir ayaṃ madbhartā na niṣkrāmati mamaiva kevalam atiprītyā samīpavartī nānyāsām asmadbhaginīnām
analyzed: kiṃtu ekam mama etat duḥkha kāraṇam yat asmad gṛhāt mahā ṛṣiḥ ayam mad bhartā na niṣkrāmati mama eva kevalam ati prītyā samīpa vartī na anyāsām asmad bhaginīnām
translated: But this is the cause of my sorrow: that this great sage, my husband, does not leave our house, but is only extremely attached to me and stays near me, not to my other sisters.

original: evaṃ ca mama sahodaryā duḥkhitā ity evam atiduḥkhakāraṇam ity uktas tayā dvitīyaṃ prāsādam upetya svatanayāṃ pariṣvajyopaviṣṭas tathaiva pṛṣṭavān
analyzed: evam ca mama sahodaryāḥ duḥkhitāḥ iti evam ati duḥkha kāraṇam iti uktaḥ tayā dvitīyam prāsādam upetya sva tanayām pariṣvajya upaviṣṭaḥ tathā eva pṛṣṭavān
translated: And thus my co-wives are unhappy. This is the cause of my great sorrow. Thus addressed by her, he went to the second palace, sat down embracing his daughter, and asked the same question.

original: tayāpi tathaiva sarvam etat prāsādādyupabhogasukham ākhyātaṃ mamaiva kevalam atiprītyā
analyzed: tayā api tathā eva sarvam etat prāsāda ādi upabhoga sukham ākhyātam mama eva kevalam ati prītyā
translated: She too described all this happiness of enjoying the palace and so on, saying, He is only extremely attached to me and stays near me,

original: pārśvavartī nāsmadbhaginīnām ity evamādi śrutvā samastaprāsādeṣu rājā praviveśa tanayās
analyzed: pārśva vartī na asmad bhaginīnām iti evamādi śrutvā samasta prāsādeṣu rājā praviveśa tanayāḥ
translated: not to my co-wives. Hearing this and so on, the king entered all the palaces and

original: tathaivāpṛcchat // / / //
analyzed: tathā eva apṛcchat
translated: asked his daughters in the same way.

original: sarvābhiś ca tābhis tathaivābhihitaḥ paritoṣavismayanirbharavivaśahṛdayo bhagavantaṃ saubharim ekāntāvasthitam upetya kṛtapūjo 'bravīt // / /
analyzed: sarvābhiḥ ca tābhiḥ tathā eva abhihitaḥ paritoṣa vismaya nirbhara vivaśa hṛdayaḥ bhagavantam saubharim ekānta avasthitam upetya kṛta pūjaḥ bravīt
translated: And hearing the same from all of them, his heart filled with satisfaction, wonder, and emotion, he approached the revered Saubhari, who was sitting in a secluded place, paid homage, and said:

original: dṛṣṭas te bhagavan sumahān eṣa siddhiprabhāvo naivaṃvidham anyasya kasyacid asmābhir vibhūtivilasitam upalakṣitaṃ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭaḥ te bhagavan su mahān eṣa siddhi prabhāvaḥ na evaṃvidham anyasya kasyacid asmābhiḥ vibhūti vilasitam upalakṣitam
translated: You have seen, Blessed One, this great power of the sage's spiritual attainment. We have not observed such a display of splendor in anyone else.

original: kiyad etad bhagavaṃs tapasaḥ phalam ity abhipūjya tam ṛṣiṃ tatraiva tena ṛṣivaryeṇa saha kiṃcit kālam abhimatopabhogaṃ bubhuje svapuraṃ ca
analyzed: kiyat etat bhagavan tapasaḥ phalam iti abhipūjya tam ṛṣim tatra eva tena ṛṣi varyeṇa saha kiṃcid kālam abhimata upabhogam bubhuje sva puram ca
translated: How great is this fruit of austerities, Blessed One? Having thus praised the sage, he enjoyed for some time there with that excellent sage the pleasures he desired, and then returned to his own city.

original: kālena gacchatā tasya rājatanayāsu putraśataṃ sārdham abhavat // / / //
analyzed: kālena gacchatā tasya rāja tanayāsu putra śatam sa ardham abhavat
translated: In due course, he had a hundred sons by his royal daughters.

original: anudinānurūḍhasnehaprasaraś ca sa tatrātīva mamatākṛṣṭahṛdayo 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: anu dina anurūḍha sneha prasaraḥ ca sa tatra atīva mamatā ākṛṣṭa hṛdayaḥ bhavat
translated: And as his affection for them increased day by day, his heart was drawn with intense love to them.

original: apy ete 'smatputrāḥ kalabhāṣiṇaḥ padbhyāṃ gaccheyuḥ /
analyzed: api ete smad putrāḥ kala bhāṣiṇaḥ padbhyām gaccheyuḥ
translated: Will these sons of mine ever learn to speak?

original: apy ete yauvanino bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: api ete yauvaninaḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Will they ever become young?

original: api kṛtadārān etān paśyeyam /
analyzed: api kṛtadārān etān paśyeyam
translated: Will I ever see them married?

original: apy eṣāṃ putrā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: api eṣām putrāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Will they ever have sons?

original: apy etatputrān putrasamanvitān paśyeyam evamādimanorathān anudinakālasaṃpattivṛttim avetyaitat saṃcintayām āsa /
analyzed: api etad putrān putra samanvitān paśyeyam evamādi manorathān anu dina kāla saṃpatti vṛttim avetya etat saṃcintayām āsa
translated: Will I ever see them with sons and grandsons? Thus, realizing that his desires for the fulfillment of these and other wishes increased day by day, he thought:

original: aho me mohasyātivistāraḥ // / / //
analyzed: aho me mohasya ati vistāraḥ
translated: Alas, how far my delusion has spread!

original: manorathānāṃ na samāptir asti varṣāyutenāpi tathābdalakṣaiḥ /
analyzed: manorathānām na samāptiḥ asti varṣā ayutena api tathā abda lakṣaiḥ
translated: There is no end to desires, even in ten thousand years or a hundred thousand years.

original: pūrṇeṣu pūrṇeṣu punar navānām utpattayaḥ santi manorathānām // / / //
analyzed: pūrṇeṣu pūrṇeṣu punar navānām utpattayaḥ santi manorathānām
translated: When one desire is fulfilled, there arise new desires.

original: padbhyāṃ gatā yauvaninaś ca jātā dāraiś ca saṃyogam itāḥ prasūtāḥ /🔽dṛṣṭāḥ sutās tattanayaprasūtiṃ draṣṭuṃ punar vāñchati me 'ntarātmā // / / //
analyzed: padbhyām gatāḥ yauvaninaḥ ca jātāḥ dāraiḥ ca saṃyogam itāḥ prasūtāḥ  dṛṣṭāḥ sutāḥ tad tanaya prasūtim draṣṭum punar vāñchati me ntarātmā
translated: They have gone on foot, become young, married, had children,🔽and I have seen their children's children. My mind still desires to see more.

original: drakṣyāmi teṣām api cet prasūtiṃ manoratho me bhavitā tato 'nyaḥ /
analyzed: drakṣyāmi teṣām api ced prasūtim manorathaḥ me bhavitā tatas
translated: If I could see their children's children, I would have another desire.

original: pūrṇe 'pi tatrāpy aparasya janma nivāryate kena manorathasya // / / //
analyzed: pūrṇe tatra api aparasya janma nivāryate kena manorathasya
translated: When that is fulfilled, another birth arises. By whom is the arising of desire prevented?

original: āmṛtyuto naiva manorathānām anto 'sti vijñātam idaṃ mayādya /
analyzed: ā mṛtyutas na eva manorathānām antaḥ sti vijñātam idam mayā adya
translated: Until death, there is no end to desires. This I have understood today.

original: manorathāsaktiparasya cittaṃ na jāyate vai paramārthasaṅgi // / / //
analyzed: manoratha āsakti parasya cittam na jāyate vai paramārtha saṅgi
translated: The mind of one attached to desires does not turn to the ultimate truth.

original: sa me samādhir jalavāsamitra matsyasya saṅgāt sahasaiva naṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: sa me samādhiḥ jala vāsa mitra matsyasya saṅgāt sahasā eva naṣṭaḥ
translated: That concentration of mine, O friend who dwells in the water, was suddenly lost due to association with the fish.

original: parigrahaḥ saṅgakṛto mamāyaṃ parigrahotthā ca mahāvidhitsā // / / //
analyzed: parigrahaḥ saṅga kṛtaḥ mama ayam parigraha utthā ca mahā vidhitsā
translated: This possession of mine is due to attachment, and from possession arises great desire.

original: duḥkhaṃ yadaivaikaśarīrajanma śatārdhasaṃkhyaṃ yad idaṃ prasūtam /
analyzed: duḥkham yadā evā eka śarīra janma śata ardha saṃkhyam yat idam prasūtam
translated: When suffering is born in one body alone, and this is produced in half a hundred [lives],

original: parigraheṇa kṣitipātmajānāṃ sutair anekair bahulīkṛtaṃ tat // / / //
analyzed: parigraheṇa kṣitipa ātmajānām sutaiḥ anekaiḥ bahulīkṛtam tat
translated: It is multiplied by the possession of many sons of the daughters of the earth.

original: sutātmajais tattanayaiś ca bhūyo bhūyaś ca teṣāṃ svaparigraheṇa /
analyzed: suta ātmajaiḥ tad tanayaiḥ ca bhūyas bhūyas ca teṣām sva parigraheṇa
translated: And again by the sons of those sons and their sons, and again by their possessions,

original: vistāram eṣyaty atiduḥkhahetuḥ parigraho vai mamatānidhānam // / / //
analyzed: vistāram eṣyati ati duḥkha hetuḥ parigrahaḥ vai mamatā nidhānam
translated: This possession, the abode of self-love, will spread out, becoming a cause of great suffering.

original: cīrṇaṃ tapo yat tu jalāśrayeṇa tasyarddhir eṣā tapaso 'ntarāyaḥ /
analyzed: cīrṇam tapaḥ yat tu jalāśrayeṇa tasya ṛddhiḥ eṣā tapasaḥ ntarāyaḥ
translated: The austerity that was practiced by resorting to water, this is the prosperity of that austerity, an obstacle.

original: matsyasya saṅgād abhavac ca yo me sutādirāgo muṣito 'smi tena // / / //
analyzed: matsyasya saṅgāt abhavat ca yaḥ me suta ādi rāgaḥ muṣitaḥ smi tena
translated: And the affection for sons and so on that arose from association with the fish, by that I am deceived.

original: niḥsaṅgatā muktipadaṃ yatīnāṃ saṅgād aśeṣāḥ prabhavanti doṣāḥ /
analyzed: niḥsaṅga tā mukti padam yatīnām saṅgāt aśeṣāḥ prabhavanti doṣāḥ
translated: Non-attachment is the path to liberation for ascetics; all faults arise from attachment.

original: ārūḍhayogo 'pi nipātyate 'dhaḥ saṅgena yogī kim utālpasiddhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: ārūḍha yogaḥ pi nipātyate saṅgena yogī kim uta alpa siddhiḥ
translated: Even one who has attained yoga is brought down by attachment; what to speak of a yogi with little accomplishment.

original: ahaṃ cariṣyāmi tathātmano 'rthe parigrahagrāhagṛhītabuddhiḥ /
analyzed: aham cariṣyāmi tathā ātmanaḥ rthe parigraha grāha gṛhīta buddhiḥ
translated: And I will act in the same way for my own sake, with a mind grasped by the hook of possession,

original: yathā hi bhūyaḥ parihīnadoṣo janasya duḥkhair bhavitā na duḥkhī // / / //
analyzed: yathā hi bhūyas parihīna doṣaḥ janasya duḥkhaiḥ bhavitā na duḥkhī
translated: So that in the future, having abandoned faults, I will not be made miserable by the sufferings of people.

original: sarvasya dhātāram acintyarūpam aṇor aṇīyāṃsam atipramāṇam /
analyzed: sarvasya dhātāram acintya rūpam aṇoḥ aṇīyāṃsam atipramāṇam
translated: The supporter of all, of inconceivable form, smaller than the smallest and greater than the greatest,

original: sitāsitaṃ ceśvaram īśvarāṇām ārādhayiṣye tapasaiva viṣṇum // / / //
analyzed: sita asitam ca īśvaram īśvarāṇām ārādhayiṣye tapasā eva viṣṇum
translated: I shall worship Vishnu, the lord of lords, the controller of all, by austerities alone.

original: tasminn aśeṣaujasi sarvarūpiṇy avyaktavispaṣṭatanāv anante /
analyzed: tasmin aśeṣa ojasi sarva rūpiṇi avyakta vispaṣṭa tanau anante
translated: In Him, who is the receptacle of all energy, who is of all forms, who is both unmanifest and manifest, who is infinite,

original: mamācalaṃ cittam apetadoṣaṃ sadāstu viṣṇāv abhavāya bhūyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mama acalam cittam apeta doṣam sadā astu viṣṇau abhavāya bhūyas
translated: May my mind be steady, free from faults, and always devoted to Vishnu for the attainment of final beatitude.

original: samastabhūtād amalād anantāt sarveśvarād anyad anādimadhyāt /
analyzed: samasta bhūtāt amalāt anantāt sarva īśvarāt anyat an ādi madhyāt
translated: From Him who is the cause of all beings, who is pure, infinite, the lord of all, who is without beginning and end,

original: yasmān na kiṃcit tam ahaṃ gurūṇāṃ paraṃ guruṃ saṃśrayam emi viṣṇum // / / //
analyzed: yasmāt na kiṃcid tam aham gurūṇām param gurum saṃśrayam emi viṣṇum
translated: From whom nothing else exists, I seek refuge in Vishnu, the supreme guru of all gurus.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity ātmānam ātmanaivābhidhāyāsau saubharir apahāya putragṛhāsanaparicchadādikam aśeṣam arthajātaṃ sakalabhāryāsamaveto vanaṃ praviveśa // / /
analyzed: iti ātmānam ātmanā eva abhidhāya asau saubhariḥ apahāya putra gṛha āsana paricchada ādikam aśeṣam artha jātam sakala bhāryā samavetaḥ vanam praviveśa  /
translated: Having thus declared himself, Saubhari abandoned his son, house, possessions, and all else, and entered the forest with all his wives.

original: tatrāpy anudinaṃ vaikhānasaniṣpādyam aśeṣaṃ kriyākalāpaṃ niṣpādya kṣapitasakalapāpaḥ paripakvamanovṛttir ātmany agnīn samāropya bhikṣur abhavat
analyzed: tatra api anudinam vaikhānasa niṣpādyam aśeṣam kriyā kalāpam niṣpādya kṣapita sakala pāpaḥ paripakva manaḥ vṛttiḥ ātmani agnīn samāropya bhikṣuḥ abhavat
translated: There too, performing all the duties prescribed by the Vaikhānasa scriptures day after day, he destroyed all his sins, matured his mental faculties, and became a mendicant, having merged the sacrificial fires within himself.

original: bhagavaty āsajyākhilakarmakalāpaṃ ajam avikāram amaraṇādidharmam avāpa paraṃ paravatām acyutapadam // / / //
analyzed: bhagavati āsajya akhila karma kalāpam ajam a vikāram a maraṇa ādi dharmam avāpa param paravatām acyuta padam
translated: Having thus, with his whole heart, devoted himself to the Supreme Lord, the unborn, the immutable, the imperishable, he attained the highest state of the liberated, the imperishable abode of Vishnu.

original: ity etan māṃdhātur duhitṛsaṃbandhād ākhyātam // / / //
analyzed: iti etat māṃdhātuḥ duhitṛ saṃbandhāt ākhyātam
translated: Thus is related the story of Mandhatri's daughter.

original: yaś caitat saubharicaritam anusmarati paṭhati śṛṇoti avadhārayati lekhayati tasyāṣṭau🔽janmany asanmatir asaddharmo vā manaso 'sanmārgācaraṇam aśeṣaheyeṣu vā mamatvaṃ na
analyzed: yaḥ ca etat saubhari caritam anusmarati paṭhati śṛṇoti avadhārayati lekhayati tasya aṣṭau  janmani asat matiḥ asat dharmaḥ vā manasaḥ sat mārga ācaraṇam aśeṣa heyeṣu vā mamatvam na
translated: He who remembers this story of Saubhari, who recites it, listens to it, understands it, or causes it to be written, has eight

original: bhavati // / / //
analyzed: bhavati
translated: blessings. In his eight births, he does not have wrong views, unrighteousness, wrong conduct of the mind, or attachment to all that is to be abandoned.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe caturthāṃśe dvitīyo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe caturtha aṃśe dvitīyaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the second chapter in the fourth section of the Visnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ato māṃdhātuḥ putrasaṃtatir abhidhīyate // / / //
analyzed: atas māṃdhātuḥ putra saṃtatiḥ abhidhīyate
translated: Now the line of Mandhatri's sons is described.

original: ambarīṣasya māṃdhātus tanayasya yuvanāśvaḥ putro 'bhūt // / / //
analyzed: ambarīṣasya māṃdhātuḥ tanayasya yuvanāśvaḥ putraḥ bhūt
translated: Ambarisha, the son of Mandhatri, had a son named Yuvanashva.

original: tasmād dharīto yato 'ṅgiraso hārītāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt harītaḥ yatas ṅgirasaḥ hārītāḥ
translated: From him came Harita, from whom the Angirasas known as Haritas were born.

original: rasātale ca mauneyā nāma gandharvāḥ ṣaṭkoṭisaṃkhyās tair aśeṣāṇi nāgakulāny apahṛtapradhānaratnādhipatyāny akriyanta // / / //
analyzed: rasātale ca mauneyāḥ nāma gandharvāḥ ṣaṣ koṭi saṃkhyāḥ taiḥ aśeṣāṇi nāga kulāni apahṛta pradhāna ratna ādhipatyāni akriyanta
translated: In the nether regions, there were sixty million Gandharvas called Maunayas, who robbed all the Naga clans of their chieftainship and jewels.

original: taiś ca gandharvavīryāvadhūtair urageśvarair bhagavān aśeṣadeveśastavaśravaṇonmīlitonnidrapuṇḍarīkanayano jalaśayano nidrāvasānād vibuddhaḥ
analyzed: taiḥ ca gandharva vīrya avadhūtaiḥ uraga īśvaraiḥ bhagavān aśeṣa deva īśa stava śravaṇa unmīlita unnidra puṇḍarīka nayanaḥ jala śayanaḥ nidrā avasānāt vibuddhaḥ  /
translated: And those lords of serpents, shaken by the energy of the Gandharvas, the Blessed One, the Lord of all gods, whose eyes are like fully bloomed lotuses opened by hearing their praise, awakened from his sleep on the water-bed, at the end of his slumber.

original: praṇipatyābhihitaḥ /
analyzed: praṇipatya abhihitaḥ
translated: Bowing down, he was addressed:

original: bhagavann apy asmākam etebhyo gandharvebhyo bhayam upaśamam eṣyatīti āha bhagavān
analyzed: bhagavan api asmākam etebhyaḥ gandharvebhyaḥ bhayam upaśamam eṣyati iti āha bhagavān
translated: O Blessed One, will this fear of ours from these Gandharvas be pacified? The Blessed One said:

original: anādipuruṣaḥ puruṣottamo yauvanāśvasya māṃdhātuḥ purukutsanāmā putras tam aham anupraviśya
analyzed: an ādi puruṣaḥ puruṣottamaḥ yauvanāśvasya māṃdhātuḥ purukutsa nāmā putraḥ tam aham anupraviśya
translated: The beginningless Purusha, the Supreme Person, having entered the son of Mandhatri, Yauvanashva, named Purukutsa,

original: tān aśeṣaduṣṭagandharvān upaśamaṃ nayiṣyāmi // / / //
analyzed: tān aśeṣa duṣṭa gandharvān upaśamam nayiṣyāmi
translated: I will bring those wicked Gandharvas to complete peace.

original: ity ākarṇya bhagavate kṛtapraṇāmāḥ punar nāgalokam āgatāḥ pannagapatayo narmadāṃ ca purukutsānayanāya codayām āsuḥ // / / //
analyzed: iti ākarṇya bhagavate kṛta praṇāmāḥ punar nāga lokam āgatāḥ pannaga patayaḥ narmadām ca purukutsa ānayanāya codayām āsuḥ
translated: Having heard this, the lords of the serpents, having bowed to the Blessed One, returned to the world of the serpents and urged Narmada to bring Purukutsa.

original: sā cainaṃ rasātalaṃ nītavatī // / / //
analyzed: sā ca enam rasātalam nītavatī
translated: And she led him to Rasatala.

original: rasātalagataś cāsau bhagavattejasāpyāyitātmavīryaḥ sakalagandharvāñ jaghāna /
analyzed: rasātala gataḥ ca asau bhagavat tejasā āpyāyita ātma vīryaḥ sakala gandharvām jaghāna
translated: And he, having gone to Rasatala, his own valor nourished by the energy of the Blessed One, killed all the Gandharvas.

original: punaś ca svabhavanam ājagāma // / / //
analyzed: punar ca sva bhavanam ājagāma
translated: And he returned to his own abode.

original: sakalapannagapatayaś ca narmadāyai varaṃ daduḥ /
analyzed: sakala pannaga patayaḥ ca narmadāyai varam daduḥ
translated: And the lords of all the serpents gave a boon to Narmadā.

original: yas te 'nusmaraṇasamavetaṃ nāmagrahaṇaṃ kariṣyati na tasya sarpaviṣabhayaṃ bhaviṣyatīti // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ te nusmaraṇa samavetam nāmagrahaṇam kariṣyati na tasya sarpa viṣa bhayam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: He who will utter your name along with the recollection, will not have the fear of serpent poison.

original: atra ca ślokaḥ /
analyzed: atra ca ślokaḥ
translated: And here is a verse:

original: narmadāyai namaḥ prātar narmadāyai namo niśi /
analyzed: narmadāyai namaḥ prātar narmadāyai namaḥ niśi
translated: Salutations to Narmadā in the morning, salutations to Narmadā at night.

original: namo 'stu narmade tubhyaṃ trāhi māṃ viṣasarpataḥ // / / //
analyzed: namaḥ stu narmade tubhyam trāhi mām viṣa sarpataḥ
translated: Salutations to you, Narmadā, save me from the serpents and poison.

original: ity uccāryāharniśam andhakārapraveśe vā na sarpair daśyate na cāpi kṛtānusmaraṇabhujo viṣam api bhuktam upaghātāya bhaviṣyati // / /
analyzed: iti uccārya aharniśam andhakāra praveśe vā na sarpaiḥ daśyate na ca api kṛta anusmaraṇa bhujaḥ viṣam api bhuktam upaghātāya bhaviṣyati
translated: Having uttered this day and night, or when entering darkness, one is not bitten by serpents. And even if one eats poison, having made the recollection, it will not cause harm.

original: purukutsāya ca saṃtativicchedo na bhavato bhaviṣyatīty uragapatayo varaṃ daduḥ // / / //
analyzed: purukutsāya ca saṃtati vicchedaḥ na bhavataḥ bhaviṣyati iti uraga patayaḥ varam daduḥ
translated: And the lords of the serpents gave a boon that the lineage of Purukutsa would not be cut off.

original: purukutso narmadāyāṃ trasadasyum ajījanat // / / //
analyzed: purukutsaḥ narmadāyām trasadasyum ajījanat
translated: Purukutsa begot Trasadasyu on Narmadā.

original: trasadasyutaḥ saṃbhūtas tato 'naraṇyas taṃ rāvaṇo digvijaye nijaghāna /
analyzed: trasadasyutaḥ saṃbhūtaḥ tatas naraṇyaḥ tam rāvaṇaḥ digvijaye nijaghāna
translated: From Trasadasyu, Sambhūta was born, then Anaraṇya, whom Rāvaṇa killed in his conquest of the directions.

original: anaraṇyasya pṛṣadaśvaḥ pṛṣadaśvasya haryaśvaḥ putro 'bhavat /
analyzed: anaraṇyasya pṛṣadaśvaḥ pṛṣadaśvasya haryaśvaḥ putraḥ bhavat
translated: Anaraṇya's son was Pṛṣadaśva, and Pṛṣadaśva's son was Haryaśva.

original: tataś ca vasumanās tasyāpi tridhanvā tridhanvanas trayyāruṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca vasumanāḥ tasya api tridhanvā tridhanvanaḥ trayyāruṇaḥ
translated: Then Vasumana, then of him Tri-dhana, then of him Tri-dhana Tri-y-aruṇa.

original: tasmāt satyavrato yo 'sau triśaṅkusaṃjñām avāpa /
analyzed: tasmāt satyavrataḥ yaḥ sau triśaṅku saṃjñām avāpa
translated: Then Vasumana, then his son Tri-dandhi, then Tri-dandhi's son Trayya-runa, then Trayya-runa's son Satya-vrata, who became known as Tri-shanku.

original: caṇḍālatām upagataś ca // / / //
analyzed: caṇḍāla tām upagataḥ ca
translated: And he went to the state of a Chandala.

original: dvādaśavārṣikyām anāvṛṣṭyāṃ viśvāmitrakalatrāpatyapoṣaṇārthaṃ cāṇḍālapratigrahapariharaṇāya jāhnavītīranyagrodhe mṛgamāṃsam anudinaṃ babandha
analyzed: dvādaśa vārṣikyām anāvṛṣṭyām viśvāmitra kalatra apatya poṣaṇa artham cāṇḍāla pratigraha pariharaṇāya jāhnavī tīra nyagrodhe mṛga māṃsam anudinam babandha
translated: During a twelve-year drought, he daily killed deer on a banyan tree on the banks of the Jahnavi to support Vishvamitra's wife and children and to avoid accepting alms from a Chandala.

original: parituṣṭena viśvāmitreṇa saśarīraḥ svargam āropitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: parituṣṭena viśvāmitreṇa sa śarīraḥ svargam āropitaḥ
translated: Vishvamitra, being pleased, raised him to heaven with his body.

original: triśaṅkor hariścandras tasmād rohitāśvas tataś ca harito haritāc cañcuś cañcor vijayasudevau ruruko vijayād rurukasya vṛkaḥ // / / //
analyzed: triśaṅkoḥ hariścandraḥ tasmāt rohitāśvaḥ tatas ca haritaḥ haritāt cañcuḥ cañcoḥ vijaya sudevau rurukaḥ vijayāt rurukasya vṛkaḥ
translated: From Tri-shanku came Hari-shchandra, from him Rohita-shva, from him Harita, from Harita Chanchu, from Chanchu Vijaya and Sudeva, from Vijaya Ruruka, from Ruruka Vrika.

original: tato bāhur yo 'sau haihayatālajaṅghādibhir avajito 'ntarvatnyā mahiṣyā saha vanaṃ viveśa // / / //
analyzed: tatas bāhuḥ yaḥ sau haihaya tālajaṅgha ādibhiḥ avajitaḥ ntarvatnyā mahiṣyā saha vanam viveśa
translated: Then came Bahu, who, defeated by the Haihayas, Talajangha and others, entered the forest with his pregnant wife.

original: tasyāś ca sapatnyā garbhastambhanāya garo dattaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasyāḥ ca sapatnyāḥ garbha stambhanāya garaḥ dattaḥ
translated: And a poison was given to her co-wife to stop her conception.

original: tenāsyā garbhaḥ saptavarṣāṇi jaṭhara eva tasthau /
analyzed: tena asyāḥ garbhaḥ sapta varṣāṇi jaṭhare eva tasthau
translated: By that, her child remained in her womb for seven years.

original: sa ca bāhur vṛddhabhāvād aurvāśramasamīpe mamāra // / / //
analyzed: sa ca bāhuḥ vṛddha bhāvāt aurva āśrama samīpe mamāra
translated: And that arm, being old, died near the hermitage of Aurva.

original: sā tasya bhāryā citāṃ kṛtvā tam āropyānumaraṇakṛtaniścayābhūt // / / //
analyzed: sā tasya bhāryā citām kṛtvā tam
translated: And his wife, having made a funeral pyre, ascended it, determined to die with him.

original: athaitām atītānāgatavartamānakālavedī bhagavān aurvaḥ svāśramān nirgatyābravīt /
analyzed: atha etām atīta anāgata vartamāna kāla vedī bhagavān aurvaḥ sva āśramāt nirgatya abravīt
translated: Then the revered Aurva, who knew the past, future, and present, came out from his hermitage and said:

original: alam anenāsadgrāheṇākhilabhūmaṇḍalapatir ativīryaparākramo naikayajñakṛd arātipakṣakṣayakartā tavodare cakravartī tiṣṭhati // / / //
analyzed: alam anena asat grāheṇa akhila bhū maṇḍala patiḥ ati vīrya parākramaḥ na eka yajña kṛt arāti pakṣa kṣaya kartā tava udare cakravartī tiṣṭhati
translated: Enough of this evil attachment! A universal monarch, of great valor and prowess, the performer of many sacrifices, the destroyer of the enemies' faction, is dwelling in your womb.

original: maivaṃ maivaṃ sāhasādhyavasāyinī bhavetyukte ca sā tasmād anumaraṇanirbandhād virarāma // / / //
analyzed: mā evam mā evam sāhasa adhyavasāyinī bhava iti ukte ca sā tasmāt anumaraṇa nirbandhāt virarāma
translated: When this was said, she desisted from her resolve to die with him, thinking, It should not be so, it should not be so!

original: tenaiva bhagavatā svāśramam ānīyata /
analyzed: tena eva bhagavatā sva āśramam ānīyata
translated: And by him alone she was brought to his hermitage.

original: katipayadinābhyantare ca sahaiva tena gareṇātitejasvī bālako jajñe /
analyzed: katipaya dina abhyantare ca saha eva tena gareṇa ati tejasvī bālakaḥ jajñe
translated: And after a few days, a very brilliant boy was born along with that garbha.

original: tasyaurvo jātakarmādikriyāṃ niṣpādya sagara iti nāma cakāra // / / //
analyzed: tasya aurvaḥ jātakarma ādi kriyām niṣpādya sagaraḥ iti nāma cakāra
translated: Aurva performed his birth rites and other ceremonies and gave him the name Sagara.

original: kṛtopanayanaṃ cainam aurvo vedaśāstrāṇy astraṃ cāgneyaṃ bhārgavākhyam adhyāpayām āsa // / / //
analyzed: kṛta upanayanam ca enam aurvaḥ veda śāstrāṇi astram ca āgneyam bhārgava ākhyam adhyāpayām āsa
translated: And Aurva initiated him and taught him the Vedas, scriptures, and the weapon called Agneya of the Bhargava lineage.

original: utpannabuddhiś ca mātaram apṛcchat /
analyzed: utpanna buddhiḥ ca mātaram apṛcchat
translated: And when he had acquired knowledge, he asked his mother,

original: amba katham atra vayaṃ kva tāto 'smākam ity evamādi pṛcchatas tanmātā sarvam avocat // / / //
analyzed: amba katham atra vayam kva smākam iti evamādi pṛcchataḥ tad mātā sarvam avocat
translated: Mother, how are we here? Where is our father? and so on. When he asked this, his mother told him everything.

original: tataḥ pitṛrājyaharaṇāmarṣito haihayatālajaṅghādivadhāya pratijñām akarot /
analyzed: tatas pitṛ rājya haraṇa āmarṣitaḥ haihaya tālajaṅgha ādi vadhāya pratijñām akarot
translated: Then, enraged at the usurpation of his father's kingdom, he made a vow to kill Haihaya, Talajangha, and others.

original: prāyaśaś ca haihayāñ jaghāna // / / //
analyzed: prāyaśas ca haihayām jaghāna
translated: And he mostly killed the Haihayas.

original: śakayavanakāmbojapāradapahlavā hanyamānās tatkulaguruṃ vasiṣṭhaṃ śaraṇaṃ yayuḥ // / / //
analyzed: śaka yavana kāmboja pārada pahlavāḥ hanyamānāḥ tad kula gurum vasiṣṭham śaraṇam yayuḥ
translated: The Shakas, Yavanas, Kambojas, Paradas, and Pahlavas, being slaughtered, sought refuge with Vasishtha, the family preceptor.

original: athaitān vasiṣṭho jīvanmṛtakān kṛtvā sagaram āha /
analyzed: atha etān vasiṣṭhaḥ jīvat mṛtakān kṛtvā sagaram āha
translated: Then Vasishtha, having made them live-dead, said to Sagara,

original: vatsālam ebhir jīvanmṛtakair anumṛtaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: vatsa alam ebhiḥ jīvat mṛtakaiḥ anumṛtaiḥ
translated: Son, these live-dead ones are following you.

original: ete ca mayaiva tvatpratijñāparipālanāya nijadharmadvijasaṅgaparityāgaṃ kāritāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ete ca mayā eva tvad pratijñā paripālanāya nija dharma dvija saṅga parityāgam kāritāḥ
translated: And they have been made to abandon their own dharma and association with Brahmins by me alone for the sake of fulfilling your vow.

original: sa tatheti tad guruvacanam abhinandya teṣāṃ veṣānyatvam akārayat yavanān muṇḍitaśiraso
analyzed: sa tathā iti tat guru vacanam abhinandya teṣām veṣa anya tvam akārayat yavanān muṇḍita śirasaḥ
translated: He agreed, saying So be it, and rejoiced in the words of his guru. He made them change their dress. He made the Yavanas shave their heads,

original: 'rdhamuṇḍāñ chakān pralambakeśān pāradān pahlavāṃś ca śmaśrudharān niḥsvādhyāyavaṣaṭkārān
analyzed: rdha muṇḍām śakān pralamba keśān pāradān pahlavān ca śmaśru dharān niḥsvādhyāyavaṣaṭkārān
translated: the Shakas with half-shaved heads, the Paradas with long hair, and the Pahlavas with beards. He made them abandon their Vedic studies and the exclamation Vashat.

original: etān anyāṃś ca kṣatriyāṃś cakāra // / / //
analyzed: etān anyān ca kṣatriyān cakāra
translated: And these and other Kshatriyas he made (kings).

original: te ca nijadharmaparityāgād brāhmaṇaiś ca parityaktā mlecchatāṃ yayuḥ // / / //
analyzed: te ca nija dharma parityāgāt brāhmaṇaiḥ ca parityaktāḥ mleccha tām yayuḥ
translated: And they, having abandoned their own duties, and being abandoned by the Brahmanas, became Mlechchhas.

original: sagaro 'pi svam adhiṣṭhānam āgamya askhalitacakraḥ saptadvīpavatīm imām urvīṃ praśaśāsa // / / //
analyzed: sagaraḥ pi svam adhiṣṭhānam āgamya askhalita cakraḥ sapta dvīpavatīm imām urvīm praśaśāsa
translated: And Sagara, having returned to his own capital, with his wheel unimpeded, ruled this earth with its seven islands.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe tṛtīyo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe tṛtīyaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the third chapter in the fourth section of the Visnu Purana, dealing with the genealogy of Sagara.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: kāśyapaduhitā sumatir vidarbharājatanayā keśinī ca dve bhārye sagarasyāstām // / / //
analyzed: kāśyapa duhitā sumatiḥ vidarbha rāja tanayā keśinī ca dve bhārye sagarasya āstām
translated: Sagara had two wives, Sumati, the daughter of Kashyapa, and Keshini, the daughter of the king of Vidharbha.

original: tābhyāṃ cāpatyārtham ārādhita aurvaḥ parameṇa samādhinā varam adāt // / / //
analyzed: tābhyām ca apatya artham ārādhitaḥ aurvaḥ parameṇa samādhinā varam adāt
translated: For the sake of offspring, they propitiated Aurva with the highest meditation, and he granted them a boon.

original: ekā vaṃśadharam ekaṃ putram aparā ṣaṣṭiṃ putrasahasrāṇi janayiṣyati //
analyzed: ekā vaṃśa dharam ekam putram aparā ṣaṣṭim putra sahasrāṇi janayiṣyati
translated: One will give birth to one son who will continue the line, the other to sixty thousand sons.

original: yasyā yad abhimataṃ tad icchayā gṛhyatām ity ukte keśinī putram ekaṃ sumatiḥ putrasahasrāṇi ṣaṣṭiṃ vavre // / / //
analyzed: yasyāḥ yat abhimatam tat icchayā gṛhyatām iti ukte keśinī putram ekam sumatiḥ putra sahasrāṇi ṣaṣṭim vavre
translated: When it was said, Take whatever is desired by each, Keshini chose one son, and Sumati chose sixty thousand sons.

original: tatheti ca ṛṣiṇābhihite 'lpair evāhobhiḥ keśinī putram ekam asamañjasaṃ nāma vaṃśadharam asūta /
analyzed: tathā iti ca ṛṣiṇā abhihite lpaiḥ evā ahobhiḥ keśinī putram ekam asamañjasam nāma vaṃśa dharam asūta
translated: When the Rishi said, 'So be it,' in a few days Kesini gave birth to a son named Asamanjasa, who became the supporter of the race.

original: vinatātanayāyās tu sumatyāḥ ṣaṣṭiḥ putrasahasrāṇy abhavan // / / //
analyzed: vinatā tanayāyāḥ tu sumatyāḥ ṣaṣṭiḥ putra sahasrāṇi abhavan
translated: But Sumati, the daughter of Vinata, had sixty thousand sons.

original: tasmād asamañjaso 'ṃśumān nāma kumāro jajñe // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt asamañjasaḥ u ṃśumān nāma kumāraḥ jajñe
translated: From him was born a son named Amshuman.

original: sa tv asamañjā bālyād evāpavṛttaḥ pitā cāsyācintayad ayam atītabālyo buddhimān bhaviṣyatīti // / / //
analyzed: sa tu asamañjāḥ bālyāt eva apavṛttaḥ pitā ca asya acintayat ayam atīta bālyaḥ buddhimān bhaviṣyati iti
translated: But Asamanjasa, from his childhood, was addicted to evil ways. His father thought, 'When he has passed his childhood, he will become wise.'

original: atha tatrāpi vayasy atīte tac caritam evainaṃ pitā tatyāja // / / //
analyzed: atha tatra api vayasi atīte tat caritam eva enam pitā tatyāja
translated: But when he had passed his youth, his father abandoned him for his evil conduct.

original: tāny api ṣaṣṭiḥ kumārasahasrāṇy asamañjasaś caritam anucakruḥ // / / //
analyzed: tāni api ṣaṣṭiḥ kumāra sahasrāṇi asamañjasaḥ caritam anucakruḥ
translated: And those sixty thousand princes followed the example of Asamanjasa.

original: tataś cāsamañjasaś caritānukāribhiḥ sāgarair apadhvastayajñādisanmārge jagati devāḥ
analyzed: tatas ca asamañjasaḥ carita anukāribhiḥ sāgaraiḥ apadhvasta yajña ādi sat mārge jagati devāḥ
translated: Then, when the world was lost in evil ways, with sacrifices and other good practices destroyed, by the example of Asamanjasa and the Sagaras, the gods

original: sakalavidyāmayam asaṃspṛṣṭam aśeṣadoṣair bhagavataḥ puruṣottamasyāṃśabhūtaṃ kapilaṃ
analyzed: sakala vidyā mayam a saṃspṛṣṭam aśeṣa doṣaiḥ bhagavataḥ puruṣottamasya aṃśa bhūtam kapilam
translated: bowed to Kapila, who was an incarnation of the Supreme Lord, full of all knowledge, untouched by any fault,

original: praṇamya tad artham ūcuḥ // / / //
analyzed: praṇamya tat artham ūcuḥ
translated: and spoke to him for that purpose.

original: bhagavann ebhiḥ sagaratanayair asamañjasaś caritam anugamyate /
analyzed: bhagavan ebhiḥ sagara tanayaiḥ asamañjasaḥ caritam anugamyate
translated: O Lord, the sons of Sagara are following the conduct of Asamanjasa.

original: katham evam ebhir anusaradbhir jagad bhaviṣyatīty ārtajagatparitrāṇāya ca bhagavato
analyzed: katham evam ebhiḥ anusaradbhiḥ jagat bhaviṣyati iti ārta jagat paritrāṇāya ca bhagavataḥ
translated: How will the world be when they are following like this? For the protection of the afflicted world, the Lord

original: 'tra śarīragrahaṇam ity ākarṇya bhagavān alpair eva dinair ete vinaṅkṣyantīty uktavān // / / //
analyzed: śarīra grahaṇam iti ākarṇya bhagavān alpaiḥ eva dinaiḥ ete vinaṅkṣyanti iti uktavān
translated: took birth here. Having heard this, the Lord said, In a few days, they will perish.

original: tatrāntare ca sagaro hayamedham ārebhe tatra ca putrair adhiṣṭhitam asyāśvaṃ ko 'py apahṛtya bhuvo bilaṃ praviveśa // / / //
analyzed: tatra antare ca sagaraḥ hayamedham ārebhe tatra ca putraiḥ adhiṣṭhitam asya aśvam kaḥ pi apahṛtya bhuvaḥ bilam praviveśa
translated: In the meantime, Sagara began the horse sacrifice. And someone stole his horse guarded by his sons and entered the cave of the earth.🔽Then he employed his sons to search for the horse. Then his sons, following the hoofprints of the horse, dug the earth one Yojana after another with great persistence.

original: tataś cāśvānveṣaṇāya tanayān yuyoja tatas tattanayāś cāśvakhurapadavīm anusaranto atinirbandhena vasudhātalam ekaiko yojanaṃ yojanam avaneś 🔽cakhāna // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca aśva anveṣaṇāya tanayān yuyoja tatas tad tanayāḥ ca aśva khura padavīm anusarantaḥ ati nirbandhena vasudhā talam ekaikaḥ yojanam yojanam avaneḥ  cakhāna
translated: They dug the earth one Yojana after another.

original: pātāle cāśvaṃ paribhramantaṃ tam avanīpatitanayās te dadṛśuḥ // / / //
analyzed: pātāle ca aśvam paribhramantam tam avanīpati tanayāḥ te dadṛśuḥ
translated: And in the nether world, the sons of the king saw the horse wandering.

original: nātidūrāvasthitaṃ ca bhagavantam apaghane śaratkāle 'rkam iva tejobhir anavaratam ūrdhvam adhaś cāśeṣadiśaś codbhāsayamānaṃ kapilarṣim apaśyan
analyzed: na ati dūra avasthitam ca bhagavantam apaghane śarad kāle rkam iva tejobhiḥ anavaratam ūrdhvam adhas ca aśeṣa diśaḥ ca udbhāsayamānam kapila ṛṣim apaśyan
translated: And not far from there, in the clear autumn season, they saw the sage Kapila, illuminating the entire sky above, below, and in all directions with his radiance, like the sun.

original: tataś codyatāyudhā durātmāyam asmadapakārī yajñavighātakartā hayahartā hanyatāṃ hanyatām ity avocan /
analyzed: tatas ca udyata āyudhāḥ durātmā ayam asmad apakārī yajña vighāta kartā haya hartā hanyatām hanyatām iti avocan
translated: Then they said, This evil-minded one has harmed us, disrupted the sacrifice, and stolen the horse. Let him be killed, let him be killed! with their weapons raised.

original: tatas tenāpi bhagavatā kiṃcidīṣatparivartitalocanenāvalokitāḥ svaśarīrasamutthenāgninā dahyamānā vineśuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas tena api bhagavatā kiṃcid īṣat parivartita locanena avalokitāḥ sva śarīra samutthena agninā dahyamānāḥ vineśuḥ
translated: Then, when they were looked at by the Blessed One with his eyes slightly turned, they were burned by the fire arising from his own body and perished.

original: sagaro 'py avagamyāśvānusāri tat putrabalam aśeṣaṃ paramarṣikapilatejasā dagdham aṃśumantam asamañjasaḥ putram aśvānayanāya codayām āsa //
analyzed: sagaraḥ pi avagamya aśva anusāri tat putra balam aśeṣam parama ṛṣi kapila tejasā dagdham aṃśumantam asamañjasaḥ putram aśva ānayanāya codayām āsa
translated: Sagara, having understood, sent his grandson Anṣumat to bring the horse, after his army following the horse had been completely burned by the power of the great sage Kapila.

original: sa tu sagaratanayakhātamārgeṇa kapilam upagamya bhaktinamras tathā tuṣṭāva yathainaṃ
analyzed: sa tu sagara tanaya khāta mārgeṇa kapilam upagamya bhakti namraḥ tathā tuṣṭāva yathā enam
translated: He, approaching Kapila along the path dug by Sagara's sons, with devotion and humility praised him in such a way that

original: bhagavān āha gacchainaṃ pitāmahāyāśvaṃ prāpaya varaṃ vṛṇīṣva ca putrapautraś ca te
analyzed: bhagavān āha gaccha enam pitāmahāya aśvam prāpaya varam vṛṇīṣva ca putra pautraḥ ca te
translated: the Blessed One said, Go and bring the horse to your grandfather, and choose a boon, O son, your son and grandson

original: svargād gaṅgāṃ ānayiṣyatīti // / / //
analyzed: svargāt gaṅgām ānayiṣyati iti
translated: will bring the Ganges down from heaven.

original: athāṃśumān api brahmadaṇḍahatānām asmatpitṝṇām asvargayogyānāṃ svargaprāptikaraṃ varam asmākaṃ bhagavān prayacchatv iti pratyāha // / /
analyzed: atha aṃśumān api brahma daṇḍa hatānām asmad pitṝṇām a svarga yogyānām svarga prāpti karam varam asmākam bhagavān prayacchatu iti pratyāha
translated: Then Anshuman also replied, May the Blessed One grant us a boon that will enable our fathers, who were struck down by the Brahmanical staff and were not fit for heaven, to attain heaven.

original: taṃ cāha bhagavān uktam evaitan mayā pautras te tridivād gaṅgāṃ bhuvam ānayiṣyatīti /
analyzed: tam ca āha bhagavān uktam eva etat mayā pautraḥ te tridivāt gaṅgām bhuvam ānayiṣyati iti
translated: And the Blessed One said to him, This has already been said by me - your grandson will bring Ganga from heaven to earth.

original: tadambhasā saṃspṛṣṭeṣv asthibhasmasv ete svargam ārokṣyanti /
analyzed: tad ambhasā saṃspṛṣṭeṣu asthi bhasmasu ete svargam ārokṣyanti
translated: By the water of that (Ganga), these (bones) will ascend to heaven.

original: bhagavadviṣṇupādāṅguṣṭhavinirgatasya jalasya hi tanmāhātmyam // / / //
analyzed: bhagavat viṣṇu pāda aṅguṣṭha vinirgatasya jalasya hi tat māhātmyam
translated: For the water that flows from the big toe of Lord Vishnu's foot has that greatness.🔽Not only is it beneficial in bathing and other uses when done with intention, but even when not intended, the body parts such as bones, skin, sinews, hair, etc. that are cast off

original: yan na kevalam abhisaṃdhipūrvakaṃ snānādyupabhogeṣūpakārakam anabhisaṃhitam apy apetaprāṇasyāsthicarmasnāyukeśādyutsṛṣṭaṃ
analyzed: yat na kevalam abhisaṃdhi pūrvakam snāna ādi upabhogeṣu upakārakam anabhisaṃhitam api apeta prāṇasya asthi carma snāyu keśa ādi utsṛṣṭam
translated: of one whose life has departed,

original: śarīrajam yad bhūpatitam śarīriṇaṃ sadyaḥ svargaṃ nayatīty uktaḥ praṇamya ca bhagavate
analyzed: śarīra jam yat bhū patitam śarīriṇam sadyas svargam nayati iti uktaḥ praṇamya ca bhagavate
translated: when fallen on the ground, immediately lead the embodied being to heaven. Having said this and bowed to the Blessed One,

original: 'śvam ādāya pitāmahayajñam ājagāma // / / //
analyzed: śvam ādāya pitāmaha yajñam ājagāma
translated: he took the horse and went to the sacrifice of the grandfather.

original: sagaro 'py aśvam āsādya taṃ yajñaṃ samāpayām āsa // / / //
analyzed: sagaraḥ pi aśvam āsādya tam yajñam samāpayām āsa
translated: And Sagara, having obtained the horse, completed that sacrifice.

original: sāgaraṃ cātmajaprītyā putratve kalpayām āsa // / / //
analyzed: sāgaram ca ātmaja prītyā putra tve kalpayām āsa
translated: And out of affection for his son, he adopted the ocean as his son.

original: tasyāṃśumato dilīpaḥ putro 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: tasya aṃśumataḥ dilīpaḥ putraḥ bhavat
translated: Of him, Âṁshumat, Dilîpa was the son.

original: dilīpasya bhagīratho yo 'sau gaṅgāṃ svargād ihānīya bhāgīrathīsaṃjñāṃ cakāra // / / //
analyzed: dilīpasya bhagīrathaḥ yaḥ sau gaṅgām svargāt iha ānīya bhāgīrathī saṃjñām cakāra
translated: Of Dilîpa, Bhagiratha, who brought down the Ganges from heaven and gave it the name Bhagirathî.

original: bhagīrathāc chrutas tasyāpi nābhāgas tato 'mbarīṣas tasmāt sindhudvīpaḥ /
analyzed: bhagīrathāt śrutaḥ tasya api nābhāgaḥ tatas mbarīṣaḥ tasmāt sindhudvīpaḥ
translated: Of Bhagiratha, Shruta; of him, Nâbhâga; of him, Ambarîsha; of him, Sindhudvipa.

original: sindhudvīpād ayutāyus tatputraś ca ṛtuparṇo nalasahāyo 'kṣahṛdayajño 'bhūt // / / //
analyzed: sindhudvīpāt ayutāyuḥ tad putraḥ ca ṛtuparṇaḥ nala sahāyaḥ kṣa hṛdaya jñaḥ bhūt
translated: Of Sindhudvipa, Ayutâyu; his son was Rituparna, who was a friend of Nala and knew the heart of dice.

original: ṛtuparṇaputraḥ sarvakāmas tattanayaḥ sudāsaḥ sudāsāt saudāso mitrasahanāmā // / / //
analyzed: ṛtuparṇa putraḥ sarvakāmaḥ tad tanayaḥ sudāsaḥ sudāsāt saudāsaḥ mitrasaha nāmā
translated: Rituparna's son was Sarvakâma; his son was Sudâsa; of Sudâsa, the son of Sûdâsa, was Mitrasaha.

original: sa cāṭavyāṃ mṛgayāṃ gato vyāghradvayam apaśyat // / / //
analyzed: sa ca aṭavyām mṛgayām gataḥ vyāghra dvayam apaśyat
translated: He, while hunting in the forest, saw a couple of tigers.

original: tābhyāṃ ca tad vanam apamṛgaṃ kṛtaṃ sa caikaṃ tayor bāṇena jaghāna // / / //
analyzed: tābhyām ca tat vanam kṛtam sa ca ekam tayoḥ bāṇena jaghāna
translated: And by them that forest was cleared of deer. He struck one of them with an arrow.

original: mriyamāṇaś cāsāv atibhīṣaṇākṛtir atikarālavadano rākṣaso 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: mriyamāṇaḥ ca asau ati bhīṣaṇa ākṛtiḥ ati karāla vadanaḥ rākṣasaḥ bhavat
translated: And as it was dying, it became a Râkshasa of exceedingly terrible form and exceedingly grim visage.

original: dvitīyo 'pi pratikriyāṃ te kariṣyāmīty uktvāntardhānaṃ jagāma // / / //
analyzed: dvitīyaḥ pi pratikriyām te kariṣyāmi iti uktvā antardhānam jagāma
translated: And the other said, 'I will requite you,' and disappeared.

original: kālena gacchatā sa saudāso yajñam ayajat /
analyzed: kālena gacchatā sa saudāsaḥ yajñam ayajat
translated: In course of time, that Saunada performed a sacrifice.

original: pariniṣṭhitayajñe cācārye vasiṣṭhe niṣkrānte tad rakṣo vasiṣṭharūpam āsthāya yajñāvasāne
analyzed: pariniṣṭhita yajñe ca ācārye vasiṣṭhe niṣkrānte tat rakṣaḥ vasiṣṭha rūpam āsthāya yajña avasāne
translated: And when the sacrifice was completed and the teacher Vasishtha had departed, that Rakshasa, assuming the form of Vasishtha,

original: mama samāṃsaṃ bhojanaṃ deyaṃ tat saṃskriyatāṃ kṣaṇād ihāgamiṣyāmīty uktvā niṣkrāntaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mama sa māṃsam bhojanam deyam tat saṃskriyatām kṣaṇāt iha āgamiṣyāmi iti uktvā niṣkrāntaḥ
translated: said, At the conclusion of the sacrifice, you must give me human flesh to eat. Prepare it quickly. I will come here in a moment. Having said this, he went out.

original: bhūyaś ca sūdaveṣaṃ kṛtvā rājājñayā mānuṣamāṃsaṃ saṃskṛtya rājñe nyavedayat // / / //
analyzed: bhūyas ca sūda veṣam kṛtvā rāja ājñayā mānuṣa māṃsam saṃskṛtya rājñe nyavedayat
translated: And again, assuming the guise of a cook, he prepared human flesh at the king's command and reported to the king.

original: asāv api hiraṇyapātrasthitaṃ māṃsam ādāya vasiṣṭhāgamanapratīkṣo 'bhavat /
analyzed: asau api hiraṇya pātra sthitam māṃsam ādāya vasiṣṭha āgamana pratīkṣaḥ bhavat
translated: And he too, taking the flesh in a golden vessel, awaited Vasishtha's arrival.

original: āgatāya ca vasiṣṭhāya niveditavān // / / //
analyzed: āgatāya ca vasiṣṭhāya niveditavān
translated: And when Vasishtha came, he reported it to him.

original: sa cāpy acintayad aho 'sya rājño dauḥśīlyaṃ yenaitan māṃsam asmākaṃ prayacchati kim etad dravyajātam iti dhyānaparo 'bhūt /
analyzed: sa ca api acintayat aho sya rājñaḥ dauḥśīlyam yena etat māṃsam asmākam prayacchati kim etat dravya jātam iti dhyāna paraḥ bhūt
translated: And he thought, Ah! This king is so immoral that he gives us this flesh. What kind of substance is this? He became absorbed in meditation.

original: apaśyac ca tan mānuṣamāṃsam /
analyzed: apaśyat ca tat mānuṣa māṃsam
translated: And he saw that it was human flesh.

original: tataś ca krodhakaluṣīkṛtacetā rājānaṃ prati śāpam utsasarja /
analyzed: tatas ca krodha kaluṣīkṛta cetāḥ rājānam prati śāpam utsasarja
translated: Then, his mind polluted with anger, he pronounced a curse on the king.

original: yasmād abhojyam etad asmadvidhānāṃ tapasvinām avagacchann api bhavān mahyaṃ dadāti tasmāt tavaivātra lolupā buddhir bhaviṣyatīti // / /
analyzed: yasmāt abhojyam etat asmadvidhānām tapasvinām avagacchan api bhavān mahyam dadāti tasmāt tava eva atra lolupā buddhiḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: Since this is unfit food for ascetics like me, although you know it, you give it to me, therefore your mind will be greedy for it alone.

original: anantaraṃ ca tenāpi bhagavataivābhihito 'smīty ukte kiṃ kiṃ mayaivābhihitam iti saṃcintya munir api samādhau tasthau // / / //
analyzed: anantaram ca tena api smi iti ukte kim kim mayā eva abhihitam iti saṃcintya muniḥ api samādhau tasthau
translated: And when he also said, I have been spoken to by the Blessed One himself, thinking, What have I said? the sage also remained in meditation.

original: samādhivijñānāvagatārthaś cānugrahaṃ tasmai cakāra /
analyzed: samādhi vijñāna avagata arthaḥ ca anugraham tasmai cakāra
translated: And having understood the meaning through the knowledge of meditation, he showed favor to him.

original: nātyantikam etad dvādaśābdaṃ tava bhojanaṃ bhaviṣyatīti // / / //
analyzed: na ātyantikam etat dvādaśa abdam tava bhojanam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: This food of yours will last only twelve years, not forever.🔽But he, taking up a handful of water, was ready to bestow the sage's curse, when his wife Madayantī appeased him,

original: asāv api tu pragṛhyodakāñjaliṃ muniśāpapradānāyodyato bhagavān asmadgurur nārhasy enaṃ kuladevatābhūtam ācāryaṃ śaptum iti madayantyā svapatnyā
analyzed: asau api tu pragṛhya udaka añjalim muni śāpa pradānāya udyataḥ bhagavān asmad guruḥ na arhasi enam kuladevatā bhūtam ācāryam śaptum iti madayantyā sva patnyā  /
translated: saying, Our guru, the Blessed One, should not curse this teacher who is like our family deity.

original: prasāditaḥ /
analyzed: prasāditaḥ
translated: He was appeased.

original: sasyāmbudarakṣaṇārthaṃ tac chāpāmbu norvyāṃ na cākāśe cikṣepa tenaiva svapadau siṣeca // / / //
analyzed: sasya ambuda rakṣaṇa artham tat śāpa ambu nā urvyām na ca ākāśe cikṣepa tena eva sva padau siṣeca
translated: In order to protect the crops and the clouds, he did not throw that curse-water on the earth or in the sky, but sprinkled it on his own feet.

original: tena krodhāśritenāmbhasā dagdhacchāyau tatpādau kalmāṣatām upagatau /
analyzed: tena krodha āśritena ambhasā dagdha chāyau tad pādau kalmāṣa tām upagatau
translated: By that water infused with anger, his feet, with their luster destroyed, became mottled.

original: tataḥ sa kalmāṣapādasaṃjñām avāpa // / / //
analyzed: tatas sa kalmāṣapāda saṃjñām avāpa
translated: And then he received the name of Kalmashapada.

original: vasiṣṭhaśāpāc ca ṣaṣṭhe kāle rākṣasabhāvam upetyāṭavyāṃ paryaṭann anekaśo mānuṣān abhakṣayat // / / //
analyzed: vasiṣṭha śāpāt ca ṣaṣṭhe kāle rākṣasa bhāvam upetya aṭavyām paryaṭan anekaśas mānuṣān abhakṣayat
translated: And by the curse of Vasishtha, at the sixth period of the day, he became a Rakshasa, and wandering in the forest, he devoured many men.

original: ekadā tu kaṃcin munim ṛtukāle bhāryayā saha saṃgataṃ dadarśa /
analyzed: ekadā tu kaṃcid munim ṛtu kāle bhāryayā saha saṃgatam dadarśa
translated: One day he saw a hermit in the season of love with his wife.

original: tayoś ca tam atibhīṣaṇaṃ rākṣasam avalokya trāsāt pradhāvitayor dampatyor brāhmaṇaṃ jagrāha // / / //
analyzed: tayoḥ ca tam ati bhīṣaṇam rākṣasam avalokya trāsāt pradhāvitayoḥ dampatyoḥ brāhmaṇam jagrāha
translated: And when the couple, beholding that exceedingly terrible Rakshasa, ran away in fear, he seized the Brahmana.

original: tataḥ sā brāhmaṇī bahuśas taṃ yācitavatī /
analyzed: tatas sā brāhmaṇī bahuśas tam yācitavatī
translated: Then the Brahmani entreated him in many ways.

original: prasīdekṣvākukulatilakabhūtas tvaṃ mahārāja mitrasaho na rākṣaso nārhasi strīdharmasukhābhijño
analyzed: prasīda ikṣvāku kula tilaka bhūtaḥ tvam mahā rāja mitrasahaḥ na rākṣasaḥ na arhasi strī dharma sukha abhijñaḥ
translated: Be gracious, O great king, O crest-jewel of the Ikshvaku race, you are a friend, not a Rakshasa, and you know the duties and happiness of women.🔽You ought not to eat this my husband, when I am not satisfied.

original: mayy akṛtārthāyām imaṃ madbhartāram attum ity evaṃ bahuprakāraṃ tasyāṃ vilapantyāṃ
analyzed: mayi akṛtārthāyām imam mad bhartāram attum iti evam bahu prakāram tasyām vilapantyām
translated: Thus did she lament in many ways,

original: vyāghraḥ paśum iva taṃ brāhmaṇam abhakṣayat // / / //
analyzed: vyāghraḥ paśum iva tam brāhmaṇam abhakṣayat
translated: but the king ate up the Brahmana as a tiger eats a deer.

original: tataś cātikopasamanvitā brāhmaṇī taṃ rājānaṃ yasmād evaṃ mayy atṛptāyāṃ tvayāyaṃ matpatir bhakṣitaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca ati kopa samanvitā brāhmaṇī tam rājānam yasmāt evam mayi atṛptāyām tvayā ayam mad patiḥ bhakṣitaḥ
translated: Then the Brahmani, filled with exceeding wrath, said to the king: Since you have eaten this my husband, when I am not satisfied,

original: tasmāt tvam apy antaṃ kāmopabhogapravṛttaḥ prāpsyasīti śaśāpa /
analyzed: tasmāt tvam api antam kāma upabhoga pravṛttaḥ prāpsyasi iti śaśāpa
translated: Therefore, you too, engaged in the pursuit of sensual pleasures, will meet your end. And he cursed him.

original: agniṃ praviveśa ca // / / //
analyzed: agnim praviveśa ca
translated: And he entered the fire.

original: tatas tasya dvādaśābdaviparyaye vimuktaśāpasya strīviṣayābhilāṣiṇo madayantī smārayām āsa // / / //
analyzed: tatas tasya dvādaśa abda viparyaye vimukta śāpasya strī viṣaya abhilāṣiṇaḥ madayantī smārayām āsa
translated: Then, after the lapse of twelve years, when he was released from the curse and had a desire for women, Madayanti reminded him.

original: tataḥ param asau strībhogaṃ tatyāja /
analyzed: tatas param asau strī bhogam tatyāja
translated: Then he gave up the enjoyment of women.

original: vasiṣṭhaś cāputreṇa rājñā putrārtham abhyarthito madayantyāṃ garbhādhānaṃ cakāra /
analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ ca aputreṇa rājñā putra artham abhyarthitaḥ madayantyām garbhādhānam cakāra
translated: And Vasishtha, requested by the childless king for a son, performed the Garbhadhana (embryo-consecration) rite on Madayanti.

original: yadā ca saptavarṣāṇy asau garbho na jajñe tatas taṃ garbham aśmanā sā devī jaghāna /
analyzed: yadā ca sapta varṣāṇi asau garbhaḥ na jajñe tatas tam garbham aśmanā sā devī jaghāna
translated: And when the embryo did not take birth for seven years, then the queen struck that embryo with a stone.

original: putraś cājāyata tasya cāśmaka eva nāmābhavat // / / //
analyzed: putraḥ ca ajāyata tasya ca aśmakaḥ eva nāma abhavat
translated: And a son was born to him, and his name was Asmaka.

original: aśmakasya mūlako nāma putro 'bhavat /
analyzed: aśmakasya mūlakaḥ nāma putraḥ bhavat
translated: Asmaka had a son named Mulaka.

original: yo 'sau niḥkṣatre kṣmātale 'smin kriyamāṇe strībhir vivastrābhiḥ parivārya rakṣitaḥ tatas taṃ nārīkavacam udāharanti // / / //
analyzed: niḥkṣatre kṣmā tale smin kriyamāṇe strībhiḥ vivastrābhiḥ parivārya rakṣitaḥ tatas tam nārīkavacam udāharanti
translated: He was protected by women, who surrounded him when the Kshatriyas were being exterminated on the earth, being naked. Therefore, he is called Narikakavach (armored with women).

original: mūlakād daśarathas tasmād ilivilas tataś ca viśvasahaḥ /
analyzed: mūlakāt daśarathaḥ tasmāt ilivilaḥ tatas ca viśvasahaḥ
translated: From Mulaka, Dasaratha; from him, Ilavilya; from him, Vishvavaha.

original: tasmāc ca khaṭvāṅgo dilīpaḥ yo 'sau devāsurāṇāṃ saṃgrāme devair abhyarthito 'surāñ jaghāna /
analyzed: tasmāt ca khaṭvāṅgaḥ dilīpaḥ yaḥ sau deva asurāṇām saṃgrāme devaiḥ abhyarthitaḥ surām jaghāna
translated: And from him was born Dilīpa, who, in a battle between the gods and demons, was requested by the gods to kill the demons.

original: svarge ca kṛtapriyair devair varagrahaṇāya coditaḥ prāha /
analyzed: svarge ca kṛta priyaiḥ devaiḥ vara grahaṇāya coditaḥ prāha
translated: And in heaven, when the gods who had done him favors urged him to choose a boon, he said:

original: yady avaśyaṃ varo grāhyas tan mamāyuḥ kathyatām iti /
analyzed: yadi avaśyam varaḥ grāhyaḥ tat mama āyuḥ kathyatām iti
translated: If I must necessarily choose a boon, then let my lifespan be told.

original: anantaraṃ ca tair uktam ekamuhūrtapramāṇaṃ tavāyur ity ukto 'thāskhalitagatinā vimānena laghimaguṇo martyalokam āgamyedam āha /
analyzed: anantaram ca taiḥ uktam eka muhūrta pramāṇam tava āyuḥ iti uktaḥ vimānena laghima guṇaḥ martya lokam āgamya idam āha
translated: And immediately they said, Your lifespan is the measure of one moment. Then, having come to the mortal world by a swift-moving celestial vehicle with the quality of lightness, he said this:

original: yathā na brāhmaṇebhyaḥ sakāśād ātmāpi me priyataraḥ /
analyzed: yathā na brāhmaṇebhyaḥ sakāśāt ātmā api me priyataraḥ
translated: Just as my self is not dearer to me than the Brahmins,

original: na ca svadharmollaṅghanaṃ mayā kadācid apy anuṣṭhitam /
analyzed: na ca svadharma ullaṅghanam mayā kadācid api anuṣṭhitam
translated: and I have never transgressed my own duty,

original: na ca sakaladevamānuṣapaśuvṛkṣādike 'py 'cyutavyatirekavatī dṛṣṭir mamābhūt /🔽tathā tam eva devaṃ munijanānusmṛtaṃ bhagavantam askhalitagatiḥ prāpayeyam ity aśeṣadevagurau bhagavaty anirdeśyavapuṣi sattāmātrātmany ātmānaṃ
analyzed: na ca sakala deva mānuṣa paśu vṛkṣa ādike pi cyuta vyatirekavatī dṛṣṭiḥ mama abhūt  tathā tam eva devam muni jana anusmṛtam bhagavantam askhalita gatiḥ prāpayeyam iti aśeṣa deva gurau bhagavati anirdeśya vapuṣi sattā mātra ātmani ātmānam
translated: and I have never had a view that distinguishes between all gods, humans, animals, trees, and so on,

original: paramātmani vāsudevākhye yuyoja /
analyzed: paramātmani vāsudeva ākhye yuyoja
translated: in the same way, without faltering, may I reach that very god, the revered one remembered by the sages, in the supreme self called Vāsudeva, who has a body that cannot be indicated, whose self is mere existence,🔽the revered one who is the guru of all gods.

original: tatraiva ca layam avāpa // / / //
analyzed: tatra eva ca layam avāpa
translated: and there he fell asleep.

original: atrāpi śrūyate śloko gītaḥ saptarṣibhiḥ purā /
analyzed: atrā api śrūyate ślokaḥ gītaḥ saptarṣibhiḥ purā
translated: Here also is heard a verse sung in ancient times by the seven sages:

original: khaṭvāṅgena samo nānyaḥ kaścid urvyāṃ bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: khaṭvāṅgena samaḥ nā anyaḥ kaścid urvyām bhaviṣyati
translated: No one else on earth will be equal to Khataṅga.

original: yena svargād ihāgamya muhūrtaṃ prāpya jīvitam /
analyzed: yena svargāt iha āgamya muhūrtam prāpya jīvitam
translated: By whom, having come here from heaven, having obtained life for a moment,

original: trayo 'bhisaṃdhitā lokā buddhyā dānena caiva hi // / / //
analyzed: trayaḥ bhisaṃdhitāḥ lokāḥ buddhyā dānena ca eva hi
translated: the three worlds were united by intelligence and by charity.

original: khaṭvāṅgād dīrghabāhuḥ putro 'bhavat /
analyzed: khaṭvāṅgāt dīrghabāhuḥ putraḥ bhavat
translated: From Khataṅga, Dīrghabāhu was born as a son.

original: tato raghus tasmād apy ajaḥ /
analyzed: tatas raghuḥ tasmāt api ajaḥ
translated: From him, Raghu. From him, Aja.

original: ajād daśaratho daśarathasyāpi bhagavān abjanābho jagatsthityartham ātmāṃśena rāmalakṣmaṇabharataśatrughnarūpiṇā caturdhā putratvam āyāsīt /
analyzed: ajāt daśarathaḥ daśarathasya api bhagavān abjanābhaḥ jagat sthiti artham ātma aṃśena rāma lakṣmaṇa bharata śatrughna rūpiṇā caturdhā putra tvam āyāsīt
translated: From Aja, Daśaratha. And to Daśaratha, the Blessed One, the lotus-naveled one, for the sake of maintaining the world, took birth as his four sons in the form of Rāma, Lakṣmaṇa, Bharata, and Śatrughna, with a portion of his own self.

original: rāmo 'pi bāla eva viśvāmitrayajñarakṣaṇāya gacchaṃs tāṭakāṃ jaghāna // / / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ pi bālaḥ eva viśvāmitra yajña rakṣaṇāya gacchan tāṭakām jaghāna
translated: And Rāma, even as a child, going to protect Viśvāmitra's sacrifice, killed Tāṭakā.

original: yajñe ca mārīcam iṣupātāhataṃ dūraṃ cikṣepa subāhupramukhāṃś ca kṣayam anayat /
analyzed: yajñe ca mārīcam iṣu pāta āhatam dūram cikṣepa subāhu pramukhān ca kṣayam anayat
translated: And at the sacrifice, he struck Mārīca with an arrow and threw him far away, and destroyed Subāhu and others.

original: darśanamātreṇaivāhalyām apāpāṃ cakāra /
analyzed: darśana mātreṇa eva ahalyām apāpām cakāra
translated: By merely seeing her, he made Ahalyā sinless.

original: janakagṛhe ca māheśvaraṃ cāpam anāyāsenaiva babhañja /
analyzed: janaka gṛhe ca māheśvaram cāpam anāyāsena eva babhañja
translated: And in Janaka's house, he effortlessly broke the bow of Maheśvara.

original: sītāṃ ca ayonijāṃ janakarājatanayāṃ vīryaśulkāṃ lebhe // / / //
analyzed: sītām ca a yoni jām janaka rāja tanayām vīrya śulkām lebhe
translated: And he obtained Sita, born not from a womb, the daughter of King Janaka, given as a wife for his prowess.

original: sakalakṣatrakṣayakāriṇam aśeṣahaihayakuladhūmaketubhūtaṃ ca paraśurāmam apāstavīryabalāvalepaṃ cakāra // / / //
analyzed: sakala kṣatra kṣaya kāriṇam aśeṣa haihaya kula dhūmaketu bhūtam ca paraśurāmam apāsta vīrya bala avalepam cakāra
translated: He humbled Parashurama, the destroyer of all Kshatriyas, the very smoke-banner of the Haihaya dynasty, and removed his pride in his prowess and strength.

original: pitṛvacanāc cāgaṇitarājyābhilāṣo bhrātṛbhāryāsamaveto vanaṃ viveśa // / / //
analyzed: pitṛ vacanāt ca agaṇita rājya abhilāṣaḥ bhrātṛ bhāryā samavetaḥ vanam viveśa
translated: And at his father's command, disregarding his desire for the kingdom, he entered the forest with his brother's wife.

original: virādhakharadūṣaṇādīn kabandhavālinau ca nijaghāna // / / //🔽baddhvā cāmbhonidhim aśeṣarākṣasakulakṣayaṃ kṛtvā daśānanāpahṛtāṃ tadvadhāpahatakalaṅkām
analyzed: virādha khara dūṣaṇa ādīn kabandha vālinau ca nijaghāna  baddhvā ca ambhonidhim aśeṣa rākṣasa kula kṣayam kṛtvā daśānana apahṛtām tad vadha apahata kalaṅkām
translated: And he slew Viratha, Khara, Dushana, and others, Kabandha and Vali.🔽And binding the ocean and destroying the entire race of Rakshasas, he brought back to Ayodhya Sita, the daughter of King Janaka, who had been carried off by Ravana, but whose stain had been removed by his death,

original: apy analapraveśaśuddhām aśeṣadeveśasaṃstūyamānāṃ sītāṃ janakarājatanayām ayodhyām🔽āninye // / / //
analyzed: api anala praveśa śuddhām aśeṣa deva īśa saṃstūyamānām sītām janaka rāja tanayām ayodhyām  āninye
translated: and who, though purified by entering the fire, was praised by all the gods.

original: viśvāmitrabharadvājāgastyaprabhṛtibhir munivaraiḥ ṛgyajuḥsāmātharvaiḥ saṃstūyamāno
analyzed: viśvāmitra bharadvāja agastya prabhṛtibhiḥ muni varaiḥ ṛk yajuḥ sāma atharvaiḥ saṃstūyamānaḥ
translated: He was praised by the best of sages, Vishvamitra, Bharadvaja, Agastya, and others, with the Rig, Yajur, Sama, and Atharva Vedas,

original: nṛtyagītavādyākhilalokamaṅgalavādyair vīṇāveṇumṛdaṅgabherīpaṭahaśaṅkhakāhalagomukhaprabhṛtibhiḥ
analyzed: nṛtya gīta vādya akhila loka maṅgala vādyaiḥ vīṇā veṇu mṛdaṅga bherī paṭaha śaṅkha kāhala gomukha prabhṛtibhiḥ
translated: and with all the auspicious instruments of the world, such as dancing, singing, and music, with the veena, flute, drums, kettledrums, conch shells, and trumpets.

original: sunādaiḥ samastabhūbhṛtāṃ madhye sakalalokarakṣārthaṃ yathocitam abhiṣikto dāśarathiḥ🔽kosalendro raghukulatilako jānakīpriyo bhrātṛtrayapriyaḥ siṃhāsanagato dvādaśābdasahasraṃ
analyzed: su nādaiḥ samasta bhūbhṛtām madhye sakala loka rakṣā artham yathocitam abhiṣiktaḥ dāśarathiḥ  kosala indraḥ raghu kula tilakaḥ jānakī priyaḥ bhrātṛ traya priyaḥ siṃhāsana gataḥ dvādaśa abda sahasram
translated: The son of Dasaratha, consecrated in the midst of all the kings with auspicious sounds, for the protection of the entire world,

original: rājyam akarot // / / //
analyzed: rājyam akarot
translated: the lord of Kosala, the crest-jewel of the Raghu dynasty, dear to Janaki, dear to the three brothers, seated on the throne, ruled for twelve thousand years.

original: bharato 'pi gandharvaviṣayasādhanāyogragandharvakoṭīs tisro jaghāna /
analyzed: bharataḥ pi gandharva viṣaya sādhanāya ugra gandharva koṭīḥ tisraḥ jaghāna
translated: Bharata also killed three koṭis of fierce gandharvas engaged in conquering the gandharva realm.

original: śatrughnenāpy atibalaparākramo madhuputro lavaṇo nāma rākṣaseśvaro nihato madhurā ca niveśitā // / / //
analyzed: śatrughnena api ati bala parākramaḥ madhu putraḥ lavaṇaḥ nāma rākṣasa īśvaraḥ nihataḥ madhurā ca niveśitā
translated: By Śatrughna also, the lord of the rākṣasas named Lavaṇa, the son of Madhu, of great strength and valor, was slain, and Madhurā was founded.

original: ity evamādiatulabalaparākramair atiduṣṭanibarhaṇair 'śeṣasyāsya jagato niṣpāditasthitayo rāmalakṣmaṇabharataśatrughnāḥ punar api divam ārūḍhāḥ
analyzed: iti evamādi atula bala parākramaiḥ ati duṣṭa nibarhaṇaiḥ śeṣasya asya jagataḥ niṣpādita sthitayaḥ rāma lakṣmaṇa bharata śatrughnāḥ punar api divam ārūḍhāḥ
translated: Thus, Rāma, Lakṣmaṇa, Bharata, and Śatrughna, having accomplished the protection of this remaining world with their incomparable strength and valor, destroying the extremely wicked, again ascended to heaven.

original: ye 'pi teṣu bhagavadaṃśeṣv anurāgiṇaḥ kosalanagarajanapadās te 'pi tanmanasas tatsalokatām avāpuḥ // / / //
analyzed: ye pi teṣu bhagavat aṃśeṣu anurāgiṇaḥ kosala nagara janapadāḥ te pi tad manasaḥ tad salokatām avāpuḥ
translated: And those people of the city and country of Kosala, who were devoted to those incarnations of the Lord, they also attained the same world as them, with their minds fixed on them.

original: rāmasya tu kuśalavau putrau lakṣmaṇasyāṅgadacandraketū takṣapuṣkarau bharatasya subāhuśūrasenau śatrughnasya kuśasyātithir atither api niṣadhaḥ 🔽putro 'bhavat /
analyzed: rāmasya tu kuśa lavau putrau lakṣmaṇasya aṅgada candraketū takṣa puṣkarau bharatasya subāhu śūrasenau śatrughnasya kuśasya atithiḥ atitheḥ api niṣadhaḥ  / putraḥ bhavat
translated: Rama had two sons, Kusha and Lava; Lakshmana had two sons, Angada and Chandraketu; Bharata had two sons, Taksha and Pushkara; Shatrughna had two sons, Subahu and Shurasena.🔽Kusha had a son named Atithi, and Atithi had a son named Nishadha.

original: niṣadhasyāpi nalas tasya api nabho nabhasaḥ puṇḍarīkaḥ /
analyzed: niṣadhasya api nalaḥ tasya api nabhaḥ nabhasaḥ puṇḍarīkaḥ
translated: Nishadha had a son named Nala, and Nala had a son named Nabha. Nabha had a son named Pundarika.

original: tattanayaḥ kṣemadhanvā tasya ca devānīkas tasyāpy ahīnagus tato rurus tasya ca pāriyātraḥ
analyzed: tad tanayaḥ kṣemadhanvā tasya ca devānīkaḥ tasya api ahīnaguḥ tatas ruruḥ tasya ca pāriyātraḥ
translated: His son was Kshemadhanva, and his son was Devanag. His son was Ahinagu, and his son was Ruru. His son was Pariyatra.

original: pāriyātrād dalo dalāc chalas tasyāpy uktha ukthād vajranābhas tasmāc chaṅkhanābhas
analyzed: pāriyātrāt dalaḥ dalāt śalaḥ tasya api ukthaḥ ukthāt vajranābhaḥ tasmāt śaṅkhanābhaḥ
translated: Pariyatra had a son named Dala, and Dala had a son named Shala. His son was Uktha, and Uktha had a son named Vajranabha. His son was Shankhanabha.

original: tato vyutthitāśvas tataś ca viśvasaho jajñe // / / //
analyzed: tatas vyutthitāśvaḥ tatas ca viśvasahaḥ jajñe
translated: From him was born Vyushitaswa, and from him was born Vishvashu.

original: hiraṇyanābhas tato mahāyogīśvaro jaiminiśiṣyo yato yājñavalkyo yogam avāpa // / / //
analyzed: hiraṇyanābhaḥ tatas mahā yogi īśvaraḥ jaimini śiṣyaḥ yatas yājñavalkyaḥ yogam avāpa
translated: Hiranyanabha, the great lord of yogis, was a disciple of Jaimini. From him Yajnavalkya obtained yoga.

original: hiraṇyanābhasya putraḥ puṣyas tasmād dhruvasaṃdhis tataḥ sudarśanas tasmād agnivarṇas tataś ca śīghragas tasyāpi maruḥ putro 'bhūt
analyzed: hiraṇyanābhasya putraḥ puṣyaḥ tasmāt dhruvasaṃdhiḥ tatas sudarśanaḥ tasmāt agnivarṇaḥ tatas ca śīghragaḥ tasya api maruḥ putraḥ bhūt
translated: Hiranyanabha's son was Pushya, and his son was Dhruvasandhi. His son was Sudarshana, and his son was Agnivarna. His son was Shighraga, and his son was Maru.

original: yo 'sau yogam āsthāyādyāpi kalāpagrāmam āśritas tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: yaḥ sau yogam āsthāya adya api kalāpa grāmam āśritaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: He who, resorting to Yoga, still remains in the village of Kalāpa.

original: āgāmiyuge sūryavaṃśakṣatrapravartayitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: āgāmi yuge sūryavaṃśa kṣatra pravartayitā bhaviṣyati
translated: In the future Yuga, he will be the founder of the Kṣatriya dynasty in the solar race.

original: prasuśrutas tasyātmajas tasyāpi susaṃdhis tataś cāpy amarṣas tasya ca mahasvāṃs tataś
analyzed: prasuśrutaḥ tasya ātmajaḥ tasya api susaṃdhiḥ tatas ca api amarṣaḥ tasya ca mahasvān tatas
translated: His son will be Prasusruta, his Prasusruta's son will be Susandhi, his Susandhi's son will be Amarsha, his Amarsha's son will be Mahaswan, his Mahaswan's son will be

original: ca viśrutavāṃs tato bṛhadbalo yo 'rjunatanayenābhimanyunā bhāratayuddhe kṣayam anīyata // / / //
analyzed: ca viśrutavān tatas bṛhadbalaḥ yaḥ rjuna tanayena abhimanyunā bhārata yuddhe kṣayam anīyata
translated: Visruta, his Visruta's son will be Vrihadbala, who was killed by Arjuna's son Abhimanyu in the battle of the Bharata war.

original: ete hīkṣvākubhūpālāḥ prādhānyena mayeritāḥ /
analyzed: ete hi ikṣvāku bhūpālāḥ prādhānyena mayā īritāḥ
translated: These are the principal kings of the Ikshvaku dynasty mentioned by me.

original: eteṣāṃ caritaṃ śṛṇvan sarvapāpaiḥ pramucyate // / / //
analyzed: eteṣām caritam śṛṇvan sarva pāpaiḥ pramucyate
translated: By listening to the deeds of these kings, one is freed from all sins.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe caturtho 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe caturthaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourth chapter in the fourth section of the Visnu Purana, dealing with the genealogy of the kings of the solar race.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ikṣvākutanayo yo 'sau nimir nāmā sa tu sahasrasaṃvatsaraṃ satram ārebhe vasiṣṭhaṃ ca hotāraṃ varayām āsa // / / //
analyzed: ikṣvāku tanayaḥ sau nimiḥ nāmā sa tu sahasra saṃvatsaram satram ārebhe vasiṣṭham ca hotāram varayām āsa
translated: The son of Ikshvaku, named Nimi, began a sacrifice lasting for a thousand years and chose Vasishtha as the Hotri priest.

original: tam āha vasiṣṭho 'ham indreṇa pañcavarṣaśataṃ yāgārthaṃ prathamataraṃ vṛtas tadanantaraṃ
analyzed: tam āha vasiṣṭhaḥ ham indreṇa pañca varṣa śatam yāga artham prathamataram vṛtaḥ tad anantaram
translated: Vasishtha said to him, I was first chosen by Indra for a sacrifice lasting five hundred years, after that

original: pratipālyatām āgatas tavāpi ṛtvig bhaviṣyāmīty ukte sa pṛthivīpatir na kiṃcid uktavān // / / //
analyzed: pratipālyatām āgataḥ tava api ṛtvij bhaviṣyāmi iti ukte sa pṛthivīpatiḥ na kiṃcid uktavān
translated: When he said, Wait, I will be your officiating priest too, that lord of the earth said nothing.

original: vasiṣṭho 'py anena samanvicchitam ity amarapater yāgam akarot // / / //
analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ u pi anena samanvicchitam iti amarapateḥ yāgam akarot
translated: Vashishtha also performed the sacrifice of the lord of the immortals, thinking that this was what he desired.

original: so 'pi tatkālam evānyair gautamādibhir yāgam akārayat /
analyzed: saḥ u pi tad kālam eva anyaiḥ gautama ādibhiḥ yāgam akārayat
translated: He also had the sacrifice performed by others like Gautama at that very time.

original: samāpte cāmarapater yāge tvarāvān vasiṣṭho nimeḥ karma kariṣyāmīty ājagāma /🔽tatkarmakartṛtvaṃ ca tatra gautamasya dṛṣṭvātha svapate tasmai rājñe mām apratyākhyāyaitad
analyzed: samāpte ca amarapateḥ yāge tvarāvān vasiṣṭhaḥ nimeḥ karma kariṣyāmi iti ājagāma  tad karma kartṛ tvam ca tatra gautamasya dṛṣṭvā atha svapate tasmai rājñe mām a pratyākhyāya etat
translated: And when the sacrifice of the lord of the immortals was completed, Vashishtha, eager to perform Nimi's rite, came, saying, I will do it.🔽Seeing Gautama there as the performer of that rite, he then cursed his own lord, the king, saying, Since you have entrusted another rite to Gautama without consulting me,

original: anena gautamāya karmāntaraṃ samarpitaṃ yasmāt tasmād ayaṃ videho bhaviṣyatīti śāpaṃ🔽dadau // / / //
analyzed: anena gautamāya karmāntaram samarpitam yasmāt tasmāt ayam videhaḥ bhaviṣyati iti śāpam  dadau
translated: therefore he will become bodiless.

original: pratibuddhaś cāsāv avanipatir api prāha /🔽yasmān mām asaṃbhāṣyājñānata eva śayānasya śāpotsargam asau duṣṭaguruś cakāra tasmāt tasyāpi dehaḥ patito bhaviṣyatīti pratiśāpaṃ dattvā deham
analyzed: pratibuddhaḥ ca asau avanipatiḥ api prāha  yasmāt mām a saṃbhāṣya ajñānataḥ eva śayānasya śāpa utsargam asau duṣṭa guruḥ cakāra tasmāt tasya api dehaḥ patitaḥ bhaviṣyati iti pratiśāpam dattvā deham
translated: And the awakened lord of the earth also said,

original: atyajat // / / //
analyzed: atyajat
translated: Since this wicked guru cursed me while I was lying down without consulting me out of ignorance, therefore his body will fall down. Having given this counter-curse, he abandoned his body.

original: tasmāc chāpāc ca mitrāvaruṇayos tejasi vasiṣṭhatejaḥ praviṣṭam /
analyzed: tasmāt śāpāt ca mitrāvaruṇayoḥ tejasi vasiṣṭha tejaḥ praviṣṭam
translated: From that curse, Vashishtha's energy entered the energy of Mitra and Varuna.

original: urvaśīdarśanād udbhūtabījaprapātayos sakāśād vasiṣṭho deham aparaṃ lebhe // / / //
analyzed: urvaśī darśanāt udbhūta bīja prapātayoḥ sakāśāt vasiṣṭhaḥ deham aparam lebhe
translated: Due to seeing Urvashi, Vashishtha obtained another body from the place where the seed fell due to arousal.

original: nimer api taccharīram atimanoharatailagandhādibhir upasaṃskriyamāṇaṃ naiva kledādikaṃ doṣam avāpa sadyomṛtam iva tasthau /
analyzed: nimeḥ api tat śarīram ati manohara taila gandha ādibhiḥ upasaṃskriyamāṇam nā eva kleda ādikam doṣam avāpa sadyas mṛtam iva tasthau
translated: Nimi's body, being processed with very charming oil, fragrance, etc., did not incur faults like stickiness, etc., and remained like one just dead.

original: yajñasamāptau bhāgagrahaṇāyāgatān devān V devān āgatān ṛtvija ūcuḥ /
analyzed: yajña samāptau bhāga grahaṇāya āgatān devān u devān āgatān ṛtvijaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: At the conclusion of the sacrifice, the priests said to the gods who had come to receive their shares:

original: yajamānāya varo dīyatām iti devaiś ca chandito 'sau nimir āha // / / //
analyzed: yajamānāya varaḥ dīyatām iti devaiḥ ca sau nimiḥ āha
translated: Let a boon be given to the sacrificer. And the gods, being pleased, said to Nimi:

original: bhagavanto 'khilasaṃsāraduḥkhasaṃghātasya chettāro na hy etāvaj jagaty anyad duḥkham asti yac charīrātmanor viyoge bhavati /
analyzed: bhagavantaḥ khila saṃsāra duḥkha saṃghātasya chettāraḥ na hi etāvat jagati anyat duḥkham asti yat śarīra ātmanoḥ viyoge bhavati
translated: O lords, you are the cutters of the mass of all worldly sufferings. There is no other suffering in the world like that which occurs when there is separation of the body and the soul.

original: tad aham icchāmi sakalalokalocaneṣu vastuṃ na punaḥ śarīragrahaṇaṃ kartum ity evam uktair devair asāv aśeṣabhūtānāṃ netreṣv avatāritaḥ // / /
analyzed: tat aham icchāmi sakala loka locaneṣu vastum na punar śarīra grahaṇam kartum iti evam uktaiḥ devaiḥ asau aśeṣa bhūtānām netreṣu avatāritaḥ  /
translated: Therefore, I wish to dwell in the eyes of all people, and not to take up a body again. Thus addressed by the gods, he was introduced into the eyes of all beings.

original: tato bhūtāny unmeṣanimeṣaṃ cakruḥ /
analyzed: tatas bhūtāni unmeṣa nimeṣam cakruḥ
translated: Then the elements opened and closed.

original: aputrasya tasya bhūbhujaḥ śarīram arājakabhīravas te munayo 'raṇyā mamanthuḥ // / / //
analyzed: aputrasya tasya bhūbhujaḥ śarīram arājaka bhīravaḥ te munayaḥ raṇyā mamanthuḥ
translated: The sages, afraid of anarchy, churned the body of that childless king.

original: tatra ca kumāro jajñe jananāj janakasaṃjñāṃ cāvāpa // / / //
analyzed: tatra ca kumāraḥ jajñe jananāt janaka saṃjñām ca avāpa
translated: And a prince was born, who from his birth received the name of Janaka.

original: abhūd videho 'sya piteti vaideho mathanān mithir abhūt /
analyzed: abhūt videhaḥ sya pitā iti vaidehaḥ mathanāt mithiḥ abhūt
translated: And because his father was bodiless, he was called Videha, and from being churned, he was called Mithi.

original: tasyodāvasuḥ putro 'bhavat /
analyzed: tasya udāvasuḥ putraḥ bhavat
translated: His son was Udavasu.

original: udāvasor nandivardhanas tataḥ suketuḥ tasmāc ca devarātas tataś ca bṛhadukthas tasya
analyzed: udāvasoḥ nandivardhanaḥ tatas suketuḥ tasmāt ca devarātaḥ tatas ca bṛhadukthaḥ tasya
translated: From Udavasu, Nandivardhana, from him Suketu, from him Devarata, from him Brihaduktha,

original: ca mahāvīryas tasyāpi satyadhṛtis dhṛtiḥ tataś ca dhṛṣṭaketur ajāyata dhṛṣṭaketor
analyzed: ca mahāvīryaḥ tasya api satyadhṛtiḥ dhṛtiḥ tatas ca dhṛṣṭaketuḥ ajāyata dhṛṣṭaketoḥ
translated: from him Mahavirya, from him Satyadhrti, from him Dhriti, and from him Dhristaketu was born.

original: haryaśvas tasya ca marur maroḥ pratibandhakas tasmāt kṛtarathas tasmāt kṛtis tasya
analyzed: haryaśvaḥ tasya ca maruḥ maroḥ pratibandhakaḥ tasmāt kṛtarathaḥ tasmāt kṛtiḥ tasya
translated: From Dhristaketu, Haryashva, from him Maru, from Maru, Pratibandhaka, from him Kritaratha, from him Kritin,

original: vibudhaḥ tasyāpi mahādhṛtis tataś ca kṛtirātas tato mahāromā /
analyzed: vibudhaḥ tasya api mahādhṛtiḥ tatas ca kṛtirātaḥ tatas mahāromā
translated: from him Vibudha, from him Maha-dhrti, from him Kritaratha, from him Maharoman.

original: tasya suvarṇaromā tasyāpi hrasvaromā tataḥ sīradhvajo 'bhūt /
analyzed: tasya suvarṇaromā tasya api hrasvaromā tatas sīradhvajaḥ bhūt
translated: His son was Suvarnaroman, from him Hrasvaroman, from him Sirdhvaja was born.

original: tasya putrārthaṃ yajanabhuvaṃ kṛṣataḥ sīre sītā duhitā samutpannā /
analyzed: tasya putra artham yajana bhuvam kṛṣataḥ sīre sītā duhitā samutpannā
translated: For the sake of a son, while plowing the sacrificial ground, a daughter named Sita was born in the furrow.

original: sīradhvajasya bhrātā sāṃkāśyādhipatiḥ kuśadhvajanāmā /
analyzed: sīradhvajasya bhrātā sāṃkāśya adhipatiḥ kuśadhvaja nāmā
translated: The brother of Sīradhvaja, the lord of Sāṃkāśya, was named Kuśadhvaja.

original: sīradhvajasyāpatyaṃ bhānumān bhānumataḥ śatadyumnaḥ tasya śucis tasmād ūrjavaho putro jajñe // / / //
analyzed: sīradhvajasya apatyam bhānumān bhānumataḥ śatadyumnaḥ tasya śuciḥ tasmāt ūrjavaho putraḥ jajñe
translated: The son of Sīradhvaja was Bhānumān, the son of Bhānumān was Śatadyumna, his son was Śuci, his son was Ūrjavāha.

original: tasyāpi śatadhvajaḥ tataḥ kuṇiḥ kuṇer añjanas tatputra ṛtujit tato 'riṣṭanemis tasmāc
analyzed: tasya api śatadhvajaḥ tatas kuṇiḥ kuṇeḥ añjanaḥ tad putraḥ ṛtujit tatas riṣṭanemiḥ tasmāt
translated: His son was Śatadhvaja, his son was Kuṇi, the son of Kuṇi was Aṅjana, his son was Ṛtujit, his son was Ariṣṭanemi,

original: chrutāyuḥ śrutāyuṣaḥ supārvas tasmāt saṃjayas tataḥ kṣemāris tasmād anenās tasmād
analyzed: chrutāyuḥ śrutāyuṣaḥ supārvaḥ tasmāt saṃjayaḥ tatas kṣemāriḥ tasmāt anenāḥ tasmāt
translated: his son was Śrutayu, his son was Suparvan, his son was Saṃjaya, his son was Kṣemāri, his son was Anenā,

original: mīnarathas tasya satyarathas tasya sātyarathiḥ sātyarather upagus tasmāc chāśvatas
analyzed: mīnarathaḥ tasya satyarathaḥ tasya sātyarathiḥ sātyaratheḥ upaguḥ tasmāt śāśvataḥ
translated: his son was Mīnaratha, his son was Satyaratha, his son was Sātyarathi, his son was Upagu, his son was Śāśvata,
