original: tasmāt sudhanvā tasyāpi subhāṣaḥ tataḥ suśrutas tasmāj jayo jayaputro vijayas tasya
analyzed: tasmāt sudhanvā tasya api subhāṣaḥ tatas suśrutaḥ tasmāt jayaḥ jayaputraḥ vijayaḥ tasya
translated: his son was Sudhanvan, his son was Subhāṣa, his son was Suśruta, his son was Jaya, his son was Vijaya,

original: ca ṛto nāma suśrutaḥ tasmāt suśrutāj jayaḥ tasya putro
analyzed: ca ṛtaḥ nāma suśrutaḥ tasmāt suśrutāt jayaḥ tasya putraḥ
translated: his son was Ṛta, his son was Suśruta, his son was Jaya, his son was

original: vijayaḥ vijayasya ṛtaḥ ṛtāt sunayas tato vītahavyas tasmād dhṛtir dhṛter bahulāśvas tasya putraḥ kṛtiḥ kṛtau saṃtiṣṭate 'yaṃ janakavaṃśaḥ //
analyzed: vijayaḥ vijayasya ṛtaḥ ṛtāt sunayaḥ tatas vītahavyaḥ tasmāt dhṛtiḥ dhṛteḥ bahulāśvaḥ tasya putraḥ kṛtiḥ kṛtau saṃtiṣṭate yam janaka vaṃśaḥ
translated: The son of Vijaya was Ritu, from Ritu was born Sunaha, from Sunaha was born Vītahavya, from Vītahavya was born Dhriti, from Dhriti was born Bahulāśva, his son was Kṛti, and the family of Janaka ends with Kṛti.

original: ity ete maithilāḥ prācuryeṇa teṣām ātmavidyāśrayiṇo bhūpālā bhaviṣyantīti // / / //
analyzed: iti ete maithilāḥ prācuryeṇa teṣām ātma vidyā āśrayiṇaḥ bhūpālāḥ bhaviṣyanti iti
translated: These are the principal kings of the Mithila dynasty, who will be devoted to the knowledge of the soul.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe pañcamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe pañcamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fifth chapter in the fourth section of the Visnu Purana.

original: maitreya uvāca /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca
translated: Maitreya said:

original: sūryasya bhagavan vaṃśaḥ kathito bhavatā mama /
analyzed: sūryasya bhagavan vaṃśaḥ kathitaḥ bhavatā mama
translated: You have told me about the solar dynasty, O Lord.

original: somasya vaṃśe tv akhilāñ śrotum icchāmi pārthivān // / / //
analyzed: somasya vaṃśe tu akhilām śrotum icchāmi pārthivān
translated: I wish to hear about the entire lunar dynasty of kings.

original: kīrtyate sthirakīrtīnāṃ yeṣām adyāpi saṃtatiḥ /
analyzed: kīrtyate sthira kīrtīnām yeṣām adyā api saṃtatiḥ
translated: The descendants of those of firm fame are still being sung.

original: prasādasumukhas tan me brahmann ākhyātum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: prasāda su mukhaḥ tat me brahman ākhyātum arhasi
translated: O Brahman, it befits you to tell me this, with a face beaming with favor.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: śrūyatāṃ muniśārdūla vaṃśaḥ prathitatejasaḥ /
analyzed: śrūyatām muni śārdūla vaṃśaḥ prathita tejasaḥ
translated: Listen, O tiger among sages, about the dynasty of the famous kings.

original: somasyānukramāt khyātā yatrorvīpatayo 'bhavan // / / //
analyzed: somasya anukramāt khyātāḥ yatra urvīpatayaḥ bhavan
translated: In which the lords of the earth were born, in the line of Soma.

original: ayaṃ hi vaṃśo 'tibalaparākramadyutiśīlaceṣṭāvadbhir atiguṇānvitair nahuṣayayātikārtavīryārjunādibhir bhūpālair alaṃkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: ayam hi vaṃśaḥ ti bala parākrama dyuti śīla ceṣṭāvadbhiḥ ati guṇa anvitaiḥ nahuṣa yayāti kārtavīrya arjuna ādibhiḥ bhūpālaiḥ alaṃkṛtaḥ
translated: This dynasty is adorned with kings like Nahuṣa, Yayāti, Kārtavīrya, Arjuna, and others, who were endowed with great qualities, possessing immense strength, valor, splendor, character, and deeds.

original: tam ahaṃ kathayāmi śrūyatām // / / //
analyzed: tam aham kathayāmi śrūyatām
translated: I shall narrate it. Listen...

original: akhilajagatsraṣṭur bhagavannārāyaṇanābhisarojinīsamudbhavābjayoner brahmaṇaḥ putro 'trir atreḥ somaḥ // / / //
analyzed: akhila jagat sraṣṭuḥ bhagavat nārāyaṇa nābhi sarojinī samudbhava abjayoneḥ brahmaṇaḥ tris atreḥ somaḥ
translated: Brahmā, born from the lotus in the navel of Lord Nārāyaṇa, the creator of the entire world, had a son named Atri. Atri's son was Soma...

original: taṃ ca bhagavān abjayonir aśeṣauṣadhīdvijanakṣatrāṇām ādhipatye 'bhyaṣecayat // / / //
analyzed: tam ca bhagavān abjayoniḥ aśeṣa oṣadhī dvija nakṣatrāṇām ādhipatye bhyaṣecayat
translated: And the Lord of the Lotus, Brahmā, consecrated him as the lord of all herbs, twice-born ones, and stars...

original: sa ca rājasūyam akarot /
analyzed: sa ca rājasūyam akarot
translated: And he performed the Rajasuya sacrifice.

original: tatprabhāvād atyutkṛṣṭādhipatyādhiṣṭhātṛtvāc cainaṃ mada āviveśa // / / //
analyzed: tad prabhāvāt ati utkṛṣṭa ādhipatya adhiṣṭhātṛ tvāt ca enam madaḥ āviveśa
translated: And due to its power and his position as the lord of extremely exalted dominion, intoxication entered him...

original: madāvalepāc cāsau sakaladevaguror bṛhaspates tārāṃ nāma patnīṃ jahāra // / / //
analyzed: mada avalepāt ca asau sakala deva guroḥ bṛhaspateḥ tārām nāma patnīm jahāra
translated: And due to the intoxication and arrogance, he abducted Tārā, the wife of Bṛhaspati, the preceptor of all gods...

original: bahuśas tu bṛhaspaticoditena bhagavatā brahmaṇā codyamānaḥ sakalaiś ca devarṣibhir yācyamāno 'pi na mumoca // / / //
analyzed: bahuśas tu bṛhaspati coditena bhagavatā brahmaṇā codyamānaḥ sakalaiḥ ca deva ṛṣibhiḥ yācyamānaḥ pi na mumoca
translated: Though repeatedly urged by Bṛhaspati, requested by Lord Brahmā, and entreated by all the celestial sages, he did not release her...

original: tasya ca bṛhaspatidveṣād uśanā pārṣṇigrāho 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: tasya ca bṛhaspati dveṣāt uśanā pārṣṇigrāhaḥ bhavat
translated: And due to his hatred for Bṛhaspati, Śukra became his supporter...

original: aṅgiraḥ sakāśād upalabdhavidyo bhagavān rudro bṛhaspateḥ sahāyyam akarot // / / //
analyzed: aṅgiraḥ sakāśāt upalabdha vidyaḥ bhagavān rudraḥ bṛhaspateḥ sahāyyam akarot
translated: The illustrious Rudra, having obtained knowledge from Angiras, became the helper of Brihaspati.

original: yataś cośanā tato jambhakumbhādyāḥ samastā eva daityadānavanikāyā mahāntam udyamaṃ cakruḥ /
analyzed: yatas ca uśanā tatas jambha kumbha ādyāḥ samastāḥ eva daitya dānava nikāyāḥ mahāntam udyamam cakruḥ
translated: And from Ushanas, all the classes of Daityas and Danavas, headed by Jambha, Kumbha, and others, made a great effort.

original: bṛhaspater api sakaladevasainyasahāyaḥ śakro 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: bṛhaspateḥ api sakala deva sainya sahāyaḥ śakraḥ bhavat
translated: And Shakra also became the helper of Brihaspati with the entire army of the gods.

original: evaṃ ca tayor atīvograḥ saṃgrāmas tārānimittas tārakāmayo nāmābhavat /
analyzed: evam ca tayoḥ atīva ugraḥ saṃgrāmaḥ tārā nimittaḥ tārakā mayaḥ nāma abhavat
translated: And thus there was a very fierce battle between them, for the sake of Tara, named the battle of the stars.

original: tataḥ samastaśastrāṇy asureṣu rudrapurogamā devā deveṣu cāśeṣadānavā mumucuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas samasta śastrāṇi asureṣu rudra purogamāḥ devāḥ deveṣu ca aśeṣa dānavāḥ mumucuḥ
translated: And the gods, headed by Rudra, released all their weapons on the asuras, and the entire class of danavas on the gods.

original: evaṃ ca devāsurāhavakṣobhakṣubdhahṛdayam aśeṣaṃ eva jagad brahmāṇaṃ śaraṇaṃ jagāma // / / //
analyzed: evam ca deva asura āhava kṣobha kṣubdha hṛdayam aśeṣam eva jagat brahmāṇam śaraṇam jagāma
translated: And thus the entire world, agitated by the disturbance of the battle between the gods and asuras, went for refuge to Brahma.

original: tataś ca bhagavān apy uśanasaṃ śaṃkaram asurān devāṃś ca nivārya bṛhaspataye tārām adadāt /
analyzed: tatas ca bhagavān api uśanasam śaṃkaram asurān devān ca nivārya bṛhaspataye tārām adadāt
translated: And then the Lord also, having restrained Ushanas, Shankara, the asuras, and the gods, gave Tara to Brihaspati.

original: tāṃ cāntaḥprasavām avalokya bṛhaspatir āha // / / //
analyzed: tām ca antar prasavām avalokya bṛhaspatiḥ āha
translated: And seeing her pregnant, Brihaspati said...

original: naiṣa mama kṣetre bhavatyānyasya suto dhāryaḥ samutsṛjainam alam atidhārṣṭyeneti // / / //
analyzed: na eṣa mama kṣetre bhavatyā anyasya sutaḥ dhāryaḥ samutsṛja enam alam ati dhārṣṭyena iti
translated: He is not to be reared in my house as the son of another. Cast him off. Enough of this impudence.

original: sā ca tenaivam uktātipativratā bhartṛvacanāt tam īṣikāstambe garbham utsasarja // / / //
analyzed: sā ca tena evam uktā ati pativratā bhartṛ vacanāt tam īṣikā stambe garbham utsasarja
translated: Thus addressed by him, that exceedingly chaste wife, at the command of her husband, cast that embryo on the stem of a sugarcane in the forest.

original: sa cotsṛṣṭamātra evātitejasā devānāṃ tejāṃsy ācikṣepa // / / //
analyzed: sa ca utsṛṣṭa mātraḥ eva ati tejasā devānām tejāṃsi ācikṣepa
translated: As soon as it was cast off, it eclipsed the splendour of the gods with its own excessive splendour.

original: bṛhaspatim induṃ ca tasya kumārasyāticārutayā sābhilāṣau dṛṣṭvā devāḥ samutpannasaṃdehās tārāṃ papracchuḥ // / / //
analyzed: bṛhaspatim indum ca tasya kumārasya ati cāru tayā sa abhilāṣau dṛṣṭvā devāḥ samutpanna saṃdehāḥ tārām papracchuḥ
translated: Seeing that youth's excessive beauty, Brihaspati and Indu became desirous. The gods, having doubts, asked Tara about it.

original: satyaṃ kathayāsmākam atisubhage kasyāyam ātmajaḥ somasyātha bṛhaspateḥ putraḥ /
analyzed: satyam kathaya asmākam ati subhage kasya ayam ātmajaḥ somasya atha bṛhaspateḥ putraḥ
translated: Tell us the truth, O exceedingly fortunate one. Whose son is this, Soma's or Brihaspati's?

original: ityuktāpi sā tārā hriyā na kiṃcid uvāca /
analyzed: iti uktā api sā tārā hriyā na kiṃcid uvāca
translated: Though thus addressed, Tara, out of shame, said nothing.

original: bahuśo 'py abhihitā yadāsau devebhyo nācacakṣe tataś ca sa kumāras tāṃ śaptum udyataḥ prāha ca /
analyzed: bahuśas pi abhihitā yadā asau devebhyaḥ na ācacakṣe tatas ca sa kumāraḥ tām śaptum udyataḥ prāha ca
translated: Even when repeatedly asked, when she did not declare it to the gods, then that youth, ready to curse her, said:

original: duṣṭe kasmān mama tātaṃ nākhyāsi /
analyzed: duṣṭe kasmāt mama tātam na ākhyāsi
translated: O wicked one, why do you not declare my father?

original: adyaiva te 'līkalajjāvatyās tathā śāstim ayam ahaṃ karomi yathā naivam anyāpy atimantharavacanā bhaviṣyatīti
analyzed: adyā eva te līka lajjāvatyāḥ tathā śāstim ayam aham karomi yathā nā evam anyā api ati manthara vacanā bhaviṣyati iti
translated: I will punish you so severely today, O you who are falsely modest, that no other woman will speak so slowly.

original: atha bhagavān pitāmahas taṃ kumāraṃ saṃnivārya svayam apṛcchat tārām /
analyzed: atha bhagavān pitāmahaḥ tam kumāram saṃnivārya svayam apṛcchat tārām
translated: Then the Blessed Grandfather, having restrained the boy, himself asked Tārā:

original: kathaya vatse kasyāyam ātmajaḥ somasya atha bṛhaspater ity uktā lajjājaḍam āha somasyeti // / / //
analyzed: kathaya vatse kasya ayam ātmajaḥ somasya atha bṛhaspateḥ iti uktā lajjā jaḍam āha somasya iti
translated: Tell me, child, whose son is this? Is he Soma's or Brihaspati's? Thus asked, she said with a voice stammering from shame, Soma's.

original: tataḥ sphuraducchvasitāmalakapolakāntir bhagavān uḍupatis tam āliṅgya kumāraṃ sādhu sādhu vatsa prājño 'sīti budha iti nāma cakre // / /
analyzed: tatas sphurat ucchvasita amala kapola kāntiḥ bhagavān uḍupatiḥ tam āliṅgya kumāram sādhu sādhu vatsa prājñaḥ si iti budhaḥ iti nāma cakre  /
translated: Then the Blessed Lord of the Stars, with the beauty of his cheeks shining and breathing, embraced that boy and said, Well done, well done, child, you are wise. He gave him the name Budha.

original: sa cākhyātam evaitad yathelāyām ātmajapurūravasam utpādayām āsa /
analyzed: sa ca ākhyātam eva etat yathā ilāyām ātmaja purūravasam utpādayām āsa
translated: And it is well known how he begot on Ilā his son Purūravas.

original: purūravās tv atidānaśīlo 'tiyajvātitejasvī yaṃ satyavādinam atirūpiṇaṃ mitrāvaruṇaśāpān mānuṣe loke mayā vastavyam iti kṛtamatir urvaśī dadarśa
analyzed: purūravāḥ tu ati dāna śīlaḥ u ti yajvā ati tejasvī yam satya vādinam ati rūpiṇam mitrāvaruṇa śāpāt mānuṣe loke mayā vastavyam iti kṛta matiḥ urvaśī dadarśa
translated: But Purūravas, being very generous, very devout, and very brilliant, was seen by Urvaśī, who had resolved, I must live in the human world because of the curse of Mitra and Varuṇa, and who was known for her truthfulness, her beauty, and her excessive love of pleasure.

original: dṛṣṭamātre ca yasminn apahāya mānam aśeṣasvargābhilāṣam apāsya tanmanaskā bhūtvā tam evopatasthe // / / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭa mātre ca yasmin apahāya mānam aśeṣa svarga abhilāṣam apāsya tad manaskā bhūtvā tam eva upatasthe
translated: And as soon as she saw him, she cast off all pride, abandoned all desire for heaven, became intent on him, and approached him.

original: so 'pi ca tām atiśayitasakalalokastrīkāntisaukumāryalāvaṇyagativilāsahāsādiguṇām avalokya tadāyattacittavṛttir babhūva // / / //
analyzed: saḥ pi ca tām atiśayita sakala loka strī kānti saukumārya lāvaṇya gati vilāsa hāsa ādi guṇām avalokya tad āyatta cittavṛttiḥ babhūva
translated: And he, beholding her, whose beauty, youth, grace, gait, and smile surpassed those of all women in the world, became absorbed in her, his thoughts fixed on her.

original: ubhayam api tanmanaskam ananyadṛṣṭi parityaktasamastānyatprayojanam abhūt // / / //
analyzed: ubhayam api tad manaskam ananya dṛṣṭi parityakta samasta anya prayojanam abhūt
translated: And both of them, their minds fixed on each other, their eyes on no other object, abandoned all other purposes.

original: rājā tu prāgalbhyāt tām āha // / / //
analyzed: rājā tu prāgalbhyāt tām āha
translated: But the king, being bold, said to her:

original: subhru tvām aham atikāmo 'smi /
analyzed: subhru tvām aham atikāmaḥ smi
translated: Fair-browed one, I am very much in love with you.

original: prasīdānurāgam udvahety uktā lajjāvakhaṇḍitam urvaśī prāha // / / //
analyzed: prasīda anurāgam udvaha iti uktā lajjā avakhaṇḍitam urvaśī prāha
translated: Be gracious and accept my love. Thus addressed, Urvashi, abashed by shame, replied:

original: bhavatv evaṃ yadi me samayaparipālanaṃ bhavān karoti // / / //
analyzed: bhavatu evam yadi me samaya paripālanam bhavān karoti
translated: So be it, if you will keep your promise.

original: ākhyāhi me samayam ity atha pṛṣṭā punar abravīt /
analyzed: ākhyāhi me samayam iti atha pṛṣṭā punar abravīt
translated: Tell me your promise. When asked again, she said:

original: śayanasamīpe mamoraṇakadvayaṃ putrabhūtaṃ nāpaneyam /
analyzed: śayana samīpe mama uraṇaka dvayam putra bhūtam na apaneyam
translated: Near my bed, two sparrows, like my children, are not to be removed.

original: bhavāṃś ca mayā nagno na draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: bhavān ca mayā nagnaḥ na draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: And you are not to be seen naked by me.

original: ghṛtamātraṃ ca mamāhāra ity evam eveti bhūpatir āha /
analyzed: ghṛta mātram ca mama āhāraḥ iti evam eva iti bhūpatiḥ āha
translated: And my food is to be only ghee. The king said, So be it.

original: tayā ca sahāvanīpatir alakāyāṃ caitrarathādivaneṣv amalapadmaṣaṇḍeṣu saraḥsv abhiramamāṇa ekaṣaṣṭivarṣāṇy anudinapravardhamānapramodo 'nayat
analyzed: tayā ca saha avanīpatiḥ alakāyām caitraratha ādi vaneṣu amala padma ṣaṇḍeṣu saraḥsu abhiramamāṇaḥ eka ṣaṣṭi varṣāṇi anu dina pravardhamāna pramodaḥ nayat
translated: And with her the lord of the land, his joy increasing day by day, spent sixty-one years in the gardens of Alakā, such as the Caitraratha, and in the lakes with their clusters of spotless lotuses.

original: urvaśī ca tadupabhogāt pratidinapravardhamānānurāgā amaralokavāse 'pi na spṛhāṃ cakāra // / / //
analyzed: urvaśī ca tad upabhogāt prati dina pravardhamāna anurāgā amara loka vāse na spṛhām cakāra
translated: And Urvaśī, her love increasing day by day from his enjoyment of her, did not even long to dwell in the world of the immortals.

original: vinā corvaśyā suraloko 'psarasāṃ siddhagandharvāṇāṃ ca nātiramaṇīyo 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: vinā ca urvaśyā upsarasām siddha gandharvāṇām ca na ati ramaṇīyaḥ bhavat
translated: And without Urvaśī, the world of the gods, with its nymphs, siddhas, and gandharvas, was not very delightful.

original: tataś corvaśīpurūravasoḥ samayavid viśvāvasur gandharvasamaveto niśi śayanābhyāśād ekam uraṇakaṃ jahāra // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca urvaśī purūravasoḥ samaya vid viśvāvasuḥ gandharva samavetaḥ niśi śayana abhyāśāt ekam uraṇakam jahāra
translated: Then Viśvāvasu, who knew the agreement between Urvaśī and Purūravas, together with the gandharvas, carried off one of the sheep at night from near their bed.

original: tasyākāśe nīyamānasyorvaśī śabdam aśṛṇot /
analyzed: tasya ākāśe nīyamānasya urvaśī śabdam aśṛṇot
translated: And Urvaśī heard the sound of it being carried off into the sky.

original: āha ca mamānāthāyāḥ putraḥ kenāpy'pahriyate kaṃ śaraṇam upayāmīty V iti ākarṇya rājā nagnaṃ māṃ devī drakṣyatīti na yayau /
analyzed: āha ca mama anāthāyāḥ putraḥ kena api apahriyate kam śaraṇam upayāmi iti iti ākarṇya rājā nagnam mām devī drakṣyati iti na yayau
translated: And she said, My son is being carried off by someone, helpless that I am. To whom shall I go for protection? Hearing this, the king did not go, thinking, The queen will see me naked.

original: athānyam apy uraṇakam ādāya gandharvā yayuḥ /
analyzed: atha anyam api uraṇakam ādāya gandharvāḥ yayuḥ
translated: Then the gandharvas took another sheep and went away.

original: tasyāpy apahriyamāṇasyaśabdam ākarṇya'kāśe punar apy anāthāsmy aham abhartṛkā kupuruṣāśrayety ārtarāviṇī babhūva // / / //
analyzed: tasya api apahriyamāṇasya aśabdam ākarṇya kāśe punar api anāthā asmi aham abhartṛkā kupuruṣa āśrayā iti ārta rāviṇī babhūva
translated: Hearing the sound of her being carried off, she cried out in the sky again, 'I am helpless, without a husband, dependent on a bad man.' And she lamented piteously.

original: rājāpy amarṣavaśād andhakāram etad iti khaḍgam ādāya duṣṭa duṣṭa hato 'sīti vyāharann abhyadhāvat // / / //
analyzed: rājā api amarṣa vaśāt andhakāram etat iti khaḍgam ādāya duṣṭa duṣṭa hataḥ sīti vyāharan abhyadhāvat
translated: The king, out of anger, thinking it was darkness, took up his sword and ran forward, shouting, 'You wretch, you're killed!'

original: tāvac ca gandharvair atīvojjvalā vidyuj janitā /
analyzed: tāvat ca gandharvaiḥ atīva ujjvalā vidyut janitā
translated: And just then, the gandharvas created a very bright lightning flash.

original: tatprabhayā corvaśī rājānam apagatāmbaraṃ dṛṣṭvāpavṛttasamayā tatkṣaṇād evāpakrāntā // / / //
analyzed: tad prabhayā ca urvaśī rājānam apagata ambaram dṛṣṭvā apavṛtta samayā tad kṣaṇāt eva apakrāntā
translated: And by its light Urvashī saw the king without his clothes, and her time was over at that moment, so she immediately departed.

original: parityajya tāv uraṇakau gandharvāḥ suralokam upagatāḥ // / / //
analyzed: parityajya tau uraṇakau gandharvāḥ sura lokam upagatāḥ
translated: And the gandharvas, leaving the two rams, went to the world of the gods.

original: rājāpi ca tau meṣāv ādāya hṛṣṭamanāḥ svaśayanam āyāto norvaśīṃ dadarśa // / / //
analyzed: rājā api ca tau meṣau ādāya hṛṣṭa manāḥ sva śayanam āyātaḥ nā urvaśīm dadarśa
translated: And the king, taking the two rams, went joyfully to his bed, but did not see Urvashī.

original: tāṃ cāpaśyann apagatāmbara evonmattarūpo babhrāma /
analyzed: tām ca apaśyan apagata ambaraḥ evā unmatta rūpaḥ babhrāma
translated: And not seeing her, he wandered about in a mad state, still without his clothes.

original: kurukṣetre cāmbhojasarasy anyābhiś catasṛbhir apsarobhiḥ samavetām urvaśīṃ dadarśa /
analyzed: kurukṣetre ca ambhoja sarasi anyābhiḥ catasṛbhiḥ apsarobhiḥ samavetām urvaśīm dadarśa
translated: And in Kurukshetra, he saw Urvashī together with four other celestial nymphs in a lotus lake.

original: tataś conmattarūpo jāye he tiṣṭha manasi ghore tiṣṭha vacasīty anekaprakāraṃ sūktam avocat // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca unmatta rūpaḥ jāye he tiṣṭha manasi ghore tiṣṭha vacasi iti aneka prakāram sūktam avocat
translated: Then he became like a madman, saying in various ways, Stay, mind! Stay, thought! and so on.

original: āha corvaśī /
analyzed: āha ca urvaśī
translated: And Urvasi said:

original: mahārājālam anenāvivekaceṣṭitenāntarvatny aham abdānte bhavatātrāgantavyaṃ kumāras🔽te bhaviṣyatīty ekāṃ ca niśām ahaṃ tvayā saha vatsyāmīty uktaḥ prahṛṣṭaḥ svapuraṃ
analyzed: mahā rāja alam anena aviveka ceṣṭitena antarvatnī aham abda ante bhavatā atra āgantavyam kumāraḥ  te bhaviṣyati iti ekām ca niśām aham tvayā saha vatsyāmi iti uktaḥ prahṛṣṭaḥ sva puram
translated: Great king, enough of this unseemly behavior. I am pregnant. At the end of a year you should come here.

original: jagāma // / / //
analyzed: jagāma
translated: You will have a son. And she said, I will spend one night with you. Thus addressed, he joyfully went to his own city.

original: tāsāṃ cāpsarasām urvaśī kathayām āsa /
analyzed: tāsām ca apsarasām urvaśī kathayām āsa
translated: And Urvasi told the other celestial nymphs:

original: ayaṃ sa puruṣotkarṣṭo yenāham etāvantaṃ kālam anurāgākṛṣṭamānasā sahoṣitety evam uktās tām apsarasa ūcuḥ /
analyzed: ayam sa puruṣa utkarṣṭaḥ yena aham etāvantam kālam anurāga ākṛṣṭa mānasā saha uṣitā iti evam uktāḥ tām apsarasaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: This is the best of men with whom I have lived for so long, my mind drawn by love. When they heard this, the nymphs said:

original: sādhu sādhv asya rūpam anena sahāsmākam api sarvakālam abhirantuṃ spṛhā bhavet /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu asya rūpam anena saha asmākam api sarvakālam abhirantum spṛhā bhavet
translated: Excellent, excellent! We too would always delight in him.

original: ity abde ca pūrṇe sa rājā tatrājagāma /
analyzed: iti abde ca pūrṇe sa rājā tatra ājagāma
translated: And when the year was full, the king came there.

original: kumāraṃ cāyuṣam asmai tadorvaśī dadau // / / //
analyzed: kumāram ca āyuṣam asmai tadā urvaśī dadau
translated: And Urvasi gave him the boy Ayus.

original: ekāṃ ca niśāṃ tena rājñā sahoṣitvā pañcaputrotpattaye garbham avāpa // / / //
analyzed: ekām ca niśām tena rājñā saha uṣitvā pañca putra utpattaye garbham avāpa
translated: And having spent one night with the king, she conceived a child who would have five sons.

original: uvāca cainaṃ rājānam asmatprītyā mahārājāya sarva eva gandharvā varadāḥ saṃvṛttā vriyatāṃ vara iti // / / //
analyzed: uvāca ca enam rājānam asmad prītyā mahā rājāya sarve eva gandharvāḥ vara dāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ vriyatām varaḥ iti
translated: And he said to the king: 'For the sake of Urvasi, O king, all the Gandharvas have become givers of boons. Choose a boon.'

original: āha rājā /
analyzed: āha rājā
translated: The king said:

original: vijitasakalārātir avihatendriyasāmarthyo bandhumān amitabalakośo nānyad asmākam urvaśīsālokyād aprāpyam asti /
analyzed: vijita sakala arātiḥ avihata indriya sāmarthyaḥ bandhumān amita bala kośaḥ na anyat asmākam urvaśī sālokyāt a prāpyam asti
translated: 'I have conquered all my enemies, my faculties are unimpaired, I have kinsmen, and my strength and wealth are unlimited. There is nothing that I cannot obtain except the companionship of Urvasi.

original: tad aham anayā sahorvaśyā kālaṃ netum abhilaṣāmi // / / //
analyzed: tat aham anayā saha urvaśyā kālam netum abhilaṣāmi
translated: Therefore I desire to spend my time with Urvasi.'

original: ity ukte gandharvā rājñe 'gnisthālīṃ daduḥ // / / //
analyzed: iti ukte gandharvāḥ rājñe gni sthālīm daduḥ
translated: When this was said, the Gandharvas gave the king a pot of fire.

original: ūcuś cainam agnim āmnāyānusārī bhūtvā tridhā kṛtvorvaśīsalokatāmanoratham uddiśya
analyzed: ūcuḥ ca enam agnim āmnāya anusārī bhūtvā tridhā kṛtvā urvaśī salokatā manoratham uddiśya
translated: And they said to him: 'Having followed the Vedic injunctions, divide your desire for companionship with Urvasi into three parts,

original: samyag yajethās tato 'vaśyam abhilaṣitam avāpsyasīty uktas tām agnisthālīm ādāyājagāma
analyzed: samyak yajethāḥ tatas vaśyam abhilaṣitam avāpsyasi iti uktaḥ tām agni sthālīm ādāya ājagāma
translated: and worship properly. Then you will certainly obtain what you desire.' Having been told this, he took the pot of fire and went away.

original: antar aṭavyām acintayad aho me 'timūḍhatā yad agnisthalī mayānītā norvaśīti /
analyzed: antar aṭavyām acintayat aho me ti mūḍha tā yat agni sthalī mayā ānītā nā urvaśī iti
translated: In the middle of the forest, he thought: 'Alas, my extreme foolishness! I have brought a pot of fire, not Urvasi.'

original: athainām aṭavyām evāgnisthālīṃ tatyāja svapuraṃ cājagāma // / / //
analyzed: atha enām aṭavyām eva agni sthālīm tatyāja sva puram ca ājagāma
translated: Then he abandoned the pot of fire in the forest itself and returned to his city.

original: vyatītārdharātrasamaye vinidraś cācintayat /
analyzed: vyatīta ardharātra samaye vinidraḥ ca acintayat
translated: When midnight had passed, he woke up and thought:

original: mamorvaśīsālokyaprāptyartham agnisthālī gandharvair dattā sā ca mayāṭavyāṃ parityaktā /
analyzed: mama urvaśī sālokya prāpti artham agni sthālī gandharvaiḥ dattā sā ca mayā aṭavyām parityaktā
translated: For the attainment of the world of Urvasi, a pot for Agni was given to me by the Gandharvas, and that was abandoned by me in the forest.

original: tad ahaṃ tatra tadāharaṇāya yāsyāmīty utthāya tatrāpy upagato nāgnisthālīm apaśyat /
analyzed: tat aham tatra tad āharaṇāya yāsyāmi iti utthāya tatra api upagataḥ na agni sthālīm apaśyat
translated: Therefore, I shall go there to fetch it. Having said this, he got up and went there, but did not see the pot for Agni.

original: śamīgarbhaṃ cāśvattham agnisthālīsthāne dṛṣṭvācintayat /
analyzed: śamīgarbham ca aśvattham agni sthālī sthāne dṛṣṭvā acintayat
translated: And seeing a fig tree with a shami tree inside it in place of the pot for Agni, he thought:

original: mayātra sthālī nikṣiptā sā cāśvatthaḥ śamīgarbho 'bhūt /
analyzed: mayā atra sthālī nikṣiptā sā ca aśvatthaḥ śamīgarbhaḥ bhūt
translated: The pot was placed by me here, and that has become a fig tree with a shami tree inside.

original: tad enam evāham agnirūpam ādāya svapuram abhigamyāraṇīṃ kṛtvā tadutpannāgner upāstiṃ kariṣyāmīty evam eva svapuram upagato 'raṇiṃ cakāra //🔽tatpramāṇaṃ cāṅgulaiḥ kurvan gāyatrīm apaṭhat /
analyzed: tat enam eva aham agni rūpam ādāya sva puram abhigamya araṇīm kṛtvā tad utpanna agneḥ upāstim kariṣyāmi iti evam eva sva puram upagataḥ raṇim cakāra  tad pramāṇam ca aṅgulaiḥ kurvan gāyatrīm apaṭhat
translated: Therefore, taking this very one in the form of Agni, I shall go to my city, make a churning stick, and perform the worship of the fire produced from it. Having thought thus, he went to his city and made a churning stick.🔽And measuring it with his fingers, he recited the Gayatri.

original: paṭhataś cākṣarasaṃkhyāny evāṅgulāny araṇy abhavat /
analyzed: paṭhataḥ ca akṣara saṃkhyāni eva aṅgulāni araṇī abhavat
translated: And as he was reciting, the churning stick became as many fingers long as there are syllables in the Gayatri.

original: tatrāgniṃ nirmathyāgnitrayam āmnāyānusārī bhūtvā juhāva urvaśīsālokyaṃ ca phalam abhisaṃhitavān // / / //
analyzed: tatra agnim nirmathya agnitrayam āmnāya anusārī bhūtvā juhāva urvaśī sālokyam ca phalam abhisaṃhitavān
translated: There, having churned out the fire, he offered oblations to the three fires in accordance with the scriptures, and aimed for the fruit of attaining the world of Urvasi.

original: tenaivāgnividhinā bahuvidhān yajñān iṣṭvā gāndharvalokān avāpyorvaśyā saha viyogaṃ nāvāpa // / / //
analyzed: tena eva agni vidhinā bahuvidhān yajñān iṣṭvā gāndharva lokān avāpya urvaśyā saha viyogam na avāpa
translated: And by the same fire-rite, having performed many sacrifices, he obtained the Gandharva world, and did not experience separation from Urvasi.

original: eko 'gnir ādāv abhavad ailena tv atra manvantare tredhā pravartita iti // / / //
analyzed: ekaḥ gniḥ ādau abhavat ailena tu atra manvantare tredhā pravartitaḥ iti
translated: The one fire was divided into three in this Manvantara by Aila.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe ṣaṣṭho 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe ṣaṣṭhaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixth chapter in the fourth section of the Visnu Purana, dealing with the Manvantaras of Cākṣuṣa.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tasyāpy āyur dhīmān amāvasur viśvāvasuḥ śatāyur śrutāyuḥ saṃjñāḥ ṣaḍ abhavan putrāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasya api āyuḥ dhīmān amāvasuḥ viśvāvasuḥ śatāyuḥ śrutāyuḥ saṃjñāḥ ṣaṭ abhavan putrāḥ
translated: He had six sons named Ayus, Dhimat, Amavasu, Vishvavasu, Shatayus, Shrutayu, and Samjna.

original: amāvasor bhīmo nāma putro 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: amāvasoḥ bhīmaḥ nāma putraḥ bhavat
translated: Amavasu had a son named Bhima.

original: bhīmasya kāñcanaḥ kāñcanāt suhotras tasyāpi jahnuḥ /
analyzed: bhīmasya kāñcanaḥ kāñcanāt suhotraḥ tasya api jahnuḥ
translated: Bhima's son was Kanchana, Kanchana's son was Suhotra, and Suhotra's son was Jahnu.

original: yo 'sau yajñavāṭam akhilaṃ gaṅgāmbhasā plāvitam ālokya krodhasaṃraktanayano bhagavantaṃ yajñapuruṣam ātmani parameṇa samādhinā samāropyākhilām 🔽eva gaṅgām apibat // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ sau yajña vāṭam akhilam gaṅgā ambhasā plāvitam ālokya krodha saṃrakta nayanaḥ bhagavantam yajñapuruṣam ātmani parameṇa samādhinā samāropya akhilām  eva gaṅgām apibat
translated: When Jahnu saw the entire sacrificial ground flooded with the waters of the Ganges, his eyes became red with anger. He then concentrated his mind on the Supreme Personality of Godhead, the Supersoul, and drank up the entire Ganges.

original: athainaṃ devarṣayaḥ prasādayām āsuḥ /🔽duhitṛtve cāsya gaṅgām anayan // / / //
analyzed: atha enam deva ṛṣayaḥ prasādayām āsuḥ 🔽duhitṛ tve ca asya gaṅgām anayan
translated: The great sages and demigods then pacified him and made the Ganges his daughter.

original: jahnoś ca sumantur nāma putro 'bhavat /🔽tasyāpy ajakas tato balākāśvas tasmāt kuśaḥ kuśasya kuśāmbakuśanābhāmūrtarayāmāvasavaś catvāraḥ putrā babhūvuḥ // / / //
analyzed: jahnoḥ ca sumantuḥ nāma putraḥ bhavat  tasya api ajakaḥ tatas balākāśvaḥ tasmāt kuśaḥ kuśasya kuśāmba kuśanābha āmūrta raya amāvasavaḥ catvāraḥ putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: And Jahnu had a son named Sumantu.🔽His son was Ajaka, then Balakashva, then Kushi. Kushi had four sons: Koushambi, Koushanabha, Murtarayama and Vasu.

original: teṣāṃ kuśāmbaḥ śakratulyo me putro bhaved iti tapaś cakāra /
analyzed: teṣām kuśāmbaḥ śakra tulyaḥ me putraḥ bhavet iti tapaḥ cakāra
translated: Among them, Koushambi performed austerities, thinking, May my son be equal to Shakra (Indra).

original: taṃ cogratapasam avalokya mā bhavatv anyo 'smattulyavīrya ity ātmanaivāsyendraḥ putratvam agacchat // / / //
analyzed: tam ca ugra tapasam avalokya mā bhavatu smad tulya vīryaḥ iti ātmanā eva asya indraḥ putra tvam agacchat
translated: Seeing his severe austerities, Indra thought, Let there be no one equal to me in prowess. Thus, he himself became his son.

original: gādhir nāma sa kauśiko 'bhavat /
analyzed: gādhiḥ nāma sa kauśikaḥ bhavat
translated: He became known as Gadhi, a descendant of Kushi.

original: gādhiś ca satyavatīṃ kanyām ajanayat /
analyzed: gādhiḥ ca satyavatīm kanyām ajanayat
translated: Gadhi begot a daughter named Satyavati.

original: tāṃ ca bhārgava ṛcīko vavre // / / //
analyzed: tām ca bhārgavaḥ ṛcīkaḥ vavre
translated: And Richika of the Bhrigu lineage chose her.

original: gādhir apy atiroṣaṇāyātivṛddhāya ca brāhmaṇāya dātum anicchann ekataḥ śyāmakarṇānām induvarcasām anilaraṃhasām aśvānāṃ sahasraṃ kanyāśulkam
analyzed: gādhiḥ api ati roṣaṇāya ati vṛddhāya ca brāhmaṇāya dātum an icchan ekatas śyāmakarṇānām indu varcasām anila raṃhasām aśvānām sahasram kanyā śulkam  /
translated: Gadhi, unwilling to give her to the extremely angry and aged Brahmin, asked for a dowry of a thousand horses with one black ear each, having the luster of the moon and the speed of the wind.

original: ayācata // / / //
analyzed: ayācata
translated: He also requested for the same.

original: tenāpy ṛṣ /iṇā varuṇasakāśād upalabhyāśvatīrthotpannaṃ tādṛgaśvasahasraṃ dattam /
analyzed: tena api ṛṣiṇā varuṇa sakāśāt upalabhya aśvatīrtha utpannam tādṛś aśva sahasram dattam
translated: The Rishi obtained a similar thousand horses born at Ashvatirtha from Varuna and gave them.

original: tatas tām ṛcīkaḥ kanyām upayeme /
analyzed: tatas tām ṛcīkaḥ kanyām upayeme
translated: Then Richika married the maiden.

original: ṛcīkaś ca tasyāś carum apatyārthaṃ cakāra // / / //
analyzed: ṛcīkaḥ ca tasyāḥ carum apatya artham cakāra
translated: And Richika prepared a sacrificial pap for her to obtain offspring.

original: tatprasāditaś ca tanmātre kṣatravaraputrotpattaye carum aparaṃ sādhayām āsa // / / //
analyzed: tad prasāditaḥ ca tad mātre kṣatra vara putra utpattaye carum aparam sādhayām āsa
translated: And when she was propitiated, he prepared another pap for the birth of a son of the best of Kshatriyas from her alone.

original: eṣa carur bhavatyāyam aparas tvanmātrā samyag upayojya ity uktvā vanaṃ jagāma // / / //
analyzed: eṣa caruḥ bhavatyā ayam aparaḥ tvad mātrā samyak upayojyaḥ iti uktvā vanam jagāma
translated: And saying, This pap is for you, and the other should be properly used by your mother, he went to the forest.

original: upayogakāle ca tāṃ mātā satyavatīm āha /
analyzed: upayoga kāle ca tām mātā satyavatīm āha
translated: And at the time of using it, her mother Satyavati said to her:

original: putri sarva evātmaputram atiguṇaṃ samabhilaṣati
analyzed: putri sarvaḥ eva ātma putram atiguṇam samabhilaṣati
translated: Daughter, every father desires his own son to be of very good qualities.

original: nātmajāyābhrātṛguṇeṣv atīvādṛto bhavati //
analyzed: na ātma jāyā bhrātṛ guṇeṣu atīva ādṛtaḥ bhavati
translated: He is not very much pleased with the qualities of his daughter or brother.

original: ato 'rhasi mamātmīyaṃ caruṃ dātuṃ madīyaṃ carum ātmanopayoktum // / / //
analyzed: atas rhasi mama ātmīyam carum dātum madīyam carum ātmanā upayoktum
translated: Therefore, it is proper for you to give me your pap and for me to use your pap.

original: matputreṇa hi sakalabhūmaṇḍalaparipālanaṃ kāryaṃ kiyad vā brāhmaṇasya balavīryasaṃpad ity uktvā sā svacaruṃ mātre dattavatī // / / //
analyzed: mad putreṇa hi sakala bhū maṇḍala paripālanam kāryam kiyat vā brāhmaṇasya bala vīrya saṃpad iti uktvā sā sva carum mātre dattavatī
translated: For my son must rule the entire earth. What is the power and strength of a Brahmana? Saying this, she gave her own pap to her mother.

original: atha vanād apy āgamya satyavatīm ṛṣir apaśyat // / / //
analyzed: atha vanāt api āgamya satyavatīm ṛṣiḥ apaśyat
translated: Then the Rishi, having come from the forest, saw Satyavati.

original: āha cainām atipāpe kim idam akāryaṃ bhavatyā kṛtam /
analyzed: āha ca enām ati pāpe kim idam akāryam bhavatyā kṛtam
translated: And he said to her, O extremely sinful one, what is this improper act that you have done?

original: atiraudraṃ te vapur ālakṣyate /
analyzed: ati raudram te vapuḥ ālakṣyate
translated: Your body appears extremely terrible.

original: nūnaṃ tvayā tvanmātṛsātkṛtaś carur upayukto na yuktam etat // / / //
analyzed: nūnam tvayā caruḥ upayuktaḥ na yuktam etat
translated: Surely you have eaten the rice intended for your mother. This is not right.

original: mayā hi tatra carau sakalaiva śauryavīryabalasaṃpad āropitā /
analyzed: mayā hi tatra carau sakalā eva śaurya vīrya bala saṃpad āropitā
translated: For in that rice I have deposited all your heroism, strength, and power,

original: tvadīye carāv apy akhilaśāntijñānatitikṣādikī brāhmaṇasaṃpat /
analyzed: tvadīye carau api akhila śānti jñāna titikṣā ādikī brāhmaṇa saṃpad
translated: and in your rice I have deposited all the Brahminic virtues of peace, knowledge, patience, and so on.

original: etac ca viparītaṃ kurvantyās tavātiraudrāstradhāraṇamāraṇaniṣṭhaḥ kṣatriyācāraḥ putro bhaviṣyaty asyā /
analyzed: etat ca viparītam kurvantyāḥ tava ati raudra astra dhāraṇa māraṇa niṣṭhaḥ kṣatriya ācāraḥ putraḥ bhaviṣyati asyāḥ
translated: And by doing this in the opposite way, your son will be devoted to the Kshatriya practices of holding terrible weapons and killing,

original: copaśamarucir brāhmaṇācāra ity ākarṇyaiva sā tasya pādau jagrāha // / / //
analyzed: ca upaśama ruciḥ brāhmaṇa ācāraḥ iti ākarṇya eva sā tasya pādau jagrāha
translated: while her son will be devoted to the Brahmin practices of tranquility and peace. As soon as she heard this, she took his feet and...

original: praṇipatya cainam āha /
analyzed: praṇipatya ca enam āha
translated: and having bowed to him, she said:

original: bhagavan mayaitad ajñānād anuṣṭhitam /
analyzed: bhagavat mayā etat ajñānāt anuṣṭhitam
translated: Lord, this was done by me out of ignorance.

original: prasādaṃ me kuru /
analyzed: prasādam me kuru
translated: Be gracious to me.

original: maivaṃvidhaḥ putro bhavatu /
analyzed: mā evaṃvidhaḥ putraḥ bhavatu
translated: Let not my son be like this.

original: kāmam evaṃvidhaḥ pautro bhavatv ity ukto munir apy āhaivam astv iti // / / //
analyzed: kāmam evaṃvidhaḥ pautraḥ bhavatu iti uktaḥ muniḥ api āha evam astu iti
translated: Let him rather be like this in his grandson. When this was said, the sage also said, So be it.

original: anantaraṃ ca sā jamadagnim ajījanat /
analyzed: anantaram ca sā jamadagnim ajījanat
translated: And afterwards she gave birth to Jamadagni,

original: tanmātā ca viśvāmitraṃ janayām āsa /
analyzed: tad mātā ca viśvāmitram janayām āsa
translated: and his mother gave birth to Vishvamitra.

original: satyavatī ca kauśikī nāma nady abhavat /
analyzed: satyavatī ca kauśikī nāma nadī abhavat
translated: And Satyavati became the river named Kausiki.

original: jamadagnir ikṣvākuvaṃśodbhavasya reṇos tanayāṃ reṇukām upayeme /
analyzed: jamadagniḥ ikṣvāku vaṃśa udbhavasya reṇoḥ tanayām reṇukām upayeme
translated: Jamadagni married Renuka, the daughter of king Renu of the Ikshvaku dynasty.

original: tasyāṃ cāśeṣakṣatrahantāraṃ paraśurāmasaṃjñaṃ bhagavataḥ sakalalokaguror nārāyaṇasyāṃśaṃ jamadagnir ajījanat // / / //
analyzed: tasyām ca aśeṣa kṣatra hantāram paraśurāma saṃjñam bhagavataḥ sakala loka guroḥ nārāyaṇasya aṃśam jamadagniḥ ajījanat
translated: And by her Jamadagni begot the incarnation of Vishnu, known as Rama, the slayer of all Kshatriyas.

original: viśvāmitraputras tu bhārgava eva śunaḥśepo devair dattaḥ /
analyzed: viśvāmitra putraḥ tu bhārgavaḥ eva śunaḥśepaḥ devaiḥ dattaḥ
translated: The son of Vishvamitra was the Bhargava Shunahshepa, given by the gods.

original: tataś ca devarātanāmābhavat /
analyzed: tatas ca devarāta nāmā bhavat
translated: Then he became known as Devarata.

original: tataś cānye madhucchandajayakṛtadevāṣṭakakacchapahārītakākhyā viśvāmitraputrā babhūvuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca anye madhucchanda jaya kṛtadeva aṣṭaka kacchapa hārītaka ākhyāḥ viśvāmitra putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: And then there were other sons of Vishvamitra named Madhucchandaja, Devashtaka, Kachchapa, Harita, and others.

original: teṣāṃ ca bahūni kauśikagotrāṇy ṛṣyantareṣu vaivāhyāni bhavantīti // / / //
analyzed: teṣām ca bahūni kauśika gotrāṇi ṛṣi antareṣu vaivāhyāni bhavanti iti
translated: And there are many families of the Kushika gotra among the other Rishis, who are related by marriage.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe saptamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe saptamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the seventh chapter in the fourth section of the Vishnupurana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: purūravaso jyeṣṭhaputro yas tv āyurnāmā sa rāhor duhitaram upayeme // / / //
analyzed: purūravasaḥ jyeṣṭha putraḥ yaḥ tu āyuḥ nāmā sa rāhoḥ duhitaram upayeme
translated: The eldest son of Pururava, named Ayu, married the daughter of Rahu.

original: tasyāṃ sa pañca putrān utpādayām āsa /
analyzed: tasyām sa pañca putrān utpādayām āsa
translated: By her he begot five sons.

original: nahuṣakṣatravṛddharambharajisaṃjñās tathaivānenāḥ pañcamaḥ putro 'bhūt /
analyzed: nahuṣa kṣatravṛddha rambha raji saṃjñāḥ tathā eva anenāḥ pañcamaḥ putraḥ bhūt
translated: Nahusha, Kshatravirya, Rambha, and Raji, and the fifth was Anena.

original: kṣatravṛddhāt suhotraḥ putro 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: kṣatravṛddhāt suhotraḥ putraḥ bhavat
translated: From Kṣatravṛddha, Suhotra was born as a son.

original: kāśyaleśagṛtsamadās tasya putrās trayo 'bhavan /
analyzed: kāśya leśa gṛtsamadāḥ tasya putrāḥ trayaḥ bhavan
translated: He had three sons: Kāśya, Leśa, and Gṛtsamada.

original: gṛtsamadasya śaunakaś cāturvarṇyapravartayitābhūt // / / //
analyzed: gṛtsamadasya śaunakaḥ cāturvarṇya pravartayitā abhūt
translated: Gṛtsamada's son was Śaunaka, the promulgator of the four varnas.

original: kāśyasya kāśīrājas tato dīrghatamāḥ putro 'bhavat /
analyzed: kāśyasya kāśī rājaḥ tatas dīrghatamāḥ putraḥ bhavat
translated: Kāśya's son was the king of Kāśī, then his son was Dīrghatamas.

original: dhanvantaris tu dīrghatamaso 'bhavat /
analyzed: dhanvantariḥ tu dīrghatamasaḥ bhavat
translated: Dhanvantari was born to Dīrghatamas.

original: sa hi saṃsiddhakāryakaraṇaḥ sakalasaṃbhūtiṣv aśeṣajñānavid bhagavatā nārāyaṇena cātītasaṃbhūtāv asmai varo dattaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa hi saṃsiddha kārya karaṇaḥ sakala saṃbhūtiṣu aśeṣa jñāna vid bhagavatā nārāyaṇena ca atīta saṃbhūtau asmai varaḥ dattaḥ
translated: He, having accomplished his duties and organs, knowing all knowledge in all creations, was granted a boon by Lord Nārāyaṇa in the past creation.

original: kāśīrājagotre 'vatīrya tvam aṣṭadhā samyag āyurvedaṃ kariṣyasi yajñabhāk ca bhaviṣyasīti abhihitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāśī rāja gotre vatīrya tvam aṣṭadhā samyak āyurvedam kariṣyasi yajña bhāj ca bhaviṣyasi iti abhihitaḥ
translated: He was told, You will descend in the lineage of the king of Kāśī and properly divide the Ayurveda into eight parts, and you will enjoy sacrifices.

original: tasya ca dhanvantareḥ putraḥ ketumān ketumato bhīmarathaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca dhanvantareḥ putraḥ ketumān ketumataḥ bhīmarathaḥ
translated: And Dhanvantari's son was Ketumān, and Ketumān's son was Bhīmaratha.

original: tasyāpi divodāsas tataḥ pratardanaḥ /
analyzed: tasya api divodāsaḥ tatas pratardanaḥ
translated: His son was Divodāsa, then Pratardana.

original: sa ca bhadraśreṇyavaṃśavināśād aśeṣāḥ śatravo 'nena jitā iti śatrujid abhavat // / / //
analyzed: sa ca bhadraśreṇya vaṃśa vināśāt aśeṣāḥ śatravaḥ nena jitāḥ iti śatrujit abhavat
translated: And because he conquered all enemies without exception by destroying the lineage of Bhadrasenya, he became known as Śatrujit.

original: tena ca prītimatātmaputro vatsa vatsety abhihitas tato vatso sāv 'bhavat /
analyzed: tena ca prītimatā ātma putraḥ vatsa vatsa iti abhihitaḥ tatas vatso sau bhavat
translated: And because he was pleased, he called his son Vatsa, and so he became known as Vatsa.

original: satyaparatayā ṛtadhvajasaṃjñām avāpa /
analyzed: satya para tayā ṛtadhvaja saṃjñām avāpa
translated: And because he was devoted to truth, he came to be called Rtadhvaja.

original: punaś ca kuvalayanāmānam aśvaṃ lebhe tataḥ kuvalayāśva ity asyāṃ pṛthivyāṃ prathitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: punar ca kuvalaya nāmānam aśvam lebhe tatas kuvalayāśvaḥ iti asyām pṛthivyām prathitaḥ
translated: And he obtained a horse named Kuvalaya, and so he became famous on this earth as Kuvalayashva.

original: tasya ca vatsasya putro 'larko nāmābhavat /
analyzed: tasya ca vatsasya putraḥ larkaḥ nāma abhavat
translated: And Vatsa had a son named Alarka.

original: yasyāyam adyāpi śloko gīyate /
analyzed: yasya ayam adyā api ślokaḥ gīyate
translated: And even today this verse is sung about him:

original: ṣaṣṭivarṣasahasrāṇi ṣaṣṭivarṣaśatāni ca /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭi varṣa sahasrāṇi ṣaṣṭi varṣa śatāni ca
translated: For sixty thousand years and sixty hundred years,

original: alarkād aparo nānyo bubhuje medinīṃ yuvā // / / //
analyzed: alarkāt aparaḥ nā anyaḥ bubhuje medinīm yuvā
translated: No one else but Alarka enjoyed the earth in his youth.

original: tasyāpy alarkasya sannatir nāmātmajo 'bhavat /
analyzed: tasya api alarkasya sannatiḥ nāma ātmajaḥ bhavat
translated: And Alarka had a son named Sannati.

original: tataḥ sunīthas tasya suketus tato dharmaketuḥ /
analyzed: tatas sunīthaḥ tasya suketuḥ tatas dharmaketuḥ
translated: Then Sunitha, then Suketu, then Dharmaketu.

original: tataḥ satyaketus tasmād vibhus tattanayaḥ suvibhus tataś ca sukumāras tasyāpi dṛṣṭaketuḥ /
analyzed: tatas satyaketuḥ tasmāt vibhuḥ tad tanayaḥ suvibhuḥ tatas ca sukumāraḥ tasya api dṛṣṭaketuḥ
translated: Then Satyaketu, then Vibhu, his son was Subhibhu, then Sukumara, then his Drishtketu.

original: tataś ca vainahotras tataś ca bhargo bhārgasya bhārgabhūmiḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca vainahotraḥ tatas ca bhargaḥ bhārgasya bhārgabhūmiḥ
translated: Then Vainahotr, then Bharga, Bharga's son was Bharga-bhu.

original: tataś cāturvarṇyapravṛttiḥ
analyzed: tatas cāturvarṇya pravṛttiḥ
translated: Then the four varnas became active.

original: ity ete kāśayo bhūpatayaḥ kathitāḥ /
analyzed: iti ete kāśayaḥ bhūpatayaḥ kathitāḥ
translated: Thus have been described the kings of Kashi.

original: rajes tu saṃtatiḥ śrūyatām iti // / / //
analyzed: rajeḥ tu saṃtatiḥ śrūyatām iti
translated: Now hear the account of the descendants of Raghu.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe 'ṣṭamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe ṣṭamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eighth chapter in the fourth section of the great epic, the Vishnu Purana, composed by the great sage, the son of Parashara and Satyavati.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: rajeḥ pañca putraśatāny atulavīryasārāṇy āsan // / / //
analyzed: rajeḥ pañca putra śatāni atula vīrya sārāṇi āsan
translated: Raghu had five hundred sons, of incomparable strength and vigor.

original: devāsurasaṃgrāmārambhe parasparavadhepsavo devāś cāsurāś ca brahmāṇam papracchuḥ // / / //
analyzed: deva asura saṃgrāma ārambhe paraspara vadha īpsavaḥ devāḥ ca asurāḥ ca brahmāṇam papracchuḥ
translated: At the beginning of the battle between the gods and demons, the gods and demons asked Brahma, desiring to kill each other.

original: bhagavann asmākam atra virodhe kataraḥ pakṣo jetā bhaviṣyatīti // / / //
analyzed: bhagavan asmākam atra virodhe kataraḥ pakṣaḥ jetā bhaviṣyati iti
translated: O Lord, in this conflict of ours, which side will be victorious?

original: athāha bhagavān yeṣām arthe rajir āttāyudho yotsyatīti /
analyzed: atha āha bhagavān yeṣām arthe rajiḥ ātta āyudhaḥ yotsyati iti
translated: Then the Lord said, For whom Raghu will fight with raised weapons.

original: atha daityair upetya rajir ātmasāhāyyadānāyābhyarthitaḥ prāha /
analyzed: atha daityaiḥ upetya rajiḥ ātma sāhāyya dānāya abhyarthitaḥ prāha
translated: Then the demons approached Raghu and requested him to help them, he said:

original: yotsye 'haṃ bhavatām arthe yady aham amarajayād bhavatām indro bhaviṣyāmīty ākarṇyaitat
analyzed: yotsye ham bhavatām arthe yadi aham amara jayāt bhavatām indraḥ bhaviṣyāmi iti ākarṇya etat
translated: I will fight for your cause if I become your Indra after defeating the gods. Hearing this,

original: tair abhihito na vayam anyathā vadiṣyāmo 'nyathā kariṣyāmo 'smākam indraḥ prahlādas
analyzed: taiḥ abhihitaḥ na vayam anyathā vadiṣyāmaḥ nyathā kariṣyāmaḥ smākam indraḥ prahlādaḥ
translated: they said, We will not say one thing and do another. Our Indra is Prahlada.

original: tadartham ayam udyama ity uktvā gateṣv asureṣu devair apy asāv avanīpatir evam evoktas
analyzed: tad artham ayam udyamaḥ iti uktvā gateṣu asureṣu devaiḥ api asau avanīpatiḥ evam evā uktaḥ
translated: This is our effort for that purpose. Saying this, when the demons left, the gods also said the same to the king Raghu.

original: tenāpi ca tathaivokte devair indras tvaṃ bhaviṣyasīti samanvicchitam // / / //
analyzed: tena api ca tathā evā ukte devaiḥ indraḥ tvam bhaviṣyasi iti samanvicchitam
translated: And by him also, when he said the same, it was resolved by the gods that he would be Indra.

original: rajināpi devasainyasahāyenānekair mahāstrais tad aśeṣam asurabalaṃ niṣūditam // / / //
analyzed: rajinā api deva sainya sahāyena anekaiḥ mahā astraiḥ tat aśeṣam asura balam niṣūditam
translated: And by Raji also, with the help of the army of gods, that entire army of demons was destroyed with many great weapons.

original: avajitārātipakṣaś cendro rajicaraṇayugalam ātmaśirasā nipīḍyāha /
analyzed: avajita arāti pakṣaḥ ca indraḥ raji caraṇa yugalam ātma śirasā nipīḍya āha
translated: And Indra, having conquered the faction of his enemies, pressed the pair of Raji's feet with his own head and said:

original: bhayatrāṇadānād asmatpitā bavān aśeṣalokānām uttamo bhavān yasyāhaṃ putras trilokendraḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhaya trāṇa dānāt asmad pitā bavān aśeṣa lokānām uttamaḥ bhavān yasya aham putraḥ triloka indraḥ
translated: You are my father, the best of all worlds, for I am your son, the lord of the three worlds.

original: sa cāpi rājā prahasyāha /
analyzed: sa ca api rājā prahasya āha
translated: And the king also said with a smile:

original: evam evāstv anatikramaṇīyā hi vairipakṣād apy anekavidhacāṭuvākyagarbhā praṇatir ity uktvā svapuraṃ jagāma // / / //
analyzed: evam evā astu an atikramaṇīyā hi vairi pakṣāt api anekavidha cāṭu vākya garbhā praṇatiḥ iti uktvā sva puram jagāma
translated: Let it be so. For bowing down, which is full of many kinds of flattering words even from the faction of enemies, is indeed not to be transgressed. Saying this, he went to his own city.

original: śatakratur apīndratvaṃ cakāra // / / //
analyzed: śatakratuḥ api indra tvam cakāra
translated: And Shatakratu also acted as Indra.

original: svaryāte tu rajau nāradarṣicoditā rajisutāḥ śatakratum ātmapitṛputraṃ ācārād rājyaṃ yācitavantaḥ // / / //
analyzed: svaryāte tu rajau nārada ṛṣi coditāḥ raji sutāḥ śatakratum ātma pitṛ putram ācārāt rājyam yācitavantaḥ
translated: But when Raji went to heaven, the sons of Raji, urged by the sage Narada, asked their own father's son Shatakratu for the kingdom according to the rules of conduct.

original: apradāne cāvajityendram atibalinaḥ svayam indratvaṃ cakruḥ // / / //
analyzed: a pradāne ca avajitya indram ati balinaḥ svayam indra tvam cakruḥ
translated: And when he did not give it, they conquered Indra and, being extremely powerful, themselves became Indra.

original: tataś ca bahutithe kāle vyatīte bṛhaspatim ekānte dṛṣṭvāpahṛtatrailokyayajñabhāgaḥ śatakratur uvāca // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca bahutithe kāle vyatīte bṛhaspatim ekānte dṛṣṭvā apahṛta trailokya yajña bhāgaḥ śatakratuḥ uvāca
translated: Then, after a long time had passed, Indra, having taken away the share of sacrifice from the three worlds, saw Brihaspati in a secluded place and said:

original: badarīphalamātram apy arhasi mamāpyāyanāya puroḍāśakhaṇḍaṃ dātum ity ukto bṛhaspatir uvāca /
analyzed: badarī phala mātram api arhasi mama āpyāyanāya puroḍāśa khaṇḍam dātum iti uktaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ uvāca
translated: You should give me a piece of sacrificial cake, even if it is the size of a jujube fruit, to nourish me. Thus addressed, Brihaspati said:

original: yady evaṃ pūrvam eva tvayāhaṃ coditaḥ syāṃ tan mayā tvadarthaṃ kim akartavyam iti /
analyzed: yadi evam pūrvam eva tvayā aham coditaḥ syām tat mayā tvad artham kim akartavyam iti
translated: If you had urged me earlier, what could I not have done for you?

original: svalpair evāhobhis tvāṃ nijaṃ padaṃ prāpayiṣyāmīty abhidhāya teṣām anudinābhicārikaṃ buddhimohāya śakrasya ca tejobhivṛddhaye juhāva /
analyzed: su alpaiḥ evā ahobhiḥ tvām nijam padam prāpayiṣyāmi iti abhidhāya teṣām anu dina ābhicārikam buddhi mohāya śakrasya ca tejobhiḥ vṛddhaye juhāva
translated: Saying, In just a few days, I will bring you back to your own position, he offered oblations every day for the delusion of their intelligence and the increase of Indra's energy.

original: te cāpi tena buddhimohenābhibhūyamānā brahmadviṣo dharmatyāgino vedavādaparāṅmukhā babhūvuḥ // / / //
analyzed: te ca api tena buddhi mohena abhibhūyamānāḥ brahma dviṣaḥ dharma tyāginaḥ veda vāda parāṅmukhāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: And they, being overcome by that delusion, became haters of Brahman, abandoners of dharma, and turned away from the Vedic teachings.

original: tataś ca tān apetadharmācārān indro jaghāna /
analyzed: tatas ca tān apeta dharma ācārān indraḥ jaghāna
translated: And then Indra killed them, who had abandoned the practice of dharma.

original: purohitāpyāyitatejāś ca tridivam ākramat /
analyzed: purohita āpyāyita tejāḥ ca tridivam ākramat
translated: And, his energy having been increased by the nourishment of the priest, he ascended to heaven.

original: etad indrasya svapadacyāvanārohaṇaṃ śrutvā puruṣaḥ svapadabhraṃśaṃ daurātmyaṃ ca nāpnoti // / / //
analyzed: etat indrasya sva pada cyāvana ārohaṇam śrutvā puruṣaḥ sva pada bhraṃśam daurātmyam ca na āpnoti
translated: Having heard this ascent and descent of Indra from his own position, a man does not suffer loss of position and wickedness.

original: rambhas tv anapatyo 'bhavat /
analyzed: rambhaḥ tu anapatyaḥ bhavat
translated: Rambha, however, had no son.

original: kṣatravṛddhasutaḥ pratikṣatras // / / //
analyzed: kṣatravṛddha sutaḥ pratikṣatraḥ
translated: Kshetravrddhi's son was Pratik-shatra.

original: tatputraḥ saṃjayas tasyāpi jayas tataś ca vijayas tasmāc ca jajñe kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tad putraḥ saṃjayaḥ tasya api jayaḥ tatas ca vijayaḥ tasmāt ca jajñe kṛtaḥ
translated: His son was Sanjaya, his son was Jaya, his son was Vijaya, and from him was born Krita.

original: tasya harṣavardhano harṣavardhanasutaḥ sahadevas tasmād adīnas tasya jayatsenaḥ tataś
analyzed: tasya harṣavardhanaḥ harṣavardhana sutaḥ sahadevaḥ tasmāt adīnaḥ tasya jayatsenaḥ tatas
translated: His son was Harshavardhana, his son was Sahadeva, his son was Adena, his son was Jayatsena, his son was

original: ca saṃkṛtis tatputraḥ kṣatradharmā ity ete kṣatravṛddhasyāto nahuṣavaṃśaṃ pravakṣyāmīti // / / //
analyzed: ca saṃkṛtiḥ tad putraḥ kṣatradharmā iti ete kṣatravṛddhasya atas nahuṣa vaṃśam pravakṣyāmi iti
translated: Sankriti, his son was Kshatradharma. Thus, I will now describe the lineage of Nahusha.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe navamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe navamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: This is the ninth chapter of the fourth part in the Visnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: yatiyayātisaṃyātyāyātiviyātikṛtisaṃjñā nahuṣasya ṣaṭ putrā mahābalaparākramā babhūvuḥ // / / //
analyzed: yati yayāti saṃyāti āyāti viyāti kṛti saṃjñāḥ nahuṣasya ṣaṭ putrāḥ mahā bala parākramāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Nahusha had six sons named Yati, Yayati, Samyati, Ayati, Viyat, and Kritavirya, who were of great strength and valor.

original: yatis tu rājyaṃ naicchat /
analyzed: yatiḥ tu rājyam na aicchat
translated: But Yati did not desire the kingdom.

original: yayātis tu bhūbhṛd abhavat // / / //
analyzed: yayātiḥ tu bhūbhṛt abhavat
translated: But Yayati became the ruler of the earth.

original: uśanasaś ca duhitaraṃ devayānīṃ śarmiṣṭhāṃ ca vārṣaparvaṇīm upayeme /
analyzed: uśanasaḥ ca duhitaram devayānīm śarmiṣṭhām ca vārṣaparvaṇīm upayeme
translated: He married Devayani, the daughter of Usanas, and Sharmishtha, the daughter of Vrishaparva.

original: atrānuvaṃśaśloko bhavati // / / //
analyzed: atra anuvaṃśa ślokaḥ bhavati
translated: Here is a verse from the genealogy:

original: yaduṃ ca turvasuṃ caiva devayānī vyajāyata /
analyzed: yadum ca turvasum ca eva devayānī vyajāyata
translated: Devayani gave birth to Yadu and Turvasu,

original: druhyuṃ cānuṃ ca pūruṃ ca śarmiṣṭhā vārṣaparvaṇī // / / //
analyzed: druhyum ca anum ca pūrum ca śarmiṣṭhā vārṣaparvaṇī
translated: while Sharmishtha, the daughter of Vrishaparva, gave birth to Druhyu, Anu, and Puru.

original: kāvyaśāpāc cākālenaiva yayātir jarām avāpa // / / //
analyzed: kāvya śāpāt ca akālena eva yayātiḥ jarām avāpa
translated: And due to the curse of Kavya, Yayati prematurely fell into old age.

original: prasannaśukravacanāc ca svajarāṃ saṃkrāmayituṃ jyeṣṭhaputraṃ yadum uvāca // / / //
analyzed: prasanna śukra vacanāt ca sva jarām saṃkrāmayitum jyeṣṭha putram yadum uvāca
translated: And by the words of the pleased Shukra, he spoke to his eldest son Yadu to transfer his old age:

original: tvanmātāmahaśāpād iyam akālenaiva jarā mām upasthitā /
analyzed: tvad mātāmaha śāpāt iyam akālena eva jarā mām upasthitā
translated: By the curse of your maternal grandfather, this old age has come upon me prematurely.

original: tām ahaṃ tasyaivānugrahād bhavataḥ saṃcārayāmy ekaṃ varṣasahasram atṛpto 'smi viṣayeṣu tvadvayasā viṣayān ahaṃ bhoktum icchāmi /
analyzed: tām aham tasya eva anugrahāt bhavataḥ saṃcārayāmi ekam varṣa sahasram atṛptaḥ smi viṣayeṣu tvad vayasā viṣayān aham bhoktum icchāmi
translated: By his grace, I am transferring it to you for one thousand years. I am not satisfied with worldly pleasures. I wish to enjoy them with your youth.

original: nātra bhavatā pratyākhyānaṃ kartavyam ity uktaḥ sa naicchat tāṃ jarām ādātum /
analyzed: na atra bhavatā pratyākhyānam kartavyam iti uktaḥ sa na aicchat tām jarām ādātum
translated: You should not refuse this. Thus spoken to, he did not wish to take that old age.

original: taṃ cāpi pitā śaśāpa /
analyzed: tam ca api pitā śaśāpa
translated: And his father also cursed him:🔽Your offspring will not be fit for the kingdom.🔽Thus spoken to, he did not wish to take that old age.🔽And his father also cursed him:

original: tvatprasūtir na rājyārhā bhaviṣyatīti // / / //
analyzed: tvad prasūtiḥ na rājya arhā bhaviṣyati iti
translated: Your offspring will not be fit for the kingdom.

original: anantaraṃ ca durvasuṃ druhyum anuṃ ca pṛthivīpatir jarāgrahaṇārthaṃ svayauvanapradānāya cābhyarthayām āsa /
analyzed: anantaram ca durvasum druhyum anum ca pṛthivīpatiḥ jarā grahaṇa artham sva yauvana pradānāya ca abhyarthayām āsa
translated: Then the lord of the earth requested Durvasu, Druhyu, and Anu to take his old age upon themselves and to give him their youth.

original: tair apy ekaikaśyena pratyākhyātas tāñ chaśāpa // / / //
analyzed: taiḥ api ekaikaśyena pratyākhyātaḥ tām śaśāpa
translated: They too, one by one, refused, and he cursed them.

original: atha śarmiṣṭhātanayam aśeṣakanīyāṃsaṃ pūruṃ tathaivāha /
analyzed: atha śarmiṣṭhā tanayam aśeṣa kanīyāṃsam pūrum tathā eva āha
translated: Then he spoke in the same way to Puru, the son of Sharmishtha, who was the youngest of all.

original: sa cātipravaṇamatiḥ praṇamya pitaraṃ sabahumānaṃ mahān prasādo 'yam asmākam ity udāram abhidhāya jarāṃ pratijagrāha /
analyzed: sa ca ati pravaṇa matiḥ praṇamya pitaram sa bahu mānam mahān prasādaḥ yam asmākam iti udāram abhidhāya jarām pratijagrāha
translated: He, with a very devoted mind, bowed to his father and said with great respect, This is a great favor to us. Having spoken nobly, he accepted old age.

original: svakīyaṃ ca yauvanaṃ pitre dadau // / / //
analyzed: svakīyam ca yauvanam pitre dadau
translated: And he gave his own youth to his father.

original: so 'pi pauravaṃ yauvanam āsādya dharmāvirodhena yathākāmaṃ yathākālopapannaṃ yathotsāhaṃ viṣayāṃś cacāra /
analyzed: saḥ pi pauravam yauvanam āsādya dharma avirodhena yathākāmam yathā kāla upapannam yathotsāham viṣayān cacāra
translated: He too, having attained the youth of Puru, enjoyed the objects of sense according to his desire, without violating righteousness, as much as was proper for the time and according to his enthusiasm.

original: samyak ca prajāpālanam akarot // / //ḥ
analyzed: samyak ca prajā pālanam akarot
translated: And he ruled the subjects righteously.

original: viśvācyā devayānyā ca sahopabhogaṃ bhuktvā kāmānām antam avāpsyāmīty anudinaṃ tanmanasko babhūva // / / //
analyzed: viśvācyā devayānyā ca saha upabhogam bhuktvā kāmānām antam avāpsyāmi iti anudinam tad manaskaḥ babhūva
translated: Thinking day by day, Having enjoyed pleasures together with Vishvachi and Devayani, I shall reach the end of desires, he became intent on that.

original: anudinaṃ copabhogataḥ kāmān atīvābhiramyān mene // / / //
analyzed: anudinam ca upabhogataḥ kāmān atīva abhiramyān mene
translated: And day by day, through enjoyment, he considered desires to be extremely delightful.

original: tataś caivam agāyata /
analyzed: tatas ca evam agāyata
translated: And then he sang this.

original: na jātu kāmaḥ kāmānām upabhogena śāmyati /
analyzed: na jātu kāmaḥ kāmānām upabhogena śāmyati
translated: Desire is never satisfied by the enjoyment of desired objects.

original: haviṣā kṛṣṇavartmeva bhūya evābhivardhate // / / //🔽yat pṛthivyāṃ vrīhiyavaṃ hiraṇyaṃ paśavaḥ striyaḥ /
analyzed: haviṣā kṛṣṇavartmā iva bhūyas eva abhivardhate  yat pṛthivyām vrīhi yavam hiraṇyam paśavaḥ striyaḥ
translated: Like a black-burning fire by oblations, it only grows more and more.

original: ekasyāpi na paryāptaṃ tasmāt tṛṣṇāṃ parityajet // / / //🔽yadā na kurute bhāvaṃ sarvabhūteṣu pāpakam /
analyzed: ekasya api na paryāptam tasmāt tṛṣṇām parityajet  yadā na kurute bhāvam sarva bhūteṣu pāpakam
translated: The rice, barley, gold, cattle, and women on the earth are not enough for even one man. Therefore, one should give up craving.

original: samadṛṣṭes tadā puṃsaḥ sarvāḥ sukhamayā diśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sama dṛṣṭeḥ tadā puṃsaḥ sarvāḥ sukha mayāḥ diśaḥ
translated: When one does not entertain evil thoughts towards any being, then for that man of equal vision, all directions are full of happiness.

original: yā dustyajā durmatibhir yā na jīryati jīryataḥ /
analyzed: yā dustyajā durmatibhiḥ yā na jīryati jīryataḥ
translated: That craving which is difficult to abandon for the wicked-minded, which does not decay even as one grows old,

original: tāṃ tṛṣṇāṃ saṃtyajet prājñaḥ sukhenaivābhipūryate // / / //
analyzed: tām tṛṣṇām saṃtyajet prājñaḥ sukhena eva abhipūryate
translated: the wise one should give up that craving. He is filled with happiness alone.

original: jīryanti jīryataḥ keśā dantā jīryanti jīryataḥ /
analyzed: jīryanti jīryataḥ keśāḥ dantāḥ jīryanti jīryataḥ
translated: The hair of one who grows old decays, the teeth of one who grows old decay.

original: dhanāśā jīvitāśā ca jīryato 'pi na jīryataḥ // / / //
analyzed: dhana āśā jīvita āśā ca jīryataḥ pi na jīryataḥ
translated: But the hope for wealth and the hope for life do not decay even for one who grows old.

original: pūrṇaṃ varṣasahasraṃ me viṣayāsaktacetasaḥ /
analyzed: pūrṇam varṣa sahasram me viṣaya āsakta cetasaḥ
translated: For a full thousand years my mind has been attached to sensual pleasures.

original: tathāpy anudinaṃ tṛṣṇā mamaiteṣv eva jāyate // / / //
analyzed: tathā api anudinam tṛṣṇā mama eteṣu eva jāyate
translated: Yet even now, day by day, my craving arises for just these things.

original: tasmād etām ahaṃ tyaktvā brahmaṇy ādhāya mānasam /
analyzed: tasmāt etām aham tyaktvā brahmaṇi ādhāya mānasam
translated: Therefore, having given up this craving and fixed my mind on Brahman,

original: nirdvandvo nirmamo bhūtvā cariṣyāmi mṛgaiḥ saha // / / //
analyzed: nirdvandvaḥ nirmamaḥ bhūtvā cariṣyāmi mṛgaiḥ saha
translated: free from the pairs of opposites and free from egoism, I shall wander with the deer.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽pūroḥ sakāśād ādāya jarāṃ dattvā ca yauvanam /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  pūroḥ sakāśāt ādāya jarām dattvā ca yauvanam
translated: Parashara said:🔽Having taken old age from Puru and given him youth,

original: rājye 'bhiṣicya pūruṃ ca prayayau tapase vanam // / / //🔽diśi dakṣiṇapūrvāyāṃ turvasuṃ praty athādiśat /
analyzed: rājye bhiṣicya pūrum ca prayayau tapase vanam  diśi dakṣiṇa pūrvāyām turvasum prati atha ādiśat
translated: and having consecrated Puru in the kingdom, he went to the forest for austerities.🔽In the southeast direction, he appointed Turvasu,

original: pratīcyāṃ ca tathā druhyuṃ dakṣiṇāyāṃ tato yadum // / / //
analyzed: pratīcyām ca tathā druhyum dakṣiṇāyām tatas yadum
translated: in the west Druhyu, and then in the south Yadu,

original: udīcyāṃ ca tathaivānuṃ kṛtvā maṇḍalino nṛpān /
analyzed: udīcyām ca tathā eva anum kṛtvā maṇḍalinaḥ nṛpān
translated: and in the north Anuh, making them kings of their respective regions.

original: sarvapṛthvīpatiṃ pūruṃ so 'bhiṣicya yayau vanam // / / //
analyzed: sarva pṛthvīpatim pūrum saḥ abhiṣicya yayau vanam
translated: Having consecrated Puru as the lord of the entire earth, he went to the forest.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe daśamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe daśamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the tenth chapter in the fourth section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ataḥ paraṃ yayāteḥ prathamaputrasya yador vaṃśam ahaṃ kathayāmi /🔽yatrāśeṣalokanivāsimanuṣyasiddhagandharvayakṣarākṣasaguhyakakiṃpuruṣāpsaroragavihagadaityadānavarudravasvaśvi
analyzed: atas param yayāteḥ prathama putrasya yadoḥ vaṃśam aham kathayāmi  yatra aśeṣa loka nivāsi manuṣya siddha gandharva yakṣa rākṣasa guhyaka kiṃpuruṣa apsarā uraga vihaga daitya dānava rudra vasu aśvi
translated: Hereafter, I shall narrate the lineage of Yadu, the eldest son of Yayati.🔽Wherein, by men, Siddhas, Gandharvas, Yakshas, Rakshasas, Guhyakas, Kimpurushas, Apsaras, Nagas, birds, Daityas, Danavas, Rudras, Vasus, Ashvins,

original: maruddevarṣidvijarṣimumukṣibhir dharmārthakāmamokṣārthibhis tattatphalalābhāya sadābhiṣṭutāparicchedyamāhātmyenāṃśena
analyzed: marut devarṣi dvijarṣi mumukṣibhiḥ dharma artha kāma mokṣa arthibhiḥ tad tad phala lābhāya sadā abhiṣṭuta aparicchedya māhātmyena aṃśena
translated: Maruts, celestial sages, twice-born sages, and seekers of liberation, who reside in all the worlds, for the sake of attaining the fruits of Dharma, Artha, Kama and Moksha, with a portion of his incomprehensible greatness, which is always praised,

original: bhagavān anādinidhano viṣṇur avatatāra // / / //
analyzed: bhagavān an ādi nidhanaḥ viṣṇuḥ avatatāra
translated: The Blessed One, who has no beginning or end, descended as Vishnu.

original: atra ca ślokaḥ /
analyzed: atra ca ślokaḥ
translated: And here is a verse:

original: yador vaṃśaṃ naraḥ śrutvā sarvapāpaiḥ pramucyate /
analyzed: yadoḥ vaṃśam naraḥ śrutvā sarva pāpaiḥ pramucyate
translated: A man who hears the lineage of Yadu is freed from all sins.

original: yatrāvatīrṇaṃ viṣṇvākhyaṃ paraṃ brahma nirākṛti // / / //
analyzed: yatra avatīrṇam viṣṇu ākhyam param brahma nirākṛti
translated: Where the Supreme Brahman, known as Vishnu, descended in an unmanifest form.

original: sahasrajitkroṣṭunalaraghusaṃjñāś catvāro yaduputrā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: sahasrajit kroṣṭu nala raghu saṃjñāḥ catvāraḥ yadu putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: The four sons of Yadu were known as Sahasrajit, Kroshtri, Nala and Raghu.

original: sahasrajitputraḥ śatajit /
analyzed: sahasrajit putraḥ śatajit
translated: Sahasrajit's son was Shatajit.

original: tasya haihayahehayaveṇuhayās trayaḥ putrā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: tasya haihaya hehaya veṇuhayāḥ trayaḥ putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: He had three sons named Haihaya, Hehaya and Venuhāya.

original: haihayaputro dharmas tasyāpi dharmanetras tataḥ kuntiḥ kunteḥ sāhaṃjit /
analyzed: haihaya putraḥ dharmaḥ tasya api dharmanetraḥ tatas kuntiḥ kunteḥ sāhaṃjit
translated: Haihaya's son was Dharma, his son was Dharmanetra, then Kunti, Kunti's son was Sahajita.

original: tattanayo mahiṣmān // / / //
analyzed: tad tanayaḥ mahiṣmān
translated: His son was Mahishamati.

original: tasmād bhadraśreṇyas tato durdamas tasmād dhanakaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt bhadraśreṇyaḥ tatas durdamaḥ tasmāt dhanakaḥ
translated: From him, Bhadrasenya, from him, Durdama, from him, Dhanaka.

original: dhanakasya kṛtavīryakṛtāgnikṛtadharmakṛtaujasaś catvāraḥ putrāḥ /
analyzed: dhanakasya kṛtavīrya kṛtāgni kṛtadharma kṛtaujasaḥ catvāraḥ putrāḥ
translated: Dhanaka had four sons: Kritavirya, Kritagni, Kritadharma and Kritaujas.

original: kṛtavīryād arjunaḥ saptadvīpapatir bāhusahasrī jajñe /
analyzed: kṛtavīryāt arjunaḥ saptadvīpā patiḥ bāhu sahasrī jajñe
translated: From Kritavirya, Arjuna, the lord of the seven islands, was born with a thousand arms.

original: yo 'sau bhagavadaṃśam atrikulaprasūtaṃ dattātreyākhyam ārādhya bāhusahasram adharmasevānivāraṇaṃ
analyzed: bhagavat aṃśam atri kula prasūtam dattātreya ākhyam ārādhya bāhu sahasram adharma sevā nivāraṇam
translated: He, having propitiated the portion of the Blessed Lord born in the family of Atri, known as Dattatreya, obtained a thousand arms as a deterrent to the practice of adharma.

original: dharmeṇa pṛthivījayaṃ dharmataś cānupālanam arātibhyo 'parājayam akhilajagatprakhyātapuruṣāc
analyzed: dharmeṇa pṛthivī jayam dharmataḥ ca anupālanam arātibhyaḥ parājayam akhila jagat prakhyāta puruṣāt
translated: He obtained the boon of conquering the earth righteously, of ruling righteously, of being invincible to enemies, and of death at the hands of a man renowned throughout the world.

original: ca mṛtyum ity etān varān abhilaṣitavāṃl lebhe ca // / / //
analyzed: ca mṛtyum iti etān varān lebhe ca
translated: He desired these boons and obtained them.

original: teneyam aśeṣadvīpavatī pṛthivī samyak paripālitā /
analyzed: tena iyam aśeṣa dvīpavatī pṛthivī samyak paripālitā
translated: By him this earth, with all its islands, was properly ruled.

original: daśa yajñasahasrāṇy asāv ayajat // / / //
analyzed: daśa yajña sahasrāṇi asau ayajat
translated: He performed ten thousand sacrifices.

original: tasya ca śloko 'dyāpi gīyate /
analyzed: tasya ca ślokaḥ dyā api gīyate
translated: And even today his verse is sung:

original: na nūnaṃ kārtavīryasya gatiṃ yāsyanti pārthivāḥ /
analyzed: na nūnam kārtavīryasya gatim yāsyanti pārthivāḥ
translated: The kings will surely not attain the state of Kartavirya,

original: yajñair dānais tapobhir vā praśrayeṇa śrutena ca // / / //
analyzed: yajñaiḥ dānaiḥ tapobhiḥ vā praśrayeṇa śrutena ca
translated: By sacrifices, gifts, austerities, humility, and learning.

original: anaṣṭadravyatā ca tasya rājye 'bhavat /
analyzed: anaṣṭa dravya tā ca tasya rājye bhavat
translated: And in his kingdom, property was never lost.

original: evaṃ pañcāśītivarṣasahasrāṇy avyāhatārogyaśrībalaparākramo rājyam akarot // / / //
analyzed: evam pañca aśīti varṣa sahasrāṇi avyāhata ārogya śrī bala parākramaḥ rājyam akarot
translated: Thus, for eighty-five thousand years, he ruled the kingdom with unimpeded health, prosperity, strength, and valor.

original: māhiṣmatyāṃ digvijayābhyāgato narmadājalāvagāhanakrīḍātipānamadākulenāyatnenaiva
analyzed: māhiṣmatyām digvijaya abhyāgataḥ narmadā jala avagāhana krīḍā ati pāna mada ākulena a yatnena eva
translated: Having conquered all directions, he came to Mahishmati. While playing in the water of Narmada, he became intoxicated by drinking too much.

original: tenāśeṣadevadaityagandharveśajayodbhūtamadāvalepo 'pi rāvaṇaḥ paśur iva baddhvā svanagaraikānte
analyzed: tena aśeṣa deva daitya gandharva īśa jaya udbhūta mada avalepaḥ rāvaṇaḥ paśuḥ iva baddhvā sva nagara ekānte
translated: By him, Ravana, who was arrogant due to his victory over all gods, demons, and gandharvas, was bound like an animal and kept in a secluded place in his city.

original: sthāpitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sthāpitaḥ
translated: He was kept there for a long time.

original: yaś ca pañcāśītivarṣasahasropalakṣaṇakālāvasāne bhagavannārāyaṇāṃśena paraśurāmeṇopasaṃhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca pañca aśīti varṣa sahasra upalakṣaṇa kāla avasāne bhagavat nārāyaṇa aṃśena paraśurāmeṇa upasaṃhṛtaḥ
translated: And that was destroyed at the end of a period of eighty-five thousand years by Parashurama, an incarnation of Vishnu.

original: tasya ca putraśatapradhānāḥ pañca putrā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca putra śata pradhānāḥ pañca putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: He had five sons, the eldest of whom was Shura.

original: śūraśūrasenavṛṣaṇamadhujayadhvajasaṃjñāḥ // / / //
analyzed: śūra śūrasena vṛṣaṇa madhu jayadhvaja saṃjñāḥ
translated: The other four were Shurasen, Vrishana, Madhu, and Jayadhwaja.

original: jayadhvajāt tālajaṅghaḥ putro 'bhavat /
analyzed: jayadhvajāt tālajaṅghaḥ putraḥ bhavat
translated: Jayadhwaja had a son named Talajangha.

original: tālajaṅghasya tālajaṅghākhyaṃ putraśatam āsīt /
analyzed: tālajaṅghasya tālajaṅgha ākhyam putra śatam āsīt
translated: Talajangha had a hundred sons, all named Talajangha.

original: yeṣāṃ jyeṣṭho vītihotras tathānyo bharataḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām jyeṣṭhaḥ vītihotraḥ tathā anyaḥ bharataḥ
translated: The eldest of them was Vihotra, and another was Bharata.

original: bharatād vṛṣasujātau ca /
analyzed: bharatāt vṛṣa sujātau ca
translated: From Bharata came Vrisha and Sujata.

original: vṛṣasya putro madhur abhavat /
analyzed: vṛṣasya putraḥ madhuḥ abhavat
translated: Vrisha had a son named Madhu.

original: tasyāpi vṛṣṇipramukhaṃ putraśatam āsīt /
analyzed: tasya api vṛṣṇi pramukham putra śatam āsīt
translated: He had a hundred sons, the eldest of whom was Vrishni.

original: yato vṛṣṇisaṃjñām etad gotram avāpa // / / //🔽madhusaṃjñāhetuś ca madhur abhavat /
analyzed: yatas vṛṣṇi saṃjñām etat gotram avāpa  madhu saṃjñā hetuḥ ca madhuḥ abhavat
translated: From him the Yadavas got the name of Vrishnis.🔽Madhu was also called Madhu because he was the cause of the name Madhu.

original: yādavāś ca yadunāmopalakṣaṇāt // / / //
analyzed: yādavāḥ ca yadu nāma upalakṣaṇāt
translated: And the Yadavas were called Yadavas after Yadu, the son of Yayati.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe ekādaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe ekādaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eleventh chapter in the fourth section of the great Mahabharata, called the Shama-panchada.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽kroṣṭoś ca yaduputrasyātmajo vṛjinīvān /🔽tataś ca svāhis tato ruṣaṅkuḥ /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  kroṣṭoḥ ca yadu putrasya ātmajaḥ vṛjinīvān  tatas ca svāhiḥ tatas ruṣaṅkuḥ
translated: Parashara said:🔽Vrishni was the son of Kroshtri, the son of Yadu.🔽From Vrishni came Svahi, from him Rishanku.

original: ruṣaṅkoś citrarathaḥ /
analyzed: ruṣaṅkoḥ citrarathaḥ
translated: From Rishanku came Chitraratha.

original: tattanayaḥ śaśabinduś caturdaśamahāratnaś cakravarty abhavat /
analyzed: tad tanayaḥ śaśabinduḥ caturdaśa mahā ratnaḥ cakravartī abhavat
translated: His son was Śaśabindu, who became a universal monarch with the fourteen great jewels.

original: tasya ca śatasahasraṃ patnīnām abhavat /
analyzed: tasya ca śata sahasram patnīnām abhavat
translated: He had a hundred thousand wives.

original: daśalakṣasaṃkhyāś ca putrāḥ // / / //
analyzed: daśa lakṣa saṃkhyāḥ ca putrāḥ
translated: And he had ten million sons.

original: teṣāṃ ca pṛthuyaśāḥ pṛthukarmā pṛthujayaḥ pṛthukīrtiḥ pṛthudānaḥ pṛthuśravāś ca ṣaṭ putrāḥ pradhānāḥ // / / //
analyzed: teṣām ca pṛthuyaśāḥ pṛthukarmā pṛthujayaḥ pṛthukīrtiḥ pṛthudānaḥ pṛthuśravāḥ ca ṣaṭ putrāḥ pradhānāḥ
translated: And of them, the six principal sons were Pṛthuyasha, Pṛthukarma, Pṛthuja, Pṛthukīrti, Pṛthudāna, and Pṛthushrava.

original: pṛthuśravasaś ca putras tamaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthuśravasaḥ ca putraḥ tamaḥ
translated: And Pṛthushrava's son was Tama.

original: tasmād uśanā yo vājimedhānāṃ śatam ājahāra /
analyzed: tasmāt uśanāḥ yaḥ vājimedhānām śatam ājahāra
translated: From him was born Uśanas, who performed a hundred horse sacrifices.

original: tasya ca śitapur nāma putro 'bhūt /
analyzed: tasya ca śitapuḥ nāma putraḥ bhūt
translated: And he had a son named Śitapura.

original: tasyāpi rukmakavacaḥ /
analyzed: tasya api rukmakavacaḥ
translated: And from him was Rukmakavaca.

original: tataḥ parāvṛt parāvṛto rukmeṣupṛthujyāmaghapālitaharitasaṃjñās tasya pañcātmajā babhūvuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas parāvṛt parāvṛtaḥ rukmeṣu pṛthu jyāmagha pālita harita saṃjñāḥ tasya pañca ātmajāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: From him were born five sons named Parāvṛt, Parāvṛta, Rukmeṣu, Pṛthu, Jyāmagha, Pālita, and Harita.

original: atrāpy ayam adyāpi jyāmaghasya śloko gīyate /
analyzed: atrā api ayam adyā api jyāmaghasya ślokaḥ gīyate
translated: And even today this verse of Jyāmagha is sung:

original: bhāryāvaśyās tu ye kecid bhaviṣyanty atha vā mṛtāḥ /
analyzed: bhāryā vaśyāḥ tu ye kecid bhaviṣyanti atha vā mṛtāḥ
translated: Those who are under the control of their wives, whether they are alive or dead,

original: teṣāṃ tu jyāmaghaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ śaibyāpatir abhūn nṛpaḥ // / / //
analyzed: teṣām tu jyāmaghaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ śaibyā patiḥ abhūt nṛpaḥ
translated: Among them, the best was king Jyāmagha, the husband of Śaibyā.

original: aputrā tasya sā patnī śaibyā nāma tathāpy asau /
analyzed: aputrā tasya sā patnī śaibyā nāma tathā api asau
translated: And although his wife Śaibyā was childless, he said:🔽I am not interested in another wife, even if she is the daughter of a king.

original: apatyakāmo 'pi bhayān nānyāṃ bhāryām avindata // / / //
analyzed: apatya kāmaḥ u pi bhayāt na anyām bhāryām avindata
translated: But being desirous of offspring, he did not take another wife, fearing to offend his first.

original: sa tv ekadā atiprabhūtagajaturagarathasaṃmardātidāruṇe mahāhave yudhyamānaḥ sakalam evārāticakram ajayat /🔽tac cāricakram apāstaputrakalatrabandhubalakośaṃ svam adhiṣṭhānaṃ parityajya diśaḥ pravidrutam // / / //
analyzed: sa tu ekadā ati prabhūta gaja turaga ratha saṃmarda ati dāruṇe mahā āhave yudhyamānaḥ sakalam eva arāti cakram ajayat  tat ca ari cakram apāsta putra kalatra bandhu bala kośam svam adhiṣṭhānam parityajya diśaḥ pravidrutam
translated: One day, when engaged in a great battle, exceedingly terrible on account of the clash of numerous elephants, horses, and chariots, he vanquished the whole hostile army.🔽And that hostile army, having lost its sons, wives, friends, forces, and treasures, abandoned its own position and fled in all directions.

original: tasmiṃś ca vidrute 'titrāsalolāyatalocanayugalaṃ trāhi trāhi tātāmba bhrātar ity ākulavilāpavidhuraṃ rājakanyāratnam adrākṣīt // / /
analyzed: tasmin ca vidrute ti trāsa lola āyata locana yugalam trāhi trāhi tāta amba bhrātar iti ākula vilāpa vidhuram rāja kanyā ratnam adrākṣīt
translated: And when they had fled, he saw a jewel of a princess, with a pair of eyes rolling in terror, crying out in confusion, 'Save me, father, mother, brother!'

original: taddarśanāc ca tasyām anurāgānugatāntarātmā sa nṛpo 'cintayat /
analyzed: tad darśanāt ca tasyām anurāga anugata antarātmā sa nṛpaḥ cintayat
translated: And at the sight of her, the king, whose heart was moved by love for her, thought:

original: sādhv idaṃ mamāpatyavirahitasya vandhyābhartuḥ sāmprataṃ vidhināpatyakāraṇaṃ kanyāratnam upapāditam /
analyzed: sādhu idam mama apatya virahitasya vandhyā bhartuḥ sāmpratam vidhinā apatya kāraṇam kanyā ratnam upapāditam
translated: 'Well, now, Providence has provided me, who am childless and a barren husband, with a jewel of a daughter, as a means of obtaining offspring.

original: tad etat udvahāmy athaināṃ syandanam āropya svam adhiṣṭhānaṃ nayāmi // / / //
analyzed: tat etat udvahāmi atha enām syandanam āropya svam adhiṣṭhānam nayāmi
translated: I will marry her, and taking her on my chariot, I will go to my own abode.'

original: tayaiva devyā śaibyayāham anujñātaḥ samudvakṣyāmīty athaināṃ ratham āropya svanagaram agacchat // / / //🔽vijayinaṃ ca rājānam aśeṣapaurabhṛtyaparijanāmātyasamavetā śaibyā draṣṭum adhiṣṭhānadvāram āgatā // / / //
analyzed: tayā eva devyā śaibyayā aham anujñātaḥ samudvakṣyāmi iti atha enām ratham āropya sva nagaram agacchat  vijayinam ca rājānam aśeṣa paura bhṛtya parijana amātya samavetā śaibyā draṣṭum adhiṣṭhāna dvāram āgatā
