translated: With the permission of that very queen Śaibyā, I will recite. Then, having placed her on the chariot, he went to his own city.🔽 And when the victorious king, accompanied by the entire city's servants, attendants, and ministers, came to the palace gate to see him, Śaibyā

original: sā cāvalokya rājñaḥ savyapārśvavartinīṃ kanyām īṣadudbhūtāmarṣasphuradadharapallavā rājānam avocat /
analyzed: sā ca avalokya rājñaḥ savya pārśva vartinīm kanyām īṣat udbhūta amarṣa sphurat adhara pallavā rājānam avocat
translated: saw the maiden standing at the king's left side, and with her lips trembling slightly with rising anger, she said to the king:

original: aticapalacittātra syandane keyam āropitety asāv apy anālocitottaravacano 'tibhayāt tām āha snuṣā mameyam iti // / / //
analyzed: ati capala cittā atra syandane kā iyam āropitā iti asau api anālocita uttara vacanā u ti bhayāt tām āha snuṣā mama iyam iti
translated: Who is this placed on the chariot, so fickle-minded? The king, not having thought of an answer, said out of great fear, She is my daughter-in-law.

original: athainaṃ śaibyovāca /
analyzed: atha enam śaibyā uvāca
translated: Then Śaibyā said to him:

original: nāhaṃ prasūtā putreṇa nānyā patny abhavat tava /
analyzed: na aham prasūtā putreṇa na anyā patnī abhavat tava
translated: I have not given birth to a son, nor have you had another wife.

original: snuṣāsaṃbandhatā hy eṣā katamena sutena te // / / //
analyzed: snuṣā saṃbandha tā hi eṣā katamena sutena te
translated: This is the connection with a daughter-in-law. Which son of yours is she?

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parāśara said:

original: ity ātmerṣyākopakaluṣitavacanamuṣitavivekatayā duruktaparihārārtham idam avanīpatir āha /
analyzed: iti ātma īrṣyā kopa kaluṣita vacana muṣita viveka tayā durukta parihāra artham idam avanīpatiḥ āha
translated: Thus, with her mind clouded by jealousy and anger, and her discrimination lost, the queen spoke these words. To make amends for her harsh speech, the lord of the earth said this:

original: yas te janiṣyaty ātmajas tasyeyam anāgata eva bhāryā nirūpitety ākarṇyodbhūtamṛduhāsā tathety āha praviveśa ca rājñā sahādhiṣṭhānam // / /
analyzed: yaḥ te janiṣyati ātmajaḥ tasya iyam anāgate eva bhāryā nirūpitā iti ākarṇya udbhūta mṛdu hāsā tathā iti āha praviveśa ca rājñā saha adhiṣṭhānam
translated: The king said, She is destined to be the wife of the son who will be born to you, even before he is born. Hearing this, she smiled gently and said, So be it, and entered the palace with the king.

original: anantaraṃ cātiśuddhalagnahorāṃśakāvayavoktakṛtaputrajanmālāpaguṇād vayasaḥ pariṇāmam upagatāpi śaibyā svalpair evāhobhir garbham avāpa // / /
analyzed: anantaram ca ati śuddha lagna horā aṃśaka avayava ukta kṛta putra janma ālāpa guṇāt vayasaḥ pariṇāmam upagatā api śaibyā su alpaiḥ evā ahobhiḥ garbham avāpa
translated: And soon after, although she had reached the decline of her youth, Shaivya conceived a son, as predicted by the astrologers who had calculated the auspicious conjunction of the stars.

original: kālena ca kumāram ajījanat /
analyzed: kālena ca kumāram ajījanat
translated: In due course, she gave birth to a prince.

original: tasya ca vidarbha iti pitā nāma cakre /
analyzed: tasya ca vidarbhaḥ iti pitā nāma cakre
translated: His father named him Vidarbha.

original: sa ca tāṃ snuṣām upayeme // / / //
analyzed: sa ca tām snuṣām upayeme
translated: He married that daughter-in-law.

original: tasyāṃ cāsau krathakaiśikasaṃjñau putrāv ajanayat /
analyzed: tasyām ca asau kratha kaiśika saṃjñau putrau ajanayat
translated: And she gave birth to two sons named Kratha and Kaishika.

original: punas tṛtīyaṃ romapādasaṃjñaṃ kumāram ajījanat /
analyzed: punar tṛtīyam romapāda saṃjñam kumāram ajījanat
translated: Then she gave birth to a third prince named Rompada.

original: romapādād babhruḥ babhroḥ putro dhṛtiḥ /
analyzed: romapādāt babhruḥ babhroḥ putraḥ dhṛtiḥ
translated: From Rompada came Babhru, from Babhru came Dhriti,

original: dhṛteḥ kaiśikaḥ kaiśikasyāpi cediḥ putro 'bhūd yasya saṃtatau caidyā bhūpālāḥ /
analyzed: dhṛteḥ kaiśikaḥ kaiśikasya api cediḥ putraḥ bhūt yasya saṃtatau caidyāḥ bhūpālāḥ
translated: from Dhriti came Kaishika, and from Kaishika came Chedi, whose descendants were the Chedi kings.

original: krathasya snuṣāputrasya kuntir abhavat // / / //
analyzed: krathasya snuṣā putrasya kuntiḥ abhavat
translated: Kratha's daughter's son was Kunti.

original: kunter vṛṣṇir vṛṣṇer nirvṛtiḥ /
analyzed: kunteḥ vṛṣṇiḥ vṛṣṇeḥ nirvṛtiḥ
translated: From Kunti came Vrishni, from Vrishni came Nirvritti,

original: nirvṛter daśārhas tataś ca vyomaḥ /
analyzed: nirvṛteḥ daśārhaḥ tatas ca vyomaḥ
translated: After Nirvritti, the Arhat, then Vyoma.

original: tasmād api jīmūtas tato vikṛtis tataś ca bhīmarathaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt api jīmūtaḥ tatas vikṛtiḥ tatas ca bhīmarathaḥ
translated: After him, Jimuta, then Vikriti, then Bhimaratha.

original: tasmān navarathas tasyāpi daśarathas tataś ca śakunis tattanayaḥ karambhiḥ karambher devarāto 'bhavat /
analyzed: tasmāt navarathaḥ tasya api daśarathaḥ tatas ca śakuniḥ tad tanayaḥ karambhiḥ karambheḥ devarātaḥ bhavat
translated: After him, Navaratha, after him, Dasharatha, after him, Shakuni, his son was Karambhi, and from Karambhi was born Devrata.

original: tasyāpi devakṣatro devakṣatrān madhur madhor anavaratho 'navarathāt kuruvatsas tataś cānurathaḥ tataḥ puruhotro jajñe /
analyzed: tasya api devakṣatraḥ devakṣatrāt madhuḥ madhoḥ anavarathaḥ navarathāt kuruvatsaḥ tatas ca anurathaḥ tatas puruhotraḥ jajñe
translated: After him, Devakshatra, from Devakshatra, Madhu, from Madhu, Anavaratha, from Anavaratha, Kuruvatsa, after him, Anuratha, then Puruhotra was born.

original: tataś cāṃśus tataś ca satvataḥ satvatād ete sātvatāḥ ity etāṃ jyāmaghasaṃtatiṃ samyag chraddhāsamanvitaḥ śrutvā sarvapāpaiḥ pramucyate // / /
analyzed: tatas ca aṃśuḥ tatas ca satvataḥ satvatāt ete sātvatāḥ iti etām jyā magha saṃtatim samyak śraddhā samanvitaḥ śrutvā sarva pāpaiḥ pramucyate  /
translated: After him, Amshu, after him, Satvata. From Satvata, these are the Satvatas. One who listens to this lineage of Jyamagha with perfect faith, is freed from all sins.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe dvādaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe dvādaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: This is the twelfth chapter in the fourth section of the Visnu Purana, dealing with the genealogy of the Yadavas.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: bhajanabhajamānadivyāndhakadevāvṛdhamahābhojavṛṣṇi saṃjñāḥ satvatasya putrā babhūvuḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhajana bhajamāna divya andhaka devāvṛdha mahābhoja vṛṣṇi saṃjñāḥ satvatasya putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Satawaha had sons named Bhajamana, Bhajamana, Divya, Andhaka, Devavriddha, Mahabhoja, Vrishni, and Vrishni.

original: bhajamānasya nimikṛkaṇavṛṣṇayas tathānye tadvaimātrāḥ śatajitsahasrajidayutajitsaṃjñāḥ
analyzed: bhajamānasya nimi kṛkaṇa vṛṣṇayaḥ tathā anye tad vaimātrāḥ śatajit sahasrajit ayutajit saṃjñāḥ
translated: Bhajamana had sons named Nimi, Krikana, Vrishni, and others of the same lineage, named Shatajit, Sahasrajit, and Ayutajit.

original: devāvṛdhasyāpi babhruḥ putro 'bhūt /
analyzed: devāvṛdhasya api babhruḥ putraḥ bhūt
translated: Devāvridha had a son named Babhru.

original: tayoś cāyaṃ śloko gīyate /
analyzed: tayoḥ ca ayam ślokaḥ gīyate
translated: And about them this verse is sung:

original: yathaiva śṛṇumo dūrāt saṃpaśyāmas tathāntikāt /
analyzed: yathā eva śṛṇumaḥ dūrāt saṃpaśyāmaḥ tathā antikāt
translated: As we hear from afar, so we see from near,

original: babhruḥ śreṣṭho manuṣyāṇāṃ devair devāvṛdhaḥ samaḥ // / / //
analyzed: babhruḥ śreṣṭhaḥ manuṣyāṇām devaiḥ devāvṛdhaḥ samaḥ
translated: Babhru is the best of men, Devāvridha is equal to the gods.

original: puruṣāḥ ṣaṭ ca ṣaṣṭiś ca ṣaṭ sahasrāṇi cāṣṭa ca /
analyzed: puruṣāḥ ṣaṭ ca ṣaṣṭiḥ ca ṣaḍ sahasrāṇi ca aṣṭa ca
translated: Six men, sixty, and six thousand and eight,

original: ye 'mṛtatvam anuprāptā babhror devāvṛdhād api // / / //
analyzed: ye mṛta tvam anuprāptāḥ babhroḥ devāvṛdhāt api
translated: who have attained immortality, from Babhru and Devāvridha.

original: mahābhojas tv atidharmātmā tasyānvaye bhojā mārtikāvatā babhūvuḥ // / / //
analyzed: mahābhojaḥ tu ati dharma ātmā tasya anvaye bhojāḥ mārtikāvatāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Mahābhoja, however, was of exceedingly virtuous soul. In his line were born the Bhojas, the Mārttikāvatas, and the Andhākas.

original: vṛṣṇeḥ sumitro yudhājic ca putrāv abhūtām /
analyzed: vṛṣṇeḥ sumitraḥ yudhājit ca putrau abhūtām
translated: Vṛṣṇi had two sons, Sūmitra and Yudhajit.

original: tataś cānamitraśinī tathānamitrān nighno nighnasya prasenasatrājitau /
analyzed: tatas ca anamitra śinī tathā anamitrāt nighnaḥ nighnasya prasena satrājitau
translated: Then from Sūmitra came Anāmitra, from Anāmitra came Nighna, from Nighna came Prasenajit and Satrājit.

original: tasya satrājitasya bhagavān ādityaḥ sakhābhavat /
analyzed: tasya satrājitasya bhagavān ādityaḥ sakhā bhavat
translated: And to that Satrājit the Blessed Sun was a friend.

original: ekadā tv ambhonidhitīrasaṃśrayaḥ sūryaṃ satrājitas tuṣṭāva tanmanaskatayā ca bhāsvān abhiṣṭūyamāno 'gratas tasya tasthau /
analyzed: ekadā tu ambhonidhi tīra saṃśrayaḥ sūryam satrājitaḥ tuṣṭāva tad manaska tayā ca bhāsvān abhiṣṭūyamānaḥ gratas tasya tasthau
translated: One day, while resting on the shore of the ocean, Satrājit praised the Sun with a mind full of him, and the shining one, being praised, stood before him.

original: aspaṣṭamūrtidharaṃ cainam ālokya satrājitaḥ sūryam āha /
analyzed: aspaṣṭa mūrti dharam ca enam ālokya satrājitaḥ sūryam āha
translated: And seeing the Sun with an indistinct form, Satrājit said to the Sun:

original: yathaiva vyomni vahnipiṇḍopamam aham apaśyaṃ tathaivādyāgrato gatam apy atra na kiṃcid bhagavatā prasādīkṛtaṃ viśeṣam upalakṣayāmi //
analyzed: yathā eva vyomni vahni piṇḍa upamam aham apaśyam tathā eva adya agratas gatam api atra na kiṃcid bhagavatā prasādīkṛtam viśeṣam upalakṣayāmi
translated: Just as I saw the sun in the sky before, so I see it now in front of me. But I do not perceive any special favor shown by the Blessed One.

original: ityevam ukte bhagavatā sūryeṇa nijakaṇṭhād unmucya syamantakanāmā mahāmaṇir avatāryaikānte nyastaḥ // / / //
analyzed: iti evam ukte bhagavatā sūryeṇa nija kaṇṭhāt unmucya syamantaka nāmā mahā maṇiḥ avatārya ekānte nyastaḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed Sun removed the great jewel named Syamantaka from his neck and placed it aside in a secluded place.

original: tatas tam ātāmrojjvalahrasvavapuṣam īṣadāpiṅgalanayanam ādityam adrākṣīt /
analyzed: tatas tam ātāmra ujjvala hrasva vapuṣam īṣat āpiṅgala nayanam ādityam adrākṣīt
translated: Then he saw the sun with a copper-red, shining, short body, and eyes slightly tawny.

original: kṛtapraṇipātastavādikaṃ ca satrājitam āha /
analyzed: kṛta praṇipāta stava ādikam ca satrājitam āha
translated: Having made salutations and so on, he said to Satrājit:

original: bhagavān varam asmatto 'bhimataṃ vṛṇīṣveti /
analyzed: bhagavān varam asmattaḥ bhimatam vṛṇīṣva iti
translated: The Blessed One, choose a boon that is desired from us.

original: sa ca tad eva maṇiratnam ayācata /
analyzed: sa ca tat eva maṇi ratnam ayācata
translated: And he asked for that very jewel.

original: sa cāpi tasmai tad dattvā viyati svadhiṣṇyam āruroha // / / //
analyzed: sa ca api tasmai tat dattvā viyati sva dhiṣṇyam āruroha
translated: And he gave it to him, and ascended to his own abode in the sky.

original: satrājito 'py amalamaṇiratnasanāthakaṇṭhatayā sūrya iva tejobhir aśeṣadigantarāṇy udbhāsayan dvārakāṃ viveśa // / / //
analyzed: satrājitaḥ api amala maṇi ratna sanātha kaṇṭha tayā sūryaḥ iva tejobhiḥ aśeṣa digantarāṇi udbhāsayan dvārakām viveśa
translated: And Satrājit, with his neck adorned with the pure jewel, illuminating all the ends of the directions with his splendor like the sun, entered Dvārakā.

original: dvārakāvāsijanapadas tu tam āyāntam avekṣya bhagavantam ādipuruṣaṃ puruṣottamam avanibhārāvataraṇāyāṃśena mānuṣarūpadhāriṇaṃ praṇipatyāha /
analyzed: dvārakā vāsi janapadaḥ tu tam āyāntam avekṣya bhagavantam ādipuruṣam puruṣottamam avani bhāra avataraṇāya aṃśena mānuṣa rūpa dhāriṇam praṇipatya āha
translated: The people of Dvārakā, seeing the Lord coming, bowed down to him, the original Puruṣa, the best of men, who had assumed a human form as an incarnation to relieve the earth of her burden.

original: bhagavan bhagavantam ayaṃ nūnaṃ draṣṭum āyāty āditya ity ākarṇya prahasya ca tān āha /
analyzed: bhagavan bhagavantam ayam nūnam draṣṭum āyāti ādityaḥ iti ākarṇya prahasya ca tān āha
translated: They said, O Lord, he is surely coming to see the Lord. Hearing this, the Lord smiled and said to them,

original: bhagavān nāyam ādityaḥ satrājito yam ādityadattaṃ syamanatakākhyaṃ mahāmaṇiṃ bibhrad atropayāti /
analyzed: bhagavān na ayam ādityaḥ satrājitaḥ yam āditya dattam syamanataka ākhyam mahā maṇim bibhrat atra upayāti
translated: The Lord said, This is not the sun. It is Satrājit who is coming here with the great jewel called Syamantaka, given to him by the sun.

original: tad enaṃ visrabdhāḥ paśyata ity uktās te yayuḥ /
analyzed: tat enam visrabdhāḥ paśyata iti uktāḥ te yayuḥ
translated: You may see him fearlessly. Thus addressed, they went away.

original: sa ca taṃ syamantakākhyaṃ mahāmaṇim ātmaniveśane cakre // / / //
analyzed: sa ca tam syamantaka ākhyam mahā maṇim ātma niveśane cakre
translated: And he placed that great jewel called Syamantaka in his own house.

original: pratidinaṃ ca tan maṇiratnapravaram aṣṭau kanakabhārān sravati /
analyzed: pratidinam ca tat maṇi ratna pravaram aṣṭau kanaka bhārān sravati
translated: And that best of jewels, the Syamantaka, yielded eight bhāras of gold every day.

original: tatprabhāvāc ca sakalasyaiva rāṣṭrasyopasargānāvṛṣṭivyālāgnitoyadurbhikṣādibhayaṃ na bhavati // / / //
analyzed: tad prabhāvāt ca sakalasya eva rāṣṭrasya upasarga anāvṛṣṭi vyāla agni toya durbhikṣa ādi bhayam na bhavati
translated: And by its power, the whole kingdom was free from calamities, drought, wild beasts, fire, water, famine, and other dangers.

original: acyuto 'pi tad ratnam ugrasenasya bhūpater yogyam etad iti lipsāṃ cakre /
analyzed: acyutaḥ u tat ratnam ugrasenasya bhūpateḥ yogyam etat iti lipsām cakre
translated: Achyuta (Kṛṣṇa) thought that jewel was worthy of king Ugrasena and desired to possess it.

original: gotrabhedabhayāc chakto 'pi na jahāra // / / //
analyzed: gotra bheda bhayāt śaktaḥ u pi na jahāra
translated: Although able, he did not take it, fearing a division in the family.

original: satrājito apy acyuto mām etad yācayiṣyatīty avagataratnalobhaḥ svabhrātre prasenāya tad ratnam dattavān /
analyzed: satrājitaḥ api acyutaḥ mām etat yācayiṣyati iti avagata ratna lobhaḥ sva bhrātre prasenāya tat ratnam dattavān
translated: Satyajit, knowing that Achyuta would ask him for the jewel, gave it to his brother Prasena out of greed for the jewel.

original: tac ca śucinā dhriyamāṇam aśeṣam eva suvarṇasrāvādikaṃ guṇam utpādayati /
analyzed: tat ca śucinā dhriyamāṇam aśeṣam eva suvarṇa srāva ādikam guṇam utpādayati
translated: And that jewel, when worn by a pure person, produces all the qualities such as a stream of gold, and so on.

original: anyathā ya enaṃ dhārayati tam eva hantīty /
analyzed: anyathā yaḥ enam dhārayati tam eva hanti iti
translated: Otherwise, it kills the one who wears it.

original: asāv api prasenaḥ syamantakena kaṇṭhāsaktenāśvam āruhyāṭavyāṃ mṛgayām agacchat /
analyzed: asau api prasenaḥ syamantakena kaṇṭha āsaktena aśvam āruhya aṭavyām mṛgayām agacchat
translated: That Prasena also, with the Syamantaka jewel fastened to his neck, mounted a horse and went to the forest to hunt.

original: tatra ca siṃhād vadham avāpa /🔽sāśvaṃ ca taṃ nihatya siṃho 'py amalamaṇiratnam āsyāgreṇādāya gantum udyata ṛkṣādhipatinā jāmbavatā dṛṣṭo ghātitaś ca /
analyzed: tatra ca siṃhāt vadham avāpa  sa aśvam ca tam nihatya siṃhaḥ pi amala maṇi ratnam āsya agreṇa ādāya gantum udyataḥ ṛkṣa adhipatinā jāmbavatā dṛṣṭaḥ ghātitaḥ ca
translated: And there he was killed by a lion.🔽The lion, having killed him and the horse, raised up the pure jewel with its mouth to go, but was seen and killed by the lord of the bears, Jambavan.

original: jāmbavān apy amalaṃ tan maṇiratnam ādāya svabilaṃ praviveśa /
analyzed: jāmbavān api amalam tat maṇi ratnam ādāya sva bilam praviveśa
translated: Jambavan also, taking that pure jewel, entered his own cave.

original: sukumārasaṃjñāya ca bālakāya krīḍanakam akarot // / / //
analyzed: sukumāra saṃjñāya ca bālakāya krīḍanakam akarot
translated: And he made it a plaything for the young one named Sukumāra.

original: anāgacchati ca tasmin prasene kṛṣṇo maṇiratnam abhilaṣitavān /
analyzed: an āgacchati ca tasmin prasene kṛṣṇaḥ maṇi ratnam
translated: When Prasena did not return, Krishna desired the jewel.

original: na ca prāptavān nūnam etad asya karmety akhila eva yadulokaḥ parasparaṃ karṇākarṇy'kathayat // / / //
analyzed: na ca prāptavān nūnam etat asya karma iti akhilaḥ eva yadu lokaḥ parasparam karṇākarṇī kathayat
translated: And the whole Yadava race whispered to one another that this was not the work of Prasena.

original: viditalokāpavādavṛttāntaś ca bhagavān yadusainyaparivāraḥ prasenāśvapadavīm anusasāra /🔽dadarśa cāśvasametaṃ prasenaṃ nihataṃ siṃhenākhilajanapadamadhye siṃhapadadarśanakṛtapariśuddhiḥ siṃhapadam anusasāra // / / //
analyzed: vidita loka apavāda vṛttāntaḥ ca bhagavān yadu sainya parivāraḥ prasena aśva padavīm anusasāra  dadarśa ca aśva sametam prasenam nihatam siṃhena akhila janapada madhye siṃha pada darśana kṛta pariśuddhiḥ siṃha padam anusasāra
translated: And the Lord, hearing of the people's talk, followed the track of Prasena's horse, accompanied by the Yadava army.🔽And he saw Prasena, with the horse, slain by a lion, in the midst of the people. Having ascertained the truth by seeing the lion's footprints, he followed the lion's tracks.

original: ṛkṣavinihataṃ ca siṃham apy alpe bhūmibhāge dṛṣṭvā tataś ca tadratnagauravād ṛkṣasyāpi padāny anuyayau /
analyzed: ṛkṣa vinihatam ca siṃham api alpe bhūmi bhāge dṛṣṭvā tatas ca tad ratna gauravāt ṛkṣasya api padāni anuyayau
translated: And seeing the lion also slain by a bear in a small part of the ground, he followed the bear's footprints, out of respect for the jewel.

original: giritaṭe ca sakalam eva yadusainyam avasthāpya tatpadānusārī ṛkṣabilaṃ praviveśa /
analyzed: giri taṭe ca sakalam eva yadu sainyam avasthāpya tad pada anusārī ṛkṣa bilam praviveśa
translated: And leaving the whole Yadava army on the mountain slope, he entered the bear's cave, following its footprints.

original: ardhapraviṣṭaś ca dhātryāḥ sukumārakam ullāpayantyā vāṇīṃ śuśrāva /
analyzed: ardha praviṣṭaḥ ca dhātryāḥ sukumārakam ullāpayantyāḥ vāṇīm śuśrāva
translated: And half-way in, he heard the voice of his nurse, consoling the tender child.

original: siṃhaḥ prasenam avadhīt siṃho jāmbavatā hataḥ /
analyzed: siṃhaḥ prasenam avadhīt siṃhaḥ jāmbavatā hataḥ
translated: The lion slew Prasena, and the lion was slain by Jāmbavān.

original: sukumāraka mā rodīs tava hy eṣa syamantakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sukumāraka mā rodīḥ tava hi eṣa syamantakaḥ
translated: O tender child, do not weep, for this Syamantaka is yours.

original: ity ākarṇyalabdhasyamantakodantaḥ praviṣṭaḥ kumārakrīḍanakīkṛtaṃ ca dhātryā haste tejobhir jājvalyamānaṃ syamantakaṃ dadarśa // / /🔽taṃ ca syamantakābhilāṣicakṣuṣam apūrvapuruṣam āgataṃ samavekṣya dhātrī trāhi trāhīti vyājahāra // / / //
analyzed: iti ākarṇya labdha syamantaka udantaḥ praviṣṭaḥ kumāra krīḍanakīkṛtam ca dhātryāḥ haste tejobhiḥ jājvalyamānam syamantakam dadarśa  / tam ca syamantaka abhilāṣi cakṣuṣam apūrva puruṣam āgatam samavekṣya dhātrī trāhi trāhi iti vyājahāra
translated: Having heard this, he entered the house, and saw the Syamantaka jewel, which was shining with its own splendour, in the hands of the nurse, who was playing with the child.🔽And seeing that extraordinary man who had come, with eyes longing for the Syamantaka jewel, the nurse cried out, Save me, save me!

original: tadārtanādaśravaṇānantaraṃ cāmarṣapūrṇahṛdayaḥ sa jāmbavān ājagāma /
analyzed: tadā ārta nāda śravaṇa anantaram ca āmarṣa pūrṇa hṛdayaḥ sa jāmbavān ājagāma
translated: And immediately after hearing that cry of distress, Jāmbavān, his heart filled with anger, came.

original: tayoś ca parasparam yudhyator dvayor yuddham ekaviṃśatidināny abhavat /
analyzed: tayoḥ ca parasparam yudhyatoḥ dvayoḥ yuddham ekaviṃśati dināni abhavat
translated: And the fight between the two, who were fighting each other, lasted for twenty-one days.

original: te ca yadusainikās tatra saptāṣṭa dināni tanniṣkrāntim udīkṣamāṇās tasthuḥ /
analyzed: te ca yadu sainikāḥ tatra sapta aṣṭa dināni tad niṣkrāntim udīkṣamāṇāḥ tasthuḥ
translated: And those Yadu soldiers, expecting his return there for seven or eight days, remained there.

original: aniṣkramamāṇe ca madhuripāv asāv avaśyam atra bile 'tyantaṃ nāśam āpto bhaviṣyaty
analyzed: a niṣkramamāṇe ca madhuripau asau avaśyam atra bile tyantam nāśam āptaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And when Madhū's enemy did not come out, he must have certainly met with complete destruction in this hole.

original: anyathā tasya jīvataḥ katham etāvanti dināni śatrujaye vyākṣepo bhavatīti kṛtādhyavasāyā
analyzed: anyathā tasya jīvataḥ katham etāvanti dināni śatru jaye vyākṣepaḥ bhavati iti kṛta adhyavasāyā
translated: Otherwise, how could there be such a delay in conquering the enemy while he was alive? Having come to this conclusion,

original: dvārakām āgatya hataḥ kṛṣṇa iti kathayām āsuḥ // / / //
analyzed: dvārakām āgatya hataḥ kṛṣṇaḥ iti kathayām āsuḥ
translated: they came to Dvārakā and said, Kṛṣṇa is killed.

original: tadbāndhavāś ca tatkālocitam akhilam uparatakriyākalāpaṃ cakruḥ /
analyzed: tad bāndhavāḥ ca tad kāla ucitam akhilam uparata kriyā kalāpam cakruḥ
translated: And his relatives performed all the rites proper for that occasion.

original: tatrāsya yuddhyamānasyātiśraddhādattaviśiṣṭapātropayuktānnatoyādinā kṛṣṇasya balaprāṇapuṣṭir abhūt // / / //
analyzed: tatra asya yuddhyamānasya ati śraddhā datta viśiṣṭa pātra upayukta anna toya ādinā kṛṣṇasya bala prāṇa puṣṭiḥ abhūt
translated: There, while fighting, Krishna's strength and life were nourished by the food, water, etc. given by him with great faith and used by the excellent recipient.

original: itarasyānudinam atigurupuruṣabhidyamānasyātiniṣṭhuraprahārapīḍitākhilāvayavasya nirāhāratayā balahāniḥ /
analyzed: itarasya anudinam ati guru puruṣa bhidyamānasya ati niṣṭhura prahāra pīḍita akhila avayavasya nirāhāra tayā bala hāniḥ
translated: On the other hand, for the other one, who was being struck by very powerful men every day and whose entire body was afflicted by very severe blows, there was a loss of strength due to fasting.

original: nirjitaś ca bhagavatā jāmbavān praṇipatyāha V vyājahāra /
analyzed: nirjitaḥ ca bhagavatā jāmbavān vyājahāra
translated: And Jambavan, who was defeated by the Lord, bowed down and said:

original: asurasurayakṣagandharvarākṣasādibhir apy akhilair bhagavān na jetuṃ śakyaḥ /
analyzed: asura sura yakṣa gandharva rākṣasa ādibhiḥ api akhilaiḥ bhagavān na jetum śakyaḥ
translated: The Lord cannot be conquered by all the demons, gods, yakshas, gandharvas, rakshasas, and others.

original: kim utāvanigocarair alpavīryair narair narāvayavabhūtaiś ca tiryagyonyanusṛtibhiḥ kiṃ punar asmadvidhaiḥ /
analyzed: kim uta avani gocaraiḥ alpa vīryaiḥ naraiḥ nara avayava bhūtaiḥ ca tiryagyoni anusṛtibhiḥ kim punar asmadvidhaiḥ
translated: What to speak of human beings who have only a little strength and move on the earth, and of those who are born as animals and are parts of human beings? What to speak of us?

original: avaśyaṃ bhagavato 'smatsvāmino nārāyaṇasya sakalajagatparāyaṇasyāṃśena bhagavatā bhavitavyam ity uktas tasmai bhagavān akhilāvanibhārāvatāram
analyzed: avaśyam bhagavataḥ smad svāminaḥ nārāyaṇasya sakala jagat parāyaṇasya aṃśena bhagavatā bhavitavyam iti uktaḥ tasmai bhagavān akhila avani bhāra avatāram
translated: The Lord must certainly be an incarnation of the Lord Narayana, who is the master of us all and the ultimate refuge of the entire world. When this was said, the Lord told him about the incarnation to relieve the burden of the entire earth.

original: ācacakṣe /
analyzed: ācacakṣe
translated: He told him everything.

original: prītyābhyañjitakaratalasparśanena cainam apagatayuddhakhedaṃ cakāra // / / //
analyzed: prītyā abhyañjita kara tala sparśanena ca enam apagata yuddha khedam cakāra
translated: And by the touch of his hand, anointed with affection, he removed the fatigue of the battle from his body.

original: sa ca praṇipatyainaṃ punar api prasādya jāmbavatīṃ nāma kanyāṃ gṛhāgamanārghyabhūtāṃ grāhayām āsa // / / //
analyzed: sa ca praṇipatya enam punar api prasādya jāmbavatīm nāma kanyām gṛha āgamana arghya bhūtām grāhayām āsa
translated: And he, having bowed to him, and again propitiated him, accepted a maiden named Jāmbavatī, who was a worthy present for coming to his house.

original: syamantakamaṇim apy asau praṇipatya tasmai pradadau /
analyzed: syamantaka maṇim api asau praṇipatya tasmai pradadau
translated: And he, having bowed to him, gave him the Syamantaka jewel.

original: acyuto 'py atipraṇatāt tasmād agrāhyam api tan maṇiratnam ātmasaṃśodhanāya jagrāha // / / //
analyzed: acyutaḥ pi ati praṇatāt tasmāt agrāhyam api tat maṇi ratnam ātma saṃśodhanāya jagrāha
translated: And Achyuta, though it was not to be accepted from him, who was very much bowed down, accepted that jewel for the purification of himself.

original: saha jāmbavatyā sa dvārakām ājagāma /
analyzed: saha jāmbavatyā sa dvārakām ājagāma
translated: And with Jāmbavatī he went to Dvārakā.

original: bhagavadāgamanodbhūtaharṣotkarṣasya dvārakāvāsijanasya kṛṣṇāvalokanāt tatkṣaṇam evātipariṇatavayaso 'pi navayauvanam ivābhavat /
analyzed: bhagavat āgamana udbhūta harṣa utkarṣasya dvārakā vāsi janasya kṛṣṇa avalokanāt tad kṣaṇam eva ati pariṇata vayasaḥ nava yauvanam iva abhavat
translated: And the people of Dvārakā, who were filled with the highest joy at the arrival of the Lord, by beholding Kṛṣṇa, became as it were young again, though their age was very advanced.

original: ānakadundubhiṃ ca diṣṭyā diṣṭyeti sakalayādavāḥ striyaś ca sabhājayām āsuḥ /
analyzed: ānakadundubhim ca diṣṭyā diṣṭyā iti sakala yādavāḥ striyaḥ ca sabhājayām āsuḥ
translated: And all the Yādavas and the women exclaimed, By good luck! By good luck! and honored Ānakadundubhi.

original: bhagavān api yathānubhūtam aśeṣayādavasamāje yathāvad ācacakṣe /
analyzed: bhagavān api yathā anubhūtam aśeṣa yādava samāje yathāvat ācacakṣe
translated: And the Lord also related in full to the assembly of all the Yādavas what had happened, as it was.

original: syamantakaṃ ca satrājitāya dattvā mithyābhiśastiviśuddhim avāpa // / / //
analyzed: syamantakam ca satrājitāya dattvā mithyā abhiśasti viśuddhim avāpa
translated: And having given the Syamantaka jewel to Satrājit, he was absolved from the false accusation.

original: jāmbavatīṃ cāntaḥpure niveśayām āsa /
analyzed: jāmbavatīm ca antaḥpure niveśayām āsa
translated: And he placed Jāmbavatī in the inner apartments.

original: satrājito 'pi mayāsyābhūtamalinam āropitam iti jātasaṃtrāsaḥ svasutāṃ satyabhāmāṃ bhagavate bhāryāṃ dadau /
analyzed: satrājitaḥ u pi āropitam iti jāta saṃtrāsaḥ sva sutām satyabhāmām bhagavate bhāryām dadau
translated: Satrājit, fearing that he had falsely accused him, gave his own daughter Satyabhāmā to the Lord as his wife.

original: tāṃ cākrūrakṛtavarmaśatadhanvapramukhā yādavāḥ pūrvaṃ varayāṃ āsuḥ /
analyzed: tām ca akrūra kṛtavarma śatadhanva pramukhāḥ yādavāḥ pūrvam varayām āsuḥ
translated: And the Yādavas headed by Akrūra, Kṛtavarman, and Śatadhanvā had previously asked for her hand.

original: tatas tatpradānād avajñātam ivātmānaṃ manyamānāḥ satrājite vairānubandhaṃ cakruḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas tad pradānāt avajñātam iva ātmānam manyamānāḥ satrājite vaira anubandham cakruḥ
translated: Then, considering themselves slighted by his giving her away, they formed an enmity with Satrājit.

original: akrūrakṛtavarmapramukhāś ca śatadhanvānam ūcuḥ /
analyzed: akrūra kṛtavarma pramukhāḥ ca śatadhanvānam ūcuḥ
translated: And Akrūra, Kṛtavarman, and the others said to Śatadhanvā:

original: ayam atidurātmā satrājito yo 'smābhir bhavatā ca abhyarthito 'py ātmajām asmān bhavantaṃ cāvigaṇayya kṛṣṇāya dattavān /
analyzed: ayam ati durātmā satrājitaḥ yaḥ smābhiḥ bhavatā ca abhyarthitaḥ pi ātmajām asmān bhavantam ca a vigaṇayya kṛṣṇāya dattavān
translated: This extremely wicked Satrājit, though requested by us and by you, has given his daughter to Kṛṣṇa, disregarding us and you.

original: tad alam anena jīvatā ghātayitvainaṃ tan mahāratnaṃ tvayā kiṃ na gṛhyate /
analyzed: tat alam anena jīvatā ghātayitvā enam tat mahā ratnam tvayā kim na gṛhyate
translated: So what is the point of keeping him alive? Having killed him, why don't you take that great jewel?

original: vayam abhyupapatsyāmo yady acyutas tavopari vairānubandhaṃ kariṣyatīti // / / //
analyzed: vayam abhyupapatsyāmaḥ yadi acyutaḥ tava upari vaira anubandham kariṣyati iti
translated: We will support you, if Achyuta forms an enmity with you.

original: evam uktas tathety asāv apy āha /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tathā iti asau api āha
translated: Thus addressed, he replied, So be it.

original: jatugṛhadagdhānāṃ pāṇḍutanayānāṃ viditaparamārtho 'pi bhagavān duryodhanaprayatnaśaithilyakaraṇārtham ānukūlyakaraṇāya vāraṇāvataṃ gataḥ //
analyzed: jatu gṛha dagdhānām pāṇḍu tanayānām vidita parama arthaḥ pi bhagavān duryodhana prayatna śaithilya karaṇa artham ānukūlya karaṇāya vāraṇāvatam gataḥ
translated: Although the Blessed One knew the ultimate truth about the Pandava sons who were burned in the lac house, he went to Varanavata to make it easy for Duryodhana's efforts and to do what was favorable.

original: gate ca tasmin suptam eva satrājitaṃ śatadhanvā jaghāna maṇiratnaṃ cādade /
analyzed: gate ca tasmin suptam eva satrājitam śatadhanvā jaghāna maṇi ratnam ca ādade
translated: And when he had gone, Shatadhanva killed Shatanika while he was asleep and took the jewel.

original: pitṛvadhāmarṣapūrṇā ca satyabhāmā śīghraṃ syandanam ārūḍhā vāraṇāvataṃ gatvā bhagavate 'haṃ pratipāditety akṣāntimatā śatadhanvanāsmatpitā
analyzed: pitṛ vadha amarṣa pūrṇā ca satyabhāmā śīghram syandanam ārūḍhā vāraṇāvatam gatvā bhagavate ham pratipāditā iti akṣāntimatā śatadhanvanā asmad pitā
translated: And Sathyabhama, filled with rage at the death of her father, quickly mounted her chariot, went to Varanavata, and said to the Blessed One, I have been given to you by Shatadhanva, who is intolerant.

original: tac ca syamantakamaṇiratnam apahṛtam /
analyzed: tat ca syamantaka maṇi ratnam apahṛtam
translated: And that jewel Syamantaka has been stolen by him.

original: tad iyam asyāvahāsanā /
analyzed: tat iyam asya avahāsanā
translated: This is his insult.

original: tad ālocya yad atra yuktaṃ tat kriyatām iti kṛṣṇam āha // / / //
analyzed: tat ālocya yat atra yuktam tat kriyatām iti kṛṣṇam āha
translated: Considering this, do what is proper in this matter.

original: tayā caivam uktaḥ parituṣṭāntaḥkaraṇo 'pi kṛṣṇaḥ satyabhāmām amarṣatāmralocanaḥ prāha /
analyzed: tayā ca evam uktaḥ parituṣṭa antaḥkaraṇaḥ pi kṛṣṇaḥ satyabhāmām amarṣa tāmra locanaḥ prāha
translated: And Krishna, thus addressed by her, although his heart was satisfied, said to Sathyabhama with eyes reddened with intolerance.

original: satye mamaivaiṣāvahāsanā /
analyzed: satye mama eva eṣā avahāsanā
translated: This insult is mine alone, O Sathyabhama.

original: nāham etāṃ tasya durātmanaḥ sahiṣye /
analyzed: na aham etām tasya durātmanaḥ sahiṣye
translated: I will not tolerate this of that wicked man.

original: na hy anullaṅghya varapādapaṃ tatkṛtanīḍāśrayiṇo vihaṃgā vadhyante /
analyzed: na hi an ullaṅghya vara pādapam tad kṛta nīḍa āśrayiṇaḥ vihaṃgāḥ vadhyante
translated: For birds that have built their nests in a tree are not killed without the tree being cut down.

original: tad alam atyartham amunāsmatpurataḥ śokapreritavākyaparikareṇety uktvā dvārakām abhyetya baladevam ekānte vāsudevaḥ prāha /
analyzed: tat alam atyartham amunā asmad puratas śoka prerita vākya parikareṇa iti uktvā dvārakām abhyetya baladevam ekānte vāsudevaḥ prāha
translated: Therefore, enough of this excessive display of words prompted by grief in our presence. Having said this, Vasudeva went to Dvārakā and said to Baladeva in private:

original: mṛgayāgataṃ prasenam aṭavyāṃ mṛgapatir jaghāna /
analyzed: mṛgayā gatam prasenam aṭavyām mṛga patiḥ jaghāna
translated: While hunting, Prasena was killed by the lord of beasts in the forest.

original: satrājito 'py adhunā śatadhanvanā nidhanaṃ prāpitaḥ /
analyzed: satrājitaḥ u pi adhunā śatadhanvanā nidhanam prāpitaḥ
translated: And now Śatadhanvā has also been killed by Śatadhanvā.

original: tadubhayavināśāt tan maṇiratnam āvābhyāṃ sāmānyaṃ bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: tad ubhaya vināśāt tat maṇi ratnam āvābhyām sāmānyam bhaviṣyati
translated: Because of the destruction of both of them, that jewel gem will be ours in common.

original: tad uttiṣṭhāruhyatāṃ rathaḥ śatadhanvanidhanāyodyamaṃ kurv ity abhihitas tatheti samanvicchitavān /
analyzed: tat uttiṣṭha āruhyatām rathaḥ śatadhanva nidhanāya udyamam kuru iti abhihitaḥ tathā iti
translated: Rise up, let us mount the chariot and make an effort to kill Śatadhanvā. When this was said, he agreed.

original: kṛtodyogau ca tāv ubhāv upalabhya śatadhanvā kṛtavarmāṇam upetya pārṣṇipūraṇakarmanimittam acodayat /
analyzed: kṛta udyogau ca tau ubhau upalabhya śatadhanvā kṛtavarmāṇam upetya pārṣṇi pūraṇa karma nimittam acodayat
translated: And when they both made an effort, Śatadhanvā, having understood, approached Kṛtavarman and urged him to fulfill the promise.

original: āha cainaṃ kṛtavarmā /
analyzed: āha ca enam kṛtavarmā
translated: And Kṛtavarman said to him:

original: nāhaṃ balabhadravāsudevābhyāṃ saha virodhāyālam ity uktaś cākrūram acodayat /
analyzed: na aham balabhadra vāsudevābhyām saha virodhāya alam iti uktaḥ ca akrūram acodayat
translated: I am not able to oppose Balabhadra and Vasudeva. When this was said, he urged Akrūra.

original: asāv apy āha /
analyzed: asau api āha
translated: And he also said:🔽I am not able to oppose them.

original: na hi kaścid bhagavatā pādaprahāraparikampitajagattrayeṇāsurapuravanitāvaidhavyakāriṇā🔽prabalaripucakrāpratihatacakreṇa cakriṇā madamuditanayanāvalokitāribalaviśātanenātiguruvairi
analyzed: na hi kaścid bhagavatā pāda prahāra parikampita jagattrayeṇa asura pura vanitā vaidhavya kāriṇā  prabala ripu cakra apratihata cakreṇa cakriṇā mada mudita nayana avalokita ari bala viśātanena ati guru vairi
translated: For no one is able to fight with the discus-bearer, who with his discus, which shakes the three worlds with the blows of his feet, which brings widowhood to the women of the demon cities,

original: vāraṇāpakarṣaṇāviṣkṛtamahimorusīreṇa sīriṇā ca saha sakalajagadvandyānām amaravarāṇām
analyzed: vāraṇa apakarṣaṇa āviṣkṛta mahima uru sīreṇa sīriṇā ca saha sakala jagat vandyānām amara varāṇām
translated: which is invincible to the mighty armies of enemies, who with his eyes full of pride destroys the armies of his enemies, who with his ploughshare, whose great glory is manifested by dragging the great elephant of his enemy,

original: api yoddhuṃ samarthaḥ kim utāhaṃ tadanyataḥ śaraṇam abhilaṣyatām // / / //
analyzed: api yoddhum samarthaḥ kim uta aham tad anyatas śaraṇam abhilaṣyatām
translated: is to be worshipped by all the people, even by the best of the immortals. What to speak of me, who am seeking refuge elsewhere than with him.

original: ity uktaḥ śatadhanvāha /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ śatadhanvā āha
translated: Thus addressed, Śatadhanvā said:

original: yady asmatparitrāṇāsamarthaṃ bhavān ātmānam avagacchati tad ayam asmanmaṇiḥ saṃgṛhya rakṣyatām ityuktaḥ so 'py āha /
analyzed: yadi asmad paritrāṇa asamartham bhavān ātmānam avagacchati tat ayam asmad maṇiḥ saṃgṛhya rakṣyatām iti uktaḥ saḥ u pi āha
translated: If you consider yourself incapable of saving us, then take this jewel of ours and protect it. Thus addressed, he said:

original: yady antāyām apy avasthāyāṃ na kasmaicid bhavān kathayiṣyati tad aham enaṃ grahīṣyāmīti /
analyzed: yadi antāyām api avasthāyām na kasmaicid bhavān kathayiṣyati tat aham enam grahīṣyāmi iti
translated: If in the end you will not tell anyone, then I will take it.

original: tathety ukte cākrūras tan maṇiratnaṃ jagrāha // / / //
analyzed: tathā iti ukte ca akrūraḥ tat maṇi ratnam jagrāha
translated: When it was said So be it, Akrūra took that jewel.

original: śatadhanvāpy atulavegāṃ śatayojanavāhinīṃ vaḍavām āruhyāpakrāntaḥ /
analyzed: śatadhanvā api atula vegām śata yojana vāhinīm vaḍavām āruhya apakrāntaḥ
translated: And Śatadhanvā mounted a mare that could travel a hundred leagues with incomparable speed and fled.

original: śaibyasugrīvameghapuṣpabalāhakāśvacatuṣṭayayuktarathāvasthitau baladevavāsudevau tam anuprayātau // / / //
analyzed: śaibya sugrīva meghapuṣpa balāhaka aśva catuṣṭaya yukta ratha avasthitau baladeva vāsudevau tam anuprayātau
translated: Balarāma and Kṛṣṇa, mounted on their chariots, each drawn by four horses, Śaibya, Sugrīva, Meghapuṣpa, and Balāhaka, followed him.

original: sā ca vaḍavā śatayojanapramāṇamārgam atītya punar api vāhyamānā mithilāvanoddeśe prāṇān utsasarja /
analyzed: sā ca vaḍavā śata yojana pramāṇa mārgam atītya punar api vāhyamānā mithilā vana uddeśe prāṇān utsasarja
translated: The mare, having traveled a path of a hundred yojanas, was again driven and gave up her life in the forest region of Mithilā.

original: śatadhanvāpi tāṃ parityajya padātir evādravat // / / //
analyzed: śatadhanvā api tām parityajya padātiḥ eva adravat
translated: Śatadhanvā, having abandoned her, ran on foot.

original: kṛṣṇo 'pi balabhadram āha /
analyzed: kṛṣṇaḥ u pi balabhadram āha
translated: Kṛṣṇa also said to Balarāma:

original: tāvad atraiva syandane bhavatā stheyam aham enam adhamācāraṃ padātinam anugamya yāvad ghātayāmi /
analyzed: tāvat atra eva syandane bhavatā stheyam aham enam adhama ācāram padātinam anugamya yāvat ghātayāmi
translated: You should stay here in the chariot for now. I will follow this low-born one on foot and kill him.

original: atra hi bhūbhāge dṛṣṭadoṣā hayāḥ /
analyzed: atra hi bhū bhāge dṛṣṭa doṣāḥ hayāḥ
translated: For the horses have shown their faults on this part of the ground.

original: naite 'śvā bhavatemaṃ bhūmibhāgam ullaṅghya neyāḥ // / / //
analyzed: na ete śvā bhavatā imam bhūmi bhāgam ullaṅghya neyāḥ
translated: These horses should not be made to cross this part of the ground.

original: tathety uktvā balabhadro ratha eva tasthau /
analyzed: tathā iti uktvā balabhadraḥ rathe eva tasthau
translated: Saying So be it, Balarāma stayed in the chariot.

original: kṛṣṇo 'pi dvikrośamātraṃ bhūmibhāgam anusṛtya dūrasthitasyaiva cakraṃ kṣiptvā śatadhanvanaḥ śiraś ciccheda /
analyzed: kṛṣṇaḥ pi dvi krośa mātram bhūmi bhāgam anusṛtya dūra sthitasya eva cakram kṣiptvā śatadhanvanaḥ śiraḥ ciccheda
translated: Kṛṣṇa, having followed the ground for about two kṛoṣas, threw his discus from a distance and cut off the head of Śatadhanvā.

original: taccharīrāmbarādiṣu ca bahuprakāram anviṣyann api syamantakaṃ maṇiṃ nāvāpa yadā tadopagamya balabhadram āha /
analyzed: tad śarīra ambara ādiṣu ca bahu prakāram anviṣyan api syamantakam maṇim nā avāpa yadā tadā upagamya balabhadram āha
translated: Searching in various ways in the body, clothes, etc. of Satadhanvan, when he did not find the Syamantaka jewel, he then approached Balarama and said:

original: vṛthaivāsmābhir ghātitaḥ śatadhanvā /
analyzed: vṛthā eva asmābhiḥ ghātitaḥ śatadhanvā
translated: Shatadhanvan has been killed by us in vain.

original: na prāptam akhilajagatsārabhūtaṃ tan maṇiratnaṃ /
analyzed: na prāptam akhila jagat sāra bhūtam tat maṇi ratnam
translated: That jewel, which is the essence of all the worlds, has not been obtained.

original: ity ākarṇyodbhūtakopo balabhadro vāsudevam āha /
analyzed: iti ākarṇya udbhūta kopaḥ balabhadraḥ vāsudevam āha
translated: Hearing this, Balarama, his anger aroused, said to Vasudeva:

original: dhik tvāṃ yas tvam evam arthalipsur etac ca te bhrātṛtvān marṣaye /
analyzed: dhik tvām yaḥ tvam evam artha lipsuḥ etat ca te bhrātṛ tvāt marṣaye
translated: Fie on you, who are so greedy for wealth, and I forgive you for this because you are my brother.

original: tad ayaṃ panthāḥ svecchayā gamyatāṃ /
analyzed: tat ayam panthāḥ sva icchayā gamyatām
translated: This is the path. Go as you please.

original: na me dvārakayā na bandhubhiḥ kāryam alam ebhir mamāgrato 'līkaśapathair ity ākṣipya taṃ kathaṃcit prasādyamāno 'pi na tasthau /
analyzed: na me dvārakayā na bandhubhiḥ kāryam alam ebhiḥ mama agratas līka śapathaiḥ iti ākṣipya tam kathaṃcid prasādyamānaḥ pi na tasthau
translated: I have no use for Dvaraka or relatives. Enough of these false oaths in my presence. Thus rebuking him, though somehow appeased, he did not stay.

original: videhapurīṃ praviveśa // / / //
analyzed: videha purīm praviveśa
translated: He entered the city of Videha.

original: janakaś cārghyapūrvakam enaṃ gṛhaṃ praveśayām āsa /
analyzed: janakaḥ ca arghya pūrvakam enam gṛham praveśayām āsa
translated: Janaka too, with the offering of Arghya, made him enter his house.

original: tatraiva ca tasthau /
analyzed: tatra eva ca tasthau
translated: And he stayed there itself.

original: vāsudevo 'pi dvārakām ājagāma /
analyzed: vāsudevaḥ pi dvārakām ājagāma
translated: Vasudeva too went to Dvaraka.

original: yāvac ca janakarājagṛhe balabhadro 'vatasthe tāvad dhārtarāṣṭro duryodhanas tatsakāśād gadāśikṣām aśikṣata /
analyzed: yāvat ca janaka rāja gṛhe balabhadraḥ vatasthe tāvat dhārtarāṣṭraḥ duryodhanaḥ tad sakāśāt gadā śikṣām aśikṣata
translated: As long as Balabhadra remained in the palace of king Janaka, Duryodhana, the son of Dhritarashtra, learned the art of mace-fighting from him.

original: varṣatrayānte ca babhrūgrasenaprabhṛtibhir yādavair na tad ratnaṃ kṛṣṇenāpahṛtam iti kṛtāvagatibhir videhapurīṃ gatvā baladevaḥ saṃpratyāyya
analyzed: varṣa traya ante ca babhru ugrasena prabhṛtibhiḥ yādavaiḥ na tat ratnam kṛṣṇena apahṛtam iti kṛta avagatibhiḥ videha purīm gatvā baladevaḥ saṃpratyāyya
translated: At the end of three years, the Yadavas, headed by Babhru and Ugrasena, having come to the conclusion that the jewel had been stolen by Krishna, went to the city of Videha and informed Balarama.

original: dvārakām ānītaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dvārakām ānītaḥ
translated: He was brought back to Dvārakā.

original: akrūro 'py uttamamaṇisamudbhūtasuvarṇadhyānaparas tato yajñān īje /
analyzed: akrūraḥ pi uttama maṇi samudbhūta suvarṇa dhyāna paraḥ tatas yajñān īje
translated: Akrura also, intent on meditation on the gold produced from the best gem, performed sacrifices.

original: savanagatau hi kṣatriyavaiśyau nighnan brahmahā bhavatīty ato dīkṣākavacaṃ praviṣṭa eva tasthau /
analyzed: savana gatau hi kṣatriya vaiśyau nighnan brahma hā bhavati iti atas dīkṣā kavacam praviṣṭaḥ eva tasthau
translated: For if a Kshatriya or a Vaisya were to be killed during the Soma libation, one would become a Brahman-slayer. Therefore, he remained within the armor of initiation.

original: dviṣaṣṭivarṣāṇy evaṃ tanmaṇiprabhāvāt tatropasargadurbhikṣamarakādikaṃ nābhūt // / / //
analyzed: dvi ṣaṣṭi varṣāṇi evam tad maṇi prabhāvāt tatra upasarga durbhikṣa maraka ādikam
translated: Thus, for sixty-two years, due to the power of that gem, there was no calamity, famine, epidemic, or the like there.

original: athākrūrapakṣīyair bhojaiḥ śatrughne sātvatasya prapautre vyāpādite bhojaiḥ sahākrūro dvārakām apahāyāpakrāntaḥ // / / //
analyzed: atha akrūra pakṣīyaiḥ bhojaiḥ śatrughne sātvatasya prapautre vyāpādite bhojaiḥ saha akrūraḥ dvārakām apahāya apakrāntaḥ
translated: Then, when Satvata's great-grandson Shatrughna was killed by the Bhojas who sided with Akrura, Akrura, leaving Dvārakā, fled with the Bhojas.

original: tadapakrāntidinād ārabhya tatropasargavyālānāvṛṣṭimarakādyupadrāvā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: tad apakrānti dināt ārabhya tatra upasarga vyāla anāvṛṣṭi maraka ādi upadrāvāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: From the day of his departure, calamities, such as invasions, famines, droughts, and epidemics, occurred there.

original: atha yādavabalabhadrograsenasamaveto 'mantrayad bhagavān uragāriketanaḥ /
analyzed: atha yādava balabhadra ugrasena samavetaḥ mantrayat bhagavān uraga ari ketanaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, the banner of the serpent-tamer, together with Yādava, Balabhadra, and Ugrasena, consulted:

original: kim yad idam ekadaiva pracuropadravāgamanam etad ālocyatām // / / //
analyzed: kim yat idam ekadā eva pracura upadrava āgamanam etat ālocyatām
translated: Why is there now an influx of many calamities at once? Let this be considered.

original: ity ukte 'ndhakanāmā yaduvṛddhaḥ prāha /
analyzed: iti ukte ndhaka nāmā yadu vṛddhaḥ prāha
translated: When this was said, the Yadava elder named Andhaka said:

original: asyākrūrasya pitā śvaphalko yatra yatrābhūt tatra tatra durbhikṣamarakānāvṛṣtyādikaṃ nābhūt // / / //
analyzed: asya akrūrasya pitā śvaphalkaḥ yatra tatra tatra durbhikṣa maraka anāvṛṣti ādikam
translated: Wherever Śvaphalka, the father of this Akrūra, was, there was no famine, epidemic, drought, or the like.

original: kāśīrājasya viṣaye 'tyantānāvṛṣṭyāṃ śvaphalko 'nīyata /
analyzed: kāśī rājasya viṣaye tyanta anāvṛṣṭyām śvaphalkaḥ nīyata
translated: In the kingdom of the king of Kāśī, when there was a severe drought, Śvaphalka was brought.

original: tatas tatkṣaṇād eva devo vavarṣa /
analyzed: tatas tad kṣaṇāt eva devaḥ vavarṣa
translated: Then, at that very moment, the god rained.

original: kāśīrājapatnyāś ca garbhe kanyāpūrvam āsīt // / / //
analyzed: kāśī rāja patnyāḥ ca garbhe kanyā pūrvam āsīt
translated: And the wife of the king of Kāśī had a previous birth as a girl.

original: sāpi pūrṇe 'pi prasūtikāle naiva niścakrāma /
analyzed: sā api pūrṇe pi prasūti kāle na eva niścakrāma
translated: She also did not come out even when the time for delivery was complete.

original: evaṃ ca tasya garbhasya dvādaśa varṣāṇy aniṣkrāmato yayuḥ /
analyzed: evam ca tasya garbhasya dvādaśa varṣāṇi a niṣkrāmataḥ yayuḥ
translated: Thus, twelve years passed for that unborn fetus.

original: kāśīrājaś ca garbhasthāṃ tām ātmajām āha /
analyzed: kāśī rājaḥ ca garbha sthām tām ātmajām āha
translated: And the king of Kāśī said to that daughter of his who was in the womb:

original: putri kasmān na jāyase niṣkramyatām āsyaṃ te draṣṭum icchāmy ahaṃ svakāṃ ca mātaraṃ kim iti ciraṃ kleśayiṣyasīty ukte garbhasthaiva vyājahāra
analyzed: putri kasmāt na jāyase niṣkramyatām āsyam te draṣṭum icchāmi aham svakām ca mātaram kim iti ciram kleśayiṣyasi iti ukte garbha sthā eva vyājahāra
translated: Daughter, why are you not born? Come out. I want to see your face and my own mother. Why will you torment me for a long time? When this was said, she spoke from the womb itself:

original: tāta yady ekaikāṃ gāṃ dine dine brāhmaṇebhyaḥ prayacchasi tad aham anyais tribhir varṣair asmād garbhād avaśyaṃ niṣkramiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: tāta yadi ekaikām gām dine dine brāhmaṇebhyaḥ prayacchasi tat aham anyaiḥ tribhiḥ varṣaiḥ asmāt garbhāt avaśyam niṣkramiṣyāmi iti
translated: Father, if you give a cow to the Brahmins every day, then after three more years I will certainly come out of this womb.

original: etac ca tadvacanam ākarṇya rājā dine dine brāhmaṇāya gāṃ prādāt /
analyzed: etat ca tad vacanam ākarṇya rājā dine dine brāhmaṇāya gām prādāt
translated: Hearing these words of hers, the king gave a cow to a Brahmin every day.

original: sāpi tāvatā kālena jātā /
analyzed: sā api tāvatā kālena jātā
translated: And she was born after that much time.

original: tatas tasyāḥ pitā gāndinīti nāma cakāra /
analyzed: tatas tasyāḥ pitā gāndinī iti nāma cakāra
translated: Then her father gave her the name Gandini.

original: tāṃ ca gāndinīṃ kanyāṃ śvaphalkāya priyopakāriṇe gṛhāgatāyārghabhūtāṃ prādāt // / / //
analyzed: tām ca gāndinīm kanyām śvaphalkāya priya upakāriṇe gṛhāgatāya argha bhūtām prādāt
translated: And that maiden Gandini, who was like a welcome guest to Shvapalka, who was dear to him, he gave her as a gift.

original: tasyām ayam akrūraḥ śvaphalkāj jajñe /
analyzed: tasyām ayam akrūraḥ śvaphalkāt jajñe
translated: And Akrura was born to Shvapalka from her.

original: tad asyaivaṃguṇamithunād utpattiḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat asya evaṃguṇa mithunāt utpattiḥ
translated: Thus he was born from such a virtuous couple.

original: katham asminn apakrānte marakadurbhikṣādyupadravā na bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: katham asmin apakrānte maraka durbhikṣa ādi upadravāḥ na bhaviṣyanti
translated: How will calamities like famine and drought not occur when he has left?

original: tad ayam ānīyatām ity alam atiguṇavaty aparādhānveṣaneneti // / / //
analyzed: tat ayam ānīyatām iti alam ati guṇavati aparādha anveṣanena iti
translated: Therefore, let him be brought back. Enough of this search for faults in one who is extremely virtuous.

original: yaduvṛddhasyāndhakasyaitad vacanam ākarṇya keśavograsenabalabhadrapurogamair yadubhiḥ kṛtāparādhatitikṣābhavam abhayaṃ dattvā śvāphalkiḥ svapuram 🔽ānītaḥ /
analyzed: yadu vṛddhasya andhakasya etat vacanam ākarṇya keśava ugrasena balabhadra purogamaiḥ yadubhiḥ kṛta aparādha titikṣā bhavam abhayam dattvā śvāphalkiḥ sva puram  ānītaḥ
translated: Hearing these words of the blind Yadu king Andhaka, Keshava, Ugrasena, Balabhadra, and the other Yadus, having granted him pardon and security, brought him to their own city.

original: tatra cāgatamātra eva tasya tatsthasya maṇer anubhāvad anāvṛṣṭimarakadurbhikṣavyālādyupadravaḥ śaśāma /
analyzed: tatra ca āgata mātraḥ eva tasya tad sthasya maṇeḥ anubhāvat anāvṛṣṭi maraka durbhikṣa vyāla ādi upadravaḥ śaśāma
translated: And as soon as he arrived there, by the power of that jewel in his possession, the calamities of drought, pestilence, famine, wild beasts, and so on, ceased.

original: kṛṣṇaś ca cintayām āsa /
analyzed: kṛṣṇaḥ ca cintayām āsa
translated: And Krishna thought:

original: svalpam etat kāraṇaṃ yad ayaṃ gāndinyāṃ śvaphalkenākrūro jātaḥ /
analyzed: su alpam etat kāraṇam yat ayam gāndinyām śvaphalkena akrūraḥ jātaḥ
translated: This is a small reason that he was born to Gandini by Shvaphalka as Akrura.

original: sumahāṃś cāyam anāvṛṣṭidurbhikṣamarakādyupadravaśamanakārī prabhāvaḥ // / / //
analyzed: su mahān ca ayam anāvṛṣṭi durbhikṣa maraka ādi upadrava śamana kārī prabhāvaḥ
translated: And this power of his is very great, in removing the calamities of drought, famine, pestilence, and so on.

original: tan nūnam asya sakāśe sa mahāmaṇiḥ syamantakākhyas tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: tat nūnam asya sakāśe sa mahā maṇiḥ syamantaka ākhyaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: Therefore, surely that great jewel called Syamantaka is with him.

original: tasya hy evaṃvidhāḥ prabhāvāḥ śrūyante /
analyzed: tasya hi evaṃvidhāḥ prabhāvāḥ śrūyante
translated: For such powers are heard to belong to it.

original: ayam api ca yajñād anantaram anyat kratvantaraṃ anantaram ca tasmād yajñāntaraṃ yajatīti /
analyzed: ayam api ca yajñāt anantaram anyat kratu antaram anantaram ca tasmāt yajña antaram yajati iti
translated: And he performs another sacrifice immediately after this one, and another sacrifice immediately after that.

original: alpopādānaṃ cāsyā saṃśayam atrāsau varamaṇis tiṣṭhatīti kṛtādhyavasāyo 'nyat prayojanam uddiśya sakalayādavasamājam ātmageha evācīkarat //
analyzed: alpa upādānam saṃśayam atra asau vara maṇiḥ tiṣṭhati iti kṛta adhyavasāyaḥ prayojanam uddiśya sakala yādava samājam ātma gehe eva acīkarat
translated: And thinking that it was better to keep the jewel in his own house, he made up his mind to do so, and with the object of accomplishing some other purpose, he caused the whole Yadava assembly to be held in his own house.

original: tatra copaviṣṭeṣv akhileṣu yādaveṣu pūrvaprayojanam upanyasya paryavasite ca tasmin prasaṅgāgataparihāsakathām akrūreṇa saha kṛtvā janārdanas
analyzed: tatra ca upaviṣṭeṣu akhileṣu yādaveṣu pūrva prayojanam upanyasya paryavasite ca tasmin prasaṅga āgata parihāsa kathām akrūreṇa saha kṛtvā janārdanaḥ
translated: And when all the Yadavas were seated there, he brought forward the former object, and when that was finished, Janardana, having had a conversation full of jokes with Akrura on various topics,

original: tam akrūram āha // / / //
analyzed: tam akrūram āha
translated: said to Akrura:

original: dānapate jānīma eva vayaṃ yathā śatadhanvanā tad akhilajagatsārabhūtaṃ syamantakaratnaṃ bhavataḥ samarpitaṃ tad etad rāṣṭropakārakaṃ bhavataḥ 🔽sakāśe tiṣṭhatīti /
analyzed: dānapate jānīmaḥ eva vayam yathā śatadhanvanā tat akhila jagat sāra bhūtam syamantaka ratnam bhavataḥ samarpitam tat etat rāṣṭra upakārakam bhavataḥ  sakāśe tiṣṭhati iti
translated: O lord of charity, we know very well how the Syamantaka jewel, which is the essence of the whole world, was entrusted to you by Satadhanwan. We know that it remains with you, being of use to the kingdom.

original: tiṣṭhatu sarva eva vayaṃ tatprabhāvaphalabhujaḥ kiṃ tv eṣa balabhadro 'smān āśaṅkitavāṃs tad asmatprītaye darśayety abhihitaḥ saratnaḥ so 'cintayat
analyzed: tiṣṭhatu sarve eva vayam tad prabhāva phala bhujaḥ kim tu eṣa balabhadraḥ smān āśaṅkitavān tat asmad prītaye darśaya iti abhihitaḥ sa ratnaḥ saḥ u cintayat
translated: Let it remain with us all, we are the enjoyers of its power and fruit. But this Balabhadra suspects us, so show it to him for our satisfaction. Thus addressed, he, with the jewel, thought:

original: kim atrānuṣṭheyam anyathā ced bravīmy ahaṃ tat kevalāmbaratirodhānam anviṣyanto ratnam
analyzed: kim atra anuṣṭheyam anyathā ced bravīmi aham tat kevala ambara tirodhānam anviṣyantaḥ ratnam
translated: What should be done here? If I say otherwise, they will search for the jewel, hiding only in the sky.

original: etad drakṣyantīty anveṣaṇaṃ na kṣemam iti saṃcintya tam akhilajagatkāraṇabhūtaṃ nārāyaṇam āhākrūraḥ /
analyzed: etat drakṣyanti iti anveṣaṇam na kṣemam iti saṃcintya tam akhila jagat kāraṇa bhūtam nārāyaṇam āha akrūraḥ
translated: Thinking that it would not be safe to search for it, Akrura said to Narayana, who is the cause of the entire world:

original: bhagavan mamaitat syamantakaratnaṃ śatadhanvanā samarpitam // / / //
analyzed: bhagavat mama etat syamantaka ratnam śatadhanvanā samarpitam
translated: O Lord, this Syamantaka jewel was given to me by Satadhanwan.

original: apagate ca tasminn adya śvaḥ paraśvo vā bhagavān māṃ yācayiṣyatīti etāvantaṃ kālam atikṛcchreṇādhārayam /
analyzed: apagate ca tasmin adya śvas paraśvas vā bhagavān mām yācayiṣyati iti etāvantam kālam atikṛcchreṇa adhārayam
translated: And thinking that the Lord would ask me for it today, tomorrow or the day after, I have held it with great difficulty for so long.

original: tasya ca dhāraṇakleśenāham aśeṣopabhogeṣv asaṅgimānaso na vedmi svasukhakalām api // / / //
analyzed: tasya ca dhāraṇa kleśena aham aśeṣa upabhogeṣu asaṅgi mānasaḥ na vedmi sva sukha kalām api
translated: And because of the trouble of holding it, my mind is not attached to any enjoyment, and I do not know even a fraction of my own happiness.

original: etāvanmātram apy aśeṣarāṣṭropakārī dhārayituṃ na śaknotīti māṃ bhavān maṃsyata ity ātmanā na coditam // / / //
analyzed: etāvat mātram api aśeṣa rāṣṭra upakārī dhārayitum na śaknoti iti mām bhavān maṃsyate iti ātmanā na ca uditam
translated: I have not urged you myself, thinking that you might think that I cannot hold even this much that benefits the entire kingdom.

original: tad idaṃ syamantakaratnaṃ gṛhyatām icchayā yasyābhimataṃ tasya samarpyatām /
analyzed: tat idam syamantaka ratnam gṛhyatām icchayā yasya abhimatam tasya samarpyatām
translated: So take this Syamantaka jewel and give it to whoever desires it.

original: tataḥ so 'dharavastranigopitātilaghukanakasamudgakaṃ pragaṭīkṛtavān // / / //
analyzed: tatas saḥ dhara vastra nigopita ati laghu kanaka samudgakam pragaṭīkṛtavān
translated: Then he revealed a very small golden casket hidden under his lower garment.

original: tataś ca niṣkrāmya syamantakamaṇiṃ tasmin yadusamāje mumoca /
analyzed: tatas ca niṣkrāmya syamantaka maṇim tasmin yadu samāje mumoca
translated: And taking out the Syamantaka jewel, he released it in that assembly of Yadus.

original: muktamātre ca tenātikāntyā tad akhilam āsthānam uddyotitam // / / //
analyzed: mukta mātre ca tena ati kāntyā tat akhilam āsthānam uddyotitam
translated: And as soon as it was released by him, that entire assembly was illuminated with that surpassing beauty.

original: athāhākrūraḥ /
analyzed: atha āha akrūraḥ
translated: Then Akrura said:

original: sa eṣa maṇir yaḥ śatadhanvanāsmākaṃ samarpito yasyāyaṃ sa enaṃ gṛhṇātv iti /
analyzed: saḥ eṣa maṇiḥ yaḥ śatadhanvanā asmākam samarpitaḥ yasya ayam saḥ enam gṛhṇātu iti
translated: This is the jewel that Shatadhanva gave to us. Let him who owns it take it.

original: tam ālokya sarvayādavānāṃ sādhu sādhv iti vismitavacasāṃ vāco 'śrūyanta /
analyzed: tam ālokya sarva yādavānām sādhu sādhu iti vismita vacasām vācaḥ śrūyanta
translated: Seeing it, the voices of all the Yadavas were heard exclaiming in wonder, Excellent! Excellent!

original: tam ālokyamamāyam acyutenaiva sāmānyaḥ samanvicchita iti balabhadraḥ saspṛho 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: tam ālokya mamāyam acyutena eva sāmānyaḥ samanvicchitaḥ iti balabhadraḥ sa spṛhaḥ bhavat
translated: Seeing it, Balarama became desirous, thinking that it was meant for him by Achyuta alone.

original: mamedaṃ pitṛdhanam ity atīva ca satyabhāmā spṛhāṃ cakāra /
analyzed: mama idam pitṛ dhanam iti atīva ca satyabhāmā spṛhām cakāra
translated: And Satyabhama became extremely desirous, thinking, This is my paternal property.

original: balabhadrasatyānanāvalokanāt kṛṣṇo 'py ātmānaṃ cakrāntarāvasthitam iva mene /
analyzed: balabhadra satya ānana avalokanāt kṛṣṇaḥ pi ātmānam cakra antara avasthitam iva mene
translated: And Krishna, from the glances of Balarama and Satyabhama, considered himself to be standing between the discuses.

original: sakalayādavapratyakṣaṃ cākrūram āha /
analyzed: sakala yādava pratyakṣam ca akrūram āha
translated: And in the presence of all the Yadavas, he said to Akrura:

original: etad dhi maṇiratnam ātmasaṃśodhanāya eṣāṃ yadūnāṃ darśitam etac ca mama balabhadrasya ca sāmānyaṃ pitṛdhanaṃ caitat satyabhāmāyā nānyasya //
analyzed: etat hi maṇi ratnam ātma saṃśodhanāya eṣām yadūnām darśitam etat ca mama balabhadrasya ca sāmānyam pitṛ dhanam ca etat satyabhāmāyāḥ na anyasya
translated: This jewel has been shown to these Yadus for their own purification. And it is meant for me and Balarama. It is our paternal property, and Satyabhama's, not anyone else's.

original: etat sarvakālaṃ śucinā brahmacaryeṇa dhriyamāṇam aśeṣarāṣṭrasyopakārakam aśucinā dhriyamāṇam ādhāram eva hanti // / / //
analyzed: etat sarvakālam śucinā brahmacaryeṇa dhriyamāṇam aśeṣa rāṣṭrasya upakārakam aśucinā dhriyamāṇam ādhāram eva hanti
translated: This, when observed with pure celibacy at all times, is beneficial to the whole kingdom. When observed with impurity, it destroys the very foundation.

original: ato 'ham asya ṣoḍaśastrīsahasraparigrahād asamartho dhāraṇe /
analyzed: atas ham asya ṣoḍaśa strī sahasra parigrahāt asamarthaḥ dhāraṇe
translated: Therefore, I am unable to bear this, with my possession of sixteen thousand women.

original: katham caitat satyabhāmā svīkarotu /
analyzed: katham ca etat satyabhāmā svīkarotu
translated: How can Satyabhama accept this?

original: āryabalabhadreṇāpi madirāpānādyaśeṣopabhogaparityāgaḥ kathaṃ kāryaḥ /
analyzed: ārya balabhadreṇa api madirā pāna ādi aśeṣa upabhoga parityāgaḥ katham kāryaḥ
translated: And how can noble Balabhadra give up all enjoyment, including drinking wine?

original: tad ayaṃ yaduloko 'haṃ balabhadraḥ satyā ca tvāṃ dānapate prārthayāmaḥ /
analyzed: tat ayam yadu lokaḥ ham balabhadraḥ satyā ca tvām dānapate prārthayāmaḥ
translated: Therefore, this Yaduloka, Balabhadra, and Satya, we all request you, O Lord of Charity.

original: etad bhavān eva dhārayituṃ samarthaḥ /
analyzed: etat bhavān eva dhārayitum samarthaḥ
translated: You alone are capable of bearing this.

original: tvadsthaṃ cāsya rāṣṭrasyopakārakaṃ tad bhavān aśeṣarāṣṭropakāranimittam etat pūrvavad dhārayatu /
analyzed: tvad stham ca asya rāṣṭrasya upakārakam tat bhavān aśeṣa rāṣṭra upakāra nimittam etat pūrvavat dhārayatu
translated: And when it is in your possession, it is beneficial to this kingdom. Therefore, for the sake of benefiting the entire kingdom, you should bear it as before.

original: tvayānyan na vaktavyam ity ukto dānapatis tathety uktvā jagrāha ca tan mahāratnam /
analyzed: tvayā anyat na vaktavyam iti uktaḥ dānapatiḥ tathā iti uktvā jagrāha ca tat mahā ratnam
translated: You should not say anything else. When this was said, the Lord of Charity said, So be it, and accepted that great jewel.

original: tataḥ prabhṛti ca akrūraḥ prakaṭenaivātitejasā jājjvalyamānenātmakaṇṭhāsaktenāditya ivāṃśumālī cacāra // / / //
analyzed: tatas prabhṛti ca akrūraḥ prakaṭena eva ati tejasā jājjvalyamānena ātma kaṇṭha āsaktena ādityaḥ iva aṃśumālī cacāra
translated: And from that time onwards, Akrura moved about with a very bright and shining jewel necklace around his neck, like the sun with its own rays.

original: ity etāṃ bhagavato mithyābhiśastikṣālanāṃ yaḥ smarati na tasya kadācid alpāpi mithyābhiśastir bhavati /
analyzed: iti etām bhagavataḥ mithyā abhiśasti kṣālanām yaḥ smarati na tasya kadācid alpā api mithyā abhiśastiḥ bhavati
translated: He who remembers this purification of the Blessed One from false accusations, will never suffer even the slightest false accusation.

original: avyāhatendriyaś cākhilapāpamokṣam avāpnotīti // / / //
analyzed: avyāhata indriyaḥ ca akhila pāpa mokṣam avāpnoti iti
translated: And with unimpaired faculties, he attains liberation from all sins.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe trayodaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe trayodaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirteenth chapter in the fourth section of the Visnu Purana, describing the purification of the Blessed One from false accusations.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: anamitrasya sutaḥ śinir nāmābhavat /
analyzed: anamitrasya sutaḥ śiniḥ nāma abhavat
translated: Anumitra had a son named Shini.

original: tasyāpi satyakaḥ satyakāt sātyakir yuyudhānanāmā /
analyzed: tasya api satyakaḥ satyakāt sātyakiḥ yuyudhāna nāmā
translated: From him, Satyaka; from Satyaka, Satyaki, also known as Yuyudhana.

original: tasmād apy asaṅgas tatputraś ca tūṇis tūṇer yugaṃdharaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt api asaṅgaḥ tad putraḥ ca tūṇiḥ tūṇeḥ yugaṃdharaḥ
translated: From him, Asanga; his son, Toon; Toon's son, Yugandhara.

original: iti śaineyāḥ // / / //
analyzed: iti śaineyāḥ
translated: Thus are the Shini lineage.

original: anamitrasyaivānvaye vṛṣṇiḥ /
analyzed: anamitrasya eva anvaye vṛṣṇiḥ
translated: In the lineage of Anumitra himself, Vrishni.

original: tasmāc ca śvaphalkas tatprabhāvaḥ kathita eva /
analyzed: tasmāt ca śvaphalkaḥ tad prabhāvaḥ kathitaḥ eva
translated: And his son Shvaphalka's power has already been described.

original: śvaphalkasya kanīyāṃś citrako nāmābhavad bhrātā /
analyzed: śvaphalkasya kanīyān citrakaḥ nāma abhavat bhrātā
translated: Shvaphalka's younger brother was named Chitrika.

original: śvaphalkād akrūro gāndinyām abhavat /
analyzed: śvaphalkāt akrūraḥ gāndinyām abhavat
translated: From Shvaphalka, Akrura was born to Gandini.

original: tathopamadgur upamadgor mṛduraviśārimejayagirikṣatropakṣatraśatrughnārimardanadharmadṛgdṛṣṭavarmagandhamojavāhaprativāhākhyāḥ putrāḥ sutārākhyā
analyzed: tathā upamadguḥ upamadgoḥ putrāḥ sutāra ākhyā
translated: Similarly, Upamandgu, Upamandgu's son Mridhu, Avisha, Mejaya, Giri, Kshatra, Upakhshatra, Shatrughna, Arimaradana, Dharmadarshi, Drishtvarma, Gandha, Mojavaha, and Prativaha were the sons. Sutarashmi was the daughter.

original: ca kanyā /
analyzed: ca kanyā
translated: And Kaniyā.

original: devavān upadevaś cākrūraputrau /
analyzed: devavān upadevaḥ ca akrūra putrau
translated: Devavān and Upadeva were the sons of Akrūra.

original: pṛthuvipṛthupramukhāś citrakasya putrā bahavo 'bhavan
analyzed: pṛthu vipṛthu pramukhāḥ citrakasya putrāḥ bahavaḥ bhavan
translated: Citrak had many sons, headed by Pṛthuviprithu.

original: kukurabhajamānaśucikambalabarhiṣākhyās tathāndhakasya catvāraḥ putrāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kukura bhajamāna śuci kambalabarhiṣa ākhyāḥ tathā andhakasya catvāraḥ putrāḥ
translated: And Andhaka had four sons named Kukura, Bhajamāna, Śuci, and Kambalabarhiṣa.

original: kukurād dhṛṣṭas tasmāc ca kapotaromā tataś ca vilomā /
analyzed: kukurāt dhṛṣṭaḥ tasmāt ca kapotaromā tatas ca vilomā
translated: From Kukura came Dhṛṣṭa, from him Kapota-romā, from him Vilomā.

original: tasmād api tumburusakhā bhavasaṃjñaś candanodakadundubhiḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt api tumburusakhāḥ bhava saṃjñaḥ candana udakadundubhiḥ
translated: From him also Tumburu-sakha, Bhava-saṃjña, Canda-nodaka-dundubhi.

original: tataś cābhijit tataḥ punarvasuḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca abhijit tatas punarvasuḥ
translated: From him Abhijita, from him Punarvasu.

original: tasyāpy āhukaḥ putra āhukī ca kanyā // / / //
analyzed: tasya api āhukaḥ putraḥ āhukī ca kanyā
translated: From him Āhuka had a son and a daughter named Āhukī.

original: āhukasya devakograsenau dvau putrau /
analyzed: āhukasya devaka ugrasenau dvau putrau
translated: Āhuka had two sons, Devaka and Ugrasena.

original: devavān upadevaḥ sahadevo devarakṣito devakasyāpi catvāraḥ putrāḥ /
analyzed: devavān upadevaḥ sahadevaḥ devarakṣitaḥ devakasya api catvāraḥ putrāḥ
translated: Devaka had four sons: Devavān, Upadeva, Sahadeva, and Devarakṣita.

original: teṣāṃ ca vṛkadevopadevā devarakṣitā śrīdevā śāntidevā sahadevā devakī ca sapta bhaginyaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām ca vṛkadevā upadevāḥ devarakṣitā śrīdevā śāntidevā sahadevā devakī ca sapta bhaginyaḥ
translated: And they had seven sisters: Vṛkadeva, Upadeva, Devarakṣita, Śrīdeva, Śāntideva, Sahadeva, and Devakī.

original: tāś ca sarvā eva vasudeva upayeme /
analyzed: tāḥ ca sarvāḥ eva vasudevaḥ upayeme
translated: And all of them Vasudeva married.

original: ugrasenasyāpi kaṃsanyagrodhasunāmakaṅkaśaṅkusubhūmirāṣṭrapālayuddhamuṣṭituṣṭimatsaṃjñāḥ putrāḥ /
analyzed: ugrasenasya api kaṃsa nyagrodha sunāma kaṅka śaṅku subhūmi rāṣṭrapāla yuddhamuṣṭi tuṣṭimat saṃjñāḥ putrāḥ
translated: And Ugrasena had sons named Kaṃsa, Nyagrodha, Sunāman, Kaṅka, Śaṅku, Subhūmi, Rāṣṭrapāla, Yuddhamukti, Tuṣṭimanta.

original: kaṃsā kaṃsavatī sutanū rāṣṭrapālī kaṅkī ca ugrasenatanūjāḥ /
analyzed: kaṃsā kaṃsavatī sutanuḥ rāṣṭrapālī kaṅkī ca ugrasena tanūjāḥ
translated: Kamsa, Kamsavati, Sutanu, Rashtrapali, Kanki, and Ugrasena's daughter,

original: bhajamānāc ca vidūrathaḥ putro 'bhavat /
analyzed: bhajamānāt ca vidūrathaḥ putraḥ bhavat
translated: and from Bhama, Viduratha was born as a son.

original: vidūrathāc chūraḥ śūrāc chamī śaminaḥ pratikṣatraḥ /
analyzed: vidūrathāt śūraḥ śūrāt śamī śaminaḥ pratikṣatraḥ
translated: From Viduratha, Sura; from Sura, Shami; from Shamin, Pratikshatra.

original: tasmāt svayaṃbhojas tataś ca hṛdikaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt svayaṃbhojaḥ tatas ca hṛdikaḥ
translated: From him, Svamboja; from him, Hridika.

original: tasyāpi kṛtavarmaśatadhanurdevamīḍhuṣākhyāḥ putrā babhūvuḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasya api kṛtavarma śatadhanuḥ devamīḍhuṣa ākhyāḥ putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: He had sons named Kritavarman, Shatadhanu, and Devamidusha.

original: devamīḍhuṣasya śūrasya māriṣā nāma patny abhavat // / / //
analyzed: devamīḍhuṣasya śūrasya māriṣā nāma patnī abhavat
translated: Devamidusha had a wife named Marisha.

original: tasyāṃ cāsau daśa putrān ajanayad vasudevapūrvān /
analyzed: tasyām ca asau daśa putrān ajanayat vasudeva pūrvān
translated: She gave birth to ten sons, with Vasudeva as the eldest.

original: vasudevasya jātamātrasyaiva tadgṛhe bhagavadaṃśāvatāram avyāhatadṛṣṭyā paśyadbhir devair divyānakadundubhayaś ca vāditāḥ /
analyzed: vasudevasya jāta mātrasya eva tad gṛhe bhagavat aṃśa avatāram avyāhata dṛṣṭyā paśyadbhiḥ devaiḥ divya ānakadundubhayaḥ ca vāditāḥ
translated: As soon as Vasudeva was born, the gods saw with unobstructed vision the Lord's incarnation in his house and sounded divine anka-drums.

original: tatas tadaivānakadundubhisaṃjñām avāpa /
analyzed: tatas tadā evā ānakadundubhi saṃjñām avāpa
translated: Therefore, he received the name Ankadundubhi.

original: tasyāpi devabhāgadevaśravānādhṛṣṭikarundhakavatsabālakasṛñjayaśyāmaśamīkagaṇḍūṣasaṃjñā nava bhrātaro babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: tasya api devabhāga deva śravān ādhṛṣṭika rundhaka vatsa bālaka sṛñjaya śyāma śamīka gaṇḍūṣa saṃjñāḥ nava bhrātaraḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: He also had nine brothers named Devabhaga, Devashrava, Anadhrishti, Karundhaka, Vatsabala, Srinjaya, Shami, Gandusha, and Shami.

original: pṛthā śrutadevā śrutakīrtiḥ śrutaśravā rājādhidevī ca vasudevādīnāṃ pañca bhaginyo 'bhavan // / / //
analyzed: pṛthā śrutadevā śrutakīrtiḥ śrutaśravāḥ rājādhidevī ca vasudeva ādīnām pañca bhaginyaḥ bhavan
translated: Pritha, Shrutadeva, Shrutakirti, Shruta-shrava, and Rajadhidevi were the five sisters of Vasudeva and others.

original: śūrasya kuntir nāma sakhābhavat /
analyzed: śūrasya kuntiḥ nāma sakhā bhavat
translated: Shura had a friend named Kuntibhoja.

original: tasmai cāputrāya pṛthām ātmajāṃ vidhinā śūro dattavān /
analyzed: tasmai ca aputrāya pṛthām ātmajām vidhinā śūraḥ dattavān
translated: To him, who had no son, Shura gave his daughter Pritha in accordance with the rules.

original: tāṃ ca pāṇḍur uvāha /
analyzed: tām ca pāṇḍuḥ uvāha
translated: And Pandu married her.

original: tasyāṃ ca dharmānilaśakrair yudhiṣṭhirabhīmārjunākhyās trayaḥ putrāḥ samutpāditāḥ /
analyzed: tasyām ca dharma anila śakraiḥ yudhiṣṭhira bhīma arjuna ākhyāḥ trayaḥ putrāḥ samutpāditāḥ
translated: And by Dharma, Anila, and Shakra, three sons named Yudhishthira, Bhima, and Arjuna were begotten on her.

original: pūrvam anūḍhāyāś ca bhagavatā bhāsvatā kānīnaḥ karṇo nāma putro 'janyata // / / //
analyzed: pūrvam anūḍhāyāḥ ca bhagavatā bhāsvatā kānīnaḥ karṇaḥ nāma putraḥ janyata
translated: And before she was married, a son named Karna was born to her by the illustrious Sun-god.

original: tasyāś ca sapatnī mādrī nāmābhavat /
analyzed: tasyāḥ ca sapatnī mādrī nāma abhavat
translated: And she had a co-wife named Madri.

original: nāsatyadasrābhyāṃ tasyām api nakulasahadevau pāṇḍoḥ putrau janitau /
analyzed: nāsatya dasrābhyām tasyām api nakula sahadevau pāṇḍoḥ putrau janitau
translated: And by the twin Ashvins, two sons named Nakula and Sahadeva were begotten on her by Pandu.

original: śrutadevāṃ tu vṛddhaśarmā nāma kārūśa upayeme /
analyzed: śrutadevām tu vṛddhaśarmā nāma kārūśaḥ upayeme
translated: But Shrutadeva was married by Vridha-sharmā of the Karūshas.

original: tasyāṃ dantavakro nāma mahāsuro jajñe /
analyzed: tasyām dantavakraḥ nāma mahā asuraḥ jajñe
translated: And on her was born a great Asura named Dantavakra.

original: śrutakīrtim api kaikeyarāja upayeme /
analyzed: śrutakīrtim api kaikeya rājaḥ upayeme
translated: And Shrutakirti was married by the king of Kaikeya.

original: tasyāṃ saṃtardanādayaḥ kaikeyāḥ pañca putrā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: tasyām saṃtardana ādayaḥ kaikeyāḥ pañca putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: And on her were born five sons of Pandu, named Santardana and others.

original: rājādhidevyām āvantyau vindānuvindau jajñāte /
analyzed: rājādhidevyām āvantyau vinda anuvindau jajñāte
translated: And on Rajadhidevi were born two sons of Pandu, named Vinda and Anuvinda of Avanti.

original: śrutaśravasam api cedirājo damaghoṣanāmopayeme /
analyzed: śrutaśravasam api cedi rājaḥ damaghoṣa nāmā upayeme
translated: The king of Chedi, named Damaghosha, married Shruta-shrava.

original: tasyāṃ śiśupālam utpādayām āsa /
analyzed: tasyām śiśupālam utpādayām āsa
translated: In her he begot Shishupala.

original: sa hi pūrvam apy anācāravikramasaṃpanno daityānām ādipuruṣo hiraṇyakaśipur abhūt // / / //
analyzed: sa hi pūrvam api anācāra vikrama saṃpannaḥ daityānām ādi puruṣaḥ hiraṇyakaśipuḥ abhūt
translated: He was formerly the first of the Daityas, named Hiranyakashipu, endowed with the prowess of bad conduct.

original: yaś ca bhagavatā sakalalokaguruṇā ghātitaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca bhagavatā sakala loka guruṇā ghātitaḥ
translated: And he was slain by the Lord, the preceptor of all the worlds.

original: punar apy akṣatavīryaśauryasaṃpatparākramaguṇaḥ samākrāntasakalatrailokyeśvarapratāpo daśānano 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: punar api akṣata vīrya śaurya saṃpad parākrama guṇaḥ samākrānta sakala trailokya īśvara pratāpaḥ daśānanaḥ bhavat
translated: Again, he became the ten-headed Ravana, with unimpaired valour, heroism, prowess and virtues, and with the splendour of the lord of the entire three worlds, who was conquered.

original: bahukālopabhuktabhagavatsakāśād avāptaśarīrapātodbhavapuṇyaphalo 'tha bhagavatāeva rāghavarūpiṇā so 'pi nidhanam upapāditaḥ /
analyzed: bahu kāla upabhukta bhagavat sakāśāt avāpta śarīrapāta udbhava puṇya phalaḥ bhagavatā eva rāghava rūpiṇā saḥ pi nidhanam upapāditaḥ
translated: Then, having enjoyed for a long time the fruits of the merit arising from the fall of his body obtained from the Lord himself, he was brought to death by the Lord himself in the form of Rama.

original: cedirājadamaghoṣātmajaś cedipatiḥ śiśupālanāmābhavat // / / //
analyzed: cedi rāja damaghoṣa ātmajaḥ cedi patiḥ śiśupāla nāmā bhavat
translated: The son of Damaghosha, the king of Chedi, became the lord of Chedi, named Shishupala.

original: śiśupālatve 'pi bhagavato bhūbhārāvatāraṇāyāvatīrṇāṃśasya puṇḍarīkanayanākhyasyopari dveṣānubandham atitarāñ cakāra /
analyzed: śiśupāla tve pi bhagavataḥ bhū bhāra avatāraṇāya avatīrṇa aṃśasya puṇḍarīkanayana ākhyasya upari dveṣa anubandham atitarām cakāra
translated: Even in the state of Shishupala, he felt extreme hatred towards the lotus-eyed Lord, who had descended as an incarnation to relieve the earth of its burden.

original: bhagavatā ca nidhanam upanītas tatraiva paramātmabhūte manasas tadekāgratayā tatraiva sāyujyam avāpa // / / //
analyzed: bhagavatā ca nidhanam upanītaḥ tatra eva paramātma bhūte manasaḥ tad ekāgra tayā tatra eva sāyujyam avāpa
translated: And when he was slain by the Lord, he obtained union with him, by fixing his mind on him alone, and becoming absorbed in the Supreme Spirit.

original: bhagavān hi prasanno yathābhilaṣitaṃ dadāty aprasanno 'pi nighnan divyam anupamaṃ sthānaṃ prayacchatīti // / / //
analyzed: bhagavān hi prasannaḥ yathā abhilaṣitam dadāti a prasannaḥ pi nighnan divyam anupamam sthānam prayacchati iti
translated: For the Lord, when pleased, grants all that is desired; and when displeased, he bestows even death, and a heavenly and incomparable abode.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe caturdaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe caturdaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourteenth chapter of the fourth book of the Vishnu Purana.

original: maitreya uvāca /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca
translated: Maitreya said:

original: hiraṇyakaśiputve ca rāvaṇatve ca viṣṇunā /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipu tve ca rāvaṇa tve ca viṣṇunā
translated: In his birth as Hiranyakashipu and as Ravana, Vishnu

original: avāpa nihato bhogān aprāpyān amarair api // / / //🔽na layaṃ tatra tenaiva nihataḥ sa kathaṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: avāpa nihataḥ bhogān a prāpyān amaraiḥ api  na layam tatra tena eva nihataḥ sa katham punar
translated: granted him enjoyments unattainable even by the immortals.

original: saṃprāptaḥ śiśupālatve sāyujyaṃ śāśvate harau // / / //
analyzed: saṃprāptaḥ śiśupāla tve sāyujyam śāśvate harau
translated: How then was he slain by Vishnu again in his birth as Shishupala, and attained union with the eternal Hari?

original: etad icchāmy ahaṃ śrotuṃ sarvadharmabhṛtāṃ vara /
analyzed: etat icchāmi aham śrotum sarva dharma bhṛtām vara
translated: I desire to hear this, O best of all virtuous men.

original: kautūhalapareṇaitat pṛṣṭo me vaktum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: kautūhala pareṇa etat pṛṣṭaḥ me vaktum arhasi
translated: Being filled with curiosity, you should tell me this when asked.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: daityeśvarasya tu vadhāyākhilalokotpattisthitivināśakāriṇāpūrvaṃ tanugrahaṇaṃ kurvatā nṛsiṃharūpam āviṣkṛtam /
analyzed: daitya īśvarasya tu vadhāya akhila loka utpatti sthiti vināśa kāriṇā apūrvam tanu grahaṇam kurvatā nṛsiṃha rūpam āviṣkṛtam
translated: But for the destruction of the lord of demons, taking up a new body, which brings about the origin, sustenance, and destruction of all worlds, the form of Nṛsiṃha was manifested.

original: tatra tu hiraṇyakaśipor viṣṇur ayam ity etan na manasy abhūt // / / //🔽niratiśayapuṇyajātasamudbhūtam etat sattvam iti rajodrekapreritaikāgramatis tadbhāvanāyogāt🔽tato 'vāptavadhahaitukīṃ niratiśayām evākhilatrailokyādhikyadhāriṇīṃ daśānanatve
analyzed: tatra tu hiraṇyakaśipoḥ viṣṇuḥ ayam iti etat na manasi abhūt  niratiśaya puṇya jāta samudbhūtam etat sattvam iti raja udreka prerita ekāgra matiḥ tad bhāvanā yogāt  tatas vāpta vadha haitukīm niratiśayām evā akhila trailokya ādhikya dhāriṇīm daśānana tve
translated: In that (incident), it did not occur to Hiraṇyakaśipu that this (Nṛsiṃha) was Viṣṇu.🔽With a mind solely impelled by the predominance of passion, thinking that this being arose from an extraordinary collection of merit,

original: bhogasaṃpadam avāpa // / / //
analyzed: bhoga saṃpadam avāpa
translated: then, in the state of Rāvaṇa, he obtained the highest position in all the three worlds, which was the cause of his own destruction, and was endowed with incomparable wealth of enjoyment.

original: nātas tasminn anādinidhane parabrahmabhūte bhagavaty anālambanīkṛte manasas tallayam /
analyzed: na atas tasmin anādinidhane para brahma bhūte bhagavati an ālambanīkṛte manasaḥ tad layam
translated: Therefore, when that unborn, imperishable, supreme Brahman, the Lord, was not taken as the support (of his mind), the mind did not merge into Him.

original: daśānanatve 'py anaṅgaparādhīnatayā jānakīsaktacetaso dāśarathirūpadhāriṇas tadrūpadarśanam
analyzed: daśānana tve pi anaṅga para adhīna tayā jānakī sakta cetasaḥ dāśarathi rūpa dhāriṇaḥ tad rūpa darśanam
translated: Even in the state of Rāvaṇa, with his mind attached to Jānakī due to being under the control of Kāma, when he assumed the form of Rāma, the mere sight of His form

original: evāsin nāyam acyuta ity āsaktir vipadyato 'ntaḥkaraṇasya mānuṣabuddhir eva kevalam
analyzed: eva asin na ayam acyutaḥ iti āsaktiḥ vipadyataḥ ntaḥkaraṇasya mānuṣa buddhiḥ eva kevalam
translated: was not enough to make his mind, which was about to perish, think, This is not Acyuta (Viṣṇu). It was only the human intellect

original: asyābhūt // / / //
analyzed: asya abhūt
translated: that arose in him.

original: punar apy acyutavinipātamātraphalam akhilabhūmaṇḍalaślāghyacedirājakule janmāvyāhataṃ aiśvaryaṃ śiśupālatve cāvāpa // / / //
analyzed: punar api acyuta vinipāta mātra phalam akhila bhū maṇḍala ślāghya cedi rāja kule janma avyāhatam aiśvaryam śiśupāla tve ca avāpa
translated: Again, he obtained birth in the Chedi king's family, which was praised by the entire earth, with prosperity unimpeded, in the state of Shishupala, with the sole fruit of the fall of Achyuta.

original: tatra tv akhilāny eva bhagavannāmakāraṇāny abhavan /
analyzed: tatra tu akhilāni eva bhagavat nāma kāraṇāni abhavan
translated: There, all the names of the Lord became the causes.
