original: tataś ca tatkāraṇakṛtānāṃ teṣām aśeṣāṇām evācyutanāmnām anavaratam anekajanmasaṃvardhitavidveṣānubandhicitto vinindanasaṃtarjanādiṣūccāraṇam 🔽akarot // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca tad kāraṇa kṛtānām teṣām aśeṣāṇām eva acyuta nāmnām anavaratam aneka janma saṃvardhita vidveṣa anubandhi cittaḥ vinindana saṃtarjana ādiṣu uccāraṇam  akarot
translated: And then, he uttered the names of Achyuta, which were the causes of those, all of them, without interruption, with a mind bound by hatred nurtured in many births, in the acts of reviling, threatening, and so on.

original: tac ca rūpam utphullapadmadalāmalākṣam atyujjvalapītavastradhāry amalakirīṭakeyūrakaṭakopaśobhitam🔽udārapīvaracaturbāhuśaṅkhacakragadādharam atiprauḍhavairānubhāvād aṭanabhojanasnānāsanaśayanādiṣv
analyzed: tat ca rūpam utphulla padma dala amala akṣam ati ujjvala pīta vastra dhāri amala kirīṭa keyūra kaṭaka upaśobhitam  udāra pīvara catur bāhu śaṅkha cakra gadā dharam ati prauḍha vaira anubhāvāt aṭana bhojana snāna āsana śayana ādiṣu
translated: And that form, with eyes pure like the petals of a blooming lotus, wearing a very bright yellow garment, adorned with a pure crown, bracelets, and armlets,

original: aśeṣāvasthāntareṣu naivāpayayāv asyātmacetasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: aśeṣa avasthā antareṣu na eva apayayau asya ātma cetasaḥ
translated: holding a conch, discus, and mace in its four generous and stout arms, due to the intensity of its long-standing enmity, did not leave his mind in any state, whether walking, eating, bathing, sitting, lying down, or so on.

original: tam evākrośeṣūccārayaṃs tam eva hṛdayena dhārayann ātmavadhāya bhagavadastacakrāṃśumālojjvalam
analyzed: tam eva ākrośeṣu uccārayan tam eva hṛdayena dhārayan ātma vadhāya bhagavat asta cakra aṃśu mālā ujjvalam
translated: Uttering that very name in curses, holding that very one in his heart, for his own destruction, with the garland of rays of the Lord's weapon discus blazing,

original: akṣayatejaḥsvarūpaṃ paraṃ brahmasvarūpam apagatarāgadveṣādidoṣaṃ bhagavantam adrākṣīt // / / //
analyzed: akṣaya tejaḥ svarūpam param brahma svarūpam apagata rāga dveṣa ādi doṣam bhagavantam adrākṣīt
translated: He saw the Blessed One, whose essence is imperishable splendor, whose essence is the supreme Brahman, free from the faults of passion, hatred, and so on.

original: tāvac ca bhagavaccakreṇāśu vyāpāditas tena tatsmaraṇadagdhākhilāghasaṃcayo bhagavataivāntam upanītas tasminn eva layam upayayau /
analyzed: tāvat ca bhagavat cakreṇa āśu vyāpāditaḥ tena tad smaraṇa dagdha akhila agha saṃcayaḥ bhagavatā eva antam upanītaḥ tasmin eva layam upayayau
translated: And just then, quickly killed by the Blessed One's discus, his entire mass of sins burned up by the recollection of that [discus], brought to an end by the Blessed One himself, he attained absorption in that very [discus].

original: etat tavākhilaṃ mayābhihitam /
analyzed: etat tava akhilam mayā abhihitam
translated: And this entire [story] has been told to you by me.

original: ayaṃ hi bhagavān kīrtitaḥ saṃsmṛtaś ca dveṣānubandhenāpy akhilasurāsurādidurlabhaṃ phalaṃ prayacchati kim uta samyag bhaktimatām /
analyzed: ayam hi bhagavān kīrtitaḥ saṃsmṛtaḥ ca dveṣa anubandhena api akhila sura asura ādi durlabham phalam prayacchati kim uta samyak bhaktimatām
translated: For this Blessed One, even when merely praised or remembered with an attachment to hatred, grants a fruit difficult to obtain for all gods, demons, and so on, much more so for those with perfect devotion.

original: vasudevasyānakadundubheḥ pauravīrohiṇīmadirābhadrādevakīpramukhā bahvyaḥ patnyo 'bhavan // / / //
analyzed: vasudevasya ānakadundubheḥ pauravī rohiṇī madirā bhadrā devakī pramukhāḥ bahvyaḥ patnyaḥ bhavan
translated: Vasudeva, the son of Andhakadundubhi, had many wives, chief among them Pauravī, Rohiṇī, Madirā, Bhadrā, and Devakī.

original: balabhadrasāraṇaśaṭhadurmadādīn putrān rohiṇyām ānakadundubhir utpādayām āsa /
analyzed: balabhadra sāraṇa śaṭha durmada ādīn putrān rohiṇyām ānakadundubhiḥ utpādayām āsa
translated: Andhakadundubhi begot sons in Rohiṇī, such as Balabhadra, Sāraṇa, Śaṭha, Durmada, and others.

original: balabhadro 'pi revatyāṃ niśaṭholmukau putrāv ajanayat /
analyzed: balabhadraḥ pi revatyām niśaṭha ulmukau putrau ajanayat
translated: Balabhadra also begot two sons, Niśṭha and Ulmuka, in Revatī.

original: mārṣṭimārṣimacchiśiśiśusatyadhṛtipramukhāḥ sāraṇasyātmajāḥ /
analyzed: mārṣṭi mārṣi macchi śi śiśu satyadhṛti pramukhāḥ sāraṇasya ātmajāḥ
translated: The sons of Sāraṇa were Mārṣṭi, Māṛṣi, Acchisha, Shisha, Shishu, Satyadhriti, and others.

original: bhadrāśvabhadrabāhudurdamabhūtādyā rohiṇyāḥ kulajāḥ // / / //🔽nandopanandakṛtakādyā madirāyās tanayāḥ /
analyzed: bhadrāśva bhadrabāhu durdama bhūta ādyāḥ rohiṇyāḥ kula jāḥ  nanda upananda kṛtaka ādyāḥ madirāyāḥ tanayāḥ
translated: Bhadra, Ashva, Bhadra-Bahu, Durdama, Bhuta, and others were born in the race of Rohini.🔽Nanda, Upananda, Krita, and others were the sons of Madira.

original: bhadrāyāś copanidhigadādyāḥ /
analyzed: bhadrāyāḥ ca upanidhi gada ādyāḥ
translated: And of Bhadra, Upanidhi, Gada, and others were born.

original: vaiśālyāṃ ca kauśikam ekam ajanayat /
analyzed: vaiśālyām ca kauśikam ekam ajanayat
translated: And in Vaishali, she gave birth to one Koushika.

original: ānakadundubhir devakyām api kīrtimatsuṣeṇodāyibhadrasenarjudāsabhadradevākhyāḥ ṣaṭ putrā jajñire // / / //
analyzed: ānakadundubhiḥ devakyām api ṣaṭ putrāḥ jajñire
translated: And in Devaki, Ananta, Kounteya, Vasudeva, gave birth to six sons named Kirti, Sushena, Udayi, Bhadrasena, Rudada, and Bhadradeva.

original: tāṃś ca sarvān eva kaṃso ghātitavān /
analyzed: tān ca sarvān eva kaṃsaḥ ghātitavān
translated: And all of them were killed by Kamsa.

original: anantaraṃ ca saptamaṃ garbham ardharātre bhagavatprahitā yoganidrā rohiṇyā jaṭharam avakṛṣya nītavatī // / / //
analyzed: anantaram ca saptamam garbham ardharātre bhagavat prahitā yoganidrā rohiṇyāḥ jaṭharam avakṛṣya nītavatī
translated: And after that, at midnight, the seventh conception, sent by the Lord, was taken out of Rohini's womb by Yoga-nidra and carried away.

original: karṣaṇāc cāsāv api saṃkarṣaṇākhyām avāpa // / / //
analyzed: karṣaṇāt ca asau api saṃkarṣaṇa ākhyām avāpa
translated: And from Karshana, he obtained the name of Sankarshana.

original: tataś ca sakalajaganmahātarumūlabhūto bhūtātītabhaviṣyādisakalasurāsuramunimanujamanasām
analyzed: tatas ca sakala jagat mahā taru mūla bhūtaḥ bhūta atīta bhaviṣya ādi sakala sura asura muni manuja manasām
translated: And then, being the root of the great tree of the entire world, beyond the past, future, and present, and beyond the minds of all gods, demons, sages, and men,

original: apy agocaro 'bjabhavapramukhair analapramukhaiś ca praṇamyāvanibhāraharaṇāya prasādito
analyzed: api agocaraḥ bjabhava pramukhaiḥ anala pramukhaiḥ ca praṇamya avani bhāra haraṇāya prasāditaḥ
translated: he was propitiated by Brahma and others, headed by Anala, to remove the burden of the earth.

original: bhagavān anādimadhyo devakīgarbhe samavatatāra vāsudevaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhagavān an ādi madhyaḥ devakī garbhe samavatatāra vāsudevaḥ
translated: The Lord, who is without beginning, middle, or end, descended into the womb of Devaki as Vasudeva.

original: tatprasādavivardhitamānābhimānā ca yoganidrā nandagopapatnyā yaśodāyā garbham adhiṣṭhitavatī // / / //
analyzed: tad prasāda vivardhita māna abhimānā ca yoganidrā nanda gopa patnyāḥ yaśodāyāḥ garbham adhiṣṭhitavatī
translated: And Yoga-nidra, whose pride and self-esteem were increased by his grace, occupied the womb of Yashoda, the wife of Nanda the cowherd.

original: suprasannādityacandrādigraham avyālādibhayaṃ svasthamānasam akhilam evaitaj jagad apāstādharmam abhavat tasmiṃś ca puṇḍarīkanayane jāyamāne
analyzed: su prasanna āditya candra ādi graham avyāla ādi bhayam svastha mānasam akhilam eva etat jagat apāsta adharmam abhavat tasmin ca puṇḍarīkanayane jāyamāne
translated: And when that lotus-eyed one was born, the whole world, with the sun, moon, and planets in perfect harmony, and free from the fear of calamities and other dangers, became tranquil in mind and abandoned unrighteousness.

original: jātena ca tenākhilam evaitat sanmārgavarti jagad akriyata /
analyzed: jātena ca tena akhilam eva etat sat mārga varti jagat akriyata
translated: And by his birth, the whole world was made to follow the right path.

original: bhagavato 'py atra martyaloke 'vatīrṇasya ṣoḍaśasahasrāṇy ekottaraśatādhikāni bhāryāṇām abhavan /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ pi atra martya loke vatīrṇasya ṣoḍaśa sahasrāṇi eka uttara śata adhikāni bhāryāṇām abhavan
translated: And the Lord, who had descended into this mortal world, had sixteen thousand and one hundred wives.

original: tāsāṃ ca rukmiṇīsatyabhāmājāmbavatīcāruhāsinīpramukhā hy aṣṭau patnyaḥ pradhānā /
analyzed: tāsām ca rukmiṇī satyabhāmā jāmbavatī cāruhāsinī pramukhāḥ hi aṣṭau patnyaḥ pradhānā
translated: And of these, Rukmini, Satyabhama, Jambavati, Charuhasini, and others were the eight principal wives.

original: tāsu cāṣṭāyutāni lakṣaṃ ca putrāṇāṃ bhagavān akhilamūrtir anādimān ajanayat // / / //
analyzed: tāsu ca aṣṭa ayutāni lakṣam ca putrāṇām bhagavān akhila mūrtiḥ anādimān ajanayat
translated: And the Lord, who is without beginning, begot of them eighty thousand and one hundred thousand sons.

original: teṣāṃ ca pradyumnacārudeṣṇasāmbādayas trayodaśa pradhānāḥ /
analyzed: teṣām ca pradyumna cārudeṣṇa sāmba ādayaḥ trayodaśa pradhānāḥ
translated: And of them, Pradyumna, Charudeshna, Samba, and others were the thirteen principal ones.

original: pradyumno 'pi rukmiṇas tanayāṃ kakudvatīṃ nāmopayeme /
analyzed: pradyumnaḥ pi rukmiṇaḥ tanayām kakudvatīm nāma upayeme
translated: Pradyumna also married Rukmini's daughter named Kakudvati.

original: tasyām asyāniruddho jajñe /
analyzed: tasyām asya aniruddhaḥ jajñe
translated: Aniruddha was born to him through her.

original: aniruddho 'pi rukmiṇa eva pautrīṃ subhadrāṃ nāmopayeme /
analyzed: aniruddhaḥ pi rukmiṇaḥ eva pautrīm subhadrām nāma upayeme
translated: Aniruddha also married Rukmini's granddaughter named Subhadra.

original: tasyām asya vajro 'bhavat /
analyzed: tasyām asya vajraḥ bhavat
translated: Vajra was born to him through her.

original: vajrasya pratibāhus tasyāpi sucāruḥ /
analyzed: vajrasya pratibāhuḥ tasya api sucāruḥ
translated: Prativahu was born to Vajra, and to him was born Sucharu.

original: evam anekaśatasāhasrapuruṣasaṃkhyasya yadukulasya puruṣasaṃkhyā varṣaśatair api jñātuṃ na śakyate // / / //
analyzed: evam aneka śata sāhasra puruṣa saṃkhyasya yadu kulasya puruṣa saṃkhyā varṣa śataiḥ api jñātum na śakyate
translated: Thus, the number of men in the Yadu clan cannot be known even in hundreds of years, though it is counted in many hundreds of thousands.

original: yato hi ślokāv atra caritārthau // / / //
analyzed: yatas hi ślokau atra caritārthau
translated: For the two verses here have served their purpose.

original: tisraḥ koṭyaḥ sahasrāṇām aṣṭāśītiśatāni ca /
analyzed: tisraḥ koṭyaḥ sahasrāṇām aṣṭāśīti śatāni ca
translated: Three and a half crores, eight hundred and eighty thousand,

original: kumārāṇāṃ gṛhācāryāś cāpayogyāsu ye ratāḥ // / / //
analyzed: kumārāṇām gṛha ācāryāḥ cāpa yogyāsu ye ratāḥ
translated: The young house-teachers who are engaged in the unsuitable.

original: saṃkhyānaṃ yādavānāṃ kaḥ kariṣyati mahātmanām /
analyzed: saṃkhyānam yādavānām kaḥ kariṣyati mahātmanām
translated: Who will count the great-souled Yadavas,

original: yatrāyutānām ayutaṃ lakṣeṇāste sadāhukaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yatra ayutānām ayutam lakṣeṇa āste sadā āhukaḥ
translated: Where a hundred thousand is always present with Ahuka.

original: devāsurahatā ye tu daiteyāḥ sumahābalāḥ /
analyzed: deva asura hatāḥ ye tu daiteyāḥ su mahā balāḥ
translated: Those Daityas who were killed by the gods and demons, who were very powerful,

original: te cotpannā manuṣyeṣu janopadravakāriṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: te ca utpannāḥ manuṣyeṣu jana upadrava kāriṇaḥ
translated: They were born among humans, causing harm to the people.

original: teṣām utsādanārthāya bhuvi devā yadoḥ kule /
analyzed: teṣām utsādana arthāya bhuvi devāḥ yadoḥ kule
translated: For their destruction, the gods were born in Yadu's clan on earth,

original: avatīrṇāḥ kulaśataṃ yatraikābhyadhikaṃ dvija // / / //
analyzed: avatīrṇāḥ kula śatam yatra eka abhyadhikam dvija
translated: Where a hundred families descended, one more than that, O Brahmin.

original: viṣṇus teṣāṃ pramāṇe ca prabhutve ca vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ teṣām pramāṇe ca prabhu tve ca vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Vishnu was established as their authority and ruler.

original: nideśasthāyinas tasya babhūvuḥ sarvayādavāḥ // / / //
analyzed: nideśa sthāyinaḥ tasya babhūvuḥ sarva yādavāḥ
translated: All the Yadavas became obedient to his command.

original: prasūtiṃ vṛṣṇivīrāṇāṃ yaḥ śṛṇoti naraḥ sadā /
analyzed: prasūtim vṛṣṇi vīrāṇām yaḥ śṛṇoti naraḥ sadā
translated: The man who always listens to the birth of the heroes of the Vrishni lineage,

original: sa sarvaiḥ pātakair mukto viṣṇulokaṃ prapadyate // / / //
analyzed: sa sarvaiḥ pātakaiḥ muktaḥ viṣṇu lokam prapadyate
translated: He, being freed from all sins, attains the world of Vishnu.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe pañcadaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe pañcadaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fifteenth chapter in the fourth section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity eṣa samāsatas te kathito yador vaṃśaḥ /
analyzed: iti eṣa samāsatas te kathitaḥ yadoḥ vaṃśaḥ
translated: Thus, this lineage of Yadu has been told to you in brief.

original: turvasor vaṃśam avadhāraya // / / //
analyzed: turvasoḥ vaṃśam avadhāraya
translated: Now understand the lineage of Turvasu.

original: turvasor vahnir ātmajo vahner gobhānus tataś ca traiśānus tasmāc ca karaṃdhamaḥ /
analyzed: turvasoḥ vahniḥ ātmajaḥ vahneḥ gobhānuḥ tatas ca traiśānuḥ tasmāt ca karaṃdhamaḥ
translated: Turvasu's son was Vahni, from Vahni came Gobhanu, from him Trisaunu, from him Karandhama.

original: tasyāpi maruttaḥ /
analyzed: tasya api maruttaḥ
translated: His son was Marutta.

original: so 'napatyo 'bhavat /🔽tataś ca pauravaṃ duṣyantaṃ putram akalpayat /
analyzed: saḥ napatyaḥ bhavat  tatas ca pauravam duṣyantam putram akalpayat
translated: He had no son.🔽Therefore, he adopted Dushyanta of the Puru lineage as his son.

original: evaṃ yayātiśāpāt tadvaṃśaḥ pauravam vaṃśaṃ samāśritavān // / / //
analyzed: evam yayāti śāpāt tad vaṃśaḥ pauravam vaṃśam samāśritavān
translated: Thus, due to Yayati's curse, his lineage resorted to the Puru lineage.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe ṣoḍaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe ṣoḍaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixteenth chapter in the fourth section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: druhyos tu tanayo babhruḥ // / / //
analyzed: druhyoḥ tu tanayaḥ babhruḥ
translated: The son of Babhru was Aṣṭaka.🔽The son of Aṣṭaka was Bṛhatkṣatra.🔽The son of Bṛhatkṣatra was Śravasta.

original: tataḥ setuḥ /🔽setuputra āradvānnāmā /🔽tadātmajo gāndhāraḥ /
analyzed: tatas setuḥ  setu putraḥ āradvān nāmā  tad ātmajaḥ gāndhāraḥ
translated: The son of Śravasta was Śatajit.🔽The son of Śatajit was Śatadhanvan.🔽The son of Śatadhanvan was Puruhotra.

original: tato dharmo dharmād dhṛto dhṛtād durdamaḥ /🔽tataḥ pracetāḥ /🔽pracetasaḥ putraśatam adharmabahulānāṃ mlecchānām udīcyānām ādhipatyam akarot // / / //
analyzed: tatas dharmaḥ dharmāt dhṛtaḥ dhṛtāt durdamaḥ  tatas pracetāḥ  pracetasaḥ putra śatam adharma bahulānām mlecchānām udīcyānām ādhipatyam akarot
translated: The son of Puruhotra was Dhṛṣṭaketu.🔽The son of Dhṛṣṭaketu was Śrāvasta.🔽The son of Śrāvasta was Śrāvastyāyana.🔽The son of Śrāvastyāyana was Śrāvastyāyanīya.🔽The son of Śrāvastyāyanīya was Śrāvastyāyanīyānīya.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe saptadaśo 'dhyāyaḥ 🔽parāśara uvāca /🔽yayāteś caturthasyaputrasyānoḥ sabhānaracakṣuparamekṣusaṃjñās trayaḥ putrā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe saptadaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ  parāśaraḥ uvāca  yayāteḥ sabhā nara cakṣu paramekṣu saṃjñāḥ trayaḥ putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: The son of Śrāvastyāyanīyānīya was Śrāvastyāyanīyānīyānīya.🔽The son of Śrāvastyāyanīyānīyānīya was Śrāvastyāyanīyānīyānīyānīya.🔽The son of Śrāvastyāyanīyānīyānīyānīya was Śrāvastyāyanīyānīyānīyānīyānīya.

original: sabhānaraputraḥ kālānaraḥ kālānarāt sṛñjayaḥ sṛñjayāt puraṃjayaḥ /🔽tasmāj janamejayas tato mahāśālas tasmāc ca mahāmanāḥ /🔽tasmād apy uśīnaratitikṣū dvau putrāv utpannau /🔽uśīnarasyāpi śibinṛganarakṛmidarvākhyāḥ pañca putrā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: sabhānara putraḥ kālānaraḥ kālānarāt sṛñjayaḥ sṛñjayāt puraṃjayaḥ  tasmāt janamejayaḥ tatas mahāśālaḥ tasmāt ca mahāmanāḥ  tasmāt api uśīnara titikṣū dvau putrau utpannau  uśīnarasya api śibi nṛga nara kṛmi darva ākhyāḥ pañca putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: The son of Śrāvastyāyanīyānīyānīyānīyānīya was Śrāvastyāyanīyānīyānīyānīyānīyānīya.🔽The son of Śrāvastyāyanīyānīyānīyānīyānīyānīya was Śrāvastyāyanīyānīyānīyānīyānīyānīyānīya.🔽The son of Śrāvastyāyanīyānīyānīyānīyānīyānīyānīya was Śrāvastyāyanīyānīyānīyānīyānīyānīyānīyānīya.

original: vṛṣadarbhasuvīrakaikeyamadrakāś catvāraḥ śibiputrāḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣadarbha suvīra kaikeya madrakāḥ catvāraḥ śibi putrāḥ
translated: The son of Śrāvastyāyanīyānīyānīyānīyānīyānīyānīyānīyānīya was Śrāvastyāyanīyānīyānīy

original: titikṣor api ruśadrathaḥ putro 'bhūt /
analyzed: titikṣoḥ api ruśadrathaḥ putraḥ bhūt
translated: And Titikṣu's son was Ruśadratha.

original: tato 'pi hemo hemāt sutapās tasmād baliḥ /
analyzed: tatas pi hemaḥ hemāt sutapāḥ tasmāt baliḥ
translated: From him, Hema; from Hema, Sutas; from him, Bali.

original: yasya kṣetre dīrghatamasā aṅgavaṅgakaliṅgasuhyapauṇḍrākhyaṃ bāleyaṃ kṣatram ajanyata // / / //
analyzed: yasya kṣetre dīrghatamasā aṅga vaṅga kaliṅga suhya pauṇḍra ākhyam bāleyam kṣatram ajanyata
translated: In whose field, by Dīrghatamas, the Kṣatriya race called Bāleya was born, named Aṅga, Vaṅga, Kaliṅga, Suhma, and Pauṇḍra.

original: tannāmasaṃtatisaṃjñāś ca pañca viṣayāḥ babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: tad nāma saṃtati saṃjñāḥ ca pañca viṣayāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: And the five regions were named after their names.

original: aṅgasya tv anapānas tasyātmajo divirathas tasmād dharmarathaḥ /
analyzed: aṅgasya tu anapānaḥ tasya ātmajaḥ divirathaḥ tasmāt dharmarathaḥ
translated: But Anupama was the son of Aṅga, his son was Diviratha, from him Dharma-ratha.

original: tataś citraratho romapādasaṃjñaḥ /
analyzed: tatas citrarathaḥ romapāda saṃjñaḥ
translated: From him Citra-ratha, named Roma-pāda.

original: yasya putro daśaratho jajñe /
analyzed: yasya putraḥ daśarathaḥ jajñe
translated: From whom was born Daśaratha.

original: yasmai ajaputro daśarathaḥ śāntāṃ nāma kanyām anapatyāya duhitṛtve yuyoja // / / //
analyzed: yasmai aja putraḥ daśarathaḥ śāntām nāma kanyām anapatyāya duhitṛ tve yuyoja
translated: To whom the son of Aja, Daśaratha, gave his daughter Śantā as a daughter, to him who had no son.

original: romapādāc caturaṅgas tasmāc ca pṛthulākṣaḥ /
analyzed: romapādāt caturaṅgaḥ tasmāt ca pṛthulākṣaḥ
translated: And from Roma-pāda, Catur-aṅga; from him, Pṛthu-lākṣa.

original: tataś campo yaś campāṃ niveśayām āsa /
analyzed: tatas campaḥ yaḥ campām niveśayām āsa
translated: From him, Campa, who founded Campa.

original: campasya haryaṅgas tato bhadrarathas tato bṛhadrathas tato bṛhatkarmā bṛhatkarmaṇaś ca bṛhadbhānus tasmād bṛhanmanās tato jayadrathaḥ /
analyzed: campasya haryaṅgaḥ tatas bhadrarathaḥ tatas bṛhadrathaḥ tatas bṛhatkarmā bṛhatkarmaṇaḥ ca bṛhadbhānuḥ tasmāt bṛhanmanāḥ tatas jayadrathaḥ
translated: From Campa, Haryaṅga; from him, Bhadra-ratha; from him, Bṛhadrath; from him, Bṛhat-karma; from Bṛhat-karma, Bṛhadbhānu; from him, Bṛhan-mana; from him, Jayadratha.

original: jayadratho brahmakṣatrāntarālasaṃbhūtyāṃ patnyāṃ vijayaṃ nāma putram ajījanat // / / //
analyzed: jayadrathaḥ brahma kṣatra antarāla saṃbhūtyām patnyām vijayam nāma putram ajījanat
translated: Jayadratha begot on his wife Brahmakṣatriyāntarālasambhūtā a son named Vijaya.

original: vijayaś ca dhṛtiṃ putram avāpa /
analyzed: vijayaḥ ca dhṛtim putram avāpa
translated: And Vijaya obtained a son named Dhriti.

original: tasyāpi dhṛtavrataḥ putro 'bhūt /
analyzed: tasya api dhṛtavrataḥ putraḥ bhūt
translated: And he had a son named Dhṛtavrata.

original: dhṛtavratāt satyakarmā satyakarmaṇas tv adhirathaḥ /
analyzed: dhṛtavratāt satyakarmā satyakarmaṇaḥ tu adhirathaḥ
translated: And from Dhṛtavrata was born Satyavrata. And from Satyavrata was born Adhiratha.

original: yo 'sau gaṅgāṃ gato mañjūṣāgataṃ pṛthāpaviddhaṃ karṇaṃ putram avāpa /
analyzed: yaḥ sau gaṅgām gataḥ mañjūṣā gatam pṛthā apaviddham karṇam putram avāpa
translated: He who went to the Ganges and obtained as his son Karṇa, who had been cast off by Pritha in a box.

original: karṇād vṛṣasena ity ete 'ṅgāḥ // / / //
analyzed: karṇāt vṛṣasenaḥ iti ete ṅgāḥ
translated: From Karṇa was born Vṛṣasena. These are the Aṅgas.

original: ataś ca puror vaṃśaṃ śrotum arhasīti // / / //
analyzed: atas ca puroḥ vaṃśam śrotum arhasi iti
translated: And therefore you should listen to the lineage of Puru.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe 'ṣṭadaśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe ṣṭadaśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eighteenth chapter in the fourth section of the Viṣṇu Purāṇa.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parāśara said:

original: pūror janamejayaḥ putras tasyāpi pracinvān pracinvataḥ pravīraḥ /
analyzed: pūroḥ janamejayaḥ putraḥ tasya api pracinvān pracinvataḥ pravīraḥ
translated: Janamejaya was the son of Puru. His son was Pracinvān. Pracinvān's son was Pravīra.

original: tasmān manasyur manasyoś cābhayadas tasyāpi sudyuḥ sudyor bahugavaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt manasyuḥ manasyoḥ ca abhayadaḥ tasya api sudyuḥ sudyoḥ bahugavaḥ
translated: From him was born Manasvin. And from Manasvin was born Abhaydas. His son was Sudyu. Sudyu's son was Bahugava.

original: tasyāpi saṃyātiḥ saṃyāter ahaṃyātiḥ tato raudrāśvaḥ /
analyzed: tasya api saṃyātiḥ saṃyāteḥ ahaṃyātiḥ tatas raudrāśvaḥ
translated: His son was Samyāti. Samyāti's son was Aham-yāti. After him was Raudrāśva.

original: ṛteyuḥ kakṣeyuḥ sthaṇḍileyur dhṛteyur jaleyuḥ sthaleyur dharmeyuḥ saṃnateyur dhaneyur vaneyur nāmāno raudrāśvasya daśātmajā V putrā babhūvuḥ
analyzed: ṛteyuḥ kakṣeyuḥ sthaṇḍileyuḥ dhṛteyuḥ jaleyuḥ sthaleyuḥ dharmeyuḥ saṃnateyuḥ dhaneyuḥ vaneyuḥ nāmānaḥ raudrāśvasya daśa ātmajāḥ u putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Ṛteyu, Kakṣeyu, Sthaṇḍileyu, Dhṛteyu, Jaleyu, Sthaleyu, Dharm-eyu, Santateyu, Dhaneyu, and Vameyū were the ten sons of Raivata.

original: ṛteyo rantināraḥ putro 'bhūt /
analyzed: ṛteyaḥ rantināraḥ putraḥ bhūt
translated: Ṛteyu had a son named Rantināra.

original: sumatim apratirathaṃ dhruvaṃ ca rantināraḥ putrān avāpa /
analyzed: sumatim apratiratham dhruvam ca rantināraḥ putrān avāpa
translated: Rantināra had three sons: Sumati, Apratiratha, and Dhruva.

original: apratirathāt kaṇvas tasyāpi medhātithiḥ /
analyzed: apratirathāt kaṇvaḥ tasya api medhātithiḥ
translated: Apratiratha had a son named Kaṇva, and Kaṇva had a son named Medhātithi.

original: yataḥ kaṇvāyanā dvijā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: yatas kaṇvāyanāḥ dvijāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: From Medhātithi came the Brāhmaṇas known as Kaṇv-āyanas.

original: apratirathasyāparaḥ putro 'bhūd ailīnaḥ /
analyzed: apratirathasya aparaḥ putraḥ bhūt ailīnaḥ
translated: Apratiratha had another son named Ilīna.

original: tato duṣyantādyāś catvāraḥ putrā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: tatas duṣyanta ādyāḥ catvāraḥ putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: From Ilīna came four sons, Duṣyanta being the eldest.

original: duṣyantāc cakravartī bharato 'bhavat yannāmahetur devaiḥ śloko gīyate /
analyzed: duṣyantāt cakravartī bharataḥ bhavat yad nāma hetuḥ devaiḥ ślokaḥ gīyate
translated: Duṣyanta had a son named Cakravartī Bharata, who was the cause of the following verse being sung by the demigods:

original: mātā bhastrā pituḥ putro yena jātaḥ sa eva saḥ /
analyzed: mātā bhastrā pituḥ putraḥ yena jātaḥ saḥ eva saḥ
translated: The mother is only a carrier of the child, and the father is the one who begets the child.

original: bharasva putraṃ duṣyanta māvamaṃsthāḥ śakuntalām // / / //
analyzed: bharasva putram duṣyanta mā avamaṃsthāḥ śakuntalām
translated: O King Duṣyanta, therefore you should accept your son and not insult Śakuntalā.

original: retodhāḥ putro nayati naradeva yamakṣayāt /
analyzed: retodhāḥ putraḥ nayati naradeva yama kṣayāt
translated: O King of human society, the father is the one who gives the semen, and he is the one who delivers the child from the hellish condition of life.

original: tvaṃ cāsya dhātā garbhasya satyam āha śakuntalā // / / //
analyzed: tvam ca asya dhātā garbhasya satyam āha śakuntalā
translated: You are the father of this child, and Śakuntalā has spoken the truth.

original: bharatasya patnitraye nava putrā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: bharatasya nava putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Bharata had nine sons by his three wives.

original: naite mamānurūpā ity abhihitās tanmātaro jaghnuḥ parityāgabhayāt /🔽tato 'sya vitathe putrajanmani putrārthino marutsomayājino dīrghatamasā pārṣṇyapāstabṛhaspativīryād
analyzed: na ete mama anurūpāḥ iti abhihitāḥ tad mātaraḥ jaghnuḥ parityāga bhayāt  tatas sya vitathe putra janmani putra arthinaḥ marut soma yājinaḥ dīrghatamasā pārṣṇi apāsta bṛhaspati vīryāt
translated: When they were told by him, These are not suitable for me, his mothers, out of fear of abandonment, killed them.🔽Then, for him who had a false birth of a son, the Maruts, desiring a son, offered a Soma sacrifice. From the semen of Brihaspati, expelled by Dirghatamas,

original: utathyapatnīmamatāsamutpanno bharadvājākhyaḥ putro marudbhir dattaḥ // / / //
analyzed: utathya patnī mamatā samutpannaḥ bharadvāja ākhyaḥ putraḥ marudbhiḥ dattaḥ
translated: a son named Bharadvaja, born from the wife of Utathya, was given by the Maruts.

original: tasyāpi nāmanirvacanaślokaḥ paṭhyate // / / //
analyzed: tasya api nāma nirvacana ślokaḥ paṭhyate
translated: A verse is recited about the etymology of his name:

original: mūḍhe bhara dvājam imaṃ bhara dvājaṃ bṛhaspate /
analyzed: mūḍhe bhara dvājam imam bhara dvājam bṛhaspate
translated: O foolish one, carry this Bharadvaja. Carry Bharadvaja, O Brihaspati.

original: yātau yad uktvā pitarau bharadvājas tatas tv ayam // / / //
analyzed: yātau yat uktvā pitarau bharadvājaḥ tatas tu ayam
translated: Since the parents left, saying 'Carry,' this one is Bharadvaja.

original: iti bharadvājaś ca tasya vitathe putrajanmani marudbhir dattas tato vitathasaṃjñām avāpa // / / //
analyzed: iti bharadvājaḥ ca tasya vitathe putra janmani marudbhiḥ dattaḥ tatas vitatha saṃjñām avāpa
translated: Thus, Bharadvaja was given by the Maruts for him who had a false birth of a son. Therefore, he obtained the name Vitatha.

original: vitathasya bhavan manyuḥ putro 'bhūt /
analyzed: vitathasya bhavat manyuḥ putraḥ bhūt
translated: Vitatha's son was born out of anger.

original: bṛhatkṣatramahāvīryanaragargā abhavan manyuputrāḥ /
analyzed: bṛhatkṣatra mahāvīrya nara gargāḥ abhavan manyu putrāḥ
translated: Brihatkshatra, Mahavirya, Nara, and Garga were the sons of Manyu.

original: narasya saṃkṛtiḥ saṃkṛte ruciradhīrantidevau /
analyzed: narasya saṃkṛtiḥ saṃkṛte rucira dhī rantidevau
translated: Of Nara, Sankriti; of Sankriti, Ruci and Adhiratha.

original: gargāc chinis tato gārgyāḥ śainyāḥ kṣatropetā dvijātayo babhūvuḥ // / / //
analyzed: gargāt śiniḥ tatas gārgyāḥ śainyāḥ kṣatra upetāḥ dvijātayaḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: From Garga, Shini; from Shini, the Gargyas; the Shiniyas became mixed with Kshatriyas.

original: mahāvīryād durukṣayo nāma putro 'bhūt
analyzed: mahāvīryāt durukṣayaḥ nāma putraḥ bhūt
translated: From Mahāvīrya, a son named Durukṣaya was born.

original: tasya trayyāruṇapuṣkariṇau kapiś ca putratrayam abhūt /
analyzed: tasya trayya aruṇa puṣkariṇau kapiḥ ca putra trayam abhūt
translated: He had three sons: Trayyāruṇa, Puṣkariṇa, and Kapi.

original: tac ca tritayam api paścād vipratām upajagāma /
analyzed: tat ca tritayam api paścāt vipra tām upajagāma
translated: And all three of them later became Brahmins.

original: bṛhatkṣatrasya suhotraḥ suhotrād dhastī ya idaṃ hastināpuram āropayām āsa /
analyzed: bṛhatkṣatrasya suhotraḥ suhotrāt hastī yaḥ idam hastināpuram āropayām āsa
translated: Suhotra was born from Bṛhatsatra. Suhotra's son was Hastī, who established this city of Hastināpura.

original: ajamīḍhadvimīḍhapurumīḍhās trayo hastinas tanayāḥ /
analyzed: ajamīḍha dvimīḍha purumīḍhāḥ trayaḥ hastinaḥ tanayāḥ
translated: Hastī had three sons: Ajamīḍha, Dvimīḍha, and Purumīḍha.

original: ajamīḍhāt kaṇvaḥ kaṇvān medhātithiḥ /
analyzed: ajamīḍhāt kaṇvaḥ kaṇvāt medhātithiḥ
translated: From Ajamīḍha, Kaṇva; from Kaṇva, Medhātithi.

original: yataḥ kaṇvāyanā dvijāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yatas kaṇvāyanāḥ dvijāḥ
translated: From whom the Kaṇvâyanas, the Brahmins, originated.

original: ajamīḍhasyānyaḥ putro bṛhadiṣuḥ /
analyzed: ajamīḍhasya anyaḥ putraḥ bṛhadiṣuḥ
translated: Ajamīḍha had another son named Bṛhadiṣu.

original: tato bṛhaddhanus tataś ca bṛhatkarmā tasmāj jayadrathas tato 'pi viśvajit /
analyzed: tatas bṛhaddhanuḥ tatas ca bṛhatkarmā tasmāt jayadrathaḥ tatas u pi viśvajit
translated: From him, Bṛhaddhanu; from him, Bṛhatkarmā; from him, Jayadratha; from him, Viśvajit.

original: tataḥ senajit /
analyzed: tatas senajit
translated: From him, Senajit.

original: rucirāśvakāśyadṛḍhahanuvatsahanusaṃjñāḥ senajitaḥ putrāḥ /
analyzed: rucirāśva kāśya dṛḍhahanu vatsahanu saṃjñāḥ senajitaḥ putrāḥ
translated: Senajit's sons were named Ruciraśva, Kāśya, Dṛdhahanu, and Vatsaha.

original: rucirāśvataḥ pṛthusenaḥ /
analyzed: rucirāśvataḥ pṛthusenaḥ
translated: From Ruciraśva, Pṛthusena.

original: tasmāt pāraḥ pārān nīpaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt pāraḥ pārāt nīpaḥ
translated: From him, Pāra; from Pāra, Nīpa.

original: tasyaikaśataṃ putrāṇām /
analyzed: tasya ekaśatam putrāṇām
translated: He had one hundred sons.

original: teṣāṃ pradhānaḥ kāmpilyādhipatiḥ samaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: teṣām pradhānaḥ kāmpilyā adhipatiḥ samaraḥ
translated: Among them, Samara, the lord of Kāmpilya, was the chief.

original: samarasyāpi pārasupārasadaśvās trayaḥ putrāḥ /
analyzed: samarasya api pāra supāra sadaśvāḥ trayaḥ putrāḥ
translated: Samara also had three sons: Pāra, Supāra, and Sadāśva.

original: pārāt pṛthuḥ pṛthoḥ sukṛtiḥ sukṛter vibhrājaḥ /
analyzed: pārāt pṛthuḥ pṛthoḥ sukṛtiḥ sukṛteḥ vibhrājaḥ
translated: Pṛthu from Pṛthu, Sukṛti from Sukṛti, Vibhrāja

original: tataś cāṇuho yaḥ śukaduhitaraṃ kṛtvīṃ nāmopayeme // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca aṇuhaḥ yaḥ śuka duhitaram kṛtvīm nāma upayeme
translated: from him, and Aṇuha, who married Kṛtvī, the daughter of Śuka.

original: aṇuhād brahmadattaḥ /
analyzed: aṇuhāt brahmadattaḥ
translated: From Aṇuha, Brahmadatta.

original: tato viṣvaksenas tasyodaksenaḥ /
analyzed: tatas viṣvaksenaḥ tasya udaksenaḥ
translated: From him, Viṣvaksena, from him, Ugrasena.

original: bhallāṭas tasyātmajaḥ /
analyzed: bhallāṭaḥ tasya ātmajaḥ
translated: Bhallāṭa was his son.

original: dvimīḍhasya tu yavīnarasaṃjñas tasyāpi dhṛtimāṃs tataḥ satyadhṛtis tataś ca dṛḍhanemiḥ
analyzed: dvimīḍhasya tu yavīnara saṃjñaḥ tasya api dhṛtimān tatas satyadhṛtiḥ tatas ca dṛḍhanemiḥ
translated: But Dvimīḍha's son was named Yavīnara, from him Dhṛtimān, from him Satyadhṛti, and from him Dṛḍhanemi.

original: tasmāc ca supārśvas tataḥ sumatis tataś ca sannatimān sannatimataḥ kṛto 'bhūt /
analyzed: tasmāt ca supārśvaḥ tatas sumatiḥ tatas ca sannatimān sannatimataḥ kṛtaḥ bhūt
translated: From him, Supārśva, from him Sumati, from him Sannatimān, from Sannatimān Kṛta was born.

original: yaṃ hiraṇyanābho yogam adhyāpayām āsa /
analyzed: yam hiraṇyanābhaḥ yogam adhyāpayām āsa
translated: Whom Hiraṇyanābha taught yoga.

original: yaś caturviṃśati prācyasāmagānāṃ saṃhitāś cakāra // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ caturviṃśati prācya sāmagānām saṃhitāḥ cakāra
translated: And who composed twenty-four Saṃhitās of the Prācya Sāma-singers.

original: kṛtāc cogrāyudho yena prācuryeṇa nīpakṣayaḥ kṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṛtāt ca ugrāyudhaḥ yena prācuryeṇa nīpa kṣayaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: From Kṛta, Ugrāyudha, by whom the destruction of the Nīpas was carried out in abundance.

original: ugrāyudhāt kṣemyaḥ kṣemyāt suvīras tasmād ripuṃjayas tasmāc ca bahuratha ity ete pauravāḥ /
analyzed: ugrāyudhāt kṣemyaḥ kṣemyāt suvīraḥ tasmāt ripuṃjayaḥ tasmāt ca bahurathaḥ iti ete pauravāḥ
translated: From Ugrāyudha, Kṣema, from Kṣema, Suvīra, from him Ripunjaya, and from him Bahuratha. These are the Pauravas.

original: ajamīḍhasya nalinī nāma patnī tasyāṃ nīlasaṃjñaḥ putro 'bhavat /
analyzed: ajamīḍhasya nalinī nāma patnī tasyām nīla saṃjñaḥ putraḥ bhavat
translated: Ajamīḍha's wife was named Nalinī, and from her was born a son named Nīla.

original: tasmād api śāntiḥ śānteḥ suśāntiḥ suśānteḥ purujānuḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt api śāntiḥ śānteḥ suśāntiḥ suśānteḥ purujānuḥ
translated: From him, Śānti, from Śānti, Suśānti, from Suśānti, Purujānu.

original: tataś cakṣus tato haryaśvaḥ /
analyzed: tatas cakṣuḥ tatas haryaśvaḥ
translated: From him, Cakṣus, from him, Haryaśva.

original: haryaśvān mudgalasṛñjayabṛhadiṣupravīrakāmpilyāḥ /🔽pañcānām eteṣāṃ viṣayāṇāṃ rakṣaṇāyālam ete matputrā iti pitrābhihitam /
analyzed: haryaśvāt mudgala sṛñjaya bṛhadiṣu pravīra kāmpilyāḥ  pañcānām eteṣām viṣayāṇām rakṣaṇāya alam ete mad putrāḥ iti pitrā abhihitam
translated: From Haryaśva, Mudgala, Sṛñjaya, Bṛhadiṣu, Prāvira, Kāmpilya.

original: ataḥ pāñcālāḥ // / / //
analyzed: atas pāñcālāḥ
translated: These five sons were declared by their father to be capable of protecting the territories of these five, and therefore they are called Pāñcālas.

original: mudgalāc ca maudgalyāḥ kṣatropetā dvijātayo babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: mudgalāt ca maudgalyāḥ kṣatra upetāḥ dvijātayaḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: From Mudgala, the Mudgalyas, who became twice-born with the duties of Kshatriyas.

original: mudgalād vadhyaśvo vadhyaśvād divodāso 'halyā ca mithunam abhūt /
analyzed: mudgalāt vadhyaśvaḥ vadhyaśvāt divodāsaḥ halyā ca mithunam abhūt
translated: From Mudgala, Vadhryaśva, from Vadhryaśva, Divodasa and Ahalya were born as a couple.

original: śaradvato 'halyāyāṃ śatānando 'bhavat /
analyzed: śaradvataḥ halyāyām śatānandaḥ bhavat
translated: From Sharadvata and Ahalya, Shatananda was born.

original: śatānandāt satyadhṛtir dhanurvedāntago jajñe /
analyzed: śatānandāt satyadhṛtiḥ dhanurveda antagaḥ jajñe
translated: From Shatananda, Satyadhriti, who mastered the science of archery, was born.

original: satyadhṛtes tu varāpsarasam urvaśīṃ dṛṣṭvā retaḥ skannaṃ śarastambe papāta // / / //
analyzed: satyadhṛteḥ tu vara apsarasam urvaśīm dṛṣṭvā retaḥ skannam śara stambe papāta
translated: But Satyadhriti, seeing the excellent celestial nymph Urvashi, his semen was emitted and fell into a clump of reeds.

original: tac ca dvidhā gatam apatyadvayaṃ kumāraḥ kanyakā cābhavat /
analyzed: tat ca dvidhā gatam apatya dvayam kumāraḥ kanyakā ca abhavat
translated: And that divided into two, became a boy and a girl.

original: mṛgayām upagataḥ śāntanur dṛṣṭvā kṛpayā jagrāha // / / //
analyzed: mṛgayām upagataḥ śāntanuḥ dṛṣṭvā kṛpayā jagrāha
translated: King Shantanu, while out hunting, saw them and out of compassion took them.

original: tataḥ sa kumāraḥ kṛpaḥ kanyā cāśvatthāmno jananī kṛpī droṇasya patny abhavat /
analyzed: tatas sa kumāraḥ kṛpaḥ kanyā ca aśvatthāmnaḥ jananī kṛpī droṇasya patnī abhavat
translated: Then that prince Kripa and the daughter Kripi became the wife of Drona.

original: divodāsasyāpi mitrāyuḥ putro mitrāyoś cyavano nāma rājā cyavanāt sudāsaḥ /
analyzed: divodāsasya api mitrāyuḥ putraḥ mitrāyoḥ cyavanaḥ nāma rājā cyavanāt sudāsaḥ
translated: Divodasa also had a son named Mitrayu, and Mitrayu's son was a king named Cyavana, from Cyavana came Sudasa.

original: tataḥ saudāsaḥ sahadevas tasyāpi somakaḥ /
analyzed: tatas saudāsaḥ sahadevaḥ tasya api somakaḥ
translated: Then Saudasa, also called Sahadeva, and from him Somaka.

original: tato jantuḥ putraśatajyeṣṭho 'bhavat /
analyzed: tatas jantuḥ putra śata jyeṣṭhaḥ bhavat
translated: Then he had a son named Jantu, who had a hundred sons.

original: teṣāṃ yavīyān pṛṣataḥ pṛṣatād drupadas tasmād dhṛṣṭadyumnas tato dhṛṣṭaketuḥ /
analyzed: teṣām yavīyān pṛṣataḥ pṛṣatāt drupadaḥ tasmāt dhṛṣṭadyumnaḥ tatas dhṛṣṭaketuḥ
translated: The youngest of them was Prishata, from Prishata came Drupada, from him Dhrishtadyumna, and from him Dhrishtaketu.

original: ajamīḍhasyānya ṛkṣanāmā putro 'bhūt /
analyzed: ajamīḍhasya anyaḥ ṛkṣa nāmā putraḥ bhūt
translated: Ajamidha also had another son named Rkṣa.

original: ṛkṣāt saṃvaraṇaḥ saṃvaraṇāc ca kuruḥ /
analyzed: ṛkṣāt saṃvaraṇaḥ saṃvaraṇāt ca kuruḥ
translated: From Rkṣa came Saṃvaraṇa, from Saṃvaraṇa came Kuru.

original: ya idaṃ dharmakṣetraṃ kurukṣetraṃ cakāra // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ idam dharma kṣetram kurukṣetram cakāra
translated: He who made this field of righteousness, Kurukṣetra.

original: sudhanurjahnuparīkṣitpramukhāḥ kuroḥ putrāḥ babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: sudhanuḥ jahnu parīkṣit pramukhāḥ kuroḥ putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: The sons of Kuru were headed by Sudhanu, Jahnu, Parīkṣit, and others.

original: sudhanuṣaḥ putraḥ suhotraḥ
analyzed: sudhanuṣaḥ putraḥ suhotraḥ
translated: The son of Sudhanu was Suhotra.

original: tasmāc cyavanaś cyavanāt kṛtakaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt cyavanaḥ cyavanāt kṛtakaḥ
translated: From him came Cyavana, from Cyavana Kṛtaka.

original: tataś coparicaro vasuḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca uparicaraḥ vasuḥ
translated: From him came Uparicara Vasu.

original: bṛhadrathapratyagrakuśāmbamāvellamatsyapramukhāḥ vasoḥ putrāḥ saptājāyanta /
analyzed: bṛhadratha pratyagra kuśāmba māvella matsya pramukhāḥ vasoḥ putrāḥ sapta ajāyanta
translated: The sons of Vasu were seven, headed by Bṛhadratha, Pratipa, Kuśāmba, Māvelā, Matsya, and others.

original: bṛhadrathāt kuśāgras tasmād ṛṣabhas tataḥ puṣpavān /
analyzed: bṛhadrathāt kuśāgraḥ tasmāt ṛṣabhaḥ tatas puṣpavān
translated: From Brihadratha was born Kushagra, from him Rishabha, from him Pushpa,

original: tasmāt satyahitas tasmāt sudhanvā tasya ca jantuḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt satyahitaḥ tasmāt sudhanvā tasya ca jantuḥ
translated: from him Satya, from him Sudhanva, from him Jantu.

original: bṛhadrathāc cānyaḥ śakaladvayajanmā jarayā saṃdhito jarāsaṃdhanāmā /
analyzed: bṛhadrathāt ca anyaḥ śakala dvaya janmā jarayā saṃdhitaḥ jarāsaṃdha nāmā
translated: And from Brihadratha was born another, born from two pieces of wood, joined by old age, named Jarasandha.

original: tasmāt sahadevas tataḥ somapis tataḥ śrutaśravāḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt sahadevaḥ tatas somapiḥ tatas śrutaśravāḥ
translated: From him was born Sahadeva, from him Somapit, from him Sruta-shrava.

original: ity ete māgadhā bhūbhṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: iti ete māgadhāḥ bhūbhṛtaḥ
translated: Thus these were the Magadha kings.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe ekonaviṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe ekonaviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the nineteenth chapter in the fourth section of the Vishnupurana.

original: śrīparāśara uvāca /
analyzed: śrī parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Shree Parashara said:

original: parīkṣito janamejayaśrutasenograsenabhīmasenāś catvāraḥ putrāḥ // / / //
analyzed: parīkṣitaḥ janamejaya śrutasena ugrasena bhīmasenāḥ catvāraḥ putrāḥ
translated: Parikhsit had four sons: Janamejaya, Shruta-sena, Ugra-sena and Bhima-sena.

original: jahnos tu suratho nāmātmajo babhūva // / / //
analyzed: jahnoḥ tu surathaḥ nāma ātmajaḥ babhūva
translated: Jahnvi had a son named Suratha.

original: tasya ca vidūrathaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca vidūrathaḥ
translated: His son was Viduratha.

original: vidūrathasya sārvabhaumaḥ sārvabhaumāj jayatsenas tasmād ārādhitas tataś cāyutāyur ayutāyor akrodhanaḥ /
analyzed: vidūrathasya sārvabhaumaḥ sārvabhaumāt jayatsenaḥ tasmāt ārādhitaḥ tatas ca ayutāyuḥ ayutāyoḥ akrodhanaḥ
translated: Viduratha's son was Sarvabhauma, Sarvabhauma's son was Jayatsena, from him was born Aradhita, from him Ayutayu, from him Akramana,

original: tasmād devātithiḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt devātithiḥ
translated: from him Devatithi,

original: tato ṛkṣaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas ṛkṣaḥ
translated: from him Rikshu.

original: ṛkṣād bhīmasenas tataś ca dilīpaḥ /
analyzed: ṛkṣāt bhīmasenaḥ tatas ca dilīpaḥ
translated: From Rikshu was born Bhimasena, from him Dilipa,

original: dilīpāt pratīpaḥ /
analyzed: dilīpāt pratīpaḥ
translated: from Dilipa Pratyusha,

original: tasyāpi devāpiśāṃtanubāhlīkasaṃjñās trayaḥ putrā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: tasya api devāpi śāṃtanu bāhlīka saṃjñāḥ trayaḥ putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: He also had three sons named Devapi, Shantanu, and Balhika.

original: devāpir bāla evāraṇyaṃ viveśa // / / //
analyzed: devāpiḥ bālaḥ eva araṇyam viveśa
translated: Devapi, while still a boy, entered the forest.

original: śāṃtanus tu mahīpālo 'bhavat /
analyzed: śāṃtanuḥ tu mahīpālaḥ bhavat
translated: Shantanu, however, became the king.

original: ayaṃ ca tasya ślokaḥ pṛthivyāṃ gīyate /
analyzed: ayam ca tasya ślokaḥ pṛthivyām gīyate
translated: And this verse of his is sung on earth:

original: yaṃ yaṃ karābhyāṃ spṛśati jīrṇaṃ yauvanam eti saḥ /
analyzed: yam yam karābhyām spṛśati jīrṇam yauvanam eti saḥ
translated: Whatever he touches with his hands becomes youthful again.

original: śāntiṃ cāpnoti yenāgryāṃ karmaṇā tena śāṃtanuḥ // / / //
analyzed: śāntim ca āpnoti yena agryām karmaṇā tena śāṃtanuḥ
translated: By that foremost deed he obtained peace, therefore he is Shantanu.

original: tasya śāṃtano rāṣṭre dvādaśavarṣāṇi devo na vavarṣa // / / //
analyzed: tasya śāṃtanoḥ rāṣṭre dvādaśa varṣāṇi devaḥ na vavarṣa
translated: In his kingdom, Shantanu, the god did not rain for twelve years.

original: tataś cāśeṣarāṣṭravināśam avekṣyāsau rājā brāhmaṇān apṛcchat /
analyzed: tatas ca aśeṣa rāṣṭra vināśam avekṣya asau rājā brāhmaṇān apṛcchat
translated: Then, seeing the destruction of the entire kingdom, the king asked the Brahmins:

original: kasmād asmadrāṣṭre devo na varṣati ko mamāparādha iti /
analyzed: kasmāt asmad rāṣṭre devaḥ na varṣati kaḥ mama aparādhaḥ iti
translated: Why does the god not rain in my kingdom? What is my offense?

original: te tam ūcuḥ /
analyzed: te tam ūcuḥ
translated: They said to him:

original: agrajasya te 'rheyam avanis tvayā bhujyate parivettā tvam ity uktaḥ sa punas tān apṛcchat /
analyzed: agrajasya te rha iyam avaniḥ tvayā bhujyate parivettā tvam iti uktaḥ sa punar tān apṛcchat
translated: You are enjoying the land that belongs to your elder brother. You are a usurper. Thus addressed, he again asked them:

original: kiṃ mayā vidheyam iti /
analyzed: kim mayā vidheyam iti
translated: What should I do?

original: te punar apy ūcuḥ /
analyzed: te punar api ūcuḥ
translated: They said again:

original: yāvad devāpir na patanādibhir doṣair abhibhūyate tāvat tasyārhaṃ rājyam /
analyzed: yāvat devāpiḥ na patana ādibhiḥ doṣaiḥ abhibhūyate tāvat tasya arham rājyam
translated: As long as Devapi is not overcome by faults such as falling, the kingdom belongs to him.

original: tad alam etena tasmai dīyatām ity ukte tasya mantripravareṇāśmasāriṇātatrāraṇye tapasvino vedavādavirodhavaktāraḥ prayuktāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat alam etena tasmai dīyatām iti ukte tasya mantri pravareṇa aśmasāriṇā a tatra araṇye tapasvinaḥ veda vāda virodha vaktāraḥ prayuktāḥ
translated: So let it be given to him. When this was said, that best of ministers, Aśmasārin, sent to that forest ascetics who spoke in contradiction to the Vedic teachings.

original: tair asyātiṛjumater mahīpatiputrasya buddhir vedavirodhamārgānusāriṇy akriyata // / / //
analyzed: taiḥ asya ati ṛju mateḥ mahīpati putrasya buddhiḥ veda virodha mārga anusāriṇī akriyata
translated: By them, the mind of that very straightforward prince was turned to following the path that contradicted the Vedas.

original: rājā ca śāṃtanur dvijavacanotpannaparivedanaśokas tān brāhmaṇān agraṇīkṛtyāgrajarājyapradānāyāraṇyaṃ jagāma /
analyzed: rājā ca śāṃtanuḥ dvija vacana utpanna parivedana śokaḥ tān brāhmaṇān agraṇīkṛtya agraja rājya pradānāya araṇyam jagāma
translated: And King Śāntanu, his sorrow arising from hearing the words of the brahmins, took those brahmins as his leaders and went to the forest to give the kingdom to his elder brother.

original: tadāśramam upagatāś ca tam avanīpatiputraṃ devāpim upatasthuḥ /
analyzed: tad āśramam upagatāḥ ca tam avanīpati putram devāpim upatasthuḥ
translated: And the gods approached that prince Devapi, who had gone to that hermitage.

original: te brāhmaṇā vedavādānubaddhāni vacāṃsi rājyam agrajena kartavyam ity arthavanti tam ūcuḥ /
analyzed: te brāhmaṇāḥ veda vāda anubaddhāni vacāṃsi rājyam agrajena kartavyam iti arthavanti tam ūcuḥ
translated: Those brahmins spoke to him words connected with the Vedic teachings and meaningful, saying, The kingdom should be ruled by the elder brother.

original: asāv api devāpir vedavādavirodhiyuktidūṣitam anekaprakāraṃ tān āha /
analyzed: asau api devāpiḥ veda vāda virodhi yukti dūṣitam aneka prakāram tān āha
translated: But that Devapi also spoke to them in many ways, refuting with reasoning that contradicted the Vedic teachings.

original: tatas te brāhmaṇāḥ śāṃtanum ūcuḥ /
analyzed: tatas te brāhmaṇāḥ śāṃtanum ūcuḥ
translated: Then those brahmins said to Śāntanu:

original: āgaccha bho rājann alam atrātinirbandhena praśānta evāsāv anāvṛṣṭidoṣaḥ patito 'yam anādikālam ahitavedavacanadūṣaṇoccāraṇāt /
analyzed: āgaccha bho rājan alam atrā ati nirbandhena praśāntaḥ eva asau anāvṛṣṭi doṣaḥ patitaḥ yam anādi kālam ahita veda vacana dūṣaṇa uccāraṇāt
translated: Come, O king, enough of this excessive insistence. This fault of drought has been pacified. This has fallen, the utterance of the fault of the Vedas, which is harmful from beginningless time.

original: patite cāgraje naiva pārivedyaṃ bhavatīty uktaḥ śāṃtanuḥ svapuram āgatya rājyam akarot /
analyzed: patite ca agraje nā eva pārivedyam bhavati iti uktaḥ śāṃtanuḥ sva puram āgatya rājyam akarot
translated: And when the elder brother has fallen, one is not a parivettā. Thus addressed, Śāntanu, having come to his own city, ruled the kingdom.

original: vedavādavirodhivacanoccāraṇadūṣite ca tasmin devāpāv akhilasya niṣpattaye vavarṣa bhagavān parjanyaḥ /
analyzed: veda vāda virodhi vacana uccāraṇa dūṣite ca tasmin devāpau akhilasya niṣpattaye vavarṣa bhagavān parjanyaḥ
translated: And when he was defiled by the utterance of words contradicting the Vedic statements, the blessed cloud rained for the completion of all.

original: bāhlīkasya somadattaḥ putro 'bhūt // / / //
analyzed: vāhlīkasya somadattaḥ putraḥ bhūt
translated: Somadatta was the son of Bāhlika.

original: somadattasyāpi bhūribhūriśravaḥśalyasaṃjñās trayaḥ putrāḥ /
analyzed: somadattasya api bhūri bhūriśravaḥ śalya saṃjñāḥ trayaḥ putrāḥ
translated: Somadatta also had three sons named Bhūri, Bhūriśravas, and Śalya.

original: śāṃtanor apy amaranadyāṃ gaṅgāyām udārakīrtir aśeṣaśāstrārthavid bhīṣmaḥ putro 'bhūt /
analyzed: śāṃtanoḥ api amara nadyām gaṅgāyām udāra kīrtiḥ aśeṣa śāstra artha vid bhīṣmaḥ putraḥ bhūt
translated: And Śāntanu had a son of great fame, Bhīṣma, who knew the meaning of all scriptures, born from the divine river Gaṅgā.

original: satyavatyāṃ ca citrāṅgadavicitravīryau putrāv utpādayām āsa śāṃtanuḥ /
analyzed: satyavatyām ca citrāṅgada vicitravīryau putrau utpādayām āsa śāṃtanuḥ
translated: And Śāntanu begot two sons, Citrāṅgada and Vicitravīrya, on Satyavatī.

original: citrāṅgadas tu bāla eva citrāṅgadena gandharveṇāhave vinihataḥ /
analyzed: citrāṅgadaḥ tu bālaḥ eva citrāṅgadena gandharveṇa āhave vinihataḥ
translated: But Citrāṅgada was killed in battle by the gandharva Citrāṅgada while still a child.

original: vicitravīryo 'pi kāśīrājatanaye ambikāmbālike upayeme /
analyzed: vicitravīryaḥ pi kāśī rāja tanaye ambikā ambālike upayeme
translated: And Vicitravīrya married Aṃbikā and Ambālikā, the daughters of the king of Kāśī.

original: tadupabhogātikhedāc ca yakṣmaṇā gṛhītaḥ pañcatvam agamat /
analyzed: tad upabhoga ati khedāt ca yakṣmaṇā gṛhītaḥ pañcatvam agamat
translated: And from the excessive fatigue of enjoying her, he was seized by consumption and died.

original: satyavatīniyogāc ca tatputraḥ kṛṣṇadvaipāyano mātur vacanam anatikramaṇīyam iti vicitravīryakṣetre dhṛtarāṣṭrapāṇḍū tatprahitabhujiṣyāyāṃ ca
analyzed: satyavatī niyogāt ca tad putraḥ kṛṣṇadvaipāyanaḥ mātuḥ vacanam an atikramaṇīyam iti vicitravīrya kṣetre dhṛtarāṣṭra pāṇḍū tad prahita bhujiṣyāyām ca
translated: And by the order of Satyavati, his son Krishna Dvaipayana, thinking that the words of his mother were not to be transgressed, produced Dhritarashtra and Pandu in the field of Vichitravirya and in the wife given by him,

original: viduraṃ utpādayām āsa // / / //
analyzed: viduram utpādayām āsa
translated: and Vidura in the wife of a Shudra.

original: dhṛtarāṣṭro 'pi duryodhanaduḥśāsanādipradhānaṃ putraśatam utpādayām āsa /
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ pi duryodhana duḥśāsana ādi pradhānam putra śatam utpādayām āsa
translated: Dhritarashtra also produced a hundred sons, of whom Duryodhana and Dushasana were the chief.

original: pāṇḍor apy araṇye mṛgaśāpopahataprajananasāmarthyasya dharmavāyuśakrair yudhiṣṭhirabhīmārjunāḥ kuntyāṃ nakulasahadevau cāśvibhyāṃ mādryāṃ pañca 🔽putrāḥ samutpāditāḥ /
analyzed: pāṇḍoḥ api araṇye mṛga śāpa upahata prajanana sāmarthyasya dharma vāyu śakraiḥ yudhiṣṭhira bhīma arjunāḥ kuntyām nakula sahadevau ca aśvibhyām mādryām pañca  / putrāḥ samutpāditāḥ
translated: And Pandu, whose ability to procreate was destroyed by the curse of a deer in the forest, had five sons produced by Dharma, Vayu, and Shakra in Kunti - Yudhishthira, Bhima, Arjuna, and by the Ashvins in Madri - Nakula and Sahadeva.

original: teṣāṃ ca draupadyāṃ pañca putrā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: teṣām ca draupadyām pañca putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: And they had five sons by Draupadi.

original: yudhiṣṭhirāt prativindhyo bhīmasenāc chrutasomaḥ śrutakīrtir arjunāc chatānīko nakulāc chrutakarmā sahadevāt /
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhirāt prativindhyaḥ bhīmasenāt śrutasomaḥ śrutakīrtiḥ arjunāt śatānīkaḥ nakulāt śrutakarmā sahadevāt
translated: Yudhishthira had Prativindhya, Bhimasena had Sutasoma and Srutakirti, Arjuna had Shatanika, Nakula had Srutakarma, and Sahadeva had Srutayus.

original: apare ca pāṇḍavānām ātmajās tad yathā /
analyzed: apare ca pāṇḍavānām ātmajāḥ tat yathā
translated: And there were other sons of the Pandavas, namely:

original: yaudheyī yudhiṣṭhirād devakaṃ putram avāpa /
analyzed: yaudheyī yudhiṣṭhirāt devakam putram avāpa
translated: Yaudheyī obtained the son Deva from Yudhiṣṭhira.

original: hiḍimbā ghaṭotkacaṃ bhīmasenāt putraṃ lebhe /
analyzed: hiḍimbā ghaṭotkacam bhīmasenāt putram lebhe
translated: Hiḍimbā obtained the son Ghaṭotkaca from Bhīmasena.

original: kāśī ca bhīmasenād eva sarvatragaṃ putram avāpa /
analyzed: kāśī ca bhīmasenāt eva sarvatragam putram avāpa
translated: And Kāsī obtained the son Sarvatraga from Bhīmasena alone.

original: sahadevāc ca vijayā suhotraṃ nāma putraṃ prāptavatī /🔽kareṇumatyāṃ ca nakulo 'pi niramitram ajījanat // / / //
analyzed: sahadevāt ca vijayā suhotram nāma putram prāptavatī  kareṇumatyām ca nakulaḥ pi niramitram ajījanat
translated: And Vijayā obtained the son Suhotra from Sahadeva.🔽And Nakula also begot a son named Niramitra on Kareṇumati.

original: arjunasyāpy ulūpyāṃ nāgakanyāyām irāvān nāma putro 'bhūt /
analyzed: arjunasya api ulūpyām nāga kanyāyām irāvān nāma putraḥ bhūt
translated: Arjuna also had a son named Irāvat on the Nāga maiden Ulūpī.

original: maṇipurapatiputryāṃ ca putrikādharmeṇa babhruvāhanaṃ nāma putram arjuno 'janayat // / / //
analyzed: maṇipura pati putryām ca putrikā dharmeṇa babhruvāhanam nāma putram arjunaḥ janayat
translated: And Arjuna begot a son named Babhruvāhana on the daughter of the king of Maṇipura by the custom of the son's being for the father.

original: subhadrāyāṃ cārbhakatve 'pi yo 'sāv atibalaparākramasamastārātirathavijetā so 'bhimanyur ajāyata /
analyzed: subhadrāyām ca arbhaka tve saḥ bhimanyuḥ ajāyata
translated: And Abhimanyu, who was the conqueror of all the enemy's chariots in his great strength and valor, was born to Subhadrā even in his childhood.

original: abhimanyor uttarāyāṃ parikṣīṇeṣu kuruṣv aśvatthāmaprayuktabrahmāstreṇa garbha eva
analyzed: abhimanyoḥ uttarāyām parikṣīṇeṣu kuruṣu aśvatthāma prayukta brahmāstreṇa garbhaḥ eva
translated: Abhimanyu, when the Kurus were exhausted, was reduced to ashes in the womb itself by the Brahmā weapon used by Aśvatthāmā.

original: bhasmīkṛto bhagavataḥ sakalasurāsuravanditacaraṇayugalasyātmecchākāraṇamānuṣarūpadhāriṇo
analyzed: bhasmīkṛtaḥ bhagavataḥ sakala sura asura vandita caraṇa yugalasya ātma icchā kāraṇa mānuṣa rūpa dhāriṇaḥ
translated: The son of the Blessed One, whose two feet are worshipped by all gods and demons, who assumes a human form out of his own will,

original: 'nubhāvāt punar jīvitam avāpya parīkṣij jajñe /
analyzed: nubhāvāt punar jīvitam avāpya parīkṣit jajñe
translated: By the power of the sage, Parikshit regained his life and lived.

original: yo 'yaṃ sāmpratam etad bhūmaṇḍalam akhaṇḍitāyatidharmeṇa pālayati/ / //
analyzed: yaḥ yam sāmpratam etat bhū maṇḍalam akhaṇḍita āyati dharmeṇa
translated: He is the one who now rules this earth with undivided Dharma.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe viṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe viṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twentieth chapter of the fourth section in the great epic of Vishnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ataḥ paraṃ bhaviṣyān ahaṃ bhūpālān kīrtayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: atas param bhaviṣyān aham bhūpālān kīrtayiṣyāmi
translated: From here I will narrate the future kings.

original: yo 'yaṃ sāmpratam avanīpatiḥ parīkṣit tasyāpi janamejayaśrutasenograsenabhīmasenāḥ putrāś catvāro bhaviṣyanti // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ yam sāmpratam avanīpatiḥ parīkṣit tasya api janamejaya śrutasena ugrasena bhīmasenāḥ putrāḥ catvāraḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: The present king Parikshit will have four sons - Janamejaya, Shruta-sena, Ugra-sena and Bhimasena.

original: tasyāparaḥ śatānīko bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tasya aparaḥ śatānīkaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: After him, his son Shatanika will be born.

original: yo 'sau yājñavalkyād vedam adhītya kṛpād astrāṇy avāpya viṣayaviraktacittavṛttiś ca śaunakopadeśād ātmavijñānapravīṇaḥ paraṃ nirvāṇam āpsyati
analyzed: yaḥ sau yājñavalkyāt vedam adhītya kṛpāt astrāṇi avāpya viṣaya virakta citta vṛttiḥ ca śaunaka upadeśāt ātma vijñāna pravīṇaḥ param nirvāṇam āpsyati
translated: He will study the Vedas from Yajnavalkya, learn weapons from Kripa, become detached from worldly pursuits, and attain the highest liberation through the teachings of Shaunaka.

original: śatānīkād apy aśvamedhadatto bhavitā /
analyzed: śatānīkāt api aśvamedhadattaḥ bhavitā
translated: After Shatanika, Ashvamedhadatta will be born.

original: tasmād apy adhisīmakṛṣṇaḥ adhisīmakṛṣṇān niścaknuḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt api adhi sīma kṛṣṇaḥ adhi sīma kṛṣṇāt niścaknuḥ
translated: After him, Adhisimmakrishna will be born.

original: yo gaṅgayāpahṛte hastināpure kauśāmbyāṃ nivatsyati /
analyzed: yaḥ gaṅgayā apahṛte hastināpure kauśāmbyām nivatsyati
translated: He will reside in Koshala, Hastinapura, which will be carried away by the Ganges.

original: tasyāpy uṣṇaḥ putro bhavitā /
analyzed: tasya api uṣṇaḥ putraḥ bhavitā
translated: His son will be Ushna.

original: uṣṇāc citrarathas tataḥ śucirathas tasmād vṛṣṇimāṃs tataḥ suṣeṇaḥ /
analyzed: uṣṇāt citrarathaḥ tatas śucirathaḥ tasmāt vṛṣṇimān tatas suṣeṇaḥ
translated: From Uṣanā came Citraratha, from him Śuciratha, from him Vṛṣṇimān, from him Suṣeṇa,

original: tasmād api sunīthaḥ sunīthād ṛcas tato nṛcakṣus tasyāpi sukhibalas tasmād pariplavas tataś ca sunayas tato medhāvī /
analyzed: tasmāt api sunīthaḥ sunīthāt ṛcaḥ tatas nṛcakṣuḥ tasya api sukhibalaḥ tasmāt pariplavaḥ tatas ca sunayaḥ tatas medhāvī
translated: from him Sunītha, from Sunītha Ricas, from Ricas Nṛcaksus, from Nṛcaksus Sukhabala, from Sukhabala Pariplava, from Pariplava Sunaya, from Sunaya Medhāvin,

original: tato n /paṃjayas tato mṛdus tasmāt tigmas tigmād bṛhadrathaḥ /
analyzed: tatas npaṃjayaḥ tatas mṛduḥ tasmāt tigmaḥ tigmāt bṛhadrathaḥ
translated: from Medhāvin Nṛpaṅka, from Nṛpaṅka Mṛdu, from Mṛdu Tigma, from Tigma Bṛhadrathas,

original: tasmād vasudānas tato 'paraḥ śatānīkaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt vasudānaḥ paraḥ śatānīkaḥ
translated: from Bṛhadrathas Vasudāna, from Vasudāna another Śatānīka,

original: tasmāc codayana udayanād ahīnaras tataś ca daṇḍapāṇis tato niramitras tasmāc ca kṣemakaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt ca udayanaḥ udayanāt ahīnaraḥ tatas ca daṇḍapāṇiḥ tatas niramitraḥ tasmāt ca kṣemakaḥ
translated: from Śatānīka Udayana, from Udayana Ahīnagu, from Ahīnagu Daṇḍapāṇi, from Daṇḍapāṇi Niramitra, from Niramitra Kṣemaka.

original: atrāyaṃ ślokaḥ /
analyzed: atra ayam ślokaḥ
translated: Here is a verse on this:

original: brahmakṣatrasya yo yonir vaṃśo rājarṣisatkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: brahma kṣatrasya yaḥ yoniḥ vaṃśaḥ rājarṣi satkṛtaḥ
translated: The womb of the Brahmanas and Kshatriyas, the family honored by royal sages,

original: kṣemakaṃ prāpya rājānaṃ sa saṃsthāṃ prāpsyate kalau // / / //
analyzed: kṣemakam prāpya rājānam sa saṃsthām prāpsyate kalau
translated: will reach its end in the Kali age when it comes to King Kṣemaka.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe ekaviṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe ekaviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-first chapter in the fourth section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ataś cekṣvākavo bhaviṣyāḥ pārthivāḥ kathyante /
analyzed: atas ca ikṣvākavaḥ bhaviṣyāḥ pārthivāḥ kathyante
translated: Now the future kings of the Ikshvaku dynasty are described.

original: bṛhadbalasya putro bṛhatkṣaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bṛhadbalasya putraḥ bṛhatkṣaṇaḥ
translated: Brihadbala's son was Brihakshana.

original: tasmād urukṣayas tato vatso vatsād vatsavyūhaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt urukṣayaḥ tatas vatsaḥ vatsāt vatsavyūhaḥ
translated: From him Urukshaya, from him Vatsa, from Vatsa Vatsavyuha.

original: tataḥ prativyomas tasyāpi divākaras tasmāt sahadevaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas prativyomaḥ tasya api divākaraḥ tasmāt sahadevaḥ
translated: Then Prativyoma, then Divakara, then Sahadeva.

original: tato bṛhadaśvas tatsūnur bhānurathas tasya pratītāśvas tasyāpi supratīkaḥ /🔽tato marudevo marudevāt sunakṣatras tasmāt kiṃnaraḥ /
analyzed: tatas bṛhadaśvaḥ tad sūnuḥ bhānurathaḥ tasya pratītāśvaḥ tasya api supratīkaḥ  tatas marudevaḥ marudevāt sunakṣatraḥ tasmāt kiṃnaraḥ
translated: Then Brihadbhanu, then Bhanuratha, then Pratitasva, then Supratika.🔽Then Marudeva, then Sunakshatra, then Kinnara.

original: kiṃnarad antarikṣas tasmāt suvarṇas tataś cāmitrajit /
analyzed: antarikṣaḥ tasmāt suvarṇaḥ tatas ca amitrajit
translated: From Kinnara, then Antariksha, then Suvarna, then Amitrajit.

original: tataś ca bṛhadrājas tasyāpi dharmī dharmiṇaḥ kṛtaṃjayaḥ /🔽kṛtaṃjayād raṇaṃjayo raṇaṃjayāt saṃjayas tasmāc chākyaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca bṛhadrājaḥ tasya api dharmī dharmiṇaḥ kṛtaṃjayaḥ  kṛtaṃjayāt raṇaṃjayaḥ raṇaṃjayāt saṃjayaḥ tasmāt śākyaḥ
translated: Then Brihadratha, then Dharman, then Kritanjaya.🔽From Kritanjaya, then Rananjaya, then Sanjaya, then Shakya.

original: śākyāc chuddhodanas tasmād rāhulas tataḥ prasenajit /
analyzed: śākyāt śuddhodanaḥ tasmāt rāhulaḥ tatas prasenajit
translated: From Shakya, then Shuddhodana, then Rahula, then Prasenajit.

original: tataś ca kṣudrakas tataś ca kuṇḍakas tasmād api surathaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca kṣudrakaḥ tatas ca kuṇḍakaḥ tasmāt api surathaḥ
translated: Then Kshudraka, then Kundaka, then Suratha.

original: tatputraś ca sumitro 'ntya ity ete cekṣvākavo bṛhadbalānvayāḥ /
analyzed: tad putraḥ ca sumitraḥ ntyaḥ iti ete ca ikṣvākavaḥ bṛhadbala anvayāḥ
translated: His son was Sumitra, the last. These are the Ikshvaku kings of the lineage of Brihadbala.

original: atrānuvaṃśaślokaḥ /
analyzed: atra anuvaṃśa ślokaḥ
translated: Here is a verse of genealogy:

original: ikṣvākūṇām ayaṃ vaṃśaḥ sumitrānto bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ikṣvākūṇām ayam vaṃśaḥ sumitrā antaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: This lineage of the Ikshvaku kings will end with Sumitra,

original: yatas taṃ prāpya rājānaṃ sa saṃsthāṃ prāpsyate kalau // / / //
analyzed: yatas tam prāpya rājānam sa saṃsthām prāpsyate kalau
translated: having reached whom, that king, the Kali age will come to an end.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe dvāviṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe dvāviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-second chapter in the fourth section of the Vishnu Purana, dealing with the future kings of Magadha, the descendants of Brihadratha.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: māgadhānāṃ bārhadrathānāṃ bhaviṣyāṇām anukramaṃ kathayāmi /
analyzed: māgadhānām bārhadrathānām bhaviṣyāṇām anukramam kathayāmi
translated: I shall now describe the future kings of the Magadha dynasty, the descendants of Brihadratha.

original: atra hi vaṃśe mahābalā jarāsaṃdhapradhānā babhūvuḥ // / / //
analyzed: atra hi vaṃśe mahā balāḥ jarāsaṃdha pradhānāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: In this dynasty, the greatly powerful Jarasandha and others will rule.

original: jarāsaṃdhasutāt sahadevāt somāpis tasmāc chṛtavāṃs tasyāpy ayutāyus tataś ca niramitras tattanayaḥ sukṣatras tasmād api bṛhatkarmā /
analyzed: jarāsaṃdha sutāt sahadevāt somāpiḥ tasmāt śṛtavān tasya api ayutāyuḥ tatas ca niramitraḥ tad tanayaḥ sukṣatraḥ tasmāt api bṛhatkarmā
translated: Jarasandha's son will be Sahadeva, from him Somapi, from him Srutava, from him Ayutayu, from him Niramitra, from him Sukshatra, from him Brihatkarman.

original: tataś ca senajit tasmāc ca śrutaṃjayas tato vipras tasya putraḥ śucināmā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tatas ca senajit tasmāt ca śrutaṃjayaḥ tatas vipraḥ tasya putraḥ śuci nāmā bhaviṣyati
translated: From him Senajit, from him Srutañjaya, from him Vipra, from him a son named Shuchi will be born.

original: tasyāpi kṣemyas tataś ca suvrataḥ suvratād dharmas tataḥ suśramaḥ /
analyzed: tasya api kṣemyaḥ tatas ca suvrataḥ suvratāt dharmaḥ tatas suśramaḥ
translated: From him Kshemya, from him Suvrata, from Suvrata Dharma, from Dharma Sushrama.

original: tato dṛḍhasenas tataḥ sumatis tasmāt subalas tasya sunīto bhavitā /
analyzed: tatas dṛḍhasenaḥ tatas sumatiḥ tasmāt subalaḥ tasya sunītaḥ bhavitā
translated: From Sushrama Dridhasena, from Dridhasena Sumati, from Sumati Subala, from Subala Sunita will be born.

original: tataḥ satyajit satyajito viśvajit tasyāpi ripuṃjayaḥ putraḥ /
analyzed: tatas satyajit satyajitaḥ viśvajit tasya api ripuṃjayaḥ putraḥ
translated: From Sunita Satyajit, from Satyajit Vishwajit, from Vishwajit Ripunjaya will be born.

original: ity ete bārhadrathā bhūpatayo varṣasahasram ekaṃ bhaviṣyantīti // / / //
analyzed: iti ete bārhadrathāḥ bhūpatayaḥ varṣa sahasram ekam bhaviṣyanti iti
translated: Thus these descendants of Brihadratha will rule for one thousand years.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe trayoviṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe trayoviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-third chapter in the fourth section of the Vishnu Purana, dealing with the history of the solar dynasty.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: yo 'yaṃ ripuṃjayo nāma bārhadratho 'ntyas tasya muniko nāmāmātyo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yaḥ yam ripuṃjayaḥ nāma bārhadrathaḥ tasya munikaḥ nāma amātyaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The last king of the Bharadvaja dynasty will be Ripunjaya. His minister will be named Muni.

original: sa cainaṃ svāminaṃ hatvā svaputraṃ pradyotanāmānam abhiṣekṣyati /
analyzed: sa ca enam svāminam hatvā sva putram pradyota nāmānam abhiṣekṣyati
translated: He will kill his master and enthrone his own son named Pradyota.

original: tasyāpi pālako nāma putro bhavitā /
analyzed: tasya api pālakaḥ nāma putraḥ bhavitā
translated: Pradyota's son will be named Palaka.

original: tataś ca viśākhayūpas tatputro janakas tasya ca nandivardhanaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca viśākhayūpaḥ tad putraḥ janakaḥ tasya ca nandivardhanaḥ
translated: After Palaka will come Vishalaksha, his son Janaka, and his son Nandivardhana.

original: ity ete 'ṣṭatriṃśaduttaram abdaśataṃ pañca pradyotāḥ pṛthivīṃ bhokṣyanti // / / //🔽tataś ca śiśunāgas tatputraś ca kākavarṇo bhavitā /🔽tatputraḥ kṣemadharmā tasyāpi kṣatraujāḥ /🔽tatputro vidhisāras tataś cājātaśatruḥ /
analyzed: iti ete ṣṭatriṃśat uttaram abda śatam pañca pradyotāḥ pṛthivīm bhokṣyanti  tatas ca śiśunāgaḥ tad putraḥ ca kākavarṇaḥ bhavitā  tad putraḥ kṣemadharmā tasya api kṣatraujāḥ  tad putraḥ vidhisāraḥ tatas ca ajātaśatruḥ
translated: These five Pradyotas will rule the earth for 385 years.

original: tasmāc ca darbhako darbhakāc codayanaḥ /🔽tasmād api nandivardhanas tato mahānandī /🔽ity ete śaiśunāgā daśa bhūmipālās trīṇi varṣaśatāni dviṣaṣṭyadhikāni bhaviṣyanti // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt ca darbhakaḥ darbhakāt ca udayanaḥ 🔽tasmāt api nandivardhanaḥ tatas mahānandī 🔽iti ete śaiśunāgāḥ daśa bhūmipālāḥ trīṇi varṣa śatāni dviṣaṣṭi adhikāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: After them will come Shishunaga, his son Kshavaka, his son Kshemadhurti, his son Kshema, his son Kshemajit, his son Kshemavarman, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema, his son Kshema

original: mahānandisutaḥ śūdrāgarbhodbhavo 'tilubdho mahāpadmo nandaḥ paraśurāma ivāparo 'khilakṣatrāntakārī bhavitā // / / //
analyzed: mahānandi sutaḥ ti lubdhaḥ mahāpadmaḥ nandaḥ paraśurāmaḥ iva aparaḥ khila kṣatra anta kārī bhavitā
translated: The son of Mahānandī, born from a Śūdra womb, very greedy, Mahāpadma Nanda, like another Paraśurāma, will destroy all the Kṣatriyas.

original: tataḥprabhṛti śūdrā bhūmipālā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tatas prabhṛti śūdrāḥ bhūmipālāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: From that time on, Śūdras will become rulers of the earth.

original: sa caikacchatrām anullaṅghitaśāsano mahāpadmaḥ pṛthivīṃ bhokṣyati // / / //
analyzed: sa ca eka chatrām an ullaṅghita śāsanaḥ mahāpadmaḥ pṛthivīm bhokṣyati
translated: And that Mahāpadma, whose rule will not be transgressed, will enjoy the earth.

original: tasyāpy aṣṭau sutāḥ sumālyādyā bhavitāraḥ /
analyzed: tasya api aṣṭau sutāḥ sumālya ādyāḥ bhavitāraḥ
translated: And he will have eight sons, headed by Sumanas.

original: tasya ca mahāpadmasyānu pṛthivīṃ bhokṣyanti /
analyzed: tasya ca mahāpadmasya anu pṛthivīm bhokṣyanti
translated: And they will enjoy the earth after Mahāpadma.

original: mahāpadmas tatputrāś ca ekaṃ varṣaśatam avanīpatayo bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: mahāpadmaḥ tad putrāḥ ca ekam varṣa śatam avanīpatayaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Mahāpadma and his sons will be rulers of the earth for one hundred years.

original: navaitān nandān kauṭilyo brāhmaṇaḥ samuddhariṣyati // / / //
analyzed: nava etān nandān kauṭilyaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ samuddhariṣyati
translated: The brāhmaṇa Kauṭilya will raise up these nine Nandas.

original: teṣām abhāve mauryāḥ pṛthivīṃ bhokṣyanti /
analyzed: teṣām abhāve mauryāḥ pṛthivīm bhokṣyanti
translated: In their absence, the Mauryas will enjoy the earth.

original: kauṭilya eva candraguptaṃ rājye 'bhiṣekṣyati // / / //
analyzed: kauṭilyaḥ eva candraguptam rājye bhiṣekṣyati
translated: And Kauṭilya himself will consecrate Candragupta in the kingdom.

original: tasyāpi putro bindusāro bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tasya api putraḥ bindusāraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And his son will be Bindusāra.

original: tasyāpy aśokavardhanas tataḥ suyaśās tato daśarathas tataḥ saṃgatas tataḥ śāliśūkas tasmāt somaśarmā tasmāc chatadhanvā /
analyzed: tasya api aśokavardhanaḥ tatas suyaśāḥ tatas daśarathaḥ tatas saṃgataḥ tatas śāliśūkaḥ tasmāt somaśarmā tasmāt śatadhanvā
translated: And after him, Aśokavardhana, then Suyaśas, then Daśaratha, then Saṅgata, then Śāliśūka, then Somaśarman, then Śatadhanvan.

original: tasyāpy'nu bṛhadrathanāmā bhavitā /
analyzed: tasya api nu bṛhadratha nāmā bhavitā
translated: After him, one named Brihadratha will appear.

original: evaṃ mauryā daśa bhūpatayo bhaviṣyanti abdaśataṃ saptatriṃśaduttaram /
analyzed: evam mauryāḥ daśa bhūpatayaḥ bhaviṣyanti abda śatam saptatriṃśat uttaram
translated: Thus, the Mauryas will have ten kings, ruling for thirty-seven years.

original: teṣām ante pṛthivīṃ śuṅgā bhokṣyanti // / / //
analyzed: teṣām ante pṛthivīm śuṅgāḥ bhokṣyanti
translated: After them, the earth will be ruled by the Shungas.

original: puṣyamitraḥ senāpatiḥ svāminaṃ hatvā rājyaṃ kariṣyati // / / //
analyzed: puṣyamitraḥ senāpatiḥ svāminam hatvā rājyam kariṣyati
translated: Pushyamitra, the general, will kill his master and rule the kingdom.

original: asyātmajo 'gnimitras tasmāt sujyeṣṭhas tato vasumitras tasmād apy ardrakas tataḥ pulindakas tato ghoṣavasus tasmād api vajramitras tato bhāgavataḥ
analyzed: asya ātmajaḥ gnimitraḥ tasmāt sujyeṣṭhaḥ tatas vasumitraḥ tasmāt api ardrakaḥ tatas pulindakaḥ tatas ghoṣavasuḥ tasmāt api vajramitraḥ tatas bhāgavataḥ
translated: His son will be Agnimitra, then Sujyeshtha, then Vasumitra, then Ardhaka, then Pundarika, then Ghoshavasu, then Vajramitra, then Bhaga.

original: tasmād devabhūtiḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt devabhūtiḥ
translated: After him, Devabhuuti.

original: ity ete daśa śuṅgā dvādaśottaraṃ varṣaśataṃ pṛthivīṃ bhokṣyanti /
analyzed: iti ete daśa śuṅgāḥ dvādaśa uttaram varṣa śatam pṛthivīm bhokṣyanti
translated: Thus, these ten Shungas will rule the earth for one hundred and twelve years.

original: tataḥ kaṇvān eṣā bhūr yāsyati // / / //
analyzed: tatas kaṇvān eṣā bhūḥ yāsyati
translated: Then, the earth will go to the Kanvas.

original: devabhūtiṃ tu śuṅgarājānaṃ vyasaninaṃ tasyaivāmātyaḥ kaṇvo vasudevanāmā nipātya svayam avanīṃ bhokṣyate /🔽tasya putro bhūmitras tasyāpi nārāyaṇaḥ /
analyzed: devabhūtim tu śuṅga rājānam vyasaninam tasya eva amātyaḥ kaṇvaḥ vasudeva nāmā nipātya svayam avanīm bhokṣyate  tasya putraḥ bhūmitraḥ tasya api nārāyaṇaḥ
translated: But when the Shunga king Devabhuuti becomes addicted, his minister Kanva, named Vasudeva, will kill him and rule the earth himself.🔽His son will be Bhuminara, his son Narayana.

original: nārāyaṇasyātmajaḥ suśarmā /
analyzed: nārāyaṇasya ātmajaḥ suśarmā
translated: Narayana's son will be Susharma.

original: ete kāṇvāyanāś catvāraḥ pañcacatvāriṃśad varṣāṇi bhūpatayo bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ete kāṇvāyanāḥ catvāraḥ pañcacatvāriṃśat varṣāṇi bhūpatayaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: These four Kāṇvas will rule for forty-five years.

original: suśarmāṇaṃ tu kāṇvaṃ svabhṛtyo balāt śiprakanāmā hatvāndhrajātīyo vasudhāṃ bhokṣyati /
analyzed: suśarmāṇam tu kāṇvam sva bhṛtyaḥ balāt śipraka nāmā hatvā andhra jātīyaḥ vasudhām bhokṣyati
translated: But a servant of Suśarman of the Kāṇva family, named Śiprīka, of the Andhra race, will forcibly kill him and enjoy the earth.

original: tataś ca kṛṣṇanāmā tadbhrātā bhūpatir bhāvī /
analyzed: tatas ca kṛṣṇa nāmā tad bhrātā bhūpatiḥ bhāvī
translated: Then his brother named Kṛṣṇa will be the king.

original: tasya putraḥ śrīśātakarṇis tasyāpi pūrṇotsaṅgas tatputraś ca śātakarṇis tasmāc ca lambodaras tasmād divīlakas tato meghasvātis tataḥ paṭumān
analyzed: tasya putraḥ śrīśātakarṇiḥ tasya api pūrṇotsaṅgaḥ tad putraḥ ca śātakarṇiḥ tasmāt ca lambodaraḥ tasmāt divīlakaḥ tatas meghasvātiḥ tatas paṭumān
translated: His son will be Śrī Śātakarṇi, his son Pūrṇotsaṅga, his son Śātakarṇi, his son Lambodara, his son Divīlaka, his son Megha-svāti, his son Paṭumān.

original: tataś cāriṣṭakarmā tato hālo hālāt pattalakas tataḥ pravilla senas tataḥ sundaraḥ śātakarṇī tasmāc cakoraḥ śātakarṇī tataḥ śivasvātis tataś
analyzed: tatas ca ariṣṭakarmā tatas hālaḥ hālāt pattalakaḥ tatas pravilla senaḥ tatas sundaraḥ śātakarṇī tasmāt cakoraḥ śātakarṇī tatas śivasvātiḥ tatas
translated: Then Ariṣṭakarma, then Hāla, from Hāla Patta-laka, from him Pravil-la-sena, from him Sundara Śātakarṇi, from him Cakora Śātakarṇi, from him Śiva-svāti,

original: ca gomatīputras tatputraḥ pulimān /
analyzed: ca gomatīputraḥ tad putraḥ pulimān
translated: and then Goma-ti-putra, his son Pulumān.

original: tasyāpi śātakarṇī tataḥ śivaśrīs tataḥ śivaskandhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya api śātakarṇī tatas śiva śrīḥ tatas śiva skandhaḥ
translated: His son also will be Śātakarṇi, then Śiva-śrī, then Śiva-skandha.

original: tasmād yajñaśrīs tato vijayas tataś candraśrīs tasyāpi pulomāviḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt yajña śrīḥ tatas vijayaḥ tatas candra śrīḥ tasya api pulomā aviḥ
translated: From him Yajña-śrī, then Vijaya, then Candra-śrī, his son also Pulomavi.

original: evam ete triṃśac catvāry abdaśatāni ṣaṭpañcāśadadhikāni pṛthivīṃ bhokṣyanty āndhrabhṛtyāḥ // / / //
analyzed: evam ete triṃśat catvāri abda śatāni ṣaṭpañcāśat adhikāni pṛthivīm bhokṣyanti āndhra bhṛtyāḥ
translated: Thus, these (kings) will rule the earth for thirty-four hundred and fifty-six years.

original: saptābhīrāḥ daśa gardabhilāś ca bhūbhujo bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: sapta ābhīrāḥ daśa gardabhilāḥ ca bhūbhujaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Then seven Abhiras, ten Gardabhas will be kings.

original: tataḥ ṣoḍaśa śakā bhūpatayo bhavitāraḥ /
analyzed: tatas ṣoḍaśa śakāḥ bhūpatayaḥ bhavitāraḥ
translated: After that, sixteen Shakas will be kings.

original: tataś cāṣṭau yavanāś caturdaśa tuṣārā muṇḍāś ca trayodaśa ekādaśa maunāḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca aṣṭau yavanāḥ caturdaśa tuṣārāḥ muṇḍāḥ ca trayodaśa ekādaśa maunāḥ
translated: After that, eight Yavanas, fourteen Tusharas, thirteen Munda kings, eleven Mauras will rule.

original: ete pṛthivīṃ trayodaśavarṣaśatāni navanavatyadhikāni bhokṣyanti // / / //
analyzed: ete pṛthivīm trayodaśa varṣa śatāni nava navati adhikāni bhokṣyanti
translated: They will rule the earth for one thousand three hundred and ninety-three years.

original: tataś ca paurā ekādaśa bhūpatayo 'bdaśatāni trīṇi mahīṃ bhokṣyanti /
analyzed: tatas ca paurāḥ ekādaśa bhūpatayaḥ bda śatāni trīṇi mahīm bhokṣyanti
translated: After them, eleven Paura kings will rule the earth for three hundred years.

original: teṣūtsanneṣu kailakilā yavanā bhūpatayo bhaviṣyanty amūrdhābhiṣiktāḥ /
analyzed: teṣu utsanneṣu kailakilāḥ yavanāḥ bhūpatayaḥ bhaviṣyanti a mūrdha abhiṣiktāḥ
translated: When they are destroyed, the Yavanas will become kings, anointed on the head.

original: teṣāṃ vindhyaśaktiḥ // / / //
analyzed: teṣām vindhya śaktiḥ
translated: Among them, Vindhya-shakti...

original: tataḥ puraṃjayas tato rāmacandras tasmād dharmo dharmād vaṅgaraḥ kṛtanandanaḥ suṣinandis tadbhrātā nandiyaśāḥ śiśukapravīrau caite varṣaśataṃ
analyzed: tatas puraṃjayaḥ tatas rāmacandraḥ tasmāt dharmaḥ dharmāt vaṅgaraḥ kṛtanandanaḥ suṣinandiḥ tad bhrātā nandiyaśāḥ śiśuka pravīrau ca ete varṣa śatam
translated: After him, Puranjaya, then Ramachandra, then Dharma, from Dharma, Vanga, Kritanandana, Susha-nandi, his brother, Nandisha, Shishuka and Pravira, these will rule for

original: ṣaḍ varṣāṇi ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ṣaḍ varṣāṇi ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: one hundred and six years.

original: tatas tatputrās trayodaśaite bāhlikāś ca trayaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tad putrāḥ trayodaśā ete bāhlikāḥ ca trayaḥ
translated: Then their sons, these thirteen, and the three Bahlikas,

original: tataḥ puṣyamitrapaṭumitrās trayodaśa mekalāś ca saptāndhrāḥ /🔽kosalāyāṃ tu navaiva bhūpatayo bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tatas puṣyamitra paṭumitrāḥ trayodaśa mekalāḥ ca sapta andhrāḥ  kosalāyām tu navā eva bhūpatayaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Then the three - Pushyamitra, Patumitra, and the thirteen Mekalas and seven Andhras,🔽But in Kosala there will be only nine kings.

original: naiṣadhās tu tāvanta eva // / / //
analyzed: naiṣadhāḥ tu tāvantaḥ eva
translated: But in the Nishadas there will be as many...

original: māgadhāyāṃ tu viśvasphaṭikasaṃjño 'nyān varṇān kariṣyati /
analyzed: māgadhāyām tu viśvasphaṭika saṃjñaḥ nyān varṇān kariṣyati
translated: But in Magadha, one named Vishvasphatika will make other castes.

original: kaivartapaṭupulindabrāhmaṇān rājye sthāpayiṣyati /
analyzed: kaivarta paṭu pulinda brāhmaṇān rājye sthāpayiṣyati
translated: He will establish the Kaivartas, Patus, Pulindas, and Brahmins in the kingdom.

original: utsādyākhilakṣatrajātim /
analyzed: utsādya akhila kṣatra jātim
translated: Having destroyed all the Kshatriya caste.

original: nava nāgāḥ padmāvatyāṃ nāma puryāṃ mathurāyām anugaṅgāprayāgaṃ māgadhā guptāś ca bhokṣyanti /
analyzed: nava nāgāḥ padmāvatyām nāma puryām mathurāyām anu gaṅgā prayāgam māgadhāḥ guptāḥ ca bhokṣyanti
translated: The nine Nagas will enjoy the city named Padmavati, Mathura, along the Ganges up to Prayaga, Magadha, and Gupta.

original: kośalauḍrapuṇḍratāmraliptān samudrataṭapurīṃ ca devarakṣito rakṣiṣyati /
analyzed: kośala oḍra puṇḍra tāmraliptān samudra taṭa purīm ca devarakṣitaḥ rakṣiṣyati
translated: Devarakshita will protect Kosala, Audra, Pundra, Tamralipta, and the city on the seashore.

original: kaliṅgamāhiṣakamāhendrā bhaumāṃ guhāṃ bhokṣyanti /
analyzed: kaliṅga māhiṣaka māhendrāḥ bhaumām guhām bhokṣyanti
translated: The Kalingas, Mahisakas, and Mahendras will enjoy the land of the Bhogas.

original: naiṣadhanaimiṣikakālatoyān janapadān maṇidhānakavaṃśyā bhokṣyanti /
analyzed: naiṣadha naimiṣika kālatoyān janapadān maṇidhānaka vaṃśyāḥ bhokṣyanti
translated: The descendants of Manidhanaka will enjoy the countries of Nishada, Naimisha, and Kalatoya.

original: trairājyamūṣikajanapadān kanakāhvayā bhokṣyanti /
analyzed: trairājya mūṣika janapadān kanakāhvayāḥ bhokṣyanti
translated: The Kanakahvayas will enjoy the three kingdoms and the countries of the mice.

original: saurāṣṭrāvantiśūdrān arbudamarubhūmiviṣayāṃś ca vrātyā dvijābhīraśūdrādyā bhokṣyanti /
analyzed: saurāṣṭra āvanti śūdrān arbuda maru bhūmi viṣayān ca vrātyāḥ dvija ābhīra śūdra ādyāḥ bhokṣyanti
translated: The Vrātyas, the twice-born, the Ābhīras, the Śūdras, and others will enjoy the countries of Saurāṣṭra, Avantī, Śūdra, Arbuda, and Marubhūmi.

original: sindhutaṭadāvikorvīcandrabhāgākāśmīraviṣayāṃś ca vrātyā mlecchādayaḥ śūdrā bhokṣyanti /
analyzed: sindhu taṭa dāvika urvī candrabhāgā kāśmīra viṣayān ca vrātyāḥ mleccha ādayaḥ śūdrāḥ bhokṣyanti
translated: The Vrātyas, the Mlecchas, and others, the Śūdras will enjoy the countries of the Sindhu coast, Dāvika, Urvī, Candrabhāgā, and Kāśmīra.

original: ete ca tulyakālāḥ sarve pṛthivyāṃ bhūbhṛto bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ete ca tulya kālāḥ sarve pṛthivyām bhūbhṛtaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And all these kings will be contemporaries on the earth.

original: alpaprasādā bṛhatkopāḥ sarvakālam anṛtādharmarucayaḥ strībālagovadhakartāraḥ parasvādānarucayo
analyzed: alpa prasādāḥ bṛhat kopāḥ sarvakālam anṛta adharma rucayaḥ strī bāla go vadha kartāraḥ para sva ādāna rucayaḥ
