translated: They will have little favor, great anger, will always delight in falsehood and unrighteousness, will kill women, children, and cows, and will delight in taking others' possessions.

original: 'lpasārā uditāstamitaprāyāḥ svalpāyuṣo mahecchā hy alpadharmāś ca bhaviṣyanti // / / //
analyzed: lpa sārāḥ udita astamita prāyāḥ su alpa āyuṣaḥ mahā icchāḥ hi alpa dharmāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have little essence, will rise and set quickly, will have short lives, will have great desires, and will have little dharma.

original: taiś ca vimiśrā janapadās tacchīlavartino rājāśrayaśuṣmiṇo mlecchācāryāś ca viparyayeṇa vartamānāḥ prajāḥ kṣapayiṣyanti /
analyzed: taiḥ ca vimiśrāḥ janapadāḥ tad śīla vartinaḥ rāja āśraya śuṣmiṇaḥ mleccha ācāryāḥ ca viparyayeṇa vartamānāḥ prajāḥ kṣapayiṣyanti
translated: And the countries will be mixed with them, the people will follow their conduct, the kings will be powerful, the Mlecchas will be teachers, and acting contrary to the rules, they will destroy the people.

original: tataś cānudinam alpālpahrāsavyavacchedād dharmārthayor jagataḥ saṃkṣayo bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca anudinam alpa alpa hrāsa vyavacchedāt dharma arthayoḥ jagataḥ saṃkṣayaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And then, due to the daily decrease of little by little, there will be a destruction of the world's dharma and artha.

original: tataś cārtha evābhijanahetuḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca arthaḥ eva abhijana hetuḥ
translated: And then, wealth alone will be the cause of birth in a good family.

original: dhanam evāśeṣadharmahetuḥ /
analyzed: dhanam eva aśeṣa dharma hetuḥ
translated: Wealth alone will be the cause of all dharma.

original: abhirucir eva dāmpatyasaṃbandhahetuḥ /
analyzed: abhiruciḥ eva dāmpatya saṃbandha hetuḥ
translated: Affection alone is the cause of the relationship between husband and wife.

original: strītvam evopabhogahetuḥ /
analyzed: strī tvam eva upabhoga hetuḥ
translated: Womanhood alone is the cause of enjoyment.

original: anṛtam eva vyavahārajayahetuḥ /
analyzed: anṛtam eva vyavahāra jaya hetuḥ
translated: Falsehood alone is the cause of victory in legal disputes.

original: ratnatāmrabhāgitaiva pṛthivīhetuḥ /
analyzed: ratna tāmra bhāgitā eva pṛthivī hetuḥ
translated: Possession of jewels and copper alone is the cause of owning land.

original: brahmasūtram eva vipratvahetuḥ /
analyzed: brahmasūtram eva vipra tva hetuḥ
translated: The brahminical thread alone is the cause of being a brahmin.

original: liṅgadhāraṇam evāśramahetuḥ /🔽anyāya eva vṛttihetuḥ // / / //🔽daurbalyam evāvṛttihetuḥ /
analyzed: liṅga dhāraṇam eva āśrama hetuḥ  anyāyaḥ eva vṛtti hetuḥ  daurbalyam eva avṛtti hetuḥ
translated: Wearing the sacred thread alone is the cause of being in an ashrama.🔽Unrighteousness alone is the cause of livelihood.🔽Weakness alone is the cause of lack of livelihood.

original: bhayagarbhoccāraṇam eva pāṇḍityahetuḥ /
analyzed: bhaya garbha uccāraṇam eva pāṇḍitya hetuḥ
translated: Fearful utterance alone is the cause of being learned.

original: āḍhyataiva sādhutvahetuḥ // / / //
analyzed: āḍhya tā eva sādhu tva hetuḥ
translated: Wealth alone is the cause of being virtuous.

original: snānam eva prasādhanahetuḥ /
analyzed: snānam eva prasādhana hetuḥ
translated: Bathing alone is the cause of being well-groomed.

original: dānam eva dharmahetuḥ /
analyzed: dānam eva dharma hetuḥ
translated: Giving alone is the cause of dharma.

original: svīkaraṇam eva vivāhahetuḥ /
analyzed: svīkaraṇam eva vivāha hetuḥ
translated: Taking a wife alone is the cause of marriage.

original: sadveśadhāry eva pātram /
analyzed: sat veśa dhāri eva pātram
translated: One who wears good clothes is a worthy recipient.

original: dūrāyatanodakam eva tīrtham /
analyzed: dūra āyatana udakam eva tīrtham
translated: Water from a distant holy place alone is a holy place.

original: ity evam anekadoṣottare bhūmaṇḍale sarvavarṇeṣv eva yo yo balavān sa sa bhūpatir bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: iti evam aneka doṣa uttare bhū maṇḍale sarva varṇeṣu eva yaḥ yaḥ balavān sa sa bhūpatiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Thus, in this world-globe, which is full of many faults, whoever is powerful among all the castes will become the ruler of the land.

original: evaṃ cātilubdhakarabhārāsahāḥ śailānām antaradroṇīḥ prajāḥ saṃśrayiṣyanti /
analyzed: evam ca ati lubdha kara bhāra asahāḥ śailānām antara droṇīḥ prajāḥ saṃśrayiṣyanti
translated: And in this way, the people, unable to bear the heavy burden of excessive greed, will take refuge in the valleys between the mountains.

original: madhuśākamūlaphalapattrapuṣpādyāhārāś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: madhu śāka mūla phala pattra puṣpa ādi āhārāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will subsist on honey, vegetables, roots, fruits, leaves, flowers, and so on.

original: taruvalkalacīraprāvaraṇāś cātibahuprajāḥ śītavātātapavarṣasahā bhaviṣyanti /🔽na ca kaścit trayoviṃśativarṣāṇi jīviṣyati anavarataṃ cātra kaliyuge kṣayam āyāty akhila evaiṣa janaḥ kṣayam upaiṣyati // / / //
analyzed: taru valkala cīra prāvaraṇāḥ ca ati bahu prajāḥ śīta vāta ātapa varṣa sahāḥ bhaviṣyanti  na ca kaścid trayoviṃśati varṣāṇi jīviṣyati anavaratam ca atra kali yuge kṣayam āyāti akhilaḥ evā eṣa janaḥ kṣayam upaiṣyati
translated: They will wear garments of tree-bark and rags, have many children, and endure cold, wind, sun, and rain.🔽No one will live for more than twenty-three years, and in this Kali Yuga, all these people will continuously decline and perish.

original: śrautasmārtadharme viplavam atyantam upagate kṣīṇaprāye ca kalāv aśeṣajagatsraṣṭuś
analyzed: śrauta smārta dharme viplavam atyantam upagate kṣīṇa prāye ca kalau aśeṣa jagat sraṣṭuḥ
translated: When the Dharma of the Vedas and Smritis has completely declined and the Kali Yuga is almost over, the portion of the creator of the entire universe,

original: carācaraguror ādimayasyāntamayasya sarvamayasya brahmamayasyātmarūpiṇo bhagavato
analyzed: carācara guroḥ ādi mayasya anta mayasya sarva mayasya brahma mayasya ātma rūpiṇaḥ bhagavataḥ
translated: the primordial, final, all-pervading, Brahman-like, self-manifest Lord Vāsudeva, the guru of the moving and unmoving,

original: vāsudevasyāṃśaḥ śambalagrāmapradhānabrāhmaṇaviṣṇuyaśaso gṛhe 'ṣṭaguṇarddhisamanvitaḥ
analyzed: vāsudevasya aṃśaḥ śambala grāma pradhāna brāhmaṇa viṣṇuyaśasaḥ gṛhe ṣṭaguṇa ṛddhi samanvitaḥ
translated: will descend in the form of Kalki, the son of Viṣṇuyaśas, the chief Brahmin of the village of Śambhala, endowed with the eight supernatural powers,

original: kalkirūpī jagaty atrāvatīrya sakalamlecchadasyuduṣṭācaraṇacetasām aśeṣāṇām aparicchinnamāhātmyaśaktiḥ kṣayaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: kalki rūpī jagati atrā avatīrya sakala mleccha dasyu duṣṭa ācaraṇa cetasām aśeṣāṇām aparicchinna māhātmya śaktiḥ kṣayam kariṣyati
translated: and will destroy all the barbarians, robbers, and evil-doers in the world, whose strength and greatness are immeasurable.

original: svadharmeṣu cākhilaṃ jagat saṃsthāpayiṣyati /
analyzed: svadharmeṣu ca akhilam jagat saṃsthāpayiṣyati
translated: He will also establish the entire world in its own Dharma.

original: anantaraṃ cāśeṣakaler avasāne niśāvasānaprabuddhānāṃ teṣām eva janapadānām amalasphaṭikaviśuddhā matayo bhaviṣyanti // / / //
analyzed: anantaram ca aśeṣa kaleḥ avasāne niśā avasāna prabuddhānām teṣām eva janapadānām amala sphaṭika viśuddhāḥ matayaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And then, at the end of the entire Kali age, the minds of those very people awakened at the end of the night will become pure like clear crystal.

original: teṣāṃ ca bījabhūtānām aśeṣamanuṣyāṇāṃ pariṇatānām api tatkālakṛtānām apatyaprasūtir bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām ca bīja bhūtānām aśeṣa manuṣyāṇām pariṇatānām api tad kāla kṛtānām apatya prasūtiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And for those who are the seeds of all human beings, even those who have attained perfection, the birth of offspring will occur at that time.

original: tāni ca tadapatyāni kṛtayugadharmānusārīṇy eva bhaviṣyantīti // / / //
analyzed: tāni ca tad apatyāni kṛta yuga dharma anusārīṇi eva bhaviṣyanti iti
translated: And those offspring of theirs will follow the dharma of the Kṛta age alone.

original: atrocyate /🔽yadā candraś ca sūryaś ca yadā tiṣyabṛhaspatī /
analyzed: atra ucyate  yadā candraḥ ca sūryaḥ ca yadā tiṣya bṛhaspatī
translated: Here it is said:

original: ekarāśau sameṣyanti bhaviṣyati tadā kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: eka rāśau sameṣyanti bhaviṣyati tadā kṛtam
translated: When the moon, the sun, and Bṛhaspati of the Dvāpara age enter the same sign, then the Kṛta age will come.

original: atītā vartamānāś ca tathaivānāgatāś ca ye /
analyzed: atītāḥ vartamānāḥ ca tathā eva anāgatāḥ ca ye
translated: The kings of the past, present, and future,

original: ete vaṃśeṣu bhūpālāḥ kathitā munisattama // / / //
analyzed: ete vaṃśeṣu bhūpālāḥ kathitāḥ muni sattama
translated: these kings have been mentioned in the lineages, O best of sages.

original: yāvat parīkṣito janma yāvan nandābhiṣecanam /
analyzed: yāvat parīkṣitaḥ janma yāvat nanda abhiṣecanam
translated: From the birth of Parīkṣit up to the consecration of Nanda,

original: etad varṣasahasraṃ tu jñeyaṃ pañcadaśottaram // / / //
analyzed: etat varṣa sahasram tu jñeyam pañcadaśa uttaram
translated: this period should be known as one thousand and fifteen years.

original: saptarṣīṇāṃ tu yau pūrvau dṛśyete uditau divi /
analyzed: saptarṣīṇām tu yau pūrvau dṛśyete uditau divi
translated: The two former of the seven sages that are seen risen in the sky,

original: tayos tu madhye nakṣatraṃ dṛśyate yat samaṃ niśi /
analyzed: tayoḥ tu madhye nakṣatram dṛśyate yat samam niśi
translated: and the constellation that is seen in the middle of them at night,

original: tena saptarṣayo yuktās tiṣṭhanty abdaśataṃ nṛṇām // / / //
analyzed: tena saptarṣayaḥ yuktāḥ tiṣṭhanti abda śatam nṛṇām
translated: Therefore, the seven sages remain in conjunction with the stars for one hundred human years.

original: te tu pārīkṣite kāle maghāsv āsan dvijottama /
analyzed: te tu pārīkṣite kāle maghāsu āsan dvijottama
translated: O best of Brahmins, when that time of Parikshit arrived, they were in the Magha constellation.

original: tadā pravṛttaś ca kalir dvādaśābdaśatātmakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tadā pravṛttaḥ ca kaliḥ dvādaśa abda śata ātmakaḥ
translated: Then Kali, consisting of twelve hundred years, began.

original: yadaiva bhagavadviṣṇor aṃśo yāto divaṃ dvija /
analyzed: yadā eva bhagavat viṣṇoḥ aṃśaḥ yātaḥ divam dvija
translated: O Brahmin, as soon as the portion of Lord Vishnu went to heaven,

original: vasudevakulodbhūtas tadaivātrāgataḥ kaliḥ // / / //
analyzed: vasudeva kula udbhūtaḥ tadā eva atra āgataḥ kaliḥ
translated: Kali came here, born in the family of Vasudeva.

original: yāvat sa pādapadmābhyāṃ pasparśemāṃ vasuṃdharām /
analyzed: yāvat sa pāda padmābhyām pasparśa imām vasuṃdharām
translated: As long as he touched this earth with his lotus feet,

original: tāvat pṛthvīpariṣvaṅge samartho nābhavat kaliḥ // / / //
analyzed: tāvat pṛthvī pariṣvaṅge samarthaḥ nā abhavat kaliḥ
translated: Kali was not able to embrace the earth.

original: gate sanātanasyāṃśe viṣṇos tatra bhuvo divam /
analyzed: gate sanātanasya aṃśe viṣṇoḥ tatra bhuvaḥ divam
translated: When the eternal portion of Vishnu went from there to heaven,

original: tatyāja sānujo rājyaṃ dharmaputro yudhiṣṭhiraḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatyāja sa anujaḥ rājyam dharmaputraḥ yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: Yudhishthira, the son of Dharma, renounced the kingdom along with his younger brothers.

original: viparītāni dṛṣṭvā ca nimittāni sa pāṇḍavaḥ /
analyzed: viparītāni dṛṣṭvā ca nimittāni sa pāṇḍavaḥ
translated: And seeing inauspicious omens, that Pandava,

original: yāte kṛṣṇe cakārātha so 'bhiṣekaṃ parīkṣitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yāte kṛṣṇe cakāra atha saḥ bhiṣekam parīkṣitaḥ
translated: when Krishna had left, performed the consecration of Parikshit.

original: prayāsyanti yadā caite pūrvāṣāḍhāṃ maharṣayaḥ /
analyzed: prayāsyanti yadā ca ete pūrvāṣāḍhām mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: When these great sages will enter the constellation Purva Ashadha,

original: tadā nandāt prabhṛty eṣa kalir vṛddhiṃ gamiṣyati // / / //
analyzed: tadā nandāt prabhṛti eṣa kaliḥ vṛddhim gamiṣyati
translated: then this Kali will begin to increase from the month of Nanda.

original: yasmin kṛṣṇo divaṃ yātas tasminn eva tadāhani /
analyzed: yasmin kṛṣṇaḥ divam yātaḥ tasmin eva tadā ahani
translated: On that very day when Krishna went to heaven,

original: pratipannaṃ kaliyugaṃ tasya saṃkhyāṃ nibodha me // / / //🔽trīṇi lakṣāṇi varṣāṇāṃ dvija mānuṣasaṃkhyayā /
analyzed: pratipannam kali yugam tasya saṃkhyām nibodha me  trīṇi lakṣāṇi varṣāṇām dvija mānuṣa saṃkhyayā
translated: The Kali Yuga has set in. Listen to me as I tell you its duration.🔽Three hundred and sixty thousand years, O twice-born one, according to human calculation,

original: ṣaṣṭiṃ caiva sahasrāṇi bhaviṣyaty eṣa vai kaliḥ // / / //
analyzed: ṣaṣṭim ca eva sahasrāṇi bhaviṣyati eṣa vai kaliḥ
translated: will be the duration of this Kali Yuga.

original: śatāni tāni divyāni sapta pañca ca saṃkhyayā /
analyzed: śatāni tāni divyāni sapta pañca ca saṃkhyayā
translated: Those years, according to the divine reckoning, are five hundred and seventy.

original: niḥśeṣeṇa tatas tasmin bhaviṣyati punaḥ kṛtam // / / //
analyzed: niḥśeṣeṇa tatas tasmin bhaviṣyati punar kṛtam
translated: When that is over, the Krita Yuga will return again.

original: brāhmaṇāḥ kṣatriyā vaiśyāḥ śūdrāś ca dvijasattama /
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ kṣatriyāḥ vaiśyāḥ śūdrāḥ ca dvijasattama
translated: Brahmanas, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras, O best of Brahmanas,

original: yuge yuge mahātmānaḥ samatītāḥ sahasraśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yuge yuge mahātmānaḥ samatītāḥ sahasraśas
translated: in thousands, great souls, have passed away in every Yuga.

original: bahutvān nāmadheyānāṃ parisaṃkhyā kule kule /
analyzed: bahu tvāt nāmadheyānām parisaṃkhyā kule kule
translated: The names of many of them have been lost, and the families in which they were born have become extinct.

original: punaruktabahutvāt tu na mayā parikīrtitā // / / //
analyzed: punarukta bahu tvāt tu na mayā parikīrtitā
translated: Therefore, I do not mention them, lest I should have to repeat them again and again.

original: devāpiḥ pauravo rājā maruś cekṣvākuvaṃśajaḥ /
analyzed: devāpiḥ pauravaḥ rājā maruḥ ca ikṣvāku vaṃśa jaḥ
translated: King Devapi of the Puru race and Maru born in the Ikshvaku race,

original: mahāyogabalopetau kalāpagrāmasaṃśrayau // / / //🔽kṛte yuga ihāgatya kṣatraprāvartakau hi tau /
analyzed: mahā yoga bala upetau kalāpa grāma saṃśrayau  kṛte yuge iha āgatya kṣatra prāvartakau hi tau
translated: endowed with great Yoga power, took refuge in the village of Kalpa.🔽Having come here in the Krita Yuga, they became the founders of the Kshatriya race.

original: bhaviṣyato manor vaṃśabījabhūtau vyavasthitau // / / //
analyzed: bhaviṣyataḥ manoḥ vaṃśa bīja bhūtau vyavasthitau
translated: They remained as the seeds of Manu's future race.

original: etena kramayogena manuputrair vasuṃdharā /
analyzed: etena krama yogena manu putraiḥ vasuṃdharā
translated: By this order, the earth was ruled by the sons of Manu.

original: kṛtatretādisaṃjñāni yugāni trīṇi bhujyate // / / //
analyzed: kṛta tretā ādi saṃjñāni yugāni trīṇi bhujyate
translated: The three ages of Krita, Treta, etc., are enjoyed.

original: kalau tu bījabhūtās te kecit tiṣṭhanti bhūtale /
analyzed: kalau tu bīja bhūtāḥ te kecid tiṣṭhanti bhū tale
translated: But in Kali, some of them remain on the earth as seeds.

original: yathaiva devāpimarū sāmprataṃ samavasthitau // / / //
analyzed: yathā eva devāpi marū sāmpratam samavasthitau
translated: Just as the gods and demons are now in the same state.

original: eṣa tūddeśato vaṃśas tavokto bhūbhujāṃ mayā /
analyzed: eṣa tu uddeśataḥ vaṃśaḥ tava uktaḥ bhūbhujām mayā
translated: This genealogy of kings has been told to you by me in brief.

original: nikhilo gadituṃ śakyo naiva janmaśatair api // / / //
analyzed: nikhilaḥ gaditum śakyaḥ nā eva janma śataiḥ api
translated: It cannot be told completely even in a hundred births.

original: ete cānye ca bhūpālā yair atra kṣitimaṇḍale /
analyzed: ete ca anye ca bhūpālāḥ yaiḥ atra kṣiti maṇḍale
translated: These and other kings, by whom this earth was made their own,

original: kṛtaṃ mamatvaṃ mohāndhair nitye 'nityakalevaraiḥ // / / //🔽kathaṃ mameyam acalā matputrasya kathaṃ mahī /
analyzed: kṛtam mamatvam moha andhaiḥ nitye nitya kalevaraiḥ  katham mama iyam acalā mad putrasya katham mahī
translated: by those blinded by delusion, in this eternal and impermanent body.

original: madvaṃśasyeti cintārtā jagmur antam ime nṛpāḥ // / / //
analyzed: mad vaṃśasya iti cintā ārtāḥ jagmuḥ antam ime nṛpāḥ
translated: How can this earth be mine? How can it be my son's? How can it be my dynasty? Thus afflicted by thoughts, these kings have gone to their end.

original: tebhyaḥ pūrvatarāś cānye tebhyas tebhyas tathāpare /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ pūrvatarāḥ ca anye tebhyaḥ tebhyaḥ tathā apare
translated: Before them were others, and after them still others,

original: bhaviṣyāś caiva yāsyanti teṣām anye ca ye 'dhy anu // / / //
analyzed: bhaviṣyāḥ ca eva yāsyanti teṣām anye ca ye dhi anu
translated: and those who will come after them will also pass away.

original: vilokyātmajayodyogayātrāvyagrān narādhipān /
analyzed: vilokya ātmajayā udyoga yātrā vyagrān narādhipān
translated: Seeing the kings engrossed in the preparations for their sons' campaigns,

original: puṣpaprahāsaiḥ śaradi hasatīva vasuṃdharā // / / //
analyzed: puṣpa prahāsaiḥ śaradi hasati iva vasuṃdharā
translated: the earth seems to laugh in the autumn with the blossoming of flowers.

original: maitreya pṛthivīgītāḥ ślokāś cātra nibodha tān /
analyzed: maitreya pṛthivī gītāḥ ślokāḥ ca atra nibodha tān
translated: Maitreya, listen to the verses sung by the earth in this regard.

original: yān āha dharmadhvajine janakāyāsito muniḥ // / / //
analyzed: yān āha dharma dhvajine janakāya asitaḥ muniḥ
translated: which the sage Asita told to the king Janaka, the banner of righteousness.

original: pṛthivī uvāca /🔽katham eṣa narendrāṇāṃ moho buddhimatām api /
analyzed: pṛthivī uvāca  katham eṣa narendrāṇām mohaḥ buddhimatām api
translated: The Earth said:🔽How is it that even the wise kings are deluded,

original: yena phenasadharmāṇo 'py ativiśvastacetasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yena phena sadharmāṇaḥ pi ati viśvasta cetasaḥ
translated: by which they, though having the nature of foam, are extremely confident in their minds?

original: pūrvam ātmajayaṃ kṛtvā jetum icchanti mantriṇaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvam ātma jayam kṛtvā jetum icchanti mantriṇaḥ
translated: Having first conquered themselves, the ministers wish to conquer,

original: tato bhṛtyāṃś ca paurāṃś ca jigīṣante tathā ripūn // / / //
analyzed: tatas bhṛtyān ca paurān ca jigīṣante tathā ripūn
translated: then the servants, citizens, and enemies in the same way.

original: krameṇānena jeṣyāmo vayaṃ pṛthvīṃ sasāgarām /
analyzed: krameṇa anena jeṣyāmaḥ vayam pṛthvīm sa sāgarām
translated: By this sequence, we will conquer the earth with its oceans,

original: ity āsaktadhiyo mṛtyuṃ na paśyanty avidūragam // / / //
analyzed: iti āsakta dhiyaḥ mṛtyum na paśyanti avidūra gam
translated: thus their minds are attached, and they do not see death coming from afar.

original: samudrāvaraṇaṃ yāti manmaṇḍalam atho vaśam /
analyzed: samudra āvaraṇam yāti mad maṇḍalam atho vaśam
translated: Then the circle of my dominion goes under the control of the ocean.

original: kiyad ātmajayād etan muktir ātmajaye phalam // / / //
analyzed: kiyat ātma jayāt etat muktiḥ ātma jaye phalam
translated: How much is this from self-conquest? The fruit of self-conquest is liberation.

original: utsṛjya pūrvajā yātā yāṃ nādāya gataḥ pitā /
analyzed: utsṛjya pūrva jā yātā yām na ādāya gataḥ pitā
translated: The ancestors have gone, leaving her, and the father has gone without taking her.

original: tāṃ mameti vimūḍhatvāj jetum icchanti pārthivāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tām mama iti vimūḍha tvāt jetum icchanti pārthivāḥ
translated: The kings, out of delusion, wish to conquer her, thinking, She is mine.

original: matkṛte pitṛputrāṇāṃ bhrātṝṇāṃ cāpi vigrahāḥ /
analyzed: mad kṛte pitṛ putrāṇām bhrātṝṇām ca api vigrahāḥ
translated: For my sake, there are disputes between fathers and sons, and also between brothers,

original: jāyante 'tyantamohena mamatvādṛtacetasām // / / //
analyzed: jāyante tyanta mohena mamatva ādṛta cetasām
translated: arising from extreme delusion, with minds devoted to ownership.

original: pṛthvī mameyaṃ sakalā mameyaṃ madanvayasyāpi ca śāśvateyam /
analyzed: pṛthvī mama iyam sakalā mama iyam mad anvayasya api ca śāśvatā iyam
translated: This whole earth is mine, and it is also mine for my descendants for ever.

original: yo yo mṛto hy atra babhūva rājā kubuddhir āsīd iti tasya tasya // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ yaḥ mṛtaḥ hi atra babhūva rājā kubuddhiḥ āsīt iti tasya tasya
translated: And, Whatever king has died here, he was of wicked understanding.

original: dṛṣṭvā mamatvādṛtacittam ekaṃ vihāya māṃ mṛtyupathaṃ vrajantam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā mamatva ādṛta cittam ekam vihāya mām mṛtyu patham vrajantam
translated: Seeing one whose mind is attached to the idea of mine, and who, abandoning me, goes along the path of death,

original: tasyānvayasthasya kathaṃ mamatvaṃ hṛdy āspadaṃ matprabhavaṃ karoti // / / //
analyzed: tasya anvaya sthasya katham mamatvam hṛdi āspadam mad prabhavam karoti
translated: How can the idea of mine, which is the abode in the heart, be produced in his descendant by me?

original: pṛthvī mamaiṣāśu parityajaināṃ vadanti ye dūtamukhaiḥ svaśatrum /
analyzed: pṛthvī mama eṣā āśu parityaja enām vadanti ye dūta mukhaiḥ sva śatrum
translated: Those kings who say to their enemies through messengers, This earth is mine, quickly abandon it,

original: narādhipās teṣu mamātihāsaḥ punaś ca mūḍheṣu dayābhyupaiti // / / //
analyzed: narādhipāḥ teṣu mama ati hāsaḥ punar ca mūḍheṣu dayā abhyupaiti
translated: In them, I have fear, and compassion arises again for those fools.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity ete dharaṇīgītāḥ ślokā maitreya yaiḥ śrutaiḥ /
analyzed: iti ete dharaṇī gītāḥ ślokāḥ maitreya yaiḥ śrutaiḥ
translated: O Maitreya, these verses sung by the earth are the ones by hearing which,

original: mamatvaṃ vilayaṃ yāti tāpanyastaṃ yathā himam // / / //
analyzed: mamatvam vilayam yāti tāpa nyastam yathā himam
translated: The idea of mine is destroyed, just as snow is melted by the sun.

original: ity eṣa kathitaḥ samyaṅ manor vaṃśo mayā tava /
analyzed: iti eṣa kathitaḥ samyak manoḥ vaṃśaḥ mayā tava
translated: Thus this lineage of Manu has been fully described to you by me,

original: yatra sthitipravṛttasya viṣṇor aṃśāṃśakā nṛpāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yatra sthiti pravṛttasya viṣṇoḥ aṃśa aṃśakāḥ nṛpāḥ
translated: In which the kings are the parts and portions of Vishnu, who is engaged in maintaining the world.

original: śṛṇoti ya imaṃ bhaktyā manor vaṃśam anukramāt /
analyzed: śṛṇoti yaḥ imam bhaktyā manoḥ vaṃśam anukramāt
translated: He who listens to this lineage of Manu in due order with devotion,🔽 And recites it to the best of his ability, obtains the fruit of a horse sacrifice.

original: tasya pāpam aśeṣaṃ vai praṇaśyaty amalātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasya pāpam aśeṣam vai praṇaśyati amala ātmanaḥ
translated: The entire sin of that pure-souled one perishes.

original: dhanadhānyarddhim atulāṃ prāpnoty avyāhatendriyaḥ /
analyzed: dhana dhānya ṛddhim atulām prāpnoti avyāhata indriyaḥ
translated: He obtains unparalleled prosperity in wealth and grain, with unimpaired senses.

original: śrutvaivam akhilaṃ vaṃśaṃ praśastaṃ śaśisūryayoḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā evam akhilam vaṃśam praśastam śaśi sūryayoḥ
translated: Having heard the entire lineage, praised by the moon and the sun,

original: ikṣvākujahnumāndhātṛsagarāvikṣitān raghūn // / / //
analyzed: ikṣvāku jahnu māndhātṛ sagara āvikṣitān raghūn
translated: Of Ikṣvāku, Jahnu, Māndhātṛ, Sagara, Aṅga, Riṣṭa,

original: yayātinahuṣādyāṃś ca jñātvā niṣṭhām upāgatān /
analyzed: yayāti nahuṣa ādyān ca jñātvā niṣṭhām upāgatān
translated: And having known Yayāti, Nahuṣa and others who have reached their end,

original: mahābalān mahāvīryān anantadhanasaṃcayān // / / //
analyzed: mahā balān mahā vīryān ananta dhana saṃcayān
translated: The greatly powerful, greatly valorous, and possessors of infinite wealth,

original: kṛtān kālena balinā kathāśeṣān narādhipān // / / //🔽śrutvā na putradārādau gṛhakṣetrādike tathā /
analyzed: kṛtān kālena balinā kathā śeṣān narādhipān  śrutvā na putra dāra ādau gṛha kṣetra ādike tathā
translated: The kings who have been made mere stories by powerful Time,🔽Having heard this, a wise man does not develop a sense of ownership

original: dravyādau vā kṛtaprajño mamatvaṃ kurute naraḥ // / / //🔽taptaṃ tapo yaiḥ puruṣapravīrair udbāhubhir varṣagaṇān anekān /
analyzed: dravya ādau vā kṛtaprajñaḥ mamatvam kurute naraḥ  taptam tapaḥ yaiḥ puruṣa pravīraiḥ udbāhubhiḥ varṣa gaṇān anekān
translated: In sons, wife, house, field, etc., or in wealth, etc.🔽The heroes who performed austerities for many years with outstretched arms,

original: iṣṭāś ca yajñā balino 'tivīryāḥ kṛtās tu kālena kathāvaśeṣāḥ // / / //
analyzed: iṣṭāḥ ca yajñāḥ balinaḥ tivīryāḥ kṛtāḥ tu kālena kathā avaśeṣāḥ
translated: And who performed sacrifices, were powerful and greatly valorous, have been made mere stories by Time.

original: pṛthuḥ samastān pracacāra lokān avyāhato yo 'rividāricakraḥ /
analyzed: pṛthuḥ samastān pracacāra lokān avyāhataḥ yaḥ rividāri cakraḥ
translated: Pṛthu, who conquered his enemies and roamed through all the worlds unhindered,

original: sa kālavātābhihato vinaṣṭaḥ kṣiptaṃ yathā śālmalitūlam agnau // / / //
analyzed: sa kāla vāta abhihataḥ vinaṣṭaḥ kṣiptam yathā śālmali tūlam agnau
translated: Destroyed by the winds of time, like cotton fluff cast into a fire.

original: yaḥ kārtavīryo bubhuje samastān dvīpān samākramya hatāricakraḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ kārtavīryaḥ bubhuje samastān dvīpān samākramya hata ari cakraḥ
translated: Kartavīrya, who enjoyed all the continents after conquering them, having destroyed the wheel of enemies,

original: kathāprasaṅgeṣv abhidhīyamānaḥ sa eva saṃkalpavikalpahetuḥ // / / //
analyzed: kathā prasaṅgeṣu abhidhīyamānaḥ saḥ eva saṃkalpa vikalpa hetuḥ
translated: Is the cause of imagination and doubt when mentioned in stories.

original: daśānanāvīkṣitarāghavāṇām aiśvaryam udbhāsitadiṅmukhānām /
analyzed: daśānana avīkṣita rāghavāṇām aiśvaryam udbhāsita diṅmukhānām
translated: The prosperity of the ten-headed Rāvaṇa, who illuminated the directions,

original: bhasmāpi jātaṃ na kathaṃ kṣaṇena bhrūbhaṅgapātena dhig antakasya // / / //
analyzed: bhasma api jātam na katham kṣaṇena bhrū bhaṅga pātena dhik antakasya
translated: How was it reduced to ashes in an instant by the mere lowering of Śiva's brow? Shame on Death!

original: kathāśarīratvam avāpa yad vai māndhātṛnāmā bhuvi cakravartī /
analyzed: kathā śarīra tvam avāpa yat vai māndhātṛ nāmā bhuvi cakravartī
translated: The one who became the body of the story, the universal monarch named Māndhātṛ on earth,

original: śrutvāpi taṃ ko hi karoti sādhur mamatvam ātmany api mandacetāḥ // / / //
analyzed: śrutvā api tam kaḥ hi karoti sādhuḥ mamatvam ātmani api manda cetāḥ
translated: Having heard about him, what good person of dull mind would have a sense of ownership even in himself?

original: bhagīrathādyāḥ sagaraḥ kakutstho daśānano rāghavalakṣmaṇau ca /
analyzed: bhagīratha ādyāḥ sagaraḥ kakutsthaḥ daśānanaḥ rāghava lakṣmaṇau ca
translated: Bhīma, Arjuna, Karṇa, Śalya, the Pāṇḍavas, the Kauravas, Bhagīratha and others, Sagara, Kakutstha, Rāvaṇa, Rāma and Lakṣmaṇa,

original: yudhiṣṭhirādyāś ca babhūvur ete satyaṃ na mithyā kva nu te na vidmaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhira ādyāḥ ca babhūvuḥ ete satyam na mithyā kva nu te na vidmaḥ
translated: Yudhiṣṭhira and others - these all existed. We do not know where those truths are now, whether they are true or false.

original: ye sāmprataṃ ye ca nṛpā bhaviṣyāḥ proktā mayā vipravarogravīryāḥ /
analyzed: ye sāmpratam ye ca nṛpāḥ bhaviṣyāḥ proktāḥ mayā vipra vara ugra vīryāḥ
translated: The present kings and those future kings of fierce valor mentioned by me, O best of brahmins,

original: ye te tathānye ca tathābhidheyāḥ sarve bhaviṣyanti yathaiva pūrve // / / //
analyzed: ye te tathā anye ca tathā abhidheyāḥ sarve bhaviṣyanti yathā eva pūrve
translated: And those that are mentioned in the same way, all will be as they were before.

original: etad viditvā na nareṇa kāryaṃ mamatvam ātmany api paṇḍitena /
analyzed: etat viditvā na nareṇa kāryam mamatvam ātmani api paṇḍitena
translated: Knowing this, a wise man should not have a sense of ownership even towards himself.

original: tiṣṭhantu tāvat tanayātmajāyāḥ kṣetrādayo ye tu śarīrato 'nye // / / //🔽iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe caturthe 'ṃśe caturviṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: tiṣṭhantu tāvat tanaya ātmajāyāḥ kṣetra ādayaḥ ye tu śarīrataḥ nye  iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe caturthe ṃśe caturviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Let alone the sons, grandsons, wives, fields, and others that are different from the body.

original: V ins /
analyzed: u ins
translated: Thus ends the twenty-fourth chapter in the fourth section of the Visnu Purana, describing the genealogy of kings.🔽[End of the fourth section on the genealogy of kings.]

original: śrīmate rāmānujāya namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śrīmate rāmānujāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the illustrious Ramanuja.

original: maitreya uvāca /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca
translated: Maitreya said:

original: nṛpāṇāṃ kathitaḥ sarvo bhavatā vaṃśavistaraḥ /
analyzed: nṛpāṇām kathitaḥ sarvaḥ bhavatā vaṃśa vistaraḥ
translated: You have told me the entire genealogy of kings,

original: vaṃśānucaritaṃ caiva yathāvad anuvarṇitam // / / //🔽aṃśāvatāro brahmarṣe yo 'yaṃ yadukulodbhavaḥ /
analyzed: vaṃśānucaritam ca eva yathāvat anuvarṇitam  aṃśa avatāraḥ brahmarṣe yaḥ yam yadukulodbhavaḥ
translated: And described the history of the dynasties as it truly occurred.

original: viṣṇos taṃ vistareṇāhaṃ śrotum icchāmy aśeṣataḥ // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ tam vistareṇa aham śrotum icchāmi aśeṣatas
translated: O brahmin sage, I wish to hear in detail about the partial incarnations of Vishnu that have appeared in the Yadu dynasty.

original: cakāra yāni karmāṇi bhagavān puruṣottamaḥ /
analyzed: cakāra yāni karmāṇi bhagavān puruṣottamaḥ
translated: The deeds that the Lord, the Supreme Being, performed

original: aṃśāṃśenāvatīryorvyāṃ tatra tāni mune vada // / / //
analyzed: aṃśāṃśena avatīrya urvyām tatra tāni mune vada
translated: By descending in part on earth, tell me about them, O sage.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: maitreya śrūyatām etad yat pṛṣṭo 'ham iha tvayā /
analyzed: maitreya śrūyatām etat yat pṛṣṭaḥ ham iha tvayā
translated: Maitreya, listen to this, which you have asked me about here.

original: viṣṇor aṃśāṃśasaṃbhūticaritaṃ jagato hitam // / / //🔽devakasya sutāṃ pūrvaṃ vasudevo mahāmune /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ aṃśa aṃśa saṃbhūti caritam jagataḥ hitam  devakasya sutām pūrvam vasudevaḥ mahā mune
translated: The story of the birth of Vishnu's portion, for the good of the world.🔽O great sage, Vasudeva, the son of Devaka,

original: upayeme mahābhāgāṃ devakīṃ devatopamām // / / //🔽kaṃsas tayor vararathaṃ codayām āsa sārathiḥ /
analyzed: upayeme mahābhāgām devakīm devatā upamām  kaṃsaḥ tayoḥ vara ratham codayām āsa sārathiḥ
translated: married Devaki, the daughter of Devaka, who was greatly fortunate and equal to a goddess.🔽Kamsa, the enhancer of the Bhoja dynasty,

original: vasudevasya devakyāḥ saṃyoge bhojavardhanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vasudevasya devakyāḥ saṃyoge bhojavardhanaḥ
translated: urged the charioteer to drive the excellent chariot of the two, when Vasudeva and Devaki were united.

original: athāntarikṣe vāg uccaiḥ kaṃsam ābhāṣya sādaram /
analyzed: atha antarikṣe vāc uccais kaṃsam ābhāṣya sa ādaram
translated: Then a voice from the sky, addressing Kamsa respectfully,

original: meghagambhīranirghoṣaṃ samābhāṣyedam abravīt // / / //
analyzed: megha gambhīra nirghoṣam samābhāṣya idam abravīt
translated: spoke these words in a voice deep like the rumbling of clouds.

original: yām enāṃ vahase mūḍha saha bhartrā rathe sthitām /
analyzed: yām enām vahase mūḍha saha bhartrā rathe sthitām
translated: O fool, you are carrying her, seated in the chariot with her husband.

original: asyās tavāṣṭamo garbhaḥ prāṇān apahariṣyati // / / //
analyzed: asyāḥ tava aṣṭamaḥ garbhaḥ prāṇān apahariṣyati
translated: Her eighth child will take away your life.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity ākarṇya samādāya khaḍgaṃ kaṃso mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: iti ākarṇya samādāya khaḍgam kaṃsaḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: Having heard this, the greatly powerful Kamsa took up his sword.

original: devakīṃ hantum ārabdho vasudevo 'bravīd idam // / / //
analyzed: devakīm hantum ārabdhaḥ vasudevaḥ bravīt idam
translated: And was about to kill Devaki, when Vasudeva said this:

original: na hantavyā mahābhāga devakī bhavatā tava /
analyzed: na hantavyā mahābhāga devakī bhavatā tava
translated: O greatly fortunate one, Devaki should not be killed by you.

original: samarpayiṣye sakalān garbhān asyāudarodbhavān // / / //
analyzed: samarpayiṣye sakalān garbhān
translated: I will give you all the children born from her womb.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tathety āha ca taṃ kaṃso vasudevaṃ dvijottama /
analyzed: tathā iti āha ca tam kaṃsaḥ vasudevam dvijottama
translated: O best of the twice-born, Kamsa said to Vasudeva, So be it.

original: na ghātayām āsa ca tāṃ devakīṃ tasya gauravāt // / / //
analyzed: na ghātayām āsa ca tām devakīm tasya gauravāt
translated: And out of respect for him, he did not kill Devaki.

original: etasminn eva kāle tu bhūribhārāvapīḍitā /🔽jagāma dharaṇī merau samāje tridivaukasām // / / //
analyzed: etasmin eva kāle tu bhūri bhāra avapīḍitā  jagāma dharaṇī merau samāje tridivaukasām
translated: At this very time, the earth, afflicted by the weight of many burdens,🔽went to the assembly of the heaven-dwellers on Meru.

original: sabrahmakān surān sarvān praṇipatyātha medinī /
analyzed: sa brahmakān surān sarvān praṇipatya atha medinī
translated: The earth, after bowing to all the gods with Brahma,

original: kathayām āsa tat sarvaṃ khedāt karuṇabhāṣiṇī // / / //
analyzed: kathayām āsa tat sarvam khedāt karuṇa bhāṣiṇī
translated: told them all that, out of sorrow, in a piteous voice.

original: bhūmir uvāca /
analyzed: bhūmiḥ uvāca
translated: The Earth said:

original: agniḥ suvarṇasya gurur gavāṃ sūryaḥ paro guruḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ suvarṇasya guruḥ gavām sūryaḥ paraḥ guruḥ
translated: Fire is the preceptor of gold, the sun is the supreme preceptor of cows,

original: mamāpy akhilalokānāṃ gurur nārāyaṇo guruḥ // / / //
analyzed: mama api akhila lokānām guruḥ nārāyaṇaḥ guruḥ
translated: and Narayana is the preceptor of me and all the worlds.

original: prajāpatipatir brahmā pūrveṣām api pūrvajaḥ /
analyzed: prajāpati patiḥ brahmā pūrveṣām api pūrvajaḥ
translated: Brahma, the lord of Prajapati, is the first of the first-born,

original: kalākāṣṭhānimeṣātmā kālaś cāvyaktamūrtimān // / / //
analyzed: kalā kāṣṭhā nimeṣa ātmā kālaḥ ca avyakta mūrtimān
translated: and time, with its essence of unmanifest form, has the nature of kalas, kashthas, and nimeshas.

original: tadaṃśabhūtaḥ sarveṣāṃ samūho vaḥ surottamāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tad aṃśa bhūtaḥ sarveṣām samūhaḥ vaḥ sura uttamāḥ
translated: O best of the gods, the collection of you all is a part of that.

original: ādityā marutaḥ sādhyā rudrā vasvaśvivahnayaḥ /
analyzed: ādityāḥ marutaḥ sādhyāḥ rudrāḥ vasu aśvi vahnayaḥ
translated: The Adityas, Maruts, Sadhyas, Rudras, Vasus, Ashvins, and Agni,

original: pitaro ye ca lokānāṃ sraṣṭāro 'tripurogamāḥ // / / //
analyzed: pitaraḥ ye ca lokānām tri purogamāḥ
translated: and the ancestors who are the creators of the worlds, headed by Atri,

original: etat tasyāprameyasya rūpaṃ viṣṇor mahātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: etat tasya aprameyasya rūpam viṣṇoḥ mahātmanaḥ
translated: this is the form of that immeasurable, great-souled Vishnu.

original: yakṣarākṣasadaiteyā piśācoragadānavāḥ /
analyzed: yakṣa rākṣasa daiteyā piśāca uraga dānavāḥ
translated: Yakshas, Rakshasas, Daityas, Pisachas, Uragas, Danavas,

original: gandharvāpsarasaś caiva rūpaṃ viṣṇor mahātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: gandharva apsarasaḥ ca eva rūpam viṣṇoḥ mahātmanaḥ
translated: Gandharvas and Apsaras - all these are forms of the great Vishnu.

original: graharkṣatārakācitragaganāgnijalānilāḥ /
analyzed: graha ṛkṣa tārakā citra gagana agni jala anilāḥ
translated: The planets, stars, constellations, the sky, fire, water and air,

original: ahaṃ ca viṣayāś caitat sarvaṃ viṣṇumayaṃ jagat // / / //
analyzed: aham ca viṣayāḥ ca etat sarvam viṣṇu mayam jagat
translated: And I myself, and all these objects of the senses - the entire universe is pervaded by Vishnu.

original: tathāpy anekarūpasya tasya rūpāṇy aharniśam /
analyzed: tathā api aneka rūpasya tasya rūpāṇi aharniśam
translated: Even so, the various forms of Him, who is of manifold forms,

original: bādhyabādhakatāṃ yānti kallolā iva sāgare // / / //
analyzed: bādhya bādhaka tām yānti kallolāḥ iva sāgare
translated: Are seen to be mutually destructive, like the waves of the ocean.

original: tatsāmpratam ime daityāḥ kālanemipurogamāḥ /
analyzed: tat sāmpratam ime daityāḥ kālanemi purogamāḥ
translated: Now these Daityas, headed by Kalaneemi,

original: martyalokaṃ samākramya bādhante 'harniśaṃ prajāḥ // / / //
analyzed: martya lokam samākramya bādhante harniśam prajāḥ
translated: Having invaded the mortal world, are afflicting the people day and night.

original: kālanemir hato yo 'sau viṣṇunā prabhaviṣṇunā /
analyzed: kālanemiḥ hataḥ yaḥ sau viṣṇunā prabhaviṣṇunā
translated: That Kalaneemi, who was slain by Vishnu, the powerful one,

original: ugrasenasutaḥ kaṃsaḥ saṃbhūtaḥ sa mahāsuraḥ // / / //
analyzed: ugrasena sutaḥ kaṃsaḥ saṃbhūtaḥ sa mahā asuraḥ
translated: Has been born again as the great Asura Kansa, the son of Ugrasena.

original: ariṣṭo dhenukaḥ keśī pralambo narakas tathā /
analyzed: ariṣṭaḥ dhenukaḥ keśī pralambaḥ narakaḥ tathā
translated: Arishta, Dhenuka, Keshi, Pralamba, Naraka,

original: sundo 'suras tathātyugro bāṇaś cāpi baleḥ sutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sundo suraḥ tathā ati ugraḥ bāṇaḥ ca api baleḥ sutaḥ
translated: The Asura Sunda, the fierce Baka, and also Vana, the son of Bali,

original: tathānye ca mahāvīryā nṛpāṇāṃ bhavaneṣu ye /
analyzed: tathā anye ca mahā vīryāḥ nṛpāṇām bhavaneṣu ye
translated: And other greatly powerful ones, who have been born in the palaces of kings,

original: samutpannā durātmānas tān na saṃkhyātum utsahe // / / //
analyzed: samutpannāḥ durātmānaḥ tān na saṃkhyātum utsahe
translated: I dare not enumerate those wicked-souled ones.

original: akṣauhiṇyo 'tra bahulā divyamūrtidharāḥ surāḥ /
analyzed: akṣauhiṇyaḥ tra bahulāḥ divya mūrti dharāḥ surāḥ
translated: O gods, here are many Akshauhinis (of troops), having divine forms.

original: mahābalānāṃ dṛptānāṃ daityendrāṇāṃ mamopari // / / //
analyzed: mahā balānām dṛptānām daitya indrāṇām mama upari
translated: The haughty and mighty kings of the Daityas are on my head.

original: tadbhūribhārapīḍārtā na śaknomy amareśvarāḥ /
analyzed: tad bhūri bhāra pīḍā ārtā na śaknomi amara īśvarāḥ
translated: O lords of the immortals, afflicted by the heavy burden, I am unable to bear myself.

original: bibhartum ātmānam aham iti vijñāpayāmi vaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bibhartum ātmānam aham iti vijñāpayāmi vaḥ
translated: I inform you thus.

original: kriyatāṃ tan mahābhāgā mama bhārāvatāraṇam /
analyzed: kriyatām tat mahābhāgāḥ mama bhāra avatāraṇam
translated: O greatly fortunate ones, do that which will lighten my burden.

original: yathā rasātalaṃ nāhaṃ gaccheyam ativihvalā // / / //
analyzed: yathā rasātalam na aham gaccheyam ati vihvalā
translated: So that I may not go to the nether regions, extremely distressed.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽ity ākarṇya dharāvākyam aśeṣaṃ tridaśais tataḥ /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  iti ākarṇya dharā vākyam aśeṣam tridaśaiḥ tatas
translated: Parashara said:🔽Having heard these words of the earth in their entirety, the gods

original: bhuvo bhārāvatārārthaṃ brahmā prāha pracoditaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhuvaḥ bhāra avatāra artham brahmā prāha pracoditaḥ
translated: urged Brahma to speak for the removal of the earth's burden.

original: brahmovāca /
analyzed: brahmā uvāca
translated: Brahma said:

original: yathāha vasudhā sarvaṃ satyam etad divaukasaḥ /
analyzed: yathā āha vasudhā sarvam satyam etat divaukasaḥ
translated: O dwellers of heaven, all this that the earth has said is true.

original: ahaṃ bhavo bhavantaś ca sarvaṃ nārāyaṇātmakam // / / //🔽vibhūtayas tu yās tasya tāsām eva parasparam /
analyzed: aham bhavaḥ bhavantaḥ ca sarvam nārāyaṇa ātmakam  vibhūtayaḥ tu yāḥ tasya tāsām eva parasparam
translated: I, Shiva, and you all are forms of Narayana.

original: ādhikyanyūnatā bādhyabādhakatvena vartate // / / //
analyzed: ādhikya nyūna tā bādhya bādhaka tvena vartate
translated: But the superiority and inferiority of His manifestations are due to the relation of the conqueror and the conquered.

original: tad āgacchata gacchāmaḥ kṣīrābdhes taṭam uttaram /
analyzed: tat āgacchata gacchāmaḥ kṣīrābdheḥ taṭam uttaram
translated: Therefore, let us go to the northern shore of the Milk Ocean.

original: tatrārādhya hariṃ tasmai sarvaṃ vijñāpayāma vai // / / //
analyzed: tatra ārādhya harim tasmai sarvam vijñāpayāma vai
translated: There, having propitiated Hari, we shall inform him everything.

original: sarvadaiva jagaty arthe sa sarvātmā jaganmayaḥ /
analyzed: sarvadā eva jagatī arthe sa sarva ātmā jagat mayaḥ
translated: For the sake of the world, he, the soul of all, the essence of the universe,

original: svalpāṃśenāvatīryorvyāṃ dharmasya kurute sthitim // / / //
analyzed: su alpa aṃśena avatīrya urvyām dharmasya kurute sthitim
translated: having descended with a small portion on the earth, establishes righteousness.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity uktvā prayayau tatra saha devaiḥ pitāmahaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktvā prayayau tatra saha devaiḥ pitāmahaḥ
translated: Having said this, the Grandfather went there with the gods.

original: samāhitamatiś cainaṃ tuṣṭāva garuḍadhvajam // / / //
analyzed: samāhita matiḥ ca enam tuṣṭāva garuḍadhvajam
translated: And with a concentrated mind, he praised the Garudabana (Garudabana?).

original: brahmovāca /
analyzed: brahmā uvāca
translated: Brahma said:

original: dve vidye tvam anāmnāya parā caivāparā tathā /
analyzed: dve vidye tvam an āmnāya parā ca eva aparā tathā
translated: You are the two kinds of knowledge, the unmanifest and the manifest,

original: ta eva bhavato rūpe mūrtāmūrtātmike prabho // / / //
analyzed: te eva bhavataḥ rūpe mūrta amūrta ātmike prabho
translated: And those two are your forms, O Lord, consisting of the manifest and the unmanifest.

original: dve brahmaṇī tv aṇīyo 'tisthūlātman sarvasarvavit /
analyzed: dve brahmaṇī tu tisthūla ātman sarva sarva vid
translated: You are the two Brahmas, subtler than the subtle and greater than the great, O knower of all,

original: śabdabrahmaparaṃ caiva brahma brahmamayasya yat // / / //
analyzed: śabdabrahma param ca eva brahma brahma mayasya yat
translated: The supreme Brahman, which is the Brahman of the Brahman consisting of the Vedas.

original: ṛgvedas tvaṃ yajurvedaḥ sāmavedas tv atharva ca /
analyzed: ṛgvedaḥ tvam yajurvedaḥ sāmavedaḥ tu atharva ca
translated: You are the Rig Veda, the Yajur Veda, the Sama Veda, and the Atharva Veda,

original: śikṣā kalpo niruktaṃ ca chando jyotiṣam eva ca // / / //
analyzed: śikṣā kalpaḥ niruktam ca chandaḥ jyotiṣam eva ca
translated: The Siksha, the Kalpa, the Nirukta, the Chandas, and the Jyotisha.

original: itihāsapurāṇe ca tathā vyākaraṇaṃ prabho /
analyzed: itihāsa purāṇe ca tathā vyākaraṇam prabho
translated: You are the Itihasa, the Purana, and also the grammar, O Lord,

original: mīmāṃsā nyāyikaṃ tadvad dharmaśāstrāṇy adhokṣaja // / / //
analyzed: mīmāṃsā nyāyikam tadvat dharma śāstrāṇi adhokṣaja
translated: The Mimamsa, the Nyaya, and the Dharma Shastras, O Adhokshaja (Vishnu).

original: ātmātmadehaguṇavadvicārācāri yad vacaḥ /
analyzed: ātma ātma deha guṇavat vicāra ācāri yat vacaḥ
translated: That speech which moves in the investigation of the qualities of the self, the body and the self,

original: tad apy ādyapate nānyad adhyātmātmasvarūpavat // / / //
analyzed: tat api ādya pate na anyat adhyātma ātma sva rūpavat
translated: That also, O Lord of the beginning, is not different from the form of the self of the inner self.

original: tvam avyaktam anirdeśyam acintyānāmavarṇavat /
analyzed: tvam avyaktam anirdeśyam acintyānām avarṇavat
translated: You are the unmanifest, indescribable, inconceivable, nameless, formless,

original: apāṇipādarūpaṃ ca viṣṇur nityaṃ parāt param // / / //
analyzed: a pāṇi pāda rūpam ca viṣṇuḥ nityam parāt param
translated: Vishnu, always higher than the highest, without hands and feet.

original: śṛṇoṣy akarṇaḥ paripaśyasi tvam acakṣur eko bahurūparūpaḥ /
analyzed: śṛṇoṣi a karṇaḥ paripaśyasi tvam a cakṣuḥ ekaḥ bahu rūpa rūpaḥ
translated: You hear without ears, you see without eyes, alone, with many forms,

original: apādahasto javano grahītā tvaṃ vetsi sarvaṃ na ca sarvavedyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: a pāda hastaḥ javanaḥ grahītā tvam vetsi sarvam na ca sarva vedyaḥ
translated: Without feet and hands, swift, the grasper, you know everything, but you are not known by all.

original: aṇor aṇīyāṃsam asatsvarūpaṃ tvāṃ paśyato 'jñānanivṛttir agryā /
analyzed: aṇoḥ aṇīyāṃsam asat svarūpam tvām paśyataḥ jñāna nivṛttiḥ agryā
translated: For one who sees you, smaller than the smallest, of unreal form, the cessation of ignorance is supreme.

original: dhīr asya dhīryasya bibharti nānyad vareṇyarūpāt parataḥ parātman // / / //
analyzed: dhīḥ asya dhīḥ yasya bibharti na anyat vareṇya rūpāt paratas parātman
translated: The intellect of the one who has that intellect bears nothing else but the form of the most excellent Self, O Supreme Self beyond the highest.

original: tvaṃ viśvam ādir bhuvanasya goptā sarvāṇi bhūtāni tavāntarāṇi /
analyzed: tvam viśvam ādiḥ bhuvanasya goptā sarvāṇi bhūtāni tava antarāṇi
translated: You are the universe, the beginning, the protector of the world, all beings are within you.

original: yad bhūtabhavyaṃ tad aṇor aṇīyaḥ pumāṃs tvam ekaḥ prakṛteḥ parastāt // / / //
analyzed: yat bhūta bhavyam tat aṇoḥ aṇīyaḥ pumān tvam ekaḥ prakṛteḥ parastāt
translated: What is past and future, that is smaller than the smallest, you are the one Purusha beyond Prakriti.

original: ekaś caturdhā bhagavān hutāśo varcovibhūtiṃ jagato dadāti /
analyzed: ekaḥ caturdhā bhagavān hutāśaḥ varcaḥ vibhūtim jagataḥ dadāti
translated: The Lord, the four-faced one, gives the splendor and prosperity of the world.

original: tvaṃ viśvataś cakṣur anantamūrte tredhā padaṃ tvaṃ nidadhe vidhātaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tvam viśvatas cakṣuḥ ananta mūrte tredhā padam tvam nidadhe vidhātar
translated: You are the all-seeing one, of infinite form, the ordainer who has placed your foot in three ways.

original: yathāgnir eko bahudhā samidhyate vikārabhedair avikārarūpaḥ /
analyzed: yathā agniḥ ekaḥ bahudhā samidhyate vikāra bhedaiḥ a vikāra rūpaḥ
translated: Just as one fire is kindled in many ways, with variations in form but unchanging in essence,

original: tathā bhavān sarvagataikarūpo rūpāṇy anekāny anupuṣyatīśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tathā bhavān sarva gata eka rūpaḥ rūpāṇi anekāni anupuṣyati īśaḥ
translated: so you, O Lord, all-pervading in one form, nourish many forms.

original: ekas tvam agryaṃ paramaṃ padaṃ yat paśyanti tvāṃ sūrayo jñānadṛśyam /
analyzed: ekaḥ tvam agryam paramam padam yat paśyanti tvām sūrayaḥ jñāna dṛśyam
translated: You are the one supreme state, which the wise ones see as visible through knowledge.

original: tvatto nānyat kiṃcid asti svarūpaṃ yad vā bhūtaṃ yac ca bhavyaṃ parātman // / / //
analyzed: tvattaḥ nā anyat kiṃcid asti svarūpam yat vā bhūtam yat ca bhavyam parātman
translated: There is nothing else but you, O Supreme Self, whether it has been or will be.

original: vyaktāvyaktasvarūpas tvaṃ samaṣṭivyaṣṭirūpavān /
analyzed: vyakta avyakta svarūpaḥ tvam samaṣṭi vyaṣṭi rūpavān
translated: You are the manifest and unmanifest form, having the form of the whole and the parts.

original: sarvajñaḥ sarvadṛk sarvaśaktijñānabalarddhimān // / / //
translated: Omniscient, all-seeing, endowed with all power, knowledge, strength and prosperity.

original: anyūnaś cāpy avṛddhiś ca svādhīno 'nādimān vaśī /
analyzed: anyūnaḥ ca api avṛddhiḥ ca svādhīnaḥ na ādimān vaśī
translated: Neither deficient nor increasing, independent, beginningless, the controller.

original: klamatandrībhayakrodhakāmādibhir asaṃyutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: klama tandrī bhaya krodha kāma ādibhiḥ a saṃyutaḥ
translated: Not bound by fatigue, laziness, fear, anger, desire and so on.

original: niravadyaḥ paraḥ śānto niradhiṣṭho 'kṣaraḥ kramaḥ /
analyzed: niravadyaḥ paraḥ śāntaḥ kṣaraḥ kramaḥ
translated: Faultless, supreme, peaceful, without support, imperishable, the sequence.

original: sarveśvara parādhāra dhāmnāṃ dhāmātmako 'kṣayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarveśvara para ādhāra dhāmnām dhāma ātmakaḥ kṣayaḥ
translated: O Lord of all, the support of all, the imperishable essence of abodes.

original: sakalāvaraṇātīta nirālambanabhāvana /
analyzed: sakala āvaraṇa atīta nirālambana bhāvana
translated: Beyond all coverings, the contemplation without support.

original: mahāvibhūtisaṃsthāna namas te puruṣottama // / / //
translated: O you who are established in great glory, salutations to you, O Supreme Person.

original: nākāraṇāt kāraṇād vā kāraṇākāraṇān na ca /
analyzed: na akāraṇāt kāraṇāt vā kāraṇa akāraṇāt na ca
translated: Not without cause, nor from a cause, nor from both cause and non-cause,

original: śarīragrahaṇaṃ vyāpin dharmatrāṇāya te param // / / //
analyzed: śarīra grahaṇam vyāpin dharma trāṇāya te param
translated: O all-pervading one, you have taken up a body for the supreme protection of Dharma.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity evaṃ saṃstavaṃ śrutvā manasā bhagavān ajaḥ /
analyzed: iti evam saṃstavam śrutvā manasā bhagavān ajaḥ
translated: Having heard this praise, the unborn Lord,

analyzed: brahmāṇam āha viśvātmā viśva rūpa dharaḥ hariḥ
translated: the soul of the universe, Hari, the bearer of the universe, spoke to Brahma.

original: bhagavān uvāca /
analyzed: bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Lord said:

original: bho bho brahmaṃs tvayā mattaḥ saha devair yad iṣyate /
analyzed: bho bho brahman tvayā mattaḥ saha devaiḥ yat iṣyate
translated: O Brahma, whatever is desired by you and the gods from me,

analyzed: tat ucyatām aśeṣam ca siddham evā avadhāryatām
translated: speak it all, and know that it is already accomplished.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

analyzed: tatas brahmā hareḥ divyam viśva rūpam samīkṣya tat
translated: Then Brahma, having seen that divine universal form of Hari,

analyzed: tuṣṭāva bhūyas deveṣu sādhvasa avanata ātmasu

original: brahmovāca /
analyzed: brahmā uvāca
translated: Brahma said:

analyzed: namaḥ namaḥ te stu sahasra mūrte sahasra bāho bahu vaktra pāda

translated: O subtlest of the subtle, greater than the greatest, O soul of the most weighty and weighty,

translated: Like the primary elements and senses, O Lord, O Supreme Self, be gracious from the primordial Self.

analyzed: eṣā mahī deva mahī prasūtaiḥ mahā asuraiḥ pīḍita śaila bandhā

analyzed: ime ca rudrāḥ vasavaḥ sa sūryāḥ samīraṇa agni pramukhāḥ tathā anye
translated: These Rudras, Vasus, and the sun-gods, and others headed by Vāyu and Agni,

analyzed: surāḥ samastāḥ sura nātha kāryam ebhiḥ mayā yat ca tat īśa sarvam
translated: All the gods, O Lord of gods, whatever task is to be done by them and by me, O Lord, all that

analyzed: ājñāpaya ājñām paripālayantaḥ tathā eva tiṣṭhāma sadā asta doṣāḥ

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parāśara said:

analyzed: evam saṃstūyamānaḥ tu bhagavān parameśvaraḥ
translated: Thus praised, the Blessed Lord, the Supreme God,

analyzed: ujjahāra ātmanaḥ keśau sita kṛṣṇau mahā mune

analyzed: surāḥ ca sakalāḥ sva aṃśaiḥ avatīrya mahī tale

analyzed: kurvantu yuddham unmattaiḥ pūrva utpannaiḥ mahā asuraiḥ
translated: Let them fight with the mad and previously born great demons.

analyzed: tatas kṣayam aśeṣāḥ te daiteyāḥ dharaṇī tale
translated: Then all those Daityas on the earth will perish.

analyzed: prayāsyanti na saṃdehaḥ mad dṛś pāta vicūrṇitāḥ

analyzed: vasudevasya yā patnī devakī devatā upamā
translated: The wife of Vasudeva, Devaki, who is like a goddess,

analyzed: tasya ayam aṣṭamaḥ garbhaḥ mad keśaḥ bhavitā surāḥ
translated: her eighth child will be my hair, O gods.

original: avatīrya ca tatrāyaṃ kaṃsaṃ ghātayitā bhuvi /
analyzed: avatīrya ca tatra ayam kaṃsam ghātayitā bhuvi
translated: Having descended there, he will kill Kamsa on earth,

original: kālanemiṃ samudbhūtam ity uktvāntardadhe hariḥ // / / //
analyzed: kālanemim samudbhūtam iti uktvā antardadhe hariḥ
translated: the risen Kalaneemi. Having said this, Hari disappeared.

original: adṛśyāya tatas te 'pi praṇipatya mahātmane /
analyzed: adṛśyāya tatas te pi praṇipatya mahātmane
translated: Then they, bowing to that great soul who had become invisible,

analyzed: meru pṛṣṭham surāḥ jagmuḥ avateruḥ ca bhū tale  kaṃsāya ca aṣṭame garbhe devakyām dharaṇīdharaḥ
translated: the gods went to the peak of Meru and descended to the earth.🔽And the illustrious sage Narada declared to Kamsa

analyzed: bhaviṣyati iti ācacakṣe bhagavān nāradaḥ muniḥ

analyzed: kaṃsaḥ u pi tat upaśrutya nāradāt kupitaḥ tatas
translated: Having heard that from Narada, Kamsa became angry and

analyzed: devakīm vasudevam ca gṛhe guptau adhārayat
translated: kept Devaki and Vasudeva imprisoned in his house.

analyzed: jātam jātam ca kaṃsāya tena eva uktam yathā purā
translated: And as soon as each child was born, he was told by him as before,

analyzed: tathā eva vasudevaḥ pi putram arpitavān dvija
translated: Similarly, Vasudeva also entrusted his son to the brāhmaṇa.

original: hiraṇyakaśipoḥ putrāḥ ṣaḍgarbhā iti viśrutāḥ /
analyzed: hiraṇyakaśipoḥ putrāḥ ṣaṣ garbhāḥ iti viśrutāḥ
translated: The sons of Hiraṇyakaśipu, known as the six embryos,

analyzed: avidyayā jagat sarvam tām āha bhagavān hariḥ
translated: the Lord Hari said to that (illusion):

original: bhagavān uvāca /🔽nidre gaccha mamādeśāt pātālatalasaṃśrayān /
analyzed: bhagavān uvāca  nidre gaccha mama ādeśāt pātāla tala saṃśrayān
translated: The Lord said:🔽O Nidrā, go by my order and bring the six embryos, who are staying at the bottom of Pātāla,

original: ekaikaśyena ṣaḍ garbhān devakījaṭharaṃ naya // / / //
analyzed: ekaikaśyena ṣaṭ garbhān devakī jaṭharam naya
translated: one by one, into the womb of Devakī.

original: hateṣu teṣu kaṃsena śeṣākhyo 'ṃśas tato mama /
analyzed: hateṣu teṣu kaṃsena śeṣa ākhyaḥ ṃśaḥ tatas mama
translated: When they are killed by Kaṃsa, then the portion called Śeṣa of mine,

analyzed: aṃśāṃśena udare tasyāḥ saptamaḥ saṃbhaviṣyati

analyzed: tasyāḥ sa saṃbhūti samam devi neyaḥ tvayā udaram

analyzed: saptamaḥ bhojarājasya bhayāt rodha uparodhataḥ

analyzed: devakyāḥ patitaḥ garbhaḥ iti lokaḥ vadiṣyati

analyzed: garbha saṃkarṣaṇāt saḥ u tha loke saṃkarṣaṇa iti vai
translated: Then, due to the dragging of the embryo, he will be known in the world as Saṃkarṣaṇa.

original: saṃjñām avāpsyate vīraḥ śvetādriśikharopamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃjñām avāpsyate vīraḥ śveta adri śikhara upamaḥ

analyzed: tatas ham saṃbhaviṣyāmi devakī jaṭhare śubhe
translated: Then I will be born in the auspicious womb of Devaki,

original: garbhe tvayā yaśodāyā gantavyam avilambitam // / / //
analyzed: garbhe tvayā yaśodāyāḥ gantavyam avilambitam
translated: and you should go without delay to the womb of Yashoda.

original: prāvṛṭkāle ca nabhasi kṛṣṇāṣṭamyām ahaṃ niśi /
analyzed: prāvṛṣ kāle ca nabhasi kṛṣṇa aṣṭamyām aham niśi

translated: I will be born, and on the ninth day, you will give birth.

analyzed: mad śakti prerita matiḥ vasudevaḥ nayiṣyati  kaṃsaḥ ca tvām upādāya devi śaila śilā tale
translated: But Vasudeva, his mind impelled by my power, will take me to the bed of Yashoda, and you, O faultless one, to that of Devaki.🔽O goddess, Kamsa, taking you, will throw you on the rocky surface of a mountain,

original: prakṣepsyaty antarikṣe ca tvaṃ sthānaṃ samavāpsyasi // / / //
analyzed: prakṣepsyati antarikṣe ca tvam sthānam samavāpsyasi

analyzed: tatas tvām śatadṛś śakraḥ praṇamya mama gauravāt
translated: Then Indra, with a hundred eyes, out of respect for me,

analyzed: praṇipāta ānata śirāḥ bhaginī tve grahīṣyati
translated: will accept you as his sister, bowing his head in salutation.

original: tataḥ śumbhaniśumbhādīn hatvā daityān sahasraśaḥ /
analyzed: tatas śumbha niśumbha ādīn hatvā daityān sahasraśas
translated: Then, having killed thousands of demons like Shumbha and Nishumbha,

original: sthānair anekaiḥ pṛthivīm aśeṣāṃ maṇḍayiṣyasi // / / //
analyzed: sthānaiḥ anekaiḥ pṛthivīm aśeṣām maṇḍayiṣyasi
translated: you will adorn the entire earth with many abodes.

analyzed: tvam bhūtiḥ sannatiḥ kīrtiḥ kṣāntiḥ dyauḥ pṛthivī dhṛtiḥ

original: lajjā puṣṭir uṣā yā ca kācid anyā tvam eva sā // / / //
analyzed: lajjā puṣṭiḥ uṣāḥ yā ca kācid anyā tvam eva sā
translated: You are that very one, O Goddess, who is called modesty, prosperity, dawn, and whatever else there may be.

original: ins /
analyzed: ins
translated: (Insertion:)

original: yā ca kācana vidyeti matprasādāt tvam eva sā // / / //
analyzed: yā ca kācana vidyā iti mad prasādāt tvam eva sā
translated: And whatever knowledge there may be, you alone are that by my grace.🔽Those who will praise you in the morning and afternoon with bowed bodies,

original: ye tvām āryeti durgeti vedagarbhe 'mbiketi ca /
analyzed: ye tvām ārye iti durgā iti vedagarbhe mbikā iti ca
translated: calling you noble one, Durgā, pregnant with the Vedas, Ambikā,

original: bhadreti bhadrakālīti kṣemyā kṣemakarīti ca // / / //🔽prātaś caivāparāhṇe ca stoṣyanty ānamramūrtayaḥ /
analyzed: bhadrā iti bhadrakālī iti kṣemyā kṣemakarī iti ca  prātar ca eva aparāhṇe ca stoṣyanti ānamra mūrtayaḥ
translated: fortunate one, Bhadrakālī, prosperous one, and bestower of prosperity,

original: teṣāṃ hi prārthitaṃ sarvaṃ matprasādād bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: teṣām hi prārthitam sarvam mad prasādāt bhaviṣyati
translated: all their desires will be fulfilled by my grace.

original: surāmāṃsopahārais tu bhakṣyabhojyaiś ca pūjitā /🔽nṝṇām aśeṣakāmāṃs tvaṃ prasannā saṃpradāsyasi // / / //
analyzed: surā māṃsa upahāraiḥ tu bhakṣya bhojyaiḥ ca pūjitā  nṝṇām aśeṣa kāmān tvam prasannā saṃpradāsyasi
translated: Honored with offerings of liquor, meat, and food,🔽you, being pleased, will grant all desires to men.

original: te sarve sarvadā bhadre matprasādād asaṃśayam /
analyzed: te sarve sarvadā bhadre mad prasādāt asaṃśayam
translated: All of them, O fortunate one, will undoubtedly be successful in all things by my grace.

original: asaṃdigdhā bhaviṣyanti gaccha devi yathoditam // / / //
analyzed: asaṃdigdhāḥ bhaviṣyanti gaccha devi yathā uditam
translated: Go, O Goddess, as instructed.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pañcame 'ṃśe prathamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pañcame ṃśe prathamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the first chapter in the fifth book of the Viṣṇu Purāṇa.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parāśara said:

original: yathoktaṃ sā jagaddhātrī devadevena vai tadā /
analyzed: yathā uktam sā jagaddhātrī devadevena vai tadā
translated: As told by the Lord of gods then, that mother of the world,

original: ṣaḍgarbhagarbhavinyāsaṃ cakre cānyasya karṣaṇam // / / //
analyzed: ṣaḍgarbha garbha vinyāsam cakre ca anyasya karṣaṇam
translated: arranged the conception of the six embryos and the destruction of another.

original: saptame rohiṇīṃ prāpte gate garbhe tato hariḥ /
analyzed: saptame rohiṇīm prāpte gate garbhe tatas hariḥ
translated: When the seventh month arrived, Hari, the embryo, departed.

original: lokatrayopakārāya devakyāḥ praviveśa vai // / / //🔽yoganidrā yaśodāyās tasminn eva tato dine /
analyzed: loka traya upakārāya devakyāḥ praviveśa vai  yoganidrā yaśodāyāḥ tasmin eva tatas dine
translated: When the seventh month arrived, Hari entered Devaki's womb for the welfare of the three worlds.

original: saṃbhūtā jaṭhare tadvad yathoktaṃ parameṣṭhinā // / / //
analyzed: saṃbhūtāḥ jaṭhare tadvat yathā uktam parameṣṭhinā
translated: On that very day, Yogani (the power of deep sleep) was born in Yashoda's womb, as stated by the Supreme Lord.

original: tato grahagaṇaḥ samyak pracacāra divi dvija /
analyzed: tatas graha gaṇaḥ samyak pracacāra divi dvija
translated: Then, O Brahmin, the planets moved properly in the sky,

original: viṣṇor aṃśe bhuvaṃ yāte ṛtavaś cābhavan śubhāḥ // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ aṃśe bhuvam yāte ṛtavaḥ ca abhavan śubhāḥ
translated: and the seasons became auspicious when Vishnu's portion went to earth.

original: na sehe devakīṃ draṣṭuṃ kaścid apy atitejasā /
analyzed: na sehe devakīm draṣṭum kaścid api ati tejasā
translated: No one could bear to see Devaki due to her excessive brilliance.

original: jājvalyamānāṃ tāṃ dṛṣṭvā manāṃsi kṣobham āyayuḥ // / / //
analyzed: jājvalyamānām tām dṛṣṭvā manāṃsi kṣobham āyayuḥ

original: adṛṣṭāḥ puruṣaiḥ strībhir devakīṃ devatāgaṇāḥ /
analyzed: adṛṣṭāḥ puruṣaiḥ strībhiḥ devakīm devatā gaṇāḥ

original: bibhrāṇāṃ vapuṣā viṣṇuṃ tuṣṭuvus tām aharniśam // / / //
analyzed: bibhrāṇām vapuṣā viṣṇum tuṣṭuvuḥ tām aharniśam

original: devatā ūcuḥ /
analyzed: devatāḥ ūcuḥ

analyzed: prakṛtiḥ tvam parā sūkṣmā brahma garbhā abhavaḥ purā

original: tato vāṇī jagaddhātur vedagarbhātiśobhane // / / //
analyzed: tatas vāṇī jagaddhātuḥ vedagarbha ati śobhane
translated: Then, O you of great beauty, you became pregnant with the Vedas, the essence of the Creator of the universe.

original: sṛjyasvarūpagarbhā ca sṛṣṭibhūtā sanātane /
analyzed: sṛjya sva rūpa garbhā ca sṛṣṭi bhūtā sanātane

analyzed: bīja bhūtā tu sarvasya trayī
translated: You became the essence of all sacrifices, the source of the three Vedas.

analyzed: phala garbhā tvam eva ijyā vahni garbhā tathā araṇiḥ
translated: You are the sacrifice with the fruit as its essence, and the kindling stick with fire as its essence.

analyzed: phulla indīvara patra ābham catur bāhum udīkṣya tam
