translated: And having praised him with pleasing words, the greatly wise one,

original: vijñāpayām āsa tadā kaṃsād bhīto dvijottama // / / //
analyzed: vijñāpayām āsa tadā kaṃsāt bhītaḥ dvijottama
translated: Fearing Kamsa, O best of Brahmins, then made a request.

original: vasudeva uvāca /
analyzed: vasudevaḥ uvāca
translated: Vasudeva said:

original: jñāto 'si devadeveśa śaṅkhacakragadādharam /
analyzed: jñātaḥ si devadeveśa śaṅkha cakra gadā dharam
translated: You are known as the lord of the gods, the wielder of the conch, discus, and club.

original: divyaṃ rūpam idaṃ deva prasādenopasaṃhara // / / //
analyzed: divyam rūpam idam deva prasādena upasaṃhara
translated: O god, please withdraw this divine form by your grace.

original: adyaiva deva kaṃso 'yaṃ kurute mama yātanām /
analyzed: adyā eva deva kaṃsaḥ yam kurute mama yātanām
translated: O god, today only this Kamsa will inflict torture on me,

original: avatīrṇam iti jñātvā tvam asmin mama mandire // / / //
analyzed: avatīrṇam iti jñātvā tvam asmin mama mandire
translated: Knowing that you have descended in my abode.

original: devaky uvāca /
analyzed: devakī uvāca
translated: Devaki said:

original: yo 'nantarūpo 'khilaviśvarūpo garbhe 'pi lokān vapuṣā bibharti /
analyzed: yaḥ nanta rūpaḥ khila viśva rūpaḥ garbhe pi lokān vapuṣā bibharti
translated: He who has an infinite form, the form of the entire universe, and who bears the worlds in his womb with his body,

original: prasīdatām eṣa sa devadevaḥ svamāyayāviṣkṛtabālarūpaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prasīdatām eṣa sa devadevaḥ sva māyayā āviṣkṛta bāla rūpaḥ
translated: May that god of gods, who has manifested a form of a child by his own Maya, be pleased.

original: upasaṃhara sarvātman rūpam etac caturbhujam /
analyzed: upasaṃhara sarva ātman rūpam etat catur bhujam
translated: Withdraw this four-armed form, O soul of all.

original: jānātu māvatāraṃ te kaṃso 'yaṃ ditijātmajaḥ // / / //
analyzed: jānātu mā avatāram te kaṃsaḥ yam ditija ātmajaḥ
translated: Let this Kansa, the son of Diti, know that I have come down (on earth).

original: bhagavān uvāca /🔽stuto 'haṃ yat tvayā pūrvaṃ putrārthinyā tad adya te /
analyzed: bhagavān uvāca  stutaḥ ham yat tvayā pūrvam putra arthinyā tat adya te
translated: The Lord said:🔽Since you had formerly prayed to me, O goddess, for a son, that prayer of yours has now borne fruit.

original: saphalaṃ devi saṃjātaṃ jāto 'haṃ yat tavodarāt // / / //
analyzed: saphalam devi saṃjātam jātaḥ ham yat tava udarāt
translated: Since I have been born of your womb, I am your son.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity uktvā bhagavāṃs tūṣṇīṃ babhūva munisattama /
analyzed: iti uktvā bhagavān tūṣṇīm babhūva muni sattama
translated: Having said this, the Lord became silent, O best of sages.

original: vasudevo 'pi taṃ rātrāv ādāya prayayau bahiḥ // / / //
analyzed: vasudevaḥ pi tam rātrau ādāya prayayau bahis
translated: Vasudeva also, taking him (with him), went out that night.

original: mohitāś cābhavaṃs tatra rakṣiṇo yoganidrayā /
analyzed: mohitāḥ ca abhavan tatra rakṣiṇaḥ yoganidrayā
translated: And the guards there were stupefied by the Yoga-sleep.

original: mathurādvārapālāś ca vrajaty ānakadundubhau // / / //🔽varṣatāṃ jaladānāṃ ca toyam atyulbaṇaṃ niśi /
analyzed: mathurā dvārapālāḥ ca vrajati ānakadundubhau  varṣatām jaladānām ca toyam ati ulbaṇam niśi
translated: And the gate-keepers of Mathura were also stupefied when Ankadundubhi was going away.

original: saṃcchādyānuyayau śeṣaḥ phaṇair ānakadundubhim // / / //🔽yamunāṃ cātigambhīrāṃ nānāvartaśatākulām /
analyzed: saṃcchādya anuyayau śeṣaḥ phaṇaiḥ ānakadundubhim  yamunām ca ati gambhīrām nānā āvarta śata ākulām
translated: And Shesha followed Ankadundubhi with his hoods, covering him with the heavy rain of the clouds falling at night.

original: vasudevo vahan viṣṇuṃ jānumātravahāṃ yayau // / / //🔽kaṃsasya karam ādāya tatraivābhyāgatāṃs taṭe /
analyzed: vasudevaḥ vahan viṣṇum jānu mātra vahām yayau  kaṃsasya karam ādāya tatra eva abhyāgatān taṭe
translated: And Vasudeva, carrying Vishnu, crossed the Yamuna, which was very deep and full of hundreds of whirlpools, and went where the water was only knee-deep.

original: nandādīn gopavṛddhāṃś ca yamunāyāṃ dadarśa saḥ // / / //
analyzed: nanda ādīn gopa vṛddhān ca yamunāyām dadarśa saḥ
translated: And on the bank, he saw Nanda and the other old cowherds, who had come there with the tribute for Kansa, in the Yamuna.

original: tasmin kāle yaśodāpi mohitā yoganidrayā /
analyzed: tasmin kāle yaśodā api mohitā yoganidrayā
translated: At that time, Yashodā also, bewildered by the Yoga-sleep,

original: tām eva kanyāṃ maitreya prasūtā mohite jane // / / //
analyzed: tām eva kanyām maitreya prasūtāḥ mohite jane
translated: gave birth to that very girl, O Maitreya, when the people were deluded.

original: vasudevo 'pi vinyasya bālam ādāya dārikām /
analyzed: vasudevaḥ pi vinyasya bālam ādāya dārikām
translated: Vasudeva, having placed the boy and taking the girl,

original: yaśodāśayane tūrṇam ājagāmāmitadyutiḥ // / / //
analyzed: yaśodā śayane tūrṇam ājagāma amita dyutiḥ
translated: quickly went to the bed of Yashodā, the one of immeasurable splendour.

original: dadṛśe ca prabuddhā sā yaśodā jātam ātmajam /
analyzed: dadṛśe ca prabuddhā sā yaśodā jātam ātmajam
translated: And Yashodā, having awakened, saw her own son born,

original: nīlotpaladalaśyāmaṃ tato 'tyarthaṃ mudaṃ yayau // / / //
analyzed: nīlotpala dala śyāmam tyartham mudam yayau
translated: dark like the petals of a blue lotus, and then she was exceedingly delighted.

original: ādāya vasudevo 'pi dārikāṃ nijamandire /
analyzed: ādāya vasudevaḥ pi dārikām nija mandire
translated: Vasudeva also, taking the girl, in his own abode,

original: devakīśayane nyasya yathāpūrvam atiṣṭhata // / / //
analyzed: devakī śayane nyasya yathāpūrvam atiṣṭhata
translated: having placed her on Devakī's bed, remained as before.

original: tato bāladhvaniṃ śrutvā rakṣiṇaḥ sahasotthitāḥ /
analyzed: tatas bāla dhvanim śrutvā rakṣiṇaḥ sahasā utthitāḥ
translated: Then the guards, having heard the sound of a child, suddenly arose,

original: kaṃsāyāvedayām āsur devakīprasavaṃ dvija // / / //
analyzed: kaṃsāya āvedayām āsuḥ devakī prasavam dvija
translated: and informed Kansa, O twice-born one, of Devakī's delivery.

original: kaṃsas tūrṇam upetyaināṃ tato jagrāha bālikām /
analyzed: kaṃsaḥ tūrṇam upetya enām tatas jagrāha bālikām
translated: Kansa, having quickly approached, then seized that girl,

original: muñca muñceti devakyā sannakaṇṭhyā nivāritaḥ // / / //
analyzed: muñca muñca iti devakyā sannakaṇṭhyā nivāritaḥ
translated: and was restrained by Devakī, with her throat choked, saying, Release, release.

original: cikṣepa ca śilāpṛṣṭhe sā kṣiptā viyati sthitim /
analyzed: cikṣepa ca śilā pṛṣṭhe sā kṣiptā viyati sthitim
translated: And she, having been thrown on the rocky surface, stood in the sky,

original: avāpa rūpaṃ ca mahat sāyudhāṣṭamahābhujam // / / //
analyzed: avāpa rūpam ca mahat sa āyudha aṣṭa mahā bhujam
translated: and attained a great form with eight mighty arms holding weapons.

original: prajahāsa tathaivoccaiḥ kaṃsaṃ ca ruṣitābravīt /
analyzed: prajahāsa tathā evā uccais kaṃsam ca ruṣitā abravīt
translated: And laughed aloud, and angrily said to Kansa,

original: kiṃ mayā kṣiptayā kaṃsa jāto yas tvāṃ vadhiṣyati // / / //
analyzed: kim mayā kṣiptayā kaṃsa jātaḥ yaḥ tvām vadhiṣyati
translated: What need is there of me, Kansa? He is born who will slay you.

original: sarvasvabhūto devānām āsīn mṛtyuḥ purā sa te /
analyzed: sarva sva bhūtaḥ devānām āsīt mṛtyuḥ purā sa te
translated: He who was formerly the death of the gods, is now born as your death.

original: tad etat saṃpradhāryāśu kriyatāṃ hitam ātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat etat saṃpradhārya āśu kriyatām hitam ātmanaḥ
translated: Considering this, do what is for your good.

original: ity uktvā prayayau devī divyasraggandhabhūṣaṇā /
analyzed: iti uktvā prayayau devī divya sraj gandha bhūṣaṇā
translated: Having said this, the goddess, adorned with celestial garlands, perfumes, and ornaments,

original: paśyato bhojarājasya stutā siddhair vihāyasā // / / //
analyzed: paśyataḥ bhojarājasya stutā siddhaiḥ vihāyasā
translated: went away, even before the eyes of the king of the Bhojas, praised by the Siddhas in the sky.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pañcame 'ṃśe tṛtīyo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pañcame ṃśe tṛtīyaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the third chapter in the fifth section of the Visnu Purana, dealing with the birth of Vasudeva's son.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: kaṃsas tataudvignamanāḥ prāha sarvān mahāsurān /
analyzed: kaṃsaḥ tatas audvigna manāḥ prāha sarvān mahā asurān
translated: Then Kansa, with a troubled heart, called together all the great Asuras,

original: pralambakeśipramukhān āhūyāsurapuṃgavān // / / //
analyzed: pralamba keśi pramukhān āhūya asura puṃgavān
translated: and the foremost of the Asuras, headed by Pralamva, Keshi, and others,🔽and said to them.

original: kaṃsa uvāca /
analyzed: kaṃsaḥ uvāca
translated: Kansa said:

original: he pralamba mahābāho keśin dhenuka pūtane /
analyzed: he pralamba mahā bāho keśin dhenuka pūtane
translated: O Pralamva of mighty arms, O Keshi, O Dhenuka, O Putana,

original: ariṣṭādyais tathā cānyaiḥ śrūyatāṃ vacanaṃ mama // / / //
analyzed: ariṣṭa ādyaiḥ tathā ca anyaiḥ śrūyatām vacanam mama
translated: O Aristha and others, hear my words.

original: māṃ hantum amarair yatnaḥ kṛtaḥ kila durātmabhiḥ /
analyzed: mām hantum amaraiḥ yatnaḥ kṛtaḥ kila durātmabhiḥ
translated: The wicked gods have, it is said, made an effort to kill me,

original: madvīryatāpitair vīrā na tv etān gaṇayāmy aham // / / //
analyzed: mad vīrya tāpitaiḥ vīrāḥ na tu etān gaṇayāmi aham
translated: and the heroes, heated by my prowess, I do not reckon them at all.

original: kim indreṇālpavīryeṇa kiṃ hareṇaikacāriṇā /🔽hariṇā vāpi kiṃ sādhyaṃ chidreṣv asuraghātinā // / / //
analyzed: kim indreṇa alpa vīryeṇa kim hareṇa ekacāriṇā  hariṇā vā api kim sādhyam chidreṣu asura ghātinā
translated: What is Indra of little prowess? What is Hari who moves alone?🔽Or what is accomplished by Hari, the slayer of demons in battles?

original: kim ādityaiḥ savasubhir alpavīryaiḥ kim agnibhiḥ /
analyzed: kim ādityaiḥ sa vasubhiḥ alpa vīryaiḥ kim agnibhiḥ
translated: What is the use of the sun and the Vasus of little prowess? What is the use of the fires?

original: kiṃ vānyair amaraiḥ sarvair madbāhubalanirjitaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: kim vā anyaiḥ amaraiḥ sarvaiḥ mad bāhu bala nirjitaiḥ
translated: Or what is the use of all the other immortals conquered by the strength of my arms?

original: kiṃ na dṛṣṭo 'marapatir mayā saṃyugam etya saḥ /
analyzed: kim na dṛṣṭaḥ marapatiḥ mayā saṃyugam etya saḥ
translated: Was not the lord of the immortals seen by me when he came to battle?

original: pṛṣṭhenaiva vahan bāṇān apāgacchan na vakṣasā // / / //
analyzed: pṛṣṭhena eva vahan bāṇān apāgacchat na vakṣasā
translated: He went away with his back turned, not with his chest, carrying the arrows.

original: madrāṣṭre vāritā vṛṣṭir yadā śakreṇa kiṃ tadā /
analyzed: mad rāṣṭre vāritā vṛṣṭiḥ yadā śakreṇa kim tadā
translated: When the rain was restrained in my kingdom by Indra, what then?

original: madbāṇabhinnair jaladair āpo muktā yathepsitāḥ // / / //🔽kim urvyām avanīpālā madbāhubalabhīravaḥ /
analyzed: mad bāṇa bhinnaiḥ jaladaiḥ āpaḥ muktāḥ yathā īpsitāḥ  kim urvyām avanīpālāḥ mad bāhu bala bhīravaḥ
translated: The waters were released by the clouds torn by my arrows as desired.🔽Why did not all the lords of the earth, frightened by the strength of my arms,

original: na sarve sannatiṃ yātā jarāsaṃdham ṛte gurum // / / //
analyzed: na sarve sannatim yātāḥ jarāsaṃdham ṛte gurum
translated: not all go to submission except the elder Jarasandha?

original: amareṣu mamāvajñā jāyate daityapuṃgavāḥ /
analyzed: amareṣu mama avajñā jāyate daitya puṃgavāḥ
translated: O best of the demons, contempt for the immortals arises in me.

original: hāsyaṃ me jāyate vīrās teṣu yatnapareṣv api // / / //🔽tathāpi khalu duṣṭānāṃ teṣām abhyadhikaṃ mayā /
analyzed: hāsyam me jāyate vīrāḥ teṣu yatna pareṣu api  tathā api khalu duṣṭānām teṣām abhyadhikam mayā
translated: O heroes, even when they strive, laughter arises in me.🔽Nevertheless, indeed, for those wicked ones, for those of evil souls,

original: apakārāya daityendrā yatanīyaṃ durātmanām // / / //
analyzed: apakārāya daitya indrāḥ yatanīyam durātmanām
translated: I must strive more for their harm, O lords of the demons.

original: tad ye tapasvinaḥ kecit pṛthivyāṃ ye ca yajvinaḥ /
analyzed: tat ye tapasvinaḥ kecid pṛthivyām ye ca yajvinaḥ
translated: Therefore, all those ascetics and sacrificers on earth,

original: kāryo devāpakārāya teṣāṃ sarvātmanā vadhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāryaḥ deva apakārāya teṣām sarva ātmanā vadhaḥ
translated: should be killed by every means for causing harm to the gods.

original: utpannaś cāpi mṛtyur me bhūtapūrvaś ca me kila /
analyzed: utpannaḥ ca api mṛtyuḥ me bhūta pūrvaḥ ca me kila
translated: And that death has arisen for me, and was also in my past,

original: ity etad bālikā prāha devakīgarbhasaṃbhavā // / / //
analyzed: iti etat bālikā prāha devakī garbha saṃbhavā
translated: thus did that girl born in Devaki's womb speak.

original: tasmād bāleṣu paramo yatnaḥ kāryo mahītale /
analyzed: tasmāt bāleṣu paramaḥ yatnaḥ kāryaḥ mahī tale
translated: Therefore, utmost effort should be made on earth towards children.

original: yatrodriktaṃ balaṃ bāle sa hantavyaḥ prayatnataḥ // / / //
analyzed: yatra udriktam balam bāle sa hantavyaḥ prayatnataḥ
translated: Where a child has excessive strength, he should be carefully killed.

original: ity ājñāpyāsurān kaṃsaḥ praviśyātmagṛhaṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: iti ājñāpya asurān kaṃsaḥ praviśya ātma gṛham tatas
translated: Thus commanding the demons, Kamsa then entered his own house,

original: mumoca vasudevaṃ ca devakīṃ ca nirodhataḥ // / / //
analyzed: mumoca vasudevam ca devakīm ca nirodhataḥ
translated: and released Vasudeva and Devaki from confinement.

original: kaṃsa uvāca /
analyzed: kaṃsaḥ uvāca
translated: Kamsa said:

original: yuvayor ghātitā garbhā vṛthaivaite mayādhunā /
analyzed: yuvayoḥ ghātitāḥ garbhāḥ vṛthā eva ete mayā adhunā
translated: You two have had your foetuses killed by me in vain now.

original: ko 'py anya eva nāśāya bālo mama samudgataḥ // / / //
analyzed: kaḥ pi anyaḥ eva nāśāya bālaḥ mama samudgataḥ
translated: But some other child has arisen for my destruction.

original: tad alaṃ paritāpena nūnaṃ tad bhāvino hi te /
analyzed: tat alam paritāpena nūnam tat bhāvinaḥ hi te
translated: Therefore, enough of lamenting. They are surely destined for you.

original: arbhakā yuvayoḥ ko vā nāyuṣo 'nte vihanyate // / / //
analyzed: arbhakāḥ yuvayoḥ kaḥ vā na āyuṣaḥ nte vihanyate
translated: What child of yours will not be destroyed at the end of life?

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity āśvāsya vimuktvā ca kaṃsas tau pariśaṅkitaḥ /
analyzed: iti āśvāsya vimuktvā ca kaṃsaḥ tau pariśaṅkitaḥ
translated: Thus comforting and releasing them, Kamsa, suspecting them,

original: antargṛhaṃ dvijaśreṣṭha praviveśa punaḥ svakam // / / //
analyzed: antargṛham dvijaśreṣṭha praviveśa punar svakam
translated: and again entered his own house.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pañcame 'ṃśe caturtho 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pañcame ṃśe caturthaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourth chapter in the fifth section of the Vishnu Purana, dealing with the birth of Krishna.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: vimukto vasudevo 'pi nandasya śakaṭaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: vimuktaḥ vasudevaḥ pi nandasya śakaṭam gataḥ
translated: Vasudeva, released, went to the cart of Nanda,

original: prahṛṣṭaṃ dṛṣṭavān nandaṃ putro jāto mameti vai // / / //
analyzed: prahṛṣṭam dṛṣṭavān nandam putraḥ jātaḥ mama iti vai
translated: and saw Nanda delighted, saying, A son is born to me.

original: vasudevo 'pi taṃ prāha diṣṭyā diṣṭyeti sādaram /
analyzed: vasudevaḥ pi tam prāha diṣṭyā diṣṭyā iti sādaram
translated: Vasudeva also said to him respectfully, By good luck, by good luck!

original: vārddhake 'pi samutpannas tanayo yat tavādhunā // / / //
analyzed: vārddhake samutpannaḥ tanayaḥ yat tava adhunā
translated: That a son is born to you now in old age,

original: datto hi vārṣikaḥ sarvo bhavadbhir nṛpateḥ karaḥ /
analyzed: dattaḥ hi vārṣikaḥ sarvaḥ bhavadbhiḥ nṛpateḥ karaḥ
translated: for all of you have paid the annual tax to the king.

original: yadartham āgatās tasmān nātra stheyaṃ mahādhanāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yad artham āgatāḥ tasmāt na atra stheyam mahādhanāḥ
translated: Therefore, you great wealth-holders, you should not stay here.

original: yadartham āgatāḥ kāryaṃ tan niṣpannaṃ kim āsyate /
analyzed: yad artham āgatāḥ kāryam tat niṣpannam kim āsyate
translated: The purpose for which you have come, that is accomplished, why do you tarry?

original: bhavadbhir gamyatāṃ nanda tac chīghraṃ nijagokulam // / / //
analyzed: bhavadbhiḥ gamyatām nanda tat śīghram nija gokulam
translated: O Nanda, you should quickly go to your own cow-pen.

original: mamāpi bālakas tatra rohiṇīprasavo hi yaḥ /
analyzed: mama api bālakaḥ tatra rohiṇī prasavaḥ hi yaḥ
translated: And the boy who is there, born of Rohini,

original: sa rakṣaṇīyo bhavatā yathāyaṃ tanayo nijaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa rakṣaṇīyaḥ bhavatā yathā ayam tanayaḥ nijaḥ
translated: he should be protected by you as much as this your own son.

original: ity uktāḥ prayayur gopā nandagopapurogamāḥ /
analyzed: iti uktāḥ prayayuḥ gopāḥ nanda gopa purogamāḥ
translated: Thus addressed, the cowherds, with Nanda at their head, departed.

original: śakaṭāropitair bhāṇḍaiḥ karaṃ dattvā mahābalāḥ // / / //
analyzed: śakaṭa āropitaiḥ bhāṇḍaiḥ karam dattvā mahā balāḥ
translated: Having paid a large amount of duty in the form of goods loaded on carts, the mighty ones

original: vasatāṃ gokule teṣāṃ pūtanā bālaghātinī /
analyzed: vasatām gokule teṣām pūtanā bāla ghātinī
translated: While they were living in Gokula, Putanā, the child-killer,

original: suptaṃ kṛṣṇam upādāya rātrau tasmai dadau stanam // / / //
analyzed: suptam kṛṣṇam upādāya rātrau tasmai dadau stanam
translated: Taking up the sleeping Kṛṣṇa at night, she gave her breast to him.

original: yasmai yasmai stanaṃ rātrau pūtanā saṃprayacchati /
analyzed: yasmai yasmai stanam rātrau pūtanā saṃprayacchati
translated: To whomever Putanā gave her breast at night,

original: tasya tasya kṣaṇenāṅgaṃ bālakasyopahanyate // / / //🔽kṛṣṇas tasyāḥ stanaṃ gāḍhaṃ karābhyām atipīḍitam /
analyzed: tasya tasya kṣaṇena aṅgam bālakasya upahanyate  kṛṣṇaḥ tasyāḥ stanam gāḍham karābhyām atipīḍitam
translated: In a moment the body of that child was afflicted.🔽Kṛṣṇa, with anger, tightly squeezed her breast with his two hands,

original: gṛhītvā prāṇasahitaṃ papau kopasamanvitaḥ // / / //🔽sā vimuktamahārāvā vicchinnasnāyubandhanā /
analyzed: gṛhītvā prāṇa sahitam papau kopa samanvitaḥ  sā vimukta mahā rāvā vicchinna snāyu bandhanā
translated: And drank it along with her life.🔽She, with her loud cries cut off and her sinews severed,

original: papāta pūtanā bhūmau mriyamāṇātibhīṣaṇā // / / //
analyzed: papāta pūtanā bhūmau mriyamāṇā ati bhīṣaṇā
translated: Fell down on the ground, terrifyingly dying.

original: tannādaśrutisaṃtrāsāt prabuddhās te vrajaukasaḥ /
analyzed: tad nāda śruti saṃtrāsāt prabuddhāḥ te vraja okasaḥ
translated: Out of fear from hearing that cry, the people of Vraja woke up,

original: dadṛśuḥ pūtanotsaṅge kṛṣṇaṃ tāṃ ca nipātitām // / / //
analyzed: dadṛśuḥ pūtanā utsaṅge kṛṣṇam tām ca nipātitām
translated: And saw Kṛṣṇa on Putanā's lap and her fallen down.

original: ādāya kṛṣṇaṃ saṃtrastā yaśodāpi dvijottama /
analyzed: ādāya kṛṣṇam saṃtrastā yaśodā api dvijottama
translated: O best of the twice-born, Yashodā, out of fear, took up Kṛṣṇa,

original: gopucchaṃ bhrāmya hastena bāladoṣam apākarot // / / //
analyzed: go puccham bhrāmya hastena bāla doṣam apākarot
translated: And waving the cow's tail with her hand, removed the fault of the child.

original: gopurīṣam upādāya nandagopo 'pi mastake /
analyzed: go purīṣam upādāya nanda gopaḥ mastake
translated: The cowherd Nanda also, taking cow dung on his head,

original: kṛṣṇasya pradadau rakṣāṃ kurvaṃś caitad udīrayan // / / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇasya pradadau rakṣām kurvan ca etat udīrayan
translated: And granting protection to Krishna, uttered these words.

original: nandagopa uvāca /
analyzed: nanda gopaḥ uvāca
translated: Nanda the cowherd said:

original: rakṣatu tvām aśeṣāṇāṃ bhūtānāṃ prabhavo hariḥ /
analyzed: rakṣatu tvām aśeṣāṇām bhūtānām prabhavaḥ hariḥ
translated: May Hari, the origin of all beings, protect you,

original: yasya nābhisamudbhūtapaṅkajād abhavaj jagat // / / //🔽yena daṃṣṭrāgravidhṛtā dhārayaty avanī jagat /
analyzed: yasya na abhisamudbhūta paṅkajāt abhavat jagat  yena daṃṣṭra agra vidhṛtā dhārayati avanī jagat
translated: From whose navel-born lotus the universe originated.

original: varāharūpadhṛg devaḥ sa tvāṃ rakṣatu keśavaḥ // / / //🔽nakhāṅkuravinirbhinnavairivakṣaḥsthalo vibhuḥ /
analyzed: varāha rūpa dhṛk devaḥ sa tvām rakṣatu keśavaḥ
translated: May that Lord Keshava, who in the form of a boar,🔽Supports the earth with the tip of his tusk, protect you everywhere.

original: nṛsiṃharūpī sarvatra sa tvāṃ rakṣatu keśavaḥ // / / //🔽vāmano rakṣatu sadā bhavantaṃ yaḥ kṣaṇād abhūt /
analyzed: nṛsiṃha rūpī sarvatra sa tvām rakṣatu keśavaḥ  vāmanaḥ rakṣatu sadā bhavantam yaḥ kṣaṇāt abhūt
translated: May that Lord Keshava, in the form of Narasimha, whose chest is torn by the tips of his claws, protect you everywhere.

original: trivikramakramākrāntatrailokyaḥ sphuradāyudhaḥ // / / //
translated: May that Vamana, who in a moment became the Trivikrama, whose steps covered the three worlds, and whose weapons shone, always protect you.

original: śiras te pātu govindaḥ kaṇṭhaṃ rakṣatu keśavaḥ /
analyzed: śiraḥ te pātu govindaḥ kaṇṭham rakṣatu keśavaḥ
translated: May Govinda protect your head, may Keshava protect your neck,

original: guhyaṃ sajaṭharaṃ viṣṇur jaṅghe pādau janārdanaḥ // / / //🔽mukhaṃ bāhū prabāhū ca manaḥ sarvendriyāṇi ca /
analyzed: guhyam sa jaṭharam viṣṇuḥ jaṅghe pādau janārdanaḥ  mukham bāhū prabāhū ca manaḥ sarva indriyāṇi ca
translated: May Vishnu protect your private parts and belly, and Janardana your calves and feet.

original: rakṣatv avyāhataiśvaryas tava nārāyaṇo 'vyayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: rakṣatu avyāhata aiśvaryaḥ tava nārāyaṇaḥ vyayaḥ
translated: May the imperishable Narayana, whose power is unobstructed, protect your face, arms, forearms, mind, and all the senses.

original: śārṅgacakragadāpāṇeḥ śaṅkhanādahatāḥ kṣayam /
analyzed: śārṅga cakra gadā pāṇeḥ śaṅkha nāda hatāḥ kṣayam
translated: Destroyed by the conch-sound of the one holding a Sharnga bow, discus, and mace,

original: gacchantu pretakūṣmāṇḍarākṣasā ye tavāhitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: gacchantu preta kūṣmāṇḍa rākṣasāḥ ye tava ahitāḥ
translated: May the ghosts, pumpkins and demons who are harmful to you be destroyed by the sound of the conch of the one holding a Sharnga bow, discus and mace in his hands.

original: tvāṃ pātu dikṣu vaikuṇṭho vidikṣu madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: tvām pātu dikṣu vaikuṇṭhaḥ vidikṣu madhusūdanaḥ
translated: May Vaikuntha protect you in the directions, Madhusudana in the intermediate directions,

original: hṛṣīkeśo 'mbare bhūmau rakṣatu tvāṃ mahīdharaḥ // / / //
analyzed: hṛṣīkeśaḥ mbare bhūmau rakṣatu tvām mahīdharaḥ
translated: Hrishikesha in the sky, and the upholder of the earth protect you on the earth.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: evaṃ kṛtasvastyayano nandagopena bālakaḥ /
analyzed: evam kṛta svastyayanaḥ nanda gopena bālakaḥ
translated: Thus, the child was blessed by the cowherd Nanda.

original: śāyitaḥ śakaṭasyādho bālaparyaṅkikātale // / / //
analyzed: śāyitaḥ śakaṭasya adhas bāla paryaṅkikā tale
translated: He was laid down on a child's bed under a cart.

original: te ca gopā mahad dṛṣṭvā pūtanāyāḥ kalevaram /
analyzed: te ca gopāḥ mahat dṛṣṭvā pūtanāyāḥ kalevaram
translated: The cowherds, seeing the huge body of Putana,

original: mṛtāyāḥ paramaṃ trāsaṃ vismayaṃ ca tadā yayuḥ // / / //
analyzed: mṛtāyāḥ paramam trāsam vismayam ca tadā yayuḥ
translated: were greatly frightened and amazed at her death.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pañcame 'ṃśe pañcamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pañcame ṃśe pañcamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fifth chapter in the fifth section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: kadācic chakaṭasyādhaḥ śayāno madhusūdanaḥ /🔽cikṣepa caraṇāv ūrdhvaṃ stanyārthī praruroda ca // / / //🔽tasya pādaprahāreṇa śakaṭaṃ parivartitam /
analyzed: kadācid śakaṭasya adhas śayānaḥ madhusūdanaḥ  cikṣepa caraṇau ūrdhvam stanya arthī praruroda ca  tasya pāda prahāreṇa śakaṭam parivartitam
translated: Once, Madhusudana, lying under a cart,🔽raised his feet and cried for milk.🔽By the kick of his feet, the cart was overturned,

original: vidhvastakumbhabhāṇḍaṃ tad viparītaṃ papāta ca // / / //
analyzed: vidhvasta kumbha bhāṇḍam tat viparītam papāta ca
translated: and it fell upside down, with its pots and vessels broken.

original: tato hāhākṛtaḥ sarvo gopagopījano dvija /
analyzed: tatas hāhākṛtaḥ sarvaḥ gopa gopī janaḥ dvija
translated: Then, O Brahmin, all the cowherds and cowherdesses cried out in alarm,

original: ājagāmātha dadṛśe bālam uttānaśāyinam // / / //
analyzed: ājagāma atha dadṛśe bālam uttāna śāyinam
translated: He came and saw the child lying on his back.

original: gopāḥ keneti kenedaṃ śakaṭaṃ parivartitam /
analyzed: gopāḥ kena iti kena idam śakaṭam parivartitam
translated: The cowherds said, By whom was this cart overturned?

original: tatraiva bālakāḥ procur bālenānena pātitam // / / //
analyzed: tatra eva bālakāḥ procuḥ bālena anena pātitam
translated: The boys there said, By this child it was thrown down.

original: rudatā dṛṣṭam asmābhiḥ pādavikṣepatāḍitam /
analyzed: rudatā dṛṣṭam asmābhiḥ pāda vikṣepa tāḍitam
translated: We saw it crying, struck by the tossing of its feet.

original: śakaṭaṃ parivṛttaṃ vai naitad anyasya ceṣṭitam // / / //
analyzed: śakaṭam parivṛttam vai na etat anyasya ceṣṭitam
translated: The cart was overturned, this is not the work of anyone else.

original: tataḥ punar atīvāsan gopā vismitacetasaḥ /
analyzed: tatas punar atīva āsan gopāḥ vismita cetasaḥ
translated: Then the cowherds became even more astonished.

original: nandagopo 'pi jagrāha bālam atyantavismitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: nanda gopaḥ pi jagrāha bālam atyanta vismitaḥ
translated: The cowherd Nanda also took the child, greatly astonished.

original: yaśodā śakaṭārūḍhabhagnabhāṇḍakapālikāḥ /
analyzed: yaśodā śakaṭa ārūḍha bhagna bhāṇḍa kapālikāḥ
translated: Yashoda, with the broken pots and vessels on the cart,

original: śakaṭaṃ cārcayām āsa dadhipuṣpaphalākṣataiḥ // / / //
analyzed: śakaṭam ca arcayām āsa dadhi puṣpa phala akṣataiḥ
translated: and the cart itself, worshipped with curd, flowers, fruits, and unbroken rice.

original: gargaś ca gokule tatra vasudevapracoditaḥ /
analyzed: gargaḥ ca gokule tatra vasudeva pracoditaḥ
translated: And Garga, urged by Vasudeva, in that cowpen,

original: pracchanna eva gopānāṃ saṃskārān akarot tayoḥ // / / //🔽jyeṣṭhaṃ ca rāmam ity āha kṛṣṇaṃ caiva tathāparam /
analyzed: pracchannaḥ eva gopānām saṃskārān akarot tayoḥ  jyeṣṭham ca rāmam iti āha kṛṣṇam ca eva tathā aparam
translated: unseen by the cowherds, performed the purificatory rites for the two.🔽The greatly wise Garga, best among the wise, naming the elder one Rama,

original: gargo matimatāṃ śreṣṭho nāma kurvan mahāmatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: gargaḥ matimatām śreṣṭhaḥ nāma kurvan mahāmatiḥ
translated: and the other one Krishna,

original: svalpenaiva hi kālena riṅgiṇau tau tadā vraje /
analyzed: su alpena eva hi kālena riṅgiṇau tau tadā vraje
translated: in a short time only, those two became able to crawl in Vraja.

original: ghṛṣṭajānukarau vipra babhūvatur ubhāv api // / / //
analyzed: ghṛṣṭa jānu karau vipra babhūvatuḥ ubhau api
translated: O Brahmin, both of them had their knees rubbed raw.

original: karīṣabhasmadigdhāṅgau bhramamāṇāv itas tataḥ /
analyzed: karīṣa bhasma digdha aṅgau bhramamāṇau itas tatas
translated: Their bodies smeared with cow-dung ash, they wandered here and there.

original: na nivārayituṃ sehe yaśodā na ca rohiṇī // / / //🔽govāṭamadhye krīḍantau vatsavāṭagatau punaḥ /
analyzed: na nivārayitum sehe yaśodā na ca rohiṇī  go vāṭa madhye krīḍantau vatsa vāṭa gatau punar
translated: Yashoda and Rohini were unable to stop them.🔽Playing in the middle of the cow pen, they then went to the calf pen.

original: tadaharjātagovatsapucchākarṣaṇatatparau // / / //🔽yadā yaśodā tau bālāv ekasthānacarāv ubhau /
analyzed: tad ahar jāta go vatsa puccha ākarṣaṇa tatparau  yadā yaśodā tau bālau eka sthāna carau ubhau
translated: Devoted to pulling the tails of the newly born calves and cows.

original: śaśāka no vārayituṃ krīḍantāv aticañcalau // / / //🔽ins /🔽yaśodā yaṣṭim ādāya kopenānugatā ca tam // / / / //
analyzed: śaśāka naḥ vārayitum krīḍantau ati cañcalau  ins  yaśodā yaṣṭim ādāya kopena anugatā ca tam
translated: When Yashoda was unable to stop the two restless and overactive boys, who were playing together in one place,🔽she took up a stick and angrily followed him.

original: kṛṣṇaṃ kamalapatrākṣaṃ tarjayantī ruṣā tadā // / / / //🔽ins /
analyzed: kṛṣṇam kamala patra akṣam tarjayantī ruṣā tadā  ins
translated: Yashoda, in anger, rebuked Krishna, the lotus-eyed one.

original: bahir āvaraṇaṃ nāsti yasya yenedam āvṛtam // / / / //
analyzed: bahis āvaraṇam na asti yasya yena idam āvṛtam
translated: The one by whom this is covered, there is no external covering for him.

original: taṃ kṛṣṇaṃ puṇḍarīkākṣaṃ dāmnā baddhuṃ pracakrame // / / / //
analyzed: tam kṛṣṇam puṇḍarīkākṣam dāmnā baddhum pracakrame
translated: She tried to bind the lotus-eyed Krishna with a rope.

original: dāmnā baddhvā tadā madhye nibabandha ulūkhale /
analyzed: dāmnā baddhvā tadā madhye nibabandha ulūkhale
translated: Having bound him with a rope in the middle, she tied him to the mortar.

original: kṛṣṇam akliṣṭakarmāṇam āha cedam amarṣitā // / / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇam akliṣṭa karmāṇam āha ca idam amarṣitā
translated: The intolerant one then said this to Krishna, the performer of unsullied deeds:

original: yadi śaknoṣi gaccha tvam aticañcalaceṣṭita /
analyzed: yadi śaknoṣi gaccha tvam ati cañcala ceṣṭita
translated: If you are able, go, O you of restless movements,

original: ity uktvā ca nijaṃ karma sā cakāra kuṭumbinī // / / //🔽vyagrāyām atha tasyāṃ sa karṣamāṇa ulūkhalam /
analyzed: iti uktvā ca nijam karma sā cakāra kuṭumbinī  vyagrāyām atha tasyām sa karṣamāṇaḥ ulūkhalam
translated: Having said this, the housewife went about her own work.🔽Then, while she was busy, he, the lotus-eyed one, pulling the mortar,

original: yamalārjunamadhyena jagāma kamalekṣaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yamala arjuna madhyena jagāma kamala īkṣaṇaḥ
translated: went between the twin Arjuna trees.

original: karṣatā vṛkṣayor madhye tiryaggatam ulūkhalam /
analyzed: karṣatā vṛkṣayoḥ madhye tiryak gatam ulūkhalam
translated: While being pulled, the mortar, lying obliquely between the two trees,

original: bhagnāv uttuṅgaśākhāgrau tena tau yamalārjunau // / / //
analyzed: bhagnau uttuṅga śākhā agrau tena tau yamala arjunau
translated: broke the tops of their tall branches, thus those twin Arjuna trees were broken.

original: tataḥ kaṭakaṭāśabdasamākarṇanakātaraḥ /
analyzed: tatas kaṭakaṭā śabda samākarṇana kātaraḥ
translated: Then, frightened by the sound of the mortar breaking,

original: ājagāma vrajajano dadṛśe ca mahādrumau // / / //🔽bhagnaskandhau nipatitau bhagnaśākhau mahītale /🔽navodgatālpadantāṃśusitahāsaṃ ca bālakam /
analyzed: ājagāma vraja janaḥ dadṛśe ca mahā drumau  bhagna skandhau nipatitau bhagna śākhau mahī tale  nava udgata alpa danta aṃśu sita hāsam ca bālakam
translated: the people of Vraja came and saw the two great trees.🔽With their trunks broken and fallen on the ground, with their branches broken,🔽and a child in the middle of them, with a smile as white as the newly grown teeth,

original: tayor madhyagataṃ baddhaṃ dāmnā gāḍhaṃ tathodare // / / //
analyzed: tayoḥ madhya gatam baddham dāmnā gāḍham tathā udare
translated: bound tightly with a rope in the belly.

original: tataś ca dāmodaratāṃ sa yayau dāmabandhanāt // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca dāmodara tām sa yayau dāma bandhanāt
translated: And then he became known as Damodara because of being bound with a rope.

original: gopavṛddhās tataḥ sarve nandagopapurogamāḥ /
analyzed: gopa vṛddhāḥ tatas sarve nanda gopa purogamāḥ
translated: Then all the elders of the cowherds, led by the cowherd Nanda,

original: mantrayām āsur udvignā mahotpātātibhīravaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mantrayām āsuḥ udvignāḥ mahā utpāta ati bhīravaḥ
translated: being anxious and afraid of the great portents, consulted together.

original: sthāneneha na naḥ kāryaṃ vrajāmo 'nyan mahāvanam /
analyzed: sthānena iha na naḥ kāryam vrajāmaḥ mahā vanam
translated: We should not stay here. We will go to another great forest.🔽Here is the realigned and corrected output:

original: utpātā bahavo hy atra dṛśyante nāśahetavaḥ // / / //🔽pūtanāyā vināśaś ca śakaṭasya viparyayaḥ /
analyzed: utpātāḥ bahavaḥ hi atra dṛśyante nāśa hetavaḥ  pūtanāyāḥ vināśaḥ ca śakaṭasya viparyayaḥ
translated: And many portents are seen here as causes of destruction.🔽The destruction of Putanā, the overturning of the cart,

original: vinā vātādidoṣeṇa drumayoḥ patanaṃ tathā // / / //
analyzed: vinā vāta ādi doṣeṇa drumayoḥ patanam tathā
translated: And the falling of the two trees without the fault of wind, etc.

original: vṛndāvanam itaḥ sthānāt tasmād gacchāma mā ciram /
analyzed: vṛndāvanam itas sthānāt tasmāt gacchāma mā ciram
translated: Therefore, let us go from this place to Vṛndāvana, and not delay.

original: yāvad bhaumamahotpātadoṣo nābhibhaved vrajam // / / //
analyzed: yāvat bhauma mahā utpāta doṣaḥ na abhibhavet vrajam
translated: As long as the fault of a great terrestrial calamity does not overwhelm Vraja.

original: iti kṛtvā matiṃ sarve gamane te vrajaukasaḥ /
analyzed: iti kṛtvā matim sarve gamane te vraja okasaḥ
translated: Having thus made up their minds to go, all those residents of Vraja,

original: ūcuḥ svaṃ svaṃ kulaṃ śīghraṃ gamyatāṃ mā vilambyatām // / / //
analyzed: ūcuḥ svam svam kulam śīghram gamyatām mā vilambyatām
translated: Said to their own families, Go quickly, do not delay.

original: tataḥ kṣaṇena prayayuḥ śakaṭair godhanais tathā /
analyzed: tatas kṣaṇena prayayuḥ śakaṭaiḥ go dhanaiḥ tathā
translated: Then in a moment they departed with carts and herds of cows,

original: yūthaśo vatsapālāṃś ca kālayanto vrajaukasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yūthaśas vatsa pālān ca kālayantaḥ vraja okasaḥ
translated: Urging the cowherds and their flocks in groups, the residents of Vraja.

original: dravyāvayavanirdhūtaṃ kṣaṇamātreṇa tat tadā /
analyzed: dravya avayava nirdhūtam kṣaṇa mātreṇa tat tadā
translated: In a moment, it was emptied of all its belongings,

original: kākabhāsasamākīrṇaṃ vrajasthānam abhūd dvija // / / //🔽vṛndāvanaṃ bhagavatā kṛṣṇenākliṣṭakarmaṇā /
analyzed: kāka bhāsa samākīrṇam vraja sthānam abhūt dvija  vṛndāvanam bhagavatā kṛṣṇena akliṣṭa karmaṇā
translated: O Brahmin, the dwelling place of Vraja became filled with crows and vultures.🔽Vṛndāvana was meditated upon with a pure mind by Lord Kṛṣṇa, the performer of effortless deeds,

original: śubhena manasā dhyātaṃ gavāṃ vṛddhim abhīpsatā // / / //
analyzed: śubhena manasā dhyātam gavām vṛddhim abhīpsatā
translated: Desiring the prosperity of the cows.

original: tatas tatrātirūkṣe 'pi gharmakāle dvijottama /
analyzed: tatas gharma kāle dvijottama
translated: Then, O best of Brahmins, in that extremely dry hot season,

original: prāvṛṭkāla ivodbhūtaṃ navaśaṣpaṃ samantataḥ // / / //
analyzed: prāvṛṣ kāle iva udbhūtam nava śaṣpam samantataḥ
translated: and the fresh grass all around was like the onset of the rainy season.

original: sa samāvāsitaḥ sarvo vrajo vṛndāvane tataḥ /
analyzed: sa samāvāsitaḥ sarvaḥ vrajaḥ vṛndāvane tatas
translated: And then the entire Vraja settlement was established in Vṛndāvana,

original: śakaṭīvāṭaparyantaś candrārdhākārasaṃsthitiḥ // / / //
analyzed: śakaṭī vāṭa paryantaḥ candra ardha ākāra saṃsthitiḥ
translated: with the cowherds' huts arranged in a semicircular shape around it.

original: vatsapālau ca saṃvṛttau rāmadāmodarau tataḥ /
analyzed: vatsa pālau ca saṃvṛttau rāma dāmodarau tatas
translated: And then Rāma and Dāmodara became the cowherds,

original: ekasthānasthitau goṣṭhe ceratur bālalīlayā // / / //🔽barhipatrakṛtāpīḍau vanyapuṣpāvataṃsakau /
analyzed: eka sthāna sthitau goṣṭhe ceratuḥ bāla līlayā  barhi patra kṛta āpīḍau vanya puṣpa avataṃsakau
translated: and they roamed in the cow pen in the childish play of staying in one place.🔽With peacock feathers as their headdresses and wild flowers as their earrings,

original: gopaveṇukṛtātodyau patravādyakṛtasvanau // / / //
analyzed: gopa veṇu kṛta ātodyau patra vādya kṛta svanau
translated: with the cowherds' flutes as their musical instruments and the sound of their leaf instruments,

original: kākapakṣadharau bālau kumārāv iva pāvakī /
analyzed: kākapakṣa dharau bālau kumārau iva pāvakī
translated: the two boys, with hair like crow's wings, looked like two young fire gods.

original: hasantau ca ramantau ca ceratus tan mahāvanam // / / //🔽kvacid dhasantāv anyonyaṃ krīḍamānau tathāparaiḥ /
analyzed: hasantau ca ramantau ca ceratuḥ tat mahā vanam  kvacid dhasantau anyonyam krīḍamānau tathā aparaiḥ
translated: Laughing and enjoying themselves, they roamed that great forest.🔽Sometimes laughing at each other and playing with the other cowherd boys,

original: gopaputraiḥ samaṃ vatsāṃś cārayantau viceratuḥ // / / //
analyzed: gopa putraiḥ samam vatsān cārayantau viceratuḥ
translated: they roamed around tending the calves.

original: kālena gacchatā tau tu saptavarṣau mahāvraje /
analyzed: kālena gacchatā tau tu sapta varṣau mahāvraje
translated: As time passed, they became seven years old in the great Vraja,

original: sarvasya jagataḥ pālau vatsapālau babhūvatuḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarvasya jagataḥ pālau vatsa pālau babhūvatuḥ
translated: and those two protectors of the entire world became the cowherds.

original: prāvṛṭkālas tato 'tīva meghaughasthagitāmbaraḥ /
analyzed: prāvṛṣ kālaḥ tīva megha ogha sthagita ambaraḥ
translated: Then the rainy season arrived, with the sky covered by dense clouds,

original: babhūva vāridhārābhir aikyaṃ kurvan diśām iva // / / //
analyzed: babhūva vāri dhārābhiḥ aikyam kurvan diśām iva
translated: as if uniting the directions with streams of rain.

original: prarūḍhanavaśaṣpāḍhyā śakragopāstṛtā mahī /
analyzed: prarūḍha nava śaṣpa āḍhyā śakragopa āstṛtā mahī
translated: The earth was covered with newly grown grass and Shakragopa plants,

original: tadā mārakatevāsīt padmarāgavibhūṣitā // / / //🔽ūhur unmārgavāhīni nimnagāmbhāṃsi sarvataḥ /
analyzed: tadā mārakatā iva āsīt padmarāga vibhūṣitā  ūhuḥ unmārga vāhīni nimnagā ambhāṃsi sarvatas
translated: then it seemed like a painting by an artist, adorned with rubies.🔽The waters of the rivers flowed in wrong directions everywhere,

original: manāṃsi durvinītānāṃ prāpya lakṣmīṃ navām iva // / / //
analyzed: manāṃsi durvinītānām prāpya lakṣmīm navām iva
translated: like the minds of the ill-disciplined, having attained fresh prosperity.

original: na reje 'ntaritaś candro nirmalo malinair ghanaiḥ /
analyzed: na reje ntaritaḥ candraḥ nirmalaḥ malinaiḥ ghanaiḥ
translated: The spotless moon did not shine, obstructed by the dark clouds,

original: sadvākyavādo mūrkhāṇāṃ pragalbhābhir ivoktibhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: sat vākya vādaḥ mūrkhāṇām pragalbhābhiḥ iva uktibhiḥ
translated: like a speaker of good words by the bold statements of fools.

original: nirguṇenāpi cāpena śakrasya gagane padam /
analyzed: nirguṇena api cāpena śakrasya gagane padam
translated: Indra's foot-print was obtained in the sky by the bow, though devoid of string,

original: avāpyatāvivekasya nṛpasyeva parigrahe // / / //
analyzed: avāpya tā vivekasya nṛpasya iva parigrahe
translated: like the acquisition of a king by one devoid of discrimination.

original: meghapṛṣṭhe balākānāṃ rarāja vimalā tatiḥ /
analyzed: megha pṛṣṭhe balākānām rarāja vimalā tatiḥ
translated: The pure line of cranes shone on the back of the clouds,

original: durvṛtte vṛttaceṣṭeva kulīnasyātiśobhanā // / / //
analyzed: durvṛtte vṛtta ceṣṭā iva kulīnasya ati śobhanā
translated: like good conduct in a person of noble birth, though of bad conduct.

original: na babandhāmbare sthairyaṃ vidyud atyantacañcalā /
analyzed: na babandha ambare sthairyam vidyut atyanta cañcalā
translated: The lightning, extremely fickle, did not find stability in the sky,

original: maitrīva pravare puṃsi durjanena prayojitā // / / //
analyzed: maitrī iva pravare puṃsi durjanena prayojitā
translated: like friendship employed by a wicked person towards an excellent man.

original: mārgā babhūvur aspaṣṭā navaśaṣpacayāvṛtāḥ /
analyzed: mārgāḥ babhūvuḥ aspaṣṭāḥ nava śaṣpa caya āvṛtāḥ
translated: The paths became indistinct, covered with fresh grass,

original: arthāntaram anuprāptāḥ prajaḍānām ivoktayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: artha antaram anuprāptāḥ prajaḍānām iva uktayaḥ
translated: have become something else, like the words of the wise.

original: unmattaśikhisāraṅge tasmin kāle mahāvane /🔽kṛṣṇarāmau mudā yuktau gopālaiś ceratuḥ saha // / / //
analyzed: unmatta śikhi sāraṅge tasmin kāle mahā vane  kṛṣṇa rāmau mudā yuktau gopālaiḥ ceratuḥ saha
translated: In that great forest, which was like a mad peacock or a deer,🔽Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma, full of joy, roamed with the cowherds.

original: kvacid gobhiḥ samaṃ ramyaṃ geyatānaratāv ubhau /
analyzed: kvacid gobhiḥ samam ramyam geya tāna ratau ubhau
translated: Sometimes both of them, full of love, roamed with the cows, singing and dancing.

original: ceratuḥ kvacid atyarthaṃ śītavṛkṣatalāśrayau // / / //
analyzed: ceratuḥ kvacid atyartham śītavṛkṣa tala āśrayau
translated: Sometimes they roamed excessively, taking shelter under the shade of cool trees.

original: kvacit kadambasrakcitrau mayūrasragdharau kvacit /
analyzed: kvacid kadamba sraj citrau mayūra sraj dharau kvacid
translated: Sometimes they were adorned with garlands of kadamba flowers, sometimes with peacock feathers,

original: vicitrau kvacid āsātāṃ vividhair giridhātubhiḥ // / / //🔽parṇaśayyāsu saṃsuptau kvacin nidrāntaraiṣiṇau /🔽kvacid garjati jīmūte hāhākāraravādṛtau // / / //
analyzed: vicitrau kvacid āsātām vividhaiḥ giri dhātubhiḥ  parṇa śayyāsu saṃsuptau kvacid nidrā antara eṣiṇau  kvacid garjati jīmūte hāhākāra ravāt ṛtau
translated: and sometimes they sported with various minerals from the mountains.🔽Sometimes they slept on beds of leaves, sometimes seeking rest from sleep,🔽sometimes when the clouds thundered, they were delighted by the sounds of Hā Hā.

original: gāyatām anyagopānāṃ praśaṃsāparamau kvacit /
analyzed: gāyatām anya gopānām praśaṃsā paramau kvacid
translated: Sometimes they were engrossed in praising the singing of other cowherds,

original: mayūrakekānugatau gopaveṇupravādakau // / / //
analyzed: mayūra kekā anugatau gopa veṇu pravādakau
translated: following the cries of peacocks, playing the cowherds' flutes.

original: iti nānāvidhair bhāvair uttamaprītisaṃyutau /
analyzed: iti nānāvidhaiḥ bhāvaiḥ uttama prīti saṃyutau
translated: Thus, full of supreme love, with various emotions,

original: krīḍantau tau vane tasmiñ ceratus tuṣṭamānasau // / / //
analyzed: krīḍantau tau vane tasmin ceratuḥ tuṣṭa mānasau
translated: they sported in that forest, their minds content, they roamed.

original: vikāle ca samaṃ gobhir gopavṛndasamanvitau // / / //🔽After / / /B ins /
analyzed: vikāle ca samam gobhiḥ gopa vṛnda samanvitau 🔽after ins
translated: And in the evening, together with the cows, accompanied by the cowherd groups,

original: ājagmatuḥ kṛṣṇabalau gopaveṣadharāv ubhau // / / //
analyzed: ājagmatuḥ kṛṣṇa balau gopa veṣa dharau ubhau
translated: Krishna and Balarama, the two mighty sons of Vasudeva, came to the cowherds' colony, disguised as cowherds.

original: vikāle ca yathājoṣaṃ vrajam etya mahābalau // / / //
analyzed: vikāle ca yathājoṣam vrajam etya mahā balau
translated: And in the evening, the two mighty ones, as they pleased, came to Vraja,

original: gopaiḥ samānaiḥ sahitau krīḍantāv amarāv iva // / / //🔽After / ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: gopaiḥ samānaiḥ sahitau krīḍantau amarau iva  after e t veṅk ins
translated: and sported with their companions, the cowherds, like two immortals.

original: evaṃ tāv ūṣatus tatra rāmakṛṣṇau mahādyutī // / / //
analyzed: evam tau ūṣatuḥ tatra rāma kṛṣṇau mahā dyutī
translated: After this, the two mighty sons of Vasudeva, Krishna and Balarama, sported in the cowherds' colony for some time.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pañcame 'ṃśe ṣaṣṭho 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pañcame ṃśe ṣaṣṭhaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixth chapter in the fifth section of the Vishnu Purana, composed by the great sage, the son of Parashara and Satyavati.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ekadā tu vinā rāmaṃ kṛṣṇo vṛndāvanaṃ yayau /
analyzed: ekadā tu vinā rāmam kṛṣṇaḥ vṛndāvanam yayau
translated: Once upon a time, Krishna went to Vrndavana without Rama.

original: vicacāra vṛto gopair vanyapuṣpasragujjvalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vicacāra vṛtaḥ gopaiḥ vanya puṣpa sraj ujjvalaḥ
translated: Surrounded by cowherds, he wandered, shining with garlands of wild flowers.

original: sa jagāmātha kālindīṃ lolakallolaśālinīm /
analyzed: sa jagāma atha kālindīm lola kallola śālinīm
translated: He then went to the Kalindi river, full of playful waves,

original: tīrasaṃlagnaphenaughair hasantīm iva sarvataḥ // / / //🔽tasyāṃ cātimahābhīmaṃ viṣāgnisṛtavāriṇam /
analyzed: tīra saṃlagna phena oghaiḥ hasantīm iva sarvatas  tasyām ca ati mahā bhīmam viṣa agni sṛta vāriṇam
translated: as if laughing all around with the foam clinging to its banks.🔽And in it, he saw the extremely terrible lake of the serpent Kaliya, with water moving like poison and fire,

original: hradaṃ kāliyanāgasya dadṛśe 'tīva bhīṣaṇam // / / //🔽viṣāgninā visaratā dagdhatīramahātarum /
analyzed: hradam kāliya nāgasya dadṛśe tīva bhīṣaṇam  viṣa agninā visaratā dagdha tīra mahā tarum
translated: very frightening.🔽The great trees on its banks were burned by the spreading poison fire,

original: vātāhatāmbuvikṣepasparśadagdhavihaṃgamam // / / //
analyzed: vāta āhata ambu vikṣepa sparśa dagdha vihaṃgamam
translated: and the birds were scorched by the touch of the water thrown up by the wind.

original: tam atīva mahāraudraṃ mṛtyuvaktram ivāparam /
analyzed: tam atīva mahā raudram mṛtyu vaktram iva aparam
translated: That lake was extremely terrible, like another mouth of death,

original: vilokya cintayām āsa bhagavān madhusūdanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vilokya cintayām āsa bhagavān madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Seeing this, the illustrious Madhusudana thought:

original: asmin vasati duṣṭātmā kāliyo 'sau viṣāyudhaḥ /
analyzed: asmin vasati duṣṭa ātmā kāliyaḥ sau viṣa āyudhaḥ
translated: Here dwells the wicked-souled Kalya, whose weapon is poison.

original: yo mayā nirjitas tyaktvā duṣṭo naṣṭaḥ payonidhim // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ mayā nirjitaḥ tyaktvā duṣṭaḥ naṣṭaḥ payonidhim
translated: He, having been defeated by me, has left and gone to the ocean.

original: teneyaṃ dūṣitā sarvā yamunā sāgarāṅganā /
analyzed: tena iyam dūṣitā sarvā yamunā sāgara aṅganā
translated: By him, this entire Yamuna, the ocean's daughter, has been polluted.

original: na narair godhanair vāpi tṛṣārtair upabhujyate // / / //
analyzed: na naraiḥ go dhanaiḥ vā api tṛṣā ārtaiḥ upabhujyate
translated: It is not enjoyed by thirsty men or herds of cattle.

original: tad asya nāgarājasya kartavyo nigraho mayā /
analyzed: tat asya nāga rājasya kartavyaḥ nigrahaḥ mayā
translated: Therefore, this king of serpents must be restrained by me.

original: ciram atra sukhaṃ yena careyur vrajavāsinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ciram atra sukham yena careyuḥ vraja vāsinaḥ
translated: So that the residents of Vraja may roam here happily for a long time.

original: etadarthaṃ nṛloke 'sminn avatāro mayā kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: etad artham nṛ loke smin avatāraḥ mayā kṛtaḥ
translated: It is for this purpose that I have taken birth in the world of men,

original: yad eṣām utpathasthānāṃ kāryā śāntir durātmanām // / / //
analyzed: yat eṣām utpatha sthānām kāryā śāntiḥ durātmanām
translated: That I may bring peace to these wicked ones who stand in the wrong path.

original: tad etan nātidūrasthaṃ kadambam uruśākhinam /
analyzed: tat etat na ati dūra stham kadambam uru śākhinam
translated: To that large-branched kadamba tree not far away,

original: adhiruhyotpatiṣyāmi hrade 'sminn anilāśinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: adhiruhya utpatiṣyāmi hrade smin anilāśinaḥ
translated: I will climb and jump into this lake of the wind-eating serpent.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: itthaṃ vicintya baddhvā ca gāḍhaṃ parikaraṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: ittham vicintya baddhvā ca gāḍham parikaram tatas
translated: Having thought thus and tightly girding his loins,

original: nipapāta hrade tatra sarparājasya vegitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: nipapāta hrade tatra sarpa rājasya vegitaḥ
translated: He swiftly jumped into the lake of the king of serpents.

original: tenāpi patatā tatra kṣobhitaḥ sa mahāhradaḥ /
analyzed: tena api patatā tatra kṣobhitaḥ sa mahā hradaḥ
translated: By his jumping in there, that great lake was agitated,

original: atyarthaṃ dūrajātāṃs tu tān asiñcan mahīruhān // / / //🔽te hi duṣṭaviṣajvālātaptāmbupavanokṣitāḥ /
analyzed: atyartham dūra jātān tu tān asiñcat mahīruhān  te hi duṣṭa viṣa jvālā tapta ambu pavana ukṣitāḥ
translated: But they sprinkled those trees which were at a great distance.🔽Those trees, sprinkled with water heated by the poisonous flames,

original: jajvaluḥ pādapāḥ sadyo jvālāvyāptadigantarāḥ // / / //
analyzed: jajvaluḥ pādapāḥ sadyas jvālā vyāpta digantarāḥ
translated: immediately caught fire, filling the whole horizon with flames.

original: āsphoṭayām āsa tadā kṛṣṇo nāgahrade bhujam /
analyzed: āsphoṭayām āsa tadā kṛṣṇaḥ nāga hrade bhujam
translated: Then Krishna clapped his arms in the serpent lake.

original: tacchabdaśravaṇāc cāśu nāgarājo 'bhyupāgamat // / / //🔽ātāmranayanaḥ kopād viṣajvālākulaiḥ phaṇaiḥ /
analyzed: tad śabda śravaṇāt ca āśu nāga rājaḥ bhyupāgamat  ātāmra nayanaḥ kopāt viṣa jvālā ākulaiḥ phaṇaiḥ
translated: And at the sound of that, the king of the serpents quickly approached.🔽With eyes coppery red with anger, with hoods filled with poisonous flames,

original: vṛto mahāviṣaiś cānyair uragair anilāśibhiḥ // / / //🔽nāgapatnyaś ca śataśo hārihāropaśobhitāḥ /
analyzed: vṛtaḥ mahāviṣaiḥ ca anyaiḥ uragaiḥ anilāśibhiḥ  nāga patnyaḥ ca śataśas hāri hāra upaśobhitāḥ
translated: surrounded by other great poisonous serpents, eaters of the wind.🔽And the serpent wives, hundreds of them, adorned with beautiful necklaces,

original: prakampitatanukṣepacalatkuṇḍalakāntayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prakampita tanu kṣepa calat kuṇḍala kāntayaḥ
translated: with the beauty of their earrings moving as their bodies trembled.

original: tataḥ praveśitaḥ sarpaiḥ sa kṛṣṇo bhogabandhanam /
analyzed: tatas praveśitaḥ sarpaiḥ sa kṛṣṇaḥ bhoga bandhanam
translated: Then Krishna was bound by the serpents with their coils.

original: dadaṃśuś cāpi te kṛṣṇaṃ viṣajvālāvilair mukhaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: dadaṃśuḥ ca api te kṛṣṇam viṣa jvālā āvilaiḥ mukhaiḥ
translated: And they bit Krishna with their mouths filled with poisonous flames.

original: taṃ tatra patitaṃ dṛṣṭvā sarpabhoganipīḍitam /
analyzed: tam tatra patitam dṛṣṭvā sarpa bhoga nipīḍitam
translated: Seeing him fallen there, oppressed by the coils of the serpents,

original: gopā vrajam upāgamya cukruśuḥ śokalālasāḥ // / / //
analyzed: gopāḥ vrajam upāgamya cukruśuḥ śoka lālasāḥ
translated: the cowherds, filled with grief, went to the Vraja and cried out.

original: gopā ūcuḥ /
analyzed: gopāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The cowherds said:

original: eṣa mohaṃ gataḥ kṛṣṇo magnau vai kāliye hrade /
analyzed: eṣa moham gataḥ kṛṣṇaḥ magnau vai kāliye hrade
translated: This Krishna has fallen into a swoon, sunk in the lake of Kaliya.

original: bhakṣyate sarparājena tad āgacchata paśyata // / / //
analyzed: bhakṣyate sarpa rājena tat āgacchata paśyata
translated: is being devoured by the king of serpents. Come and see.

original: tac chrutvā te tadā gopā vajrapātopamaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: tat śrutvā te tadā gopāḥ vajra pāta upamam vacaḥ
translated: Hearing those words, which were like the fall of a thunderbolt,

original: gopyaś ca tvaritā jagmur yaśodāpramukhā hradam // / / //
analyzed: gopyaḥ ca tvaritāḥ jagmuḥ yaśodā pramukhāḥ hradam
translated: the cowherds and the cowherdesses, headed by Yashodā, quickly went to the lake.

original: hā hā kvāsāv iti jano gopīnām ativihvalaḥ /
analyzed: hā hā kva asau iti janaḥ gopīnām ati vihvalaḥ
translated: Where is he? the cowherdesses cried out in great distress.

original: yaśodayā samaṃ bhrānto drutaṃ praskhalitaṃ yayau // / / //
analyzed: yaśodayā samam bhrāntaḥ drutam praskhalitam yayau
translated: Along with Yashodā, they wandered about, hurrying and stumbling.

original: nandagopaś ca gopāś ca rāmaś cādbhutavikramaḥ /🔽tvaritaṃ yamunāṃ jagmuḥ kṛṣṇadarśanalālasāḥ // / / //
analyzed: nanda gopaḥ ca gopāḥ ca rāmaḥ ca adbhuta vikramaḥ  tvaritam yamunām jagmuḥ kṛṣṇa darśana lālasāḥ
translated: Nandagopa, the cowherds, and Rāma of wondrous valor,🔽hurried to the Yamunā, eager to see Kṛṣṇa.

original: dadṛśuś cāpi te tatra sarparājavaśaṃ gatam /
analyzed: dadṛśuḥ ca api te tatra sarpa rāja vaśam gatam
translated: And there they saw Kṛṣṇa, under the power of the king of serpents,

original: niṣprayatnakṛtaṃ kṛṣṇaṃ sarpabhogena veṣṭitam // / / //
analyzed: niṣprayatna kṛtam kṛṣṇam sarpa bhogena veṣṭitam
translated: helpless, wrapped in the coils of the serpent.

original: nandagopaś ca niśceṣṭo nyasya putramukhe dṛśam /
analyzed: nanda gopaḥ ca niśceṣṭaḥ nyasya putra mukhe dṛśam
translated: Nandagopa, his eyes fixed on his son's face, became motionless,

original: yaśodā ca mahābhāgā babhūva munisattama // / / //🔽gopyas tv anyā rudantyaś ca dadṛśuḥ śokakātarāḥ /
analyzed: yaśodā ca mahābhāgā babhūva muni sattama  gopyaḥ tu anyāḥ rudantyaḥ ca dadṛśuḥ śoka kātarāḥ
translated: and the greatly fortunate Yashodā, O best of sages,🔽the other cowherdesses, weeping and terrified with grief,

original: procuś ca keśavaṃ prītyā bhayakātaryagadgadam // / / //
analyzed: procuḥ ca keśavam prītyā bhaya kātarya gadgadam
translated: and affectionately said to Kṛṣṇa in voices trembling with fear and distress:

original: sarvā yaśodayā sārdhaṃ viśāmo 'tra mahāhrade /
analyzed: sarvāḥ yaśodayā sārdham viśāmaḥ tra mahā hrade
translated: We will all enter this great lake with Yashodā.

original: nāgarājasya no gantum asmākaṃ yujyate vraje // / / //
analyzed: nāga rājasya no gantum asmākam yujyate vraje
translated: It is not proper for us to go to the king of serpents without him.

original: divasaḥ ko vinā sūryaṃ vinā candreṇa kā niśā /
analyzed: divasaḥ kaḥ vinā sūryam vinā candreṇa kā niśā
translated: What is a day without the sun? What is night without the moon?

original: vinā vṛṣeṇa kā gāvo vinā kṛṣṇena ko vrajaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vinā vṛṣeṇa kāḥ gāvaḥ vinā kṛṣṇena kaḥ vrajaḥ
translated: What are cows without a bull? What is Vraja without Krishna?

original: vinākṛtā na yāsyāmaḥ kṛṣṇenānena gokulam /
analyzed: vinākṛtāḥ na yāsyāmaḥ kṛṣṇena anena gokulam
translated: We will not go to Gokula without this Krishna.

original: araṇyaṃ nātisevyaṃ ca vārihīnaṃ yathā saraḥ // / / //
analyzed: araṇyam na atisevyam ca vāri hīnam yathā saraḥ
translated: A forest without him is not to be frequented, like a lake without water.

original: yatra nendīvaradalaprakhyakāntir ayaṃ hariḥ // / / //🔽ins / / / after /
analyzed: yatra nā indīvara dala prakhya kāntiḥ ayam hariḥ  ins after
translated: Where there is no Hari, whose beauty is like the petals of a blue lotus.

original: kenāyaṃ mānuṣo jāto na ca mānuṣaceṣṭitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kena ayam mānuṣaḥ jātaḥ na ca mānuṣa ceṣṭitaḥ
translated: By whom he was born as a human, but does not act like a human.

original: tenāpi martyavāsena ratir astīti vismayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tena api martya vāsena ratiḥ asti iti vismayaḥ
translated: It is a wonder that he, who dwells among mortals, still finds pleasure there.

original: utphullapaṅkajadalaspaṣṭakāntivilocanam /
analyzed: utphulla paṅkaja dala spaṣṭa kānti vilocanam
translated: With eyes shining like the petals of a blooming lotus,

original: apaśyanto hariṃ dīnāḥ kathaṃ goṣṭhe bhaviṣyatha // / / //
analyzed: a paśyantaḥ harim dīnāḥ katham goṣṭhe bhaviṣyatha
translated: Seeing Krishna not there, how will you be in the cowherds' colony?

original: atyarthamadhurālāpahṛtāśeṣamanodhanam /
analyzed: atyartha madhura ālāpa hṛta aśeṣa manaḥ dhanam
translated: With all the wealth of mind captivated by his extremely sweet speech,

original: na vinā puṇḍarīkākṣaṃ yāsyāmo nandagokulam // / / //
analyzed: na vinā puṇḍarīkākṣam yāsyāmaḥ nanda gokulam
translated: We will not go to Nanda's cowherds' colony without the lotus-eyed one.

original: bhogenāveṣṭitasyāpi sarparājena paśyata /
analyzed: bhogena āveṣṭitasya api sarpa rājena paśyata
translated: Look, even though he is surrounded by the king of serpents,

original: smitaśobhimukhaṃ gopyaḥ kṛṣṇasyāsmadvilokane // / / //
analyzed: smita śobhi mukham gopyaḥ kṛṣṇasya asmad vilokane
translated: The cowherdesses, with smiling faces, are looking at us.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: iti gopīvacaḥ śrutvā rauhiṇeyo mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: iti gopī vacaḥ śrutvā rauhiṇeyaḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: Hearing these words of the cowherdesses, the greatly powerful son of Rohini,

original: gopāṃś ca trāsavidhurān vilokya stimitekṣaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: gopān ca trāsa vidhurān vilokya stimita īkṣaṇaḥ
translated: seeing the cowherds with terrified eyes,

original: nandaṃ ca dīnam atyarthaṃ nyastadṛṣṭiṃ sutānane /
analyzed: nandam ca dīnam atyartham nyasta dṛṣṭim suta ānane
translated: and Nanda, who was extremely distressed and whose eyes were fixed on the face of his son,

original: mūrcchākulāṃ yaśodāṃ ca kṛṣṇamāhātmyasaṃjñayā // / / //
analyzed: mūrcchā ākulām yaśodām ca kṛṣṇa māhātmya saṃjñayā
translated: and Yashoda, who was overwhelmed with swoon, by the greatness of Krishna,

original: balabhadra uvāca /🔽kimarthaṃ devadeveśa bhāvo 'yaṃ mānuṣas tvayā /
analyzed: balabhadraḥ uvāca  kimartham devadeveśa bhāvaḥ yam mānuṣaḥ tvayā
translated: Balabhadra said:🔽For what purpose, O Lord of the Lord of gods, is this human sentiment displayed by you?

original: vyajyate 'tyantam ātmānaṃ kim anantaṃ na vetsi yat // / / //
analyzed: vyajyate tyantam ātmānam kim anantam na vetsi yat
translated: Do you not know that you are infinite?

original: tvam asya jagato nābhir arāṇām iva saṃśrayaḥ /
analyzed: tvam asya jagataḥ nābhiḥ arāṇām iva saṃśrayaḥ
translated: You are the navel of this world, the support of the spokes,

original: kartāpahartā pātā ca trailokye tvaṃ trayīmayaḥ // / / //🔽sendrarudrāśvivasubhir ādityair marudagnibhiḥ /
analyzed: kartā apahartā pātā ca trailokye tvam trayī mayaḥ  sa indra rudra aśvi vasubhiḥ ādityaiḥ marut agnibhiḥ
translated: the creator, destroyer and protector of the three worlds, you are the essence of the three Vedas.🔽You are contemplated upon by Indra, Rudra, the Ashvins, the Vasus, the Adityas, the Maruts and the fire gods,

original: cintyase tvam acintyātman samastaiś caiva yogibhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: cintyase tvam acintya ātman samastaiḥ ca eva yogibhiḥ
translated: and by all the yogis, O inconceivable one.

original: jagatyarthe jagannātha bhārāvataraṇecchayā /
analyzed: jagatī arthe jagannātha bhāra avataraṇa icchayā
translated: For the sake of the world, O Lord of the world, with the desire to remove the burden,

original: avatīrṇo 'tra martyeṣu tavāṃśaś cāham agrajaḥ // / / //
analyzed: avatīrṇaḥ tra martyeṣu tava aṃśaḥ ca aham agrajaḥ
translated: you have descended here among mortals, and I am your elder brother, a part of you.

original: manuṣyalīlāṃ bhagavan bhajatā bhavatā surāḥ /
analyzed: manuṣya līlām bhagavan bhajatā bhavatā surāḥ
translated: O Lord, the gods,

original: viḍambayantas tvallīlāṃ sarva eva sadāsate // / / //
analyzed: viḍambayantaḥ tvad līlām sarve eva sadā āsate
translated: And all of them are ever engaged in imitating your sports.

original: avatārya bhavān pūrvaṃ gokule 'tra surāṅganāḥ /
analyzed: avatārya bhavān pūrvam gokule sura aṅganāḥ
translated: You first brought down the celestial women to Gokula here,

original: krīḍārtham ātmanaḥ paścād avatīrṇo 'si śāśvata // / / //
analyzed: krīḍā artham ātmanaḥ paścāt avatīrṇaḥ si śāśvata
translated: And then, O eternal one, you yourself descended for your own sport.

original: atrāvatīrṇayoḥ kṛṣṇa gopā eva hi bāndhavāḥ /
analyzed: atra avatīrṇayoḥ kṛṣṇa gopāḥ eva hi bāndhavāḥ
translated: Here, O Krishna, the cowherds are indeed the kinsmen of those who have descended.

original: gopyaś ca sīdataḥ kasmāt tvaṃ bandhūn samupekṣase // / / //
analyzed: gopyaḥ ca sīdataḥ kasmāt tvam bandhūn samupekṣase
translated: And the cowherdesses, why do you neglect your kinsmen who are in distress?

original: darśito mānuṣo bhāvo darśitaṃ bālacāpalam /
analyzed: darśitaḥ mānuṣaḥ bhāvaḥ darśitam bāla cāpalam
translated: You have shown human nature, you have shown childish fickleness,

original: tad ayaṃ damyatāṃ kṛṣṇa duṣṭātmā daśanāyudhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat ayam damyatām kṛṣṇa duṣṭa ātmā daśana āyudhaḥ
translated: Therefore, O Krishna, this wicked-souled one, whose weapon is his fangs, should be subdued.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: iti saṃsmāritaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ smitabhinnauṣṭhasaṃpuṭaḥ /
analyzed: iti saṃsmāritaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ smita bhinna oṣṭha saṃpuṭaḥ
translated: Thus reminded, Krishna, with his lips slightly parted in a smile,

original: āsphoṭya mocayām āsa svadehaṃ bhogabandhanāt // / / //
analyzed: āsphoṭya mocayām āsa sva deham bhoga bandhanāt
translated: Clapped his hands and released his body from the coils of the serpent.

original: ānamya cāpi hastābhyām ubhābhyāṃ madhyamaṃ phaṇam /
analyzed: ānamya ca api hastābhyām ubhābhyām madhyamam phaṇam
translated: And bending the middle hood with both hands,

original: āruhyābhugnaśirasi prananartoruvikramaḥ // / / //
analyzed: āruhya ābhugna śirasi prananarta uru vikramaḥ
translated: The one of great prowess mounted on the bent head and danced.

original: vraṇāḥ phaṇe 'bhavaṃś cāsya kṛṣṇasyāṅghrinikuṭṭanaiḥ /
analyzed: vraṇāḥ phaṇe bhavan ca asya kṛṣṇasya aṅghri nikuṭṭanaiḥ
translated: And wounds appeared on the hood from Krishna's stamping with his feet,

original: yatronnatiṃ ca kurute nanāmāsya tataḥ śiraḥ // / / //
analyzed: yatra unnatim ca kurute nanāma asya tatas śiraḥ
translated: And wherever it tried to raise itself, its head bent down.

original: mūrcchām upāyayau bhrāntyā nāgaḥ kṛṣṇasya recakaiḥ /
analyzed: mūrcchām upāyayau bhrāntyā nāgaḥ kṛṣṇasya recakaiḥ
translated: The serpent, by the exhalations of Krishna, fell into a swoon, as if in a fit.

original: daṇḍapātanipātena vavāma rudhiraṃ bahu // / / //🔽taṃ nirbhugnaśirogrīvam āsyebhyaḥ srutaśoṇitam /
analyzed: daṇḍa pāta nipātena vavāma rudhiram bahu  tam nirbhugna śiraḥ grīvam āsyebhyaḥ sruta śoṇitam
translated: And from the strokes of the rod, it vomited much blood.🔽Seeing him with his head and neck bent down, and blood flowing from his mouth,

original: vilokya śaraṇaṃ jagmus tatpatnyo madhusūdanam // / / //
analyzed: vilokya śaraṇam jagmuḥ tad patnyaḥ madhusūdanam
translated: his wives sought refuge in Madhusudana.

original: nāgapatnya ūcuḥ /
analyzed: nāga patnyaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The wives of the serpent said:

original: jñāto 'si devadeveśa sarveśas tvam anuttamaḥ /
analyzed: jñātaḥ u si devadeveśa sarva īśaḥ tvam anuttamaḥ
translated: You are known as the Lord of the gods, the Lord of all, the supreme,

original: paraṃ jyotir acintyaṃ yat tadaṃśaḥ parameśvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: param jyotiḥ acintyam yat tad aṃśaḥ parameśvaraḥ
translated: The highest light, the inconceivable, and a part of that Supreme Lord.

original: na samarthāḥ surāḥ stotuṃ yam ananyabhavaṃ prabhum /
analyzed: na samarthāḥ surāḥ stotum yam an anya bhavam prabhum
translated: The gods are unable to praise that unborn Lord,

original: svarūpavarṇanaṃ tasya kathaṃ yoṣit kariṣyati // / / //
analyzed: svarūpa varṇanam tasya katham yoṣit kariṣyati
translated: How can a woman describe His form?

original: yasyākhilaṃ mahīvyomajalāgnipavanātmakam /
analyzed: yasya akhilam mahī vyoma jala agni pavana ātmakam
translated: In whom this entire universe consisting of earth, sky, water, fire and air,

original: brahmāṇḍam alpakāṃśāṃśaḥ stoṣyāmas taṃ kathaṃ vayam // / / //
analyzed: brahmāṇḍam alpaka aṃśāṃśaḥ stoṣyāmaḥ tam katham vayam
translated: A mere part of a part, we shall praise Him.

original: yatanto na vidur nityaṃ yatsvarūpam ayoginaḥ /
analyzed: yatantaḥ na viduḥ nityam yad svarūpam a yoginaḥ
translated: The non-yogis, though trying, never know His true nature,

original: paramārtham aṇor alpaṃ sthūlāt sthūlaṃ natāḥ sma tam // / / //
analyzed: parama artham aṇoḥ alpam sthūlāt sthūlam natāḥ sma tam
translated: We bow to Him, the supreme reality, smaller than the smallest and greater than the greatest.

original: na yasya janmane dhātā yasya nāntāya cāntakaḥ /
analyzed: na yasya janmane dhātā yasya na antāya ca antakaḥ
translated: For His birth, there is no creator, and for His end, no destroyer,

original: sthitikartā na cānyo 'sti yasya tasmai namaḥ sadā // / / //
analyzed: sthiti kartā na ca anyaḥ sti yasya tasmai namaḥ sadā
translated: There is no other preserver, salutations always to Him.

original: kopaḥ svalpo 'pi te nāsti sthitipālanam eva te /
analyzed: kopaḥ te nā asti sthiti pālanam eva te
translated: You have not even the slightest anger, you are the protector and preserver.

original: kāraṇaṃ kāliyasyāsya damane śrūyatām ataḥ // / / //
analyzed: kāraṇam kāliyasya asya damane śrūyatām atas
translated: Listen to the reason for subduing this Kāliya.

original: striyo 'nukampyāḥ sādhūnāṃ mūḍhā dīnāś ca jantavaḥ /
analyzed: striyaḥ nukampyāḥ sādhūnām mūḍhāḥ dīnāḥ ca jantavaḥ
translated: Women are to be pitied by the good, foolish and helpless creatures.

original: yatas tato 'sya dīnasya kṣamyatāṃ kṣamatāṃ vara // / / //
analyzed: dīnasya kṣamyatām kṣamatām vara
translated: Therefore, O best of the forgiving, forgive this helpless one.

original: samastajagadādhāro bhavān alpabalaḥ phaṇī /
analyzed: samasta jagat ādhāraḥ bhavān alpa balaḥ phaṇī
translated: You are the support of the entire world, and this serpent is of little strength.

original: tvatpādapīḍito jahyān muhūrtārdhena jīvitam // / / //
analyzed: tvad pāda pīḍitaḥ jahyāt muhūrta ardhena jīvitam
translated: Afflicted by your foot, he will give up his life in half a moment.

original: kva pannago 'lpavīryo 'yaṃ kva bhavān bhuvanāśrayaḥ /
analyzed: kva pannagaḥ lpa vīryaḥ yam kva bhavān bhuvana āśrayaḥ
translated: Where is this serpent of little strength, and where are you, the support of the world?

original: prītidveṣau samotkṛṣṭagocarau ca yato 'vyaya // / / //
analyzed: prīti dveṣau sama utkṛṣṭa gocarau ca yatas vyaya
translated: Since love and hatred have equal and superior objects, O imperishable one.

original: tataḥ kuru jagatsvāmin prasādam avasīdataḥ /
analyzed: tatas kuru jagatsvāmin prasādam avasīdataḥ
translated: Therefore, O lord of the world, show grace to this one who is sinking.

original: prāṇāṃs tyajati nāgo 'yaṃ bhartṛbhikṣā pradīyatām // / / //
analyzed: prāṇān tyajati nāgaḥ yam bhartṛ bhikṣā pradīyatām
translated: This serpent is giving up its life, grant the alms of a master.

original: After / ed /
analyzed: after e t
translated: After.

original: vedāntavedya deveśa duṣṭadaityanibarhaṇa // / / //
analyzed: vedānta vedya deveśa duṣṭa daitya nibarhaṇa
translated: Knowable through Vedānta, lord of gods, destroyer of wicked demons.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parāśara said:

original: ity ukte tābhir āśvasya klāntadeho 'pi pannagaḥ /
analyzed: iti ukte tābhiḥ āśvasya klānta dehaḥ pi pannagaḥ
translated: When this was said by them, the serpent, though his body was exhausted, was comforted.

original: prasīda deva deveti prāha vākyaṃ śanaiḥ śanaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: prasīda deva deva iti prāha vākyam śanais śanais
translated: and said these words slowly and softly: Be gracious, O Lord of the gods!

original: kāliya uvāca /
analyzed: kāliyaḥ uvāca
translated: Kāliya said:

original: tavāṣṭaguṇam aiśvaryaṃ nātha svābhāvikaṃ param /
analyzed: tava aṣṭaguṇam aiśvaryam nātha svābhāvikam param
translated: Your lordship's natural supreme power has eight qualities,

original: nirastātiśayaṃ yasya tasya stoṣyāmi kiṃ nv aham // / / //
analyzed: nirasta atiśayam yasya tasya stoṣyāmi kim nu aham
translated: whose excess is removed. What shall I praise of Him?

original: tvaṃ paras tvaṃ parasyādyaḥ paraṃ tvattaḥ parātmakam /
analyzed: tvam paraḥ tvam parasya ādyaḥ param tvattaḥ para ātmakam
translated: You are the supreme, you are the first of the supreme, the supreme is beyond you, the supreme Self,

original: parasmāt paramo yas tvaṃ tasya stoṣyāmi kiṃ nv aham // / / //
analyzed: parasmāt paramaḥ yaḥ tvam tasya stoṣyāmi kim nu aham
translated: whose supreme is you. What shall I praise of Him?

original: yasmād brahmā ca rudraś ca candrendramarudaśvinaḥ /
analyzed: yasmāt brahmā ca rudraḥ ca candra indra marut aśvinaḥ
translated: From whom Brahmā, Rudra, the moon, Indra, the Maruts, the Aśvins,

original: vasavaś ca sahādityais tasya stoṣyāmi kiṃ nv aham // / / //
analyzed: vasavaḥ ca saha ādityaiḥ tasya stoṣyāmi kim nu aham
translated: the Vasus along with the Ādityas, what shall I praise of Him?

original: ekāvayavasūkṣmāṃśo yasyaitad akhilaṃ jagat /
analyzed: eka avayava sūkṣma aṃśaḥ yasya etat akhilam jagat
translated: This entire world is a subtle part of one of His limbs,

original: kalpanāvayavāṃśasya taṃ stoṣyāmi kathaṃ tv aham // / / //
analyzed: kalpanā avayava aṃśasya tam stoṣyāmi katham tu aham
translated: how shall I praise Him, whose limbs are the imagination?

original: After / / ins /
analyzed: after ins
translated: After this, an additional verse is inserted:

original: nāgapatnībhir evaṃ vai stūyamānasya kāliyaḥ // / / / //
analyzed: nāga patnībhiḥ evam vai stūyamānasya kāliyaḥ
translated: While Kāliya was being praised thus by the wives of the Nāgas,

original: stotreṇa praṇipatyocet kṛtvā karatalāñjalim // / / / //
analyzed: stotreṇa praṇipatya ucet kṛtvā kara tala añjalim
translated: he bowed down with folded hands and said in a hymn:

original: namas te nātha bhagavan pītavastrācyuteśvara // / / / //
analyzed: namaḥ te nātha bhagavan pīta vastra acyuta īśvara
translated: Salutations to you, O Lord, O Blessed One, O lord of the yellow-robed,

original: prasīda me jagannātha na jñātaṃ kiṃ mayā prabho // / / / //
analyzed: prasīda me jagannātha na jñātam kim mayā prabho
translated: Be gracious to me, O Lord of the world, what have I not known, O Lord?

original: sadasadrūpiṇo yasya brahmādyās tridaśottamāḥ /
analyzed: sat asat rūpiṇaḥ yasya brahma ādyāḥ tridaśa uttamāḥ
translated: Whose forms, good and bad, the best of the thirty gods, Brahma and others,

original: paramārthaṃ na jānanti tasya stoṣyāmi kiṃ nv aham // / / //
analyzed: parama artham na jānanti tasya stoṣyāmi kim nu aham
translated: Do not know the ultimate truth, how can I praise him?

original: brahmādyair arcyate divyair yaś ca puṣpānulepanaiḥ /
analyzed: brahma ādyaiḥ arcyate divyaiḥ yaḥ ca puṣpa anulepanaiḥ
translated: Who is worshipped by Brahma and others with divine flowers and ointments,

original: nandanādisamudbhūtaiḥ so 'rcyate vā kathaṃ mayā // / / //
analyzed: nandana ādi samudbhūtaiḥ saḥ arcyate vā katham mayā
translated: And by those arising from Nandana and other places, how can I worship him?

original: yasyāvatārarūpāṇi devarājaḥ sadārcati /
analyzed: yasya avatāra rūpāṇi devarājaḥ sadā arcati
translated: Whose incarnations the king of the gods always worships,

original: na vetti paramaṃ rūpaṃ so 'rcyate vā kathaṃ mayā // / / //
analyzed: na vetti paramam rūpam saḥ arcyate vā katham mayā
translated: Not knowing the supreme form, how can I worship him?

original: viṣayebhyaḥ samāhṛtya sarvākṣāṇi ca yoginaḥ /
analyzed: viṣayebhyaḥ samāhṛtya sarva akṣāṇi ca yoginaḥ
translated: Having withdrawn all the senses from the objects of sense,

original: yam arcayanti dhyānena so 'rcyate vā kathaṃ mayā // / / //
analyzed: yam arcayanti dhyānena saḥ rcyate vā katham mayā
translated: The yogis worship him with meditation, how can I worship him?

original: hṛdi saṃkalpya yad rūpaṃ dhyānenārcanti yoginaḥ /
analyzed: hṛdi saṃkalpya yat rūpam dhyānena arcanti yoginaḥ
translated: The form that the yogis worship with meditation, having conceived it in the heart,

original: bhāvapuṣpādibhir nāthaḥ so 'rcyate vā kathaṃ mayā // / / //
analyzed: bhāva puṣpa ādibhiḥ nāthaḥ saḥ arcyate vā katham mayā
translated: With the flowers of devotion and other things, how can I worship the Lord?

original: so 'haṃ te devadeveśa nārcanādau stutau na ca /
analyzed: saḥ u ham te devadeveśa na arcana ādau stutau na ca
translated: Therefore, O Lord of the gods, I am not capable of worship, praise, etc.,

original: sāmarthyavān kṛpāmātramanovṛttiḥ prasīda me // / / //
analyzed: sāmarthyavān kṛpā mātra manaḥ vṛttiḥ prasīda me
translated: My mind is inclined only towards compassion, be gracious to me.

original: sarpajātir iyaṃ krūrā yasyāṃ jāto 'smi keśava /
analyzed: sarpa jātiḥ iyam krūrā yasyām jātaḥ smi keśava
translated: O Keshava, this is the cruel nature of the serpent race in which I am born.

original: tatsvabhāvo 'yam atrāsti nāparādho mamācyuta // / / //
analyzed: tad svabhāvaḥ yam atrā asti na aparādhaḥ mama acyuta
translated: This is my nature, not my fault, O Achyuta.
