analyzed: hantum abhyāyayau kopāt jarāsaṃdhaḥ sa yādavam
translated: came in anger to kill the Yadava.

original: upetya mathurāṃ so 'tha rurodha magadheśvaraḥ /
analyzed: upetya mathurām saḥ tha rurodha magadha īśvaraḥ
translated: Having reached Mathura, the lord of Magadha besieged it.

original: akṣauhiṇībhiḥ sainyasya trayoviṃśatibhir vṛtaḥ // / / //🔽niṣkramyālpaparīvārāv ubhau rāmajanārdanau /
analyzed: akṣauhiṇībhiḥ sainyasya trayoviṃśatibhiḥ vṛtaḥ  niṣkramya alpa parīvārau ubhau rāma janārdanau
translated: Surrounded by twenty-three divisions of troops,

original: yuyudhāte samaṃ tasya balinau balisainikaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: yuyudhāte samam tasya balinau bali sainikaiḥ
translated: Rama and Janardana, with a small retinue, came out and fought with the powerful soldiers of his army.

original: tato rāmaś ca kṛṣṇaś ca cakrāte matim uttamām /
analyzed: tatas rāmaḥ ca kṛṣṇaḥ ca cakrāte matim uttamām
translated: Then Rama and Krishna formed an excellent plan, O best of sages,

original: āyudhānāṃ purāṇānām ādāne munisattama // / / //🔽anantaraṃ hareḥ śārṅgaṃ tūṇau cākṣayasāyakau /
analyzed: āyudhānām purāṇānām ādāne muni sattama  anantaram hareḥ śārṅgam tūṇau ca akṣaya sāyakau
translated: to take up the ancient weapons.

original: ākāśād āgatau vipra tathā kaumodakī gadā // / / //
analyzed: ākāśāt āgatau vipra tathā kaumodakī gadā
translated: Immediately after that, Hari's Sharnga bow and two quivers with inexhaustible arrows came from the sky, O Brahmin, and also the Kaumodaki mace.

original: halaṃ ca balabhadrasya gaganād āgataṃ jvalat /
analyzed: halam ca balabhadrasya gaganāt āgatam jvalat
translated: The blazing plough of Balabhadra also came from the sky.

original: manasābhimataṃ vipra saunandaṃ musalaṃ tathā // / / //
analyzed: manasā abhimatam vipra saunandam musalam tathā
translated: the Saundanda and Musala clubs, which are dear to the mind, O Brahmana.

original: tato yuddhe parājitya sasainyaṃ magadhādhipam /
analyzed: tatas yuddhe parājitya sa sainyam magadha adhipam
translated: Then, having defeated the king of Magadha along with his army in battle,

original: purīṃ viviśatur vīrāv ubhau rāmajanārdanau // / / //
analyzed: purīm viviśatuḥ vīrau ubhau rāma janārdanau
translated: both the heroes Rama and Janardana entered the city.

original: jite tasmin sudurvṛtte jarāsaṃdhe mahāmune /
analyzed: jite tasmin su durvṛtte jarāsaṃdhe mahā mune
translated: O great sage, when that extremely wicked Jarasandha was defeated,

original: jīvamāne gate kṛṣṇas taṃ nāmanyata nirjitam // / / //
analyzed: jīvamāne gate kṛṣṇaḥ tam nā amanyata nirjitam
translated: and Krishna considered him defeated even though he had fled with his life.

original: punar apy ājagāmātha jarāsaṃdho balānvitaḥ /
analyzed: punar api ājagāma atha jarāsaṃdhaḥ bala anvitaḥ
translated: Then Jarasandha came again with his army,

original: jitaś ca rāmakṛṣṇābhyām apakrānto dvijottama // / / //
analyzed: jitaḥ ca rāma kṛṣṇābhyām apakrāntaḥ dvijottama
translated: and was defeated by Rama and Krishna, and fled, O best of Brahmins.

original: daśa cāṣṭau ca saṃgrāmān evam atyantadurmadaḥ /
analyzed: daśa ca aṣṭau ca saṃgrāmān evam atyanta durmadaḥ
translated: In this way, the extremely proud king of Magadha fought eighteen battles

original: yadubhir māgadho rājā cakre kṛṣṇapurogamaiḥ // / / //🔽sarveṣv eteṣu yuddheṣu yādavaiḥ sa parājitaḥ /
analyzed: yadubhiḥ māgadhaḥ rājā cakre kṛṣṇa purogamaiḥ  sarveṣu eteṣu yuddheṣu yādavaiḥ sa parājitaḥ
translated: with the Yadavas led by Krishna.🔽In all these battles, Jarasandha, though stronger in army, was defeated by the Yadavas

original: apakrānto jarāsaṃdhaḥ svalpasainyair balādhikaḥ // / / //
analyzed: apakrāntaḥ jarāsaṃdhaḥ su alpa sainyaiḥ bala adhikaḥ
translated: and fled with a small army.

original: tad balaṃ yādavānāṃ tair ajitaṃ yad anekaśaḥ /
analyzed: tat balam yādavānām taiḥ ajitam yat anekaśas
translated: That army of the Yadavas, which was not conquered by them many times,

original: tat tu saṃnidhimāhātmyaṃ viṣṇor aṃśasya cakriṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat tu saṃnidhi māhātmyam viṣṇoḥ aṃśasya cakriṇaḥ
translated: is due to the greatness of the presence of Vishnu, the wielder of the discus.

original: manuṣyadharmaśīlasya līlā sā jagataḥ pateḥ /
analyzed: manuṣya dharma śīlasya līlā sā jagataḥ pateḥ
translated: That was the sport of the lord of the universe, who follows the conduct of human dharma.

original: astrāṇy anekarūpāṇi yad arātiṣu muñcati // / / //
analyzed: astrāṇi aneka rūpāṇi yat arātiṣu muñcati
translated: And the various weapons he releases against his enemies.

original: manasaiva jagatsṛṣṭiṃ saṃhāraṃ ca karoti yaḥ /
analyzed: manasā eva jagat sṛṣṭim saṃhāram ca karoti yaḥ
translated: He who creates and destroys the world merely with his mind,

original: tasyāripakṣakṣapaṇe kiyān udyamavistaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasya ari pakṣa kṣapaṇe kiyān udyama vistaraḥ
translated: What great effort is required of him to destroy the faction of his enemies?

original: tathāpi ye manuṣyāṇāṃ dharmās tadanuvartanam /
analyzed: tathā api ye manuṣyāṇām dharmāḥ tad anuvartanam
translated: Nevertheless, he follows the customs of human beings,

original: kurvan balavatā saṃdhiṃ hīnair yuddhaṃ karoty asau // / / //
analyzed: kurvan balavatā saṃdhim hīnaiḥ yuddham karoti asau
translated: Making peace with the strong and waging war with the weak.

original: sāma copapradānaṃ ca tathā bhedaṃ pradarśayan /
analyzed: sāma ca upapradānam ca tathā bhedam pradarśayan
translated: Displaying conciliation, gifts, and dissension,

original: karoti daṇḍapātaṃ ca kvacid eva palāyanam // / / //
analyzed: karoti daṇḍa pātam ca kvacid eva palāyanam
translated: He sometimes strikes with punishment and sometimes flees.

original: manuṣyadehināṃ ceṣṭām ity evam anuvartataḥ /
analyzed: manuṣya dehinām ceṣṭām iti evam anuvartataḥ
translated: Following the behavior of human beings in this way,

original: līlā jagatpates tasya chandataḥ saṃpravartate // / / //
analyzed: līlā jagatpateḥ tasya chandataḥ saṃpravartate
translated: The play of that Lord of the universe proceeds as he wills.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pañcame 'ṃśe dvāviṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pañcame ṃśe dvāviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-second chapter in the fifth section of the Vishnu Purana, dealing with the birth of Krishna.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽gārgyaṃ goṣṭhyāṃ dvijaṃ śyālaḥ ṣaṇḍa ity uktavān dvija /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  gārgyam goṣṭhyām dvijam śyālaḥ ṣaṇḍaḥ iti uktavān dvija
translated: Parashara said:

original: yadūnāṃ saṃnidhau sarve jahasur yādavās tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: yadūnām saṃnidhau sarve jahasuḥ yādavāḥ tatas
translated: The Shudra called Gargya a eunuch in the presence of the Yadu clan, and all the Yadavas laughed.

original: tataḥ kopasamāviṣṭo dakṣiṇāpatham etya saḥ /
analyzed: tatas kopa samāviṣṭaḥ dakṣiṇāpatham etya saḥ
translated: Then, filled with anger, he went to the southern region and performed austerities.

original: sutam icchaṃs tapas tepe yaducakrabhayāvaham // / / //🔽ārādhayan mahādevaṃ so 'yaścūrṇam abhakṣayat /
analyzed: sutam icchan tapaḥ tepe yadu cakra bhaya āvaham  ārādhayat mahādevam saḥ yaḥ cūrṇam abhakṣayat
translated: desirous of a son, performed austerities, causing fear to the Yadu dynasty.🔽He propitiated Mahadeva and ate iron powder.

original: dadau varaṃ ca tuṣṭo 'smai varṣe dvādaśame haraḥ // / / //
analyzed: dadau varam ca tuṣṭaḥ smai varṣe dvādaśame haraḥ
translated: And Hara, being pleased, granted him a boon in the twelfth year.

original: sabhājayām āsa ca taṃ yavaneśo hy anātmajaḥ /
analyzed: sabhājayām āsa ca tam yavana īśaḥ hi an ātmajaḥ
translated: The childless king of the Yavanas honored him.

original: tadyoṣitsaṃgamāc cāsya putro 'bhūd alisaṃnibhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tad yoṣit saṃgamāt ca asya putraḥ bhūt ali saṃnibhaḥ
translated: And from his union with that woman, a son was born resembling a bee.

original: taṃ kālayavanaṃ nāma rājye sve yavaneśvaraḥ /
analyzed: tam kālayavanam nāma rājye sve yavana īśvaraḥ
translated: The lord of the Yavanas, having consecrated him named Kalayavana in his own kingdom,

original: abhiṣicya vanaṃ yāto vajrāgrakaṭhinorasam // / / //
analyzed: abhiṣicya vanam yātaḥ vajra agra kaṭhina urasam
translated: went to the forest, whose chest was hard as the tip of a thunderbolt.

original: sa tu vīryamadonmattaḥ pṛthivyāṃ balino nṛpān /
analyzed: sa tu vīrya mada unmattaḥ pṛthivyām balinaḥ nṛpān
translated: But he, intoxicated with the pride of his prowess, asked the kings on earth who were powerful,

original: papraccha nāradas tasmai kathayām āsa yādavān // / / //
analyzed: papraccha nāradaḥ tasmai kathayām āsa yādavān
translated: and Narada told him about the Yadavas.

original: mlecchakoṭisahasrāṇāṃ sahasraiḥ so 'bhisaṃvṛtaḥ /🔽gajāśvarathasaṃpannaiś cakāra paramodyamam // / / //
analyzed: mleccha koṭi sahasrāṇām sahasraiḥ saḥ abhisaṃvṛtaḥ  gaja aśva ratha saṃpannaiḥ cakāra parama udyamam
translated: He was surrounded by thousands of thousands of millions of Mlecchas,🔽and made great preparations with elephants, horses and chariots.

original: prayayau cāvyavacchinnaṃ chinnayāno dine dine /
analyzed: prayayau ca avyavacchinnam chinna yānaḥ dine dine
translated: And he proceeded uninterruptedly, with his chariot broken every day,

original: yādavān prati sāmarṣo maitreya mathurāṃ purīm // / / //
analyzed: yādavān prati sa amarṣaḥ maitreya mathurām purīm
translated: with a grudge against the Yadavas, towards the city of Mathura, O Maitreya.

original: kṛṣṇo 'pi cintayām āsa kṣapitaṃ yādavaṃ balam /
analyzed: kṛṣṇaḥ u pi cintayām āsa kṣapitam yādavam balam
translated: And Krishna also thought that the Yadava army had been destroyed,

original: yavanena raṇe gamyaṃ māgadhasya bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: yavanena raṇe gamyam māgadhasya bhaviṣyati
translated: The Yavanas will be able to conquer the Magadhas in battle.

original: māgadhena balaṃ kṣīṇaṃ sa kālayavano balī /
analyzed: māgadhena balam kṣīṇam sa kālayavanaḥ balī
translated: The powerful Kaleyavana will destroy the Magadha army.

original: hantā tad idam āyātaṃ yadūnāṃ vyasanaṃ dvidhā // / / //
analyzed: hantā tat idam āyātam yadūnām vyasanam dvidhā
translated: This twofold calamity of the Yadus has now come upon them.

original: tasmād durgaṃ kariṣyāmi yadūnām aridurjayam /
analyzed: tasmāt durgam kariṣyāmi yadūnām ari durjayam
translated: Therefore, I will make a fortress for the Yadus, invincible by enemies.

original: striyo 'pi yatra yudhyeyuḥ kiṃ punar vṛṣṇipuṃgavāḥ // / / //
analyzed: striyaḥ api yatra yudhyeyuḥ kim punar vṛṣṇi puṃgavāḥ
translated: Where even women will fight, what to speak of the bulls among the Vrishnis.

original: mayi matte pramatte vā supte pravasite tathā /
analyzed: mayi matte pramatte vā supte pravasite tathā
translated: Whether I am intoxicated, heedless, asleep, or away,

original: yādavābhibhavaṃ duṣṭā mā kurvaṃs tv arayo 'dhikāḥ // / / //🔽iti saṃcintya govindo yojanāni mahodadhim /
analyzed: yādava abhibhavam duṣṭāḥ mā kurvan tu arayaḥ dhikāḥ  iti saṃcintya govindaḥ yojanāni mahā udadhim
translated: May the wicked enemies not oppress the Yadus excessively.🔽Thinking thus, Govinda requested the great ocean for twelve yojanas.

original: yayāce dvādaśa purīṃ dvārakāṃ tatra nirmame // / / //
analyzed: yayāce dvādaśa purīm dvārakām tatra nirmame
translated: There he built the city of Dvaraka.

original: mahodyānāṃ mahāvaprāṃ taḍāgaśataśobhitām /
analyzed: mahā udyānām mahā vaprām taḍāga śata śobhitām
translated: With great gardens and ponds, adorned with hundreds of lakes,

original: prākāragṛhasaṃbādhām indrasyevāmarāvatīm // / / //
analyzed: prākāra gṛha saṃbādhām indrasya iva amarāvatīm
translated: Crowded with ramparts and houses, like Indra's Amaravati.

original: mathurāvāsino lokāṃs tatrānīya janārdanaḥ /
analyzed: mathurā vāsinaḥ lokān tatra ānīya janārdanaḥ
translated: Janardana brought the people living in Mathura there.

original: āsanne kālayavane mathurāṃ ca svayaṃ yayau // / / //
analyzed: āsanne kālayavane mathurām ca svayam yayau
translated: When Kaleyavana was near, he himself went to Mathura.

original: bahir āvasite sainye mathurāyā nirāyudhaḥ /
analyzed: bahis āvasite sainye mathurāyāḥ nirāyudhaḥ
translated: When the army was encamped outside Mathura, unarmed,

original: nirjagāma sa govindo dadṛśe yavaneśvaram // / / //
analyzed: nirjagāma sa govindaḥ dadṛśe yavana īśvaram
translated: Govinda came out and saw the lord of the Yavanas.

original: sa jñātvā vāsudevaṃ taṃ bāhupraharaṇo nṛpaḥ /
analyzed: sa jñātvā vāsudevam tam bāhu praharaṇaḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: The king, who fought with his arms, knowing him to be Vasudeva,

original: anuyāto mahāyogicetobhiḥ prāpyate na yaḥ // / / //
analyzed: anuyātaḥ mahā yogi cetobhiḥ prāpyate na yaḥ
translated: followed the great yogi who is not attained by the minds of others.

original: tenānuyātaḥ kṛṣṇo 'pi praviveśa mahāguhām /
analyzed: tena anuyātaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ pi praviveśa mahā guhām
translated: Krishna, followed by him, entered a great cave,

original: yatra śete mahāvīryo mucukundo nareśvaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: yatra śete mahā vīryaḥ mucukundaḥ nareśvaraḥ
translated: where the greatly valorous king Muchukunda was lying down.

original: so 'pi praviṣṭo yavano dṛṣṭvā śayyāgataṃ naram /
analyzed: saḥ pi praviṣṭaḥ yavanaḥ dṛṣṭvā śayyā gatam naram
translated: The Yavana, having entered, seeing a man lying down,

original: pādena tāḍayām āsa matvā kṛṣṇaṃ sudurmatiḥ // / / //🔽ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: pādena tāḍayām āsa matvā kṛṣṇam su durmatiḥ  e t veṅk ins
translated: with his foot the extremely evil-minded one struck him, thinking him to be Krishna.

original: utthāya mucukundo 'pi dadarśa yavanaṃ nṛpaḥ // / / //
analyzed: utthāya mucukundaḥ pi dadarśa yavanam nṛpaḥ
translated: Maitreya, having seen the Yavana, the king Muchukunda,

original: dṛṣṭamātraś ca tenāsau jajvāla yavano 'gninā /
analyzed: dṛṣṭa mātraḥ ca tena asau jajvāla yavanaḥ gninā
translated: and as soon as he was seen by him, the Yavana blazed with the fire,

original: tatkrodhajena maitreya bhasmībhūtaś ca tatkṣaṇāt // / / //🔽sa hi devāsure yuddhe gato jitvā mahāsurān /
analyzed: tad krodha jena maitreya bhasmībhūtaḥ ca tad kṣaṇāt  sa hi devāsure yuddhe gataḥ jitvā mahā asurān
translated: and in that moment was reduced to ashes by the fire born of his anger.🔽He, having gone in the battle of the gods and demons, having conquered the great demons,

original: nidrārtaḥ sumahat kālaṃ nidrāṃ vavre varaṃ surān // / / //
analyzed: nidrā ārtaḥ su mahat kālam nidrām vavre varam surān
translated: being afflicted by sleep, for a very long time asked the gods for the boon of sleep.

original: proktaś ca devaiḥ saṃsuptaṃ yas tvām utthāpayiṣyati /
analyzed: proktaḥ ca devaiḥ saṃsuptam yaḥ tvām utthāpayiṣyati
translated: And he was told by the gods, Whoever will awaken you from sleep,

original: dehajenāgninā sadyaḥ sa tu bhasmībhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: deha jena agninā sadyas sa tu bhasmībhaviṣyati
translated: will be reduced to ashes by the fire generated in his own body.

original: evaṃ dagdhvā sa taṃ pāpaṃ dṛṣṭvā ca madhusūdanam /
analyzed: evam dagdhvā sa tam pāpam dṛṣṭvā ca madhusūdanam
translated: Having thus burnt the sinner and seen Madhusudana,

original: kas tvam ity āha so 'py āha jāto 'haṃ śaśinaḥ kule /
analyzed: kaḥ tvam iti āha saḥ u pi āha jātaḥ ham śaśinaḥ kule
translated: he said, Who are you? He replied, I am born in the lunar dynasty.

original: vasudevasya tanayo yador vaṃśasamudbhavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vasudevasya tanayaḥ yadoḥ vaṃśa samudbhavaḥ
translated: I am the son of Vasudeva, born in the Yadu dynasty.

original: mucukundo 'pi tatrāsau vṛddhagargavaco 'smarat // / / //
analyzed: mucukundaḥ tatra asau vṛddha garga vacaḥ smarat
translated: There, Mucukunda remembered the words of the aged Garga.

original: saṃsmṛtya praṇipatyainaṃ sarvaṃ sarveśvaraṃ harim /
analyzed: saṃsmṛtya praṇipatya enam sarvam sarva īśvaram harim
translated: Remembering and bowing to him, the lord of all, Hari,

original: prāha jñāto bhavān viṣṇor aṃśas tvaṃ parameśvara // / / //
analyzed: prāha jñātaḥ bhavān viṣṇoḥ aṃśaḥ tvam parameśvara
translated: he said, You are known to be a part of Vishnu, the supreme lord.

original: purā gargeṇa kathitam aṣṭāviṃśatime yuge /
analyzed: purā gargeṇa kathitam aṣṭāviṃśatime yuge
translated: In the past, Garga had said that in the twenty-eighth yuga,

original: dvāparānte harer janma yador vaṃśe bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: dvāpara ante hareḥ janma yadoḥ vaṃśe bhaviṣyati
translated: at the end of Dvapara, Hari would take birth in the Yadu dynasty.

original: sa tvaṃ prāpto na saṃdeho martyānām upakārakṛt // / / //
analyzed: sa tvam prāptaḥ na saṃdehaḥ martyānām upakāra kṛt
translated: There is no doubt that you have come to help mortals.

original: tathā hi sumahat tejo nālaṃ soḍhum ahaṃ tava /🔽tathā hi sajalāmbhodanādadhīrataraṃ tava /
analyzed: tathā hi su mahat tejaḥ na alam soḍhum aham tava  tathā hi sa jala ambhoda nāda dhīrataram tava
translated: Indeed, I am unable to bear your great radiance.🔽Your words are deeper than the rumbling of a rain cloud.

original: vākyaṃ namati caivorvī yuṣmatpādaprapīḍitā // / / //
analyzed: vākyam namati ca evā urvī yuṣmad pāda prapīḍitā
translated: The earth bows down when pressed by your feet.

original: devāsuramahāyuddhe daityasainyamahābhaṭāḥ /
analyzed: deva asura mahā yuddhe daitya sainya mahā bhaṭāḥ
translated: In the great battle between the gods and demons, the great warriors of the demon army,

original: na sehur mama tejas te tvattejo na sahāmy aham // / / //
analyzed: na sehuḥ mama tejaḥ te tvad tejaḥ na sahāmi aham
translated: They could not bear my radiance, I cannot bear your radiance.

original: ins /
analyzed: d ins
translated: Ins.🔽🔽

original: yaḥ saṃsmarati tasyaitat tejas tvāṃ śaraṇaṃ gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ saṃsmarati tasya etat tejaḥ tvām śaraṇam gataḥ
translated: He who remembers this, to him is this radiance. You have gone to him for refuge.🔽.

original: saṃsārapatitasyaiko jantos tvaṃ śaraṇaṃ param /
analyzed: saṃsāra patitasya ekaḥ jantoḥ tvam śaraṇam param
translated: You are the one supreme refuge for a being fallen into the cycle of birth and death.🔽Be gracious, O destroyer of the distress of those who have surrendered, O Shiva, quickly remove my inauspiciousness.

original: sa prasīda prapannārtihantar hara mamāśubham // / / //🔽tvaṃ payonidhayaḥ śailāḥ saritas tvaṃ vanāni ca /
analyzed: sa prasīda prapanna ārti hantar hara mama aśubham  tvam payonidhayaḥ śailāḥ saritaḥ tvam vanāni ca
translated: .🔽You are the oceans, mountains, rivers, and forests.

original: medinī gaganaṃ vāyur āpo 'gnis tvaṃ tathā manaḥ // / / //
analyzed: medinī gaganam vāyuḥ āpaḥ gniḥ tvam tathā manaḥ
translated: You are the earth, sky, wind, water, fire, and mind.🔽.

original: buddhir avyākṛtaṃ prāṇāḥ prāṇeśas tvaṃ tathā pumān /
analyzed: buddhiḥ avyākṛtam prāṇāḥ prāṇa īśaḥ tvam tathā pumān
translated: You are the intellect, the unmanifest, the life-breaths, the lord of the life-breaths, and the individual soul.

original: puṃsaḥ parataraṃ yac ca vyāpy ajanmavikalpavat // / / //
analyzed: puṃsaḥ parataram yat ca vyāpi a janma vikalpavat
translated: And what is superior to the individual soul, pervading like the unborn and unconditioned.🔽.

original: śabdādihīnam ajaram ameyaṃ kṣayavarjitam /
analyzed: śabda ādi hīnam ajaram ameyam kṣaya varjitam
translated: Devoid of sound and other qualities, undecaying, immeasurable, free from destruction,

original: avṛddhināśaṃ tad brahma tvam ādyantavivarjitam // / / //
analyzed: a vṛddhi nāśam tat brahma tvam ādi anta vivarjitam
translated: That Brahman, which is free from increase and decrease, is you, free from beginning and end.🔽.

original: tvatto 'marāḥ sapitaro yakṣagandharvakiṃnarāḥ /
analyzed: tvattaḥ marāḥ sa pitaraḥ yakṣa gandharva kiṃnarāḥ
translated: From you, the immortals, the fathers, the Yakshas, Gandharvas, Kinnaras,

original: siddhāś cāpsarasas tvatto manuṣyāḥ paśavaḥ khagāḥ // / / //
analyzed: siddhāḥ ca apsarasaḥ tvattaḥ manuṣyāḥ paśavaḥ khagāḥ
translated: The Siddhas, the celestial nymphs, humans, animals, birds,

original: sarīsṛpā mṛgāḥ sarve tvattaḥ sarve mahīruhāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarīsṛpāḥ mṛgāḥ sarve tvattaḥ sarve mahīruhāḥ
translated: All the reptiles, all the beasts, and all the trees come from you.🔽.

original: ins /
analyzed: t ins
translated: Ins.🔽🔽

original: sthūlā madhyās tathā sūkṣmāḥ sūkṣmāt sūkṣmatarāś ca ye // / / //
analyzed: sthūlāḥ madhyāḥ tathā sūkṣmāḥ sūkṣmāt sūkṣmatarāḥ ca ye
translated: gross, medium, and subtle, and those subtler than the subtle,

original: yac ca bhūtaṃ bhaviṣyac ca kiṃcid atra carācaram // / / //
analyzed: yat ca bhūtam bhaviṣyat ca kiṃcid atra carācaram
translated: and whatever exists or will exist here, whether moving or unmoving,

original: amūrtaṃ mūrtam athavā sthūlaṃ sūkṣmataraṃ sthitam /
analyzed: amūrtam mūrtam athavā sthūlam sūkṣmataram sthitam
translated: whether formless or embodied, whether gross or subtler than subtle,

original: tat sarvaṃ tvaṃ jagatkartar nāsti kiṃcit tvayā vinā // / / //
analyzed: tat sarvam tvam jagat kartar na asti kiṃcid tvayā vinā
translated: you are all that, O creator of the world. There is nothing without you.

original: mayā saṃsāracakre 'smin bhramatā bhagavan sadā /
analyzed: mayā saṃsāra cakre smin bhramatā bhagavan sadā
translated: By me, who has been always wandering in this cycle of birth and death, O Lord,

original: tāpatrayābhibhūtena na prāptā nirvṛtiḥ kvacit // / / //
analyzed: tāpa traya abhibhūtena na prāptā nirvṛtiḥ kvacid
translated: overwhelmed by the three kinds of miseries, no peace has been attained anywhere.

original: duḥkhāny eva sukhānīti mṛgatṛṣṇājalāśayā /
analyzed: duḥkhāni eva sukhāni iti mṛgatṛṣṇā jalāśayā
translated: Considering miseries as happiness, like a mirage as water,

original: mayā nātha gṛhītāni tāni tāpāya cābhavan // / / //
analyzed: mayā nātha gṛhītāni tāni tāpāya ca abhavan
translated: O Lord, I have grasped them, and they have become a cause of torment.

original: rājyam urvī balaṃ kośo mitrapakṣas tathātmajāḥ /
analyzed: rājyam urvī balam kośaḥ mitra pakṣaḥ tathā ātmajāḥ
translated: Kingdom, land, army, treasury, allies, sons,

original: bhāryā bhṛtyajano ye ca śabdādyā viṣayāḥ prabho // / / //🔽sukhabuddhyā mayā sarvaṃ gṛhītam idam avyaya /
analyzed: bhāryā bhṛtya janaḥ ye ca śabda ādyāḥ viṣayāḥ prabho  sukha buddhyā mayā sarvam gṛhītam idam avyaya
translated: wife, servants, and all objects of sense such as sound, O Lord,🔽I have grasped all this, O Imperishable One, with the notion of happiness.

original: pariṇāme tad eveśa tāpātmakam abhūn mama // / / //
analyzed: pariṇāme tat eva īśa tāpa ātmakam abhūt mama
translated: But when it changed, it became a cause of torment for me.

original: devalokagatiṃ prāpto nātha devagaṇo 'pi hi /
analyzed: deva loka gatim prāptaḥ nātha deva gaṇaḥ hi
translated: Even the host of gods, O Lord, who have attained the state of the world of gods,

original: mattaḥ sāhāyyakāmo 'bhūc śāśvatī kutra nirvṛtiḥ // / / //
analyzed: mattaḥ sāhāyya kāmaḥ bhūt śāśvatī kutra nirvṛtiḥ
translated: Desiring help from me, where is eternal peace?

original: tvām anārādhya jagatāṃ sarveṣāṃ prabhavāspadam /
analyzed: tvām an ārādhya jagatām sarveṣām prabhava āspadam
translated: Without propitiating you, the source of all worlds,

original: śāśvatī prāpyate kena parameśvara nirvṛtiḥ // / / //🔽tvanmāyāmūḍhamanaso janmamṛtyujarādikam /
analyzed: śāśvatī prāpyate kena parameśvara nirvṛtiḥ  tvad māyā mūḍha manasaḥ janma mṛtyu jarā ādikam
translated: O Supreme Lord, by whom is eternal peace attained?🔽Those whose minds are deluded by your maya, men who have attained birth, death, old age, and so on,

original: avāpya tāpān paśyanti pretarājānanaṃ narāḥ // / / //
analyzed: avāpya tāpān paśyanti pretarāja ānanam narāḥ
translated: see the face of the king of the dead, the afflictions.

original: tato nijakriyāsūtinarakeṣv atidāruṇam /
analyzed: tatas nija kriyā sūti narakeṣu ati dāruṇam
translated: Then, in the extremely terrible hells born of their own actions,

original: prāpnuvanti narā duḥkham asvarūpavidas tava // / / //
analyzed: prāpnuvanti narāḥ duḥkham a sva rūpa vidaḥ tava
translated: men attain suffering, not knowing your true nature.

original: aham atyantaviṣayī mohitas tava māyayā /
analyzed: aham atyanta viṣayī mohitaḥ tava māyayā
translated: I, extremely attached to objects, deluded by your maya,

original: mamatvagarvagartāntar bhramāmi parameśvara // / / //
analyzed: mamatva garva garta antar bhramāmi parameśvara
translated: wander in the abyss of possessiveness and pride, O Supreme Lord.

original: so 'haṃ tvāṃ śaraṇam apāram īśam īḍyaṃ saṃprāptaḥ paramapadaṃ yato na kiṃcit /
analyzed: saḥ ham tvām śaraṇam apāram īśam īḍyam saṃprāptaḥ parama padam yatas na kiṃcid
translated: I have come to you for refuge, the immeasurable Lord, the worthy of praise, from whom is the supreme state, which is nothing.

original: saṃsāraśramaparitāpataptacetā nirvāṇe pariṇatadhāmni sābhilāṣaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃsāra śrama paritāpa tapta cetāḥ nirvāṇe pariṇata dhāmni sa abhilāṣaḥ
translated: My mind scorched by the fatigue and pain of worldly existence, longing for the state of complete liberation.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pañcame 'ṃśe trayoviṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pañcame ṃśe trayoviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-third chapter in the fifth section of the Vishnu Purana, composed by the great sage Parashara.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: itthaṃ stutas tadā tena mucukundena dhīmatā /
analyzed: ittham stutaḥ tadā tena mucukundena dhīmatā
translated: Thus praised by the wise Muchukunda,

original: prāheśaḥ sarvabhūtānām anādir bhagavān hariḥ // / / //
analyzed: prāha īśaḥ sarva bhūtānām anādiḥ bhagavān hariḥ
translated: The beginningless Lord Hari, the master of all beings, said:

original: yathābhivāñchitān divyān lokān gaccha nareśvara /
analyzed: yathā abhivāñchitān divyān lokān gaccha nareśvara
translated: O lord of men, go to the desired divine worlds.

original: avyāhataparaiśvaryo matprasādopabṛṃhitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: avyāhata para aiśvaryaḥ mad prasāda upabṛṃhitaḥ
translated: Enlarged by my grace, with unimpeded supreme lordship,

original: bhuktvā divyān mahābhogān bhaviṣyasi mahākule /
analyzed: bhuktvā divyān mahā bhogān bhaviṣyasi mahā kule
translated: Having enjoyed great divine pleasures, you will be born in a great family.

original: jātismaro matprasādāt tato mokṣam avāpsyasi // / / //
analyzed: jātismaraḥ mad prasādāt tatas mokṣam avāpsyasi
translated: By my grace, remembering your birth, you will then attain liberation.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity uktaḥ praṇipatyeśaṃ jagatām acyutaṃ nṛpaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ praṇipatya īśam jagatām acyutam nṛpaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, the king bowed down to Achyuta, the lord of the worlds.

original: guhāmukhād viniṣkrāntaḥ dadṛśe so 'lpakān narān // / / //🔽tataḥ kaliyugaṃ jñātvā prāptaṃ taptuṃ nṛpas tapaḥ /
analyzed: guhā mukhāt viniṣkrāntaḥ dadṛśe saḥ ulpakān narān  tatas kali yugam jñātvā prāptam taptum nṛpaḥ tapaḥ
translated: Emerging from the mouth of the cave, he saw men of little stature.

original: naranārāyaṇasthānaṃ prayayau gandhamādanam // / / //
analyzed: nara nārāyaṇa sthānam prayayau gandhamādanam
translated: Then, knowing that the Kali Yuga had arrived, the king went to the place of Nara and Narayana on Gandhamadana to perform austerities.

original: kṛṣṇo 'pi ghātayitvārim upāyena hi tadbalam /
analyzed: kṛṣṇaḥ pi ghātayitvā arim upāyena hi tad balam
translated: Krishna, having killed the enemy's army by stratagem,

original: jagrāha mathurām etya hastyaśvasyandanojjvalam // / / //
analyzed: jagrāha mathurām etya hasti aśva syandana ujjvalam
translated: took possession of Mathura, resplendent with elephants, horses and chariots.

original: ānīya cograsenāya dvāravatyāṃ nyavedayat /
analyzed: ānīya ca ugrasenāya dvāravatyām nyavedayat
translated: And having brought it, he announced it to Ugrasena in Dvaravati.

original: parābhibhavaniḥśaṅkaṃ babhūva ca yadoḥ kulam // / / //
analyzed: para abhibhava niḥśaṅkam babhūva ca yadoḥ kulam
translated: And the Yadu clan became fearless of any defeat.

original: baladevo 'pi maitreya praśāntākhilavigrahaḥ /
analyzed: baladevaḥ pi maitreya praśānta akhila vigrahaḥ
translated: O Maitreya, Baladeva also, having put down all hostilities,

original: jñātidarśanasotkaṇṭhaḥ prayayau nandagokulam // / / //🔽tato gopāṃś ca gopīś ca yathāpūrvam amitrajit /
analyzed: jñāti darśana sa utkaṇṭhaḥ prayayau nanda gokulam  tatas gopān ca gopīḥ ca yathāpūrvam amitra jit
translated: went to the cow-pen of Nanda, being eager to see his kinsmen.🔽Then the conqueror of foes, as before,

original: tathaivābhyavadat premṇā bahumānapuraḥsaram // / / //🔽kaiś cāpi saṃpariṣvaktaḥ kāṃścic ca pariṣasvaje /
analyzed: tathā eva abhyavadat premṇā bahu māna puraḥsaram  kaiḥ ca api saṃpariṣvaktaḥ kāṃścid ca pariṣasvaje
translated: greeted the cowherds and cowherdesses with love and respect.🔽He embraced some, and was embraced by others.

original: hāsyaṃ cakre samaṃ kaiścid gopair gopījanais tathā // / / //🔽priyāṇy anekāny avadan gopās tatra halāyudham /
analyzed: hāsyam cakre samam kaiścid gopaiḥ gopī janaiḥ tathā  priyāṇi anekāni avadan gopāḥ tatra halāyudham
translated: He laughed with some of the cowherds and cowherdesses.🔽The cowherds spoke many pleasing words to the holder of the plough.

original: gopyaś ca premakupitāḥ procuḥ serṣyam athāparāḥ // / / //🔽gopyaḥ papracchur aparā nāgarījanavallabhaḥ /
analyzed: gopyaḥ ca prema kupitāḥ procuḥ sa īrṣyam atha aparāḥ  gopyaḥ papracchuḥ aparāḥ nāgarī jana vallabhaḥ
translated: The cowherdesses, filled with love, said, and others, out of jealousy,🔽The cowherdesses asked another, Does Krishna, the lover of the city women,

original: kaccid āste sukhaṃ kṛṣṇaś calatpremalavātmakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kaccit āste sukham kṛṣṇaḥ calat prema lava ātmakaḥ
translated: dwell happily, his nature unsteady with love?🔽Does he, laughing at our actions,

original: asmacceṣṭām apahasan na kaccit purayoṣitām /🔽saubhāgyamānam adhikaṃ karoti kṣaṇasauhṛdaḥ // / / //
analyzed: asmad ceṣṭām apahasan na kaccit pura yoṣitām  saubhāgya mānam adhikam karoti kṣaṇa sauhṛdaḥ
translated: make the city women proud of his momentary friendship?

original: kaccit smarati naḥ kṛṣṇo gītānugamanaṃ kalam /
analyzed: kaccit smarati naḥ kṛṣṇaḥ gīta anugamanam kalam
translated: Does Krishna remember our childish singing while he was being taken away?

original: apy asau mātaraṃ draṣṭuṃ sakṛd apy āgamiṣyati // / / //
analyzed: api asau mātaram draṣṭum sakṛt api āgamiṣyati
translated: Will he ever come back once to see his mother?

original: atha vā kiṃ tadālāpair aparā kriyatāṃ kathā /
analyzed: atha vā kim tad ālāpaiḥ aparā kriyatām kathā
translated: Or rather, what is the use of talking about him? Let us talk about something else.

original: yasyāsmābhir vinā tena vināsmākaṃ bhaviṣyati // / / //🔽pitā mātā tathā bhrātā bhartā bandhujanaś ca kim /
analyzed: yasya asmābhiḥ vinā tena vinā asmākam bhaviṣyati  pitā mātā tathā bhrātā bhartā bandhu janaḥ ca kim
translated: Without whom we will exist, without him we will not exist.

original: na tyaktas tatkṛte 'smābhir akṛtajñadhvajo hi saḥ // / / //
analyzed: na tyaktaḥ tad kṛte smābhiḥ akṛtajña dhvajaḥ hi saḥ
translated: Father, mother, brother, husband, and relatives - what did we not give up for his sake? He is indeed the banner of ingratitude.

original: ins /
analyzed: d ins
translated: Inserts a verse not found in the other editions:

original: saṃdeśaiḥ sāmamadhurair nāsmān smarati kutracit // / / //🔽tathāpi kaccid ālāpam ihāgamanasaṃśrayam /
analyzed: saṃdeśaiḥ sāma madhuraiḥ na asmān smarati kutracid  tathā api kaccit ālāpam iha āgamana saṃśrayam
translated: He does not remember us anywhere with sweet and gentle messages.

original: karoti kṛṣṇo vaktavyaṃ bhavatā rāma nānṛtam // / / //
analyzed: karoti kṛṣṇaḥ vaktavyam bhavatā rāma na anṛtam
translated: Nevertheless, does Krishna talk about his possible return here? You should not tell a lie, Rama.

original: dāmodaraḥ sa govindaḥ purastrīsaktamānasaḥ /
analyzed: dāmodaraḥ sa govindaḥ pura strī sakta mānasaḥ
translated: That Dāmodara, that Govinda, whose mind is attached to the women of the city,

original: apetaprītir asmāsu durdarśaḥ pratibhāti naḥ // / / //
analyzed: apeta prītiḥ asmāsu durdarśaḥ pratibhāti naḥ
translated: appears to us to be devoid of affection for us and difficult to see.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽āmantritaḥ sa kṛṣṇeti punar dāmodareti ca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  āmantritaḥ sa kṛṣṇa iti punar dāmodara iti ca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ruruduḥ sasvaraṃ gopyo hariṇā hṛtacetasaḥ // / / //🔽saṃdeśaiḥ sāmamadhuraiḥ premagarbhair agarvitaiḥ /
analyzed: ruruduḥ sa svaram gopyaḥ hariṇā hṛta    saṃdeśaiḥ sāma madhuraiḥ prema garbhaiḥ a garvitaiḥ
translated: When addressed as Krishna and again as Damodara, the cowherdesses, their minds captivated by Hari, wept aloud.

original: rāmeṇāśvāsitā gopyaḥ kṛṣṇasyātimanoharaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: rāmeṇa āśvāsitāḥ gopyaḥ kṛṣṇasya ati manoharaiḥ
translated: The cowherdesses were consoled by Rama with messages from Krishna, which were sweet with harmony, full of love, and free from pride.

original: gopaiś ca pūrvavad rāmaḥ parihāsamanoramāḥ /
analyzed: gopaiḥ ca pūrvavat rāmaḥ parihāsa manoramāḥ
translated: Rama, as before, had delightful conversations with the cowherds.

original: kathāś cakāra reme ca saha tair vrajabhūmiṣu // / / //
analyzed: kathāḥ cakāra reme ca saha taiḥ vraja bhūmiṣu
translated: and held conversations with them, and sported with them in the lands of Vraja.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pañcame 'ṃśe caturviṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pañcame ṃśe caturviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-fourth chapter in the fifth section of the Visnu Purana, dealing with the birth of Krishna.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽vane vicaratas tasya saha gopair mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  vane vicarataḥ tasya saha gopaiḥ mahātmanaḥ
translated: Parashara said:

original: mānuṣachadmarūpasya śeṣasya dharaṇībhṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mānuṣa chadma rūpasya śeṣasya dharaṇībhṛtaḥ
translated: While the great-souled one, the upholder of the earth, the incarnation of Shesha, was wandering in the forest with the cowherds in human disguise,

original: niṣpāditorukāryasya kāryeṇorvīvicāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: niṣpādita uru kāryasya kāryeṇa urvī vicāriṇaḥ
translated: having accomplished his great task, and wandering on the earth for some purpose,

original: upabhogārtham atyarthaṃ varuṇaḥ prāha vāruṇīm // / / //
analyzed: upabhoga artham atyartham varuṇaḥ prāha vāruṇīm
translated: Varuna spoke to Varuni for the sake of his excessive enjoyment:

original: abhīṣṭā sarvadā yasya madire tvaṃ mahaujasaḥ /
analyzed: abhīṣṭā sarvadā yasya madire tvam mahā ojasaḥ
translated: O Madhvi, you are always desired by that greatly powerful one.

original: anantasyopabhogāya tasya gaccha mude śubhe // / / //
analyzed: anantasya upabhogāya tasya gaccha mude śubhe
translated: O auspicious one, go to him for Ananta's enjoyment and for your own delight.

original: ity uktā vāruṇī tena saṃnidhānam athākarot /
analyzed: iti uktā vāruṇī tena saṃnidhānam atha akarot
translated: Thus addressed by him, Varuni then made her presence felt

original: vṛndāvanavanotpannakadambatarukoṭare // / / //
analyzed: vṛndāvana vana utpanna kadamba taru koṭare
translated: in the hollow of a Kadamba tree born in the forest of Vrndavana.

original: vicaran baladevo 'pi madirāgandham uttamam /🔽āghrāya madirātarṣam avāpātha purātanam // / / //🔽tataḥ kadambāt sahasā madyadhārāṃ sa lāṅgalī /
analyzed: vicaran baladevaḥ madirā gandham uttamam  āghrāya madirā tarṣam avāpa atha purātanam  tatas kadambāt sahasā madya dhārām sa lāṅgalī
translated: Balarama, while wandering, also smelled the excellent fragrance of liquor,🔽and then experienced his ancient craving for wine.🔽Then, O Maitreya, the plough-wielder suddenly saw the stream of liquor falling from the Kadamba tree,

original: patantīṃ vīkṣya maitreya prayayau paramāṃ mudam // / / //
analyzed: patantīm vīkṣya maitreya prayayau paramām mudam
translated: and experienced supreme joy.

original: papau ca gopagopībhiḥ samaveto mudānvitaḥ /
analyzed: papau ca gopa gopībhiḥ samavetaḥ mudā anvitaḥ
translated: And in the company of the cowherds and cowherdesses, He drank with great joy.

original: pragīyamāno lalitaṃ gītavādyaviśāradaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: pragīya mānaḥ lalitam gīta vādya viśāradaiḥ
translated: And was sweetly sung by those skilled in singing and music.

original: sa matto 'tyantagharmāmbhaḥkaṇikāmauktikojjvalaḥ /
analyzed: sa tyanta gharmāmbhaḥ kaṇikā mauktika ujjvalaḥ
translated: He, shining with drops of water like pearls, very intoxicated and perspiring profusely,

original: āgaccha yamune snātum icchāmīty āha vihvalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: āgaccha yamune snātum icchāmi iti āha vihvalaḥ
translated: Said with agitation, Come, Yamuna! I wish to bathe.

original: tasya vācaṃ nadī sā tu mattoktām avamanya vai /
analyzed: tasya vācam nadī sā tu matta uktām avamanya vai
translated: But that river, disregarding the words spoken by the intoxicated one,

original: nājagāma tataḥ kruddho halaṃ jagrāha lāṅgalī // / / //
analyzed: na ājagāma tatas kruddhaḥ halam jagrāha lāṅgalī
translated: Did not come. Then the plough-bearer, enraged, took up his plough.

analyzed: sa abhilāṣā tadā sā tu babhūva gaja gāminī  māyāvatī dadau ca asmai māyāḥ sarvāḥ mahātmane
translated: then that one with the gait of an elephant became full of desire.🔽And Maya, blinded by love for Pradyumna, with her heart and eyes fixed on him,

original: pradyumnāyānurāgāndhā tannyastahṛdayekṣaṇā // / / //🔽For / / / / substitutes /

analyzed: antra antare bhīṣmakasya dākṣiṇyā tasya bhūpateḥ
translated: In the heart of King Bhismaka, there was a feeling of affection towards Krishna.

original: śuśrāva rukmiṇīṃ kṛṣṇaḥ kanyāṃ rūpeṇa viśrutām // / / / //
analyzed: śuśrāva rukmiṇīm kṛṣṇaḥ kanyām rūpeṇa viśrutām
translated: Krishna heard that Rukmini, the daughter of Bhismaka, was famous for her beauty.

analyzed: sā api śuśrāva kaṃsārim kṛṣṇam kamala locanam
translated: She also heard about Krishna, the enemy of Kamsa, the lotus-eyed one.

analyzed: abhilāṣa rasa udāram kim api āste manaḥ tayoḥ

analyzed: bhīṣmakasya ātmajaḥ rukmī bhuja śālī raṇa utkaṭaḥ

analyzed: vīraḥ bibharti yaḥ spardhām bhuvi bhārgava bhīṣmayoḥ

analyzed: anujām rukmiṇīm dṛptaḥ sa kṛṣṇena arthitaḥ sadā

analyzed: na dadau kaṃsa dāsaḥ yam iti dveṣāt udāharat
translated: Out of hatred, he said, This is Kamsa's slave, he does not give.

original: tato jarāsandhagirā śiśupālāya bhūbhuje // / / / //
analyzed: tatas jarāsandha girā śiśupālāya bhūbhuje
translated: Then, at the words of Jarasandha, to King Shishupala

analyzed: tām dattam udyayau putrīm bhīṣmakaḥ putra saṃmate  vasudevaḥ vasuḥ putraḥ tad purīm
translated: Bhishmaka, with the consent of his son, gave his daughter in marriage to Shishupala.

original: kṛṣṇādibhir vṛṣṇivīrair varayātrānimantritaiḥ // / / / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇa ādibhiḥ vṛṣṇi vīraiḥ vara yātrā nimantritaiḥ
translated: Vasudeva, the prosperous son, then went to that city with the Vrishni heroes headed by Krishna, invited for the wedding procession.

original: dantavakrajarāsandhamukhyaiś ca saha rājabhiḥ // / / / //
analyzed: dantavakra jarāsandha mukhyaiḥ ca saha rājabhiḥ
translated: With the kings headed by Dantavakra and Jarasandha.

analyzed: sa vivāha utsave prāyāt bhīṣmakeṇa abhipūjitaḥ  bhavānī pūjita vyagrām tatra locana candrikām
translated: Honored by Bhishmaka, he went to the wedding festivities.🔽There Krishna saw Rukmini, whose moon-like eyes were busy worshipping Bhavानी,

original: dadarśa rukmiṇīṃ kṛṣṇaḥ kṛṣṇasārāyatekṣaṇām // / / / //🔽dṛṣṭvā tām atha vaikuṇṭhaḥ sotkaṇṭhāṃ manmathākulaḥ // / / / //
analyzed: dadarśa rukmiṇīm kṛṣṇaḥ kṛṣṇasāra āyata īkṣaṇām  dṛṣṭvā tām atha vaikuṇṭhaḥ sa utkaṇṭhām manmatha ākulaḥ
translated: with eyes like a black antelope.🔽Then Vaikuntha, seeing her longing and agitated with love,

original: jahāra paśyatāṃ nṝṇāṃ sahasā bhīṣmakātmajām // / / / //
analyzed: jahāra paśyatām nṝṇām sahasā bhīṣmaka ātmajām

analyzed: na hatvā malina ācāram kṛṣṇam durnaya kāriṇam

analyzed: sva puram samupeṣyāmi vīra vrata paricyutaḥ
translated: I will not return to my city, fallen from the vow of a hero.

original: ity uktvā ratham āruhya vīrair anugato nṛpaḥ // / / / //
analyzed: iti uktvā ratham āruhya vīraiḥ anugataḥ nṛpaḥ

original: vātoddhūtapatākāgraḥ sa yayau nādayan diśaḥ // / / / //
analyzed: vāta uddhūta patākā agraḥ sa yayau nādayan diśaḥ

analyzed: dūrāt āyāntam ālokya ratha sthaḥ rukmiṇīsakhaḥ
translated: Seeing him coming from afar, Rukmini's companion, standing on his chariot,

analyzed: tasthau hariḥ parāvṛttya karṇa anta ākṛṣṭa kārmukaḥ

analyzed: divya astra varṣiṇaḥ śauri chittvā sarva āyudhāni atha
translated: Having cut off all the weapons of Shouri, who was showering divine missiles,

analyzed: rukmiṇam tīvra nārācaiḥ vivyādha hṛdaye nimiḥ
translated: Nimi pierced Rukmin in the heart with fierce iron arrows.

original: mūrcchite patite tasmin vidrute rājamaṇḍale // / / / //
analyzed: mūrcchite patite tasmin vidrute rāja maṇḍale
translated: When he fell unconscious and the circle of kings fled,

analyzed: rarakṣa śauriḥ dayayā rukmiṇām rukmiṇī girā
translated: Shouri protected Rukmini's relatives out of compassion at Rukmini's request.

original: yāte dvāravatīṃ kṛṣṇe vinivṛtteṣu vṛṣṇiṣu // / / / //
analyzed: yāte dvāravatīm kṛṣṇe vinivṛtteṣu vṛṣṇiṣu

analyzed: pratijayā parityaktaḥ puras saṃvidadhe puram

analyzed: puram bhojakaṭam nāma māna bhaṅgam vicintayan
translated: Thinking of the humiliation, he entered the city named Bhojakata.

analyzed: jaya śriyam iva ādāya śriyam mūrti antara āgatām
translated: As if taking victory and prosperity in embodied form,🔽he entered the city named Kundina.

analyzed: kāmaḥ tu vāsudeva aṃśaḥ dagdhaḥ prāk śūdra manyunā

analyzed: deha upapattaye bhūyas tam eva pratyapadyata

analyzed: saḥ eva vaidarbhyām kṛṣṇa vīrya samudbhavaḥ

analyzed: pradyumnaḥ iti vikhyātaḥ arvataḥ navamaḥ pituḥ

analyzed: sa viditvā ātmanaḥ śatrum prāsya udanvati agāt gṛham

analyzed: tam nirjagāra balavān mīnaḥ saḥ u pi aparaiḥ saha
translated: The powerful fish swallowed him, along with others.

analyzed: vṛtaḥ jālena mahatā gṛhītaḥ matsya jīvibhiḥ

analyzed: tam śambarāya kaivartāḥ upājahuḥ upāyanam  sūdāḥ mahānasam nītvā vidyan svadhitinā drutam

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tat udare bālam māyāvatyai nyavedayan

analyzed: bālasya tattvam utpattim matsya udara niveśanam

analyzed: sā ca kāmasya vai patnī ratiḥ nāma yaśasvinī

analyzed: patyuḥ nirdagdha dehasya deha utpattim pratīkṣitī

analyzed: nirūpitā śambareṇa sā sūpa odana sādhane

analyzed: kāmadevam śiśum buddhvā cakre sneham tadā arbhake
translated: Knowing Kamadeva to be a child, she felt affection for him in his childhood,

analyzed: na ati dīrgheṇa kālena sa kārṣṇīḥ rūḍha yauvanaḥ

analyzed: janayām āsa nārīṇām vīkṣantīnām su vibhramam
translated: And begot a son named Pradyumna, causing the women to gaze with great charm.

analyzed: prasajjantīm tu tām āha sa kārṣṇiḥ kamala īkṣaṇām
translated: But when that lotus-eyed one was approaching him, that son of Krishna said to her,

analyzed: mātṛ bhāvām apāhāya kim evam vartase nyathā
translated: Having abandoned your maternal feelings, why do you behave in this way?

original: sā cāsmai kathayām āsa na putras tvaṃ mameti vai /
analyzed: sā ca asmai kathayām āsa na putraḥ tvam mama iti vai
translated: And she told him, You are not my son.

analyzed: tanayam tvām ayam viṣṇoḥ hṛtavān kālaśambaraḥ

analyzed: kṣiptaḥ samudre matsyasya saṃprāptaḥ jaṭharāt mayā
translated: Cast into the ocean, you were obtained by me from the belly of a fish.

analyzed: sā tu roditi te mātā kāntā adyā api ati vatsalā

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

analyzed: iti uktaḥ śambaram yuddhe pradyumnaḥ sa samāhvayat
translated: Thus addressed, Pradyumna challenged Shambara to a fight.

analyzed: krodha ākulīkṛta manāḥ yuyudhe ca mahā balaḥ

analyzed: hatvā sainyam aśeṣam tu tasya daityasya mādhaviḥ
translated: Having killed the entire army of that demon, the descendant of Madhu,

analyzed: tayā jaghāna tam daityam māyayā kālaśambaram
translated: By that, he killed the demon Kālaśambara with illusion.

original: utpatya ca tayā sārdham ājagāma pitur gṛham // / / //
analyzed: utpatya ca tayā sārdham ājagāma pituḥ gṛham
translated: And having risen up with her, he went to his father's house.

original: antaḥpure nipatitaṃ māyāvatyā samanvitam /
analyzed: antaḥpure nipatitam māyāvatyā samanvitam
translated: Seeing him fallen in the inner quarters, accompanied by Māyāvatī,

analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā kṛṣṇa saṃkalpāḥ babhūvuḥ kṛṣṇa yoṣitaḥ
translated: the wives of Kṛṣṇa, intent on Kṛṣṇa, became

analyzed: rukmiṇī ca avadat premṇā sa asra dṛṣṭiḥ aninditā
translated: and the faultless Rukmiṇī, with tearful eyes, affectionately said:

analyzed: dhanyāyāḥ khalu ayam putraḥ vartate nava yauvane
translated: Blessed indeed is this son of yours, who is in the prime of youth.

original: asmin vayasi putro me pradyumno yadi jīvati /
analyzed: asmin vayasi putraḥ me pradyumnaḥ yadi jīvati
translated: If my son Pradyumna lives in this age,

analyzed: sabhāgyā jananī vatsa tvayā kā api vibhūṣitā
translated: his mother must be some fortunate woman adorned by you, my child.

original: athavā yādṛśaḥ sneho mama yādṛg vapus tava /
analyzed: athavā yādṛśaḥ snehaḥ mama yādṛś vapuḥ tava
translated: Or, since your affection for me is like this and your form is like this,

analyzed: hareḥ apatyam su vyaktam bhavān vatsa bhaviṣyati
translated: it is clear, my child, that you are the son of Hari.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parāśara said:

analyzed: etasmin antare prāptaḥ saha kṛṣṇena nāradaḥ
translated: In the meantime, Nārada arrived with Kṛṣṇa.

translated: And spoke to Queen Rukmini, who was in the inner apartments, delighting her.🔽This is your son, O you of beautiful eyebrows, who has come after slaying Shambara.

original: hṛto yenābhavad bālo bhavatyāḥ sūtikāgṛhāt // / / //
analyzed: hṛtaḥ yena abhavat bālaḥ bhavatyāḥ sūtikāgṛhāt
translated: By whom the child was carried away from the lying-in chamber of you.

original: iyaṃ māyāvatī bhāryā tanayasyāsya te satī /
analyzed: iyam māyāvatī bhāryā tanayasya asya te satī
translated: This is the chaste wife of your son, named Maya.

original: śambarasya na bhāryeyaṃ śrūyatām atra kāraṇam // / / //
analyzed: śambarasya na bhāryā iyam śrūyatām atra kāraṇam
translated: She is not the wife of Shambara. Hear the reason of this.

original: manmathe tu gate nāśaṃ tadudbhavaparāyaṇā /
analyzed: manmathe tu gate nāśam tad udbhava parāyaṇā
translated: When Manmatha was destroyed, she, intent on his birth,

analyzed: śambaram mohayām āsa māyā rūpeṇa rūpiṇī  vihāra ādi upabhogeṣu rūpam māyā mayam śubham
translated: deluded Shambara with a magical form.🔽In sports and other enjoyments, this wine-eyed one

analyzed: darśayām āsa daityasya tasya iyam madirā īkṣaṇā
translated: showed the demon her beautiful illusory form.

analyzed: kāmaḥ avatīrṇaḥ putraḥ te tasya iyam dayitā ratiḥ
translated: Your son is an incarnation of Kama, and this is his beloved Rati.

original: viśaṅkā nātra kartavyā snuṣeyaṃ tava śobhanā // / / //
analyzed: viśaṅkā nā atra kartavyā snuṣā iyam tava śobhanā

analyzed: tatas harṣa samāviṣṭā rukmiṇī keśavaḥ tathā
translated: Then Rukmini and Keshava were filled with joy,

original: nagarī ca samastā sā sādhu sādhv ity abhāṣata // / / //
analyzed: nagarī ca samastā sā sādhu sādhu iti abhāṣata
translated: and the entire city exclaimed, Excellent! Excellent!

original: ciranaṣṭena putreṇa saṃgatāṃ prekṣya rukmiṇīm /
analyzed: cira naṣṭena putreṇa saṃgatām prekṣya rukmiṇīm
translated: Seeing Rukmini reunited with her long-lost son,
