analyzed: avāpa vismayam sarvaḥ dvāravatyām janaḥ tadā
translated: And all the people of Dvārakā were filled with wonder.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pañcame 'ṃśe saptaviṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pañcame ṃśe saptaviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-seventh chapter in the fifth section of the Padma Purāṇa dealing with the birth of Pradyumna and others.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: cārudeṣṇaṃ sudeṣṇaṃ ca cārudehaṃ ca vīryavān /
analyzed: cārudeṣṇam sudeṣṇam ca cārudeham ca vīryavān
translated: He begot four sons, namely Charudeshna, Sudehsna, the valorous Charudeha,

original: suṣeṇaṃ cāruguptaṃ ca bhadracāruṃ tathā param // / / //🔽cāruvindaṃ sucāruṃ ca cāruṃ ca balināṃ varam /
analyzed: suṣeṇam cāruguptam ca bhadracārum tathā param  cāruvindam sucārum ca cārum ca balinām varam
translated: Sushena, Charugupta, the great Bhadracharu,

original: rukmiṇy ajanayat putrān kanyāṃ cārumatīṃ tathā // / / //
analyzed: rukmiṇī ajanayat putrān kanyām cārumatīm tathā
translated: Charuvinda, Sucharu and Charu, the foremost among the strong. He also begot a daughter named Charumati.

original: anyāś ca bhāryāḥ kṛṣṇasya babhūvuḥ sapta śobhanāḥ /
analyzed: anyāḥ ca bhāryāḥ kṛṣṇasya babhūvuḥ sapta śobhanāḥ
translated: Krishna had seven other beautiful wives.

original: kālindī mitravindā ca satyā nāgnajitī tathā // / / //
analyzed: kālindī mitravindā ca satyā nāgnajitī tathā
translated: They were Kalindi, Mitravinda, Satya, Nagnajiti,

original: devī jāmbavatī cāpi rohiṇī kāmarūpiṇī /
analyzed: devī jāmbavatī ca api rohiṇī kāmarūpiṇī
translated: the goddess Jambaavati, Rohini who could assume any form at will,

original: madrarājasutā cānyā suśīlā śīlamaṇḍanā // / / //
analyzed: madra rāja sutā ca anyā suśīlā śīla maṇḍanā
translated: and another daughter of the king of Madra, Sulasala who was adorned with good conduct.

original: sātrājitī satyabhāmā lakṣmaṇā cāruhāsinī /
analyzed: sātrājitī satyabhāmā lakṣmaṇā cāru hāsinī
translated: Sataraajit, Satyabhama, Lakshmana with a beautiful smile,

original: ṣoḍaśāsan sahasrāṇi strīṇām anyāni cakriṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ṣoḍaśa āsan sahasrāṇi strīṇām anyāni cakriṇaḥ
translated: and sixteen thousand other women were the wives of the discus-holder.

original: ins / / ins / after /
analyzed: d io g ins after ap
translated: Ins

original: pradyumnaḥ prathamas teṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ rukmiṇīsutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pradyumnaḥ prathamaḥ teṣām sarveṣām rukmiṇī sutaḥ
translated: Pradyumna, the son of Rukmini, was the first among them all.

original: pradyumno 'pi mahāvīryo rukmiṇas tanayāṃ śubhām /
analyzed: pradyumnaḥ pi mahā vīryaḥ rukmiṇaḥ tanayām śubhām
translated: The greatly powerful Pradyumna also married the beautiful daughter of Rukmin.

original: svayaṃvarasthāṃ jagrāha sā ca taṃ tanayaṃ hareḥ // / / //
analyzed: svayaṃvara sthām jagrāha sā ca tam tanayam hareḥ
translated: She was present at the Svayamvara and she chose the son of Hari.

original: tasyām asyābhavat putro mahābalaparākramaḥ /
analyzed: tasyām asya abhavat putraḥ mahā bala parākramaḥ
translated: On her was born a son of great strength and prowess.

original: aniruddho raṇe ruddho vīryodadhir ariṃdamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: aniruddhaḥ raṇe ruddhaḥ vīrya udadhiḥ ariṃdamaḥ
translated: Aniruddha, the ocean of prowess, the subduer of foes, was obstructed in battle.

original: tasyāpi rukmiṇaḥ pautrīṃ varayām āsa keśavaḥ /
analyzed: tasya api rukmiṇaḥ pautrīm varayām āsa keśavaḥ
translated: Keshava chose the granddaughter of Rukmin for him.

original: dauhitrāya dadau rukmī tāṃ spardhann api śauriṇā // / / //
analyzed: dauhitrāya dadau rukmī tām spardhan api śauriṇā
translated: Though competing with Shouri, Rukmin gave her to his grandson.

original: tasyā vivāhe rāmādyā yādavā hariṇā saha // / / //
analyzed: tasyāḥ vivāhe rāma ādyāḥ yādavāḥ hariṇā saha
translated: On the occasion of her marriage, Rama and other Yadavas, along with Hari,

original: ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: e t veṅk ins
translated: (went there).

original: kalyāṇārthaṃ tataḥ sarve ye cānye bhūbhṛtas tathā // / / //
analyzed: kalyāṇa artham tatas sarve ye ca anye bhūbhṛtaḥ tathā
translated: For the sake of welfare, all of them, as well as the other kings,

original: rukmiṇo nagaraṃ jagmur nāmnā bhojakaṭaṃ dvija // / / //
analyzed: rukmiṇaḥ nagaram jagmuḥ nāmnā bhojakaṭam dvija
translated: went to the city of Rukmin named Bhojakata, O Brahmin.

original: vivāhe tatra nirvṛtte prādyumneḥ sumahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: vivāhe tatra nirvṛtte prādyumneḥ su mahātmanaḥ
translated: When the marriage of the greatly illustrious Pradyumna was over,

original: kaliṅgarājapramukhā rukmiṇaṃ vākyam abruvan // / / //
analyzed: kaliṅga rāja pramukhāḥ rukmiṇam vākyam abruvan
translated: the kings headed by the king of Kalinga spoke to Rukmin:

original: anakṣajño halī dyūte tathāsya vyasanaṃ mahat /
analyzed: an akṣa jñaḥ halī dyūte tathā asya vyasanam mahat
translated: The plough-wielder is not skilled in gambling, and he has a great addiction to it.

original: na jayāmo balaṃ kasmād dyūte nainaṃ mahādyute // / / //
analyzed: na jayāmaḥ balam kasmāt dyūte na enam mahā dyute
translated: Why do we not defeat him in gambling, O greatly radiant one?

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tatheti tān āha nṛpān rukmī balasamanvitaḥ /
analyzed: tathā iti tān āha nṛpān rukmī bala samanvitaḥ
translated: Then Rukmin, accompanied by his army, said to those kings, So be it.

original: sabhāyāṃ saha rāmeṇa cakre dyūtaṃ ca vai tadā // / / //
analyzed: sabhāyām saha rāmeṇa cakre dyūtam ca vai tadā
translated: And then he played at dice with Rama in the assembly hall.

original: sahasram ekaṃ niṣkāṇāṃ rukmiṇā vijito balaḥ /
analyzed: sahasram ekam niṣkāṇām rukmiṇā vijitaḥ balaḥ
translated: Baladeva was defeated by Rukmin in the first round, losing a thousand gold coins.

original: dvitīye 'pi paṇe cānyat sahasraṃ rukmiṇā jitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dvitīye pi paṇe ca anyat sahasram rukmiṇā jitaḥ
translated: In the second round also, he was defeated by Rukmin and lost another thousand coins.

original: tato daśasahasrāṇi niṣkāṇāṃ paṇam ādade /
analyzed: tatas daśa sahasrāṇi niṣkāṇām paṇam ādade
translated: Then he staked ten thousand gold coins.

original: balabhadro 'jayat tāni rukmī dyūtavidāṃ varaḥ // / / //
analyzed: balabhadraḥ jayat tāni rukmī dyūta vidām varaḥ
translated: Baladeva lost them too, and Rukmin, the best among those who know dice, won.

original: tato jahāsa svanavat kaliṅgādhipatir dvija /
analyzed: tatas jahāsa svanavat kaliṅga adhipatiḥ dvija
translated: Then the king of Kalinga laughed loudly, O Brahmin.

original: dantān vidarśayan mūḍho rukmī cāha madoddhataḥ // / / //
analyzed: dantān vidarśayan mūḍhaḥ rukmī ca āha mada uddhataḥ
translated: The foolish Rukmin, intoxicated with pride, showed his teeth and said:

original: avidyo 'yaṃ mayā dyūte baladevaḥ parājitaḥ /
analyzed: avidyaḥ yam mayā dyūte baladevaḥ parājitaḥ
translated: This ignorant Baladeva has been defeated by me in gambling.

original: mudhaivākṣāvalepāndho yo 'vamene 'kṣakovidān // / / //🔽dṛṣṭvā kaliṅgarājānaṃ prakāśadaśanānanam /🔽rukmiṇaṃ cāpi durvākyaṃ kopaṃ cakre halāyudhaḥ // / / //🔽tataḥ kopaparītātmā niṣkakoṭiṃ halāyudhaḥ /
analyzed: mudhā eva akṣa avalepa andhaḥ yaḥ vam ene kṣa kovidān  dṛṣṭvā kaliṅga rājānam prakāśa daśana ānanam  rukmiṇam ca api durvākyam kopam cakre halāyudhaḥ  tatas kopa parīta ātmā niṣka koṭim halāyudhaḥ
translated: He has insulted those who are skilled in dice, blinded by the arrogance of dice.🔽Seeing the king of Kalinga with his teeth exposed and also the ill-spoken Rukmin, Halayudha (Balarama) became angry.

original: glahaṃ jagrāha rukmī ca tadarthe 'kṣān apātayat // / / //
analyzed: glaham jagrāha rukmī ca tad arthe kṣān apātayat
translated: Then, with his mind filled with anger, Halayudha staked a crore of gold coins. Rukmin also took up the dice for that amount.

original: ajayad baladevas taṃ prāhoccais taṃ jitaṃ mayā /
analyzed: ajayat baladevaḥ tam prāha uccais tam jitam mayā
translated: Balarama then defeated him and cried out, I have won!

original: mayeti rukmī prāhoccair alīkoktair alaṃ bala // / / //
analyzed: mayā iti rukmī prāha uccais alīka uktaiḥ alam bala
translated: Rukshmi also cried out, I have won! Enough of these false statements, O Balarama!

original: tvayokto 'yaṃ glahaḥ satyaṃ na mayaiṣo 'numoditaḥ /
analyzed: tvayā uktaḥ yam glahaḥ satyam na mayā eṣaḥ
translated: You said this wager, but I did not approve of it.

original: evaṃ tvayā ced vijitaṃ mayā na vijitaṃ katham // / / //
analyzed: evam tvayā ced vijitam mayā na vijitam katham
translated: If you have won in this way, then how have I not won?

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: athāntarikṣe vāg uccaiḥ prāha gambhīranādinī /
analyzed: atha antarikṣe vāc uccais prāha gambhīra nādinī
translated: Then a voice spoke from the sky, deep and resonant,

original: baladevasya taṃ kopaṃ vardhayantī mahātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: baladevasya tam kopam vardhayantī mahātmanaḥ
translated: exalting the anger of the great-souled Balarama.

original: jitaṃ balena dharmeṇa rukmiṇā bhāṣitaṃ mṛṣā /
analyzed: jitam balena dharmeṇa rukmiṇā bhāṣitam mṛṣā
translated: Balarama has won, what Rukshmi has said is false.

original: anuktvāpi vacaḥ kiṃcit kṛtaṃ bhavati karmaṇā // / / //
analyzed: an uktvā api vacaḥ kiṃcid kṛtam bhavati karmaṇā
translated: Even without speaking, it is done by action.

original: tato balaḥ samutthāya kopasaṃraktalocanaḥ /
analyzed: tatas balaḥ samutthāya kopa saṃrakta locanaḥ
translated: Then Balarama rose up, his eyes red with rage,

original: jaghānāṣṭāpadenaiva rukmiṇaṃ sa mahābalaḥ // / / //
analyzed: jaghāna aṣṭāpadena eva rukmiṇam sa mahā balaḥ
translated: and with a kick of his foot, the mighty one struck down Rukshmi.

original: kaliṅgarājaṃ cādāya visphurantaṃ balād balaḥ /
analyzed: kaliṅga rājam ca ādāya visphurantam balāt balaḥ
translated: And taking the struggling king of Kalinga, Balarama, in his rage,

original: babhañja dantān kupito yaiḥ prakāśaṃ jahāsa saḥ // / / //
analyzed: babhañja dantān kupitaḥ yaiḥ prakāśam jahāsa saḥ
translated: crushed his teeth with which he had laughed aloud.

original: ākṛṣya ca mahāstambhaṃ jātarūpamayaṃ balaḥ /
analyzed: ākṛṣya ca mahā stambham jātarūpa mayam balaḥ
translated: And drawing out a great pillar made of gold,

original: jaghāna ye 'nye tatpakṣāḥ bhūbhṛtaḥ kupito balaḥ // / / //
analyzed: jaghāna ye nye tad pakṣāḥ bhūbhṛtaḥ kupitaḥ balaḥ
translated: and other kings who sided with him, the enraged Baladeva.

original: tato hāhākṛtaṃ sarvaṃ palāyanaparaṃ dvija /
analyzed: tatas hāhākṛtam sarvam palāyana param dvija
translated: Then, O twice-born one, the entire assembly, crying Alas! Alas! became intent on flight.

original: tad rājamaṇḍalaṃ sarvaṃ babhūva kupite bale // / / //🔽balena nihataṃ śrutvā rukmiṇaṃ madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: tat rāja maṇḍalam sarvam babhūva kupite bale  balena nihatam śrutvā rukmiṇam madhusūdanaḥ
translated: And that entire circle of kings became agitated when Baladeva was enraged.🔽Having heard that Rukmin was slain by Baladeva,

original: novāca kiṃcin maitreya rukmiṇībalayor bhayāt // / / //🔽tato 'niruddham ādāya kṛtodvāhaṃ dvijottama /
analyzed: na uvāca kiṃcid maitreya rukmiṇī balayoḥ bhayāt  tatas niruddham ādāya kṛta udvāham dvijottama
translated: Madhusudana said nothing, O Maitreya, out of fear for Rukmini and Baladeva.🔽Then, O best of Brahmins, Keshava, having brought Aniruddha, who had been married,

original: dvārakām ājagāmātha yaducakraṃ sa keśavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dvārakām ājagāma atha yadu cakram sa keśavaḥ
translated: arrived at Dvaraka with the Yadava assembly.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pañcame 'ṃśe 'ṣṭāviṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pañcame ṃśe ṣṭāviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-eighth chapter in the fifth section of the Visnu Purana, dealing with the destruction of Naraka and the marriage of Aniruddha.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽dvāravatyāṃ tataḥ śauriṃ śakras tribhuvaneśvaraḥ /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  dvāravatyām tatas śaurim śakraḥ tribhuvana īśvaraḥ
translated: Parashara said:

original: ājagāmātha maitreya mattairāvatapṛṣṭhagaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ājagāma atha maitreya matta airāvata pṛṣṭha gaḥ
translated: Then Shakra, the lord of the three worlds, came to Shouri in Dvaraka, riding on his intoxicated Airvata elephant, O Maitreya.

original: praviśya dvārakāṃ so 'tha sametya hariṇā tataḥ /🔽kathayām āsa daityasya narakasya viceṣṭitam // / / //
analyzed: praviśya dvārakām saḥ tha sametya hariṇā tatas  kathayām āsa daityasya narakasya viceṣṭitam
translated: Having entered Dvaraka and met Hari, he then related the activities of the demon Naraka.

original: tvayā nāthena devānāṃ manuṣyatve 'pi tiṣṭhatā /
analyzed: tvayā nāthena devānām manuṣya tve pi tiṣṭhatā
translated: O lord of the gods, while you, though abiding in the human state, are the protector of the gods, the demons, disregarding the gods, are oppressing us.🔽 Having heard this, the lotus-eyed Hari said to Shakra, Do not fear.🔽 And having comforted the lord of the gods, he said to him, Go, O Shakra! I will do what is to be done.🔽 Having thus spoken to Shakra, the lotus-eyed one, the slayer of Madhu, went to the abode of the lord of the demons.

original: praśamaṃ sarvaduḥkhāni nītāni madhusūdana // / / //
analyzed: praśamam sarva duḥkhāni nītāni madhusūdana
translated: O Madhusudana, you have brought peace to all sufferings.

original: tapasvijananāśāya so 'riṣṭo dhenukas tathā /
analyzed: tapasvi jana nāśāya saḥ riṣṭaḥ dhenukaḥ tathā
translated: For the destruction of ascetics, that Aristha, Dhenuka,

original: pravṛtto yas tathā keśī te sarve nihatās tvayā // / / //
analyzed: pravṛttaḥ yaḥ tathā keśī te sarve nihatāḥ tvayā
translated: and Keshi who were engaged, all of them have been killed by you.

original: kaṃsaḥ kuvalayāpīḍaḥ pūtanā bālaghātinī /
analyzed: kaṃsaḥ kuvalayāpīḍaḥ pūtanā bāla ghātinī
translated: Kamsa, Kuvalayapida, Putana who killed children,

original: nāśaṃ nītās tvayā sarve ye 'nye jagadupadravāḥ // / / //
analyzed: nāśam nītāḥ tvayā sarve ye nye jagat upadravāḥ
translated: all of them who were afflicting the world have been destroyed by you.

original: yuṣmaddordaṇḍasadbuddhiparitrāte jagattraye /
analyzed: yuṣmad dos daṇḍa sat buddhi paritrāte jagattraye
translated: In the three worlds protected by the good policy of your strong arms,

original: yajviyajñāṃśasaṃprāptyā tṛptiṃ yānti divaukasaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yajvi yajña aṃśa saṃprāptyā tṛptim yānti divaukasaḥ
translated: the dwellers of heaven are satisfied by obtaining their share in the sacrifices performed by the sacrificers.

original: so 'haṃ sāmpratam āyāto yannimittaṃ janārdana /
analyzed: saḥ ham sāmpratam āyātaḥ yat nimittam janārdana
translated: For that purpose, O Janardana, I have now come here.

original: tac chrutvā tatpratīkāraprayatnaṃ kartum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: tat śrutvā tad pratīkāra prayatnam kartum arhasi
translated: Having heard that, you should make an effort to remedy it.

original: bhaumo 'yaṃ narako nāma prāgjyotiṣapureśvaraḥ /
analyzed: bhaumaḥ yam narakaḥ nāma prāgjyotiṣa pura īśvaraḥ
translated: This Naraka, the son of the earth, the lord of the city of Pragjyotisha,

original: karoti sarvabhūtānām upaghātam ariṃdama // / / //🔽devasiddhāsurādīnāṃ nṛpāṇāṃ ca janārdana /
analyzed: karoti sarva bhūtānām upaghātam ariṃdama  deva siddha asura ādīnām nṛpāṇām ca janārdana
translated: is causing harm to all beings, O destroyer of enemies.🔽O Janardana, that demon has abducted the daughters of gods, Siddhas, Asuras, and kings,

original: hṛtvā hi so 'suraḥ kanyā rurodha nijamandire // / / //
analyzed: hṛtvā hi saḥ suraḥ kanyāḥ rurodha nija mandire
translated: and has confined them in his own palace.

original: chatraṃ yat salilasrāvi taj jahāra pracetasaḥ /
analyzed: chatram yat salila srāvi tat jahāra pracetasaḥ
translated: He has taken away the umbrella that sheds water, belonging to Prachetas,

original: mandarasya tathā śṛṅgaṃ hṛtavān maṇiparvatam // / / //
analyzed: mandarasya tathā śṛṅgam hṛtavān maṇi parvatam
translated: and also the peak of Mandara, and the jewel-mountain.

original: amṛtasrāviṇī divye manmātuḥ kṛṣṇa kuṇḍale /
analyzed: amṛta srāviṇī divye mad mātuḥ kṛṣṇa kuṇḍale
translated: The earrings of my mother, Aditi, which exude nectar and are divine,

original: jahāra so 'suro 'dityā vāñchaty airāvataṃ gajam // / / //
analyzed: jahāra saḥ suraḥ dityāḥ vāñchati airāvatam gajam
translated: that asura took away. He desires the elephant Airvata.

original: durnītam etad govinda mayā tasya tavoditam /
analyzed: durnītam etat govinda mayā tasya tava uditam
translated: O Govinda, this is the wrong done by him, which I have told you.

original: yad atra pratikartavyaṃ tat svayaṃ parimṛśyatām // / / //
analyzed: yat atra pratikartavyam tat svayam parimṛśyatām
translated: What should be done about it should be carefully considered by yourself.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: iti śrutvā smitaṃ kṛtvā bhagavān devakīsutaḥ /
analyzed: iti śrutvā smitam kṛtvā bhagavān devakī sutaḥ
translated: Hearing this, the Lord, the son of Devaki, smiled.

original: gṛhītvā vāsavaṃ haste samuttasthau varāsanāt // / / //🔽ins /
analyzed: gṛhītvā vāsavam haste samuttasthau varāsanāt  ins
translated: Taking Indra's hand, he rose from his excellent seat.

original: cintayām āsa ca vibhur manasā pannagāśanam // / / //
analyzed: cintayām āsa ca vibhuḥ manasā pannagāśanam
translated: (He thought:) The Lord thought in his mind about the serpent-eater (Garuda).

original: saṃcintitam upāruhya garuḍaṃ gaganecaram /
analyzed: saṃcintitam upāruhya garuḍam gaganecaram
translated: Having thought, he mounted Garuda, the sky-goer,

original: satyabhāmāṃ samāropya yayau prāgjyotiṣaṃ puram // / / //
analyzed: satyabhāmām samāropya yayau prāgjyotiṣam puram
translated: and placing Satyabhama on him, went to the city of Pragjyotisha.

original: āruhyairāvataṃ nāgaṃ śakro 'pi tridiśālayam /
analyzed: āruhya airāvatam nāgam tri diśā ālayam
translated: Shakra also, having mounted the elephant Airvata, went to the abode of heaven,

original: tato jagāma maitreya paśyatāṃ dvārakaukasām // / / //
analyzed: tatas jagāma maitreya paśyatām dvārakā okasām
translated: then he went, O Maitreya, while the residents of Dvaraka were looking on.

original: prāgjyotiṣapurasyāsīt samantāc chatayojanam /
analyzed: prāgjyotiṣa purasya āsīt samantāt śata yojanam
translated: Around the city of Pragjyotisha, for a hundred yojanas,

original: ācitā mauravaiḥ pāśaiḥ kṣurāntair bhūr dvijottama // / / //
analyzed: ācitā mauravaiḥ pāśaiḥ kṣura antaiḥ bhūḥ dvijottama
translated: O best of the twice-born, the earth was covered with nets made of Muru's hair, having edges like razors.

original: tāṃś ciccheda hariḥ pāśān kṣiptvā cakraṃ sudarśanam /
analyzed: tān ciccheda hariḥ pāśān kṣiptvā cakram sudarśanam
translated: Hari cut those nets and hurled his discus Sudarshana.

original: tato muruḥ samuttasthau taṃ jaghāna ca keśavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas muruḥ samuttasthau tam jaghāna ca keśavaḥ
translated: Then Muru rose up and Keshava struck him down.

original: muros tu tanayān sapta sahasrāṃs tāṃs tato hariḥ /
analyzed: muroḥ tu tanayān sapta sahasrān tān tatas hariḥ
translated: Then Hari killed the seven thousand sons of Muru.

original: cakradhārāgninirdagdhāṃś cakāra śalabhān iva // / / //🔽hatvā muruṃ hayagrīvaṃ tathā pañcajanaṃ dvija /
analyzed: cakra dhārā agni nirdagdhān cakāra śalabhān iva  hatvā murum hayagrīvam tathā pañcajanam dvija
translated: He reduced them to ashes, as if they were insects, by the fire of the edge of his discus.🔽O twice-born one, having killed Muru, Hayagriva and Panchjana,

original: prāgjyotiṣapuraṃ dhīmāṃs tvarāvān samupādravat // / / //
analyzed: prāgjyotiṣa puram dhīmān tvarāvān samupādravat
translated: the wise one quickly rushed to the city of Pragjyotisha.

original: narakeṇāsya tatrābhūn mahāsainyena saṃyugaḥ /
analyzed: narakeṇa asya tatra abhūt mahā sainyena saṃyugaḥ
translated: There he had a battle with Naraka, who had a great army.

original: kṛṣṇasya yatra govindo jaghne daityān sahasraśaḥ // / / //🔽śastrāstravarṣaṃ muñcantaṃ taṃ bhaumaṃ narakaṃ balī /
analyzed: kṛṣṇasya yatra govindaḥ jaghne daityān sahasraśas  śastra astra varṣam muñcantam tam bhaumam narakam balī
translated: In that battle, Krishna, the Govinda, killed thousands of daityas.

original: kṣiptvā cakraṃ dvidhā cakre cakrī daiteyacakrahā // / / //
analyzed: kṣiptvā cakram dvidhā cakre cakrī daiteya cakra hā
translated: The powerful wielder of the discus, the destroyer of the circle of daityas, hurled his discus and cut the powerful Naraka, the son of the earth, into two pieces, as he was releasing a shower of weapons and missiles.

original: hate tu narake bhūmir gṛhītvāditikuṇḍale /
analyzed: hate tu narake bhūmiḥ gṛhītvā aditi kuṇḍale
translated: When Naraka was killed, the earth took the earrings of Aditi

original: upatasthe jagannāthaṃ vākyaṃ cedam athābravīt // / / //
analyzed: upatasthe jagannātham vākyam ca idam atha abravīt
translated: and approached the Lord of the universe and spoke these words:

original: yadāham uddhṛtā nātha tvayā sūkaramūrtinā /
analyzed: yadā aham uddhṛtā nātha tvayā sūkara mūrtinā
translated: When I was rescued by you, O Lord, in the form of a boar,

original: tvatsparśasaṃbhavaḥ putras tadāyaṃ mayy ajāyata // / / //
analyzed: tvad sparśa saṃbhavaḥ putraḥ tadā ayam mayi ajāyata
translated: This son, born from the touch of you, was born to me.

original: so 'yaṃ tvayaiva datto me tvayaiva vinipātitaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ yam tvayā eva dattaḥ me tvayā eva vinipātitaḥ
translated: He was given to me by you alone and was brought down by you alone.

original: gṛhāṇa kuṇḍale ceme pālayāsya ca saṃtatim // / / //
analyzed: gṛhāṇa kuṇḍale ca ime pālaya asya ca saṃtatim
translated: Accept these earrings and protect this lineage of his.

original: bhārāvataraṇārthāya mamaiva bhagavān imam /
analyzed: bhāra avataraṇa arthāya mama eva bhagavān imam
translated: For the sake of removing the burden, the Lord himself,

original: aṃśena lokam āyātaḥ prasādasumukhaḥ prabho // / / //
analyzed: aṃśena lokam āyātaḥ prasāda su mukhaḥ prabho
translated: With a part, has come to this world, O Lord, with a face pleased by grace.

original: tvaṃ kartā ca vikartā ca saṃhartā prabhavo 'pyayaḥ /
analyzed: tvam kartā ca vikartā ca saṃhartā prabhavaḥ pyayaḥ
translated: You are the creator, the transformer, the destroyer, the origin, and the end.

original: jagatāṃ tvaṃ jagadrūpaḥ stūyate 'cyuta kiṃ tava // / / //
analyzed: jagatām tvam jagat rūpaḥ stūyate cyuta kim tava
translated: You are the form of the world in the worlds. O Achyuta, what can be said about you?

original: vyāpī vyāpyaḥ kriyā kartā kāryaṃ ca bhagavān yadā /
analyzed: vyāpī vyāpyaḥ kriyā kartā kāryam ca bhagavān yadā
translated: When the Lord is the all-pervading, the all-pervaded, the agent of action, and the object of action,

original: sarvabhūtātmabhūtasya stūyate tava kiṃ tadā // / / //
analyzed: sarva bhūta ātma bhūtasya stūyate tava kim tadā
translated: Then how can praise be offered to you who are the self of all beings?

original: paramātmā tvam ātmā ca bhūtātmā cāvyayo bhavān /
analyzed: parama ātmā tvam ātmā ca bhūtātmā ca avyayaḥ bhavān
translated: You are the supreme self, the individual self, and the imperishable self of beings.

original: yadā tadā stutir nāsti kimarthā te pravartate // / / //
analyzed: yadā tadā stutiḥ na asti kimarthā te pravartate
translated: When that is so, there is no praise. For what purpose does it proceed?

original: prasīda sarvabhūtātman narakeṇa kṛtaṃ hi yat /
analyzed: prasīda sarva bhūta ātman narakeṇa kṛtam hi yat
translated: Be gracious, O soul of all beings! What has been done by Naraka,

original: tat kṣamyatām adoṣāya tvatsutaḥ sa nipātitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat kṣamyatām adoṣāya tvad sutaḥ sa nipātitaḥ
translated: Let that be forgiven without fault. Your son has been brought down.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tatheti coktvā dharaṇīṃ bhagavān bhūtabhāvanaḥ /
analyzed: tathā iti ca uktvā dharaṇīm bhagavān bhūtabhāvanaḥ
translated: The Blessed One, the creator of beings, said So be it to the earth.

original: ratnāni narakāvāsāj jagrāha munisattama // / / //🔽kanyāpure sa kanyānāṃ ṣoḍaśātulavikramaḥ /
analyzed: ratnāni naraka āvāsāt jagrāha muni sattama  kanyāpure sa kanyānām ṣoḍaśa atula vikramaḥ
translated: And, O best of sages, he took the jewels from Naraka's abode.

original: śatādhikāni dadṛśe sahasrāṇi mahāmune // / / //
analyzed: śata adhikāni dadṛśe sahasrāṇi mahā mune
translated: In the maidens' quarters, the one of incomparable valor saw, O great sage, more than a hundred thousand maidens.

original: caturdaṃṣṭrān gajāṃś cogrān ṣaṭsahasrān sa dṛṣṭavān /
analyzed: catur daṃṣṭrān gajān ca ugrān ṣaṣ sahasrān sa dṛṣṭavān
translated: And he saw six thousand fierce elephants with four tusks.

original: kāmbojānāṃ tathāśvānāṃ niyutāny ekaviṃśatim // / / //🔽kanyās tāś ca tathā nāgāṃs tāṃś cāśvān dvārakāṃ purīm /
analyzed: kāmbojānām tathā aśvānām niyutāni ekaviṃśatim  kanyāḥ tāḥ ca tathā nāgān tān ca aśvān dvārakām purīm
translated: And twenty-one million horses from Kamboja.

original: preṣayām āsa govindaḥ sadyo narakakiṃkaraiḥ // / / //
analyzed: preṣayām āsa govindaḥ sadyas naraka kiṃkaraiḥ
translated: Govinda immediately sent those maidens, those elephants, those horses, and the bejeweled mountain to the city of Dvaraka through Naraka's servants.

original: dadṛśe vāruṇaṃ chatraṃ tathaiva maṇiparvatam /
analyzed: dadṛśe vāruṇam chatram tathā eva maṇi parvatam
translated: He saw the Varuna umbrella and the jeweled mountain.

original: āropayām āsa harir garuḍe patageśvare // / / //
analyzed: āropayām āsa hariḥ garuḍe pataga īśvare
translated: Hari placed them on Garuda, the lord of birds.

original: āruhya ca svayaṃ kṛṣṇaḥ satyabhāmāsahāyavān /
analyzed: āruhya ca svayam kṛṣṇaḥ satyabhāmā sahāyavān
translated: And Krishna himself, accompanied by Satyabhama,

original: adityāḥ kuṇḍale dātuṃ jagāma tridivālayam // / / //🔽iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pañcame 'ṃśe ekonatriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ 🔽parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: adityāḥ kuṇḍale dātum jagāma tridiva ālayam 🔽iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pañcame ṃśe ekonatriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ 🔽parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: mounted (Garuda) and went to heaven to give Aditi her earrings.

original: garuḍo vāruṇaṃ chatraṃ tathaiva maṇiparvatam /
analyzed: garuḍaḥ vāruṇam chatram tathā eva maṇi parvatam
translated: Garuda carried the Varuna umbrella and the bejewelled mountain,

original: sabhāryaṃ ca hṛṣīkeśaṃ līlayaiva vahan yayau // / / //
analyzed: sa bhāryam ca hṛṣīkeśam līlayā eva vahan yayau
translated: and Hrishikesha with his wife, as if in play.

original: tataḥ śaṅkham upādhmāsīt svargadvāragato hariḥ /
analyzed: tatas śaṅkham upādhmāsīt svarga dvāra gataḥ hariḥ
translated: Then Hari, having reached the gate of heaven, blew his conch shell.

original: upatasthus tato devāḥ sārghyapātrā janārdanam // / / //
analyzed: upatasthuḥ tatas devāḥ sa arghya pātrāḥ janārdanam
translated: Then the gods, with vessels of Arghya, approached Janardana.

original: sa devair arcitaḥ kṛṣṇo devamātur niveśanam /
analyzed: sa devaiḥ arcitaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ devamātuḥ niveśanam
translated: Krishna, worshipped by the gods, entered the abode of Aditi,

original: sitābhraśikharākāraṃ praviśya dadṛśe 'ditim // / / //
analyzed: sita abhra śikhara ākāram praviśya dadṛśe ditim
translated: which resembled the peak of a white cloud, and saw Aditi.

original: sa tāṃ praṇamya śakreṇa saha te kuṇḍalottame /
analyzed: sa tām praṇamya śakreṇa saha te kuṇḍala uttame
translated: He, along with Shakra, offered her those excellent earrings,

original: dadau narakanāśaṃ ca śaśaṃsāsyai janārdanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dadau naraka nāśam ca śaśaṃsa asyai janārdanaḥ
translated: and Janardana told her about the destruction of Naraka.

original: tataḥ prītā jaganmātā dhātāraṃ jagatāṃ harim /
analyzed: tatas prītā jaganmātā dhātāram jagatām harim
translated: Then the mother of the world, Aditi, pleased with Hari, the creator of the worlds,

original: tuṣṭāvāditir avyagrā kṛtvā tatpravaṇaṃ manaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tuṣṭāva aditiḥ avyagrā kṛtvā tad pravaṇam manaḥ
translated: with a mind devoted to him, spoke with joy.

original: aditir uvāca /
analyzed: aditiḥ uvāca
translated: Aditi said:

original: namas te puṇḍarīkākṣa bhaktānām abhayaṃkara /
analyzed: namaḥ te puṇḍarīkākṣa bhaktānām abhayaṃkara
translated: Salutations to you, O lotus-eyed one, the bestower of fearlessness to the devotees,

original: sanātanātman sarvātman bhūtātman bhūtabhāvana // / / //
analyzed: sanātana ātman sarva ātman bhūtātman bhūtabhāvana
translated: O eternal Self, the Self of all, the Self of beings, the nourisher of beings.

original: praṇetā manaso buddher indriyāṇāṃ guṇātmaka /
analyzed: praṇetā manasaḥ buddheḥ indriyāṇām guṇa ātmaka
translated: You are the impeller of the mind, intellect and senses, having the qualities as your essence,

original: triguṇātīta nirdvandva śuddha sarvahṛdisthita // / / //
analyzed: triguṇa atīta nirdvandva śuddha sarva hṛdisthita
translated: transcending the three qualities, free from duality, pure, residing in all hearts.

original: sitadīrghādiniḥśeṣakalpanāparivarjita /
analyzed: sita dīrgha ādi niḥśeṣa kalpanā parivarjita
translated: Free from all concepts of white, long, etc.,

original: janmādibhir asaṃspṛṣṭa svapnādiparivarjita // / / //
analyzed: janma ādibhiḥ a saṃspṛṣṭa svapna ādi parivarjita
translated: Untouched by birth, etc., free from dreams, etc.,

original: saṃdhyā rātrir aho bhūmir gaganaṃ vāyur ambu ca /
analyzed: saṃdhyā rātriḥ ahaḥ bhūmiḥ gaganam vāyuḥ ambu ca
translated: Twilight, night, day, earth, sky, air, water,

original: hutāśano mano buddhir bhūtādis tvaṃ tathācyuta // / / //
analyzed: hutāśanaḥ manaḥ buddhiḥ bhūtādiḥ tvam tathā acyuta
translated: Fire, mind, intellect, the primordial elements, and you, O Acyuta,

original: sṛṣṭisthitivināśānāṃ kartā kartṛpatir bhavān /
analyzed: sṛṣṭi sthiti vināśānām kartā kartṛ patiḥ bhavān
translated: You are the agent, the lord of the agents, of creation, sustenance, and dissolution.

original: brahmaviṣṇuśivākhyābhir ātmamūrtibhir īśvara // / / //
analyzed: brahma viṣṇu śiva ākhyābhiḥ ātma mūrtibhiḥ īśvara
translated: O Lord, with your own forms named Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva,

original: devā yakṣās tathā daityā rākṣasāḥ siddhapannagāḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ yakṣāḥ tathā daityāḥ rākṣasāḥ siddha pannagāḥ
translated: Gods, yakshas, demons, rakshasas, siddhas, serpents,

original: kūṣmāṇḍāś ca piśācāś ca gandharvā manujās tathā // / / //
analyzed: kūṣmāṇḍāḥ ca piśācāḥ ca gandharvāḥ manujāḥ tathā
translated: Kushamanda ghosts, pishachas, gandharvas, humans,

original: paśavo mṛgāḥ pataṃgāś ca tathaiva ca sarīsṛpāḥ // / / //
analyzed: paśavaḥ mṛgāḥ pataṃgāḥ ca tathā eva ca sarīsṛpāḥ
translated: Animals, deer, insects, and reptiles,

original: for / subst /🔽paśava uragā mīnā mṛgāś ca vanajātayaḥ // / / / //🔽kīṭāś caiva pataṅgāś ca tathaiva ca sarīsṛpāḥ // / / / //
analyzed: for  substitute  paśavaḥ uragāḥ mīnāḥ mṛgāḥ ca vana jātayaḥ  kīṭāḥ ca eva pataṅgāḥ ca tathā eva ca sarīsṛpāḥ
translated: For. For the sake of.🔽Animals, snakes, fish, and wild animals,🔽Insects, birds, and reptiles,

original: vṛkṣagulmalatāvallīsamastatṛṇajātayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vṛkṣa gulma latā vallī samasta tṛṇa jātayaḥ
translated: Trees, shrubs, creepers, vines, and all kinds of grass,

original: sthūlā madhyās tathā sūkṣmāḥ sūkṣmāt sūkṣmatarāś ca ye /
analyzed: sthūlāḥ madhyāḥ tathā sūkṣmāḥ sūkṣmāt sūkṣmatarāḥ ca ye
translated: The gross, the middling, the subtle, and those subtler than the subtle,

original: dehabhedā bhavān sarve ye kecit pudgalāśrayāḥ // / / //🔽māyā taveyam ajñātaparamārthātimohinī /
analyzed: deha bhedāḥ bhavān sarve ye kecid pudgala āśrayāḥ  māyā tava iyam ajñāta parama arthā ati mohinī
translated: All the different bodies that exist, which are the basis of individual souls,🔽This is your illusion, unknown to those whose highest truth is deluded,

original: anātmany ātmavijñānaṃ yayā mūḍho nirudhyate // / / //
analyzed: anātmani ātma vijñānam yayā mūḍhaḥ nirudhyate
translated: By which the ignorant one is obstructed, the knowledge of the self in what is not the self.

original: V ins /🔽asve svam iti bhāvo 'tra yat puṃsām upajāyate // / / //
analyzed: u ins  a sve svam iti yat puṃsām upajāyate
translated: (missing verse)🔽The notion that arises in men here, This is mine, regarding what is not theirs,

original: ahaṃ mameti bhāvo 'tra yat puṃsām abhijāyate /
analyzed: aham mama iti yat puṃsām abhijāyate
translated: The notion that arises in men here, I am, and This is mine,

original: saṃsāramātur māyāyās tavaitan nātha ceṣṭitam // / / //
analyzed: saṃsāra mātuḥ māyāyāḥ tava etat nātha ceṣṭitam
translated: O Lord, this is the activity of your illusion, the mother of the world,

original: yaiḥ svadharmaparair nātha narair ārādhito bhavān /
analyzed: yaiḥ svadharma paraiḥ nātha naraiḥ ārādhitaḥ bhavān
translated: O Lord, those men who worship you, being devoted to their own duties,

original: te taranty akhilām etāṃ māyām ātmavimuktaye // / / //
analyzed: te taranti akhilām etām māyām ātma vimuktaye
translated: They cross over this entire illusion for the liberation of the self.

original: brahmādyāḥ sakalā devā manuṣyāḥ paśavas tathā /
analyzed: brahma ādyāḥ sakalāḥ devāḥ manuṣyāḥ paśavaḥ tathā
translated: Brahma and all the gods, humans and animals,

original: viṣṇumāyāmahāvartamohāndhatamasā vṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇu māyā mahā varta moha andhatamasā vṛtāḥ
translated: Are enveloped in the darkness of delusion from the great whirlpool of Vishnu's illusion.

original: ārādhya tvām abhīpsante kāmān ātmabhavakṣayam /
analyzed: ārādhya tvām abhīpsante kāmān ātma bhava kṣayam
translated: They worship you, desiring desires that destroy their own existence,

original: yad ete puruṣā māyā saiveyaṃ bhagavaṃs tava // / / //
analyzed: yat ete puruṣāḥ māyā sā eva iyam bhagavan tava
translated: That is your illusion, O Lord, which these men desire.

original: mayā tvaṃ putrakāminyā vairipakṣakṣayāya ca /
analyzed: mayā tvam putra kāminyā vairi pakṣa kṣayāya ca
translated: I worshipped you, desiring sons and the destruction of my enemies,🔽Not for liberation, for that was the play of your illusion.

original: ārādhito na mokṣāya māyāvilasitaṃ hi tat // / / //
analyzed: ārādhitaḥ na mokṣāya māyā vilasitam hi tat
translated: (missing verse)

original: kaupīnācchādanaprāyā vāñchā kalpadrumād api /
analyzed: kaupīna ācchādana prāyā vāñchā kalpadrumāt api
translated: The desire of the impious for the fulfilment of their wishes, even from the wish-granting tree, is like the desire of a man for the covering of his private parts.🔽This is the fault of their own sins.

original: jāyate yad apuṇyānāṃ so 'parādhaḥ svadoṣajaḥ // / / //🔽tat prasīdākhilajaganmāyāmohakarāvyaya /
analyzed: jāyate yat apuṇyānām saḥ u parādhaḥ sva doṣa jaḥ  tat prasīda akhila jagat māyā moha kara avyaya
translated: Be pleased, O imperishable one, who deludes the illusion of the entire world.

original: ajñānaṃ jñānasadbhāvabhūtaṃ bhūteśa nāśaya // / / //
analyzed: ajñānam jñāna sadbhāva bhūtam bhūteśa nāśaya
translated: O Lord of beings, destroy this ignorance, which is the true nature of knowledge.

original: namas te cakrahastāya śārṅgahastāya te namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ te cakra hastāya śārṅga hastāya te namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, O wielder of the discus in your hand, salutations to you, O wielder of the Sharnga bow in your hand.

original: gadāhastāya te viṣṇo śaṅkhahastāya te namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: gadā hastāya te viṣṇo śaṅkha hastāya te namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, O Vishnu, O wielder of the mace in your hand, salutations to you, O wielder of the conch in your hand.

original: etat paśyāmi te rūpaṃ sthūlacihnopalakṣitam /
analyzed: etat paśyāmi te rūpam sthūla cihna upalakṣitam
translated: I see this form of yours, marked with gross signs.

original: na jānāmi paraṃ yat te prasīda parameśvara // / / //
analyzed: na jānāmi param yat te prasīda parameśvara
translated: I do not know your supreme form. Be pleased, O Supreme Lord.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: adityaivaṃ stuto viṣṇuḥ prahasyāha surāraṇim /
analyzed: adityā evam stutaḥ viṣṇuḥ prahasya āha surāraṇim
translated: Thus praised by Aditi, Vishnu smiled and said to the mother of the gods:

original: mātā devi tvam asmākaṃ prasīda varadā bhava // / / //
analyzed: mātā devi tvam asmākam prasīda vara dā bhava
translated: O Goddess, you are our mother. Be pleased and grant us boons.

original: aditir uvāca /🔽evam astu yathecchā te tvam aśeṣaiḥ surāsuraiḥ /
analyzed: aditiḥ uvāca  evam astu yathā icchā te tvam aśeṣaiḥ sura asuraiḥ
translated: Aditi said:

original: ajeyaḥ puruṣavyāghra martyaloke bhaviṣyasi // / / //
analyzed: ajeyaḥ puruṣa vyāghra martya loke bhaviṣyasi
translated: Let it be so, as you wish. You will be invincible by all the gods and demons, O tiger among men, in the mortal world.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tato 'nantaram evāsya śakrāṇīsahitāditim /
analyzed: tatas nantaram eva asya śakrāṇī sahitā aditim
translated: Immediately after this, Aditi, together with Shakra's wife (Indra's wife), said to Aditi:

original: satyabhāmā praṇamyāha prasīdeti punaḥ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: satyabhāmā praṇamya āha prasīda iti punar punar
translated: Satyabhāmā repeatedly bowed down and said, Be pleased.

original: aditir uvāca /🔽matprasādān na te subhru jarā vairūpyam eva ca /
analyzed: aditiḥ uvāca  mad prasādāt na te subhru jarā vairūpyam eva ca
translated: Aditi said:🔽O you with beautiful eyebrows, by my grace, you will not have old age or ugliness.

original: bhaviṣyaty anavadyāṅgī sarvakālaṃ bhaviṣyasi // / / //
analyzed: bhaviṣyati anavadya aṅgī sarvakālam bhaviṣyasi
translated: You will always be faultless in your limbs.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽adityā tu kṛtānujño devarājo janārdanam /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  adityā tu kṛta anujñaḥ devarājaḥ janārdanam
translated: Parashara said:

original: yathāvat pūjayām āsa bahumānapuraḥsaram // / / //
analyzed: yathāvat pūjayām āsa bahu māna puraḥsaram
translated: With Aditi's permission, the king of the gods duly worshipped Janardana with great respect.

original: ed / Veṅk / ins /🔽śacī ca satyabhāmāyai pārijātasya puṣpakam // / / / //
analyzed: e t veṅk ins  śacī ca satyabhāmāyai pārijātasya puṣpakam
translated: (Here is the realigned and corrected output:)

original: na dadau mānuṣīṃ matvā svayaṃ puṣpair alaṃkṛtā // / / / //
analyzed: na dadau mānuṣīm matvā svayam puṣpaiḥ alaṃkṛtā
translated: Shachi (Indra's wife) did not give a flower of the Parijata tree to Satyabhama, thinking her to be a human being, and adorned herself with flowers.

original: tato dadarśa kṛṣṇo 'pi satyabhāmāsahāyavān /
analyzed: tatas dadarśa kṛṣṇaḥ satyabhāmā sahāyavān
translated: Then Krishna, accompanied by Satyabhama,

original: devodyānāni hṛdyāni nandanādīni sattama // / / //🔽dadarśa ca sugandhāḍhyaṃ mañjarīpuṣpadhāriṇam /
analyzed: deva udyānāni hṛdyāni nandana ādīni sattama  dadarśa ca su gandha āḍhyam mañjarī puṣpa dhāriṇam
translated: saw the delightful celestial gardens like Nandana, O best one.🔽He saw the Parijata tree, full of fragrance, bearing bunches of flowers,

original: śaityāhlādakaraṃ tāmrabālapallavaśobhitam // / / //
analyzed: śaitya āhlāda karam tāmra bāla pallava śobhitam
translated: giving coolness and delight, adorned with coppery young leaves.

original: mathyamāne 'mṛte jātaṃ jātarūpopamatvacam /
analyzed: mathyamāne mṛte jātam jātarūpa upama tvacam
translated: Born when the nectar was being churned, having a bark resembling gold,

original: pārijātaṃ jagannāthaḥ keśavaḥ keśisūdanaḥ // / / //🔽ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: pārijātam jagannāthaḥ keśavaḥ keśisūdanaḥ 🔽e t veṅk ins
translated: Keshava, the lord of the universe, the slayer of Keshi, saw the Parijata tree.

original: tutoṣa paramaprītyā tarurājam anuttamam // / / //
analyzed: tutoṣa parama prītyā taru rājam anuttamam
translated: And was highly pleased with that excellent king of trees.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā prāha govindaṃ satyabhāmā dvijottama /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā prāha govindam satyabhāmā dvijottama
translated: Seeing it, Satyabhāmā said to Govinda, O best of Brahmins:

original: kasmān na dvārakām eṣa nīyate kṛṣṇa pādapaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kasmāt na dvārakām eṣa nīyate kṛṣṇa pādapaḥ
translated: Why is this tree not being taken to Dvārakā, O Kṛṣṇa?

original: yadi te tad vacaḥ satyaṃ satyātyarthaṃ priyeti me /
analyzed: yadi te tat vacaḥ satyam satya atyartham priya iti me
translated: If your words are true, and if I am truly dear to you,

original: madgehaniṣkuṭārthāya tad ayaṃ nīyatāṃ taruḥ // / / //
analyzed: mad geha niṣkuṭa arthāya tat ayam nīyatām taruḥ
translated: then let this tree be taken for the sake of my pleasure garden.

original: na me jāmbavatī tādṛg abhīṣṭā na ca rukmiṇī /
analyzed: na me jāmbavatī tādṛś abhīṣṭā na ca rukmiṇī
translated: Jāmbavatī is not so dear to me, nor is Rukmiṇī,

original: satye yathā tvam ity uktaṃ tvayā kṛṣṇāsakṛt priyam // / / //
analyzed: satye yathā tvam iti uktam tvayā kṛṣṇa asakṛt priyam
translated: as you are, O Kṛṣṇa, this has been said by you many times, O dear one.

original: satyaṃ tad yadi govinda nopacārakṛtaṃ tava /🔽tad astu pārijāto 'yaṃ mama gehavibhūṣaṇam // / / //
analyzed: satyam tat yadi govinda na upacāra kṛtam tava  tat astu pārijātaḥ yam mama geha vibhūṣaṇam
translated: If that is true, O Govinda, and not mere flattery,🔽then let this Pārijāta be an ornament in my house.

original: bibhratī pārijātasya keśapakṣeṇa mañjarīm /
analyzed: bibhratī pārijātasya keśapakṣeṇa mañjarīm
translated: Wearing a cluster of Pārijāta flowers in my hair,

original: sapatnīnām ahaṃ madhye śobheyam iti kāmaye // / / //
analyzed: sapatnīnām aham madhye śobheyam iti kāmaye
translated: I wish to shine among my co-wives.

original: ins /
analyzed: g ins
translated: Inserts:

original: tathā xxx kā bhūtvā ratim utpādayāmi te // / / / //
analyzed: tathā xxx kā bhūtvā ratim utpādayāmi te
translated: And thus xxx, I will arouse passion in you.

original: rugmiṇīprabhṛtibhyas te devībhyaś cātisundarī // / / / //
analyzed: rugmiṇī prabhṛtibhyaḥ te devībhyaḥ ca ati sundarī
translated: You are more beautiful than those goddesses beginning with Rukmiṇī.

original: etena pārijātena bhavāmi tava karmaṇā // / / / //
analyzed: etena pārijātena bhavāmi tava karmaṇā
translated: By this Pārijāta tree, I will become your servant.

original: yathāhaṃ mādhava vibho tathā mām adhikāṃ kuru // / / / //
analyzed: yathā aham mādhava vibho tathā mām adhikām kuru
translated: O Madhava, O Lord, make me superior to her.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽ity uktaḥ sa prahasyaināṃ pārijātaṃ garutmati /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  iti uktaḥ sa prahasya enām pārijātam garutmati
translated: Parashara said:🔽Thus addressed, Hari laughed and placed the Parijata tree on Garuda.

original: āropayām āsa haris tam ūcur vanarakṣiṇaḥ // / / //🔽bho śacī devarājasya mahiṣī tatparigraham /
analyzed: āropayām āsa hariḥ tam ūcuḥ vana rakṣiṇaḥ  bho śacī devarājasya mahiṣī tad parigraham
translated: The forest guards said to him:

original: pārijātaṃ na govinda hartum arhasi pādapam // / / //
analyzed: pārijātam na govinda hartum arhasi pādapam
translated: O Shachi, you are the queen of the king of gods. O Govinda, you should not take away the Parijata tree, which belongs to him.

original: ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: e t veṅk ins
translated: (The guards said:)

original: utpanno devarājāya dattaḥ so 'pi dadau punaḥ // / / / //🔽mahiṣyai sumahābhāga devyai śacyai kutūhalāt // / / / //
analyzed: utpannaḥ devarājāya dattaḥ saḥ pi dadau punar  mahiṣyai su mahābhāga devyai śacyai kutūhalāt
translated: It was produced for the king of gods and he gave it again🔽to his greatly fortunate queen Shachi out of curiosity.

original: śacīvibhūṣaṇārthāya devair amṛtamanthane /
analyzed: śacī vibhūṣaṇa arthāya devaiḥ amṛta manthane
translated: For the sake of ornamenting Shachi, this tree was produced by the gods in the churning of the nectar ocean.

original: utpādito 'yaṃ na kṣemī gṛhītvainaṃ gamiṣyasi // / / //🔽devarājo mukhaprekṣo yasyās tasyāḥ parigraham /
analyzed: utpāditaḥ yam na kṣemī gṛhītvā enam gamiṣyasi  devarājaḥ mukha prekṣaḥ yasyāḥ tasyāḥ parigraham
translated: You will not be safe by taking it away.🔽The king of gods is looking at your face. Out of foolishness, you are asking for what belongs to him.

original: mauḍhyāt prārthayase kṣemī gṛhītvainaṃ hi ko vrajet // / / //
analyzed: mauḍhyāt prārthayase kṣemī gṛhītvā enam hi kaḥ vrajet
translated: Who would go safely by taking it away?

original: avaśyam asya devendro niṣkṛtiṃ kṛṣṇa yāsyati /
analyzed: avaśyam asya deva indraḥ niṣkṛtim kṛṣṇa yāsyati
translated: O Krishna, the king of gods will certainly take revenge on you.

original: vajrodyatakaraṃ śakram anuyāsyanti cāmarāḥ // / / //
analyzed: vajra udyata karam śakram anuyāsyanti ca amarāḥ
translated: Shakra, with his thunderbolt raised in his hand, will be followed by the immortals.🔽(The guards said:)

original: tad alaṃ sakalair devair vigraheṇa tavācyuta /
analyzed: tat alam sakalaiḥ devaiḥ vigraheṇa tava acyuta
translated: Therefore, O Achyuta, enough of this quarrel with all the gods.

original: vipākakaṭu yat karma tan na śaṃsanti paṇḍitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: vipāka kaṭu yat karma tat na śaṃsanti paṇḍitāḥ
translated: The wise do not praise that action whose ripening is bitter.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity ukte tair uvācaitān satyabhāmātikopinī /
analyzed: iti ukte taiḥ uvāca etān satyabhāmā ati kopinī
translated: When this was said by them, Satyabhama, greatly enraged, said to them:

original: kā śacī pārijātasya ko vā śakraḥ surādhipaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kā śacī pārijātasya kaḥ vā śakraḥ sura adhipaḥ
translated: Who is Shachi? Who is Shakra, the lord of the gods, in regard to the Parijata tree?

original: sāmānyaḥ sarvalokānāṃ yady eṣo 'mṛtamanthane /
analyzed: sāmānyaḥ sarva lokānām yadi eṣaḥ mṛta manthane
translated: If this tree, which arose from the churning of the ocean, belongs to all the worlds,

original: samutpannaḥ surāḥ kasmād eko gṛhṇāti vāsavaḥ // / / //🔽yathā sudhā yathaivendur yathā śrīr vanarakṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: samutpannaḥ surāḥ kasmāt ekaḥ gṛhṇāti vāsavaḥ  yathā sudhā yathā evā induḥ yathā śrīḥ vana rakṣiṇaḥ
translated: why does Vasava alone take it away?

original: sāmānyaḥ sarvalokasya pārijātas tathā drumaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sāmānyaḥ sarva lokasya pārijātaḥ tathā drumaḥ
translated: O forest guards, the Parijata tree is as common to all the worlds as nectar, the moon, and Shri.

original: bhartṛbāhumahāgarvād ruṇaddhy enam atho śacī /🔽tat kathyatām alaṃ kṣāntyā satyā hārayati drumam // / / //
analyzed: bhartṛ bāhu mahā garvāt ruṇaddhi enam atho śacī  tat kathyatām alam kṣāntyā satyā hārayati drumam
translated: If Shachi is dear to her husband and if the husband is obedient to her,🔽then let her take away the tree. But if she is not dear to him,🔽then let her not take away the tree.

original: kathyatāṃ ca drutaṃ gatvā paulomyā vacanaṃ mama /
analyzed: kathyatām ca drutam gatvā paulomyāḥ vacanam mama
translated: Go quickly and tell this to Paulomi,

original: satyabhāmā vadaty etad iti garvoddhatākṣaram // / / //
analyzed: satyabhāmā vadati etat iti garva uddhata akṣaram
translated: the words of Satyabhama, spoken with proud and haughty syllables:

original: yadi tvaṃ dayitā bhartur yadi vaśyaḥ patis tava /
analyzed: yadi tvam dayitā bhartuḥ yadi vaśyaḥ patiḥ tava
translated: If you are dear to your husband and if your husband is obedient to you,

original: madbhartur harato vṛkṣaṃ tat kāraya nivāraṇam // / / //
analyzed: mad bhartuḥ harataḥ vṛkṣam tat kāraya nivāraṇam
translated: Prevent my husband from taking away the Pārijāta tree.

original: jānāmi te patiṃ śakraṃ jānāmi tridaśeśvaram /
analyzed: jānāmi te patim śakram jānāmi tridaśeśvaram
translated: I know your husband is Indra, I know you are the lord of the thirty gods.

original: pārijātaṃ tathāpy enaṃ mānuṣī hārayāmi te // / / //
analyzed: pārijātam tathā api enam mānuṣī hārayāmi te
translated: Nevertheless, as a human woman, I will take away this Pārijāta tree from you.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity uktā rakṣiṇo gatvā śacyā ūcur yathoditam /
analyzed: iti uktāḥ rakṣiṇaḥ gatvā śacyai ūcuḥ yathā uditam
translated: Thus addressed, the guards went and told Shachi what she had said.

original: śacī cotsāhayām āsa tridaśādhipatiṃ patim // / / //🔽tataḥ samastadevānāṃ sainyaiḥ parivṛto harim /
analyzed: śacī ca utsāhayām āsa tridaśa adhipatim patim  tatas samasta devānām sainyaiḥ parivṛtaḥ harim
translated: And Shachi encouraged her husband, the lord of the thirty gods.

original: prayayau pārijātārtham indro yodhayituṃ dvija // / / //🔽tataḥ parighanistriṃśagadāśūlavarāyudhāḥ /
analyzed: prayayau pārijāta artham indraḥ yodhayitum dvija  tatas parigha nistriṃśa gadā śūla vara āyudhāḥ
translated: Then, surrounded by the armies of all the gods, Indra went, O Brahmin, to fight with Hari for the sake of the Pārijāta tree.

original: babhūvus tridaśāḥ sajjāḥ śakre vajrakare sthite // / / //🔽tato nirīkṣya govindo nāgarājopari sthitam /
analyzed: babhūvuḥ tridaśāḥ sajjāḥ śakre vajra kare sthite  tatas nirīkṣya govindaḥ nāga rājā upari sthitam
translated: Then, with the weapons of clubs, swords, maces, spears and excellent weapons, the thirty gods stood ready, with Shakra holding the thunderbolt in his hand.🔽Then Govinda saw Indra, surrounded by the gods, seated on the king of serpents,

original: śakraṃ devaparīvāraṃ yuddhāya samupasthitam // / / //
analyzed: śakram deva parīvāram yuddhāya samupasthitam
translated: present for battle.

original: cakāra śaṅkhanirghoṣaṃ diśaḥ śabdena pūrayan /
analyzed: cakāra śaṅkha nirghoṣam diśaḥ śabdena pūrayan
translated: He blew his conch shell, filling the directions with the sound,

original: mumoca ca śaravrātaṃ sahasrāyutasaṃmitam // / / //
analyzed: mumoca ca śara vrātam sahasra ayuta saṃmitam
translated: and released a flock of arrows numbering in the thousands and tens of thousands.

original: tato diśo nabhaś caiva dṛṣṭvā śaraśatācitam /
analyzed: tatas diśaḥ nabhaḥ ca eva dṛṣṭvā śara śata ācitam
translated: Then, seeing the directions and the sky covered with hundreds of arrows,

original: mumucus tridaśāḥ sarve astraśastrāṇy anekaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mumucuḥ tridaśāḥ sarve astra śastrāṇi anekaśas
translated: all the gods released numerous weapons and missiles.

original: ekaikaṃ śastram astraṃ ca devair muktaṃ sahasradhā /
analyzed: ekaikam śastram astram ca devaiḥ muktam sahasradhā
translated: Each weapon and missile released by the gods was split into a thousand pieces.

original: ciccheda līlayaiveśo jagatāṃ madhusūdanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ciccheda līlayā eva īśaḥ jagatām madhusūdanaḥ
translated: The Lord, the destroyer of Madhu, the Lord of the worlds, playfully cut them down.

original: pāśaṃ salilarājasya samākṛṣyoragāśanaḥ /
analyzed: pāśam salilarājasya samākṛṣya uragāśanaḥ
translated: The serpent-eater, having drawn the noose of the king of the waters,

original: cakāra khaṇḍaśaś cañcvā bālapannagadehavat // / / //🔽yamena prahitaṃ daṇḍaṃ gadāvikṣepakhaṇḍitam /🔽pṛthivyāṃ pātayām āsa bhagavān devakīsutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: cakāra khaṇḍaśas cañcvā bāla pannaga deha vat  yamena prahitam daṇḍam gadā vikṣepa khaṇḍitam  pṛthivyām pātayām āsa bhagavān devakī sutaḥ
translated: cut it into pieces with his beak, like the body of a young serpent.🔽The Lord, the son of Devaki, brought down on the ground the staff sent by Yama, which was shattered by the blow of his club.

original: śibikāṃ ca dhaneśasya cakreṇa tilaśo vibhuḥ /🔽cakāra śaurir arkaṃ ca dṛṣṭidṛṣṭaṃ hataujasam // / / //
analyzed: śibikām ca dhaneśasya cakreṇa tilaśas vibhuḥ  cakāra śauriḥ arkam ca dṛṣṭi dṛṣṭam hata ojasam
translated: The Lord, with his discus, reduced to pieces the palanquin of the lord of wealth,🔽and made the sun, seen by the eyes, lose its splendor.

original: nīto 'gniḥ śataśo bāṇair drāvitā vasavo diśaḥ /
analyzed: nītaḥ gniḥ śataśas bāṇaiḥ drāvitāḥ vasavaḥ diśaḥ
translated: Fire was driven away in a hundred ways by arrows, and the Vasus were scattered in all directions by arrows.

original: cakravicchinnaśūlāgrā rudrā bhuvi nipātitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: cakra vicchinna śūla agrāḥ rudrāḥ bhuvi nipātitāḥ
translated: The Rudras, with the tips of their spears cut off by the discus, were brought down on the ground.

original: sādhyā viśve ca maruto gandharvāś caiva sāyakaiḥ /🔽śārṅgeṇa preritair astā vyomni śālmalitūlavat // / / //
analyzed: sādhyāḥ viśve ca marutaḥ gandharvāḥ ca eva sāyakaiḥ  śārṅgeṇa preritaiḥ astāḥ vyomni śālmali tūla vat
translated: The Sadhyas, the Vishvedevas, the Maruts, and the Gandharvas,🔽were pierced by the arrows shot from the Sharnga bow, and fell in the sky like cotton from a Shalmali tree.

original: garutmān api vaktreṇa pakṣābhyāṃ nakharāṅkuraiḥ /
analyzed: garutmān api vaktreṇa pakṣābhyām nakhara aṅkuraiḥ
translated: Garuda, with his beak, wings, and the tips of his claws,

original: bhakṣayaṃs tāḍayan devān dārayaṃś ca cacāra vai // / / //
analyzed: bhakṣayan tāḍayan devān dārayan ca cacāra vai
translated: Devouring, striking and tearing the gods, he roamed about.

original: tataḥ śarasahasreṇa devendramadhusūdanau /
analyzed: tatas śara sahasreṇa devendra madhusūdanau
translated: Then Indra and Vishnu, with a thousand arrows,

original: parasparaṃ vavarṣāte dhārābhir iva toyadau // / / //
analyzed: parasparam vavarṣāte dhārābhiḥ iva toyadau
translated: showered upon each other like two clouds with torrents of rain.

original: airāvatena garuḍo yuyudhe tatra saṃkule /
analyzed: airāvatena garuḍaḥ yuyudhe tatra saṃkule
translated: Garuda fought with Airavata in that tumultuous battle,

original: devaiḥ samastair yuyudhe śakreṇa ca janārdanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: devaiḥ samastaiḥ yuyudhe śakreṇa ca janārdanaḥ
translated: and Janardana fought with all the gods and Shakra.

original: chinneṣv aśeṣabāṇeṣu śastreṣv astreṣu ca tvaran /
analyzed: chinneṣu aśeṣa bāṇeṣu śastreṣu astreṣu ca tvaran
translated: When all the arrows, weapons and missiles were exhausted,

original: jagrāha vāsavo vajraṃ kṛṣṇaś cakraṃ sudarśanam // / / //
analyzed: jagrāha vāsavaḥ vajram kṛṣṇaḥ cakram sudarśanam
translated: Indra quickly grasped the thunderbolt and Krishna the discus Sudarshana.

original: tato hāhākṛtaṃ sarvaṃ trailokyaṃ dvijasattama /
analyzed: tatas hāhākṛtam sarvam trailokyam dvijasattama
translated: Then, O best of Brahmanas, the three worlds cried out Alas!

original: vajracakradharau dṛṣṭvā devarājajanārdanau // / / //
analyzed: vajra cakra dharau dṛṣṭvā devarāja janārdanau
translated: Seeing Indra and Janardana, the king of the gods, holding the thunderbolt and discus,

original: kṣiptaṃ vajram athendreṇa jagrāha bhagavān hariḥ /
analyzed: kṣiptam vajram atha indreṇa jagrāha bhagavān hariḥ
translated: Indra hurled the thunderbolt, which the Blessed Hari caught.

original: na mumoca tathā cakraṃ śakraṃ tiṣṭheti cābravīt // / / //
analyzed: na mumoca tathā cakram śakram tiṣṭha iti ca abravīt
translated: And he did not release the discus, but said to Shakra, Stay!

original: praṇaṣṭavajraṃ devendraṃ garuḍakṣatavāhanam /
analyzed: praṇaṣṭa vajram devendram garuḍa kṣata vāhanam
translated: Seeing Indra, the king of the gods, with his thunderbolt lost and his vehicle wounded by Garuda,

original: satyabhāmābravīd vīraṃ palāyanaparāyaṇam // / / //
analyzed: satyabhāmā bravīt vīram palāyana parāyaṇam
translated: Satyabhama said to the hero who was intent on fleeing:

original: trailokyeśvara no yuktaṃ śacībhartuḥ palāyanam /
analyzed: trailokya īśvara naḥ yuktam śacī bhartuḥ palāyanam
translated: O lord of the three worlds, it is not proper for the husband of Shachi to flee.

original: pārijātasragābhogā tvām upasthāsyate śacī // / / //🔽kīdṛśaṃ devarājyaṃ te pārijātasragujjvalām /
analyzed: pārijāta sraj ābhogā tvām upasthāsyate śacī  kīdṛśam deva rājyam te pārijāta sraj ujjvalām
translated: Shachi, adorned with the Parijata garland, will serve you.

original: apaśyato yathā pūrvaṃ praṇayābhyāgatāṃ śacīm // / / //
analyzed: a paśyataḥ yathā pūrvam praṇaya abhyāgatām śacīm
translated: What kind of rule over the gods is yours, when you cannot see Shachi, who has come out of love, shining with the Parijata garland, as before?

original: alaṃ śakra prayātena na vrīḍāṃ gantum arhasi /
analyzed: alam śakra prayātena na vrīḍām gantum arhasi
translated: Enough, Shakra! Go away! You should not feel ashamed.

original: nīyatāṃ pārijāto 'yaṃ devāḥ santu gatavyathāḥ // / / //🔽patigarvāvalepena bahumānapuraḥsaram /
analyzed: nīyatām pārijātaḥ yam devāḥ santu gata vyathāḥ  pati garva avalepena bahu māna puraḥsaram
translated: Let this Parijata tree be taken away. Let the gods be free from sorrow.

original: na dadarśa gṛhāyātām upacāreṇa māṃ śacī // / / //
analyzed: na dadarśa gṛha āyātām upacāreṇa mām śacī
translated: Out of pride in her husband and arrogance, she did not receive me with hospitality when I came to her house.

original: strītvād agurucittāhaṃ svabhartṛślāghanāparā /
analyzed: strī tvāt a guru cittā aham sva bhartṛ ślāghanā parā
translated: I am a woman, fickle-minded, and devoted to praising my own husband.

original: tataḥ kṛtavatī śakra bhavatā saha vigraham // / / //
analyzed: tatas kṛtavatī śakra bhavatā saha vigraham
translated: Therefore, Shakra, I have made war with you.

original: tad alaṃ pārijātena parasvena hṛtena naḥ /
analyzed: tat alam pārijātena para svena hṛtena naḥ
translated: Enough of this Parijata tree, which belongs to another.

original: rūpeṇa garvitā sā tu bhartrā strī kā na garvitā // / / //
analyzed: rūpeṇa garvitā sā tu bhartrā strī kā na garvitā
translated: Proud of her beauty, which woman is not proud of her husband?

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity ukto vai nivavṛte devarājas tayā dvija /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ vai nivavṛte devarājaḥ tayā dvija
translated: Thus addressed by her, O twice-born one, the king of the gods turned back.

original: prāha cainām alaṃ caṇḍi sakhi khedātivistaraiḥ // / / //
analyzed: prāha ca enām alam caṇḍi sakhi kheda ati vistaraiḥ
translated: And he said to her, Enough, O angry one! O friend, do not be too much exhausted by these efforts.

original: na cāpi sargasaṃhārasthitikartākhilasya yaḥ /
analyzed: na ca api sarga saṃhāra sthiti kartā akhilasya yaḥ
translated: And he who is the creator, the destroyer, and the preserver of the entire universe,

original: jitasya tena me vrīḍā jāyate viśvarūpiṇā // / / //
analyzed: jitasya tena me vrīḍā jāyate viśva rūpiṇā
translated: I am ashamed of having been conquered by him, who assumes the form of the universe.

original: yasmiñ jagat sakalam etad anādimadhye yasmād yataś ca na bhaviṣyati sarvabhūtāt /
analyzed: yasmin jagat sakalam etat an ādi madhye yasmāt yatas ca na bhaviṣyati sarva bhūtāt
translated: In whom this entire universe exists without beginning, middle, or end, from whom, and to whom it will never be, from whom all beings,

original: tenodbhavapralayapālanakāraṇena vrīḍā kathaṃ bhavati devi nirākṛtasya // / / //
analyzed: tena udbhava pralaya pālana kāraṇena vrīḍā katham bhavati devi nirākṛtasya
translated: By whom is created, destroyed, and protected, O Goddess, how can there be shame for one who has been defeated?

original: sakalabhuvanasūtir mūrtir asyāṇusūkṣmā viditasakalavedyair jñāyate yasya nānyaiḥ /
analyzed: sakala bhuvana sūtiḥ mūrtiḥ asya aṇu sūkṣmā vidita sakala vedyaiḥ jñāyate yasya na anyaiḥ
translated: The creator of the entire world, whose form is extremely subtle, is known only by those who have realized all that is to be known, not by others.

original: tam ajam akṛtam īśaṃ śāśvataṃ svecchayainaṃ jagadupakṛtimartyaṃ ko vijetuṃ samarthaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tam ajam akṛtam īśam śāśvatam sva icchayā enam jagat upakṛti martyam kaḥ vijetum samarthaḥ
translated: Who is able to conquer that unborn, uncreated, eternal Lord, who voluntarily takes birth to do good to the world?

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pañcame 'ṃśe triṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pañcame ṃśe triṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirtieth chapter in the fifth section of the Visnu Purana, describing the defeat of Indra.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: saṃstuto bhagavān itthaṃ devarājena keśavaḥ /
analyzed: saṃstutaḥ bhagavān ittham devarājena keśavaḥ
translated: Thus praised by the king of gods, Lord Keshava,

original: prahasya bhāvagambhīram uvācendraṃ dvijottama // / / //
analyzed: prahasya bhāvagambhīram uvāca indram dvijottama
translated: smiling, spoke to Indra in a grave voice, O best of Brahmanas.

original: bhagavān uvāca /
analyzed: bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Lord said:

original: devarājo bhavān indro vayaṃ martyā jagatpate /
analyzed: devarājaḥ bhavān indraḥ vayam martyāḥ jagatpate
translated: You are Indra, the king of gods, and we are mortals, O lord of the world.

original: kṣantavyaṃ bhavataivaitad aparādhakṛtaṃ mama // / / //
analyzed: kṣantavyam bhavatā eva etat aparādha kṛtam mama
translated: This offense committed by me should be forgiven by you.

original: pārijātataruś cāyaṃ nīyatām ucitāspadam /
analyzed: pārijāta taruḥ ca ayam nīyatām ucita āspadam
translated: And let this Parijata tree be taken to its proper place.

original: gṛhīto 'yaṃ mayā śakra satyāvacanakāraṇāt // / / //
analyzed: gṛhītaḥ yam mayā śakra satyā vacana kāraṇāt
translated: I have taken it up, O Shakra, for the sake of fulfilling my promise.

original: vajraṃ cedaṃ gṛhāṇa tvaṃ yad grastaṃ prahitaṃ tvayā /
analyzed: vajram ca idam gṛhāṇa tvam yat grastam prahitam tvayā
translated: Take back this thunderbolt that you had hurled at me.

original: tavaivaitat praharaṇaṃ śakra vairividāraṇam // / / //
analyzed: tava eva etat praharaṇam śakra vairi vidāraṇam
translated: This weapon, O Shakra, is yours, O slayer of Asuras, for cleaving the enemies.

original: śakra uvāca /
analyzed: śakraḥ uvāca
translated: Shakra said:

original: vimohayasi mām īśa martyo 'ham iti kiṃ vadan /
analyzed: vimohayasi mām īśa martyaḥ ham iti kim vadan
translated: Why do you confound me, O Lord, by saying that I am mortal?

original: jānīmas tvāṃ bhagavato na tu sūkṣmavido vayam // / / //
analyzed: jānīmaḥ tvām bhagavataḥ na tu sūkṣma vidaḥ vayam
translated: We know you to be the Supreme Lord, but we are not able to understand your subtle ways.

original: yo 'si so 'si jagattrāṇapravṛttau nātha saṃsthitaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ si saḥ si jagat trāṇa pravṛttau nātha saṃsthitaḥ
translated: You are He who is engaged in the protection of the world, O Lord, and are established in that work.

original: jagataḥ śalyaniṣkarṣaṃ karoṣy asurasūdana // / / //
analyzed: jagataḥ śalya niṣkarṣam karoṣi asurasūdana
translated: You are the one who removes the thorns of the world, O slayer of Asuras.

original: nīyatāṃ pārijāto 'yaṃ kṛṣṇa dvāravatīṃ purīm /
analyzed: nīyatām pārijātaḥ yam kṛṣṇa dvāravatīm purīm
translated: Let this Parijata tree be taken to the city of Dvaravati, O Krishna.

original: martyaloke tvayā mukte nāyaṃ saṃsthāsyate bhuvi // / / //🔽T / / / /ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: martya loke tvayā mukte na ayam saṃsthāsyate bhuvi  veṅk ins
translated: When you leave it in the mortal world, it will not remain on earth.

original: devadeva jagannātha kṛṣṇa viṣṇo mahābhuja // / / / //
analyzed: devadeva jagannātha kṛṣṇa viṣṇo mahā bhuja
translated: O Lord of gods, O Lord of the universe, O Krishna, O Vishnu, O mighty-armed one,

original: śaṅkhacakragadāpāṇe śārṅgāsidhara mādhava // / / / //
analyzed: śaṅkha cakra gadā pāṇe śārṅga asi dhara mādhava
translated: O wielder of conch, discus, and mace, O holder of the Sharnga bow and sword, O Madhava,

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tathety uktvā ca devendram ājagāma bhuvaṃ hariḥ /
analyzed: tathā iti uktvā ca deva indram ājagāma bhuvam hariḥ
translated: Having said So be it to the Lord of the gods, Hari came to earth.

original: prasaktaiḥ siddhagandharvaiḥ stūyamānaḥ surarṣibhiḥ // / / //🔽ins / after / whereas / ins / after /
analyzed: prasaktaiḥ siddha gandharvaiḥ stūyamānaḥ sura ṛṣibhiḥ  d ins after
translated: Being praised by the attached perfected beings, gandharvas, and celestial sages.🔽.🔽

original: āgamiṣyati deveśa svayam eva triviṣṭapam // / / //
analyzed: āgamiṣyati deveśa svayam eva triviṣṭapam
translated: The Lord of gods will himself come to heaven.

original: tataḥ śaṅkham upādhmāya dvārakopari saṃsthitaḥ /
analyzed: tatas śaṅkham upādhmāya dvārakā upari saṃsthitaḥ
translated: Then, stationed above Dvārakā, he blew his conch shell,

original: harṣam utpādayām āsa dvārakāvāsināṃ dvija // / / //
analyzed: harṣam utpādayām āsa dvārakā vāsinām dvija
translated: and, O Brahmin, he caused delight to the residents of Dvārakā.

original: avatīryātha garuḍāt satyabhāmāsahāyavān /
analyzed: avatīrya atha garuḍāt satyabhāmā sahāyavān
translated: Then, descending from Garuḍa, accompanied by Satyabhāmā,

original: niṣkuṭe sthāpayām āsa pārijātaṃ mahātarum // / / //
analyzed: niṣkuṭe sthāpayām āsa pārijātam mahā tarum
translated: he placed the great tree Pārijāta in the courtyard,

original: yam abhyetya janaḥ sarvo jātiṃ smarati paurvikīm /
analyzed: yam abhyetya janaḥ sarvaḥ jātim smarati paurvikīm
translated: approaching which all people remember their previous birth,

original: vāsyate yasya puṣpotthagandhenorvī triyojanam // / / //🔽tatas te yādavāḥ sarve dehabandhān amānuṣān /
analyzed: vāsyate yasya puṣpa uttha gandhena urvī tri yojanam  tatas te yādavāḥ sarve deha bandhān amānuṣān
translated: and the earth within three yojanas is filled with the fragrance arising from its flowers.🔽Then all those Yādavas saw the superhuman bonds on their bodies,

original: dadṛśuḥ pādape tasmin kurvato mukhadarśanam // / / //
analyzed: dadṛśuḥ pādape tasmin kurvataḥ mukha darśanam
translated: when the tree showed its face.

original: kiṃkaraiḥ samupānītaṃ hastyaśvādi tato dhanam /
analyzed: kiṃkaraiḥ samupānītam hasti aśva ādi tatas dhanam
translated: Then the wealth of elephants, horses, etc. brought by the servants,

original: striyaś ca kṛṣṇo jagrāha narakasya parigrahān // / / //
analyzed: striyaḥ ca kṛṣṇaḥ jagrāha narakasya parigrahān
translated: and the women, Kṛṣṇa accepted as the possessions of Naraka.🔽.

original: ed / ins / after /
analyzed: e t ins after
translated: After.

original: vibhajya pradadau kṛṣṇo bāndhavānāṃ mahāmatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: vibhajya pradadau kṛṣṇaḥ bāndhavānām mahāmatiḥ
translated: The greatly intelligent Kṛṣṇa divided and gave it to his relatives.🔽.

original: tataḥ kāle śubhe prāpte upayeme janārdanaḥ /
analyzed: tatas kāle śubhe prāpte upayeme janārdanaḥ
translated: Then, when an auspicious time arrived, Janardana married them.

original: tāḥ kanyā narakeṇāsan sarvato yāḥ samāhṛtāḥ // / / //🔽ekasminn eva govindaḥ kāle tāsāṃ mahāmune /
analyzed: tāḥ kanyāḥ narakeṇa āsan sarvatas yāḥ samāhṛtāḥ  ekasmin eva govindaḥ kāle tāsām mahā mune
translated: Those maidens who were brought by Naraka from all directions...🔽O great sage, Govinda took the hands of all of them in the same moment,

original: jagrāha vidhivat pāṇīn pṛthaggeheṣu dharmataḥ // / / //
analyzed: jagrāha vidhivat pāṇīn pṛthak geheṣu dharmataḥ
translated: according to the rules of dharma, in separate houses...

original: ṣoḍaśastrīsahasrāṇi śatam ekaṃ tathādhikam /
analyzed: ṣoḍaśa strī sahasrāṇi śatam ekam tathā adhikam
translated: Sixteen thousand and one hundred and one,

original: tāvanti cakre rūpāṇi bhagavān madhusūdanaḥ // / / //🔽ekaikaśyena tāḥ kanyā menire madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: tāvanti cakre rūpāṇi bhagavān madhusūdanaḥ  ekaikaśyena tāḥ kanyāḥ menire madhusūdanaḥ
translated: the illustrious slayer of Madhu assumed as many forms...

original: mamaiva pāṇigrahaṇaṃ bhagavān kṛtavān iti // / / //🔽niśāsu ca jagatsraṣṭā tāsāṃ geheṣu keśavaḥ /
analyzed: mama eva pāṇigrahaṇam bhagavān kṛtavān iti  niśāsu ca jagatsraṣṭā tāsām geheṣu keśavaḥ
translated: Each of those maidens thought, The slayer of Madhu has taken my hand in marriage.🔽And at night, the creator of the universe, Keshava,

original: uvāsa vipra sarvāsāṃ viśvarūpadharo hariḥ // / / //
analyzed: uvāsa vipra sarvāsām viśva rūpa dharaḥ hariḥ
translated: dwelt in the houses of all of them, O Brahmana, Hari assuming a universal form...

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pañcame 'ṃśe ekatriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pañcame ṃśe ekatriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Thirty-first Chapter in the Fifth Book of the Srimad Bhakti-rasamrit-sindhu, composed by Srila Rupa Gosvami.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: pradyumnādyā hareḥ putrā rukmiṇyāḥ kathitās tava /
analyzed: pradyumna ādyāḥ hareḥ putrāḥ rukmiṇyāḥ kathitāḥ tava
translated: I have told you about Pradyumna and other sons of Hari born of Rukmini.

original: bhānuṃ bhaimarikaṃ caiva satyabhāmā vyajāyata // / / //
analyzed: bhānum bhaimarikam ca eva satyabhāmā vyajāyata
translated: Satyabhama gave birth to Bhanu and Bhima.

original: dīptimantaḥ prayakṣādyā rohiṇyās tanayā hareḥ /
analyzed: dīptimantaḥ prayakṣa ādyāḥ rohiṇyāḥ tanayāḥ hareḥ
translated: The radiant Pradyumna and others were the sons of Hari born of Rohini.

original: babhūvur jāmbavatyāṃ ca sāmbādyā bāhuśālinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: babhūvuḥ jāmbavatyām ca sāmba ādyāḥ bāhu śālinaḥ
translated: And the powerful Sāmba and others were born to Jāmbavatī.

original: tanayā bhadravindādyā nāgnajityāṃ mahābalāḥ /
analyzed: tanayāḥ bhadravinda ādyāḥ nāgnajityām mahā balāḥ
translated: The very powerful Bhadravinda and others were the sons of Nāgnajitī.

original: saṃgrāmajitpradhānās tu śaibyāyāś cābhavan sutāḥ // / / //🔽vṛkādyāś ca sutā mādryāṃ gātravatpramukhān sutān /
analyzed: saṃgrāmajit pradhānāḥ tu śaibyāyāḥ ca abhavan sutāḥ  vṛka ādyāḥ ca sutāḥ mādryām gātravat pramukhān sutān
translated: The sons headed by Saṅgrāmajit were born to Śaibyā.🔽The sons headed by Vṛka were born to Mādrī.

original: avāpa lakṣmaṇā putrāḥ kālindyāś ca śrutādayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: avāpa lakṣmaṇā putrāḥ kālindyāḥ ca śruta ādayaḥ
translated: Lakṣmaṇā obtained sons headed by Gātravān, and Śrutadhāmā and others were born to Kālindī.

original: anyāsāṃ caiva bhāryāṇāṃ samutpannāni cakriṇaḥ /
analyzed: anyāsām ca eva bhāryāṇām samutpannāni cakriṇaḥ
translated: And the discus-holder (Kṛṣṇa) had sons born to other wives also.

original: aṣṭāyutāni putrāṇāṃ sahasrāṇāṃ śataṃ tathā // / / //
analyzed: aṣṭa ayutāni putrāṇām sahasrāṇām śatam tathā
translated: He had eight myriads of sons, and a hundred thousand sons.

original: pradyumnaḥ prathamas teṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ rukmiṇīsutaḥ /
analyzed: pradyumnaḥ prathamaḥ teṣām sarveṣām rukmiṇī sutaḥ
translated: Of all of them, Rukmiṇī's son Pradyumna was the first.

original: pradyumnād aniruddho 'bhūd vajras tasmād ajāyata // / / //🔽aniruddho raṇe ruddho baleḥ pautrīṃ mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: pradyumnāt aniruddhaḥ bhūt vajraḥ tasmāt ajāyata  aniruddhaḥ raṇe ruddhaḥ baleḥ pautrīm mahā balaḥ
translated: Aniruddha was born from Pradyumna, and Vajra was born from him.

original: bāṇasya tanayām ūṣām upayeme dvijottama // / / //
analyzed: bāṇasya tanayām ūṣām upayeme dvijottama
translated: The greatly powerful Aniruddha, being obstructed in battle, O best of the twice-born, married Uṣā, the granddaughter of Bala and the daughter of Bāṇa.

original: yatra yuddham abhūd ghoraṃ hariśaṃkarayor mahat /
analyzed: yatra yuddham abhūt ghoram hari śaṃkarayoḥ mahat
translated: Where there was a great and terrible battle between Śiva and Viṣṇu,

original: chinnaṃ sahasraṃ bāhūnāṃ yatra bāṇasya cakriṇā // / / //
analyzed: chinnam sahasram bāhūnām yatra bāṇasya cakriṇā
translated: And where the thousand arms of Bāṇa were cut off by the discus-holder.

original: maitreya uvāca /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca
translated: Maitreya said:

original: kathaṃ yuddham abhūd brahmann uṣārthe harakṛṣṇayoḥ /
analyzed: katham yuddham abhūt brahman uṣā arthe hara kṛṣṇayoḥ
translated: How did the battle take place, O Brahmana, for the sake of Usha between Hari and Krishna?

original: kathaṃ kṣayaṃ ca bāṇasya bāhūnāṃ kṛtavān hariḥ // / / //
analyzed: katham kṣayam ca bāṇasya bāhūnām kṛtavān hariḥ
translated: How did Hari cut off the arms of Vana?

original: etat sarvaṃ mahābhāga mamākhyātuṃ tvam arhasi /
analyzed: etat sarvam mahābhāga mama ākhyātum tvam arhasi
translated: O greatly fortunate one, it behoveth thee to relate all this to me.

original: mahat kautūhalaṃ jātaṃ kathāṃ śrotum imāṃ hareḥ // / / //
analyzed: mahat kautūhalam jātam kathām śrotum imām hareḥ
translated: A great curiosity hath been excited in me to hear this story of Hari.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽uṣā bāṇasutā vipra pārvatīṃ saha śambhunā /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  uṣāḥ bāṇa sutā vipra pārvatīm saha śambhunā
translated: Parashara said:

original: krīḍantīm upalakṣyoccaiḥ spṛhāṃ cakre tadāśrayām // / / //
analyzed: krīḍantīm upalakṣya uccais spṛhām cakre tad āśrayām
translated: O Brahmana, Usha, the daughter of Vana, beholding Parvati sporting with Shambhu, conceived a strong desire to be like her.

original: tataḥ sakalacittajñā gaurī tām āha bhāminīm /
analyzed: tatas sakala citta jñā gaurī tām āha bhāminīm
translated: Then Gauri, the beautiful goddess, who knew all the thoughts of others, said to her:

original: alam atyarthatāpena bhartrā tvam api raṃsyase // / / //
analyzed: alam atyartha tāpena bhartrā tvam api raṃsyase
translated: You will also enjoy with your husband. Do not grieve too much.

original: ityukte sā tadā cakre kadeti matim ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: iti ukte sā tadā cakre kadā iti matim ātmanaḥ
translated: When this was said, she made up her mind as to when (it would happen).

original: ko vā bhartā mamety enāṃ punar apy āha pārvatī // / / //🔽vaiśākhaśukladvādaśyāṃ svapne yo 'bhibhavaṃ tava /
analyzed: kaḥ vā bhartā mama iti enām punar api āha pārvatī  vaiśākha śukla dvādaśyām svapne yaḥ tava
