original: kṛṣṇahuṃkāranirdhūtaśaktiś cāpayayau guhaḥ // / / //🔽ins /
analyzed: kṛṣṇa huṃkāra nirdhūta śaktiḥ ca apayayau guhaḥ  ins
translated: and his Shakti destroyed by Krishna's humkara, went away.

original: pramathānāṃ tataḥ sainyaṃ bāṇavarṣād anīnaśat // / / //🔽jṛmbhite śaṃkare naṣṭe daityasainye guhe jite /
analyzed: pramathānām tatas sainyam bāṇa varṣāt anīnaśat  jṛmbhite śaṃkare naṣṭe daitya sainye guhe jite
translated: Then he destroyed the army of the Pramathas with a shower of arrows.🔽When Shankara yawned and disappeared, when the Daitya army was defeated, when Guha was conquered,

original: nīte pramathasainye ca saṃkṣayaṃ śārṅgadhanvanā // / / //
analyzed: nīte pramatha sainye ca saṃkṣayam śārṅgadhanvanā
translated: when the army of the Pramathas was destroyed by the wielder of the Sharnga bow,

original: nandīśasaṃgṛhītāśvam adhirūḍho mahāratham /
analyzed: nandīśa saṃgṛhīta aśvam adhirūḍhaḥ mahā ratham
translated: he mounted his great chariot, the horses of which were held by Nandishaha.

original: bāṇas tatrāyayau yoddhuṃ kṛṣṇakārṣṇibalaiḥ saha // / / //🔽balabhadro mahāvīryo bāṇasainyam anekadhā /
analyzed: bāṇaḥ tatra āyayau yoddhum kṛṣṇa kārṣṇi balaiḥ saha  balabhadraḥ mahā vīryaḥ bāṇa sainyam anekadhā
translated: Bana came there to fight with the forces of Krishna, Balarama and Pradyumna.

original: vivyādha bāṇaiḥ prabhraśya dharmataś cāpalāyata // / / //
analyzed: vivyādha bāṇaiḥ prabhraśya dharmataḥ ca apalāyata
translated: The greatly powerful Balarama pierced the army of Bana in many ways with arrows and then fled from the battlefield righteously.

original: ākṛṣya lāṅgalāgreṇa musalenāvapothitam /
analyzed: ākṛṣya lāṅgala agreṇa musalena avapothitam
translated: Having dragged it with the tip of his plough, he crushed it with his club.

original: balaṃ balena dadṛśe bāṇo bāṇaiś ca cakriṇā // / / //
analyzed: balam balena dadṛśe bāṇaḥ bāṇaiḥ ca cakriṇā
translated: Bana saw the army being destroyed by Balarama and by the arrows of Krishna.

original: tataḥ kṛṣṇasya bāṇena yuddham āsīt samantataḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas kṛṣṇasya bāṇena yuddham āsīt samantataḥ
translated: Then there was a battle all around between Krishna and Bana.

original: parasparam iṣūn dīptān kāyatrāṇavibhedakān /🔽kṛṣṇaś ciccheda bāṇais tān bāṇena prahitān śarān /🔽bibheda keśavaṃ bāṇo bāṇaṃ vivyādha cakrabhṛt // / / //
analyzed: parasparam iṣūn dīptān kāya trāṇa vibhedakān  kṛṣṇaḥ ciccheda bāṇaiḥ tān bāṇena prahitān śarān  bibheda keśavam bāṇaḥ bāṇam vivyādha cakrabhṛt
translated: They shot at each other blazing arrows that pierced through the body armor.🔽Krishna cut off those arrows shot by Bana with his own arrows.🔽Bana pierced Keshava and the wielder of the discus pierced Bana.

original: mumucāte tathāstrāṇi bāṇakṛṣṇau jigīṣayā /
analyzed: mumucāte tathā astrāṇi bāṇa kṛṣṇau jigīṣayā
translated: Bana and Krishna then released weapons with the desire to conquer each other.

original: parasparaṃ kṣatiparau paramāmarṣiṇau dvija // / / //
analyzed: parasparam kṣati parau parama amarṣiṇau dvija
translated: They were greatly enraged and intent on harming each other, O Brahmin.

original: chidyamāneṣv aśeṣeṣu śareṣv astre ca sīdati /
analyzed: chidyamāneṣu aśeṣeṣu śareṣu astre ca sīdati
translated: When all the arrows were cut off and the weapons failed,

original: prācuryeṇa harir bāṇaṃ hantuṃ cakre tato manaḥ // / / //
analyzed: prācuryeṇa hariḥ bāṇam hantum cakre tatas manaḥ
translated: Hari then made up his mind to kill Bana.

original: tato 'rkaśatasaṃghātatejasaḥ sadṛśadyutiḥ /
analyzed: tatas rka śata saṃghāta tejasaḥ sadṛśa dyutiḥ
translated: Then, with a radiance like that of a hundred suns,

original: jagrāha daityacakrārir hariś cakraṃ sudarśanam // / / //
analyzed: jagrāha daitya cakra ariḥ hariḥ cakram sudarśanam
translated: And Hari, the enemy of the circle of demons, took up the discus Sudarshana.

original: muñcato bāṇanāśāya tac cakraṃ madhuvidviṣaḥ /
analyzed: muñcataḥ bāṇa nāśāya tat cakram madhuvidviṣaḥ
translated: And that discus of the enemy of Madhu, as he released it to destroy the arrows,

original: nagnā daiteyavidyābhūt koṭavī purato hareḥ // / / //🔽tām agrato harir dṛṣṭvā mīlitākṣaḥ sudarśanam /
analyzed: nagnā daiteya vidyā abhūt koṭavī puratas hareḥ  tām agratas hariḥ dṛṣṭvā mīlita akṣaḥ sudarśanam
translated: The demoness Vidya became naked in front of Hari.🔽Seeing her in front, Hari, with eyes closed,

original: mumoca bāṇam uddiśya chettuṃ bāhuvanaṃ ripoḥ // / / //🔽krameṇa tat tu bāhūnāṃ bāṇasyācyutacoditam /
analyzed: mumoca bāṇam uddiśya chettum bāhu vanam ripoḥ  krameṇa tat tu bāhūnām bāṇasya acyuta coditam
translated: Released Sudarshana aiming at the arrow to cut off the forest of arms of the enemy.🔽But that discus, urged by Achyuta, in due course,

original: chedaṃ cakre 'surāpāstaśastraughakṣapaṇādṛtam // / / //
analyzed: chedam cakre sura apāsta śastra ogha kṣapaṇa ādṛtam
translated: Cut off the arms of Bana, revered for destroying the multitude of weapons of the demons.

original: chinne bāhuvane tat tu karasthaṃ madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: chinne bāhu vane tat tu kara stham madhusūdanaḥ
translated: When the forest of arms was cut off, Madhusudana, with the discus in his hand,

original: mumukṣur bāṇanāśāya vijñātas tripuradviṣā // / / //🔽sa upetyāha govindaṃ sāmapūrvam umāpatiḥ /
analyzed: mumukṣuḥ bāṇa nāśāya vijñātaḥ tripuradviṣā  saḥ upetya āha govindam sāma pūrvam umāpatiḥ
translated: Desiring to release it for the destruction of Bana, was recognized by the enemy of Tripura.🔽Approaching Govinda, the lord of Uma, after seeing Bana, who was raining blood from the severed arms,

original: vilokya bāṇaṃ dordaṇḍacchedāsṛksrāvavarṣiṇam // / / //
analyzed: vilokya bāṇam dordaṇḍa cheda asṛk srāva varṣiṇam
translated: spoke to him with conciliation.

original: śaṃkara uvāca /
analyzed: śaṃkaraḥ uvāca
translated: Shankara said:

original: kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa jagannātha jāne tvāṃ puruṣottamam /
analyzed: kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa jagannātha jāne tvām puruṣottamam
translated: Krishna, Krishna, lord of the world, I know you as the best of men,

original: pareśaṃ paramātmānam anādinidhanaṃ param // / / //
analyzed: para īśam parama ātmānam an ādi nidhanam param
translated: The supreme lord, the supreme soul, the beginningless and endless supreme one.

original: devatiryaṅmanuṣyeṣu śarīragrahaṇātmikā /
analyzed: deva tiryak manuṣyeṣu śarīra grahaṇa ātmikā
translated: In gods, animals, and humans, the soul takes up bodies.

original: līleyaṃ sarvabhūtasya tava ceṣṭopalakṣaṇā // / / //
analyzed: līlā iyam sarva bhūtasya tava ceṣṭā upalakṣaṇā
translated: This sport of yours is the indication of the activity of the Supreme Being.

original: tat prasīdābhayaṃ dattaṃ bāṇasyāsya mayā prabho /
analyzed: tat prasīda abhayam dattam bāṇasya asya mayā prabho
translated: O Lord, I have granted safety to this Bāṇa.

original: tat tvayā nānṛtaṃ kāryaṃ yan mayā vyāhṛtaṃ vacaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat tvayā na anṛtam kāryam yat mayā vyāhṛtam vacaḥ
translated: Therefore, you should not make false the words spoken by me.

original: asmatsaṃśrayavṛddho 'yaṃ nāparādhyas tavāvyaya /
analyzed: asmad saṃśraya vṛddhaḥ yam na aparādhyaḥ tava avyaya
translated: This one, who has grown by resorting to us, should not offend you, O Imperishable One.

original: mayā dattavaro daityas tatas tvāṃ kṣamayāmy aham // / / //
analyzed: mayā datta varaḥ daityaḥ tatas tvām kṣamayāmi aham
translated: The demon has been granted a boon by me, therefore I forgive you.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽ity uktaḥ prāha govindaḥ śūlapāṇim umāpatim /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  iti uktaḥ prāha govindaḥ śūlapāṇim umāpatim
translated: Parashara said:🔽Thus addressed, Govinda, with a cheerful face, his anger gone against the demon,

original: prasannavadano bhūtvā gatāmarṣo 'suraṃ prati // / / //
analyzed: prasanna vadanaḥ bhūtvā gata amarṣaḥ suram prati
translated: spoke to the trident-wielding lord of Uma.

original: bhagavān uvāca /
analyzed: bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Lord said:

original: yuṣmaddattavaro bāṇo jīvatām eṣa śaṃkara /
analyzed: yuṣmad datta varaḥ bāṇaḥ jīvatām eṣa śaṃkara
translated: O Shankara, let this Bāṇa, granted a boon by you, live.

original: tvadvākyagauravād etan mayā cakraṃ nivartitam // / / //
analyzed: tvad vākya gauravāt etat mayā cakram nivartitam
translated: Out of respect for your words, I have withdrawn this discus.

original: tvayā yad abhayaṃ dattaṃ tad dattam akhilaṃ mayā /
analyzed: tvayā yat abhayam dattam tat dattam akhilam mayā
translated: Whatever safety has been granted by you, all that has been granted by me.

original: matto 'vibhinnam ātmānaṃ draṣṭum arhasi śaṃkara // / / //
analyzed: mattaḥ vibhinnam ātmānam draṣṭum arhasi śaṃkara
translated: O Shankara, you should see your own self as inseparable from me.

original: yo 'haṃ sa tvaṃ jagac cedaṃ sadevāsuramānuṣam // / / //🔽ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: yaḥ ham sa tvam jagat ca idam sa deva asura mānuṣam 🔽veṅk ins
translated: I am you, and this world with gods, demons and humans.

original: matto nānyad aśeṣaṃ yat tat tvaṃ jñātum ihārhasi // / / //
analyzed: mattaḥ nā anyat aśeṣam yat tat tvam jñātum iha arhasi
translated: You should know that there is nothing else apart from me.

original: avidyāmohitātmānaḥ puruṣā bhinnadarśinaḥ // / / //🔽ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: avidyā mohita ātmānaḥ puruṣāḥ bhinna darśinaḥ  veṅk ins
translated: Men whose minds are deluded by ignorance, who see differences,

original: vadanti bhedaṃ paśyanti cāvayor antaraṃ hara // / / / //
analyzed: vadanti bhedam paśyanti ca āvayoḥ antaram hara
translated: say and see a difference between us, O Hara.

original: prasanno 'haṃ gamiṣyāmi tvaṃ gaccha vṛṣabhadhvaja // / / / //
analyzed: prasannaḥ ham gamiṣyāmi tvam gaccha vṛṣabhadhvaja
translated: I am pleased. I will go. You go, O bull-bannered one.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity uktvā prayayau kṛṣṇaḥ prādyumnir yatra tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: iti uktvā prayayau kṛṣṇaḥ prādyumniḥ yatra tiṣṭhati
translated: Having said this, Krishna went to where Pradyumna's son was.

original: tadbandhaphaṇino neśur garuḍānilaśoṣitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tad bandha phaṇinaḥ neśuḥ garuḍa anila śoṣitāḥ
translated: The serpents that bound him were destroyed by Garuda's wind.

original: tato 'niruddham āropya sapatnīkaṃ garutmati /
analyzed: tatas niruddham āropya sa patnīkam garutmati
translated: Then, placing Aniruddha and his wife on Garuda,

original: ājagmur dvārakāṃ rāmakārṣṇidāmodarāḥ purīm // / / //🔽ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: ājagmuḥ dvārakām rāma kārṣṇi dāmodarāḥ purīm  veṅk ins
translated: Rama, Krishna and Dāmodara went to the city of Dvārakā.

original: putrapautraiḥ parivṛtas tatra reme janārdanaḥ // / / / //
analyzed: putra pautraiḥ parivṛtaḥ tatra reme janārdanaḥ
translated: Surrounded by sons and grandsons, Janārdana enjoyed there.

original: devībhiḥ satataṃ vipra bhūbhārataraṇecchayā // / / / //
analyzed: devībhiḥ satatam vipra bhū bhāra taraṇa icchayā
translated: O Brahmin, always with the goddesses, with the desire to relieve the burden of the earth.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pañcame 'ṃśe trayastriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pañcame ṃśe trayastriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirty-third chapter in the fifth section of the Vishnu Purana, composed by the great sage Parashara.

original: maitreya uvāca /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca
translated: Maitreya said:

original: cakre karma mahac chaurir bibhrāṇo mānuṣīṃ tanum /
analyzed: cakre karma mahat śauriḥ bibhrāṇaḥ mānuṣīm tanum
translated: Shouri performed great deeds while assuming a human form.

original: jigāya śakraṃ śarvaṃ ca sarvān devāṃś ca līlayā // / / //
analyzed: jigāya śakram śarvam ca sarvān devān ca līlayā
translated: And playfully defeated Shakra, Shiva, and all the gods.

original: yac cānyad akarot karma divyaceṣṭāvidhānakṛt /
analyzed: yat ca anyat akarot karma divya ceṣṭā vidhāna kṛt
translated: And whatever other deeds he performed, the creator of divine conduct,

original: tat kathyatāṃ mahābhāga paraṃ kautūhalaṃ hi me // / / //
analyzed: tat kathyatām mahābhāga param kautūhalam hi me
translated: Tell that, O illustrious one, for I have great curiosity.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: gadato mama viprarṣe śrūyatām idam ādarāt /
analyzed: gadataḥ mama viprarṣe śrūyatām idam ādarāt
translated: O Brahmin sage, listen attentively to this from me as I speak.

original: narāvatāre kṛṣṇena dagdhā vārāṇasī yathā // / / //
analyzed: nara avatāre kṛṣṇena dagdhā vārāṇasī yathā
translated: How Krishna, in his human incarnation, burnt down Varanasi.

original: pauṇḍrako vāsudevas tu vāsudevo 'bhavad bhuvi /
analyzed: pauṇḍrakaḥ vāsudevaḥ tu vāsudevaḥ bhavat bhuvi
translated: Pundrakavashudeva became Vashudeva on earth.

original: avatīrṇas tvam ity ukto janair ajñānamohitaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: avatīrṇaḥ tvam iti uktaḥ janaiḥ ajñāna mohitaiḥ
translated: He was told by people deluded by ignorance that you had descended.

original: sa mene vāsudevo 'ham avatīrṇo mahītale /
analyzed: sa mene vāsudevaḥ ham avatīrṇaḥ mahī tale
translated: He thought, I am Vashudeva, descended on earth.

original: naṣṭasmṛtis tataḥ sarvaṃ viṣṇucihnam acīkarat // / / //
analyzed: naṣṭa smṛtiḥ tatas sarvam viṣṇu cihnam acīkarat
translated: Then, his memory lost, he made everything a mark of Vishnu.

original: dūtaṃ ca preṣayām āsa kṛṣṇāya sumahātmane /
analyzed: dūtam ca preṣayām āsa kṛṣṇāya su mahātmane
translated: And he sent a messenger to the very great-souled Krishna,

original: tyaktvā cakrādikaṃ cihnaṃ madīyaṃ nāma cātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tyaktvā cakra ādikam cihnam madīyam nāma ca ātmanaḥ
translated: Abandoning my mark like a discus and my name,

original: vāsudevātmakaṃ mūḍha muktvā garvaṃ viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: vāsudeva ātmakam mūḍha muktvā garvam viśeṣataḥ
translated: O deluded one, give up your pride especially in Vasudeva.

original: ātmano jīvitārthāya tato me praṇatiṃ vraja // / / //
analyzed: ātmanaḥ jīvita arthāya tatas me praṇatim vraja
translated: Then, for the sake of your own life, go to me for homage.

original: ity uktaḥ saṃprahasyainaṃ dūtaṃ prāha janārdanaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ saṃprahasya enam dūtam prāha janārdanaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, Janardana laughed and said to the messenger:

original: nijacihnam ahaṃ cakraṃ samutsrakṣye tvayīti vai // / / //
analyzed: nija cihnam aham cakram samutsrakṣye tvayi iti vai
translated: I will cast off my own mark, the discus, on you.

original: vācyaś ca pauṇḍrako gatvā tvayā dūta vaco mama /
analyzed: vācyaḥ ca pauṇḍrakaḥ gatvā tvayā dūta vacaḥ mama
translated: And, O messenger, you should go and tell Paundraka these words of mine:

original: jñātas tvadvākyasadbhāvo yat kāryaṃ tad vidhīyatām // / / //
analyzed: jñātaḥ tvad vākya sadbhāvaḥ yat kāryam tat vidhīyatām
translated: Knowing the truth of your words, do what is to be done.

original: gṛhītacihna evāham āgamiṣyāmi te puram /
analyzed: gṛhīta cihnaḥ eva aham āgamiṣyāmi te puram
translated: Having accepted the mark, I will come to your city.

original: samutsrakṣyāmi te cakraṃ nijacihnam asaṃśayam // / / //
analyzed: samutsrakṣyāmi te cakram nija cihnam asaṃśayam
translated: I will undoubtedly cast off my own mark, the discus, on you.

original: ājñāpūrvaṃ ca yad idam āgaccheti tvayoditam /
analyzed: ājñā pūrvam ca yat idam āgaccha iti tvayā uditam
translated: And as for your command that I should come,

original: saṃpādayiṣye śvas tubhyaṃ tad apy eṣo 'vilambitam // / / //🔽śaraṇaṃ te samabhyetya kartāsmi nṛpate tathā /
analyzed: saṃpādayiṣye śvas tubhyam tat api eṣaḥ vilambitam  śaraṇam te samabhyetya kartāsmi nṛpate tathā
translated: I will accomplish that for you tomorrow without delay.🔽Having come to your protection, O king, I will do as you say.

original: yathā tvatto bhayaṃ bhūyo na me kiṃcid bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: yathā tvattaḥ bhayam bhūyas na me kiṃcid bhaviṣyati
translated: So that I may not have any fear from you again.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity ukte 'pagate dūte saṃsmṛtyābhyāgataṃ hariḥ /
analyzed: iti ukte dūte saṃsmṛtya abhyāgatam hariḥ
translated: When this was said, and the messenger departed, Hari remembered Garutman who had come.

original: garutmantam athāruhya tvaritaṃ tatpuraṃ yayau // / / //
analyzed: garutmantam athā āruhya tvaritam tat puram yayau
translated: Then, riding on Garutman, he quickly went to that city.

original: tasyāpi keśavodyogaṃ śrutvā kāśipatis tadā /
analyzed: tasya api keśava udyogam śrutvā kāśi patiḥ tadā
translated: Having heard of Keshava's preparations, the lord of Kashi then

original: sarvasainyaparīvāraḥ pārṣṇigrāha upāyayau // / / //
analyzed: sarva sainya parīvāraḥ pārṣṇigrāhaḥ upāyayau
translated: came as an ally, surrounded by all his armies.

original: tato balena mahatā kāśirājabalena ca /
analyzed: tatas balena mahatā kāśi rāja balena ca
translated: Then with a great army and the army of the king of Kashi,

original: pauṇḍrako vāsudevo 'sau keśavābhimukhaṃ yayau // / / //
analyzed: pauṇḍrakaḥ keśava abhimukham yayau
translated: That Paundrakas Vasudeva went towards Keshava.

original: taṃ dadarśa harir dūrād udārasyandane sthitam /🔽cakrahastaṃ gadākhaḍgabāhuṃ pāṇigatāmbujam // / / //
analyzed: tam dadarśa hariḥ dūrāt udāra syandane sthitam  cakra hastam gadā khaḍga bāhum pāṇi gata ambujam
translated: Hari saw him from a distance, standing in a magnificent chariot,🔽With a discus in his hand, a mace and a sword in his arms, and a lotus in his hand,

original: sragdharaṃ dhṛtaśārṅgaṃ ca suparṇaracitadhvajam /
analyzed: sraj dharam dhṛta śārṅgam ca suparṇa racita dhvajam
translated: Wearing a garland, holding a Sharnga bow, with Suparna as his flag,

original: vakṣaḥsthale kṛtaṃ cāsya śrīvatsaṃ dadṛśe hariḥ // / / //
analyzed: vakṣaḥ sthale kṛtam ca asya śrīvatsam dadṛśe hariḥ
translated: And Hari saw the Shrivatsa mark on his chest.

original: kirīṭakuṇḍaladharaṃ pītavāsaḥsamanvitam /
analyzed: kirīṭa kuṇḍala dharam pīta vāsaḥ samanvitam
translated: Wearing a crown and earrings, and clad in yellow garments,

original: dṛṣṭvā taṃ bhāvagambhīraṃ jahāsa garuḍadhvajaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tam bhāvagambhīram jahāsa garuḍadhvajaḥ
translated: Seeing him deeply absorbed in meditation, the Garudabandha (Garuda-bannered one) laughed.

original: yuyudhe ca balenāsya hastyaśvabalinā dvija /🔽nistriṃśarṣṭigadāśūlaśaktikārmukaśālinā // / / //
analyzed: yuyudhe ca balena asya hasti aśva balinā dvija  nistriṃśa ṛṣṭi gadā śūla śakti kārmuka śālinā
translated: And he fought with his army, O twice-born one, which was strong with elephants and horses,🔽Which was full of scimitars, swords, maces, lances, spears and bows.

original: kṣaṇena śārṅganirmuktaiḥ śarair arividāraṇaiḥ /
analyzed: kṣaṇena śārṅga nirmuktaiḥ śaraiḥ ari vidāraṇaiḥ
translated: In a moment, with arrows released from the Sharnga bow, which tore the enemies,

original: gadācakranipātaiś ca sūdayām āsa tadbalam // / / //
analyzed: gadā cakra nipātaiḥ ca sūdayām āsa tat balam
translated: And with the fall of the mace and discus, he destroyed that army.

original: kāśirājabalaṃ caiva kṣayaṃ nītvā janārdanaḥ /
analyzed: kāśi rāja balam ca eva kṣayam nītvā janārdanaḥ
translated: Having reduced the army of the king of Kashi, Janardana

original: uvāca pauṇḍrakaṃ mūḍham ātmacihnopalakṣaṇam // / / //
analyzed: uvāca pauṇḍrakam mūḍham ātma cihna upalakṣaṇam
translated: Spoke to the deluded Paundrakas, who was marked with his own signs.

original: bhagavān uvāca /
analyzed: bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Lord said:

original: pauṇḍrakoktaṃ tvayā yat tu dūtavaktreṇa māṃ prati /
analyzed: pauṇḍraka uktam tvayā yat tu dūta vaktreṇa mām prati
translated: As for what you said to me through the messenger's mouth, O Paundraka,🔽

original: samutsṛjeti cihnāni tat te saṃpādayāmy aham // / / //🔽cakram etat samutsṛṣṭaṃ gadeyaṃ te visarjitā /
analyzed: samutsṛja iti cihnāni tat te saṃpādayāmi aham  cakram etat samutsṛṣṭam gadā iyam te visarjitā
translated: The message which you have sent to me through the mouth of your messenger, viz., that I should give up my symbols, I shall now accomplish.🔽This discus has been hurled by me. This mace has been discharged by me.

original: garutmān eṣa nirdiṣṭaḥ samārohatu te dhvajam // / / //
analyzed: garutmān eṣa nirdiṣṭaḥ samārohatu te dhvajam
translated: This Garuda has been pointed out by me. Let him ascend your banner.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity uccārya vimuktena cakreṇāsau vidāritaḥ /
analyzed: iti uccārya vimuktena cakreṇa asau vidāritaḥ
translated: Having said this, he was torn apart by the discus that was released.

original: pothito gadayā bhagno garutmāṃś ca garutmatā // / / //
analyzed: pothitaḥ gadayā bhagnaḥ garutmān ca garutmatā
translated: He was crushed by the mace and broken, and Garuda was struck down by Garuda.

original: tato hāhākṛte loke kāśīnām adhipo balī /
analyzed: tatas hāhākṛte loke kāśīnām adhipaḥ balī
translated: Then, in a world filled with cries of Alas! the powerful lord of Kashi,

original: yuyudhe vāsudevena mitrasyāpacitau sthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yuyudhe vāsudevena mitrasya apacitau sthitaḥ
translated: standing in the destruction of his friend, fought with Vasudeva.

original: tataḥ śārṅgadhanurmuktaiś chittvā tasya śaraiḥ śiraḥ /
analyzed: tatas śārṅga dhanuḥ muktaiḥ chittvā tasya śaraiḥ śiraḥ
translated: Then, having cut off his head with arrows released from the Sharnga bow,

original: kāśipuryāṃ sa cikṣepa kurvaṃl lokasya vismayam // / / //
analyzed: kāśi puryām sa cikṣepa kurvan lokasya vismayam
translated: he threw it into the city of Kashi, causing wonder among the people.

original: hatvā ca pauṇḍrakaṃ śauriḥ kāśirājaṃ ca sānugam /
analyzed: hatvā ca pauṇḍrakam śauriḥ kāśi rājam ca sa anugam
translated: Having killed Pundrakas and the king of Kashi along with his followers,

original: punar dvāravatīṃ prāpto reme svargagato yathā // / / //
analyzed: punar dvāravatīm prāptaḥ reme svarga gataḥ yathā
translated: Shouri again reached Dvaravati and enjoyed himself like one in heaven.

original: tacchiraḥ patitaṃ dṛṣṭvā tatra kāśipateḥ pure /
analyzed: tat śiraḥ patitam dṛṣṭvā tatra kāśi pateḥ pure
translated: Having seen the head of the lord of Kashi fall in his city,

original: janaḥ kim etad ity āha kenety atyantavismitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: janaḥ kim etat iti āha kena iti atyanta vismitaḥ
translated: The people, greatly astonished, asked one another, What is this?

original: jñātvā taṃ vāsudevena hataṃ tasya sutas tataḥ /🔽purohitena sahitas toṣayām āsa śaṃkaram // / / //
analyzed: jñātvā tam vāsudevena hatam tasya sutaḥ tatas  purohitena sahitaḥ toṣayām āsa śaṃkaram
translated: Knowing that he had been killed by Vasudeva, his son🔽Then, together with the priest, propitiated Shankara.

original: avimukte mahākṣetre toṣitas tena śaṃkaraḥ /🔽varaṃ vṛṇīṣveti tadā taṃ provāca nṛpātmajam // / / //
analyzed: avimukte mahā kṣetre toṣitaḥ tena śaṃkaraḥ  varam vṛṇīṣva iti tadā tam provāca nṛpa ātmajam
translated: In the great holy place of Avimukta, Shankara was pleased by him.🔽He said to the prince, Choose a boon.

original: sa vavre bhagavan kṛtyā pitṛhantur vadhāya me /
analyzed: sa vavre bhagavan kṛtyā pitṛ hantuḥ vadhāya me
translated: He chose, O Lord, may a Krittika (female deity) arise for the destruction of the slayer of my father.

original: samuttiṣṭhatu kṛṣṇasya tvatprasādān maheśvara // / / //
analyzed: samuttiṣṭhatu kṛṣṇasya tvad prasādāt maheśvara
translated: By your grace, O Maheshvara, may it arise against Krishna.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: evaṃ bhaviṣyatīty ukte dakṣiṇāgner anantaram /
analyzed: evam bhaviṣyati iti ukte dakṣiṇāgneḥ anantaram
translated: When it was said, It will be so, immediately after the southern fire,

original: mahākṛtyā samuttasthau tasyaivāgniniveśanāt // / / //
analyzed: mahā kṛtyā samuttasthau tasya eva agni niveśanāt
translated: A great Krittika arose from that very fire-chamber.

original: tato jvālākarālāsyā jvalatkeśakalāpikā /
analyzed: tatas jvālā karāla āsyā jvalat keśa kalāpikā
translated: Then, with a face terrible with flames, with blazing hair and tresses,

original: kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇeti kupitā kṛtyā dvāravatīṃ yayau // / / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa iti kupitā kṛtyā dvāravatīm yayau
translated: The Krittika, angry, saying Krishna, Krishna, went to Dvaravati.

original: tām avekṣya janas trāsavicalallocano mune /
analyzed: tām avekṣya janaḥ trāsa vicalat locanaḥ mune
translated: Seeing her, the people, O sage, with eyes trembling in fear,

original: yayau śaraṇyaṃ jagatāṃ śaraṇaṃ madhusūdanam // / / //
analyzed: yayau śaraṇyam jagatām śaraṇam madhusūdanam
translated: Went for refuge to Madhusudana, the protector of the worlds.

original: kāśirājasuteneyam ārādhya vṛṣabhadhvajam /
analyzed: kāśi rāja sutena iyam ārādhya vṛṣabhadhvajam
translated: This (Krittika) was propitiated by the son of the king of Kashi, the bull-bannered one.

original: utpāditā mahākṛtyety avagamyātha cakriṇā // / / //
analyzed: utpāditā mahā kṛtyā iti avagamya atha cakriṇā
translated: Having understood that the great task had been accomplished, the discus-bearer (Vishnu)

original: jahi kṛtyām imām ugrāṃ vahnijvālājaṭākulām /
analyzed: jahi kṛtyām imām ugrām vahni jvālā jaṭā ākulām
translated: Destroy this fierce Kṛtyā, enveloped in the matted locks of fire-flames.

original: cakram utsṛṣṭam akṣeṣu krīḍāsaktena līlayā // / / //🔽tadagnimālājaṭilajvālodgārātibhīṣaṇām /
analyzed: cakram utsṛṣṭam akṣeṣu krīḍā saktena līlayā  tad agni mālā jaṭila jvālā udgāra ati bhīṣaṇām
translated: The discus released in the dice, playfully attached to the game,

original: kṛtyām anujagāmāśu viṣṇucakraṃ sudarśanam // / / //
analyzed: kṛtyām anujagāma āśu viṣṇu cakram sudarśanam
translated: The Sudarśana discus of Vishnu quickly followed the Kṛtyā, which was extremely terrifying due to the flames and clusters of fire-garlands.

original: cakrapratāpavidhvastā kṛtyā māheśvarī tadā /
analyzed: cakra pratāpa vidhvastā kṛtyā māheśvarī tadā
translated: The Kṛtyā of Maheśvara, destroyed by the heat of the discus,

original: nanāśa veginī vegāt tad apy anujagāma tām // / / //🔽kṛtyā vārāṇasīm eva praviveśa tvarānvitā /
analyzed: nanāśa veginī vegāt tat api anujagāma tām  kṛtyā vārāṇasīm eva praviveśa tvarā anvitā
translated: Quickly disappeared, and the discus followed it.🔽The Kṛtyā quickly entered Vārāṇasī,

original: viṣṇucakrapratihataprabhāvā munisattama // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇu cakra pratihata prabhāvā muni sattama
translated: O best of sages, its power obstructed by the discus of Vishnu.

original: tataḥ kāśibalaṃ bhūri pramathānāṃ tathā balam /
analyzed: tatas kāśi balam bhūri pramathānām tathā balam
translated: Then the great army of Kāśī and the army of Pramathas,

original: samastaśastrāstrayutaṃ cakrasyābhimukhaṃ yayau // / / //
analyzed: samasta śastra astra yutam cakrasya abhimukham yayau
translated: Equipped with all weapons and missiles, went towards the discus.

original: śastrāstramokṣacaturaṃ dagdhvā tad balam ojasā /
analyzed: śastra astra mokṣa caturam dagdhvā tat balam ojasā
translated: Having consumed that army with its brilliance, skilled in releasing weapons and missiles,

original: kṛtyāgarbhām aśeṣāṃ tāṃ tadā vārāṇasīṃ purīm // / / //
analyzed: kṛtyā garbhām aśeṣām tām tadā vārāṇasīm purīm
translated: Then the entire city of Vārāṇasī, along with the Kṛtyā within it,

original: sabhūbhṛdbhṛtyapaurāṃ tu sāśvamātaṅgamānavām /
analyzed: sa bhūbhṛt bhṛtya paurām tu sa aśva mātaṅga mānavām
translated: Along with the kings, servants, citizens, horses, elephants, and men,

original: aśeṣakośakoṣṭhāṃ tāṃ durnirīkṣyāṃ surair api // / / //
analyzed: aśeṣa kośa koṣṭhām tām durnirīkṣyām suraiḥ api
translated: And all its treasuries and granaries, which were difficult to be seen even by the gods,

original: jvālāpariṣkṛtāśeṣagṛhaprākāracatvarām /
analyzed: jvālā pariṣkṛta aśeṣa gṛha prākāra catvarām
translated: With all its houses, ramparts, and squares surrounded by flames,

original: dadāha tad dhareś cakraṃ sakalām eva tāṃ purīm // / / //
analyzed: dadāha tat hareḥ cakram sakalām eva tām purīm
translated: The discus of Hari burned down that entire city.

original: akṣīṇāmarṣam atyalpasādhyasādhanasaspṛham /
analyzed: akṣīṇa amarṣam ati alpa sādhya sādhana sa spṛham
translated: With unabated wrath, and with little desire for the means of accomplishing the insignificant task,

original: tac cakraṃ prasphuraddīpti viṣṇor abhyāyayau karam // / / //
analyzed: tat cakram prasphurat dīpti viṣṇoḥ abhyāyayau karam
translated: That discus, with its brilliance shining forth, returned to the hand of Vishnu.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pañcame 'ṃśe catustriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pañcame ṃśe catustriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirty-fourth chapter in the fifth section of the Vishnu Purana, dealing with the destruction of the Yadavas.

original: maitreya uvāca /🔽bhūya evāham icchāmi balabhadrasya dhīmataḥ /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca  bhūyas eva aham icchāmi balabhadrasya dhīmataḥ
translated: Maitreya said:

original: śrotuṃ parākramaṃ brahman tan mamākhyātum arhasi // / / //🔽yamunākarṣaṇādīni śrutāni bhagavan mayā /
analyzed: śrotum parākramam brahman tat mama ākhyātum arhasi  yamunā ākarṣaṇa ādīni śrutāni bhagavat mayā
translated: I wish to hear again about the prowess of the wise Balarama, O Brahman. It behooves you to relate that to me.🔽O holy one, I have heard about the dragging of the Yamuna and other deeds.

original: tat kathyatāṃ mahābhāga yad anyat kṛtavān balaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tat kathyatām mahābhāga yat anyat kṛtavān balaḥ
translated: O blessed one, tell me what else Bala did.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: maitreya śrūyatāṃ karma yad rāmeṇābhavat kṛtam /
analyzed: maitreya śrūyatām karma yat rāmeṇa abhavat kṛtam
translated: Listen, Maitreya, to the deed that was done by Rama,

original: anantenāprameyena śeṣeṇa dharaṇībhṛtā // / / //
analyzed: anantena aprameyena śeṣeṇa dharaṇībhṛtā
translated: By the infinite, immeasurable, and supporting Sesha, the bearer of the earth.

original: duryodhanasya tanayāṃ svayaṃvarakṛtakṣaṇām /
analyzed: duryodhanasya tanayām svayaṃvara kṛta kṣaṇām
translated: The daughter of Duryodhana, whose time for svayamvara was set,

original: balād ādattavān vīraḥ sāmbo jāmbavatīsutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: balāt ādattavān vīraḥ sāmbaḥ jāmbavatī sutaḥ
translated: forcibly took it away. The hero Sāmba, the son of Jāmbavatī,

original: tataḥ kruddhā mahāvīryāḥ karṇaduryodhanādayaḥ /
analyzed: tatas kruddhāḥ mahā vīryāḥ karṇa duryodhana ādayaḥ
translated: Then the greatly powerful Karṇa, Duryodhana and others got angry.

original: bhīṣmadroṇādayaś cainaṃ babandhur yudhi nirjitam // / / //
analyzed: bhīṣma droṇa ādayaḥ ca enam babandhuḥ yudhi nirjitam
translated: Bhīṣma, Droṇa and others defeated him in battle and bound him.

original: tac chrutvā yādavāḥ sarve krodhaṃ duryodhanādiṣu /
analyzed: tat śrutvā yādavāḥ sarve krodham duryodhana ādiṣu
translated: Hearing that, all the Yādavas became angry with Duryodhana and others,

original: maitreya cakruś cakruś ca tān nihantuṃ mahodyamam // / / //
analyzed: maitreya cakruḥ cakruḥ ca tān nihantum mahā udyamam
translated: and O Maitreya, they made great efforts to kill them.

original: tān nivārya balaḥ prāha madalolakalākṣaram /
analyzed: tān nivārya balaḥ prāha mada lola kala akṣaram
translated: Then Bala stopped them and spoke to them with words slurred by intoxication,

original: mokṣyanti te madvacanād yāsyāmy eko hi kauravān // / / //
analyzed: mokṣyanti te mad vacanāt yāsyāmi ekaḥ hi kauravān
translated: They will be released at my word. I will go alone to the Kauravas.

original: baladevas tato gatvā nagaraṃ nāgasāhvayam /
analyzed: baladevaḥ tatas gatvā nagaram nāgasāhvayam
translated: Then Balarāma went to the city called after the elephant,

original: bāhyopavanamadhye 'bhūn na viveśa ca tat puram // / / //
analyzed: bāhya upavana madhye na viveśa ca tat puram
translated: and remained in the middle of the outer garden, but did not enter that city.

original: balam āgatam ājñāya bhūpā duryodhanādayaḥ /
analyzed: balam āgatam ājñāya bhūpāḥ duryodhana ādayaḥ
translated: The kings Duryodhana and others, knowing that Bala had come,

original: gām arghyam udakaṃ caiva rāmāya pratyavedayan // / / //
analyzed: gām arghyam udakam ca eva rāmāya pratyavedayan
translated: offered the cow, the gift, and the water to Rāma.

original: gṛhītvā vidhivat sarvaṃ tatas tān āha kauravān /
analyzed: gṛhītvā vidhivat sarvam tatas tān āha kauravān
translated: Accepting all that according to the rules, he then said to the Kauravas,

original: ājñāpayaty ugrasenaḥ sāmbam āśu vimuñcata // / / //
analyzed: ājñāpayati ugrasenaḥ sāmbam āśu vimuñcata
translated: Ugrasena commands that Sāmba be released immediately.

original: tatas te tadvacaḥ śrutvā bhīṣmadroṇādayo dvija /
analyzed: tatas te tad vacaḥ śrutvā bhīṣma droṇa ādayaḥ dvija
translated: Then, O brāhmaṇa, Bhīṣma, Droṇa and others, hearing those words,

original: karṇaduryodhanādyāś ca cukrudhur dvijasattama // / / //
analyzed: karṇa duryodhana ādyāḥ ca cukrudhuḥ dvijasattama
translated: Karna, Duryodhana and others became angry, O best of Brahmanas.

original: ūcuś ca kupitāḥ sarve bāhlikādyāś ca kauravāḥ /
analyzed: ūcuḥ ca kupitāḥ sarve bāhlika ādyāḥ ca kauravāḥ
translated: And all the Kouravas headed by Bahlika, being enraged, said:

original: arājyārhaṃ yador vaṃśam avekṣya musalāyudham // / / //
analyzed: a rājya arham yadoḥ vaṃśam avekṣya musalāyudham
translated: Seeing the Yadava dynasty, which does not deserve a kingdom, with the mace-wielding one at the head,

original: bho bhoḥ kim etad bhavatā balabhadreritaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: bho bhoḥ kim etat bhavatā balabhadra īritam vacaḥ
translated: What is this that has been said by you, O Baladeva?

original: ājñāṃ kurukulotthānāṃ yādavaḥ kaḥ pradāsyati // / / //
analyzed: ājñām kuru kula utthānām yādavaḥ kaḥ pradāsyati
translated: What Yadava can give orders to the descendants of the Kuru dynasty?

original: ugraseno 'pi yady ājñāṃ kauravāṇāṃ pradāsyati /
analyzed: ugrasenaḥ pi yadi ājñām kauravāṇām pradāsyati
translated: If Ugrasena also gives orders to the Kouravas,

original: tad alaṃ pāṇḍuraiś chatrair nṛpayogyair viḍambitaiḥ // / / //🔽tad gaccha bala mā vā tvaṃ sāmbam anyāyaceṣṭitam /
analyzed: tat alam pāṇḍuraiḥ chatraiḥ nṛpa yogyaiḥ viḍambitaiḥ  tat gaccha bala mā vā tvam sāmbam anyāya ceṣṭitam
translated: then let there be an end to the white umbrellas, which are fit for kings and are a mockery.🔽Therefore, O Baladeva, go or do not go, but we will not release your son Samba, who has acted improperly.

original: vimokṣyāmo na bhavato nograsenasya śāsanāt // / / //🔽praṇatir yā kṛtāsmākaṃ mānyānāṃ kukurāndhakaiḥ /
analyzed: vimokṣyāmaḥ na bhavataḥ na ugrasenasya śāsanāt  praṇatiḥ yā kṛtā asmākam mānyānām kukura andhakaiḥ
translated: Not by your command, nor by Ugrasena's command.🔽That homage which was paid to us, the venerable Kukuras and Andhakas,

original: nanāma sā kṛtā keyam ājñā svāmini bhṛtyataḥ // / / //
analyzed: nanāma sā kṛtā kā iyam ājñā svāmini bhṛtyataḥ
translated: what is this homage that is being done by a servant to his master?

original: garvam āropitā yūyaṃ samānāsanabhojanaiḥ /
analyzed: garvam āropitāḥ yūyam samāna āsana bhojanaiḥ
translated: You have been elevated with pride by being given equal seats and food.

original: ko doṣo bhavatāṃ nītir yat prītyā nāvalokitā // / / //
analyzed: kaḥ doṣaḥ bhavatām nītiḥ yat prītyā nā avalokitā
translated: What is the fault in your policy that you do not look upon us with affection?

original: asmābhir argho bhavato yo 'yaṃ bala niveditaḥ /
analyzed: asmābhiḥ arghaḥ bhavataḥ yaḥ yam bala niveditaḥ
translated: This homage that has been offered to you by us, O Baladeva,

original: premṇaitan naitad asmākaṃ kulād yuṣmatkulocitam // / / //
analyzed: premṇā etat na etat asmākam kulāt yuṣmad kula ucitam
translated: This is not proper for our family, which is descended from you.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity uktvā kuravaḥ sarve na muñcāmo hareḥ sutam /🔽kṛtaikaniścayās tūrṇaṃ viviśur gajasāhvayam // / / //🔽mattaḥ kopena cāghūrṇas tato 'dhikṣepajanmanā /
analyzed: iti uktvā kuravaḥ sarve na muñcāmaḥ hareḥ sutam  kṛta eka niścayāḥ tūrṇam viviśuḥ gajasāhvayam  mattaḥ kopena ca āghūrṇaḥ tatas dhi kṣepa janmanā
translated: Having said this, all the Kurus did not release Hari's son.🔽Firm in their resolve, they quickly entered Hastinapura.

analyzed: cakruḥ tatra mudā pānam vāsudeva anumoditāḥ

original: pibatāṃ tatra vai teṣāṃ saṃgharṣeṇa parasparam /
analyzed: pibatām tatra vai teṣām saṃgharṣeṇa parasparam
translated: As they drank there, a mutual friction arose among them,

original: ativādendhano jajñe kalahāgniḥ kṣayāvahaḥ // / / //🔽l / / / only / / / / / ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: ativāda indhanaḥ jajñe kalaha agniḥ kṣaya āvahaḥ  ro ins
translated: and the fire of quarrel, fueled by harsh words, arose, leading to destruction.

original: maitreyaḥ /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ
translated: Maitreya:

original: svaṃ svaṃ tu bhujyatāṃ teṣāṃ kalaho nirnimittayāḥ // / / / //
analyzed: svam svam tu bhujyatām teṣām kalahaḥ nirnimittayāḥ
translated: But let each enjoy his own, their quarrel is over something meaningless.

original: saṃgharṣo vā dvijaśreṣṭha tan mamākhyātum arhasi // / / / //
analyzed: saṃgharṣaḥ vā dvijaśreṣṭha tat mama ākhyātum arhasi
translated: Or, O best of Brahmins, was there a mutual friction? You should tell me.

original: śrīparāśaraḥ /
analyzed: śrī parāśaraḥ
translated: Shripadmanabh:

original: mṛṣṭaṃ madīyam annaṃ te na mṛṣṭam iti bhāṣatām // / / / //🔽mṛṣṭāmṛṣṭakathā jajñe saṃgharṣakalahau tadā // / / / //
analyzed: mṛṣṭam madīyam annam te na mṛṣṭam iti bhāṣatām  mṛṣṭa amṛṣṭa kathā jajñe saṃgharṣa kalahau tadā
translated: Saying Your food is delicious, mine is not,🔽the talk of delicious and not delicious arose, and then the friction and quarrel.

original: tataś cānyonyam abhyetya krodhasaṃraktalocanāḥ // / / / //
analyzed: tatas ca anyonyam abhyetya krodha saṃrakta locanāḥ
translated: Then, approaching each other with eyes red with anger,

original: jaghnuḥ parasparaṃ te tu śastrair daivabalātkṛtāḥ /
analyzed: jaghnuḥ parasparam te tu śastraiḥ daiva balātkṛtāḥ
translated: they struck each other with weapons, impelled by divine power.

original: kṣīṇaśastrāś ca jagṛhuḥ pratyāsannām athairakām // / / //
analyzed: kṣīṇa śastrāḥ ca jagṛhuḥ pratyāsannām atha erakām
translated: And when their weapons were exhausted, they seized nearby bamboo canes.

original: erakā tu gṛhītā tair vajrabhūteva lakṣyate /
analyzed: erakā tu gṛhītā taiḥ vajra bhūtā iva lakṣyate
translated: But the bamboo cane, seized by them, appeared as if turned into a thunderbolt.

original: tayā parasparaṃ jaghnuḥ saṃprahāre sudāruṇe // / / //
analyzed: tayā parasparam jaghnuḥ saṃprahāre su dāruṇe
translated: With that, they struck each other in the extremely terrible battle.

original: pradyumnasāmbapramukhāḥ kṛtavarmātha sātyakiḥ /
analyzed: pradyumna sāmba pramukhāḥ kṛtavarmā atha sātyakiḥ
translated: Pradyumna, Samba and others, Kritavarma and Satyaki,

original: aniruddhādayaś cānye pṛthur vipṛthur eva ca // / / //
analyzed: aniruddha ādayaḥ ca anye pṛthuḥ vipṛthuḥ eva ca
translated: Aniruddha and others, and also Prithu and Viprithu,

original: cāruvarmā cārukaś ca tathākrūrādayo dvija /
analyzed: cāruvarmā cārukaḥ ca tathā akrūra ādayaḥ dvija
translated: and Charuvakra and Charuka, and also the Yadavas headed by Kansa, O twice-born one,

original: erakārūpibhir vajrais te nijaghnuḥ parasparam // / / //
analyzed: erakā rūpibhiḥ vajraiḥ te nijaghnuḥ parasparam
translated: they struck each other with maces in the form of blades of grass.

original: nivārayām āsa harir yādavāṃs te ca keśavam /
analyzed: nivārayām āsa hariḥ yādavān te ca keśavam
translated: Hari restrained the Yadavas, and they also Keshava,

original: sahāyaṃ menire prāptaṃ te nijaghnuḥ parasparam // / / //🔽kṛṣṇo 'pi kupitas teṣām erakāmuṣṭim ādade /
analyzed: sahāyam menire prāptam te nijaghnuḥ parasparam  kṛṣṇaḥ u pi kupitaḥ teṣām erakā muṣṭim ādade
translated: considering him to be an ally, they struck each other.🔽Krishna also, being angry, took up a handful of eraka grass,

original: vadhāya so 'pi musalaṃ muṣṭir loham abhūt tadā // / / //🔽jaghāna tena niḥśeṣān yādavān ātatāyinaḥ /
analyzed: vadhāya saḥ pi musalam muṣṭiḥ loham abhūt tadā  jaghāna tena niḥśeṣān yādavān ātatāyinaḥ
translated: for their destruction, that handful became an iron mace.🔽With that he killed all the Yadavas who were bent on violence.

original: jaghnuś ca sahasābhyetya tathānye vai parasparam // / / //
analyzed: jaghnuḥ ca sahasā abhyetya tathā anye vai parasparam
translated: And others also suddenly attacked and killed each other.

original: tataś cārṇavamadhyena jaitro 'sau cakriṇo rathaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca arṇava madhyena jaitraḥ sau cakriṇaḥ rathaḥ
translated: Then that victorious chariot of the discus-holder, in the middle of the ocean,

original: paśyato dārukasyāśu hṛto 'śvair dvijasattama // / / //
analyzed: paśyataḥ dārukasya āśu śvaiḥ dvijasattama
translated: was quickly carried away by the horses, while Daruka was watching, O best of Brahmanas.

original: cakraṃ tathā gadā śārṅgatūṇī śaṅkho 'sir eva ca /
analyzed: cakram tathā gadā śārṅga tūṇī śaṅkhaḥ siḥ eva ca
translated: The discus, the club, the Sharnga bow, the conch, and the sword,

original: pradakṣiṇaṃ hariṃ kṛtvā jagmur ādityavartmanā // / / //
analyzed: pradakṣiṇam harim kṛtvā jagmuḥ āditya vartmanā
translated: having circumambulated Hari, went along the path of the sun.

original: kṣaṇena nābhavat kaścid yādavānām aghātitaḥ /
analyzed: kṣaṇena nā bhavat kaścid yādavānām a ghātitaḥ
translated: In a moment, no one of the Yadavas was left unstruck.

original: ṛte kṛṣṇaṃ mahābāhuṃ dārukaṃ ca mahāmune // / / //
analyzed: ṛte kṛṣṇam mahā bāhum dārukam ca mahā mune
translated: Excepting the mighty-armed Krishna and Daruka, O great sage.

original: caṅkramyamāṇau tau rāmaṃ vṛkṣamūle kṛtāsanam /🔽dadṛśāte mukhāc cāsya niṣkrāmantaṃ mahoragam // / / //
analyzed: caṅkramyamāṇau tau rāmam vṛkṣa mūle kṛta āsanam  dadṛśāte mukhāt ca asya niṣkrāmantam mahā uragam
translated: As they were wandering, they saw Rama seated at the foot of a tree,🔽and a great serpent coming out of his mouth.

original: niṣkramya sa mukhāt tasya mahābhogo bhujaṃgamaḥ /
analyzed: niṣkramya sa mukhāt tasya mahā bhogaḥ bhujaṃgamaḥ
translated: Having come out of his mouth, that great serpent of large coils,

original: prayayāv arṇavaṃ siddhaiḥ pūjyamānas tathoragaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: prayayau arṇavam siddhaiḥ pūjyamānaḥ tathā uragaiḥ
translated: went to the ocean, being worshipped by the Siddhas and the serpents.

original: tato 'rgham ādāya tadā jaladhiḥ saṃmukhaṃ yayau /
analyzed: tatas rgham ādāya tadā jaladhiḥ saṃmukham yayau
translated: Then the ocean, taking the Arghya, came face to face,

original: praviveśa ca tattoyaṃ pūjitaḥ pannagottamaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: praviveśa ca tat toyam pūjitaḥ pannaga uttamaiḥ
translated: and entered the water, being worshipped by the best of serpents.

original: dṛṣṭvā balasya niryāṇaṃ dārukaṃ prāha keśavaḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā balasya niryāṇam dārukam prāha keśavaḥ
translated: Seeing the departure of Bala, Keshava said to Daruka,

original: idaṃ sarvaṃ tvam ācakṣva vasudevograsenayoḥ // / / //
analyzed: idam sarvam tvam ācakṣva vasudeva ugrasenayoḥ
translated: Tell all this to Vasudeva and Ugrasena,

original: niryāṇaṃ balabhadrasya yādavānāṃ tathā kṣayam /
analyzed: niryāṇam balabhadrasya yādavānām tathā kṣayam
translated: the departure of Balabhadra and the destruction of the Yadavas.

original: yoge sthitvāham apy etat parityakṣye kalevaram // / / //
analyzed: yoge sthitvā aham api etat parityakṣye kalevaram
translated: Having attained Yoga, I will also abandon this body.

original: vācyaś ca dvārakāvāsī janaḥ sarvas tathāhukaḥ /
analyzed: vācyaḥ ca dvārakā vāsī janaḥ sarvaḥ tathā āhukaḥ
translated: And let all the people living in Dvaraka and Ahuka be told,

original: yathemāṃ nagarīṃ sarvāṃ samudraḥ plāvayiṣyati // / / //
analyzed: yathā imām nagarīm sarvām samudraḥ plāvayiṣyati
translated: how the ocean will inundate this entire city.

original: tasmād bhavadbhiḥ sajjais tu pratīkṣyo hy arjunāgamaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt bhavadbhiḥ sajjaiḥ tu pratīkṣyaḥ hi arjuna āgamaḥ
translated: Therefore, you should all wait for the return of Arjuna.

original: na stheyaṃ dvārakāmadhye niṣkrānte tatra pāṇḍave // / / //
analyzed: na stheyam dvārakā madhye niṣkrānte tatra pāṇḍave
translated: When the Pandava has left, you should not stay in Dvaraka.

original: tenaiva saha gantavyaṃ yatra yāti sa kauravaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tena eva saha gantavyam yatra yāti sa kauravaḥ
translated: You should go wherever that Kourava goes.

original: gatvā ca brūhi kaunteyam arjunaṃ vacanān mama /
analyzed: gatvā ca brūhi kaunteyam arjunam vacanāt mama
translated: Having gone there, tell the son of Kunti, Arjuna, these words of mine:

original: pālanīyas tvayā śaktyā jano 'yaṃ matparigrahaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pālanīyaḥ tvayā śaktyā janaḥ yam mad parigrahaḥ
translated: This people who are under my protection should be protected by you to the best of your ability.

original: ity arjunena sahito dvāravatyā bhavāñ janam /
analyzed: iti arjunena sahitaḥ dvāravatyā bhavām janam
translated: Thus, O king, you should go from Dvaraka with Arjuna,

original: gṛhītvā yātu vajraś ca yadurājo bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: gṛhītvā yātu vajraḥ ca yadu rājaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: taking the people with you, and Vajra will become the king of the Yadus.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity ukto dārukaḥ kṛṣṇaṃ praṇipatya punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ dārukaḥ kṛṣṇam praṇipatya punar punar
translated: Thus addressed, Daruka repeatedly bowed down to Krishna,

original: pradakṣiṇaṃ ca bahuśaḥ kṛtvā prāyād yathoditam // / / //
analyzed: pradakṣiṇam ca bahuśas kṛtvā prāyāt yathā uditam
translated: circumambulated him many times, and left as instructed.

original: sa gatvā ca tathā cakre dvārakāyāṃ tathārjunam /
analyzed: sa gatvā ca tathā cakre dvārakāyām tathā arjunam
translated: Having gone there, he did as he was told, and brought Arjuna to Dvaraka,

original: ānināya mahābuddhir vajraṃ cakre tathā nṛpam // / / //🔽bhagavān api govindo vāsudevātmakaṃ param /
analyzed: ānināya mahā buddhiḥ vajram cakre tathā nṛpam  bhagavān api govindaḥ vāsudeva ātmakam param
translated: and the greatly wise one made Vajra the king.🔽The Lord Govinda, having merged the supreme form of Vasudeva into the Self,

original: brahmātmani samāropya sarvabhūteṣv adhārayat // / / //
analyzed: brahma ātmani samāropya sarva bhūteṣu adhārayat
translated: supported it in all beings.

original: After / / / /
analyzed: after
translated: After this,

original: ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: e t veṅk ins
translated: (The following is inserted:)🔽(The Lord Govinda, having merged the supreme form of Vasudeva into the Self, supported it in all beings.)

original: niṣprapañce mahābhāga saṃyojyātmānam ātmani // / / / //
analyzed: niṣprapañce mahābhāga saṃyojya ātmānam ātmani
translated: O greatly fortunate one, having merged his self in his own self, which is free from conceptual elaboration,

original: turyāvasthasalīlaṃ ca śete sma puruṣottamaḥ // / / / //
analyzed: turya avasthā sa līlam ca śete sma puruṣottamaḥ
translated: the Supreme Person lay down in the fourth state, playfully...

original: saṃmānayan dvijavaco durvāsā yad uvāca ha /
analyzed: saṃmānayan dvija vacaḥ durvāsāḥ yat uvāca ha
translated: Honoring the words of the twice-born, as spoken by Durvasa,

original: yogayukto 'bhavat pādaṃ kṛtvā jānuni sattama // / / //
analyzed: yoga yuktaḥ bhavat pādam kṛtvā jānuni sattama
translated: the best of men, O best of the twice-born, became absorbed in yoga, placing one foot on his knee...

original: āyayau ca jarā nāma sa tadā tatra lubdhakaḥ /
analyzed: āyayau ca jarā nāma sa tadā tatra lubdhakaḥ
translated: Then a hunter named Jara came there,

original: musalāvaśeṣalohaikasāyakanyastatomaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: musala avaśeṣa loha eka sāyaka nyasta tomaraḥ
translated: with a spear fixed on a single iron arrow, the rest of which was a club...

original: sa tatpādaṃ mṛgākāram avekṣyārād avasthitaḥ /
analyzed: sa tad pādam mṛga ākāram avekṣya ārāt avasthitaḥ
translated: He saw that foot, shaped like a deer, and stood at a distance.

original: tale vivyādha tenaiva tomareṇa dvijottama // / / //
analyzed: tale vivyādha tena eva tomareṇa dvijottama
translated: With that very spear, he pierced the sole, O best of the twice-born...

original: gataś ca dadṛśe tatra caturbāhudharaṃ naram /
analyzed: gataḥ ca dadṛśe tatra catur bāhu dharam naram
translated: And he went there and saw a man with four arms.

original: praṇipatyāha caivainaṃ prasīdeti punaḥ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: praṇipatya āha ca eva enam prasīda iti punar punar
translated: And he repeatedly said to him, Be pleased, and prostrated himself...

original: ajānatā kṛtam idaṃ mayā hariṇaśaṅkayā /
analyzed: a jānatā kṛtam idam mayā hariṇa śaṅkayā
translated: This was done by me out of ignorance, suspecting it to be a deer.

original: kṣamyatāṃ nātmapāpena dagdhaṃ māṃ dagdhum arhasi // / / //
analyzed: kṣamyatām na ātma pāpena dagdham mām dagdhum arhasi
translated: May it be forgiven. It is not proper for you to burn me, who am already burnt by my own sin.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tatas taṃ bhagavān āha na te 'sti bhayam aṇv api /
analyzed: tatas tam bhagavān āha na te sti bhayam aṇu api
translated: Then the Blessed Lord said to him, You have not the slightest fear.

original: gaccha tvaṃ matprasādena lubdha svargaṃ surāspadam // / / //
analyzed: gaccha tvam mad prasādena lubdha svargam sura āspadam
translated: Go, O hunter, to heaven, the abode of the gods, by my grace.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: vimānam āgataṃ sadyas tadvākyasamanantaram /
analyzed: vimānam āgatam sadyas tad vākya samanantaram
translated: Immediately after his words, an aerial car arrived.

original: āruhya prayayau svargaṃ lubdhakas tatprasādataḥ // / / //
analyzed: āruhya prayayau svargam lubdhakaḥ tad prasādataḥ
translated: The hunter, by his grace, ascended it and went to heaven.

original: gate tasmin sa bhagavān saṃyojyātmānam ātmani /
analyzed: gate tasmin sa bhagavān saṃyojya ātmānam ātmani
translated: When he had departed, the Blessed Lord, having united his Self with the Self,

original: brahmabhūte 'vyaye 'cintye vāsudevamaye 'male // / / //
analyzed: brahma bhūte vyaye cintye vāsudeva maye male
translated: in the imperishable, inconceivable, Vāsudeva-essence, the pure Brahman,

original: ajanmany ajare 'nāśiny aprameye 'khilātmani /
analyzed: a janmani ajare nāśini aprameye khila ātmani
translated: in the unborn, undecaying, imperishable, immeasurable, all-pervading Self,

original: tatyāja mānuṣaṃ deham atītya trividhāṃ gatim // / / //
analyzed: tatyāja mānuṣam deham atītya trividhām gatim
translated: abandoned the human body, transcending the three states of existence.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pañcame 'ṃśe saptatriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pañcame ṃśe saptatriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirty-seventh chapter in the fifth section of the Vishnu Purana, dealing with the death of Krishna.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽arjuno 'pi tadānviṣya kṛṣṇarāmakalevare /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  arjunaḥ pi tadā anviṣya kṛṣṇa rāma kalevare
translated: Parashara said:

original: saṃskāraṃ lambhayām āsa tathānyeṣām anukramāt // / / //
analyzed: saṃskāram lambhayām āsa tathā anyeṣām anukramāt
translated: Arjuna also, having searched for them, caused the funeral rites to be performed for the bodies of Krishna and Rama,🔽and then for the others in due order.

original: aṣṭau mahiṣyaḥ kathitā rukmiṇīpramukhās tu yāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭau mahiṣyaḥ kathitāḥ rukmiṇī pramukhāḥ tu yāḥ
translated: The eight chief queens headed by Rukmini,

original: upaguhya harer dehaṃ viviśus tā hutāśanam // / / //
analyzed: upaguhya hareḥ deham viviśuḥ tāḥ hutāśanam
translated: having embraced the body of Hari, entered the funeral fire.

original: revatī caiva rāmasya deham āśliṣya sattama /
analyzed: revatī ca eva rāmasya deham āśliṣya sattama
translated: And Revati, O best of men, having embraced the body of Rama,

original: viveśa jvalitaṃ vahniṃ tatsaṅgāhlādaśītalam // / / //
analyzed: viveśa jvalitam vahnim tad saṅga āhlāda śītalam
translated: And entered the blazing fire, which was cool due to the delight of his touch.

original: ugrasenas tu tac chrutvā tathaivānakadundubhiḥ /
analyzed: ugrasenaḥ tu tat śrutvā tathā evā ānakadundubhiḥ
translated: But Ugrasena, Anākadundubhi,

original: devakī rohiṇī caiva viviśur jātavedasam // / / //
analyzed: devakī rohiṇī ca eva viviśuḥ jātavedasam
translated: Devakī, and Rohiṇī entered the fire.

original: tato 'rjunaḥ pretakāryaṃ kṛtvā teṣāṃ yathāvidhi /
analyzed: tatas rjunaḥ pretakāryam kṛtvā teṣām yathāvidhi
translated: Then Arjuna, having performed their funeral rites according to the rules,

original: niścakrāma janaṃ sarvaṃ gṛhītvā vajram eva ca // / / //
analyzed: niścakrāma janam sarvam gṛhītvā vajram eva ca
translated: Went out, taking all the people and Vajra with him.

original: dvāravatyā viniṣkrāntāḥ kṛṣṇapatnyaḥ sahasraśaḥ /
analyzed: dvāravatyāḥ viniṣkrāntāḥ kṛṣṇa patnyaḥ sahasraśas
translated: Thousands of Kṛṣṇa's wives left Dvārakā,

original: vajraṃ janaṃ ca kaunteyaḥ pālayañ chanakair yayau // / / //
analyzed: vajram janam ca kaunteyaḥ pālayam śanakais yayau
translated: And Kounteya, protecting Vajra and the people, went slowly.

original: sabhā sudharmā kṛṣṇena martyaloke samujjhite /
analyzed: sabhā sudharmā kṛṣṇena martya loke samujjhite
translated: When Kṛṣṇa abandoned the mortal world, the Sudharmā assembly

original: svargaṃ jagāma maitreya pārijātaś ca pādapaḥ // / / //
analyzed: svargam jagāma maitreya pārijātaḥ ca pādapaḥ
translated: Went to heaven, O Maitreya, and the Pārijāta tree also.

original: yasmin dine harir yāto divaṃ saṃtyajya medinīm /
analyzed: yasmin dine hariḥ yātaḥ divam saṃtyajya medinīm
translated: On the very day when Hari left heaven and abandoned the earth,

original: tasminn evāvatīrṇo 'yaṃ kālakāyo balī kaliḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasmin eva avatīrṇaḥ yam kāla kāyaḥ balī kaliḥ
translated: On that very day, this powerful Kali, the embodiment of time, descended.

original: plāvayām āsa tāṃ śūnyāṃ dvārakāṃ ca mahodadhiḥ /
analyzed: plāvayām āsa tām śūnyām dvārakām ca mahā udadhiḥ
translated: The great ocean flooded that empty Dvārakā,

original: yadudevagṛhaṃ tv ekaṃ nāplāvayata sāgaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: yadu deva gṛham tu ekam na aplāvayata sāgaraḥ
translated: But the ocean did not flood the temple of the Yadus.

original: nātikrāntum alaṃ brahmaṃs tad adyāpi mahodadhiḥ /
analyzed: na atikrāntum alam brahman tat adya api mahā udadhiḥ
translated: O Brāhmaṇa, even today the great ocean is unable to cross it.

original: nityaṃ saṃnihitas tatra bhagavān keśavo yataḥ // / / //
analyzed: nityam saṃnihitaḥ tatra bhagavān keśavaḥ yatas
translated: Because Lord Keshava is always present there.

original: tad atīva mahāpuṇyaṃ sarvapātakanāśanam /
analyzed: tat atīva mahā puṇyam sarva pātaka nāśanam
translated: That place is extremely meritorious and destroys all sins.

original: viṣṇukrīḍānvitaṃ sthānaṃ dṛṣṭvā pāpāt pramucyate // / / //🔽pārthaḥ pañcanade deśe bahudhānyasamanvite /
analyzed: viṣṇu krīḍā anvitam sthānam dṛṣṭvā pāpāt pramucyate  pārthaḥ pañcanade deśe bahu dhānya samanvite
translated: By seeing the place filled with Vishnu's sports, one is freed from sins.

original: cakāra vāsaṃ sarvasya janasya munisattama // / / //🔽tato lobhaḥ samabhavat pārthenaikena dhanvinā /
analyzed: cakāra vāsam sarvasya janasya muni sattama  tatas lobhaḥ samabhavat pārthena ekena dhanvinā
translated: O best of sages, Partha made arrangements for the residence of all the people in the country of Panchala, which was full of abundant grain.

original: dṛṣṭvā striyo nīyamānā dasyūnāṃ nihateśvarāḥ // / / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā striyaḥ nīyamānāḥ dasyūnām nihata īśvarāḥ
translated: Then, seeing the wives of the slain Dasha kings being taken away by Partha, the single archer, greed arose in them.

original: tatas te pāpakarmāṇo lobhopahatacetasaḥ /
analyzed: tatas te pāpa karmāṇaḥ lobha upahata cetasaḥ
translated: Then those sinful ones, their minds overwhelmed by greed,

original: ābhīrā mantrayām āsuḥ sametyātyantadurmadāḥ // / / //🔽ayam eko 'rjuno dhanvī strījanaṃ nihateśvaram /
analyzed: ābhīrāḥ mantrayām āsuḥ sametya atyanta durmadāḥ  ayam ekaḥ rjunaḥ dhanvī strī janam nihata īśvaram
translated: the Abhira robbers, extremely insolent, assembled and consulted together.

original: nayaty asmān atikramya dhig etad bhavatāṃ balam // / / //🔽hatvā garvaṃ samārūḍho bhīṣmadroṇajayadrathān /
analyzed: nayati asmān atikramya dhik etat bhavatām balam  hatvā garvam samārūḍhaḥ bhīṣma droṇa jayadrathān
translated: This single archer Arjuna is taking away the wives of the slain kings, disregarding us. Shame on your strength!

original: karṇādīṃś ca na jānāti balaṃ grāmanivāsinām // / / //
analyzed: karṇa ādīn ca na jānāti balam grāma nivāsinām
translated: Having killed Bhishma, Drona, Jayadratha, Karna and others, he has become arrogant and does not know the strength of the village dwellers.

original: he he yaṣṭīr mahāyāmā gṛhṇītāyaṃ sudurmatiḥ /
analyzed: he he yaṣṭīḥ mahā āyāmāḥ gṛhṇīta ayam su durmatiḥ
translated: Hey, hey, take up your long sticks, this extremely wicked one is taking away the wives of the slain kings.

original: sarvān evāvajānāti kiṃ vo bāhubhir unnataiḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarvān eva avajānāti kim vaḥ bāhubhiḥ unnataiḥ
translated: Despises all of you. What is the use of your uplifted arms?

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽tato yaṣṭipraharaṇā dasyavo loptrahāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  tatas yaṣṭi praharaṇāḥ dasyavaḥ loptra hāriṇaḥ
translated: Parashara said:🔽Then thousands of robbers armed with sticks and thieves,

original: sahasraśo 'bhyadhāvanta taṃ janaṃ nihateśvaram // / / //
analyzed: sahasraśas bhyadhāvanta tam janam nihata īśvaram
translated: rushed towards that people whose lord was killed.

original: tato nivṛtya kaunteyaḥ prāhābhīrān hasann iva /
analyzed: tatas nivṛtya kaunteyaḥ prāha ābhīrān hasan iva
translated: Then the son of Kunti, turning back, spoke to the cowherds as if laughing:

original: nivartadhvam adharmajñā yadi na stha mumūrṣavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: nivartadhvam a dharma jñāḥ yadi na stha mumūrṣavaḥ
translated: Turn back, O knowers of adharma, if you are not desirous of dying.

original: avajñāya vacas tasya jagṛhus te tadā dhanam /
analyzed: avajñāya vacaḥ tasya jagṛhuḥ te tadā dhanam
translated: Disregarding his words, they then seized the wealth,

original: strījanaṃ caiva maitreya viṣvaksenaparigraham // / / //🔽tato 'rjuno dhanur divyaṃ gāṇḍīvam ajaraṃ yudhi /
analyzed: strī janam ca eva maitreya viṣvaksena parigraham  tatas rjunaḥ dhanuḥ divyam gāṇḍīvam ajaram yudhi
translated: and also the women, O Maitreya, who were under the protection of Vishnu.🔽Then Arjuna, the powerful one, began to string the divine, undecaying bow Gandiva in battle,

original: āropayitum ārebhe na śaśāka ca vīryavān // / / //
analyzed: āropayitum ārebhe na śaśāka ca vīryavān
translated: but was unable to do so.

original: cakāra sajjaṃ kṛcchrāc ca tac cābhūc chithilaṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: cakāra sajjam kṛcchrāt ca tat ca abhūt śithilam punar
translated: With difficulty he made it ready, but it became loose again.

original: na sasmāra tathāstrāṇi cintayann api pāṇḍavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na sasmāra tathā astrāṇi cintayan api pāṇḍavaḥ
translated: The son of Pandu could not remember the weapons even while thinking about them.

original: śarān mumoca caiteṣu pārtho vairiṣv amarṣitaḥ /
analyzed: śarān mumoca ca eteṣu pārthaḥ vairiṣu amarṣitaḥ
translated: Arjuna, out of anger, released arrows at those enemies.

original: tvagbhedaṃ te paraṃ cakrur astā gāṇḍīvadhanvanā // / / //
analyzed: tvac bhedam te param cakruḥ astāḥ gāṇḍīvadhanvanā
translated: They only pierced their skin and fell down from the wielder of Gandiva.

original: vahninā ye 'kṣayā dattāḥ śarās te 'pi kṣayaṃ yayuḥ /
analyzed: vahninā ye kṣayāḥ dattāḥ śarāḥ te pi kṣayam yayuḥ
translated: The inexhaustible arrows given by Agni were also exhausted.

original: yudhyataḥ saha gopālair arjunasya bhavakṣaye // / / //
analyzed: yudhyataḥ saha gopālaiḥ arjunasya bhava kṣaye
translated: While Arjuna was fighting with the cowherds for the destruction of existence.

original: acintayac ca kaunteyaḥ kṛṣṇasyaiva hi tad balam /
analyzed: acintayat ca kaunteyaḥ kṛṣṇasya eva hi tat balam
translated: And the son of Kunti thought that it was only the power of Krishna,

original: yan mayā śarasaṃghātaiḥ sakalā bhūbhṛto jitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yat mayā śara saṃghātaiḥ sakalāḥ bhūbhṛtaḥ jitāḥ
translated: By which all the kings were conquered by me with multitudes of arrows.

original: miṣataḥ pāṇḍuputrasya tatas tāḥ pramadottamāḥ /
analyzed: miṣataḥ pāṇḍu putrasya tatas tāḥ pramadā uttamāḥ
translated: And while the son of Pandu was looking on, those best of women,

original: ābhīrair apakṛṣyanta kāmāc cānyāḥ pravavrajuḥ // / / //
analyzed: ābhīraiḥ apakṛṣyanta kāmāt ca anyāḥ pravavrajuḥ
translated: Were taken away by the cowherds, and others went away of their own accord.

original: tataḥ śareṣu kṣīṇeṣu dhanuṣkoṭyā dhanaṃjayaḥ /
analyzed: tatas śareṣu kṣīṇeṣu dhanuṣkoṭyā dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: Then when the arrows were exhausted, Dhananjaya with the tip of his bow,

original: jaghāna dasyūṃs te cāsya prahārāñ jahasur mune // / / //
analyzed: jaghāna dasyūn te ca asya prahārān jahasuḥ mune
translated: Slew the bandits, but they laughed at his blows, O sage.

original: prekṣataś caiva pārthasya vṛṣṇyandhakavarastriyaḥ /
analyzed: prekṣataḥ ca eva pārthasya vṛṣṇi andhaka vara striyaḥ
translated: And while Partha was looking on, the best of the Vrishni and Andhaka women,

original: jagmur ādāya te mlecchāḥ samastā munisattama // / / //
analyzed: jagmuḥ ādāya te mlecchāḥ samastāḥ muni sattama
translated: Were all taken away by the Mlecchas, O best of sages.

original: tataḥ suduḥkhito jiṣṇuḥ kaṣṭaṃ kaṣṭam iti bruvan /
analyzed: tatas su duḥkhitaḥ jiṣṇuḥ kaṣṭam kaṣṭam iti bruvan
translated: Then Jishnu, greatly afflicted, saying Alas! Alas!

original: aho bhagavatā tena mukto 'smīti ruroda vai // / / //
analyzed: aho bhagavatā tena muktaḥ smi iti ruroda vai
translated: And wept, thinking I am indeed released by that Lord.

original: tad dhanus tāni śastrāṇi sa rathas te ca vājinaḥ /
analyzed: tat dhanuḥ tāni śastrāṇi sa rathaḥ te ca vājinaḥ
translated: That bow, those weapons, that chariot, and those horses,

original: sarvam ekapade naṣṭaṃ dānam aśrotriye yathā // / / //
analyzed: sarvam eka pade naṣṭam dānam aśrotriye yathā
translated: All is lost in a moment, like a gift to one who is not a true Brahmin.

original: aho 'tibalavad daivaṃ vinā tena mahātmanā /
analyzed: aho ti balavat daivam vinā tena mahātmanā
translated: Oh, how powerful is fate, without that great soul,

original: yad asāmarthyayukte 'pi nīcavarge jayapradam // / / //
analyzed: yat a sāmarthya yukte pi nīca varge jaya pradam
translated: By which victory was bestowed upon the weak and powerless class.

original: tau bāhū sa ca me muṣṭiḥ sthānaṃ tat so 'smi cārjunaḥ /
analyzed: tau bāhū sa ca me muṣṭiḥ sthānam tat saḥ smi ca arjunaḥ
translated: Those arms, that fist, that place, and I am Arjuna,

original: puṇyenaiva vinā tena gataṃ sarvam asāratām // / / //
analyzed: puṇyena eva vinā tena gatam sarvam asāra tām
translated: All have become worthless without that merit.

original: mamārjunatvaṃ bhīmasya bhīmatvaṃ tat kṛtaṃ dhruvam /
analyzed: mama arjuna tvam bhīmasya bhīma tvam tat kṛtam dhruvam
translated: My Arjuna-hood and Bhima's Bhima-hood are certainly due to him,

original: vinā tena yad ābhīrair jito 'haṃ katham anyathā // / / //
analyzed: vinā tena yat ābhīraiḥ jitaḥ ham katham anyathā
translated: Otherwise, how could I have been defeated by cowherds without him?

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: itthaṃ vadan yayau jiṣṇur mathurākhyaṃ purottamam /
analyzed: ittham vadan yayau jiṣṇuḥ mathurā ākhyam pura uttamam
translated: Saying this, Jishnu went to the excellent city called Mathura.

original: cakāra tatra rājānaṃ vajraṃ yādavanandanam // / / //
analyzed: cakāra tatra rājānam vajram yādava nandanam
translated: There he made Vajra, the delighter of the Yadus, the king.

original: sa dadarśa tato vyāsaṃ phālgunaḥ kānanāśrayam /
analyzed: sa dadarśa tatas vyāsam phālgunaḥ kānana āśrayam
translated: Phalguna (Arjuna) then saw Vyasa residing in the forest.

original: tam upetya mahābhāgaṃ vinayenābhyavādayat // / / //
analyzed: tam upetya mahābhāgam vinayena abhyavādayat
translated: Approaching that illustrious one, he respectfully saluted him.

original: taṃ vandamānaṃ caraṇāv avalokya muniś ciram /
analyzed: tam vandamānam caraṇau avalokya muniḥ ciram
translated: The sage, looking at him who was bowing at his feet for a long time,

original: uvāca pārthaṃ vicchāyaḥ katham atyantam īdṛśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: uvāca pārtham vicchāyaḥ katham atyantam īdṛśaḥ
translated: said to Partha, with a gloomy face, How have you become so extremely pale?

original: avīrajo'nugamanaṃ brahmahatyāthavā kṛtā /
analyzed: brahma hatyā athavā kṛtā
translated: Or you have committed the sin of killing a brahmin by following a non-hero.

original: dṛḍhāśābhaṅgaduḥkhīva bhraṣṭacchāyo 'si sāmpratam // / / //
analyzed: dṛḍha āśā bhaṅga duḥkhī iva bhraṣṭa chāyaḥ si sāmpratam
translated: You are now like one whose firm hopes have been shattered, with a faded complexion.

original: ins /
analyzed: d ins
translated: Inserts:

original: urjje dattaṃ naiva kṛṣṇe ca pakṣe durvarṇaṃ vā annagodhūmamiśram /
analyzed: urjje dattam na eva kṛṣṇe ca pakṣe durvarṇam vā anna godhūma miśram
translated: Given in Urjjja, not in the dark fortnight, or food mixed with barley, of poor color,

original: viṣṇuṃ natvā sarvakāmapradaṃ bho tenedaṃ te rūpam īdṛg vibhāti // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇum natvā sarva kāma pradam bho tena idam te rūpam īdṛś vibhāti
translated: Having bowed to Vishnu, the bestower of all desires, therefore your form shines thus.

original: sāntānikādayo vā te yācamānā nirākṛtāḥ /🔽agamyastrīratir vā tvaṃ tenāsi vigataprabhaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sāntānika ādayaḥ vā te yācamānāḥ nirākṛtāḥ  agamya strī ratiḥ vā tvam tena asi vigata prabhaḥ
translated: Or you have refused supplicants such as those seeking offspring,🔽Or you have indulged in sex with a woman who should not be approached, therefore you are devoid of radiance.

original: bhuṅkte 'pradāya viprebhyo eko miṣṭam atho bhavān /
analyzed: bhuṅkte pradāya viprebhyaḥ ekaḥ miṣṭam atho bhavān
translated: Or you alone have eaten something sweet without giving to the brahmins,

original: kiṃ vā kṛpaṇavittāni hṛtāni bhavatārjuna // / / //
analyzed: kim vā kṛpaṇa vittāni hṛtāni bhavatā arjuna
translated: Or you have taken the wealth of the miserly, Arjuna.

original: kaccit tvaṃ śūrpavātasya gocaratvaṃ gato 'rjuna /
analyzed: kaccit tvam śūrpa vātasya gocara tvam gataḥ ṛjuna
translated: Or, Arjuna, have you come under the influence of the wind of a winnowing basket,

original: duṣṭacakṣurhato vāpi niḥśrīkaḥ katham anyathā // / / //
analyzed: duṣṭa cakṣuḥ hataḥ vā api niḥśrīkaḥ katham anyathā
translated: Or struck down by an evil eye, otherwise how could you be so lusterless?

original: spṛṣṭo nakhāmbhasā vātha ghaṭavāryukṣito 'pi vā /
analyzed: spṛṣṭaḥ nakha ambhasā vā atha ghaṭa vāri ukṣitaḥ vā
translated: Or you have been touched by the water of nails, or even sprinkled with the water of a pot,

original: tenātīvāsi vicchāyo nyūnair vā yudhi nirjitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tena atīva asi vicchāyaḥ nyūnaiḥ vā yudhi nirjitaḥ
translated: Therefore you are extremely pale, or defeated by inferiors in battle.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tataḥ pārtho viniśvasya śrūyatāṃ bhagavann iti /
analyzed: tatas pārthaḥ viniśvasya śrūyatām bhagavan iti
translated: Then Partha sighed and said, O Lord, let it be heard.

original: prokto yathāvad ācaṣṭe vyāsāyātmaparābhavam // / / //
analyzed: proktaḥ yathāvat ācaṣṭe vyāsāya ātma parābhavam
translated: as it happened, to Vyasa, of his own defeat.

original: arjuna uvāca /
analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

original: yad balaṃ yac ca nas tejo yad vīryaṃ yaḥ parākramaḥ /
analyzed: yat balam yat ca naḥ tejaḥ yat vīryam yaḥ parākramaḥ
translated: That strength, that energy, that prowess, that valor,

original: yā śrīś chāyā ca naḥ so 'smān parityajya harir gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: yā śrīḥ chāyā ca naḥ saḥ smān parityajya hariḥ gataḥ
translated: That glory and that shade of ours, Hari has left us and gone away.

original: itareṇeva mahatā smitapūrvābhibhāṣiṇā /
analyzed: itareṇa iva mahatā smita pūrva abhibhāṣiṇā
translated: As if by another great one, speaking with a smile first,

original: hīnā vayaṃ mune tena jātās tṛṇamayā iva // / / //
analyzed: hīnāḥ vayam mune tena jātāḥ tṛṇa mayāḥ iva
translated: We are deprived of him, O sage, and have become as if made of straw.

original: astrāṇāṃ sāyakānāṃ ca gāṇḍīvasya tathā mama /
analyzed: astrāṇām sāyakānām ca gāṇḍīvasya tathā mama
translated: The essence that was embodied in my weapons, arrows, and the Gandiva,

original: sāratā yābhavan mūrtā sa gataḥ puruṣottamaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sāra tā yā abhavat mūrtā sa gataḥ puruṣottamaḥ
translated: That Supreme Being has gone.

original: yasyāvalokanād asmāñ śrīr jayaḥ saṃpad unnatiḥ /
analyzed: yasya avalokanāt asmām śrīḥ jayaḥ saṃpad unnatiḥ
translated: By whose sight, Sri, victory, prosperity, and elevation did not abandon us,

original: na tatyāja sa govindas tyaktvāsmān bhagavān gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: na tatyāja sa govindaḥ tyaktvā asmān bhagavān gataḥ
translated: That Lord Govinda has left us and gone, abandoning us.

original: bhīṣmadroṇāṅgarājādyās tathā duryodhanādayaḥ /
analyzed: bhīṣma droṇa aṅgarāja ādyāḥ tathā duryodhana ādayaḥ
translated: Bhishma, Drona, the king of Anga, and others, as well as Duryodhana and others,

original: yatprabhāvena nirdagdhāḥ sa kṛṣṇas tyaktavān bhuvam // / / //
analyzed: yad prabhāvena nirdagdhāḥ sa kṛṣṇaḥ tyaktavān bhuvam
translated: By whose power they were consumed, that Krishna has abandoned the earth.

original: niryauvanā hataśrīkā bhraṣṭacchāyeva me mahī /
analyzed: niryauvanā hata śrīkā bhraṣṭa chāyā iva me mahī
translated: The earth appears to me as if shorn of youth, deprived of glory, and fallen in radiance,

original: vibhāti tāta naiko 'haṃ virahe tasya cakriṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vibhāti tāta nā ekaḥ ham virahe tasya cakriṇaḥ
translated: Shining, O father, not alone in the absence of that discus-holder.

original: yasyānubhāvād bhīṣmādyair mayy agnau śalabhāyitam /
analyzed: yasya anubhāvāt bhīṣma ādyaiḥ mayi agnau śalabhāyitam
translated: By whose power Bhishma and others were reduced to ashes in me,

original: vinā tenādya kṛṣṇena gopālair asmi nirjitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vinā tena adya kṛṣṇena gopālaiḥ asmi nirjitaḥ
translated: Without that Krishna, I have been defeated by the cowherds today.

original: gāṇḍīvaṃ triṣu lokeṣu khyātiṃ yadanubhāvataḥ /
analyzed: gāṇḍīvam triṣu lokeṣu khyātim yad anubhāvataḥ
translated: By whose power the Gandiva became famous in the three worlds,

original: gataṃ tena vinābhīrair laguḍais tannirākṛtam // / / //
analyzed: gatam tena vinā ābhīraiḥ laguḍaiḥ tat nirākṛtam
translated: That has been destroyed by the cowherds with their sticks.

original: strīsahasrāṇy anekāni mannāthāni mahāmune /
analyzed: strī sahasrāṇi anekāni mad nāthāni mahā mune
translated: O great sage, many thousands of women who were under my protection,

original: yatato mama nītāni dasyubhir laguḍāyudhaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: yatataḥ mama nītāni dasyubhiḥ laguḍa āyudhaiḥ
translated: Were taken away by the bandits armed with sticks, while I was trying to protect them.

original: ānīyamānam ābhīraiḥ kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇāvarodhanam /
analyzed: ānīyamānam ābhīraiḥ kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa avarodhanam
translated: O Krishna, the women of Krishna's harem, who were being brought by the cowherds,

original: hṛtaṃ yaṣṭipraharaṇaiḥ paribhūya balaṃ mama // / / //
analyzed: hṛtam yaṣṭi praharaṇaiḥ paribhūya balam mama
translated: Were seized by them, who ridiculed my strength, with their stick-like weapons.

original: niḥśrīkatā na me citraṃ yaj jīvāmi tad adbhutam /
analyzed: niḥśrīka tā na me citram yat jīvāmi tat adbhutam
translated: It is no wonder that I am shorn of glory; it is a wonder that I am alive.

original: nīcāvamānapaṅkāṅkī nirlajjo 'smi pitāmaha // / / //
analyzed: nīca avamāna paṅka aṅkī nirlajjaḥ smi pitāmaha
translated: O grandfather, smeared with the mud of insult from the low, I am shameless.

original: After / / / / ins /
analyzed: after ins
translated: After this, the following is inserted:

original: kṛṣṇaśabdasya bhājo vai traya eva mahāmune // / / / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇa śabdasya bhājaḥ vai trayaḥ eva mahā mune
translated: O great sage, there are only three who are worthy of the name Krishna -

original: ahaṃ ca tvaṃ ca devaś ca yathārhaṃ kṛtavān vibhuḥ // / / / //
analyzed: aham ca tvam ca devaḥ ca yathārham kṛtavān vibhuḥ
translated: Myself, you, and the almighty Lord, who have done what is proper.

original: kṛṣṇe tasmin mahābāhau mahātmani mahīpatau // / / / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇe tasmin mahā bāhau mahātmani mahīpatau
translated: In that Krishna, the mighty-armed, the great-souled king,

original: mama cittaṃ yathāśaktaṃ nānyo vedeha vedmy aham // / / / //
