original: urvī mahāṃś ca jagataḥ prānte 'ntar bāhyatas tathā // / / //
analyzed: urvī mahān ca jagataḥ prānte ntar bāhyatas tathā
translated: The earth and Mahān are at the end and inside the universe, both externally and internally.

original: evaṃ sapta mahābuddheḥ kramāt prakṛtayas tu vai /
analyzed: evam sapta mahābuddheḥ kramāt prakṛtayaḥ tu vai
translated: Thus, O greatly wise one, the seven primordial natures arise in sequence from the great intellect.

original: pratyāhāre tu tāḥ sarvāḥ praviśanti parasparam // / / //🔽yenedam āvṛtaṃ sarvam aṇḍam apsu pralīyate /
analyzed: pratyāhāre tu tāḥ sarvāḥ praviśanti parasparam  yena idam āvṛtam sarvam aṇḍam apsu pralīyate
translated: But when there is withdrawal, all of them enter each other.

original: saptadvīpasamudrāntaṃ saptalokaṃ saparvatam // / / //
analyzed: sapta dvīpa samudra antam sapta lokam sa parvatam
translated: By which this entire universe, up to the seven islands and oceans, the seven worlds and mountains, is enveloped and dissolves into water.

original: udakāvaraṇaṃ yat tu jyotiṣā pīyate tu tat /
analyzed: udaka āvaraṇam yat tu jyotiṣā pīyate tu tat
translated: The water-covering is drunk up by fire,

original: jyotir vāyau layaṃ yāti yāty ākāśe samīraṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: jyotiḥ vāyau layam yāti yāti ākāśe samīraṇaḥ
translated: fire merges into air, and air merges into space.

original: ākāśaṃ caiva bhūtādir grasate taṃ tathā mahān /
analyzed: ākāśam ca eva bhūtādiḥ grasate tam tathā mahān
translated: Bhūtādi swallows space, and Mahān swallows that.

original: mahāntam ebhiḥ sahitaṃ prakṛtir grasate dvija // / / //
analyzed: mahāntam ebhiḥ sahitam prakṛtiḥ grasate dvija
translated: O twice-born one, the great one along with these is swallowed by Prakriti.

original: guṇasāmyam anudriktam anyūnaṃ ca mahāmune /
analyzed: guṇa sāmyam an udriktam anyūnam ca mahā mune
translated: O great sage, the state of equilibrium of the qualities, neither excessive nor deficient,

original: procyate prakṛtir hetuḥ pradhānaṃ kāraṇaṃ param // / / //
analyzed: procyate prakṛtiḥ hetuḥ pradhānam kāraṇam param
translated: is said to be Prakriti, the cause, the primordial, the supreme cause.

original: ity eṣā prakṛtiḥ sarvā vyaktāvyaktasvarūpiṇī /
analyzed: iti eṣā prakṛtiḥ sarvā vyakta avyakta svarūpiṇī
translated: Thus, this Prakriti is all, having the form of the manifest and the unmanifest.

original: vyaktasvarūpam avyakte tasmin maitreya līyate // / / //
analyzed: vyakta svarūpam avyakte tasmin maitreya līyate
translated: The manifest form dissolves into the unmanifest, O Maitreya.

original: ekaḥ śuddho 'kṣaro nityaḥ sarvavyāpī tathā pumān /
analyzed: ekaḥ kṣaraḥ nityaḥ sarva vyāpī tathā pumān
translated: The Purusha is one, pure, immutable, eternal, all-pervading, and so on.

original: so 'py aṃśaḥ sarvabhūtasya maitreya paramātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saḥ u pi aṃśaḥ sarva bhūtasya maitreya paramātmanaḥ
translated: He is also a part of the supreme Self of all beings, O Maitreya.

original: na santi yatra sarveśe nāmajātyādikalpanāḥ /
analyzed: na santi yatra sarva īśe nāma jāti ādi kalpanāḥ
translated: Where there are no conceptualizations of names, species, etc. in the Lord of all,

original: sattāmātrātmake jñeye jñānātmany ātmanaḥ pare // / / //
analyzed: sattā mātra ātmake jñeye jñāna ātmani ātmanaḥ pare
translated: in the knowable which is of the nature of mere existence, in the Self of knowledge, the supreme Self,

original: tad brahma tat paraṃ dhāma paramātmā sa ceśvaraḥ /
analyzed: tat brahma tat param dhāma paramātmā sa ca īśvaraḥ
translated: That is Brahman, that is the supreme abode, that is the supreme Self, and that is the Lord.

original: sa viṣṇuḥ sarvam evedaṃ yato nāvartate yatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa viṣṇuḥ sarvam eva idam yatas na āvartate yatiḥ
translated: That Vishnu is all this, from which the ascetic does not return.

original: prakṛtir yā mayā khyātā vyaktāvyaktasvarūpiṇī /
analyzed: prakṛtiḥ yā mayā khyātā vyakta avyakta svarūpiṇī
translated: That Prakriti which I have described as having the form of the manifest and the unmanifest,

original: puruṣaś cāpy ubhāv etau līyete paramātmani // / / //
analyzed: puruṣaḥ ca api ubhau etau līyete paramātmani
translated: and also Purusha, both of these dissolve into the supreme Self.

original: paramātmā ca sarveṣām ādhāraḥ parameśvaraḥ /
analyzed: paramātmā ca sarveṣām ādhāraḥ parameśvaraḥ
translated: And the supreme Self, the supreme Lord, is the support of all.

original: viṣṇur nāmnā sa vedeṣu vedānteṣu ca gīyate // / / //
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ nāmnā sa vedeṣu vedānteṣu ca gīyate
translated: He is sung about in the Vedas and Vedanta by the name of Vishnu.

original: pravṛttaṃ ca nivṛttaṃ ca dvividhaṃ karma vaidikam /
analyzed: pravṛttam ca nivṛttam ca dvividham karma vaidikam
translated: Vedic rites are of two kinds - pravritta (active) and nivritta (passive).

original: tābhyām ubhābhyāṃ puruṣaiḥ sarvamūrtiḥ sa ijyate // / / //
analyzed: tābhyām ubhābhyām puruṣaiḥ sarva mūrtiḥ saḥ ijyate
translated: He, the embodiment of all, is worshipped by men through both these.

original: ṛgyajuḥsāmabhir mārgaiḥ pravṛttair ijyate hy asau /
analyzed: ṛk yajuḥ sāmabhiḥ mārgaiḥ pravṛttaiḥ ijyate hi asau
translated: He is worshipped by those engaged in the paths of Rig, Yajus and Sama.

original: yajñeśvaro yajñapumān puruṣaiḥ puruṣottamaḥ // / / //
translated: Vishnu, the lord of sacrifices, the embodiment of sacrifice, the supreme being, is worshipped by men.

original: jñānātmā jñānayogena jñānamūrtiḥ sa cejyate /
analyzed: jñāna ātmā jñāna yogena jñāna mūrtiḥ sa ca ijyate
translated: He, the soul of knowledge, the embodiment of knowledge, is worshipped through the yoga of knowledge.

original: nivṛtte yogibhir mārge viṣṇur muktiphalapradaḥ // / / //
analyzed: nivṛtte yogibhiḥ mārge viṣṇuḥ mukti phala pradaḥ
translated: Vishnu, the giver of the fruit of liberation, is worshipped by yogis on the path of nivritti.

original: hrasvadīrghaplutair yat tu kiṃcid vastv abhidhīyate /
analyzed: hrasva dīrgha plutaiḥ yat tu kiṃcid vastu abhidhīyate
translated: Whatever object is denoted by short, long and prolated vowels,

original: yac ca vācām aviṣaye tat sarvaṃ viṣṇur avyayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yat ca vācām aviṣaye tat sarvam viṣṇuḥ avyayaḥ
translated: and whatever is beyond the range of speech, all that is the imperishable Vishnu.

original: vyaktaṃ sa eva cāvyaktaṃ sa eva puruṣo 'vyayaḥ /
analyzed: vyaktam saḥ eva ca avyaktam saḥ eva puruṣaḥ vyayaḥ
translated: He alone is the manifest and the unmanifest, he alone is the imperishable Purusha.

original: paramātmā ca viśvātmā viśvarūpadharo hariḥ // / / //
analyzed: paramātmā ca viśvātmā viśva rūpa dharaḥ hariḥ
translated: Hari, the supreme soul, the universal soul, the bearer of the universe,

original: vyaktāvyaktātmikā tasmin prakṛtiḥ saṃpralīyate /
analyzed: vyakta avyakta ātmikā tasmin prakṛtiḥ saṃpralīyate
translated: Prakriti dissolves into him, consisting of the manifest and the unmanifest.

original: puruṣaś cāpi maitreya vyāpiny avyāhatātmani // / / //
analyzed: puruṣaḥ ca api maitreya vyāpini avyāhata ātmani
translated: And the Purusha, O Maitreya, in the all-pervading and unobstructed self,

original: dviparārdhātmakaḥ kālaḥ kathito yo mayā tava /
analyzed: dvi parārdha ātmakaḥ kālaḥ kathitaḥ yaḥ mayā tava
translated: The period of time which I have told you as consisting of two Parardhas,

original: tad ahas tasya maitreya viṣṇor īśasya kathyate // / / //
analyzed: tat ahar tasya maitreya viṣṇoḥ īśasya kathyate
translated: That, O Maitreya, is said to be a day of Vishnu, the Lord.

original: vyakte ca prakṛtau līne prakṛtyāṃ puruṣe tathā /
analyzed: vyakte ca prakṛtau līne prakṛtyām puruṣe tathā
translated: When the Manifest is dissolved in the Unmanifest, and the Unmanifest in the Purusha,

original: tatra sthite niśā cānyā tatpramāṇā mahāmune // / / //
analyzed: tatra sthite niśā ca anyā tad pramāṇā mahā mune
translated: Then, O great sage, the other night of equal duration sets in, in which the Lord remains.

original: naivāhas tasya na niśā nityasya paramātmanaḥ /
analyzed: na eva ahar tasya na niśā nityasya paramātmanaḥ
translated: There is neither day nor night for that eternal Supreme Self.

original: upacāras tathāpy eṣa tasyeśasya dvijocyate // / / //
analyzed: upacāraḥ tathā api eṣa tasya īśasya dvija ucyate
translated: Yet, O Brahmin, this mode of speaking is used in regard to that Lord.

original: ity eṣa tava maitreya kathitaḥ prākṛto layaḥ /
analyzed: iti eṣa tava maitreya kathitaḥ prākṛtaḥ layaḥ
translated: Thus, O Maitreya, this natural dissolution has been told to you.

original: ātyantikam atho brahman nibodha pratisaṃcaram // / / //
analyzed: ātyantikam atho brahman nibodha pratisaṃcaram
translated: Now, O Brahmin, understand the absolute dissolution.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe ṣaṣṭhe 'ṃśe caturtho 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe ṣaṣṭhe ṃśe caturthaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourth chapter in the sixth section of the Vishnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ādhyātmikādi maitreya jñātvā tāpatrayaṃ budhaḥ /
analyzed: ādhyātmika ādi maitreya jñātvā tāpa trayam budhaḥ
translated: O Maitreya, the wise one, having known the three kinds of distress, namely, physical, mental and spiritual,

original: utpannajñānavairāgyaḥ prāpnoty ātyantikaṃ layam // / / //
analyzed: utpanna jñāna vairāgyaḥ prāpnoti ātyantikam layam
translated: attains the ultimate dissolution, having acquired knowledge and detachment.

original: ādhyātmiko vai dvividhaḥ śārīro mānasas tathā /
analyzed: ādhyātmikaḥ vai dvividhaḥ śārīraḥ mānasaḥ tathā
translated: The physical distress is of two kinds - bodily and mental.

original: śārīro bahubhir bhedair bhidyate śrūyatāṃ ca saḥ // / / //
analyzed: śārīraḥ bahubhiḥ bhedaiḥ bhidyate śrūyatām ca saḥ
translated: The bodily distress is divided into many types. Let that be heard.

original: śirorogapratiśyāyajvaraśūlabhagaṃdaraiḥ /🔽gulmārśaḥśvāsaśvayathucchardyādibhir anekadhā // / / //
analyzed: śiraḥ roga pratiśyāya jvara śūla bhagaṃdaraiḥ  gulma arśaḥ śvāsa śvayathu chardi ādibhiḥ anekadhā
translated: Headache, cold, fever, pain, hemorrhoids,🔽Gulma, piles, asthma, edema, vomiting and so on in many ways,

original: tathākṣirogātīsārakuṣṭhāṅgāmayasaṃjñakaiḥ /
analyzed: tathā akṣi roga atīsāra kuṣṭha aṅga āmaya saṃjñakaiḥ
translated: And by diseases of the eyes, diarrhea, leprosy, and other bodily ailments,

original: bhidyate dehajas tāpo mānasaṃ śrotum arhasi // / / //🔽kāmakrodhabhayadveṣalobhamohaviṣādajaḥ /
analyzed: bhidyate deha jaḥ tāpaḥ mānasam śrotum arhasi  kāma krodha bhaya dveṣa lobha moha viṣāda jaḥ
translated: The bodily suffering is divided. You should listen to the mental one.🔽Arising from desire, anger, fear, hatred, greed, delusion, and sorrow,

original: śokāsūyāvamānerṣyāmātsaryādibhavas tathā // / / //
analyzed: śoka asūyā avamāna īrṣyā mātsarya ādi bhavaḥ tathā
translated: And from grief, envy, insult, jealousy, malice, and so on,

original: mānaso 'pi dvijaśreṣṭha tāpo bhavati naikadhā /
analyzed: mānasaḥ pi dvijaśreṣṭha tāpaḥ bhavati na ekadhā
translated: The mental suffering also occurs in many ways, O best of the twice-born.

original: ity evamādibhir bhedais tāpo hy ādhyātmikaḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: iti evamādibhiḥ bhedaiḥ tāpaḥ hi ādhyātmikaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Thus, the internal suffering is said to be divided into these and other categories.

original: mṛgapakṣimanuṣyādyaiḥ piśācoragarākṣasaiḥ /
analyzed: mṛga pakṣi manuṣya ādyaiḥ piśāca uraga rākṣasaiḥ
translated: Caused by animals, birds, humans, and others, by demons, serpents, and demons,

original: sarīsṛpādyaiś ca nṛṇāṃ janyante cādhibhautikaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sarīsṛpa ādyaiḥ ca nṛṇām janyante ca ādhibhautikaḥ
translated: And by reptiles and so on, the external suffering is produced in humans.

original: śītoṣṇavātavarṣāmbuvaidyutādisamudbhavaḥ /
translated: Arising from cold, heat, wind, rain, water, lightning, and so on,

original: tāpo dvijavaraśreṣṭha kathyate cādhidaivikaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tāpaḥ dvijavara śreṣṭha kathyate ca ādhidaivikaḥ
translated: The suffering is described as external, O best of the best of the twice-born.

original: garbhajanmajarājñānamṛtyunārakajaṃ tathā /
analyzed: garbha janma jarā jñāna mṛtyu nāraka jam tathā
translated: And from birth in the womb, old age, knowledge, death, and hell,

original: duḥkhaṃ sahasraśo bhedair bhidyate munisattama // / / //
analyzed: duḥkham sahasraśas bhedaiḥ bhidyate muni sattama
translated: The suffering is divided into thousands of categories, O best of sages.

original: sukumāratanur garbhe jantur bahumalāvṛte /🔽ulbasaṃveṣṭito bhugnapṛṣṭhagrīvāsthisaṃhatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: su kumāra tanuḥ garbhe jantuḥ bahu mala āvṛte  ulba saṃveṣṭitaḥ bhugna pṛṣṭha grīvā asthi saṃhatiḥ
translated: The tender body of the creature in the womb, covered with much impurity,🔽wrapped in the caul, with its back, neck and bones bent,

original: atyamlakaṭutīkṣṇoṣṇalavaṇair mātṛbhojanaiḥ /
analyzed: ati amla kaṭu tīkṣṇa uṣṇa lavaṇaiḥ mātṛ bhojanaiḥ
translated: by the mother's food which is very sour, pungent, sharp, hot and salty,

original: atitāpibhir atyarthaṃ vardhamānātivedanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ati tāpibhiḥ atyartham vardhamāna ativedanaḥ
translated: increasing excessively with great pain,

original: prasāraṇākuñcanādau nāṅgānāṃ prabhur ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: prasāraṇa ākuñcana ādau na aṅgānām prabhuḥ ātmanaḥ
translated: not having control over the stretching and contracting of its limbs,

original: śakṛnmūtramahāpaṅkaśāyī sarvatrapīḍitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śakṛt mūtra mahā paṅka śāyī sarvatrapīḍitaḥ
translated: lying in a great mire of feces and urine, oppressed everywhere,

original: nirucchvāsaḥ sacaitanyaḥ smarañ janmaśatāny atha /
analyzed: nirucchvāsaḥ sa caitanyaḥ smaram janma śatāni atha
translated: without breath, with consciousness, remembering hundreds of births,

original: āste garbhe 'tiduḥkhena nijakarmanibandhanaḥ // / / //🔽jāyamānaḥ purīṣāsṛṅmūtraśukrāvilānanaḥ /
analyzed: āste garbhe ti duḥkhena nija karma nibandhanaḥ  jāyamānaḥ purīṣa asṛj mūtra śukra āvila ānanaḥ
translated: remains in the womb with great suffering, bound by its own actions.🔽Being born, with a face soiled by feces, blood, urine and semen,

original: prājāpatyena vātena pīḍyamānāsthibandhanaḥ // / / //🔽adhomukho vai kriyate prabalaiḥ sūtimārutaiḥ /
analyzed: prājāpatyena vātena pīḍyamāna asthi bandhanaḥ  adhomukhaḥ vai kriyate prabalaiḥ sūtimārutaiḥ
translated: with its bone joints afflicted by the wind of Prajapati,🔽is turned face downwards by the powerful winds of delivery,

original: kleśair niṣkrāntim āpnoti jaṭharān mātur āturaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kleśaiḥ niṣkrāntim āpnoti jaṭharāt mātuḥ āturaḥ
translated: and emerges from the womb with great difficulty, afflicted.

original: mūrcchām avāpya mahatīṃ saṃspṛṣṭo bāhyavāyunā /
analyzed: mūrcchām avāpya mahatīm saṃspṛṣṭaḥ bāhya vāyunā
translated: Having fainted greatly, touched by the external air,

original: vijñānabhraṃśam āpnoti jātaś ca munisattama // / / //
analyzed: vijñāna bhraṃśam āpnoti jātaḥ ca muni sattama
translated: having lost consciousness, O best of sages, after being born,

original: kaṇṭakair iva tunnāṅgaḥ krakacair iva dāritaḥ /
analyzed: kaṇṭakaiḥ iva tunna aṅgaḥ krakacaiḥ iva dāritaḥ
translated: His body is as if pierced by thorns, as if split by saws,

original: pūtivraṇān nipatito dharaṇyāṃ kṛmiko yathā // / / //
analyzed: pūti vraṇāt nipatitaḥ dharaṇyām kṛmikaḥ yathā
translated: As if fallen on the ground from a putrid wound, like a worm.

original: kaṇḍūyane 'pi cāśaktaḥ parivarte 'py anīśvaraḥ /
analyzed: kaṇḍūyane ca aśaktaḥ parivarte pi anīśvaraḥ
translated: He is also unable to scratch, powerless even to turn over,

original: snānapānādikāhāram avāpnoti parecchayā // / / //
analyzed: snāna pāna ādika āhāram avāpnoti para icchayā
translated: He obtains food such as bathing, drinking, and so on, by the will of another.

original: aśuciprastare suptaḥ kīṭadaṃśādibhis tathā /
analyzed: aśuci prastare suptaḥ kīṭa daṃśa ādibhiḥ tathā
translated: Having slept on an impure bed, and being eaten by insects, bites, and so on,

original: bhakṣyamāṇo 'pi naivaiṣāṃ samartho vinivāraṇe // / / //
analyzed: bhakṣyamāṇaḥ na eva eṣām samarthaḥ vinivāraṇe
translated: He is also unable to ward them off.

original: janmaduḥkhāny anekāni janmano 'nantarāṇi ca /
analyzed: janma duḥkhāni anekāni janmanaḥ nantarāṇi ca
translated: The many sufferings of birth, and those immediately after birth,

original: bālabhāve yadāpnoti ādhibhautādikāni ca // / / //
analyzed: bāla bhāve yat āpnoti ādhibhauta ādikāni ca
translated: And what he obtains in childhood, such as the sufferings caused by ghosts and so on.

original: ajñānatamasācchanno mūḍhāntaḥkaraṇo naraḥ /
analyzed: ajñāna tamasā ācchannaḥ mūḍha antaḥkaraṇaḥ naraḥ
translated: A man whose inner mind is deluded, covered by the darkness of ignorance,

original: na jānāti kutaḥ ko 'haṃ kvāhaṃ gantā kimātmakaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na jānāti kutas kaḥ ham kva aham gantā kimātmakaḥ
translated: Does not know: From where am I? Who am I? Where shall I go? What is my nature?

original: kena bandhena baddho 'haṃ kāraṇaṃ kim akāraṇam /
analyzed: kena bandhena baddhaḥ ham kāraṇam kim akāraṇam
translated: By what bond am I bound? What is the cause? What is the non-cause?

original: kiṃ kāryaṃ kim akāryaṃ vā kiṃ vācyaṃ kiṃ ca nocyate // / / //
analyzed: kim kāryam kim akāryam vā kim vācyam kim ca nā ucyate
translated: What is to be done? What is not to be done? What should be said? What should not be said?

original: ko 'dharmaḥ kaś ca vai dharmaḥ kasmin varte 'thavā katham /
analyzed: kaḥ dharmaḥ kaḥ ca vai dharmaḥ kasmin varte katham
translated: What is unrighteousness? What is righteousness? In what do I abide? Or how?

original: kiṃ kartavyam akartavyaṃ kiṃ vā kiṃ guṇadoṣavat // / / //
analyzed: kim kartavyam akartavyam kim vā kim guṇa doṣavat
translated: What is to be done? What is not to be done? What has good qualities and faults?

original: evaṃ paśusamair mūḍhair ajñānaprabhavaṃ mahat /
analyzed: evam paśu samaiḥ mūḍhaiḥ ajñāna prabhavam mahat
translated: Thus, by foolish men who are like animals, great misery born of ignorance

original: avāpyate narair duḥkhaṃ śiśnodaraparāyaṇaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: avāpyate naraiḥ duḥkham śiśna udara parāyaṇaiḥ
translated: is obtained by men who are devoted to the penis and the belly.

original: ajñānaṃ tāmaso bhāvaḥ kāryārambhāpravṛttayaḥ /
analyzed: ajñānam tāmasaḥ bhāvaḥ kārya ārambhā pravṛttayaḥ
translated: Ignorance is a state of tamas, and the engagement in the commencement of actions.

original: ajñānināṃ pravartante karmalopās tato dvija // / / //
analyzed: ajñāninām pravartante karma lopāḥ tatas dvija
translated: For the ignorant, the omissions of duties occur, and from that, O Brahmin,

original: narakaṃ karmaṇāṃ lopāt phalam āhur maharṣayaḥ /
analyzed: narakam karmaṇām lopāt phalam āhuḥ mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: hell is the fruit of the omission of duties, the great sages say.

original: tasmād ajñānināṃ duḥkham iha cāmutra cottamam // / / //🔽jarājarjaradehaś ca śithilāvayavaḥ pumān /
analyzed: tasmāt ajñāninām duḥkham iha ca amutra ca uttamam  jarā jarjara dehaḥ ca śithila avayavaḥ pumān
translated: Therefore, for the ignorant, there is supreme misery both in this world and the next.🔽A man with a body worn out by old age, with limbs slack,

original: vicalacchīrṇadaśano valisnāyuśirāvṛtaḥ // / / //🔽dūrapraṇaṣṭanayano vyomāntargatatārakaḥ /
analyzed: vicalat śīrṇa daśanaḥ vali snāyu sirā vṛtaḥ  dūra praṇaṣṭa nayanaḥ vyoma antargata tārakaḥ
translated: with teeth falling out and broken, covered with wrinkles, sinews, and veins,🔽with eyes far gone and decayed, with stars in the sky,

original: nāsāvivaraniryātalomapuñjaś caladvapuḥ // / / //
analyzed: nāsā vivara niryāta loma puñjaḥ calat vapuḥ
translated: with tufts of hair protruding from the nostrils, with a trembling body,

original: prakaṭībhūtasarvāsthir natapṛṣṭhāsthisaṃhatiḥ /🔽utsannajaṭharāgnitvād alpāhāro 'lpaceṣṭitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: utsanna jaṭhara agni tvāt alpa āhāraḥ lpa ceṣṭitaḥ
translated: with all the bones exposed, with the collection of backbones bent,🔽with the digestive fire in the stomach diminished, eating little, moving little,

original: kṛcchrāc caṅkramaṇotthānaśayanāsanaceṣṭitaḥ /
analyzed: kṛcchrāt caṅkramaṇa utthāna śayana āsana ceṣṭitaḥ
translated: with difficulty walking, standing, lying down, and sitting,

original: mandībhavacchrotranetraḥ sravallālāvilānanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: mandībhavat śrotra netraḥ sravat lālā āvila ānanaḥ
translated: with ears and eyes becoming dull, with a face covered with dribbling saliva,

original: anāyattaiḥ samastaiś ca karaṇair maraṇonmukhaḥ /
analyzed: anāyattaiḥ samastaiḥ ca karaṇaiḥ maraṇa unmukhaḥ
translated: With all the senses not under his control and facing death,

original: tatkṣaṇe 'py anubhūtānām asmartākhilavastūnām // / / //
analyzed: tad kṣaṇe pi anubhūtānām
translated: not remembering any objects experienced even at that moment,

original: sakṛd uccārite vākye samudbhūtamahāśramaḥ /
analyzed: sakṛt uccārite vākye samudbhūta mahā śramaḥ
translated: with great exhaustion arising from a single utterance of words,

original: śvāsakāsamahāyāsasamudbhūtaprajāgaraḥ // / / //
analyzed: śvāsa kāsa mahā āyāsa samudbhūta prajāgaraḥ
translated: with sleeplessness arising from great exertion due to asthma and cough,

original: anyenotthāpyate 'nyena tathā saṃveśyate jarī /
analyzed: anyena utthāpyate tathā saṃveśyate jarī
translated: the old man is raised by one and made to lie down by another,

original: bhṛtyātmaputradārāṇām avamānāspadīkṛtaḥ // / / //🔽prakṣīṇākhilaśaucaś ca vihārāhārasaspṛhaḥ /
analyzed: bhṛtya ātma putra dārāṇām avamāna āspadīkṛtaḥ  prakṣīṇa akhila śaucaḥ ca vihāra āhāra sa spṛhaḥ
translated: becoming an object of contempt for servants, self, sons and wife,🔽with all cleanliness lost, with no desire for recreation or food,

original: hāsyaḥ parijanasyāpi nirviṇṇāśeṣabāndhavaḥ // / / //
analyzed: hāsyaḥ parijanasya api nirviṇṇa aśeṣa bāndhavaḥ
translated: an object of ridicule even to servants, with all relatives disgusted,

original: anubhūtam ivānyasmiñ janmany ātmaviceṣṭitam /
analyzed: anubhūtam iva anyasmin janmani ātma viceṣṭitam
translated: remembering as if experienced in another birth his own actions,

original: saṃsmaran yauvane dīrghaṃ niḥśvasity atitāpitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃsmaran yauvane dīrgham niḥśvasiti atitāpitaḥ
translated: he sighs deeply in youth, greatly tormented,

original: evamādīni duḥkhāni jarāyām anubhūya vai /
analyzed: evamādīni duḥkhāni jarāyām anubhūya vai
translated: having experienced such miseries in old age,

original: maraṇe yāni duḥkhāni prāpnoti śṛṇu tāny api // / / //
analyzed: maraṇe yāni duḥkhāni prāpnoti śṛṇu tāni api
translated: listen also to the miseries he attains at death.

original: ślathadgrīvāṅghrihasto 'tha vyāpto vepathunā naraḥ /
analyzed: vyāptaḥ vepathunā naraḥ
translated: Then the man, with loose neck, feet and hands, trembling all over,

original: muhur glāniḥ paravaśo muhur jñānalavānvitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: muhur glāniḥ para vaśaḥ muhur jñāna lava anvitaḥ
translated: sometimes languid, sometimes dependent on others, sometimes endowed with a little knowledge,

original: hiraṇyadhānyatanayabhāryābhṛtyagṛhādiṣu /
analyzed: hiraṇya dhānya tanaya bhāryā bhṛtya gṛha ādiṣu
translated: Thinking, What will happen to my gold, grain, sons, wife, servants, house, etc.?

original: ete kathaṃ bhaviṣyantīty atīvamamatākulaḥ // / / //🔽marmabhidbhir mahārogaiḥ krakacair iva dāruṇaiḥ /🔽śarair ivāntakasyograiś chidyamānāsthibandhanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: ete katham bhaviṣyanti iti atīva mamatā ākulaḥ  marma bhidbhiḥ mahā rogaiḥ krakacaiḥ iva dāruṇaiḥ  śaraiḥ iva antakasya ugraiḥ chidyamāna asthi bandhanaḥ
translated: He becomes extremely agitated by excessive attachment.🔽He is cut with sharp weapons, pierced with sharp arrows, and torn apart with sharp saws.🔽His bones are cut with sharp weapons, as if by saws.

original: vivartamānatārākṣir hastapādaṃ muhuḥ kṣipan /🔽saṃśuṣyamāṇatālvoṣṭhapuṭo ghuraghurāyate // / / //
analyzed: vivartamāna tārā akṣiḥ hasta pādam muhur kṣipan  saṃśuṣyamāṇa tālu oṣṭha puṭaḥ ghuraghurāyate
translated: His eyes roll, he frequently throws his arms and legs,🔽and with his palate and lips drying up, he makes a gurgling sound.

original: niruddhakaṇṭho doṣaughair udānaśvāsapīḍitaḥ /🔽tāpena mahatā vyāptas tṛṣā cārtas tathā kṣudhā // / / //
analyzed: niruddha kaṇṭhaḥ doṣa oghaiḥ udāna śvāsa pīḍitaḥ  tāpena mahatā vyāptaḥ tṛṣā ca ārtaḥ tathā kṣudhā
translated: His throat is choked with masses of impurities, and he is afflicted by the upward and exhaled breaths.🔽He is pervaded by great heat, and afflicted by thirst and hunger.

original: kleśād utkrāntim āpnoti yāmyakiṃkarapīḍitaḥ /
analyzed: kleśāt utkrāntim āpnoti yāmya kiṃkara pīḍitaḥ
translated: Oppressed by the messengers of Yama, he attains death with great difficulty.

original: tataś ca yātanādehaṃ kleśena pratipadyate // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca yātanā deham kleśena pratipadyate
translated: Then, with difficulty, he attains a body fit for torment.

original: etāny anyāni cogrāṇi duḥkhāni maraṇe nṛṇām /
analyzed: etāni anyāni ca ugrāṇi duḥkhāni maraṇe nṛṇām
translated: These and other terrible sufferings of men at the time of death,

original: śṛṇuṣva narake yāni prāpyante puruṣair mṛtaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: śṛṇuṣva narake yāni prāpyante puruṣaiḥ mṛtaiḥ
translated: Listen to the sufferings that are experienced by men who die and go to hell.

original: yāmyakiṃkarapāśādigrahaṇaṃ daṇḍatāḍanam /
analyzed: yāmya kiṃkara pāśa ādi grahaṇam daṇḍa tāḍanam
translated: Being seized by the noose etc. of Yama's messengers, being beaten with sticks,

original: yamasya darśanaṃ cogram ugramārgavilokanam // / / //
analyzed: yamasya darśanam ca ugram ugra mārga vilokanam
translated: Seeing the fierce Yama, seeing the fierce path,

original: karambhavālukāvahniyantraśastrādibhīṣaṇe /
analyzed: karambha vālukā vahni yantra śastra ādi bhīṣaṇe
translated: In the terrible hells like Karabha, Valuka, Vahni, Yantra, Shastra, etc.,

original: pratyekaṃ narake yāś ca yātanā dvija duḥsahāḥ // / / //🔽krakacaiḥ pāṭyamānānāṃ mūṣāyāṃ cāpi dhamyatām /
analyzed: pratyekam narake yāḥ ca yātanāḥ dvija duḥsahāḥ  krakacaiḥ pāṭyamānānām mūṣāyām ca api dhamyatām
translated: And in each individual hell, O Brahmin, the tortures are unbearable.🔽Those who are being sawed apart, those who are being roasted in a mold,

original: kuṭhāraiḥ kṛtyamānānāṃ bhūmau cāpi nikhanyatām // / / //🔽śūleṣv āropyamāṇānāṃ vyāghravaktre praveśyatām /
analyzed: kuṭhāraiḥ kṛtyamānānām bhūmau ca api  śūleṣu āropyamāṇānām vyāghra vaktre
translated: Those who are being cut with axes, those who are being buried in the ground,🔽Those who are being impaled on stakes, those who are being thrown into the mouths of tigers,

original: gṛdhraiḥ saṃbhakṣyamāṇānāṃ dvīpibhiś copabhujyatām // / / //🔽kvāthyatāṃ tailamadhye ca klidyatāṃ kṣārakardame /
analyzed: gṛdhraiḥ saṃbhakṣyamāṇānām dvīpibhiḥ  taila madhye ca klidyatām kṣāra kardame
translated: Those who are being devoured by vultures, those who are being eaten by leopards,🔽Those who are being boiled in oil, those who are being smeared in caustic mud,

original: uccān nipātyamānānāṃ kṣipyatāṃ kṣepayantrakaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: uccān nipātyamānānām kṣipyatām kṣepa yantrakaiḥ
translated: Those who are being thrown from high places, those who are being hurled by catapults,

original: narake yāni duḥkhāni pāpahetūdbhavāni vai /
analyzed: narake yāni duḥkhāni pāpa hetu udbhavāni vai
translated: The miseries that are experienced by the denizens of hell, arising from sinful causes,

original: prāpyante nārakair vipra teṣāṃ saṃkhyā na vidyate // / / //
analyzed: prāpyante nārakaiḥ vipra teṣām saṃkhyā na vidyate
translated: O Brahmin, their number is not known.

original: na kevalaṃ dvijaśreṣṭha narake duḥkhapaddhatiḥ /
analyzed: na kevalam dvijaśreṣṭha narake duḥkha paddhatiḥ
translated: O best of Brahmins, not only is there a path of misery in hell,

original: svarge 'pi pātabhītasya kṣayiṣṇor nāsti nirvṛtiḥ // / / //
analyzed: svarge pi pāta bhītasya kṣayiṣṇoḥ nā asti nirvṛtiḥ
translated: Even in heaven, one who is afraid of falling and whose [good karma] is perishable, has no peace of mind.

original: punaś ca garbhe bhavati jāyate ca punar naraḥ /
analyzed: punar ca garbhe bhavati jāyate ca punar naraḥ
translated: Again, one enters the womb and is born as a human being.

original: garbhe vilīyate bhūyo jāyamāno 'stam eti ca // / / //
analyzed: garbhe vilīyate bhūyas jāyamānaḥ u stam eti ca
translated: and again dissolves away in the womb, and when born, it goes to destruction.

original: jātamātraś ca mriyate bālabhāve 'tha yauvane /
analyzed: jāta mātraḥ ca mriyate bāla bhāve yauvane
translated: One dies immediately after birth, or in childhood, or in youth,

original: madhyamaṃ vā vayaḥ prāpya vārddhake vā dhruvā mṛtiḥ // / / //
analyzed: madhyamam vā vayaḥ prāpya vārddhake vā dhruvā mṛtiḥ
translated: or having attained middle age, or in old age, death is certain.

original: yāvaj jīvati tāvac ca duḥkhair nānāvidhaiḥ plutaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat jīvati tāvat ca duḥkhaiḥ nānāvidhaiḥ plutaḥ
translated: As long as one lives, one is overwhelmed by various kinds of suffering,

original: tantukāraṇapakṣmaughair āste kārpāsabījavat // / / //🔽dravyanāśe tathotpattau pālane ca tathā nṛṇām /
analyzed: tantu kāraṇa pakṣma oghaiḥ āste kārpāsa bīja vat  dravya nāśe tathā utpattau pālane ca tathā nṛṇām
translated: like a cotton seed between the filaments, stalks, and petals.🔽For men, there are many sufferings in the loss and acquisition of wealth, and in its protection,

original: bhavanty anekaduḥkhāni tathaiveṣṭavipattiṣu // / / //
analyzed: bhavanti aneka duḥkhāni tathā evā iṣṭa vipattiṣu
translated: and likewise in the misfortune of what is desired.

original: yad yat prītikaraṃ puṃsāṃ vastu maitreya jāyate /
analyzed: yat yat prīti karam puṃsām vastu maitreya jāyate
translated: Whatever object brings pleasure to men, O Maitreya,

original: tad eva duḥkhavṛkṣasya bījatvam upagacchati // / / //🔽kalatraputramitrārthagṛhakṣetradhanādikaiḥ /
analyzed: tat eva duḥkha vṛkṣasya bīja tvam upagacchati  kalatra putra mitra artha gṛha kṣetra dhana ādikaiḥ
translated: that very thing becomes the seed of the tree of suffering.🔽For men, much happiness is not made as easily by wife, son, friends, wealth, house, field, money, and so on,

original: kriyate na tathā bhūri sukhaṃ puṃsāṃ yathāsukham // / / //
analyzed: kriyate na tathā bhūri sukham puṃsām yathāsukham
translated: as by mere contentment.

original: iti saṃsāraduḥkhārkatāpatāpitacetasām /
analyzed: iti saṃsāra duḥkha arka tāpa tāpita cetasām
translated: Thus, for those whose minds are scorched by the heat of the sun of the suffering of worldly existence,

original: vimuktipādapacchāyām ṛte kutra sukhaṃ nṛṇām // / / //
analyzed: vimukti pādapa chāyām ṛte kutra sukham nṛṇām
translated: where else can there be happiness for men except in the shade of the tree of liberation?

original: tad asya trividhasyāpi duḥkhajātasya paṇḍitaiḥ /
analyzed: tat asya trividhasya api duḥkha jātasya paṇḍitaiḥ
translated: Therefore, for this threefold type of suffering, the wise ones,

original: garbhajanmajarādyeṣu sthāneṣu prabhaviṣyataḥ // / / //🔽nirastātiśayāhlādasukhabhāvaikalakṣaṇā /
analyzed: garbha janma jarā ādyeṣu sthāneṣu prabhaviṣyataḥ  nirasta atiśaya āhlāda sukha bhāva eka lakṣaṇā
translated: which will have power over the stages of embryo, birth, old age, etc.🔽Having the sole characteristic of the feeling of bliss devoid of any superior excellence,

original: bheṣajaṃ bhagavatprāptir ekāntātyantikī matā // / / //
translated: the attainment of the Lord is considered as the remedy, which is absolutely and eternally lasting.

original: tasmāt tatprāptaye yatnaḥ kartavyaḥ paṇḍitair naraiḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tad prāptaye yatnaḥ kartavyaḥ paṇḍitaiḥ naraiḥ
translated: Therefore, effort should be made by learned men for attaining that.

original: tatprāptihetur jñānaṃ ca karma coktaṃ mahāmune // / / //
analyzed: tad prāpti hetuḥ jñānam ca karma ca uktam mahā mune
translated: The means of attaining that have been said by the great sage to be knowledge and action.

original: āgamotthaṃ vivekāc ca dvidhā jñānaṃ tathocyate /
analyzed: āgama uttham vivekāt ca dvidhā jñānam tathā ucyate
translated: Knowledge is said to be of two kinds, arising from scripture and from discrimination.

original: śabdabrahmāgamamayaṃ paraṃ brahma vivekajam // / / //🔽andhaṃ tama ivājñānaṃ dīpavac cendriyodbhavam /
analyzed: śabdabrahma āgama mayam param brahma viveka jam  andham tamaḥ iva ajñānam dīpa vat ca indriya udbhavam
translated: The knowledge arising from scripture is the Brahman of sound; the knowledge arising from discrimination is the supreme Brahman.🔽Ignorance is like blind darkness; the knowledge arising from the senses is like a lamp.

original: yathā sūryas tathā jñānaṃ yad viprarṣe vivekajam // / / //
analyzed: yathā sūryaḥ tathā jñānam yat viprarṣe viveka jam
translated: O Brahmin sage, the knowledge arising from discrimination is like the sun.

original: manur apy āha vedārthaṃ smṛtvā yan munisattama /
analyzed: manuḥ api āha veda artham smṛtvā yat muni sattama
translated: Manu also, the best of sages, having remembered the meaning of the Vedas,

original: tad etac chrūyatām atra saṃbandhe gadato mama // / / //🔽dve brahmaṇī veditavye śabdabrahma paraṃ ca yat /
analyzed: tat etat śrūyatām atra saṃbandhe gadataḥ mama  dve brahmaṇī veditavye śabdabrahma param ca yat
translated: let that be heard here in this context as I speak.🔽The two Brahmans should be known, the Brahman of sound and the supreme one.

original: śabdabrahmaṇi niṣṇātaḥ paraṃ brahmādhigacchati // / / //
analyzed: śabdabrahmaṇi niṣṇātaḥ param brahma adhigacchati
translated: One who is proficient in the Brahman of sound attains the supreme Brahman.

original: dve vidye veditavye vai iti cātharvaṇī śrutiḥ /
analyzed: dve vidye veditavye vai iti ca ātharvaṇī śrutiḥ
translated: The Atharvan Veda declares that the two kinds of knowledge should be known,

original: parayā tv akṣaraprāptir ṛgvedādimayāparā // / / //
analyzed: parayā tu akṣara prāptiḥ ṛgveda ādi mayā aparā
translated: and by the higher one, one attains the imperishable, and by the other consisting of the Rig Veda etc., one attains the perishable.

original: yat tad avyaktam ajaram acintyam ajam avyayam /
analyzed: yat tat avyaktam ajaram acintyam ajam avyayam
translated: That which is unmanifest, undecaying, inconceivable, unborn, imperishable,

original: anirdeśyam arūpaṃ ca pāṇipādādyasaṃyutam // / / //
analyzed: anirdeśyam arūpam ca pāṇi pāda ādi asaṃyutam
translated: indescribable, formless, devoid of hands, feet, etc.,

original: vibhuṃ sarvagataṃ nityaṃ bhūtayonim akāraṇam /
analyzed: vibhum sarva gatam nityam bhūta yonim akāraṇam
translated: omnipresent, all-pervading, eternal, the source of beings, without a cause,

original: vyāpy avyāptaṃ yataḥ sarvaṃ taṃ vai paśyanti sūrayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vyāpī avyāptam yatas sarvam tam vai paśyanti sūrayaḥ
translated: pervading and not pervading everything, the wise ones see that.

original: tad brahma tat paraṃ dhāma tad dhyeyaṃ mokṣakāṅks /iṇām /
analyzed: tat brahma tat param dhāma tat dhyeyam mokṣa kāṅksiṇām
translated: That is Brahman, that is the highest abode, that is to be meditated upon by those who desire liberation,

original: śrutivākyoditaṃ sūkṣmaṃ tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam // / / //🔽tad eva bhagavadvācyaṃ svarūpaṃ paramātmanaḥ /
analyzed: śruti vākya uditam sūkṣmam tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam  tat eva bhagavat vācyam svarūpam paramātmanaḥ
translated: that subtle supreme abode of Vishnu, declared in the statements of the Vedas.🔽That alone is the nature of the Supreme Self, which is denoted by the word Bhagavat.

original: vācako bhagavacchabdas tasyādyasyākṣayātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: vācakaḥ bhagavat śabdaḥ tasya ādyasya akṣaya ātmanaḥ
translated: The word Bhagavat is the denotator of that primordial imperishable Self.

original: evaṃ nigaditārthasya sa tattvaṃ tasya tattvataḥ /
analyzed: evam nigadita arthasya sa tattvam tasya tattvataḥ
translated: The truth of that, whose meaning has been thus stated, is known

original: jñāyate yena taj jñānaṃ param anyat trayīmayam // / / //
analyzed: jñāyate yena tat jñānam param anyat trayī mayam
translated: by that which is the highest knowledge, different from the three Vedas.

original: aśabdagocarasyāpi tasya vai brahmaṇo dvija /
analyzed: a śabda gocarasya api tasya vai brahmaṇaḥ dvija
translated: O Brahmin, that Brahman, which is beyond the reach of words,

original: pūjāyāṃ bhagavacchabdaḥ kriyate hy aupacārikaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pūjāyām bhagavat śabdaḥ kriyate hi aupacārikaḥ
translated: The word Bhagavat is used figuratively in worship.

original: śuddhe mahāvibhūtyākhye pare brahmaṇi vartate /
analyzed: śuddhe mahāvibhūti ākhye pare brahmaṇi vartate
translated: It resides in the pure supreme Brahman called Mahāvibhu,

original: maitreya bhagavacchabdaḥ sarvakāraṇakāraṇe // / / //
analyzed: maitreya bhagavat śabdaḥ sarva kāraṇa kāraṇe
translated: O Maitreya, the word Bhagavat in the cause of all causes.

original: saṃbharteti tathā bhartā bhakāro 'rthadvayānvitaḥ /
analyzed: saṃbhartā iti tathā bhartā bhakāraḥ rtha dvaya anvitaḥ
translated: The letter bha is associated with the meanings of bearing and supporting.

original: netā gamayitā sraṣṭā gakārārthas tathā mune // / / //
analyzed: netā gamayitā sraṣṭā gakāra arthaḥ tathā mune
translated: The letter ga means leading, guiding, and creating, O sage.

original: aiśvaryasya samagrasya vīryasya yaśasaḥ śriyaḥ /
analyzed: aiśvaryasya samagrasya vīryasya yaśasaḥ śriyaḥ
translated: Of all-powerful sovereignty, of heroism, of fame, of prosperity,

original: jñānavairāgyayoś caiva ṣaṇṇāṃ bhaga itīraṇā // / / //🔽vasanti tatra bhūtāni bhūtātmany akhilātmani /
analyzed: jñāna vairāgyayoḥ ca eva ṣaṇṇām bhagaḥ iti īraṇā  vasanti tatra bhūtāni bhūtātmani akhilātmani
translated: Of knowledge and detachment, the word bhagavat is derived from the six.🔽All beings reside in Him, the soul of all beings, the universal self.

original: sa ca bhūteṣv aśeṣeṣu vakārārthas tato 'vyayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sa ca bhūteṣu aśeṣeṣu vakāra arthaḥ tatas vyayaḥ
translated: And He, the imperishable, is in all beings. Thus is the meaning of the letter va.

original: evam eṣa mahāśabdo bhagavān iti sattama /
analyzed: evam eṣa mahā śabdaḥ bhagavān iti sattama
translated: Thus, O best one, this great word Bhagavat

original: paramabrahmabhūtasya vāsudevasya nānyagaḥ // / / //
analyzed: parama brahma bhūtasya vāsudevasya na anya gaḥ
translated: Belongs only to Vāsudeva, who is the supreme Brahman, not to anything else.

original: tatra pūjyapadārthoktiparibhāṣāsamanvitaḥ /
analyzed: tatra pūjya padārtha ukti paribhāṣā samanvitaḥ
translated: There, the word Bhagavat is used in its literal sense, along with the definition of the object of worship.

original: śabdo 'yaṃ nopacāreṇa anyatra hy upacārataḥ // / / //
analyzed: śabdaḥ yam na upacāreṇa anyatra hi upacārataḥ
translated: This word is not used figuratively, except in other cases where it is used figuratively.

original: utpattiṃ pralayaṃ caiva bhūtānām āgatiṃ gatim /
analyzed: utpattim pralayam ca eva bhūtānām āgatim gatim
translated: The origin and dissolution of beings, their coming and going,

original: vetti vidyām avidyāṃ ca sa vācyo bhagavān iti // / / //
analyzed: vetti vidyām avidyām ca sa vācyaḥ bhagavān iti
translated: He who knows both knowledge and ignorance, He is to be called the Blessed Lord.

original: jñānaśaktibalaiśvaryavīryatejāṃsy aśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: jñāna śakti bala aiśvarya vīrya tejāṃsi aśeṣatas
translated: Knowledge, power, strength, lordship, valor, and splendor, in their entirety,

original: bhagavacchabdavācyāni vinā heyair guṇādibhiḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhagavat śabda vācyāni vinā heyaiḥ guṇa ādibhiḥ
translated: are denoted by the word Blessed Lord, devoid of the faults of qualities and so on.

original: sarvāṇi tatra bhūtāni vasanti paramātmani /
analyzed: sarvāṇi tatra bhūtāni vasanti paramātmani
translated: All beings dwell in Him, the Supreme Self,

original: bhūteṣu ca sa sarvātmā vāsudevas tataḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhūteṣu ca sa sarva ātmā vāsudevaḥ tatas smṛtaḥ
translated: and He, the all-pervading Vasudeva, is known to be in all beings.

original: khāṇḍikyajanakāyāha pṛṣṭaḥ keśidhvajaḥ purā /
analyzed: khāṇḍikyajanakāya āha pṛṣṭaḥ keśidhvajaḥ purā
translated: To Khāṇḍikya Janaka, Keśidhvaja, asked in the past,

original: nāmavyākhyām anantasya vāsudevasya tattvataḥ // / / //
analyzed: nāma vyākhyām anantasya vāsudevasya tattvataḥ
translated: the true explanation of the name of the infinite Vasudeva.

original: bhūteṣu vasate so 'ntar vasanty atra ca tāni yat /
analyzed: bhūteṣu vasate saḥ u ntar vasanti atra ca tāni yat
translated: Because He dwells within all beings, and all beings are within Him,

original: dhātā vidhātā jagatāṃ vāsudevas tataḥ prabhuḥ // / / //
analyzed: dhātā vidhātā jagatām vāsudevaḥ tatas prabhuḥ
translated: the creator, the ordainer of the worlds, is Lord Vāsudeva.🔽For.

original: For / subst / / while ins / after
analyzed: for b subst after
translated: While inserting after

original: bhūteṣu yo 'ntar vasati sma nityaṃ sarvāṇi bhūtāni ca yatra santi /
analyzed: bhūteṣu yaḥ ntar vasati sma nityam sarvāṇi bhūtāni ca yatra santi
translated: He who always dwells within all beings, and in whom all beings exist,

original: dhātā vidhātā parameśvaraś ca sa vāsudevo na yataḥ paro 'nyaḥ // / / //
analyzed: dhātā vidhātā parameśvaraḥ ca sa vāsudevaḥ na yatas paraḥ nyaḥ
translated: the creator, the ordainer, the Supreme Lord, is Vāsudeva, there is nothing higher than Him.

original: sa sarvabhūtaprakṛtiṃ vikāraṃ guṇādidoṣāṃś ca mune vyatītaḥ /
analyzed: sa sarva bhūta prakṛtim vikāram guṇa ādi doṣān ca mune vyatītaḥ
translated: O sage, He is beyond the primordial nature of all beings, their modifications, qualities, and faults,

original: atītasarvāvaraṇo 'khilātmā tenāstṛtaṃ yad bhuvanāntarāle // / / //
analyzed: atīta sarva āvaraṇaḥ khila ātmā tena āstṛtam yat bhuvana antarāle
translated: He is the self of all, beyond all coverings. He is the one who pervades the space between the worlds.

original: samastakalyāṇaguṇātmako hi svaśaktileśāvṛtabhūtasargaḥ /
analyzed: samasta kalyāṇa guṇa ātmakaḥ hi sva śakti leśa āvṛta bhūta sargaḥ
translated: He is the embodiment of all auspicious qualities, his creation of elements covered by a small part of his power.

original: icchāgṛhītābhimatorudehaḥ saṃsādhitāśeṣajagaddhito 'sau // / / //
analyzed: icchā gṛhīta abhimata uru dehaḥ saṃsādhita aśeṣa jagat hitaḥ sau
translated: He has taken up a great desired body out of his own will, and has accomplished the welfare of the entire world.

original: tejobalaiśvaryamahāvabodha svavīryaśaktyādiguṇaikarāśiḥ /
analyzed: tejaḥ bala aiśvarya mahā avabodha sva vīrya śakti ādi guṇa eka rāśiḥ
translated: He is a mass of qualities like radiance, strength, lordship, great knowledge, his own power, and so on.

original: paraḥ parāṇāṃ sakalā na yatra kleśādayaḥ santi parāvareśe // / / //
analyzed: paraḥ parāṇām sakalāḥ na yatra kleśa ādayaḥ santi parāvara īśe
translated: In the highest of the high, where the lord of the highest and the lowest has no afflictions etc.,

original: sa īśvaro vyaṣṭisamaṣṭirūpo 'vyaktasvarūpaḥ prakaṭasvarūpaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ īśvaraḥ vyaṣṭi samaṣṭi rūpaḥ vyakta svarūpaḥ prakaṭa svarūpaḥ
translated: He is the lord, in the form of the individual and the universal, in the unmanifest form, in the manifest form,

original: sarveśvaraḥ sarvadṛk sarvavettā samastaśaktiḥ parameśvarākhyaḥ // / / //
translated: The lord of all, the seer of all, the knower of all, the embodiment of all powers, known as the supreme lord.

original: saṃjñāyate yena tad astadoṣaṃ śuddhaṃ paraṃ nirmalam ekarūpam /
analyzed: saṃjñāyate yena tat asta doṣam śuddham param nirmalam eka rūpam
translated: By which that faultless, pure, supreme, stainless, one-formed (reality) is known,

original: saṃdṛśyate vāpy avagamyate vā taj jñānam ajñānam ato 'nyad uktam // / / //
analyzed: saṃdṛśyate vā api avagamyate vā tat jñānam ajñānam atas uktam
translated: That is knowledge, other than that is said to be ignorance.

original: ins /🔽vyarthaṃ janmaśataṃ tasya śrutvā vaktraparāṅmukhaḥ // / / / //
analyzed: d ins  vyartham janma śatam tasya śrutvā vaktra parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: Inserts:🔽His hundred useless births are heard, turning away from the face.

original: aśvamedhasamaṃ jñeyaṃ kurukṣetraśatādhikam // / / / //
analyzed: aśvamedha samam jñeyam kurukṣetra śata adhikam
translated: It should be known as equal to a horse sacrifice, more than a hundred Kurus.

original: niṣphalaṃ jīvitaṃ tasya asya jñānaparāṅmukhaḥ // / / / //
analyzed: niṣphalam jīvitam tasya asya jñāna parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: The life of him who is averse to this knowledge is fruitless.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe ṣaṣṭhe 'ṃśe pañcamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe ṣaṣṭhe ṃśe pañcamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fifth chapter in the sixth section of the Visnu Purana.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: svādhyāyasaṃyamābhyāṃ sa dṛśyate puruṣottamaḥ /
analyzed: svādhyāya saṃyamābhyām sa dṛśyate puruṣottamaḥ
translated: That Supreme Being is seen through self-study and control.

original: tatprāptikāraṇaṃ brahma tad etad iti paṭhyate // / / //
analyzed: tad prāpti kāraṇam brahma tat etat iti paṭhyate
translated: The cause of attaining Him is said to be this Brahman.

original: svādhyāyād yogam āsīta yogāt svādhyāyam ācaret /
analyzed: svādhyāyāt yogam āsīta yogāt svādhyāyam ācaret
translated: One should sit in yoga through self-study and practice self-study through yoga.

original: svādhyāyayogasaṃpattyā paramātmā prakāśate // / / //
analyzed: svādhyāya yoga saṃpattyā paramātmā prakāśate
translated: By the perfection of self-study and yoga, the Supreme Self is revealed.

original: tadīkṣaṇāya svādhyāyaś cakṣur yogas tathāparam /
analyzed: tad īkṣaṇāya svādhyāyaḥ cakṣuḥ yogaḥ tathā aparam
translated: Self-study is for seeing Him, and yoga is the other eye.

original: na māṃsacakṣuṣā draṣṭuṃ brahmabhūtaḥ sa śakyate // / / //
analyzed: na māṃsa cakṣuṣā draṣṭum brahma bhūtaḥ sa śakyate
translated: The one who has become Brahman cannot be seen by the physical eye.

original: maitreya uvāca /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca
translated: Maitreya said:

original: bhagavaṃs tam ahaṃ yogaṃ jñātum icchāmi taṃ vada /
analyzed: bhagavan tam aham yogam jñātum icchāmi tam vada
translated: O Lord, I wish to know that yoga, please tell me.

original: jñāte yatrākhilādhāraṃ paśyeyaṃ parameśvaram // / / //
analyzed: jñāte yatra akhila ādhāram paśyeyam parameśvaram
translated: Having known it, I will see the Supreme Lord, the support of all.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: yathā keśidhvajaḥ prāha khāṇḍikyāya mahātmane /
analyzed: yathā keśidhvajaḥ prāha khāṇḍikyāya mahātmane
translated: As Keshi-dvaja told the great soul Khandinya,

original: janakāya purā yogaṃ tathāhaṃ kathayāmi te // / / //
analyzed: janakāya purā yogam tathā aham kathayāmi te
translated: So I will tell you the yoga that he told Janaka in the past.

original: maitreya uvāca /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ uvāca
translated: Maitreya said:

original: khāṇḍikyaḥ ko 'bhavad brahman ko vā keśidhvajo 'bhavat /
analyzed: khāṇḍikyaḥ kaḥ bhavat brahman kaḥ vā keśidhvajaḥ bhavat
translated: Who was that Khandinya, O Brahmana, and who was that Keshi-dvaja?

original: kathaṃ tayoś ca saṃvādo yogasaṃbandhavān abhūt // / / //
analyzed: katham tayoḥ ca saṃvādaḥ yoga saṃbandhavān abhūt
translated: How did they hold conversation with each other, which was connected with Yoga?

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: dharmadhvajo vai janakas tasya putro 'mitadhvajaḥ /
analyzed: dharmadhvajaḥ vai janakaḥ tasya putraḥ mitadhvajaḥ
translated: Janaka was Dharma-dvaja, his son was Amitadvaja,

original: kṛtadhvajaś ca nāmnāsīt sadādhyātmaratir nṛpaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṛtadhvajaḥ ca nāmnā āsīt sadā adhyātma ratiḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: and Kritadvaja was a king who was always devoted to spiritual matters.

original: kṛtadhvajasya putro 'bhūt khyātaḥ keśidhvajo dvija /
analyzed: kṛtadhvajasya putraḥ bhūt khyātaḥ keśidhvajaḥ dvija
translated: O Brahmana, Kritadvaja had a son named Keshi-dvaja.

original: putro 'mitadhvajasyāpi khāṇḍikyajanako 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: putraḥ mitadhvajasya api khāṇḍikyajanakaḥ bhavat
translated: And Amitadvaja's son was Khandinya Janaka.

original: karmamārge 'ti khāṇḍikyaḥ pṛthivyām abhavat kṛtī /
analyzed: karma mārge ti khāṇḍikyaḥ pṛthivyām abhavat kṛtī
translated: Khandinya was successful in the path of action on earth.

original: keśidhvajo 'py atīvāsīd ātmavidyāviśāradaḥ // / / //
analyzed: keśidhvajaḥ pi atīva āsīt ātma vidyā viśāradaḥ
translated: And Keshi-dvaja was also very learned in the knowledge of the self.

original: tāv ubhāv api caivāstāṃ vijigīṣū parasparam /
analyzed: tau ubhau api ca evā āstām vijigīṣū parasparam
translated: Both of them were desirous of conquering each other.

original: keśidhvajena khāṇḍikyaḥ svarājyād avaropitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: keśidhvajena khāṇḍikyaḥ sva rājyāt avaropitaḥ
translated: Khandinya was deposed from his kingdom by Keshi-dvaja.

original: purodhasā mantribhiś ca samaveto 'lpasādhanaḥ /
analyzed: purodhasā mantribhiḥ ca samavetaḥ lpa sādhanaḥ
translated: He, having little means, assembled with his priest and ministers,

original: rājyān nirākṛtaḥ so 'tha durgāraṇyacaro 'bhavat // / / //
analyzed: rājyāt nirākṛtaḥ saḥ tha durga araṇya caraḥ bhavat
translated: and being expelled from the kingdom, he wandered in the inaccessible forest.

original: iyāja so 'pi subahūn yajñāñ /
analyzed: iyāja saḥ pi su bahūn
translated: He also performed many sacrifices,

original: jñānavyapāśrayaḥ /
analyzed: jñāna vyapāśrayaḥ
translated: taking refuge in knowledge.

original: brahmavidyām adhiṣṭhāya tartuṃ mṛtyum avidyayā // / / //🔽ekadā vartamānasya yāge yogavidāṃ vara /
analyzed: brahma vidyām adhiṣṭhāya tartum mṛtyum avidyayā  ekadā vartamānasya yāge yoga vidām vara
translated: and to cross death through ignorance of Brahman.🔽Once, when he was performing a sacrifice, O best of those who know yoga,

original: dharmadhenuṃ jaghānograḥ śārdūlo vijane vane // / / //
analyzed: dharmadhenum jaghāna ugraḥ śārdūlaḥ vijane vane
translated: a fierce tiger killed the sacrificial cow in a deserted forest.

original: tato rājā hatāṃ jñātvā dhenuṃ vyāghreṇa ṛtvijaḥ /
analyzed: tatas rājā hatām jñātvā dhenum vyāghreṇa ṛtvijaḥ
translated: Then the king, knowing that the cow had been killed by the tiger,

original: prāyaścittaṃ sa papraccha kim atreti vidhīyate // / / //
analyzed: prāyaścittam sa papraccha kim atra iti vidhīyate
translated: asked the priests what expiation should be performed in this case.

original: te cocur na vayaṃ vidmaḥ kaśeruḥ pṛcchyatām iti /
analyzed: te ca ūcuḥ na vayam vidmaḥ kaśeruḥ pṛcchyatām iti
translated: They said, We do not know. Ask Kasheruka.

original: kaśerur api tenoktas tatheti prāha bhārgavam // / / //
analyzed: kaśeruḥ api tena uktaḥ tathā iti prāha bhārgavam
translated: Kasheruka, when asked by him, said to Bhargava, So be it.

original: śunakaṃ pṛccha rājendra nāhaṃ vedmi sa vetsyati /
analyzed: śunakam pṛccha rāja indra na aham vedmi sa vetsyati
translated: Ask Shunaka, O lord of kings. I do not know. He will know.

original: sa gatvā tam apṛcchac ca so 'py āha śṛṇu yan mune // / / //
analyzed: sa gatvā tam apṛcchat ca saḥ u pi āha śṛṇu yat mune
translated: He went and asked him. He also said, Listen, O sage.

original: na kaśerur na caivāhaṃ na cānyaḥ sāmprataṃ bhuvi /
analyzed: na kaśeruḥ na ca eva aham na ca anyaḥ sāmpratam bhuvi
translated: Neither Kasheruka, nor I, nor anyone else on earth at present,

original: vetty eka eva tvacchatruḥ khāṇḍikyo yo jitas tvayā // / / //
analyzed: vetti ekaḥ eva tvad śatruḥ khāṇḍikyaḥ yaḥ jitaḥ tvayā
translated: knows except your enemy, Khandika, whom you have defeated.

original: sa cāha taṃ prayāmy eṣa praṣṭum ātmaripuṃ mune /
analyzed: sa ca āha tam prayāmi eṣa praṣṭum ātma ripum mune
translated: He said to him, I am going to ask him, O sage, who is my enemy.

original: prāpta eva mayā yajño yadi māṃ sa haniṣyati // / / //
analyzed: prāptaḥ eva mayā yajñaḥ yadi mām sa haniṣyati
translated: If he kills me, the sacrifice will be accomplished for me.

original: prāyaścittaṃ sa cet pṛṣṭo vadiṣyati ripur mama /
analyzed: prāyaścittam sa ced pṛṣṭaḥ vadiṣyati ripuḥ mama
translated: If, when questioned, the enemy tells me the expiation,

original: tataś cāvikalo yāgo muniśreṣṭha bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: tatas ca avikalaḥ yāgaḥ muni śreṣṭha bhaviṣyati
translated: then, O best of sages, the sacrifice will be complete.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: ity uktvā ratham āruhya kṛṣṇājinadharo nṛpaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktvā ratham āruhya kṛṣṇa ajina dharaḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: Having said this, the king, wearing a black antelope skin, mounted his chariot

original: vanaṃ jagāma yatrāste khāṇḍikyaḥ sa mahāmatiḥ // / / //🔽tam āyāntaṃ samālokya khāṇḍikyo ripum ātmanaḥ /
analyzed: vanam jagāma yatra āste khāṇḍikyaḥ sa mahāmatiḥ  tam āyāntam samālokya khāṇḍikyaḥ ripum ātmanaḥ
translated: and went to the forest where the greatly wise Khandinya was staying.🔽Seeing him coming, Khandinya, his eyes red with anger, raised his bow

original: provāca krodhatāmrākṣaḥ samāropitakārmukaḥ // / / //
analyzed: provāca krodha tāmra akṣaḥ samāropita kārmukaḥ
translated: and said to his enemy.

original: khāṇḍikya uvāca /
analyzed: khāṇḍikyaḥ uvāca
translated: Khandinya said:

original: kṛṣṇājinaṃ tvaṃ kavacam ābadhyāsmān nihaṃsyasi /🔽kṛṣṇājinadhare vetsi na mayi prahariṣyati // / / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇa ajinam tvam kavacam ābadhya asmān nihaṃsyasi  kṛṣṇa ajina dhare vetsi na mayi prahariṣyati
translated: You will put on the black antelope skin as armor and kill us.🔽You know that the one wearing a black antelope skin will not strike me.

original: mṛgāṇāṃ vada pṛṣṭheṣu mūḍha kṛṣṇājinaṃ na kim /
analyzed: mṛgāṇām vada pṛṣṭheṣu mūḍha kṛṣṇājinam na kim
translated: O fool, do you not see the black antelope skin on the backs of deer,

original: yeṣāṃ mayā tvayā cogrāḥ prahitāḥ śitasāyakāḥ // / / //
analyzed: yeṣām mayā tvayā ca ugrāḥ prahitāḥ śita sāyakāḥ
translated: whose sharp arrows have been shot by me and you?

original: sa tvām ahaṃ haniṣyāmi na me jīvan vimokṣyase /
analyzed: sa tvām aham haniṣyāmi na me jīvan vimokṣyase
translated: I will kill you, you will not escape me alive.

original: ātatāyy asi durbuddhe mama rājyaharo ripuḥ // / / //
analyzed: ātatāyī asi durbuddhe mama rājya haraḥ ripuḥ
translated: O evil-minded one, you are an assassin, an enemy who has taken away my kingdom.

original: keśidhvaja uvāca /
analyzed: keśidhvajaḥ uvāca
translated: Keshidhwaja said:

original: khāṇḍikya saṃśayaṃ praṣṭuṃ bhavantam aham āgataḥ /
analyzed: khāṇḍikya saṃśayam praṣṭum bhavantam aham āgataḥ
translated: O Khandinya, I have come to ask you a question about doubt.

original: na tvāṃ hantuṃ vicāryaitat kopaṃ bāṇaṃ vimuñca vā // / / //
analyzed: na tvām hantum vicārya etat kopam bāṇam vimuñca vā
translated: But after consideration, I do not find any reason for slaying you. Therefore, either give up your anger or discharge your arrow.

original: parāśara uvāca /🔽tataḥ sa mantribhiḥ sārdham ekānte sapurohitaiḥ /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca  tatas sa mantribhiḥ sārdham ekānte sa purohitaiḥ
translated: Parashara said:🔽Then the greatly wise Khandinya, along with his ministers and priests,

original: mantrayām āsa khāṇḍikyaḥ sarvair eva mahāmatiḥ // / / //
analyzed: mantrayām āsa khāṇḍikyaḥ sarvaiḥ eva mahāmatiḥ
translated: held a private consultation with all of them.

original: tam ūcur mantriṇo vadhyo ripur eṣa vaśaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: tam ūcuḥ mantriṇaḥ vadhyaḥ ripuḥ eṣa vaśam gataḥ
translated: The ministers said to him, This enemy, now under our control, should be killed.

original: hate tu pṛthivī sarvā tava vaśyā bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: hate tu pṛthivī sarvā tava vaśyā bhaviṣyati
translated: If he is killed, the entire earth will come under your sway.

original: khāṇḍikyaś cāha tān sarvān evam etan na saṃśayaḥ /🔽hate tu pṛthivī sarvā mama vaśyā bhaviṣyati // / / //
analyzed: khāṇḍikyaḥ ca āha tān sarvān evam etat na saṃśayaḥ  hate tu pṛthivī sarvā mama vaśyā bhaviṣyati
translated: Khandinya said to them all, This is certainly so.🔽If he is killed, the entire earth will come under my sway.

original: paralokajayas tasya pṛthivī sakalā mama /
analyzed: para loka jayaḥ tasya pṛthivī sakalā mama
translated: If he conquers the next world, the entire earth is mine.

original: na hanmi cel lokajayo mama tv asya vasuṃdharā // / / //
analyzed: na hanmi ced loka jayaḥ mama tu asya vasuṃdharā
translated: If I do not kill him, the conquest of the world is mine, and the earth is his.

original: ed / Veṅk / ins /
analyzed: e t veṅk ins
translated: Ed. Veṅkaṭa inserts:

original: nāhaṃ manye lokajayād adhikā syād vasuṃdharā // / / //
analyzed: na aham manye loka jayāt adhikā syāt vasuṃdharā
translated: I do not think the earth can be greater than the conquest of the world.

original: paralokajayo 'nantaḥ svalpakālo mahījayaḥ /
translated: The conquest of the next world is endless, the conquest of the earth is for a short time.

original: tasmād enaṃ na haniṣye yat pṛcchati vadāmi tat // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt enam na haniṣye yat pṛcchati vadāmi tat
translated: Therefore, I will not kill him. I will answer whatever he asks.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tatas tam abhyupetyāha khāṇḍikyajanako ripum /
analyzed: tatas tam abhyupetya āha khāṇḍikyajanakaḥ ripum
translated: Then Khandinya Janaka approached his enemy and said:

original: praṣṭavyaṃ yat tvayā sarvaṃ tat pṛcchasva vadāmy aham // / / //
analyzed: praṣṭavyam yat tvayā sarvam tat pṛcchasva vadāmi aham
translated: Whatever you wish to ask, ask me now. I shall tell you everything.

original: tataḥ sarvaṃ yathāvṛttaṃ dharmadhenuvadhaṃ dvija /
analyzed: tatas sarvam yathāvṛttam dharmadhenu vadham dvija
translated: Then, O twice-born one, having told everything as it happened, the killing of the cow of Dharma,

original: kathayitvā sa papraccha prāyaścittaṃ hi tadgatam // / / //
analyzed: kathayitvā sa papraccha prāyaścittam hi tad gatam
translated: he asked about the expiation that was appropriate for that.

original: sa cācaṣṭa yathānyāyaṃ dvija keśidhvajāya tat /
analyzed: sa ca ācaṣṭa yathānyāyam dvija keśidhvajāya tat
translated: And he duly told Keshi-dhvaja, O twice-born one,

original: prāyaścittam aśeṣeṇa yad vai tatra vidhīyate // / / //
analyzed: prāyaścittam aśeṣeṇa yat vai tatra vidhīyate
translated: the entire expiation that is prescribed for that.

original: viditārthaḥ sa tenaiva anujñāto mahātmanā /
analyzed: vidita arthaḥ sa tena eva anujñātaḥ mahātmanā
translated: Having understood the truth, he was permitted by that great soul.

original: yāgabhūmim upāgamya cakre sarvāḥ kriyāḥ kramāt // / / //🔽krameṇa vidhivad yāgaṃ nītvā so 'vabhṛthāplutaḥ /
analyzed: yāga bhūmim upāgamya cakre sarvāḥ kriyāḥ kramāt  krameṇa vidhivat yāgam nītvā saḥ vabhṛtha āplutaḥ
translated: Having gone to the sacrificial ground, he performed all the rites in order.🔽Having duly completed the sacrifice in due order and bathed in the Avabhṛtha,

original: kṛtakṛtyas tato bhūtvā cintayām āsa pārthivaḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṛtakṛtyaḥ tatas bhūtvā cintayām āsa pārthivaḥ
translated: the king, having accomplished his purpose, then thought:

original: pūjitā ṛtvijaḥ sarve sadasyā mānitā mayā /
analyzed: pūjitāḥ ṛtvijaḥ sarve sadasyāḥ mānitāḥ mayā
translated: All the priests have been honored by me, and the assembly has been respected by me.

original: tathaivārthijano 'py arthair yojito 'bhimatair mayā // / / //
analyzed: tathā eva arthi janaḥ pi arthaiḥ yojitaḥ bhimataiḥ mayā
translated: And likewise, the supplicants have been provided with their desired wealth by me.

original: yathārham atra lokasya mayā sarvaṃ viceṣṭitam /
analyzed: yathārham atra lokasya mayā sarvam viceṣṭitam
translated: Everything has been done by me here in the world as befits it.

original: aniṣpannakriyaṃ cetas tathāpi mama kiṃ yathā // / / //
analyzed: aniṣpanna kriyam cetaḥ tathā api mama kim yathā
translated: But still, my mind is not satisfied as to what should be done.

original: itthaṃ saṃcintayann eva sasmāra sa mahīpatiḥ /
analyzed: ittham saṃcintayan eva sasmāra sa mahīpatiḥ
translated: Thinking thus, the king remembered:

original: khāṇḍikyāya na datteti mayā vai gurudakṣiṇā // / / //
analyzed: khāṇḍikyāya na dattā iti mayā vai guru dakṣiṇā
translated: I have not given the guru-fee to Khaṇḍikya.

original: sa jagāma tato bhūyo ratham āruhya pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: sa jagāma tatas bhūyas ratham āruhya pārthivaḥ
translated: Then the king again mounted his chariot and went

original: maitreya durgagahanaṃ khāṇḍikyo yatra saṃsthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: maitreya durga gahanam khāṇḍikyaḥ yatra saṃsthitaḥ
translated: to the place where Khaṇḍikya was staying in the inaccessible forest, O Maitreya.

original: khāṇḍikyo 'pi punar dṛṣṭvā tam āyāntaṃ dhṛtāyudhaḥ /
analyzed: khāṇḍikyaḥ pi punar dṛṣṭvā tam āyāntam dhṛta āyudhaḥ
translated: Khaṇḍikya, seeing him coming again with his weapon held,

original: tasthau hantuṃ kṛtamatis tam āha sa punar nṛpaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tasthau hantum kṛta matiḥ tam āha sa punar nṛpaḥ
translated: stood ready to kill him. The king again said to him:

original: bho nāhaṃ te 'pakārāya prāptaḥ khāṇḍikya mā krudhaḥ /
analyzed: bho na aham te pakārāya prāptaḥ khāṇḍikya mā krudhaḥ
translated: O Khaṇḍikya, I have come not to harm you, do not be angry.

original: guror niṣkrayadānāya mām avehi tvam āgatam // / / //
analyzed: guroḥ niṣkraya dānāya mām avehi tvam āgatam
translated: Know that I have come to give the guru-fee.

original: niṣpādito mayā yāgaḥ samyak tvadupadeśataḥ /
analyzed: niṣpāditaḥ mayā yāgaḥ samyak tvad upadeśataḥ
translated: The sacrifice has been performed by me properly according to your instructions.

original: so 'haṃ te dātum icchāmi vṛṇuṣva gurudakṣiṇām // / / //
analyzed: saḥ u ham te dātum icchāmi vṛṇuṣva guru dakṣiṇām
translated: I wish to give it to you. Choose the guru-fee.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: bhūyaḥ sa mantribhiḥ sārdhaṃ mantrayām āsa pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: bhūyas sa mantribhiḥ sārdham mantrayām āsa pārthivaḥ
translated: The king again consulted with his ministers:

original: guruniṣkṛtikāmo 'tra kim ayaṃ prārthyatām iti // / / //
analyzed: guru niṣkṛti kāmaḥ tra kim ayam prārthyatām iti
translated: Here he wants to repay the guru. What should we ask him for?

original: tam ūcur mantriṇo rājyam aśeṣaṃ prārthyatām ayam /
analyzed: tam ūcuḥ mantriṇaḥ rājyam aśeṣam prārthyatām ayam
translated: The ministers said: Ask him for the entire kingdom.

original: kṛtibhiḥ prārthyate rājyam anāyāsitasainikaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: kṛtibhiḥ prārthyate rājyam an āyāsita sainikaiḥ
translated: By the wise, who do not trouble their soldiers, is sought a kingdom.

original: prahasya tān āha nṛpaḥ sa khāṇḍikyo mahāmatiḥ /
analyzed: prahasya tān āha nṛpaḥ sa khāṇḍikyaḥ mahāmatiḥ
translated: The greatly wise king Khāṇḍikya, smiling, said to them:

original: svalpakālaṃ mahīrājyaṃ mādṛśaiḥ prārthyate katham // / / //
analyzed: su alpa kālam mahī rājyam mādṛśaiḥ prārthyate katham
translated: How can a kingdom be sought by one like me for a short time?

original: evam etad bhavanto 'tra arthasādhanamantriṇaḥ /
analyzed: evam etat bhavantaḥ tra artha sādhana mantriṇaḥ
translated: Thus, you are the ministers here, seeking the means of attaining wealth.

original: paramārthaḥ kathaṃ ko 'tra yūyaṃ nātra vicakṣaṇāḥ // / / //
analyzed: parama arthaḥ katham yūyam na atra vicakṣaṇāḥ
translated: What is the highest truth here? You are not experts in this.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parāśara said:

original: ity uktvā samupetyainaṃ sa tu keśidhvajaṃ nṛpam /
analyzed: iti uktvā samupetya enam sa tu keśidhvajam nṛpam
translated: Having said this, he approached that king Keśidhvaja,

original: uvāca kim avaśyaṃ tvaṃ dadāsi gurudakṣiṇām // / / //
analyzed: uvāca kim avaśyam tvam dadāsi guru dakṣiṇām
translated: and said, Do you certainly give the guru-fee?

original: bāḍham ity eva tenoktaḥ khāṇḍikyas tam athābravīt /
analyzed: bāḍham iti eva tena uktaḥ khāṇḍikyaḥ tam athā bravīt
translated: Certainly, said by him, Khāṇḍikya then said to him:

original: bhavān adhyātmavijñānaparamārthavicakṣaṇaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhavān adhyātma vijñāna parama artha vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: You are skilled in the highest truth of the knowledge of the self.

original: yadi ced dīyate mahyaṃ bhavatā guruniṣkrayaḥ /
analyzed: yadi ced dīyate mahyam bhavatā guru niṣkrayaḥ
translated: If you give me the guru-fee,

original: tat kleśapraśamāyālaṃ yat karma tad udīraya // / / //
analyzed: tat kleśa praśamāya alam yat karma tat udīraya
translated: then tell me that deed which is capable of removing suffering.

original: iti śrīviṣṇupurāṇe ṣaṣṭhe 'ṃśe ṣaṣṭho 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī viṣṇupurāṇe ṣaṣṭhe ṃśe ṣaṣṭhaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixth chapter in the sixth book of the Viṣṇu Purāṇa, composed by the sage Parāśara.

original: keśidhvaja uvāca /
analyzed: keśidhvajaḥ uvāca
translated: Keśidhvaja said:

original: na prārthitaṃ tvayā kasmān mama rājyam akaṇṭakam /
analyzed: na prārthitam tvayā kasmāt mama rājyam akaṇṭakam
translated: Why do you not ask for my kingdom free from thorns?

original: rājyalābhād vinā nānyat kṣatriyāṇām atipriyam // / / //
analyzed: rājya lābhāt vinā na anyat kṣatriyāṇām atipriyam
translated: For Kshatriyas there is nothing more pleasing than the acquisition of a kingdom.

original: khāṇḍikya uvāca /
analyzed: khāṇḍikyaḥ uvāca
translated: Khandinya said:

original: keśidhvaja nibodha tvaṃ mayā na prārthitaṃ yataḥ /
analyzed: keśidhvaja nibodha tvam mayā na prārthitam yatas
translated: O Keshi-dvaja, understand that I did not ask for this,

original: rājyam etad aśeṣaṃ te yatra gṛdhnanty apaṇḍitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: rājyam etat aśeṣam te yatra gṛdhnanti apaṇḍitāḥ
translated: this entire kingdom where the unwise are greedy.

original: kṣatriyāṇām ayaṃ dharmo yat prajāparipālanam /
analyzed: kṣatriyāṇām ayam dharmaḥ yat prajā paripālanam
translated: This is the duty of Kshatriyas, to protect the subjects,

original: vadhaś ca dharmayuddhena svarājyaparipanthinām // / / //
analyzed: vadhaḥ ca dharma yuddhena sva rājya paripanthinām
translated: and to kill those who oppose their own kingdom in a righteous battle.

original: After / ins /
analyzed: after g ins
translated: After this, the text continues:

original: yat prajāpālanaṃ yac ca svarājyapratipakṣaṇām // / / //
analyzed: yat prajā pālanam yat ca sva rājya pratipakṣaṇām
translated: Where there is the protection of the subjects and the defense of one's own kingdom,

original: yatrāśaktasya me doṣo naivāsty apahṛte tvayā /
analyzed: yatrā aśaktasya me doṣaḥ nā evā asti apahṛte tvayā
translated: since I am powerless, I have no fault in this, even though you have taken it away.

original: bandhāyaiva bhavaty eṣā avidyāpy akramojjhitā // / / //
analyzed: bandhāya eva bhavati eṣā avidyā api a krama ujjhitā
translated: This ignorance, when abandoned without sequence, leads only to bondage.

original: janmopabhogalipsārtham iyaṃ rājyaspṛhā mama /
analyzed: janma upabhoga lipsā artham iyam rājya spṛhā mama
translated: This desire for the kingdom is for the sake of obtaining birth and enjoyment for me.

original: anyeṣāṃ doṣajā naiva dharmam evānurudhyate // / / //
analyzed: anyeṣām doṣa jā na eva dharmam eva anurudhyate
translated: It does not arise from the faults of others, but follows only dharma.

original: na yācñā kṣatrabandhūnāṃ dharmāyaitat satāṃ matam // / / //
analyzed: na yācñā kṣatrabandhūnām dharmāya etat satām matam
translated: Begging is not for Kshatriyas, this is the opinion of the virtuous.

original: After ins /
analyzed: after ap g ins
translated: After this, the text continues:

original: janmopabhogakṣayadaṃ yogād anyan na vidyate // / / / //
analyzed: janma upabhoga kṣaya dam yogāt anyat na vidyate
translated: There is nothing else besides yoga that leads to the destruction of birth, enjoyment, and exhaustion.

original: brahmavīhi mahābhāga yogaṃ yogaviduttama // / / / //
analyzed: brahma vīhi mahābhāga yogam yoga vid uttama
translated: O Brahmana, O greatly fortunate one, O best of those who know Yoga, I ask you about Yoga.

original: vijñātayogaśāstrārthāḥ tvam asyān nimisaṃtatau // / / / //
analyzed: vijñāta yoga śāstra arthāḥ tvam nimi saṃtatau
translated: You who know the meaning of the scriptures on Yoga, in this lineage of Nimi,

original: ato na yācitaṃ rājyam avidyāntargataṃ tava // / / //
analyzed: atas na yācitam rājyam avidyā antargatam tava
translated: Therefore, I do not ask for the kingdom that is enveloped in ignorance.

original: rājye gṛdhnanty avidvāṃso mamatvāhṛtacetasaḥ /
analyzed: rājye gṛdhnanti avidvāṃsaḥ mamatva āhṛta cetasaḥ
translated: The ignorant, their minds captivated by possessiveness, crave for kingdoms.

original: ahaṃmānamahāpānamadamattā na mādṛśāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ahaṃmāna mahā pāna mada mattāḥ na mādṛśāḥ
translated: We who are intoxicated by the great drink of egoism are not like them.

original: parāśara uvāca /
analyzed: parāśaraḥ uvāca
translated: Parashara said:

original: tataḥ prahṛṣṭaḥ sādhv iti prāha keśidhvajo nṛpaḥ /
analyzed: tatas prahṛṣṭaḥ sādhu iti prāha keśidhvajaḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: Then King Keshidhwaja joyfully said, Excellent!

original: khāṇḍikyajanakaṃ prītyā śrūyatāṃ vacanaṃ mama // / / //🔽aham avidyayā mṛtyuṃ tartukāmaḥ karomi vai /
analyzed: khāṇḍikyajanakam prītyā śrūyatām vacanam mama  aham avidyayā mṛtyum tartu kāmaḥ karomi vai
translated: With affection, he said to the father of Khandinya, 'Listen to my words.

original: rājyaṃ yāgāṃś ca vividhān bhogaiḥ puṇyakṣayaṃ tathā // / / //
analyzed: rājyam yāgān ca vividhān bhogaiḥ puṇya kṣayam tathā
translated: I, desiring to cross death through ignorance, am performing various sacrifices and kingdoms, and through enjoyments, I am exhausting my merit.'

original: tad idaṃ te mano diṣṭyā vivekaiśvaryatāṃ gatam /
analyzed: tat idam te manaḥ diṣṭyā viveka aiśvarya tām gatam
translated: By good fortune, your mind has attained the sovereignty of discrimination.

original: śrūyatāṃ cāpy avidyāyāḥ svarūpaṃ kulanandana // / / //
analyzed: śrūyatām ca api avidyāyāḥ svarūpam kula nandana
translated: And listen, O delighter of the family, to the nature of ignorance.

original: anātmany ātmabuddhir yā asve svam iti yā matiḥ /
analyzed: anātmani ātma buddhiḥ yā asve svam iti yā matiḥ
translated: The notion of the self in what is not the self, and the idea that what is not mine is mine,

original: avidyātarusaṃbhūtibījam etad dvidhā sthitam // / / //
analyzed: avidyā taru saṃbhūti bījam etat dvidhā sthitam
translated: This is the twofold seed of the growth of the tree of ignorance.

original: pañcabhūtātmake dehe dehī mohatamovṛtaḥ /
analyzed: pañcabhūta ātmake dehe dehī moha tamaḥ vṛtaḥ
translated: The embodied soul, enveloped in the darkness of delusion, in this body consisting of the five elements,

original: aham etad itīty uccaiḥ kurute kumatir matim // / / //
analyzed: aham etat iti iti uccais kurute kumatiḥ matim
translated: The deluded one loudly proclaims the thought: This is mine.

original: ākāśavāyvagnijalapṛthivībhyaḥ pṛthak sthite /
analyzed: ākāśa vāyu agni jala pṛthivībhyaḥ pṛthak sthite
translated: Existing separately from space, air, fire, water, and earth,

original: ātmany ātmamayaṃ bhāvaṃ kaḥ karoti kalevare // / / //
analyzed: ātmani ātma mayam bhāvam kaḥ karoti kalevare
translated: Who makes the idea of the body being one's own in the self, in this lifeless body?

original: kalevaropabhogyaṃ hi gṛhakṣetrādikaṃ ca kaḥ /
analyzed: kalevara upabhogyam hi gṛha kṣetra ādikam ca kaḥ
translated: For the house, field, and so on are indeed to be enjoyed by the body.

original: adehe hy ātmani prājño mamedam iti manyate // / / //
analyzed: adehe hi ātmani prājñaḥ mama idam iti manyate
translated: The wise one considers in the bodiless self: This is mine.

original: itthaṃ ca putrapautreṣu taddehotpāditeṣu kaḥ /
analyzed: ittham ca putra pautreṣu tad deha utpāditeṣu kaḥ
translated: And thus, in the sons and grandsons produced from that body,

original: karoti paṇḍitaḥ svāmyam anātmani kalevare // / / //
analyzed: karoti paṇḍitaḥ svāmyam anātmani kalevare
translated: The learned one does not consider himself the owner of the non-self, lifeless body.

original: sarvaṃ dehopabhogāya kurute karma mānavaḥ /
analyzed: sarvam deha upabhogāya kurute karma mānavaḥ
translated: A man performs all actions for the enjoyment of the body.

original: dehaś cānyo yadā puṃsas tadā bandhāya tatparam // / / //🔽After / ins /
analyzed: dehaḥ ca anyaḥ yadā puṃsaḥ tadā bandhāya tat param  after ś d ins
translated: But when the body of a person is different, then that is for bondage.🔽After if the name of this body,

original: yadi nāmāsya kāyasya yad antas tad bahir bhavet // / / / //
analyzed: yadi nāma asya kāyasya yat antar tat bahis bhavet
translated: If what is inside this body were outside,

original: daṇḍam ādāya loko 'yaṃ śunaḥ kākāṃś ca vārayet // / / / //🔽mṛṇmayaṃ hi yathā gehaṃ lipyate vai mṛdambhasā /
analyzed: daṇḍam ādāya lokaḥ yam śunaḥ kākān ca vārayet  mṛṇmayam hi yathā geham lipyate vai mṛd ambhasā
translated: Then this world would take up a stick to ward off dogs and crows.🔽For just as a house made of clay is smeared with clay water,

original: pārthivo 'yaṃ tathā deho mṛdambholepanasthitiḥ // / / //
analyzed: pārthivaḥ yam tathā dehaḥ mṛd ambhaḥ lepana sthitiḥ
translated: So this bodily self exists in the state of being smeared with clay water.

original: pañcabhūtātmakair bhogaiḥ pañcabhūtātmakaṃ vapuḥ /
analyzed: pañcabhūta ātmakaiḥ bhogaiḥ pañcabhūta ātmakam vapuḥ
translated: The body, consisting of the five elements, is enjoyed by the objects consisting of the five elements.

original: āpyāyate yadi tataḥ puṃso garvo 'tra kiṃ kṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: āpyāyate yadi tatas puṃsaḥ garvaḥ kim kṛtaḥ
translated: If the body, which is composed of the five elements, is nourished by the enjoyments which are also composed of the five elements, then what pride can a man have in this matter?

original: anekajanmasāhasrīṃ saṃsārapadavīṃ vrajan /
analyzed: aneka janma sāhasrīm saṃsāra padavīm vrajan
translated: Wandering through the path of worldly existence for thousands of births,

original: mohaśramaṃ prayāto 'sau vāsanāreṇuguṇṭhitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: moha śramam vāsanā reṇu guṇṭhitaḥ
translated: he becomes covered with the dust of desires and experiences the fatigue of delusion.

original: prakṣālyate yadā so 'sya reṇur jñānoṣṇavāriṇā /
analyzed: prakṣālyate yadā saḥ sya reṇuḥ jñāna uṣṇa vāriṇā
translated: When that dust of his is washed away by the hot water of knowledge,

original: tadā saṃsārapānthasya yāti mohaśramaḥ śamam // / / //
analyzed: tadā saṃsāra pānthasya yāti moha śramaḥ śamam
translated: then the fatigue of delusion of the traveler in the world of worldly existence is pacified.

original: mohaśrame śamaṃ yāte svasthāntaḥkaraṇaḥ pumān /
analyzed: moha śrame śamam yāte svastha antaḥkaraṇaḥ pumān
translated: When the fatigue of delusion is pacified, the man whose mind is at ease,

original: ananyātiśayābādhaṃ paraṃ nirvāṇam ṛcchati // / / //
analyzed: ananya atiśaya ābādham param nirvāṇam ṛcchati
translated: attains the highest state of liberation, which is not obstructed by any other excellence.

original: nirvāṇamaya evāyam ātmā jñānamayo 'malaḥ /
analyzed: nirvāṇa mayaḥ eva ayam ātmā jñāna mayaḥ malaḥ
translated: This Self is indeed full of liberation, full of knowledge, and pure.

original: duḥkhājñānamalā dharmāḥ prakṛtes te tu nātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: duḥkha ajñāna malāḥ dharmāḥ prakṛteḥ te tu na ātmanaḥ
translated: But the qualities of sorrow, ignorance, and impurity belong to Prakṛti, not to the Self.

original: jalasya nāgnisaṃsargaḥ sthālīsaṅgāt tathāpi hi /
analyzed: jalasya na agni saṃsargaḥ sthālī saṅgāt tathā api hi
translated: Just as water does not come into contact with fire, but still, due to contact with a pot,

original: śabdodrekādikān dharmāṃs tat karoti yathā mune // / / //
analyzed: śabda udreka ādikān dharmān tat karoti yathā mune
translated: it produces qualities like the sound of water, O sage,

original: tathātmā prakṛteḥ saṅgād ahaṃmānādidūṣitaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ātmā prakṛteḥ saṅgāt ahaṃmāna ādi dūṣitaḥ
translated: in the same way, the Self, due to contact with Prakṛti, being tainted by egoism and so on,

original: bhajate prākṛtān dharmān anyas tebhyo hi so 'vyayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhajate prākṛtān dharmān anyaḥ tebhyaḥ hi saḥ vyayaḥ
translated: undergoes the qualities of Prakṛti, but it is different from them and is imperishable.

original: tad etat kathitaṃ bījam avidyāyā mayā tava /
analyzed: tat etat kathitam bījam avidyāyāḥ mayā tava
translated: This has been told to you by me, O king, the seed of ignorance.

original: kleśānāṃ ca kṣayakaraṃ yogād anyan na vidyate // / / //
analyzed: kleśānām ca kṣaya karam yogāt anyat na vidyate
translated: And for the destruction of the afflictions, there is no other means than Yoga.

original: khāṇḍikya uvāca /
analyzed: khāṇḍikyaḥ uvāca
translated: Khandicya said:

original: taṃ bravīhi mahābhāga yogaṃ yogaviduttama /
analyzed: tam bravīhi mahābhāga yogam yoga vid uttama
translated: O greatly fortunate one, O best of those who know Yoga, tell me about that Yoga.

original: vijñātayogaśāstrārthas tvam asyāṃ nimisaṃtatau // / / //
analyzed: vijñāta yoga śāstra arthaḥ tvam asyām nimi saṃtatau
translated: You are the one who has understood the meaning of the scriptures on Yoga in this lineage of Nimi.

original: keśidhvaja uvāca /
analyzed: keśidhvajaḥ uvāca
translated: Keshidhwaja said:

original: yogasvarūpaṃ khāṇḍikya śrūyatāṃ gadato mama /
analyzed: yoga svarūpam khāṇḍikya śrūyatām gadataḥ mama
translated: O Khandicya, listen to me as I describe the nature of Yoga.

original: yatra sthito na cyavate prāpya brahmalayaṃ muniḥ // / / //
analyzed: yatra sthitaḥ na cyavate prāpya brahma layam muniḥ
translated: Remaining in which, a sage does not fall away, having attained the dissolution into Brahman.

original: mana eva manuṣyāṇāṃ kāraṇaṃ bandhamokṣayoḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ eva manuṣyāṇām kāraṇam bandha mokṣayoḥ
translated: The mind alone is the cause of bondage and liberation for human beings.

original: bandhasya viṣayāsaṅgi mukter nirviṣayaṃ tathā // / / //
analyzed: bandhasya viṣaya āsaṅgi mukteḥ nirviṣayam tathā
translated: Of bondage, attached to objects; of liberation, free from objects.

original: viṣayebhyaḥ samāhṛtya vijñānātmā mano muniḥ /
analyzed: viṣayebhyaḥ samāhṛtya vijñāna ātmā manaḥ muniḥ
translated: The sage, having withdrawn the mind from objects into the conscious Self,

original: cintayen muktaye tena brahmabhūtaṃ pareśvaram // / / //🔽ātmabhāvaṃ nayaty enaṃ tad brahmadhyāyinaṃ mune /
analyzed: cintayet muktaye tena brahma bhūtam para īśvaram  ātma bhāvam nayati enam tat brahma dhyāyinam mune
translated: should contemplate the Supreme Lord, identified with Brahman, for liberation.🔽That Brahman, by the power of the Self, leads him, the sage who meditates on it,

original: vikāryam ātmanaḥ śaktyā loham ākarṣako yathā // / / //
